¶because whan thou goest study holy scripture thou shuldest reuerence therfore thy instruction louynge admonicion therto reuerende father god nicolas bisshoppe salisbury hath prescrybed prayer folowynge taken lorde god almyghtye whiche longe agoo saydest mouthe iames thyn apostleiacob • lacke wysdom let hym aske god whiche geueth plenteously men casteth man tethe shalbe geuen hym heare peticion thy promes sake let prayer ascende luckely thy syght lyke incensepsal 140 psal 129 sa • 9 let thy • eare attent vnto depe desyre geue wysdome eue • assistent thy seate put amonge 〈…〉 thy seruaunt ye sonne thy handmayde▪ 〈…〉 meane thy godly wysedome thyne holy heauens trone thy maiestye maye laboure yt may knowe acceptable thy syght oh lerne goodnespsal 118 nurtoure knowlege beleue thy commaundementes thou art good gracyous instructe thyne ordynaunces let myne hertie besechynge ascende thy presence geue vnderstondynge accordynge thy worde oh geue vnderstō dynge shall kepe thy lawe yee shall kepe myne hertepsa • 24 shewe thy wayes lorde teache thy patthes leade thy trueth lerne thou art god helth depende alwaypsal 26 heare voyce lorde haue cryed vnto haue mercy vpon gracyouslye heare iesus christes sake oure lorde lyueth reygneth father holy goost worlde without ende amen ¶after ende chapter yf thou wylt thou mayest saye verse folowynge psal 118leade lorde thy waye let walke thy trueth oh let myne herte delyte fearynge thy name ordre goynges thy worde wyckednes reygne kepe steppe within thy patthes lest fete turne contrary waye vnto victorious prynce oure gracyous soueraigne lorde kynge henry kynge englonde fraunce lorde irlonde c defendour fayth vnder god chefe suppreme heade church englonde ¶the ryght iust administracyon lawes god gaue vnto moses vnto iosua testimonye faythfulnes god gaue dauid plenteous abundaunce wysdome god gaue vnto salomon lucky prosperous age multiplicacyon sede whiche god gaue vnto abraham sara wyfe geuē vnto gracyous prynce dearest iust wyfe vertuous pryncesse quene anne amen caiphas beynge bysshope yeare lyke blynde prophete vnderstandyng sayd prophecied better put christ vnto death people shulde peryssheio 11 c meanyng christ heretike deceauer people destroyer lawe better therfore put christ vnto death thā suffre hym lyue deceaue people c dede christ true prophete true messias onely true sauiour worlde sent heauenly father suffre moste cruell shamefull necessary death redempcyon accordyng ye meanynge prophecie truely vnderstonde euen maner ye blynde bysshoppe rome blynde baalam saye vnderstondynge dyd gaue vnto grace tytle defendour fayth onely bycause hyghnes suffred bysshoppes burne god worde rote fayth persecute louers mynisters ye dede blynde bysshoppe though knewe dyd prophecied ryghteous admynistracyon contynuall diligence youre grace fayth shulde defended god worde mother fayth frutes therof shulde haue fre course thorowe christendome specyally realme yf hyghnesse pryncely benignite wyll pardon compare two bysshoppes meane bysshoppe caiphas bysshoppe rome theyr prophecy together doute shal fynde agree lyke brother though one iewe counterfayre christian fyrst caiphas prophecied better put christ vnto death people shulde perysshe bysshoppe rome also knowynge prophecied gaue youre grace tytle defendour fayth trueth prophecy holy goost baalams prophecie though spake thē knewe sayd trueth caiphas prophecie necessary man saluacyon christ death shulde ouercome death redeme v trueth oure baalams prophecie isnume 24 c yt grace dede shulde defende fayth yee euen true fayth christ dreames fable heresie papisticall inuencions vncorrupte fayth god holy worde set forth praysed goodnes god increace youre gracyous purpose hyghnes youre honorable councell applyeth studye endeuoure two blynde bysshopes agree ye vnderstādyng theyr prophecy caiphas taketh christ heretike oure balaā taketh worde christ heresie caiphas iudgeth good dede put christ vnto death shulde deceaue people oure balaam calleth defendynge fayth suppressyng kepyng secrete burnyng worde fayth lest lyght thereof shulde vtter darknes lest owne decretales decree owne lawes constitucions owne statute inuencions shulde come none effecte lest intollerable exaction vsurpacions shulde lose theyr strengthe lest shulde knowen thefe murtherer cause christ haynous traytoure god man defraudynge christen kynges prynces theyr due obedience lest youre grace subiectes shulde haue eye worde god last spye crafty conueyaūce iuglynges lest men shulde se sore false apostle haue deceaued christendome specyally youre noble realme englonde thus grace seyth brotherly iewysh bysshoppe oure balaam agree together onely myter outwarde appearaunce one persecuted lorde iesus owne persone doth persecute worde resysteth holy ordynaunce auctorite anoynted kynges moche nowe worde god onely trueth dryueth awaye lye discloseth iuglyng disceate therfore oure balaam rome lothe scripture shulde knowē mother tonge lest yf kynges prynces specially aboue exercysed therin shulde reclame chalenge agayne theyr due auctorite falsely hath vsurped many yeres 〈◊〉 tye hym shorter lest people beyng taught worde god shulde fall ye false fayned obediēce hym disguysed apostle vnto true obedience commaunded god owne mouthe namely obey theyr prynce obey father mother c steppe ouer father mother bely enter paynted religion ypocrites teache knoweth well ynough yf cleare sonne god worde come one heate daye shal dryue awaye foule myst deuelysh doctrine therfore mayntenaunce antichristes kyngdome worlde styll ignoraunce blyndnes scripture shulde neuer come lyghte scripture olde testament new declareth aboū • dauntly office auctorite power geuen god vnto kynges earth aboue power let call thē selues pope cardynalles euer willro 13 worde god declareth yee commaundeth vnder payne dampnacion obedient vnto temporall swerde olde testament prophetesmath 17 tit 3 exod 22 psal 81 prestes leuites new testament christ apostle obedient selues taught obedience men vnto theyr prynces ād temporall ruler vnto v worlde present persone god called goddes scripture bycause excellēcy theyr office though mo auctorities proue p̄ eminence temporall swerde yet scripture declareth playnly nothyng aboue god man aboue kynge realme onely vnder god chefe heade cōgregacyon church token true hath ben olde antiquite yet vnto daye louynge ceremonye vsed realme englonde yt whā grace subiectes reade letter begynne talke comē hyghnes moue theyr bonettes signe token reuerence vnto grace soueraigne lorde heade vnder god thyng man vseth eny bysshoppe wherby yf oure vnderstondyng nat blynded myght euydently perceaue euen nature teacheth v scripture cōmaū deth v lyke agaynst god worde kynge shulde chefe heade people euen saye agaynst kynde shulde knowe heade aboue hym vnder god prest bysshoppe exempte lawfully obedience prynce scripture full strayte cōmaundemētes practises holyest men ✚ aaron obedient vnto moses called hym lordenume 12 b io 4 c 3 reg 1 c 3 reg 18 b leuit 18 b math 14 though owne brother eleasar phin • vnder obediēce iosua ✚ nathan prophete fell downe grounde kynge dauid prynce reuerence made kynge kysse fote bysshoppe rome maketh emperours notwithstondynge spared rebuke hym ryght sharply whan fell worde god adultery manslaughter afrayed reproue hym sinnes nomore helyas prophete stode feare saye vnto kynge achab ✚ thou thy father house trouble israel ye haue forsaken ye commaundementes lorde walke baal iohan baptyste durst saye vnto kynge herode lawful take thy brother wyfe purpose passe ouer innumerable mo ensāples olde testament new feare lest tedyous vnto grace sūma godly regimentes olde tyme kynge tēporall iudge obeyed euery man alwaye vnder god chefe suppreme heade whole congregacyon deposed euen prestes whan sawe vrgent cause salomon dyd vnto abiathar3 reg 2 coulde stonde agaynst godly obedience prynce excepte wolde defyaunce god holy ordinaunces well acquaynted holy scripture earnestly cōmendeth vnto euery one v auctorite power geuen god vnto kynges temporall rulersexod 22 ierem 29 b bar 2 c math 17 therfore doth moses strately forbyde israelite speake moche euell worde agaynst prynce ye people moche lesse disobeye hym withstonde hym doth ieremy prophete baruc also exhorte people captiuite praye prosperous welfare kynge babilon obeye hym though infidele new testament whā oure sauioure christ beyng yet fre lorde al kynges prynces shewed obedience payenge trybute oure ensample ✚ dyd miracle puttynge pece money fysshes mouth peter myght paye customer therwith stablysshe obedience due vnto prynces ✚ dyd ioseph mary mother sauiour christ departe frō nazareth vnto bethleē farre home shewe theyr obedience payenge taxe pryncelu 2 wolde oure sauioure borne obediencero 13 ✚ doth paule pronounce hym resyste god hym selfe resysteth auctorite prynce shorte apostle peter dothe onely stablysshe obedience vnto prynces temporall ruler affirmeth playnly kynge bysshoppe chefe heade innumerable place mo scripture1 petr 2 b bynde v obedience oure prynce declare vnto v man lawfully excepte mynisters goddes worde vnder tēporall swerde prynces onely owe obedience vnto god worde anthichrist vnto youre grace tyme dyd thrust heade ye imperiall crowne hyghnes doth yet noble prynces mo lerned sathā authour pryde therin doth agaynst doctryne also agaynst ye ensample christe whiche kyngdome worlde medled temporal matter euydent wordes practyse luc xii math xxvi ioh vi ioh xviii yt hath eye se maye se yt hath eares heare maye heare yt christes admynistracion nothyng tēporall playne spiritual hym selfe affirmeth proueth fourth chapter saynt luke prophete esay bysshoppes prestes maye se farre theyr byndynge lowsynge extendeth theyr office consisteth namely preachynge gospell c wherfore gracyous prynce tonge thynke fully expresse declare vntollerable iniuries haue bene done vnto god al prynces comynalties christen realmes sence shulde onely minister god worde became lordes worlde thrust ye true iust prynces theyr rowmes whose herte wolde pitie yee euē lamentacyon remember onely vntollerable wronge done antychrist rome vnto youre grace noble predecessoure kynge iohn̄ passe ouer pestilent pykynge peter pen youre realme stealynge awaye youre money pardon benefice bysshoprykes disceauyng youre subiectes soules deuelyshe doctrynes sectes false religion bloudsheddyng many grace people bokes scripture▪ whose herte wolde greued yee measure call remēbraūce obstinate disobedient presumptuous stubburne antychrist made bysshoppes youre realme agaynst grace noble predecessours tymes past manyfest ye cronicles trust verely suche within youre realme▪ yf let remembre wordes scripture presumptuousnes goeth destrucciōproue 16▪ • proude stomacke foloweth fall cause vntollerable nomore suffred abhominacions truely euen ignoraunce scripture god el ben possyble blyndnes shulde haue come ye worlde ye lyghte god worde bene extyncte coulde men saye haue bene farre true seruyce god due obedience theyr prynce lawe god bene clene shut vp depressed cast asyde put remembraunce afore tyme noble kynge iosias hath bene also amonge v vnto youre grace tyme whose ryghteous admynistracyon thorowe mercyfull goodnes god founde agayne4 22 b 2 par 24 c ✚ dayes vertuous kynge iosias praysed father sonne holy goost worlde without ende excellently hath endewed youre pryncely hert feruentnes honoure welth youre louyng subiectes maye ryghtuously iust occasyons youre persone cōpare youre hyghnes vnto noble gracyous kynge yt lanterne lyghte amonge prynces feruent protectour defender lawes god cōmaunded straytly youre grace doth lawe god shulde redde taught vnto ye people set prestes theyr office worde god destroyed idolatry false ydols put downe euell customes abusyons set vp true honoure god applyed studye endeuoure ryghtuous admynistracyon vncorrupte lawe god c felicite amonge ye people ierusalem dayes prosperous health soule body foloweth lyke mynistracion youre hyghnes begynne praysed god haue experienceierem 44 foras false doctryne origenall cause euell plage destruccyon ye true executynge lawe god ād preachyng mother godly prosperite onely worde god saye cause felicitesapie 7 b bryngeth goodnes bryngeth lernynge gē dreth vnderstondynge causeth good workes maketh chyldren obedience breuely teacheth estate theyr office duety seynge scripture god teacheth v euery thynge sufficiently oughte oughte leaue vndone whome bounde obey whome shulde obeye therfore saye causeth prosperite setteth euery thyng frame taught knowen lyghteneth darkenesses cōforteth sory hertes leaueth poore man vnhelped suffreth nothynge amysse vnamended letteth prynce disobeyed permytteth heresie preached refourmeth thinges amēdeth amysse setteth euery thynge order geuen inspiracyon god therfore euer bryngynge profyte frute teachynge improuynge amendynge refourmyng thē yt wyl receaue it2 tim 3 b make parfecte mete vnto good workes considerynge gracyous prynce inestimable treasure frute prosperite euerlastynge god geueth worde trustynge infynite goodnes wolde brynge symple rude laboure herin good effecte therfore holy goost moued mē cost herof boldened god laboure agayne consyderynge youre imperiall maiestye onely naturall soueraigne liege lorde chefe heade ye church englōde also true defender maynteyner god lawes thought dutye belonge vnto allegiaunce whan translated bible onely dedicate translacyon vnto youre hyghnesse wholy commytte vnto intent yf thynge therin translated amysse many thynges fayle euen whan thynke sure may stōde youre grace handes correcte amende improue yee cleane reiecte yf youre godly wysdome shall thynke necessary humblenes submitte myne vnderstondynge poore translacyon vnto ye spirite trueth grace make protestacyon hauyng god recorde cōscience haue nether wrested altered moch one worde mayntenaūce maner secte haue cleare conscience purely faythfully translated fyue sundry interpreter hauyng onely manyfest trueth scripture myne eye trustynge goodnes god shalbe vnto worshippe quietnes tranquilite vnto hyghnes perfecte stablyshment god ordynaunces within youre grace domynion generall comforte christen hertes continuall thankfulnesse olde yonge vnto god youre grace beynge oure moses bringynge v olde egypte cruell handes spirituall pharao iewes ten thousande partes moch bounde vnto kynge dauid subduynge greate goliath theyr enemyes1 reg 17 g grace delyuerynge v oure olde babylonycall captiuyte yt delyueraunce victory beseke oure onely medyatoure iesus christ make soch meanes v vnto heauenly father yt neuer vnthankfull vnto ner vnto youre grace euer increace feare obedience vnto hyghnesse loue vnfayned vnto oure neghbours vertue commeth god ye defendynge blessed worde grace rightfull administracyon honoure thankes glory dominyon worlde without ende amen youre grace humble subiecte daylye oratour myles couerdale prologe myles couerdale vnto christen reader considerynge excellent knowlege lernynge interpreter scripture oughte haue tongue ponderyng also myne owne insufficiency therin weake perfourme ye office translatoure lothe medle worke notwithstondynge whan cōsydered greate pytie shulde wante longe called remembraunce ye aduersite onely rype knowlege wolde also theyr hertes haue perfourmed yt beganne yf impediment considerynge saye reason theyr aduersyte coulde soone haue bene broughte ende oure prosperous nacyon wolde fayne haue reasonable cause consydered bolde take hande helpe herin haue sondrye translacions onely latyn also douche interpreter theyr synguler gyftes speciall diligence bible haue ben glad folowe parte accordynge requyred saye trueth god nether laboure ner desyre haue worke put hande neuertheles greued ye nacyōs shulde plenteously prouyded ye scripture theyr mother tongue therfore whan instantly requyred though coulde well wolde thought yet dewtye best good wyll men thynke yt many translacyons make diuisyon ye fayth people god yt neuer better congregacion god whan euery church allmost ye byble sondrye trāslacion amonge grekes origen specyall translacyon vulgarius one peculyar lykewyse chrysostom besyde seuentye interpreter translacyon aquila theodotio symachus sondrye agayne amonge latyn men thou findest yt euery one allmost vsed specyall sondrye translacyon moch euery bysshoppe knowlege ye tongue gaue diligence haue byble awne translacion doctours hireneus cyprianus tertullian iherome augustine hylarius ambrose vpon dyuerse place scripture reade ye texte alyke therfore oughte taken euel yt soch men haue vnderstondynge oure tyme exercyse selues ye tongue geue diligence translate one language another yee ought rather geue god hye thankes therfore thorow sprete stereth vp mēs myndes exercise selues therin wolde god neuer bene left ye tyme augustine shulde neuer haue come soch blindnes ignoraūce soch erroures delusyons soone byble cast asyde nomore put exercyse beganne euery one awne heade wryte euer came brayne yt semed good awne eye grewe ye darknes mēs tradiciōs ye cause yt haue many wryters seldome made mē cyon ye scripture byble though tyme aleged yet done farre season wyde ye purpose mā maye well perceaue neuer sawe oryginall seynge yt diligent exercyse translatynge doth moch good edifyeth language shulde euell oures doutles lyke nacyons ye dyuersite speaches maye knowe one god vnyte faith one loue euen maye dyuerse translacyons vnderstonde one another head article grounde oure blessed faith though vse sondrye wordes wherfore thynke haue greate occasyon geue thankes vnto god hath opened vnto church gyfte interpretacyon pryntyng tyme many▪ soch diligēce faithfulnes interprete ye scripture honoure god edifyenge people lyke whan many shutynge together euery one doth best nyest marke though attayne therto yet shuteth one nyer another hytteth better another yee one better thē another vnreasonable despytefull enuyous abhorre yt doth diligence hytte ye prycke shute nyest though mysse come nyest mark ought soch one rather commēded helped forwarde maye exercyse himselfe therin cause acordyng desyred toke vpon set forth speciall translacyon checker reprouer despyser men translacyons amonge many yet haue founde none without occasyon greate thankesgeuynge vnto god lowly faythfully haue folowed myne interpreter vnder correccyon though haue fayled eny noman mysseth thynge loue shall constyrre ye best without eny peruerse iudgment noman lyuynge yt cause thynges nether hath god geuen eny man knowe euery thynge one seyth clearly another one hath vnderstondyng another one vtter thynge better another noman ought enuye dispyse another better another shulde set naught yt vnderstondeth lesse yee hath ye vnderstondyng ought remembre gyfte god yt god hath geuē teach enfourme ignoraunt yf thou hast knowlege therfore iudge eny faute made doute thou wilt helpe amende yf loue ioyned thy knowlege howbeit wherin euer perceaue selfe informacyon haue fayled wonder shall helpe god ouerloke better amende wil exhorte euer thou ye readest scripture yf thou fynde oughte therin yt thou vnderstondest apeareth repugnaunt geue temerarious ner haystye iudgmēt therof ascrybe thyne awne ignoraunce scrypture thynke yt thou vnderstondest yt hath meanynge yt happlye ouersene ye interpreter wronge prynted agayne shall greately helpe yt vnderstonde scripture yf thou marke onely spoken wrytten vnto wordes tyme intent circumstaunce consyderynge goeth foloweth thynges done wryttē intente yt shulde lykewyse whan abraham beleueth god obedient vnto worde defendeth loth kynsman violent wronge thynges also wryttē intente yt shulde eschue soch lyke whan dauid lyeth vrias wyfe causeth slayne therfore saye whan thou readest scripture wyse circumspecte whan thou commest soch straunge maners speakynge darke sentence soch parable similitude soch dreames vysions hyd thy vnderstondynge cōmytte vnto god gyfte holy sprete yt better lerned thou commendacyon god holy scripture wolde fayne magnifye worthy farre vnsufficiēt therto therfore thoughte better holde tonge wordes prayse commēde exhortynge ye deare reader loue cleue vnto folowe thy daylye conuersacyon yt men seynge thy good workes frutes ye holy goost maye prayse father heauen geue worde good reporte lyue lawe god leade vertuous conuersacyon greatest prayse yt thou canst geue • nto doctryne touchynge euell reporte disprayse good worde god hath corrupte euell conuersacyon yt daylye heare professe outwardly theyr mouthes exhorte ye deare reader let yt offende ner withdrawe thy mynde frō loue ye trueth nether moue ye partaker lyke vnthankfulnes seynge ye lighte come worlde loue nomore workes darknes receaue grace god vayne call thy remembraunce louynge mercifull god vnto kyndly fatherly helpeth al • trouble teacheth thyne ignoraunce healeth thy sycknesse forgeueth thy synnes fedeth ye geueth drynke helpeth ye preson norysheth straunge countrees careth seyeth yt thou wante nothynge call mynde saye earnestly consydre thou hast receaued god benefites yee many mo thou canst desyre thou art bounde lykewise shewe thy selfe vnto thy neghboure farre thou canst teach yf ignoraunt helpe trouble heale sycknes forgeue offence hartely fede cherish care se yt wante nothyng· behalfe beseke thou yt hast ye ryches worlde louest god thy harte lyfte vp thyne eye se greate multitude poore people renne thorow euery towne haue pitie thyne awne flesh helpe good harte thy councell euer thou canst vnshamefast beggynge maye put downe ydle folkes maye set laboure soch able get theyr lyuynge maye prouyded leest thou yt art councell soch auctoryte geue occasyon cast theyr heades together make prouysyon poore put remembraunce noble cityes countrees auctoryte theyr prynces haue rychely ād well prouided theyr poore people greate shame deshonestye v yf lykewyse receauynge ye worde god shewe soch lyke frutes therof wolde god yt men whose office maynteyne ye comon welth diligent cause let v bewarre tymes vnthankfulnes foloweth euer plage mercyful hande god v defende v partaker therof go deare reader syt downe lordes fete reade wordes moses teacheth iewes take theyr herte let thy talkynge communicacion whan thou syttest thyne housedeute 6 goest ye waye whan thou lyest downe whan thou ryseth vp aboue thynges fasshyon thy lyfe cōuersacion acordyng doctryne holy goost therin thou mayest partaker ye good promyses god byble heyre blessynge christ yf thou put thy trust vnfayned reader hearer hys worde thy hert thou shalt fynde swetenesse theryn spye wōderous thynges thy vnderstondynge auoydynge sedicyous sectes abhorrynge thy olde synfull lyfe stablyshynge thy godly conuersacyon first boke moses called genesis thou mayest lerne knowe almightye power god creatynge naught infinite wysdome ordryng ryghteousnes punyshynge ye vngodly loue fatherly mercy comfortynge righteous promes c seconde boke called exodus se myghtye arme god delyuerynge people greate bondage egypte prouysyon maketh wildernes teacheth wholsome worde tabernacle made set vp thyrde boke called leuiticus declared sacrifice prestes leuites vsed theyr office ministracyon fourth boke called numerus declared people nombred mustred captaynes chosen ye trybes kynreds wē te forth ye battayll pitched theyr tentes brake vp fyfth boke called deuteronomium sheweth moses beynge olde rehearseth lawe god vnto ye people putteth remembraunce agayne wonder benefice god shewed exhorteth earnestly loue ye lorde theyr god cleue vnto put trust herken vnto voyce death moses doth iosue brynge people lōde promes god doth wonderous thynges people iosue distributeth ye londe vnto vnto euery trybe theyr possession theyr wealth forgat goodnes god oft tymes gaue thē ouer hande theyr enemy neuertheles whan euer called faithfully vpon conuerted delyuered agayne boke iudges declareth bokes kynges descrybed regiment good euell prynces decaye nacions commeth euel kynges ieroboam thou seyst myschefe ydolatrye soch like abhominacyon foloweth whā kynge maynteyner false doctryne ād causeth people synne agaynst god fallinge awaye god worde increased sore amonge cause theyr sorowe misery occasion israel first iuda caryed awaye captyuite agayne iosaphat ezechias iosias thou seyst nature vertuous kynge2 par 17 b putteth downe house ydolatrye seyth prestes teach nothynge ye lawe god cō maundeth lordes go se teach people kynges saye thou seyst cōdicyon true defender ye fayth spareth nether cost ner laboure manteyne lawes god seke welth prosperite people rote wicked soch prince thou seyst agayne god defendeth people though haue neuer many enemyes thus wente thē olde tyme euen ye maner goeth v god praysed therfore ād graunte v fatherly mercy vnthankfull lest geueth v iosaphat ezechias yee iosias sende v pharao ieroboam achab two first bokes e • dras hester thou seyst delyueraunce people though fewe yet vnto v speciall cōforte moch god forgetfull promes bryngeth captiuite acordynge tolde boke iob lerne comforte pacience god onely punysheth wicked proueth tryeth iust righteous howbeit noman innocent sighte dyuerse trouble lyfe declaryng therby yt bastardes deare sonnes loueth psalmes lerne resorte onely vnto god oure trouble seke helpe call onely vpon satle oure myndes paciēce ought prosperite thankfull vnto prouerbes preacher salomon teach v wysdome knowe god oure owne selues worlde vayne thynges saue onely cleue vnto god doctryne prophetes el earnest exhortacion eschue synne turne vnto god faythfull promes mercy ād pardon god vnto yt turne vnto threatenyng wrath vngodly sauynge prophecye also manifestly christ ye expulsion iewes callynge heythen thus moch thought speake ye olde testament wherin almyghtie god openeth vnto v myghtye power wysdome louynge mercy righteousnesse cause oughte man abhorred despysed lyghtly regarded though olde scripture yt nothyng belōged vnto v yt refused god true scripture testimony lorde iesus commaundeth iewes search euer beleueth scriptureio 5 beleueth christ refuseth refuseth god also new testament gospell manyfest cleare testymony christ god perfourmeth ooth promes made olde testament new declared included olde olde fulfylled verifyed new famous interpreter geue sondrye iudgmentes texte farre done ye sprete knowlege holy goost thynke noman shulde offended referre theyr doinges mekenes sprete trueth congregacyon god sure commeth knowlege vnderstondinge scripture theyr sondrie translacyons gloses oure sophisticall doctours one interpreteth somthynge obscurely one place trans • ateth another el selfe manifestly playne vocable meanyng another place thou offended therfore good reader though one call scrybe another calleth lawyer elder another calleth father mother repentaunce another calleth pennaunce amendment yf thou disceaued men tradiciōs thou shalt fynde nomore dyuersite betwene termes betwene foure pen grote maner haue vsed translacyon callyng place pennaunce another place call repentaunce onely interpreter haue done aduersaries trueth maye se abhorre worde pēnaunce vntruly reporte v interpreter latyn abhorre penitere whan reade resipiscere onely oure hertes desyre vnto god people blynded theyr vnderstondyng lest beleue pennaunce ought saue repētaunce amēdment conuersyon vnto god vnfayned new creature christ lyue acordyng lawe el shall fal olde blasphemy christes bloude beleue thē selues able make satisfaccion vnto god theyr awne synnes erroure god mercy plēteous goodnes preserue conclude moch scripture wrytten thy doctryne ensample shalbe necessary take holde vpon whyle offred yee ten handes thankfully receaue though worthely ministred vnto translacyon reason rudnes yet yf thou feruēt thy prayer god shal onely sende better shappe mynistracyon beganne afore shall also moue hertes yet medled withall take hande bestowe gifte theyr vnderstondynge theron well oure language famous interpreter language praye god thorow poore ministracyon maye geue better occasyon exhortyng deare reader meane whyle god behalfe yf thou heade iudge ruler ye people thou let boke lawe departe thy mouth exercise thyselfe therin daye nyghteios 1 deute 17 euer readyng longe thou lyuest thou mayest lerne feare lorde thy god turne asyde commaundement nether right hande ner lefte left thou knower personnes iudgmēt wrest righte straunger fatherles wedowedeute 24 rom 12 b 1 pet 4 b actu 20 1 petr 5 1 tim 4 b ti 2 ye curse come vpon office euer thou hast wayte vpon execute mayntenaunce peace welth thy people defendynge lawes god louers therof destruccyon wicked yf thou preacher hast ouersighte flocke christ awake fede christes shepe good herte spare laboure good seke thy selfe bewarre fylthy lucre vnto ye flocke ensample ye worde cōuersacyon loue feruentnes ye sprete euer readynge exhortynge teachynge god worde people god renne vnto doctrynes lest thou thy selfe whan thou shuldest teach founde ignoraunt therin rather thou woldest teach people eny thynge god worde take boke thyne hande reade wordes euē stonde therin shame shame make lye saye soch yet experte scripture reproue preachyng without boke longe saye trueth yf thou man hast wyfe childrē first loue thy wyfeephe 5 c acordynge ensample loue wherwith christ loued cōgregacion remembre doynge thou louest euen thyselfe yf thou hate thou hatest thine awne flesh yf thou cherishe make moch thou cherisest makest moch thyselfe bone thy bone flesh thy flesh euer thou hast child bryng vp nurtour informacion lordeephe 6 yf thou ignoraunt art otherwyse occupied laufully thou canst teach thy selfe euen diligent seke good master thy childrē thou wast seke mother beare lieth great weight one ye yee better thē vnborne feare god euel brought vp thynge meane bryngynge vp well child yf diligently loked vpholdinge comon welthes negligence decaye realmes fynally euer thou take wordes scripture thy herte onely outwarde hearer doer therafter practyse thyselfe therin thou mayest fele thine hert swete promyses therof thy consolacion trouble sure stablyshinge thy hope christ haue euer eye ye wordes scripture yf thou teacher thou mayest within boundes trueth leest though thou hearer reader another man doynges thou mayest yet haue knowlege iudge spretes fre euery erroure vtter destruccion sedicious sectes straunge doctrynes holy scrypture maye haue fre passage reputacion worshippe author therof euen god himselfe blessed worde glory domynion euer amen bokes hole byble▪ named englysh c chap ix god blesseth noe sonnes forbyddeth eate bloude beestes shed mās bloude maketh conuenaunt geueth raynbowe token wyll destroye worlde water noe dronken ham vncouereth hym getteth curse chap x increace mās generaciō no thre sonnes go abrode begynne buylde chap xi buyldynge towre babel hyndreth thorowe confusyon tonges generacion sem vntyll abram whiche goeth loth vnto haran chap xii abram goeth loth straunge londe worde lord appeareth vnto hym canaan promiseth geue londe vnto sede afterwarde goeth abram egypte fayneth saray syster chap xiii abram loth departe agayne egypte haue many cattell dwell together abram receaueth blessynge promes chap xiiii loth taken presoner abram deliuereth hym melchisedech fedeth abram returnynge abram geueth hym tythes spoyles holdeth nothinge kynge sodom goodes chap xv god conforteth abram promyseth hym sede beleueth iustified chap xvi sarai geueth abram leue take hyr mayde whiche beareth hym ismaell chap xvii cōuenaunt circumcisyon c chap xviii thre mē appeare vnto abrahā destruction sodome declared chap xix loth receaueth two angel men sodome go aboute abuse loth delyuered sodome destroyed loths wyfe turned pyler salt doughters beare chyldren vnto hym chap xx abraham departeth straunger gerar fayneth sarai syster kynge taketh geueth hym agayne chap xxi byrth isaac agar put hyr sonne abraham abimelech sworne frendes chap xxii god tryeth abraham whiche word wolde offre owne sonne promes confirmed vnto hym ooth chap xxiii death sara abraham byeth pece londe burye chap xxiiii abraham wyll haue sonne mary owne kynred seruaunt bryngeth rebecca whō isaac taketh wyfe chap xxv abraham begetteth mo chyldren another wyfe geueth good vnto isaac dyeth isaac begynneth growe esau selleth byrth righte chap xxvi isaac goeth gerar fayneth rebecca syster increasseth ryches philistine stoppe welles abimelech sworne frendes chap xxvii iacob blessed esau esau threateneth hym flyeth haram laba • mother brother chap xxviii isaac • rachell lea geuen hym yet serueth seuen yeare mo rachell chap xxx rachel geueth iacob hyr mayden doeth lea beare hym chyldren reward appoynted condicion wherby made ryche chap xxxi iacob goeth home ward rachell stealet • hyr father ymages laban ouertaketh fyndeth ymages sweare together angell meteth iacob chap xxxii iacob sendeth presentes vnto esau putteth god remembraunce promes wresteleth thou eatest therof thou shalt dye death lorde god sayde good yt mā shulde alone wil make helpe reade▪ 〈◊〉 nexte beare cōpany whan god lorde made earth maner beastes felde maner foules vnder heauē good eate lustye vnto eye pleasaunt tre reade whyle made wyse make wyse toke frute ate gaue vnto hir husbande also therof ate eye opened perceaued naked sowed fygge leaues together gene 2 made apurns therfore hyd sayde tolde thou art naked hast thou eaten tre wherof commaunded yt thou shuldest eate sayde adam woman thou gauest beare company gaue tre ate lorde god sayde vnto woman wherfore hast thou done woman sayde serpent disceaued ate apo 12 c sayde lorde god vnto serpent thou hast done cursed thou aboue catell aboue beastes felde vpon thy bely shalt thou go earth shalt thou eate dayes thy life wyll put enemyte betwene woman betwene ye sede hir sede matt 4 col 2 b shal treade downe thy heade thou shalt treade hele vnto woman sayde increase thy sorow whan thou art childe payne shalt thou beare thy childrē reade thou shalt bowe downe thy self thy husbande thy lust shal pertayne vnto ye huszbande shal rule vnto adam sayde moch thou hast herkened vnto voyce thy wyfe hast eaten tre wherof commaunded sayenge thou shalt eate cursed ye earth thy sake sorowe shalt thou eate therof dayes thy life thornes thistle shalt beare vnto thou shalt eate herbes felde sweate thy face shalt thou eate thy bred tyll thou turned agayne vnto earth eccl 40 b iob 34 b whēce thou art takē earth thou art vnto earth shalt thou turned agayne adam called wyfe hena mother lyuynge lorde god made adam wyfe garmentes skynnes put lorde god sayde lo adam become one v knoweth good euell lest stretch hande take also tre life eate lyue euer lorde god put garden eden tyll ye earth whē ce takē cast adam garden eden set cherubes naked syrie swerde kepe ye waye vnto tre life iiii chapter morouer adam laye hena wyfe cōceaued bare cain sayde haue opteyned ye man lorde proceaded forth bare brother abell abell became shepherde cain became huszbande man fortuned certaine day cain brought frute earth offrynge vnto ye lorde abell brought also firstlinges shepe ye fat heb 11 lorde respecte vnto abell offerynge vnto cain offerynge loked cain exceadinge wroth countenaunce chaunged lorde sayde vnto cain art thou angrie doth thy countenaunce chaunge yf thou well thou shalt receaue yf thou euell thy synne lyeth open dore reade let subdued vnto rule thou shal subdued vnto wilt thou rule cain talked abell brother happened whan felde cain arose agaynst abell brother slew sayde lorde vnto cain abell thy brother sayde tell brother keper sap 10 1 ioh 3 b heb 12 sayde hast thou done voyce thy brother bloude crieth vnto earth shalt thou cursed vpon earth hath opened hir mouth receaued thy brother bloude thine hande whan thou tyllest ye grounde shall henszforth geue hir power vnto pro • vagabunde rennagate shalt thou vpon ye earth cain sayde vnto ye lorde synne greater iob • maye forgeuen beholde thou castest daye ye londe ye sight must hyde must vagabunde rennagate vpon ye earth thus shal go fyndeth shal slaye lorde sayde thus vnto euer slayeth cain gen • shalbe auenged seuenfolde lorde put marck vpon cain man founde shulde kyll cain wente ye face lorde dwelt lande nod vpon east syde eden cain laye wyfe conceaued bare henoch buylded cite called name sonne henoch henoch begat doughters whole age nyene hundreth nyene trescore yeares dyed lamech hundreth two foure score yeare olde begat sonne called noe sayde shall cōforte v oure workes sorowe oure hondes vpon earth gen 3 lorde hath cursed lyued fyue hūdreth fyue nyentie yeare begat sonnes doughters whole age seuen hundreth seuen seuentie yeares dyed noe fyue hundreth yeare olde begat sem ham iaphet vi chapter whan men beganne multiplie vpon earth begot doughters child god sawe doughters men fayre toke vnto thē wyues soch liked sayde ye lorde sprete shal allwaye stryue man flesh also1 pet 3 c wil yet geue respyte hundreth twēty yeares giauntes also worlde tyme whan child god lyen daughter men begotten child ye child became mightie worlde men renowne whan lorde sawe yt wickednes man increased vpon ye earth ye thought imaginacion hert onely euell contynually repented him1 15 c made man vpon earth sorowed hert sayde wyll destroye man kynde haue made earth man beest worme foule vnder heauen repenteth haue made esa 42 c neuertheles noe founde grace sight lorde ye generacion noe noe righteous parfecte mā eccl 44 b led godly life tyme begat thre sonnes sem ham iaphet notwithstondinge ye earth corrupte ye sight god full myschefe god loked vpon ye earth lo corrupte flesh corrupte waye vpon earth sayde god vnto noe ende flesh come earth full myschefe lo wyll destroye earth make arcke pyne tre make chamber pitch within without pitch make fashion length shal thre hundreth cubites bredth fiftie cubites heyght thirtie cubites wyndow shalt thou make aboue cubyte greate dore shalt thou set myddest syde arke shalt thou make thre loftes one aboue another • wyll bringe floude water vpon earth destroye flesh wherin breth life vnder heauē vpon earth shal perishe wyll make couenaunt thou shalt go arcke thy sonnes thy wyfe thy sonnes wyues creature euer flesh thou shalt bringe arcke euen payre male female maye lyue wt foules kynde beastes kynde maner wormes earth kinde euery one shal payre go vnto maye lyue thou shalt take vnto maner meate maye eaten shalt laye vp stoare maye meate noe dyd acordinge god commaunded vii chapter ye lorde sayde vnto noe go arcke thou thy whole house • pet 2 b haue sene righteous tyme leuit 11 cleane beastes take vnto seuen seuen male female vncleane beastes payre male female like wyse foules vnder heauen seuen seuen male female maye besede left lyue vpon whole earth yet seuen dayes wil sende raine vpon earth fourtie dayes fourtie nightes wyll destroye maner thinges haue made face earth noe dyd lorde commaunded sixe hūdreth yeare olde whan water floude came vpon earth wente arcke matt • luc 1 sonnes wyfe sonnes wyues water floude cleane beastes vncleane fethered foules crepeth vpon earth wente vnto arcke pares male female ye lorde cōmaunded whan seuen dayes past water floude came vpon earth sixe hundreth yeare no age vpon seuentene daye seconde moneth daye ye fountaynes greate depe broken vp wyndowes heauen opened came rayne vpon ye earth fourtie dayes fourtie nightes vpon selfe daye wēte noe arcke sem ham iaphet sonnes wyfe thre wyues sonnes maner beastes kynde maner catell kynde maner crepynge thinges crepe vpō earth kynde maner foules euer coude flye euer fethers kynde wente vnto noe arcke cooples flesh breth life male female maner flesh wente acordinge god commaūded lorde shut dore vpon came water floude fourtie dayes vpon earth water increased eccli▪ • bare vp arcke lift vp ouer ye earth thus water preuayled increased sore vpon earth arcke wente vpon water yee water preuayled increased sore vpon earth hye mountaynes vnder whole heauen couered fyftene cubytes hye preuayled ye water ouer mountaynes couered flesh crepte vpon earth perished foules catell beastes yt moued vpon earth men euer breth life vpon drye londe dyed thus destroyed vpon earth man beast sap •• wormes foules vnder ye heauē destroyed earth saue noe onely remayned arcke water preuayled vpon earth hundreth fiftie dayes viii chapter god remembred noe beastes catell arcke caused wynde come vpon earth ye water ceassed fountaynes depe wyndowes heauen stopte rayne heauē forbydden water ranne styll awaye ye earth decreased hundreth fiftye dayes vpon seuentene daye seuenth moneth rested arcke vpon mountaynes ararat water wēte awaye decreased vntyll tenth moneth first daye tenth moneth toppes mountaynes appeared fourtie dayes noe opened ye wyndow arcke made▪ sent forth rauen flew 〈…〉 came agayne vntyll water dryed vp vpō earth sent forth doue wete whether water fallē vpon earth ye doue coude fynde restynge place hir fete came agayne vnto arcke water yet vpon face earth put hande toke arke abode yet seuen dayes mo sent doue agayne arke returned vnto aboute euen tyde beholde broken leaf olyue tre bare hir nebb noe perceaued water abated vpon earth neuertheles taried yet seuen dayes sent forth doue came nomore agayne sixte hundreth one yeare no age vpon first daye ye first moneth water dryed vp vpon earth noe toke hatch arke sawe yt face earth drye vpon seuen twentye daye seconde moneth whole earth drye spake god vnto noe sayde go arke thou thy wyfe thy sonnes thy sonnes wyues beastes euer flesh foule catell maner wormes crepe vpon earth let go ye occupied vpon earth growe multiplye vpon earth • ene 1 noe wente sonnes wife sonnes wyues beastes also wormes foules crepte vpon earth wente arke euery one vnto like noe buylded altare vnto ye lorde leui 11 toke maner cleane beastes maner cleane foules offred brē • sacrifice vpon ye altare ye lorde smelled swete sauor sayde hert wyl hence forth curse earth nomore mās sake ymaginacion man hert euell euen youth therfore hēce forth wil nomore smyte lyueth haue done nether shall sowynge tyme haruest colde 〈◊〉 heate sommer wynter daye 〈◊〉 ceasse longe earth endure • ▪ ix chapter god blessed noe sonnes sayde vnto increace multiplye fyll earth feare also drede vpon beastes earth vpon foules vnder heauen vpon crepeth earth fyshes see geuen youre hādes moueth hath life youre meate euen grene herbe gen 1 haue geuē leui 7 c 17 onely eate flesh bloude wherin soule bloude wherin youre soule wyll requyre hande beastes soule mā wyll requyre man hande exo 21 c ye • euery man soule anothers hande sheddeth mās bloude tren 4 b mat 26 c apo 13 b bloude shal shed man agayne god made man owne licknesse ye frutefull increase gen 1 • occupied vpon earth ye maye multiplye therin farthermore god sayde vnto noe sonnes wt beholde esa 54 make couenaunt youre sede euery lyuynge creature foule catell beastes vpon earth gone arke euer beast earth thus make couenaunt • cclesias •• ci 44 b hence forth flesh shal destroyed water eny floude hence forth shall come floude destroye earth god sayde token couenaunt haue made betwene lyuynge creature amonge euermore bowe set cloudes shal token couenaunt betwene ye earth whā brynge cloudes vpon earth bowe shal appeare cloudes wyll thynke vpon couenaunt betwixte lyuynge creature maner flesh hence forth shall nomore come eny floude water destroye flesh therfore shall bowe cloudes maye loke vpon remembre euerlastynge couenaunt betwixte god liuynge creature flesh vpon earth god sayde also vnto noe tokē couenaunt haue made betwene flesh vpon earth sonnes noe wente arke sem ham iaphet ham father canaā no thre sonnes londes ouerspred noe beganne take hede vnto ye tyllinge grounde esa 5 matt 21 planted vyniarde dranke wyne dronken laye vncouered tente hā father canaan sawe father preuities tolde two brother without thē toke sem iaphet mantell put vpō shulders wente backwarde couered father secretes face turned asyde yt shulde se father preuyties whan noe awaked wyne perceaued yonger sonne done vnto sayde cursed canaan seruaunt seruauntes vnto brother sayde morouer praysed lorde god sem canaan seruaunt god increase iaphet let dwell tentes sem canaan seruaunt noe lyued floude thre hundreth fiftie yeare yt whole age ix▪ hūdreth fyftie yeare dyed x chapter generacion childrē noe sem ham iaphet begat child floude child iaphet gomer magog madai iauan tubal1 pat▪ mesech thyras childrē gomer ascenas riphat toga • child iauan elisa tharsis cithim dodanim deuided iles ye heithen countrees euery one speach kynred people childrē ham chus misraim phut canaan child chus seba heuila sabtha reyma sabthecha child reyma sheba dedā chus also begat nemrod beganne mightie earth mightie hunter sight lorde therof commeth prouerbe mightie hunter lorde like nemrod origenall kyngdome babel erech gene • acad chalne ye londe synear lōde came assur buylded niniue ye stretes ye cite calah ressen betwene ninyue calah greate cite ionae •• mizraim begat ludim enamim leabim naphtuhim pathrusim ca • uhim whence came philistynes capthorims canaā also begat zidon eldest sonne heth iebusi emori girgosi hiui arki sini aruadi zemari hamati frō whence ye kynreds ye cananites dispersed abrode ye coastes ye cananites frō sidō forth thorow gerar vnto gasa tyll thou cōmest vnto sodoma gomorra adama zeboim vnto lasa child ham kynreds tunges londes people sem ye father child eber elder brother iaphet begat childrē also child elā assur arphachad lud aram childrē aram vz hul gether ma arphachsad begat sala sala begat eber eber begat two sonnes name one peleg tyme worlde deuyded brother name iaketan iaketan begat almodad saleph hazarmaphet iarah hadoram vsal dikela obal abimael seba ophir heuila iobab ye childrē iaketan dwellynge mesa tyll thou come vnto sephar mountayne ye east ye child sem generacions tunges londes people ye generacion ye child noe kynredes people ye people vpon earth spred brode ye floude xi chapter morouer worlde one tonge language wente • ome • ade • rō 〈◊〉 towarde east founde playne ye londe synear dwelt saide one another come let v make bryck burne toke bryck stone slyme morter sayde come let v buylde cite tower whose toppe maye reach vnto heauē yt maye make v name afore scatred abrode londes came ye lorde downe se ye cite tower yt ye childrē mē buylded ye lorde saide beholde people one haue one maner language amōge thē haue begonne wil leaue yt haue purposed come let v go downe cōfounde tonge euē yt one vnderstonde another saieth deu 32 thus ye lorde scatred thē frō thēce lōdes yt left buylde cite therfore called babell lorde cōfounded language worlde thēce scatred abrode londes ye generacions sem sem hundreth yeare olde begat arphachsad two yeare floude lyued therafter fyue hūdreth yeare begat sonnes doughters arphachsad fiue thirtie yeare olde begat salah lyued therafter foure hundreth thre yeare begat sonnes doughters salah thirtie yeare olde begat eber lyued therafter foure hūdreth thre yeare begat sonnes doughters eber foure thirtie yeare olde begat peleg lyued therafter foure hundreth thirtie yeare begat sonnes doughters peleg thirtie yeare olde begat regu lyued therafter two hūdreth nyene yeare begat sonnes doughters regu two thirtie yeare olde begat serug lyued therafter two hundreth seuen yeare begat sonnes doughters serug thirtie yeare olde begat nahor lyued therafter two hundreth yeare begat sonnes doughters nahor nyene twentye yeare olde begat terah lyued herafter hundreth nyentene yeare begat sonnes doughters terah seuentie yeare olde begat abram nahor haran generation terah te rah begat abram nahor haran iosu 24 1 pa • 1 b haran begat lot harā dyed terah father ye londe borne vr chaldea abram nahor toke wyues abrams wife called sarai gen 20 c gen 22 nahors wyfe milca doughter haran father milca iisca sarai baren childe toke terah abrā straunger derth sore londe whan come nye entre egipte sayde vnto sarai wife beholde knowe yt thou art fayre woman loke vpon whan egipcians se gen 20 26 wil saye wife shal slaye saue alyue therfore lorde xiiii chapter chaunsed tyme amraphel kynge synear arioch kynge ellasar kedorlaomer kinge elam thydeal kynge ye heithen made warre wt bera ye kynge sodome wt birsa kynge gomorra sineab kynge adama semeaber kynge zeboim kynge bela called zoar came together brode valley salt see twolue yeares subiectes vnto kinge kedorlaomer thirtenth yeare fell therfore fourtenth yeare came kedorlaomer kynges yt smote giauntes astaroth karnaim susim ham emim felde kiriathaim ye horites owne mount seir vnto playne pharan bordreth vpō wildernes turned came well iudgment cades smote countre amalechites also amorites dwelt hazezon thamar wente kynge sodome kynge gomorra kynge adama kynge zeboim kynge bela called zoar prepared selues fight brode valley wt kedorlaomer kynge elam thideal ye kynge heithen amraphel ye kynge synear arioch kynge ellasar foure kynges wt fyue yt brode valley many slyme pyttes kynge sodoma gomorra put flight fell residue fled vnto ye mountaynes toke goodes sodoma gomorra vytales wente waye toke lot also abrams brother sonne good dwelt sodome departed came one escaped tolde abram aleaunt gen 13 dwelt okegroue mamre amoryte brother escol aner confederate thē chased awaye vnto hoba lieth ye left hande cite damascos 〈◊〉 39 b brought agayne goodes also brother lot goodes ye wemen also people came agayne slaughter kedorlaomer kinges kynge sodome wente toke agar hir mayde ye egipcian dwelt ten yeare londe canaan gaue vnto hir huszbande abrā wife wente vnto agar conceaued whan sawe yt conceyued despysed hir mastresse sayde sarai vnto abram must sede ye thorow posterites euery manchilde amonge shalbe circumcyded ye shall circumcyde foreskynne yor flesh shalbe token couenaunt betwene euery manchilde whan eight dayes olde 〈◊〉 2 c 〈◊〉 12 〈◊〉 2 • shalbe circūcyded thorow youre posterity like maner houszholde folkes borne home bought eny also straūger thy sede thus shall couenaunt youre flesh euerlastinge couenaunt yf shalbe manchilde vncircumcided fore skinne flesh soule shalbe roted people hath broken couenaunt god sayde vnto abraham sarai thy wyfe shall nomore called sarai sara shal hir name blesse geue sonne wil blesse people stryken age wente nomore sara ye maner wemen therfore laughed hir self sayde olde 1 pet 3 • cc • 25 lorde olde also shal yet geue self lust sayde ye lorde vnto abraham wherfore doth sara laugh saye true dede shal beare yet olde shulde eny soch thinge harde lorde • 4 b ro 9 aboute tyme yf lyue wil come agayne sara shal haue sonne sara denyed sayde laughed afrayed sayde thou dyddest laughe men stode vp thence turned towarde sodeme abraham wente brynge waye sayde lorde hyde f • om abraham ye thinge wil seynge shal greate mightie people ye people vpō earth shalbe blessed knowe wil cō maunde child housholde kepe waye ye lorde right conscience lorde maye bringe vpō abraham hath promised lorde sayde crie sodome gomorra eze 16 • greate synnes exceadinge greuous therfore go downe se whether haue done together acordinge crye • 1 come maye knowe men turned face wēte towarde sodome abraham stode still ye lorde stepte vnto sayde wilt thou destroye righteous vngodly peraduēture maye fiftie righteous within ye cite wilt thou destroye spare place fiftie righteous sake therin farre frō yt thou shuldest slaye righteous vngodly righteous shulde vngodly farre shulde iudge worlde acordinge right lorde sayde yf fynde fiftie righteous sodome cite wil spare place sake abraham answered sayde se haue taken vpon speake vnto lorde gen 2 b howbeit dust aszshes peraduenture maye fyue lesse fiftie righteous therin wilt thou de • troye whole cite fyue sayde yf fynde fyue fourtie therin destroye proceded speake vnto sayde peraduenture might fourtie founde therin sayde wil nothinge vnto fourtyes sake abraham sayde oh let lorde angrie speake yet peraduēture might thirtie founde therin sayde yf fynde thirtie therin nothinge vnto sayde se haue taken vpon speake vnto lorde peraduēture might twētie founde therin answered wyll destroye twentyes sake sayde let lorde angrie speake yet peraduenture might ten founde therin saide wil destroye ten sake lorde wente waye whan left talkynge abraham abraham returned vnto place xix chapter euenynge came two angel vnto sodome lot sat vnder gate cite whē sawe rose vp mete bowed self downe grounde vpon face sayde se lordes turne praye youre seruauntes house tarye night let youre fete waszshen maye ye ryse tomorow tymes go youre waye neuertheles sayde nay wyll byde stretes night 〈…〉 compelled sore turned vnto came house made feast baked swete cake 〈1 paragraph〉 ate wente rest men cite sodome came compased house rounde aboute yonge olde people quarter called lot sayde vnto mē came vnto night bringe vnto v 〈1 paragraph〉 maye knowe lot wente dore vnto thē shut dore sayde 〈…〉 brother wickedly beholde haue two doughters yet haue knowne man brynge vnto liketh onely nothinge vnto men god therfore come vnder shadowe rofe sayde come thou hither sayde camest thou onely herin straunger •• • b wilt thou iudge wel deale worse thē pressed sore vpon ye man lot whan ranne pet 2 b wolde haue broken vp dore men put hondes pulled lot vnto house • re▪ 6 • p 19 shut dore • n ye dore house smyttē blyndnesse small greate coude fynde dore ye men saide vnto lot hast thou yet eny sonne lawe sonnes doughters euer belongeth vnto cite brynge place must destroye place crye greate lorde hath sent v destroye wente lot forth spake sonnes lawe shulde haue maried doughters sayde stonde vp get place lorde wyll destroye cite neuertheles toke sporte whan mornynge arose angel caused lot spede sayde stonde vp cap 10 b take thy wife thy two doughters hande thou also per • synne cite whyle prolonged tyme men caught wife two doughters hande lorde mercifull vnto brought forth set without cite whē brought sayde saue thy soule loke behynde nether stonde thou countre saue thy self vpon mountayne thou perish sayde lot vnto thē oh lorde beholde moch • thy seruaūt hath founde grace thy sight make ye mercy greate thou hast shewed vnto thou sauest soule alyue saue self vpon mountayne might mysfortune fall vpon shulde dye beholde cite maye flye vnto litle one let saue litle one soule maye lyue sayde vnto beholde haue loked vpon poynte also ouerthrowe cite wherof thou hast spoken haist saue thy self nothinge tyll thou come thither therfore cite called zoar sonne vp vpon earth whan lot came zoar lorde caused brymstone fyre rayne downe lorde heauen vpon sodoma gomorra ouerthrew city esa 13 iere 50 g ose 11 b amos 4 whole region dwelt city grew vpon earth lu 17 sap 10 b wife loked behynde turned pillar salt abraham rose vp early mornynge gat vnto place gen 18 stonde lorde turned face towarde sodoma gomorra ye londe countre loked beholde rose vp smoke ye countre bene ye smoke fornace whan god destroyed ye city region thought vpon abraham conueyed lot city ouerthrew wherin lot dwelt lot departed zoar dwelt mountaynes daughter afrayed tary zoar remayned caue wt daughter sayde ye elder vnto yonger oure father olde man vpon earth come vnto v maner worlde come therfore let v geue oure father wyne drynke lye maye saue sede oure father gaue father wyne drynke night elder doughter wente leui 18 laye hir father perceaued nether laye downe ner rose vp morow elder sayde vnto yonger beholde yesternight laye father let v geue wyne drynke night also thou mayest go lye maye saue sede oure father gaue father wyne drynke night also yonger arose like wyse laye perceaued nether laye downe ner rose vp thus doughters lot childe father elder bare sonne called moab come ye moabytes vnto daye ye yonger bare sonne also called sonne ammi come child ammon vnto daye xx chapter abraham departed thence south countre dwelt betwixte cades sur straunger gerar sayde sara wife gen 12 c • nd 26 sister abimelech kinge gerar sent caused fett awaye god came abimelech night dreame sayde vnto beholde thou art deed man woman sake thou hast taken man wife neuertheles abimelech yet touched sayde lorde wilt thou sley righteous people sayde vnto sister yee sayde self also brother pure hert innocent handes haue done god sayde vnto dreame knowe thou dyddest wt pure hert therfore kepte thou shuldest synne agaynst nether haue suffred touch therfore delyuer man wife ageyne prophet let pray ye thou shalt lyue yf thou delyuer ageyne sure thou shalt dye death thine abimelech rose vp tymes mornynge called seruauntes tolde thinges eares men sore afrayed abimelech called abraham sayde vnto wherfore hast thou done vnto v haue offended ye thou shuldest brynge kyngdome greate synne thou hast dealt v man shulde deale abimelech saide morouer vnto abraham sawest thou yt thou hast done thinge abraham sayde thought peraduenture feare god actes god tempted abraham sayde vnto abraham iudit 8 eccl 44 heb 11 answered sayde take ye sonne onely sonne thine euē isaac thou louest go thy waye londe moria offre burnt offerynge vpon mountayne shal shew abraham stode vp tymes mornynge sad led asse toke two yonge men sonne isaac cloue wodd brent offerynge gat vp wente vnto place wherof lorde sayde vnto vpon thirde daye abraham lift vp eye sawe place farre sayde vnto yonge mē tary ye asse childe wyl go yonder whan haue worshipped wyll come againe abrahā toke wodd brent offerynge layed vpon isaac sonne self toke fyre knyfe hande wente vp departed vnto mesopotamia cite nahor let camel lye downe without cite besyde well water euenynge aboute tyme wemen vsed go forth drawe water sayde lorde thou god master abraham mete daye shew mercy vnto master abraham lo stonde besyde well water men doughters cite wyll come forth drawe water yf come damsell saye bowe downe thy pytcher let drynke yf saye drynke wyll geue ye camel drynke also ye thou hast prouyded thy seruaunt isaac maye knowe ye thou hast shewed mercy vpon master euer left speakynge beholde rebecca doughter bethuel sonne milca wyfe nahor abraham brother came forth bare pytcher vpon hir shulder fayre damsell face yet virgin vnknowne eny man wente downe well fylled hir pitcher came vp agayne ranne seruaunt mete sayde let drynke litle water ye pitcher sayde drynke syr haistely let downe pitcher hir hande gaue drynke whan geuen drynke sayde wyll drawe thy camel also tyll haue dronke ynough made haist poured hir pitcher trough ranne agayne well drawe drew camel mā marueyled helde tonge tyll knewe whether lorde prospered iourney whan camel dronken toke goldē earynge half sycle weight two bracelettes hir handes weynge ten sycles golde sayde doughter whose art thou tell rowme v thy father house lodge sayde vnto doughter bethuel sonne mylca bare vnto nahor gen 22 sayde morouer vnto haue plentye litter prouender rowme ynough lodge man bowed thanked lorde sayde praysed lorde god master abraham hath withdrawen mercy trueth fro master lorde hath brought waye master brother house damsell ranne tolde hir mother house rebecca brother called laban laban ranne man without well syde came reason sawe earynges bracelettes vpon sister handes herde wordes rebecca syster sayde thus spake man vnto whan came man beholde stode camel well syde sayde come reade thou loued thou blessed lorde wherfore stondest thou without haue dressed house made rowme ye camel brought man ye house vnbridled camel gaue litter prouender water wash fete men set meate neuertheles hande brought vnto father sayde father answered art thou sonne iacob sayde esau thy firstborne sonne haue done thou saydest vnto aryse syt vp eate venyson thy soule maye blesse isaac sayde vnto sonne sonne hast thou founde soone answered lorde ye god brought hande thē sayde isaac vnto iacob come neare sonne maye fele whether thou sonne esau iacob wē te vnto isaac father whan felt sayde voyce god thy father abraham god isaac 〈…〉 londe yt thou lyest vpon wyl geue vnto 〈…〉 thy sede thy sede shal ye dust ye earth thou shalt sprede forth towarde west east north south 〈…〉 thorow thy sede shall kynreds vpon earth blessed beholde ye wyll kepe euer thou goest wyl brynge hither agayne lande wil leaue tyll haue made good haue promysed whan iacob awaked slepe saide surely lorde place knew afraied sayde fearfull place nothinge el house god gate vnto heauē iacob arose early mornynge toke stone layed vnder heade set vp 〈…〉 poured oyle vpon called place bethel afore cite called lu iacob made vowe sayde yf god wyll 〈…〉 kepe iourney yt go geue bred eate clothinge put brynge peaceably home agayne vnto father thē shall lorde god stone haue set vp shal house god thou geuest wyl geue tenth therof xxix chapter iacob gat vp vpon fete wente east countre loked aboute beholde well felde ye flockes shepe therby flockes dranke well laye greate stone welles mouth thyther vsed brynge flockes roule stone ye mouth well geue shepe drynke put stone agayne vpon welles mouth place iacob sayde vnto brother whēce ye answered haran sayde vnto knowe ye laban sonne nahor answered knowe well 〈◊〉 4 • c sayde good health answered good health lo commeth doughter rachel shepe sayde yet hye daye yet tyme dryue catell geue shepe drynke go youre waye fede answered tyll flockes brought together tyll roule stone welles mouth geue shepe drynke whyle yet talked rachel came hir father shepe kepte ye shepe whan iacob sawe rachel ye doughter laban mother brother shepe laban mother brother wē te rouled stone welles mouth gaue mother brother shepe drynke kyssed rachel lift vp voyce wepte tolde yt hir father brother ye sonne rebecca ranne tolde father whā laban herde iacob sister sonne ranne mete enbraced kyssed brought house tolde matter thē sayde laban vnto wel thou art bone flesh abyde moneth longe saide vnto iacob thou art brother shalt thou therfore serue nought tell shall thy wage laban two doughters eldest called lea yongest rachel lea tender eyed rachel beutyfull well fauoured face iacob loued well sayde serue seuen yeare rachel thy yongest doughter laban answered better geue vnto another tary thou iacob serued seuen yeare rachel semed vnto dayes loued well iacob saide vnto laban geue wyfe tyme come shulde lye thē laban bad people place made mariage euē toke doughter lea brought vnto laye wt laban gaue zilpa mayde vnto doughter lea hir mayde morow beholde lea sayde vnto laban hast thou done vnto haue serued ye rachel hast thou begyled laban answered maner oure countre mary yongest eldest holde weke geue also seruyce yt thou shalt yet seuen yeares iacob dyd helde yt weke gaue rachel doughter wyfe laban gaue bilha mayden vnto rachel doughter hir mayden laye rachel also loued rachel thē lea serued yet seuen yeares lorde sawe lea nothinge regarded made frutefull rachel baren lea cōceaued bare sonne called ruben1 par 2 sayde lorde hath loked vpon aduersite wyll huszbande loue conceaued agayne bare sonne sayde lorde hath herde despysed hath geuē also called symeon cōceaued yet agayne bare sonne sayde wyll huszbande kepe company agayne haue borne thre sonnes therfore called name leui conceaued ye fourth tyme bare sonne sayde wyll geue thankes vnto lorde therfore called iuda left bearynge xxx chapter rachel sawe bare child vnto iacob enuye hir sister saide vnto iacob geue childrē also el deed iacob wroth rachel sayde god steade kepeth ye frute ye wombe ye neuertheles sayde beholde bilha mayden lye wt yt maye beare vpon lappe maye increased gaue bilha hir mayden wyfe iacob laye bilha conceaued bare iacob sonne sayde rachel god hath geuen sentence syde herde voyce geuē sonne therfore called dan bilha rachel mayde cōceaued agayne bare another sonne vnto iacob sayde rachel god hath turned sister haue gottē vpperhande called nephthali whan lea sawe left bearynge toke silpa hir mayde gaue vnto iacob wyfe silpa lea mayde bare iacob sonne saide lea good lucke called gad silpa lea mayde bare iacob another sonne sayde lea well doughters call blessed called asser ruben wente tyme ye wheate haruest founde mandragora felde brought home vnto mother lea sayde rachel vnto lea geue ye sonnes mādragoras answered hast thou ynough thou hast taken awaye huszbande wilt take awaye sonnes mandragora also rachel saide wel let lye night thy sonnes mandragora whan iacob came home euen felde lea wente forth mete sayde thou shalt lye wt haue bought sonnes mandragora slepte night god herde lea conceaued bare iacob fifth sonne sayde god hath rewarded gaue mayden vnto huszbande called isachar lea conceaued yet agayne bare iacob sixte sonne sayde god hath endewed good dowry wyll huszbande dwell agayne haue borne sixe sonnes called zabulon bare doughter called ge 34 dina neuertheles god thought vpō rachel herde made frutefull conceaued bare sonne sayde god hath taken awaye rebuke called ioseph1 par 2 sayde god geue yet another sonne whan rachel borne ioseph iacob sayde vnto laban • 11 let go departe place vnto myne owne lande geue wyues child haue serued yt maye go thou knowest seruyce haue done laban sayde vnto fynde fauoure thy sight perceaue god hath blessed thy sake gen • appoynte thou rewarde yt shal geue saide vnto thou knowest haue serued maner catell thou hast vnder thou haddest litle afore came hither growne multitude lorde hath blessed yt sake whan shall loke myne owne house also saide shal geue iacob sayde thou shalt geue nothinge yf thou wilt yt saye wyll fede kepe thy shepe agayne wyll go thorow thy flockes daye separate thou amonge shepe spotted partye coloured blacke shepe amonge lambes loke shalbe partie coloured spotted amōge kyddes shal rewarde shal righteousnes testifie daye tomorow whan cōmeth vnto rewarde euer spotted partye coloured amonge kyddes blacke amō ge lambes let theft sayde laban beholde let thou hast sayde daye sundered speckled partye coloured goates spotted partye coloured kyddes eny whyte vpon black amonge lambes put vnder hande child made rowme thre dayes iourney wyde betwixte iacob iacob kepte residue laban flocke iacob toke staues grene wyllies hasell chestnottrees pylled whyte strekes layed staues pylled drynkinge troughes flocke came drynke shulde conceaue whan came drynke flockes conceaued ouer ye staues brought forth speckelde spotted partye coloured iacob parted ye lambes put flocke vnto spotted blacke laban flocke put vnto spotted made flocke owne put vnto laban flocke neuertheles first buckynge tyme flockes layed staues drynkinge troughes eye flockes shulde conceaue ouer staues latter buckynge tyme layed later laban firstlinges iacobs thus man became exceadinge riche many shepe maydens seruauntes camel ass xxxi chapter herde also ye wordes laban child sayde iacob hath brought father good vnto self oure father good hath gotten rich iacob behelde laban countenaunce beholde towarde yesterdaye yeryesterdaye lorde sayde vnto gen • 2 b departe agayne thy fatherlāde thy kynred wyll sent iacob bad call rachel lea felde flockes sayde vnto se youre father countenaunce towarde like yesterdaye yeryesterdaye god father hath bene ye knowe haue serued youre father power hath disceaued chaunged wage ten tymes god hath suffred harme yf sayde partye coloured shalbe thy rewarde whole flocke bare partye coloured yf sayde speckelde shalbe thy rewarde thē whole flocke bare speckelde thus hath god drawen youre father goodes geuen vnto whan buckynge tyme came lift vp myne eye sawe dreame beholde rammes leapte vpon flocke speckelde spotted partye coloured angel god sayde vnto dreame iacob answered sayde lift vp thine eye beholde rammes leape vpon speckelde spotted partie coloured flocke haue sene yt laban doth vnto ye god bethel gen • 8 thou dyddest anoynte stone maydest vowe vnto get vp departe londe go agayne londe thy kynred answered rachel lea sayde vnto v haue porcionner inheritaūce oure father house hath coūted v straūgers hath solde v spent vp wage therfore hath god withdrawē father rich vnto v oure child euer god hath sayde vnto iacob gat vp set child wyues vpon camel caried awaye catell substaunce gotten mesopotamia yt might come vnto isaac father lande canaan gen 38 • 2 13 • labā gone clyppe flocke rachel stale hir father gen 35 • ymages thus dyd iacob steale awaie ye hert laban ye syrian yt tolde fled fled gat vp passed ouer water wente straight towarde mount gilead vpon thirde daye tolde laban iacob fled toke brethrē vnto folowed seuen dayes iourney ouertoke vpon mount gilead god came vnto laban syrian dreame night sayde vnto bewarre thou speake nothinge iacob good labā drew nye vnto iacob iacob pytched tente vpon mount laban brethrē pytched tent also vpon mount gilead sayde laban vnto iacob hast thou done thou hast stollen awaie hert caried awaye doughters though bene taken captyue wt ye swerde wherfore keptest thou secrete thou woldest flye hast stollen awaye fro toldest might haue brought waye myrth synginge tabrettes harpes hast suffred kysse child doughters thou hast done foolishly moch might haue made coude haue done euell youre father god saide yesterdaye vnto bewarre thou speake nothinge vnto iacob good moch thou woldest nedes departe longedest sore ye father house hast thou stollen away goddes iacob answered sayde vnto laban afrayed thou shuldest haue taken away thy doughters fro loke thou fyndest thy goddes let dye oure brother seke thine take awaye knew rachel stollen wente laban iacobs tent lea tent maydens tētes founde nothinge lea tente wente rachel tent toke rachel ymages layed vnder camel strawe sat downe vpon laban searched whole tent founde nothinge sayde vnto hir father angrie lorde ryse vp vnto goeth wt maner wemen sought founde ymages iacob wroth chode laban answered sayde vnto haue trespased offended yt thou art whote vpon thou hast searched housholde stuff hast thou founde thy housholde stuff laye brother thyne yt maye iudge betwene v twentye yeare haue bene wt thy shepe goates haue bene vnfrutefull rammes thy flocke haue eaten loke ex 22 b torne beastes brought vnto yt fayne paie self thou requyredest hand • whether stollen fro daye night daye tyme heate cōsumed frost night slepe departed fro myne eye thus haue serued twentye yeare thy house fourtene yeares thy doughters sixe thy flocke ten tymes hast thou chaunged rewarde yf god father god abraham feare isaac bene syde thou haddest latten go awaye emptye god hath loked vpon myne aduersite laboure rebuked yesterdaye laban answered sayde doughters doughters child childrē flockes flockes thou seist myne daye vnto doughters child haue borne therfore come let v make couenaunt thou maye wytnesse betwene toke iacob stone set vp piler markstone sayde vnto brother gather stone toke stone made heape ate vpon heape labā called iegar sahadutha iacob called gilead either properte language sayde laban hosu 22 f • 24 f heape wytnesse betwene daye therfore called gilead testimony sayde lorde loke betwene ye whan departed ye one ye yf thou vexe doughters take wyues vnto mā v lo god wytnesse betwene laban sayde morouer vnto iacob beholde heape marckstone haue set vp betwixte heape wytnesse marckstone also wytnesse yf passe ouer vnto yf thou passe ouer heape marckstone vnto eny harme god abraham god nahor god father iudge betwene v iacob sware vnto feare father isaac iacob offred offerynge vpon mount called brethrē eate bred whan eaten taried vpon mount night vpon morow laban rose vp early kyssed childrē doughters blessed thē departed came agayne vnto place iacob wente iourney angel god met whan sawe sayde god hoost called place mahanaim xxxii chapter iacob sent messaungers brother esau io • • lande seir felde edom commaunded thē sayde saye thus vnto lorde esau thy seruaunt iacob sendeth ye worde haue bene wt laban haue bene hither amonge straungers haue ox ass shepe seruauntes maydēs haue sent forth shewe lorde yt might fynde fauoure thy sight messaungers came agayne vnto iacob sayde came vnto thy brother esau commeth forth also agaynst foure hundreth men iacob sore afrayed wyst waye turne deuyded people shepe ox camel two droues sayde yf esau come vpon one droue smyte shal escape iacob sayde morouer god father abrahā god father isaac lorde thou saydest vnto ge • • departe agayne thine owne londe thy kynred wyl good litle mercy trueth thou hast shewed vnto thy seruaunt staff whan wente ouer iordan become two droues delyuer ye hande brother frō hāde esau afrayed lest come smyte mother child thou saydest wyll good wyll make thy sede sonde ye see nombred multitude taried night toke soch came hande present vnto brother esau two hūdreth goates1 • twentye goates two hundreth shepe twentye rammes thirtie mylck camel wt foales fourtye kyne ten bullockes twentye ass ten foales put handes seruauntes euery flock selues sayde vnto go ye forth put space betwixte one flocke commaunded first sayde brother esau meteth axeth whose art thou whyther goest thou whose thou dryuest thou shalt saye thy seruaunt iacobs sendeth present vnto lorde esau commeth behynde v self thus commaunded seconde also thirde folowed flockes sayde like haue tolde speake ye vnto esau whan ye mete saye vnto also beholde yt seruaūt iacob behynde v thought wyll reconcyle present goeth warde wyll se self peraduenture shall receaue grace present wente taried tente night rose vp ye night toke two wyues two maydens eleuen sonnes wente vnto foorde iacob toke caried ouer water came ouer taried self alone syde ose 12 wrestled man vntyll breake ye daye whan sawe yt might ouercome touched senowe thye ye senowe thye shrancke wrestlinge sayde let go ye daye breaketh answered let yt go excepte thou blesse sayde thy name gen 35 b • 18 answered iacob sayde thou shalt nomore called iacob israel thou hast stryuen god men hast preuayled iacob axed sayde tell ye name sayde iudi • 13 c axest thou name blessed iacob called place peniel haue sene god face face soule recouered came ouer frō peniel ye sonne rose vpō halted vpon thye therfore eate child israel vane vpon senow ye thye vnto daye ye vane vpon senow iacobs thye touched xxxiii chapter iacob lift vp eye sawe brother esau cōmynge foure hundreth men deuyded child vnto lea vnto rachel maydēs set maydens child lea hir childrē rachel ioseph hynder wente bowed self grounde seuen tymes tyll came brother ge 27 g esau ranne mete enbraced fell aboute neck kyssed wepte lift vp eye sawe wyues child sayde answered child god hath geuen vnto thy seruaunt maydens came forth child dyd obeysaunce vnto lea came forth also hir childrē kneled vnto afterwarde came ioseph rachel forth kneled vnto like wyse sayde meanest thou wt droue met answered might fynde grace sight lorde esau sayde haue ynough brother kepe thou hast iacob answered oh nay yf haue founde grace ye sight receaue present hande sawe thy face2 19 c hest 15 b though sene face god one take present good worth haue brought ye god hath geuen haue ynough thinges compelled take sayde let v go take oure iourney wyll go thy company sayde vnto lorde thou knowest haue tender child small greate catell also yet yonge yf shulde dryuē ouer one daye whole flocke wolde dye let lorde go seruaūt wyll dryue fayre softly catell child go tyll come lorde seir esau sayde yet wil leaue people answered nede let onely fynde grace sight lorde esau departed againe daye towarde seir iacob toke iourney towarde sucoth buylded house made tētes catell therfore place called sucoth afterwarde came iacob peaceably vnto cite sichem lyeth ye lande canaan gen 28 • come agayne mesopotamia pitched cite iosu 24 • bought pece londe child hemor ye father sichem reade hū dreth lā be hundreth pen pitched tent set vp altare called vpon name mightie god israel xxxiiii chapter dina ye doughter lea bare vnto iacob wente beholde doughters londe whan sichem sonne hemor henite lorde lōde sawe toke laye forced hert hanged vpon loued ye damsell talked louyngly spake father hemor get mayden wife iacob vnderstode dina doughter defyled sonnes catell felde iacob helde tonge tyll came hemor father sichem wente forth vnto iacob comen meane season came iacobs sonnes ye felde whan herde greued men wroth wrought foly israel lyen iacobs doughter vse comened hemor thē sayde sonne sichems hert longeth youre doughter ge • e hir wife make frendshipe v geue v youre doughters take ye oure doughters dwell v londe shall open vnto dwell occupie haue youre possession therin sichem sayde vnto hir father brother let fynde grace loke ye appoynte geue requyre dowrye gift hardely wyll geue acordinge ye wyll axe onely geue damsell wife iacobs sonnes answered sichem hemor father spake disceatfully sister dina defyled sayde vnto geue oure sister vncircumcided man shame vnto v neuertheles wyll consente vnto yf ye wylbe like vnto v circumcided many male amonge geue oure doughters take youre doughters vnto v dwell one people yf ye wyll herken vnto v circumcided wyl take oure doughter go oure waye wordes pleased hemor sonne wel yonge man defe • de lust iacobs doughter holden honoure aboue father house came hemor sichem sonne vnder ye gate cite comened citisens cite saide men peaceable v dwell lande occupye londe brode sydes wyl take doughters vnto v geue oure doughters wyll consent vnto v dwell v one people v yf circumcyse men child amonge v like circumcysed catell goodes haue shal yf consent vnto maye dwel v herkened vnto hemor sichem sonne many wente ye gate cite circumcided male wente cite vpon thirde daye whan panefull two sonnes iacob simeon leui dinas brother iud • • toke euery man swerde wente boldly cite ge▪ • slew male slew hemor also sichem sonne edge swerde toke sister dina sichems house wente waye came iacobs sonnes ouer slayne spoyled cite defyled sister toke shepe ox ass euer cite londe maner goodes child wyues toke captyue spoyled yt house iacob sayde vnto symeon leui ye haue brought passe yt stynke inhabiters lande ye cananites pheresites small nombre yf gather selues together shal slaye shal destroyed house answered shulde thē deale oure sister whoore xxxv chapter god youre selues chaunge youre clothes let v get vp go vnto bethel maye make altare vnto god herde tyme trouble 〈◊〉 28 • hath bene waye haue gone gaue straunge goddes vnder handes earynges buried vnder oke stode besyde sichem departed came feare god vpon city laye roūde aboute folowed ye sonnes iacob came iacob vnto lu ye lande canaan called bethel people buylded altare called ye place bethel lorde kynges shall come thy loynes lande gaue vnto abraham isaac wyll geue vnto wyl geue vnto thy sede god departed ye place talked wt iacob set vp piler stone place talked poured drynk offerynges theron poured oyle vpon iacob called ye place god talked bethel departed bethel whan yet felde brode ephrath rachel traueyled byrth came harde vpon hir whan soch payne trauelynge • 4 ye myd wife sayde vnto feare thou shalt haue sonne also hir soule departynge yt must dye called ben oni neuertheles father called hī bē iamin gen 4 • b rachel died buried waye towarde ephrath called bethlehē iacob set vp piller vpon hir graue rachel grauestone vnto daye israel departed pitched tent beyonde tower • ich 4 b eder chaunsed▪ israel dwelt londe ruben wente ge 49 laye bilha father concubyne came israel eares iacob twolue sonnes sonnes lea ruben iacobs first borne sonne simeon leui iuda isachar zabulō sonnes rachel ioseph ben iamin sonnes bilha raches mayde dan nepthali sonnes silpa lea mayde gad aser ye sonnes iacob borne vnto mesopotamia came father isaac mamre head cite called hebron abrahā isaac straūgers isaac hundreth foure score yeare olde fell sicke dyed gathered vnto people whan olde lyued ynough sonnes esau iacob buried xxxvi chapter generaciō esau called edom esau toke wyues doughters canaan ge 27 ada doughter elō hethite ahalibama doughter ana childes childe zibeon heuyte basmath ge 28 b ismaels doughter sister nebaioth adabare eliphas vnto esau basmath bare reguel ahalibama bare ie • iaelam korah childrē esau yt borne vnto lande canaan esau toke wiues sonnes doughters soules house substaunce catell goodes gotten lande canaan wente countre awaye frō brother iacob substaunce greate coude dwell together londe wherin straungers might holde goodes esau dwelt vpon mount seir esau edom ye generaciō esau whō come ye edomites vpon ye mount seir ye name childrē esau eliphas ye sonne ada esau wife reguel ye sonne basmath esau wife sonnes eliphas theman omar zepho gaetham
