childe zibeon bare vnto esau ieus iaelam korah 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 prynces amōge childrē esau child eliphas first sonne esau prynce theman ye prynce omar prynce zepho prynce kenas prynce korah prynce gaethan prynce amaleck prynces eliphas lāde edō child ada child roguel esau sonne ye prynce nahath ye prynce serah ye prynce sāma ye prynce misa ye prynces reguel ye londe ye edomites ye child basmath esau wife child ahalibama esau wife prynce icu ye prince iaelam prynce korah prynces ahalibama ye doughter ana esau wife ye childrē esau prince edom child seir ye horite yt dwelt londe lothan sobal zibeon ana dison ezer disan prynces horites child seir londe idumea ye childrē lothan hori hemā lothās sister called ge 36 b thimna child sobal aluā manahat ebal sepho onā childrē zibeō aia ana ana yt foūde leu 19 c mule ye wyldernes whā kepte father zibeons ass child ana dison ahalibama yt ye doughter ana childrē dison hemdan eszban iethrā charan child ezer bilhan seauā ackan child disan vz aran ye prīces ye horites prince lothan ye prynce sobal ye prynce zibeō ye prynce ana ye prynce dison ye prince ezer ye prynce disan prynces horites ruled ye londe seir kynges reigned londe edumea childrē israel eny kynge these1 pa • 1 bela ye sonne beor kynge edumea ye name cite dinhaba whā bela died iobab ye sonne serah bosra kinge steade iobab dyed husam ye lōde themanites kynge steade whan husam dyed hadad ye sonne bedad slewe ye madianites ye moabites felde kinge steade name cite auith whan hadad dyed samla masreck kinge steade whā samla died saul rehoboth ye water syde kinge steade whan saul dyed baal hanā sonne achbor kynge steade whā baal hanā sonne achbor dyed hadad kinge steade name cite pagu wife name meher abeel doughter matred doughter mesahab thus prince esau called kynreds place name prynce thymna ye prynce alua ye prynce ietheth prynce ahalibama prynce ela prynce pynon prynce kenas ye prynce theman ye prince mibzar prince magdiel ye prynce irā prynces edumea like dwelt ye lāde possession esau ye father ye edomites xxxvii chapter iacob dwelt ye lande wherin father straunger namely lāde canaā ye generaciōs iacob ioseph seuētene yeare olde whā became keper catell wt brother lad wt child bilha silpa father wyues tolde father ye euell reporte yt thē israel loued ioseph thē childrē begottē olde age made cote many coloures whā brethrē sawe yt father loued thē brethrē euell wyll coude speake frēdl • worde vnto hī ioseph also dre • tolde brethrē therof thē hate • ye sayde heare praye dreamed thought byndinge sheeues vpō ye felde shefe arose stode vp youre sheeues rounde aboute made obeysaunce vnto shefe sayde brethrē vnto shalt thou kinge haue domyniō ouer v hated yet ye dreame wordes yet another dreame tolde brethrē saide beholde yet another dreame thought ye sonne ye moone eleuen starres made obeisaūce whā tolde father brethrē father reproued sayde vnto maner dreame yt thou hast dreamed shall thy mother thy brother come fall ye vpon groūde brethrē envie father marcked sayenge whā brother gone forth kepe father catell sichē israel sayde vnto ioseph ye brother kepe catell sichem come wil sende vnto thē answered 〈1 paragraph〉 sayde go thy waye loke whether well wt thy brother ye catell brynge worde agayne sent valley hebron go vnto sichem certayne man founde wandringe waye felde axed sayde sekest thou answered seke brother tell pray kepe man sayde gone hence herde saye let v go vnto dothan folowed ioseph brother founde dothan whan sawe farre afore came thē deuysed sleye sayde one another lo cōmeth dreamer 〈…〉 come let v sley cast pytt saye wicked beast hath deuoured thē shal sene dreames ruben herde wolde haue delyuered handes sayde 〈◊〉 42 c let v sley soule ruben sayde morouer vn shed bloude cast pytt yt wyldernes laye ye hādes vpon wolde haue delyuered hādes yt might haue brought agayne vnto father whan ioseph came brethrē stryped cote partye coloured cote vpon toke cast pytt pytt emptye water sat downe eate meane season lift vp eye sawe cō pany ismaelites cōmynge gilead camel barespyces balme myrre goinge downe egipte saide iuda vnto brethrē helpeth v sleye oure brother hyde bloude come let v sell vnto ismaelites oure handes defyled vpon oure brother oure flesh bloude herkened vnto madianites marchaunt men wente drew ioseph pytt solde vnto ismaelites twē tye syluer pen brought egipte act 7 b whan ruben came agayne vnto pytt founde ioseph therin rent clothes came agayne brethrē sayde lad yonder whyther shal go toke iosephs cote slewe goate dypped cote ye blonde sent awaye partie coloured cote caused brought vnto father sayde haue founde loke whether thy sonnes coate knewe sayde sonnes coate ge 44 wicked beast hath deuoured rauyshinge beast hath rauyshed ioseph iacob rēte clothes put sackcloth aboute loynes mourned sonne longe season sonnes doughters came vnto cōforte wolde cōforted saide sorowe wil go downe graue vnto sonne father wepte madianites solde egipte vnto potiphar pharaos chefe marshall psa 104 c xxxviii chapter fortuned time yt iuda wente downe frō brother gat man called hyra odollam iuda sawe mā canaās doughter called sua toke whē lyen conceaued bare sonne called er conceaued agayne bare son whō called onā proceaded yet bare sonne whō called sela whā borne left bearinge iuda gaue first sonne er wife whose name thamar wicked lorde therfore lorde slew sayde iuda vnto sonne onan go lie thy brother wife marye thyself thou mayest rayse vp sede vnto thy brother onan knewe sede shulde owne whan laye brother wife deut 25 • let fall vpon earth destroyed yt shulde geue sede vnto brother thinge dyd displeased lorde sore slewe also sayde iudas vnto thamar sonnes wyfe remayne wyddow thy father house tyll sonne sela growne thought peraduenture might dye also like brother thamar wente hir waye remained hir father house whā many dayes past ye doughter sua iudas wife dyed whan iuda left mournynge wente vp vnto thimnath ge 31 c 2 1 • c clyppe shepe shepherde hyra odollam tolde thamar beholde thy father lawe goeth vp vnto thimnath clyppe shepe put ye wyddowes garmentes vpon couered dysgysed hir self sat hir downe without porte waye syde towarde thymnath sawe sela growne geuen vnto wife whan iuda sawe thought bene whoore couered hir face gat waye saide praye let lye knewe doughter lawe answered wilt thou geue thou mayest lie sayde wil sende kydd flocke answered geue pledge tyll thou sende sayde pledge wilt thou geue answered thy signet thy bracelet thy staff thou hast thy hā de gaue laye childe gat hir vp wente hir waye layed hir cloke put hir wyddowes garmē te agayne iuda sent kydd shepherde odolla fetch pledge agayne woman founde axed men place sayde whoore yt sat without waye answered hath whoore bene came agayne vnto iuda saide haue founde morouer ye men place saide hath whoore bene iuda sayde let take vnto lest happly shamed haue sent kydd thou hast founde thre monethes tolde iuda thamar thy doughter lawe hath plaied whoore beholde whordome gotten childe iuda sayde brynge forth maye brent whan brought forth sent vnto hir father lawe sayde man yt oweth wt childe sayde knowest thou whose signet bracelet staff iuda knewe thē sayde righteous thē gaue hir sonne sela laye nomore whan tyme came shulde delyuered two twyns founde hir wombe trauelynge one put hande mydwife toke boūde reed threde aboute saide shal come first whan pluckte hande agayne brother came forth sayde wherfore rent mayde thy sake called 〈1 paragraph〉 phares afterwarde came brother forth ye reed threde aboute hande called zarah xxxix chapter ioseph brought downe egipte 〈…〉 potiphar egipciā pharaos chefe marshall bought ye ismaelites yt brought downe ye lorde wt ioseph moch yt became luckye mā master ye egipcians house master sawe yt lorde wt euer dyd lorde made prospere hāde yt founde fauor master sight seruaunt made ruler house put vnder hande tyme forth made ruler house goodes ye lorde blessed egipcians house iosephs sake nothynge blessynge lorde yt ye house felde therfore left yt iosephs hande medled nothinge saue onely bred ate ioseph fayre bewtye well fauoured offace fortuned actes master wife cast hir eye vpon ioseph sayde slepe denyed saide vnto beholde master knoweth ye house hath hath put vnder hande man greate house hath kepte nothinge fro excepte thou art wife shulde greate euell synne agaynst god spake soch wordes vnto ioseph daylie neuertheles herkened vnto slepe company fortuned vpon tyme ioseph wente house busynesse none ye folkes house thereby caught garment sayde slepe left garment hir hande fled gat house whā sawe left garmēt hir hande fled called folkes house sayde vnto thē lo hath brought v hebrue v shame came vnto slepe cried loude voyce whan herde made noyse cried left garmēt fled ranne layed vp garmēt tyll master came home tolde euen wordes sayde hebrue seruaunt thou broughtest vnto v came shame whan made noyse cried left garment fled whan master herde wordes wyfe tolde sayde thus hath hebrue seruaunt done vnto wroth master toke put preson 〈◊〉 4 c wherin kinges presoners laie laye preson lorde mercy vpon caused fynde fauor sight officer ye preson committed presoners preson vnto hādes euer done might done officer preson sawe yt lorde yt vnder handes euer dyd lorde made come prosperously passe xl chapter fortuned ye kynge egiptes chefe butlar ye chefe baker offended lorde kynge egipte pharao angrie wt caused put preson ye chefe marshal house ioseph laye presoner chefe marshall put ioseph vnto yt might serue preson season dreamed butlar baker one night euery mā owne dreame euery dreame interpretaciō mornynge whan ioseph came vnto sawe loked sadly axed sayde loke ye sadly daye answered haue dreamed haue man declare vnto v ioseph sayde interpretinge belongeth vnto god tell yet chefe butlar tolde ioseph dreame saide vnto dreamed vyne thre braunches budded grewe bare blossom grape therof rype pharaos cuppe hande toke grape wronge thē ye cuppe gaue pharao cuppe hāde ioseph sayde interpretaciō thre braunches thre dayes ouer thre dayes shall pharao take putt thine office agayne thou mayest geue cuppe hande olde maner whā thou wast butlar whan thou art thy prosperite thynke vpon shewe kyndnesse thou mayest certifie pharao yt maie bringe house preuely caried lande hebrues also haue done nothinge shulde haue put dongeon whan chefe baker sawe interpretacion good sayde vnto ioseph dreamed bare thre wyker baskettes vpon heade ye vppermost baszket maner bakē meates vnto pharao foules ate baszket vpon heade ioseph answered sayde interpretacion thre baszkettes thre dayes thre dayes shall pharao take hange vpon galowe foules shal eate thy flesh ye vpon thirde daye came passe pharao helde mat 14 byrth daye made feast vnto seruauntes toke chefe butlar chefe baker seruauntes restored chefe butlar butlarshipe agayne reached cuppe pharaos hande chefe baker caused hanged like ioseph interpretated vnto neuerthelesse chefe butlar thought ioseph forgat xli chapter two yeares pharao dreame stode water syde beholde water came seuen goodly kyne fatfleshed wente fedinge medowe sawe seuen kyne come water euell fauoured leane fleshed wente kyne vpon ye water syde euell fauoured leene kyne ate vp seuen goodly fatt kyne pharao awaked slepte agayne dreamed seconde tyme sawe seuen eares corne grewe vpon one stalke full good afterwarde sawe seuē thynne 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 blasted eares come vp seuen thynne eares deuoured seuen greate full eares pharao awaked sawe dreame whan daye sprete troubled sente caused call soythsayers egipte wyse men tolde dreame none coude tell pharao interpretacion spake chefe butlar vnto pharao saide daye remembre fawte whan pharao angrie seruauntes put preson ye chefe baker ye chefe marshal house dreamed one night euery mā dreame hauinge owne interpretacion v yonge man hebrue chefe marshal seruaunt vnto tolde declared oure dreames vnto v vnto euery mā acordinge dreame declared vnto v came passe restored vnto myne office hanged pharao sent called ioseph let dongeon let shauen chaunged clothes came vnto pharao saide pharao vnto haue dreamed dreame man interprete haue herde tell whā thou hearest dreame thou declarest ioseph answered pharao sayde god shall geue pharao prosperous answere yee well without pharao sayde vnto ioseph dreamed stode water syde beholde water came seuen kyne fatfleshed goodly wente fedinge ye medowe sawe seuē kyne come thynne euell fauoured leenfleshed euell fauoured sawe neuer lande egipte seuen leene euell fauoured kyne ate vp seuen first fat kyne whan eatē vp man conde perceaue eaten euell fauoured afore awaked sawe agayne dreame seuen eares corne growinge vpō one stalke full good afterwarde spronge vp seuen wythred eares thynne blasted seuen thynne eares deuoured seuen good eares haue shewed vnto soithsayers tell nothinge therof ioseph answered pharao pharaos dreames one god sheweth pharao wil seuen good kyne seuen yeares seuen good eares seuen yeares also one dreame seuen leene euell fauoured kyne came vp seuen yeares seuen thynne blasted eares shalbe seuen yeares derth thinge tolde pharao god sheweth pharao wyll beholde shal come seuen yeares wt greate plenteousnes ye whole lande egipte shall come seuen yeares derth plenteousnes shalbe forgotten ye lande egipte derth shall consume lande plenteousnes shal perceaued lande derth commeth therafter shall greate pharao dreamed seconde tyme signifieth thinge surely prepared god god wil shortly brynge passe let pharao prouyde man vnderstondinge wyszdome maye set ouer lande egipte se ordene officer londe take ye fifth parte lande egipte seuen plenteous yeares gather ye foode yt shal come plenteous yeares maye laye vp corne vnder pharaos power sustenaunce city kepe yt maye foode founde prepared lande seuen deare yeares shall come vpon lande egipte lande destroyed honger sayenge pleased pharao well seruaūtes pharao sayde vnto seruauntes might fynde soch man sprete god sayde vnto iosep moch god hath shewed ye none soch vnderstondinge wyszdome thou thou shalt ouer house acordinge vnto thy worde shall people obeye 〈…〉 onely kynges seate wyll thou sayde beholde haue set ouer whole lande egipte toke ringe hāde gaue ioseph hāde clothed whyte sylke honge cheyne golge aboute neck made ryde vpō seconde charet caused proclamed men shulde bowe knee vnto whō pharao set ouer whole lande egipte pharao sayde vnto ioseph pharao without thy wyll came asnath doughter potiphar prest bare vnto • en 46 c first called manasses god sayde hath caused forget laboure father house seconde called ephraim god sayde hath caused growe ye lande trouble whan ye seuen plenteous yeares ended egipte beganne seuen deare yeares come act 7 b wherof ioseph sayde derth landes lāde egipte foode whan lande egipte beganne suffre honger also people cryed vnto pharao bred pharao sayde vnto ye egipcians go vnto ioseph sayeth vnto yt doo whan derth ye lāde ioseph opened yt solde vnto egipcians thus ye derth preuayled lande countrees came egipte bye ioseph derth mightie landes xlii chapter whan iacob sawe moch corne egipte sayde vnto sonnes gape ye beholde heare moch come egipte go downe bye v corne yt maie lyue dye iosephs ten brethrē wente downe bye corne egipte ben iamyn iosephs brother iacob wolde let go wt brethrē sayde mysfortune might happen vnto ye childrē israel came bye corne amonge yt came wt derth also ye lande canaan ioseph gouernoure lande solde corne vnto people lande whā brethrē came fell downe grounde vpon face sawe knewe thē helde straunge towarde talked roughly saide vnto whence come ye sayde lande canaan bye vytayle neuertheles though knewe yet knewe ioseph thought vpon ye dreames dreamed gen 37 sayde vnto ye spyes come se lande open answered lorde thy seruauntes come bye vytayle one man sonnes vnfayned thy seruauntes neuer spyes sayde vnto thē ye come se lande open answered thy seruauntes twolue brother sonnes one man lāde canaan yongest oure father one awaye ioseph sayde vnto sayde vnto spyes ye wyll proue life pharao ye shall yet hence excepte youre yongest brother come hither sende awaye one fetch youre brother ye shalbe preson thus wyll trye yor wordes whether ye go aboute wt trueth el life pharao ye spyes put thē together warde thre dayes longe vpon thirde daye sayde vnto thē yf ye wil lyue thē thus feare god yf ye vnfayned let one youre brother lye bounde youre preson go ye youre waye cary home necessary foode brynge youre yongest brother wyll beleue youre wordes ye shall dye dyd sayde one another haue deserued oure brother sawe anguysh soule whan besought v wolde heare therfore cōmeth trouble vpon v ruben answered saide tolde ye whan sayde ge 37 synne agaynst ye lad ye wolde heare bloude requyred knew ioseph vnderstode spake vnto thē interpreter turned wepte whan turned agayne talked wt toke symon amonge bounde eye commaunded fyll sackes wt corne put euery man money sack geue euery one expense waye done vnto laded corne vpon ass departed thence whan one opened sacke geue asse prouender inne spyed money sack mouth sayde vnto brother money restored agayne lo sack hertes fayled afrayed amonge selues sayde wherfore hath god done vnto v whan came home iacob father lāde canaan tolde happened vnto sayde man lorde londe spake roughly v toke v spyes countre whan answered vnfayned neuer spyes twolue brother sonnes oure father one awaye yongest yet daye wt oure father lande canaan sayde hereby wyl marke ye vnfayned leaue one youre brother take foode necessary youre house go youre waye brynge youre yongest brother vnto shal knowe ye spyes vnfayned thē shal delyuer youre brother also ye maye occupie lande whan opened sackes euery man founde boundell money sacke whā father sawe bundels money afrayed sayde iacob father ye haue robbed child ioseph awaye simeon awaye ye take ben iamin awaye goeth ouer ruben answered father sayde yf brynge againe slaye two sonnes delyuer hande wyl brynge agayne vnto sayde sonne shal go downe brother deed left alone yf eny mysfortune shulde happen vnto waye yt ye go ye shulde bringe graye hayre sorowe downe vnto graue xliii chapter bvt derth oppressed ye lande whan vytales brought egipte spent iacob father sayde vnto go agayne bye v litle foode thē iuda answered sayde man sware vnto v sayde ye shal se face excepte youre brother yf thou wilt sende oure brother v wil go downe bye foode yf thou wilt sende wyl go downe man sayde vnto v ye shal se face excepte youre brother israel sayde wherfore haue ye done euell vnto tell ye man ye yet brother answered man enquered strately v oure kynrede sayde youre father yet lyue haue ye yet brother tolde axed v coulde knowe wolde saye brynge youre brother downe wt sayde iuda vnto israel father let lad go maye get v vp take oure iourney lyue dye thou oure childrē 〈1 paragraph〉 wyll suertye handes shalt thou requyre yf brynge vnto agayne set thine eye wil beare ye blame life longe yf made tarienge bene come agayne twyse sayde israel father vnto thē yf must nedes take best frutes lande youre sackes brynge man present curtesy balme hony spyces myrre date almondes take money also money brought agayne youre sacke mouthes cary agayne peraduenture ouersight take youre brother get vp go agayne vnto man allmightie god geue mercy sight ye man maye let haue youre brother ben iamin forme must one robbed child toke present money ben iamin gat thē vp brought hither money came agayne oure sackes first pyke quarell v laye somethinge oure charge take v bonde seruauntes oure ass therfore came ye man ruler iosephs house talked wt doore sayde syr • en 4 • c came downe first bye foode whan came inne opened oure sackes beholde euery man money sack mouth full weight therfore haue brought v agayne haue brought money v also bye foode tell put oure money cuppe sack mouth yongest money ye vytayles dyd ioseph sayde morow whan daye let ye men go ass whan cite come farre ioseph sayde ruler house vp folowe mē whan thou ouertakest saie vnto wherfore haue ye rewarded euell good lorde drynketh prophecieth withall euell done ye haue done whan ouertaken sayde wordes vnto answered wherfore saieth lorde soch wordes▪ god forbyd thy seruauntes shulde eny soch thinge beholde money foūde oure sackes mouthes brought vnto agayne lande canaan shulde haue stollen either syluer golde thy lordes house loke shall founde amonge thy seruauntes let dye yee also wyll lordes bondman sayde let ye haue spoken loke shall founde let seruaunt ye shalbe harmlesse made haist toke downe euery man sack grounde euery man opened sack searched beganne greatest vnto yongest cuppe founde ben iamins sacke rente clothes euery man lade burthen vpon asse wente agayne vnto cite iuda wente brother vnto iosephs house yet fell groūde ioseph sayde vnto maner dede ye haue done knewe ye soch man prophecy iuda sayde shall saye vnto lorde shal speake excuse shal make god hath founde ye wickednesse thy seruauntes beholde cuppe founde lordes seruauntes sayde god forbyd shulde man cuppe founde shall seruaunt go ye vp peace vnto youre father thē stepte iuda vnto sayde lorde let thy seruaunt speake one worde thine eares lorde displesed y• seruaunt also thou art euē pharao lorde axed seruauntes sayde haue ye yet father brother answered haue father olde yonge lad begotten age brother deed left alone mother father loueth saydest thou brynge downe vnto wil se answered wife bare two sonnes one wente fro sayde torne peces gen • 7 f yf ye take fro also eny mysfortune happē shal ye brynge gray heer sorowe downe vnto graue gen 42 e yf come home vnto father lad seynge soule hangeth soule shall come passe yf se lad shal dye shal thy seruauntes brynge gray heer thy seruaunt oure father sorowe downe graue thy seruaunt became suertye lad vnto father gen 43 b sayde yf brynge agayne beare blame lyfe longe therfore let thy seruaunt byde steade ye lad lordes bonde man let lad go vp brother go vp vnto father yf lad shulde se mysery shulde happen vnto father xlv chapter coude ioseph refrayne self stode aboute cōmaunded euery man go stode man whan ioseph vttred self vnto brother wepte loude ye egipcians pharaos housholde herde act 7 b sayde vnto brother ioseph father yet alyue brother coulde answere abashed face sayde come nye vnto came nye sayde ioseph youre brother ge • • ye solde egipte vexe youre selues thinke yt eny wrath ye solde hither ge • • god sent hither yor lyues sake two yeares ye derth hath bene lande yet fyue yeares behynde wherin shalbe plowinge ner haruest god sent hither yt might let remayne vpon earth saue youre lyues greate delyueraunce ye sent hither god hath made father vnto pharao lorde ouer house prynce whole lande egipte haist therfore go vp vnto father saye vnto thy sonne ioseph sendeth worde god hath made lorde egipte come downe vnto tarye thou shalt dwel lande gosen thou thy child thy childers childrē thy small greate catell thou hast wyll make prouysion yet fyne yeares derth thou perishe wt thine house thyne beholde youre eye eye brother ben iamin se myne owne self speake vnto mouth shewe father worshipe egipte ye haue sene haist come downe hither father fell aboute brother ben iamyns neck wepte ben iamin wepte vpon neck also kyssed brother wepte vpon afterwarde talked brother wt tydinges came pharaos house iosephs brother come pleased pharao well seruauntes pharao spake vnto ioseph saye vnto thy brother thus lade youre beastes go youre waye whan ye come lande canaan take youre father youre housholdes come vnto wyl geue goodes lāde egipte ye shall eate fatt lande commaunded thus take charettes ye lande egipte youre child wyues brynge youre father come regarde youre housholde stuff goodes lā de egipte shalbe child israel dyd ioseph gaue thē charettes acordynge pharaos commaundement expense waye gaue vnto euery one chaunge rayment vnto ben iamin gaue thre hundreth syluer pen fyue chaunge rayment father sent ten ass laden goodes egipte ten ass corne bred vytayles father ye waye sent awaye brother sayde vnto stryue waye thus departed egipte came lande canaan vnto iacob father tolde sayde thy sonne ioseph yet alyue lorde lande egipte hert wauered beleued thē tolde wordes ioseph sayde vnto whan sawe ye charettes ioseph sent fetch sprete reuyued sayde haue ynough sonne ioseph yet liue wil go se dye xlvi chapter israel toke iourney iosu 24 act 7 b whan came berseba offred offerynges vnto ye god father isaac god spake vnto vision night iacob iacob sayde saide ye mightie god thy father afrayed go egipte wyl make greate people wyll go downe wil brynge vp also ioseph shal laye hande vpon thine eye iacob gat vp berseba ye child israel caried iacob father child wyues vpon charettes pharao sent cary toke catell substaunce gotten lande canaan came egipte child simeon iemuel iamin ohad iachim zohar saul sonne cananitish woman childrē leui gerson cahath merari childrē iuda er onan sela phares serah er onan dyed lande canaan childrē phares hesron hamul child isachar1 pat 8 thola phua iob semron child zabulon sered elon iahleel childrē lea bare vnto iacob mesopotamia doughter dina together sonnes doughters make thre thirtie soules childrē gad zipheon haggi suni e • bon eri arodi areli child asser iemna iesua iesui bria serum sister child bria heber malchiel child silpa ge 29 laban gaue vnto lea doughter bare vnto iacob sixtene soules childrē rachel iacobs wife ioseph ben iamin vnto ioseph ye lande egipte ge 41 g borne manasses ephraim asnath doughter potiphar prest bare vnto child ben iamin bela becher asber gera naamā ehi ro mupim hupim ard child rachel borne vnto iacob fourtene soules alltogether child dan husim childrē nephtali iahzeel guni iezer sillem child bilha laban gaue vnto doughter rachel bare iacob seuen soules soules yt came wt iacob egipte deut 10 • proceaded loynes besyde wyues childrē alltogether sixe sixtie soules iosephs childrē borne vnto egipte two soules soules house iacob came egipte seuentye sent iuda vnto ioseph shew waye gosen came lande gosen ioseph bended charett fast wente vp mete israel father vnto gosen whan sawe fell aboute neck wepte sore vpon neck sayde israel vnto ioseph content dye moch haue sene thy face thou art yet alyue ioseph sayde vnto brother father house go vp tell pharao saye vnto brethrē father house come vnto lande canaan kepers catell men deale catell small greate catell haue haue brought yf pharao call saye youre occupaciō ye shal saye thy seruauntes men yt haue dealt wt catell oure youth vp hytherto oure father ye maye dwell lande gosen egipcians abhorre kepers catell xlvii chapter came ioseph tolde pharao sayde father brother small greate catell yt haue come ye lande canaan beholde lande gosen toke fyue brother presented vnto pharao sayde pharao vnto brother youre occupacion answered thy seruauntes kepers catell oure father also sayde morouer vnto pharao come dwell lande ye seruaūtes haue pasture catell sore doth derth oppresse lande canaan therfore let ye seruauntes dwell lande gosen pharao sayde vnto ioseph thy father thy brother come vnto lande egipte open let dwell best place lande se yt dwell euen lande gosen yf thou knowest men actiuyte amōge thē make thē ruler catell ioseph brought iacob father also set pharao iacob thanked pharao pharao axed iacob olde art thou iacob sayde tyme iob 14 c psal 118 c pylgremage hūdreth thirtie yeares litle euell tyme pilgremage attayneth vnto tyme father pylgremages iacob thanked pharao wēte ioseph prepared dwellinges father brother gaue possession lande egipte euen best place lande namely lande raemses pharao cōmaunded made prouysion father brother father house bred euen yonge child bred londe derth sore yt lande egipte lande canaan fameshed ye reason derth ioseph brough • together money founde egipte canaan ye corne bought layed vp money pharaos house whan money fayled lande egipte canaan egipcians came vnto ioseph saide geue v bred suffrest thou v dye yt weare without money ioseph saide brynge hither youre catell wil geue youre catell seynge ye without money brought catell vnto ioseph gaue thē bred horse shepe ox ass fed bred yt yeare catell whan yt yeare ended came vnto next yeare sayde vnto wil hyde lorde yt onely money catell also spent vnto lorde nothinge left lorde onely body oure lande wherfore suffrest thou v dye oure londe take v oure lāde bred oure lande maye bonde vnto pharao geue v sede maye lyue dye yt lande become wildernesse ioseph toke lande egipte pharao egipcians solde euery man lande ye derth mightie vpon lōde became pharaos people went • city one syde egipte vnto excepte prestes londe toke ordened pharao prestes shulde eate appoynted gaue therfore neded sell londes sayde ioseph vnto people beholde haue taken possession youre lande daye pharao beholde haue ye sede sowe londe corne ye shall geue fifth parte vnto pharao foure partes shalbe youres sowe londe youre sustenaunce youre house child sayde let v lyue fynde grace oure lorde wyl gladly pharaos seruauntes ioseph made thē lawe vnto daye ouer egipcians londe geue pharao fifth parte excepte prestes londe bonde vnto pharao israel dwelt egipte londe gosen possession grew multiplied exceadingly iacob lyued seuentene yeare lande egipte whole age hūdreth seuen fourtye yeares whan tyme came israel shulde dye called ioseph sonne sayde vnto yf haue founde grace thy sight • e 24 laye thine honde vnder • hye yt thou shalt shewe mercy faithfulnes vpon burye egipte lye father thou shalt carye egipte burye buryall sayde wil thou hast sayde sayde • e 25 sweare vnto sware vnto thē israel bowed towarde bed heade xlviii chapter tolde ioseph▪ beholde yi father sicke toke two sonnes manasses ephraim tolde iacob beholde yi sonne ioseph cōmeth vnto ye israel toke corage vnto sat vp vpō ye bed sayde vnto ioseph allmightye god appeared vnto ge 28 c lu ye lāde canaan blessed saide vnto beholde wil cause ye growe increase wyll make multitude people ye wil geue lāde vnto ye sede ye euerlastinge possession therfore shal thy two sonnes manasses ephraim borne vnto egipte gen 41 g came hither vnto myne like ruben simeon thou begettest thē shal thine owne shalbe named name brother inheritaunce whā came mesopotamia rachel dyed lande canaan gen 25 waye whan yet feldes brede vnto eprath buryed waye towarde ephrath called bethleem israel loked vpon iosephs sonnes sayde ioseph answered sonnes god hath geuen sayde brynge thē hither yt maye blesse thē israel eye heuy age coude well se brought thē vnto kyssed enbraced thē saide vnto ioseph beholde haue sene ye face thought lo god hath caused se ye sede also ioseph toke lappe fell downe grounde vpon face ioseph toke ephraim right hande towarde israel left hā de manasses left hande towarde israel right hāde brought thē vnto israel stretched right hande layed vpō ye heade ephraim ye yōgest left hande vpō manasses heade wyttingly wt handes iosu 1 • manasses ye firstborne heb isaac yt maye growe multiplye vpon earth whā ioseph sawe yt father layed ye right hāde vpō ephraims heade displeased lif • vp father hande remoue frō ephraims heade vnto ye heade manasses sayde chapter ye name childrē israel came iacob egipte 〈…〉 euery one came wt house ruben simeon leui iuda isachar zabulō ben iamin dan nephtali gad aser soules came loynes iacob seuentie ioseph egipte ready whā ioseph deed brother lyued tyme 〈…〉 child israel grewe increased multiplied became exceadinge mightie yt lande full thē came new kynge ouer egipte knewe nothinge ioseph sayde vnto people beholde people child israel many mightier vp let v deale wysely yt many yf shulde ryse vp eny warre agaynst v might ioyne selues also vnto oure enemy ouercome v get lande set worke master ouer kepe vnder burthen buylded city phiton raemses treasury vnto pharao vexed multiplied grew therfore indignaciō child israel egipcians compelled child israel without mercy seruyce made lyues bytter vnto greuous laboure claye brycke maner bondage ye felde maner laboure layed vpon without mercy kynge egipte sayde vnto mydwyues hebrueswemen one called siphra pua whan ye helpe wemen hebrues se vpon stole sonne slaye yf doughter let lyue neuertheles mydwyues feared god dyd kinge egipte commaunded let child lyue kynge egipte called mydwyues sayde vnto wherfore ye ye let child lyue mydwyues answered pharao wemen hebrues wemen egipte sturdy wemen euer mydwyues come delyuered therfore god dealt well mydwyues people multiplied became exceadinge mightie moch mydwyues feared god psalmo 126 made house pharao commaūded people sayde sonnes borne cast water let doughters lyue ii chapter wente forth man house leui exod 6 c toke doughter leui act 7 c heb 11 wife conceaued bare sonne whan sawe yt proper childe hyd thre monethes whan coude hyde longer toke arke redes dawbed ouer slyme pitch layed childe therin set amonge redes water brynke sister stode farre wete wolde come pharaos doughter came downe wash water hir maydens walked water syde whan sawe arke amonge redes sent one hir maydens caused fett whan opened sawe ye childe beholde babe wepte pytie vpon sayde one hebrues child sayde syster vnto pharaos doughter shal go call nurse hebrues wemen nurse ye childe pharaos doughter sayde vnto go thy waye mayde wente called childes mother sayde pharaos doughter vnto take childe nurse wyll geue ye thy rewarde woman toke childe nursed whan childe growne brought vnto pharaos doughter became hir sonne called moses sayde toke water vpon tyme whan moses greate wente forth vnto brother loked vpon burthen sawe egipciā smote one brother ye hebrues loked rounde aboute whan sawe man slew egipcian buried sonde next daye wente forth also sawe two men hebrues stryuynge together sayde vngodly wherfore smytest thou thy neghboure sayde ge 19 b mat 21 c act 7 c made ruler iudge ouer v wilt thou slaye also thou slewest egipcian thē moses afrayed sayde knowne pharao herde sought moses slaye moses fled pharao kepte lande madian sat downe well syde prest madian seuen doughters came drawe water fylled troughes geue father shepe drinke came shepherdes droue thē awaye moses gat vp helped gaue shepe drynke whan came reguel father saide came ye soone daie sayde man egipte delyuered v ye shepherdes drew vnto v gaue shepe drynke sayde vnto doughters wherfore let ye man go ye called eate v moses content dwell man nu 12 gaue moses doughter zipora bare sonne exo 18 called gerson sayde become straunger straunge lande bare yet sonne called elieser sayde god father helper hath delyuered pharaos hāde processe tyme kynge egipte dyed childrē israel sighed ouer laboure cried crye ouer labor came god god herde cōplaynte remēbred couenaunt iudic 2 c gen 15 c abraham isaac iacob god loked vpon childrē israel god knew iii chapter moses kepte shepe iethro father lawe prest madian droue shepe backsyde wyldernes came mountayne god4 e 14 act 7 horeb angell ye lorde appeared vnto flāme fyre bush sawe ye bush brent wt fyre yet consumed saide wil go hence se greate sight ye bush brent whan lorde sawe wente waye se god called vnto bush sayde moses moses answered sayde come hither put thy shues thy fete place vpon thou stondest iosu 5 wholy groū de sayde morouer 〈…〉 god thy father god abraham ye god isaac god iacob moses couered face afrayed loke vpon god lorde sayde haue sene trouble people egipte 〈…〉 haue herde crye ouer oppresse knowe sorowe come downe delyuer power egipcians carye lō de good wyde londe euen londe floweth mylke hony namely vnto place cananites hethites amorites pheresites heuytes iebusites moch complaynte child israel come haue sene oppression wherwith egipcians oppresse go ye waye therfore wil sende vnto pharao 〈…〉 thou mayest brynge people child israel egipte moses sayde vnto god 〈…〉 yt shulde go vnto pharao brynge child israel egipte sayde wyll shall token yt haue sent whan thou hast brought people egipte ye shal serue god vpon mountayne moses sayde vnto god beholde whan come childrē israel saye vnto god youre father hath sent vnto saye vnto name shal saye vnto god saide vnto moses wyl wyll sayde thus shalt thou saye vnto ye child israel 〈1 paragraph〉 wyl hath sent vnto god sayde morouer vnto moses thus shalt thou saye vnto child israel lorde god youre father 〈…〉 god abraham god isaac ye god iacob hath sent vnto name euer memoriall childe childes childe go thy waye therfore gather elder israel tother saye vnto lorde god youre father god abraham god isaac god iacob hath appeared vnto sayde haue vysited sene done vnto egipte haue sayde wil brynge trouble egipte ye lande ye cananites hethites amorites pheresites heuites iebusites lōde yt floweth mylke hony yf heare ye voyce shalt thou elder israel go kynge egipte saye vnto 〈…〉 lorde god ye hebrues hath called v let v go therfore thre dayes iourney wyldernes yt maye sacrifice vnto lorde oure god knowe kynge egipte wil let go thorow mightie hā de stretch myne hande smyte egipte wt maner wonder therin yt shal let go wil geue people fauoure sight egipcians 〈…〉 whan ye go forth ye shal go forth emptie euery wife shall borowe hir neghbouresse geourneth hir house iewels syluer golde rayment shal ye put vpon youre sonnes doughters spoyle egipcians iiii chapter moses answered sayde beholde shall beleue ner heare voyce shal saye lorde hath appeared vnto lorde sayde vnto yt thou hast thine hande saide staff sayde cast vpon grounde cast frō turned serpent moses fled frō ye lorde saide vnto stretch forth thine hande take tayle stretched forth hande toke became staff agayne hande therfore shal beleue ye lorde god father god abraham god isaac ye god iacob hath appeared vnto lorde sayde furthermore vnto thrust thine hāde ye bosome thrust bosome toke beholde thē leper like snowe saide put ye bosome agayne put agayne bosome toke beholde thē turned againe flesh yf wil beleue ner heare ye voyce first token yet shal beleue voyce seconde token yf wil beleue two token ner heare thy voyce take water ryuer poure vpon drye londe shall water yt thou hast takē ye ryuer turned vnto bloude vpō ye drye londe moses sayde vnto lorde oh lorde •• 1 •• 8 b man yt eloquēt yesterdaye yeryesterdaye sence tyme yt thou hast spo •• ▪ vnto thy seruaunt haue slowe speach slowe tunge lorde sayde vnto hath made mouth man hath made domme deaf seynge ye blynde haue lorde done go thy waye therfore wil wt thy mouth teach thou shalt saye moses sayde▪ lorde sende thou wilt sende lorde angrie moses saide knowe yt thy brother aaron leuite well spoken beholde shal go forth mete ye whan seyth exod 4 c shal reioyse hert thou shalt speake vnto put wordes mouth wil thy mouth teach ye shall doo shall speake vnto people the▪ shal thy mouth thou shalt god take thine hande staff wherwith thou shalt token moses wēte came agayne vnto iethro father lawe sayde vnto let go praye maye turne agayne vnto brethrē egipte se whether yet alyue iethro sayde vnto go thy waye peace lorde sayde also vnto madian go yi waye turne againe egipte ye mē deed sought thy life moses toke wife sonnes caried vpon asse wente againe lande egipte toke staff god hande lorde saide vnto moses thou cōmest agayne egipte se yt thou wonder pharao haue put ye hāde exod 7 wil hardē hert yt shall let people go thou shalt saie vnto pharao thus sayeth ye lorde israel firstborne sonne saye vnto let sonne go yt maye serue yf thou wilt let go wil slaye thy firstborne sonne exod 12 c waye inne lorde met wolde haue slayne toke zipora iosu 5 stone circumcyded foreskynne hir sonne touched fete sayde bloudy brydegrome art thou vnto thē let go sayde bloudy brydegrome circumcision lorde sayde vnto aaron go mete moses wildernes wēte met mount god kyssed moses tolde aaron wordes lorde sent token yt charged withall wēte gathered elder childrē israel aaron tolde ye wordes yt lorde spokē vnto moses dyd token people people beleued whan herde yt lorde vysited child israel loked vpon trouble bowed selues worshipped v chapter afterwarde wente moses aaron spake vnto pharao thus sayeth lorde god israel let people go yt maye kepe holy daye vnto wildernes pharao answered iob 2 • b felowe lorde must heare voyce let israel go knowe lorde nether wil let israel go sayde god hebrues hath called v let v go therfore thre dayes iourney wildernes sacrifice vnto lorde god yt happen vnto v pestilēce swerde thē sayde ye kynge egipte vnto thē make ye ye people thou moses aaron leaue worke get hēce yor laboure pharao saide morouer beholde ye people many ye lande yet wil ye byd ceasse laboure daye therfore dyd pharao cō maunde workmasters people officer sayde ye shal gather geue people eny strawe burne bryck yesterdaye yeryesterdaye let go gather strawe selues nombre brycke made yesterdaye yeryesterdaye shall ye laye vpon neuertheles mynish nothinge therof ydle therfore crye saye wil go sacrifice vnto oure god let men kepte downe wt laboure yt maye haue turne selues false wordes wente workmasters people officer spake vnto people thus sayeth pharao shall strawe geuen go youre waye youre selues get strawe ye fynde youre labor shall nothinge mynished people scatred ye lande egipte gather stubble might haue strawe workmasters haistied forwarde sayde fulfill yor daye worke like whan ye strawe officer ye child israel pharaos worckmasters set ouer beaten saide vnto wherfore haue ye fulfilled yor appoynted daye worke daye yesterdaye like tymes past wente officer child israel cōplayned vnto pharao wherfore wilt thou deale thus wt thy seruauntes thy seruauntes haue strawe geuen thē yet must make brycke appoynted v beholde thy seruauntes beaten thy people euell intreated pharao sayde ye ydle ydle ye therfore saye ye go sacrifice vnto lorde go yor waye therfore worke shall strawe geuen nombre brycke shal ye delyuer sawe officer child israel yt amended sayde ye shal mynish nothinge daye worke brycke whan moses aaron wente pharao came forth mete sayde vnto lorde loke vpon iudge ye haue made sauoure v stynke pharao seruauntes haue geuen swerde handes slaye v moses came agayne vnto lorde sayde lorde wherfore dealest thou euell wt people wherfore hast thou sent sence tyme wente vnto pharao speake vnto thy name hath dealt euell people thou hast delyuered ye people lorde sayde vnto moses shalt thou se vnto pharao thorow mightie hande must let go thorow mightie hande must dryue londe 〈…〉 vi chapter god spake vnto moses sayde vnto ye lorde appeared vnto abraham isaac iacob allmightie god 〈1 paragraph〉 name lorde haue shewed vnto couenaunt also haue made 〈…〉 wil geue londe canaan londe pilgremage wherin haue bene straungers morouer haue herde complaynte child israel ye egipcians oppresse laboure haue remembred couenaunt therfore saye vnto childrē israel lorde wil brynge yor burthen egipte wil rydd youre laboure wil delyuer thorow stretched arme greate iudgmētes receaue people yor god ye shal knowe lorde yor god brynge burthen egipte brynge lande ouer haue lift vp hande geue vnto abraham isaac iacob ye wil geue vnto possession lorde moses tolde vnto childrē israel herkened vnto anguysh sprete sore laboure thē spake lorde vnto moses sayde go thy waye speake vnto pharao kynge egypte yt let childrē israel go lande moses spake ye lorde saide beholde ye childrē israel herkē vnto shulde pharao thē heare 〈◊〉 4 c also vncircumcised lyppes lorde spake vnto moses aaron gaue thē commaundemēt vnto childrē israel vnto pharao kynge egipte yt shulde brynge childrē israel egipte 〈◊〉 6 b 〈◊〉 26 〈◊〉 6 ye heades house yeare olde child merari maheli musi ye generacions leui kynreds amram toke vncles doughter 〈◊〉 2 〈◊〉 26 g iochebed wife bare aaron moses amram c vij thirtie yeare olde childrē iezear korah nepheg korahites eleasar aaron sonne toke one doughters putiel wife bare phineas heades amonge father generacions leuites yt aaron moses vnto ye lorde sayde bringe ye childrē israel lande egipte wt army namely moses aaron yt spake vnto pharao kynge egipte yt might brynge child israel egipte daie spake ye lorde vnto moses ye lande egipte sayde ye lorde speake thou vnto pharao ye kynge egipte yt saye vnto ye answered ye lorde beholde vncircumcised lippes exod 6 b shall pharao thē heare vii chapter lorde sayde vnto moses beholde haue made god ouer pharao aarō ye brother shal ye prophet thou shalt speake yt cōmaū de ye aaron ye brother shal speake vnto pharao yt maye let childrē israel go lande exo 4 neuertheles wil harden pharaos hert yt maye multiplye token wonder londe egipte pharao shal heare yt maye shewe hande egipte brynge myne armyes euen people childrē israel ye lande egipte greate iudgmē te ye egipcians shal knowe yt lorde whan shal stretch hande vpon egipte brynge child israel amonge moses aaron dyd lorde cō maūded moses fourescore yeare olde aaron thre foure score yeare olde whan spake vnto pharao ye lorde sayde vnto moses aaron whan pharao sayeth vnto shew youre wonder shalt thou saye vnto aaron take thy staff cast pharao shal turne serpent wēte moses aaron vnto pharao dyd lorde cōmaunded aaron cast staff pharao seruauntes turned serpēt pharao called ye wyse men sorcerer sorcerer egipte also dyd like wyse sorcery euery one cast staff turned vnto serpentes aaron staff deuoured staues pharaos hert hardened herkened vnto euen lorde sayde lorde sayde vnto moses hert pharao hardened refuseth let ye people go get ye vnto pharao mornynge holde shal come vnto ye water mete thou vpō water brynke take ye staff turned serpēt thine hande saye vnto lorde god hebrues hath sent vnto sendeth ye worde let people go exod • • maye serue wyldernesse hither thou woldest heare therfore thus sayeth lorde hereby shalt thou knowe yt ye lorde beholde wt staff yt haue hande wil smyte water ye ryuer shal turned bloude fish ryuer shall dye ryuer shall stynke shall greue egipcians drynke ye water ryuer ye lorde spake vnto moses saye vnto aaron take ye staff stretchout thine hāde ouer ye water egipte ouer ryuers brokes pondes ouer water pole yt maye turned bloude maye bloude ye lande egipte vessel wodd stone psal 77 c moses aaron dyd ye lorde cōmaunded lift vp staff smote water yt ryuer pharao seruauntes water ryuer turned bloude fysh ryuer dyed ryuer stanke yt egipcians coulde drynke water ye ryuer bloude lande egipte sorcerer also egipte dyd likewyse sorcery pharaos hert hardened herkened vnto thē like lorde sayde pharao turned wente home set hert egipciās dygged roūde aboute ye ryuer water drinke coude drynke ye water ryuer endured seuen dayes longe lorde smote ryuer viii chapter lorde sayde vnto moses go ye waye pharao speake vnto thus saieth lorde let people go yt maye serue yf thou wilt let thē go beholde wil smyte ye border ye lōde wt frogges yt ryuer shal scraule wt frogges shal clymme vp come thine house yi chamber thou slepest vpon thy bed house thy seruauntes amonge thy people thine ouens vpon thy dowe frogges shall come vp vpon vpon thy people vpon thy seruauntes lorde spake vnto moses saie vnto aaron psal 77 c 104 stretch forth thine hande wt thy staff ouer streames ryuers pondes let frogges come vpon londe egipte aaron stretched hāde ouer water egipte came vp frogges yt • onde egipte couered sorcerer also dyd likewyse wt sorcerirs caused frogges come vpō ye lōde egipte thē called pharao moses aaron sayde 〈1 paragraph〉 praye lorde yt maye take awaye frogges fro fro people let ye people go yt maye sacrifice vnto lorde moses sayde haue thou honor appoynte whā shal praye ye ye seruauntes thy people yt frogges maye dryuen awaye frō frō thy house remayne onely ryuer sayde tomorow sayde euen thou hast sayde yt thou mayest knowe yt none like vnto lorde god frogges shal takē yi house thy seruauntes thy people remayne onely ryuer moses aaron wēte pharao moses cried vnto lorde appoyntment ouer frogges promysed vnto pharao ye lorde dyd moses sayde frogges dyed ye house ye courtes vpon ye felde gathered thē together heape heape lande stanke whan pharao sawe yt gotten breth hert hardened herkened vnto thē euen lorde sayde lorde spake vnto moses saie vnto aaron stretch thy staff smyte dust vpon earth yt maye lyfe whole lōde egipte dyd aaron stretched hande wt staff smote dust vpon earth lyse vpon men vpon catell dust lande turned vnto lyse lande egipte sorcerer also assayde likewyse wt sorcerirs yt might brynge forth lyse coude ye lyse vpon men catell sayde ye sorcerer vnto pharao fynger god pharaos hert hardened herkened vnto thē euen lorde sayde ye lorde saide vnto moses get ye vp tomorow tymes stonde pharao beholde wil go vnto water speake thou vnto thus saieth ye lorde let people go yt maye serue yf beholde wil cause cruell wormes flyes come vpon thy seruauntes ye people thy house yt egipcians house felde theron shall full cruell wormes daye wil separate londe 〈1 paragraph〉 gosen wherin people yt cruell worme shalbe thou mayest knowe ye lorde myddest earth wil set delyueraunce betwene people thyne tomorow shal token come passe lorde dyd came perlous cruell wormes pharaos house seruauntes house vpon londe egipte londe marred noysome wormes thē called pharao moses aaron sayde go yor waye sacrifice vnto yor god ye londe moses sayde mete yt shulde shulde offer ye abhominacion ye egipcians vnto lorde god beholde yf shulde offer abhominacion ye egipcians eye shulde stone v thre dayes iourney go wyldernes sacrifice vnto lorde oure god • xod 3 c like hath sayde vnto v pharao sayde wil let go yt ye maie sacrifice vnto lorde yor god wyldernes onely yt ye go farther praye moses sayde beholde whan come forth ye wil praye vnto ye lorde yt cruell wormes maye taken pharao seruaūtes frō people euen tomorow onely disceaue nomore thou woldest let people go sacrifice vnto lorde moses wēte pharao prayed vnto lorde lorde dyd moses sayde toke awaye cruell wormes pharao seruauntes people yt remayned one pharao hardened hert euē also let ye people go ix chapter lorde sayde vnto moses go pharao speake vnto thus sayeth lorde god ye hebrues let people go yt maye serue yf thou wilt holde longer beholde hande lorde shal vpon thy catell felde vpon horse vpon ass vpon camel vpon ox vpon shepe sore pestilence ye lorde shall make diuysion betwene catell israelite egipcians yt shal nothinge dye child israel haue ye lorde appoynted tyme sayde tomorow shal lorde vpon earth lorde dyd morow dyed maner catell egipcians ye catell ye childrē israel dyed one pharao sent thither beholde one catell israel deed pharaos hert hardened yt let ye people go sayde ye lorde vnto moses aaron take youre handes full aszshes fornace let moses sprenkle towarde heauen pharao maye dust lande egipte maye sore blaynes vpon men vpon catell lande egipte toke aszshes ye fornace stode pharao moses sprenkled towarde heauē sore blaynes vpon men vpon catell sorcerer might stōde moses reason sore sore vpō sorcerer well vpon egipcians lorde hardened pharaos hert herkened vnto euē lorde sayde vnto moses sayde lorde vnto moses get vp tomorow tymes stonde pharao speake vnto thus sayeth ye lorde god hebrues let people go yt maye serue el wyll tyme sende plage thine hert vpon thy seruaūtes vpon thy people thou mayest knowe yt none like londes stretch hande smyte thy people wt pestilence yt thou shalt roted earth yet haue reade haue holden vp stered ye vp cause euen shew power vpon ye name might declared londes thou holdest people yet wilt let go beholde tomorow aboute tyme wyll cause mightie greate hayle rayne soch hath bene londe egipte sence tyme groūded hither sende thou saue thy catell yt thou hast felde men catell shalbe founde felde brought house yf hayle fall vpon shall dye feared worde lorde amonge pharaos seruauntes caused seruauntes catell flye house loke whose hertes regarded worde ye lorde left seruauntes catell felde sayde lorde vnto moses strech thy hande towarde heauē maye hayle vpon lande egipte vpon men vpon catell vpon herbes felde lande egipte moses stretched staff towarde heauen psal 77 c 104 lorde caused thonder hayle yt fyre ranne alonge vpon earth thus lorde hayled rayned vpon londe egipte hayle fyre wente horrybly together neuer lā de egipte sen tyme people therin hayle smote whole lande egipte vpon ye felde men catell smote herbes vpon felde brake tree vpon ye felde saue onely lande gosen childrē israel hayled sent pharao called moses aaron sayde vnto haue synned ye lorde righteous people vngodly yet praye ye vnto lorde thonder hayle god maye ceasse wyl let go ye shal tary longer moses sayde vnto whan come cite wyll stretch myne handes vnto lorde shal thonder ceasse shal nomore hayle thou mayest knowe earth lordes knowe yt thou thy seruauntes feare yet lorde god thus flax barlye smytten barlye shot vp ye flax boulled wheate ye r • e smytten late sowen moses wente pharao ye cite stretched hādes vnto ye lorde ye thōder hayle ceassed rayne dropped vpō earth whā pharao sawe yt rayne thonder hayle ceassed synned agayne herdened hert seruauntes pharaos hert hardened yt let childrē israel go euē lorde sayde moses x chapter lorde saide vnto moses go vnto pharao haue hardened hert hertes seruaūtes yt might tokēs amonge thē thou mightest shewe eares thy child thy childers child haue done egipte haue shewed token amōge thē ye maye knowe lorde moses aaron wente vnto pharao spake vnto thus sayeth ye lorde god hebrues longe refusest thou submyt thy self vnto let people go yt maye serue yf thou wilt let people go beholde tomorow wil cause greshoppers come vpon place yt maye couer lande yt lande sene shal eate vp yt left delyuered frō hayle shal eate vp yor grene tree vpon felde shal fyll thy house ye seruaūtes house egipcians house soch ye father ye father father haue sene sen tyme yt vpon earth vnto daye turned wente pharao saide pharaos seruauntes vnto longe shall snared maner let men go may serue ye lorde god knowest thou yet yt egipte destroyed moses aaron brought agayne pharao saide vnto go yor waye serue ye lorde yor god yt shall go moses sayde wil go wt yonge olde wt sonnes doughters shepe oxē ▪ haue feast lorde sayde vnto thē let lorde shulde let go yor childrē also loke ye haue myschefe hāde go ye men serue lorde youre desyre thrust pharao thē saide ye lorde vnto moses stretch thine hande ouer ye londe egipte psa▪ sap •• ioel▪ •• apo▪ • greshoppers yt maye come vpō ye londe egipte eate vp herbes londe wt yt escaped hayle moses stretched staff ouer ye lande egipte lorde brought east wynde londe yt daye yt night mornynge east wynde brought greshoppers came ouer whole lande egipte lighted place egipte exceadinge many tyme neuer soch nether shalbe couered londe made darcke ate vp herbes ye londe frutes vpon tree remayned ye hayle left grene thinge behinde tree herbes vpon felde lande egipte pharao called moses aaron ye haist saide haue synned lorde yor god agaynst forgeue synne also pray lorde yor god yt maye take awaye fro death onely wēte pharao prayed vnto lorde thē lorde turned maruelous strōge west wynde toke vp greshoppers ca •• reed see one left quarter egipte lorde hardened pharaos hert let childrē israel go lorde sayde vnto moses stretch thine hāde towarde heauen darck londe egipte yt maye felt moses stretched hāde towarde heauen thē thicke darcknesse londe egipte thre dayes sap • yt thre dayes mā sawe another rose vp ye place wt childrē israel light dwellinges pharao called moses sayde go yor waye serue lorde onely leaue yor shepe yor ox let yor childrē go wt also moses sayde thou must geue v offringes brent offerynges maye sacrifice vnto lorde god oure catell shal go wt v shal one hooffe left behynde must take therof seruyce lorde god morouer knowe wherwithall shal serue ye lorde tyll come thither lorde hardened pharaos hert yt wolde let go pharao sayde vnto get hence fro bewarre thou come nomore sight loke daie euer thou cō mest sight thou shalt dye moses answered euē thou hast sayde wil come nomore thy sight xi chapter lorde sayde vnto moses wil yet brynge plage vpon pharao egipte yt shal let go hence shal onely let go also dryue hence therfore saye vnto people yt euery man borowe neghboure euery woman neghbouresse iewels syluer golde • 3 • • ud 12 • lorde shal geue people fauor sight ye egipciās • ccli 45 moses greate man lande egipte ye sight pharaos seruauntes sight people moses sayde thus sayeth lorde mydnight wil go lande egipte ye first borne lande egipte shall dye pharaos first sonne yt sytteth vpon seate vnto first sonne mayde seruaunte behynde ye myll first borne amonge catell shalbe greate crie lande egipte soch neuer ner shalbe amonge childrē israel shall dogg quatch wt tonge fro men vnto catell yt ye maye knowe yt lorde hath put differēce betwixte egipte israel thē shal thy seruauntes come downe vnto fal fote saye get thou people vnder wyl departe wēte frō pharao wt wroth full displeasure lorde saide vnto moses pharao herkeneth vnto yt many wōders maye done ye lāde egipte moses aaron dyd wōders pharao ye lorde hardened hert yt wolde let ye childrē israel go londe xii chapter lorde sayde vnto moses aaron londe egipte moneth shal ye first moneth ye shall begynne monethes yeare speake ye vnto congregacion israel saye vpon ye tenth daye moneth let euery one take ioh 1 lābe kydd housholder euery house lābe yf housholde lambe thē let neghbor yt next vnto house take acordinge nombre ye soules counte lambe euery man maye eate shal lambe blemish male yeare olde amonge lambes goates shal ye take ye shal kepe vnto ye fourtene daye moneth euery man congregacion israel shal slaye aboute eueninge shal take bloude eze 9 stryke syde postes dore vpperdore post house eate shal eate flesh ye night rosted fyre vnleuended bred shal eate sowre sawse ye shal eate rawe ner sodden water onely rosted fyre heade wt fete pertenaunce ye shal leaue nothynge ouer vntyll mornynge yf eny thinge left ouer vntyll mornynge ye shal burne fyre maner shal ye eate ye shal gyrded aboute youre loynes haue youre shues vpon youre fete staues yor handes ye shal eate haist ye lordes passeouer psa 135 night wil go thorow londe egipte smyte firstborne lande egipte men vnto catell vpon goddes egipte wyll execucion euen lorde bloude shal youre token vpon house wherin ye heb 11 • yt whan se bloude maye passe ouer plage happen vnto destroye whan smyte londe egipte daye shall ye haue remembraunce ye shall kepe holy feast vnto lorde ye youre posterity perpetuall custome exo 23 b ▪ 34 c seuen dayes shall ye eate vnleuended bred namely vpon first daie shal ye leaue leuended bred youre house euer eateth leuended bred first daye vnto ye seuenth soule shall roted israel first daye shall called holy amonge seuenth also maner worke shall ye therin saue belongeth meate maner soules onely maye ye kepe leuended bred euen vpon daye wil brynge youre army londe egipte therfore shall ye youre posterity kepe daye perpetuall custome vpon fourtene daye first moneth leui 23 nu 28 c euen shall ye eate vnleuended bred vnto one twentye daye moneth euen leuended bred founde youre house seuen dayes euer eateth leuended bred soule shall roted congregacion israel whether straunger borne londe therfore eate leuended bred onely vnleuended bred youre dwellynges moses called elder israel sayde vnto chose take euery housholde shepe kyll passeouer vnto lorde take bunch ysope dyppe bloude basen stryke vpon vpperposte vpon two syde postes none go dore house vntyll ye mornynge lorde wyll go aboute plage egipcians whan seyth bloude vpō vpperposte vpon two syde postes wyl passe ouer dore suffre destroyer come youre house plage therfore kepe custome thy child euer whan ye come ye londe lorde shal geue hath sayde kepe seruyce io 4 whan youre child saye vnto seruyce ye haue ye shal saye sacrifice lordes passeouer passed ouer child israel egipte whan plaged egipcians saued oure house people bowed ye eate sowre dowe daye ye gone euē ye moneth abib • xo 2 • c 〈◊〉 33 whā ye lorde hath brought ye ye lande ye cananites hethites amorites heuites iebusites 〈◊〉 15 •• od 3 sware vnto yi father geue ye euen londe floweth wt mylke hony shalt thou kepe seruyce moneth seuē dayes shalt thou eate vnleuended bred vpon seuenth daye lordes feast therfore shalt thou eate vnleuended bred seuē dayes sowre dowe ner sowred bred sene thy quarter thou shalt tell thy sonne tyme saye ye lorde dyd whan departed egipte therfore shalt signe vnto ye thine hande token remembraunce thine eye lawe ye lorde maye thy mouth ye lorde brought egipte mightie hande therfore kepe maner yearly tyme whan lorde hath brought ye ye lande cananites hath sworne vnto thy father hath geuen • en 15 shalt thou sunder vnto lorde breaketh matrice firstborne amonge thy catell soch male firstborne asse shalt thou bye shepe yf thou redeme breake neck firstborne men amonge thy child shalt thou redeme whan thy childe axeth daie tomorow thou shalt saye vnto lorde brought v egipte house bondage wt mightie hande whan pharao loth let v go lorde slew firstborne lande egipte firstborne men vnto ye firstborne catell therfore offer vnto lorde breaketh ye matrice beynge male ye firstborne child redeme shal signe vnto thine hande token thinke vpon thine eye lorde brought v egipte mightie hande whan pharao let ye people go god led waye thorow lōde philistynes ye nexte thoughte people might repēt whā se warre turne agayne egipte therfore led people aboute euen waye thorow wyldernes ye reed see childrē israel wente harnessed londe egipte moses toke iosephs bone ge 50 iosu 24 f toke ooth child israel sayde god wyll surely vyset therfore cary awaye bone hence toke iourney frō suchoth pitched tētes ethā ye edge wildernes nu 14 b neem 9 • 1 cor 10 esaiae 4 b ye lorde wēte thē daye piler cloude lede thē ye right waye night piler fyre might shewe thē light walke daie night piler cloude departed neuer people daye pyler fyre departed thē night xiiii chapter lorde spake vnto moses sayde speake vnto child israel byd turne aboute num •• b pitch tentes valley hyroth betwixte migdol see towarde baal zephō pitch ye tentes right ouer see pharao shall saye child israel tell get▪ londe wyldernesse hath shut wyll harden hert yt shal folowe wil get honoure vpon pharao vpon power ye egipciās shal knowe yt lorde dyd whan tolde ye kinge egipte yt ye people fled hert seruauntes turned agaynst ye people saide haue done haue let israel go yt shulde serue v bounde charettes fast toke people wt toke sixe hūdreth chosen charettes charettes besyde egipte captaynes ouer lorde hardened ye hert pharao kynge egipte folowed child israel child israel wente hye hande egipcians folowed thē ouertoke pitched ye see vnto moses graues egipte yt thou hast brought v awaye dye wyldernes • sal 103 wherfore hast thou done vnto v thou hast caried v egipte sayde vnto egipte leaue let v serue egipcians better v serue egipcians dye wyldernes moses sayde vnto people • pa 20 c • sa 30 c feare stonde styll beholde saluacion lorde shall shewe vpon daye deu 2 • g egipcians ye se daye shall ye neuer se euer lorde shal fight onely quyete youre selues lorde sayde vnto moses wherfofore criest thou vnto speake vnto ye child israel yt go forwarde lift thou vp yi staff stretch thine hāde ouer ye see • ap 14 parte asunder yt child israel maye go thorow ye middest vpon drye grounde beholde wyll harden ye hert egipcians yt shall folowe thus wyl get honoure vpon pharao vpon power vpō charettes horsmen egipcians shal knowe ye lorde whan haue gotten honor vpon pharao vpon charettes vpon horsmen angell god yt wente army israel psal 104 c remoued gat behynde cloudy piler remoued also stode behinde thē came horsmen pharaos power folowed see remayned one child israel wente drye thorow ye myddest see esa • water vnto wall vpon right hande vpon lefte thus lorde delyuered israel yt daye hande egipcians 〈…〉 synge vnto ye lorde hath done gloriously horse charet hath ouer throwne see 〈◊〉 117 b 〈◊〉 12 lorde strength songe become saluacion god wil magnifie father god wil exalte lorde right man warre lorde name charettes pharao power hath cast see chosen captaynes drowned reed see ye depe hath couered fell grounde stone thy right hande lorde glorious power thy right hāde lorde hath smytten enemy thy greate glory thou hast destroyed thine aduersaries thou sentestout ye wrath cōsumed euen stobble breth thy wrath water fell together floudes wente vpon heape depes plomped together ye myddest see enemie thought folowe vpon ouertake deuyde ye spoyle coole mynde vpon wil drawe swerde hande shal destroye thou blewest thy wynde see couered sancke downe leed mightie water lorde like vnto amonge ye goddes glorious holynes fear full laudable doinge wonder whan thou stretchedest ye right hande earth swalowed vp thou ye mercy hast led people thou hast delyuered ye strength thou hast brought vnto dwellynge thy sanctuary whan ye nacions herde raged sorowe came vpon philistynes ye prynces edom afrayed tremblynge came vpō ye mightie moab indweller canaan waxed faynte harted let feare drede fall vpon thorow thy greate arme maye styll stone tyll thy people lorde gone thorow tyll yi people thou hast gotten gone thorow brynge plante vpon mountayne thy enheritaunce vnto ye place thou hast made thyne owne dwellynge euen ye tēple lorde thy handes haue prepared lorde shal kynge euer euer pharao wente see horse charettes horsmen lorde made see fall agayne vpon child israel wēte drye thorow myddest see miriam prophetisse aaron sister toke tymbrell hir hande woman folowed timbrel daunse miriam sange thē let v synge vnto lorde hath done gloriously exo 1 • • man horse hath ouer throwne see twolue welles water seuentie palme tree pitched ye water syde elim toke iourney whole congregacion child israel came wyldernesse sin lyeth betwene elim sinai vpon fyftene daye seconde moneth departed londe egipte ye whole multitude child israel nu 11 murmured agaynst moses aaron ye wildernes saide vnto wolde god dyed londe egipte hande lorde whan sat ye flesh pottes bred ynough eate ye haue brought v wyldernes cause whole multitude dye honger thē sayde ye lorde vnto moses beholde wyl rayne bred heauen let people go gather daylie nede maye proue whether walke lawe vpon sixte daye shal prepare thē selues maye brynge twyse moch gather daylie moses aaron saide vnto child israel euen ye shall knowe lorde hath brought lō de egipte mornynge shall ye se glory lorde hath herde youre grudginges agaynst lorde ye grudge agaynst v num 11 moses sayde morouer euen shall lorde geue flesh eate mornynge bred ynough ye lorde hath herde youre grudginges ye haue grudged agaynst youre murmuringe agaynst v lorde moses sayde vnto aaron speake vnto whole multitude ye child israel come forth lorde hath herde youre murmuringes whyle aaron spake thus vnto whole congegacion childrē israel turned towarde wyldernes beholde glory lorde appeared cloude lorde sayde vnto moses haue herde murmuringe ye child israel tell euen shall ye haue flesh eate mornynge shal ye fylled bred ye shall knowe lorde youre god euen quayles came vp couered tentes mornynge dewe laye rounde aboute tentes whan dew fallē beholde laye thinge wildernes thynne small horefrost vpon grounde whan child israel sawe saide one anothersome reade mā wyst moses sayde vnto bred ye lorde hath geuē eate ye lorde hath commaūded euery one gather moch eateth take gomor euery heade acordinge nombre soules tente child israel dyd gathered lesse whan measured ye gomor gathered moch 〈…〉 yt gathered litle wanted nothinge euery one gathered moch ate moses sayde vnto let mā leaue ought therof vntyll mornynge harkened vnto moses left vntill morninge waxed full wormes stanke moses angrie euery mornynge gathered selues moch euery one ate soone whote sonne melted awaye vpon sixte daye gathered twyse moch bred two gomors one ruler congregaciō came tolde moses sayde vnto lorde hath sayde tomorow sabbath holy rest lorde loke ye wil bake bake ye wyll seeth seeth remayneth ouer let remayne yt maye kepte vntyll mornynge let remayne tyll morow moses commaunded stanke nether eny worme therin thē sayde moses eate daye daye ye sabbath lorde daye shal ye fynde none felde sixe dayes shall ye gather seuenth daye sabbath wherin shal none vpon seuenth daye wente people gather founde nothinge sayde ye lorde vnto moses 〈…〉 longe refuse ye kepe commaundementes lawes beholde ye lorde hath geuen sabbath therfore vpon sixte daye geueth bred two dayes therfore let euery man byde home man go forth place vpon seuenth daye people rested vpō ye seuenth daye house israel called man like coriander sede whyte 〈…〉 wife hir child wente moses forth mete dyd obeysaūce vnto kyssed whan saluted ech wente tente moses tolde father lawe lorde done vnto pharao egipcians israel sake trauayle happened ye waye lorde delyuered iethro reioysed ouer ye good lorde done israel yt delyuered hāde egipcians iethro sayde praysed lorde hath delyuered hande egipcians pharao knoweth delyuer people egipcians hande knowe lorde greater thē goddes dealt proudly wt iethro toke brent offerynges offered vnto god came aaron ye elder israel eate bred moses father lawe god next morow sat moses iudge people people stode roūde aboute moses momynge vntyll ye euen whan father lawe sawe dyd people sayde thou doest people wherfore syttest thou alone ye people stonde rounde aboute morninge vntyll euen moses answered people come axe councell god whan haue eny thinge come vnto maye iudge betwixte euery one neghboure shewe statute god lawes father lawe sayde vnto well thou doest thou weeriest thy self people busynesse sore thou canst perfourme alone herken vnto voyce geue councell god shall thou vnto people god warde brynge cause god prouide statute lawes thou mayest shewe thē waie wherin shulde walke workes shulde loke amonge people honest men feare god soch true hate couetousnes make ruler ouer ouer thousandes ouer hundredes ouer fiftie ouer ten maye allwaye iudge people eny greate matter deut 1 people tentes 〈◊〉 4 b afrayde moses brought people tentes mete wt god stode vnder mount mount sinai smoked ye lorde came downe vpō fyre smoke therof wente vp smoke fornace whole mount exceadinge charge people yt preasse vnto lorde se many perishe ruler also come nye vnto ye lorde shal sanctifie themselues lest lorde smyte thē moses sayde vnto lorde people come vp vpon mount sinai thou hast charged v sayde set markes aboute mount sanctifie lorde sayde vnto go thy waye get ye downe thou aaron shalt come vp ruler ye people shal preasse come vp vnto ye lorde lest smyte thē moses wente alone also yf came maried shall wife go yf master haue geuē wife haue borne sonnes doughters thē shal wife ye child master shall go alone neuertheles deu 15 c yf seruaunt saye loue master wife child wil go fre let master brynge goddes holde dore post bore thorow eare botkin let seruaunt euer yf man sell doughter hand mayde shal go men seruauntes yf please hir master haue maried shal let go fre sell vnto straūge people hath auctorite moch hath despysed yf promyse vnto sonne shal vnto lawe doughters yf geue another wife shall mynishe nothinge hir foode rayment dewtye mariage yf thre shal go fre paye nothinge smyteth man dye shall dye death leu 14 matth 5 c nu 35 b deut 19 yf haue layed wayte god let fall hande vnawares wil appoynte place shal flye vnto yf man presume vpon neghboure slaye disceate • 1 g shalt thou take fro myne altare maye slayne▪ smyteth father mother shall dye death stealeth man selleth 〈…〉 founde shall dye death 〈1 paragraph〉 curseth father mother shal dye death yf men stryue together one smyte another stone fist dye lyeth bedd yf ryse go forth vpon staff thē shall smote vngiltie saue shal paye losse tyme geue ye money healynge smyteth seruaunt mayde staff dye vnder handes shall suffre vengeaunce therfore yf endure daye two shall suffre vēgeaunce therfore money yf men stryue hytt woman childe ye frute departe harme happen vnto shall punyshed money moch woman huszbande layeth charge shall geue acordinge appoyntement dayes men yf come harme vnto thorow 〈1 paragraph〉 shal paye soule soule eye eye toth toth hande hande fote fote burnynge burnynge wounde wounde strype strype yf man smyte seruaunt mayde eye destroye shal let go fre lowse eye sake like maner yf smyte tothe seruaunt mayde shall let go fre lowse tothes sake 〈1 paragraph〉 yf oxe gorre man woman dye shall oxe stoned flesh eaten master oxe vngiltie yf oxe haue bene vsed push tymes past hath bene tolde master hath kepte besydes slayeth man woman shal ye oxe stoned master shal dye yf money set vpon loke put vpon shall geue delyuer soule likewyse shall dealte withall yf gorre sonne doughter yf gorre seruaunt mayde shall geue master thirtie syluer sycles oxe shalbe stoned yf man open well dygge pytt couer fall oxe asse therin shall owner pytt make good money restore vnto master deed carcase shalbe owne yf one man oxe gorre another dye shall sell lyuynge oxe deuyde money deed carcase shal deuyde also yf knowne oxe haue bene vsed gorre afore shal paye oxe deed carcase shal owne xxii chapter yf man steale oxe shepe slaye sell shall restore fyue ox oxe 〈…〉 foure shepe shepe yf thefe taken breakinge vpon smytten dye shall smote giltie bloude yf sonne gone vp vpō hath committed manslaughter shal dye thefe shall make restitucion yf haue nothīge thē let solde theft yf ye theft founde alyue oxe vnto asse shepe shall restore dubble yf man hurte felde vynyarde yt let catell harme another man felde shall make restitucion euen best owne felde vynyarde 〈◊〉 14 c yf fyre come take holde ye thornes sheeues consumed corne stondeth yet vpon felde kyndled fyre shall make restitucion mac 3 c yf man delyuer neghboure money vessel kepe stollen house yf thefe founde shal restore dubble yf thefe founde shal good man house brought • sal 81 〈◊〉 10 goddes shal sweare hath put hande vnto neghbours good yf one accuse another eny maner trespace whether oxe asse shepe rayment euer lost shall cause come goddes loke goddes condempne shal restore dubble vibe neghboure yf man delyuer vnto neghboure asse oxe shepe eny maner catell kepe dye hurte dryuen awaye man se shall • oth lorde go betwene hath put hande vnto neghbours good owner ye good shal accepte shall make good yf thefe steale shal make restituciō vnto owner therof yf rauyshed beastes shal brynge recorde therof make good hir father refuse geue vnto thē shall ye money acordinge dowry virgin thou shalt suffre witch lyue1 28 deu 27 • lyeth wt beest shal dye death offreth eny goddes saue vnto lorde onely let dye without thou shalt make two cherubyns beaten golde vpō ye endes mercyseate yt one cherub maye vpon one ende vpon ende two cherubyns vpon endes mercyseate cherubyns shall sprede wynges ouer hye yt maye couer brasen lauer also fote brasse wash shalt set betwixte tabernacle witnesse ye altare put water therin aarō sonnes maye wash handes fete therout whan go tabernacle wytnesse altare mynistre vnto lorde offerynge incense yt dye shalbe perpetuall custome sede amonge posterity ye lorde spake vnto moses sayde take vnto spyces best 〈…〉 fyue hundreth sycles myrre cynamō half moch euen two hundreth fyftie kalmus two hundreth fiftye cassia fyue hundreth sycle sanctuary hin oyle olyue make holy anoyntinge oyle craft apotecary wt shalt thou anoynte tabernacle wytnesse 〈◊〉 8 b arke wytnes table apparell ye candilsticke apparell altare incense altare burnt offerynges apparell lauer fote thus shalt thou consecrate maye holy wil touch thē must consecrated thou shalt anoynte aaron also sonnes consecrate prestes thou shalt speake vnto childrē israel saye oyle shalbe holy oyntment vnto amonge yor posterity shal poured vpon man body nether shalt thou make eny soch like holy therfore shal holy vnto maketh eny soch like geueth straūger therof shalbe roted amonge people lorde sayde vnto moses take vnto spyces balme stacte galban pure franckencense one moch another make incense therof craft apotecary myngled together maye pure holy thou shalt beate poulder shalt put wytnesse tabernacle wytnesse • e wyll proteste vnto shalbe holy vnto lorde maketh soch cense therwith shalbe roted amōge people xxxi chapter lorde spake vnto moses saide 〈◊〉 ▪ 35 〈◊〉 2 b haue called name bezaleel sonne vri ye sonne hur ye trybe iuda 7 b haue fylled ye sprete god wyszdome vnderstō dynge knowlege worke maner connynge worke golde syluer brasse graue stone connyngly set carue well tymbre make maner worke beholde haue geuen ahaliab sonne ahisamach trybe dan companyon haue geuen wyszdome hertes wyse shall make haue commaunded tabernacle wytnesse 〈◊〉 ▪ 2526 •• 30 arke wytnesse mercyseate theron ornamentes ye tabernacle table apparell candilsticke apparell altare incense altare burnt offerynges wt apparell lauer fote mynistrynge vestimentes aaron ye prest garmentes sonnes serue like prestes anoyntinge oyle incē se spyces ye sāctuary haue commaunded shal make lorde talked vnto moses sayde speake vnto child israel saye kepe sabbath exo 20 • ▪ token betwene youre posterity ye maye knowe lorde haloweth therfore kepe sabbath shalbe holy vnto nu 1 • • vnhaloweth shall dye death doth eny worke therin shalbe roted amonge people sixe dayes shall men worke vpon seuenth daye sabbath gene • holy rest lorde doth eny worke vpon sabbath daye shall dye death therfore shal child israel kepe sabbath maye kepe also amonge posterity euerlastynge couenaunt euerlastynge token betwixte child israel sixe dayes made lorde heauē earth vpon ye seuenth daye rested refreshed whan lorde made ende talkinge moses vpon mount sinai gaue two table witnesse exo 24 c 32 deut 5 c 9 b stone wrytten fynger god xxxii chapter bvt whan people sawe moses made lōge taryenge come downe frō mount gathered thē together agaynst aaron sayde vnto vp make v goddes go v acto 7 c tell become man moses brought v egipte aaron sayde vnto iudic 8 c plucke golden earynges eares youre wynes yor sonnes yor doughters brynge vnto people pluckte golden earynges eares brought vnto aaron toke handes fashioned wt grauer •• al 105 c made molten calfe sayde thy goddes israel brought londe egipte whan aaron sawe buylded altare caused proclamed sayde tomorow lordes feast arose vp early mornynge offred burnt offerynges brought dead offerynges also cor 10 people sat downe eate drynke rose vp playe • eut 9 c
