meatofferynges drynk offerynges health offeringes moses tolde child israel lorde commaunded xxx chapter moses spake vnto ruler trybes child israel saide lorde hath commaūded 〈…〉 yf eny man make vowe vnto lorde sweare ooth binde soule shal breake worde proceaded mouth yf damsell make vowe vnto ye lorde bynde hirself whyle hir father house vnmaried hir vowe bonde maketh ouer hir soule commeth hir father eares holde peace therto thē hir vowes bondes yt hath boūde hir self withall ouer hir soule shal stōde effecte yf hir father forbyd ye daye heareth thē shal vowe ner bonde hath bounde hir self withall ouer hir soule vayle lorde shalbe mercifull vnto moch hir father forbad yf haue huszbande hath vowe vpon yf haue letten go hir lippes bōde ouer hir soule hir huszbande heare holdeth peace therat daye heareth hir vowe bonde wherwith hath boūde hir self ouer hir soule shal stonde effecte yf hir huszbande forbyd daye heareth thē vowe lowse yt hath vpō hir bonde also hath letten go hir lippes ouer hir soule lorde shalbe gracious vnto vowe wyddowe yt deuorced yt byndeth hir self withall ouer hir soule shal stonde effecte vpō yf vowe hir huszbādes house binde hir self wt ooth ouer hir soule hir husbande heare holde peace therto forbyddeth thē shal ye vowe yt hath boūde hir self wt ouer hir soule stōde ī effecte yf hir huszbāde disanulle ye daye yt heareth thē value yt proceaded hir lippes hath vowed boūde ouer hir soule hir huszbāde hath made lowse lorde shalbe gracious vnto vowes oothes yt bynde humble ye soule maie hir huszbāde stablish breake thus yf holde peace therto frō one daie another stablisheth hir vowes bondes yt hath vpon helde peace daye yt herde thē yf disanulle thē yt hath herde thē shal take awaie hir miszdede statute yt lorde cō maunded moses betwene man wife betwene father doughter whyle yet damsell hir father house xxxi chapter lorde spake vnto moses sayde 〈…〉 auenge childrē israel madianites yt thou mayest afterwarde gathered vnto ye people thē spake moses vnto people sayde harnesse men amonge warre agaynst madianites yt maye auenge ye lorde vpon madianites euery trybe thousande yt euery trybe israel ye maye sende battayll amonge thousandes israel tok • one thousande euery tribe euen twolue thousande prepared vnto battayll moses sent phineas sonn • eleasar prest battayll holy vessel ye trompettes blowe hande fought agaynst ye madianites ye lorde cōmaunded moses slew ye male kynge madianites slew also amonge slaine namely eui rekem zur hur reba fyue kynges madianites slew 2 pet 2 • balaam sonne beor wt swerde ye child israel toke wemen madianites presoners childrē catell substaunce goodes spoiled city dwellynges castels burnt wt fyre toke ye spoyles yt coulde catche men catell brought thē vnto moses eleasar prest ye congregacion child israel namely ye presoners catell yt takē good spoyled th • hoost felde moabites lyeth besyde iordane ouer iericho moses eleasar prest captaines ye congregacion gen 14▪ • wēte hoost mete thē moses angrie officer hoost captaynes ouer thousandes hūdreds yt came battayll sayde vnto thē haue ye saued ye wemen alyue beholde num 25 • apo • c haue thorow balaams busynes turned awaye ye childrē israel synne agaynst lorde vpō peor came plage ouer whole cōgregacion ye lorde iud • 1 b therfore slaie male amōge ye childrē kyll ye wemen yt haue knowne men lyen wt wemen child yt haue knowne mē ner lien wt kepe alyue youre selues lodge ye without hoost nu 19 b yt haue slayne man touched slayne thirde seuenth daie ye maie purifie yor selues ye haue taken presoners clothes stuffe made szkynnes maner furres vessel wod shal ye purifie eleasar prest sayde vnto ye captaynes hoost yt wente battayll statute lawe lorde cōmaunded moses golde siluer brasse yron tynne leed suffreth fyre shall ye cause go thorow fyre clense maye purified ye sprencklynge water soch suffreth fyre ye shal cause go thorow ye water shal washe yor clothes vpon seuenth daye thē shall ye cleane shall ye come hooste lorde spake vnto moses sayde deu 20 b 22 b io 8 f 2 mac 8 c take summe spoyle taken wemen catell thou eleasar prest chefe father congregacion geue ye halfe vnto toke warre vpon wente battayll ye halfe congregacion men warre wente ye battayll thou shalt heue vnto lorde one soule fyue hundreth wemen ox ass shepe halfe parte shalt thou take geue vnto eleasar prest heue offerynge vnto lorde child israel halfe parte thou shalt take one heade fyftie wemen ox ass shepe catell shalt geue vnto leuites wayte vpon habitaciō lorde moses eleasar prest dyd lorde commaunded moses spoyle praye ye men warre spoyled sixe hundreth thousande fyue seuentye thousande shepe two seuentye thousande ox one thre score thousande ass wemen yt knowne men ner lyen wt two thirtie thousande soules halfe parte belonged vnto wente warre nō bre thre hundreth thousande seuen thirtie thousande fyue hundreth shepe lorde sixe hundreth fyue seuentye shepe item sixe thirtie thousande ox wherof lorde two seuentye item thirtie thousande fyue hundreth ass wherof lorde one thre score item sixtene thousande soules wemen wherof lorde two thirtie moses gaue heue offerynge lorde vnto eleasar prest lorde commaunded halfe moses deuyded vnto child israel frō ye men warre namely ye halfe fell congregacion also thre hundreth thousande seuen thyrtie thousande fyue hundreth shepe sixe thirtie thousande ox thyrtie thousande fyue hundreth ass sixtene thousande wemen soules halfe childrē israel toke moses one euery fyftie catell wemen gaue vnto ye leuites waited vpon habitaciō lorde ye lorde cōmaūded moses captaynes ouer ye thousandes hoost namely ouer thousandes ouer hundred came forth vnto moses sayde vnto thy seruauntes haue taken ye summe ye men warre vnder oure hande lacked one therfore brynge present vnto lorde euery one hath foūde iewels golde cheynes bracelettes rynges earinges tach oure soules maye reconcyled lorde moses eleasar ye prest toke ye golde maner ornamentes golde heue offerynge heued vnto lorde sixtene thousande seuen hundreth fyftye sycles captaynes ouer thousandes hundred loke euery one spoyled awne moses wt eleasar prest toke golde captaynes ouer thousandes hundred broughte tabernacle witnesse remembraunce child israel lorde xxxii chapter child ruben child gad exceadinge greate multitude catell sawe londe iaeser gilead yt mete place catell came spake vnto moses eleasar prest captaynes congregacion londe atroth dibon iaesar nimra hesz • ō eleale seban nebo beon lorde smote ye congregacion israel mete londe catell thy seruauntes haue many catell sayde morouer yf haue founde fauoure thē geue thy seruauntes londe possession wyl go ouer iordane moses sayde vnto youre brother shall go warre wyll ye tary wherfore turne ye ye hertes child israel shulde go ouer londe lorde shall geue them▪ 〈…〉 thus dyd youre father also whan sent cades bernea spye ye londe whan come vp ye ryuer escol sawe ye londe turned hertes child israel yt wolde londe ye lorde wolde haue geuen lorde wroth tyme 〈…〉 sware sayde men yt come egipte twētye yeare olde aboue shall se lande sware vnto abraham isaac iacob haue wholy folowed saue caleb ye sonne iephune ye renisite iosua ye sonne nun haue wholy folowed ye lorde lorde wroth wt ▪ israel let thē wander wildernesse fourtye yeares tyll ye generacion yt done euell lorde consumed beholde ye rysen vp youre father steade increase nombre synfull men augmente yet wrath indignacion lorde agaynst israel yf ye turne backe folowinge shal yet leaue wildernes shal ye destroye people stepte sayde wyll buylde shepefoldes oure shepe ca • ell city child oure selues go ready armed child israel tyll haue broughte vnto place oure childrē shal remayne fenced city ye indweller londe turne home agayne tyll child israel haue taken euery one inheritaunce possession wyll inheret beyonde iordane inheritaunce shal fall vnto v vpon syde iordane eastwarde moses sayde vnto 〈…〉 yf ye wil this▪ ye wil harnesse youre selues warre lorde go ouer iordane lorde euer harnessed amonge tyll haue dryuen enemy face vntyll londe subdued lorde shal ye returne vngiltye lorde israel shal ye haue londe possession lorde yf ye beholde ye shal offende agaynst lorde sure youre synne shal fynde buylde city therfore youre child shepefoldes stalles youre shepe catell ye haue spoken childrē gad childrē ruben sayde vnto moses thy seruauntes shal lorde hath cōmaunded oure child wyues substaunce catell shal ye city gilead ye seruauntes go harnessed warre vnto battaill ye lorde lorde hath saide thē moses cōmaunded eleasar ye prest iosua sonne nun chefe father tribe child israel saide vnto yf child gad child ruben go ouer iordane wt prepared fight lorde io 4 c whan londe subdued vnto ye • thē geue londe gilead 〈◊〉 possessiō yf go ouer 〈…〉 harnes shal inheret wt ye l • de canaā child gad child rubē answered sayde ye lorde hath spoken vnto ye seruauntes wyll wil go harnessed lorde ye lā de canaan possesse oure enheritaunce syde iordane moses gaue vnto ye child gad child ruben deut • b io 22 • halfe trybe manasse sonne ioseph ye kyngdome sihon kynge amorites kyngdome og kynge basan londe city therof ye coastes ye countre rounde aboute thē ye child gad buylded dibon ataroth aroer atroth sophan iaeser iegabeha bethnimra betharan stronge fenced city shepe foldes child ruben buylded heszbō eleale kiriathaim nebo baal meon turned ye name sibamas gaue name vnto ye city buylded ye child machir sonne manasse wente gilead conquered droue amorites yt therin moses gaue gilead vnto machir ye sonne manasse dwelt therin iair ye sonne manasse wente conquered vyllagies therof called hauoth iair nobah wente cōquered kena • h townes belonginge therto called nobah awne name xxxiii chapter ye iourneys childrē israel wēte ye lande egipte acordinge army 〈◊〉 moses aarō moses wrote 〈◊〉 iourneyed ye cōmaund • ment ye lorde namely yourneyes outgoinge exod 12 f departed frō raemses vpon ye fiftene daye first moneth euen morow easter thorow hye hande egipcians sawe buried first borne lorde slayne amonge lorde executed iudgment also vpon goddes departed raemses pitched sucoth frō sucoth departed pitched tentes ethā lyeth ye edge ye wildernes exod 1 • frō etham departed abode valley hiroth lyeth towarde baal zephon pitched ouer agaynst migdol exo 14 hyroth departed exo 14 e wente thorow ye middes see ye wyldernes wente thre dayes yourney wildernes etham pit • hed marah exo 15 marah departed came vnto elim wh • twolue welles water seuentye palme tree pitched▪ exo 16 elim departed pitched reed see ye reed see departed pitched wildernesse sin wildernes sin departed pitched daphka frō daphka departed pitched alus alus departed pitched raphidim exo 17 people water drynke raphidim departed pitched wildernes sinai exo 19 sinai departed pitched lustgraues num 10 b num 11 g frō lustgraues departed pitched hazeroth nu 12 b hazeroth departed pitched departed pitched ezeon gaber ezeon gaber departed pitched ye wildernes zin cades nu 20 cades departed pitched mount hor nu 20 deu 10 b border londe edom aaron prest wente vp vnto mount hor acordynge commaundement lorde died fourtyeth yeare yt child israel departed londe egipte first daie fifte moneth whā hundreth thre twentye yeare olde arad kynge cananites dwelt south countre canaā herde yt child israel came mount hor departed pitched zalmona zalmona departed pitched phimon phimon departed 〈…〉 pitched oboth oboth departed pitched igim abarim vpon border lō de ye moabites igim departed pitched dib •• gad dibō gad departed pitched almon diblathama frō almon diblathama departed pitched mountaynes abarim ouer agaynst nebo moū taynes abarim departed pitched ye felde moabites besyde io • dane ouer agaynst iericho frō beth haiesmoth vnto playne sitim laye felde moabites 〈…〉 lorde spake vnto moses felde moabites iordane ouer agaynst iericho sayde speake child israel saie vnto whā ye come ouer iordane lande canaan 〈…〉 ye shal dryue inhabiters youre face plucke downe pilers ymages metall destroye 〈…〉 hye place ye maye take londe possession dwell therin haue geuē londe enioye londe shall ye deuyde lott amonge youre kynreds vnto many shall ye deuyde vnto fewe shall ye deuyde lesse euen lott falleth vnto euery one shal haue acordinge trybes father yf ye wyll dryue inhabiters ye lande yor face 〈…〉 whō ye suffre remayne shall become thornes youre eye dartes youre sydes shall vexe londe ye dwell wil come passe shal vnto euen thought vnto xxxiiii chapter annd lorde spake vnto moses sayde commaunde childrē israel saye vnto whan ye come londe canaan londe yt falleth youre inheritaunce shall haue hir border londe canaan south quarter shall begynne wyldernesse zin edom youre south quarter edge salt see lyeth towarde south ye quarter fet compasse south vp acrabim go thorow zimma goinge south vnto cades barnea reache vnto hazor adar go thorow azmona stretch azmona vnto ryuer egipte ende therof greate see west quarter shal namely greate see let yt youre border towarde west north quarter shalbe ye shall compasse greate see vnto mount hor fro mount hor ye shall compasse tyll man come vnto hemath goynge therof coast zedada border go vnto siphron goynge hazor enan let youre north quarter youre east quarter shall ye cōpasse hazor enan vnto sephan let coaste go downe sephan ribla east syde thē let go downe reache vnto syde see chinereth east warde come downe iordane yt goynge salt see let youre londe border therof rounde aboute moses commaunded child israel sayde youre londe ye shal deuyde amonge lott lorde hath commaunded geue vnto nyne trybes halfe trybe 〈◊〉 32 f trybe child ruben father house trybe child gad acordinge father house half trybe manasse haue receaued porcion thus two trybes halfe trybe haue enheritaunce allready syde iordane ouer agaynst iericho eastwarde lorde spake vnto moses sayde 〈◊〉 3 〈…〉 4 ye name men shal deuyde londe amonge eleasar prest iosua sonne nun captayne euery trybe shal ye take deuyde londe name men caleb sonne iephune trybe iuda semuel sonne ammihud trybe simeon elidad ye sonne cislon trybe ben iamin buki sonne iagli trybe childrē dan hamuel sonne ephod trybe child manasse amonge child ioseph kemuel sonne siphthan trybe child ephraim elizaphan sonne parnach trybe childrē zabulon palthiel sonne asan trybe childrē isachar abihud sonne selomi ye trybe child asser pedahel sonne ammihud trybe child nephtali ye lorde commaunded shulde deuyde inheritaunce vnto child israel londe canaan xxxv chapter lorde spake vnto moses felde moabites iordane ouer agaynst iericho sayde commaunde childrē israel iosu • 1 geue vnto ye leuites inheritaūce possession city dwell suburbes also aboute city shal ye geue vnto leuites maye dwell city suburbes haue catell substaunce beestes suburbes ye geue vnto ye leuites shal reache frō wall ye cite outwarde cubites rounde aboute thus ye shal measure without cite ye east syde two thousande cubites ye south syde two thousande cubites ye west syde two thousande cubites ye north syde two thousande cubites yt cite myddes shal suburbes iosu 20 amōge city ye shal geue vnto leuites ye shall geue thē sixe fre city cōmitteth slaughter maie flye thither besydes ye shal geue thē yet two fourtie city yt ye city ye geue vnto ye leuites eight fourtye wt suburbes ye ye shal geue thē yt haue moch possession amonge child israel lesse haue litle possession euery one acordinge enheritaunce deuyded vnto shall geue city vnto leuites lorde talked wt moses saide speake childrē israel saye vnto thē exo 21 b deut 19 whan ye come ouer iordane ye londe canaan ye shall chose city fre city yt cōmytteth slaughter vnawarres maye flye thither soch fre city shalbe amonge auenger bloude hath commytted slaughter dye tyll stonde iudgment congregacion city ye shall geue shalbe sixe fre city thre shal ye geue side iordane thre londe canaan sixe fre city ye childrē israel straungers soch dwell amōge yt euer hath slaine eny soule vnawarres maye flye thither exo 21 b yt smyteth eny man wt yron weapō yt dye murthurer shal dye death yf cast wt stone wherwith eny man maye slayne yt dye therof murthurer shal dye death yf smyte wt handweapon wodd wherwith eny man maie slayne dye murthurer shal dye death auenger bloude shal bringe ye murthurer death whan fyndeth shal slaye yf thrust hate cast ought laienge wayte smyte envye wt hande dye shal hath slayne dye death murthurer auenger bloude shal brynge death soone fyndeth yf thrust chaunce envye deu 19 hurle ought without eny layenge wayte cast stone wherof man maye dye sawe yt dye enemie nether thought eny euell thē shal cōgregacion iudge betwene yt hath cōmytted ye slaughter auenger bloude soch case cōgregacion shal delyuer deed slayer hande ye auenger bloude shal let come agayne fre cite whither fled shall abyde vnto ye death hye prest anoynted ye holy oyle yf deed sleyer go border fre cite fled vnto auenger bloude fynde without ye border fre cite kyll shal gyltye bloude shulde haue bydden fre cite vntyll ye death hye prest ye hye prestes death come agayne vnto londe enheritaunce shalbe statute lawe vnto amōge youre posterity youre dwellinges deed slayer shal slayne ye mouth witness deu 17 b 19 c one witnesse shal answere ouer soule death ye shal receaue none attonement ouer soule deedslayer giltye death shal dye death ye shal receaue none attonement fled fre cite yt shulde come agayne dwell londe tyll hye prest dye defyle ye ye londe wherin ye dwell giltye bloude defyleth londe londe reconcyled bloude shed therin onely thorow bloude shed defyle ye londe ye dwell wherin dwell also lorde dwell amōge ye child israel xxxvi chapter ye chefe father kynred childrē gilead ye sonne machir sonne manasse kynred child ioseph came forth spake moses captaynes amonge chefe father child israel saide syr lorde hath 〈…〉 commaunded ye shulde geue londe lott vnto childrē israel inheret thou lorde hast commaunded thorow lorde 〈…〉 enheritaunce brother zelaphead shulde geuē vnto doughters yf eny men trybes israel take wyues shal oure father enheritaunce lesse moch haue shal come ye enheritaunce trybe come vnto thus shal lott oure inheritaunce mynished whan year • iubilye commeth vnto childrē israel shal enheritaunce come ye enheritaunce trybe thus shal oure father enheritaunce mynished moch haue moses charged childrē israel acordinge commaundement lorde sayde trybe child ioseph hath sayde righte ye lorde commaundeth doughters zelaphead sayeth 〈…〉 let mary like best onely mary ye kynred trybe father enheritaunce child israel fall frō one trybe another euery one amonge child israel shall cleue enheritaunce trybe father euery doughter possesseth eny enheritaunce amonge trybes child israel shal maryed vnto one kynred trybe hir father 〈…〉 yt euery one amonge child israel maye enioye father enheritaunce enheritaunce fall one trybe another euery one maye cleue awne enheritaunce amonge trybes child israel lorde cōmaunded moses euē dyd ye doughters ye zelaphead mahela thirza hagla milca noa maried vnto father brother sonnes ye kynred child manasse sonne ioseph enheritaūce remayned trybe kynred father commaundemētes lawes ye lorde commaunded moses vnto childrē israel felde moabites iordane ouer agaynst iericho ende fourth boke moses called numerus fyfth boke moses called deuteronomion boke conteyneth chap moses putteth childrē israel remembraunce greate benefites haue receaued god rebuketh vnthankfulnesse myszbeleue chap ii commaunded fighte agaynst seir moabites ammonite sihon kynge amorrites delyuered vnto chap iii og kynge basan slayne londe taken destroyed▪ ruben gad halfe trybe manasse haue enheritaunce syde iordane iosua ordeyned moses steade chap iiii hath rehearsed vnto benefites god exorteth kepe commaundementes forget fredome soch committe slaughter vnawarres chap v rehearseth commaundementes god vnto agayne exorteth earnestly kepe chap vi telleth statute ordinaūces god exortinge kepe teache child cahp vii commaunded whan come lōde canaan make frendshipe ner kepe company people therof vtterly rote afrayed chap viii exorteth forget commaundementes god remembre singuler kindnes god hath shewed trouble hath delyuered geueth londe go vnto good reporte chap ix warneth ascrybe goodnes god hath done awne power yf serued awne deseruinge destroyed euerychone chap x proceadeth forth tellinge wickednes departed chap xi consyderinge multitude roth benefites god receaued pleasaunt londe receaue exorteth againe kepe god commaundementes chap xii descrybeth vnto againe statute ordinaunces lorde chap xiii men shal knowe false prophetes ought punyshed chap xiiii moch cleane people god commaunded avoyde customes heythen shauynge heades eatinge certayne mea • e c chap xv seuenth yeare wherof thou readest also xxv chapter thirde boke moses poore folkes bonde men oughte intreated chap xvi feaste easter whytsondaye tabernacle chap xvii certayne statute office kynges iudges chap xviii porcion leuites prophete promised vnto people false prophetes maye knowne chap xix fre city deedslayers many witness accepted matter false oughte punished chap xx godly ordinaunce concernynge warre strykinge battayll chap xxi ought done one founde slaine felde woman taken presoner child wil obeye father mother stoned death deed body maye hange styll vpon tre chap xxii loue towarde man nehgboure dyuerse commaundemētes man shal ordre wife founde mayden chap xxiii maye come congregacion lorde commaundementes chap xxiiii deuorcement fredome new maried commaundementes concernynge loue towarde man neghboure chap xxv iudge ought punyshe one brother shulde rayse vp sede another true weightes measure destroyenge amaleck chap xxvi first frutes tythes broughte prayse thankesuynge vnto god chap xxvii stone set vp beyonde iordane commaundementes god wrytten theron blessinge cursinge vpon two mountaynes chap xxviii swete gracious promyses soch loue commaundementes god agayne maruelous sore fearfull plage threatened vnto thē regarde god worde chap xxix couenaunt renewed londe moab moses putteth mynde louynge benefites god maie stedfast lorde chap xxx merciful kyndnesse god yf men wil herken vnto voyce conuerte frō awne euell wayes sore punyshment • f wil obeye chap xxxi iosua geuē vnto people captayne moses steade prophecie wyl forsake waye god punyshed therfore chap xxxii songe moses goeth vp mount seyth londe promesse commeth chap xxxiii swete blessinge wherwith moses blesseth people death chap xxxiiii moses goeth vp mount dyeth child israel make lamentacion first chapter wordes moses spake vnto israel syde iordane wildernesse playne felde towarde reed see betwene paran thophel laban hazeroth disahab eleuen day iourney horeb waye mount seir vnto cades bernea fortuned first daye eleuenth moneth fortieth yeare moses spake vnto ye child israel acordinge vnto ye lorde commaunded num 3 • smytten sihon ye kynge amorites dwelt heszbon og kynge basan dwelt astaroth edrei syde iordane ye lande moabites beganne moses declare lawe sayde lorde god spake vnto v vpon mount horeb sayde ye haue bene lōge ynough vpon mountayne turne departed hence ye maye come mountaynes amorites neghbours ye feldes vpon mountaynes valley towarde south towarde see syde lande canaan mount libanus euen vnto greate water euphrates beholde haue delyuered londe go take possession lorde sware vnto yor father abraham isaac iacob • ene 15 • nd 17 b wolde geue vnto thē sede saide vnto tyme able beare self alone exod 18 c lorde youre god hath increased daye ye ye starres heauen multitude lorde god yor father make yet many thousande tymes mo blesse hath promysed alone beare soche cōbraunce charge stryfe amōge prouyde men wyszdome vnderstondinge soch knowne amonge youre trybes thē wil set heades vnto answered ye sayde good thinge thou sayest thou wilt do▪ toke ye heades youre trybes wyse famous mē set ouer heades ouer thousandes ouer hundred ouer fiftye ouer ten officer amonge youre trybes charged youre iudges ye tyme sayde heare youre brethrē 〈…〉 iudge righteously betwene euery man brother straunger ye shall knowe personne iudgment shall heare small well greate afrayed man iudgment god yf eny cause harde 〈…〉 let broughte vnto yt maye heare thus commaunded tyme yt ye shulde doo departed horeb walked thorow whole wyldernesse greate terryble ye haue sene waye ye mountaynes amorites lorde oure god commauded v came vnto cades bernea sayde vnto ye come ye mountaynes ye amorites lorde god shal geue v beholde londe lorde thy god hath geuē vnto go vp conquere ye lorde god thy father hath sayde vnto 〈…〉 feare discoraged came ye vnto sayde let v sende men v 〈…〉 spye v londe brynge v worde agayne waye shal go vp city shal come pleased well toke twolue men amonge euery trybe one whan departed wente vp hye countre came ryuer escol spyed toke frute ye londe thē 〈…〉 broughte downe vnto v broughte v worde agayne sayde good londe lorde oure god hath geuen v ye wolde go vp dishobedient vnto mouth lorde youre god murmured youre tentes sayde lorde hateth v therfore hath broughte v londe egipte delyuer v handes amorites destroye v whither shal go vp oure brother haue discoraged oure hertes 〈…〉 saide people greater hyer stature thē ye city greate walled euen vp heauen morouer haue sene child enakim sayde vnto feare afrayed lorde youre god goeth shall fighte like dealte egipte youre eye wyldernesse thou sawest lorde thy god bare euen man beareth sonne thorow waye ye haue walked tyll ye came place yet ye haue beleued lorde youre god wente searche place ye shulde pitch youre tentes 〈◊〉 9 c • od • 3 night fyre shewe waye wherin ye shulde go daye tyme cloude whan lorde herde ye voyce yor wordes 〈◊〉 ▪ 94 b 〈◊〉 14 c 〈◊〉 • 6 g wroth swore saide shall none euell generacion se good londe sware geue vnto youre father excepte caleb sonne iephune 〈◊〉 14 b shal se vnto wyl geue londe hath troddē vpon child hath perfectly folowed lorde lorde angrye wt also youre sake 〈◊〉 20 b 〈◊〉 c 34 sayde thou also shalt go thither iosua ye sonne nun stondeth shal go thither corage shal deuyde enheritaunce vnto israel youre childrē 〈◊〉 14 whō ye sayde shulde praye youre sonnes daie vnderstonde nether good ner bad shal go thither vnto wil geue shall enioye turne take youre iourney wyldernesse euen waye reed see 〈◊〉 14 f answered ye sayde vnto haue synned agaynst ye lorde wil go vp fighte acordinge lorde hath commaunded v whan ye prepared yor selues euery one harnesse poynte go vp mountaynes ye lorde sayde vnto speake vnto yt go vp fighte amōge ye smytten youre enemy whan tolde ye wolde heare dishobedient vnto worde lorde presumptuous wente vp ye mountaines amorites dwelt vpon moūtaynes came chaced bee smote seir euen vnto horma whan ye came againe wepte lorde wolde heare youre voyce enclyned eares vnto nu 20 • ye abode cades longe season ii chapter turned v toke oure iourney wildernesse nu 21 euen waye reed see lorde sayde vnto compassed mount seir longe season ye lorde saide vnto ye haue cōpassed mountayne lōge ynough turne northwarde commaūde people saye ye shal go thorow ye coastes youre brother child esau dwell seir shal afrayed take diligente hede youre selues ye prouoke wyl geue one fote bredth londe gen 36 • mal 1 mount seir haue geuen child esau possesse ye shal bye meate moneye ye maye eate water shal ye bye money ye maye drynke lorde thy god hath blessed workes thy hondes hath considered thy iourneyes thorow greate wyldernesse fortye yeares hath lorde thy god bene thou hast wanted nothinge whan departed brother child esau dwelt vpon mount seir waye felde elath ezeon gaber turned v wente waye wyldernesse ye moabites sayde lorde vnto iudic 3 • thou shalt vexe moabites ner prouoke thē vnto battayll wil geue londe possesse ar haue geuen vnto child lot possession gen 14 • emims dwelt tyme greate stronge people hye stature enakims taken giauntes like ye enakims ye moabites called emims gen 36 • horites also dwelt seir afore tyme ye child esau droue destroyed dwelt steade like israel dyd ye lōde possession lorde gaue get vp go ouer ryuer sared wente ouer tyme goinge frō cades barnea tyll came ouer ryuer sared eight thirtye yeares tyll men warre waysted hoost nu 14 c 26 • lorde sware vnto hande lorde also agaynst destroye thē hoost tyll consumed whan men warre cō sumed yt deed amonge people lorde spake vnto sayde daie shalt thou go thorow coast ye moabites ar shalt come nye vnto ye child ammon • dic 11 f thou shalt vexe ner prouoke wyll geue lōde childrē ammon possesse haue geuē vnto childrē lot possession takē lōde giauntes also giauntes dwelt therin afore tyme ye ammonite calle thē samsumims people greate many hye stature enakims ye lorde destroyed thē let possesse dwelt steade • en 36 like dyd childrē esau dwell vpō mount seir whan destroyed horites let possesse haue dwelt steade vnto daye caphthorims came caphther destroyed ye auims yt dwelt hazarim euen vnto gaza dwelt steade get vp departe go ouer ryuer arnon beholde haue geuē sihon ye kynge amorites heszbon thy hande go conquere prouoke vnto battayll daye wyll begynne naciōs vnder heauen shal feare drede ye moch yt whā heare shal tremble quake thy commynge sent messaungers ye wyldernesse east vnto sihon kynge heszbon • eu 20 b wt peaceble wordes • um 21 c caused saye vnto wil go thorow ye lōde wil go longe hye waye wil nether turne righte hāde ner ye lefte thou shalt sell meate money maye eate water shalt thou sell money maye drinke onely let go thorow fote 〈◊〉 20 c child esau dwell seir dyd vnto moabites dwell ar vntyll come ouer iordane londe lorde oure god shal geue vnto v sihon kynge heszbon wolde let v go lorde yi god herdened mynde made hert tough mighte delyuer thy hādes come passe daye ye lorde sayde vnto beholde haue begonne delyuer sihon londe go cōquere possesse lōde 〈…〉 sihō came wt people fight agaynst v iahza lorde oure god delyuered oure handes smote child people toke city tyme destroyed vtterly city men wemen child let none remayne saue catell caught oure selues spoyle city wanne aroer lyeth vpon ryuer syde arnon cite ryuer vnto gilead cite coulde defende selfe v lorde oure god delyuered v v 〈…〉 vnto londe child ammon thou camest ner ryuer iabok ner ye city vpō ye mountaines ner vnto euer lorde oure god forbad v iii chapter turned v wente vp ye waie vnto basan 〈…〉 og ye kynge basan came wt people fight agaynst v edrei lorde sayde vnto afrayed haue delyuered people wt londe thy hande thou shalt wt thou dyddest wt sihon kynge ye amorites dwelt heszbon 〈…〉 thus ye lorde oure god delyuered og ye kynge basan oure handes also people smote tyll nothinge left ouer vnto wanne tyme city one cite toke euen thre score city whole region argob kyngdome og basan city strōge hye walles gate barres besyde many vnwalled townes vtterly destroyed dyd sihon kynge heszbon deu 〈…〉 city destroyed vtterly men wemen child catell spoyle city caughte oure selues thus toke tyme londe honde two kynges amorites beyonde iordane ryuer arnon vnto mount hermon sidon call sirion amorites call senir city vpon playne gilead basan vnto salcha edrei city kyngdome og basan onely og kynge basan remayned ouer giauntes beholde yron bed rabath amonge child ammon nyne cubites longe foure cubites brode cubite man londe conquered tyme aroer lyeth ye ryuer arnon 〈◊〉 32 f 〈◊〉 ▪ 29 b 〈◊〉 ▪ 1 • vnto rubenites gaddites gaue halfe mount gilead city therof ye remnaunt gilead basan kyngdome og gaue vnto halfe trybe manasse whole region argob basan called giauntes londe iair sonne manasse toke region argob vnto coastes gessuri maachati basan called hauoth iair awne name vnto daye vnto machir gaue gilead vnto rubenites gaddites gaue one parte gilead vnto ryuer arnon myddes ryuer ye border vnto ryuer iabok border child ammon felde also iordane coaste cinereth vnto see felde namely ye salt see vnder mount pisga eastwarde 〈…〉 commaunded tyme sayde lorde youre god hath geuen londe take possession go youre waye forth therfore harnessed youre brother child israel ye mete warre youre wyues child catell knowe ye haue moch catell let remayne youre city haue geuen vntyl lorde youre god haue broughte yor brother rest also well also maye take mightie hāde god heauen earth ye workes thy power let go se yt good londe beyonde iordane yt goodly hye countre libanus lorde angrie youre sake wolde heare deu 1 f 4 c sayde vnto content speake londe ye ye go ouer iordane possesse ye shal dwell longe therin shal vtterly destroyed ye lorde shal scater amonge ye nacions ye shall left small people amōge ye heythen 〈…〉 whyther lorde shall daye ye maye stronge come conquere londe whither ye go possesse ye maye lyue longe londe 〈…〉 lorde sware vnto youre father geue vnto sede euē londe floweth mylke hony londe whither thou commest therin begynnynge yeare vnto ende yf ye shal herken therfore vnto commaundementes commaunde daye yt ye loue lorde youre god serue youre hert youre soule 〈…〉 wyl geue rayne vnto youre lōde due season early late thou mayest gather thy corne thy wyne thine oyle wyll geue grasse vpon thy felde thy catell ye maye eate fylled bewarre yt youre hert disceaued ye go asyde serue goddes worshipe wrath lorde waxe whote vpō 〈…〉 shut vp heauē come rayne earth geue hir increase ye perishe shortly good lōde lorde hath geuen put vp therfore wordes youre hertes youre soules 〈…〉 bynde thē signe vpon youre handes yt maye token remembraunce yor eye teach youre child thou talke therof whan thou syttest thine house walkest waye whan thou lyest downe whan thou rysest vp wryte vpon postes thine house vpon thy gate thou thy child maye lyue longe londe lorde sware vnto thy father geue longe dayes heauen endure vpon earth yf ye shal kepe commaundementes commaunde ye therafter ye loue lorde youre god walke wayes cleue vnto shall lorde dryue nacions ye shall cōquere greater mightier nacions ye youre selues place sol youre fete treade vpon shalbe wyldernes fro mount libanus water euphrates vnto ye vttemost see shal youre coastes noman shal able wt stonde lorde youre god shal let feare drede come vpon ye londes wherin ye go like hath promysed 〈◊〉 • 0 c beholde laye daye blessynge curse 〈…〉 blessynge yf ye obedient vnto commaundementes lorde youre god commaunde daye curse yf ye wyl obedient commaundementes lorde youre god turne waye cōmaunde daye ye walke goddes ye knowe whan ye lorde ye god hath broughte londe whither thou commest possesse 〈◊〉 27 b shalt thou geue blessynge vpon mount grisim curse vpon mount ebal beyonde iordane waye towarde goinge downe sonne lōde cananites dwell ye playne felde ouer agaynst gilgal besyde oke groue ye shal go ouer iordane ye maye come take possession londe lorde youre god hath geuen conquere dwell therin take hede therfore ye acordinge vnto ordinaunces lawes laye daye xii chapter ordinaunces lawes ye shal kepe ye therafter londe lorde god thy father hath geuen possesse longe ye lyue vpon earth 〈◊〉 7 destroye place wherin ye heithen whō ye shal conquere haue serued goddes whether vpō hye mountaynes vpō hilles amonge grene tree ouerthrowe altares breake downe pilers burne groues fyre hewe downe ymages goddes brynge name naught youre house haue geuē youre handes lorde thy god hath blessed deu 29 • ye shall none thinges yt daye euery man semeth good awne eye ye yet come rest ner ye enheritaūce lorde thy god shal geue ye shal go ouer iordane dwell londe yt lorde youre god shall deuyde vnto shal geue rest youre enemy rounde aboute ye shal dwell safe whan lorde thy god hath chosen place make name dwell ye shall brynge geue ye possesse thou shalt prepare waye parte coastes ye londe ye lorde thy god shal deuyde vnto thre partes whosoeuer hath commytted slaughter maye flie thither shalbe cause 〈…〉 whosoeuer hath committed slaughter maye flye thyther lyue yf eny man smyte neghboure vnawarres 〈…〉 hath hated tyme passed whan man goeth vnto wod neghboure hew downe tymber turneth hande wt axe hewe downe wod yron slyppeth helue hytteth neghboure dyeth shal flye one city maye lyue lest auenger bloude folowe deedsleyer whyle hert whote ouertake whyle waye farre slaye yet cause death hī moch hated tyme passed therfore commaunde thou appoynte thre city whan lorde ye god enlargeth thy border hath sworne vnto thy father geueth lōde promysed thy father geue thou kepe cōmaundementes yt commaunde daye yt thou loue lorde thy god walke wayes ye life longe thē shalt thou adde yet thre city vnto thre innocent bloude shed thy londe lorde ye god geueth enheritaunce bloude come vpon 〈◊〉 14 yf eny man beare hate agaynst neghboure layeth waite ryseth agaynst smyteth dye flyeth one city shall elder cite sende thither cause fetched thence delyuer handes auenger bloude maye dye thine eye shal pitie giltye bloude shalt thou put awaye frō israel thou mayest prospere 〈◊〉 27 c 〈◊〉 24 • thou shalt remoue thy neghbours marck olde tyme haue set thine enheritaunce thou enheretest londe lorde thy god hath geuen ouercome xxi chapter whan one slayne founde ye londe ye lorde ye god shall geue ye possesse lyeth ye felde knowne hath slaine shal thy elder iudges go forth meet slayne vnto city lye rounde aboute loke cite nexte ye elder shal take yōge cowe hath bene laboured ner hath drawē yocke shal brynge valley nether earinge sowinge strike hir heade valley shal prestes ye child leuicome forth deut 17 b shal open vnto ye good treasure euen heauen geue rayne vnto thy londe due season prospere workes thine handes deu 15 thou shalt lēde vnto many naciōs thou shalt borowe man ye lorde shal set behynde thou shalt aboue onely benethe yf thou obedient vnto commaundementes ye lorde thy god commaunde daye kepe yf thou deu 4 17 c bowe asyde eny wordes commaunde ye daye either righte hande lefte yt thou woldest walke goddes serue yf thou wylt herken vnto voyce lorde thy god leu 26 b kepe commaundementes ordinaunces commaunde yt daie bar 1 b dan 9 b shall curse come vpon ouertake cursed shalt thou towne cursed ye felde cursed shal thy baszket thy stoare cursed shall frute thy body frute thy londe frute thine ox frute thy shepe cursed shalt thou whan thou goest cursed whā thou goest lorde shal sende consuminge complayninge cursynge thou takest hande tyll haue destroyed shortly broughte naughte thy wicked inuencions thou hast forsaken lorde shall make pestylence byde longe tyll haue consumed londe thou commest possesse lorde shall smyte swellynge feuers heate burnynge venome drouth palenesse shall persecute tyll haue destroyed • eut 10 c thy heauen ouer thy heade shalbe brasse earth vnder yron lorde shall geue thy londe dust rayne aszshes heauen vpon vntyll thou broughte naught lorde shall cause smytten thine enemyes thou shalt come one waye agaynst seuen wayes shalt thou flye shalt scatered amō ge kyngdomes vpon earth thy carcase shalbe meate vnto maner foules ayre beestes vpon earth shalbe man fraye awaye lorde shal smyte ye botch egipte emorodes scalle maungynesse thou shalt healed therof mich 3 b rom 1 c lorde shall smyte madnesse blyndnesse dasynge hert thou shalt grope noone daye ye blynde gropeth darknesse shalt prospere thy waye thou shalt suffre vyolence wronge thy lifelonge man shal helpe ye1 12 c thou shalt spouse wife another shal lye deu 20 thou shalt buylde house another shall dwell therin thou shalt plante vynyarde shalt make comen thine oxe shalbe slayne thine eye thou shalt eate therof thine asse shalbe violently taken awaye euen ye face shal restored yt againe thy shepe shalbe geuen vnto thine enemy man shal helpe thy sonnes thy doughters shalbe geuen vnto another nacion thine eye shal se dase vpon daye longe thy hande shal able delyuer frute ye londe ye laboure shall nacion eate thou knowest thou shalt onely shalbe oppressed suffre wronge dayes thy life thou shalt cleane besyde thy selfe sighte thine eye shal se lorde shal smyte myscheuous botch ye knee legges thou canst healed euen sole thy fote vnto crowne thy heade▪ lorde shal brynge thy kynge thou hast set ouer vnto nacion 〈…〉 thou knowest nether thy father shalt thou serue geddes euen wodd stone thou shalt go waist become byworde laughinge stocke amōge nacions whither ye lorde hath caryed thou shalt cary moch sede ye felde shalt gather litle 〈…〉 greshoppers shal destroye thou shalt plante vynyardes dresse thē thou shalt nether drynke wyne ner gather ye grape ye wormes shal consume thou shalt haue olyue tree ye coastes shalt anoynted oyle thyne oliue tree shalbe roted thou shalt get sonnes doughters yet haue shal caried awaye captiue thy tree frutes thy londe shall marred blastinge straunger ye shal clymme vp ouer allwaye aboue thou shalt come downe alowe lye euer beneth shal lende vnto thou shalt lende shalbe thou shalt behynde curse shall come vpon folowe ouertake yt tyll thou destroyed thou herkenest vnto ye voyce lorde yt god kepe commaundemētes ordinaunces hath commaunded therfore shal betokens wonder vpon vpon thy sede euer thou hast serued ye lorde thy god ioyfull good hert whan thou haddest abundaunce thinges therfore shalt thou serue thine enemye lorde shal sende vpon hunger thyrst nakednesse neade thinge shal put yocke yron vpon thy necke vntyll haue broughte naughte lorde shal brynge nacion vpon farre 〈…〉 euen ende ye worlde flyenge aegle people whose speache thou canst vnderstonde harde fauoured people regarde personne olde ner haue compassion yonge shal eate vp ye frute thy catell frute thy londe tyll haue destroyed shall leaue nothinge corne wyne oyle frute ye ox shepe vntyll haue broughte naughte shal laye sege vnto wt thy gate tyll cast downe thy hye stronge walles wherin thou trustest thorow thy londe thou shalt beseged within thy porte thorow thy londe lorde thy god hath geuen 6 f • en 4 b 〈◊〉 • thou shalt eate frute thine awne body flesh thy sonnes thy doughters lorde yt god hath geuē straytnesse sege wherwith thine enemye shall besege shal greue man yt afore hath lyued tenderly voluptuousnes amonge loke vpon brother vpon wife yt lyeth bosome sonne left ouer sonnes lest shulde geue eny flesh child eateth moch nothinge left straytnesse sege wherwith thine enemye shal besege yt within thy gate woman afore hath lyued tenderly voluptuously amonge durste set sole hir fote vpon grounde tendernes voluptuousnes shal greued loke vpon hir huszbande lieth hir bosome hir sonne hir doughter euen hir doughters hath norished betwixte hir legges hir lappe hir sonnes hath borne shall eate secretly scarcenesse thinges straytnesse sege wherwith thine enemye shal besege yt thy gate yf thou wilt diligent wordes lawe wrytten boke thou mayest feare glorious fearfull name euen lorde thy god shal lorde entreate ye wonderously plage vpon ye thy sede yee greate continuall plage euell contynuall sickness shal brynge vpō ye ye sickness egipte wherof thou wast afrayed shal cleue vnto therto maner sickness maner plage wrytten boke lawe shal lorde thy god cause come vpon vntyll haue destroyed shal left fewe people deut 10 afore starres heauen multitude thou hast herkened vnto voyce lorde thy god ye lorde reioysed ouer afore good multiplye iere 31 • euē shall reioyse ouer destroye brynge naughte ye shalbe waysted londe whither thou goest possesse lorde shal scater amonge nacions one ende worlde vnto another shalt thou serue goddes thou knowest ner yet▪ thy father euen wodd stone amonge nacions shalt thou haue quyetnesse nether shal sole ye fote haue eny rest lorde shal geue fearfull hert dasynge eye troubled soule thy life shal hāge night daye shalt thou feare shalt haue trust thy life mornynge thou shalt saye shall geue euenynge euen shalt thou saye shal geue mornynge greate feare thine hert shal make afrayed fighte thine eye thou shalt se lorde shal brynge agayne egipte shippe fulles euen thorow waye wherof sayde vnto exo 14 • thou shalt se nomore shal ye solde vnto youre enemy bonde seruauntes bondemaidens shal man bye xxix chapter ye wordes couenaunt lorde cōmaunded moses make wt child israel londe moabites nu 21 c exo 19 • besyde ye couenaunt made horeb moses called israel sayde vnto ye haue sene lorde dyd youre eye londe egipte vnto pharao seruaūtes londe greate tentacions thine eye haue sene greate tokēs wonder deu 10 b iere 31 yet vnto daye hath lorde geuen hert vnderstondeth eye se eares heare hath caused walke fortye yeares wyldernesse deu • youre clothes waxed olde vpon nether thy shue waxed olde thy fote ye haue eaten bred dronken wyne ner stronge drynke ye mighte knowe ye lorde youre god whan ye came vnto place sihon kynge heszbon nu 81 dc og ye kynge basan • e • 2 f •• • came agaynst v vnto battayll smote toke londe gaue enheritaunce vnto ye rubenites gaddites halfe trybe manassites deu 4 kepe therfore wordes couenaunt therafter ye maye haue vnderstondinge ye ye stonde daye lorde youre god chefe ruler youre trybes youre elder youre officer euery man israel youre child youre wyues ye straungers thine hoost 〈◊〉 9 hewer ye wodd vnto ye drawer yt water thou shuldest enter couenaunt lorde thy god ooth lorde thy god maketh daye mighte set vp daye people vnto mighte thy god hath sayde vnto • en 17 sware vnto ye father abraham isaac iacob make couenaunt ooth onely yt daye stonde v lorde oure god also v daye ye knowe haue dwelt londe egipte came thorow myddes heythen ye passed sawe abhominacions idol wodd stone syluer golde lest amōge man woman housholde trybe turneth awaye hert daye lorde oure god go serue ye goddes nacions lest amonge rote beareth gall worm wodd though heare wordes curse blesse selfe yet hert saye • ere 5 b • oph 1 c deu 12 tush shal euell wil walke • ere 5 b • oph 1 c deu 12 meanynge myne awne hert dronken maye perishe thyrstie shall lorde mercifull vnto wrath gelousy shall smoke ouer soch man curse wrytten boke shall lighte vpon lorde shal put name vnder heauen shall separate vnto euell trybes israel acordinge vnto curse couenaunt wrytten boke lawe posterity youre childrē shal ryse vp straungers come farre countrees shall saye whan se plage londe disease wherwith lorde hath smytten hath brent vp londe brymstone salt yt cannot sowne ner frutefull nether groweth eny grasse therin 〈…〉 like sodom gomor adama zeboim ouer throwne lorde ouerthrewe wrath anger shall nacions saye ie • • 3 〈◊〉 wherfore hath lorde done thus vnto londe greate wrothfull displeasure shalt sayde euen haue forsaken couenaunt ye lorde god father made whan broughte londe egipte wēte serued goddes worshipped thē euen soch goddes knewe deuyded vnto therfore wrath lorde waxed whote ouer londe brynge vpon curse wrytten boke lorde thrust londe wt greate wrath indignacion displeasoure hath cast another londe come passe daye 〈…〉 secretes lorde oure god opened vnto v oure child euer yt shulde wordes lawe vnto voyce thou thy child ye hert thy soule commaunde daye 〈…〉 shal lorde thy god turne thy captiuyte haue compassion vpon shal gather thy congregacion agayne amonge nacions whither lorde thy god hath scatered though thou werest thrust vnto vttemost partes heauen yet shall lorde thy god gather thence thēce shal fetch shal brynge londe thy father haue possessed thou shalt enioye shal good multiplye aboue thy father 〈◊〉 10 lorde thy god shall circumcyse thine hert hert thy sede thou mayest loue lorde yt god thy hert ye soule thou mayest lyue curse shall lorde thy god laye vpon thine enemyes vpon hate persecute thou shalt turne herken vnto voyce lorde commaundementes commaunde daye lorde thy god shal make plenteous workes thine hādes frute thy body frute thy catell frute thy londe good 〈…〉 lorde shall turne reioyse ouer good reioysed ouer thy father thou herken vnto voyce lorde thy god kepe commaundementes ordinaunces wrytten boke lawe turne vnto lorde thy god thy hert thy soule 〈◊〉 10 commaundement commaunde ye daye wonderfull ner farre ner yet heauen thou neadest saye wil go vp v heauen brynge vnto v maie heare nether beyonde see thou neadest saye wyll go ouer see v fetch v maye heare worde nye vnto euē thy mouth thine hert thou 〈◊〉 11 〈◊〉 21 b beholde haue layed daye life good death euell cō maunde daye loue lorde thy god walke wayes kepe commaundementes ordinaunces lawes thou mayest lyue multiplye lorde thy god maye blesse londe whither thou goest possesse yf thou turnest awaye thine hert thou wilt heare fall waye worshipe goddes serue certifye daye ye shal perishe lyue longe londe whither thou goest ouer iordane possesse • eu 4 •• 31 g take heauen earth daye recorde ouer haue layed life death blessinge cursinge thou mayest chose life thou thy sede maye lyue yt ye maye loue lorde youre god herken vnto voyce cleue vnto thy life thy lōge age thou mayest dwell londe lorde sware vnto thy father abraham isaac iacob geue xxxi chapter moses wente spake wordes thou mayest conquere iosua shall go ouer nu 27 lorde hath sayde lorde shal vnto dyd vnto sihon og kynges amorites vnto lōde destroyed num 21 deu 7 • 0 c whan lorde shal deliuer thē ye shal vnto iosua sayde deu 5 • 1 mac 2 • iere 42all thou hast commaunded v wyll whither euer thou sendest v wyl go thither like haue obeyed moses wyl obedient also vnto onely lorde thy god ye like moses euer disobeyeth thy mouth herkeneth vnto thy wordes thou hast commaunded v shal dye onely thou stronge bolde ii chapter iosua sonne nun sent two spyes preuely setim sayde vnto go youre waye loke vpon londe iericho wente forth heb 11 • iac 2 • came ye house harlot called rahab laye tolde kynge iericho lo men come nighte childrē israel spye londe sent kynge iericho vnto rahab saynge delyuer men forth come vnto thy house come spye whole londe two men woman hyd sayde came men vnto dede knewe whence shuttinge gate whan darcke wente yt tell whither gone folowe soone ye shal ouertake caused clymme vp vnto house toppe hyd vnder stalkes flaxe prepared vpō toppe house howbeit men folowed ye waye towarde iordane euen vnto ferye whan folowed vpon gone forth gate shut euer men layed downe slepe wente vp vnto house toppe sayde vnto thē knowe lorde shal delyuer londe deu 2 • • osu 5 feare fallen vpon v inhabiters londe discoraged youre commynge haue herde lorde dryed vp water reed see exo 14 e whā ye departed egipte nu 21 ye dyd vnto two kynges amorites sihon og beyonde iordane ye roted destroyed sence herde therof oure hert hath failed v nether good stomacke eny man reason youre commynge lorde yor god god aboue heauē beneth vpon earth sweare vnto • eu 10 euen lorde moch haue dealte mercifully ye wyl also shewe mercy vpon father house geue true token ye wyl let father lyue mother brother sister haue delyuer oure soules death men sayde vnto • su • yf shewe mercy faithfulnesse vpon whan lorde geueth v londe let oure soule dye farre thou betrayest oure deuyce let downe thorow wyndowe coarde hir house wa • wall cite wall hir dwellynge sayde vnto go youre waye vp mountaynes lest mete folowe vpon hyde youre selues thre dayes tyll come againe yt folowe get youre waye men sayde vnto ooth thou hast taken v wyll discharged whan come ye londe excepte thou knyttest wyndowe ye lyne rosecoloured rope yt thou hast lettē v downe gatherest vnto ye house thy father thy mother yi brother thy father house loke euer goeth dore thy house bloude vpon owne heade giltlesse yt ye house yf hande layed vpon thē bloude shalbe vpō heade yf thou bewrayest eny deuyce thē wil discharged ooth yt thou hast takē v sayde let ye saye let thē go wente waye knyt rose coloured lyne wyndowe wente waye came mountaynes remayned thre dayes tyll folowed vpon come agayne soughte thorow euery strete yet founde two men turned agayne departed mountaynes passed ouer iordane came iosua sonne nun tolde euery thinge founde sayde vnto iosua lorde hath geuē v londe oure handes dwell londe sore afrayed v iii chapter iosua rose vp early departed setim came vnto iordane child israel remayned night afore wē te ouer thre dayes wente officer thorow ye hoost commaunded people sayde whan ye se arke ye couenaunt lorde youre god prestes amōge leuites bearinge departe ye youre place folowe rowme betwene two thousande cubites ye come nye yt ye maye knowe waye ye shulde go ye neuer wente waye afore iosua sayde vnto people halowe youre selues 〈…〉 tomorow shal ye lorde bringe wonderous thinges passe amō ge vnto prestes sayde beare ye arke ye couenaūt go people 〈…〉 bare arke wente people lorde sayde vnto iosua daye wyl begynne make greate sighte israel maie knowe like moses also commaunde thou prestes beare arke saye whan ye come water iordane stonde styll iosua sayde vnto child israel come hither heare worde lorde youre god sayde morouer shal ye perceaue lyuynge god amonge shall dryue ye cananites hethites heuites pheresites girgosites amorites iebusites beholde arke couenaunt yt hath domynion ouer londes shall go iordane take therfore twolue men ye trybes israel euery trybe one whan sol fete prestes beare ye arke lorde gouernoure londes set water iordane shal ye water iordane withdrawe selfe water floweth aboue maye stonde heape whan people departed tentes go ouer iordane prestes bare arke couenaunt people came iordane dypte fete water iordane banckes full maner water 〈…〉 londe water came downe frō aboue stode straight vp vpon one heape farre cite adom lyeth syde zarthan water ranne downe see euen salt see fell awaye decreased 〈◊〉 65 ye people wente thorow ouer agaynst iericho prestes bare arke lordes couenaunt stode drye ye myddes iordane readye prepared israel wēte thorow drye shod vntyll ye whole people come ouer iordane iiii chapter ye lorde sayde vnto iosua take twolue men euery trybe one cōmaunde saye 〈◊〉 • 7 take vp twolue stone iordane place fete prestes stode araye cary yt ye maie leaue ye lodginge ye shal lodge night thē iosua called twolue mē prepared child israel euery trybe one sayde vnto thē go youre waye ouer arke lorde youre god myddes iordane take euery man stone vpon shulder nombre trybes ye child israel yt maye token amonge whan youre child axe father saye stone ye maye saye vnto water iordane claue sunder arke lordes couenaunt whan wente thorow iordane stone set perpetuall remembraunce vnto child israel dyd child israel iosua commaunded bare twolue stone myddes iordane lorde sayde vnto iosua 1 •• • acordinge nombre trybes child israel broughte lodginge lefte iosua set vp twolue stone ye myddes iordane ye fete prestes stode bare ye arke couenaunt yet vnto daye ye prestes bare ye arke stode myddes iordane vntyll perfourmed lorde charged iosua saye vnto ye people deu 27 • acordinge moses gaue iosua commaundemēt people also made haist wente ouer whan people gone ouer arke lorde wente ouer also prestes wente people num 32 • iosu • c rubenites gaddites ye halfe trybe manasse wente harnessed childrē israel like moses sayde vnto thē aboute fortye thousande men ready harnessed warre wente lorde battayll vpon ye felde iericho iosu 3 c daye lorde made iosua greate sighte israel like feared moses stode awe life longe lorde sayde vnto iosua commaunde prestes beare arke witnesse come vp iordane iosua cōmaunded prestes sayde come vp iordane whan prestes yt bare arke couenaūt ye lorde come iordane trode sol fete vpon drye londe ye water iordane came agayne place flowed like afore tyme vpon banckes ye tenth daye first moneth whan people came vp iordane pitched tentes gilgall vpon ye east syde ye cite iericho ye twolue stone taken iordane dyd iosua set vp gilgall saide vnto child israel exo 1 • • whan youre child axe father herafter saie meane stone ye shall tell thē saye israel wēte drye thorow iordane tyme ye lorde yor god dryed vp ye water iordane vntyll ye ouer like lorde yor god dyd reed see • xo 14 c dryed vp v yt mighte go thorow people vpon earth mighte knowe hāde lorde mightie intent ye shulde allwaye feare lorde youre god v chapter whan kynges ye amorites dwelt beyonde iordane westwarde kynges ye cananites see syde herde ye lorde dryed vp water iordane child israel tyll come ouer • osu 2 b hert fayled nether eny corage presence child israel tyme sayde ye lorde vnto iosua make knyues • xod 4 c stone circumcyse child israel agayne seconde tyme iosua made knyues stone circumcysed childrē israel vpon toppe foreszkynnes cause iosua circumcysed male people yt come egipte men warre dyed ye wildernesse waye departed egipte people came forth circumcysed people borne ye wyldernesse waye departed egipte circumcysed child israel walked fortye yeares wyldernesse vntyll people men warre came egipte consumed herkened vnto voyce lorde like lorde sware vnto 〈◊〉 14 shulde se londe lorde sware vnto father geue vnto v euen londe floweth mylke honye child come vp steade dyd iosua circumcyse foreszkynne circumcysed waye whan people circumcysed abode place euē ye tētes tyll whole ye lorde saide vnto iosua daie haue turned ye shame egipte awaye place called gilgall vnto daye whyle child israel laye thus gilgall kepte easter exod 1 • fourtenth daye moneth euē felde iericho ate corne lōde seconde daye easter namely vnleuended bred fyrmentye yt yeare euē daye vpon morow • xod •• f manna fayled whan ate corne ye londe child israel nomore manna ate corne londe canaan yeare fortuned whā iosua iericho lifte vp eye awarre stode mā agaynst naked swerde hande iosua wē te sayde vnto art thou one v oure enemy sayde 〈…〉 prynce lordes hoost come fell iosua downe earth vpon face worshipped sayde vnto sayeth lorde vnto seruaunt prynce ouer lordes hoost sayde vnto 〈…〉 put ye shues ye fete place whervpō thou stondest holy iosua dyd vi chapter iericho shut kepte childrē israel man mighte go ner lorde sayde vnto iosua beholde haue geuen iericho ye kynge men warre therof ye hande let men warre go rounde aboute ye cite sixe dayes vpon seuenth daye let prestes take seuen trompettes yeare iubilye arke go seuenth daye seuen tymes abou •• cite let prestes blowe trompettes whan horne yeare iubilye bloweth maketh sounde ye heare trompettes people shal make greate shoute shal walles cite fall downe ye people shal fall euery one straight iosua sonne nun called ye prestes sayde vnto beare ye th • arke couenaunt let seuen prestes take seuen trompettes yeare iubilye arke lorde vnto people sayde get hence go roūde aboute cite let harnessed go arke lorde whan iosua spoken vnto people seuen prestes bare seuen trompettes yeare iubilye arke lorde wente blew trompettes arke lordes couenaūt folowed harnessed wente prestes blewe trompettes multitude folowed arke full ye noyse trompettes iosua commaunded people sayde ye shall make shoute ner let youre voyce herde nother shall ye geue one worde youre mouth vntyll daye yt saye vnto make shoute make shoute arke lorde wente rounde aboute cite came agyne ye hooste remayned therin iosua vsed ryse vp early mornynge prestes bare arke lorde dyd seuen prestes beare seuen trompettes yeare iubilye ye arke lorde wente blewe trompettes harnessed wente thē ye multitude folowed ye arke lorde full noyse trompettes seconde daye wente aboute cite also came agayne hoost thus dyd sixe dayes vpon seuēth daye whan mornynge sprynge arose gat vp early wente maner seuen tymes aboute ye cite vpon one seuenth daye wente seuen tymes aboute cite seuēth tyme whan prestes blewe trompettes iosua sayde vnto people make shoute ye lorde hath delyuered cite howbeit cite therin shalbe damned vnto lorde 〈◊〉 • c onely harlot rahab shal lyue ye house hyd messaungers sent forth 〈◊〉 • onely bewarre damned lest ye damne youre selues yf ye take ought damned make hoost israel damned brynge mysfortune syluer golde ornamētes brasse yron shalbe sanctified vnto lorde maye come lordes treasure made people greate shoute prestes blewe trompettes whan people herde noyse trompettes made greate shoute 〈…〉 walles fell ehe people clymmed vp cite euery one straight thus wanne ye cite deut •• • destroyed cite edge swerde man woman yonge olde oxe shepe asse iosua sayde vnto ye two men spyed londe go house harlot bringe woman frō thence hath acordynge ye haue sworne vnto ye yonge men spyes wente brought forth rahab hir father mother brother hir kynred caused dwell without hoost israel cite brent fyre therin onely syluer golde ornamentes brasse yrō put vnto treasure house ye lorde iosua let heb 11 • iacob • • harlot rahab lyue hir father house dwelt israel vnto daie hyd messaungers whō iosua sent vnto iericho spye tyme sware iosua sayde • 1 • • cursed man lorde setteth vp cite iericho buyldeth whan laieth ye foundaciō therof let cost first sonne whā setteth vp gate let cost yō gest sonne thus lorde iosua spoken londes vii chapter bvt child israel cōmytted sinne thinge yt damned deut 7 • iosu 6 • 1 • • achan sonne charmi sonne sabdi sonne serah ye trybe iuda toke yt dāned wrath lorde fearce ouer child israel whan iosua sent men iericho vnto hai lyeth besyde bethanē ye east syde bethel sayde vnto thē go vp spye londe whan gone vp spyed hai came agayne iosua sayde vnto let people go vp vpon two thre thousande maye go vp smyte hai lest people weerye themselues fewe wente vp people vpon thre thousande men fled men hai hai smote vpon syxe thyrtie men chaced porte vnto sebar • smote downe waye hert people discoraged became like water psa • 1 b iosua rente clothes fell vpon face vnto earth arke lorde vntill eueninge elder israel cast dust vpon heades iosua sayde oh lorde lorde wherfore hast thou broughte people ouer iordane delyuer v handes amorites destroye v taried beionde iordane begāne oh lorde shal saye whyle israel turneth backe vpon enemy whā cananites heare shal compasse v rounde aboute yee rote oure name earth wylt thou vnto thy greate name sayde lorde vnto iosua stō de vp lyest thou vpon thy face israel hath offended trāsgressed ouer couenaunt commaunded thē haue taken also thinge damned haue stollen dyssembled layed amonge ornamentes child israel able stonde aduersaries must turne backes vpon enemy acursed wyll hēce forth yf ye put damned amonge stonde vp sanctifie people saye 16 sanctifie yor selues agaynst tomorow thus sayeth lorde god israel • eut 13 c • nd 17 b damned thinge israel therfore canst thou stonde thine enemy tyll ye put awaye damned amonge ye shall ryse vp early one trybe another loke trybe euer lorde taketh shall come forth one kynred another loke kynred lorde taketh shall come forth one house another loke house lorde taketh shal come forth one housholder another euer founde ye curse shalbe burnt fyre hath hath gone beyonde couenaunt lorde committed folye israel iosua gat vp tymes mornynge brought forth israel one trybe another ye trybe iuda taken whan brought forth kynreds iuda ye kinred serahites taken whan brought forth kynred serahites one housholde another sabdi taken whā brought forth house one housholder another achan sonne charmi ye sonne sabdi sonne serah trybe iuda taken iosua sayde vnto achan sonne geue glory vnto lorde god israel geue prayse tell thou hast done hide nothinge fro answered achan vnto iosua sayde verely haue synned agaynst ye lorde god israel thus thus haue done sawe amōge ye spoiles costly babilonish garment two hūdreth sycles syluer tunge golde worth fiftye sycles weight vnto lust toke beholde hyd grounde tente syluer vnder iosua sent messaungers thither ranne tente beholde hyd tente siluer vnder toke tente broughte vnto iosua child israel poured lorde iosua israel toke achan sonne serah siluer garment goldē tunge sonnes doughters ox ass shepe broughte ye valley achor iosua sayde moch thou hast troubled v lorde trouble daye israel stoned burned fyre whan stoned made ouer greate heape stone remayneth vnto daye lorde turned rigorousnes wrath therfore place called ye valley achor vnto daye viii chapter ye lorde saide vnto iosua feare afrayed set thou 〈…〉 preuy watch behynde cite iosua arose ye men warre go vp vnto hai iosua chose thirtie thousande fightinge men sent night commaunded sayde take hede ye shal ye preuye watch behynde cite go farre cite se ye redye alltogether people wyll make v cite whan come forth agaynst v 〈…〉 afore wyll flye maye folowe v tyll haue prouoked forth cite shal thinke flye like ye first whyle flye ye shal get vp preuy watch wynne cite ye lorde youre god shal delyuer youre handes whan ye haue wonne cite set fyre vpon doinge 〈◊〉 • 0 c acordinge vnto worde lorde· beholde haue commaunded iosua sent awaye wente vnto place preuy watch laye betwixte bethel hai west syde hai iosua abode night amōge people mornynge arose early set people order wente vp elder israel people towarde hai men warre wente vp gat forth came ouer agaynst cite pitched tentes north syde hai yt valley betwene hai taken aboute fyue thousande men set hynder watch betwene bethel hai west syde cite ordred people whole hoost north syde cite vttemost people reached vnto west ende cite iosua wente nighte myddes valley whan kynge hai sawe made haist gat vp early men cite mete israel ye battayll people euen righte felde wyst preuy watch behynde backe syde cite iosua israel feble fled waye ye wyldernesse cried people ci •• •• shulde folowe vpon • •• ey folowed iosua ruszshed 〈◊〉 cite remayned one man hai bethel wente folowe vpon israel lefte cite stondinge open mighte persecute israel thē sayde ye lorde vnto iosua reach speare thou hast thine hande towarde hai wyll delyuer thy hande whan iosua reached speare hande towarde ye cite ye hinder watch brake vp place ranne whan stretched hande came cite wanne made haist set fyre vpon men hai turned loked behynde smoke cite wente vp towarde heauen place flie vnto nether hither ner thither people fled towarde wyldernes turned aboute folowe vpon whan iosua israel sawe yt hynder watch wonne cite ye smoke cite ascended turned againe smote men hai cite came forth also agaynst yt came myddes amonge israel sydes slewe one man left ouer escaped toke kynge hai alyue broughte vnto iosua whā israel slayne inhabiters hai folowed vpon felde wildernesse whan fallen thorow edge swerde tyll destroied thē turned israel vnto hai smote edge ye swerde fell daye fro man vnto womā twolue thousande men hai iosua withdrue hande wherwith reached speare tyll inhabiters hai vtterly destroyed num •• deut 20 • iosu 8 22 b sauynge catell spoyle ye cite dyd israel parte amonge themselues acordinge vnto worde lorde cō maunded iosua iosua burned vp hai made heape therof euer yet vnto daye kynge hai caused hanged tre vntyll euen whā sonne gone downe deut 20 • iosu 10 c commaunded take body tre cast vnder gate cite made vpon greate heape stone yet vnto daye buylded iosua altare vnto lorde god israel vpon mount ebal acordinge moses seruaunt ye lorde commaunded child israel deu 27 • xo 20 wrytten boke lawe moses euen altare whole stone whervpon yron lifted offred burntofferinges health offeringes vpon stone wrote seconde lawe moses wrote childrē israel israel elder officer iudges stode sydes arke right ouer agaynst prestes yt bare arke couenaunt lorde straunger well one selues one halfe besyde mount grysim halfe beside mount ebal deu 27 b moses seruaunt lorde commaunded afore blesse people israel afterwarde caused proclame wordes lawe blessynge cursynge wrytten boke lawe one worde moses commaunded iosua caused proclamed congregacion israel wemē child straū gers walked amonge ix chapter whan kynges beyonde iordane vpon mountaynes lowe countrees hauens greate see besyde mount libanus herde namely ye hethites amorites cananites pheresites heuites iebusytes gathered thē selues together one acorde fighte agaynst iosua agaynst israel whan inhabiters gibeon herde iosua done iericho hai dealte craftely wēte waie made message toke olde sackes vpon ass olde rente wyne botels olde mended shues vpon fete put olde peced garmentes ye bred vytayles harde moulde wente vnto iosua ye hoost gilgall sayde vnto euery man israel come farre countre therfore make couenaunt wt v sayde euery man israel vnto ye heuyte peraduenture thou dwellest amonge v make couenaunt saide vnto iosua ye seruaū te iosua sayde vnto ye whence come ye sayde thy seruauntes come farre countre name lorde thy god haue herde reporte dyd egipte dyd vnto two kynges amorites beyō de iordane sihon kynge heszbō og kynge basan dwelt astaroth therfore sayde oure elder inhabiters oure countre take fode youre iourney go mete saye vnto youre seruaūtes therfore make bonde v oure bred toke oure house oure foode new whan toke iourney towarde lo harde moulde bottels fylled new lo rēte oure clothes shues waxed olde ye reason sore longe iourney captaynes toke vytayles axed mouth lorde ▪ 〈…〉 iosua made peace set vp couenaunt shulde saued alyue ruler congregacion sware vnto thre dayes made couenaunt herde neghbours dwelt amonge child israel wente forth iourney came thirde daye vnto city called gibeon caphira beeroth cirath iearim smote thē ruler congregacisn sworne vnto name lorde god israel whan congregacion murmured agaynst ruler ruler sayde vnto whole congregacion haue sworne vnto lorde god israel therfore maye touch wil vnto let lyue come wrath vpon v ooth haue made vnto ruler sayde vnto let lyue maye 〈…〉 hewer wodd bearer water whole congregacion ruler haue sayde vnto iosua called commened sayde wherfore haue ye disceaued v sayde ye farre v ye dwell amonge v therfore shall ye cursed shall ceasse seruauntes hew wodd beare water house god answered iosua sayde tolde thy seruauntes lorde thy god commaunded moses seruaunt shulde geue whole lōde wolde destroye inhabiters londe therfore sore afrayed oure lyues thus haue done lo thy handes loke thou thinkest good righte vnto v dyd euen vnto delyuered child israel hā de shulde slaye vpō daye iosua made hewer wodd water bearer congregacion altare lorde vnto daye place shall chose x chapter whan adonisedech kynge ierusalem herde iosua wonne hai damned done vnto hai ye kynge like dyd vnto iericho kynge therof 〈…〉 gibeon made peace israel come vnder sore afrayed gibeon greate cite like one kynges city greater hai citesyns therof men armes therfore sent vnto hoham kynge hebron pirea kynge iarmuth iaphia kynge lachis debir kynge eglon caused saie vnto come vp vnto helpe maie smyte gibeon haue made peace iosua child israel came fyue kynges amorites together wente vp kynge ierusalem kynge hebron ye kynge iarmuth kynge lachis kynge eglon army layed sege vnto gibeon foughte agaynst howbeit gibeon sent vnto iosua gilgall caused saye vnto withdrawe thine hande thy seruauntes come vp soone vnto v delyuer helpe v kynges amorites dwell vpon mountaynes gathered together agaynst v iosua wente vp gilgall warryers men armes lorde sayde vnto iosua 〈◊〉 1 feare haue geuē thy hande shall one able stonde iosua came sodenly vpon night wente vp gilgall esa 28 lorde discomfyted thē israel smote greate slaughter gibeon chaced waie downe beth horon smote vnto aseka makeda whan fled israel waye downe bethoron lorde caused greate hayle heauen fall vpon vnto aseka dyed many mo dyed hayle child israel slewe swerde spake iosua vnto lorde daye lorde gaue ouer amorites child israel sayde presence israel eccli 46 sonne holde styll gibeon thou moone valley aialon sonne helde styll ye moone stode vntyll people auenged thē selues enemy wrytten boke righteous thus sonne stode styll myddes heauen dyfferred go downe space whole daye daye like vnto nether ner whan lorde herkened vnto voyce one man lorde fought israel iosua wente agayne gilgall tē te israel fyue kynges fled hyd thē selues caue makeda tolde iosua haue foū de fyue kynges hyd caue makeda iosua sayde rolle greate stone hole caue set men kepe stonde ye styll folowe youre enemy smyte behynde let come city lorde youre god hath delyuered thē youre hande whan iosua ye child israel ended sore greate slaughter vpō yt brought naught remnaunt came stronge city people came agayne hoost vnto iosua makeda peace man durst moue tunge agaynst child israel iosua sayde open mouth caue brynge fyue kynge forth vnto dyd broughte kynges vnto caue kinge ierusalem kynge hebrō kynge iarmuth kynge lachis kinge eglon whan fyue kynges broughte forth vnto iosua called euery man israel sayde vnto ruler men warre wente come forth treade vpon neckes kynges youre fete came forth trode vpon neckes fete iosua saide vnto afrayed feare stronge bolde thus shal lorde vnto yor enemy agaynst ye fighte iosua smote afterwarde put death hanged vpon fyue tree hanged styll vpon tree vntyll euenynge deut •• whan sonne gone downe commaunded take tree cast caue wherin hyd selues hole caue layed greate stone yet vnto daye daye wanne iosua makeda also smote edge swerde kynge therof deut 20 c damned soules therin let none remayne escaped dyd vnto kynge makeda iosu 6 c dyd vnto kynge iericho iosua israel departed fro makeda vnto lybna foughte agaynst lorde gaue ye kynge therof hande israel smote soules therin edge swerde let one remayne dyd vnto kinge therof done vnto kynge iericho afterwarde wente iosua israel lybna vnto lachis layed sege vnto fought agaynst lorde delyuered lachis also hande israel wanne vpon seconde daye smote ye edge swerde soules therin acordinge done vnto lybna tyme horam ye kynge gazer wente vp helpe lachis iosua smote people tyll remayned one iosua wente israel lachis vnto eglon layed sege vnto fought agaynst wanne daye smote edge swerde damned soules therin daye acordynge vnto done vnto lachis wente iosua israel eglon vnto hebron foughte agaynst wanne smote ye edge swerde kynge 〈◊〉 city therof soules 〈◊〉 therin let one remayne aco •• dynge vnto done vnto eg ••• damned soules 〈◊〉 therin turned iosua agayne •• rael towarde debir fought agaynst 〈◊〉 wanne kinge ye city therof smote edg • swerde damned ye soules therin let one remayne ouer▪ euen done vnto hebrō l ••• na kynges dyd also vnto •• bir kynge therof thus iosua smote londe vpon mountaynes towarde south lowe countrees ryuers kynges let one remaine ouer damned breth lorde god israel commaunded iosua smote cades bernea vnto gaza londe gosen vnto gibeon toke kynges lō de one tyme lorde god israel foughte israel iosua wente agayne withall israel tentes vnto gilgal xi chapter whan iabin kynge asor herde sent vnto iabob kynge madon kynge samron kynge achsaph kynges dwelt towarde north vpon mountaynes playne southsyde cineroth lo •• countrees lordshippes dor see syde cananites towarde ye east west ye amorites hethites pheresites iebusites vpon mountaynes heuites vnder mount hermon londe mispa wēte army greate people many ye sonde see exceadinge many horse charettes kinges gathered thē selues came pitched together ye water meram fighte israel lorde sayde vnto iosua feare tomorow aboute tyme wil delyuer slayne child israel thou shalt lame horse burne charettes fire 〈…〉 io •• came sodenly vpon men warre water mero •• fell vpon lorde delyuered ye handes israel smote chaced vnto greate sidō warme water playne mispa towarde ye east smote vntyll remayned one dealte iosua ye lorde saide vnto lamed theis horse brent charettes turned backe tyme wanne hasor smote ye kynge wt swerde hasor afore tyme ye head cite kyngdomes smote soules therin wt edge swerde damned let nothinge remayne breth damned hasor fyre city kyngdomes wāne iosua also smote thē edge swerde damned 〈◊〉 20 c acordinge moses seruaunt lorde commaunded howbeit city stode vpon hilles dyd child israel burne fyre hasor onely dyd iosua burne 〈◊〉 31 spoyles city catell dyd child israel deale amonge smote men edge swerde tyll destroyed let nothinge remayne breth lorde commaunded seruaunt moses moses commaunded iosua euen dyd iosua nothinge vndone lorde cō maunded moses iosua toke lōde vpon ye moū taynes yt lyeth towarde south londe gosen lowe countre playne felde mountayne israel valley therof mountayne parteth londe vp towarde seir vnto baalgad playne moūt libanus beneth mount hermon kynges toke smote put thē death 〈◊〉 23 howbeit warred longe season kynges yet one cite yelded selfe peaceably vnto child israel 〈◊〉 9 excepte heuites dwelt gibeon wanne battayll done lorde hert hardened come child israel battayll yt mighte dāned fauoure shewed vnto destroyed • eu 20 c lorde commaunded moses tyme came iosua roted enakims ye mountayne hebron debir anab euery mountayne iuda euery mountayne israel damned thē city let none enakims remayne londe child israel saue gasa 1 1 • ga • th asod remayned thus iosua conquered londe acordinge vnto lorde sayde vnto moses gaue vnto israel enheritaunce nu 26 vnto euery trybe porcion ye londe rested warre xii chapter ye kynges londe whō childrē israel smote conquered lōde beyonde iordane eastwarde frō water arnon vnto mount hermon vnto ye playne felde towarde east nu 21 c deut 2 • sihon kynge amorites dwelt heszbon dominion aroer lieth water syde arnon vnto myddes ye water ouer halfe gilead vnto water iabok border childrē ammon ouer playne felde vnto see cynneroth eastwarde vnto see playne felde namely salt see towarde east waye vnto beth iesimoth south beneth ryuers mount pisga border og kynge basan remayned yet raphaim nu 21 c deut 3 • dwelt astaroth edrei dominion ouer moūt hermon ouer salcha ouer basan vnto border gessuri maachati halfe gilead border sihon kynge hesbon moses seruaunt lorde childrē israel smote nu 32 34 • deut 3 • iosu 13 • moses seruaunt ye lorde gaue vnto rubenites gaddites halfe trybe manasse possession kynges lōde iosua child israel smote syde iordane westwarde frō baalgad vpō playne mount libanus vnto ye moūt parteth londe vp towarde seir iosua gaue vnto trybes israel possession vnto euery one parte euer ye moūtaynes valleyes playne feldes ryuers ye wyldernesses towarde south hethites amorites cananites pheresites heuites iebusites kynge iericho kynge hai lyeth besyde bethel •• su • 〈◊〉 8 • osu 10 kynge ierusalem kynge hebron xiii chapter whan iosua olde wel stricken age lorde sayde vnto thou art olde well aged remayneth yet moch londe conquere namely galile philistynes gessuri sihor floweth egipte vnto border ekron northwarde rekened vnto cananites fyue lordes philistynes namely gasites aszdodites ascalonites gethites ekronites hauites north ye londe cananites maara sidonians vnto aphek euen vnto border amorites morouer londe giblites eastwarde baalgad vnder mount hermon tyll mā come vnto hamath dwell vpon mount libanus vnto warme water sidonians wyl dryue child israel onely let dealte amonge israel haue commaunded deuyde thou lōde enheritaū ce amonge nyne trybes ye halfe trybe manasse •• su 12 b rubenites gaddites ye halfe trybe manasse haue receaued enheritaūce moses gaue thē beyonde iordane eastwarde nu 32 acordinge moses seruaunt lorde gaue ar • er lieth vp water syde arnon cite myddes water coaste • medba vnto dibon city sihon kynge amorites dwelt heszbon 〈…〉 vnto border child ammon gad amonge kynreds gaue moses border iahesar city gilead halfe londe child ammon vnto aroer lyeth rabbath heszbon vnto ramath mispe betomim fro mahanaim vnto border debir valley beth haram beth nimra suchoth zaphon remayned yet realme sihon kynge heszbon iordane vnto edge see cyneroth syde iordane eastwarde inheritaunce child gad kynreds city vyllagyes 〈◊〉 17 〈◊〉 6 vnto halfe trybe child manasse forth child iuda iosua gilgall caleb ye sonne iephunne kenisite sayde vnto thou knowest ye lorde 〈◊〉 14 c sayde vnto moses man god concerninge cades bernea fortye yeare olde whan moses seruaunt lorde 〈◊〉 1 • sent cades bernea spye londe broughte worde agayne euen hert howbeit brother wente vp discoraged hert people folowed ye lorde god vnto vttemost sware moses vnto daye sayde londe whervpon thou hast troden thy fote shalbe thine enheritaunce thy childrens euer thou hast folowed lorde god vnto vttemost hath lorde letten lyue nu 14 c acordinge sayde fyue fortie yeare sence ye lorde spake vnto moses whā israel walked wildernesse lo daie fyue foure score yeare olde eccl 4 • • yet stronge daye daye whan moses sent euen strength also fighte go geue therfore mountayne wherof lorde spake daye thou herdest daye enakims dwell theron hath greate stronge city yf happly lorde wyl maye dryue thē hath sayde iosua blessed 1 pa • 7 • iosu 21 b gaue hebron vnto caleb sonne iephune therfore hebron
