ianoha vnto ataroth naaratha bordreth iericho goeth iordane thapuah goeth westwarde vnto naalkama goinge see enheritaunce trybe child ephraim amonge kynreds border city vyllages childrē ephraim laye scatred amonge enheritaunce child manasse droue ye cananites dwelt gaser ye cananites remayned amōge ephraim vnto daye became tributary xvii chapter lot fell vpō trybe manasse 〈◊〉 48 c iosephs first sonne fell vpon machir first sonne manasse ye father gilead mā armes therfore gilead basan fell also vnto child manasse namely vnto ye childrē abieser child helek child asriel child sechem child hepher child semida childrē manasse sonne ioseph male amonge kynreds 〈◊〉 17 〈◊〉 • 6 zelaphead sonne hepher sonne gilead sonne machir sonne manasse sonnes doughters name mahala noa hagla milca tirza came eleasar prest iosua sonne nun ruler sayde lorde commaunded moses geue v enheritaunce amonge oure brother enheritaunce geuen amonge father brother acordinge commaundement lorde fell vpon manasse ten meetlynes without londe gilead basan lyeth beyōde iordane ye doughters manasse receaued enheritaunce amonge sonnes child manasse londe gilead border manasse frō asser forth vnto michmethath lyeth sichem reacheth vnto righte syde en tapuah londe tapuah fell vnto manasse border manasse vnto childrē ephraim commeth downe nahelkana towarde south syde ryuer city ephraims amonge city manasse north border manasse ryuer goeth forth see syde south warde vnto ephraim manasse northwarde see coaste shal border aser north isachar easte amōge isachar asser manasses beth sean townes therof ieblaam townes therof dor townes en dor townes taanach townes mageddo townes thirde parte cite nophet child manasse coude dryue awaye inhabiters city cananites beganne dwell londe howbeit whan child israel able made cananites tributary droue spake child ioseph vnto iosua sayde wherfore hast thou geuē one porcion one meetlyne enheritaunce yet greate people lorde hath blessed largely sayde iosua vnto moch thou art greate people go vp therfore ye wodd make thy selfe rowme londe pheresites raphaim seynge moūt ephraim narowe sayde child ioseph shal able attayne vnto mountaynes yron charettes amonge cananites dwell londe emek lyeth beth sean vyllages therof iesrael emek iosua sayde vnto house ioseph euen ephraim manasses thou art greate people moch thou art greate thou must haue one lot mountayne ye wod shal thine rote yt ye shall outgoinge thy porcion whan thou dryuest cananites haue yrō charettes mightie xviii chapter multitude child israel gathered selues together vnto silo set vp ye tabernacle witnesse londe subdued vnto yet seuen trybes childrē israel vnto deuyded enheritaunce iosua sayde vnto child israel howlonge ye slowe go cō quere londe lorde god youre father hath geuen chose thre men euery trybe yt maye sende maye get vp go thorow londe descrybe acordinge enheritaunces therof come vnto deuyde londe seuen partes iudas shal remayne vpon border south syde house ioseph shal remayne vpon border north parte descrybe ye londe seuen partes brynge vnto shal cast ye lot lorde oure god •• su 13 〈◊〉 14 leuites haue porcion amonge presthode lorde enheritaunce •• su 12 b gad ruben ye halfe trybe manasse haue receaued enheritaunce beyonde iordane eastwarde moses seruaunt lorde gaue men gat vp go waye whan aboute go descrybe londe iosua commaunded sayde go youre waye walke thorow londe descrybe come agayne vnto maye cast ye lot lorde silo men departed wente thorow londe descrybed seuen partes vpon letter acordinge city came iosua hoost silo iosua cast lot ouer io •• ▪ 24 • thimnath serah vpon moūt ephraim buylded cite dwelt therin enheritaunces eleasar prest iosua ye sonne nun chefest father amonge ye tribe deuided lot vnto childrē israel silo lorde euen dore tabernacle wytnes ended deuydinge londe xx chapter lorde spake vnto iosua sayde speake child israel geue amonge fre city • xo 21 b deut 19 c wherof spake vnto moses deedsleyer sleyeth soule vnawarres vnwittingly maye flye thither yt maye fre amōge avenger bloude flyeth one city shal stonde without porte cite shewe cause elder cite shall take cite geue place dwell yf auenger bloude folowe vpon shall delyuer deedslayer handes moch hath slayne neghboure vnawarres enemye afore shall dwell ye cite tyll stonde congregacion iudgment vntyll hye prest dye shall tyme shall deedsleyer returne go vnto awne cite vnto house cite whence fled appoynted kedes galile vpon mount nepthali sechem vpon mount ephraim kiriatharba hebron vpon moūt iuda beyōde iordane east syde iericho gaue beser wildernes vpon playne trybe ruben ramoth gilead trybe gad golan basan trybe manasse city appoynted ye child israel straungers dwelt amonge whosoeuer slayne soule vnawarres might flye thither shulde put death auenger bloude tyll stonde congregacion xxi chapter chefe father amonge leuites came forth vnto eleasar prest iosua sonne nun ye awncient father amōge trybes child israel spake vnto silo londe canaan sayde num 35 lorde commaunded moses shulde haue city geuen v dwell suburbes oure catell child israel gaue enheritaunce city suburbes therof vnto leuites acordynge commaundement lorde gaue city suburbes vnto leuites lott lorde commaunded moses trybe child iuda trybe child simeon gaue city named name vnto child aaron kynred kahathites amonge child leui first lot theyrs gaue kiriatharba father enak hebren vpon mount iuda suburbes therof rounde aboute 〈…〉 felde cite vyllages therof gaue vnto caleb sonne iephune possession thus gaue vnto child aaron prest fre cite deed sleyers hebron suburbes therof libna suburbes therof iathir suburbes therof esthuma suburbes therof holon suburbes therof debir suburbes therof suburbes therof iuta suburbes therof beth semes suburbes therof euen nyne city two trybes trybe ben iamin gaue foure city gibeon ye suburbes therof gaba suburbes therof anathot suburbes therof almon suburbes therof city child aaron prest thirtene suburbes kynreds child kahath leuites lott foure city trybe ephraim gaue thē fre cite deedsleiers sechē suburbes therof vpon mount ephraim gaser suburbes therof kibzaim suburbes therof bethron suburbes therof trybe dan foure city eltheke ye suburbes therof gibthon suburbes therof aialon suburbes therof gath rimon suburbes therof halfe trybe manasses two city thaenach suburbes therof gath rimon suburbes therof city child ye kynred kahath ten suburbes vnto child gerson amonge kynreds leuites geuen halfe trybe manasse two city fre cite deedslayer gola basan suburbes therof beasthra suburbes therof trybe isachar foure city kision suburbes therof dabrach suburbes therof iarmuth suburbes therof engannim suburbes therof trybe asser foure city miseal abdon helkath rehob suburbes therof trybe nephtali thre city fre cite kedes deedsleyer galile hamoth dor karthan suburbes therof city kynred gersonites thirtene wt suburbes vnto kynreds merari leuites geuen trybe zabulon foure city iakneam kartha dimna nahalal wt ye suburbes therof trybe ruben foure city bezer iahza kedemoth mephaat suburbes trybe gad foure city fre cite deedsleyer ramoth gilead mahanaim heszbon iaeser suburbes city child merari amonge kynreds ye leuites twolue thus city leuites amonge ye possession child israel eight fortye suburbes city dealte euery one suburbes rounde aboute one thus lorde gaue child israel londe sworne vnto father geue toke possession dwelt therin lorde gaue thē rest yt aboute • en 17 like sware vnto father none enemy stode agaynst thē enmies delyuered hande myssed nothinge good lorde promysed vnto house israel came euery whyt xxii chapter iosua called ye rubenites gaddites ye halfe trybe manasse sayde vnto ye haue kepte num • 2 • deut 3 b iosu 1 • moses seruaunt lorde commaunded haue herkened vnto voyce yt haue commaū ded ye haue forsaken youre brethrē longe season vnto daye haue wayted vpon commaundement lorde youre god moch lorde youre god hath broughte youre brethrē rest promysed turne go youre waye youre tentes londe youre possession moses seruaunt lorde gaue beyō de iordane take diligent hede ye acordinge commaundement lawe moses seruaunt lorde hath commaunded deut 10 c ye loue lorde youre god walke wayes kepe commaundementes cleue vnto serue youre hert youre soule iosua blessed let go wente vnto tentes vnto halfe trybe manasse moses geuen possession basan vnto halfe gaue iosua amonge brother syde iordane westwarde whan let go tentes blessed sayde vnto ye come home agayne greate good vnto youre tētes exceadynge moch catell syluer golde brasse yron rayment deut • 0 b num 31 iosu 8 f 1 30 e distribute therfore spoyle youre enemyes amonge youre brother rubenites gaddites halfe trybe manasse returned wente child israel silo lyeth londe canaan go countre gilead londe possession mighte possesse acordynge commaundement lorde moses whan came vnto heapes iordane lye londe canaan rubenites gaddites halfe trybe manasses buylded besyde iordane fayre greate altare whan child israel herde saye beholde child ruben child gad halfe trybe manasse haue buylded altare ouer agaynst londe canaan vpon heapes iordane syde child israel gathered selues together whole congregacion silo go vp agaynst thē armye meane season sent londe gilead phineas sonne eleasar prest ten chefe prynces amonge house father euery tribe israel one came child ruben child gad halfe trybe manasse londe gilead sayde thus sayeth whole congregacion lorde vnto iudi 20 b trespace yt ye haue trespaced agaynst god israel ye shulde turne backe ye lorde daye builde altare fall awaye lorde num 25 haue ynough wickednesse peor yet clensed daye came plage amonge congregacion lorde ye turne backe daye lorde daye ye fallen awaye lorde maye wroth daye tomorow whole congregacion lorde yf londe youre possession vncleane come ouer londe lorde possesseth dwellynge lorde take possession amonge v fall awaye lorde v builde altare altare lorde oure god iosu 7 achan sonne serah trespace thinge damned wrath came ouer ye whole congregacion israel wente downe alone myszdede answered child ruben child gad halfe trybe manasse sayde vnto heades prynces israel mightie god ye lorde mightie god lorde knoweth israel knoweth also yf trangressynge trespacynge agaynst lorde let helpe v daye yf haue buylded altare wolde turne awaye backe lorde offre burnt offerynges meat offeringes theron make eny deed offerynges vpon let lorde requyre yf haue done rather feare thinge sayde daye tomorow mighte youre child saye vnto oure child haue ye lorde god israel lorde hath set iordane border betwene v ye child ruben gad ye haue porcion lorde shulde • child make oure child turne awaye feare lorde therfore sayde let v make oure child altare sacrifice ner burnt offeringe 〈…〉 maye takē betwene v oure posterity maye serue lorde sighte oure burnt offeringes deed offeringes offeringes yt youre child daye tomorow neade saye vnto oure child ye haue parte lorde sayde yf shulde speake vnto v oure posterity daye tomorow maye saye beholde symilitude ye altare lorde oure father made sacrifyce ner burnt offerynge wytnesse betwene v god forbydde shulde fall awaye lorde turne backe daye buylde altare sacrifice burnt offeringe eny presente without ye altare lorde oure god stondeth habitacion whan phineas prest chefe congregacion prynces israel herde wordes child ruben gad manasse spoken pleased well phineas sonne eleasar prest sayde vnto child rubē gad manasse daye knowe ye lorde amonge v ye haue trespaced agaynst lorde dede haue ye delyuered child israel hande lorde phineas sonne eleasar prest ruler returned londe gilead child ruben gad vnto ye londe canaā child israel brought worde agayne matter child israel well cō tente thinge praysed god israel sayde nomore wolde go vp agaynst armye destroye londe childrē ruben gad dwelt ye childrē ruben gad called name altare altare witnesse betwene v lorde god xxiii chapter longe season whan lorde broughte israel rest enemy rounde aboute iosua olde well stricken age called israel elder heades iudges officer sayde vnto olde well aged ye haue sene lorde youre god hath done vnto nacions youre sighte lorde youre god hath foughte beholde haue parted amonge ye rēnaunt nacions lot vnto euery trybe enheritaunce iordane forth nacions haue roted vnto greate see westwarde lorde youre god shal thrust dryue awaye ye maye haue londe possession lorde youre god hath promysed strōge therfore ye maye obserue wrytten boke lawe moses 〈…〉 ye turne asyde nether righte hande ner lefte ye come amonge ye remnaunt naciōs se ye make mencion ner 〈…〉 sweare name goddes nether serue ner bowe youre selues vnto cleue vnto lorde youre god ye haue done vnto daye thē shal lorde dryue awaye greate mightie nacions like hath man bene able stonde vnto daye 〈…〉 one shall chace thousande lorde youre god fighteth acordinge promysed take diligent hede therfore vnto youre soules ye loue lorde youre god 〈…〉 yf ye turne backe cleue vnto nacions make mariages ye come amōge amonge ye sure lorde youre god shall nomore dryue nacions 〈…〉 shall vnto snare net prickes youre sydes thornes youre eye vntyll haue destroyed good lōde lorde youre god hath geuen beholde 〈…〉 daye go waye worlde ye shal knowe euen youre hert youre soule hath fayled one worde good lorde youre god promysed like good come lorde youre god promised deut 2 • b euen shal lorde cause euell come vpon tyll haue destroied good londe lorde youre god hath geuen yf ye transgresse ye couenaunt lorde youre god hath commaunded yf ye go yor waye serue goddes worshipe thē shall wrath lorde waxe whote ouer shall shortly destroye good londe yt hath geuen xxiiii chapter iosua gathered trybes israel together vnto sichem called elder israel heades iudges officer whā come god sayde vnto people thus sayeth lorde god israel gen 11 yor father dwelt afore time beyōde ye water abrahā nahor wt tarah father serued goddes gen 12 toke yor father abraham lorde put darcknesse betwene egipcians broughte see vpon ouerwhelmed youre eye haue sene dyd ye egipcians ye dwelt ye wildernes lōge season num 21 broughte ye londe amorites dwelt beionde iordane whā fought agaynst delyuered yor hande ye mighte haue countre possession destroyed num 22 deut 23 balac sonne ziphor kynge moabites gat vp foughte agaynst israel sente bad call balaam sonne beor curse neuertheles wolde heare blessed delyuered hande whan ye wente ouer iordane came vnto iericho citesyns iericho foughte agaynst amorites pheresites cananites hethites girgosites henites iebusites howbeit delyuered thē youre hande exo 33 deu 7 sent hornettes droue namely two kynges ye amorites thorow thy swerde ner thorow thy bowe haue geuen londe whervpon ye bestowed laboure deut 6 b city ye haue buylded ye might dwell therin ye might eate vynyardes olyue tree ye haue planted feare lorde therfore serue perfectly trueth1 reg 7 tob 14 c let go goddes youre father serued beyonde water egipte serue ye ye lorde yf ye like serue lorde thē chose daye ye wyll serue god youre father serued beionde ye water ye goddes amorites whose lōde ye dwell house wyll serue lorde answered people saide god forbidde shulde forsake lorde serue goddes lorde oure god brought v oure father londe egipte frō house bondage soch greate token oure eye preserued v ye waye wente amonge nacions trauayled lorde thrust v people amorites dwelt londe therfore wyll also serue lorde oure god iosua sayde vnto people ye serue lorde holy god mightie gelous spareth youre trangressions synnes yf ye forsake lorde serue straunge god shall lorde turne iosu 23 euell consume hath done good people sayde vnto iosua serue lorde sayde iosua vnto people ye witness ouer youre selues ye haue chosen lorde serue sayde yee put awaye sayde straunge goddes yt amonge enclyne youre hert vnto lorde god israel people sayde vnto iosua wyll serue lorde oure god obedient vnto voyce4 23 iosua made couenaunt people ye daye laied agayne ye lot simeon wente whan iuda wente vp lorde delyuered cananites pheresites hādes slewe tē thousande mē besek foūde adoni besek besek foughte agaynst slewe cananites pheresites adoni besek fled folowed whan ouertaken cut thō be handes fete sayde adoni besek thre score ten kynges wt thombes hādes fete cut gathered vp meate yt lefte vnder table leu 24 iudic 15 • haue done hath god rewarded agayne broughte vnto ierusalē dyed ye childrē iuda foughte agaynst ierusalem wāne deu 20 • smote edge swerde set fyre vpon cite wente child israel downe fighte agaynst ye cananites yt dwelt vpon mount towarde south vall •• 〈…〉 iuda wente agaynst cananites dwelt hebron iosu 15 hebron called kiriatharba afore tyme smote sesai achiman thalmai thence wente agaynst ye inhabiters debir debir called kiriath sepher aforetyme caleb sayde iosu 15 2 par 12 1 17 c yt smyteth kiriath sepher wynneth wyl geue doughter achsa wife athniel sonne kenas calebs yongest brother wāne gaue doughter achsa wife fortuned yt whan wēte counceled hir houszbande axe pece londe hir father fell asse thē sayde caleb vnto ayleth ye sayde geue blessynge thou hast geuen south drye londe geue also watery londe gaue londe watery aboue beneth childrē ye kenyte moses brother lawe wente vp deu 34 palme cite child iuda wyldernesse iuda lyeth ye south syde cite arad nu 10 1 15 wente waye dwelt amonge people iuda wente brother simeon smote cananites zephath damned called name cite horma num 21 iosu 15 iuda also wanne gasa border therof ascalon hir border accaron coastes therof lorde wt iuda conquered mountaynes dwelt valley coulde conquere yron charettes acordinge moses sayde gaue hebron vnto caleb droue thre sonnes enak iosu 14 howbeit ye child ben iamin droue ye iebusites dwelt ierusalem iosu 15 g ye iebusites dwelt amonge child ben iamin ierusalem vnto daye likewyse child ioseph wēte vp also vnto bethel lorde wt thē iosu 16 house ioseph spyed bethel afore tyme called lu watch men sawe man goinge cite saide vnto shewe v maye come cite iosu 2 c wyll shewe mercy vpon whan shewed mighte come cite smote ye cite wt edge swerde let man go frendes wēte man vp ye countre hethites buylded cite called lu name yet vnto daye manasses nu 33 g iosu 17 c 〈◊〉 beth sean wt vyllages therof ner thaenah vyllages therof n • r inhabiters dor vyllages therof ner inbiters iebleam wt vyllages therof ner inhabiters mageddo wt vyllages therof ye cananites beganne dwell londe whan israel mightie made cananites tributary droue iosu 16 b like maner ephraim droue ye cananites dwelt gaser cananites dwelt amonge gaser zabulon also droue inhabiters kitron nahalol ye cananites dwelt amonge tributary asser droue ye inhabiters aco ye inhabiters sidon ahelab achsib helba aphik rehob ye asserites dwelt amōge cananites dwelt lōde droue thē nephtali droue ye inhabiters beth semes ner beth anath dwelt amonge cananites dwelt londe howbeit beth semes beth anath tributary amorites subdued childrē dan vpon mountaine suffred come downe valley amorites beganne dwell vpō mount here aiolon saalbim howbeit ye hande ye house ioseph sore became tributary border amorites mā goeth vp towarde acrabim rocke toppe ii chapter bvt came vp messaūger ye lorde gilgall vnto bochim sayde haue caried vp hither egipte broughte londe sware vnto youre father saide deut▪ 〈…〉 wyl neuer breake couenaunt wt ye shulde make couenaunt •• dweller londe breake downe altares neuertheles ye haue herk •• ed vnto voyce wherfore haue ye done saide morouer wil • dryue may • fall vnto goddes 〈◊〉 whan ye messaunger lorde spoken wordes vnto child israel people lefte vp voyce wepte called ye name place bochim offred vnto lorde whan iosua sente awaye ye people childrē israel gone euery one enheritaūce take possession londe 〈…〉 people serued lorde longe iosua lyued ye elder lyued longe iosua yt sawe greate workes lorde dyd israel whan iosua sonne nun seruaunt lorde 〈…〉 deed whan hūdreth ten yeare olde buried ye border inheritaunce timnath here vpon mount ephraim north syde mount gaas whan generacion gathered vnto father came vp another generacion knew lorde ner workes done israel wroughte child israel euell lorde 〈…〉 serued baal • forsoke ye lorde god father broughte londe egipte folowed goddes goddes nacions dwelt rounde aboute worshipped displeased lorde forsoke ye lorde euer serued baal astaroth ye wrath lorde waxed whote vpō israel delyuered thē ye handes yt spoyled thē mighte spoyle solde thē handes enemy roūde aboute able withstonde enemy eny waye euer wolde ye hā de lorde agaynst thē hurte euen lorde sayde sware vnto sore oppressed 〈…〉 whan lorde raysed vp iudges helped hande soch spoyled thē folowed iudges nether wente whoringe goddes worshipped soone gone ye waye yt father walked heare cōmaundementes lorde dyd dyd whan ye lorde raysed vp iudges vnto lorde ye iudge helped hande enemy longe iudge lyued •• od 2 lorde pitie complaynte made ouer yt subdued thē oppressed neuertheles whan iudge dyed turned backe 〈…〉 marred thē father folowed goddes serue bowe selues vnto wolde fall purpose ner obstinate waye therfore waxed wrath lorde allwaie whote ouer israel sayde moch people haue transgressed couenaunt commaunded father folowe voyce wil hence forth dryue none heythen whō iosua lefte behynde whā dyed 〈◊〉 8 〈◊〉 13 maye proue israel whether wil kepe waye lorde walke therin father dyd thus lorde suffred nacions shorte tyme droue geuen ouer iosuas hande iii chapter nacions lorde suffred remayne yt mighte proue israel vnderstondinge warres canaan onely yt trybes childrē israel might knowe lerne warre afore knowlege therof namely fyue lordes ye philistynes cananites sidonians hethites yt dwelt vpon mount libanus fro mount baal hermon vntyll man come vnto hemath remayned israel mighte proued mighte knowne whether wolde herken commaundementes lorde commaunded father moses whan child israel dwelt thus amōge cananites hethites amorites pheresites heuites iebusites • eut 7 〈◊〉 12 toke doughters wyues gaue doughters vnto sonnes serued goddes wroughte wickednes lorde forgat lorde god serued baalim astaroth ye wrath ye lorde waxed whote ouer israel solde thē vnder hāde cusan risathaim kynge mesopotamia ye childrē israel serued cusan risathaim viij yeare thē cried childrē israel vnto lorde lorde raysed thē vp sauior delyuered thē namely 〈◊〉 1 c athniel ye sonne kenas calebs yongest brother sprete lorde came vpon iudge israel wente warre fare ye lorde delyuered cusan risathaim kynge syria hāde yt hande strōge • par 1 • londe rest fortye yeares athniel sonne kenas dyed child israel dyd yet euell lorde lorde strengthed eglon kynge ye moabites agaynst ye childrē israel wrought wickednesse ye lorde gathered vnto ye childrē ammon amalechites wēte smote israel conquered deut • 0▪ cite palme tree child israel serued eglon ye kynge ye moabites eightene yeare thē cried vnto lorde lorde raysed thē vp sauioure namely ehud sonne gera ye sonne iemini man mighte nothinge righte hande whā childrē israel sent present vnto eglon kynge moabites ehud made two edged dagger spanne longe gyrded vnder garmēt vpō righte thye broughte ye present vnto eglon kynge ye moabites eglon fat man whan delyuered presente let people go caried present himselfe turned backe idol gilgall caused saye thus vnto kynge haue secrete thinge tell kynge commaunded kepe sylence stode aboute wente ehud came vnto sat syled sommer perler selfe alone ehud saide haue somwhat saye vnto god thē rose vp frō seate ehud put forth lefte hande toke dagger righte thye thrust bely yt hefte wente also blade fatt closed hefte drue ye dagger bely ye fylthines departed frō ehud gat backe dore put ye dore lockte whan gone seruauntes came sawe dore sommer perler lockte sayde peraduenture gone preuye syled sommer perler whan wayted lōge tyll ashamed man opened perler dore toke keye opened 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 beholde laye lorde deed vpō earth ehud gotten awaye whyle made longe tariēge wente ouer idol ranne waye vnto seirath whan came 〈◊〉 ▪ 10 blewe ye trompet vpō mount ephraim child israel wente mount saide vnto folowe lorde hath delyuered moabites youre enemy yor hande folowed wanne ye ferye iordane yt goeth towarde moab suffred man go ouer ye tyme smote moabites vpō ten thousande men noble men armes escaped one thus moabites broughte vnder hande child israel tyme londe w • rest foure score yeares afterwarde • ud 5 samgar ye sonne anath slewe sixe hundreth philistynes ox gadd delyuered israel also iiii chapter bvt child israel dyd yet euell ye lorde whan ehud deed lorde solde thē hande iabin kynge cananites dwelt hazor chefe captayne hooste sissera dwelt haroseth heythen childrē israel cried vnto lorde nyne hūdreth yron charettes subdued child israel violence twentye yeare ye tyme iudgesse israel prophetisse debbora wyfe lapidoth dwelt vnder ye palme debbora betwene rama bethel vpon mount ephraim child israel came vp vnto lawe sent forth 〈◊〉 5 b called barak sonne abi noam kedes nephtali sayde vnto hath ye lorde god israel cō maunded go thy waye get vp vnto mount thabor take wt ten thousande men child nephtali zabulon wil make sissera chefe captayne iabins hoost come vnto ye psal • 2 water cyson charettes multitude wyll delyuer thy hande barak sayde vnto yf thou wilt come wt wil go yf thou wilt come wil go sayde wyll go neuerthelesse prayse shal thine iourney thou goest ye lorde shal delyuer sissera womās hande debbora gat hir vp wente barak vnto kedes barak called zabulon nephtali vnto kedes wēte fote wt ten thousande men debbora wente wt also heber kenyte departed kenytes child 〈…〉 hobab moses brother lawe pitched tent ye oke zaanaim besyde kedes tolde sissera yt barak sonne abi noā gone vp vnto moūt thabor gathered charettes together nyne c yron charettes people yt haroseth heythē vnto water cyson debbora sayde vnto barak vp daie wherin lorde hath delyuered sissera ye hande ye lorde shal go forth ye barak wente fro mount thabor ye ten thousande men lorde discomfited sissera wt charettes hoost made thē afrayed edge swerde barak yt sissera leapte charet fled fote neuerthelesse barak folowed vpon charettes hoost vnto haroseth heythen sisseras hoost fell thorow ye edge swerde yt one escaped sissera fled fote vnto tente iael ye wife heber ye kenite peace betwene kynge iabin hasor house heber kenite iael wēte forth mete sissera sayde vnto turne lorde turne afrayed turned vnto tente couered garmēt sayde vnto praye ye geue litle water drynke thyrst 〈…〉 thē opened mylke pot gaue drynke couered sayde vnto stōde tente dore yf one come axe eny man saye noman iael wife heber toke nale tente hammer hir hande wente preuely vnto smote nale thorow temple heade yt sancke ye earth fallen slomber weery dyed whā barak folowed sissera iael wente mete sayde vnto come hither wil shewethe man thou sekest whan came vnto sawe sissera deed nale stickinge temple thus god broughte downe iabin kynge cananites child israel tyme hande child israel wente subdued iabin ye kynge cananites tyll roted debbora barac sonne abi noam sange tyme sayde v chapter ye come rest ye quyete men israel prayse ye lorde amonge soch people frewyllinge heare ye kynges herken ye prynces wyl wyl synge lorde euen vnto lorde ye god israel wil playe 〈◊〉 19 c •• ut 4 b lorde whan thou wentest seir camest felde edom ye earth quaked heauen dropped cloudes dropped water 〈◊〉 96 hilles melted lorde sinai lorde god israel tyme 〈◊〉 3 sanger sonne anath tyme 〈◊〉 4 c iael wayes fayled shulde haue gone pathes walked thorow croked wayes scarcenesse scarcenesse houszbande men israel vntyll debbora came vp vntyll came vp mother israel god hath chosen new thinge hath ouercome ye porte battayll yet sene nether shylde ner speare amonge fortye thousande israel hert loueth ye teacher israel ye yt frewyllinge amonge people prayse lorde ye ryde vpō fayre ass ye syt iudgment geue sentence ye go waye prayse lorde whā ye archer cried betwene ye drawer water spokē ye righteousnes lorde righteousnes huszbande men israel ruled people lorde vnder gate vp debbora vp get vp get vp rehearse songe 〈◊〉 4 arise barak catch yt catched thou sonne abinoam desolate rule mightie people lorde ye dominion thorow giauntes 〈◊〉 3 ephraim rote amalek ben iamin thy people machir haue teacher ruled zabulō become gouernours thorow wrytinge penne isachar prynces debbora isachar barak ye valley sent people fote • ruben stode hye awne consayte separated selfe v abodest thou betwixte border whan thou herdest noyse flockes ruben stode hye awne cōsayte separated selfe v gilead abode beyonde iordane dwelt dan amonge shippes asser sat hauen see taried porcions zabulons people ioperde life vnto death nephtali also toppe ye felde merom kynges came foughte foughte ye kynges cananites thaanah water megiddo spoyle money broughte heauē foughtē agaynst starres course foughte sissera broke cyson ouerwhelmed broke kedumim yee broke cyson soule treade thou vpon mightie made horse fete ruszshinge together greate violence mightie horse men curse cite meros sayde ye angell lorde curse citesyns therof cause come helpe ye lorde helpe lorde giauntes blessynge amonge wemen haue iael wife heber kenite blessinge haue tente amonge wemen iud 4 c whan axed water gaue mylke broughte forth butter lordlyd • szshe toke holde nale wt hir hande smyth hammer hir righte hande smote sissera cut heade pearsed bored thorow temple bowed selfe downe hir fete fell downe laye sanke downe fell hir fete whan soncke downe laye destroyed mother loked wyndowe cried piteously thorow tr • llace tarieth charet lōge cōmeth wherfore wheles charet make longe tarienge wysest amōge lady answered sayde vnto shulde finde deuide spoyle vnto euery man fayre mayde two pray partye coloured garmē te nedle worke sissera spoyle partye coloured garmentes nedle worke aboute necke pray thus thine enemy must perishe lorde loue shal euen sonne rysinge vp mighte londe peace fortye yeares vi chapter whan child israel dyd euell sighte lorde lorde delyuered vnder hande madianites vij yeares whā hande madianites mightie ouer child israel child israel made clyffes ye mountaynes caues holdes defende selues ye madianites whan israel sowed eny thinge ye madianites amalechites child towarde south came vp vpon pitched tētes agaynst destroyed increase londe downe vnto gasa let nothinge remayne ouer beestes israel nether shepe ner ox ner ass came vp catell tentes bene greate multitude greshoppers nether ner camel mighte nombred fell londe mighte destroye thus israel exceadinge small madianites cried child israel vnto lorde whan cried vnto lorde cause ye madianites ye lorde sent thē prophet sayde vnto thē thus saieth lorde god israel caried egipte broughte ye house bondage delyuered hande egipcians hāde oppressed haue thrust geuen lōde sayde vnto lorde youre god • ge 17 g •• e 10 feare ye goddes amorites whose londe ye dwell neuertheles ye haue herkened vnto voyce came angell lorde sat downe vnder oke aphra belonged vnto ioas father ye esrites sonne gedeon throsshinge wheate barne mighte flye awaye madianites appeared vnto angell ye lorde sayde vnto lorde ye thou mightie giaunte gedeon sayde vnto syr yf lorde wt v wherfore happened vnto v wonder oure father tolde v sayde lorde brought v egipte hath lorde forsaken v delyuered v hande madianites lorde turned vnto sayde go thy waye thy strength thou shalt delyuer israel hande ye madianites haue sent sayde lorde wherwithall shal delyuer israel beholde kynred smallest manasse leest father house lorde sayde vnto wt yt thou shalt smyte madianites euen though one man sayde vnto yf haue foūde grace thy sighte make token thou speakest go awaye tyll come ye brynge meatofferynge set sayde wyll tary tyll thou cōmest agayne gedeon wēte made ready kydd epha vnleuended floure layed flesh maunde put broth pot broughte forth vnto vnder oke came nye angell god sayde vnto 〈…〉 take flesh vnleuended bred set vpon stonye rocke poure broth theron dyd angell lorde stretched staffe hande ende touched flesh vnleuended floure 〈…〉 fyre came rocke consumed flesh vnleuended floure angell lorde vanyshed sighte whā gedeon sawe angell ye lorde sayde 〈…〉 lorde lorde haue thus sene angell ye lorde face face lorde sayde vnto peace feare thou shalt dye thē gedeon buylded altare vnto ye lorde called lorde peace stondeth yet vnto daye apra yt belōgeth vnto father ye esrites ye night sayde ye lorde vnto take fedd bullocke frō amō ge thy father ox another bullocke seuen yeare olde breake downe altare baall thy father cut downe groue stondeth buylde thou altare vnto lorde ye god aboue vpon toppe rocke make ready take bullocke offre burnt offerynge wodd groue thou hast hewen downe toke gedeon ten men seruauntes dyd ye lorde sayde vnto afrayed daye tyme father house people ye cite dyd nighte whan people cite rose vp early mornynge beholde baal altare broken groue hewen downe bullocke burnt offerynge vpon altare buylded one sayde vnto another hath done whan soughte made searche sayde gedeon sonne ioas hath done thē sayde people ye cite vnto ioas brynge forth ye sonne must dye hath broken baal altare hewen downe groue therby ioas sayde vnto stode wyl ye stryue baal wil ye delyuer yt stryueth shal dye mornynge yf god let auēge selfe altare broken downe yt daye forth called ierubaal sayde let baal auenge selfe altare broken downe whan ye madianites ye amalechites childrē towarde south gathered thēselues together passed thorow iordane pitched tentes valley iesrael sprete lorde endued gedeon caused trompet blowne called house 〈…〉 abieser shulde folowe sent messaungers vnto manasse called yt shulde folowe also sent messaungers likewyse vnto asser zabulon nephtali came vp mete gedeon sayde vnto god yf thou wilt delyuer israel thorow hande thou hast saide thē wil laye flese woll courte yf ye dew onely vpon ye flese drye vpon grounde wyll perceaue thou shalt delyuer israel thorow hande thou hast sayde came passe whan rose vp early morow wrāge ye dew flese fylled dyszshe full water gedeon sayde vnto god 〈◊〉 18 wroth speake yet one tyme wyl proue yet flese let drye onely vpon flese dew vpon grounde god dyd nighte drye onely vpon flese dew vpon grounde vii chapter ierubaal gedeon gat vp early iud 6 • people pitched tentes besyde well harod hoost madianites north side behynde hyll valley lorde sayde vnto gedeon people yt many delyuer madian hande lest israel boost selues agaynst saye hande hath delyuered cause proclamacion made eares people saye deu 20 b 1 mac 3 g feareth afrayed let turne backe get soone fro mount gilead returned people aboute two twenty thousande left ten thousande lorde sayde vnto gedeon people yet many brynge downe water wyl proue ye saye shal go wt shal go whō saie shal go shall go broughte people vnto ye water lorde sayde vnto gedeon whosoeuer licketh water tū ge dogg licketh make stonde asyde lykewyse soeuer falleth downe vpō knee drynke nombre licked hande mouth thre hundreth men lorde sayde vnto gedeon thorow thre hū dreth haue licked wyl delyuer geue ouer madianites thy hā de people let go euery one vnto place toke vytayles ye people trompettes israelite let go euery one vnto tente strengthed himselfe thre hundreth men madianites hoost laye beneth valley night sayde lorde vnto vp go downe hoost haue geuen ouer thy hande yf thou afrayed go downe let ye seruaunt pura go downe vnto hoost yt thou maiest heare saie shalt thou bolde thy honde stronge thou mayest go downe hoost wente gedeon downe seruaunt vnto ye vttemost parte ye watchmē armes yt ye hoost ye madianites amalechites child south layed selues beneth valley multitude greshoppers camel nombred multitude euē sonde ye see shore whan gedeon came beholde one tolde another dreame sayde beholde haue dreamed dreame thoughte bakē barlye lofe came rollinge downe ye hoost ye madianites whan came tente smote ouerthrew turned vpsyde downe tente fell answered nothinge el ye swerde gedeon sonne ioas ye israelite god hath geuē ouer madianites hoost hande whan gedeon herde dreame tolde interpretacion worshipped came agayne hoost israel sayde vp lorde hath delyuered ye hoost madianites youre hāde deuyded thre hundreth men thre partes gaue euery one trompet hande emptye pytchers lampes therin sayde vnto loke vnto • ud 9 g ye euē beholde whā come vttemost parte hoost euen ye also whan blowe ye trompet wt shal ye blowe ye trōpettes also rounde aboute hoost saye lorde gedeon thus came gedeon thre hundreth men vnto vttemost parte ye hoost aboute tyme whan mydwatch begynneth waked vp watchmē blewe trompettes smote asunder pitcher handes thre company blewe ye trompettes brake pitcher lampes helde lefte hande trompettes righte hāde blewe cried swerde lorde gedeon euery one stode place aboute hoost ranne hoost cried fled whyle thre hundreth men blewe trompettes ye lorde broughte passe • 14 c • pa 20 euery man swerde ye hoost agaynst another hoost fled vnto bethsitha zereratha vnto border playne mehohab besyde tabath ye men israel nephtali asser manasse cried folowed vpon madianites gedeon sent messaungers vp vnto mount ephraim sayenge come downe madianites stoppe water vnto beth bara iordane cryed ephraim stopped water vnto bethbara iordane toke two prynces madianites oreb zeb slewe oreb vpon rocke oreb zeb wyne presse zeb folowed vpon madianites broughte heades oreb zeb vnto gideon ouer iordane viii chapter men ephraim sayde vnto wherfore hast thou done vnto v thou hast called v whā thou wentest forth fight agaynst ye madianites chode sore sayde vnto haue done like youre acte gadderynge ephraim better whole haruest abieser 〈…〉 god hath delyuered ye prynces madianites oreb zeb youre hande coulde ye haue done whā sayde blast swaged whan gedeon came vnto iordane wente ouer thre hundreth mē weery folowed vpon chace sayde vnto men sucoth praye geue people loaues bred weery maye folowe vpon zebea salmana kinges madianites ruler sucoth sayde handes zebea salmana thy handes allready must geue bred vnto thy men warre gedeon sayde well whan lorde delyuereth zebea salmana hāde wyll thres • youre flesh thornes wyldernesse breares thence wente vp vnto penuel spake euen vnto mē penuel gaue like answere sucoth sayde also vnto men penuel yf come peaceably agayne wil breake downe tower zebea salmana karkar hoost vpon fyftene thousande lefte whole hoost child easte fallen hundreth twentye thousande coulde drawe swerde gedeon wente vp waye dwell tentes east side nobah iakbeha smote hoost hoost carelesse mystrusted nothinge zebea salmana fled folowed toke ye two kynges madianites zebea salmana put hoost feare▪ whan gedeon ye sonne ioas came agayne frō battayll ye east toke lad men sucoth examyned wrote vp name ruler sucoth elder euē thre score seuentene men came men sucoth sayde beholde zebea salmana cōcernynge whō ye laughed scorne sayde handes zebea salmana thy hādes ready must geue bred vnto thy men weery toke elder cite thornes wildernes breres caused ye men sucoth torne therwith 〈…〉 tower penuel brake downe slewe men cite saide vnto zebea salmana maner mē whō ye slewe thabor sayde euen like goodly men yf bene kynges childrē sayde brother euen mother sonnes truly lorde lyueth yf ye lettē lyue wolde slaye saide vnto first borne sonne iether stonde vp slaye howbeit lad drue swerde afrayed moch yet lad zebea salmana sayde stonde thou vp slaye v man soch also strēgth gedeon arose slewe zebea salmana toke ornamentes aboute camel neckes sayde certayne israel vnto gedeon thou lorde ouer v thou thy sonne thy sonnes sonne moch thou hast delyuered v ye hande ye madianites neuertheles gedeon saide vnto wil lorde ouer nether shal sonne lorde ouer lorde shalbe lorde ouer gedeon sayde vnto one thinge desyre euery man geue earinge hath spoyled moch ye men ismaelites earinges sayde wyll geue spred cloth euery man cast earinge theron spoyled golden earynges requyred weight thousande seuen hundreth sycles golde besyde spanges cheynes scarlet rayment kynges madianites dyd weere besyde neckbandes camel gideon made cote armoure therof set cite aphra israel wente whoringe turned occasion fallinge vnto gedeon house thus ye madianites brought downe child israel lifte vp heade nomore londe rest fortye yeares lōge gedeon lyued ierubaal sonne ioas wēte dwelt house4 10▪ • gedeon thre score ten sonnes come thye many wyues concubyne sichē bare sonne also called abimelech gideon sonne ioas dyed good age buried aphra ye sepulcre father ioas father esrites whan gedeon deed childrē israel turned backe wente awhoringe baalim made couenaunt wt baal berith yt shulde god ye childrē israel thoughte ye lorde god delyuered frō hande enemy rounde aboute shewed mercy vnto house ierubaal gedeon acordinge good done vnto israel ix chapter abimelech sonne ierubaal wente vnto sichē mother brother spake vnto kynred mother father house sayde praye speake eares men sichem better threscore ten men child ierubaal shulde lordes ouer one man shulde lorde ouer remembre also youre bone youre flesh spake mother brethrē wordes ye eares ye men sichem hert enclyned abimelech thoughte oure brother gaue thre score ten syluerlinges ye house baal berith wt abimelech hyred men vagabundes light condicions folowed came father house vnto aphra slew brother child ierubaal2 pa • 21 • euen thre score men tē vpon one stone iotham yongest sonne ierubaal remayned ouer hydd men sichem house millo gathered selues together wente made abimelech kynge oke stondeth sichem whan tolde iotham wente stode vpon toppe mount grisim lifte vp voyce cried sayde heare ye men sichem god maye heare also 2 par 25 c 4 esd 4 b tree wente anointe kinde ouer sayde vnto olyue tre thou oure kynge olyue tre answered shall go leaue fatnesse god men commende go puft vp aboue tree sayde tree vnto fygge tre come thou kynge ouer v fygge tre sayde vnto thē shal leaue swetnes good frute go puft vp aboue tree sayde tree vnto vyne come thou oure kinge vyne sayde vnto shal leaue swete wyne reioyseth god men go puft vp aboue tree thē sayde tree vnto thorne buszshe come thou kynge ouer v thorne buszshe sayde vnto tree yf true yt ye anoynte kynge ouer thē come put youre trust vnder shadowe yf go fyre thorne buszshe cōsume ye ceder tree libanō yf ye haue done right iustly yt ye haue made abimelech kynge yf ye haue done well vnto ierubaal house haue done vnto deserued vnto euen father foughte youre sake ioperde lyfe delyuer madianites hāde euē rysen vp daye agaynst father house haue slaine childrē thre score personnes ten vpon one stone haue made kynge euen abimelech sonne handmaide ouer men sichem moch youre brother yf ye haue done right iustly vnto ierubaal house daye reioyse ouer abimelech let reioyse ouer yf go fyre abimelech cōsume men sichem house millo fyre go also frō men sichem house millo consume abimelech iothā whan spoken fled gat waye wente vnto ber dwelt brother abimelech whan abimelech reigned thre yeare ouer israel esa 45 god sent euell mynde betwene abimelech men sichen men sichem despysed abimelech rehearsed wr • nge done sonnes ierubaal bloude layed vpon abimelech brother slewe vpon men sichem strengthed hande therto mighte slaye brother men sichem set hynd •• watch vpon toppes mountaynes spoyled walked nye waye tolde abimelech came gaal sonne ebed brother entred sichem men sichem put trust wēte felde gathered vynyardes pressed made daunse wente god house ate dranke cursed abimelech gaal ye sonne ebed sayde abimelech sichem shulde serue sonne ierubaal hath set sebul seruaūt ouer men 〈…〉 hemor father sichem▪ wherfore shulde serue wolde god people vnder hāde yt mighte put downe abimelech tolde abimelech increace thine hooste departe sebul chefe ruler cite whan herde wordes gaal ye sonne ebed wroth fully displeased sente message secretly abimelech caused saye vnto beholde gaal sonne ebed brother come sichem make cite agaynst arise therfore nyght thou thy people laye wayte thē felde tomorow whan sonne aryseth get vp soone fall vpon cite yf people come vnto thē deale thyne hande fyndeth abimelech stode vp night people layed wayte sichem foure company men warre gaal sonne ebed wē stode dore gate cite abimelech gat vp hinder watch people whan gaal sawe people sayde vnto sebul beholde commeth people downe toppe ye mount sebul saide vnto thou seist ye shadowe mountaines though • ē gaal spake yet sayde beholde commeth people downe ye myddes londe one bonde men cōmeth waye ye witch oke thē sayde sebul ye mouth yt sayde abimelech▪ shulde serue ye people thou hast refused go forth fighte gaal wente forth citesyns sichem foughte abimelech abimelech chaced fled fell many slayne euen vnto gate cite abimelech abode aruma sebul droue awaye gaal brother must remayne sichem vpon morowe wente people forth ye felde whā tolde abimelech toke people parted thre bōdes men wayted thē felde whan sawe yt people wēte cite rose agaynst thē smote abimelech ye company men fell vpon stepte vnto dore porte two company fell vpon felde slewe thē foughte abimelech agaynst cite ye daye wanne slewe people brake downe ye cite sowed salt theron whan men tower sichem herde wente stronge holde ye house god berith whan abimelech herde men tower sichem gathered thē selues together wente vp vnto mount zelmon people toke axe hāde hewed downe braunch tre toke vp layed vpon shulder sayde vnto people 〈…〉 ye haue sene make ye haist euen people hewed downe euery one braūch folowed abimelech layed holde set fyre vpon agaynst holde men tower sichem dyed thorow smoke fyre vpon thousande men wemen abimelech wēte vnto thebetz layed sege vnto wanne myddes cite stronge tower vnto men wemen citesyns cite fled shutt clymmed vp toppe tower came abimelech vnto tower foughte agaynst came nye vnto dore tower might burne fyre 2 11 c woman cast pece mylstone vpon abimelechs heade brake brane panne abimelech haist called seruaunt bare wapen sayde vnto drawe thy swerde kyll me1 reg 11 1 par 11 sayde woman hath slayne seruaunt thrust thorow dyed whan israelite sawe yt abimelech deed gatt awaye euery one vnto awne place thus god recompenced abimelech euell done vnto father whā slewe thre score ten brother like wyse euell men sichem dyd god rewarde vpon heade iud 9 c curse iotham ye sonne ierubaal came vpon x chapter abimelech rose vp another sauioure israel thola man isachar sonne pua sonne dodo dwelt samir vpō mount ephraim iudged israel thre twentye yeare died buried samir stode vp one iair gileadite iudged israel two twentye yeare hath thirtie sonnes iud 1 • c rydinge vpon thirtie ass foales thirtie city whose name hauoth iair city iair vnto daye lye gilead iair dyed▪ buried camon child israel wrought wickednes sighte lorde serued baalim astaroth goddes siria goddes sidon goddes moab goddes ye child ammon goddes philistine forsoke ye lorde serued ye wrath ye lorde fearce vpon israel gaue thē ouer vnder hāde philistynes child ammō vexed oppressed ye child israel eightene yeare longe child israel beyonde iordane londe moabites lyeth gilead child ammon also wente ouer iordane fought agaynst iuda ben iamin agaynst house ephraim israel sore troubled cryed child israel vnto lorde sayde haue synned agaynst haue forsaken oure god serued baalim lorde sayde vnto childrē israel egipciās amorites child ammon ye philistine sidonians amalechites maonites oppresse helped hande whan ye cryed vnto yet haue ye forsaken serued goddes therfore wyll helpe nomore deut 32 c iere 2 go youre waye crye vpon goddes ye haue chosen let helpe tyme youre trouble childrē israel sayde vnto lorde haue synned thou vnto v pleaseth onely delyuer v tyme put straunge goddes frō serued lorde soule pytie mysery israel child ammon called selues together pitched gilead child israel gathered selues together also pitched mispa ye people chefest gilead sayde amōge selues euer begynneth fight agaynst child ammon shalbe heade ouer dwell gilead xi chapter iephthae gileadite valeaūt man armes harlottes childe gilead begat iephthae whan wyfe borne child vnto gilead wyues childrē waxē greate thrust iephtae sayde vnto thou shalt heire oure father house thou art another womās sonne thē fled brethrē dwelt londe tob resorted vnto vagabūdes wēte certayne tyme foughte child ammon israel whā childrē ammon foughte thus israel elder wente gilead fetch iephthae londe tob sayde vnto come oure captayne fight agaynst child ammon iephthae sayde vnto eldes gilead ye hate haue thrust father house come ye whan ye trouble elder gilead sayde therfore come againe vnto thou mayest go v fighte agaynst ch • ldren ammon oure captayne ouer dwell gilead iephthae sayde vnto elder gilead yf ye fetch agayne fighte agaynst childrē ammon lorde delyuer shal youre heade elder gilead saide vnto iephthae lorde hearer betwene v yf thou hast sayde iephthae wēte elder gilead people made heade duke ouer iephthae spake lorde mispa sente iephthae messaungers kynge child ammon caused saye vnto hast thou thou cōmest vnto fight agaynst londe kynge childrē ammō answered iephthaes messaungers israel toke awaye londe whan departed egipte arnon vnto iabock vnto iordane geue agayne therfore peaceably iephthae sent yet mo messaungers ye kynge child ammon sayde vnto thus sayeth iephthae 〈…〉 israel hath taken londe nether moabites ner child ammon departed egipte israel walked thorow wyldernes vnto reed see came cades 〈…〉 sent messaungers kynge edomites sayde let go thorow thy londe kynge ye edomites wolde heare thē sent lykewyse vnto kynge moabites wolde also thus israel abode cades compased lōde edomites moabites came eastsyde londe moabites pitched beyonde arnon came • within coaste moabites 〈…〉 arnon border moabites israel sent messaungers vnto si • hon kynge amorites heszbon 〈…〉 caused saye vnto let go thorow thy londe vnto place neuertheles sihon wolde trust israel go thorow border londe gathered people pitched iahza foughte israel howbeit lorde god israel gaue sihon people israel hāde slewe thus israel conquered londe amorites dwelt ye countre toke possessiō border amorites arnon vnto iabok ye wyldernesse vnto iordane ye lorde god israel droue awaye amorites people israel wilt thou cōquere yf thy god camo gaue oughte possesse woldest thou possesse euer lorde oure god hath geuē v v possesse shal conquere take possession hast thou better right thinkest thou thē 〈◊〉 22 〈◊〉 23 balac sonne ziphor kynge ye moabites dyd euer go lawe fighte agaynst israel though israel haue dwelt vpō thre hūdreth yeare hesbon vyllages therof aroer vyllages therof city lye arnon dyd ye rescue tyme haue offended thou doest euell fighte agaynst lorde geue sentence daie betwene israel child ammon neuertheles kynge child ammon wolde heare ye wordes iephthae sent vnto came ye sprete lorde vpon iephthae wente thorow gilea • • nd manasse thorow mispa lieth gilead fro mispa lieth gilead vnto ye child ammon iephthae vowed vowe vnto lorde sayde 〈…〉 yf thou wilt delyuer childrē ammon hande euer commeth first dore house waye whan returne agayne peaceably childrē ammon shalbe lordes wyl offre burtn offerynge iephthae wente vpon child ammon fighte ye lorde gaue hande smote thē ar • er tyll thou comest vnto minnith euen twentye city vnto playne ye vynyardes greate slaughter thus child ammon subdued child israel whan iephthae came mispa vnto house beholde doughter wente mete tabrettes daunces onely childe el nether sonne ner doughter whan sawe rente clothes sayde ala doughter thou makest hert soroufull discomfortest haue opened mouth vnto lorde call agayne sayde father yf thou hast opened thy mouth vnto lorde vnto proceaded ye mouth acordinge lorde hath auēged thyne enemy child ammon sayde vnto hir father geue leue go downe vpō mountaynes two monethes maye bewep • virginite playfeeres sayde go thy waye let go two monethes wente playefeeres bewayled hir mayden heade vpon mountaynes two monethes came agayne vnto hir father dyd vnto acordinge vowed neuer bene daunger eny man custome israel doughters israel shulde go euery yeare mourne doughter iephthae gileadite foure dayes yeare xii chapter ephraim made insurreccion wente northwarde sayde vnto iephthae iud 8 • wherfore wētest thou battayll agaynst child ammon hast called v mighte go wil burne thy house fyre iephthae sayde vnto thē people greate matter ye child ammon cried vpon ye helped handes whan sawe yt helper put psal 118 • soule honde wente agaynst child ammon lorde delyuered hande wherfore come ye vp fighte agaynst iephthae gathered men gilead foughte agaynst ephraim men gilead smote ephraim sayde ye gileadites yt fle awaye ephraim dwell amōge ephraim manasse gileadites toke ye ferye iordane ephraim whā one ye fugityue ephraites dyd saye let go ouer ye men gilead sayde art thou ephraite yf answered bad saye schiboleth sayde siboleth coulde speake righte toke slew ye ferye iordane yt tyme fell epraim two fortye iephthae iudged israel sixe yeares iephthae ye gileadite dyed buried one city gilead iudged▪ israel one ebzan bethleem thirtie sonnes many doughters thirtie doughters gaue forth mariage thirtie doughters toke without sonnes iudged israel seuen yeare died 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈2 page missing〉 shulders loynes wēte downe dwelt stone clyffe etam wente philistynes vp layed sege vnto iuda pitched lechi iuda sayde wherfore ye come vp v answered come vp bynde samson yt maye vnto hath done vnto v wēte thre men iuda downe stone clyffe etam sayde vnto samson knowest thou philistynes raigne ouer v wherfore hast thou done vnto v sayde dyd vnto haue done vnto thē agayne sayde vnto come downe bynde delyuer yt hāde philistynes samson sayde vnto thē sweare promyse yt ye wyll slaye answered wyll kyll wil bynde delyuer hande wyl slaye ye bounde two new coardes caried stone whan came vnto lechi philistynes shouted rāne vnto ye sprete ye lorde came vpon coardes aboute armes like thredes burnt fyre yt bondes lowsed hondes founde cheke bone deed asse put forth hande toke slewe thousande men therwith samson sayde olde ass cheke bone yee euē cheke bone asse haue slayne thousande men whan sayde yt cast ye cheke bone hande called place ramath lechi whā sore thyrst called vpō lorde saide soch greate health hast thou geuē hāde thy seruaunt must dye thyrst fall ye hande ye vncircūcised thē god opened gome tothe ye cheke bone yt water wēte whan dranke sprete came agayne refreszshed therfore vnto daye yet called ye well ye cheke bone yt made intercession iudged israel tyme philistynes twētye yeare xvi chapter samson wente vnto gasa sawe harlot laye thē saide vnto gasites samson come hither compased aboute caused laye wayte preuely watched nighte gate ye cite nighte helde styll sayde abyde tomorow whan lighte wyll slaye samson laye vnto mydnighte rose mydnighte toke holde ye syde porte ye gate cite wt postes lifte barres layed vpon shulders bare vp ye toppe ye mount ouer agaynst hebron fell loue woman ye broke sorek whose name dalila vnto prynces philistynes came vp sayde vnto persuade loke wherin hath soch greate strēgth maye ouercome yt mighte bynde subdue wyll geuethe euery man c syluerlinges dalila sayde vnto samson praye tell wherin thy greate strēgth thou mightest bounde subdued samson sayde vnto yf bounde seuē roapes fresh senowes yet dryed vp shulde weake another man thē prynces philistynes broughte vp vnto seuen new roapes yet dryed vp bounde therwith wayte layed besyde chamber sayde vnto pilistynes vpon samson neuertheles brake roapes sunder euē twyned threde breaketh whan hath catched heate fyre knowne wherin strength sayde dalila vnto samson beholde thou hast begyled dyssembled tell yet wherwithall mayest thou bounde answered yf bounde new coardes wherwith labor hath bene done shulde feble another man toke dalila new coardes bounde withall sayde philistynes vpō samson wayte layed chamber brake armes euen bene threde dalila sayde vnto yet hast thou begyled dessembled wt tell yet wherwithall mightest thou bounde answered yf thou playtest seuē hayri • locke heade together fyllet fastenest nayle shulde weake saide vnto philistynes vpō samson awaked slepe drue ye playted hayrie locke nale fyllet thē sayde vnto cāst thou saye yt thou louest thine hert yet thre tymes hast thou disceaued tolde wherin thy greate strength whan euery daye importune vpon wt wordes wolde let haue rest soule faynte euen vnto death shewed whole hert sayde vnto 〈◊〉 6 〈◊〉 1 • came neuer rasoure vpon heade nazaree god fro mother wombe yf shauen strength shulde departe fro shulde weake men whan dalila sawe opened hert vnto her▪ sent called prynces philistynes sayde come yet vp hath opened whole hert vnto thē came prynces philistynes vp vnto broughte money wt handes made slepe vpon hir lappe called one shoue seuē hayrie locke heade beganne vexe thē strength departed frō sayde vnto philistynes vpon samson whā awoke slepe thoughte wil go forth haue done afore tyme ease selfe knewe yt lorde departed philistynes toke put eye broughte downe gasa bounde wt fetter made grynde preson heer heade beganne growe agayne shauen whan ye prynces philistynes gathered together make greate sacrifice vnto dagon god ioyfull sayde oure god hath delyuered samson enemye hande like wyse whan ye people sawe praysed god sayde oure god hath delyuered oure handes oure enemye yt destroyed oure londe slewe many v whan hert ioyfull sayde let v fetch samson maye make pastyme v fetched samson preson made pastyme set betwene two pilers samson sayde vnto lad yt led hande let touche pilers wher vpon house stondeth yt maye leane ther vnto ye house full men wemen prynces philistynes also vpon rofe aboute thre thousande men wemen behelde pastyme samson made samson called vpon lorde sayde lorde lorde thynke vpon strength god beseke yt myne eye maye auēge philistynes toke holde ye two mydpilers house stode vpon holden one righte hāde ye lefte saide soule dye wt philistynes bowed selfe mightely fell house vpon prynces vpon people therin mo ye slayne dyed death thē slewe whyle lyued came brother downe father house toke caried vp buried graue father manoah betwene zarga esthaol iudged israel twentye yeare xvii chapter man vpō mount ephraim named micha sayde vnto mother thousande hundreth syluerlinges thou hast taken vnto sworne spoken myne eares beholde ye money haue taken vnto sayde mother blessinge lorde haue thou sonne gaue mother thousande hundreth syluerlinges agayne mother saide money haue sanctified vnto lorde wt hande sonne make molten ymage therfore geue agayne neuertheles delyuered ye money agayne vnto mother toke mother two hundreth syluerlinges put forth ye goldsmyth made molten ymage yt afterwarde michas house thus man micha god house made ouerbody cote idol fylled ye handes one sonnes yt mighte prest iud 18 • • 1 yt tyme kynge israel euery man dyd thinge yt righte awne eye yōge man bethleem iuda amōge kynreds iuda leuite straunger wente cite bethleem iuda walke whither coulde whā came vp mount ephraim vnto house micha go iourney micha axed whence cōmest thou answered leuite bethleem iuda walkynge micha sayde vnto tary thou shalt father prest geue euery yeare ten syluerlinges thy appoynted raymēt meate drynke leuite wēte leuite agreed abyde man helde yonge mā one owne sonnes micha fylled leuites hande mighte prest michas house micha sayde sure lorde wyll good haue leuite prest xviii chapter tyme kynge israel ye trybe ye danites soughte enheritaunce dwell •• su 19 vnto daie enheritaunce fallen vnto amonge trybes israel childrē dan sent kynreds fyue captaynes men armes zarga esthaol spye search londe sayde vnto go youre waie search londe came vp mount ephraim ye house micha taried nighte whyle wt michas huszsholde knewe ye voyce yonge man leuite sayde vnto broughte ye hither makest thou woldest thou come hither answered thē thus thus hath micha done vnto hath hyred prest sayde vnto axe god yt maye perceaue whether oure iourney go shal prospere well prest answered go youre waye peace youre iourney yt ye go lorde fyue men wente waye came vnto lais sawe people therin dwelt sure euen ye sidonians rest carelesse lorde londe vexe farre sidoniās nothinge eny man came brethrē zarga esthaol brother saide vnto wt sayde arise let v go vp vnto haue sene londe yt good londe make haist therfore slacke go ye maye come take possession londe whan ye come ye shall come carelesse people londe wyde god hath delyuered place yor hande nothinge wanteth yt vpon earth wente thence kynreds dan zarga esthaol sixe hundreth men ready wapened ye battayll wente vp pitched kiriath iearim iuda therfore called sam • place ye hoost dan vnto daye behinde kiriath iearim frō thence wēte vp vnto moūt ephraim came house micha answered fyue men wēte spye londe lais sayde vnto brother knowe ye house ouerbody cote idol molten ymages maye ye loke ye haue departed thence came house yonge man leuite michas house saluted frēdly sixe hundreth men ye child dan stode ready harnessed ye gate fyue men gone one spye ye londe wēte vp came thither toke ymage ouerbody cote molten idol meane whyle stode ye prest gate sixe hundreth readye harnessed whā come michas house toke ymage ouerbody cote molten idol prest sayde vnto ye answered holde thy peace laye thine hande vpon thy mouth go v yt thou mayest oure father prest better prest one man house amonge whole trybe kynred israel pleased prest well toke ouerbody cote idol ymage came amonge people whan turned wente thence sent child catell soch precious thynges whan come farre house micha men yt michas house gathered thē together michas house folowed ye childrē dan cried vpon childrē dan turned face aboute sayde vnto micha ayleth yt thou makest soch crienge answered ye haue taken awaye goddes prest goinge yor waie haue behynde yet ye saye vnto ayleth childrē dan saide vnto let thy voyce herde amōge v wrothfull mē thrust ye soule soule ye house destroyed childrē dan wēte waye micha whan sawe yt stronge turned backe came agayne house toke micha made prest came vnto lais quyete carelesse people slewe edge swerde burnt cite fyre man delyuer laye farre frō sidon man laye valley besyde beth rehob buylded cite dwelt therin 〈◊〉 19 called dan name father dan israel begat ye cite called lais afore tyme child dan set vp ymage ionathan ye sonne gerson sonne manasse sonnes prestes amōge trybe ye danites 〈◊〉 17 vnto tyme yt led awaye captyue londe thus set amonge thē ymage micha made lōge ye house god silo xix chapter tyme kynge israel man leui straūger besyde moūt ephraim taken cōcubine bethleem iuda wife whā played harlot besyde ranne frō hir father house vnto bethleem iuda foure monethes longe hir huszbāde gat vp wente speake frēdly wt fetch againe seruaunt couple ass wt led hir father house whan damsel father sawe glad receaued father lawe yt damsel father kepte yt taried thre dayes wt thus ate drōke remayned nighte ye fourth daye gat vp early wolde go waye sayde ye damsel father vnto sonne lawe • en 18 •• al 105 b refresh thine hert first wt morsell bred shal ye go sat downe ate dronke together sayde damsel father vnto man oh tarye nighte yt waie refresh thine hert ye mā arose wolde nedes go father lawe constrayned tarye nighte fifth daye mornynge gat vp wolde gone sayde damsel father praye comforte thine hert let v tary tyll ye daye farther past ate together man gat vp wolde go concubyne seruaunt father lawe damsel father saide vnto agayne lo daye spente begynneth euen tary night beholde lodginge yet daye abyde night shal refresh thine hert tomorow time get vp go youre waye vnto thy tent neuerttheles man wolde tar • gat vp wēte waye▪ came ouer agaynst iebus ierusalem couple ass ladē concubyne whan come nye vnto iebus daye •• fast awaye ye seruaūt saide vnto master praie go let v turne cite iebusites tarye therin allnight withstondinge master sayde vnto wil turne ye cite aleauntes child israel wyl go ouer vnto gibea sayde vnto seruaūt go thou maye come place tarye gibea ramah allnight wente walked sonne wente downe vpon thē harde gibea lyeth trybe ben iamin turned yt mighte come tarye gibea nighte whan came sat downe ye strete cite noman wolde lodge house night beholde came olde mā worke felde eueninge also mount ephraim straūger gibea ye mē place ye childrē iemini whan lifte vp eies sawe straunger strete sayde vnto whither wilt thou go whence cōmest thou answered goinge oure iourney betleē iuda vntyll come besyde mount ephraim whēce wente vnto bethleem iuda go vnto ye house ye lorde mā wil harbarow haue strawe prouēder oure ass bred wyne thy handmayden yonge man thy seruaunt yt wante nothinge olde man sayde peace soeuer thou wantest thou findest wt onely tarye strete nighte broughte house gaue ass prouender washed fete ate dronke whā hert ioyfull men cyte child belial came compased house rounde aboute ruszshed ye dore sayde vnto ye olde man good man ye house bringe mā come thy house maye knowe gen 19 b good man house wente forth sayde vnto oh brother wickedly consideringe man come house oh soch folye beholde haue doughter yet virgin man hath cōcubine wil brynge forth vnto ye maye humble ye lyke soch foly vnto man neuertheles men wolde herken vnto toke ye man concubine broughte forth vnto knewe dealte shamefully yt night vntill mornynge whan mornynge brake let go came woman early mornynge fell downe dore mās house lorde laye tyll light whan hir lorde rose vp mornynge opened dore house wente forth go iourney beholde concubyne laye dore house hir handes vpon thresholde saide vnto stonde vp let v go neuertheles gaue answere thē toke vp vpon asse gat vp wente vnto place whan came home toke swerde helde concubyne cut wt bone twolue peces sent coastes israel euer sawe sayde soch thinge hath bene done ner sene sence tyme ye child israel departed londe egipte vnto daye concernynge take youre advysement geue yor councell shew forth xx chapter wente child israel gathered congregacion together one man frō dan vntill bersaba londe gilead vnto lorde mispa came together quarter people trybes israel congregacion people god foure hundreth thousande fote men drue ye swerde child ben iamin herde ye child israel gone vp vnto mispa child israel sayde tell v happened euell answered leuite huszbande woman slayne sayde came gibea ben iamin concubyne tary allnight cyt • ▪ sin gibea gat vp agaynst compased aboute house night thoughte slaye defyled cō cubyne dyed toke cō cubyne cut peces sent peces euery countre inheritaunce israel haue done abhominacion folye israel beholde ye child israel aduyse well take matter hande people gat vp one mā sayde nomā shal go tente ner departe house wil agaynst gibea let v cast lot take ten men hundreth hundreth thousande thousande ten thousande ye trybes israel yt maie take fode ye people come gibea ben iamin acordynge folye haue done israel thus men israel beynge confederate gathered selues together one man vnto cite trybes israel sent men vnto kinreds ben iamin caused saye vnto maner wickydnes done amonge delyuer therfore men child belial gibea maye put death awaye euell israel neuertheles child ben iamin wolde folowe voyce brother child israel gathered selues ye city vnto gibea go forth battayll agaynst child israel daye nombred child ben iamin city sixe twentye thousande men drue swerde beside citesyns gibea tolde seuē hundreth chosen men amōge people chosen seuen hundreth men vsed right hande lefte yet wt slynge coulde touch heer mysse men israel beside bē iamin nōbred foure hūdreth thousande drue swerde men armes child israel arose wente vp house god silo axed god sayde shall go vp v beginne battayll ye child ben iamin lorde saide iuda shall begynne child israel gat thē vp ye mornīge pitched ouer agaīst gibea euery man israel wēte fighte ben iamin set selues araye fighte agaynst gibea fell child ben iamin gibea slewe daye amonge israel two twentye thousande grounde people men israel comforted selues made ready fighte yet place prepared selues daye afore child israel wente vp wepte lorde vntyll euenynge axed lorde sayde shall go enymore fighte oure brother child ben iamin lorde sayde go vp vnto whan child israel gat vp childrē ben iamin ye next daye ben iamites fell gibea agaynst daye slewe yet eightene thousande ye child israel grounde drue swerde wente child israel vp people came house god wepte taried lorde fasted daye vntyll euen offred burnt offerynges deed offeringes lorde child israel axed lorde arke couenaunt god tyme phineas sonne eleasar sonne aaron stode tyme sayde shal go forth eny fighte oure brother childrē ben iamin shal leaue lorde sayde go vp tomorow wyll delyuer youre handes child israel set preuy watch agaynst gibea rounde aboute child israel wente vp child ben iamin thirde daye set selues araye agaynst gibea like two tymes afore thē came child ben iamin agaynst people brake cite beganne slaye certayne wounded people like two time afore felde vpon two stretes wherof one goeth towarde bethel vnto gilead vpon thirtye men israel thought childrē ben iamin smytten v like afore childrē israel sayde let v flye maie prouoke cite hye stretes men israel gat vp place prepared selues vnto baal thamar hinder watch israel brake place ye caue gaba came vnto gibea twentye thousande chosen men israel sore battayll knewe euell shulde happen vnto thus lorde smote ben iamin child israel daye child israel destroyed fyue twentye thousande hundreth men ben iamin drue swerde whan childrē ben iamin sawe smitten men israel gaue rowme flye trusted watch sett gibea watch made haist also brake forth vnto gibea wente vpon smote cite edge ye swerde appoynted betwene selues men israel hynder watch f • vpon swerde whan smoke cite arose whan men israel turned battayll ben iamin beganne smyte wounded israel vpon thirtie men thoughte smytten v like battayll afore beganne piler smoke arise vp cite ben iamin loked behinde beholde flamme ye cite wente vp vnto heauen men israel turned fearce vpon ye men ben iamin sawe euell wolde happen vnto turned men israel waye wyldernesse battayll folowed vpon cite destroyed amōge compased ben iamin rounde aboute folowed vpon vnto menuah trode downe tyll afore gibea eastwarde fell ben iamin eightene thousande men men armes whan remnaunt ben iamin sawe turned fled towarde wildernesse vnto stonye rocke rimon strete slewe fyue thousande men folowed vpon vnto gideom slewe two thousande thē fell daye ben iamin fyue twenty thousande men drue ye swerde mē armes onely sixe hundreth men turned backe fled towarde wyldernesse vnto stonye rocke rimon abode rocke rimon foure monethes men israel came agayne child ben iamin smote cite ye edge swerde mē catell founde soeuer foū de cite cast fyre xxi chapter men israel sworē mispa sayde noman shal geue doughter ben iamites wife people came house god silo abode god vntill euenynge lifte vp voyce wepte sore sayde lorde god israel wherfore come passe israel daye morow people gat thē vp early builded altare offred burnt offeringes deed offerynges child israel sayde eny mā trybes israel come vp congregacion vnto lorde greate ooth made came vp mispa vnto lorde shulde dye deeth child israel sory ben iamin brother sayde daye one trybe lesse israel wyll remnaunt maye haue wyues haue sworne lorde wyl geue thē wyues oure doughters saide eny mā trybes israel come vp lorde vnto mispa beholde one man citesyns iabes gilead sent congregacion twolue thousande men armes thither commaunded sayde go youre waye smite citesyns iabes gilead swerde wemen also child ye maner num 31 c se ye damne male wemen haue lyen men amonge citesins iabes gilead foū de foure hundreth damsel virgin lyen noman broughte hoost vnto silo lyeth londe canaan sent whole congregacion caused talke child ben iamin 〈…〉 stonie rocke rimō called vnto frendly 〈…〉 child ben iamin came agayne tyme thy gaue wemen wemen iabes gilead founde mo maner people sory ben iamin ye lorde made gappe trybes israel elder congregaciō sayde wil remnaunt maye haue wyues also wemē ben iamin destroied sayde enheritaunce ben iamin escaped must nedes remayne trybe destroyed israel geue oure doughters wiues child israel haue sworne sayde cursed geueth wyfe ben iamites sayde beholde yearly feast lorde silo lieth northsyde god house eastside strete mā goeth bethel vnto sichem lieth south side libo • commaunded child ben iamin sayde go youre waye wayte vynyardes whan ye se doughters silo go forth cō panyes daunse get vynyardes euery man take wyfe doughters silo go youre waye lōde ben iamin father brother whan come lawe v wyll saye vnto fauourable haue taken thē battaill ye gaue thē vnto time youre faute child ben iamin acordinge nombre toke wyues daunse caught violence wente waye dwelt awne inheritaunce buylded city dwelt therin child israel also gat vp thence time euery one trybe kinred departed thēce euery man awne inheritaunce 〈…〉 yt time kynge israel euery man dyd ye thinge yt right awne eies ende boke iudges called
