corne felde boo hir houszbandes kynsmā chap iii ruth lyeth downe barne boo fete geueth good wordes ladeth sixe measure barlye chap iiii boo marieth ruth beareth obed dauids graundfather first chapter ye tyme whan iudges ruled derth londe wente mā bethleē iuda take iourney londe moabites wt wife two sonnes man called eli melech wife naemi two sonnes one mahelon chilion ephrates bethleem iuda whan came londe ye moabites dwelt eli melech naemis huszbande dyed left behinde wt hir two sonnes toke moabitish wyues one called arpa ruth whan dwelt ten yeare dyed mahelon chilion woman remayned desolate hir sonnes hir huszbande gat vp wt hir sonnes wyues wente agayne lōde ye moabites herde londe moabites yt lorde visited people geuen bred departed ye place hir sonnes wyues wt wēte waye come agayne londe iuda sayde vnto hir sonnes wyues go yor waye turne backe ether hir mother house lorde shewe mercy vpon ye haue done thē yt deed lorde graunte yt ye maie fynde rest ether hir huszbādes house ye shal get kyssed lift vp voyce wepte sayde vnto wil go vnto ye people naemi sayde turne agayne doughters wolde ye go haue child eny body youre huszbandes turne agayne doughters go youre waye olde take huszbande though shulde saye hope night take huszbande brynge forth child yet coulde ye tary tlll growne vp ye shulde olde ye coulde haue huszbandes doughters therfore sory ye hāde lorde gone forth ouer lifte vp voyce wepte yet arpa kyssed hir mother lawe turned backe againe ruth abode styll neuertheles sayde beholde thy syster lawe turned backe vnto hir people hir god turne thou againe also thy sister lawe ruth answered speake therof shulde forsake turne backe whither euer thou goest thither wil go also loke thou abydest wil abide also thy people people thy god god loke thou diest wil dye euen wil also buried lorde vnto death onely shal departe v whan sawe stedfastly mynded go spake nomore therof wente together till came vnto bethleem whan come bethleem whole cite moued ouer sayde naemi neuerthelesse sayde vnto call naemi mara allmightie hath made sory departed full lorde hath brought home agayne emptye call ye naemi whā lorde hath broughte lowe allmightie hath made sory aboute tyme begynninge barlye haruest whan naemi sonnes wife ruth ye moabitysse came agayne londe moabites vnto bethleem kinsman also ye kynred eli melech naemis huszbande whose name boo honest man ii chapter ruth moabitisse saide vnto naemi let go ye felde gather eares corne whose sight shal finde fau • sayde vnto go yt waie doughter wēte came gathered ye reaper ye feld fortuned felde enheritaunce boo kynred elimelech beholde boo came bethleem sayde vnto reaper lorde answered lorde blesse boo sayde vnto yongman ouersight ye reaper whose damsell yonge man set ouer ye reaper answered sayde damsell moabitisse came agayne naemi londe moabites sayde let plucke vp gather praie betwene sheues reaper thus come hath stonde euer sence mornynge within litle whyle wolde haue bene gone home agayne sayde boo vnto ruth hearest thou doughter thou shalt come vpon another man londe gather go awaye hence tary dā sels loke reape ye felde go thou haue cōmaunded seruauntes man touch yf thou thyrst go thy waye vessell drynke seruauntes drawe fell downe vpon hir face bowed hir self downe earth sayde vnto haue founde fauoure ye sighte thou woldest knowe yet straunger boo answered sayde vnto tolde alltogether thou hast done vnto thy mother lawe thy huszbā de death thou hast left ye father thy mother thy natiue countre art come people thou hast knowne afore lorde recompence thy doinge thy rewarde parfecte wt lorde god israel vnto thou art come put thy trust vnder wynges sayde let fynde fauoure syr thyne eye thou hast comforted spoken frendly vnto thy handmaydē yet like one ye handmaydēs boo sayde vnto whan eatinge tyme come hither eate bred dyppe thy morsell vyneger sat hir downe besyde reaper set parched come ate satisfyed lefte ouer whā rose gather boo commaunded seruauntes sayde let gather betwene sheues also dishonestye cast sheues vnto let lye maye gather vp se noman reproue gathered felde vntyll euen shaked gathered allmost epha barlye toke vp came cite shewed hir mother lawe gathered toke forth also gaue left wherof satysfyed thē sayde hir mother lawe vnto blessinge haue man hath knowne thou hast gathered laboured daye tolde hir mother lawe laboured sayde man name haue wroughte daye boo naemi sayde vnto hir doughter lawe blessynge lorde haue hath lefte mercifull vnto lyuynge 〈…〉 deed naemi sayde vnto man belongeth 〈◊〉 v oure nye kynsman ruth moabitisse saide saide morouer vnto thou shalt resorte vn seruauntes tyll haue made ende haruest naemi sayde vnto ruth hir doughter lawe better doughter thou go forth damsel lest eny man withstō de another felde thus kepte herselfe boo damsel gathered vntill barlye haruest wheate haruest came againe hir mother lawe iii chapter naemi hir mother lawe sayde vnto doughter wyll prouyde rest thou maiest prospere boo oure kynsman whose damsel thou hast bene casteth vp barlye night barne bathe thyselfe therfore 〈…〉 moffell put thy clothes go downe vnto barne yt nomā knowe tyll haue eaten dronken whan layeth downe slepe mark ye place lyeth downe come thou take vp couerynge fete laye downe shall tell thou shalt sayde vnto her▪ whatso euer thou saiest vnto wil wente downe barne dyd hir mother lawe cōmaunded whā boo eatē dronkē hert mery came layed downe behynde heape sheues came secretly toke vp coueringe fete layed hir downe whā midnight man afrayed groped aboute beholde woman laye fete sayde art thou answered ruth thy handmayden sprede ye wynges ouer thy hādmayden thou art nexte kynsman sayde lordes blessinge haue thou doughter thou hast done better mercy yt thou art gone yonge men nether riche ner poore feare doughter yt thou hast sayde cite people knoweth yt thou art vertuous womā trueth yt nye kynsmā one nyer tarye thou allnighte tomorow yf take well yf like take ye wil take yt selfe truly ye lorde lyueth slepe thou tyll ye mornynge slepte fete vntyll ye morow rose vp euer one coulde knowe another thoughte thus mā knowe yt hath come woman barne sayde reach cloke yt thou hast holde forth helde forth meet sixe measure barlye layed vpon wente cite came hir mother lawe sayde wt doughter tolde yt mā done vnto sayde sixe measure barlye gaue sayde thou shalt come emptye vnto ye mother lawe sayde abyde doughter tyll thou se ye matter wil growe man wilt ceasse tyll brynge ende daye iiii chapter boo wente vp ye gate sat downe beholde whan ye nye kynsman wente boo spake vnto sayde come syt downe called name came sat downe toke ten men elder ye cite sayde syt downe sat thē downe thē sayde nye kynszman naemi come againe frō lōde moabites 〈◊〉 2 • 〈◊〉 32 b offreth sell ye pece londe yt oure brother eli melech therfore thoughte shewe thine eares tell yf thou wilt redeme bye citesyns elder people yf thou wylt redeme tell yt maie knowe nye kynsmā excepte thou nexte sayde wil redeme boo saide daye yt thou byest lōde ye hande naemi thou must take ruth also moabitisse wife deed thou mayest rayse vp name ye deed inheritaunce thē sayde redeme lest happlye destroye myne awne enheritaunce redeme thou yt shulde redeme redeme olde custome israel concernynge redemynge chaūginge yt matter mighte stable one put shue gaue vnto ye yt testimony israel nye kynsman sayde vnto boo bye thou put shue boo sayde vnto elder people ye witness daie yt haue boughte hande naemi belonged eli melech chilions mahelons ruth moabitisse mahelons wife take wife deut 25 • maye rayse vp name vnto ye deed inheritaunce name roted amonge brother gate place ye witness people gate elder saide witness lorde make woman commeth thy house rachel lea ge 293 • haue buylded vp house israel maye ensample vertue ephrata haue honorable name bethleem thy house ye house phares gen 3 • • whō thamar bare vnto iuda thorow sede lorde shall geue damsell boo toke ruth became wife whan laye lorde graunted yt conceaued bare sonne thē sayde wemen vnto naemi praysed lorde hath suffred kynsman ceasse tyme name maye contynue israel shal restore thy life agayne prouyde thine age yi sonnes wife hath loued hath borne better vnto seuen sonnes naemi toke childe layde vpon hir lappe became norse hir neghbours gaue name sayde childe borne vnto naemi called name obed thankfull songe anna sonnes eli wickedly father refourmeth therfore presthode takē sonnes chap iii reuelacion shewed vnto samuel vnto eli chap iiii israel fighteth agaynst philistynes loseth victory exho • tacion chap xiii philistynes gather selues agaynst israel saul disobedient vnto lorde samuel reproueth chap xiiii ionathas discōfiteth enemy sotyltie saul helpeth father wolde slaye sonne people delyuer chap xv samuel cōmaundeth saul 〈◊〉 amalek vtterly destroye him▪ saul dishobedient therfore deposed kyngdome chap xvi dauid anoynted kynge euell sprete vexeth saul dauid easeth playenge harpe chap xvii dauid destroyeth goliath 〈◊〉 philistynes fle chap xviii ionathas dauid sworne louers dauid behaueth himselfe wysely thinges people loue saul geueth doughter purpose philistynes mighte cuppe water chap xxvii dauid flyeth vnto achis kynge geth chap xxviii dauid made achis captayne saul axeth councell sothsayer samuel appeareth vnto rebuketh chap xxix philistynes contente dauid shulde selfe first chapter man ramathaim sophim mount ephraim 〈◊〉 7 b whose name elcana ye sonne ieroham ye sonne elihu ye sonne tohu ye sonne zuph yt ephrate two wyues ye one called anna ye peninna peninna child anna childrē ye man wēte vp frō cite 〈◊〉 2 • b 〈◊〉 1 • tyme worshippe offer vnto lorde zebaoth silo prestes lorde ophni phineas two sonnes eli whan came vpon daye elcana offred gaue partes vnto wife peninna sonnes doughters vnto anna gaue one deale heuely loued anna neuertheles 〈◊〉 2 • 〈…〉 lorde closed hir wombe hir aduersary cast tethe hir vnfrutefulnes lorde closed hir wombe thus dyd euery yeare whan wente vp house lorde thus prouoked wepte ate nothinge elcana hir huszbande sayde vnto wherfore wepest thou eatest thou wherfore thine hert greued better vnto ten sonnes stode anna vp whan eaten dronken silo eli prest sat vpon stole poste temple lorde full heuyn ••• hir herte prayed vnto lorde wepte vowed vowe sayde lorde zebaoth yf thou wilt loke vpon aduersite thy handmayden thynke vpon forget thy handmayden wilt geue thy handmayden sonne wil geue vnto lorde life longe iud 13 num • shal rasou • e come vpon heade whā prayed longe ye lorde eli toke hede hir mouth anna spake hir hert hir lippes onely moued hir voyce herde thoughte eli bene dronken sayde vnto longe wilt thou dronken let come wyne thou hast neuertheles anna answered sayde lorde soroufull woman wyne stronge drynke haue dronken psal 4 • haue poured hert ye lorde counte thy handmayden doughter belial heuy thoughte sorow haue spoken hitherto eli answered sayde go yi waye peace god israel shal graunte ye thy peticion thou hast desyred sayde let thy handmayden fynde fauoure thy sighte woman wente hir waye ate loked nomore soroufully ye morow gat vp tymes whan worshipped ye lorde returned came home vnto ramatha elcana laye anna wife lorde remembred certayne dayes cōceaued bare sonne called name samuel haue desyred sayde lorde whan man elcana wente vp houszholde offre sacrifice vowe vnto lorde soch tyme ye custome anna wente vp sayde vnto hir huszbande wil go vp tyll ye childe weened brynge maye appeare lorde cō tynue num • euer elcana hir huszbande sayde vnto thē thou thynkest best tary tyll thou haue weened lorde perfourme hath spoken woman abode gaue hir sonne sucke tyll weened whan weened broughte vp thre bullockes ephi fyne floure bottell wyne broughte ye house lorde silo neuertheles childe yet yonge slewe bullocke broughte childe vnto eli sayde lorde truly thy soule lyueth lorde woman stode ye made intercession vnto lorde whan prayed childe hath ye lorde graunted peticion desyred therfore haue geuen ouer vnto lorde longe lent vnto lorde worshipped ye lorde ii chapter anna prayed sayde hert reioyseth lorde horne exalted lorde mouth opened wyde vpō myne enemy glad thy saluacion man holy lorde without nothinge cō forte like vnto oure god let go yor greate boostinge hye thynges let go youre mouth olde byworde lorde god yt knoweth thinges hath set workes order bowe mightie broken weake gyrded aboute strength fylled afore solde bred hongrie satisfied vntyll baren bare seuen tyll many childrē become weake • eut • 2 f 〈◊〉 1 • c • ob▪ 13 lorde slayeth geueth life ledeth vnto hell bryngeth agayne lorde maketh poore maketh riche bryngeth lowe exalteth •• al 112 taketh vp neady dust lifteth vp ye poore myre maye set amonge prynces let inheret seate honoure foundacions corner worlde lordes hath set compase earth theron shall preserue fete sayntes ye vngodly shal put sylēce darcnesse • eut • mā oughte owne power lordes enemy shal put feare shal thōder vpō thē heauē lorde shall iudge endes worlde shal geue strēgth vnto kynge shall exalte horne anoynted elcana wente waye ramath vnto house childe became lordes mynister eli prest elis sonnes childrē belial knewe lorde ner dutye prestes vnto people whan eny man wolde offre oughte prestes boye came whyle flesh seethinge thre forked fleshoke hande thrust cauldron ketell panne pot loke drue forth fleshoke toke prest therof thus dyd vnto israel▪ came thither vnto silo like wyse euer burned fatt prestes lad came sayde vnto broughte offerynge geue flesh maye roste prest wyl receaue sodden flesh ye rawe yf eny man sayde vnto let fat burne oughte daye afterwarde take thine hert desyreth sayde vnto thou shalt geue euen yf wyll take violēce therfore synne ye childrē greate lorde ye people spake euell ye meat offerynge ye lorde samuel mynister lorde childe gyrded ouer body cote lynnen mother also made litle cote sylke broughte vp vnto cōuenient tymes whā wente vp hir huszbande offer ye offerynge due season eli blessed elcana wife sayde lorde geue sede woman good thou hast lent vnto lorde wēte vnto place lorde vysited anna cōceaued bare thre sonnes two doughters childe samuel grewe vp lorde eli olde herde sonnes dyd vnto israel laye w • men serued god dore tabernacle witnesse sayde vnto wherfore ye heare youre euell conuersacion people childrē good reporte heare ye cause people lorde offende 〈…〉 yf eny mā synne agaynst man iudge cā redresse yf eny mā synne agaynst ye lorde redresse neuertheles herkened vnto voyce father lordes wyll slaye childe samuel wente grewe vp accepted lorde mē came man god eli sayde vnto thus sayeth lorde shewed selfe vnto thy father house whan yet egipte vnder ye house pharao chose vnto selfe trybes israel presthode shulde offer vpon myne altare burne incense weere ouerbody cote 〈…〉 vnto thy father house gaue offeringes child israel layest thou thy selfe agaynst sacrifice meat offeringes commaunded offer habitacion thou honourest thy sonnes ye mighte fede youre selues firstlinges meat offerynges people israel therfore sayeth lorde god israel haue spoken thy house thy father house shulde walke euer sayeth lorde farre fro euer honoureth wil honor also yt despyse shal regarded beholde 〈◊〉 2 tyme shal come wyll breake thyne arme two arme thy father house shal oldeman thy house thou shalt se thine aduersaries habitacion good israel shal neuer olde man thy father house yet wyll rote euery man fro myne altare yt thyne eye maye consumed ye soule maye sory 〈◊〉 22 greate multitude thy house shal dye whan come men shalbe token vnto shal come vpon thy two sonnes ophni phineas shall dye one daye 〈◊〉 4 c 〈◊〉 • 3 c vnto selfe wyll rayse vp faithfull prest shal acordinge hert soule vnto wyll buylde sure house maye allwaye walke myne anoynted euer remayneth thy house shall come worshipe syluer peny pece bred shall saye praye leaue one prestes parte maye eate morsell bred iii chapter whan childe samuel mynistred vnto lorde vnder eli worde ye lorde deare tyme nether eny sure manifest vision fortuned tyme eli laye place 〈◊〉 4 c eye beganne dymme coulde se samuel layed downe ye temple lorde arke god ye lampe god put lorde called samuel answered beholde ranne vnto eli sayde beholde thou hast called saide haue called go thy waye agayne laye downe slepe wente waye layed downe slepe lorde called againe samuel samuel arose wente vnto eli sayde beholde thou hast called neuertheles sayde sonne haue called thy waye agayne laye downe slepe samuel knewe lorde yet worde ye lorde yet shewed vnto ye lorde called samuel ye thirde tyme arose wente vnto eli sayde beholde thou hast called perceaued eli yt lorde called ye childe sayde vnto go thy waye agayne laye downe slepe yf lorde call eny saye speake lorde ye seruaunt heareth samuel wēte waye layed downe place thē came ye lorde stode called like afore samuel samuel samuel sayde speake lorde thy seruaunt heareth lorde saide vnto samuel beholde thinge israel yt euer shall heare eares shal glowe yt daie rayse vp vpon eli 1 2 g yt haue spokē cō cernynge house take hande perfourme haue tolde yt wilbe iudge ouer house euer wickednes yt knewe shamefully childrē behaued thēselues hath loked sowerly therto therfore haue sworne vnto ye house eli yt wickednes ye house eli shall recōcyled nether wt sacrifice ner wt meat offringe euer samuel laye vnto ye morow opened dores house lorde samuel afrayed tell vysion vnto eli eli called sayde samuel sonne answered beholde sayde ye worde yt lorde hath spokē vnto hyde fro god vnto ye yf thou hyde oughte fro hath talked wt samuel tolde alltogether hyd nothinge sayde lorde let pleaseth samuel grewe vp lorde wt fell none wordes vpō earth israel frō dan vnto bersaba knewe yt samuel faithfull prophet lorde lorde appeared agayne silo lorde shewed selfe vnto samuel silo thorow worde lorde iiii chapter israel spake samuel israel wente forth battayll philistynes pitched besyde 1 reg • • helpe stone philistynes pitched aphek prepared selues agaynst israel whan battayll beganne hoost deuyded israel smyttē enemy edge felde slewe aboute foure thousande men whan people came hoost elder israel sayde wherfore hath lorde caused v smytten daie philistynes let v take vnto v arke lordes couenaunt silo let come amōge v maye helpe v hande oure enemy people sent vnto silo caused set thēce arke ye couenaunt lorde zebaoth sytteth vpon cherubins arke couenaunt god two sonnes eli ophni phineas whan arke couenaunt lorde came hoost israel shouted wt greate shoute earth sounded withall whan philistynes herde ye noyse ye shoute sayde noyse soch greate shoutinge tentes hebrues whan perceaued yt arke lorde come hoost afrayed sayde god come hoost sayde morouer wo vnto v hath bene thus afore tyme wo vnto v wil delyuer v frō hande hye goddes goddes smote egipte wt maner plage wyldernesse stronge manly ye philistynes ye serue hebrues • ud 13 haue serued manly fighte foughte philistynes israel smytten euery one fled vnto tēte greate slaughter fell israel thirtye thousande fote mē arke god takē • 2 g two sonnes eli ophni phineas dyed rāne one ben iamin fore fronte battayl came vnto silo daye clothes rente earth vpō heade whan came heli sat vpon seate mighte loke towarde waye herte fearfull aboute ye arke god whan man came cite tolde forth cite cried whan eli herde ye noyse cryēge axed noyse busynes man came haistely tolde eli eli fourescore eightene yeare olde reg • eye dymme could se man sayde vnto eli come fled daye hoost sayde sonne answered tydinge bringer sayde israel fled philistynes greate slaughter hath bene amonge people thy two sonnes ophni phineas deed yee arke god takē awaye whan made mencion arke god fell downe bacwarde seate gate brake neck dyed olde heuy man iudged israel fortie yeares wife sonne phineas wt childe shulde shortly delyuered whan herde tydinges yt arke god taken yt hir brother lawe hir huszbāde deed bowed hir selfe trauayled hir payne came vpon whan poynte death wemen stode sayde feare thou hast yōge sonne gaue answere nether regarded called childe icabod sayde glory gone israel arke god taken awaye hir brother lawe hir huszbande sayde morouer glory gone israel arke god takē awaye v chapter arke god philistynes toke broughte stone helpe vnto aszdod house dagon set besyde dagon whan aszdod rose vp early morowe founde dagon lyenge face vpon earth arke lorde toke vp dagon set agayne place neuertheles whan rose vp early nexte morowe founde dagon lyenge face agayne vpon earth arke lorde heade hā de hewen vpon threszholde block laie onely therfore prestes dagon go house treade vpō threszsholde dagon aszdod vnto daye hande lorde heuy vpon aszdod destroyed smote aszdod border therof secrete place whan men aszdod sawe plaged sayde 〈…〉 let arke god israel tary v hande harde vpō v vpon god dagon sent forth gathered prynces philistynes vnto sayde shal arke god israel answered geth let arke god israel borne aboute caried arke god israel rounde aboute whā bare aboute greate rumoure cite thorow hande lorde smote people cite smallest vnto greatest destroyed secrete place sent arke lorde vnto ekron whā arke lorde came vnto ekron ekron cried haue caried arke god aboute vnto slaye people sente forth gathered ye prynces philistynes together sayde sende awaye arke god israel agayne vnto hir place slaye people greate rumoure deed cite hande god people dyed smytten secrete place noyse cite wēte vp vnto heauen vi chapter thus arke lorde londe philistynes seuen monethes philistynes called prestes soythsayers sayde shal arke lorde shewe v wher shal sende vnto hir place sayde yf ye wyll sende awaye arke god israel sende awaye emptye geue trespace offerynge shal ye made whole ye shal knowe hande departeth sayde trespace offeringe shall geue answered fyue hynder partes golde fyue golden myce acordinge nombre fyue prynces ye philistynes hath bene one maner plage vpon vpon youre prynces therfore must ye make youre hynder partes one faszshion youre myce haue destroyed youre londe ye maye geue god israel honoure peraduenture hāde shal lighter vpon vpon youre god vpon youre londe harden ye youre hert egipcians pharao hardened hert whan shewed selfe vpon 〈◊〉 12 c dyd let departe go waye go therfore make new cart take two mylke kyne vpon ye neuer came yock yocke ye cart let calues tary behynde home take ye arke lorde laye vpon cart iewels golde ye geue trespace offeringe put coffer beside sende awaye let go loke well yf go waie hir awne coaste beth semes thē hath done v greate euell yf shal ye knowe hande hath touched v yt happened vnto v chaūce men dyd toke two yonge mylke kyne yocked cart helde calues home layed arke lorde vpon cart coffer golden myce ymages disease kyne wente straight waye vnto beth semes vpon one hye strete wente blearynge turned nether righte hande ner lefte prynces philistynes wente vnto ye coast beth semes beth samite euen reapynge downe wheate haruest valley lyfte vp eye sawe arke reioysed se cart came felde iosua beth semite stode styll greate stone claue tymber cart offred kyne vnto lorde burntofferynge leuites toke downe arke lorde coffer wherin iewels golde set thē vpon greate stone men beth semes offred burnt offerynges offerynges also vnto lorde daye whan fyue prynces philistynes sene departed agayne daye towarde ekron golden disease philistynes offred trespace offerynge vnto lorde aszdod one gasa one ascalon one gath one ekron one golden myce acordynge nombre city philistynes amonge fyue prynces walled cite vnto vyllage vnto greate playne felde whervpon set arke lorde vnto daye vpon felde iosua beth semite certaine beth same slaine sene ye arke lorde slewe fyftye thousande seuentye men people mourned people lorde done greate slaughter people men beth semes sayde maye stōde lorde holy god whō shal go frō v sent messaungers ye inhabiters kiriath iearim saiēge philistynes haue brought arke god agayne come downe fetch vp vnto vii chapter men kiriath iearim came downe fetched vp ye arke ye lorde brought ye house 6 abinadab gibea consecrated eleasar sonne yt might kepe ye arke frō yt daye arke ye lorde abode kiriath iearim ye tyme extended forth longe tyll came twentye yeares house israel wepte lorde samuel sayde vnto house israel 〈◊〉 24 c • ob 14▪ c yf ye turne withall youre hert vnto lorde put awaye straunge goddes astaroth directe youre hert vnto lorde •• ut • c • 4 b serue onely shall delyuer hande philistynes childrē israel put awaye baalim astaroth serued lorde onely samuel saide gather israel together vnto mispa maye praye vnto lorde came together vnto mispa drue water poured lorde fasted daye sayde haue synned vnto lorde samuel iudged child israel mispa whan philistynes herde ye child israel come together vnto mispa prynces philistynes wēte vp israel whan ye childrē israel herde afrayed ye philistynes sayde vnto samuel ceasse crye vnto lorde oure god v yt maie helpe v hande ye philistynes • ccl • 46 c samuel toke fat lambe offred whole burnt offerynge vnto lorde cried vnto lorde israel lorde herde whyle samuel offerynge ye burnt sacrifice ye philistine came fight agaynst israel lorde thondred thonder vpon philistynes daye discōfyted thē yt smyttē israel thē wente ye men israel forth chaced ye philistynes smote till vnder beth car toke samuel stone set vp betwene mispa sen called ye help stone sayde hither hath lorde helped v 4 thus philistynes brought downe came nomore within border israel ye hāde ye lorde philistynes longe samuel lyued • israel gat city agayne philistynes conquered frō ekron vnto gath border therof israel rescue hande philistynes israel peace wt amorites samuel iudged israel lōge liued wē te aboute euery yeare vnto bethel gilgal mispa whā iudged israel place came agayne vnto ramath house iudged israel builded altare vnto ye lorde viii chapter bvt whan samuel waxed olde set sonnes iudges ouer israel firstborne sonne called ioel secōde abia iudges bersaba neuertheles sonnes walked wayes enclyned vnto couetousnes 〈…〉 toke giftes wraysted lawe ye elder israel gathered thē selues together came ramath vnto samuel saide vnto beholde thou art waxen olde thy sonnes walke yt wayes 〈…〉 set kynge ouer v therfore iudge v ye heithē haue thē samuel displeased whā sayde geue v kynge iudge samuel prayed lorde lorde saide vnto samuel herken vnto voice people yt haue sayde vnto 〈…〉 haue refused yt shulde kinge ouer vnto haue done euer sence daie yt brought londe egipte vnto daye ha • ue forsaken serued goddes herkē therfore vnto voyce yet testifye vnto shewe 〈…〉 lawe kynge shall raigne ouer samuel tolde wordes lorde vnto ye people requyred kinge shal lawe kynge yt shal raigne ouer 〈…〉 yor sonnes shall take charettes horsmen runne charettes ruler captaynes plowemen tyll londe reaper haruest make harnesse soch thinges belonge charettes yor doughters shall take thē apotecaries coke baker youre best londe vynyardes 〈…〉 oylegardens shall take geue vnto seruauntes youre sedes also viniardes shal take tithe geue vnto chā berlaynes seruauntes youre seruaū te youre maydes youre best yonge men youre ass shal take busynes withall youre flockes shal take tithe ye shal seruaūtes whan ye shal crye tyme ouer youre kynge ye haue chosen lorde shall heare tyme neuerthelesse people refused heare voyce samuel sayde shall kynge ouer v yt maye heithē yt kynge maie iudge v go forth v gouerne oure warres thē herkened samuel vnto yt ye people sayde tolde ye eares lorde lorde sayde vnto thē herken thou vnto voyce make kynge samuel sayde vnto men israel go youre waye euery one vnto cite ix chapter man ben iamin named 〈◊〉 9 ci sonne abiel sonne zeor sonne bethorah ye sonne apiah sonne man iemini valeaunt man sonne named saul goodly yonge man goodlier amonge child israel higher heade people ci father saul lost ass sayde vnto saul sonne take one child get vp go thy waye seke ass wente waye thorow mount ephraim thorow lōde solisa founde wente thorow lōde saalim passed thorow ye lōde iemini foūde thē whā came londe zuph saul sayde vnto childe come let v go home agayne lest father let go ass take care v sayde beholde honorable man god cite sayeth commeth passe let v go thither perauenture maye shewe v oure waye go saul saide vnto childe though shulde go brynge man bred gone walet el haue gifte brynge man god haue childe answered agayne sayde beholde haue fourth parte syluer sycle ye wyll geue man god maye shewe v oure waye afore tyme israel whan man wente axe councell lorde sayde come let v go seer called prophetes called seer afore tyme saul sayde vnto childe thou hast well spoken come let v go whan wente vnto cite man god came vp cite founde damsel gone forth drawe water vnto sayde seer here▪ answered sayde yee beholde make haist came cite daye people haue sacrifice daye hye place whan ye come cite ye shal fynde afore go vp hye place eate people wyll eate tyll come shall blesse offerynge shal eate called therfore go yor waie vp euē shal ye finde whan came vp cite euen myddes cite beholde samuel came forth waye wolde go vp hye place 1 reg • 5▪ • lorde opened samuel eare daye afore euer saul came sayde tomorow aboute tyme wyll sende man vnto lōde ben iamin shalt thou anoynte prynce ouer people israel maye delyuer people hande philistynes haue loked vpon people crye come whan samuel behelde saul lorde answered lo yt man tolde shulde raigne ouer people came saul vnto samuel vnder ye gate sayde tell praye seer house samuel answered saul sayde seer go vp vnto hye place ye shall eate daye tomorow wyll lett go thyne hert wyll tell ass lost thre dayes agoo care thou founde shall belonge pleasaunt israel shall belonge vnto thy father house saul answered sonne iemini iudi 20 c 1 15 smallest trybe kynred leest amonge kynreds ye trybe ben iamin speakest thou thē vnto samuel toke saul childe brought perler shulde eate satt aboue called aboute thirtie men samuel sayde vnto coke geue porcion gaue bad kepe coke toke vp shulder bare forth set saul samuel sayde beholde left laye eate kepte agaynst tyme whan called people thus saul ate samuel daye whan gone downe hye place vnto cite talked saul chamber rose vp early morow whan mornynge sprynge arose samuel called saul chamber sayde vp yt maye sende thy waye saul gat vp wēte forth together samuel whan came downe ende cite samuel sayde vnto saul speake vnto ye childe go forth v stōde thou styll maie shew • god hath sayde x chapter toke samuel glasse oyle poured vpō heade kissed sayde seist thou lorde hath anoynted prince ouer deut 9 c enheritaūce whan thou goest fro thou shalt fynde two men besyde gen 35 rachel graue coast ben iamin zelzah shal saie vnto ass founde thou wentest seke beholde thy father hath put ass mynde taketh thoughte sayeth shall sonne whan thou goest forth thence thou shalt come oke thabor shall thre men fynde go vp vnto god towarde bethel one beareth thre kiddes another thre loaues bred thyrde bottel wyne shall salute geue two loaues thou shalt take hande shalt thou come hyll god 1 reg •• philistynes watch whā thou comest cite shall mete company commeth vnder thyne hande god thou shalt go downe vnto gilgall beholde thither wyl come downe vnto thou mayest offre burnt offerynges deed offerynges 〈…〉 seuen dayes shalt thou tarye till come shewe thou shuldest whan turned shulder go samuel god chaunged another hert tokēs came daye whan came vnto hill beholde met company prophetes 〈…〉 sprete god came vpon prophecyed amonge whā knewe sawe prophecied prophetes sayde amonge selues happened vnto sonne ci saul also amonge prophetes one yt answered sayde father 〈…〉 hereof came prouerbe saul also amonge prophetes whā left prophecienge came vp hyll saul vncle sayde vnto childe whither wente ye answered seke ass whan sawe awaye came vnto samuel sayde saul vncle tell sayde samuel vnto saul answered vncle tolde v yt ass foūde ye kyngdome tolde nothinge samuel sayde samuel called people together vnto lorde mispa spake vnto child israel thus saieth ye lorde god israel broughte israel egipte delyuered hande ye egipcians hande kyngdomes oppressed 〈…〉 haue ye refused yor god hath helped youre sorowes trouble ye haue saide vnto set kinge ouer v • well stonde ye ye lorde acordinge youre trybes kynreds whan samuel brought forth trybes amonge ye vessel ranne thither fetched whan stode amonge people hygher heade people samuel sayde vnto people se ye lorde hath chosen people none like gaue people shoute sayde 〈…〉 god saue new kynge samuel tolde people 〈◊〉 • 7 lawe kyngdome wrote boke layed lorde samuel let people go euery one awne house saul wente home also vnto gibea wente one parte hoost whose hertes god touched childrē belial sayde shal felowe helpe v 〈…〉 despysed broughte presente made though herde • xi chapter nahas ye ammonite wēte vp layed sege vnto iabes gilead men iabes sayde vnto nahas one v wyll serue nahas ye ammonite answered wil make couenaunt condicion maye thrust youre right eye put shame amonge israel sayde elder iabes vnto geue v seuen dayes respyte maye sende messaungers ye coastes israel yf sauioure wyl go forth vnto messaungers came vnto gibea saul spake eares people ye people lifte vp voyce wepte beholde saul came ox felde sayde ayleth people wepe tolde earande men iabes 〈…〉 came sprete god vpon whan herde wordes wrath sore moued toke couple ox hewed sunder sent coastes israel messaungers sayenge euer goeth forth saul samuel ox shalbe thus dealte withall fell feare lorde vpon people wente forth like one man 〈…〉 tolde basek childrē israel thre hundreth thousande men thirtie thousande child iuda spake vnto messaungers come saye thus men iabes gilead tomorow shal ye haue helpe whan ye sonne whotest whan ye messaungers came tolde men iabes glad men iabes sayde tomorow wyll come forth vnto ye maye vnto v euer pleaseth ye nexte morow saul set people thre partes came hoost aboute mornynge watch smote ammonite tyll daye whotest yt remayned scatred two abode together sayde people vnto samuel sayde 1 〈…〉 shulde saul raigne ouer v delyuer v men maye put death saul sayde shal noman dye daye daye hath lorde geuen health israel samuel sayde vnto people come let v go vnto gilgall renue kyngdome wente people vnto gilgall made saul kinge lorde gilgal offred deed offeringes lorde saul men israel reioysed greatly xii chapter samuel sayde vnto israel beholde haue herkened vnto youre voyce ye sayde vnto haue made kynge ouer lo goeth youre kynge waxen olde graye heered sonnes haue gone fro youth vp vnto daye beholde i▪ answere ye agaynst rorde anoynted eccli 4 • act 20 yf haue taken eny man oxe asse yf haue done eny man violence wronge haue oppressed eny mā yf haue receaued gifte eny man hande kepte secretly wil restore agayne saide▪ thou hast done v nether violence ner wronge nether oppressed ner taken ought eny man hande sayde lorde witnesse agaynst anoynted daye ye haue founde nothinge hāde saide yee shalbe witness samuel sayde vnto people lorde made moses aaron broughte youre father londe egipte present stōde forth therfore maye iudge lorde ouer righteousnes lorde hath done youre father gen 46 exod 2 whan iacob come egipte youre father cryed vnto lorde exo 3 b sent moses aaron brynge youre father egipte cause dwell place 〈◊〉 4 whan forgat lorde god solde vnder power sissera captayne hazor 〈◊〉 13 vnder power philistynes 〈◊〉 3 b vnder power kinge moabites foughte agaynst cried vnto lorde sayde haue synned haue forsaken lorde
