nahas kynge child ammon came agaynst • reg 8 ye sayde vnto thou kynge shal raigne ouer v notwithstō dinge youre god youre kynge haue ye youre kynge whō ye haue chosen desyred lo lorde hath set kinge ouer yf ye shal feare lorde serue herken vnto voice dishobedient vnto mouth lorde shall ye youre kynge raigneth ouer folowe ye lorde youre god yf ye herken vnto ye voyce lorde dishobedient vnto mouth shal hande lorde agaynst agaynst youre father stonde forth also beholde greate thinge lorde shal youre eye wheate haruest yet wyll call vpō lorde shal cause thonder rayne ye shall knowe se greate euell ye haue done sight lorde ye haue desyred haue kynge whan samuel called vpon lorde lorde caused thōder raine daye people feared lorde greatly samuel sayde vnto samuel praie thou vnto lorde thy god thy seruauntes dye beside oure sinnes haue done euell also haue desyred vnto v kinge samuel sayde vnto people feare ye haue done euell dede neuertheles departe backe lorde serue lorde youre hert go asyde vanite profyteth nothinge delyuer moch vayne thinge exo 34 b deut 9 • iosu 7 b lorde shall forsake people greate name sake lorde hath begonne make people vnto selfe god forbyd shulde synne vnto lorde ceasse prayenge teachinge good righteous waye feare ye lorde therfore serue faithfully yor hert ye haue sene greate thinges doth vnto yf ye wickedly ye youre kynge shal perishe xiii chapter saul bene kynge one yeare whā raigned ouer israel two yeares chose thre thousande mē israel two thousande saul michmas vpon mount bethel one thousande ionathas gibea ben iamin people let go euery one vnto tente ionathas smote ye philistynes awne 〈…〉 watch gibea came ye philistynes eares saul caused blowe trompes londe saye let hebrues heare israel herde saye saul hath smytten philistynes watch israel stanke philistynes people cried saul vnto gilgal philistynes gathered selues together fighte wt israel thirtie thousande charettes sixe thousande horsmen people besyde nombre sonde see shore wente vp pitched michmas eastsyde bethauen whan men israel sawe mysfortune laye vpon neckes thē people come therto crope caues dennes rockes hole welles hebrues wente ouer iordane ye lande gad gilead saul yet gilgal people fayntharted 〈…〉 taried seuen dayes acordinge tyme apoynted samuel whan samuel came vnto gilgal people scatered abrode sayde saul brynge hither burnt offeringe deed offeringes offred burnt offerynge whan made ende burnt offerynge beholde samuel came wente saul forth mete might salute samuel sayde hast thou done saul answered sawe people scatered abrode fro thou camest due season philistynes gathered together michmas sayde shall philistynes come downe vnto gilgal haue besoughte face lorde boldened myselfe offred burnt offerynge samuel sayde vnto saul thou hast done foolishly kepte commaundement lorde thy god commaunded yf thou haddest done prospered thy kyngdome vpō israel euer shall thy kyngdome contynue 〈◊〉 • 6 c lorde hath soughte man owne hert hath lorde commaunded prynce ouer people thou hast kepte yt lorde commaunded ye samuel arose wente vp gilgal vnto gibea ben iamin saul nombred people founde vpon sixe hundreth men saul sonne ionathas ye people taried gibea ben iamin ye philistynes pitched tentes michmas hoost philistynes wente thre bondes men destroye one turned waye towarde ephra londe sual another turned towarde waye bethoron thirde turned towarde waye reacheth valley zeboim vnto wyldernes smyth founde lōde israel ye philistynes thoughte hebrues mighte happly make swerdes speares israel fayne go downe philistynes whan eny man plowshare mattock axe sythe sharpe edge plowshare mattockes forckes ax laboured poyntes blont whan daye battayll came nether swerde ner speare founde hande people saul ionathas saul ionathas sonne som founde ye philistynes watch wēte ouer michmas xiiii chapter fortuned ye tyme yt ionathas sayde vnto lad wapen bearer come let v go ouer philistynes watch yt lyeth aboue tolde father saul dwelt ye ende gibea vnder pomgranate tre suburbe 13 people yt vpon sixe hundreth men ahia sonne achitob brother icabod sonne phineas ye sonne eli ye prest lorde silo wayre ouerbody cote people knewe ionathas gone betwene passage ionathas soughte go ouer vnto phylistynes watch two hye rockes one one syde one called bozez senne ye one laye north syde towarde michmas south syde towarde gaba ionathas sayde vnto wapen bearer come let v go euer ye watch vncircumcised peraduenture lorde shall worke v 2 par 14 harde matter lorde helpe many fewe answered wapen bearer thine hert go thy w • rie beholde euen thine hert wyll ionathas sayde well whan gone ouer men come within sighte yf saye stonde styll tyll come wyll stonde styll oure place go vp yf saye come vp v wyll go vp thē hath lorde delyuered oure hande shalbe token v whan came sighte philistynes watch philistynes sayde se iudi • 14▪ ye hebrues gone hole crepte men watch answered ionathas wapē bearer sayde come vp v wyll teach matter sayde ionathas weapen bearer • mac 4▪ come vp lorde hath delyuered israel hande ionathas clamme vp handes fete wapen bearer ionathas smote downe wapē bearer slewe behynde first slaughter ionathas wapen bearer dyd vpō twentye men length halue aker londe pare ox maye tyll one daye iudi 14▪ came fearfulnes flight hoost vpon felde amonge people watch vpon 1 13 destroyer came fearfulnes also flight londe rumoure iosu 10 iud 4 c came flight thorow god saul watchmē gibea bē iamin sawe ye multitude gat awaye ranne fro saul sayde vnto people tell se v gone awaye whan nombred beholde ionathas wapen bearer saide saul vnto ahia brynge hither arke god tyme arke god child israel whyle saul yet speakynge prest multitude philistynes hoost gat vp ranne greate saul sayde vnto prest withdrawe thine hande saul cried people came battayll beholde 〈◊〉 7 f • pa 20 euery man swerde agaynst another greate rumoure hebrues also ye philistynes afore gone vp hoost euery syde ioyned selues vnto israel saul ionathas men israel 1 • b hyd thē selues vpon mount ephraim whan herde philistynes fled folowed battayll thus ye lorde helped israel tyme ye battayll lasted vnto bethauen whan men israel came forth saul charged people daye sayde cursed euery man eateth bred vntyll euen maye auenge myne enemy people taisted bred people londe came wodd laye hony vpon felde whan people came wodd heholde hony flowed man put mouth hāde people afraied ooth ionathas herde father charged people put forth staff hande dypped ende ye hony c • mbe turned hande mouth eye lighted answered one people sayde thy father hath charged people sayde cursed euery mā eateth oughte daye neuertheles people faynte sayde ionathas father hath troubled londe se lighte myne eye become haue taisted litle hony yf people daie eatē spoyle enemy founde slaughter shulde haue bene greater agaynst philistynes yet smote philistynes daye fro michmas vnto aialon people weery ye people turned spoyles toke shepe ox calues slewe vpon earth • eui • c • ud 1 • f ate bloude tolde saul beholde people synne agaynst lorde eate bloude • ayde ye haue done euell roll vnto greate stone saul sayde morouer go abrode amō ge people saye vnto euery one brynge oxe shepe slaye ye maye eate synne agaynst lorde eatynge bloude broughte people euery one oxe hāde nighte slewe saul buylded altare vnto ye lorde first altare buylded vnto lorde saul sayde let v go downe philistynes nighte spoyle tyll cleare mornynge let none escape answered euer pleaseth prest sayde let v go nye vnto god saul axed god shal go downe ye philistine wilt thou delyuer thē israel hande neuertheles answered tyme sayde saul let armyes people come hither make search se synne tyme truly god sauioure israel lyueth though sonne ionathas shal dye man answered people sayde vnto israel ye one syde sonne ionathas wyl syde people sayde vnto saul pleaseth saul sayde vnto lorde god israel thou right thē ionathas saul taken people wente forth fre saul sayde cast lot ouer sonne ionathas ionathas takē saul sayde vnto ionathas tell hast thou done ionathas tolde sayde taisted litle hony staff hande beholde must dye therfore thē sayde saul god vnto ionathas thou must dye death people sayde vnto saul shulde ionathas dye hath done greate health israel night god forbyd 〈…〉 truly lorde lyueth shal one heer heade fall vpon ye earth god hath wroughte tyme people delyuered ionathas dyed wente saul vp philistynes philistynes wente vnto place whan saul cōqu • red kyngdome ouer israel foughte enemyes rounde aboute moabites agaynst childrē ammon agaynst edomites agaynst kynge zoba agaynst ye philistynes whither euer turned gat ye victory made hoost smote ye 〈◊〉 2 • c amalechites delyuered israel hande spoyled saul sonnes ionathas isui malchisua ye name two doughters firstborne merob ye yōgest michol saul wife called ahinoam doughter ahimaas chefe captaynes name abner sonne ner saul vncle 〈…〉 〈◊〉 9 ci ye father saul ner ye father abner sonne abiel mightie sore warre philistynes lōge saul lyued saul sawe man stronge mete ye warre toke xv chapter samuel sayde vnto saul 〈◊〉 9 c lorde sent anoynte kynge ouer people israel heare therfore voyce wordes lorde thus sayeth ye lorde zebaoth haue remembred amaleck dyd vnto israel 〈◊〉 17 c 〈◊〉 24 〈◊〉 ▪ 25 c layed wayte ye waye whan wente egipte go ye waye therfore smyte amalechites damne haue spare slaye man woman child sucklynges ox shepe camel ass saul commaunded people nombred talaim two hūdreth thousande fote men ten thousande men iuda whan saul came cite amalechites set hynder watch ryuer sayde vnto ye kenites get hence departe go downe ye amalechites yt smyte 〈◊〉 10 〈◊〉 1 ye shewed mercy vnto child israel whā departed egipte kenites gat awaye amonge amalechites smote saul amalechites heuila vnto sur lyeth ouer egipte toke agag kynge ye amalechites alyue damned ye people wt edge swerde neuertheles saul people spared agag shepe ox yt good fat lambes good wolde damne thē loke foule nothinge worth damned came worde lorde vnto samuel sayde repenteth made saul kynge hath turned selfe backe fro cōfirmed wordes therfore samuel angrye cried vnto lorde nighte samuel gat vp early might mete saul ye mornynge tolde saul come vnto carmel deu 1 • set vp piler gone aboute come downe gilgall whā samuel came saul saul sayde vnto blessed thou vnto ye lorde haue perfourmed worde ye lorde samuel answered crye shepe myne eares crye ox heare saul sayde haue broughte amalechites people spared best shepe ox offerynge ye lorde thy god haue damned neuertheles samuel answered saul let tell ye lorde hath sayde vnto nighte sayde saye samuel sayde 1 9 c 10 • whan thou wast small thine awne eye wast thou ye heade amō ge trybes israel lorde anoynted kynge ouer israel ye lorde sent yt waye sayde go ye waie damne synners amalechites fighte agaynst tyll thou haue vtterly destroyed thē wherfore hast thou herkened vnto voyce lorde hast turned thy selfe spoyle done euell sighte lorde saul answered samuel yee haue herkened vnto voyce lorde haue gone waye ye lorde sent broughte agag kynge amalechites damned amalechites ye people haue takē spoyle shepe ox ye best amōge damned offer vnto ye lorde thy god gilgall samuel saide hath lorde pleasure sacrifice burnt offerynges obeynge voyce lorde beholde eccl • 4 obedience better offerynge herken better fat rammes disobedience ye synne exo 22 deut 1 • witchcrafte rebellion blasphemy idolatrye moch thou hast refused worde lorde hath refused also thou shuldest kynge sayde saul vnto samuel haue synned yt haue transgressed commaundement lorde thy worde afrayed people herkened vnto voyce forgeue synne returne maye worshippe ye lorde samuel saide vnto saul wil turne backe ye thou hast refused worde lorde lorde hath refused also yt thou shuldest kynge israel whan samuel turned backe go waye gat ye edge garment rēte sayde samuel vnto lorde hath rente kyngdome israel ye daye geuen vnto ye neghbor better thou ouer wynner israel also shal lye nether shal repente man shulde repente sayde haue synned yet honoure elder people israel turne backe maye worshippe lorde thy god samuel turned agayne saul saul mighte worshippe lorde samuel sayde bringe hither agag kynge amalechites agag wente vnto tēderly agag saide thus departeth bytternesse death samuel sayde 〈◊〉 17 c 〈◊〉 14 g like thy swerde hath made wemen childlesse shal ye mother also child amonge wemen samuel hewed agag peces ye lorde gilgall 17 samuel departed vnto ramath saul wente vp house gibea saul samuel sawe saul nomore vnto daye death neuertheles samuel mourned saul repented lorde made saul kynge ouer israel xvi chapter ye lorde sayde vnto samuel longe mournest thou saul haue refused shulde kynge ouer israel fyll thine horne oyle go thy waye wyll sende isai bethleemite amonge sonnes haue prouyded kynge samuel sayde shal go saul shal perceaue shal slaye lorde sayde take calfe droue saye come sacrifice vnto ye lorde thou shalt call isai ye sacrifice shall tell thou shalt thou mayest anoynte shall shewe samuel dyd lorde sayde came bethleem elder cite astonnyed wente forth mete sayde 2 b thy commynge peaceable sayde yee come sacrifice vnto lorde sanctifye youre selues come sacrifice sanctified isai sonnes called sacrifice whā came behelde eliab thoughte whether shulde anoynted lorde ye lorde sayde vnto samuel loke vpon countenaunce ner vpon tallnesse person iudge sighte man man hath respecte vnto thinge eye lorde loketh vpon hert isai called abinadab broughte samuel sayde hath lorde chosen isai broughte samma sayde also hath lorde chosen broughte isai seuen sonnes samuel neuertheles samuel saide vnto isai lorde hath chosen none samuel sayde vnto isai childrē sayde yet one yt leest beholde kepeth shepe thē sayde samuel vnto isai sende cause fetched syt downe table vntyll come sent caused broughte well coloured wt fayre eye beutyfull countenaunce lorde saide aryse anoynte thē toke samuel oyle ho • e anoynted amonge brethrē sprete lorde came vpō dauid frō ye daye forth samuel gat vp wente vnto ramath sprete lorde departed saul euell sprete ye lorde vexed sayde saul seruauntes vnto beholde euell sprete god vexeth let oure lorde saie vnto seruauntes stonde yt seke man playe vpon harpe instrumente whan euell sprete god cōmeth vpon maye playe wt hande ease withall sayde saul vnto seruaūtes prouyde mā playe well vpon instrumente brynge vnto answered one child sayde beholde sawe sonne isai ye bethleemite playe vpon instrumē te honest valeaūt man one yt hath vnderstōdinge matter welfauoured thē saul sent messaungers vnto isai sayē ge sende dauid ye sonne shepe toke isai asse wt bred bottell wt wyne kyd sent vnto saul dauid sonne dauid came saul stode loued well became wapen bearer saul sente vnto isai sayēge let dauid remayne hath founde fauor sighte whan sprete god came vpō saul dauid toke ye harpe played wt hande saul refreszshed eased euell sprete departed xvii chapter philistynes gathered hoost ye battayl came together socho iuda pitched tentes betwene socho aseka ende damin saul mē israel came together pitched oke valley prepared selues battayll agaynst philistynes philistynes stode vpon hyll one syde israelite vpon hyll syde valley betwene stepte forth amōge philistynes stoute bolde man named goliath 〈…〉 gath sixe cubites hande breth hye helmet stele heade fast habergion vpon weight habergion fyue thousande sicles stele harnesse stele vpon legges shylde stele vpon shulders shaft speare like weuers lome yron speare sixe hundreth sicles yron wapen bearer wente stode called vnto hoost israel sayde vnto wherfore ye come forth prepare youre selues battayll philistyne ye seruauntes saul chose one amonge come downe vnto yf fighte agaynst slaye wil youre seruauntes yf ouercome slaye shal ye oure seruauntes v seruyce philistyne sayde haue spokē diszdanedly vnto hoost israel daye geue one let v • fighte together whan saul israel herde wordes ye philistyne astonnyed sore afrayed dauid sonne man ephrata bethleem iuda whose name isai eight sonnes olde man saul tyme well strycken age amonge men thre eldest sonnes isai gone saul battayll name eliab first borne abinadab seconde samma thirde dauid yongest whan thre eldest gone saul battayll dauid wente agayne saul kepe father shepe bethleem philistyne stepte • h early mornynge euen stode fortye dayes isai sayde vnto dauid sonne take epha firmentye thy brother ten loaues bred runne hoost vnto thy brother ten new cheses brynge ye captayne loke thy brother whether go well take byd saul men israel oke valley foughte agaynst philistynes dauid gat vp early mornynge commytted shepe ye keper toke burthen wente waye isai commaunded came tēt hoost gone forth prepared selues cried battayl israel set selues araye philistynes agaynst hoost araye also lefte dauid vessell bare keper stuffe ranne hoost wente saluted brother whyle yet talkynge beholde came vp stoute bolde man whose name goliath philistine gath philistynes hoost spake like afore dauid herde euery man israel whan sawe man fled sore afrayed euery man israel sayde haue ye sene man commynge vp hither come vp hither speake diszdanedly vnto israel euer smyteth wyll kynge make ryche geue doughter make father house fre israel sayde dauid vnto men stode shalbe done man smyteth philistyne turneth shame awaye israel philistyne vncircūcysed defyeth hoost ye lyuynge god people tolde afore thus shall done vnto ye 〈◊〉 smyteth eliab greater brother herde talke men wroth agaynst dauid sayde wherfore art thou come downe hast thou left fewe shepe wyldernesse knowe thy presumptuousnesse well ynough wickednesse thine hert thou art come downe se battayll dauid answered haue downe occasion turned selfe vnto another spake acordinge sayde people answered like afore whan herde wordes dauid sayde tolde presence saul caused fetched dauid sayde vnto saul let man hert discoraged thy seruaunt shall go fighte philistyne neuertheles saul sayde vnto dauid thou art able go agaynst phylistyne fighte thou art childe man warre youth vp dauid sayde vnto saul thy seruaunt kepte father shepe came lyon bere caried awaye shepe flocke wente forth smote delyuered mouth 〈◊〉 14 b 〈◊〉 11 f whan wolde haue bene vpon toke beerde smote slewe thy seruaunt smote lyon ye bere therfore shall philistyne vncircumcysed euen one hath defyed hoost lyuynge god dauid sayde lorde delyuered ye lyon beer shall delyuer also philistyne saul sayde vnto dauid go thy waye lorde saul clothed dauid clothes set helmet stele vpon heade put habergion vpō dauid girded swerde aboue clothes beganne go neuer bene vsed afore sayde dauid vnto saul go thus haue bene vsed laied toke staff hande chose fyue slighte stone ryuer put shepardes bagge toke slynge hande made philistyne philistyne wente forth made dauid wapen bea • e • whan philistyne loked sawe dauid thoughte scorne childe well coloured beutyfull loke vpon philistyne sayde vnto dauid dogg thou commest vnto staffe cursed dauid god sayde vnto dauid come hither wil geue thy flesh foules vnder heauen beastes felde neuertheles dauid sayde vnto philistyne thou commest vnto swerde speare shylde come vnto name lorde zebaoth god hoost israel thou hast despysed daye shall lorde delyuer hāde maye smyte take thy heade geue body hoost philistynes daye vnto foules vnder heauen wylde beestes vpon earth londe maye knowe yt israel hath god congregacion shal knowe lorde saueth nether thorow swerde ner speare battayll lordes shal delyuer oure handes whan philistyne gat vp wente forth drue nye vnto dauid dauid made haiste ranne ye hoost vnto philistyne dauid put hā de bagg toke stone thrue slynge 〈…〉 hytt philisty •• euen fore heade stone st • cke fore heade fell downe grounde vpon face dauid ouercame ye philistyne slynge ye stone smote slewe moch dauid swerde hande ranne stode ouer ye philistyne 〈…〉 toke sw • rde drue sheeth slewe smote heade withall whan philistynes sawe strongest deed 〈◊〉 7 f fled men israel iuda gat thē vp cryed folowed vpon philistynes tyll came vnto valley porte ekron philistynes fell downe slayne vnto gath ekron child israel turned agayne chasynge philistynes spoyled tentes dauid toke heade phil • styne broughte vnto ierusalem armoure layed tente whan saul sawe dauid go forth agaynst philistyne saide vnto 〈◊〉 14 g abner chefe captayne abner whose sonne childe abner sayde truly thy soule lyueth kynge wote kynge sayde axe thē whose sonne yonge mā whan dauid came agayne slaughter philistyne abner toke broughte saul philistynes heade hande saul sayde vnto whose sonne art thou thou yonge man dauid sayde sonne thy seruaunt isai bethleemite xviii chapter whan made ende talkynge saul soule ionathas bounde soule dauid ionathas loued owne soule saul toke daye let go agayne father house ionathas dauid made couenaunt together loued owne soule ionathas put owne cote vpon gaue vnto dauid yee cloke swerde bowe girdell dauid wente forth whither euer saul sent behaued himselfe wysely saul set ouer men warre pleased people well seruauntes saul fortuned whan dauid come agayne slaughter philistyne wemen wente city israel songes daunses mete kynge saul tymbrels myrth fyddels wemen sange one another played sayde • 21 〈◊〉 • 9 b saul hath smytten thousande dauid ten thousande saul wroth ye worde displeased sore sayde haue ascrybed ten thousande vnto dauid one thousande vnto shal haue kyngdome daye forth saul loked sowerly vpō dauid nexte daye came euell sprete god vpon saul prophecyed ye myddes house dauid played instrumente hande wonte daylie saul iauelynge hande cast thoughte wyll stycke dauid fast wall neuerthelesse dauid turned himselfe twyse awaye saul afrayed dauid lorde departed saul saul put set prynce ouer thousande men went people dauid behaued himselfe wysely doynges lorde whan saul sawe exceadynge wyse stode feare israel iuda loued dauid wente saul sayde vnto dauid beholde greatest doughter merob 1 17 c wyl geue wyfe stronge gouerne warres lorde saul thought hāde shal vpon hande ye pilistynes neuertheles dauid answered saul life kynred father israel shulde mary kinges doughter whan tyme came merob ye doughter saul shulde haue bene geuē vnto dauid geuen vnto adriel ye meholathite wyfe neuerthelesse • chol saul doughter loued dauid whan tolde saul ye matter pleased well sayde wyl geue yt maye snare vnto handes ye philistynes maye come vpon sayde vnto dauid daye shalt thou doughters huszbāde ye secōde time saul spake vnto seruaūtes talke wt dauid secretly saye beholde kinge hath pleasure seruauntes loue mary thou therfore kynges doughter saul seruauntes spake wordes eares dauid dauid saide thynke ye small matter mary kynges doughter poore symple man saul seruauntes tolde agayne sayde soch wordes hath dauid spoken saul sayde saye ye vnto dauid kynge desyreth dowry onely hundreth foreszkynnes philistynes vengeaunce maye taken kinges enemy howbeit saul thought cause dauid slayne hā de philistynes seruauntes tolde dauid wordes dauid contente matter mary kynges doughter fewe dayes dauid gatt vp wente men smote two hundreth men amonge philistynes dauid broughte foreszkynnes made nombre sufficient vnto kynge yt mighte mary kynges doughter thē saul gaue doughter michol wyfe saul sawe perceaued lorde wt dauid michol saul doughter loued saul afrayed became enemye lō ge lyued whan prynces philistynes wēte forth dauid behaued selfe wysely seruauntes saul outgoynge name greate reputacion xix chapter saul spake ionathas sonne seruauntes shulde kyll dauid 1 • neuerthelesse ionathas sonne saul loued dauid exceadingly tolde sayde saul father goeth aboute slaye kepe therfore praye mornynge abyde secrete hyde wyll go forth stonde besyde father felde thou art wyll speake vnto father soeuer se shal brynge worde ionathas reported ye best dauid vnto saul father sayde vnto oh let kynge synne agaynst seruaunt hath synned agaynst doynge necessary 〈◊〉 12 • sal 118 put lyfe hande also smote philistyne lorde dyd greate health vnto israel hast thou sene reioysed therof wherfore wylt thou offende agaynst innocent bloude thou woldest kyll dauid without cause herkened saul vnto voice ionathas sware truly lorde lyueth shal dye ionathas called dauid tolde wordes brought saul presence like afore tyme arose battayll agayne dauid wente forth fought agaynst philistynes smote greate slaughter fled neuertheles ye euell sprete lorde came vpon saul sat house iauelynge hande dauid plaied vpon instrument hāde saul though • iauelinge sticke dauid fast wall howbeit wente asyde frō saul iauelynge smote wall dauid fled escaped night notwithstondinge saul sent messaungers dauids house shulde laye wayte kyll mornynge michol dauids wyfe tolde sayde yf thou saue thy soule night thou shalt dye tomorow 〈…〉 michol let downe thorow wyndow wente waye fled escaped mickol toke ymage layed bed laied goates szkinne heade couered clothes saul sent messaūgers fetch dauid sayde sicke neuerthelesse saul sent messaungers se dauid sayde bringe vp bed maye slayne whan messaungers came beholde ymage laye bed goates szkynne heade • sayde saul vnto michol hast thou begyled let myne enemye go mighte escape michol sayde vnto saul sayde vnto let go wyl kyll • dauid fled escaped came samuel vnto ramath tolde yt saul done vnto wente wt samuel abode naioth tolde saul beholde dauid naioth ramath saul sente messaungers fetch dauid sawe company prophetes prophecienge samuel ouersight came sprete god vpon messaungers saul prophecyed also whan tolde saul sent messaungers prophecied likewyse sente messaungers thyrde tyme like maner prophecyed wente himselfe also vnto ramath whan came greate well secho axed sayde samuel dauid tolde beholde naioth ramath wente thither euen vnto naioth ramath ye sprete god came vpon also wēte prophecied till came vnto naioth ramath put clothes prophecied likewise samuel fell downe naked daye nighte • e 10 c came prouerbe saul also amonge prophetes xx chapter dauid fled frō naioth ramath came spake ionathas haue done trespace haue made haue synned ye sighte thy father yt seketh kyll sayde vnto god forbyd thou shalt dye beholde father doth nothinge nether greate ner small sheweth myne eares wherfore shulde father thē hyde fro shal thē sware dauid agayne sayde thy father knoweth well yt haue founde fauoure ye sighte therfore shal thynke ionathas shal knowe lest greue verely truly lorde lyueth truly ye soule lyueth one steppe betwene death ionathas sayde vnto dauid wil euer thy hert desyreth dauid sayde vnto beholde tomorow new mone shulde syt table kynge let hyde selfe therfore felde vnto thirde daye euen yf thy father axe saye dauid prayed yt mighte runne bethleem vnto cite kynred haue yearly sacrifice yf saye good thē stondeth well ye seruaunt yf wroth thou shalt perceaue intendeth euell mercy therfore vpon thy seruaunt 〈…〉 〈◊〉 • 3 ye seruaunt hast thou made couenaunt lorde yf eny trespace slaye thy selfe woldest thou brynge vnto thy father ionathas sayde farre shulde perceaue father intende eny euell agaynst shulde tell dauid sayde shal brynge worde yf thy father geue harde answere ionathas sayde vnto dauid come let v go forth felde wente ye felde ionathas sayde vnto dauid lorde god israel yf perceaue father tomorow thirde daye goeth well dauid sende vnto shewe thine eares let lorde vnto ionathas yf father delyte euell agaynst wil shewe thine eares also let yt go thou mayest departe peace lorde hath bene father yf thou mercy lorde lyue whan dye plucke thy mercy fro house euer whan lorde roteth ye enemy dauid euery one londe let dauid rote ionathas also house lorde requyre hande dauids enemy ionathas proceaded sware vnto dauid loued well loued euen e owne soule ionathas sayde vnto tomorow ye new mone thou shalt axed thou shalt wanted thou wast wonte sit thirde daye come downe soone go ye place thou hydest worckdaye set downe stone asel wyl shute thre arowes yt side though wolde shute marck beholde wil sende boye saye vnto go seke ye arowes yf saye vnto lad lo arowes lye hitherwarde behynde ye fetch come thou peace parell truly lorde lyueth yf saye vnto lad beholde arowes lye yonderwarde go thou thy waye lorde hath let go 1 20 • thou haue spokē together lorde betwene euer dauid hid felde whā new mone came kynge sat downe table eate whan kynge set downe place wonte wall ionathas stode vp abner sat downe besyde saul dauid myssed place saul spake nothinge daye thoughte somwhat happend vnto cleane seconde daye new mone whan dauid myssed place saul saide vnto ionathas sonne wherfore sonne isai come table nether yesterdaye ner daye ionathas answered saul prayed mighte go vnto bethleem sayde let go oure kynred hath sacrifyce cyte brother hath sent himselfe yf haue founde fauoure thy syghte wyll go se brother therfore come kynges table kynge wroth ionathas sayde vnto thou wicked vnthrifte knowe thou hast chosen sonne isai shame thy selfe ye shamefull mother longe ye sonne isai lyueth vpō earth nether thou ner thy kingdome shal prospere sende therfore cause fetched vnto • 86 c childe death ionathas answered father saul sayde vnto wherfore shal dye hath done shot saul iauelynge might smite thē perceaued ionathas father vtterly determed kyll dauid rose vp ye table wrothfull displeasure ate bred yt seconde daye new mone vexed dauid father done soch dishonor morow wente ionathas forth felde tyme appoynted dauid litle boy sayde vnto ye boy runne seke arowes shute whan boy ranne shot arowe ouer whan boy came place whither ionathas shot ye arowe ionathas cryed sayde arowe lyeth yonder warde cryed agayne haist stonde styll boy gathered vp ion • thas arowes brought lorde boy knewe nothinge onely ionathas dauid knewe ye matter ionathas gaue boy wapēs sayde vnto go thy way cary cite whan boy gone dauid arose place towarde south fell vpon face groū de worshipped thre tymes kissed one another wepte together dauid specially ionathas saide vnto dauid go thy waye peace 1 20 soeuer haue sworne spokē together name lorde lorde witnesse betwene betwene sede ye sede euer ionathas gat vp came cite xxi chapter dauid came nobe ye prest ahimelech ahimelech astonnyed whan sawe dauid comminge sayde vnto commest thou alone man dauid sayde vnto 1 14 ahimelech prest kinge hath cōmytted matter vnto sayde let nomā knowe wherfore haue sent haue commaunded haue appoynted seruaūtes mete there1 2 • b • ud 8 b yf thou haue ought vnder thy hande loafe bred fyue geue hande euer thou findest prest answered dauid sayde haue comen bred vnder hande holy bred yf yonge men haue onely refrained selues wemen dauid answered prest sayde vnto wemen kepte thre dayes v whan departed forth yonge men vessel holy waye vnholy neuerthelesse shalbe santifyed daye instrumentes 〈…〉 prest gaue ye holy moch none bred shewbredes taken vp lorde might fresh bredes set therin daye whā toke awaye daye man sp •• red lorde one saul seruauntes named doeg edomite ye mightiest amonge saul hyrdmen dauid sayde vnto ahimelech speare swerde vnder thine hande haue taken swerde weapens kynges matter requyred haist prest sayde swerde goliath philistyne 〈…〉 thou smotest oke valley wrapped cloth behynde ouerbody cote yf thou wylt haue take el none dauid sayde soch another geue dauid gat vp fled saul came achis ye kynge gath achis seruauntes sayde vnto dauid kynge londe sunge daunse sayde 〈…〉 saul hath smytten thousande dauid ten thousande dauid toke wordes hert sore afrayed achis kynge gath altered countenaunce shewed himselfe • bene madd handes stackered towarde dores gate slauerynges ranne downe beerd sayde achis vnto seruauntes beholde ye se man wyt haue ye brought vnto haue fewe madd men ye haue brought hither madd shulde come house xxii chapter dauid wente frō thence fled vnto caue adullam whan brother father house herde came downe thither vnto gathered vnto men trouble det sory hert became heade 〈◊〉 vpon foure hundreth men dauid wente thence towarde mispa londe moabites sayde vnto kynge moabites let father mother go amonge tyll se god wil lefte kynge ye moabites remayned longe dauid castell neuertheles prophet gad sayde vnto dauid abyde castell go yt waye come londe iuda departed dauid came wodd hareth saul herde dauid men come forth whyle saul dwelt gibea vnder groue rama iauelinge hande seruauntes stode sayde saul vnto seruauntes stode heare ye child ieminir shal sonne isai geue lōdes vynyardes vnto make captaynes ouer thousandes ouer hūdreds ye haue conspyred agaynst mā sheweth myne eares 〈…〉 moch sonne also hath made couenaunt sonne isai man amonge letteth sake yt openeth vnto myne eares sonne hath stered vp seruauntes maye laye wayte manifest answered doeg ye edomite stode besyde saul seruauntes sayde 〈…〉 sawe sonne isai came vnto nobe ahimelech ye sonne achitob axed councell lorde gaue fode swerde goliath philistyne sent kynge caused call ahimelech prest sonne achitob father house prestes nobe came kynge saul sayde heare thou sonne achitob saide lorde saul sayde vnto wherfore haue ye cō spyred agaynst thou sonne isai thou hast geuen bred swerde axed councell god stere vp mighte laye awayte manifest ahimelech answered kynge saide amonge thy seruauntes like dauid faithfull hath maried kynges doughter goeth thine obedience honorably taken thine house haue begonne first daye axe councell god farre fro let kinge laie soch seruaū te charge father house thy seruaunt knewe thinges nether small ner greate neuertheles kynge saide ahimelech thou must dye ye death thou thy father house kynge sayde fote men stode turne slaye prestes lorde hande dauid also withstondinge kynges seruauntes wolde laye handes vpon ye prestes lorde slaye saide ye kynge vnto doeg turne slaye prestes1 reg 2 g 2 21 doeg edomite turned slewe prestes daye dyed fyue foure score men wayre ouerbody cote lynnen nob cite prestes smote edge swerde men wemen child sucklynges ox ass shepe neuerthelesse escaped sonne ahimelech sonne achitob whose name abiathar fled dauid tolde saul slayne ye prestes lorde dauid sayde vnto abiathar knewe well daye doeg edomite wolde tell saul giltye soules thy father house abyde thou feare layeth wayte lyfe shall laye wayte thyne also thou shalt preserued xxiii chapter tolde dauid beholde philistynes fight cegila spoyle barnes dauid axed lorde sayde shal go smyte philistynes lorde sayde vnto dauid go thy waye thou shalt smyte philistynes delyuer cegila ye men dauid sayde vnto beholde feare iewry shall go cegila vnto hoost philistynes thē dauid axed lorde agayne lorde answered sayde vp get downe cegila wil delyuer philistynes thy hande dauid wente men vnto cegila foughte agaynst philistynes droue awaye catell smote wt greate slaughter thus dauid delyuered cegila whan abiathar sonne ahimelech fled vnto dauid cegila ba • e downe ouerbody cote thē tolde saul dauid come cegila sayde god hath deliuered hāde shut fast come cite kepte wt gate barres saul caused call people downe ye battaill vnto cegila yt might besege dauid men whan dauid perceaued yt saul intēded euell saide vnto abiathar ye prest brynge hither ouerbody cote dauid sayde lorde god israel thy seruaunt hath herde saul goeth aboute come destroye cite cegila sake shal citysens cegila delyuer ouer handes shal saul come downe thy seruaunt hath herde tell thy seruaunt lorde god israel lorde saide shal come downe dauid sayde shall citysens cegila delyuer men saul handes lorde sayde yee thē dauid gat vp mē vpon sixe hundreth walked whither coulde whan tolde saul dauid escaped cegila let iourney stonde dauid remayned wildernes castell abode vpon mount wildernes siph saul soughte longe lyued neuertheles god gaue handes dauid sawe saul gone forth seke life dauid wildernes siph wodd ionathas sonne saul gat vp wēte vnto dauid wod strengthed hande god sayde vnto feare father saul hande shal finde ye thou shalt kynge ouer israel nexte vnto yt father knoweth right well 1 18 20 b made couenaunt together lorde dauid remayned wodd ionathas wente home agayne par 2 c siphites wente vp saul vnto gibeath sayde dauid hyd v castell ye wodd vpon moūt hachila lyeth righte hande wildernesse let kynge come downe therfore acordinge desyre hert wyll delyuer kynges hande sayde saul blessed ye lorde ye haue pytie vpon go youre waye therfore sure ye maye knowe se place fete haue bene hath sene tolde full sotiltye loke well spye place hydeth come agayne whan ye sure go yf londe wyl enquere amonge thousandes iud • gat vp wente waye vnto siph saul dauid men wyldernes maō euen felde righte hande wildernes whan saul wente thither men seke tolde dauid gat downe rocke abode wildernesse mahon whan saul herde folowed dauid wildernesse mahon saul men wente one syde hyll dauid wt men ye syde ye hill whan dauid made haist escape saul saul men compased aboute dauid men might take thē 〈…〉 neuertheles came messaūger vnto saul sayde make haist come philistynes fallē londe thē saul turned chacynge dauid wente agaynst philstynes therfore ye place called 〈…〉 sela mahelkoth dauid wente vp thence abode castell en gaddi xxiiii chapter whan saul came agayne philistine tolde beholde dauid wyldernes engaddi saul toke thre thousande chosen men israel wente seke dauid men vpon stony rockes wylde goates whan came shepe foldes ye waye caue saul wente 〈…〉 couer fete dauid men sat behinde within caue sayde dauids men vnto lo daye wherof lorde thy god hath sayde vnto beholde wyll delyuer thyne enemye thy hande thou mayest wt pleaseth dauid stode vp cut typpe saul garment quyetly neuertheles smote afterwarde hert cut typpe saul garment sayde vnto men lorde let farre fro shulde laye hande vpō lorde lordes anoyntd ye anoynted lorde dauid withelde seruaūtes wordes suffred thē ryse vp agaynst saul whan saul gat vp caue goinge waye dauid rose vp also wente caue cried behynde saul sayde lorde kynge saul loked behynde dauid bowed downe face earth worshipped sayde vnto saul herkenest thou vnto wordes men saye dauid seketh thy mysfortune beholde thine eye se daye lorde gaue hande caue counceled slaye neuertheles thou wast fauoured sayde wil laye hande vpon lorde lordes anoynted beholde father typpe thy garment hande wolde slaye whan cut typpe thy garment knowe se yt euell ner trespace hande nether haue offended thou folowest soule take awaye lorde shal iudge betwene auenge hāde shal vpon acordinge sayde olde prouerbe vngodlynes commeth vngodly hande shal vpon persecutest thou kynge israel persecutest thou deed dogg flee lorde iudge geue sentence betwene cōsidre defende cause delyuer thy hande whan dauid spoken wordes vnto saul saul saide 〈◊〉 26 c thy voyce sonne dauid saul lifte vp voyce wepte saide vnto dauid thou art righteous thou hast recompēsed good haue rewarded euell daye hast thou shewed thou hast done good moch ye lorde hath delyuered thy hande thou neuertheles hast slaine yf fynde enemye wyllet go good waye lorde rewarde good yt thou hast done vnto daye beholde knowe thou shalt kynge kyngdome israel stondeth thy hande sweare therfore vnto lorde yt thou shalt rote sede nether destroie name father house dauid sware vnto saul wente saul home dauid gat vp men vnto castell xxv chapter samuel dyed israel gathered selues together mourned buried house ramath dauid rose wente downe wyldernesse paran man maon possession carmel man greate power thre thousande shepe thousande goates fortuned clypped shepe carmel name nabal wyues name abigail woman good vnderstondinge bewtyfull face man harde wicked doynges one caleb whan dauid herde wyldernes yt nabal clypped shepe sent ten yonge men saide vnto go vp vnto carmel whan ye come nabal salute frendly behalfe saye good lucke peace wt thine house yt thou hast haue herde saye thou hast shepe clyppers ye shepherdes thou hast haue bene v haue done dishonoure wāted nothinge nombre longe carmel axe thy yonge men shal tell let thy yonge men fynde fauoure ye sighte come good daye geue thy seruauntes thy sonne dauid thy hande fyndeth whā dauids yonge men came spake wordes dauids behalfe vnto nabal lefte nabal answered dauids seruauntes sayde yt dauid sonne isai many seruauntes yt runne awaye master shulde take bred water flesh haue slayne clyppers geue vnto mē knowe whence thē dauids yonge mē turned waye agayne whan came agayne vnto tolde wordes thē sayde dauid vnto men euery man gyrde swerde aboute euery one gyrde swerde aboute dauid gyrde swerde aboute also wē te vp vpon foure hundreth men two hundreth remayned wt stuffe neuertheles abigail nabals wife tolde one hir yonge men sayde beholde dauid sent messaungers wyldernes blesse oure lorde notwithstondinge fearce vpō yet haue bene profitable men vnto v haue done v dishonoure wanted none nombre lōge walked whan felde haue bene oure wall daye nighte longe kepte shepe take hede therfore loke well thou doest surely mysfortune hande agaynst oure lorde agaynst house man belial man darre saye eny thinge abigail made haist toke two hundred loaues bred two botels wyne fyue shepe ready dighte fyue measure firmentye hundreth frayles rasens two hundreth frayles fygges layed vpō ass sayde hir yonge men go ye youre waye beholde wyl come tolde nabal hir housbāde nothinge therof rode vpō asse wente downe shadowe ye hill beholde dauid mē met hir downe came vpon dauid sayde wel man ye wyldernes haue kepte naughte wanted nothinge rewardeth euell good god yet vnto enemy dauid yf vntyll tomorow mornynge leaue man hath moch one maketh water agaynst ye wall whan abigail sawe dauid lighte downe asse haist fell vpō hir face dauid worshiped grounde fell fete sayde oh lorde let trespace myne let thy handmayde speake thine eares heare wordes thy handmayden let lorde set hert agaynst nabal man belial foole acordinge name called name foole foolishnes thy handmayde sawe lordes yonge men thou dyddest sende lorde truly lorde lyueth truly thy soule lyueth lorde hath kepte backe yt thou shuldest come agaynst bloude hath delyuered thine hande thine enemyes nabal wolde lorde euell ye blessynge yt thy handmayde hath brought lorde take geue vnto yonge men walke vnder lorde sure house shal ye lorde make lorde fighteth fighte lorde euell shall founde thy life longe yf eny man ryse vp persecute yt laye wayte thy soule shal soule lorde bounde bundell ye lyuynge euen lorde thy god ye soule thine enemy shalbe turned backe wt slynge whan lorde therfore doth good lorde hath promysed commaundeth yt duke ouer israel shal stomblinge blocke ner occasiion fallynge vnto lordes hert thou hast shed bloude without cause auenged thy selfe shal ye lorde good vnto lorde thou shalt thynke vpon thy hand mayden saide dauid vnto abigail blessed lorde god israel hath sent mete daye blessed thy speach blessed thou hast kepte backe daye come agaynst bloude auenge myne awne hande verely truly lorde god israel lyueth hath hyndred shulde euell yf thou haddest met haist nabal shulde haue lefte vntyll ye lighte mornynge moch one maketh water agaynst wall dauid toke hir hāde broughte sayde vnto go vp peace vnto ye house beholde haue herkened vnto ye voyce accepted thy personne whan abigail came nabal beholde prepared feast house like kynges feast hert mery dronken tolde nothinge nether small ner greate vntyll ye cleare mornynge whan daye wyne come nabal wife tolde thinges hert deed body became euen stone ouer ten dayes lorde smote yt dyed whan dauid herde nabal deed sayde blessed ye lorde hath auenged rebuke nabal preserued seruaunt euell lorde hath rewarded nabal euell vpon heade dauid sent caused talke abigail yt mighte take wife whan dauids seruauntes came abigail vnto carmel spake vnto saide dauid hath sent v vnto maye take ye wife rose vp worshipped vpon hir face vnto earth sayde beholde thy handmayde maie seruyce vnto seruauntes lorde waszshe fete abigail made haist gat vp rode vpō asse fyue maydens vnder wente dauids messaungers became wife dauid toke ahinoam iesrael also became wyues saul gaue michol doughter wife dauid vnto phalti ye sonne lais gallim xxvi chapter siph came saul vnto gibeath sayde 〈◊〉 • 5 dauid hyd vpō hill hachila lyeth ouer agaynst wyldernesse saul gat vp wente downe wildernes siph thre thousande chosen men israel seke dauid wildernes siph pitched vpon hill hachila lyeth waye wildernes dauid remayned wyldernes whan sawe saul came wildernes sent spyes knewe suertie come dede dauid gat vp came place saul pitched tēt sawe place saul laye chefe captayne 〈◊〉 14 g abner ye sonne ner saul laye tent hoost aboute answered dauid sayde vnto ahimelech hethite abisai sonne ieru ia ye brother ioab wil go downe wt saul hoost abisai sayde wil go downe dauid abisai came people night season beholde saul laye slepte tent speare stacke ye grounde heade abner people laye rounde aboute thē sayde abisai vnto dauid god hath closed thine enemye thyne hande daye therfore thrust thorow speare euen grounde yt shall haue ynough neuertheles dauid sayde vnto abisai destroye wil laye hande vpon anoynted ye lorde remayne vngiltye dauid sayde morouer truly lorde lyueth yf ye lorde selfe smyte excepte tyme come dye go battayll perishe lorde let farre fro shulde laye hande lordes anoynted take ye speare therfore heade cuppe water let v go dauid toke ye speare cuppe water saul heade wente waye man yt sawe ner perceaued nether awaked slepte euery one depe slepe fallen vpon lorde whan dauid come ouer ye syde stode vpon toppe mount farre wyde space betwene cried vpon ye people vpō abner sonne ner sayde hearest thou abner abner answered sayde art thou cryest diseasest kynge dauid sayde vnto abner art thou man soch one thou israel hast thou kepte thy lorde ye kynge one ye people come destroye thy lorde ye kynge well thou hast done truly lorde lyueth 1 • 0 ye child death ye haue kepte youre lorde lordes anoynted beholde ye kynges speare cuppe water heade knewe saul voyce dauid saide 12 c 24 • thy voyce sonne dauid dauid sayde voyce lorde kynge sayde morouer doth lorde persecute seruaunt haue done euell hande yet let lorde kynge heare wordes seruaunt yf ye lorde prouoke let smelled meat offerynge yf childrē men cursed lorde haue thrust daye shulde dwell lordes inheritaunce saye go yt waye serue goddes fall bloude vpon earth face lorde kynge israel gone forth seke flee partriche folowed vpō mountaynes saul sayde haue synned come agayne dauid sonne wil nomore hurte soule hath bene deare ye sighte daye beholde haue done foolishly vnwysely dauid answered sayde beholde kynges speare let one yonge men come ouer fetch lorde shal rewarde euery one acordinge righteousnes faith ye lorde delyuered yt daye hande neuertheles wolde laie hande vpō lordes anoynted ye soule hath bene greatly reputed sighte daye let ye lorde repute soule sighte delyuer trouble saul saide vnto dauid blessed thou dauid sonne thou shalt able dauid wente waye saul turned agayne vnto place xxvii chapter dauid thoughte hert one dayes shal fall handes saul better get waye ye londe ye philistynes saul maye leaue sekynge coastes israel shall escape handes gat vp wente ouer sixe hundreth men vnto achis sonne maoch kynge gath dauid remayned achis gath mē euery one housholde dauid two wyues ahinoam iesraelitisse abigail nabals wife carmel whan worde came saul dauid fled vnto gath soughte nomore dauid sayde vnto achis yf haue founde grace thy sighte let geuen place one city londe maye dwell therin wherfore shulde thy seruaunt dwell kynges cite achis gaue siclag daye therfore belongeth siclag kynges iuda vnto daye tyme dauid dwelt londe philistynes foure monethes dauid wente vp men fell londe gessurites girsites 15 b amalechites inhabiters londe olde thou commest sur vnto lōde egipte whā dauid smote ye londe • eu 20 c let nether man ner woman lyue toke shepe ox ass camel rayment returned came achis whan achis spake whither fell ye daye dauid sayde towarde south parte iuda towarde ye south parte ierahmielites towarde south parte kenites dauid let nether man ner woman come lyuynge vnto geth thoughte mighte peraduē ture speake reporte agaynst v thus dyd dauid maner longe dwelt ye londe philistynes therfore achis gaue credence vnto dauid thoughte hath made selfe stynke people israel therfore shal seruaunt euer xxviii chapter fortuned ye tyme philistynes gathered hoost together battayll go agaynst israel achis sayde vnto dauid thou shalt knowe thou thy men shal go forth hoost dauid sayde vnto achis well thou shalt se thy seruaūt shal achis saide vnto dauid therfore wyll ordene keper heade longe lyue 〈…〉 samuel deed ye people mourned buried cite ramath 〈…〉 saul dryuen soythsayers expounder token ye londe whan philistynes gathered selues together came pitched tentes sunem saul gathered people together pitched gilboa whan saul sawe hoost philistynes afrayed hert discoraged axed councell lorde ye lorde gaue answere nether dreames ner 〈…〉 lighte ner prophetes thē sayde saul vnto seruauntes seke womā hath sprete soythsayēge maye go vnto axe seruauntes sayde vnto beholde endor woman hath sprete soythsayenge saul chaunged clothes put wente waye two men came nighte vnto woman sayde prophecye vnto pray thorow sprete soythsayenge brynge vp shal name vnto womā saide vnto beholde thou knowest saul hath done hath roted soythsayers witch londe wherfore wilt thou brynge soule ye nett maye slayne saul sware vnto ye lorde sayde truly lorde lyueth shall harme happen vnto sayde ye woman shal brynge vp vnto sayde brynge vp samuel whan ye woman sawe samuel cryed loude sayde vnto saul wherfore hast thou begyled thou art saul kynge sayde vnto feare seist thou woman sayde vnto saul se goddes cōmynge vp ye earth sayde shapened sayde commeth vp olde man clothed longe garment perceaued saul samuel bowed selfe downe wt face grounde worshiped samuel saide vnto saul hast thou disquyeted cause broughte vp▪ saul sayde sore troubled philistynes fighte god departed fro geueth answere nether prophetes ner dreames therfore haue called yt thou mightest shewe shal samuel sayde wilt thou axe seynge lorde departed become thine enemye lorde shal vnto euen spake 〈◊〉 • 5 f shall plucke kyngdome thy hande geue vnto dauid thy neghboure thou hast herkened vnto voyce lorde ner perfourmed displeasure wrath agaynst amalek therfore hath lorde done vnto morouer lorde shal delyuer israel also handes philistynes 〈◊〉 • 1 tomorow shalt thou thy sonnes hoost israel shal lorde delyuer handes philistynes fell saul immediatly vnto earth coulde stonde sore afrayed wordes samuel nomore strength eaten bred daye night woman wente saul sawe sore vexed sayde vnto beholde thy handmayde hath herkened vnto thy voyce haue put soule hande haue herkened vnto ye wordes thou spakest vnto therfore folowe thou also voyce thy handmayde wil set morsell bred eate thou mayest come thy strength go ye waye refused sayde wil eate seruauntes woman cōpelled herkened vnto voyce rose vp ye grounde sat vpon bed woman fat calfe home made haist kylled toke meell dyd kneet baked swete cake broughte forth saul seruauntes whan eaten stode vp wēte waye yt nighte xxix chapter philistynes gathered army together aphek israel pitched iesrael prynces philistynes wēte forth hundred thousandes dauid men wēte behynde achis thē sayde prynces philistynes shal hebrues achis saide vnto thē dauid ye seruaunt saul kynge israel hath bene yeares dayes haue founde euell sence tyme fell vnto daye 〈◊〉 13 c neuertheles prynces ye philistynes wroth sayde vnto let man turne backe agayne abyde place 1 27▪ thou hast appoynted go downe v ye batayll become oure aduersary ye felde wherin coulde better lorde pleasure thē heades men dauid sunge daunce 1 18 21 saul hath smyttē thousande dauid ten thousande achis called dauid sayde vnto truly lorde lyueth take honest man thy goynge ingoynge ye hoost pleaseth well euell haue marked sence ye tyme thou camest vnto daye thou pleasest prynces returne therfore go ye waye peace thou euell sighte prynces ye philistynes dauid sayde haue done hast thou marked thy seruaunt sence ye tyme haue bene ye presence vnto daye shulde come fighte agaynst enemy lorde kynge achis answered sayde vnto dauid knowe well thou pleasest myne eye euē angell god prynces ye philistynes haue sayde let go vp v vnto batayll get vp therfore tomorow tymes ye lordes seruauntes come whan ye haue gotten vp early mornynge whan lighte go yor waye dauid men gat vp early go waye mornynge come agayne londe philistynes philistynes wente vp towarde iesrael xxx chapter whan dauid came siclag thirde daie men amalechites fallē ye south parte siclag smytten siclag burned fyre caried awaye wemē small greate neuertheles slayne man dryuen thē thence goynge waye whan dauid men came cite sawe brent wt fyre wyues sonnes doughters led awaye captyue dauid people lefte vp voyce wepte longe tyll coulde wepe nomore dauids two wyues also caried awaye captyue ahinoam ye iesraelitisse abigail nabals wife carmel dauid soroufull people wolde haue stoned ye soule people greate heuynes euery one ouer sonnes doughters neuertheles dauid strengthed selfe lorde god sayde vnto abiathar ye prest sonne ahimelech • 23 b bringe hither ouerbody cote whan abiathar broughte ouerbody cote vnto dauid dauid axed lorde sayde shal folowe vpon men warre shal ouertake sayde yee folowe vpō thou shalt ouertake shalt rescue pray wente dauid waye sixe hūdreth men whan came ryuer besor stode styll dauid foure hundreth men folowed two hūdreth men stode styll bene slowe go ouer ryuer besor founde man egipte vpon felde broughte vnto dauid •• ou 25 gaue bred eate water drynke gaue quantite fygges two quantity rasyns whan eaten sprete came againe thre dayes thre nightes eatē bred dronke water dauid sayde vnto whose art thou whence art thou sayde childe egipte amalechites seruaunt master hath forsaken sicke thre dayes goo fell towarde ye south syde chrethus vpon iuda towarde ye south parte caleb haue burned siclag fyre dauid sayde vnto wilt thou bringe downe men warre sayde • sweare vnto god yt thou shalt slaye ner delyuer master hā de wil brynge downe mē warre broughte thē downe beholde scatred vpon ye grounde eatinge drynkynge kepynge holy daye makinge mery chere greate spoyles taken londe philistynes iuda dauid smote ye morow tyll euen agaynst nexte daye escaped none excepte foure hundreth yonge men rode vpon camel fled dauid rescued amalechites taken two wyues myssed nothinge nether small ner greate nether sonnes ner doughters ner spoyles euer taken dauid broughte agayne dauid toke shepe oxē droue ye catell sayde dauids spoyle whan dauid came two hundreth men bene slowe folowe dauid abode ryuer besor wente forth mete dauid people yt dauid came people saluted frendly answered soch men euell belials men amonge gone dauid sayde seynge wente wt v shal haue none spoyles haue rescued let euery mā toke wife child goynge sayde dauid ye shall brother ye lorde hath geuen v hath preserued v delyuered men warre come agaynst v oure hādes shulde cō sente vnto herin like porcion wente downe battayll shal ye porcion also bode wt stuffe shalbe deuyded lyke tyme forth hath bene ordinaunce lawe israel vnto daye whan dauid came siclag sent spoyle vnto elder iuda neghbours sayde beholde haue ye blessynge spoyle enemy lorde namely vnto bethel vnto ramath south vnto iathir vnto aroer vnto siphamoth vnto eschemoa vnto rachal vnto city ierahmielites vnto city kenites vnto horma vnto thē borasan vnto thē atach vnto hebron vnto place dauid walked wt men xxxi chapter bvt ye 〈…〉 philistynes foughte israel men israel fled philistynes fell downe smytten vpon mount gilboa philistynes preassed vpon saul sonnes slewe ionathas abinadab malchisua sonnes saul battayll sore agaynst saul archer fell vpon bowes sore wounded archer sayde saul vnto wapēbearer▪ drawe thy swerde thrust thorow vncircumcised come slaie make laughinge stocke neuertheles wapenbearer wolde sore afrayed toke saul ye swerde fell therin whan wapenbearer sawe saul deed fell also vpon swerde dyed thus dyed saul thre sonnes wapenbearer men together daye whan ye men israel beyonde valley beyonde iordane sawe yt men israel fled saul sonnes deed lefte ye city fled also came philistynes dwelt therin 〈◊〉 11 b nexte daye came philistynes spoyle ye slayne founde saul thre sonnes lyenge vpon mount gilboa smote heade toke harnesse sent lande philistynes rounde aboute shewe house idol amonge people layed harnesse ye house astaroth body hanged vp vpō wall bethsan whan iabes gilead herde philistynes done vnto saul gat vp many men armes wente nighte toke ye body saul body sonnes ye wall bethsan broughte thē iabes 〈…〉 brent toke bone buried vnder ye tre iabes fasted seuē dayes ende first boke kynges otherwyse called first boke samuel seconde boke kynges otherwyse called seconde boke samuel boke conteyneth chap death saul shewed vnto dauid mourneth chap ii dauid anoynted kynge men iuda abner goeth aboute make iszboseth saul sonne kynge israel chap iii discorde betwixte house dauid saul abner lyeth saul concubyne reproued therfore falleth vnto dauid ioab stycketh abner chap iiii iszboseth stick • e traitour • dauid putteth death chap v dauid taketh kyngdome ouercommeth philistynes eu • ry syde chap vi dauid causeth arke lorde caried abinadabs house house obed edō v • punyshed touchinge dauid carieth cite chap vii dauid forbyddē buylde house vnto lorde vnto geueth thankes chap viii dauid subdueth philistynes 〈◊〉 aboute chap ix dauid sheweth fauoure saul kinred doth thē good ionathas sake chap x dauid sendeth messaungers kynge ammonite putteth thē shame wherfore dauid goeth agaynst wynneth victory two tymes chap xi dauid cōmitteth aduoutry bethseba causeth hir huszbāde slayne chap xii prophet nathan rebuketh dauid knowlegeth synne requyreth mercy sonne dyeth chap xiii ammon defyleth thamar therfore absalom slayeth chap xiiii ioab reconcyleth absalom vnto father suttyltie absalom sendeth ioab cōmeth burneth vp corne chap xv absalō seketh father kyngdome dauid flyeth men chap xvi dauid geueth siba good mephiboseth semei curseth blasphemeth dauid absalom lyeth father concubynes chap xvii lorde turneth councell achitophel councell chusa • goeth forth chap xviii dauids hoost wynneth victory absalom slayne dauid father soroufull chap xix ioab rebuketh kinge mournynge israel flyeth tētes iuda cleueth vnto dauid semei mephiboseth optayne fauoure barsillai sheweth kynge greate fendshippe chap xx seba maketh vproure deuydeth israel dauid ioab stycketh amasa ioab foloweth vpon seba laieth sege vnto abela chap xxi greate honger saul childrē geuē vnto gibeonites dauid fighteth agaynst philistynes chap xxii dauid prayseth lorde songe thankesgeuynge delyuered hande saul enemy chap xxiii last wordes dauid name worthy rehearsed chap xxiiii dauid nōbreth people displeaseth lorde plageth londe pestilence first chapter ye death saul whan dauid come agayne slaughter ye amalechites 30 remayned two dayes siclag beholde thirde daye came man saul hoost clothes rente earth vpon heade whan came vnto dauid fell downe grounde worshipped dauid sayde vnto whence commest thou sayde vnto hoost israel fled dauid sayde vnto tell matter sayde people fled battayll many people fallen yee saul also deed sonne ionathas dauid sayde vnto yonge mā brought worde knowest thou saul ionathas sonne deed yonge man yt tolde sayde came chaunce vnto mount gelboa beholde saul leaned vpon speare charettes horsmē folowed harde turned aboute sawe called sayde sayde vnto art thou sayde vnto amalechite saide vnto come kyll anguysh hath gotten holde life yet whole within stepte slewe knowe well coulde lyue fall toke crowne heade armelet frō arme haue broughte vnto ye lorde toke dauid holde clothes1 reg 3 f • nd 13 f rente dyd mē mourned wepte fasted vntyll euen ouer saul ionathas sonne ouer people lorde ouer house israel fallen thorow swerde dauid sayde yonge man broughte worde art thou sayde ye sonne straunger amalechite dauid sayde happeneth thou wast afrayed laye thine hā de vpon lordes anointed destroye dauid sayde vnto one yonge men come hither slaye smote dyed sayde dauid vnto thy bloude vpon thyne owne heade mat 1 • luc 19 b thy mouth hath spoken thyselfe sayde haue slayne anoynted lorde dauid mourned lamentacion ouer saul ionathas sonne commaunded teach childrē iuda bowe beholde wrytten boke righteous eldest israel slayne vpon heigth worthy fallē 〈…〉 tell gath speake ye stretes ascalon lest doughters ye philistynes reioyse lest doughters ye vncircumcysed tryumphe ye mountaynes gelboa nether dew ner rayne come vpō nether lōde wherof commeth heue offerynges ye shylde worthy smytten downe shylde saul though bene anoynted oyle 〈…〉 bowe ionathas fayled 〈…〉 swerde saul came agayne voyde bloude slayne frō fat giauntes saul ionathas louely pleasaūt lyfe deeth parted asunder lighter aegles stronger lyon ye doughters israel wepe ouer saul clothed yow purple pleasure decked iewels golde youre garmentes worthy fallen battayll ionathas slayne vpon ye heigth sory brother ionathas thou hast bene louely vnto thy loue hath bene speciall vnto loue wemen worthy falle • ye weapens destroyed ii chapter actes dauid 〈…〉 axed lorde sayde shall go vp one city iuda lorde sayde vnto go vp dauid sayde whither sayde vnto hebron dauid wente thither two wyues ahinoam iesraelitisse abigail nabals wyfe carmel dauid broughte vp men also euery one housholde dwelt city hebron ye men iuda came anointed kynge ouer house iuda whā tolde dauid 〈…〉 iabes gilead buried saul sent messaungers vnto sayenge blessed ye lorde ye haue done soch mercy vpon youre lorde saul haue buried lorde therfore shewe mercy faithfulnes vpon ye haue done also wyll good let youre hāde therfore comforted ye stronge though saul youre lorde deed yet hath house iuda chosen kynge ouer abner sonne ner saul chefe captayne toke iszboseth sonne saul broughte thorow hoost made kynge ouer gilead assuri iesrael ephraim ben iamin ouer israel iszboseth sonne saul fourtye yeare olde whan made kynge israel raigned two yeares house iuda helde dauid 〈…〉 tyme yt dauid kynge hebron ouer house iuda seuen yeare sixe monethes longe abner sonne ner wēte forth seruauntes iszboseth sonne saul ye hoost vnto gibeon ioab sonne zeru ia wēte forth dauids seruauntes met together pole gibeon laye one syde pole syde abner sayde vnto ioab let yonge mē get vp playe v ioab sayde let aryse gat vp wente nombre twolue ben iamin iszboseth saul sonnes syde twolue dauids seruauntes euery one gat another heade thrust swerde syde fell together therfore place called helkath hazurim felde worthy gibeon arose sore harde battayll daye abner men israel put flighte dauids seruauntes thre sonnes zeru ia ioab abisai asahel asahel lighte fete roo ye felde folowed abner turned asyde nether righte hande ner ye lefte abner abner turned aboute sayde art thou asahel sayde yee abner sayde vnto go thy waye ether righte hande lefte get one ye yonge men take harnesse neuertheles wolde leaue frō sayde abner agayne asahel get awaye fro wilt thou smyte grounde darre lifte vp face ye brother ioab howbeit wolde go waye abner thrust speare bely speare wēte behynde fell dyed came place asahel laye deed stode styll ioab abisai folowed vpon abner till sonne wente downe whan came ye hyll amma lieth giah ye waye wildernes gibeon child ben iamin gathered selues together behynde abner grewe multitude stode vpon toppe hyll abner called vnto ioab sayde shal swerde thē deuoure without ende knowest thou wyll bytter last longe wil thou saie vnto people leaue brethrē ioab sayde truly god lyueth yf thou haddest sayde thus daye morninge people ceassed euery one brother ioab blewe trompet people stode still folowed nomore vpon israel nether foughte eny abner men wente night ouer playne felde passed ouer iordane walked thorow bithron came tentes ioab turned abner gathered ye people together dauids seruauntes myssed nynetene men asahel dauids seruaū te smytten amonge ben iamin men abner thre hundreth threscore men deed toke vp asahel buried father graue bethleem ioab men wēte nighte breake daie came vnto hebron iii chapter longe battayll betwene house saul house dauid dauid wente increased house saul wente mynished vnto dauid child borne hebron firstborne sonne ammon ahinoam iesraelitisse seconde chileab abigail wyfe nabal carmel thirde absalon sonne maacha doughter thalmai kynge gessur fourth adonia sonne hagith fyfth saphatia sonne abital ye sixte iethream egla dauids wife borne vnto dauid hebron whan warre betwene house saul house dauid abner strengthed saul house saul concubyne whose name rispa doughter aia iszboseth sayde vnto abner wherfore liest thou father concubyne abner wroth wordes iszboseth sayde dogges heade agaynst iuda mercy vnto house saul thy father vnto brother kynsfolkes haue delyuered ye hande dauid thou layest trespace charge daye woman sake god abner yf • reg •• f • nd 16 c lorde hath sworne vnto dauid kyngdome maye taken frō house saul ye seate dauid set vp ouer israel iuda dan vnto berseba coulde answere one worde agayne feared abner sent messaungers vnto dauid sayenge whose londe sayde make thy couenaunt beholde hande shall turne israel vnto sayde wel wyll make couenaunt one thynge desyre thou se face excepte thou brynge first michol saul doughter whan thou commest se face dauid sent messaungers also vnto iszboseth sonne saul sayenge • 1 • g geue wyfe michol maried hundreth foreszkinnes philistynes iszboseth sent caused take man 1 25 g palthiel sonne lais hir huszbande wente wepte behynde vnto bahurim sayde abner vnto turne backe agayne go thy waye turned backe agayne abner talked elder israel sayde youre myndes haue bene set afore tyme longe goo vpon dauid mighte kynge ouer therfore ye lorde hath sayde dauid wil delyuer people israel hā de dauid seruaunt hande philistynes hande enemy abner spake also eares ben iamin wente speake eares dauid hebron israel whole house ben iamin contente withall whan abner came hebron vnto dauid twēty men dauid made feast abner sayde vnto dauid wyll get vp go gather israel together lorde kynge maye make couenaunt thou mayest kynge thy soules desyre dauid let abner go peace beholde dauid seruaūtes 〈◊〉 came men warre brought • greate spoyle abner wa • dauid hebron sent gone waye peace whan ioab hoost come tolde abner sonne ner came kynge sent frō gone waye peace wente ioab kynge sayde hast thou done beholde abner came hast thou sent gone waye knowest thou abner sonne ner came disceaue th • mighte knowe thy outgoynge ingoynge spie thou doest whan ioab wente dauid sent messaūgers abner fetch agayne boharsira dauid knew • therof whan abner came agayne vnto hebron ioab brought ye middes vnder ye gate talke wt secretly thrust ye bely dyed brother asahels bloude whan dauid knewe therafter sayde vngiltye kyngdodome euer lorde concernynge bloude abner ye sonne ner vpon heade ioab fall vpon father house house ioab ceasse one haue renninge yssue leprosy go vpon staffe fall thorow swerde haue scarnesse bred thus ioab brother abi • • slewe abner 〈…〉 slayne brother asahel battaill gibeon dauid sayde vnto ioab ye people yt rente youre clothes gyrde sack cloth aboute make lamentacion abner kynge wente bere whan buryed abner hebron kynge lifte vp voyce wepte besyde abners graue people wepte also kynge mourned abner sayde abner deed foole dyeth thy handes bounde thy fete vexed fetter thou art fallen man falleth wicked vnthriftes • people bewayled yet whan people came eate dauid whyle yet hye daye dauid sware sayde god vnto yf taist ether bred oughte el afore sōne go downe ye people knewe pleased well ye kynge dyd sighte people people israel perceaued daye came kynge abner sonne ner slayne kynge sayde vnto seruauntes knowe ye daye prynce greate man fallen israel yet tender anoynted kynge men child zeru ia harde lorde recompence doth euell acordinge wickednes iiii chapter whan saul sonne herde yt abner deed hebron hādes feble israell sory two men captaynes ouer soudyers vnder sonne saul one called baena rehob sonnes rimon ye berothite childrē ben iamin beroth coūted also ben iamin berothites fled vnto gethaim straūgers vnto daye ionathas also sonne saul sonne lame fete fyue yeare olde whan rumoure saul ionathas came iesrael norse toke fled whyle made haist fled fell lame name mephiboseth wente sonnes rimon ye berothite rehob baena came house iszboseth heate daye laye vpō bed noone daie came house fetch wheate thrust bely gat awaye whā came ye house laye vpō bed chamber stickte death smote heade toke heade departed waye playne felde nighte broughte heade isboseth dauid vnto hebron sayde vnto kynge beholde heade iszboseth sonne saul thine enemye layed wayte thy soule daye hath lorde auenged lorde kynge saul sede answered dauid vnto rehob baena brother ye sonnes rimon ye berothite sayde truly lorde lyueth hath deliuered soule trouble 〈◊〉 1 c toke yt brought worde sayde saul deed thoughte bene good messaunger siclag put death vnto shulde haue geuen rewarde message vngodly personnes haue slayne righteous man owne house vpon bed yee shulde requyre bloude youre handes take awaye ye earth dauid commaunded yonge men slewe smote handes fete hanged vp ye pole hebron heade iszboseth toke buried • reg • f abners graue hebron v chapter trybes israel came dauid vnto hebron sayde 1 par 1 • • beholde thy bone thy flesh afore tyme whā saul kynge ouer v thou leddest israel lorde hath sayde thou shalt kepe people israel shalt duke ouer israel elder israel came ye kynge vnto hebron kynge dauid made couenaunt hebron ye lorde anoynted dauid kynge ouer israel thyrtie yeare olde dauid whan made kynge reigned fortye yeares • • • hebron raigned seuē yeares sixe monethes ouer iuda ierusalem reigned thre thirtie yeares ouer israel iuda kynge wente men ierusalem agaynst iebusites dwelt londe neuertheles sayde vnto dauid thou shalt come hither blynde lame shal dryue yt awaie thoughte planely dauid shulde come howbeit dauid wanne castell sion cite dauid sayde dauid daye1 pa •• • euer sobab nathan salomon iebehar elisua nepheg iaphia elisama eliada eliphalet whan philistine herde dauid anoynted kinge ouer israel wē te vp seke dauid whan dauid perceaued wēte downe castell philistynas came scatered selues beneth valley rephaim • 23 • 2 5 dauid axed lorde sayde shal go vp agaynst philistynes wylt thou delyuer hande lorde sayde vnto dauid go vp wyll delyuer philistynes thy hande dauid came vnto baal prazim smote thē sayde lorde hath deuyded myne enemy euen water parte asunder therfore place called baal prazim lefte ymages dauid men caried thē awaye neuerthelesse philistynes wente vp agayne scatered selues beneth valley rephaim dauid axed lorde lorde sayde thou shalt go vp compase behinde thou mayest vpon ouer agaynst peertrees whan thou hearest vpon toppe peertrees sounde goinge bolde lorde gone forth smyte hoost philistine dauid dyd lorde commaunded smote philistynes geba tyll thou commest vnto gaser vi chapter dauid gathered agayne yonge chosen men
