zebaoth dealte vnto people multitude israel man womā vnto euery one cake bred pece flesh meece potage wente people waye euery one vnto house whan dauid came agayne blesse house michol doughter saul wente forth mete sayde glorious hath kynge israel bene daye hath vncouered himselfe maydēs seruauntes like rascall people discouer selues dauid saide vnto michol wil playe ye lorde hath chosen afore ye father afore house hath commaunded prynce ouer people lorde euen ouer israel yet wyl vyler wyll lowe myne owne sighte maydens wherof thou hast spoken wyll honoured michol doughter saul childe vnto daye hir death vii chapter whan kynge sat house 〈◊〉 18 lorde geuen rest enemy euery syde sayde vnto prophet nathan beholde dwell house cedre arke god dwelleth amonge curtaynes nathan sayde vnto kynge go thy waye euer thou hast thine hert yt lorde wt nighte came ye worde lorde vnto nathan sayde go speake seruaūt dauid thus sayeth ye lorde shalt thou buylde house dwell haue dwelt house sence daye broughte child israel vnto daye haue walked tabernacle habitacion whither euer wente child israel dyd euer speake eny trybes israel commaunded kepe people israel sayde wherfore ye buylde house ceder wodd shalt thou speake vnto seruaunt dauid thus sayeth lorde zebaoth 〈◊〉 16 c toke pasture whan thou wentest behynde shepe yt thou shuldest ye prynce ouer people israel haue bene wt whither euer thou wentest haue roted thine enemy haue made greate name acordinge name greate men vpon earth people israel wyll appoynte place wyll plante maye remayne nomore remoued yt childrē wickednes oppresse nomore like afore sence tyme ordeyned iudges ouer people israel wyll geue rest thine enemy lorde sheweth lorde wyl make house 〈◊〉 5 〈◊〉 8 c 〈◊〉 1 • 1 b whan ye tyme fulfylled yt thou shalt slepe wt thy father wil ye rayse vp thy syde shal come thy body kyngdome wyl stablishe shal buylde house name 〈◊〉 33 c wyll stablyshe ye seate kyngdome euer 〈…〉 wyll father shall sonne 3 11▪ psal 88 • whan doth trespace wyll reproue rodd men plage ye childrē men mercy shal withdrawen frō haue drawē frō saul whō haue takē awaye ye house thy kyngdome shal stablished euer thy seate shal endure fast euermore whan nathan tolde wordes vision vnto dauid kynge dauid came sat downe lorde sayde lorde god house yt thou hast broughte thus farre lorde god hast thou thoughte litle also hast spoken house thy seruaunt yet lōge come lorde god lawe men shall dauid speake vnto thou knowest thy seruaunt lorde god thy wordes sake acordinge ye hert hast thou done greate thinges yt thou mightest shewe thē vnto thy seruaunt therfore art thou greatly magnified lorde god deu 32 • none like god thou acordinge vnto haue herde eares deu 4 people vpon earth thy people israel whose sake god wente delyuer people make selfe name soch greate terrible thinges thy lōde ye people exo 14 • thou hast delyuered vnto thy selfe frō egipte people goddes thy people israel hast thou prepared people vnto thyne owne selfe euer thou lorde art become god stablish ye worde therfore euer lorde god thou hast spokē ouer thy seruaunt ouer house acordinge thou hast sayde shall thy name greate euer shal sayde lorde zebaoth god ouer israel house thy seruaunt dauid shal made sure thou lorde zebaoth thou god israel hast opened eare thy seruaunt sayde wil buylde house therfore hath ye seruaunt founde hert praye prayer vnto deu 32 f lorde god thou thy selfe art god thy wordes shal trueth thou hast spoken soch good ouer thy seruaunt begynne therfore blesse ye seruauntes house maye euer thou lorde god thine awne selfe hast spoken thy blessynge shal thy seruauntes house blessed euer viii chapter fortuned yt dauid smote ye philistynes par 19 discomfited toke brydell bondage philistynes hande nu 24 smote moabites also grounde broughte two partes death let one parte lyue thus moabites subdued vnto dauid yt broughte giftes dauid smote hadad eser also sonne rehob kynge zoba whan wēte fetch power agayne ye water euphrates toke dauid thousande seuen hundreth horsmen twenty thousande fote men lamed charettes saue hundreth kepte behynde siryans came damascon helpe hadad eser kynge zoba dauid smote two twentye thousande men syrian layed people vnto damascus syria thus syria subdued vnto dauid broughte giftes ye lorde helped dauid whither euer wente dauid toke ye shyldes golde hadad esers seruauntes broughte ierusalem bethah berothai ye city hadad eser toke dauid moch brasse • par 19 b whan thoi kynge hemath herde dauid smytten power hadad eser sent sonne ioram vnto dauid salute frendly blesse foughten adad eser smytten thoi warre hadad eser iewels syluer golde brasse kynge dauid halowed also vnto ye lorde syluer golde sanctified vnto lorde heythē subdued siria fro moab childrē ammon philistynes frō amalek spoyle hadad eser ye sonne rehob kynge zoba dauid gat selfe name also whan came • par 19 c smote eightene thousande ye sirians ye salt valley layed people edomea gen 25 c nu 24 edem subdued vnto dauid lorde helped dauid whither euer wente thus dauid kynge ouer israel executed iudgmente righteousnes vnto ye people • 20 ioab ye sonne zeru ia captayne ouer hoost iosaphat sonne ahilud chaunceler zadok sonne achitob ahimelech sonne abiathar prestes seraia scrybe benaia sonne ioiada ouer ye chr • thians plethians sonnes dauid 〈…〉 prestes ix chapter dauid sayde remayneth yet eny man saul house maye mercy vpon ionathas sake seruaunt saul house named 〈…〉 siba called vnto dauid kynge sayde vnto art thou siba sayde yee thy seruaunt kynge sayde yet eny man saul house yt maye mercy god vpon siba sayde vnto kynge 〈…〉 yet sonne ionathas lame fete kynge sayde vnto siba sayde vnto ye kynge beholde l • dober ye house 〈…〉 machir ye sonne ammuel thē sent kynge dauid thither caused fetch lodaber ye house machir sonne ammuel whan mephiboseth sonne ionathas sonne saul came vnto dauid fell vpon face worshiped him▪ dauid sayde mephiboseth sayde thy seruaunt dauid sayde vnto feare wyll mercy vpon thy father ionathas sake wil restore vnto londe thy father saul thou shalt eate bred daylie table worshiped sayde thy seruaunt thou turnest deed dogg kynge called siba ye seruaunt saul sayde vnto yt hath belonged vnto saul house haue geuen thy lordes sonne tyll londe therfore thou thy child seruauntes brynge yt maye bred ye lordes sonne yt maye enioye mephiboseth ye lordes sonne shal eate bred daylie table siba fyftene sonnes twentye seruauntes siba sayde vnto ye kynge acordinge vnto lorde kynge hath commaunded seruaunt shal seruaunt let mephiboseth sayde dauid eate table one kynges owne child mephiboseth yōge sonne whose name micha yt dwelt house siba serued mephiboseth mephiboseth selfe dwelt ierusalem ate daylie kynges table 〈…〉 lame fete x chapter fortuned ye kynge child ammon dyed 〈◊〉 20 sonne hanun kynge steade sayde dauid wyll mercy vpon hanun sonne nahas father dyd mercy vpon sent comforted seruaūtes ouer father death whan dauids seruaūtes came londe child ammon mightie men child ammon sayde vnto hanun lorde thynkest thou honor ye father ye sighte yt dauid hath sent comforter vnto hath sent seruauntes vnto ye thynkest thou spye search cite ouerthrowe toke hanun seruauntes dauid shoue one halue beerdes cut halfe garmētes euen girdell let go whā tolde dauid sent mete men put greate shame kynge caused saye vnto abyde iericho tyll youre beerdes growne come agayne whan childrē ammon sawe stynked sighte dauid sent hyred sirians house rehob sirians zoba euen twentye thousande fote men kynge maecha thousande men istob twolue thousande men whan dauid herde sent ioab hoost ye men warre child ammon wente forth prepared selues ye battayll intraunce gate siryans soba rehob istob maecha alone felde whan ioab sawe battayll set vpō behynde chose best yonge men israel prepared selfe agaynst syrian resydue people put vnder hande brother abisai mighte prepare agaynst childrē ammon sayde yf ye syrian mightie helpe thou yf child ammon mightie shal helpe take good corage vnto let v stronge oure people ye cite oure god neuertheles lorde pleaseth ioab made forth people fighte agaynst syrian fled whan child ammon sawe syrian fled fled also abisai wente cite ioab turned agayne child ammon came ierusalem whan syrian sawe yt smytten israel came together hadad eser sent broughte ye syrian beyonde water conueyed power sobath chefe captayne hadad eser wente thē whan tolde dauid gathered israel together wente ouer iordane came helam syrian prepared selues dauid fighte howbeit syrian fled israel dauid slewe syrian seuē hundreth charettes fortye thousande horsmē sobath chefe captayne smote also dyed whan kynges vnder adad eser sawe smytten israel made peace israel subdued vnto syrian afrayed helpe child ammon eny xi chapter whan ye yeare came aboute tyme ye kynges vse go forth1 par 21 dauid sent ioab seruaūtes israel destroye child ammon laye sege vnto rabba dauid abode ierusalem aboute euētyde fortuned dauid arose restinge place wente vp ye toppe kynges palace ye toppe sawe woman exo 2 susan c waszshinge hir selfe woman fayre bewtye dauid sent caused axe woman sayde bethseba doughter eliam wife v • ia hethite dauid sent messaūgers caused fetch whā come vnto laye neuertheles halowed hir selfe hir vnclennes turned gayne vnto 〈◊〉 house womā childe sent caused tell dauid saye childe dauid sent vnto ioab sayē ge sende vrias ye hethite ioab sent vrias vnto dauid whan vrias came dauid axed yf stode well ioab people battayll dauid sayde vrias go downe thy house wash thy fete whan vrias wente kynges palace kynges gifte folowed vrias layed downe slepe kynges palace gate lordes seruauntes laye wente downe house whan worde came dauid vrias gone downe house dauid sayde vnto camest thou ouer felde wentest thou downe thy house vrias sayde vnto dauid arke israel iuda abyde tentes ioab lorde lordes seruauntes lye ye felde shal go house eate drynke lye wife truly thou lyuest truly thy soule lyueth wyll thinge dauid sayde vnto vria abyde daye tomorow wil let go vrias abode ierusalem daye nexte also dauid called eate drynke made dronken euen wente lye downe slepe vpon couche lordes seruauntes wente downe house morow wrote dauid letter vnto ioab sent vrias maner wrote letter set vrias ye sorest parte ye batayll turne behynde yt maye slayne whā ioab layed sege cite set vrias ye place knewe yt mightiest men • me whan men cite fell foughte agaynst ioab fell certayne ye people dauids seruauntes vrias hethite dyed also sent ioab caused tell ye kynge matter concernynge battayll cōmaunded messaunger sayde whan thou hast tolde ye kynge matter concernynge batayll seist wroth yf kynge saye vnto wherfore came ye nye cite batayll knowe ye vse shute wall iud 9 h smote abimelech sonne ierubaall dyd womā cast pece mylstone vpō wall dyed thebez came ye nye wall shalt thou say • thy seruaunt vrias hethite deed also messaunger wente waye came tolde dauid together wherfore ioab sent messaunger sayde vnto dauid men preuayled v fell vnto v ye felde vpon harde dore ye porte archer shot wall vpon thy seruauntes slewe certayne kynges seruauntes thy seruaunt vrias hethite deed also dauid sayde vnto messaunger thus shalt thou saye vnto ioab let yt vexe swerde consumeth one another go forth battayll cite thou mayest destroye cō forte men whan vrias wife herde vrias deed mourned hir huszbande whā made ende mournynge dauid sent caused fetched vnto palace became wyfe bare sonne neuertheles dede yt dauid dyd displeased lorde xii chapter lorde sent nathan vnto dauid whan came tolde two men one cite one riche poore riche man many shepe ox poore man nothinge saue one litle shepe boughte norished grewe vp child together ate bred dranke cuppe slepte lappe helde doughter whan came straunger vnto riche man spared take awne shepe ox prepare oughte straunger come vnto toke poore man shepe prepared man come vnto thē dauid wroth greate displeasure agaynst man sayde vnto nathan truly lorde lyueth man hath done childe death 〈…〉 shepe also shal make good foure folde hath done soch thinge spared sayde nathan vnto dauid thou art euen man thus sayeth lorde god israel 〈…〉 haue anoynted kynge ouer israel delyuered hande saul haue geven yi lordes house wyues thy lappe house israel iuda haue geuen yf litle wyl yet also wherfore hast thou despysed worde lorde soch euell sighte vrias hethite hast thou slayne swerde wife hast thou taken thy wyfe hast thou slayne ye swerde child ammon therfore shal ye swerde departe thy house ouer thou hast despysed taken wife vrias hithite thy wife thus sayeth lorde beholde 〈…〉 c 〈◊〉 16 wyll rayse vp euell thyne awne house wyll take thy wyues thyne eye wyl geue vnto thy neghboure shall lye thy wyues sonne lighte thou hast done secretly wyl sighte israel sonne lighte sayde dauid vnto nathan 〈◊〉 47 c • 0 haue synned vnto lorde nathan sayde vnto dauid hath lorde also taken awaye thy synne thou shalt dye moch thou thorow dede hast caused enemy lorde blaspheme ye sonne borne vnto shall dye death nathan wente home childe vrias wife bare vnto dauid lorde smote deedsicke dauid besoughte god childe fasted wente laie nighte vpon earth rose elder house wolde haue taken vp frō grounde neuertheles wolde nether ate wt vpon seuenth daye ye childe dyed dauids seruauntes durst tell childe deed thoughte beholde whan childe yet alyue spake vnto herkened vnto oure voyce moch shall greue yf saye childe deed dauid sawe seruauntes made whisperinge together perceaued childe deed sayde vnto seruauntes childe deed sayde yee rose dauid vp earth waszshed selfe anoynted put garmentes wente house lorde worshipped whan came agayne commaunded set bred ate sayde seruauntes vnto maner thinge thou doest whan childe alyue thou fastedst weptest deed thou stōdest vp eatest sayde fasted wepte childe whan yet lyue thoughte knoweth peraduenture lorde maye gracious vnto childe maye lyue eccli 38 deed wherfore shulde fast fetch agayne shal go vnto shall come agayne vnto whan dauid comforted bethseba wife wente vnto laye 1 par 3 matt 1 bare sonne called salomon lorde loued put vnder hāde nathan ye prophet called iedidia people together laye sege ye cite wynne wynne haue name therof dauid gathered ye people together wente foughte agaynst rabba wanne toke kynges crowne frō heade weight talente golde precious stone set ierusalem agayne xiii chapter fortuned absalom ye sonne dauid fayre sister whose name thamar ammon sonne dauid loued ammon greate combraunce moch euen sicke thamar sister virgin ammon thoughte shulde harde eny thinge vnto ammon frēde whose name ionadab sonne simea dauids brother ionadab wyse man sayde vnto art thou leane thou kynges sonne daye daye mayest thou tell sayde ammon vnto loue thamar brother absaloms sister exceadingly ionadab sayde vnto laye downe vpon thy bedd make sicke whan thy father commeth loke thou doest saye vnto oh let sister thamar come maye fede make meece meate maye se eate hir hande ammon layed downe made sicke whā kynge came loke dyd ammon sayde vnto kynge oh let sister thamar come make syppynge two maye eate hir hand • sent dauid thamar house sayde vnto go thy waye thy brother ammons house make meece meate thamar wente vnto hir brother amon house laye bed toke floure mixte dighte eye made syppynge toke meece meate poured wolde eate ammon saide put forth euery man fro euery man wēte forth sayde ammon vnto thamar brynge meece meate chamber maye eate thy hande toke thamar ye syppynge made broughte vnto ammon hir brother chamber whan broughte vnto yt mighte eate toke holde sayde vnto come sister lye neuertheles saide oh brother force israel thou soch foly whither shal go shame thou shalt one vnwyse israel speake vnto kynge shal withholde howbeit wolde herken vnto ouercame gen 34 leui 18 forced laye ammon hated exceadingly hate greater loue ammon sayde vnto vp get hence saide vnto euell thou thrustest greater thou hast done vnto neuertheles herkened vnto called boye serued sayde put awaye woman fro locke dore partye garment soch garmentes wayre ye kynges doughters whyle virgin whā seruaunt put hir forth lockte dore thamar strowed aszshes vpon hir heade rente partye garment vpon layed hir hande vpon hir heade wente cryed hir brother absalom sayde vnto hath thy brother ammon bene holde thy peace sister thy brother take matter hert thamar remayned wyddowe brother absaloms house whan kynge dauid herde sory absalom spake nether euell ner good ammon absalom hated ammon forced sister thamar two yeares absalom shepe clyppers baal hazor lyeth ephraim absalom called kynges child came kynge sayde beholde thy seruaunt hath shepe clyppers let please ye kynge seruauntes go seruaunte kynge sayde vnto absalom sonne let v go lest chargeable vnto wolde nedes haue go howbeit wolde blessed absalom sayde shall brother ammon go v kynge sayde vnto wherfore shall go absalom importune vpon let ammon kynges childrē go absalom commaunded yonge men sayde take hede whan ammon mery wyne saye vnto smyte ammon slaye ye afrayed haue commaunded stronge playe men absaloms yonge men dyd vnto ammon absalom commaunded stode kynges child vp euery one gat vp vpō mule fled whyle yet waye rumoure came kynge dauid absalom slayne kynges child one lefte stode kynge vp rente clothes layed downe vpon earth seruaūtes stode aboute rente clothes answered ionadab ye sonne simea dauids brother sayde let lorde thynke yonge men kynges child deed yt ammon deed onely absalom hath kepte selfe sence daie forced sister thamar therfore let lorde kynge take hert kynges child shulde deed ammon deed onely absalom fled yonge man kepte watch lifte vp eye loked beholde greate people came waye one another hill syde sayde ionadab vnto kynge beholde kynges child come euen thy seruaunt sayde happened whan ended talkynge kynges child came lifte vp voyce wepte kynge seruauntes wepte also sore absalom fled wente vnto thalmai sonne ammihud kynge gesur dauid mourned sonne euery daye whan absalom fled gone vnto gesur thre yeare kynge dauid ceassed goinge agaynst absalom comforted selfe ouer ammon deed xiiii chapter ioab sonne ieru ia perceaued yt kynges hert agaynst absalom sent vnto thecoa caused fetch thence prudent woman saide vnto make lamētacion weere mournynge garmentes anoynte oyle fayne thy selfe woman hath mourned longe ouer deed thou shalt go kynge speake vnto ioab tolde shulde saye whan woman thecoa wolde speake kynge fell vpon hir face grounde worshipped sayde helpe kynge kynge sayde vnto ayleth sayde wedowe woman mourneth huszbāde deed thy handmayde two sonnes stroue together felde whyle noman parte thē sunder one smote slewe beholde whole kynred ryseth vp agaynst thy handmayden saye 〈◊〉 19 c delyuer hath smytten brother maye kyll soule brother hath slayne maye destroye heyre also thus mynded put sparke yet lefte shulde name ner eny thinge el remayne ouer vnto huszbā de vpon earth kynge sayde vnto woman go ye waye home wil geue cōmaundemēt ye woman thecoa saide vnto ye kynge trespace vpon lorde ye kynge vpon father house kynge seate vngiltye kynge sayde speaketh agaynst brynge vnto shall touch nomore sayde let kynge thynke vpon lorde god many auengers bloude destroye brynge sonne naught sayde 1 14 g truly lorde lyueth shall one heer thy sonne fall vpon earth woman sayde let thy handmayde speake somwhat lorde kynge sayde speake woman sayde wherfore hast thou deuised soch thinge agaynst people god happeneth kynge speaketh soch make himselfe giltie causeth outlawe broughte agayne dye death water sinketh earth taken vp • ze 18 god take awaye lyfe vnbethynketh himselfe yt euen outlawe cleane thrust thus come also speake lorde kynge presence people thy handmayden thoughte wyll speake kynge peraduenture shall handmayden sayeth shall heare handmayden delyuer hande wolde destroye sonne enheritaunce god thy handmayden thoughte ye worde lorde kynge shall meat offerynge2 19 lorde kinge angell god heare good euell therfore shall lorde thy god kynge answered sayde vnto woman kepe nothynge fro axe woman sayde let lorde kinge speake kynge sayde hande ioab woman answered sayde truly thy soule lyueth lorde kynge el noman nether righte hande ner ye lefte euen lorde kynge hath sayde thy seruaunt ioab hath commaunded himselfe hath taughte thy handmayden wordes shulde turne matter faszshiō hath ioab thy seruaunt done lorde wyse wyszdome angell god knoweth thynges vpon earth sayde kynge vnto ioab beholde haue done go thy waye therfore brynge childe absalom agayne fell ioab vpon face vnto grounde worshipped thanked kynge sayde daye doth thy seruaunt perceaue haue founde grace thy syghte lorde kynge kynge doth seruaunt hath sayde ioab gat vp wente vnto gesur broughte absalom ierusalem kinge sayde let go againe house se face thus absalom came agayne house sawe ye kynges face israel fayre maruelous goodly man absalom sole fote vnto toppe heade one blemysh whan heade rounded comonly euery yeare heuy must nedes haue bene rounded heer heade weyed two hūdreth sicles ye kynges weight vnto absalom borne thre sonnes one doughter whose name thamar woman fayre bewtye absalom abode two yeare ierusalem sawe kynges face absalom sent ioab mighte sende kynge wolde come sent seconde tyme yet wolde come sayde vnto seruauntes ye knowe ioabs pece londe lyeth myne hath barlye theron go youre waye therfore set fyre vpon absaloms seruauntes sett fyre vpon ioabs pece londe ioab gat vp came absalom house sayde vnto wherfore haue thy seruauntes set fire vpon pece londe absalō sayde vnto ioab beholde sent caused saye vnto come hither maye sende kynge saye wherfore came gesur better yet let therfore se kynges face yf eny trespace put death ioab wente kynge tolde called absalom come kynge worshipped vpon face grounge kynge kynge kyssed absalom xv chapter fortuned absalom caused prepare himselfe chearettes horse fyftye men fote mē absalō gat vp allwaye saul 〈…〉 whose name semei sonne gera wente forth exo 22 cursed caststones dauid kynge dauids seruauntes people mightie men men righte hande lefte thus sayde semei whan cursed get forth get forth thou bloudy hounde thou man belial lorde hath rewarded bloude house saul yt thou becamest kynge steade hath lorde geuen kyngdome ye hande absalom thy sonne beholde stickest thou thine owne myschefe thou art bloudy hounde abisai sonne zeru ia sayde vnto kynge shall deed dogg curse lorde kynge wyl go take heade awaye kynge saide ye child zeru ia haue wt let curse lorde hath commaunded curse dauid saye house toppe absalom laye father concub ••• sighte israel tyme whan achitophel 〈◊〉 councell euen yf man 〈◊〉 councell god councels achitophel dauid 〈◊〉 absalom xvii chapter achitophel sayde vnto absalom wil chose twolue thousande 〈◊〉 wyl get vp persue 〈◊〉 nighte fall vpō whan feble weery vexe thē people flieth wil 〈◊〉 kynge onely brynge people vnto agayne whan euery man brought vnto thou desyrest shal people peace absalom though • good dyd elder • rael absalom sayde praye call chusai arachite also let v hea •• sayeth therto whā chusai came absalom absalom saide vnto thus hath achitophel spoken saye thou shal sayde chusai vnto absalom good councell yt achitophel hath geuen tyme chusai sayde morouer thou knowest thy father well men stronge wrothfull stomack euen 〈…〉 beer robbed hir yonge one felde thy father also man warre wyl necligēt people beholde hath peraduenture hyd hymselfe caue place yf came passe chaunced euell first shulde come rumor saye slaughter done people folowed absalō thē shulde euery man discoraged el valeaunt hath hert like lyō israel knoweth thy father stronge mightie men coūcell thou gather together israel dan vnto berseba nombre sonde see go thou thine owne person amonge wil fall vpon place finde wyll ouerwhelme euen dew falleth vpon earth shal leaue one men yf resorte cite shal israel cast roapes aboute cite drawe riuer shal one stone founde sayde absalom euery man israel councell chusai arachite better achitophels councell 〈…〉 lorde broughte passe ye good councell achitophel hyndred lorde mighte brynge euell vpon absalom 〈…〉 chusai sayde vnto sadoc abiathar prestes thus thus hath achitophel counceled absalom elder israel haue counceled sende therfore haist tell dauid saye abyde nighte playne felde wyldernes get ouer kynge swalowed vp people ionathas ahimaaz stode well rogel damsell wente thither tolde wente waye tolde kynge dauid durst sene come cite lad sawe tolde absalom neuertheles wente waye came man house bahurim well courte wēte downe woman toke spred couerynge ouer welles mouth strowed firmentye corne theron perceaued whan absaloms seruauntes came woman house sayde ahimaaz ionathas womā sayde vnto gone ouer litle water whā soughte founde wente agayne ierusalem whan gone clymmed vp well wente waye tolde dauid ye kynge sayde vnto dauid get vp go soone ouer ye water thus thus hath achitophel geuen councell agaynst dauid gat vp people passed ouer iordane tyll cleare mornynge one wente ouer iordane whan achitophel sawe coūcell wente forth sadled asse gat vp wēte home cite put house poynte hanged selfe dyed buried father graue dauid came mahanaim absalom wente ouer iordane men israel wt absalom set amasa ouer hoost ioabs steade amasa sonne man whose name iethra iesraelite laye abigail doughter nahas sister zeru ia ioabs mother israel absalom pitched gilead whan dauid come mahanaim 1 11 nahas rabbath childrē ammon 2 reg • machir sonne ammiel lodebar 2 19 f 3 reg 2 b barsillai gileadite roglim broughte bedstuffe tapestrie worke basens earthen vessell barly meel parched corne beenes otemeell ryse hony butter shepe fat ox vnto dauid ye people eate thought people shall hongrie weerye thirstye wyldernes xviii chapter dauid mustred people yt set captaynes ouer thē ouer thousandes ouer hundred sent people one thirde parte vnder abisai sonne zeru ia ioabs brother one thirde parte vnder • 2 b ithai gethite kynge sayde vnto people wyll go forth also neuertheles people sayde thou shalt go forth though fle die halfe v shal regarde v thou art ten thousande v therfore better thou mayest helpe v cite kynge sayde loke ye content withall wyl kynge stode gate people wente forth hundred thousandes ye kinge cōmaunded ioab abisai ithai sayde intreate yonge man absalom gently people herde whā kynge cōmaunded captaynes concernynge absalom whan people come forth felde agaynst israel battayll beganne wod ephraim people israel smitten dauids seruauntes greate slaughter daye twentye thousande men battaill scatred abrode londe wod consumed moch people daye swerde consumed absalom met dauids seruauntes rode vpon mule whan mule came vnder greate thicke oke tre heade toke holde oke hanged betwene heauen earth mule ranne awaye vnder whan certayne man sawe tolde ioab saide beholde sawe absalom hange vpō oke tre ioab saide vnto mā yt tolde beholde sawest thou smotest thou groūde wolde haue geuen myne awne behalfe ten syluerlynges gyrdell man sayde vnto ioab yf thou haddest weyed thousande syluerlynges handes yet wolde haue layed handes kynges sonne kynge commaunded abisai ithai oure eares sayde kepe yonge man absalom yf dyssembled vpon ioperdy myne owne soule moch nothinge shulde hyd ye kinge thou thy selfe shuldest haue stōde ioab sayde wil vpon thy face toke ioab thre speares hande thrust absalom thorow ye hert yet alyue vpon oke ten yō ge men ioabs weapenbearers came aboute smote death blewe ioab trompe broughte people agayne shulde folowe nomore vpon israel ioab wolde fauoure people toke absalom cast wod greate pytt layed greate heape stone vpon israel fled euery one vnto tente absalom set vp piler whyle yet alyue stode kynges valley sayde haue sonne therfore shall remembraunce name called piler owne name vnto daie yet called absaloms place ahimaas sonne sadoc sayde let runne brynge kynge worde lorde hath gotten righte frō hande enemy ioab sayde thou shalt bringe good tidinges daie another daye shalt thou brynge worde daye kynges sonne deed vnto chusi sayde ioab go thou thy waye tell kynge thou hast sene chusi obeysaūce vnto ioab ranne ahimaas sonne sadoc saide agayne vnto ioab ranne also ioab sayde wilt thou runne sonne come hither thou shalt brynge good tydinges answered ranne yet saide vnto renne ye waye ahimaas ranne straight waye came chusi dauid sat betwene two gate watchman wente vp ye toppe porte vpon wall lifte vp eye sawe man renninge alone cryed tolde kinge kynge sayde yf alone good tydinges mouth wente came forth watchman sawe another man rennynge cryed porte sayde beholde renneth man alone kinge sayde good messaunger also watchman sayde se rennynge first rennynge ahimaas sonne sadoc kynge sayde good man bryngeth good tidinges ahimaas cryed sayde vnto ye kinge peace worshipped kynge vpon face grounde sayde praised lorde thy god hath geuen ouer ye men lifte vp handes agaynst lorde kynge kynge sayde goeth well yonge man absalom ahimaas sayde sawe greate vproure whan ioab kynges seruaunt sent thy seruaunt wote kynge sayde go aboute stonde wente aboute stode beholde came chusi sayde brynge good tydinges lorde kynge lorde hath executed righte daye hande rose vp agaynst kynge sayde vnto chusi goeth well yonge man absalom chusi sayde euen go wt enemyes lorde kynge ryse vp agaynst euell goeth yonge man kynge soroufull wente vp perler vpon gate wepte wente sayde thus sonne absalō sonne sonne absalom wolde god yt shulde dye absalom sonne sonne xix chapter tolde ioab beholde ye kinge wepeth mourneth absalom ye victory yt daye came mourninge amonge people people herde daye yt kynge toke heuely sonne ye people stale awaye daye came cite people put shame pycketh selues awaye whan fled battayll kynge couered face cryed loude sayde oh sonne absalom absalom sonne sonne ioab came kynge house sayde daye hast thou shamed thy seruauntes haue delyuered thy soule daye soules thy sonnes thy doughters thy wyues thy cōcubynes thou louest hate hatest loue ye daye thou shewest thyselfe thou carest captaynes seruauntes perceaue daye yf absalom onely alyue deed daye thou woldest thynke well get vp therfore go forth speake louyngly vnto thy seruauntes sweare vnto ye lorde yf thou go forth shall lefte one man nighte shalbe worse vnto yt euell happened sence ye youth vp hither thē kynge gat vp sat gate sayde vnto people beholde kynge sytteth gate came people ye kynge israel fled euery one vnto tent people stroue trybes israel sayde kynge ryd v hande oure enemy delyuered v hande philistynes fayne fle lōde absalom absalom anoynted ouer v deed battayll ye styll ye fetch kynge agayne kynge sent vnto sadoc abiathar prestes caused saye vnto thē speake elder iuda saye wyl ye last fetch kynge agayne vnto house ye sayenge israel come kynge house ye brother bone flesh wherfore wyl ye last brynge kynge agayne saye vnto amasa art thou bone flesh god vnto yf thou shalt chefe captayne ioabs steade longe thou lyuest bowed hert men iud • one man sent vnto ye kynge come agayne thou thy seruauntes kynge came agayne whan came vnto iordane ye men iuda come gilgal go downe mete kynge mighte brynge ye kynge ouer iordane semei sonne gera sonne iemini dwelt bahurim made haist wente downe ye men iuda mete kynge dauid thousande mē ben iamin 2 16 • siba also seruaunt house saul fyftene sonnes twenty seruauntes gat thorow iordane passed ouer ye fery mighte brynge ouer kynges housholde pleasure semei sonne gera fell downe kynge whan passed ouer iordane sayde vnto kynge lorde laye trespace vnto charge thynke vpon thy seruaunt vexed 2 16 • daye whan lorde kynge wente ierusalem let ye kynge take hert thy seruaunt knoweth hath synned beholde daye come first amonge house ioseph go downe mete lorde kynge neuertheles abisai sonne zeru ia answered sayde shulde semei dye therfore seynge hath cursed ye anoynted ye lorde dauid sayde2 16 b mat 16 c haue ye child zeru ia ye wyll become sathan vnto daye shulde eny man dye daye israel thynkest thou knowe yt become kynge ouer israel daye ye kynge sayde vnto simei thou shalt dye kynge sware vnto mephiboseth sonne saul came downe also mete kynge made cleane fete ner combde beerde nether waszshed clothes daye kynge gone awaye vntyll daye came agayne peace whā came ierusalem mete kynge kynge sayde vnto mephiboseth wherfore wentest thou sayde lorde kynge seruaūt hath dealte vnrighteously thy seruaunt thoughte wil saddell asse ryde theron go vnto kynge thy seruaunt lame hath accused thy seruaunt lorde ye kynge gen 33 b 2 14 hest 15 b lorde ye kynge angell god thou mayest pleaseth father house nothinge people death lorde ye kynge 2 9 b yet hast thou set thy seruaunt amonge eate ye table righteousnes haue shulde crye eny vnto kynge kynge sayde vnto speakest thou yet thy matter haue sayde thou siba parte londe betwene mephiboseth sayde vnto kynge let take moch lorde ye kynge come home peace barsillai gileadite came downe roglim broughte kynge ouer iordane mighte cōueye iordane barsillai olde good foure score yeare olde • 17 c prouyded ye kynge fode whyle mahanaim noble man kynge sayde vnto barsillai thou shalt go ouer wyll take care wt myne awne selfe ierusalem barsillai sayde vnto kynge haue yet lyue shulde go vp ierusalem wt kynge daye foure score yeare olde shulde knowe good euell taist eate drynke heare musician synge shulde thy seruaunt chargeable first vnto lorde kynge thy seruaunt shall go litle kynge ouer iordane wil kynge recompence maner let thy seruaunt turne backe agayne maye dye cite besyde father mother graue beholde thy seruaunt chimeam let go ouer lorde kynge vnto pleaseth kynge sayde chimeam shal go ouer wyll liketh euer thou desyrest wyll also whan ye people gone ouer iordane kynge likewyse kynge kyssed barsillai blessed turned vnto place ye kynge passed ouer vnto gilgal chimeam wente people iuda broughte kynge ouer howbeit halfe people israel beholde thē came men israel vnto kynge sayde vnto haue oure hrethren men iuda stollen awaye haue conueyed ye kynge housholde ouer iordane dauids men answered iuda vnto israel kynge oure nye kynred ye angrie therfore thynke ye haue receaued eny fode giftes kynge answered israel vnto iuda sayde haue ten tymes kynge dauid thē thou hast thou regarded lightly oures first fetch oure kynge agayne iuda spake harder israel xx chapter famous man belial whose name seba ye sonne bichri mā iemini blewe trompe sayde 〈…〉 haue porcion dauid ner inheritaunce ye sonne isai let euery get tent israel fell euery man israel dauid folowed seba sonne bichri men iuda cleued vnto kynge iordane vnto ierusalē whan dauid came home ierusalem toke ten concubynes 〈…〉 wh • lefte kep • house put holde kepte made prouysion laye shut vp vnto death lyued wedowes ye kynge sayde vnto amasa call 〈◊〉 men iuda together agaynst thirde daye thou present also amasa wēte call iuda together slacke come ye tyme appoynted dauid sayde vnto abisai shall seba sonne bichri v harme absalom take thou ye lordes seruauntes folowe vpon yt fynde strōge city escape oure sighte wente ioabs mē forth chrethian • plethians mightie mē wēte ierusalem folowe vpon seba sonne bichri whan greate stone gibeon amasa came ioab gyrded aboue garment vpon swerde gyrded hanged thye sheeth wente easely fell frō ioab sayde vnto amasa peace brother ioab toke amasa beerde righte hāde kysse amasa toke hede vnto ye swerde ioabs hande thrust therwith bely yt bowel ranne vpon earth thrust dyed ioab brother abisai folowed vpon seba ye sonne bichri one ioabs seruauntes stode sayde yt wolde agaynst ioab please dauid dauid ioabs steade amasa laye rolled bloude ye myddes strete 〈◊〉 one sawe people stode still remoued amasa strete vnto felde cast clothe vpon moch sawe euer came stode styll whan put waye euery man wēte ioab folowe vpon seba sonne bichri wente thorow ye trybes israel vnto abel beth maacha best chosen men gathered selues together folowed came beseged abel beth maacha made banke aboute cite harde ye wall people ioab layed ordynaunce wolde haue cast downe wall cried wyse womā ye cite heare heare saye vnto ioab come hither wyl speake whā came woman sayde art thou ioab sayde yee sayde vnto heare wordes thy handmayden sayde heare sayde comonsayenge somtyme wyll axe let axe abel came good ende ye noble faithfull cite israel wilt thou destroye cite mother israel wilt thou swalowe vp enheritaunce lorde ioab answered sayde farre farre fro shulde swalowe vp destroye matter certayne man mount ephraim named seba sonne bichri hath lifte vp selfe agaynst kynge dauid delyuer onely wyl departe cite woman sayde vnto ioab beholde heade shal cast vnto ouer wall woman came people hir wyszdome smote heade seba sonne bichri cast vnto ioab blewe trompe departed cite euery one vnto tent ioab came agayne ierusalem vnto kynge 〈…〉 ioab captayne ouer hoost israel benaia ye sonne ioiada ouer chrethians plethians adoram rent gatherer iosaphat sonne ahilud chaunceler seia scrybe sadoc abiathar prestes ira also ye iairite dauids prest xxi chapter derth also dauids tyme thre yeares together dauid soughte face ye lorde lorde sayde saul cause bloudy housholde 〈◊〉 22 yt slewe gibeonites kynge caused call gibeonites spake vnto gibeonites ye child israel remnaunt amorites howbeit • osu 9 c child israel sworne vnto thē saul soughte smyte gelousy childrē israel iuda sayde dauid gibeonites shal vnto withall shal make attonement ye maye blesse ye enheritaunce ye lorde gibeonites sayde vnto golde syluer haue wt saul house nether haue oughte slaye eny mā israel sayde saye ye shal vnto sayde vnto ye kynge man hath destroyed v broughte v naughte shulde destroye nothinge lefte coastes israel let geuen v seuen men sonnes maye hange vp vnto lorde gibea saul chosen lorde kynge sayde wyll geue howbeit kynge spared mephiboseth ye sonne ionathas ye sonne saul ooth lorde yt betwene 1 18 20 b 23 c namely betwene dauid ionathas sonne saul two sonnes rispa ye doughter aia borne vnto saul armoni mephiboseth fyue sonnes michol doughter saul bare vnto adriel sonne barsillai mahalothite dyd kynge take gaue handes ye gibeonites hanged thē vp vpō mount lorde seuen fell one tyme dyed tyme first haruest whan ye barly haruest begynneth toke rispa doughter aia sackcloth spred vpon rock begynnynge haruest tyll water heauen dropped vpō suffred foules heauen rest daye tyme nether wylde beestes felde nighte season tolde dauid rispa doughter aia saul concubyne done dauid wente toke bone saul bone ionathas sonne ye citesens iabes gilead 1 • 1 c stollen ye strete bethsan ye philistynes hanged thē tyme philistynes smytten saul vpon mount gilboa broughte vp thence gathered together wt bone hanged 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 bone saul sonne ionathas buried ye londe ben iamin besyde ye graue father ci god one londe arose warre agayne ye philistynes agaynst israel dauid wente downe seruauntes foughte agaynst philistynes dauid weery ieszbi nob one child rapha weight speare thre c weight brasse new harnesse vpon thoughte smyte dauid neuertheles abisai sonne zeru ia helped smote philistyne death sware dauids men vnto sayde • 18 thou shalt nomore go forth v vnto warre lanterne israel put par • 1 afterwarde arose yet warre nob philistynes sibechai husathite smote saph also one childrē rapha arose yet warre gob philistynes elhanan sonne iaere orgim bethleemite smote goliath gethite speare whose shaft like weeuers lome arose yet warre gath cōtencious man sixe fyngers handes sixe toe fete foure twēty nombre borne also rapha whan spake despitefully vnto israel ionathas ye sonne simea dauids brother smote foure borne vnto rapha gath fell thorow hande dauid seruauntes xxii chapter dauid spake wordes songe lorde tyme lorde delyuered frō hande enemy hande saul sayde lorde stony rock castell delyuerer god strength wyl put trust shylde horne saluacion defence refuge sauioure thou shalt helpe violent wronge psal 17 wil call vpon lorde prayse shal▪ delyuered fro myne enemy sorowes death cōpased brokes belial made afrayed paynes hell came aboute snare death ouertaken whā trouble called vpō lorde yee euen god called vpon herde voyce frō holy temple cōplaynte came eares earth trembled quaked foundacions heauen shoke moued cause wroth smoke wente vp nose consumynge fyre mouth cole kyndled therof bowed heauens came downe darke vnder fete sat vpon cherub dyd flye appeared vpon fethers wynde made darknes pauylion rounde aboute thicke water cloudes ye ayre brightnesse fyre cole kyndled lorde thondered heauē hyest put forth voyce shot arowes scatered lightened discomfited pourynges see sene foundacions earth discouered chydinge lorde breth sprete wrath sent downe aboue receaued drue many water delyuered fro stronge enemye hated mightie ouertoke tyme trouble lorde succoure broughte forth liberty delyuered fauoure vnto lorde shal rewarde righteousnes acordinge clennes handes shal recompence haue kepte ye waye lorde haue bene vngodly agaynst god haue eye vnto lawes haue put ordinaunces fro therfore wil perfecte vnto wyl eshue myne awne wickednes shal ye lorde rewarde righteousnes acordinge clēnes handes eye sighte holy shalt thou holy wt perfecte thou shalt perfecte cleane thou shalt cleane frowarde thou shalt frowarde thou shalt saue poore oppressed people shalt set thine eye agaynst proude brynge downe thou lorde art lanterne lorde shal lighte darknesse ye shal discōfite hoost men god shal leape ouer wall waye god perfecte ye wordes lorde tryed fyre shylde thē put trust god excepte ye lorde hath eny strength without oure god god hath strēgthed power made playne perfecte waye hath made fete like harte fete hath set vp hye teacheth handes fighte bendeth stele bowe myne armes thou hast geuen shylde ye health ye louynge correccion shalt thou multiplye thou hast enlarged goinge vnder myne ankle haue slyded wyl folowe vpon myne enemy destroye thē wyl turne backe agayne tyll haue broughte naught wil cōsume thrust thorow come vp shal fall vnder fete thou hast girded strength ye battayll hast subdued vnder yt rose vp agaynst thou hast made myne enemy turne backes vpō might destroye hate shal crye shalbe sauioure yee euen vnto lorde answereth wil beate small dust earth euen ye claye stretes wil make thynne sprede abrode shalt thou delyuer stryuynges people shalt kepe ye heade heythen people haue knowne▪ shal serue straunge child haue denyed hearynge eare shal herkē vnto straunge child waxen olde shut vp presons lorde lyueth blessed god magnified strength health god seyth auenged subdueth people vnto bryngeth fro myne enemy yt ryse vp agaynst shalt thou exalte ye cruell man shalt thou delyuer 〈◊〉 15 cause wyl geue thankes vnto amonge heythen synge prayses vnto thy name doth greate health kynge sheweth mercy vnto dauid anoynted sede euermore xxiii chapter last wordes dauid dauid sonne isai sayde man set vp ye anoynted god iacob pleasaunt dyter songes israel sayde sprete lorde hath spoken vtteraunce therof done thorow tunge sayde god israel hath spokē vnto strength israel gouernoure amonge men righteous gouernoure feare god lighte ye mornynge whan sonne aryseth brightnesse therof cloude remayneth grasse loketh vpon earth thorow rayne euen shal house god 2 7 c hath made euerlastinge couenaunt well appoynted euery syde sure health pleasure shal growe belial shal vtterly cleane roted thornes mē take hādes yt touch shal destroye wt yrons speares fyre shal brent maye broughte naught name dauids worthy iasabeam ye sonne hachmoni1 par 12 • chefest amonge thre lifte vp speare slewe eight hundreth one tyme eleasar sonne dodi sonne ahohi amonge thre worthy dauid whan spake despytefully philistynes gathered together battayll men israel wente vp stode vp smote philistynes tyll hande weery cromp • ed swerde lorde gaue greate victory tyme people turned spoyle samma sonne age ye hararite whā philistynes gathered themselues company place pece lōde full small corne people fled philistynes thē stode myddes ye pece londe▪ delyuered smote ye philistynes god gaue greate victory thre pryncipall amonge thirtie came downe haruest vnto dauid1 par 12 c caue adullam hoost ye philistynes laye ye valley rephaim dauid tyme castell ye philistynes people laye bethleem dauid desyrous sayde wolde god yt man wolde fetch drynke water well bethleem vnder gate thē brake thre worthy hoost philistynes drue water well bethleem vnder ye gate caried broughte vnto dauid neuertheles wolde drynke offred vnto lorde sayde lorde let farre fro shulde bloude men ioperded lyues wente thither wolde drynke dyd thre worthy • par 12 c • 21 abisai ye brother ioab sonne zeru ia one also chefe amōge thre lifte vp speare smote thre hundreth awncient man amōge thre noblest amonge thre ruler came vnto thre • par 12 • benaia sonne ioiada sonne ishail man greate actes cabzeell smote two mightie giaūtes ye moabites wēte downe slewe lyon well snowe tyme smote also fayre goodly man egipte speare hande wē te downe staffe toke speare egipcians hande violence slewe owne speare dyd benaia sonne ioiada famous man amōge thre worthy honorable thirtie came vnto thre dauid made secrete coūcell asahel brother ioab amonge ye thirtie elham vncles sonne bethleem samma haradite elika haradite helez paltite ira sonne tekoite abiser anthothite mebunai husathite zalmon ahohite maherai netophatite ithai sonne ribai gibea childrē ben iamin benaia pirgathonite hidai broke gaas abialbon arbathite asmaueth bahumite eliaheba baalbonite child iasen ionathas samma hararite eliphelet sonne ahaszbai ye sonne maechathi eliam sonne achitophel ye gilonite hesrai carmel paerai arbite iegael sonne nathan soba▪ ban gadite zeleg ammonite naharai beerothite weapen bearer ioab sonne zeru ia ira iethrite gareb iethrite vri • hethite alltogether seuen thirtie xxiiii chapter lorde wrothfully displeased ye new agaynst israel 〈…〉 moued dauid amonge saide go nombre israel iuda kynge sayde vnto ioab ye chefe captayne hoost go aboute trybes israel dan vnto berseba nombre people maye knowe many ioab sayde vnto kynge lorde thy god adde vnto people hundreth tymes moch lorde kynge maye se eye lust theron hath lorde kynge desyre thinge neuertheles kynges worde preuayled agaynst ioab captaynes hoost ioab ye captaynes hoost wente forth kynge nombre people israel passed ouer iordane pitched aroer righte hande cite lyeth ye ryuer gad iaseer came gilead lowe countre hadsi came vnto dan iaan aboute sidon came stronge cite tyrus city heuites cananites came forth south parte iuda vnto berseba wē te rounde aboute countre nyne monethes twenty day came ierusalem ioab delyuered vnto ye kynge summe people nombred israel eight c thousande stronge men drue swerde iuda fyue hundreth thousande men people nombred dauids hert smote selfe dauid sayde vnto ye lorde haue synned sore haue done lorde take awaie trespace thy seruaunt haue done vnwysely whan dauid rose vp mornynge worde lorde came vnto prophet gad dauids seer sayde go speake vnto dauid thus sayeth lorde ▪ brynge thre thinges chose one maye vnto gad came vnto dauid tolde sayde vnto wilt thou seuen yeare derth shall come thy londe thou fayne flye thine aduersaries thre monethes persecute pestilence thre dayes londe take aduysement therfore se answere shal bringe agayne vnto yt sent dauid sayde vnto gad extreme trouble 〈…〉 neuertheles yf maye let rather fall ye handes lorde mercy greate wyll fall handes men lorde sent pestilēce israel morow vnto tyme appoynted dyed people dan vnto berseba thre score ten thousande men whan angel stretched hande ouer ierusalem destroye lorde repented ouer euell sayde vnto angell ynough holde thy hande angell lorde besyde barne arafna iebusite whan dauid sawe angell smote people sayde vnto lorde beholde haue synned haue done trespace shepe haue done oh let thy hāde agaynst agaynst father house gad came dauid tyme saide vnto go vp set vp altare vnto lorde ye barne arafna iebusite dauid wēte vp gad sayde lorde commaunded whā arafna loked aboute sawe kynge seruauntes goinge vnto worshipped vpon face grounde sayde wherfore commeth lorde ye kynge vnto seruaunt dauid sayde bye barne buylde altare vnto lorde plage maye ceasse people arafna sayde vnto dauid let lorde kynge take offre pleaseth beholde oxe burnt offerynge sleddes vessel ox wodd gaue arafna vnto kynge arafna sayde vnto ye kynge lorde thy god make accepted vnto neuertheles ye kynge sayde vnto arafna wyll bye moch worth wyl offre burnt offerynges vnto ye lorde yt haue naughte dauid boughte barne oxe fiftye sicles syluer buylded altare vnto lorde offred burnt offerynges deed offerynges lorde mercifull vnto ye londe ye plage ceassed people israel ende seconde boke kynges otherwyse called seconde boke samuel thyrde boke kynges boke conteyneth chap i▪ adonias seketh father kyngdome salomon ordeyned kynge chap ii dauid death exhorteth salomō godlynes adonias ioab semei put death abiathar deposed presthode chap iii salomō optayneth wyszdome god wise sentence salomon betwene two wemen stroue childe chap iiii descripcion salomon kyngdome wyszdome chap v hiram kinge tyre sendeth salomon connynge craftesmen buylde temple chap vi descripcion time whā salomon beganne buylde temple buylded chap vii salomon buyldeth himselfe house tymber mount libanus chap viii arke lorde brought salomon temple thankesgeuynge prayer salomon chap ix lorde appeareth vnto salomon geueth hiram twenty city c chap x quene saba hearynge salomon wyszdome commeth ierusalem chap xi salomon displeaseth god loue heythenysh wemen god deuydeth kyngdome dyeth chap xii roboam foloweth yonge councell maketh people cleue ieroboam setteth vp idolatry two golden calues chap xiii ieroboam despiseth prophet lorde punyshed receaued grace agayne lyon slayeth dishobedient prophet chap xiiii ieroboam dyeth sonne nadab kynge roboams dominion chap xv abia reigneth iuda hī reigneth asa hath warre baasa kynge israel reigneth iosaphath baesa dyeth chap xvi ella reigneth steade father baesa simri slayeth taketh kyngdome people deuided achab kynge chap xvii greate drouth derth elia tyme lorde fedeth thorow rauens wedowe sarepta chap xviii elia commeth agayne vnto achab baal prestes slayne chap xix iesebel threateneth elia flieth fed strengthed angell lorde talketh vpon mount horeb▪ eliseus called chap xx benadab kynge siria fighteth agaynst samaria israel ouercome discomfited chap xxi achab oppresseth naboth vynyarde elia rebuketh chap xxii iosaphat ande achab helpe one another fighte prophet micheas warueth first chapter whā kinge dauid olde well stryckē age coulde warme though couered clothes sayde seruauntes vnto let v seke yonge damsell virgin oure lorde kynge stonde kynge norish slepe armes warme oure lorde kynge sought fayre dā sell coastes israel founde abisag sunem brought vnto ye kynge fayre damsell noryshed ye kynge serued howbeit kynge knewe adonias ye sonne hagith lifte vp selfe sayde wyl kynge prepared charettes horsmen fyftie men renners fote father reproued hī therfore moch saye wherfore doest thou man fayre bewtye reg 3 begotten nexte absalō matter stode ioab ye sonne zeru ia abiathar prest helped adonias sadoc prest benaia sonne ioiada nathan prest semei rei dauids worthy adonias whā adonias offred shepe oxē fat catell besyde stone soheleth lyeth • su 15 b 〈◊〉 ▪ 1 • c well rogel called brethrē kynges sonnes men iuda kynges seruaūtes prophet nathan benaia worthy brother salomon called sayde nathan vnto bethseba salomon mother hast thou herde yt adonias kynge oure lorde dauid knoweth therof come therfore wyll geue councell thou mayest delyuer thy soule soule thy sonne salomon come go kinge dauid saye vnto hast thou lorde kynge sworne sayde vnto thy handmayden salomon thy sonne shall kynge shall sytt vpon seate adonias made kynge beholde thou art yet talkest kynge wyll come tell forth thy tayle bethseba wente kynge ye chamber kynge olde abisag sunem serued kynge bethseba bowed hirselfe worshipped kynge kynge sayde wilt thou sayde vnto lorde thou hast sworne vnto thy handmayde lorde thy god thy sonne salomon shall kynge syt vpon seate lo adonias kynge lorde kynge knoweth hath offred ox fat catell many shepe hath called kynges sonnes abiathar prest ioab chefe captayne thy seruaunt salomon hath bydden neuertheles thou lorde art kynge eye israel loke vnto thou shuldest shewe shall syt vpon seate lorde kynge whā lorde kynge slepeth father shal sonne salomon fayne synners whyle yet spake kynge prophet nathan came tolde ye kinge beholde prophet nathan whan came kynge worshipped kynge vpon face grounde sayde lorde kynge hast thou saide adonias shal kinge syt vpō seate gone downe daye hath offred ox fat catell hath called kynges sonnes captaynes prest abiathar beholde eate drynke saye god saue kynge adonias thy seruaunt sadoc prest benaia sonne ioiada thy seruaunt salomon hath called hath lorde kynge commaunded certifyed seruauntes shall sytt vpon seate lorde kynge kinge answered saide call bethseba vnto came kinge whan stode kynge kynge sware sayde truly lorde lyueth hath delyuered soule trouble wyl vnto daye euen sware vnto lorde god israel salomon thy sonne shalbe kynge shal sit pon seate steade bethseba bowed hir selfe hir face grounde thanked kynge sayde god saue lorde kynge dauid euermore kynge sayde call prest sadoc prophet nathan benaia sonne ioiada whan came kynge kynge sayde vnto take youre lordes seruauntes set sonne salomon vpon mule cary downe gihon let sadoc ye prest prophet nathan anoynte kynge ouer israel blowe trompe saye god saue kynge salomon go ye vp whan commeth shal syt vpō seate kynge steade haue ordeyned prynce ouer israel iuda answered benaia sonne ioiada vnto kynge sayde amen lorde god lorde kynge saye thus also lorde hath bene lorde kynge salomon also seate maye greater seate lorde kynge dauid wente downe prest sadoc prophet nathan benaia sonne ioiada chrethians plethians set salomon vpon kynge dauids mule broughte gihon sadoc prest toke oyle horne tabernacle anoynted salomon blewe trompe ye people sayde god saue kynge salomon people wente vp people pyped pypes ioyfull earth range noyse adonias herde called wt new eaten whan ioab herde noyse trompe sayde meaneth noyse cite busynes whyle yet spake beholde ionathas sonne abiathar ye prest came adonias sayde come thou art valeaunt man bryngest good tydinges ionathas answered sayde vnto adonias ala lorde kynge dauid hath made salomon kynge hath sent sadoc prest propheth nathan benaia sonne ioiada chrethians plethians haue set vpon kynges mule sadoc ye prest prophet nathan hath anoynted kynge gihon thē ce gone vp ioye cite range noyse ye haue herde salomon also sytteth vpō kynges seate kynges seruauntes gone wysh good lucke vnto ouer lorde kynge dauid haue sayde thy god make salomon better name thy name make seate greater thy seate haue wyszshed kynge good lucke vpon bed morouer ye kynge hath sayde thus praysed ye lorde god israel daye hath made one syt vpon seate myne eye haue sene afrayed gatt vp called adonias departed euery man waye adonias afrayed salomon gat vp wēte waye toke holde ye horne ye altare tolde salomon beholde adonias feareth kynge salomō beholde taketh holde horne ye altare sayeth let kīge salomō sweare vnto daye shall slaye seruaunt swerde salomon sayde yf wil honest man shall one heer fall vpon earth yf euell founde shall dye kinge salomō sent caused fetched exo 21 b altare whan came fell downe kynge salomon salomon sayde vnto go ye waye thy house ii chapter whan tyme came dauid shulde dye commaunded salomon sonne sayde iosu 2 • go waye worlde thou strōge therfore shewe thyselfe man kepe watch lorde thy god thou walke wayes holde ordinaunces commaundementes lawes testimony deut • 7 written lawe moses thou mayest wyse thou doest whither euer thou turnest lorde maye rayse vp worde hath spokē ouer saide yf thy child kepe waye walke faithfully truly hert withall soule thē shal neuer fayle man vpon seate israel thou knowest well also ioab sonne zeru ia hath done vnto dyd vnto two chefe captaynes israel 2 3 e abner sonne ner 2 20 • amasa sonne iether slewe shed bloude warre whā peace put bloude warre vpon girdel yt aboute loynes shues vpon fete thou acordynge thy wyszdome thou brynge graye heer downe graue peace child barsyllai gileadite thou shalt shewe mercy maye eate thy table ioined thē selues vnto whan fled thy brother absalom beholde thou hast 2 16 b semei sonne gera sonne iemini bahurim cursed bytter shamefull cursynges tyme wente mahanaim yet2 19 came downe mete iordan sware vnto lorde sayde wyll slaye swerde suffre thou vngiltye thou art wyse man shalt wel knowe thou oughtest vnto thou mayest brynge graye heer downe graue bloude act 2 c 13 dauid slepte father buried cite dauid tyme dauid kynge ouer israel fortie yeare2 reg 5 seuen yeares kynge hebrō thre thirtie yeare ierusalem salomon sat vpon seate dauid father1 pa 30 e kyngdome made sure adonias sonne hagith came bethseba salomon mother sayde thy commynge peaceable spake yee sayde haue somwhat • aye sayde saye sayde thou knowest kyngdome myne israel sett selues vpon shulde kynge kyngdome turned become brother hath lorde desyre one peticion make face ashamed sayde vnto saye sayde speake vnto kynge salomon shall denye thy pe • icion shall shame thy face maye geue abisag wyfe bethseba sayde wel wil speake kynge bethseba came kynge salomon speake kynge stode vp wente mete worshipped sat downe vpon seate chayre set kynges mother sat righte hande sayde one peticion desyre make face ashamed kynge saydt axe mother wyl shame thy face saide let abisag sunem geuen thy brother adonias wyfe answered kynge salomon saide vnto mother desyrest thou abisag sunem adonias axe kyngdome also greater brother 〈…〉 hath abiathar prest ioab sonne zeru ia kynge sware lorde sayde god vnto adonias shall haue spoken agaynst lyfe truly lorde lyueth hath ordeyned made syt vpon seate father dauid hath made house 〈…〉 acordynge sayde daye shal adonias dye kynge salomon sent thither benaia sonne ioiada smote dyed prest abiathar sayde ye kynge go thy waye vnto anathoe thy londe thou art man deeth neuerthelesse wyl slaye daye thou hast borne arke lorde god father dauid hast suffred also father suffred thus salomō put forth abiathar must nomore prest lorde worde lorde mighte fulfilled 〈…〉 spake ouer house eli silo rumoure came ioab ioab cleued vnto adonias vnto salomon fled ioab tabernacle lorde toke holde horne altare tolde kynge salomon ioab fled tabernacle lorde beholde stondeth altare sent salomon benaia sonne ioiada sayde go slaye whan benaia came tabernacle lorde sayde vnto thus sayeth kynge come forth sayde wyl dye benaia tolde vnto kynge agayne sayde thus hath ioab spoken thus hath answered kinge saide vnto hath spoken slaye bury thou mayest put fro father house bloude ioab hath shed cause lorde maye recompence bloude vpon heade smote two men righteous better slewe ye swerde father dauid knewe namely 〈…〉 abner ye sonne ner chefe captaine ouer israel amasa sonne iether ye chefe captaine ouer iuda yt bloude maye recompensed vpō ye heade ioab sede euer 〈…〉 dauid sede house seate haue peace euermore lorde benaia sonne ioiada wente vp smote slewe buried house wyldernes ye kynge set benaia ye sonne ioiada steade ouer hoost 〈…〉 sadoc ye prest dyd kynge set steade abiathar kynge sent caused call semei sayde vnto buylde house ierusalem dwell departe thence nether hither ner thither daye euer thou departest forth goest ouer ye broke cedron thou sure thou shalt dye deeth thy bloude vpon thy heade semei sayde vnto kynge good meanynge lorde kynge hath sayde shal thy seruaunt semei dwelt ierusalem longe season thre yeare fortuned two seruauntes ranne awaye semei vnto achis sonne maecha kynge gath tolde semei beholde thy seruauntes gath semei gat vp sadled asse wēte vnto gath achis seke seruaūtes whā came thither broughte seruauntes gath tolde salomon semei wente ierusalem vnto gath come agayne sent kynge caused call semei sayde vnto sware lorde assured sayde loke daye euer thou departest goest hither thither sure thou shalt dye death thou saydest vnto haue herde good meanynge hast thou kepte acordinge ooth lorde commaundement commaunded kynge sayde vnto semei thou remembrest ye wickednes thy hert knoweth 〈…〉 thou dyddest vnto father dauid lorde hath recompenced ye thy wickednes vpon thy heade kynge salomon blessed seate dauid shalbe stablished ye lorde euer kynge commaunded benaia ye sonne ioiada wente forth smote dyed kyngdome stablished salomon hande iii chapter salomon made mariage wt pharao kynge egipte toke pharaos doughter broughte cite dauid tyll buylded house lordes house walles rounde aboute ierusalem people offred yet vpon hye place yet house buylded vnto name lorde vnto tyme salomon loued lorde walked ordinaunces dauid father excepte onely offred brent incense vpon hye place 2 par 1 kynge wente vnto gibeon sacrifice goodly hye place salomon offred thousande burnt offerynges vpon altare 3 reg 9 lorde appeared vnto salomon gibeon dreame nighte god sayde axe shal geue ye salomō saide thou hast done greate mercy vnto father dauid thy seruaunt like walked faithfulnes righteousnes true hert greate mercy hast thou layed vp geuen sonne syt vpon seate come passe sap 9 lorde god thou hast made thy seruaunt kynge father dauids steade small yonge man knowynge nether outgoynge ner ingoynge thy seruaunt amonge people thou hast chosen greate man nombre ner descrybe multitude geue thy seruaunt therfore obedient hert maye iudge thy people vnderstonde good bad able iudge thy mightie people pleased lorde well salomon axed soch peticion god sayde vnto moch thou axest desyrest longe lyfe nether rich nether ye soules thine enemy vnderstō dinge heare iudgment beholde therfore haue done acordynge thy wordes eccle 1 c beholde haue geuen hert wyszdome vnderstondynge soch one thou hath bene nether shall ryse vp yee thou hast prayed haue geuen also namely ryches honoure amonge kynges ye tyme soch one thou yf thou wilt walke wayes thou kepe myne ordinaunces lawes • 15 dauid thy father hath walked wyll geue longe lyfe whan salomon awaked beholde dreame 2 par 1 b came ierusalē stode arke lordes couenaunt offred burnt offerynges health offeringes made greate feast vnto seruauntes tyme came two harlottes vnto ye kynge stode one woman sayde oh lorde woman dwelt one house delyuered childe house thirde daye delyuered delyuered childe also together yt straunger ye house two woman sonne died nighte smoored slepe rose vp nighte toke sonne fro syde thy handmayde slepte layed hir arme hir deed sonne layed myne arme whan rose vp mornynge geue sonne sucke beholde deed mornynge loked well beholde sonne borne woman sayde sonne lyueth thy sonne deed sayde thy sonne deed sonne liueth thus spake kynge kynge sayde womā saieth sonne lyueth thy sonne deed yonder woman sayeth thy sonne deed sonne lyueth kynge saide fetch swerde whan swerde brought kynge kynge sayde parte lyuynge childe two partes geue woman one halfe yonder woman halfe sayde woman whose sonne lyued vnto ye kinge hir motherly hert kyndled pite ouer hir sonne oh lorde geue hir childe alyue kyll sayde let nether myne ner thine let parted answered kynge sayde geue woman lyuynge childe slaye mother israel herde iudgment kynge geuen feared kynge sawe ye wysdome god kepe iudgmēt iiii chapter thus salomon kynge ouer israel prynces asaria sonne sadoc prest elihoreph ahi ia sonnes sisa prestes iosaphat sonne ahilud chaunceler benaia ye sonne ioiada chefe captayne sadoc abiathar prestes asaria sonne nathan ouer officer sabud sonne nathan prest kynges frende ahisar stewarde adoniram sonne abda rent gatherer salomon twolue offycers ouer israel made prouysion fode kynge house one moneth longe ye yeare make prouysion sonne hur vpon mount ephraim sonne deber macaz saalbaim bethsames elon beth hanā sonne hased aruboth therto socho londe hepher sonne abinadab ye lordshippe dor taphat salomōs doughter wife baena ye sonne ahilud thaenach magiddo ouer beth sean lyeth besyde zarthana vnder iesrael beth sean vnto playne mehelo tyll syde iakmeam sonne geber ramoth gilead townes iair sonne manasse gilead ye coastes argob lyeth basan euen thre score greate walled city brasen barres ahinadab ye sonne iddo mahanaim ahimaas nephtali also toke basmath salomon doughter wife baena sonne husai asser aloth iosaphat sonne paruha isachar semei sonne ela ben iamin geber sonne vri londe gilead londe sihon kynge amorites og kynge basan one officer londe iuda israel nombre sonde see ate dronke mery 〈…〉 thus salomō lorde ouer kyngdomes water londe philistynes vnto border egipte broughte giftes serued longe lyued salomon daylie vytayles thirtye quarter fyne meel thre score quarter meel ten fat ox twē ty small catell hundreth shepe beside harte roe wilde goates fat capon foules lordshippe londe syde water frō tiphsa vnto gasa ouer ye kynges syde ye water peace subiectes rounde aboute iuda israel dwelt safe euery one vnder vyne vnder figge tre dan vnto berseba longe salomon lyued salomō fortye thousande cart horse twolue thousande horsmen officer prouyded kynge salomon vytayles whatsoeuer belonged kynges table brought euery man moneth myssed barlye also strawe horse courser broughte vnto place ye kynge euery one charge 〈◊〉 1 c god gaue salomon maruelous greate wyszdome vnderstondinge large hert sonde lyeth vpon ye see shore wyszdome salomon greater wyszdome child towarde south ye egipcians wyser men yee wyser ethan esrahite heman chalcal darda sonnes mahol greate name amonge heythē euery syde spake thre thousande 〈…〉 prouerbes 〈…〉 songes thousande fyue spake tree ye ceder libanus vnto isope yt groweth ye wall talked also catell foules wormes fiszshes came nacions heare ye wyszdome salomon came kynges ye earth herde wyszdome v chapter hiram ye kynge tyre sent seruauntes vnto salomon herde yt anoynted kynge father steade hiram warre aboute vntyll lorde delyuered vnder sol fete hath lorde god geuen rest euery syde aduersary ner euell hynderaunce beholde therfore aduysed buylde house vnto name lorde god acordinge lorde spake vnto dauid father sayde 〈◊〉 7 c thy sonne shal set vpon thy seate thy steade shal buylde house vnto name commaunde therfore hewe downe ceders libanus thy seruauntes seruauntes rewarde thy seruauntes wyll geue euer thou shalt axe thou knowest yt v mā hewe tymber sidonians whan hiram herde wordes salomon glad sayde praysed lorde daye hath geuen dauid wyse sonne ouer greate people hiram sent vnto salomon sayenge haue herde thou hast sent vnto wyl acordinge vnto thy desyre ceders pyne tree seruaūtes shall brynge downe libanus vnto ye see wyl make flote vpō see vnto place thou shalt shewe wyl cause aryue thou shalt make thē fetched thou shalt fulfyll desyre also geue fode vnto housholde folkes hirā gaue salomon ceders pyne tree acordinge desyre salomon gaue hiram twentye thousande quarter wheate eate housholde twētye quarter beaten oyle gaue salomon yearly vnto hiram lorde gaue salomon wyszdome acordynge sayde vnto peace betwene hiram salomon made couenaunt together salomon made outchosynge workman thorow israel ye outchosynge thirtie thousande mē sent thē mount libanus euery two monethes ten thousande one moneth vpon libanus two monethes home 3 4 12 c adoniram ouer outchosynge salomon thre score thousande ten bare burthen foure score thousande hewed tymber vpon mount besyde salomon chefe officer ordeyned ouer worke namely thre thousande thre hundreth ruled ye people laboured worke ye kynge commaunded shulde breake greate costly stone namely frestone foundacion house salomon mason hirams coastes hewed prepared tymbre stone buyldinge house vi chapter foure hundreth foure score yeare departinge child israel londe egipte2 par 3 act 7 f fourth yeare raigne salomon ouer israel moneth sif yt seconde moneth house buylded vnto lorde house kynge salomon buylded vnto ye lorde thre score cubytes lōge twenty cubytes brode thirtie cubites hye buylded ioh 10 c act 3 b 5 b porche temple twentye cubytes longe bredth house ten cubites brode house ye house made wyndowes might opened shut lyddes rounde aboute wall ye house buylded compase yt wente aboute temple quere made outwarde wall roūde aboute nether stacion fyue cubytes wyde ye myddest sixe cubites wyde thirde seuen cubites wyde layed balkes rounde aboute house touched ye wall house whan ye house buylded buylded whole outbroken stone yt herde nether hammer ner axe ner eny instrument yron whan house buyldinge righte syde myddes house dore yt might go vp myddest stacion turne grese myddest stacion vnto ye thirde thus buylded house fynished syled ye house aboue walles wt ceder wodd buylded galery also aboue vpon whole house fyue cubytes hye couered house ceder tymber worde lorde came vnto salomon sayde let house yt thou buyldest yf thou shalt walke myne ordinaunces acordinge lawes kepe cōmaundementes walke therin wyl stablyszshe worde ye • 7 b sayde vnto dauid thy father wyll dwell amonge childrē israel wil forsake people israel thus salomon buylded house fynished buylded walles insyde ceder tymber grounde ye house vnto rofe syled tymbre ynsyde ouerlayed floore ye house bordes pyne tre behynde house buylded wall ceder tymber twentye cubytes longe floore vnto rofe ynsyde buylded quere holy house temple quere fortye cubites longe ynsyde whole house ceder throwne knoppes floures stone sene quere prepared ynsyde house arke couenaunt lorde might set therin quere twentye cubites longe twentye cubytes brode twentye cubytes hye ouerlayed pure golde syled altare ceder salomon ouerlayed house ye ynsyde wt pure golde shot barres golde quere ouerlayed wt golde ye whole house layed ouer golde altare also ye quere ouerlayed golde 〈…〉 made also quere two cherubins ten cubites hye olyue tre one wynge ether cherub fyue cubytes edge one wynge edge wynge ten cubytes euen cherub ten cubites also cherub one measure one quantitie yt ether cherub ten cubites hye put cherubins within house cherubins spred forth wynges wynge one touched one wall cherub wynge touched wall myddes ye house one wynge •• uched another ouerlayed cherubins golde walles house rounde aboute caused make carued worke carued cherubins palme tree floures pauement house ouerlayed also goldē plate intraunce quere made two dores olyue thre fyue squared postes caused carued worke made therof cherubins palme tree floures ouerlayed plate golde made also intraunce temple foure squared postes olyue tre two dores pyne tre ether dore two syde dores one hāginge another made carued worke therof palme tree floures right appoynted buylded courte also within wt thre rowes fre stone one rowe playne ceder tymber fourth yeare moneth sif foundacion lordes house layed eleuenth yeare moneth bul eight moneth house fynished shulde seuen yeare buyldinge vii chapter bvt salomon buyldinge awne house thirtene yeare fynished namely buylded house wodd libanus hundreth cubites longe fiftye cubites wyde thirtie cubites hye fouresquared rowes pilers wt carued ceders rofe aboue syled also cederwodd vpon fyue fortie pilers one rowe fyftene pilers yt stode euer thre pilers one right ouer agaynst another euery space betwixte pilers one ouer agaynst another fouresquared pilers made porche pilers fiftye cubites longe thirtie cubites brode yet porche pilers wt greate poste made porche also vnto ye kynges seate wherin ye iudgment kepte made porche iudgment syled ceder pauement vnto pauement agayne owne house wherin dwelt ye back courte made betwene ye house porche like like vnto porche made house pharaos doughter 〈◊〉 3 salomon taken wife costly stone hewen ye measure cut sawes euery syde grounde vnto rofe without greate courte also foundacions costly greate stone ten eighte cubites greate costly fre stone theron acordinge ye measure ceders greate courte rounde aboute thre rowes fre stone one rowe playne ceders euen also courte ye houof lorde within porch house kynge salomon sent fetch one 〈◊〉 2 c hiram tyre wedowes sonne trybe nephtali father bene man tyre 〈…〉 connynge mā metall full wyszdome vnderstondinge knowlege worke maner metall worke whan came kynge salomon made worke 〈…〉 made two brasen pilers ether eightene cubites hye threde xij cubites measure aboute ye pilers made two knoppes brasse molten set aboue vpon pilers euery knoppe fyue cubytes hye euery knoppe aboue vpon ye pilers seuē wrythen rope like cheynes vpon euery knoppe made two rowes pomgranates rounde aboute one rope wherwith ye knoppe couered knoppes like rose ye porche foure cubites greate pomgranates rowes rounde aboute two hūdreth aboue beneth vpon rope wē te rounde aboute thicknes knoppe euery knoppe vpon pilers set vp pilers porche temple set right hande called iachin set lefte hande called boo stode aboue vpon pilers euen like rose thus worke ye pilers fynished made molten lauer ten cubytes wyde one syde rounde aboute fyue cubites hye threde thirtie cubites lōge ye measure rounde aboute aboute lauer cubites wyde wente knoppes edge therof rounde aboute lauer two rowes knoppes molten lauer stode vpon twolue bullockes wherof thre turned towarde north thre towarde west thre towarde south thre towarde east lauer aboue theron hynder partes within vnder lauer wherof thicknesse handbreth edge like edge cuppe floured rose conteyned two thousande bat ••• certayn • measur • liqu •• battes made ten brasen seates euery one foure cubites longe brode thre cubites hye seate made sydes betwene ledge sydes betwene ledge lyon bullockes cherubins ye ledge aboue beneth lyon bullockes sydes made set downwardes euery stole foure brasen wheles brasen axeltrees vpon foure corner proppes molten euery one ouer agaynst another vnderset vnto kettell soket vpon stole cubyte hye rounde cubyte halfe wyde soket knoppes foldes foure squared rounde foure wheles stode beneth sydes axeltrees wheles harde ye seate euery whele cubite halfe hye wheles like cart wheles axeltrees spoke nales shaftes molten foure proppes vpō foure corner euery seate harde seate soket aboue vpon seate cubyte halfe rounde aboute ledge sydes harde seate plat sydes ledge caused carue cherubins lyon palme tree one another rounde aboute theron maner made heten moltē seates one maner measure widenes made ten copper kettels one kettell cōteyned fortye battes foure cubites greate vpon euery seate kettell fyue seates set righte syde house fyue lefte syde lauer set righte hande towarde south hiram made pottes also shouels basens fynished worke kynge salomon caused made house lorde namely ye two pilers rounde knoppes aboue vpon two pilers two wrythen rope couer two rounde knoppes vpon pilers foure hūdreth pomgranates two wrythen rope euer two rowes pomgranates vnto euery rope couer two rounde knoppes vpon pilers ten seates ten kettels theron lauer twolue bullockes vnder ye lauer pottes shouels basens ornamentes hiram made vnto kynge salomon house lorde pure metall countre iordane caused kynge molten thicke earth betwene sucoth zarthan salomon let apparell vnweyed metall moch morouer salomon made apperell belonged vnto house lorde namely golden altare golden table shewbred laye fyue candelstickes righte hande fyue candelstickes lefte quere pure golde wt floures lampes snoffers golde therto flat peces charge basens spones censours pure golde hokes ye dores insyde house holy dores house tēple lorde golde thus worke kynge salomon made ye house lorde fynisshed • par 5 salomon brought father dauid sanctified syluer golde ornamentes layed amonge treasure house lorde viii chapter gathered kynge salomon ye elder israel together ruler trybes prynces father amonge child israel broughte vp tabernacle witnesse ornamentes sanctuary tabernacle dyd prestes leuites kynge salomon congregacion israel yt gathered vnto wente arke offred shepe bullockes many coulde nombred ner tolde prestes broughte arke lordes couenaunt vnto hir place euen ye quere house holy vnder ye wynges cherubins ye cherubins spred wynges place arke stode couered arke staues therof aboue staues lōge ye knoppes sene sanctuary ye quere outsyde sene vnto daye arke nothinge onely two table stone 〈…〉 moses layed therin horeb whan ye lorde made couenaunt child israel tyme departed londe egipte whan buylde house vn name lorde god israel neuertheles lorde sayde vnto father dauid thou wast mynded buylde house vnto name thou hast done well thou art aduysed howbeit thou shalt buylde house thy sonne shal come thy loynes shal buylde house vn name lorde hath perfourmed worde spake come vp father dauids steade syt vpon seate israel lorde sayde haue buylded house vnto name lorde god israel haue ordeyned place arke wherin lordes couenaunt made oure father whan broughte ye londe egipte salomon stode altare lorde presence whole congregacion israel helde handes towarde heauen sayde 〈…〉 lorde god israel god like nether aboue heauen ner beneth vpō earth thou kepest couenaūt mercy thy seruauntes walke ye hert thou hast kepte promes father dauid thy seruaunt thy mouth thou saydest thy hande hast thou fulfylled come passe daye lorde god israel make good vnto father dauid ye seruaunt thou hast promysed sayde 〈…〉 thou shalt wante man syt vpon seate israel yf thy childrē kepe waye yt walke like thou hast walked thou god israel let ye worde verified thou hast promysed vnto father dauid thy seruaunt thynkest thou yt god dwelleth vpon earth 〈…〉 beholde heauens heauens heauens maye contayne
