wherof thou saydest 〈…〉 name shall dwell thou mayest heare prayer thy seruaūt maketh place heare intercession ye seruaunt thy people israel shall make place thy habitacion heauen whan thou hearest gracious whan eny mā synneth agaynst neghboure 〈…〉 〈◊〉 22 b taketh vpon ooth wherwith byndeth himselfe ye ooth commeth thine altare house heare thou heauē se thy seruauntes haue right condemne vngodly brynge waye vpon owne heade iustifie righteous geue acordinge righteousnes • eu • 0 whan thy people israel smytten enemy whyle haue synned agaynst yf turne vnto knowlege thy name make prayer intercession vnto house thē heare thou heauen mercifull vnto synne thy people israel brynge agayne londe yt thou hast geuen vnto father • 1 • whan heauen shut vp yt rayneth moch haue synned agaynst yf make prayer place knowlege thy name turne synnes whā thou troublest heare thou heauen mercifull vnto synnes thy seruauntes thy people israel thou mayest shewe good waye wherin shulde walke let rayne vpon londe thou hast geuen thy people inheritaunce whan derth pestilence drouth burnynge greshopper catirpiller londe whan enemye layeth lege porte londe whan eny plage disease happeneth euer maketh prayer peticion esa 36 b whether eny men thy people israel thē aware plage euery one hert spredeth handes vnto house heare thou heauen seate thou dwellest mercifull se thou geue euery one acordinge hath walked like thou knowest hert thou onely knowest hert child men maye allwaye feare longe lyue lande thou hast geuen vnto oure father ioh 12 e acto • c whan eny straunger thy people israel commeth farre countre thy name sake shall heare thy greate name thy mightie hāde thy outstretched arme commeth make prayer house heare thou heauen euen seate thy dwellynge straunger calleth vpon nacions vpon earth maye knowe thy name maye feare thy people israel maye knowe house haue buylded named thy name whan thy people go forth battayll agaynst enemyes waye thou shalt sende dan 6 b shall praye vnto lorde towarde waye cite thou hast chosen towarde house haue buylded vnto thy name heare thou prayer peticion heauen execute iudgment whan synne agaynst • cle 7 c • oh 1 b mā synneth thou wroth delyuer thē vnto enemyes cary awaye captyue enemyes londe farre nye yf remembre selues londe captyue turne make intercession vnto londe captyuite saye haue synned done amysse haue bene vngodly turne vnto ye hert soule lōde enemy led awaye captyue make prayer vnto towarde waye londe thou hast geuen vnto father euen towarde cite thou hast chosen towarde house haue buylded vnto thy name heare thou prayer supplicacion heauen •• o 9 b seate thy dwellynge execute iudgment mercifull vnto thy people haue synned agaynst vnto trespaces wherwith haue transgressed agaynst • sd 1 graunte thē mercy sighte led awaye presonners enemyes maye mercyfull vnto thy people thyne enheritaunce thou broughtest egipte yron fornace thine eye maye open vnto peticion thy seruaunt thy people israel thou maiest heare thinges shall call vpon 〈◊〉 19 thou lorde lorde hast sundered inheritaunce vnto thy selfe amōge nacions vpon earth acordinge thou saydest moses thy seruaunt whan thou broughtest seate yuery ouerlayed ye precious golde seate sixe steppe ye heade seate roūde behynde two postes leane vpō sydes seate two lyon stode vpon leanynge postes twolue lyon stode vpon sixe steppe sydes soch one hath bene made eny kyngdome kynge salomōs drynkynge vessel golde vessel house ye wod libanus pure golde also syluer regarded salomon tyme kynges seeshippe yt sayled vpon see ye shippe hiram came thre yeare broughte golde syluer yuery ape pecockes 〈…〉 thus kynge salomon greater rich wyszdome kynges vpō earth worlde desyred se salomon mighte heare wyszdome god gaue hert broughte yearly euery man present vessel syluer golde rayment harnesse spyces horse mule salomon broughte charettes horsmen together thousande foure hundreth charettes twolue thousande horsmen put ye charet city kynge ierusalem kynge broughte passe moch syluer ierusalē stone many ceders wylde figge tree valley salomōs horse broughte egipte frō kena kynges marchauntes fetched kena money charet came vp egipte sixe hūdreth sycles syluer horse hūdreth fyftye thus brought also vnto kynges hethites kynges siria handes xi chapter bvt kynge salomon loued many landish wemen 〈…〉 pharaos doughter wemen moab ammō edom sidon heth euen nacions lorde spake vnto child israel go ye vnto 〈…〉 let come vnto shal surely bowe youre hertes goddes vnto dyd salomon enclyne affeccion seuen hundreth wemen wyues thre hundreth concubynes wyues turned hert asyde whan olde wyues bowed hert straunge goddes hert whole lorde god hert dauid father salomon walked asta • oth god sidonians malcom abhominacion ammonite salomon dyd yt displeased lorde folowed ye lorde ye vttemost dyd father dauid thē buylded salomō hie place vnto chamos abhominaciō ye moabites vpon mount lyeth ierusalē vnto moloch abhominacion ammunites thus dyd salomon outlādish wyues brent incense offred vnto goddes lorde wroth salomon hert turned asyde ye lorde god israel 〈…〉 two tymes appeared vnto cō maunded shulde walke goddes yet kepte lorde commaunded therfore sayde lorde vnto salomon moch done hast kepte couenaunt myne ordinaunces commaunded therfore wyll also plucke thy kyngdome geue vnto thy seruaunt neruertheles ye tyme thy father dauids sake hande thy sonne wyl plucke howbeit wyl plucke ye kyngdome cleane awaye one trybe wyll geue vnto thy sonne dauid seruauntes sake ierusalems sake haue chosen lorde raysed vp aduersary vnto salomon euen hadad edomite kynges sede edom whan dauid edom ioab chefe captayne wente vp bury slayne smote male edom ioab remayned sixe monethes israel tyl roted ye male edom fled hadad certayne men ye moabites father seruauntes hadad yonge man gat vp fro madian came vnto paran toke men paran came egipte vnto pharao kynge egipte gaue house certayne vytales appoynted gaue countre adad founde greate fauoure sighte pharao gaue wife euen sister owne wife thaphenes quene thaphenes sister bare genubath sonne thaphenes norished vp pharaos house moch genubath pharaos house amonge pharaos child whā hadad herde egipte dauid fallē slepte father yt ioab chefe captayne deed sayde vnto pharao let go countre pharao sayde vnto lackest thou thou wilt go thy countre sayde nothynge yet let go god raysed vp another aduersary also one reson sonne el iada fled lorde hadad eser kynge zeba gathered men agaynst captayne men warre whan dauid slewe wente vnto damascus dwelt reigned damascus israel aduersary lō ge salomon lyued harme yt hadad suffred therfore euell israel kynge ouer israel morouer ieroboam sonne nebatan ephraite salomon seruaunt mother name zeruga wedowe lifte vp hande also agaynst kynge cause wherfore lifte vp hande agaynst kynge whan salomon buylded millo shut vp gappe cite dauid father ieroboam mā armes whan salomon sawe mete yonge man set ouer burthen house ioseph tyme fortuned ieroboam wente ierusalem prophet ahias silo founde h • waye new cloke vpon two alone felde ahia toke holde new cloke yt rente twolue peces sayde vnto ieroboam take thou ten peces vnto thus sayeth lorde god israel beholde euen thus wyll rente kyngdome hande salomō wyll geue ten trybes one trybe shall haue seruaunt dauids sake cyte ierusalem 2 par 7 • haue chosen trybes israel haue forsaken worshipped astaroth god sidonians chamos god moabites malcō god child ammon haue walked wayes fulfill pleasure myne ordinaunces lawes dyd dauid father notwithstondynge wyll take whole kyngdome hande wil make prynce longe helyueth seruaunt dauids sake dyd chose kepte commaundementes ordinaunces3 12 c hande sonne wyl take kyngdome wyl geue ten trybes vnto one vnto sonne 3 15 psal 131 b dauid seruaunt maye allwaye haue lanterne cite ierusalem haue chosen maye set name therfore wyl take raygne ouer thine hert desyreth thou shalt kynge ouer israel yf thou folowe shall commaunde walke wayes fulfill pleasure kepe myne ordinaunces commaundementes dyd seruaūt dauid wyll buylde sure house buylded vnto dauid wyl geue israel vnto therwith wyll subdue sede dauid euermore salomon soughte kyll ieroboam ieroboam gat vp fled egipte sisak kynge egipte remayned egipte tyll salomon dyed saye salomon dyd wyszdome wrytten cronicles salomon tyme salomon kynge ierusalem ouer israel fortye yeare salomon fell slepe father buryed cite dauid father roboam sonne kynge steade xii chapter roboam wēte vnto sichem israel come sichem make kynge2 pa 10 whan ieroboam ye sonne nebat herde yet egipte 3 11 g whither fled salomon came agayne egipte sent called ieroboam congregacion israel came spake roboam sayde thy father made oure yock harde therfore make thou harde bondage sore yock lighter wyll submytte oure selues vnto sayde vnto go youre waye vnto thirde daye come agayne people wē te waye roboam kynge helde councell elder stode salomō father whyle lyued sayde youre councell maye geue people answere sayde vnto yf thou people pleasure daye folowe mynde heare geue good wordes shal obedient vnto longe thou liuest neuertheles forsoke councell ye elder geuen axed councell yonge men growne vp stode sayde vnto youre councell maye answere people haue sayde vnto make yock lighter thy father hath layed vpō v yonge men growne vp sayde vnto people haue sayde vnto thy father hath made oure yock sore make thou easyer v thus shalt thou saye vnto them▪ litle fynger shall thicker father loynes father layed sore yock vpon wyl yet laye theron father correcte scourge wyl nourtoure scorpion vpon thyrde daye came ieroboam people vnto roboam ye kynge appoynted saide come agayne thyrde daye kynge gaue people harde rough answere forsoke coūcell elder geuen talked councell yonge men sayde father made youre yock sore wyll make yet sorer vpon father correcte scourge wil nourtoure scorpiōs thus kynge folowed people mynde turned frō lorde mighte stablish worde 〈…〉 spake ahias silo vnto ieroboam sonne nebat whan israel sawe kynge wolde heare people gaue ye kynge answere • sayde 〈…〉 porcion haue dauid inheritaunce sonne isai get thy tentes israel loke thou thy house thou dauid israel wente vnto tentes roboam raigned ouer ye child israel dwelt city iuda whan kynge roboam sent thither adoram rentgatherer israel stoned death kynge roboam strengthed himselfe gat vp charet fle vnto ierusalem thus departed israel house dauid vnto daye whan israel herde ieroboam come againe sent call whole congregacion made kynge ouer israel man folowed house dauid saue onely tribe iuda 〈…〉 whan roboam came ierusalem house iuda trybe ben iamin euen hundreth foure score thousande chosen men armes gathered themselues together fight ye house israel brynge kyngdome agayne vnto roboam ye sonne salomō worde god came semeia man god sayde speake thou roboam sonne salomon kynge iuda ye house iuda ben iamin people saye thus sayeth lorde ye shall go vp fighte agaynst youre brother child israel let euery man go home agayne dede herkened vnto worde lorde turned back go waye lorde sayde roboam buylded sichem vpon mount ephraim dwelt therin departed thence buylded 〈…〉 penuel ieroboā thoughte hert kingdome shall fall agayne vnto house dauid yf people go vp offre lordes house ierusalem shall hert people turne lorde roboam kynge iuda thē shal slaye fall agayne roboam kynge iuda kynge helde councell 〈…〉 made two golden calues sayde vn • moch go ierusalē beholde 〈◊〉 32 b thy god israel broughte ye egipte one set bethel dan dede turned synne people wente one vnto dan made house also hye place 〈◊〉 3 〈◊〉 • 7 g made prestes smallest people childrē leui vpon fiftene daye eighte moneth made holy daye like solempne feast iuda offered vpon altare thus dyd bethel doynge sacrifice vnto calues made bethel ordeyned prestes hye place made offred vpon altar made bethel fiftene daye eight moneth inuented owne hert made child israel holy daye wente vp altare burne incense xiii chapter beholde came mā god iuda thorow worde lorde vnto bethel ieroboam stode altar burne incense cried agaynst altare thorow worde lorde sayde altar altar thus sayeth lorde beholde shal borne vnto ye house dauid sonne iosias name • 3 • shal offer prestes hye place burne incense vpon men bone shal burne gaue wonder token daye sayde token lorde hath spoken beholde altar shall ryue aszshes theron shall poured whan kynge herde worde man god cried agaynst altare bethel stretched hande ye altare sayde laye hondes hande stretched wythered coulde drawe vnto agayne ye altare roue aszshes poured altare acordinge wonder token man god geuen worde lorde kynge answered sayde vnto man god exod • b 9 f 10 c num 21 b act 8 c praye face lorde thy god make intercession hande maie restored vnto agayne prayed man god vnto face lorde kynges hande restored agayne became afore kynge sayde vnto man god come home dyne wil geue rewarde man god sayde vnto kynge yf thou geuest halfe thy house wil come place wyll nether eate bred ner drynke water thus commaunded thus sayde vnto worde lorde thou shalt eate bred drynke water nether returne waye thou wentest departed another waye returned agayne waye came bethel bethel dwelt olde prophet vnto whō sonnes came tolde workes yt mā god done daye bethel wordes spoken vnto kynge father sayde vnto waye gone sonnes shewed waye man god gone came iuda sayde vnto sonnes saddell asse whā sad led asse rode theron wente man god founde syttinge vnder oke tre sayde vnto art thou man god came iuda sayde yee sayde vnto come home eate bred sayde maye turne backe come nether wyll eate bred ner drynke water place spoken vnto worde lorde thou shalt nether eate bred ner yet drynke water nether shalt thou go agayne waye thou wentest sayde vnto myselfe prophet well thou angell hath spoken ye worde lorde saide bringe againe maye eate bred drynke water lyed vnto broughte agayne ate bred dranke water house whan sat table worde lorde came prophet broughte agayne cryed vnto man come frō iuda sayde thus sayeth lorde thou hast bene dishobedient vnto mouth ye lorde hast kepte commaundement lorde thy god commaunded hast turned backe hast eaten bred dronke water ye place wherof saide vnto thou shalt nether eate bred ner drynke water therfore shall thy body come thy father graue whan eaten bred dronkē asse sadled vnto prophet brought agayne3 20 f whā gone lyon founde waye slewe body cast ye waye asse stode lyon stode body whā men wente sawe body cast waye lyon stondynge besyde body came tolde cite olde prophet dwelt whan prophet broughte agayne herde sayde man god hath bene dishobediēt vn mouth lorde therfore hath ye lorde delyuered vnto lyon hath rente slayne acordynge worde lorde spake vnto sayde vnto sonnes saddell asse whan sadled wente founde body cast waie asse lyon stondynge beside ye body lyon eatē nothinge body nether torne asse toke prophet deed coarse man god layed vpō asse broughte agayne cite olde prophet mourne burye layed coarse awne graue mourned ala brother whan buryed saide vnto sonnes whan dye burye graue mā god buried laye bone besyde bone 4 24 shal come passe cried thorow worde lorde bethel agaynst ye house hye place city samaria howbeit acte dyd ieroboā turne euell waye peruerted made prestes hye place euē smallest people loke pleased handes fylled prest hye place turned synne vnto house ieroboā destroye brynge naughte xiiii chapter tyme abia sonne ieroboam sicke ieroboam saide vnto wyfe get vp disguise man perceaue thou art ieroboams wyfe go vnto silo beholde prophet ahias 〈…〉 promysed yt shulde kynge ouer people take ten loaues bred cake cuppe hony go maye tell shal go wt childe ieroboams wyfe gat hir vp wente vnto silo came house ahias ahias coulde se eye dymme age neuerthelesse lorde sayde vnto ahias beholde ieroboams wyfe commeth axe matter hir sonne sycke speake thou therfore vnto thus thus whan came shewed hirselfe straunge whan ahias herde noyse hir fete goynge dore saide come thou wyfe ieroboā shewest thou thy selfe straunge sent vnto ye harde messaunger go thy waye tell ieroboam thus sayeth ye lorde god israel 〈…〉 haue exalted amonge people set prynce ouer people israel haue rente kyngdome house dauid geuen thou hast bene seruaunt dauid kepte commaundemētes walked hert onely ye thinge righte sighte thou hast done worse haue bene thou hast gone thy waye made goddes molten ymages prouoke vnto wrath hast cast behynde thy backe beholde therfore wil brynge mysfortune vpon house ieroboam wyl rote ieroboam euē maketh water agaynst wall presoner forsaken israel posterite ye house ieroboam wyll swepe donge swepte tyll cleane broughte naught 〈…〉 dieth ieroboam cite dogges shal eate vp yt dyeth felde shall foules aire eat vp lorde hath spoken get vp therfore go home whan thy fete enter ye cite childe shal dye israel shal bewayle burye onely ieroboam shal come graue good founde lorde god israel ieroboams house 〈◊〉 15 c lorde shall rayse vp kynge shal rote ye house ieroboam daie yt hande ready lorde shal smyte israel like rede moued water shal rote israel good londe gaue vnto father shal scater beyonde water haue made groues prouoke lorde vnto wrath israel shall geuen ouer synne ieroboam hath synned selfe made israel synne ieroboams wife gat vp wente hir waye came vnto thirza whan came vpō thresholde house ye childe dyed buried israel made lamentacion 〈◊〉 14 c acordinge ye worde lorde spake seruaunt ahia ye prophet 〈…〉 saye ieroboam foughte raigned beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel tyme ieroboam raigned two twentye yeare slepte father nadab sonne kynge steade roboam ye sonne salomon kynge iuda 〈◊〉 12 c one fortye yeare olde roboam whā made kynge seuentene yeare raigned ierusalem cite yt lorde chosen ye trybes israel set name mother name naemaan ammonitisse iuda dyd yt displeased lorde prouoked indignacion thē yt father done wt synnes dyd likewyse buylded hye place pilers groues vpō euery hye hill amonge grene tree whoremōgers also dyd ye abhominaciōs ye heythē ye lorde droue child israel 〈◊〉 12 ye fifth yeare kynge roboam wēte sisack ye kynge egipte vp agaynst ierusalem toke treasure ye house lorde kynges house mighte gotten toke shyldes golde 〈◊〉 1 • c 〈◊〉 9 b salomon caused made steade wherof ye kynge roboam caused make shyldes stele commytted vnder handes chefe fotemen kepte dore kynges house oft kynge wente ye house lorde fote men bare brought agayne fote men chamber saye roboam dyd beholde wrytten cronicles kynges iuda betwene roboam ieroboam warre longe lyued 2 par 12 sonne manteyned ierusalem dauid dyd thinge yt righte ye sighte lorde departed commaunded longe lyued sauynge matter 2 11 vrias ye hethite warre betwene roboam ieroboam longe lyued saye abia dyd
