reigned one fortye yeare ierusalem graund mother name maecha doughter abisalom asa dyd righte sighte lorde dyd father dauid remoued ye 3 22 g remongers londe put downe idol father made 2 par 15 put mother mynistracion made vnto miplezeth ye groue asa roted hir miplezeth brent broke cedron hye place put downe yet hert asa perfecte lorde longe lyued syluer golde vessel father halowed soch sanctified vnto ye house lorde broughte warre betwene asa baesa kynge israel longe lyued baesa kynge israel wente vp agaynst iuda • par 16 buylded rama man shulde go asas syde kynge iuda toke asa syluer golde lefte treasure house lorde treasure kynges house delyuered seruauntes handes sent vnto • 10▪ benadab sonne tabrimon sonne hesion kynge siria dwelt damascon let saye vnto couenaunt betwene betwene father thy father therfore sende present syluer golde thou shuldest breake couenaunt thou hast baesa kynge israel maye departe fro benadab agreed vnto kynge asa sent captaynes agaynst city israel smote iion dan abel beth maecha cineroth whole londe nephtali whā baesa herde left buyldinge rama wente agayne vnto thirza kynge asa caused proclamed iuda man excepte toke awaye stone tymber rama wherwith baesa buylded kynge asa buylded geba ben iamin mispa therwith saye asa power dyd ye city buylded beholde wrytten cronicles kynges iuda sauynge olde age diseased fete asa slepte father buried father cite dauid father 2 par 17 iosaphat sonne kynge steade nadab sonne ieroboam kynge ouer israel secōde yeare asa kynge iuda raigned ouer israel two yeare dyd euell sighte lorde walked waye father synnes wherwith made israel synne howbeit baesa sonne ahia house isachar conspired agaynst smote gibbethon philistynes nadab israel layed sege gibbethon baesa slewe thirde yeare asa kynge iuda kynge steade 〈…〉 whan kynge smote house ieroboam let nothinge ieroboam remayne breth tyll destroyed acordynge ye worde lorde spake seruaunt ahia silo ieroboams synnes dyd made israel synne withall euen ye prouokynge wherwith displeased lorde god israel saye nadab dyd beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel warre betwene asa baesa kynge israel longe lyued thirde yeare asa kynge iuda baesa ye sonne ahia kynge ouer israel thirza foure twentye yeare dyd euell sighte lorde walked waye ieroboam synnes wherwith made israel synne neuertheles worde lorde came vnto iehu sonne hanani agaynst baesa sayde moch lifted dust made prynce ouer people israel thou walkest waye ieroboam makest people ouer israel synne prouoke vnto wrath thorow synnes beholde therfore wyll take awaye posterite beasa posterite house wyll set thine house euen house ieroboam sonne nebat 〈…〉 baesa dyeth cite dogges shal deuoure beynge dyeth felde foules ayre shall eate vp saye baesa dyd power beholde wrytten ye cronicles kynges israel baesa slepte father buried thirza sonne ella kynge steade worde ye lorde came prophet iehu sonne hanani ouer baesa ouer house agaynst euell dyd sighte ye lorde prouoke vnto wrath thorow workes handes became house ieroboam slewe 〈…〉 man xvi chapter sixe twentieth yeare asa kynge iuda ella sonne baesa kynge ouer israel thirza two yeare neuertheles seruaunt simri ye principall man ouer halfe ye charettes cōspyred ella thirza dranke dronkē ye house arza ruler thirza simri came slewe seuen twentieth yeare asa kynge iuda kynge steade 〈…〉 whan kynge sat vpon seate smote house baesa lefte moch one make water agaynst ye wall bloud auengers also frendes 〈…〉 thus dyd simri destroye house baesa acordinge worde lorde spake ouer baesa prophet iehu synnes baesa ella sonne dyd made israel synne prouoke lorde god israel vnto wrath thorow vanity saye ella dyd beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel seuen twentieth yeare asa kynge iuda simri kynge vij dayes thirza people laye gibbethon philistynes whan people hoost herde saye yt simri conspired slayne kynge israel daye made amri chefe captayne kynge ouer hoost amri wente vp israel gibbethon layed sege vnto thirza • 9 f whan simri sawe yt cite shulde wonne wente palace kynges house brent ye kynges house dyed synnes committed dyd euell sighte lorde walked waye ieroboam synnes dyd wherwith made israel synne saye simri conspired beholde wrytten ye cronicles kynges israel tyme ye people deuyded two partes one parte helde thibni sonne ginath might make kynge halfe helde amri people helde amri mightier people helde thibni ye sonne ginath thibni dyed amri kynge ye one thirtieth yeare asa kynge iuda amri kynge ouer israel twolue yeares raigned thirza sixe yeares boughte mount samaria semer two hundreth weight syluer buylded vpon mount called cite buylded ye name semer ye owner ye mount samaria amri dyd euell ye sighte lorde worse walked ye wayes ieroboam ye sonne nebat synnes wherwith made israel synne prouoked lorde god israel vnto wrath vanity saye amri dyd power exercysed beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel amri slepte father buried samaria achab sonne kynge steade eight thirtieth yeare asa kynge iuda achab sonne amri kynge ouer israel raigned ouer israel samaria two twentie yeare dyd euell sighte lorde thē yt thoughte small matter walke synnes ieroboam sonne nebat deut 7 toke iesabel doughter eth baal kynge sidon wife wente serued baal worshiped vnto baal set vp altare baal house buylded samaria made groue achab dyd prouoke god israel vnto wrath kynges yt israel ye tyme dyd hiel bethel buylde iericho iosu 6 e cost first sonne abiram yt layed ye foundacion yongest sonne segub yt set vp porte acordinge worde lorde spake iosua sonne nun xvii chapter elia ye theszbite one inhabiters gilead saide vnto achab 3 18 f 4 3 c iacob 5 c luc 4 c truly lorde god israel lyueth whose seruaunt shal nether rayne ner dew come yeare excepte speake worde lorde came vnto sayde get hence turne towarde east hyde bythe ryuer crith ouer agaynst iordane thou shalt drynke ryuer haue commaunded rauens shal fede departed dyd acordinge worde lorde wente waye sat downe ryuer crith ouer agaynst iordane rauēs broughte bred flesh mornynge euenynge dranke ryuer fortuned cerayne dayes riuer dryed vp rayne lōde came ye worde ye lorde vnto sayde 〈◊〉 4 c get ye vp go vnto sarepta lieth sidō haue commaunded wedowe make prouysion gat vp wente vnto sarepta whan came gate ye cite beholde wedowe gathered stickes called sayde fetch litle water vessell yt maye drinke goinge fetch cried vnto sayde brynge morsell bred also thine hande sayde truly lorde ye god lyueth haue bred handfull floure pitcher curtesy oyle cruse beholde haue gathered vp one two stickes wyll go prepare sonne maye eate dye elia sayde vnto feare go thy waye thou hast sayde yet make first morsell bred therof brynge forth afterwarde shalt thou make ye thy sonne thus sayeth ye lorde god israel meell pitcher shall spent oyle ye cruse shall fayll vnto daye yt lorde shal cause rayne vpō earth wente dyd elia sayde ate also hir house certayne season meel pitcher mynished oyle cruse fayled acordinge worde ye lorde spake elia actes sonne wife ye house sicke sicknes exceadinge sore remayned breth sayde vnto elia haue thou man god art thou come vnto yt synne shulde kepte remembraunce sonne shulde slayne sayde vnto geue thy sonne toke frō hir lappe caried vp ye chamber himselfe dwelt layed vpō bed called vpon lorde sayde lorde god hast thou dealt euell wt wedow dwell yt thou woldest slaye hir sonne eccli 48 stretched selfe ouer childe thre tymes called vpon lorde saide lorde god let soule childe come agayne lorde herde voyce elia soule childe came agayne vnto reuyued elia toke childe broughte downe chamber house delyuered vnto mother sayde beholde thy sonne lyueth woman sayde vnto elia knowe thou man god worde lorde thy mouth trueth xviii chapter longe season came ye worde lorde vnto elia thirde yeare sayde 〈…〉 go thy waye shewe ye selfe vnto achab yt maye cause rayne vpon earth elia wente shewe selfe vnto achab greate derth ī samaria achab called abdia chefe officer abdia feared ye lorde greatly whā iesabel roted ye prophetes ye lorde abdia toke c prophetes hyd caues fiftye fiftye prouyded wt bred water achab sayde vnto abdia go thorow londe vnto welles water ryuers yf happlye maye finde hay saue ye horse mule yt catell perishe parted thē selues londe go thorow achab departed one waye alone abdia ye waye alone whan abdia ye waye elia met whan knewe fell downe vpon face sayde art thou lorde elia sayde yee go thy waye tell ye lorde beholde elia sayde haue offended thou wilt delyuer thy seruaunt handes achab maye slaye truly lorde thy god lyueth people ner kingdome lorde hath sent thither seke whan sayde toke ooth kyngdome nacion founde thou sayest go tell ye lorde beholde elia whan gone sprete lorde shulde take ye awaye tell whither yf came tolde achab founde shulde slaye thy seruaunt feareth lorde youth vp hath bene tolde lorde dyd whan iesabel slewe prophetes lorde hyd hundreth lordes prophetes fiftye fiftye caues prouyded bred water thou sayest go thy waye tell thy lorde elia maye slaye elia saide truly ye lorde zebaoth lyueth stōde wil shewe selfe vnto daye wēte abdia mete achab tolde achab wēte mete elia whan achab sawe elia achab sayde vnto art thou troublest israel sayde trouble israel 〈◊〉 4 c thou thy father house ye haue forsaken commaundementes lorde walke baal go sende forth gather israel together vnto mount carmell foure hundreth fiftye prophetes baal foure hundreth prophetes ye groue eate iesabels table achab sent vnto child israel gathered prophetes together vnto mount carmell stepte elia vnto people sayde longe halte ye ye sydes yf lorde god thē walke yf baal thē folowe people gaue answere thē sayde elia vnto people onely lefte prophet ye lorde baal prophetes foure c fiftie mē geue v two bullockes let chose one bullocke hewe peces laye vpō wod put fyre theron wil take ye bullock laye vpō wod put fyre theron also call ye vpō name yor god wil call vpō name lorde loke god answereth fyre let god people answered sayde righte elia sayde vnto baal prophetes chose ye one bullock ye first ye many call ye vpon name youre god laye fyre theron toke bullock gaue prepared called vpon name baal mornynge vntyll noone daye sayde baal heare v nether voyce ner answere hopped aboute altare vse whan noone daye elia mocked sayde crye loude god peraduēture musynge hath somwhat gone iourneye happlye slepeth wolde waked vp cried loude prouoked thē selues knyues botkens maner tyll ye bloude folowed whan ye noone daye past prophecied vntyll tyme meat offerynge shulde offered nether voyce ner answere ner one regarde sayde elia vnto people come hither ye people vnto whan ye people came repayred ye • 14 c altare lorde yt broken iosu 4 b toke twolue stone acordinge nombre ye trybes childrē iacob vnto worde lorde spake sayde gen 3 35 thy name shal israel ye stone buylded altare name lorde made pytt rounde aboute altare like two forowes corne londe prepared wod hewed ye bullock peces layed vpon wod sayde fetch foure pitcher full water poured vpō burnt offerynge vpon wod sayde yet dyd agayne sayde ye thirde tyme dyd thirde tyme ye water ranne aboute altare ye pytt full water also whan tyme offer ye meat offerynge elia stepte forth sayde lorde god abraham isaac israel let knowne daye thou art god israel thy seruaunt haue done acordinge vnto ye worde heare lorde heare yt people maye knowe thou art lorde god thou mayest afterwarde turne hertes iud 6 eccli▪ 4 • 2 mac 1 fell downe fyre lorde consumed burnt offeringe wodd stone earth licked vp water pytt whan people sawe fell vpon face sayde lorde god ye lorde god elia sayde vnto deut 12 • 17 b laye handes vpon baal prophetes yt none escape toke elia broughte downe vnto ye broke cyson slewe thē elia sayde vnto achab go vp eate drynke soundeth though wolde rayne sore whan achab wēte vp eate drinke elia ascēded vp toppe carmel bowed selfe downe earth put heade betwene knee sayde vnto lad go vp loke towarde see wente vp loked sayde nothinge sayde go agayne seuen tymes seuēth tyme sayde beholde goeth vp litle cloude see like man hande sayde go vp saie vnto achab bynde ye charet go downe yt rayne ouertake mā coulde turne heauen blacke wt cloudes wynde came greate rayne achab rode waie departed vnto iesrael hāde ye lorde came vpō elia gyrde loynes ranne achab tyll came vnto iesrael xix chapter achab tolde iesabel yt elia done slayne baal prophetes wt swerde thē sent iesabel messaunger vnto elia sayenge goddes vnto yf tomorow aboute tyme make thy soule one afrayed gat vp wente wolde came vnto berseba iuda lefte lad selfe wente day iourney ye wyldernes came sat downe vnder iuniper tre wyszshed vnto soule yt mighte dye sayde ynough lorde take soule better father layed downe slepte vnder iuniper tre beholde ye angell touched sayde vnto stonde vp eate loked aboute beholde heade bred baken cole cruse wt water whan eaten dronkē layed downe agayne slepe ye angell lorde came agayne seconde tyme touched sayde stonde vp eate thou hast greate waye go arose ate drāke wente thorow strength meate • xo 34 • att 4 fortye dayes fortye nightes euē vnto horeb ye mount god came caue abode nighte beholde worde lorde came sayde vnto doest thou elia sayde haue bene zelous lorde god zebaoth child israel haue forsaken thy couenaunt broken downe thine altares slayne thy prophetes swerde lefte onely seke take awaye life sayde go forth stonde vpon mount lorde beholde lorde wēte ouer greate mightie wynde roue mountaynes brake harde stone came lorde lorde wynde wynde came earthquake lorde earthquake earth quake came fyre lorde fyre fyre came styll softe hyssinge whan elia herde couered face cloke wente forth stode dore caue beholde came voyce vnto sayde hast thou elia sayde haue bene zelous lorde god zebaoth 〈…〉 child israel haue forsakē thy couenaunt broken downe thine altares slayne ye prophetes wt theswerde onely lefte seke take awaye life lorde sayde vnto go ye waye agayne thorow wyldernes vnto damascon go 〈…〉 anoynte hasael kynge ouer siria 〈…〉 iehu sonne nimsi kynge ouer israel eliseus ye sonne saphat abel mehola prophet ye steade shal come passe yt escapeth swerde hasael iehu shall slaye escapeth ye swerde iehu eliseus shal slaye 〈…〉 wil reserue vnto vijm men israel namely ye knee haue bowed thē selues vnto baal euery mouth yt hath kyssed departed thence founde elizeus ye sonne saphat plowinge wt twolue yocke ox himselfe amōge twolue elia wēte vnto cast cloke vpon lefte ox ranne elia sayde 〈…〉 let kysse father mother wil folowe sayde vnto go thy waye come agayne haue ranne agayne toke yock ox offred sod ye flesh wod ox plowes gaue vnto people eate gat vp folowed elia mynistred vnto xx chapter 〈…〉 benadab ye kynge siria gathered power two thirtie kynges wt horse charettes wente vp layed sege vnto samaria foughte agaynst sent messaungers vnto achab ye kynge israel ye cite caused saye vnto thus sayeth benadab thy syluer thy golde myne thy wyues thy best child myne also kynge israel answered sayde lorde kynge euen thou hast sayde thine haue messaungers came agayne sayde thus sayeth benadab moch haue sent vnto sayenge thy syluer thy golde thy wyues thy childrē shalt thou geue tomorow aboute tyme wil sende seruaūtes vnto yt maye serch thyne house house thy subiectes loke pleasaunt thinge thou hast yt shal take handes cary awaye kynge israel called ye elder lōde sayde mark well se myschefe mā seketh sent vnto wyues child syluer golde haue sayde naye sayde elder people vnto thou shalt cōsente ner agree vnto spake vnto benadabs messaūgers saye vnto lorde ye kynge ye thynges wherfore thou dyddest sende vnto ye seruaunt ye first wil ye messaungers wēte tolde againe thē sent benadab vnto sayēge goddes yt vnto yf dust samaria shalbe ynough euery one people brynge handfull therof ye kynge israel answered sayde tell let yt putteth ye harnes make boast like yt hath put whā benadab herde yt euē drynkinge wt kynges ye pauylion sayde vnto seruaūtes set yor selues araye set thē selues araie ye cite beholde came prophet vnto achab ye kynge israel saide thus sayeth lorde hast thou sene greate multitude beholde daie wil delyuer thē ye hande yt thou shalt knowe yt ye lorde achab sayde sayde thus sayeth lorde euen yonge men ruler londe sayde shal order battayl sayde thou mustered yonge men ruler londe two hūdreth two thirtie thē mustured whole people childrē israel seuē thousande men wente noone daye benadab dranke dronken pauylion two thirtie kynges come helpe yonge men ruler londe wente forth first benadab sent forth brought worde sayde come men samaria sayde take alyue whether come forth peace warre whan londe ruler yonge men gone forth hoost behynde euery one smote yt came waye sirians fled israel folowed benadab kynge syria escaped horse horsmē kynge israel wente forth smote horse charettes dyd greate slaughter syrian came prophet vnto kynge israel sayde vnto go thy waye strength take hede loke well thou doest whan yeare aboute kynge syria shall come agaynst new kynge ye syrian seruauntes sayde vnto goddes goddes mountaynes therfore haue gotten victory let v fyghte playne thou shalt se shal ouercome thus put awaye kynges euery one place set duke steades appoynte hoost thou hast lost horse charettes led v fight agaynst thē plaine thou shalt se shal haue victory cōsented vnto voyce dyd whan yeare gone aboute benadab appoynted sirians wente vp towarde aphek fighte agaynst israel childrē israel mustured prouyded selues vytailes wē te mete pitched tētes ouer like two litle flockes goates londe full syrian came man god sayde vnto kynge israel thus sayeth lorde syrian haue sayde lorde god moūtaynes god valley therfore haue geuen greate heape thy handes ye maye knowe ye lorde pitched tentes right ouer agaynst seuen dayes vpon ye seuenth daye wente together battayll child israel smote sirians hundreth thousande fote men one daye remnaunt fled aphek cite wall fell vpon seuen twenty thousande men benadab fled also vnto cite litle chamber sayde seruauntes vnto beholde haue herde kynges house israel mercifull kinges let v therfore put sack cloth aboute oure loynes halter aboute oure neckes go forth kynge israel peraduenture shal let ye soule lyue put sack cloth aboute loynes halter aboute neckes came kynge israel sayde benadab thy seruaunt sayeth vnto let soule lyue sayde yf yet alyue brother men toke shortly worde expounded selues sayde yee benadab thy brother sayde come brynge thē wente benadab forth vnto caused syt vpon charet sayde vnto city father toke thy father wyl geue agayne make thou stretes thyselfe damascō father samaria wyl let go bonde peace made couenaunt let go spake man amonge child prophetes vnto neghboure worde lorde praye smite refused smite saide vnto thou hast herkened vnto voyce lorde beholde therfore shall lyon smyte whan thou goest fro me· • 13 c whan wente frō lyon founde slewe founde another man sayde praye smyte man smote wounded wente prophet stepte vnto kynge waye syde altered face aszshes whan kynge wente cried vpon ye kynge sayde thy seruaunt wente forth battayll beholde wente one asyde broughte man vnto sayde kepe mā yf myssed thy soule shall steade soule el thou shalt weye downe hundreth weighte syluer whyle thy seruaunt awaye kynge israel sayde vnto thine owne iudgment thou hast geuen thyselfe put aszshes face haist kynge israel knewe one prophetes sayde vnto thus sayeth lorde thou hast let damned man go therfore shall thy soule soule thy people people kynge israel departed vnto house beinge troubled mynde full indignacion came samaria xxi chapter actes fortuned naboth iesraelite vyniarde iefreel besyde palace achab kynge samaria achab spake naboth sayde geue thy vynyarde wyll make herbgarden therof nye house wyl geue better vynyarde yf please wyll geue syluer moch worth naboth sayde vnto achab lorde let farre fro 〈…〉 shulde geue ye father heretage came achab home beinge moued full indignacion worde naboth iesraelite spoken vnto sayde wyl geue father inheritaunce laied downe vpon bed turned face asyde ate bred iesabel wyfe came sayde vnto ye matter thy sprete cōbred thou eatest bred sayde vnto haue spokē vnto naboth iesraelite sayde geue thy vynyarde money yf please yt wyl geue another sayde wyll geue vynyarde sayde iesabel wyfe vnto kingdome israel yf thou diddest stonde vp eate bred wyl get vynyarde naboth iesraelite wrote letter vnder achabs name sealed signet sent vnto ye elder ruler cite dwelt aboute naboth wrote thus ye letter proclame fast set naboth aboue people set two men belial testifye saye thou hast blasphemed god kynge brynge forth stone death elder ruler cyte dwelt cite dyd iesabel commaunded acordynge wrytten letter sent vnto proclamed fast caused naboth syt aboue amonge people came two men belial stode testyfyed agaynst naboth ye presence people sayde naboth hath blasphemed god kynge broughte cite stoned death sent iesabel worde sayenge naboth stoned put death whā iesabel herde naboth stoned deed sayde vnto achab vp take possession vynyarde naboth iesraelite denyed geue money naboth lyueth deed whan achab herde ye naboth deed rose go downe vnthe vyniarde naboth iesraelite take possession worde lorde came elia theszbite sayde get vp go downe mete achab kynge israel samaria beholde naboths vynyarde gone downe take possession talke thou speake thus sayeth lorde thou hast slayne taken possession thou shalt talke morouer vnto saye thus sayeth lorde 〈◊〉 22 f euen place dogges licked vp naboths bloude shall dogges licke thy bloude also achab sayde vnto elia hast thou euer founde thine enemye saide yee haue founde thou art euen solde euell sighte lorde beholde • b 〈◊〉 1 • wyll brynge mysfortune vpon take awaye thy posterite wil rote achab euen maketh water agaynst wall shut vp lefte behynde israel thy house wyll make house ieroboam ye sonne nebat house baesa sonne ahia ye prouocacion wherwhith thou hast prouoked vnto wrath made israel synne ouer iesabel spake lorde also sayde 9 b dogges shal deuoure iesabel ye felde iesrael 14 b 〈…〉 16 achab dyeth ye cite shal dogges eate vp dyeth felde foules vnder heauen shall eate vp cleane 〈◊〉 1 b solde myschefe ye sighte lorde hath man bene achab iesabel hath disceaued maketh selfe greate abhominacion goeth idol acordīge vnto dyd amorites 〈…〉 lorde expelled child israel whan achab herde wordes rēte clothes put sack cloth body fasted slepte sack cloth wente aboute hanginge downe heade worde lorde came elia theszbite sayde hast thou sene achab humbleth selfe moch hūbleth selfe sighte wil brynge plage whyle lyueth sonnes life wil brynge mysfortune vpon house xxii chapter passed ouer thre yeares warre betwene sirians israel • par •• thirde yeare wente iosaphat kynge iuda downe kynge israel kynge israel sayde vnto seruauntes knowe ye yt ramoth gilead oures syt styll take hande kynge syria sayde vnto iosaphat wilt thou go battaill vnto ramoth gilead iosaphat sayde vnto kynge israel wyll thou people thy people horse thy horse iosaphat sayde vnto ye kynge israel • 23 • 2 2 2 • 3 1 • • axe daye worde lorde kynge israel gathered prophetes aboute foure hundreth men sayde vnto shal go vnto ramoth gilead fighte shal let alone sayde go vp ye lorde shal delyuer ye kinges hande iosaphat sayde one prophet ye lorde maye axe kinge israel saide vnto iosaphat yet man one micheas sonne iemla maye axe lorde hate prophecieth good euell iosaphat sayde let kynge saye called kynge israel chamberlayne sayde brynge hither soone micheas sonne iemla kynge israel iosaphat ye kinge iuda sat ether vpon seate arayed garmentes place ye dore porte samaria ye prophetes prophecied thē sedechias sonne cnaena made horne yron sayde thus sayeth lorde shalt thou puszshe ye syrian tyll thou brynge naughte prophetes prophecied likewyse sayde go vp vnto ramoth gilead thou shalt prospere right well lorde shal delyuer kynges hande messaunger wente call micheas sayde vnto beholde wordes ye prophetes one acorde good kynge let thy worde therfore worde speake thou good also micheas sayde truly lorde liueth loke lorde sayeth vnto yt wyl speake whan came kynge kynge sayde vnto micheas shal go vnto ramoth gilead fight shall let alone sayde vnto yee go vp thou shalt prospere righte well lorde shall geue kynges hande kynge sayde vnto agayne charge yt thou saye thinge vnto trueth name ye lorde sayde sawe israel scatred abrode vpon mountaynes shepe haue shepherde lorde saide haue lorde let euery one turne home agayne peace sayde ye kinge israel vnto iosaphat tolde ye wolde prophecye good euell sayde heare therfore worde lorde • pa 18 c sawe lorde syt vpon seate hoost heauen stōdinge righte hande lefte lorde saide wil disceaue achab go vp fall ramoth gilead one sayde another wē te forth sprete stode lorde sayde wyl disceaue lorde sayde vnto wherwith sayde vnto wyll go forth false sprete mouth prophetes saide thou shalt disceaue shalt able go forth beholde • ze 14 b lorde hath geuē false sprete ye mouth ye prophetes lorde hath spoken euell ouer stepte forth sedechias sonne cnaena smote micheas vpon cheke sayde sprete lorde departed fro speake micheas sayde beholde thou shalt se yt daye whan thou shalt go frō one chamber another hyde kynge israel sayde take micheas let remayne amon ruler cite ioas kynges sonne saye thus sayeth kynge put man preson fede bred water trouble tyll come agayne peace micheas sayde yf thou commest agayne peace hath lorde spoken thorow sayde herken ye people kynge israel iosaphat ye kynge iuda wente vp vnto ramoth gilead kynge israel sayde vnto iosaphat chaunge thy clothes come ye battayll thine araie kinge israel chaunged clothes also wē te battayll kynge siria commaunded ruler charettes two thirtie saide ye shal fight nether agaynst small ner greate onely agaynst kynge israel whan ruler charettes sawe iosaphat thought bene kynge israel fell vpon fightinge iosaphat cried whan ruler charettes sawe ye kinge israel turned back frō certayne man bended bowe harde shott kynge israel betwene mawe ye longes sayde vnto charetman turne thine hāde cary hoost wounded ye battayll sore daie kinge stode vpō charet agaynst syriās dyed eueninge bloude ranne wounde myddes charet whan sonne wente downe proclamacion made hoost sayde euery one gett cite countre thus kynge dyed broughte vnto samaria buryed samaria whan waszshed charett pole samaria 〈…〉 ye dogges licked bloude harlottes waszshed acordinge worde ye lorde spake saye achab yt dyd yuery house buylded beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel achab slepte father sonne ahasia kynge steade 〈…〉 iosaphat sonne asa kynge ouer iuda fourth yeare achab kynge israel fyue thirtie yeare olde whan made kynge raigned fyue twentye yeare ierusalē mother name asuba ye doughter silhi walked waye father asa departed dyd right ye sighte lorde yet put awaye ye hie place ye people offred brent cēse yet vpon hye place peace kynge israel saye iosaphat mighte exercised fought beholde wrytten cronicles kynges iuda 〈…〉 put londe also whoremonger yet lefte remayned ouer tyme father asa tyme kynges edom iosaphat caused make shippes vpon see shulde go fetch golde ophir wente broken ezeon gaber tyme sayde ahasia sonne achab vnto iosaphat let seruauntes passe thy seruauntes shippes iosaphat wolde iosaphat slepte father buried ye cite dauid ioram sonne kynge steade ende thirde boke kynges fourth boke kynges boke conteyneth chap reigne ochosias otherwyse called ahasia ioram brother fyre cōsumed two captaynes men chap ii elia taken vp fyrie charet eliseus receaueth sprete elia maketh bytter water swete curseth mysnurtoured child chap iii ioram iosaphat warre eliseus saide vnto chap iiii eliseus helpeth womā dett another woman child optayneth one god childe beynge deed rayseth vp agayne chap v naaman chefe captayne siria clensed leprosy gehasi eliseus seruaunt made leporous chap vi yron swymmeth water kynge siria fighteth agaynst israel seruauntes go aboute take eliseus smytten blyndnes greate honger samaria chap vii foure leper came tentes syrian vytayles beganne good chepe chap viii seuen yeare derth benadab sick areth coūcell eliseus ochosias sonne ioram chap ix iehu anoynted kinge ouer israel roted houof achab iesabel chap x heades achabs seuentie sonnes broughte vnto iehu ochosias brother iehu slayeth baal prestes chap xi atalia destroyeth kynges sede saue ioas escapeth made kynge ioiada prest chap xii ioas ruleth well whyle ioiada alyue euell death chap xiii kynges ioachias ioas ieroboam deed layed eliseus graue reuyued chap xiiii ioas amasias ieroboam azarias chap xv azarias leper sonne ionathas zacharias kynge israel sellum manahem pacea romelia teglatphalasser cōquererh city iuda▪ chap xvi achas resin ezechias chap xvii osea salmanasar came vpon conquered caried people awaye captyue god punyshed came steade chap xviii good kynge ezechias sennacherib troubleth chap xix ezechias sendeth vnto esay comforreth god defendeth ezechias delyuereth chap xx ezechias deed sick esay commaundement lorde promyseth lyue yet fyftene yeare chap xxi reigne vngodly kynge manasses lyued dyed sonne amon chap xxii reigne noble vertuous kynge iosias goodly actes chap xxiii iosias caused boke couenaūt red vnto people setteth vp true honoure god againe ioachas sonne chap xxiii nabuchodonosor cōmeth vpon kynge ioachim carieth awaye ioachim sonne vnto babilon chap xxv nabuchodonosor layeth sege ierusalē wynneth setteth fyre caryeth awaye kynge people presoners vnto babilon fyrst chapter ahasia sonne achab kynge ouer israel samaria ye seuententh yeare iosaphat kīge iuda reigned ouer israel two yeares dyd yt euell ye sight lorde walked waye father mother waie ieroboam ye sonne nebat made israel synne serued baal worshipped displeased lorde god israel euē father dyd moabites also fell awaye israel whan achab deed ochosias fell thorow ye grate chāber samaria deed sicke sent messaungers sayde vnto go youre waye axe councell beelzebub god ekron whether shall recouer sicknesse angell ye lorde sayde vnto elia theszbite vp go mete messaungers kynge samaria saie vnto god israel ye go axe councell ye god ekron therfore thus sayeth lorde thou shalt come bed wheron thou lyest shalt dye death elia wente waye whā ye messaunges came ochosias agayne sayde vnto thē come ye agayne sayde vnto came vp man oure waye sayde vnto v go againe kinge hath sent saye vnto thus saieth lorde god israel yt thou sendest axe coūcel beelzebub ye god ekrō therfore shalt thou come ye bed wheron thou lyest shalt dye death sayde vnto maner man mett sayde vnto sayde vnto rough heer vpon letheren gyrdell aboute loynes sayde elia theszbite sent vnto captaine ouer fiftye fyftye whan came vnto beholde sat aboue vpon moūt sayde vnto thou mā god kynge sayeth thou shalt come downe elia answered captayne ouer fyftye sayde vnto yf man god fyre fall downe heauen cō sume thy fyftie • uc 9 f fell fire heauen consumed fyftye agayne sent another captayne ouer fyftye vnto fyftye answered sayde vnto thou man god thus sayeth kynge come downe haist elia answered saide yf mā god ye fire fall downe heauen consume thy fyftye fell fyre god heauen consumed fyftye agayne sent vnto thirde captayne ouer fyftye fyftie whan came kneled elia besoughte sayde vnto thou man god let soule ye soules thy seruauntes fyftye somwhat worth thy syghte beholde fyre fell downe heauen hath consumed fyrst two captaynes ouer fyftye wt fyftyes let soule somwhat worth thy sighte saide angel lorde vnto elia go downe feare gatt vp wente downe vnto ye kynge sayde vnto thus saieth lorde thou hast sent forth messaū gers caused axe councell beelzebub god ekron though god israel axe coūcell worde therfore shalt thou come bed wheron thou hast layed shalt dye ye death dyed acordynge worde lorde elia sayde ioram brother kynge steade seconde yeare ioram sonne iosaphat kynge iuda sonne saye ochosias dyd beholde wryttē cronicles kynges israel ii chapter whan lorde mynded take vp elia tempest elia eliseus wente gilgall elia sayde eliseus tary thou praye lorde hath sent vnto bethel eliseus sayde truly lorde liueth truly thy soule lyueth wyll forsake whan came downe vnto bethel prophetes child bethel wēte forth eliseus sayde vnto knowest thou lorde wyl take thy lorde awaye thy heade daye saide knowe well holde ye youre peace elia sayde vnto eliseus tary thou praye lorde hath sent vnto iericho neuerthelesse sayde truly lorde lyueth truly thy soule lyueth wyl forsake whan came vnto iericho prophetes child iericho stepte forth eliseus sayde vnto knowest thou lorde wyll take ye lorde awaye thy heade daie sayde knowe well holde ye yor peace elia sayde vnto praie tary ye lorde hath sent vnto iordane sayde truly lorde lyueth truly thy soule lyueth wil forsake wente together fyftye men ye prophetes child wēte forth stode ouer agaynst thē farre stode iordane toke elia cloke wrapped together smote water deuyded selfe sydes wē te dry shod thorow whan come ouer elia sayde vnto eliseus axe shall afore taken awaye eliseus saide thy sprete maye vpō speake twyse moch sayde thou hast desyred harde thinge neuertheles yf thou shalt se whā taken awaye shal yf thē shal goinge together talked came fyrie charet horse fyre parted thē asunder 〈…〉 wente elia vp heauen storme eliseus sawe cryed father father charetman israel horsmē sawe nomore toke holde clothes rente two peces toke vp elia cloke fallen turned backe stode shore iordane toke cloke elia fallen smote water saide lorde god elia smote water parted asunder sydes eliseus wente thorow whan prophetes child iericho ouer agynst sawe sayde sprete elia resteth vpō eliseus wēte forth mete worshipped groūde sayde vnto beholde fiftye valeaunt mē amonge thy seruauntes let go seke thy lorde peraduenture sprete lorde hath taken cast vpon mountaine valley saide sende neuertheles constrayned tyll ashamed sayde let go sent fiftye men soughte thre dayes founde came agayne vnto abode iericho sayde vnto tolde ye shulde go men cite sayde vnto eliseus beholde good dwellynge cite lorde seyth water euell londe vnfrutefull sayde bringe hither new vessell put salt broughte wēte forth vnto well water cast salt therin sayde thus sayeth lorde haue healed water hence forth shal deed ner vnfrutefulnes come water healed vnto daye acordinge worde eliseus spake wēte vp towarde bethel goynge vp waye came litle boyes cite mocked sayde come vp thou balde heade come vp thou balde heade turned aboute whā sawe cursed name lorde came two beeres wod tente two fortye child thence wēte vp vnto mount carmel turned backe samaria iii chapter ioram sonne achab kynge ouer israel samaria ye eightenth yeare iosaphat kynge iuda raigned xij yeares dyd yt euell ye sighte ye lorde father mother put awaye ye pilers baal father caused make neuertheles cleued vnto ye synnes ieroboā ye sonne nebat made israel synne departed frō mesa ye kynge moabites many shepe payed tribute vnto kynge israel wt woll hundreth thousande lābes hūdreth thousande rāmes 4 1 whan achab deed kynge ye moabites fell awaye frō kynge israel ye tyme wēte kynge ioram frō samaria mustered israel sent vnto iosaphat kynge iuda sayenge kynge moabites fallen awaye fro come thou wt fighte agaynst ye moabites sayde wil come vp 3 22 euen thou people ye people horse thy horse sayde morouer waye wil go vp sayde waye wyldernesse edom kynge israel kynge iuda kynge edom wente forth whan gone aboute seuē dayes iourney ye hoost catell yt amonge thē water sayde kynge israel ala lorde hath called thre kynges delyuer thē hande moabites iosaphat sayde 3 22 prophet ye lorde yt maye axe coū cell ye lorde answered one ye kynge israel seruauntes saide eliseus ye sonne saphat poured water vpon elia handes iosaphat sayde worde ye lorde kynge israel iosaphat ye kynge edom wente downe vnto eliseus sayde vnto kynge israel hast thou wt go prophetes thy father ye mother prophetes kinge israel saide vnto ye lorde hath called thre kynges delyuer handes moabites eliseus sayde truly lorde zebaoth lyueth stō de yf regarded iosaphat kynge iuda wolde regarde ner set oughte ye bringe mynstrell whan mynstrell played vpō instrument hande lorde came vpō sayde thus sayeth lorde make pittes broke thus sayeth lorde ye shal se nether wynde ner rayne yet shall broke full water ye youre housholdes youre catell maie drynke yee small thinge sighte lorde moabites shal delyuer youre handes yt ye shal smyte stronge city ye chosen city deu 20 c shal fell downe good tree stoppe welles water good feldes shall ye make waist stone morow whan meat offerynge offered beholde came water ye waye edom fylled ye londe water whan moabites herde yt kynges came vp fighte agaynst thē called ye harnessed men ruler stode ye border whan rose early ye mornynge sonne wēte vp vpon ye water moabites thoughte water ouer agaynst thēto euē reed bloude sayde bloude ye kynges haue destroyed selues wt swerde one hath smytten another moab get vp spoyles whan came tentes israel israelite gat vp smote moabites fled neuertheles came smote moab brake downe city euery one cast stone vpon good feldes made full stopped ye welles water felled downe good tree tyll remayned stone brickwall compased aboute slynges smote whā kynge ye moabites sawe yt battayll strōge toke seuen c men drue ye swerde fall vpon kynge edom neuertheles able toke first sonne shulde haue bene kynge steade offred burnt offerynge vpon wall came greate wrath ouer israel departed turned agayne londe iiii chapter cried woman amōge wyues prophetes child vnto eliseus sayde thy seruaunt huszbāde deed thou knowest thy seruaunt feared lorde commeth man detter vnto wyll take awaye child bonde seruauntes eliseus sayde vnto shal forthe tell hast thou house sayde thy handmayden hath nothinge house pitcher wt oyle sayde go yt waye borowe without thy neghboures emptye vessel fewe go shut ye dore behynde thy sonnes poure ye vessel whan thou hast fylled delyuer forth wente shut dore vnto hir sonnes broughte vessel poured whan vessel full sayde vnto hir sonne brynge yet one vessell sayde vnto one vessell stode ye oyle styll sent tolde man god sayde go thy waye sell oyle paye creditour lyue thou ye sonnes resydue fortuned ye tyme eliseus wente vnto sunem riche woman helde eate passed oft thorow yt waye wē te vnto ate wt sayde vnto hir huszbande beholde perceaue holy man god goeth euer thorow waye let v make hī litle chamber boordes set bed table stole candelsticke therin whan commeth vnto v maye resorte thither fortuned vpon tyme came layed downe chamber slepte therin saide vnto gehasi childe call womā sunem whā called stode sayde vnto speake thou vnto beholde thou hast mynistred vnto v thinges shal hast thou eny matter spoken kynge chefe captayne hoost sayde idwell amonge people sayde hast thou gehasi sayde ala hath sonne hir huszbāde olde sayde call whā called stode dore sayde 〈…〉 aboute tyme yf ye frute lyue thou shalt enbrace sonne sayde ala lorde thou man god lye vnto thy handmayden woman conceaued bare sonne aboute tyme whā frute coulde lyue acordynge eliseus sayde vnto whan ye childe growne fortuned yt wente forth father vnto reaper sayde vnto father oh heade heade saide vnto seruaūt bringe mother toke broughte mother set vpon hir lappe vntyll ye noone daye thē dyed wente vp layed vpō bed man god shut dore wēte forth called hir huszbande sayde vnto sende one seruaūtes asse wyl go quyckly vnto man god come agayne sayde wilt thou go vnto daye nether new moone ner sabbath sayde well sadled asse sayde yongman dryue forth kepe bak rydinge byd wente came man god vnto mount carmell whā man god sawe ouer agaynst sayde vnto childe gehasi beholde sunamitisse runne mete axe yf go well hir huszbande hir sonne sayde well whan came man god vpon ye mount helde fete gehasi stepte put awaye ye man god sayde let alone hir soule heuynes lorde hath hyd fro shewed sayde whan desyred sonne lorde sayde yt thou shuldest mocke sayde vnto gehasi girde vp thy loynes take staffe thy hande go thy waye 〈…〉 yf eny man mete salute yf eny man salute thanke laye thou staffe vpon ye childes face childes mother sayde truly lorde lyueth truly ye soule lyueth wyll leaue gat vp wente gehasi wente layed staffe vpon childes face nether voyce ner felynge wente agayne mete shewed sayde childe rysen vp whan eliseus came house beholde ye childe laye deed vpō bed wēte shut dore thē made prayer vnto lorde wente vp layed selfe vpon childe layed mouth vpon childes mouth eye vpon eye handes vpon handes stretched selfe forth vpon yt childes body warme rose vp wente house hither thither wente vp layed selfe longe vpon nesed childe seuē tymes afterwarde childe opened eye cried vpon gehasi sayde call sunamitisse whan called came vnto sayde take thy sonne came fell fete worshipped vnto grounde toke hir sonne wente forth whā eliseus came againe vnto gilgal derth londe prophetes child dwelt sayde vnto seruaunt set greate pot make potage child prophetes wente one felde gather herbes founde cucumber stalke gathered wylde cucumber therof cotefull whan came chopped small potage pott knewe whā poured forth mē eate ate ye potage cried sayde thou man god death pot mighte eate neuertheles sayde brynge meel hither put pot sayde poure people maye eate bytter pot came man baal salisa broughte man god bred first frutes namely twentye barlye loaues new corne garment sayde geue vnto ye people maye eate mynister sayde ioh 6 • shall geue hūdreth men sayde geue vnto people maye eate thus sayeth lorde shal eate shall lefte ouer set ate lefte ouer acordinge ye worde lorde v chapter naaman chefe captayne kynge syria excellēt mā sighte lorde moch set thorow lorde gaue health vnto syria mightie man leper men warre fallen syria caried awaye litle damsel londe israel seruyce naamās wife sayde vnto hir mastresse master prophet samaria wolde heale leprosy wente lorde tolde sayde thus thus hath damsel londe israel spoken kynge syria sayde go thy waye wyl wrytte letter vnto kynge israel wente toke ten hundreth weighte syluer sixe thousande gulden ten chaunge rayment broughte letter vnto kynge israel wordes whan letter commeth vnto beholde thou shalt vnderstonde yt haue sent seruaunt naaman vnto thou mayest heale leprosy whan kynge israel red letter rente clothes sayde god kyll quyckē agayne yt sendeth vnto heale man frō leprosy considre se seketh occasion vnto whan eliseus man god herde yt kynge israel rente clothes sent vnto sayenge hast thou rente thy clothes let come maye knowe yt prophet israel naaman came horse charettes helde still dore eliseus house sent eliseus messaunger vnto sayenge go thy waye waszshe seuen tymes iordane shal thy flesh restored agayne clensed naaman wroth wente waye sayde thoughte shulde haue come forth vnto haue stōde haue called vpō name lorde god haue touched place hande haue put awaye leprosy ye water amana pharphar damascon better water israel yt might waszshe therin clēsed turned wēte waye displeasure seruauntes gat thē sayde father yf prophet cōmaunded eny greate thinge shuldest thou haue done moch thē yf saye vnto wasshe thou shalt cleane wēte downe waszshed selfe iordane seuē tymes man god sayde flesh restored agayne euen flesh yonge childe luc 4 c clensed turned agayne ye man god armye whan came stode sayde beholde knowe londes god israel take therfore blessynge praye thy seruaunt neuertheles sayde 1 13 b dan 5 • truly lorde lyueth stonde wil take wolde nedes haue take wolde sayde naaman mighte burthē earth geuē vnto ye seruaunt moch two mule maye beare thy seruaunt wyll nomore sacrifice offer burnt offerynges vn goddes vnto lorde lorde maye gracious vnto thy seruaunt yf worshippe house rimmon whā lorde goeth ye house worshippe leaneth vpon hande sayde vnto go thy waye peace gone fr • felde bredth londe gehasi seruaunt eliseus ye man god thoughte beholde lorde hath spared naamā syrian hath taken yt broughte truly ye lorde lyueth wil rūne take somthinge gehasi folowed naaman whā naaman sawe yt ranne lighte downe charet mete sayde thinges well sayde yee lorde hath sent caused saye vnto beholde come fro mount ephraim two yonge men prophetes childrē geue talēte siluer praye two chaunge rayment naamā saide go take two talētes cō pelled bande two talentes two bagges two chaunge rayment delyuered vnto two seruauntes bare whan came ye darcke toke handes layed syde house let men go whan gone waye stode lorde eliseus sayde vn whence commest thou gehasi sayde thy seruaunt wente nether hither ner thither sayde vnto wente hert wt whan man turned backe charet mete the▪ thou hast takē syluer rayment olyue tree vynyardes shepe ox seruauntes maydens leprosy naaman shal cleue vnto thy sede euer 〈…〉 wēte forth leporous snowe vi chapter child ye prophetes • yde vn eliseus beholde place dwell ye narow v let v go vnto iordane euery one fetch tymbre yt maye buylde v place dwell saide go yor waye one sayde go come wt thy seruauntes sayde wil go wē te whan came iordane hewed downe tymber one fellynge downe tre yron fell water cried sayde ala lorde burowed man god sayde fell whan shewed place cut downe sticke thrust swāme yron sayde take vp put forth hande toke kynge syria warred agaynst israel toke councell seruauntes sayde lye man god sent ye kynge israel sayenge bewarre yt thou go vnto place syrian rest kynge israel sent vnto ye place wherof ye man god tolde kepte helde watch dyd twyse onely thē ye kynge syria herte vexed therfore called seruauntes sayde vnto wyll ye tell oure men fled vnto kynge israel sayde one seruauntes lorde kynge eliseus prophet israel telleth kynge israel thou speakest thy chamber thou lyest sayde go youre waye thē loke maye sende cause fetched shewed sayde beholde dothan thē sent thither horse charetes greate power whā came thither nighte compased cite aboute mynister mā god arose early get vp wēte forth beholde laye hoost men aboute ye cite horse charettes saide childe vnto ala syr wyll sayde 〈…〉 feare mo yt v eliseus prayed sayde lorde open eye yt maye se lorde opened ye childes eye yt sawe beholde ye mount full fyrie horse charettes roūde aboute eliseus whā came downe vnto eliseus made prayer sayde lorde smyte people wt blyndnes 〈◊〉 1 • c smote thē blyndnes acordinge worde eliseus eliseus saide vnto ye waye cite folowe wil brynge man ye seke broughte vnto samaria whan came samaria eliseus sayde lorde open men eye yt maye se lorde opened eye yt sawe beholde myddes samaria whan kynge israel sawe saide vnto eliseus father shal smyte thē saide thou shalt smyte thē loke thou takest thy swerde bowe smyte set bred water maye eate drynke let departe vnto lorde thē greate dyner prepared whan eaten dronken let go departe vnto lorde tyme forth came men warre syrian nomore londe israel fortuned benadab kynge syria gathered hoost wēte vp layed sege vnto samaria greate derth samaria layed sege cite longe tyll ass heade worth foure score syluer pēs fourth parte 〈…〉 cab doues donge worth fyue syluer pen whan kynge israel wente vnto wall woman cried vnto sayde helpe lorde kynge sayde yf lorde helpe wherwith shal helpe ye barne wyne presse kynge sayde vnto ayleth ye sayde woman sayde vnto geue v ye sonne maye eate tomorow wyll eate sonne sod sonne haue eaten sayde vnto ye thirde daye geue v thy sonne let v eate hath hyd awaye whan kynge herde woman wordes rente clothes whyle goynge wall thē sawe people sackcloth vnder vpon body sayde 3 19 • 20 b god vnto yf heade eliseus sonne saphat shal daye stonde vpon eliseus sat house elder sat sent man euer messaunge came sayde vn ye elder haue ye sene childe murthure hath sent hither take awaye heade take hede whan messaunger cōmeth yt ye holde dore beholde ye noyse lordes fete foloweth whyle thus talkynge wt beholde ye messaunger came sayde beholde euell cōmeth ye lorde shal loke lorde vii chapter eliseus sayde heare worde lorde thus sayeth lorde 4 7 • tomorow aboute tyme shal buszshel fyne meel solde one sycle two buszshels barly one sycle vnder porte samaria knyghte vpon whose hande kynge leaned answered mā god sayde though lorde made wyndowes heauē coulde soch thinge come passe saide beholde thou shalt se thine eye shalt eate therof foure leporous men ye dore porte one sayde vnto another tary whyle dye though thoughte come cite yet derth ye cite shulde fayne dye yf tary must dye also let v go flye vnto hoost syrian yf let v lyue shall lyue yf slaye v deed gat vp early come vnto hoost syrian whan came vttemost ende ye tentes beholde body 2 mac 5 • sa 1 • lorde made syrian heare noyse horse charettes mightie greate hoost sayde one another amonge thēselues beholde kynge israel hath hyred kynge hethites kynge egipcians agaynst v come vpō v gat vp fled early twylight lefte bothes horse ass tentes stode fled euery man mighte saue life whan leper came place tentes wente tentes ate dronke toke syluer golde rayment wente hyd came agayne entred another tent toke therout wente hyd one saide vnto another let v thus daye daye good tidynges yf kepe secrete byde tyll lighte mornynge oure trespace wyl founde let v go therfore maye come tell kynges house whan came cried porte cite tolde sayde came tentes sirians beholde mā nether yet eny man voyce horse ass bounde bothes stonde cried ye porter tolde within ye kynges house kynge arose nighte sayde vnto seruauntes tell ye syrian deale v knowe yt suffer honger gone tētes hyde selues felde thynke thus whan go cite wyll take alyue come cite answered one seruauntes sayde let v take fyue horse remayne yet lefte cite beholde left therin ye multitude israel destroyed let v sende se thē toke two charettes ye horse kynge sent vnto tentes syrian sayde go youre waye se whan wente thē vnto iordane beholde waye laye full garmentes vessel syrian cast thē whyle made haist whan messaungers came agayne tolde kynge people wente forth spoyled tentes syrian buszshel fyne meell solde sycle two buszshels barlye sycle also 4 7 acordinge worde lorde kynge appoynted knyghte vpon whose hande leened gate people trode vpon dyed euen man god sayde whan kynge came downe vnto came passe euen ye man god tolde kynge whā sayde tomorow aboute tyme shall two buszshels barlye solde one sycle buszshel fyne meel one sycle vnder gate samaria knyghte answered man god sayde beholde though ye lorde made wyndowes heauen coulde soch thinge come passe neuertheles sayde beholde thine eye shalt thou se shalt •• te therof euen fortuned vnto people trode vpon gate yt dyed viii chapter eliseus spake vnto womā 〈…〉 whose sonne restored vnto life againe sayde get vp go thine housholde straunger thou canst lorde shall call derth shal come londe seuen yeare lōge woman gat vp dyd man god sayde wente hi • housholde straunger londe philistynes seuen yeare whan seuen yeares ended woman came agayne philistynes lōde wente forth crye vpon kynge hir house londe kynge spake vnto gehasi seruaunt man god sayde tell greate actes eliseus hath done whyle tellynge kynge made one deed lyue agayne beholde woman whose sonne caused reuyue came euen meane season cried vnto kynge hir house londe sayde gehasi lorde kynge womā hir sonne eliseus restored vnto life agayne kynge axed ye woman tolde kynge delyuered chamberlayne saide restore agayne hirs increase londe sence tyme lefte londe vntyll 〈…〉 eliseus came damascon benadab kynge syria laye sicke tolde sayde man god come hither sayde kynge vnto hasael take giftes go mete man god axe councell ye lorde saye maye recouer sicknesse hasael wente mete toke rewardes goodes damascō moch fortye camel mighte beare whan came stode sayde thy sonne benadab kynge syria hath sent vnto sayenge maye recouer sicknes eliseus sayde vnto go yi waye tell thou shalt recouer lorde hath shewed yt shal dye ye death man god loked earnestly made troublous countenaunce wepte thē sayde hasael wherfore wepeth lorde sayde knowe euell thou shalt vn child israel thou shalt burne stronge city fyre slaye yonge men swerde kyll yonge child ryppe vp wemen childe hasael sayde thy seruaunt dogg shulde soch greate thynge eliseus saide 〈…〉 lorde hath shewed yt thou shalt kynge syria wēte waye eliseus came lorde saide vnto saieth eliseus vnto sayde tolde thou shalt recouer nexte daye toke ye bed couerynge dypte water spred ouer dyed hasael kynge steade fyfth yeare ioram sonne achab kynge israel ioram ye sonne iosaphat kynge iuda 〈◊〉 2 • two thirtie yeare olde whā made kynge reigned eighte yeare ierusalem walked waye kynges israel house achab dyd achabs doughter wife dyd yt euell ye sighte lorde neuertheles lorde wolde destroye iuda seruaunt dauids sake 7 c promysed geue euer lanterne amōge childrē ye tyme fell ye edomites awaye iuda made kynge ouer selues ye cause ioram gone thorow seira charettes gotten vp nighte smytten edomites aboute ye ruler ouer charettes people fled vnto tentes therfore fell edomites awaye iuda vnto daye tyme fell libna awaye also saye ioram yt dyd heholde wrytten cronicles kynges iuda ioram fell slepe father buried wt father ye cite dauid par 22 ochosias sonne kynge steade twolueth yeare ioram sonne achab kynge israel ochosias ye sonne ioram kynge iuda two twentye yeare olde ochosias whan made kynge reigned one yeare ierusalem mother name atalia doughter amri kynge israel walked waye house achab dyd euell syght ye lorde euen dyd house achab sonne lawe house achab wente ioram sonne achab battayll agaynst hasael ye kinge syria vnto ramoth gilead ye syrian smote ioram4 9 ioram kinge turned backe healed iesreel ye woundes wherwith syrian wounded ramoth whā foughte hasael kinge syria ochosyas ye sonne iorā kinge iuda came downe viset ioram sonne achab iesreel laye sicke ix chapter eliseus prophet called one prophetes childrē sayde vnto girde vp ye loynes4 4 take cruse oyle go vnto ramoth gilead whā thou cōmest thither thou shalt se one iehu ye sonne iosaphat sonne nimsi go byd stonde vp amonge brother brynge ynmost chamber • 19 take thou ye cruse oyle poure vpon heade saye thus sayeth lorde haue anointed kynge ouer israel thou shalt open dore flye tary prophetes yonge man childe wente waye vnto ramoth gilead whan came beholde captaynes hoost sat sayde haue somwhat saye vnto captayne iehu saide vnto amonge v sayde euen vnto captayne stode vp wente poured oyle vpon heade sayde vnto him· thus sayeth lorde god israel haue anoynted yt kynge ouer lordes people israel thou shalt smyte thy lorde achabs house • 21 maye auenge bloude seruauntes prophetes bloude lordes seruauntes hande iesabel house achab maye periszshe wyl rote achab1 25 3 14 euen maketh water agaynst wall closed vp desolate israel house achab wyll make euen house ieroboam sonne nebat house baesa sonne ahia ye dogges shall eate vp iesabel vpon felde iesrael noman shall burye her3 21 opened dore fled whā iehu came forth lordes seruauntes saide vnto thinges well wherfore came madd felowe vnto saide vnto ye knowe man well hath spoken sayde▪ true tell thou v sayde thus thus hath spoken vnto sayde thus sayeth lorde haue anoynted kynge ouer israel made haist euery one toke garment laied vnder maner iudges seate blewe trompet sayde iehu made kinge iehu sonne iosaphat sonne nimsi made confederacion agaynst ioram iorā laye ramoth gilead israel agaynst hasael kynge syria • 8 ioram kynge turned backe yt might healed woundes wherwith syrian wounded whā foughte hasael kynge syrian iehu sayde yf youre mynde shall noman escape cite go tell iesreel rode departed vnto iesrael ioram laye ochosias kinge iuda come downe vyset ioram watchman stode vpon tower iesrael sawe company iehu commynge sayde se company sayde ioram take charet sende mete thē saye peace charetman rode mete sayde thus sayeth kynge peace iehu sayde hast thou peace turne behynde watchman tolde sayde messaunger come vnto cōmeth agayne sent another charetman whan came saide thus sayeth kynge peace iehu sayde hast thou peace turne ye behynde watchman tolde sayde come commeth agayne goynge goynge iehu sonne nimsi dryueth mad sayde ioram binde charet fast bounde charet wente forth ioram kynge israel ochosias kynge iuda euery one vpon charet mete iehu founde vpon felde naboth iesraelite whan ioram sawe iehu sayde iehu peace sayde peace whordome witchcraft thy mother iesabel yet come ende turned ioram hande fled sayde vnto ochosias treason ochosias iehu toke bowe sho • ioram betwene armes arowe wente thorow hert fell downe charet iehu sayde vnto bidekar knyghte take cast pece londe naboth iesraelite remembre sence thou rodest charet achab father lorde wolde laye heuy burthen vpon holde sayde lorde wyl recompence yt bloude naboth childrē euen pece londe take cast pece londe 〈…〉 acordynge worde lorde whan ochosias kinge iuda sawe fled waie vnto ye garden house iehu folowed commaunded smyte also vpon charet goynge vp towarde gur lieth ieblaam fled vnto megiddo dyed seruauntes caused caried vnto ierusalem buryed awne graue father cite dauid ochosias reigned ouer iuda ye eleuenth yeare iorā ye sonne achab whan iehu came iesrael iesabel herde therof coloured hir face decked hir heade loked wyndowe whan iehu came vnder gate sayde 〈…〉 prospered symri well slewe lorde lifte vp face wyndow sayde resorted two thre chamberlaynes vnto sayde cast downe headlinges cast downe headlynges ye wall horse sprenkled hir bloude troddē vnder fete whan came eaten dronken sayde loke vpon yonder cursed woman burye 〈…〉 kynges • oughter neuertheles whan wente burye founde nothinge szkull fete palmes handes came agayne broughte worde saide euen lorde spake seruaunt elia theszbite sayde 〈…〉 felde iesrael shal dogges eate iesabels flesh deed carcase iesabel became euen donge felde iesrael yt man coulde saye iesabel x chapter achab thre score ten sonnes samaria 〈…〉 iehu wrote letter sent samaria vnto ruler cite iesrael euen vnto elder achabs tuters sayenge wordes whan letter commeth vnto wt youre lordes sonnes charetes horse stronge city ordynaunce loke best righteous amonge youre lordes sonnes set vpon father seate fighte youre lordes house neuertheles sore afrayed sayde beholde two kynges able stonde wyl endure ouer house ouer cite elder tuters sent vnto iehu sayēge thy seruauntes wyll thou sayest vnto v wil make man kynge thou pleaseth wrote seconde letter vnto wordes yf ye myne herken vnto voyce take heades men youre lordes sonnes brynge tomorow tyme vnto iesrael kynges sonnes thre score men ten ye chefe men cite broughte thē vp whan letter came toke kynges sonnes slewe euen thre score men ten layed heades baszkettes sent vnto iesrael whan messaunger came tolde sayde haue broughte heades kynges child sayde laye vpon two heapes dore porte tyll tomorow morow whan wente forth stode sayde vnto people ye righteous beholde haue made appoyntmēt lorde slayne hath slayne vnderstonde ye therfore fallen vpon earth one worde lorde spake agaynst house achab lorde hath done euen 21 c sayde seruaunt elia iehu smote remnaunt house achab iesrael greate men kynsfolkes prestes tyll one lefte ouer gat vp wente waye came samaria waye shepherdes house iehu founde brother ochosias kynge iuda sayde whence ye sayde ochosias brother goynge downe salute kynges child quenes child sayde take alyue toke alyue slewe welles syde shepherdes house euen two fortye men let one remayne whan wente thence foū de ionadab ye sonne ier 2 • rechab met saluted sayde vnto thyne hert righte myne hert thyne hert ionadab sayde yee yf sayde geue thy hande gaue hande caused syt besyde charet saide come se zele lorde caryed vpon charet whan came samaria smote remayned achab samaria tyll destroyed acordynge worde lorde 3 21 c spake vnto elia iehu gathered people together saide vnto 3 16 • achab baal litle seruyce iehu wyll serue better call vnto therfore baal prophetes seruaūtes prestes none wantynge haue greate sacrifyce vnto baal euer myssed shal lyue iehu dyd craftely mighte destroye mynisters baal iehu sayde sanctifie ye feast vnto baal proclame iehu sent israel caused baal minister come nomā lefte behynde came came baal house house baal full one corner another sayde vnto rule vestrye brynge forth rayment baal mynisters broughte forth rayment iehu wente baal house ionadab sonne rechab sayde vnto baal mynisters search se amōge eny mynyster lorde onely baal mynisters whan came offer sacrifyces burnt offerynges iehu appoynted foure score men without sayde yf eny men escape delyuer vnder youre handes shal man soule soule whā made ende burnt offerynge iehu sayde vnto fotemen knyghtes go smyte euery man let noman go forth smote thē edge swerde fote men knightes threw thē awaie wēte vnto cite baal house brought forth piler ye house baal brent brake downe baal pyler house baal made preuy house therof vnto daie • hus iehu destroyed baal israel iehu lefte sinnes ieroboam sonne nebat caused israel synne namely golden calues bethel dan lorde sayde vnto iehu thou hast bene wyllinge righte sighte hast done vnto achabs house hert • 15 b therfore shall thy child syt vpon ye seate israel vnto fourth generacion neuerthelesse iehu diligent walke lawe lorde god israel hert lefte frō synnes ieroboam made israel synne time beganne lorde greued israel • • hasael smote border israel iordane eastwarde londe gilead gaddites rubenites manassytes aroer lyeth ryuer arnon gilead basan saye iehu dyd power beholde wryten cronicles kynges israel iehu fell slepe father buryed samaria ioahas sonne kynge steade tyme iehu reigned ouer israel eight twentye yeares samaria xi chapter athalia mother ochosias whā sawe hir sonne deed • pa 22 gat vp destroyed kynges sede ioseba kynge iorams doughter syster ochosias toke ioas sonne ochosias stale awaye norse chamber amonge kynges child slayne hyd athalia slayne hyd house lorde sixe yeares athalia quene londe pa 24 neuertheles seuenth yeare sent ioiada toke ruler ouer hūdreds captaynes fote men caused thē come house lorde made couenaunt toke ooth house lorde shewed kynges sonne cō maunded sayde ye shall one thirde parte enter sabbath shall kepe watch kynges house one thyrde parte shal porte sur one thirde parte shal ye porte behynde fote men ye shal kepe watch house massa two partes go sabbath shal kepe watch house lorde aboute kinge ye shall get rounde aboute ye kynge euery one weapen hande euer cōmeth within ye wall let die ye kinge whā goeth ruler ouer hundred dyd ioiada prest commaūded 〈…〉 toke vnto men entred vpon sabbath wente sabbath came ioiada ye prest prest gaue captaynes speares shyldes bene kynge dauids house lorde fote men stode aboute kynge euery one weapen hande frō corner righte syde house vnto corner lefte syde euen vnto altare house broughte forth kynges sonne set crowne vpon heade toke 〈…〉 witnes made kynge glad clapped handes together sayde god saue kynge 〈…〉 whan athalia herde noyse people ranne rogether came people house lorde loked beholde kynge stode piler vse syngers trō pettes kynge people ye lōde glad blewe trompettes athalia rente hir clothes sayde vproure vproure neuertheles ioiada ye prest commaunded ye ruler ouer hundred appointed ouer hoost saide vnto brynge without wall whosoeuer foloweth hir let dye swerde prest sayde shulde dye house lorde layde handes vpō wente waye horse go ye kynges house slayne made ioiada couenaunt betwene lorde kynge 〈…〉 people yt shulde people lorde likewyse also betwixte kynge ye people wente people londe house baal brake downe altares destroyed ymages right well mathan prest baal slewe altare prest appoynted officer house lorde toke ruler ouer hundred captaynes fote men ye people londe broughte kynge downe house lorde came waye porte fote men vnto kynges house sat vpon kynges seate people lōde glad cite rest athalia slewe swerde ye kynges house ioas seuen yeare olde whan made kynge xii chapter seuēth yeare iehu ioas made kynge 〈◊〉 • 4 reigned fortye yeare ierusalem mother name zibea bersaba ioas dyd righte sighte lorde longe ioiada ye prest taught put downe ye hye place people offred brent incense yet vpon hye place ioas sayde vnto prestes money sanctified bestowed vpō ye house lorde namely money yt euery man geueth vnto treasury ye money euery man geueth soule money euery man geueth fre hert bestowed house lorde let prestes take vnto euery one porcion shall repayre decaye house lorde fynde eny decaye whan ye prestes repayred decaye house vnto thre twētieth yeare kynge ioas ioas kynge called ioiada prest prestes sayde vnto wherfore ye repayre decaye house therfore shall ye take money vnto euery one porcion shall geue decaye house prestes agreed take money people repayre decaye house ioiada prest toke chest bored hole aboue therin set righte hande besyde altare entrynge house lorde prestes kepte thresholde put money therin broughte vnto house lorde whan sawe moch money chest 4 22 ye kynges scrybe came vp hye prest bounde money together tolde moch founde house lorde ready money geuen vnto wrought appoynted house lorde gaue forth carpenter thē buylded wroughte house lorde namely dawbers mason boughte tymber frestone repayre decaye house lorde founde haue nede repayringe house howbeit syluer charger flat peces basens trompettes ner eny vessell golde syluer made house lorde money brought vnto lordes house geuen vnto workman repayre decaye house lorde therwith men also money delyuered vnto geue workman neded make eny acomptes busynes vpon credence money trespace offerynges synne offerynges broughte vnto house lorde prestes tyme wente hasael kynof syria vp foughte agaynst gath wanne whan hasael set face go vp ierusalem kynge ioas toke sanctifyed father iosaphat ioram ochosias kynges iuda halowed himselfe sanctifyed golde founde treasure house lorde kynges house sent vnto hasael kynge syria departed ierusalem saye ioas dyd written cronicles kynges iuda seruauntes made insurreccion conspyred smote house millo goynge downe vnto silla iosebar sonne simeath iosabad sonne somer seruauntes smote death buried father cite dauid amasias sonne kynge steade xiii chapter ye xxiii yeare ioas sonne ochosias kynge iuda ioahas sonne iehu kynge ouer israel samaria seuentene yeare dyd yt euell sighte lorde walked sinnes ieroboam ye sonne nebat caused israel synne lefte ye wrath lorde waxed whote vpon israel delyuered ouer vnder hande hasael kynge syria vnder hande benadad sonne hasael longe lyued ioahas besoughte face lorde lorde herde consydered myserie israel kynge syria oppressed ye lorde gaue israel sauioure broughte power syrian yt child israel dwelt tentes like afore tyme yet lefte synnes house ieroboam caused israel synne walked groue samaria stode styll also people ioahas mo lefte fyftye horsmen ten charettes ten thousande fote men 4 8 b kynge syria destroyed made dust barne saye ioahas dyd power beholde wrytten cronicles kynges synnes ieroboam sonne nebat made israel synne walked saye ioas dyd power foughte amasias kynge iuda beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel ioas fell slepe father ieroboam sat vpō seate ioas buried samaria wt kynges israel eliseus fell sicknes wherof dyed ioas kynge israel came downe vnto wepte saide 4 2 c father father charet man israel horsmen eliseus sayde vnto take bowe arowes whan taken bowe arowes sayde vnto kynge israel bende bowe thine hande bent hāde eliseus layed hande vpon kynges hande sayde open wyndowe towarde ea • opened eliseus saide sh ••• shot sayde one arowe saluacion lorde one arowe saluaciō agaynst syrian thou shalt smy •• syrian aphek tyll brought naughte sayde take ye arowes wh •• taken sayde vnto kynge israel smyte earth smote thre tymes stode still them▪ god wroth sayde yf thou haddest smytten fyue sixe time thou shuldest haue smytten ye syrian tyll thou dest vtterly brought naughte shalt thou smyte thre tymes whan eliseus deed buried men warre moabites fell londe yeare fortuned yt buryed certaine man whā sawe men warre cast man eliseus graue 〈…〉 whan therin touched eliseus bone reuyued stode vpon fete hasael kynge syria oppressed israel longe ioahas lyued lorde gracious vnto mercy vpon turned couenauntes sake abraham isaac iacob wolde destroye thē 〈…〉 nether dyd cast presence vnto houre hasael kinge syria dyed benadad sonne kynge steade ioas turned backe toke hande benadad sonne hasael cyties takē battaill hande father ioahas thre tymes dyd ioas smyte broughte city israel agayne xiiii chapter seconde yeare ioas ye sonne ioahas kynge israel amasias sonne ioas kynge iuda made kynge 〈…〉 fyue twenty yeare olde whan made kynge reigned nyne twentye yeare ierusalē mother name ioadan ierusalem dyd righte sighte lorde yet father dauid salt valley wanne sela battayll called iatheel vnto daye 〈◊〉 25 c sent amasias messaungers vnto ioas sonne ioahas sonne iehu kynge israel sayenge come hither let v se one another ioas ye kynge israel sent vnto amasias kynge iuda sayenge hawthorne libanus sent ceder tre libanus sayenge geue thy doughter vnto sonne wife wylde beest felde ranne ouer ye hawthorne trode downe thou hast smyttē edomites therfore thine hert waxen proude take prayse byde home stryuest thou mysfortune yt thou mayest fall iuda howbeit amasias consented wēte ioas kynge israel vp sawe one another amasias kynge iuda beth semes lyeth iuda iuda smytten israel euery one fled tente ioas kynge israel toke amasias kynge iuda sonne ioas sonne ochosias beth semes came ierusalem brake downe ye wall ierusalem ye porte ephraim vp beholde wrytten cronicles kynges israel tyme dyd manahem smyte tiphsa yt therin coastes therof thirza wolde let smote wemen wt childe rypte vp nyne thirtieth yeare asarias kynge iuda beganne manahem sonne gad reigne ouer israel ten yeares samaria dyd euell sighte lorde longe lyued departed ye synnes ieroboam sonne nebat caused israel synne phul kynge assiria came lōde manahem gaue vnto phul thousande talentes syluer holde cōfirme kyngdome manahem raysed vp taxe israel vpon richest fiftye sycles syluer vpon eueryman geue vnto ye kynge assiria kynge assiria wēte home agayne taried sonne come vp helpe ye hande kynge syria kynge israel rysen vp agaynst achas toke syluer golde yt founde ye house ye lorde treasure ye kynges house sent present ye kynge assiria 〈◊〉 8 ye kinge assiria cōsented vnto wente vp damascon wanne caried awaye vnto cira slewe rezin kynge achas wēte damascon mete teglatphalasser ye kynge assiria whā sawe altare yt damascon kynge achas sent patrone symilitude ye altare vnto prest vrias euen made vrias prest buylded altare made acordinge kynge achas sent vnto damascon tyll achas ye kynge came damascon whan ye kynge came damascon sawe altare offred theron kyndled burnt offerynges meat offerynges vpon poured drynk offeringes theron caused bloude ye deedofferynges offred sprenkled vpon altare brasen altare stode lorde put awaye stode betwene altare house lorde set corner north syde altare achas kynge cōmaunded vrias ye prest sayde vpō greate altare shalt thou kyndle ye burnt offrynge mornynge meat offrynge euenynge kynges burnt chapter twolueth yeare achas kynge iuda begāne oseas ye sonne ela reigne ouer israel samaria nyne yeare dyd yt euell ye sighte lorde ye kynges israel yt agaynst dyd salmanasar ye kynge assiria come vp oseas subiecte vnto gaue trybutes whā ye kynge as • ria perceaued yt oseas conspyred sent messaungers sua ye kynge egipte payed trybute yearly ye kynge ye assirians beseged put preson 4 18 b kynge assiria wente vp londe samaria layed sege vnto thre yeare esa 8 nyenth yeare oseas dyd ye kynge assiria wynne samaria 4 e 1 • c caried israel awaye assiria set halah habor water gosan city meedes whan childrē israel synned agaynst ye lorde god yt broughte thē ye londe egipte hāde pharao kynge egipte serued goddes walked customes heythē lorde dryuen child israel dyd kynges israel prouoked ye lorde god dyd secretly thinges righte sighte ye lorde god namely buylded hye place city castels stronge city set vp pilers groues vpon hye hilles amonge grene tree brent incense ye hye place euen dyd heythen lorde cast wroughte wicked thinges wherwith prouoked lorde vnto wrath serued idol wherof lorde sayde vnto • eut 4 e ye shal soch thynge whan lorde testified israel iuda prophetes seer sayenge •• 25 turne agayne youre euell wayes kepe commaundemētes ordynaunces acordinge ye lawe gaue vnto youre father sent vnto seruauntes prophetes wolde herken deut • 1 f mal 3 b herdened neckes acordinge hardneck father beleued lorde god yee despysed ordinaunces couenaunt made father testimony witnessed amonge walked awne vanity became vayne folowinge heythen dwelt rounde aboute concernynge lorde commaunded shulde dyd neuertheles forsoke commaundementes lorde god • 12 made two molten calues groues worshipped hoost heauen serued baal deu 18 b caused sonnes doughters go thorow fyre medled wt soythsayers witch gaue selues ouer euell sighte lorde prouoke vnto wrath lorde wroth israel put awaye frō presence yt remayned nomo • 12 c onely ye trybe iuda nether dyd iuda kepe commaundemētes lorde god walked customes israel dyd therfore dyd ye lorde cast awaye ye sede israel troubled delyuered handes spoylers tyll cast presence israel deuyded house dauid made thē kynge one ieroboam sonne nebat turned israel back ye lorde caused thē synne sore thus walked childrē israel ye synnes ieroboam done departed frō vntyll ye lorde put israel presence acordinge spokē seruauntes ye prophetes 〈…〉 israel caried awaye awne londe assiria vnto daye kynge assiria caused men come frō babilon cutha frō aua hemath sepharuaim caused thē inhabite ye city samaria steade child israel toke possession samaria dwelt ye city whā begāne dwell feared ye lorde lorde sent lyon amō ge thē slewe caused sayde vnto ye kynge assiria heythē thou hast broughte hither caused inhabite city samaria knowe lawe ye god londe therfore hath sent lyon amōge beholde slaye thē knowe ordinaunce god londe kinge assiria cōmaunded saide bringe thither one ye prestes yt caried awaye frō thence let go thither dwell teach thē ordinaū • e god ye londe came one • prestes caried awaye samaria dwelt bethel taughte shulde feare ye lorde euery people made thē goddes put thē house vpon ye hye place samaritanes made euery people ī city wherin dwelt babilō made sochoth benoth chut made nergel hemath made asima aua made nibehas tharthak sepharuaim burnt sonnes vnto adramelech anamelech ye goddes thē sepharuaim whyle feared ye lorde made prestes ye hye place ye lowest amonge put ye house ye hye place thus feared ye lorde serued ye goddes also acordinge ye custome euery nacion whence broughte vnto daye ye olde fashion yt nether feare ye lorde ner yet kepe awne ordinaunces lawes lawe commaundement lorde cōmaunded childrē iacob 〈…〉 vnto gaue ye name israel made couenaunt commaunded sayde 〈…〉 feare none goddes worshipe serue offer vnto them▪ lorde broughte lōde egipte greate power outstretched arme feare worshippe vnto sacrifice statute ordinaunces lawe cōmaundement hath caused wrytten vnto se ye kepe ye allwaye therafter feare none goddes forget couenaunt hath made lest ye feare goddes feare ye lorde youre god shall delyuer youre enemy neuertheles wolde herken dyd olde custome thus heythen feared lorde serued idol also dyd child childers childrē likewyse euē father haue done vnto daye xviii chapter thirde yeare oseas ye sonne ela kynge israel 〈◊〉 29 reigned ezechias ye sonne achas kynge iuda fyue twentie yeare olde whan made kynge reigned nyne twentye yeare ierusalem mother name abi doughter zachary dyd righte sighte lorde acordinge vnto dyd dauid father
