vnto lorde 〈◊〉 ▪ 5 • vpon first daye seuenth moneth beganne offre burnt sacrifice vnto lorde foundacion tēple lorde yet layed neuertheles gaue money vnto ye mason carpenter meate drynke oyle vnto zidon tyre brynge thē cedre tymbre libanus see vnto 〈…〉 ioppa acordinge cō maundement cyrus kynge persia seconde yeare commynge vnto house god ierusalem seconde moneth beganne zorobabel sonne salathiel iesua sonne iosedec remnaunt brother prestes leuites come captiuyte vnto ierusalem appoynted leuites frō twentye yeare olde aboue se worke house lorde wēte forwarde iesua stode sonnes brother cadmiel sonnes child iuda furthur workman house god namely childrē henadad child brother leuites whan buylders layed foundacion temple lorde prestes stode araye trompettes leuites child asaph cimbales prayse ye lorde 〈◊〉 17▪ b dytie dauid kynge israel sunge together geuynge prayse thankes vnto ye lorde gracious mercy endureth euer vpon israell people shouted londe praysinge lorde foundacion ye house lorde layed neuertheles many olde prestes leuites awncient father sene house afore foundacion eye wepte loude many shouted ioye noyse gaue greate sounde moch people coulde knowe ye ioyfull sounde noyse wepinge people people shouted loude noyse herde farre iiii chapter bvt whan aduersaries iuda ben iamin herde child captiuyte buylded tē ple vnto lorde god israel came zorobabel pryncipall father sayde vnto wyl buylde seke lorde youre god like ye haue done sacrifice vnto him4 17 c sence tyme assar hadon kynge assur broughte v vp hither zorobabel iesua awnciēt father israel answered mete v buylde house oure god wyl buylde alone vnto lorde god israel 1 esd 1 cyrus kynge persia hath commaunded v folke londe hyndered people iuda made afrayed buylde hyred councelers aganst hyndered deuyce longe cyrus kynge persia lyued vntyll reigne darius kynge persia whan ahasuerus kynge begynnynge reigne wrote vnto complaynte agaynst iuda ierusalem tyme artaxerses wrote bisellam mithridath tabeel councell vnto artaxerses kynge persia scripture ye letter wrytten syrian speach interpretated langage syrian rehum ye chaunceler simsai scrybe wrote letter agaynst ierusalem artaxerses kynge rehum chaunceler simsai scribe councell dina arphasath tarplat persia arach babilon susan deha elam people 4 17 c greate noble asnaphar broughte ouer set city samaria syde water canaan ye summe letter sent vnto kynge artaxerses thy seruauntes men syde water canaan knowne vnto ye kynge iewes come vp v vnto ierusalē sedicious wicked cite buylde make vp ye walles brynge ye foundacion knowne therfore vnto ye kynge yt yf cite buylded walies made vp agayne thē shal geue tribute toll yearly custome deuyce shal ye kynge harme therby destroyed temple wolde longer se kynges dishonoure therfore sent caused kynge certified therof maye soughte ye cronicles thy progenitours shalt thou fynde cronicles perceaue cite sedicious noysome vnto kynges londes cause also rebell olde cause cite destroyed therfore certifie kynge yf cite buylded walles therof made vp thou shalt kepe nothinge syde water reason sent ye kynge answere vnto rehum chaunceler simsai scrybe councell dwelt samaria vnto beyonde ye water peace salutacion letter ye sent vnto v hath bene opē ly red haue commaunded make search founde cite olde hath made insurreccion agaynst kynges yt vpror rebellion hath bene commytted therin haue bene mightie kynges also ierusalē haue reigned ouer beyonde water toll tribute yearly custome geuen vnto ye commaundemēt forbyd men cite builded tyll haue geuē cōmaundemēt take hede ye necligent lest kynge haue harme thorow whā kynge artaxerses letter red rehum chaunceler simsai scrybe councell wente vp haist ierusalem vnto iewes forbad arme auctorite ceassed worke house god ierusalem continued vnto seconde yeare darius kynge persia v chapter prophetes aggeus zachary ye sonne iddo prophecied vnto ye iewes iuda ierusalē name god israel gat vp zorobabel sonne salathiel agg 1 c iesua sonne iosedec beganne buylde house god ierusalem prophetes god strengthed thē tyme came thē thathnai debite syde water sethar bosen councelers sayde thus vnto hath commaunded buylde house make vp walles therof tolde name men made buyldinge eye god came vpon elder iewes inhibyte tyll matter brought darius tyll came wrytinge therof agayne summe letter yt thathnaithe debyte syde water sethar bosen councellers apharsach syde water sent vnto kynge darius wordes sent vnto vnto darius kynge peace knowne vnto kynge came iewry house ye greate god buylded maner stone balckes layed walles ye worke goeth fast forth prospereth handes neuertheles axed elder sayde vnto hath cōmaunded buylde house make vp walles therof axed name also might certifye haue wrytten name men ruler answered v wt wordes sayde seruaūtes god heauen earth buylde house yt buylded many yeares agoo 〈…〉 greate kynge israel buylded set vp howbeit whan oure father prouoked god heauen vnto wrath 〈…〉 gaue ouer hande nabuchodonosor kynge babilon caldee brake downe house caried ye people awaye vnto babilon 〈…〉 neuertheles first yeare cyrus kynge babilon ye kynge cyrus commaunded buylde house god vessel golde siluer house god nabuchodonosor toke temple ierusalē broughte thē ye temple babilon dyd cyrus kynge take ye temple babilon 〈…〉 delyuered vnto seszbazer name made debyte sayde vnto take vessel go thy waye brynge vnto temple ierusalem let house god buylded place came seszbazar layed ye foundacion house god ierusalem sence tyme hath bene buyldinge yet fynished yf please ye kynge let search made ye kynges treasure house babilon whether haue bene kynge cyrus commaundement house god ierusalem shulde buylded sende v ye kynges mynde concernynge vi chapter cōmaunded kinge darius search shulde made ye library ye kynges treasure house laye babilon egbathanis castell lyeth londe meedes founde boke acte wrytten maner first yeare kynge cyrus cōmaunded kynge cyrus buylde ye house god ierusalem place sacrifice made laye foundacion beare thre score cubites heyght thre score cubites bredth thre walles maner stone one wall tymber expences shalbe geuen kynges house goldē syluer vessell ye house god nabuchodonosor toke temple ierusalem broughte vnto babilon shalbe restored agayne yt maye broughte vnto temple ierusalē place house god get farre therfore thou thathnai debyte beyonde water sethar bosen youre councelers beyonde water let worke ye house god debyte ye iewes elder maye buylde house god place haue commaunded also shalbe done ye elder iuda buyldinge house god shal diligently takē kynges goodes euen rente beyonde water geuen vnto men hyndered yf haue nede calues lambes goates burnt offrynge vnto ye god heauen wheate salt wyne oyle custome prestes ierusalem shalbe geuen daylie acordinge se done necligētly maye offre swete sauoures vnto ye god heauen praye kynges lyfe child commaundement haue geuē man euer altereth wordes shal balke taken house set vp shal hanged theron house shalbe prysed dede god dwelleth heauen destroye kynges people put hāde alter breake downe house god ierusalem darius haue commaunded diligently done thathnai ye debyte beyonde ye water sethar bosen councelers kynge darius sent dyd diligence ye elder iewes buylded prospered thorow prophecienge aggeus prophet zachary sonne iddo buylded set vp worke acordinge commaundement god israel commaundement cyrus darius artaxerses kynges persia perfourmed house vnto thirde daye moneth adar sixte yeare reigne kynge darius 2 par 7and child israel prestes leuites child ye captyuite helde dedicacion house god ioye offred dedicacion house god hundreth calues two hundreth lambes foure hundreth goates syn offerynge israel twolue goates acordinge nombre trybes israel set prestes course ye leuites office mynister vnto god ierusalē wrytten boke moses child captyuite helde passeouer vpon fourtenth daye first moneth ye prestes leuites purified selues yt cleane one man kylled passeouer child captyuite brethrē prestes selues childrē israel come agayne captiuyte soch separated selues vnto fylthinesse heythen londe seke lorde god israel ate helde feast vnleuēded bred seuen dayes ioye lorde made glad turned hert kynge assur vnto thē handes strengthed worke house god ye god israel vii chapter actes reigne artaxerses kynge persia • esd • wente vp babilon eszdras sonne seraia sonne asaria sonne helchias sonne sallum sonne sadoc sonne achitob sonne amaria sonne asaria sonne meraioth sonne serahia ye sonne vsi sonne buki sonne abisua sonne phineas sonne eleasar sonne aaron chefe prest quycke scrybe lawe moses 〈◊〉 20 lorde god israel dyd geue ye kynge gaue requyred acordinge hande lorde god vpon wente vp certayne child israel prestes leuites syngers porter nethinims vnto ierusalem seuenth yeare kynge artaxerses came ierusalem fifth moneth seuenth yeare kynge vpon first daye first moneth deuysed go vp babilon ye first daye fifth moneth came ierusalem acordinge good hande god vpon eszdras prepared hert seke lawe lorde teach precepte iudgment israel summe letter kynge artaxerses gaue vnto eszdras prest scrybe teacher wordes lorde statute ouer israel vnto eszdras prest scrybe lawe god heauen peace salutacion haue commaunded people israel prestes leuites realme mynded awne good wyll go vp ierusalem go beynge sent kynge seuen lordes councell vyset iuda ierusalem acordinge lawe god thy hāde thou shuldest take syluer golde kynge lordes councell geue awne good wyll vnto god israel whose habitacion ierusalem syluer golde thou canst fynde ye countre babilon people prestes geue awne good wil vnto house god ierusalem take thou bye diligently money calues lambes goates meat offerynges drynk offerynges offred vpon altare house youre god ierusalem loke lyketh thy brother remnaunt money wyll youre god vessel geuen mynistracion house thy god delyuer thou god ierusalem euer thinge shal nedefull house thy god necessary spende let geuē kynges chamber kynge artaxerses haue commaunded treasurer beyonde water yt loke euer eszdras prest scrybe lawe god heauē requyreth ye fulfyll diligently vntyll hundreth talētes syluer tyll hundreth quarter wheate tyll hūdreth batthes wyne tyll hundreth batthes oyle salt without measure whatsoeuer belongeth lawe god hea • uen let done diligence house god heauē come wrath vpon kynges realme child knowne vnto ye shall haue auctorite requyre taxinge custome yearly rente vpon eny prestes leuites syngers porter nethinims mynisters ye house god thou eszdras wyszdome ye god thy hande set thou iudges arbiter iudge people beyonde iordane euen soch knowe lawe thy god knowe se ye teache euer wyl diligently fulfyll lawe thy god kynges lawe shall haue iudgmēt dede whether vnto death banyshed condemned good put preson praysed lorde god oure father hath inspyred ye kynges • garnysh house god ierusalem hath enclyned mercy vnto presence kynge councelers kynges hye estate comforted acordinge hāde lorde god ouer gathered heades israel together yt mighte go vp viii chapter heades father named wente vp wt babilon tyme kynge artaxerses reigned childrē phineas gersom child ithamar daniel child dauid hattus childrē pareos zachary men childrē nombred hundreth fiftye child pahath moab eleoenai sonne serahia wt two hundreth male child sechania sonne iehasiel thre hundreth male child adin ebed sonne ionathan fiftie male child elam iesaia sonne athalia seuentie male child sephatia sebadia sonne michael wt foure score male op child ioab obadia sonne iehiel adonicam name eliphelet ieiel semaia thre score male child bigenai vthai sabud seuē male gathered together water renneth towarde ahena abode thre dayes whan loked amonge people prestes founde leuites thē sent elieser ariel semaia elnathan iarib elnathan natha zachary mesullam ruler ioiarib elnathan teacher sent vnto iddo ye chefest casiphia shulde fetch u mynysters house oure god tolde shulde child merari brother sonnes twentye ne • hinims dauid prince gaue mynister vnto leuites two hundreth twentye named name euen water besyde ahena caused fastinge proclamed yt mighte humble oure selues oure god seke righte waye u oure child oure substaunce ashamed require kynge soudyers horsmen helpe u agaynst enemye waye sayde vnto kynge hande oure god best vpon seke violence wrath vpon forsake fasted soughte oure god herde u toke twolue chefe prestes serebia hasabia ten brother weyed syluer golde vessel heue offeringe vnto house oure god kynge lordes councell prynces israel hande geuen heue offerynge weyed vnder hande sixe hundreth fiftye talentes syluer syluer vessell hundreth talentes golde hundreth talentes twentye cuppes golde thousande gulden two costly ornamentes good brasse cleare golde sayde vnto ye holy vnto lorde therfore vessel holy also syluer golde geuen good wyll vnto lorde god youre father watch ye therfore kepe tyll ye weye downe chefe prestes leuites awncient father israel ierusalem chestes house lorde toke prestes leuites weyed syluer golde vessell brynge ierusalem vnto ye house oure god brake vp water ahena twolueth daye first moneth go vnto ierusalem hande oure god vpon u delyuered u frō hande enemy preuy waytinges waye came ierusalem abode thre dayes ye fourth daye syluer golde vessell weyed house oure god vnder hande meremoth sonne vrias prest eleasar sonne phineas iosabad sonne iesua noadia ye sonne benui leuites acordinge nombre weight euery one weight wrytten vp tyme child captiuyte come preson offred burnt offeringes vnto ye god israel twolue bullockes israel sixe nynetye rammes seuen seuentye lambes twolue goates syn offerynge burnt offeringe lorde delyuered kynges commyssion vnto kynges officer debytes syde water promoted people house god ix chapter whan perfourmed ruler came sayde people israel prestes leuites separated nacions londes touchinge abhominacions namely cananites hethites pheresites iebusites ammonite moabites egipcians amorites deut 7 • nd 12 • osu 23 c • udic 3 haue taken doughters sonnes haue myxte holy sede ye nacions londes hande ruler lordes councell hath bene principall trespace whan herde rente clothes rayment plucte heer heade beerd sat mournynge resorted vnto soch feared worde lorde god israel greate transgression sat mournynge vntyll euenynge sacrifyce aboute euenynge sacrifice rose vp fro heuynes rente clothes raiment fell vpon knee spred handes vnto lorde god sayde god ashamed darre lifte vp mine eies vnto god oure wickedness growne ouer oure heade oure trespaces waxen greate vnto ye heauē sence tyme oure father haue bene greate trespace vnto daie deu 28 oure wickedness haue kynges bene delyuered hande ye kynges nacions swerde captiuyte spoyle confusion face come passe daye litle sodane graciousnes come lorde oure god v escaped maie geue v nayle holy place oure god maye lighte oure eye geue v litle lyfe oure bondage bondman god hath forsakē v though bondman hath enclyned mercy vnto v sighte kynges persia shulde geue v lyfe promote house oure god sett vp desolacion therof geue v hedge iuda ierusalem oure god shall saye haue forsaken thy commaundementes thou hast commaunded thy seruauntes prophetes saide londe wherin ye shal come possesse vncleane londe thorow fylthines people londes abhominacions wherwith haue made full vnclennes euery syde therfore shal ye geue youre doughters vnto sonnes doughters shall ye take vnto youre sonnes seke peace welth euer ye maye stronge enioye good londe yt ye youre child maye haue inheritaunce euermore come vpon v oure euell dedes greate trespace thou oure god hast spared oure wickedness hast geuen v delyueraunce come passe v haue turned backe haue let go thy commaundementes make contracte people abhominacions wilt thou wroth v tyll vtterly consumed nothynge remayne tyll delyueraunce lorde god israel thou art righteous remaine yet escaped daie beholde thy presence oure trespace stondinge x chapter whan eszdras prayed maner knowleged wepte laie house god resorted vnto israel greate congregacion men wemen child people wepte sore sachania sonne iehiel one child elam answered sayde vnto eszdras haue trespaced agaynst lorde oure god haue taken straunge wyues people londe hope yet israel cōcerninge therfore let v make couenaūt oure god shal put awaye wyues soch borne acordynge councell ye lorde feare commaundement oure god yt maye acordynge lawe get vp therfore matter belongeth vnto wyll good comforte rose eszdras toke ooth ruler prestes leuites israel shulde acordynge worde swore eszdras stode vp house god wente chamber iohanan sonne eliasab whan came thither ate bred dranke water mourned transgression bene captiuyte caused proclamacion made thorow iuda ierusalem vnto child bene captiuite yt shulde gather selues together vnto ierusalē soeuer came within thre dayes acordinge deuyce ruler elder substaunce shulde forfett put cō gregacion captiue men iuda ben iamin gathered selues together vnto ierusalem thre dayes yt twentieth daye nyenth moneth people sat strete house god trembled matter rayne eszdras ye prest stode vp sayde vnto 〈◊〉 7 〈◊〉 3 ye haue transgressed yt ye haue taken straunge wyues make trespace israel yet confesse therfore vnto ye lorde god youre father pleasure separate youre selues people londe ye straunge wyues thē answered cō gregacion sayde loude voyce let done thou hast sayde people many raynye wether cā stōde without nether worke one daye two many yt haue offended transgression let v appoynte oure ruler therfore congregacion yt haue taken straunge wyues oure city maye come tyme appoynted elder euery cite iudges tyll wrath oure god matter turned awaye v appoynted ionathan sonne asahel iehasia sonne thecua ouer matter mesullam sabthai leuites helped child captiuyte dyd euen eszdras prest ye awncient father thorow house father rehearsed name separated thē selues sat downe first daye tenth moneth examē matter ye first daye ye first moneth broughte matter conclusion concernynge men yt takē straunge wyues amōge childrē prestes men founde yt takē straunge wyues namely amōge child iesua sonne iosedec brethrē maeseia elieser iarib godolia gaue hādes vpon wolde put awaye wyues trespace offerynge geue rāme trespace amō ge child immer hanani sabadia amonge childrē harim maeseia elia semaia iehiel vsia amonge ye child pashur elioenai maeseia ismael nethaneel iosabad eleasa amonge leuites iosabad simei celaia celita pethahia iuda eleasar amonge syngers elyasib amonge porter sallum telem vri israel amonge child pareos ramia iesia malchia meiamin eleasar malchia benaia amonge ye child elam mathania zachary iehiel abdy ieremoth elia amonge child sathu elioenai eliasib mathania ieremoth sabad asisa amonge child bebai iohanan hanania sabai athlai amonge child ban mesullam malluch adaia iasub seal ieremoth amonge child pahath moab adna chelal benaia maesea mathania bezaleel benui manasse amonge child harim elieser iesia malchia semaia simeon bē iamin malluch samaria amonge childrē hasum mathnai mathatha sabad eliphelet ieremai manasse simei amōge childrē ban maedai amram huel benaia bedia chelui naia meremoth eliasib mathania mathnai iaesau ban benui simei selemia nathan adaia machnadbai sasai sarai afareel selemia samaria sallum amaria ioseph amonge childrē nebo ieiel mathithia sabad sebina iaddai ioel benaia taken straunge wyues amonge wyues borne child ende first boke eszdras seconde boke esdras otherwyse called boke nehemias boke conteyneth chap nehemias mourneth captiuyte people chap ii nehemias optayneth licence kynge artaxerses otherwyse called arthasastha go vnto ierusalem chap iii buyldinge cite chap iiii officer go aboute hynder buyldinge iewes watch prepayre thē selues buylde fighte chap v nehemias reproueth vsury chap vi officer go aboute kyll nehemias chap vii nombre departe babilon chap viii feast tabernacle readeth eszdras boke lawe chap ix lawe red people exhorted vnto godlynesse chap x renue couenaunt lorde seale chap xi people sundered dwell ierusalem city without chap xii name prestes leuites wente vp zorobabel dedicacion wall ierusalem chap xiii separate straungers amonge people god porcion leuites appoynted sabbath renued first chapter actes nehemias sonne hachalia fortuned ye moneth chisleu ye twētieth yeare castell susan hanani one brother came certayne mē iuda axed iewes dyd delyuered escaped captiuyte wente ierusalē sayde vnto remnaunt captiuyte londe greate mysfortune rebuke • 25 b walles ierusalem broken downe porte therof brent fyre whā herde wordes sat downe wepte mourned two dayes fasted prayed god heauen sayde lorde god heauen thou greate terrible god • xo 20 • nd 34 • eut 7 b thou yt kepest couenaunt mercy yt loue obserue thy cōmaundementes let ye eares marke let thine eies open yt thou mayest heare prayer ye seruaunt▪ praye ye daye nighte child israel thy seruauntes knowlege synnes child israel haue commytted agaynst father house haue synned also haue bene corrupte vnto yt haue kepte cōmaundementes statute lawes thou cōmaundedst ye seruaunt moses yet call remembraunce ye worde thou cōmaundedst thy seruaunt moses saydest • eut 30 yf ye trāsgresse wil scater abrode amonge naciōs yf ye turne vnto kepe commaundementes though ye cast vnto vttemost parte heauen yet wyl gather thence wyll brynge thence euē vnto place haue chosen name dwell thy seruauntes thy people thou hast delyuered thorow thy greate power mightie hande lorde let thine eares marke prayer thy seruaunt prayer thy seruauntes whose desyre feare thy name let thy seruaunt prospere daye graunte mercy sight man kynges b • • ar ii chapter moneth nisan twentieth yeare kynge artaxerses whā wyne stode toke vp wyne gaue vnto ye kynge heuy presence sayde ye kynge vnto lokest thou sadly thou art sicke ye matter thou art heuy harted neuertheles sore afrayed sayde vnto kynge god saue kynges life euer shulde loke sadly cite father buryall lyeth wayest porte therof consumed wt fyre sayde kynge vnto thē thy request made prayer god heauē sayde vnto kynge yf please kynge yf thy seruaunt fauoured thy sighte beseke sende iuda vnto ye cite father buryall maye buylde ye kynge sayde vnto dyd quene yt sat lōge shal thy iourney cōtynue whā wilt thou come agayne pleased ye kynge sende set tyme sayde vnto kynge yf please kynge let geue letter debites beyonde ye water yt maye conueye ouer tyll come iuda letter vnto assaph lorde kynges wod yt maye geue wodd balkes gate palace harde house harde walles cite house shal entre ye kynge gaue acordinge good hande god vpō whan came ye debites beyonde water gaue ye kynges letter kynge sent captaynes horsmen whan saneballath horonite tobias seruaunt ammonite herde yt greued sore yt come man soughte welth child israel whan came ierusalem bene thre day gat • vp ye night season fewe men tolde man god geuē • hert ierusalem one beest wt saue yt rode vpon rode nighte vnto valley po •• dragon well dongporte considered ye walles ierusalem broken downe porte therof consumed wt fyre wente ouer vnto ye well porte kynges condyte rowme beest yt coulde go vnder wēte nighte broke syde cōsidered ye wall turned back came home agayne ye valley porte ye ruler knewe whither wēte dyd hither tolde iewes prestes councelers ruler yt laboured worke saide vnto thē ye se myserye yt ierusalē lyeth wayst ye gate therof brent wt fyre come let v buylde vp ye walles ierusalē yt nomore rebuke tolde thē good hāde god vpō ye kynges wordes yt spokē vnto saide let v get vp buylded handes strengthed good whan saneballat ye horonite tobias seruaunt ye ammonite gosem arabian herde laughed v scorne despised v sayde ye wyll ye fall awaye agayne kynge answered sayde god heauen shal cause v prospere seruauntes gotten vp buyldinge ye haue porciō ner right ner remembraunce ierusalē iii chapter eliasib hye prest gat vp brother prestes buylded shepegate halowed set vp dores euen vnto tower mea halowed namely vnto 〈…〉 tower hananeel nexte vnto buylded ye men iericho besyde buylded sachur sonne imri fyshporte dyd child senaa buylde couered set dores locke barres nexte vnto buylded meremoth sonne vria sonne hacoz nexte vnto buylded mesullam ye sonne barachias ye sonne mesesabeel nexte vnto buylded sadoc ye sonne baena nexte vnto buylded thecoa greate mē put neckes ye seruyce lorde oldgate buylded ioiada ye sonne passeah mesullam sonne besodia couered set dores locke barres nexte vnto buylded melacia gibeon iadon morono mē gibeon mispa seate debyte syde water nexte vnto buylded vsiel sonne harhaia goldsmyth nexte vnto buylded hanania ye apotecarys sonne repayred ierusalē vnto brode wall nexte vnto buylded reph • ia sonne hur ruler halfe quarter ierusalem nexte vnto buylded iedaia sonne harumaph ouer agaynst house nexte vnto buylded hattus sonne hasabenia malchia sonne harim hasub sonne pahath moab buylded ye pece tower beside fornace nexte vnto buylded sallum sonne halohes ruler halfe quarter ierusalem daughter valley gate buylded hanum citesins sanoah buylded set dores locke barres therof thousande cubytes wall vnto dō geporte dongeporte buylded malechia sonne rechab ruler fourth parte vynyardes buylded set dores locke barres therof wellgate builded sallum ye sonne chal hose ruler fourth parte mispa builded couered set ye dores locke barres therof wall vnto pole sybah kynges garden vnto steppe go downe cite dauid builded nehemia sonne aszbulr ruler halfe quarter bethzur vntyll side ouer agaynst sepulcres dauid pole asuia vnto house mightie buylded leuites rehum sonne ban nexte vnto buylded hasabia ye ruler halfe quarter regila quarter buylded brethrē banai sonne henadab ruler halfe quarter segila buylded eser sonne iesua ye ruler mispa pece hard ouer harnesse corner buylded baruc sonne sabai pece worshipfully costly frō corner vnto ye dore ye house eliasib ye hye prest builded meremoth sonne vria sonne hacos pece frō ye dore eliasibs house vnto ende house eliasib buylded prestes mē countre buylded ben iamin hasub ouer house thē buylded asaria sonne maeseia sonne anania nexte vnto house buylded benui ye sonne henadad pece house asaria vnto turnynge vnto corner buylded palal sonne vsai ouer agaynst corner hye tower lieth ouer frō kynges house besyde courte preson pedaia sonne pareos ye nethinims dwelt ophel vnto ye watergate towarde east ye tower lieth buylded thecoa ye pece ouer ye greate tower yt lieth outwarde vnto wall • pa 33 c ophel horsgate forth buylded ye prestes euery one ouer agaynst house buylded sadoc ye sonne immer ouer house buylded semaia sonne sachania ye keper eastgate buylded hanania sonne selemia hanum sonne zalaph ye sixte ye peace builded mesullam sonne berechia ouer chest builded malchia goldsmythes sonne vntyll ye house nethinims▪ marchauntes ouer agaynst councell gate perler corner betwene perler corner vnto shepegate builded gold smythes marchauntes iiii chapter bvt whan saneballat herde builded ye wall wroth toke greate indignaciō mocked ye iewes saide brethrē mightie men samaria impotēt iewes shall thus suffred shall offre shal perfourme one daie shal make ye stone whole againe yt brought dust brent tobias ammonite beside saide let thē builde yf foxe go vp shall breake downe stonye wall heare thou oure god despysed turne shame vpon awne heade yt thou mayest geue ouer despisinge londe captiuite couer wickednesse put sinne frō ye presence haue prouoked buylders yet buylded wall ioyned whole together vnto ye halfe heigth people well mynded labor whan saneballat tobias ye arabiās ammonite aszdodites herde yt walles ierusalem made vp begonne stoppe vp ye gappes wroth cōspyred together come fight ierusalem make hinderaunce therin neuertheles made praier vnto oure god set watchmē vpō wall daye night ouer iuda saide strēgth bearer feble moch dust able builde wall aduersaries thought shall knowe nether se tyll come myddes amonge thē slaye hynder ye worke whan iewes dwelt besyde came place dwelt aboute v tolde v good tē tymes set people kynreds swerdes speares bowes beneth lowe place behynde wall loked gat vp sayde vnto chefe men ruler people ye afrayed thynke vpon ye greate lorde ought feared fighte yor brother sonnes daughter wyues house neuertheles whan enemy herde yt gotten worde god broughte councell naughte turned againe wall euery one vnto labor time forth came passe yt halfe parte yonge men dyd laboure halfe parte helde speares shyldes bowes brestplates ruler stode behynde house iuda buylded wall bare burthēs laded thē one hande dyd ye worke helde weapen euery one yt buylded swerde girde side builded trompetters stode beside sayde vnto pryncipall men ruler ye people worke greate large separated vpon wall one farre another loke place ye heare noise ye trompe resorte ye thiter vnto v 〈…〉 oure god shal fight v wil labourīge ye worke halfe parte thē helde ye speares frō ye morninge springe till ye starres came forth ye tyme sayde vnto ye people euery one abyde seruaunt ierusalem yt night season maye geue attendaunce ye watch laboure daye tyme brother seruauntes ye men watch behynde put neuer oure clothes moch washe oure selues v chapter arose greate complaynte ye people wyues brother iewes yt sayde oure sonnes doughters many let v take corne thē eate maye lyue saide let v set londes vynyardes house pledge take vp corne derth saide let v borowe money kinge vpō vsury oure londes vynyardes oure brethren body oure awne body child oure child el shulde subdue oure sonnes doughters vnto bondage oure doughters subdued allready strength oure handes men shal haue oure londes vynyardes whan herde complaynte soch wordes displeased sore aduysed mynde yt rebuked councelers ruler sayde vnto 〈…〉 wyl ye requyre vsury one another broughte greate congregacion agaynst sayde vnto oure abilyte haue boughte oure brother iewes solde vnto heythen wyl ye sell youre brother haue boughte vnto v helde peace coulde fynde nothinge answere sayde good ye oughte ye walke feare god rebuke heythen oure enemy brethrē seruauntes haue lent money corne vsury let v leaue therfore daye se ye restore thē londes agayne vynyardes oyle garden house hundreth parte money corne wyne oyle ye haue wonne sayde wyl restore agayne wyl requyre nothinge wyl thou hast spoken called prestes toke ooth thē shulde shoke lappe sayde god shake euery man maner frō house laboure maynteyneth worde euen thus shaken voyde ye congregacion sayde amen praysed lorde people dyd 〈…〉 tyme forth commytted vnto debyte londe iuda namely twentieth yeare vnto two thirtieth yeare kynge artaxerses twolue yeare brethrē lyued soch sustenaunbe geuen debyte olde debytes bene chargeable vnto people takē thē bred wyne fortye sycles syluer yee seruauntes oppressed people dyd feare god laboured also worke vpon wall boughte lōde seruaūtes came thither together vnto ye worke morouer table hundreth fiftie iewes ruler came vnto amonge heythen aboute v prepared daylie oxe sixe chosen shepe byrdes euer ten dayes greate summe wyne yet requyred lyuynge debyte ye bondage greuous vnto ye people thynke vpō god vnto ye best acordī ge haue done people2 esd 13 • vi chapter whan saneballat tobias gosem arabian oure enemyes herde buylded wall mo gappes ther howbeit tyme hanged dores vpon gate saneballat gosem sent vnto sayenge come let u mete together vyllages vpon playne cite • neuertheles thoughte euell notwithstondynge sent messaungers vnto sayenge haue greate busynes come downe worke shulde stonde still yf necligent came downe howbeit sent vnto good foure tymes maner gaue answere sent saneballat seruaunt vnto fifth tyme open letter hande wherin wrytten tolde heythen gosem hath sayde thou iewes thynke rebell ye cause thou buyldest wall wylt kynge matter hast ordeyned prophetes preach ierusalem saye kynge iuda shal come kynges eares come therfore let u take oure councell together neuertheles sent vnto sayenge soch thinge done thou sayest thou hast fayned thine owne hert mynded make u afrayed thoughte shal withdrawe handes worke yt shal laboure howbeit strēgthed hande came vnto ye house semaia ye sonne delaia sonne mechetabeel shut selfe within sayde let u come together ye house god euē vnto ye myddes ye tēple sparre ye dores ye tēple wyl come slaye ye yee euē night wyl come put death sayde shulde soch mā flye shulde soch mā go ye tēple saue life wyl go perceaued god sent yet spake prophecye vpon neuerthelesse tobias saneballat hired money therfore toke money shulde afrayed synne might haue euell reporte blaspheme god thynke thou vpon tobias saneballat acordynge vnto workes ye prophet noadia prophetes yt wolde haue put feare wall fynished fyue together one man vpon strete watergate sayde vnto eszdras scrybe shulde fetch boke lawe moses lorde commaunded israel deu 31 c 4 2 • • eszdras prest brought ye lawe congregaciō men wemen coulde vnderstonde vpon first daye seuenth moneth red therin strete watergate ye light mornynge vntyll noone daye men wemen soch coulde vnderstonde eares people inclyned vnto boke lawe eszdras scrybe stode vpon hye pulpit wod made preachynge beside stode mathithia sema anania vria ezechias maescia righte hand lefte honde stode pedaia misael malchia hasum haszbadana zachary mesullam eszdras opened ye boke ye people stode aboue ye people whan opened people stode vp eszdras praysed lorde greate god people answered amen amen handes vp bowed thē selues worshipped ye lorde face grounde iesua ban serebia iamin acub sabthai hodaia maescia celita asaria iosabad hanam plaia leuites caused ye people geue hede vnto lawe people stode place red boke lawe god distinctly planely men vnderstode thinge red nehemias hathirsatha esdras prest scrybe leuites yt caused people take hede sayde vnto people daye holy vnto lorde youre god ye sory therfore wepe ye people wepte whā herde wordes lawe therfore sayde vnto go youre waye eate fat drynke swete sende parte vnto also haue prepared themselues daye holy vnto oure lorde ye sory therfore ioye lorde youre strength leuites stylled people sayde holde youre peace daye holy vexe ye youre selues people wente waye eate drinke sende pa • te vnto make greate myrth vnderstonde wordes declared vnto nexte daye gathered together chefe father amonge people prestes leuites vnto esdras scrybe shulde teach ye wordes lawe founde written lawe leui 23 f lorde commaunded moses childrē israel shulde dwell bothes feast seuenth moneth caused declared proclamed city ierusalem sayenge go vp vnto ye moūt fetch olyue braunches pynebraunches myrtbraunches palmebraunches braunches thicketrees make bothes wrytten ye people wente vp fetched thē made bothes euery greate gladnesse euery daye first daie vnto last red boke lawe god seuen dayes helde feast eight daye gatherynge together acordynge vnto maner ix chapter foure twentieth daye moneth came child israel together fastinge sack clothes earth vpon separated sede israel straunge child stode knowleged synnes wyckednesses father stode vp place red boke lawe lorde god foure tymes daye knowleged worshipped lorde god foure tymes daye leuites stode hye namely iesua ban cadmiel sebania buni serebia ban chenani cryed loude vnto lorde god leuites iesua cadmiel ban hasabenia serebia hodia sebania pethahia sayde stonde vp prayse lorde oure god euer let thankes geuē vnto name thy glorye excelleth thankesgeuynge prayse lorde thou art alone thou hast made heauen heauen heauens hoost earth therin see therin thou geuest life vnto ye hoost heauen bowe themselues vnto thou art lorde god hast chosen abrā broughte vr chaldea 〈…〉 called abraham founde hert faithfull 〈…〉 madest couenaūt geue vnto sede londe cananites hethites amorites pheresites iebusites girgosites hast made good thy wordes thou art righteous 〈…〉 hast considered mysery oure father egipte herde complainte reed see shewed tokēs wonder vpō pharao seruaūtes people londe thou knewest yt presumptuous cruell madest thou 〈…〉 name daie reed see partedst thou sunder wēte thorow myddes see drye shod persecuters threwest thou depe stone mightie water leddest daye tyme cloudy pyler nighte season piler fyre shewe lighte waye yt wente thou camest downe also vpō mount sinai spakest vnto heauen 〈…〉 gauest righte iudgmentes true lawes good commaundementes statute declared vnto thy holy sabbath commaunded preceptes ordinaunces lawes moses thy seruaunt 〈…〉 gauest bred heauen whan hongrye 〈…〉 broughte forth water rock whan thyrstye promysed 〈…〉 shulde go take possession londe ouer thou haddest lyfte vp thine hande geue neuertheles oure father proude hardnecked folowed ye cōmaundementes refused heare myndefull wonder yt thou dyddest became obstynate heady moch turned back bondage dishobedience thou god forgauest wast gracious mercifull pacient greate goodnesse forsokest 〈◊〉 ▪ • 2 b though made molten calfe sayde thy god broughte londe egipte dyd greate blasphemy yet sokest thou wyldernes acordinge thy greate mercy 〈…〉 ye cloudy piler departed ye daye tyme lede waye nether piler fyre night season shewe lighte waye wente thou gauest thy good sprete enfourme 〈…〉 withheldest thy manna mouth 〈…〉 gauest thē water whā thirstie fortye yeares longe madest thou prouysion wyldernesse wanted nothinge 〈…〉 clothes waxed olde fete swelled thou gauest thē kīgdomes nacions partedst thē acordinge porcions possessed 〈…〉 londe sihon kynge heszbon londe og ye kynge basan 〈…〉 childrē multiplyedst thou starres heauen broughtest thē londe wherof thou haddest spoken vnto father shulde go haue possession ye child wente possessed londe 〈◊〉 ▪ • 34 thou subdudest thē inhabiters londe euen cananites gauest hande kynges ye people londe yt might wolde wanne stronge city fat londe toke possession house yt full maner goodes welles dygged vynyardes oylgardens many frutefull tree ate fylled became fat lyued welth thorow thy greate goodnes neuertheles disobedient rebelled agaynst cast thy lawe behynde backes 〈◊〉 1 • b slewe thy prophetes exhorted earnestly shulde cō uerte vnto dyd greate blasphemy therfore gauest thou ouer hā de enemy vexed ye tyme trouble cried vnto thou hardest heauen thorow thy greate mercy thou gauest sauiours helped thē hande enemy whan came rest turned back agayne euell therfore leftest thou hande enemy yt ye dominion ouer cōuerted cryed vnto thou herdest heauen many tyme hast thou delyuered acordinge ye greate mercy testified vnto shulde turne agayne vnto thy lawe notwithstōdinge proude herkened vnto thy cōmaundementes synned thy lawes man shulde lyue turned shulder awaye styffnecked wolde heare many yeares dyddest thou forbeare testified vnto thorow ye sprete euen office ye prophetes yet wolde heare therfore gauest thou thē ye hāde ye nacions londes thy greate mercy sake thou hast vtterly cō sumed nether forsaken thou art gracious mercifull god oure god thou greate god mightie terrible thou kepest couenaunt mercy regarde litle trauayle yt hath happened vnto v oure kynges prynces prestes prophetes father thy people sence tyme kynges assur vnto daie thou art righteous yt thou hast broughte vpō v thou hast done righte v haue bene vngodly kynges prynces prestes father haue done ye lawe ner regarded ye cōmaundementes thy earnest exhortaciōs wherwith thou hast exhorted haue serued ye kyngdome thy greate goodes yt thou gauest large plenteous lōde thou gauest good haue conuerted wicked workes beholde therfore bondage daye yee euen lōde thou gauest vnto oure father enioye frutes goodes therof beholde bondman greate increase vnto kynges thou hast set ouer v oure synnes haue dominion ouer oure body catell greate trouble made sure couenaunt wrote let prynces leuites prestes seale x chapter sealer nehemias hathirsatha sonne hachalia sedechias seraia asaria ieremy pashur amaria malchia hattus sebania malluch harim meremoth obadia daniel sinthun baruch mesullam abia meiamin maasga bilgai semaia prestes leuites iesua ye sonne asania binui amonge childrē henadad cadmiel brother sechania hodia celita plaia hauan micha rehob hasabia sachur serebia sebania hodia ban beninu heades people pareos pahath moab elam sathu ban buni asgad sebai adonia bigenai adiu ater hezechias asur hodia hasum bezai hariph anathot neubai magpias mesullam hesir mesesabeel sadoc iaddua platia hanan anaia hoseia hanania hasub halohes pilha sobek rehum hasabna maeseia ahia hanan anan malluch harim baena people prestes leuites porter syngers nethinims separated selues ye people lōdes vnto lawe god wyues sonnes daughter many coulde vnderstonde lordes rule receaued brother • osu 24 e • par 15 c came sweare bynde selues ooth walke god lawe geuen moses seruaunt god wolde obserue acordinge vnto commaundementes iudgmentes statute lorde oure god deut 7 wolde geue oure doughters vnto people lōde nether take doughters oure sonnes • esd 13 c yf ye people lōde broughte ware sabbath maner vytayles sell wolde take sabbath holy dayes leui 25 deut 15 wolde let seuēth yeare fre concernynge maner charge layed statute vpon oure selues geue yearly ye thirde parte sycle mynistracion house oure god namely shewbred daylie meatofferynge daylie burnt offerynge ye sabbathes new mones feast dayes thinges sanctified syn offerynges reconcyle israel busynes ye house oure god cast lot amonge prestes leuites people offerynge ye wod brought vnto ye house god yeare yeare house oure father might brent tymes appoynted vpon altare lorde oure god wrytten lawe yearly brynge firstlinges londe firstlinges oure frutes tree yeare yeare vnto ye house lorde firstlinges oure sonnes oure catell wrytten lawe firstlinges oure ox oure shepe shulde brynge house oure god vnto prestes mynister house oure god shulde brynge firstlinges oure dowe oure heue offeringes frutes maner tree wyne also oyle vnto prestes chestes house oure god tithe lōde vnto leuites yt leuites might haue tithe city oure mynistracion prest sonne aaron shal wt leuites haue also tithe ye leuites leuites shal brynge vp tithe tithe vnto house oure god chest ye treasure house child israel child leui shall brynge vp heue offerynges corne wyne oyle vnto chestes vessel sanctuary prestes yt mynister porter syngers yt forsake house oure god xi chapter ruler people dwelt ierusalem people cast lotte therfore amōge ten one parte wente ierusalem holy cite dwell nyne partes city ye people thanked men willinge dwell ierusalem heades londe dwelt ierusalem city dwelt iuda euery one possession yt city namely israel prestes leuites ye nethinims child salomon seruauntes ierusalē dwelt certayne child iuda ben iamin child iuda 〈…〉 athaia sonne vsia ye sonne zachary sonne amaria sonne sephatia sonne mahelaleel child phares maeseia sonne baruch sonne chal hose sonne hasaia sonne adaia sonne ioiarib sonne zachary sonne siloni childrē phares dwelt ierusalem foure c eight thre score valeaunt men childrē ben iamin sallu sonne mesullam ye sonne ioed 〈…〉 sonne pedaia sonne colaia ye sonne maeseia sonne ithiel ye sonne iesaia sabai sallai nyne hundreth eight twentye ioel sonne sichri ouersight iuda ye sonne hasnua ouer seconde parte cite 〈…〉 prestes dwelt iedaia ye sonne ioiarib iachin seraia sonne helchias ye sonne mesullam sonne sadoc sonne meraioth sonne achitob prynce house god brethrē perfourmed worke ye house viijc xxij adaia sonne ieroham sonne plalia sonne amzi sonne zachary sonne pashur brethrē chefe amōge father two hundreth two fortye amassai sonne asariel sonne ahusai sonne mesillemoth sonne immer brother valeaunt men hundreth eight twentye ouerseer sabdaiel sonne gedolim leuites semaia sonne hasub 〈◊〉 1 • b sonne asrikam sonne hasabia sonne bunni sabthai iosabad chefe leuites outwarde busynes ye house god mathania sonne micha sonne sabdi sonne assaph pryncipall begynne thankesgeuynge vnto prayer bacbuchia ye seconde amō ge brother abda sonne sammua sonne galal sonne iedithun leuites holy cite two hundreth foure foure score 〈◊〉 1 • c ye porter acub talman brother yt kepte porte hundreth two seuentye residue israel prestes leuites city iuda euery one inheritaunce nethinims dwelt ophel zipha gispa belonged vnto nethinims ouerseer leuites ierusalem vsi sonne ban sonne hasabia sonne mathania sonne micha child assaph syngers aboute ye busynes house god kynges commaundement cō cernynge ye syngers shulde deale faithfully euery daye acordinge pethaia sonne mesesabeel childrē serah sonne iuda nexte kynge matter concernynge people child iuda without townes londe dwelt kiriath arba vyllages therof dibon vyllages therof cabzeel ye vyllages therof iesua molada bethphalet hazarsual berseba vyllages siclag mochona vyllages enrimmon zarega ieremuth sanoah adullam vyllages lachis feldes therof aseka vyllages therof dwelt berseba vnto valley hinnom child ben iamin gaba dwelt michmas aia bethel vyllages anathoth nob anania hazor rama githaim hadid ziboim neballat lod ono carpēters valley certayne leuites yt porcions iuda dwelt ben iamin xii chapter ye prestes leuites wente vp zorobabel ye sonne saalthiel iesua seraia ieremy esdras amaria malluch hattus sechania rehum meremoth iddo ginthoi abia meiamin maadia bilga semaia ioiarib iedaia sallu amok helchias iedaia heades amō ge prestes brother tyme iesua leuites iesua bē nui cadmiel serebia iuda mathania ouer office thankesgeuynge brethrē bacbuchia vnni brethrē aboute watch iesua begat ioachim ioachim begat eliasib eliasib begat ioiada ioiada begat ionathan ionathan begat iaddua tyme ioachim chefe father amonge prestes namely seraia meraia ieremy hanania eszdras mesullam amaria iohanan malluch ionathan sebania ioseph harim adna meraioth helcai iddo zachary ginthon mesullā abia sichri miniamin moadia piltai bilga sammua semaia ionathan ioiarib mathnai iedaia vsi sallai callai amok eber helchias hasabia gedaia nethaneel tyme eliasib ioiada iohanan iaddua chefe father amonge leuites prestes wryttē vnder reigne darius ye persian child leui pryncipall father wrytten cronicles vntyll tyme iohanan sonne eliasib chefe amōge leuites hasabia serebia iesua sonne cadmiel brother ouer agaynst geue prayse thankes acordinge dauid ye mā god ordeyned one watch ouer agaynst another mathania bacbuchia obadia mesullam talmon acub porter watch thresholdes gate tyme ioiachim sonne iesua sonne iosedec tyme nehemias debyte prest eszdras scrybe dedicacion wall ierusalem leuites soughte place mighte broughte ierusalem kepe ye dedicacion gladnesse thankesgeuynges synginge cymbales psaltery harpes child syngers gathered thē selues together playne countre aboute ierusalem vyllages nethophathi house gilgal feldes gibea asmaueth ye syngers buylded vyllages aboute ierusalem ye prestes leuites purified selues clensed people gate wall caused prynces go vp vpon wall appoynted two greate queres thankesgeuynge wēte righte hande wall towarde donggate wēte hosaia halfe prynces iuda asaria eszdras mesullam iuda ben iamin semaia ieremy certayne prestes childrē wt trompettes namely zachary ye sonne ionathan sonne semaia sonne mathania sonne michaia sonne sachur sonne assaph brother semaia asareel milalai gilalai maai nathaneel iuda hanani musicall instrumentes dauid ye man god eszdras ye scrybe thē towarde wellgate wente vp ouer agaynst vpon steppe cite dauid goynge vp wall house dauid vnto watergate eastwarde quere thankesgeuynge wente ouer halfe parte people vpon ye wall towarde ye fornacegate vpwarde vntyll ye brode wall ye porte ephraim oldgate ye fyshgate tower hananeel tower meah vntyll shepegate ye presongate stode styll stode two queres thankesgeuynge house god halfe ruler prestes namely eliachim maeseia miniamin michaia elioenai zachary hanania trōpettes maeseia semaia eleasar vsi iohanan malchia elam aser syngers songe loude iesrahia ouerseer daye greate sacrifice offred reioysed god geuē greate gladnesse wyues child ioyfull myrth ierusalem herde farre tyme men appoynted ouer treasure chestes wherin ye heue offerynges firstlinges tithe shulde gather ye feldes aboute city destribute thē vnto prestes leuites acordinge lawe iuda glad prestes leuites stode wayted vpon office god office purificacion syngers porter stode commaundemēt dauid salomon sonne 〈…〉 tyme dauid assaph chefe syngers founded songes prayse thankesgeuynge vnto god tyme zorobabel nehemias dyd israel geue porciōs vnto syngers porter euery daye porcion gaue thinges halowed vnto leuites leuites gaue thinges sanctified vnto childrē aaron xiii chapter tyme boke moses red ye eares people founde wrytten therin 〈…〉 yt ammonite moabites shulde neuer come congregacion god mett child israel wt bred water 〈…〉 hyred balaam thē shulde curse neuertheles oure god turned ye curse blessynge whan herde lawe separated israel euery one myxte selfe therin prest eliasib delyuered chest ye house oure god vnto kynsman tobia made greate chest aforetyme layed meat offerynges frankencense vessell tithe corne wyne oyle acordinge commaundement geuen leuites syngers porter heue offerynges prestes ierusalem ye two thirtieth yeare artaxerses kynge babilon came vnto kynge certayne dayes optayned lycence kynge come ierusalē gat knowlege ye euell eliasib dyd vnto tobia made chest courte house god greued sore cast forth vessel tobias house chest commaū ded clense chest thither broughte agayne vessel house god meat offerynge incense perceaued porcions ye leuites geuen cause leuites syngers fled euery one londe worke reproued ruler sayde forsake house god gathered together set place brought iuda tithe corne wyne oyle vnto treasure made treasurer ouer ye treasure euen selemia ye prest sadoc scrybe leuites pedaia vnder hande hanan sonne sachur sonne mathania counted faithfull office destribute vnto brother 〈…〉 thynke vpon god wype mercy haue shewed ye house god office therof tyme sawe tredinge wyne press sabbath brynginge cluster ass laden wyth wyne grape fygges brynginge maner burthen vnto ierusalem vpon sabbath daye rebuked earnestly ye daye solde ye vytayles dwelt mē tyre also therin broughte fysh maner ware solde sabbath vnto childrē iuda ierusalem reproued ruler iuda saide vnto euell thinge ye breake sabbath daye dyd oure father euen thus oure god broughte plage vpon v vpon cite ye make wrath yet vpon israel ye breake sabbath whan porte ierusalem •• awen vp sabbath commaū ded shutt gate charged shulde opened tyll sabbath seruauntes set gate yt shulde burthē broughte sabbath daye remayned chapman marchauntes twyce ouer nighte without ierusalem maner ware reproued sore sayde vnto tary ye night aboute wall yf ye agayne wil laye handes vpon tyme forth came nomore sabbath sayde vnto leuites cleane shulde come kepe gate halowe sabbath daye thynke vpō god cōcernynge also spare acordynge thy greate mercy tyme sawe iewes maried wyues asdod ammon moab child spake halfe speache asdod coulde speake ye iewish language ye tonge mighte mā perceaue euery people reproued cursed smote certayne men thē plucte vp toke ooth god deut 7 ye shal geue youre daughter vnto sonnes nether shal ye take daughter vnto youre sonnes youre selues3 11 dyd salomon ye kynge israel synne ther yet amonge many heythen kynge like deare vnto god god made kynge ouer israel outlandish wemen one child ioiada sonne eliasib ye hye prest made cō tracte wyth saneballath horonite chaced fro god thynke thou vpon quyte presthode haue desyled couenaunt presthode leuites thus clensed soch outlandish appoynted course prestes leuites euery one office offre wod tymes appoynted first frutes thynke thou vpon god best ende seconde boke eszdras otherwyse called boke nehemias boke hester boke conteyneth chap ahasuerus maketh greate feast lordes prynces calleth vasthi quene commeth therfore deposed kyngdome chap ii amonge daughter hester pleaseth kynge mardocheus geueth kynge warnynge harme chap iii amā greate kynge hateth mardocheus wil worshippe cōmaundeth slaye iewes chap iiii greate heuynes amonge iewes chap v hester cōmeth kynge byddeth aman feast aman maketh galowe mardocheus chap vi mardocheus recompensed frendshippe shewed vnto kynge chap vii hester prayeth hir people aman hanged galowe prepared mardocheus chap viii kynge geueth amās house vnto quene hir request causeth amās wrytinges called agayne chap ix amans sonnes hanged also many enemyes slayne iewes kepe ioyfull feast chap x auctorite mardocheus vnder kynge first chapter tyme ahasuerus reigned india vnto ethiopia ouer hundreth seuen twentye londes tyme sat seate roiall castell susan thirde yeare reigne made feast vnto prynces seruauntes namely vnto mihgtie men persia medium debities ruler countrees mighte shewe noble rich kingdome glorious worshippe greatnesse many dayes longe euen hundreth foure score dayes whan dayes expyred kynge made feast vnto people castell susan vnto greate small seuen dayes longe courte garden kynges palace hanged whyte reed yalow clothes fastened coardes lynnen scarlet siluer rynges vpon pylers marble stone bench golde siluer made vpon pauement grene white yalow • black marble ye drinke caried vessel golde euer chaunge vessell kinges wine moch acordynge power kynge man appoynted shulde drinke kynge commaunded officer house euery one shulde lyked quene vasthi made feast also wemen palace ahasuerus seuenth daye whan kynge mery wine cōmaunded mehuman bistha harbona bigtha abagtha sethar charcas seuen chamberlaynes dyd seruyce presence kynge ahasuerus fetch quene vasthi crowne regall might shewe ye people prynces hir fairnesse bewtifull quene vasthi wolde come kynges worde chamberlaynes kynge wroth indignaciō kyndled kynge spake ye wyse men vnderstondinge ordinaunces londe kinges matter must hā dled soch haue knowlege lawe iudgment nexte vnto charsena sethar admatha tharsis mere marsena memuchan seuen prynces persiās meedes sawe kynges face satt aboue kyngdome lawe shulde execute vpon quene vasthi dyd acordynge worde kynge chamberlaines thē saide memuchā kynge prynces quene vasthi hath onely done euell agaynst kinge also agaynst prynces people londes kynge ahasuerus dede quene shall come abrode vnto wemen shall despyse huszbandes eye shall saye kynge ahasuers cōmaunded vasthi ye quene come wolde shall pryncesses persia medium saye lykewyse vnto kynges prynces whan heare dede quene thus shall aryse despytefulnes wrath ynough yf please kynge let go kyngly commaundemēt let wrytten acordynge lawe persian median • transgressed vasthi come nomore kynge ahasuerus let kynge geue kyngdome vnto another better yt wrytinge kynge shalbe made published thorow empyre greate wyues maye holde huszbandes honoure amonge greate smal pleased kynge prynces kynge dyd acordynge worde memuchan letter sent forth kynges londes euery londe acordinge wrytinge ther euery people lāguage yt euery man shulde lorde awne house caused spoken language people ii chapter actes whan displeasure kynge ahasuerus layed thoughte vpon vasthi done concluded concernynge sayde kynges seruauntes let fayre yonge virgin soughte kynge let kynge appoynte ouerseers ye londes empyre maye brynge together fayre yonge virgin vnto castel susan wemens buyldinge vnder hande hegai kynges clamberlayne kepeth wemen let geue apparell loke damsell pleaseth kynge let quene vasthis steade pleased kynge dyd castell susan iewe whose name mardocheus sonne iair sonne simei sonne ci sonne iemini caried awaye ierusalem 〈…〉 whan iechonias kynge iuda led awaye nabuchodonosor kynge babilon caried awaye norished hadassa hester vncles daughter nether father ner mother fayre beutyfull damsell whan hir father mother dyed mardocheus receaued awne daughter whan ye kynges cōmaundemēt cōmyssion published many dāsels broughte together vnto castell susan vnder ye hande hegai hester takē also vnto ye kynges house vnder ye hande hegai ye keper ye wemē damsell pleased founde grace sighte put wt hir maydēs ye best place ye womēs buildīge hester shewed vnto hir people hir kynred mardocheus charged yt shulde tell mardocheus walked euery daye ye courte ye womēs buyldinge yt might knowe hester dyd shulde come whan appoynted tyme euery damsell came shulde come ye kynge ahasuerus bene twolue monethes deckynge wemen deckynge must haue moch tyme namely sixe monethes balme myrre sixe monethes wt good spyces wemē beutifyed wente one damsell vnto ye kynge euer requyred yt must geuē go wt woman buyldinge vnto ye kynges palace whan one came euenynge ye wēte frō ye morow ye seconde house wemen vnder hande saasgas kynges chamberlayne kepte ye concubine must come vnto kynge nomore excepte pleased kynge caused called name whan tyme came hester daughter abihail mardocheus vncle receaued awne daughter yt shulde come kynge desyred nothinge hegai kynges chamberlayne keper wemen sayde hester founde fauoure sighte loked vpon hester taken vnto kynge ahasuerus house royall tenth moneth called tebeth seuenthe yeare reigne kynge loued hester aboue wemen founde grace mercy sighte virgin set quenes croune vpon hir heade made quene steade vasthi kynke made 〈◊〉 feast vnto prynces seruauntes • h • ch feast hester let londes quyetnes gaue royall giftes whan virgin gathered together seconde tyme mardocheus sat kynges gate yet hester shewed hir kynred hir people acordinge mardocheus bydden hester dyd worde mardocheus like whan hir tutoure tyme whyle mardocheus sat kynges gate two kinges chamberlaynes▪ bigthan there kepte dore wroth sought laye handes kynge ahasuerus wherof mardocheus gat knowlege tolde vnto quene hester hester certified kynge therof mardocheus name whan inquisicion made founde hanged tre wryttē cronicles kynge iii chapter actes dyd kynge promote aman sonne amadathi agagite vnd set hye set seate aboue ye prynces kynges seruauntes gate bowed knee dyd reuerence vnto aman kinge cōmaunded mardocheus bowed knee worshipped kynges seruauntes kynges gate sayde vnto mardocheus transgressest thou kynges commaundement whan spake daylie vnto folowed tolde aman mighte se whether mardocheus matter wolde endure tolde yt iewe whā aman sawe mardocheus bowed knee vnto ner worshipped full indignacion despyte shulde laye hondes onely mardocheus shewed ye people mardocheus sought destroye people mardocheus people whole empyre ahasuerus first moneth moneth nissan ye twolueth yeare kinge ahasuerus occasion oportunyte sought aman one daye another moneth vnto twolueth moneth moneth adar amā sayde vnto kinge ahasuerus people scatered abrode dispersed amonge people londes thine empire lawe cōtrary vnto people kynges lawes nether kinges profit suffre thē maner yf please kynge let wryte maye destroyed wil weye downe ten thousande talentes siluer vnder handes workman brought kynges chamber toke kynge rynge hande gaue vnto aman sonne amadathi agagite iewes enemie kinge sayde vnto aman let siluer geuen people also withall pleaseth kynges scrybes called ye thirtenth daye first moneth wrytten acordynge aman commaū ded vnto kynges prynces debites euery londes captaynes euery people countrees euery syde acordynge wrytinge euery nacion language name kynge ahasuerus sealed kynges rynge wrytynges sent postes kynges lōdes rote kyll destroye iewes yonge olde childrē wemen one daye namely vpon thirtenth daye twolueth moneth moneth adar spoyle goodes summe wrytinge yt shulde commaundement geuen londes published vnto people yt shulde ready agaynst daye postes wente haist acordynge kynges commaundement castell susan cōmaundement deuysed kynge aman sat dranke ye cite susan disquieted iiii chapter whan mardocheus perceaued done rēte clothes put sack cloth aszshes wente myddes cite cried loude lamentably came kynges gate might man entre within kynges gate sack cloth lōdes place farre kynges worde commaundement extended greate lamentacion amonge iewes many fasted wepte mourned laye sack clothes aszshes hesters dāsels hir chamberlaines came tolde quene exceadingly astonnyed sent rayment mardocheus shulde put laye sacklothe mardocheus wolde take thē called hester hathac one kinges chamberlaines stode gaue cō maundement vnto mardocheus might knowe wherfore dyd hathac wente forth mardocheus vnto strete cite kynges gate mardocheus tolde yt happened vnto summe siluer amā promysed weie downe kynges chamber ye iewes destroye gaue copye commaundement deuysed susan destroye mighte shewe vnto hester speake charge yt shulde go kynge make prayer supplicacion vnto hir people whā hathat came tolde hester wordes mardocheus hester spake vnto hathat cōmaunded saye vnto mardocheus kynges seruauntes people londes kynge knowe euer commeth within courte vnto ye kynge whether man woman called cōmaundement shal dye immediatly excepte kynge holde goldē cepter vnto maye lyue haue bene called come kynge thirtie dayes whā mardocheus certified hesters wordes mardocheus bad saie againe vnto hester thynke saue thine awne life whyle thou art ye kynges house iewes yf thou holdest thy peace tyme shal iewes haue helpe delyueraunce another place thou thy father house shalbe destroyed knoweth whether thou art come kyngdome tymes sake hester geue mardocheus answere go thou yt waye gather together ye iewes yt founde susan fast ye yt ye eate drynke thre dayes nether daye ner nighte damsel wil fast likewyse wyl go kynge cō trary cōmaundement yf perishe perishe mardocheus wente waye dyd yt hester cōmaunded v chapter thirde daye put hester hir royall apparell stode courte ye kinges palace within ouer agaynst kynges house ye kynge sat vpō royall seate ye kynges palace ouer agaynst ye dore house whan kynge sawe hester quene stōdinge courte founde grace sighte ye kynge helde goldē cepter hāde towarde hester hester stepte forth touched toppe ye cepter sayde ye kynge vnto wilt thou quene hester▪ requyrest thou axe euē halfe ye empyre shal geuē hester sayde yf please ye kynge let ye kynge aman come daye vnto ye banket yt haue prepared kynge sayde cause aman make haist yt maye hester hath saide whā kynge aman came ye banket yt hester prepared kynge sayde vnto hester whan dronken wyne hester thy peticion shal geuē requyrest thou euen halfe empyre shal done answered hester sayde peticion desire yf haue founde grace ye sight kynge yf please kinge geue peticion fulfill request let kynge aman come bancket yt shal prepare thē wil tomorow kynge hath sayde wente aman forth daye ioyfull mery mynde whan sawe mardocheus kynges gate yt stode vp kneled full indignacion mardocheus neuertheles refrained himselfe whā came home sent called frē de seres wyfe tolde glory rich multitude child together kynge promoted greatly taken aboue prynces seruauntes kynge aman sayde morouer ye • hester quene let man come kynge vnto bancket prepared excepte tomorow bidden vnto also kynge satisfied longe se mardocheus iewe syttinge ye kynges gate sayde seres wife frendes vnto let thē make galowe fiftye cubites hie tomorow speake thou vnto kynge mardocheus maye hanged theron yf thou cōmest merely kynge vnto bancket aman well content withall caused galowe prepared vi chapter night coulde kynge slepe commaunded brynge ye cronicles storyes whā red ye kinge happened place wryttē mardocheus tolde kynges two chā berlaynes kepte ye tresholdes sought laie hondes kinge ahasuerus kynge saide worshippe good haue done mardocheus therfore sayde kynges seruauntes mynistred vnto nothinge done kynge sayde ye courte aman gone ye courte without ye kinges house yt might speake vnto ye kinge hange mardocheus ye tre yt prepared kinges seruauntes saide vnto beholde amā stō deth courte kynge saide let come whā amā came ye kinge saide vnto shal done vnto ye mā kynge wolde fayne brynge vnto worshippe hamā thought hert shulde kynge el glad brynge vnto worshippe aman sayde vnto kynge let man vnto kynge wolde glad worshippe broughte hither maye araied royall garmentes kynge vseth weere horse kynge rydeth vpon crowne royall maye set vpon heade let rayment horse delyuered vnder hande one kynges prynces maye araye man withall kynge wolde fayne honoure cary vpon horse thorow strete cite cause proclamed thus shal done euery man kynge wolde fayne honoure kynge sayde make haist take thou hast sayde raymēt horse euen mardocheus ye iewe sitteth kynges gate let nothinge fayle thou hast spoken toke aman rayment horse arayed broughte horszbacke thorow strete cite proclamed euen thus shall done vnto euery man kynge disposed honoure mardocheus came agayne kynges gate aman gat home haist mournynge bare heade tolde seres wyfe frendes euery thynge happened sayde wise men seres wyfe vnto yf mardocheus sede iewes whō thou hast begonne fall thou canst nothynge vnto shalt fall whyle yet talkynge came kynges chamberlaynes caused aman make haist come vnto bancket hester prepared vii chapter whan kynge aman came bancket quene hester prepared kynge sayde vnto hester seconde daye whan drō ken wyne thy peticion quene hester maye geuen requyrest thou yee axe euen halfe empyre shal 〈◊〉 done hester ye quene answered sayde yf haue founde grace thy sighte kynge yf please kynge graunte lyfe desyre people peticions sake solde destroyed slayne perishe wolde god solde bondman bondwemen wolde holde tonge shulde enemye hye kynges harme kynge ahasuerus spake saide vnto quene hester yt darre presume mynde soch thinge maner hester sayde enemye aduersary wicked aman amā exceadingly afraied ye kynge ye quene kynge arose frō bancket frō ye wyne displeasure wente palace garden aman stode vp besoughte quene hester life sawe yt mischaūce prepared kynge allready whan kynge came agayne palace garden ye parler eaten aman layed vpon bed hester sat vpon saide kinge wyl force quene also besyde house soone worde wente kynges mouth couered amans face harbona one chamberlaynes stode kynge sayde beholde stondeth galowe amās house fiftie cubytes hye made mardocheus spake good ye kinge kynge sayde hange theron hanged aman galowe made mardocheus kynges wrath stylled viii chapter daye dyd kynge ahasuerus geue house aman iewes enemye vnto quene hester mardocheus came ye kinge hester tolde belōged vnto kynge put fynger rynge taken aman gaue vnto mardocheus hester set mardocheus ouer house aman hester spake yet kynge fell downe fete besought wolde put awaye wyckednes aman agagite deuice ymagined ye iewes kynge helde golde • cepter vnto hester rose hester stode kynge sayde yf please kynge yf haue foūde grace sight yf cōuenyent kinge yf accepted sighte let wryttē yt letter deuyce amā sonne amadathai agagite maie called agayne letter wrote destroie ye iewes ye kynges lōdes se euell shal happē vnto people loke vpon destruc • ion kynred sayde ye kynge ahasuerus vnto quene hester mardocheus iewe beholde haue geuen hester house aman haue hanged vpon tre layed hāde vpon ye iewes wryte ye therfore iewes liketh kynges name seale ye kynges rynge wrytinges wrytten ye kynges name sealed kynges rynge durst man dysanulle kynges scrybes called tyme thirde moneth moneth si • thre twentieth daie wrytten mardocheus cō maunded vnto iewes prynces debities captaynes londes india vntyll ethiopia namely hundreth seuen twentye londes vnto euery one acordinge wrytinge therof vnto euery people speche iewes acordinge wrytinge language written kynge ahasuerus name sealed kynges rynge postes rode vpon swyfte yonge mule sent wrytinges wher kynge graunted iewes city euer gather selues together stonde lyfe rote slaye destroye power people londe wolde trouble child wemen spoyle good vpon one daye londes kynge ahasuerus namely vpon thirtenth daye twolueth moneth moneth adar summe wrytinge cōmaundement geuen londes publisled vnto people ye iewes shulde ready agaynst daye auenge selues enemy postes rode vpon mule made haist spede acordinge kynges worde commaundement deuysed castel susan mardocheus wente kynge royall apparell yalow whyte wyth greate crowne golde beynge arayed garment linnen purple ye cite susan reioysed glad vnto iewes come light gladnesse ioye worshippe londes city place euer kynges worde commaundemēt reached ioye myrth prosperite good dayes amonge iewes moch many people londe became iewes beleue feare iewes came vpon ix chapter twolueth moneth moneth adar vpon thyrtenth daye kinges worde cō maundement appoynted shulde done euē vpon ye daie yt enemy shulde haue destroyed iewes haue oppressed turned contrary wise euen yt iewes shulde subdue enemy gathered iewes together city within ye londes kynge ahasuerus laye honde soch wolde thē euell man coulde withstonde ye feare thē come ouer people ruler londes prynces debities officer kinge promoted iewes feare mardocheus came vpō thē mardocheus greate kynges house reporte noised lōdes increased grewe thus iewes smote enemy sore slaughter slewe destroyed dyd wyll vnto soch aduersaries ye castell susan slewe iewes destroied fyue hūdreth men slewe parsandatha dalphon aspatha poratha adalia aridatha parmastha arissai aridai vaiesatha ten sonnes aman ye sonne amadathi ye enemie iewes goodes layed handes tyme kynge certified nombre slaine castell susan kynge sayde vnto quene hester iewes haue slayne destroyed fyue hūdreth men ye castell susan ten sonnes amā shal londes ye kynge thy peticion maye geuen requirest thou done hester sayde yf please kynge let suffre iewes tomorow also acordinge vnto dayes commaundement maye hange amans ten sonnes vpō ye tre kynge charged commaundement deuysed susan amans ten sonnes hanged iewes gathered thē selues together susan vpon fourtenth daye moneth adar slewe thre hundreth men susan goodes laied hādes iewes kynges lō de came together stode lyues gatt rest frō enemy slewe enemy fyue seuentye thousande howbeit layed hondes goodes done thirtēth daie moneth adar fourtenth daye moneth rested daye ordeyned daye feastinge gladnesse iewes susan come together thyrtenth daye fourtenth fyftenth daye rested daye ordeyned daye feastinge gladnes therfore iewes dwelt vyllages vnwalled townes ordeyned ye fourtenth daye moneth adar daye feastinge gladnes one sent giftes vnto another mardocheus wrote actes sent writinges vnto iewes yt ye londes kynge ahasuerus nye farre shulde yearly receaue holde fourtenth fiftenth daie moneth adar day wherin ye iewes came rest enemy moneth wherin payne turned ioye sorowe prosperite shulde obserue dayes wealth gladnes one sende giftes vnto another distribute vnto poore iewes receaued begonne mardocheus wrote vnto aman sonne amadathai ye iewes enemye deuysed destroye iewes caused lot cast put feare brynge naughte hester wente spake kynge thorow letter wicked deuyce ymagyned agaynst iewes might turned vpon awne heade sonnes hanged tre cause called daye purim name lot acordynge ye wordes wrytinge thē selues sene ha • happened vnto iewes set vp toke vpon sede vpon soch ioyned themselues vnto wolde mysse obserue two dayes yearly acordynge wryttē appoynted yt dayes forgotten kepte childers child amō ge kynreds londes city dayes purim ouerslipte amonge iewes memoriall oughte perishe sede quene hester daughter abihail mardocheus iewe wrote auctorite confirme seconde wrytinge purim sent letter vnto iewes hundreth seuen twentye londes ye empyre ahasuerus frendly faithfull wordes confirme dayes purim tyme appoynted acordynges mardocheus iewe hester quene ordeined cō cernynge lyke vpon soule vpon sede cōfirmed actes 〈…〉 fastinges hir cōplainte hester cōmaunded stablish actes purim wryte boke x chapter kynge ahasuerus layed tribute vpon londe vpon iles see ye worke power auctoryte ye greate worshippe mardocheus kynge gaue beholde wrytten cronicles kynges medium persia mardocheus iewe seconde nexte vnto kynge ahasuerus greate amonge ye iewes accepted amonge multitude brother one yt seketh welth people speaketh best sede ende seconde parte olde testament boke iob boke conteyneth chap iii prosperite iob god geueth satan power ouer body ād goodes content withall chap iii flesh suffre described vnpacient man grudgeth agaynst iudgment god chap iiii iobs frendes comforte geue synnes blame punyshmēt chap v man without synne prayse allmightynesse louynge kyndnesse god chap vi iob excuseth owne vnpacience layeth ypocrysie frēdes charge ād sayeth dyssemblers chap vii frendly contencion iob maketh god shewinge myserable life trauayle man chap viii baldad reproueth iob nature ypocrytes chap ix men synners fight god rightuousnesse commeth punysheth also chap x man without synne nether maye eny man escape honde god chap xi sophar reproueth iob synne moch man maye withstonde god byddeth paciēt chap xii thinges come mightie ordinaunce god wicked haue better dayes godly chap xiii iob speaketh thinketh reproueth ypocrysy frendes cō mendeth wisdome god chap xiiii miserable life man chap xvxvi man innocēt god conuersacion vngodly chap xvii iob declareth mysery chap xviii baldad reproueth iob vngodly sheweth punyshment wicked chap xix iob sheweth miserable estate reproueth frendes increace payne chap xx punysment proude vngodly ypocrytes chap xxi wicked men haue prosperite worlde god punysheth acordinge owne chap xxii tell iob punyshment commeth synnes chap xxiiixxiiii iob defendeth innocēcy chap xxv mā innocēt god chap xxvi iob mocketh frēdes go aboute proue thynge denieth power god chap xxvii god punysheth v acordinge oure merites mercifull spareth euen vngodly agayne chasteneth righteous iob aduersite chap xxviii wisdome ād foreknowlege god chap xxix prosperite iob fore innocency good dedes chap xxx complayneth mysery ignoraunt symple people laugh scorne chap xxxi rehearseth innocēt life chap xxxii iobs frendes angrie forsake chap xxxiii god punysheth synne yet heareth meke prayer chap xxxiiii iob withstōdeth wordes saye wicked punyshed chap xxxv iob reproued holdinge rightuous chap xxxvi argument god punisheth man excepte haue deserued chap xxxvii power god descrybed iob reproued chap xxxviiixxxixxlxli foreknowlege wisdome god chap▪ xlii iobs frendes reproued restored prosperite agayne first chapter lōde hus man called iob innocent vertuous man gen 22 soch one feared god eschued euell man vij sonnes iij doughters iob 42 c substaunce vijm shepe iijm camel vc yock ox vc ass greate housholde yt one principall men amō ge east countre sonnes wente euery man made banckettes one daye one house another daye another • ent iij sister eate drinke passed ouer tyme banckettinge rounde aboute iob sent clensed agayne stode vp early offred euery one brēt offeringe iob thought thus peraduenture sonnes haue done offence haue bene vnthankfull god hertes thus dyd iob euery daye vpon tyme seruauntes god came stode lorde iob 2 sathan came also amonge lorde sayde vnto sathan whence commest thou sathan answered lorde sayde haue gone aboute lōde walked thorow it1 pe 5 b sayde lorde vnto sathā hast thou considered seruaunt iob innocēt vertuous mā soch one feareth god eschueth euell none like londe sathan answered sayde vnto lorde doth iob feare god naught hast thou preserued house substaunce euery syde hast thou blessed workes hondes possession encreaced londe laye thyne honde vpō litle touch hath holde shall curse thy face lorde sayde vnto sathan lo hath thy power vpon self se thou laye thine honde wente sathan forth lorde vpon certayne daye sonnes doughters eatinge drynkinge wyne eldest brother house came messaunger vnto iob sayde whyle ox plowinge ass goinge pasture besyde sabees came violētly toke awaye yee haue slayne seruauntes swearde ranne waye tell whyle yet speakynge came another sayde fyre god fallen heauen hath consumed brēt vp shepe seruauntes ranne waye tell meane season whyle yet speakinge came another sayde caldees made thre army fell vpon camel haue caried awaye yee slayne seruauntes swearde gottē awaye tell whyle speakinge came yet another ād sayde thy sonnes doughters eatinge ād drynkinge wyne eldest brother house ād sodenly came mightie greate wynde south smote iiij corner house fell vpon thy child deed gotten awaye alone tell iob stode vp rente clothes shaued heade fell downe vpon groū de worshipped sayde naked came mother wombe • cl 5 c tim 6 b naked shall turne thither agayne lorde gaue 〈…〉 lorde hath taken awaye lorde hath done pleasure blessed ye name lorde 〈…〉 thinges dyd iob offende ner murmured foolishly agaynst god ii chapter happened also apon tyme seruauntes god came stode lorde 〈…〉 sathan came also amonge stode lorde sayde vnto sathan whence commest thou sathan answered sayde 〈…〉 haue gone aboute lō de walked thorow sayde lorde vnto sathan hast thou considered seruaunt iob innocent vertuous man soch one feareth god eschueth euell none like londe thou mouedest agaynst punysh yet vayne contynueth still godlynesse sathan answered lorde sayde skynne skynne yee man geue yt euer hath life laye thine honde vpon touch vpon bone flesh holde shall curse thy face sayde lorde vnto sathā lo hast thou thy power spare life wente sathan forth lorde smote iob maruelous sore byles sole fote vnto crowne sat vpon grounde asshes scraped etter sore potsherde sayde wife vnto dost tho • yet cōtynue thy perfectnesse curse god 〈…〉 dye iob sayde vnto thou speakest like foolish womā seinge haue receaued prosperite honde god wherfore shulde content aduersite also thinges 〈…〉 dyd iob synne lippes iobs frendes herde ye trouble happened vnto came thre euery one owne place namely eliphas themanite baldad suhite sophar naamathite agreed together come shewe compassion vpon comforte lifte vp eye farre knewe cried wepte euery one rente clothes sprynckled dust vpon heades ayre sat downe also vpon grounde vij dayes vij nightes nether eny spake one worde vnto sawe payne greate iii chapter opened iob mouth cursed daye 〈…〉 sayde lost daye wherin borne night sayde manchilde conceaued daye turned darcknesse regarded god aboue nether shyned vpō wt light couered darcknesse shadowe death let dymme cloude fall vpon let lapped sorowe let darckstorme ouercome ye night let reckened amonge dayes yeare ner counted monethes despysed night discommended let curse daye geue curse also euen ready rayse vp leuiathan let starres dymme thorow darcknesse let loke light let se none nether rysynge vp fayre mornynge shut vp wombe bare ner hyd sorowes fro myne eye ala dyed ye byrth dyd perysh 〈…〉 soone came mother wōbe set vpō ye irknees gaue suck brestes shulde haue lyen still shulde haue slepte bene rest like kynges ād lordes ye earth buylde selues speciall place prynces haue greate substaunce golde house full syluer vtterly beynge thīge borne tyme put asyde ether yonge child neuer sawe light must wicked ceasse tyranny soch ouerlaboured rest letten fre haue bene preson heare nomore voyce oppressoure small greate bonde man fre frō master wherfore light geuen mysery life vnto haue heuy hertes longe death commeth yf might fynde 〈◊〉 graue wolde maruelous glad dygge vp treasure man whose waye hyd god kepeth backe cause syghe eate roaringes fall like water floude thynge feared come vpon thynge afrayed happened vnto happy quyetnesse rest commeth soch mysery vpon iiii chapter answered eliphas theman sayde vnto yf begynne comon peraduēture thou wilt myscontent witholde speakynge beholde thou hast bene teacher many hast comforted weery hondes thy wordes haue set vp fallen thou hast refresshed weake knee plage come vpon thou shrēckest awaye hath touched thyself thou art faint harted tob 2 thy feare god thy stedfastnesse thy pacience perfectnesse thy life considre praye euer peryshed beynge innocent godly destroyed plowe wickednesse haue sene sowe myschefe reape ye gala 〈…〉 whē god bloweth vpon perysh destroyed thorow blast wrath roaringe lyon cryenge lyonesse ye teth ye lyōs whelpes brokē greate lyon perysheth cā get pray lyon whelpes scatred abrode spoken vnto thynge councell hath geuen terrible sounde myne eare vision night dan 10 • men fallen slepe soch feare drede came vpō bone shoke wynde passed ouer hayres flesh stode vp stode one whose face knewe ymage wether still herde voyce • maye man iustified god maye eny man iudged clene iob • 5 • psal 1 • rom 3 • iob 15 b 2 pe • reason owne workes beholde hath founde vnfaythfulnesse amonge owne seruauntes proude disobedience amonge angel moch thē shal dwell house claye whose foundacion earth moth eaten shalbe destroyed mornynge vnto euenynge yee shall perish euer awarre taken awaye clene none thē shall remayne deed euer awarre v chapter name one el yf thou canst fynde eny yee loke aboute vpon eny holy men foolish man displeasure kylleth anger slayeth ye ignoraunt haue sene self foolish deperoted psal 36 bewty sodē ly destroyed child without
