prosperite health slayne dore mā delyuer haruest eaten vp hungrie • eu 2 • weapened man spoyled thurstie droncke vp rich earth bryngeth forth trauayle nether commeth sorow ye groū de man borne vnto mysery like byrde fle speake lorde talke god doth thinges vnsearcheable marueles without nō bre • eu 28 b • ccli 10 c • uc 1 〈◊〉 144 b • 6 2 b geueth rayne vpō earth poureth water vpon thinges setteth vp lowe degre sendeth prosperite heuynesse destroyeth deuyces sotyll able perfourme thynges take hōde • 8 c cor 3 c • al 32 b compaseth ye wyse owne craf • ynesse ouertroweth councell wicked moch runne darcknesse fayre daye • eu 28 c grope aboute noone daye like night delyuereth poore swearde 〈…〉 mouth hō de cruell poore maye haue hope mouth oppressoure maye stopped beholde happie man god punysheth 〈◊〉 3 b • et 4 c •• b • 2 • ec • therfore despyse thou ye chastenynge allmighty though make wounde geueth medicyne agayne though smyte honde maketh whole agayne delyuereth sixe trouble seuenth harme touch myddest honger saueth ye death warre power swearde shall kepe person tonge trouble commeth thou shalt nede feare destruccion derth thou shalt mery 〈…〉 shalt afrayed beastes earth castels londe shal confederate beastes felde shall geue peace yee thou shalt se thy dwellynge place shalbe rest thou shalt beholde thy substaunce nomore punyshed synne thou shalt se also thy sede shall encreace thy posterite shalbe grasse vpon earth thou shalt come thy graue fayre age like ye corne sheeues brought barne due season lo matter oure selues haue proued experience therfore thou hearest take better hede thy selff vi chapter iob answered sayde misery weere weyed punyshment layed balaunces shulde heuyer sonde see cause wordes soroufull allmighty hath shott arowes whose indignacion hath droncke vp sprete ye terrible feares god fight agaynst doth wilde asse roare hath grasse crieth oxe 〈…〉 whē hath fodder ynough maye thynge eaten vnseasoned without salt taist hath ye whyte within yoke egg thinges sometyme might waye withall meate sorow might haue desyre ye god wolde graunte thynge longe wolde begynne smyte wolde let honde go hew downe thē shulde haue cōforte yee wolde desyre payne shulde spare agaynst ye wordes holy one power haue endure or▪ myne ende soule might paciēt strength strength stone flesh made brasse able helpe self▪ strength gone fro like yf one withdrewe good dede frende forsoke feare god myne owne brother passe ouer waterbroke hastely runneth thorow ye valley feare horefrost 〈…〉 snowe shal fall vpon tyme cōmeth shalbe destroyed perishe set fyre shalbe remoued place pathes yt go croked haist vayne thinges shal perish considre pathes theman wayes saba wherin haue put trust confounded put eny cō fidence whē came opteyne thynges loked brought confucion euē ye also come vnto ye se mysery ye afrayed dyd desyre come hyther geue eny youre substaunce delyuer enemy honde saue power mightie teach holde tonge yf erre shewe wherin wherfore blame ye wordes well truly spoken reproue sauynge ye sotyll check men sayenges speake many wordes wynde ye fall vpon fatherlesse ād go aboute ouerthrowe youre owne frende wherfore loke vpon vpon youre selues whether lye turne youre owne selues praye indifferent iudges considre myne vngyltinesse whether eny vnrightuousnesse tonge vayne wordes mouth vii chapter life mā vpon earth batayll dayes like dayes hyred seruaunte like bonde seruaunt desyreth shadowe hyrelinge wolde fayne haue ende worke euen haue laboured whole monethes longe vayne many carefull night haue tolde layed downe slepe 〈…〉 sayde shal ryse agayne longed sore night thus full sorowe till darcke flesh clothed wormes fylthinesse dust skynne wythered crompled together iob 9 c 14 dayes passe ouer spedely thē weeuer weeue webbe gone awarre remembre life wynde ād myne eye shal nomore se pleasure therof yee none man eye shall se eny yf thou fasten thine eye vpon come naught▪ like cloude cō sumed vanyshed awaye euen goeth downe hell commeth nomore vp ner turneth agayne house nether shall place knowe eny therfore spare mouth speake trouble sprete ye bytternesse mynde talke see whalfysh thou kepest preson thynke bedd shall comforte shall haue refresshinge talkynge vpon couche thē troublest thou dreames dan • ād makest afrayed thorow vision soule wyssheth rather hanged bone deed se remedy shall lyue nomore spare dayes vayne man matt • c deu 8 gen 22 thou hast soch reputacion settest moch thou takest diligent care sodēly doest thou trye goest thou fro ner lettest alone longe till swalow downe spetle haue offended shal vnto ye thou preseruer men hast thou made stonde thy waye heuy burden vnto doest thou forgeue synne wherfore takest thou awaye wickednesse beholde must slepe dust yff thou sekest tomorow mornynge shalbe gone viii chapter answered baldad suhit • sayde longe wilt thou talke soch thinges longe shal ye mouth speake proude wordes doth god peruerte thinge laufull doth allmightie destroye thynge right whē thy sonnes synned agaynst iob 1 c dyd punysh thē wickednesse yff thou woldest resorte vnto god tymes deu 30 make thine humble prayer ye allmightie yf thou woldest lyue pure godly life shulde wake vp vnto immediatly geue bewtie rightuousnesse agayne moch ī euer thou haddest litle afore thou shuldest haue greate abundaunce enquere haue bene search diligently amonge thy forefather namely yt yesterdaye considre oure dayes vpon earth buth shadow shall shewe psal 14 • ▪ shall tell yee gladly confesse maye resshe grene without moystnesse maye grasse growe without water euer shot forth euer gathered wythereth eny herbe euen goeth forget god euen thus also shal ypocrytes hope come naught confidence shalbe destroyed trusteth spyders webbe leeneth vpō house shal stonde holdeth fast yet shal endure oft tymes thinge doth florish men thynke maye abyde sonneshyne shuteth forth braunches garden taketh many rote moch like house stone yf taken place euery man denyeth sayenge knowe lo thus wt reioyseth owne doinges growe earth beholde god cast awaye vertuous man nether wil helpe vngodly thy mouth shall fyll laughynge ād thy lyppes gladnesse hate shalbe confounded ye dwellinges ye vngodly shal come naught ix chapter iob answered sayde yt knowe treuth psal 142 〈◊〉 ro 3 b 〈◊〉 iob 4 b 〈…〉 b 25 yt man compared vnto god iustified yf wil argue shall able answere vnto one amonge thousande wyse hert mightie strength euer prospered toke parte agaynst translateth moūtaynes euer awarre ouerthroweth wrath remoueth earth hir place hir pilers shake withall commaundeth sōne ryseth closeth vp starres vnder signet alone spredeth ye heauens goeth vpon wawes see maketh wayne heauen orion amos 5 • • e seuen • tarres •• clock soenne • ith hir • hekens vij starres secrete place south doth greate thinges soch vnsearcheable yee wonder without nombre yf came might loke vpō yf wente waye shulde perceaue yf haisty take eny thinge awaye wil make restore agayne wil saye vnto doest thou god eccls 8 g iere 10 whose wrath man maye stōde proudest must stoupe vnder shulde answere wordes shulde fynde agaynst yee though rightuous yet geue one worde agayne mekely submytte self iudge call vpon heare yet sure yt hath herde voyce troubleth tempest woundeth measure without cause let sprete rest fylleth wt bytternesse yf men speake strength stōgest yf mē speake rightousnes darre recorde yf iustifie self myne owne mouth shall cōdemne yf put forth self perfecte man shal proue wicked doer shulde innocent cōscience knoweth yee self weery life one thīge wil saye 〈…〉 destroyeth rightuous vngodly though slaye sodenly wt scourge yet laugheth punyshment innocent worlde geueth ouer power wicked soch ruler wherof londes full eny soch one dayes haue bene swifte 〈…〉 runner gone sodenly haue sene good thinge passed awaye shippes good vnder sale aegle haisteth pray purposed forget complayninges chaunge countenaunce cōforte self afrayed workes knowe thou fauourest • uell doer yf wicked one haue laboured vayne though wasshed self snowe water made myne hondes neuer clene yet shuldest thou dyppe ye myre myne owne clothes shulde • fyle yt must geue answere vnto go lawe man nether eny dayes man reproue partes laye hōde betwixte v let take rod awaye fro yee let make nomore afrayed shal answere without eny feare longe soch fearfulnesse make answere greueth soule lyue x chapter neuerthelesse put forth wordes wil speake heuynesse soule saye vnto god condemne shewe cause wherfore thou iudgest maner thinkest thou well done oppresse cast beinge worke thy hondes manteyne councell vngodly hast thou fleszshy eye doest thou loke man loketh thy dayes dayes man thy yeares man yeares thou makest soch inquisicion wickednesse searchest synne notwithstondinge thou knowest wicked person man able delyuer thine honde 〈…〉 thy hondes haue made fashioned alltogether rounde aboute wilt thou destroye sodēly remembre beseke thou madest moulde earth shalt brynge earth agayne hast thou milked mylck turned cruddes like chese thou hast couered skynne flesh ioyned together bone synowes thou hast graunted life done good diligent hede thou tokest vpon hath preserued sprete though thou hydest thinges thine hert yet sure thou remembrest thē wherfore didest thou kepe synned hast clensed fro myne offence yf wickedly wo therfore yf rightuous yet darre lift vp heade full confucion se myne owne misery thou huntest beynge heuynesse lyon troublest measure thou bringest fresh witness agaynst thy wrath increasest thou vpon many plage wherfore hast thou brought mother wombe 〈…〉 perished eye sene yf caried graue soone borne shulde though neuer bene shall short life come soone ende holde fro let alone maye ease self litle afore go thyther whence shal turne agayne namely londe darcknesse shadowe death yee darck clowdy londe deadly shadowe ordre terrible feare darcknesse xi chapter answered sophar naamathite sayde shulde maketh many wordes answered shulde bableth moch commended therin shulde men geue eare vnto thou wilt laugh men scorne shal body mocke agayne wilt thou saye vnto god thinge take honde perfecte clene thy sight god wolde speake open lippes agaynst might shewe secrete wyszdome many folde lawe shuldest thou knowe god forgotten thy synnes wilt thou fynde god thy sekynge wilt thou attayne perfectnesse allmightie hyer thē heauē wilt thou deper thē hell wilt thou knowe length exceadeth length earth bredth ye bredth see though turne thinges vp syde downe close thrust thē together darre check therfore knoweth vanite men seyth wickednesse also1 16 iere 17 shulde considre vayne body exalteth self sonne man like wylde ass foale yf thou haddest right herte liftest vp thine hondes towarde yf thou woldest put awaye wickednesse thou hast honde vngodlynesse dwelt thy house mightest thou lift vp thy face without shame thē shuldest thou sure haue nede feare shuldest thou forget thy misery thynke nomore vpon vpon water runne shulde thy life cleare noone daye sprynge forth mornynge mightest thou haue comforth hope thou hast slepe quyetly thou art buried shuldest thou take thy rest mā make afrayed yee many one shulde set moch eye vngodly shal consumed escape hope shalbe misery sorow mynde xii chapter iob answered sayde doute ye men alone wyszdome shal perish haue vnderstōdinge well ye lesse ye yee knoweth thinges thus calleth vpō god god heareth mocked neghboure godly innocent man laughed scorne godlynesse light despysed ye hertes rich set stomble vpon house robber wealth prosperite maliciously medle agaynst god dwel without care yee god geueth thinges richely honde axe catell shal enfourme foules ayre shall tell ye speake earth shall shewethe fyshes see shal certifie knoweth ye hōde lorde made whose honde soule euery lyuynge thinge • ap 3 • ob 34 breth men haue eares pleasure hearinge mouth tastinge thinge eateth 〈◊〉 32 amonge olde personnes wyszdome amonge aged vnderstōdinge yee god wyszdome strength hath councell foreknowlege yf breake downe thinge set vp agayne yf shutt thinge • sa 22 • po 3 b • sa 50 wil open beholde yf witholde water drye vp yf let thē go destroye earth strength wyszdome knoweth disceauer disceaued carieth awaye wyse men spoyle bryngeth iudges wyttes lowseth gyrdle kynges gyrdeth loynes bonde ledeth awaye prestes captiuyte turneth mightie vp syde downe taketh verite mouth • par 18 c eze 14 b disapoynteth ye aged wyszdome poureth confucion vpon prynces cō forteth haue bene oppressed luc 12 loke lyeth hyd darcknesse declareth opēly shadowe death bringeth light increaseth people destroyeth maketh multiplie dryueth awaye chaungeth herte prynces kynges earth disapoynteth go wādringe waye grope darcke without light stackeringe fro like droncken men xiii chapter lo haue sene myne eye herde myne eare vnderstonde loke ye knowe knowe also nether inferior vnto neuerthelesse purposed talke allmightie desyre comon god ye work master lye vnprofitable phisicians alltogether wolde god ye kepte youre tonge ye might taken wyse men therfore heare wordes pro 17 pondre sentence lippes ye make answere god lye māteyne disceate wil ye accepte ye personne god intreate shal helpe calleth rekenynge thynke ye begyle man begyled punysh shall reproue yf ye secretly accepte eny personne shall make afrayed sheweth shal terrible feare fall vpō youre remembraunce shalbe like dust youre pryde shalbe turned claye holde youre tonges let speake thinge come mynde wherfore beare flesh myteth soule myne hondes lo nether cōforte ner hope yf wil slaye 〈…〉 yf shewe reproue myne owne wayes sight euen maketh whole maye ypocrite come heare wordes pondre sayenges youre eares beholde though sentence geuen vpon sure knowne vngilty go lawe yf holde tonge shal dye neuerthelesse graunte ij thinges hyde self withdrawe thine honde fro let fearfull drede make afrayed sende lawe yt maye answere self el let speake geue thou answere greate myszdedes synnes let knowe trāsgressions offence wherfore hydest thou thy face holdest thine enemye wilt thou cruell extreme vnto flyenge leaf folowe vpon drye stubble thou layest sharply charge wilt vtterly vndoo ye synnes yougth thou hast put fote stockes • para thou lokest narowly vnto pathes marckest steppe fete notwithstondinge must consume like foule carion cloth moth eaten xiiii chapter man borne woman hath shorte tyme lyue full dyuerse misery cōmeth vp falleth awaye like floure flyeth shadowe neuer continueth one state thinkest thou well done open thine eye vpon soch one brynge iudgment make cleane commeth vncleane thinge body dayes man shorte ye nombre monethes knowne vnto thou hast apoynted boundes go beyonde go maye rest litle vntill daye come loketh like hyrelinge doth yf tre cutt downe hope yet sproute shute forth braunches againe though rote waxen olde deed grounde yet whē stocke getteth sent water budde brynge forth bowes like first planted man deed perished consumed awaye becommeth 〈…〉 floudes dryed vp ryuers emptie fylled agayne thorow flowinge water see 〈…〉 man slepeth ryseth agayne vntill heauen perish shal wake vp ner ryse slepe thou woldest kepe hyde hell vntill thy wrath stilled appoynte tyme wherin thou mightest remembre maye deed man lyue agayne dayes pilgremage lokynge 〈…〉 chaunginge shal come yf thou woldest call shulde obeie despyse worke thine owne hondes 〈…〉 thou hast nombred goynges yet thou extreme vpon synnes thou hast sealed vp myne offence bagg mercifull vnto wickednesse mountaynes fall awaye last rockes remoued place water pearse thorow stone litle litle floudes waszshe awaye grauell earth euen destroyest thou hope man like maner thou preuaylest agaynst passeth awaye thou chaungest estate puttest whether child come worshipe tell yf men lowe degre knoweth whyle lyueth flesh must haue trauayle whyle soule must sorowe xv chapter answered eliphas themanite sayde shulde wyse man geue soch answere one spake wynde fyll stomacke anger thou reprouest wt wordes nothinge wroth speakest thinges good shame thou hast set asyde el woldest thou make many wordes god thy wickednesse teacheth thy mouth thou hast chosen craftie tonge thine owne mouth condemneth yee thine owne lippes shappe answere art thou first man euer borne wast thou made hylles hast thou herde secrete councell god wyszdome litle ye knowest thou yt knowe vnderstondest thou v olde aged men yee soch haue lyued longer thy forefather dost thou nomore regarde comforte god thy wicked wordes wil suffre doth thine herte make proude stondest thou greatly thine owne conceate vnto loke thine eye yt thy mynde puft vp agaynst god lettest soch wordes go thy mouth man shulde vncleane hath borne woman wherby might knowne rightuous beholde hath founde vnfaithfulnesse amōge owne sanctes iob 4 b 2 pet 2 yee heauens vnclene sight moch abhominable vyle mā dryncketh wickednesse like water tell heare wil shewethe thinge knowe wyse men haue tolde hath bene hyd father vnto londe geuen▪ straunger shulde come amonge vngodly despayreth dayes life gen 4 b nombre tyrauntes yeares vnknowne fearfull sounde euer eares peace yet feareth destruccion beleueth neuer delyuered darcknesse swearde allwaye eye goeth forth get lyuinge thinketh planely daye darcknesse honde sorow carefulnesse make afrayed cōpasse rounde aboute like kinge hoost redy battayll hath stretched honde agaynst god armed agaynst ye allmightie runneth proudly vpon stiff necke fighteth agaynst couereth face fatnesse maketh body well lykynge therfore shall dwellynge desolate city house nomā inhabiteth become heapes stone shall rich nether shall substaunce continue ner encrease vpon earth shal neuer come darcknesse flame shal drye vp braunches ye blast mouth god shal takē awaie wil nether applye faithfulnes ner treuth sore disceaued wt vanite shall perish afore tyme worne honde shal grene shal pluckte vntymely grape ye vyne shal let floure fall olyue doth congregacion ypocrites vnfrutefull fyre shal consume house soch psal 7 b esa 59 gredy receaue giftes conceaueth trauayle beareth myschefe body bryngeth forth disceate xvi chapter iob answered sayde haue oft tymes herde soch thinges miserable geuers comforte ye sorte shall thy vayne wordes come yet ende hast thou yet enymore saye coude speake ye also wolde god youre soule soules steade shulde heape vp wordes agaynst shake heade shulde comforte mouth release youre payne ye talkinge lyppes shall wordes sorow wil ceasse though holde tōge yet wil departe fro full payne haue destroied wherof wryncles beare wytnesse stōdeth vp dyssembler make answere lye face angrie hateth gnassheth vpon teth myne enemy skouleth vpon eye haue opened mouthes wyde vpon me3 22 mar 14 g smytten vpon cheke despitefully haue eased thē selues thorow myne aduersite god hath geuen ouer vngodly delyuered hondes ye wicked somtyme wealth sodenly hath brought naught hath taken neck hath rente set marck shute hath compased rounde aboute dartes hath wounded loynes spared bowel hath poured vpon grounde hath geuē one wounde vpon another fallē vpon like giaunte haue sowed sack cloth vpon skynne lye strength dust face swollē wepinge myne eye waxen dymne howbeit wickednesse hondes prayer cle • e earth couer bloude let crienge fynde rowme lo witnesse heauen knoweth aboue heyth frendes laugh scorne myne eye poureth teares vnto god though body might pleate wt god one man doth another yet nombre yeares come must go waye whence shal turne agayne xvii chapter breth fayleth dayes shortened harde deathes dore haue disceaued man yet must myne eye cōtinue heuynesse delyuer set shall able thrust hondes together thou hast holdē hertes vnderstōdinge therfore shall set vp hye promiseth frēdes parte good owne childrē spende hath made byworde comon people gestinge stocke amōge thē countenaunce heuy anger membres body become like shadowe vertuous mē therfore shall wel cōsidre innocent shal take parte agaynst ypocrite rightuous wil kepe waye yt hath cleane handes wil euer stronger stronger turne get hence se one wyse mā amonge dayes past thoughtes vanished awaye haue vexed myne herte chaunginge night daye ye light darcknes though tary neuer moch yet graue house must make bed darcke call corrupcion father wormes call mother sister helpeth longe tarienge wil fulfill thinge loke haue shall go downe pytt lye dust xviii chapter answered baldad suhite sayde wil ye make ende youre wordes marcke well considre wil speake also wherfore counted beestes reputed vyle youre sight destroyest thou thy self anger shal ye earth forsaken stone remoued place yt shal light vngodly put yee flame fyre shal burne light shalbe darcke dwellinge candle shalbe put presumptuous goinges shal kepte owne councell shal cast downe fete shalbe taken nett shal walke snare fote shalbe holden gilder thurstie shal catch snare layed grounde pytfall waye fearfulnesse shal make afrayed euery syde shall knowe get honger shalbe substaunce myszfortune shall hange vpon shall eate owne skynne yee owne armes shall deuoure beynge firstborne death comforte hope shalbe roted dwellynge fearfulnesse shall brynge kynge men shall dwel house none brymstone shalbe scatered vpon habitacion rote shalbe dryed vp beneth aboue shall haruest cut downe remembraunce shall perish earth name shall praysed stretes shalbe dryuen light darcknesse cast clene worlde shall nether haue child ner kynßfolkes amonge people ner eny posterite countre yonge olde shalbe astonyshed death soch dwellynges wicked ye place knoweth god xix chap iob answered sayde lōge wil ye vexe mynde trouble wordes lo tentymes haue ye reproued ye ashamed laugh scorne yf go wronge go wronge self yf ye wil enhaunce yor selues agaynst accuse wicked personne shame come vpon knowe yt god hath handled violētly hath compased aboute scourge beholde though crie 〈…〉 yet violēce done vnto herde though complane none geue sentēce hath hedged vp path cā get awaye hath set darcknesse gate hath spoyled myne honoure taken crowne awaye fro heade hath destroyed euery syde vndone hope hath taken awaye fro tre plucte vp rote wrath kyndled agaynst taketh though enemy men warre came together made waye ouer beseged dwellinge rounde aboute 〈…〉 hath put brother farre awaye fro soch myne acquauntaunce become straū gers vnto myne owne kynszfolkes haue forsaken frendes haue put remembraunce seruauntes maydens myne owne house take straū ger become aleaunt sight call vpon seruaūt geueth answere though praie mouth myne owne wyfe maye abyde breth fayne speake fayre vnto child myne owne body yee deserte fooles despyse gone speake euell vpon soch familiers abhorre loued best turne • agaynst bone hangeth skynne flesh awaye left skynne aboute teth haue pite vpon haue pite vpon ye frendes hande lorde hath touched seynge god persecuteth wil ye vexe also haue ye yet ynough trouble flesh wordes written put boke wolde god grauē wt yron pēne leade stone sure redemer lyueth shall ryse earth latter daye shal clothed againe skynne se god flesh yee self shal beholde eye reynes con • med within yee saye persecute haue founde occasion agaynst bewarre swearde swearde wylbe avenged wickednesse sure iudgment xx chapter answered sophar naamathite sayde cause thoughtes compell answere mynde tossed haue sufficiently herde checkynge reprofe therfore purposed make answere vnderstōdinge knowest thou namely begynninge euer sence creacion man vpon earth prayse vngodly hath bene shorte ioye ypocrytes continued ye twincklinge eye though magnified vp heauē heade reacheth vnto cloudes yet perisheth last like donge moch ye haue sene saye vanysheth dreame founde passeth awaye vision ye night eye sawe getteth sight place knoweth nomore childrē go begginge handes bringe thē sorow heuynesse youth bone ful vyce shal lie downe wt ye earth whē wickednesse swete mouth hydeth vnder tonge fauoureth wyll forsake kepeth close throte meate eateth shalbe turned poyson serpētes within body rich yt deuoureth shall perbreake agayne god shal drawe bely serpentes heade shall sucke adder tonge shall slaye shal nomore se ryuers brokes hony butter laboure shal yet haue nothinge eate greate trauayle shal make rich shal enioye hath oppressed poore helped house hath spoyled buylded bely coude neuer fylled therfore shall perish couetousnesse deuoured gredely yt left nothinge behynde therfore goodes shal prospere eccls 5 b though plenteousnesse euerythinge yet poore therfore wretch euery syde though ye wicked haue neuer moch fyll bely yet god shal sende wrath vpon him▪ cause battayll rayne ouer yf fle yron weapens shall shott stele bowe arowe shal taken forth go backe glisteringe swearde thorow ye gall feare shal come vpō shal darcknes able hyde vnkyndled fyre shal consume loke remayneth house shall destroyed heauen shall declare wickednesse earth shal take parte agaynst substaunce hath house shalbe taken awaye perish daye lordes wrath porcion ye wicked shal haue god iob 27 b heretage maye loke lorde xxi chapter iob answered sayde heare wordes amende yor selues suffre litle maye speake also thē laugh wordes scorne yf ye man make disputaciō yf shulde sprete thē sore trouble marck well abaszshed laye youre hāde vpon youre mouth whē pondre considre afrayed flesh smytten feare psal 72 iere 12 wherfore wicked mē lyue health prosperite come olde age increase rich childers child lyue sight generacion eye pro 3 b heb 12 house safe feare rodd god doth smyte thē bullocke gendreth tyme cow calueth vnfrutefull sende forth child flockes sonnes lede daunce 〈…〉 beare tabrettes harpes haue instrumentes musick pleasure spende dayes welthynesse sodenly go downe hell saye vnto god go v desyre knowlege thy wayes 〈…〉 maner felowe allmightie shulde serue profit shulde haue submitte oure selues vnto lo vtterly goodnesse therfore haue councell vngodly oft shal candle ye wicked put out▪ 〈…〉 oft commeth destruccion vpon sorowe shall god geue parte wrath yee shal euen chaffe wynde 〈…〉 dust storme carieth awaye though god saue childrē soch sorowe yet wil rewarde thēselues shal knowe owne destruccion misery shal se eye drynke fearfull wrath allmighty whath car • th become housholde death whose monethes passe awaye swifter arowe moch thē god hath ye hyest power teach eny knowlege one dyeth mightie best rich prosperite euen bowel fattest bone full mary another dyeth sorowe heuynesse neuer good day slepe like earth wormes couer knowe ye thinke yee ye ymagin agaynst vnrightuously 〈…〉 ye saye prynces palace dwellynge vngodly axe eny man goeth waye yf ye regarde token dedes shal tell 〈…〉 wicked kepte vnto daye destruccion vngodly shalbe brought forth daye wrath darre reproue wayes face • rewardeth vngraciousnesse doth yet shal brought graue watch amonge heape deed thē shal fayne buried amō ge stone brokesyde men must folowe innumerable gone vayne comforte ye ye geue youre answeres cleane contrary right treuth xxii chapter eliphas themanite gaue answere sayde maye man cōpared vnto god wyszdome though seme like pleasure hath god yt thou art rightuous doth profite yt thy way perfecte afrayed reproue steppe forth wt iudgment 〈…〉 cōmeth ye greate wickednesse 〈…〉 thine vngracious dedes innumerable thou hast takē pledge thy brethrē naught robbed naked clothinge 〈…〉 soch weery hast thou geuē water drynke thou hast withdrawē bred frō hungrie shulde soch one thē vseth violēce wrōge oppression doinge thinges parcialyte hauynge respecte personnes dwell lōde thou hast sent wyddowes awaye emptie oppressed poore fatherlesse therfore art thou compased aboute snare euery syde sodēly vexed wt feare shuldest thou thē se darcknesse shulde water floude runne ouer yt god hyer thē heauens thou seist yt starres hye wilt thou therfore saye 〈…〉 tush shulde god knowe doth dominion reach beyonde cloudes tush cloudes couer yt maye se dwelleth heauen well thou wilt kepe olde waye yt wicked mē haue gone olde yonge whose foundacion runnynge water saye vnto god go v maner tush 〈…〉 wil allmightie vnto v stōdinge fylleth house wt good meanynge vngodly farre fro 〈…〉 wt ioy shal godly gladnesse shal innocent se increase shal hewen downe posterite consumed fyre therfore recōcile vnto god content shal thinges prospere wt right well 〈…〉 receaue lawe mouth laye vp wordes thine herte yf thou wilt turne allmightie 〈…〉 thou shalt stonde fast vnrightuousnesse shall farre thy dwellinge shal geue haruest plenty abundaunce shall exceade dust earth golde ophir like ryuer stone yee allmightie owne self shalbe thine haruest heape thy money shalt thou haue thy delyte allmightie lift vp thy face vnto god thē shalt thou make thy prayer vnto shal heare thou shalt kepe thy promyses thē loke thou takest honde shal make prospere light shall shyne thy wayes humbleth shal set vp loketh mekely shalbe healed yf thou innocēt shal saue thorow vngiltynesse thyne handes shalt thou delyuered xxiii chapter iob answered sayd sayenge yet daye bytternes hande heuy amonge groninges might se fynde might come seate pleate cause fyll mouth argumentes might knowe answere wolde geue might vnderstonde wolde saye vnto wil pleate agaynst greate power strength wyll leane self vtterly vpon oh let let hym geue like power go lawe sure wynne matter though go fynde yf come behynde cā get knowlege yf go left syde pondre workes atteyne vnto agayne yf go right syde hydeth yt se waye sap 3 1 pet 1 • knoweth trieth ye golde ye fyre neuertheles fete kepe path hye strete haue holden gone haue forsaken cōmaundemēt lippes loke charged mouth haue shutt vp herte alone turne back doth listeth bryngeth passe wil rewardeth bosome many thinges mo doth maye power ye cause shrenke presence considre afrayed moch god maketh herte soft seynge allmightie putteth feare thus get darcknesse cloude hath couered face xxiiii chapter consideringe tyme hyd allmightie happeneth knowe wil regarde dayes mē remoue mēs londe markes deu 19 c 27 c exo 22 c robbe catell kepe owne dryue awaye asse fatherlesse take ye wyddowes oxe pledge thrust poore waye exo 23 oppresse symple worlde together beholde wilde ass ye deserte go tymes maner spoyle yee wildernesse ministreth foode child reape corne felde their▪ owne gather grape vynyarde haue oppressed violence cause yt many men naked bare hauynge clothes couer kepe colde shower mountaynes haue rayned vpon wett haue none sucoure kepe amonge rockes spoyle suckinge fatherlesse child put poore preson moch let go naked without clothinge yet 〈◊〉 beare sheeues poore 〈◊〉 laboure oyle mylles yee 〈…〉 treade wyne press yet 〈…〉 thyrst whole cite crieth vnto • e lorde sighinge • oc 6 b e 15 b soules • layne make complaynte god destroyeth wt stōdinge rebellious disobedient enemy seke light waye ner turne agayne path 〈◊〉 22 tymely mornynge aryse murthur symple poore night go stealinge eye vngodly like aduouterer wayteth darcknesse sayeth thus self tush shal mā se disgyseth face night season search house hyde selues daye tyme wil knowe ye light soone daye breaketh shadowe death commeth vpō go horrible darcknesse vngodly swyft yt porciō also vpō earth swyfter ye runnynge water suffreth ye shipmā beholde fayre pleasaūt vyniardes yt wickednesse haue done drawen hell sooner thē snowe melteth heate yt cōpassion vpon thē forgottē yt daynties wormes clene put remembraunce vtterly hewē downe like vnfrutefull tre manteyne baren make yt beare vnto wyddowes good plucke downe mightie wt power selues gotten vp neuer without feare longe liue though might safe yet wil receaue eye loke vpon owne wayes exalted litle shortly gone brought extreme pouerte takē waye ye • vtterly plucte eares corne wil thē reproue lyar saye yt wordes nothinge worth xxv chapter answered baldad suhite sayde power feare aboue maketh peace sittinge hynesse whose men warre innumerable whose light aryseth ouer 〈…〉 maye man cōpared vnto god iustified clene borne woman beholde moone shyneth nothinge comparison starres vnclene sight moch thē mā corrupcion sonne man worme xxvi chapter iob answered sayde helpest thou weake comforte geuest thou vnto hath strēgth ye coūcell yt thou shuldest geue hath wyszdome wilt thou shewe thine excellent rightuousnes hast thou spoken wordes made breth come ye mouth giauntes worthy yt slayne lye vnder ye worlde wt cōpanions yee dwell beneth hell hyd frō destruccion self cā kepte sight stretcheth ye north ouer emptie hāgeth ye earth vpō nothinge byndeth ye water cloudes fall downe together holdeth back stole cānot sene spredeth cloudes hath cōpased water wt certayne boundes 〈…〉 vntill daye night come ende pilers heauē trēble quake reprofe 〈…〉 stilleth see power thorow wyszdome hath set forth ye worlde sprete hath garnished heauēs hande hath wounded rebellious serpēt shorte summe doynges able sufficiently rehearce workes perceaue vnderstonde ye thondre power xxvii chapter iob also proceaded wēte forth communicacion sayēge truly god lyueth hath taken awaye power fro allmightie hath vexed mynde lippes shall talke vanite tonge shal speake disceate whyle breth longe wynde god hath geuen nostrels god forbydde shulde graunte youre cause right vntill myne ende come wil neuer go fro myne innocency rightuous dealynge wil kepe fast forsake conscience reproueth conuersacion therfore myne enemy shalbe founde vngodly yt taketh parte agaynst vnrightuous hope hath ye ypocrite though haue greate good though god geue rich hertes desyre doth god heare sooner whē crieth vnto necessite hath soch pleasure delyte allmightie darre allwaye call vpon god wil teach name god thinge haue ye allmightie wil kepe beholde ye stonde yor owne conceate though ye knew thinges wherfore ye go aboute wt soch vayne wordes sayēge porcion wicked shall haue god heretage tyrauntes shal receaue ye allmightie yf get many childrē shal perish wt swearde posterite shall haue scarcenesse bred loke leaueth behinde shal dye buried man shall haue pite wyddowes though haue moch money dust earth raymēt ready claye maye well prepare godly shal put vpon innocēt shal deale money house shal endure moth bothe watch man maketh rich man dyeth carieth nothinge gone ye twincklynge eye destruccion taketh holde vpō water floude ye tēpest stealeth awaye night season vehement wynde carieth hence departeth storme plucketh place ruszsheth vpon spareth maye escape power therof clappe mē hōdes yee ieast whē loke vpon place xxviii chapter place syluer moltē 〈◊〉 • b golde tryed yron dygged grounde stone resolued metall darcknes shal come ende seke grounde thinges stone darcke horrible shadowe wt ryuer water parteth sunder straunge people yt knoweth good neghbourheade soch rude vnmanerly boysteous bryngeth foode earth yt vnder consumeth fyre founde place whose stone clene saphirs ye clottes earth golde waye also byrdes knowe vultur eye hath sene wherin ye proude hye mynded walke lyon commeth putteth honde vpon stony rockes ouerthroweth mountaynes ryuers flowe rockes loke pleasaunt eye seyth droppes bryngeth greate floudes together thinge hyd bryngeth • light commeth man wyszdome eccli 1 7 c iacob 1 • reg 3 b 4 c pro • sap 7 b place men fynde vnderstondinge verely man tell worthy thinge nether foūde lōde lyuynge depe sayeth see sayeth gotten fyne golde nether maye pryce bought eny moneye wedge golde ophir precious onix stone saphirs maye compared vnto nether golde ner christall nether swete odour ner golden plate nothinge worthy excellēt named vnto parfecte wyszdome goeth farre beyonde thē topas cōmeth inde maye wyse lickened vnto yee maner apparell pleasaunt fayre euer whēce commeth wyszdome place vnderstondinge hyd eye men yee frō foules ayre destruccion death saie haue herde tell wt oure eares god seyth hir waie knoweth hir place beholdeth endes worlde loketh vpon vnder heauē weyed wyndes measured ye water set rayne ordre gaue mightie floudes lawe dyd se thē declared prepared knewe vnto man sayde beholde psal 110 b pro 1 9 b eccli 1 e feare lorde wyszdome forsake euell vnderstondinge xxix chap iob proceaded wēte forth communicacion sayenge yt monethes past dayes whē god preserued light shyned vpon heade whē wente light shyne euē thorow darcknesse stode wt whē welthy ynough whē god prospered house allmightie housholde folkes stode aboute whē wayes ranne ouer wt butter stony rockes gaue ryuers 〈2 page missing〉 oyle wente thorow cite vnto gate whē set chayre ye strete whē yonge mē soone sawe hyd thē selues aged arose stode vp vnto whē prince left talkinge laied hāde mouth whē mightie kepte still voyce whē tonges cleued rofe mouthes yt herde called happie yt sawe wysshed good delyuered ye poore whē cried fatherlesse yt wanted helpe yt shulde haue bene lost gaue good worde ye widdowes hert praised put vpon rightuousnes couered garmēt equite crowne eye vnto blynde fote lame father vnto poore whē knew cause sought diligētly brake chaftes ye vnrightuous plucte spoyle teth gen 14 c therfore thought verely yt shulde haue dyed nest yt dayes shulde haue bene many sondes see rote spred water syde dew laye vpō corne honor encreased bowe euer stronger hande vnto men gaue eare regarded wt sylence taried coūcell yf spoken wolde haue none wayes wordes well taken amonge thē wayted earth doth rayne gaped vpon groūde doth receaue latter shower laughed knew well earnest testimony coūtenaunce pleased thē nothinge agreed vnto waye chefe sat kynge amonge seruauntes one comforteth soch heuynesse xxx chapter bvt inferiours yonger haue derision yee euē whose father wolde haue thought scorne haue set wt dogges catell power strēgth hādes might good age spēt past awaye without eny profit misery honger wente aboute wildernesse like wretch beggers pluckynge vp herbes amonge buszshes iumpers rote meate dryuen forth men cried bene thefe dwellinge beside foule brokes yee caues dennes earth vpō drye heeth wēte aboute crienge brome hilles gathered together child fooles vylanes deed awaye frō worlde 〈…〉 songe become iestinge stocke abhorre fle farre fro stayne face wt spetle ye lorde hath opened quyuer hath hytt put brydle mouth vpon right hā de rose together agaynst haue hurte fete made awaye destroye path haue clene marred easy harme neded man helpe thē fell vpon bene ye breakynge water came heapes destroye fearfulnesse turned agaynst myne honoure van • sheth awaye swiftly wynde prosperite departeth hēce like cloude therfore mynde poured full heuynesse ye dayes trouble haue takē holde vpon bone pearsed thorow ye night season synewes take rest power haue chaunged garmēt gyrded therwith wt coate euē claye become like aszshes dust whē crie vnto thou doest heare though stonde yet thou regardest thou art become myne enemye wt yi violēt hāde thou takest parte agay • st tymes past thou didest set vp hye aboue ye winde hast thou geuē sore fall sure yt thou wilt delyuer vnto death lodgyng prepared mē lyuinge vse mē violēce vnto thē yt destroyed ready • hurte done vse • helpe dyd wepe ye tyme trouble soule cōpassion vpō ye poore yet neuerthelesse loked good euell happened vnto waited light came darcknesse bowel seeth wt take rest ye dayes trouble come vpō mekely lowly came yee without eny displeasure stode vp ye cōgregacion commoned thē cōpanyon dragon felowe estriches •• ynne vpō turned black b • ne brēt wt heate harpe turned sorow pipe wepinge xxxi chap made couenaunt wt myne eye yt wolde loke vpō dāsell 〈…〉 greate porciō shal haue god frō aboue enheritaūce frō ye almightie hie vngodly yt ioyneth ye cōpani wicked doer shal farre god shulde medle wickednesse farre allmightie yt shulde medle vnrightuous dealynge rewardeth workes man 〈…〉 causeth euery man fynde acordinge wayes sure god cōdemneth man wrongeously iudgmēt allmightie vnrightuous ruleth earth steade hath set gouerne whole worlde hath geuen herte drawe sprete breth vnto flesh shal come together vnto naught 〈…〉 mē shal turne agayne vnto earth yf thou haue vnderstōdinge heare saye herken voyce wordes maye made whole loueth right yf thou innocent man shuldest thou punyshed euen yt knoweth rebellious kynges sayeth prince vngodly men ye hath respecte vnto personnes ye lordly regardeth rich thē poore worke hondes twincklinge eye shall slayne mydnight people tyrauntes rage shal perish ād taken awaye hondes • eye loke vpon wayes man 〈…〉 seyth goinges darcknes ner thicke shadowe yt hyde wicked doer mā shalbe suffred go iudgment god 〈…〉 many one yee innumerable doth punyshe setteth steades knoweth euell darcke workes therfore shal destroyed ye steade seer dealt like vngodly mē therfore turned back traytorously vnfaithfully frō hī wolde receaue wayes moch haue caused ye voyce poore come vnto heareth cōplaynte soch necessite yf delyuer graunte pardō iudge condemne yf hyde awaye countenaunce wil turne aboute agayne whether people eny man wickednesse synne ye people maketh ypocrite reigne ouer thē moch haue begonne talke god wil hyndre yf haue gone amysse enfourme yf haue done wronge wil leaue wilt thou geue reasonable answere art thou afrayed eny thinge • eynge thou begānest first speake el men vnderstō dinge wisdome haue herde might saye cāst thou speake iob hath nether spoken purpose ner wysely father let iob well tryed hath turned ye wicked yee aboue synnes hath blasphemed offence hath done euen v yt stryueth agaynst god wordes xxxv chapter eliu spake morouer sayde thinkest thou right thou sayest rightuous god seinge thou sayest doest thou knowe thinge hast thou excellēt thē yt synner therfore geue answere vnto thy frendes loke vnto heauē beholde cōsidre ye cloudes hyer thou yf thou synnest dost thou vnto yf thine offence many gettest thou fauoure yf thou rightuous geuest thou receaueth thy handes psal • 9 b heb 10 psal 49 • soch vngodly personne thou ye sonne man rightuous thou pretendest greate crie cōplaynte made thē oppressed violence yee euery man complayneth vpon cruell arme tyrauntes soch one neuer sayeth god made ād yt shyneth vpon v might prayse night geueth v vnderstōdinge doth beastes earth teacheth v foules heauē yf eny soch complayne mā geu •• h answere yt wickednesse proude tyrauntes yf man call vpon god doth heare doth almightie accepte crie whā thou speakest shulde pardon yff thou open thy self put thy trust vseth violence wrath nether hath pleasure curious depe inquisicions therfore hath iob opened mouth vayne ād folishly hath made many wordes xxxvi chapter eliu proceaded forth talkinge sayde holde still litle shal shewe haue yet speake god behalfe wil open vnto ye yet myne vnderstondinge proue maker rightuous true wordes lye knowlege wherwithall argue agaynst perfecte beholde god casteth awaye ye mightie himselff mightie power wisdome vngodly preserueth thē helpeth poore right • sal 31 b • 7 c • 10 c par 33 c turneth eye awaye rightuous setteth vp kynges trone cō firmeth allwaye syt therin yf layed preson cheynes bounde bondes pouerte sheweth workes ād dedes synnes wherwt haue vsed cruell violence punyshinge nurturinge rowneth eares warneth leaue wickednesse amende yf take hede obedient shall weere dayes prosperite esa 1 c yeares pleasure ād ioye yff obeye shall go thorow swearde perish euer awarre soch fayned dyssemblers ypocrytes heape vp wrath selues call vpon though presoners thus soule perisheth foolishnesse lyfe wt ye condēned poore delyuereth straytnesse comforteth soch necessite trouble euen shall kepe yf thou wilt content bottomlesse pytte beneth yf thou wilt holde quyete shal fyll thy table plenteousnesse neuerthelesse thou hast condemned iudgment vngodly yee euen soch iudgment sentence shalt thou suffre shal thy cause stilled crueltie ner pacified many giftes hath god ordened glorious life soch mightie men shulde put downe prolonge thou tyme till come night set people thy steade bewarre thou turne asyde wickednesse synne hyther thou hast chosen mekenesse beholde god mightie hye power soch gyde lawegeuer wil reproue waye wil saye vnto thou hast done wronge considre greate excellent workes men loaue prayse yee wondre yet se afarre beholde greate god passeth oure knowlege nether able come ye experiēce yeares turneth ye water smal droppes dryueth cloudes together rayne poure downe droppe vpon men deu 11 c 28 sprede cloudes couerynge tabernacle cause light shyne vpō couer botome see thinges gouerneth people geueth thē abundaunce meate ye turnynge hande hydeth light commaundement commeth agayne rysinge vp therof sheweth frendes catell xxxvii chapter hert astonnied moued place heare sounde voyce noyse yt goeth mouth gouerneth euery thinge vnder heauen light reacheth vnto ende worlde roaringe voyce foloweth glorious magesty geueth soch thondre clappe though man heare yet maye perceaue afterwarde geueth horrible sownde god sendeth voyce greate thinges doth cō prehende commaundeth snowe falleth vpon earth 〈…〉 soone geueth rayne charge immediatly shower haue strength fall downe sendeth feare vpon euery man might knowe owne workes beestes crepe dennes take rest south commeth tempest colde north breth god frost commeth water shed abrode cloudes laboure geuynge moystnesse cloudes poure downe rayne distributeth also euery syde acordinge pleaseth deale workes maye euer commaundeth thē thorow whole worlde whether punysh eny londe good vnto seke herken vnto iob stonde still considre wonderous workes god art thou coūcel god doth thinges causeth light come forth cloudes art thou coū cell spredeth cloudes hast thou perfecte knowlege wonder thy clothes warme whē lō de still thorow south wynde hast thou helped spred heauen loke vpō cast cleare metall teach v shal saye vnto hī vnmete darcknes shal tolde saye shulde man speake shulde kepe backe euery mā seith light yt kepeth cleare cloudes clenseth whan maketh wynde blowe golde brought north prayse honoure god feare commeth frō god fynde allmightie power equite rigtuousnesse hyer expressed seinge euery body feareth shulde wyse men also stōde feare hī chap xxxviii spake lorde vnto iob storme 〈…〉 sayde hydeth mynde foolysh wordes gyrde vp thy loynes like mā question se thou geue dyrecte answere wast thou layed ye foundacions earth tell planely yff thou hast vnderstondinge hath measured knowest thou hath spred ye lyne vpon vpon stōde pilers 〈…〉 layed ye corner stone wast thou mornynge starres gaue prayse ād angel god reioysed 〈…〉 shutt see dores brake forth childe mother wombe made cloudes coueringe swedled ye darcke 〈…〉 gaue cōmaundement makynge dores barres sayenge hither shalt thou come shalt thou laye downe thy proude hye wawes hast thou geuē mornynge charge soone thou wast borne shewed dayespringe place yt might take holde corner earth yt vngodly might shakē tokēs weapēs hast thou turned like claye set thē vp agayne chaunginge garment yee thou hast spoyled vngodly light brokē arme proude camest thou euer groūde see hast thou walked ye lowe corner ye depe haue gate death bene opened vnto hast thou sene dore euerlastīge treasure hast thou also perceaued brode ye earth yf thou hast knowlege thē shewe light dwelleth darcknes yt thou mayest bringe v vnto quarter yf thou cāst tell waye house knewest thou thou wast borne olde thou shuldest wentest thou euer treasury snowe 〈…〉 hast thou sene ye secrete place hale haue prepared agaynst tyme trouble agaynst tyme batell warre waye light parted heate dealt vpon earth deuydeth abundaūce water ryuers maketh waye stormy wether yt watereth moystureth ye drye baren grounde make grasse growe place body dwelleth wildernes mā remayneth father rayne hath begotten droppes dew whose wōbe came yse hath gendred coldnes ye ayre yt water harde stone lye congeeled aboue depe hast thou brought ye vij starres together art thou able breake circle heauē cāst thou bringe forth mornynge starre euenynge starre cōuenient tyme cōueye thē home agayne knowest thou course heauē yt thou mayest set vp ordinaunce therof vpō earth morouer cāst thou lift vp thy voyce ye cloudes yt maye poure downe greate rayne vpō canst thou thōdre also yt maye go waye obediēt vnto sayēge lo geueth sure wisdome stedfast vnderstōdinge nombreth cloudes wisdome stilleth ye vehement water heauē turneth clottes dust thē clottes agayne huntest thou praye frō lyon fedest thou whelpes lyē ge dēnes lurkinge couch prouydeth meate rauen psa 14 • • whē yonge one crie vnto god ād fle aboute want meate chap xxxix knowest thou tyme wilde gotes brīge forth yōge amō ge stony rockes layest thou wayte hindes vse fawne rekenest thou moneth ingendre yt thou knowest tyme bearinge lye downe cast yonge one delyuered trauayle payne yōge one growe vp waxe greate thorow good fedinge letteth wilde asse go fre lowseth bōdes moole vnto whō haue geuen wyldernes house vntilled londe dwellinge place maye geue force multitude people city nether regarde crienge dryuer seke pasture aboute moūtaynes folowe vpon grene grasse wyll vnicorne tame ye seruyce abyde still thy cri • cāst thou bynde ye yock aboute thy forowes make plowe ye valleis mayest thou trust hī strōge cōmitte thy labor vnto hī mayest thou beleue hī yt wil brī ge home ye corne cary eny thinge vnto ye barne estrich whose fethers fayrer thē ye wynges sparow hauke whē hath layed egges vpon grounde bredeth dust forgetteth might troden fete broken somme wilde beast harde vnto yong one though laboureth vayne without eny feare god hath taken wisdome hath geuen vnderstondinge tyme flyeth vp hye careth nether horse ner man hast thou geuen horse strength lerned bowe downe neck feare letteth self dryuen forth like greshopper stoute neyenge maketh fearfull breaketh ye grounde hoffes fete chearfully strength runneth mete harnest men layeth asyde feare stomack abated nether starteth back eny swerde though quyuers rattle vpon though speare shilde glistre yet russheth fearsly beateth vpon grounde feareth noyse trompettes soone heareth shawmes blowe tush sayeth smelleth batell afarre ye noyse captaynes shoutinge commeth thorow thy wysdome goshauke flyeth towarde south doth aegle mounte vp make nest hye thy commaundement abydeth stony rockes ād vpon hye toppes harde mountaynes man come thence maye beholde praye loke farre aboute eye yonge one fed bloude mat 24 c eny deed body lyeth immediatly morouer god spake vnto iob sayde stryueth allmightie rest shulde disputeth god geue answere iob answered lorde sayenge beholde vyle personne answere therfore laye hande vpon mouth twyse haue spoken saye nomore xl chapter spake lorde vnto iob storme sayde gyrde vp ye loynes like man iob 38 tell thī ge axe wilt thou disanulle iudgment wilt thou condemne yt thou thy self mayest made rightuous thine arme like arme god maketh thy voyce soch soūde doth arme thy self thine owne power vp decke thy ioly araye poure indignacion thy wrath se thou cast downe ye proude loke well thou makest soch stubburne obeye treade vngodly vnder thy fete cast thē downe myre couer face darcknesse confesse also thyne owne right honde hath saued beholde cruell beaste made wt eateth haye oxe lo stronge loynes power hath nauell body spredeth tale like cedre tre vaynes stiff shynnes like pipe brasse rygge bone like staues yrō first god made ordened wyldernesse yt mountaynes shulde geue grasse beastes felde take pastyme lyeth amōge redes moss fennes hyde shadowe wylowes broke couer rounde aboute lo without eny laboure might drynke whole floude suppe iordane without eny trauayle darre laye honde vpon openly vndertake catch darre put hoke thorow nose ād laye snare darrest thou drawe leuiathan angle bynde tonge snare 〈…〉 canst thou put rynge nose bore chaftes thorow naule wyll make many fayre wordes thynkest thou flatre wyll make couenaunt art thou able compell contynuall seruyce wilt thou take thy pastyne wt byrde geue vnto thy maydens thy companyons maye hew peces parted amonge marchaunt men canst thou fyll nett wt skynne ye fysh pā nyer heade darrest thou laye honde vpon better considre harme might happē thorow touch thou thynkest haue holde vpon shall begyle euery man also seyth shall go backe darre none bolde rayse vp xli chapter able stonde hath geuen eny thynge afore hande 〈…〉 bounde rewarde agayne thinges vnder heauen myne feare whether threaten speake fayre lifteth vp stripeth clothes taketh bytt brydle openeth dore face hath horrible tethe rounde aboute body couered scale shyldes lockte kepte well cōpacte together one ioyned another ayre come yee one hangeth vpon another sticke together sundered nesinge like glisteringe fyre eye like mornynge shyne mouth go torch fyre brandes nostrels goeth smoke like • ff hote seetinge pott breth maketh coales burne flame goeth mouth necke remayneth strength face sorowe turned gladnesse membres body ioyned strayte one another cleue fast together moued hert harde stone ād fast styth ye hammer man smyteth vpon goeth mightiest afrayed wawes heuy yff drawe swearde maye nether speare ner brest plate abyde setteth moch strawe yrō moch rotten stocke metall starteth • ot awaye bendeth bowe • slynge stone careth moch stubble counteth hammer better strawe laugheth scorne shaketh speare treadeth golde myre like ye sharpe potsherdes maketh depe seeth boyle like pott stereth see together like oyntment waye light depe walkynge place vpon earth power like vnto made feareth yff man cō sidre hye thinges kynge ouer child pryde xlii chapter thē iob answered lorde sayde knowe thou hast power thinges 〈…〉 thought hyd vnto kepe owne councell secrete shall knowne therfore haue spoken vnwysely seynge thinges hye passe myne vnderstondinge herken thou vnto also let speake answere vnto thinge axe haue geuen diligent eare vnto se ye myne eye wherfore geue myne owne self ye blame take repentaunce dust asshes whē lorde spoken wordes vnto iob sayde vnto eliphas ye themanite displeased thy two frendes ye haue spoken thinge yt right like serua ••• iob hath done therfore take vij ox 〈…〉 seuen rammes go seruaunt 〈…〉 offre vp also youre selues brent offe ••••• ge lat seruaunt iob praye 〈…〉 godly helpe belongeth 〈◊〉 lorde therfore let thy blessynge vpon thy people iiii psalme dauid heare whē cal god rightuousnes thou comfortest trouble haue mercy vpon herken vnto prayer ye sonnes men longe ye blaspheme myne honoure haue ye soch pleasure vanyte seke lye sela knowe lorde dealeth maruelously saynte call vpon lorde heareth angrie synne n • 〈…〉 comō wt youre owne hertes vpō yor beddes remēbre yor selues sel • offre ye sacrifice rightuousnes put yor trust ye lorde many yt saye wil v eny good thou lorde hast shewed v light ye countenaūce thou reioysest myne herte though encreace greate corne wyne therfore wil laye downe peace take rest thou lorde settest sure dwellynge v psalme dauid heare wordes lorde considre callynge marke voyce peticion kynge god vnto wil make prayer heare voyce tymes lorde early morninge wil gett vnto 〈…〉 yee yt wt diligēce thou art god yt hath pleasure wickednesse maye vngodly personne dwel soch cruell maye stonde thy sight thou art enemie vnto wicked doer thou destroyest lyers lorde abhorreth bloude thurstie disceatfull wil come thy house 〈…〉 euen vpon multitude thy mercy ād thy feare wyll worshipe towarde thy holy tēple lede lorde thy rightuousnesse myne enemyes ād make thy waye playne faithfulnesse mouthes dyssemble hertes throte open sepulchre tonges disceaue punysh god maye perish owne ymaginacions cast multitude vngodlinesse rebell agaynst agayne let put trust reioyse yee let euer geuynge thankes thou defendest loue thy name maye ioyfull thou lorde geuest thy blessinge vnto rightuous thy fauorable kyndnes thou defendest shylde vi psalme dauid oh lorde rebuke thine anger oh chastē thy heuy displeasure 〈…〉 haue mercy vpon lorde weake lorde heale bone vexed soule also greate trouble lorde longe turne lorde delyuer soule oh saue thy mercy sake death man remēbreth oh wil geue thankes hell weery gronynge euery night wasshe bedde water couche teares coūtenaūce chaunged inwarde grefe cōsume awaye 〈…〉 haue many enemy awaye fro ye wicked doer lorde hath herde voyce wepinge lorde hath herde myne humble peticiē lorde hath receaued prayer myne enemy shalbe cōfounded sore vexed yee shalbe turned backe put shame right soone vii psalme dauid lorde god ye trust saue frō thē yt persecute 〈…〉 delyuer lest hantch vp soule like lyon teare peces whyle none helpe lorde god yff haue done eny soch thinge yf eny vnrightuousnes hādes yff haue rewarded euell vnto thē yt dealt frendly wt hurte thē yt wt eny cause myne enemy let myne enemie persecute soule take yee let hī treade life downe earth laye myne honor dust sela stōde vp lorde yi wrath lift vp thyself ouer furious indignaciō myne enemy aryse vp vengeaunce thou hast promysed 〈…〉 congregacion people maye come aboute sake therfore lift vp thyselff agayne lorde iudge ouer people auenge lorde acordinge rightuousnes innocency oh let wickednes vngodly come ende manteyne iust thou rightuous god yt triest hertes reynes helpe cōmeth god preserueth yt true herte 〈…〉 god rightuous iudge god euer threateninge yf men wil turne hath whet swearde hath bent bowe made ready hath prepayred weapens death ordened arowes destroye beholde trauayleth myschefe 〈…〉 hath cōceaued vnhappynesse brought forth lye hath grauen dygged vp pytte 〈…〉 shal fall ye pytte yt hath made vnhappynes shall come vpon owne heade psal •• 9 b wickednes shall fall vpon owne pate geue thankes vnto lorde rightuousnes sake wil prayse name lorde hyest viii psalme dauid lorde oure gouernoure • onderfull thy name worlde excellent thy glory aboue heauens matt • 1 b mouth babe sucklinges thou hast ordened prayse thine enemy yt thou mightest destroye enemie auenger considre thy heauens euen worke thy fyngers moone starres thou hast made oh man yt thou art myndfull ether sonne mā thou visitest psal 143 heb 2 b thou haddest season made lower thē angel thou crownedest honor glory thou hast set aboue workes thy hondes 〈…〉 thou hast put thinges subieccion vnder fete shepe ox yee beastes felde foules ayre fysh see • walketh thorow wayes see lorde oure gouernoure wonderfull thy name worlde ix psalme dauid wil geue thākes vnto lorde whole herte wil speake thy maruelous workes psal 110 137 wil glad reioyse yee songes wil make thy name thou hyest thou hast dryuē myne enemy abacke discōfited perished thy presence thou hast manteyned right cause thou syttest trone art true iudge thou rebukest heithen destroyest vngodly thou puttest name euer euer enemy swerdes come ende thou hast ouerthrowen city memoriall perished thē ye lorde endureth euer hath prepared seate vnto iudgmēt gouerneth ye worlde rightuousnes ministreth true iudgmēt vnto people lorde defence poore defence tyme trouble therfore yt knowe thy name put trust ye thou lorde neuer faylest thē seke prayse lorde deu 4 c psal 75 dwelleth sion shewe ye people doinges maketh inquysicion bloude remembreth psal 21 c forgetteth complaynte poore haue mercy vpō lorde considre trouble amōge myne enemy thou liftest vp ye gate death maye thy prayses within porte doughter sion reioyse thy sauynge heal • h heithen sunckē • ne pytte made nette spred priuely owne fote takē thus ye lorde knowne execute true iudgment whē vngodly trapped workes owne handes sela wicked must turned vnto hell heithen yt forget god poore shal allwaye remembraunce paciēt abydinge soch trouble shall perish euer vp lorde let man haue vpper hāde let heithē cōdemned lorde set scolemaster ouer thē heithē maye knowe selues mē sela hebrues begynne x psalme art thou gone farre lorde wilt thou hyde thyselff tyme trouble whyle ye vngodly hath ouer hande poore must suffre persecucion taken ymaginacions go aboute vn godly maketh boost owne hertes desyre cuvetous blesseth self blasphemeth lorde vngodly proude full indignaciō careth nether god eye wayes allwaye filthie thy iudgmentes farre sight defyeth enemy sayeth herte tush shal neuer cast downe shal harme happē vnto mouth full cursynge fraude disceate vnder tōge trauayle sorow sytteth lurkynge garden maye pryuely murthur innocent eye set vpō poore lyeth way • inge secretly lyon denne lurketh maye rauysh poore yee rauish poore hath gotten nett smyteth oppresseth casteth downe poore auctorite sayeth herte tush god hath forgotten hath turned waye face yt neuer se aryse lorde god lift vp thine honde forget poore wherfore shulde wicked blaspheme god saye herte tush careth thou seist thou considrest mysery sorowe poore geueth himselff ouer thy hande committeth vnto thou art helper frendlesse breake thou ye arme vngodly malycious search wickednesse hath done maye perish lorde kynge euer ye heithen shal perish londe lorde thou hearest desyrous longinge poore herte sure thine eare herkeneth therto helpe fatherlesse poore vnto right vngodly nomore exalted vpon earth x psalme dauid lorde put trust ye saye soule shulde fle byrde vpon youre hill • vngodly haue bēt bowe made redy arowes quyuer maye priuely shute 〈…〉 true herte foundacion haue cast downe cā rightuous thē withall lorde holy temple lordes seate heauen 〈…〉 cōsidereth eye eye lyddes beholde child men 〈…〉 lorde seith rightuous vngodly deliteth wickednes soule abhorreth vpon vngodly shal rayne snare fyre brymstone storme tempest rewarde shal haue drynke lorde rightuous ād loueth rightuousnes countenaunce beholdeth thīge yt iust xi psalme dauid helpe lorde one saynte fewe faithfull amonge child men euery man telleth lye neghbor flater lippes dissemble herte lorde wolde rote disceatfull lippes ād tonge speaketh proude thinges saye oure tō ge shulde preuayle ought speake lorde ouer v trouble sake oppressed complaynte poore wil vp sayeth lorde wil helpe thē set thē rest wordes lorde pure wordes euē ye syluer 〈…〉 earth tried purified vij tymes fyre kepe thē therfore lorde preserue v frō generacion euer vanite ydylnes getteth ouer hande amonge child men full ye vngodly xii psalme dauid longe wilt thou forget lorde euer longe wilt thou hyde thy face fro oh lōge shall seke councell soule longe shall vexed herte longe shal myne enemie triumphe ouer considre ād heare lorde god lighten myne eye slepe death lest myne enemie saye haue preuayled agaynst hī yf cast downe trouble reioyse trust thy mercy hert ioyfull thy sauynge health wil synge lorde dealeth louyngly yee wil prayse name lorde hyest xiii psalme dauid foolish bodyes saye hertes 〈…〉 tush god corrupte ād become abhominable doynges one • doth good lorde loked downe frō heauē vpō child men 〈…〉 se yf eny wolde vnderstonde seke god gone waye alltogether become vnprofitable none doth good one 〈…〉 throte open sepulcre tonges haue disceaued poyson aspes vnder lippes 〈…〉 mouth full cursinge bytternes fete swift shed bloude 〈…〉 destruccion wretchednes wayes ād waye peace haue knowne feare god eye haue vnderstondinge yt worke myschefe eatinge vp people bred call vpō ye lorde therfore shal brought greate feare god stondeth generacion rightuous ye haue made mocke coūcell poore putteth trust lorde oh yt sauynge health geuen vnto israel sion 〈…〉 oh lorde wolde delyuer people captiuyte thē shulde iacob reioyse israel shulde right glad xiiii psalme dauid lorde shall dwell thy tabernacle 〈…〉 shal rest vpō yi holy hill euen yt ledeth vncorrupte life doth thinge right ād speaketh treuth herte yt vseth disceat tonge doth euell neghboure slaundreth neghbours yt setteth vngodly maketh moch thē feare lorde yt sweareth vnto neghboure dispoynteth geueth money vpon vsury eze 18 taketh rewarde agaynst innocēt doth thī ge shal neuer remoued xv psalme dauid preserue god trust haue sayde vnto ye lorde thou art god goodes nothinge vnto delyte vpon sanctes earth vpon soch like yt runne another shall haue greate trouble drynk offerynges bloude wil offre nether make mencion name mouth lorde good 〈◊〉 thou manteynest enheritaūce 〈…〉 fallen vnto fayre ground • 〈…〉 goodly heretage wil thanke 〈…〉 geuynge warnynge 〈…〉 haue trembled quaked • att • 7 f foūdaciōs hilles shoke remoued wrothe wēte smoke nostrels ād cōsumynge fyre mouth ye coales kyndled bowed heauēs came downe darcke vnder fete rode vpō cherubins dyd fle came flyenge wynges wynde made darcknesse pauylion rounde aboute hī darcke water thicke cloudes couer brightnes presence cloudes remoued hale stone coales fyre lorde also thondred ye heauē heyth gaue thondre wt hale stone coales fyre sent arowes scatred thē cast sore lighteninges destroyed thē springes water sene foundaciōs roūde worlde discouered yi chiding lorde blastinge breth thy displeasure sent downe frō heyth fetch toke greate water delyuered fro stronge enemy fro foe mightie forme preuented tyme trouble ye lorde defence brought forth also lyberte delyuered fauor vnto lorde shall rewarde rightuous dealynge acordinge clēnesse hōdes shal recōpense haue kepte wayes lorde haue behaued wickedly agaynst god haue eye vnto lawes cast commaundemētes fro vncorrupte hī wil eschue myne owne wickednes therfore shal ye lorde rewarde rightuous dealinge acordinge vnto ye clēnesse hōdes eye sight holy thou shalt holy wt ye innocēt thou shalt innocēt clene thou shalt clene frowarde thou shalt frowarde 〈…〉 thou shalt saue poore oppressed brī ge downe hye lokes proude 〈…〉 thou lightest cādle lorde god thou makest darcknesse light discōfit hoost mē yee god cā leape ouer wall waye god perfecte waye 〈…〉 wordes lorde tried fyre shylde defence trust god lorde 〈…〉 hath eny strength oure god 〈…〉 god hath gyrded strēgth made waye vncorrupte hath made fete like harte fete set vp hye teacheth myne hondes fight 〈…〉 maketh myne armes breake euen bowe stele thou hast geuē defence thy health thy right hande vpholdeth thy louynge correccion maketh greate thou hast made rowme ynough vnder go fote steppe shulde slyde folowe vpon myne enemy take turne till discomfited smyte shall able stonde fall vnder fete thou hast gyrded strength vnto ye batell thou hast throwē downe vnder rose vp agaynst thou hast made myne enemy turne backes vpon thou hast destroyed thē yt hated cried none helpe thē yee euen vnto lorde 〈…〉 herde thē beate small dust wynde cast ye claye stretes thou shalt delyuer stryuinges people thou shalt make heade heithē people haue knowne shall serue soone heare shall obeye straunge childrē dyssemble straunge child waxē olde go haltinge pathes lorde lyueth ād blessed helper praysed god health euē ye god seyth auenged subdueth people vnto delyuereth fro cruell enemy thou shalt lift vp ryse agaynst thou shalt ryd wicked man londes wordes endes worlde 〈…〉 thē hath sett tabernacle ye sō ne cōmeth forth brydegrome chambre reioyseth giaunte rū ne course goeth forth frō one ende heauen runneth aboute vnto ende agayne holy heauen mightie helpe right hōde put trust charettes horse wil remē bre ye name lorde oure god brought downe fallen rysen stonde vp right saue lorde helpe v kynge call vpon xx psalme dauid lorde ioyfull kynge ye strength exceadinge glad thy sauynge health thou hast geuen hertes desyre hast put frō request lippes▪ sela thou hast preuēted wt liberall blessinges set crowne golde vpon heade asked life thou gauest longe life euē foreuer euer honoure greate thy sauynge health glory greate worshipe shalt thou laye vpon thou shalt geue euerlastīge felicite make glad wt ioye ye coūtenaūce why▪ kinge putteth trust lorde mercy hiest shal myscary let thine enemy fele thy honde let thy right honde fynde thē yt hate thou shalt make thē lite fyre ouen tyme thy wrath lorde shal destroye thē displeasure fyre shall consume frute shalt thou rote earth sede frō amōge childrē men intēded myschefe agaynst ymagined soch deuyces able perfourme therfore shalt thou put thē flight thy stringes thou shalt make ready thine arowes agaynst face thou exalted lorde thine owne strength wil synge prayse thy power xxi psalme dauid god god hast thou forsaken matt • 7 • mar 15 ye wordes cleueth goomes thou hast brought dust death dogges come aboute coūcell ye wicked hath layed sege agaynst pearsed hondes fete might haue tolde bone stode staringe lokinge vpon haue parted garmentes vanite sweareth disceaue 〈…〉 shal receaue blessinge frō lorde ād mercy frō god sauioure ye generaciō thē yt seke thē yt seke yi face iacob sela open yor gate ye prī ce let euerlastinge dores opened yt ye kynge glory maye come kynge glory▪ lorde strōge mightie euen lorde mightie batell open youre gate ye prynces let euerlastinge dores opened yt kynge glory maye come kynge glory lorde hoostes kynge glory sela xxiiii psalme dauid unto lorde lift vp soule god trust ye 〈…〉 oh let confounded lest myne enemy triūphe ouer yt hope ye shal ashamed soch scornefull despysers wt cause▪ shall put cōfuciō shewe thy wayes lorde teach thy pathes lede ye trueth lerne thou art god health hope daye longe call remembraunce lorde thy tender mercyes thy louinge kyndnesses haue bene euer olde oh remēbre ye synnes offence youth acordinge vnto thy mercy thynke vpon lorde thy goodnesse frēdly rightuous lorde therfore wil teach synners waye ledeth symple right soch meke thē lerneth wayes wayes lorde mercy faith fulnesse vnto soch kepe testament couenaunt thy name sake lorde mercifull vnto synne greate euer feareth lorde shal shewe waye hath chosen soule shall dwell ease sede shall possesse londe secrete lorde amonge feare sheweth couenaunt myne eye euer lokynge vnto lorde shal plucke fete ye nett turnethe vnto haue mercy vpon desolate misery sorowes herte greate brynge trouble loke vpon aduersite misery forgeue synnes considre myne enemy many beare malicious hate agaynst kepe soule delyuer let confounded haue put trust let innocency righteuous dealinge wayte vpon hope delyuer israel flesh stombled fell though hoost men layed agaynst yet shal hert afrayed though rose vp warre yet wil put trust luce 10 • one thinge haue desyred lorde wil requyre namely maye dwell house lorde dayes life2 7 • beholde fayre beutie lorde vyset temple tyme trouble hath hyde tabernacle1 21 • yee secrete place dwellinge hath kepte set vp vpon rocke stone hath lift vp heade aboue myne enemy cōpassed rounde aboute therfore wil offre dwellinge oblacion thā kesgeuynge wil synge speake prayses vnto lorde herkē vnto voyce lorde crie vnto haue mercy vpon heare hert speaketh vnto face seketh yee lorde thy face wil seke hyde thou thy face fro cast thy seruaunt displeasure thou art succoure leaue nether forsake god sauioure father mother haue forsaken lorde hath taken vp shewe thy waye lorde lede right path myne enemy delyuer wylles myne aduersaries false wytnesses rysen vp ymagyn myschefe neuerthelesse beleue verely se goodnesse lorde londe lyuynge psal • 0 tary thou ye lordes leysure stronge let thine hert good comforte wayte thou still lorde xxvii psalme dauid unto wil crie stronge defence thinke scorne lest yf thou make though thou herdest become like go downe ye pytte heare voyce humble peticion crie vnto holde vp hondes towarde thy holy temple plucke awaye amonge vngodly wicked doer 〈◊〉 9 speake frendly neghboure ymagin myschefe hertes rewarde acordinge dedes wickednesse owne inuencions recompense ye workes thei • •• de paye haue deserued regarde workes lorde ner operacion hādes therfore shal breake downe buylde vp praysed ye lorde hath herde voyce humble peticiō • eut • lorde strēgth shylde herte hoped helped therfore hert daūseth ioye synge prayses vnto lorde strength people defender sauioure anoynted helpe thy people geue thy blessynge vnto thy enheritaunce • eut 32 fede set vp euer xxviii psalme dauid ascrybe vnto lorde ye mightie ascribe vnto lorde worshipe strength geue lorde honoure name bowe youre selues holy magesty lorde lorde commaundeth water glorious god maketh ye thonder lorde yt ruleth see voyce lorde mightie operacion voyce lorde glorious voyce • ze 17 voyce lorde breaketh cedr • tree yee lorde breaketh ceders libanus maketh skippe like calfe deut 3 b libanus sirion like yonge vnycorne num 1 • c voyce lorde deuideth flame fyre voyce lorde shaketh wildernesse yee lorde shaketh wildernesse cades voyce lorde moueth ye hyndes discouereth thicke buszshes temple shal euery man speake honoure lorde stilleth water floude ye lorde remayneth kynge euer lorde shall geue power vnto people lorde shal geue people blessynge peace xxix psalme dauid wil magnifie ye lorde thou hast set vp suffred foe triūphe ouer lorde god cried vnto thou hast healed me1 reg 2 b psal • 5 b thou lorde hast brought soule hell thou hast kepte life go downe pytte synge prayses vnto lorde ye sayntes geue thankes vnto remembraunce holynesse 〈…〉 wrath endureth twincklinge eye pleasure life heuynesse maye well endure night ioye commeth mornynge forme whē prosperite sayde tush shal neuer fall thou lorde thy goodnesse haddest made hill stronge soone thou turnedest thy face fro brought feare thē cried vnto ye lorde yee vnto ye lorde made prayer profit bloude 〈…〉 yf go downe corrupcion maye dust geue thankes vnto ye shal declare thy faithfulnesse heare lorde haue mercy vpon lorde thou helper thou hast turned heuynesse ioye thou hast put sack cloth gyrded wt gladnesse honor might synge prayses vnto wt ceassynge lorde god wil geue thankes vnto euer xxx psalme dauid lorde trust let neuer put cōfucion 〈…〉 delyuer thy rightuousnesse bowe downe thine eare make haist delyuer thou stronge rocke house defence thou mayest saue thou art stronge holde castell thou gyde lede thy name sake drawe nett yt haue layed priuely thou art strēgth 〈…〉 thy hondes commende sprete thou hast •• lyuered lorde thou god treuth hate holde vanity trust lorde glad reioyse thy mercy thou hast considred trouble thou hast knowne soule aduersite thou hast delyuered ouer hōdes enemie hast set fete large rowme haue mercy vpon lorde trouble myne eye consumed heuynesse yee soule body life waxen olde heuynesse yeares wt mournynge strēgth fayleth aduersite bone corrupte become reprofe amonge myne enemy neghbours myne owne acquauntaunce afrayed yt seme strete cōveye selues fro clene forgotten mynde deed man become like broken vessell haue herde blasphemy multitude euery man abhorreth haue gathered councel together agaynst purposed take awaye life hope ye lorde saye thou art god tyme thy honde delyuer honde myne enemy yt persecute shewe thy seruaunt light thy countenaunce helpe thy mercy sake let confounded lorde call vpon let vngodly rather put confucion brought vnto hell let lyenge lippes put sylence cruelly diszdanedly despitefully speake agaynst rightuous greate manifolde thy good thou haist hyd feare ye thinges bringest thou passe put trust euen sonnes men thou hydest priuely thine owne presence proude men thou kepest secretly thy tabernacle strife tonges thankes lorde hath shewed maruelous greate kyndnesse stronge cite sodane feare came vpon sayde cast thy sight neuertheles thou herdest myne humble prayer cried vnto loue lorde ye sayntes lorde preserueth faith full plenteously rewardeth proude doer 〈…〉 strōge therfore take good herte vnto ye put youre trust lorde xxxi psalme dauid blessed whose vnrightuousnesse forgeuen 〈…〉 whose synnes couered blessed man vnto lorde imputeth synne whose sprete gyle whyle helde tonge bone consumed awaye thorow daylie complaynynges thy hande heuy vpon daye night moysture like drouth sommer sela therfore confessed synne vnto hyd myne vnrightuousnesse 〈…〉 saide knowlege myne offence accuse self vnto lorde thou forgauest wickednesse synne 〈…〉 sela shal euery saynte make prayer vnto due season therfore shall greate water floudes come nye thou art defence trouble come aboute cōpasse thou aboute also ioye delyueraunce 〈…〉 sela wil enforme shewe waye wherin thou shalt go wil fasten myne eye vpon tob 6 pro 26 ye like horse mooles haue vnderstondinge whose mouthes thou must holde bytt brydle yf wil obeie greate plage shall ye vngodly haue putteth trust lorde mercy shall compasse
