sal 2 b taist se frendly lorde blessed man yt trusteth feare lorde psal 127 matt 6▪ c ye yt sayntes feare lacke nothinge rich shal want suffre hunger seke lorde shal wāt maner thinge good come hither ye child herken vnto wil teach feare lorde 〈◊〉 ▪ 3 b listeth lyue wolde fayne se good dayes let refrayne tonge euell lippes speake gyle let eschue euell good let seke peace ensue eye lorde ouer rightuous eares open vnto prayer face lorde beholdeth euel destroye remembraunce earth rightuous crie lorde heareth delyuereth thē trouble lorde nye vnto yt contrite hert wil helpe soch hūble sprete pro 24 c • tim 3▪ b greate ye trouble rightuous lorde delyuereth kepeth bone yt one broken miszfortune shal slaye vngodly hate ye rightuous shal giltie lorde delyuereth soules seruaū te put trust shal offende xxxiiii psalme dauid stryue thou lorde stryue wt fight thou agaynst fight agaynst laye honde vpon shylde speare stonde vp helpe drawe thy swearde stoppe waye agaynst persecute saye vnto soule yi helpe let cōfounded put shame seke soule let thē turned back brought confucion ymagin myschefe 〈…〉 let thē ye dust wynde angell lorde scaterynge thē let waye darcke slippery angell lorde persecute haue pryuely laied nett destroye without cause yee made pitte soule neuer deserued let sodane destrucciō come vpon vnawarres 〈…〉 ye nett hath layed priuely catch self maye fall owne myschefe let soule ioyfull lorde reioyse helpe bone shal saie lorde like vnto delyuerest ye poore stronge yee poore nedy robber false witness rysen vp laye charge thinges knowe 〈…〉 rewarde euell good greate discomforth soule neuertheles sick put sack cloth humbled soule fastinge prayer turned myne owne bosome behaued though bene frende brother wēte heuely one ye mourneth mother 〈…〉 aduersite reioyse gather together yee ye lame come together agaynst vnawarres makynge mowes ceasse ye gredy scornefull ypocrites gnaszshed vpon theirteth lorde whan wilt thou loke vpō restore soule ye wicked rumoure thē dearlinge lyon 〈…〉 wil geue ye thankes greate congregacion prayse amonge moch people let thē triūphe ouer myne enemy naught let wyncke wt eye hate without cause 〈…〉 comonynge peace ymagin false wordes agaynst ye outcaste londe gape vpon wt mouthes sayenge se oure eye thou seist lorde holde thy tonge thē go farre fro lorde awake lorde stonde vp auenge thou cause god lorde iudge lorde god acordinge thy rightuousnesse yt triū phe ouer let thē saye hertes wolde haue let saye haue ouercome let put confucion shame reioyse trouble let thē clothed rebuke dishonoure boost thē selues agaynst let also glad reioyse fauoure rightuous dealinge yee let saye allwaye blessed ye lorde hath pleasure prosperite seruaunt tonge shall talkynge thy rightuousnes thy prayse daye longe xxxv psalme dauid hert sheweth wickednesse vngodly feare god eye dyssembleth face longe till abhominable synne founde wordes mouth vnrightuousnesse disceate 〈…〉 wil lerned good ymagineth myschefe vpon bedde come good waye ner refuse thinge euell 〈…〉 thy mercy lorde reacheth vnto heauen thy faith fulnesse vnto cloudes thy rightuousnesse stondeth like stronge mountaynes thy iudgment like greate depe thou lorde preseruest mē beestes 〈…〉 precious thy mercy god child men maye put trust vnder ye shadowe thy wynges shalbe satisfied plēteousnesse thy house thou shalt geue drynke ryuer thy pleasure 〈…〉 ye well life thy light shall se light sprede forth thy louynge kyndnesse vnto knowe thy rightuousnes vnto thē true hert let fote pryde ouertake let hande ye vngodly cast downe wicked doer fall cast downe able stōde xxxvi psalme dauid frett thy self vngodly thou envious agaynst euell doer shall soone cut downe like ye grasse 〈…〉 wythered euen ye grene herbe put thou thy trust ye lorde 〈…〉 doinge good shalt thou dwell londe verely shal fede delyte thou lorde shal geue thy hertes desyre 〈…〉 cōmitte thy waye vnto ye lorde set thy hope shal brynge passe yee shall make thy rightuousnesse cleare light thy iust dealinge noone daye holde still ye lorde abyde paciētly vpon greue thy self one hath prosperite lyueth abhominacion leaue wrath let go displeasure let thy gelousy moue also euell w •• ed doer shal roted paciētly abyde lorde shal enheret londe suffre yet litle whyle ye vngodly shal clene gone thou shalt loke place shal awaye matt 5 meke spreted shal possesse earth haue pleasure moch rest vngodly layeth wayte iust gnaszsheth vpon wt tethe ye lorde laugheth scorne psal • seith yt daye cōminge vngodly drawe swerde bende bowe cast downe ye symple poore slaye soch go ye rightwaye neuertheles swerde shal go thorow owne hert bowe shalbe brokē pro 15 b eccli 29 • 1 tim 6 b small thinge yt rightuous hath better greate rich vngodly armes ye vngodly shalbe broken lorde vpholdeth rightuous lorde knoweth dayes godly enheritaūce shal endure euer shal cōfounded ye perlous tyme ye dayes derth shall haue ynough ye vngodly shall perishe whē ye enemy ye lorde floures shal cōsume yee euen smoke shal cōsume awaye vngodly boroweth paieth agayne rightuous mercifull liberall soch blessed shal possesse londe curseth shalbe roted lorde ordreth good man goinge hath pleasure waye though fall shal hurte lorde vpholdeth wt hāde haue bene yonge olde yet sawe neuer rightuous forsakē ner sede seke bred rightuous euer mercifull lēdeth gētly therfore shal sede blessed fle frō euell ye thinge good shalt thou dwell euer ye lorde loueth ye thinge yt right forsaketh sayntes shal preserued euermore sede vn godly shalbe roted yee rightuous shal possesse ye lōde dwell therin euer pro 10 • mouth rightuous exercised wyszdome tōge talketh iudgment lawe god hert therfore shal fotesteppes slyde vn godly seyth rightuous goeth aboute slaye lorde wil leaue hōdes ner cōdemn • iudged hope thou lorde kepe waye shal pr • mote thou shalt haue lōde enheritaūce se vngodly shall perishe haue sene vn godly greate power florishinge like grene baye tre wente lo gone sought coude founde kepe innocency take hede vnto thinge right shall brynge man peace last trāsgressours shal perishe together vn godly shal roted ye last helpe rightuous commeth lorde strength tyme trouble lorde shal stōde saue shal delyuer vn godly helpe thē put trust xxxvii psalme dauid pvt • e rebuke oh lorde thine anger • ere 10 psal 6 oh chastē thy heuy displeasure thy arowes stick fast thy honde presseth sore whole parte body cause thy displeasure rest bone reason synnes wickedness gone ouer heade like sore burthen heuy forme beare woundes styncke corrupte thorow folishnesse brought greate trouble misery go mournynge daye longe loynes clene dried vp whole parte body feble sore smyttē roare disquietnes hert lorde thou knowest desyre gronynge hyd hert paunteth strength hath fayled light myne eye gone fro louers frendes stonde lokynge vpon trouble • ob 19 b psal • 4 b kynsmen gone farre sought life euell spake lye ymagined disceate daye longe like deaf mā herde one domme openynge mouth become man heareth make resistaunce wt mouth lorde trust thou shalt heare lorde god desyre yt myne enemy triumphe ouer yf fote slippe reioyse greatly redy suffre trouble heuynesse euer sight cō fesse wickednesse synne greueth myne enemy lyue mightie hate without cause many nombre rewarde euell good speake euell folowe thinge good forsake lorde god go farre fro haist helpe lorde succoure xxxviii psalme dauid sayde wil kepe way offended tonge shut mouth whyle vngodly layed wayte helde tonge domme kepte sylence yee euē good wordes payne grefe hert hote within whyle thus musynge fyre kyndled spake tonge lorde 〈…〉 let knowe myne ende nombre dayes maye certified wante beholde 〈…〉 thou hast made dayes spanne longe life nothinge vayne men lyuynge sela yee euery man walketh shadowe disquieteth • self vayne heapeth vp rich 〈…〉 tell gathereth lorde wherin shall comforte hope delyuer myne offence make scorne vnto foolish kepe sylēce open mouth thou hast done turne thy plage awaye fro cōsumed thorow feare thy hāde thou punyshest man synne thou chastenest beutie consumeth awaye like mothe vayne men sela heare prayer lorde considre callinge shewe thy self though thy mercie sake xliiii psalme child corah hert dytinge good matter speake haue made kynge tonge ye penne ready wryter thou art fayrest amonge child mē full grace thy lippes therfore god blesseth euer gyrde thy swerde vpon thy thee thou mightie worshipe renowne good lucke haue thou thine honoure ryde treuth mekenesse rightuousnes thy right hōde shal teach ye wōderfull thinges thy arowes sharpe people shalbe subdued vnto euen myddest amonge kynges enemy thy seate god endureth euer cepter thy kyngdome right cepter 〈…〉 thou hast loued rightuousnesse hated iniquite wherfore god thy god hath anoynted oyle gladnes aboue thy f • lowes thy garmentes like myrre aloe cassia thou cō mest thine yuerie palace thy beutifull glory kynges doughters go thy goodly araye vpon thy right honde stondeth quene vesture fyne golde herken doughter considre enclyne thine eare forget thine owne people thy father house shal kynge haue pleasure thy beutie thy lorde thou shalt worshipe doughters tyre shal giftes 〈…〉 riche amonge people shal make supplicacion kynges doughter glorious within hir clothinge wrought golde▪ shalbe brought vnto kynge rayment nedle worke maydens soch next shalbe brought vnto ioye gladnesse shal brought go kynges palace steade thy fathere thou hast gotten child thou shalt make prynces londes wil remembre thy name one generaciō another therfore shal people geue thankes vnto worlde without ende xlv psalme child corah oure trouble aduersite haue founde god oure refuge oure strength helpe therfore wil feare though earth fell though hilles caried myddest see 〈…〉 though water see raged neuer troublous though mountaynes shoke tēpest sela floude wt ryuers reioyseth ye cite god holy dwellynge hyest god ye myddest therfore shall remoued god helpeth ye right early heithen madd kyngdomes make moch doo whē sheweth voyce ye earth melteth awaye lorde hoostes wt v god iacob oure defence sela come hither beholde ye workes lorde destrucciōs hath brought vpō ye earth 〈…〉 hath made warres ceasse worlde hath broken bowe hath knapped speare sonder brēt charettes fyre still thē confesse yt god wil exalted amonge heithē wil exalted vpon earth lorde hoostes wt v god iacob oure defence sela xlvi psalme child corah clappe youre hōdes together ye people synge vnto god voyce thākesgeuynge lorde hyest feared greate kynge vpō ye earth shal subdue people vnder v heithē vnder oure fete choseth v heretage beutie iacob loued sela god gone vp wt mery noyse lorde wt sownde trōpet synge prayses synge prayses vnto god synge prayses synge prayses vnto oure kynge god kynge earth synge prayses vnto vnderstondinge god kinge ouer heithē god sitteth holy seate prynces people gathered together vnto god abraham god farre farre hyer exalted mightie lordes earth xlvii psalme child corah greate ye lorde hyelie praysed ye cite god euē vpō holy hill hill sion like fayre plā te wherof londe reioyseth vpon north syde lyeth cite greate kinge god well knowne hir palace yt defence 〈…〉 lo kynges gathered gone together marveled se soch thinges aston • ied sodēly cast downe feare came vpon thē sorowe vpō woman hir trauayle thou shalt breake ye shippes see thorow east wynde like haue herde se cite lorde hoostes cite god god vpholdeth euer sela wayte thy louynge kyndnesse god myddest thy temple god acordinge vnto thy name ye prayse vnto worldes ende thy right hōde full rightuousnes oh let moūt sion reioyse psal 96 • ye doughters iuda glad thy iudgmē te walke aboute sion go rounde aboute tell hir towres marke well hir walles set v • hir house maye tolde yt come god god euer euer shal allwaie gyde xlviii psalme child corah heare ye people pondre well ye dwell vpō earth hye lowe riche poore one wt another mouth shal speake wyszdome hert shal muse vnderstondinge wil encline myne eare parable shewe darcke speach vpon harpe wherfore shulde feare euell dayes whē wickednesse heles cōpaseth rounde aboute put trust good boost selues multitude rich man maye deliuer brother ner make agrement vnto god costeth redeme soules must let alone euer yee though lyue lōge se ye graue shal sene yt soch wyse mē shal dye perishe together well ignoraunt foolish leaue goodes loke house cōtinueth still dwellinge place endure one generacion another called owne name vpon earth neuerthelesse mā abydeth soch honor cōpared vnto ye brute beastes becōmeth like vnto thē waie foolishnesse yet posterite prayse wt mouth sela lye hell like shepe death shal gnawe vpon rightuous shal haue dominacion mo •• nynge tymes strēgth shal consum • hell shalbe dwellinge god shal deliuer soule power hell receaueth sela thou afrayed whan one made riche th • glory hense increased 〈◊〉 cary nothing • awaye wt dye • nether shal pompe folowe 〈◊〉 lyueth counted happie 〈◊〉 lōge prosperite mē speake good whē foloweth father generacion shal neuer se light eny man honoure hath vnderstōdinge compared vnto brute beastes becommeth like vnto xlix psalme asaph lorde euen mightie god hath spokē called worlde rysinge vp sonne vnto goinge downe • saie 2 sion • peareth glorious beutie god oure god shal come kepe sylence goeth befo •• consumynge fyre mightie tempest rounde aboute shal call heauens aboue earth maye iudge people gather sayntes together vnto yt set couenaunt eny offeringe heauens shal declare rightuousnesse god iudge sela heare people let speake let testifie amonge israel god euen thy god reproue thy sacrifice ye burnt offeringes allwaye wil take bullockes thy house ner gotes thy foldes beestes felde • e thousandes catell vpon hilles knowe foules vpon mountaynes wilde beastes felde • sight yf hongrie wil tell • ye whole worlde myne • herin thynkest thou wil eate • flesh ox drynke bloude goa • e offre vnto god prayse thankesgeuynge paye thy vowes vnto • yest call vpō tyme trou • le wil heare thou shalt • e vnto vngodly sayeth god doest thou preach lawes ta • est couenaunt thy mouth • thou hatest refourmed castest • wordes behynde yf thou seist • hefe thou runnest art parta • er aduouterers thou lettest ye • outh speake wickednesse thy tonge payneth disceate thou syttest speakest • aynst thy brother yee slaundrest thine • wne mother sonne thou doest • e holde tonge thinkest e • ē soch one thy self wil reproue set self agaynst considre 〈◊〉 forget god lest plucke awaie 〈◊〉 none delyuer •• reth thākes prayse honoureth waye wherby wil shewe sauynge health god l psalme dauid haue mercy vpon god thy goodnes acordinge vnto thy greate mercy awaye myne offence wash well fro wickednesse clense fro synne knowlege fautes synne euer agaynst agaynst haue synned done euell thy sight thou mightest iustified thy saynges shuldest ouer come thou art iudged beholde borne wickednesse synne hath mother conceaued lo thou hast pleasure treuth▪ hast shewed secrete wyszdome reconcile isope shal clene wash thou shalbe whyter snowe oh let heare ioye gladnesse bone thou hast broken maye reioyse turne thy face fro synnes put myszdedes make clene hert god renue right sprete within cast awaie thy presence take thy holy sprete fro geue comforte thy helpe agayne stablish thy fre sprete shal teach thy wayes vnto wicked synners maye conuerted vnto delyuer bloudegyltynesse god thou art god health tonge maye prayse thy rightuousnesse open lippes lorde mouth maye shewe thy prayse yf thou haddest pleasure sacrifice wolde geue thou delytest burnt offerynges sacrifice god troubled sprete broken cōtrite god shalt thou despise fauorable gracious vnto sion walles ierusalem maye buylded shalt thou pleased sacrifice rightuousnesse burnt offerynges oblacions shal laye bullockes vpon thine aulter li psalme dauid boastest thou thy self thou tyraunt thou canst myschefe goodnesse god endureth yet daylie thy tonge ymagineth wickednesse lye cutteth like sharpe rasoure thou louest vngraciousnesse thē good talke lye rightuousnesse sela thou louest speake wordes yt maye hurte thou false tōge therfore shal god cleane destroye smyte peces plucke thy dwellinge rote londe lyuinge sela rightuous shal se feare laugh scorne 〈…〉 lo mā yt toke god strēgth trusted vnto multitude rich mightie wickednesse like grene olyue tre ye house god trust tender mercy god euer euer wil allwaye geue thankes vnto thou hast done wil hope thy name thy sayntes like well lii psalme dauid foolish body saye hertes▪ tush 〈…〉 god corrupte become abhominable wickedness one doth good god loked downe heauen vpō child men se yf eny wolde vnderstonde seke god 〈◊〉 3 b gone ye waye become vnprofitable none yt doth good one cā haue vnderstondinge worker wickednes eatinge vp people bred call vpon god afrayed feare god breaketh bone besege thou puttest confucion god despiseth oh yt sauynge health geuen vnto israel sion oh lorde wolde delyuer people captiuyte shulde iacob reioyse israel shulde right glad liii psalme dauid helpe god thy name sake delyuer thy strēgth heare prayer god considre wordes mouth straungers rysen vp agaynst mightie haue god eye seke soule sela lo god helper vpholdeth soule shall rewarde euell vnto myne enemy 〈◊〉 2 e thy treuth shalt thou destroye frewil offeringe wil geue prayse thy name lorde comfortable thou hast delyuered trouble myne eye seyth desyre vpō myne enemy liiii psalme dauid heare prayer god hyde thy self fro peticion take hede vnto heare piteously mourne cōplayne enemie crieth vngodly commeth fast mynded myschefe maliciously set agaynst herte heuy within feare death fallen vpon fearfullnesse tremblinge come vpon horrible drede hath ouerwhelmed sayde wynges like doue might fle somwhere rest lo wolde get awaye farre remayne wildernesse sela wolde make haist escape stormy wynde tempest destroie tonges lorde deuyde gen 11 se vnrightuousnes strife ye cite goeth daye night aboute walles myschefe vyce myddest wickednesse therin disceate gyle go hir stretes yf myne enemie reuyled coude beare yf one ought euell dyd threaten wolde hyde thou companyon gyde myne owne familier frēde swete 〈◊〉 secrete communicacion together louyngly walked together ye house god let death come hastely vpon let go downe quick hell wickednes amonge dwellinges call vnto god lorde shall helpe eueninge mornynge noone daye wil mourne complayne shal heare voyce delyuereth soule peace laye waite many agaynst yee euen god endureth euer shal heare brynge downe sela wil turne feare god yee laye hondes vpon soch peace thei breake couenaunt mouthes softer butter yet haue batell mynde wordes smoother oyle yet swerdes matt 6 c luc 12 1 pet 5 cast thy burthen care vpon lorde shal norish fightinge troublinge 〈…〉 enemy treade daylie vnder fete many yt proudly fight agaynst neuerthelesse whē afrayed put trust wil comforte self god worde yee wil hope god feare flesh vnto vexe daylie lvii psalme dauid • f youre myndes vpon rightuous • esse dede iudge thinge right ye sonnes men ye ymagin myschefe youre hertes youre hondes deale wickednesse vngodly frowarde euē mother wombe soone borne go astraie speake lye furious serpent 〈…〉 euen like deaf adder stoppeth hir eares shulde heare voyce charmer charme neuer wysely breake teth god mouthes smyte chaft bone lyon whelpes sonder lorde maye fall awaye like water ye runneth pace shote arowes maye brokē let thē cōsume awaye like snale like vntymely frute woman let se sonne euer youre thornes sharpe wrath shal take awaye quycke like stormy wynde 〈…〉 rightuous shal reioyse seyth vengeaunce shal wash fete bloude vngodly • shal saye verely rewarde ye rightuous doutles god iudgeth earth lviii psalme dauid delyuer fro myne enemy god defende frō thē yt ryse vp agaynst delyuer frō wicked doer saue frō bloudthurstie mē lo lye waytinge soule ye mightie mē gathered together wt eny offence faute lorde rūne prepare thē selues wt faute arise come thou helpe beholde stōde vp lorde god hoostes thou god israel vyset heithen mercifull vnto thē yt offende malicious wickednesse sela 〈…〉 let thē go fro runne aboute cite youlinge like dogges beholde speake agaynst wt mouth swerdes vnder lippes reproueth thē 〈…〉 thou lorde shalt haue derision thou shalt laugh heithē scorne strēgth ascrybe vnto thou god art defender god sheweth goodnesse plenteously god letteth se desyre vpō myne enemy slayethē lest people forget scatre thē abrode thy power put thē downe lorde oure defence ye synne mouth wordes lippes pryde let thē taken preachinge cursynge lye cōsume yi wrath cōsume thē yt maye perish knowe yt god ruleth iacob worlde sela let thē go fro rūne aboute cite youlinge like dogges let thē runne meate grudge haue ynough wil synge thy power ād prayse thy mercy betymes mornynge thou art defence refuge tyme trouble vnto strength wil synge thou god art defence merciful god lix psalme dauid god thou yt hast cast v scatred v abrode thou yt hast bene sore displeased v cōforte v agayne thou yt hast remoued lōde deuyded heale sore therof shaketh thou hast shewed thy people heuy thinges 〈…〉 thou hast geuen v drynke wyne yt slōbre withall yet hast thou geuē tokē soch feare yt maye cast vp ye treuth sela thy beloued might delyuered helpe thy right hande heare god hath spokē sāctuary thinge reioyseth wil deuyde sichē 〈…〉 mete valley 〈◊〉 suchoth galaad myne manasses myne ephraim strength heade iuda captayne moab washpotte ouer edom wil stretch shue philistea shal glad lede stronge cite bringe edom shalt thou god thou yt hast cast v thou god yt wentest wt hoostes 〈…〉 thou oure helpe trouble vayne helpe man thorow god shal greate actes shal treade downe oure enemy lx psalme dauid heare crienge god geue hede vnto prayer endes ye earth wil call vnto whē herte trouble oh set vp vpō hye rocke thou art hope stronge tower agaynst enemie dwell thy tabernacle euer maye safe vnder couerynge thy wynges sela thou lorde hast herde desyres thou hast geuen heretage vnto feare thy name thou shalt graunte kynge lōge life yeares maye endure thorow generacions maye dwell god euer oh let thy louynge mercy faithfulnes preserue wil allwaye synge prayses vnto thy name yt maye daylie perfourme vowes lxi psalme dauid soule wayteth vpon god commeth helpe strēgth saluacion defence yt shal greatly fall longe wil ye ymagin myschefe agaynst euery man ye shal slayne ye sorte yee tottringe wall shal ye like broken hedge deuyce put delyte ī lye geue good wordes wt mouth curse wt herte sela neuertheles soule abydeth vpon god god strēgth saluacion defence yt shal fall god health glory might god trust put yor trust allwaye ye people poure yor hertes god oure hope sela men vayne mē disceatfull vpō weightes al together lighter vainte trust wronge robbery geue yor selues vnto vanite yf rich increase set yor herte vpon god spake worde twyse haue herde power belongeth vnto god thou lorde art mercifull thou rewardest euery man acordinge workes lxii psalme dauid god thou art god early wil seke soule thursteth flesh longeth barē drie lōde water thus loke thy sāctuary might beholde ye power glory thy louynge kyndnesse better life lyppes shal prayse lōge liue wil magnifie lift vp hondes thy name soule satisfied euē marry fatnesse mouth prayseth ioyfull lippes bedde wil remembre ye whē wake talkynge shalbe thou hast bene helper vnder shadowe ye wynges wil reioyse soule hangeth vpon thy right honde vp holdeth seke soule vayne shal go vnder earth shal fall swerde porciō fox ye kynge shal reioyse god sweare hym shal commē ded mouth lyers shalbe stopped deut 6 lxiii psalme dauid heare voyce god cōplaynte preserue life frō feare ye enemie hyde gatheringe together ye frowarde frō ye heape wicked doere whette tūges like swerde shute wt venimous wordes like wt arowes maye preuely hurte ye innocēt sodēly hit wt eny feare haue deuysed myschefe commoned amonge selues maye laye snare 1 • tush saye shall se ymagin wickednesse kepe secrete amonge selues euery man ye depe herte god shall sodenly shute arowe yt shall wounded yee • wne tunges shall make fall moch seyth thē shal laugh thē scorne men se shal saye hath god done shal perceaue yt worke rightuous shal reioyse lorde put trust yt true herte shalbe glad therof lxiiii psalme dauid thou god art praysed sion vnto vowe perfourmed thou hearest prayer therfore cō meth flesh vnto oure myszdedes preuayle agaynst v oh thou mercyfull vnto • ure synnes blessed man whō thou chosest receauest vnto maye dwell thy courte shall satisfied pleasure thy house euen thy holy temple heare v acordinge vnto thy wō derfull rightuousnesse god oure saluaciō thou art hope endes ye earth brode see strength setteth fast moūtaynes gyrded aboute power stilleth ye ragīge see roaringe wawes woodnes people dwell ye vttemost partes afrayed thy token thou makest mornynge euenynge starres prayse ye thou visetest earth thou watrest makest plenteous ryuer god full water thou preparest man corne ād thus thou prouydest earth thou watrest hir forowes thou breakest harde clottes therof thou makest soft ye droppes rayne blessest increase thou crownest yeare thy good thy fotesteppes droppe fatnesse dwellinges wildernes fatt also yt droppe withall litle hilles pleasaunt euery syde foldes full shepe valley stonde thicke corne yt laugh synge lxv psalme dauid psal 99 ioyfull god ye lōdes synge prayses vnto honor name make prayse glorious saye vnto god wonderfull thy workes thorow greatnesse thy power shal thine enemy confoūded yt worlde wolde worshipe synge prayse thy name sela come hither beholde workes god wonderfull doinges amonge child men turned see drye lō de wente thorow water fote therfore wil reioyse ruleth power euer eye beholde people rennagates shal able exalte selues sela magnifie god ye people make ye voyce prayse herde holdeth soule life suffreth oure fete slippe thou god hast proued v thou hast tried v li •• syluer tried thou hast brought v captiuyte layed trouble vpon lo • ne thou hast suffred men ryde ouer heades wēte thorow fyre water 〈◊〉 thou hast brought v refreshed 〈◊〉 therfore go thy house wt 〈◊〉 offeringes paye vowes promised wt lippes spake mouth trouble wil offre vnto fatte brentsacrifices smo • e rāmes offre bullockes goate • sela come praysed god hath cast prayer ner turned mercy fro lxvi psalme god mercifull vnto v blesse v shewe light countenaūce apon v sela maye knowe ye waye vpō earth ye sauynge health amonge heithen let lorde reioyse hī father ye fatherlesse defender widdowes euē god holy habitaciō god yt maketh mē one mynde house bryngeth ye presoners captiuite due season letteth ye rennagates cōtinue scarcenesse god thou wētest forth ye people whē thou wētest thorow ye wildernes sela earth shoke ye heauens dropped presence god sinai ye presence god ye god israel thou god sendest gracious rayne vpon thyne enheritaūce refreshest drye thy beastes maye dwell therin thou thy goodnes hast prepared poore lorde shal geue worde wt greate hoostes euāgelistes ringes wt army shal fle ye housholde plē teous hill hoppe ye ye greate hilles pleaseth god dwell vpō hill ye • lorde wil abyde euer charettes god many tymes thousande lorde amōge holy sinai thou art gone vp hye thou hast led captyuite captyue receaued giftes mē yee euen thy enemy might dwell lorde god praysed lorde daylie euē ye god helpeth v poureth benefites vpō v sela god yt sauior euē god lorde whō escape death god smyteth enemy vpō heades vpon hayrie scalpes soch go still wikednes lorde hath sayde wil bringe agayne basan wil bringe agayne frō depe see thy fote maye dipped bloude thine enemy thy dogges maye licke vp well se • e god thou goest thou god kynge goest sanctuary syngers go mynstrells amonge maydens tymbrels geue thankes vnto god lorde congregacion welles israel litle beniamin prynces iuda prynces lorde sela sytteth heauens ouer frō begynnge lo shal sende voyce yee mightie voyce ascrybe ye power vnto god glory israel might cloudes god wonderfull sanctuary god israel geue strength power vnto people blessed god lxviii psalme dauid helpe god water come euē vnto soule sticke fast depe myre grounde come depe water floudes wil drowne weery crienge throte drye sight fayleth waytinge longe vpon god yt hate without cause mo hayres heade▪ myne enemy wolde destroye giltlesse mightie fayne paye thinges yt neuer toke god thou knowest symplenesse fautes hyd let trust lorde god hoostes ashamed cause let yt seke confounded thorow god • israel thy sake suffre reprofe shame couereth face become straunger vnto brother aleaunt vnto mother child zele thine house hath euen eaten rebuke rebuked fallen vpon wepte chastened self wt fastinge turned reprofe put sacke cloth therfore iested vpon satt gate spake agaynst dronckardes made songes vpon lorde made prayer vnto acceptable tyme heare god thy greate mercy sure helpe take myre yt syncke oh let delyuered frō thē yt hate ye depe water 〈…〉 floude drowne 〈…〉 vp yt pitte shut hir mouth vpon heare lorde thy louynge kyndnesse confortable turne vnto acordinge vnto ye greate mercy hyde thy face thy seruaūt trouble haist ye helpe drawe nye vnto • le saue oh delyuer 〈◊〉 enemy thou knowest reprofe shame dishonor aduersaries thy sight rebuke breaketh hert maketh heuy loke haue pitie vpon man cōforte fynde none • 27 ioh 18 c gaue gall eate whē thurstie gaue vyneger drynke let table made snare take selues withall ro 11 b occasion fall rewarde vnto let eye blynded se euer bowe downe backes poure thy indignacion vpon let thy wrothfull displeasure take holde let habitacion voyde man dwell tentes 〈…〉 persecute thou hast smytten besyde thy woundes haue geuen moo let fall frō one wickednesse another come thy rightuousnesse let thē wyped ye boke lyuinge written amonge rightuous 〈◊〉 2 g poore heuynesse let thy helpe defende sauynge health saye alwaye ye lorde pray 〈…〉 poore misery 〈…〉 helpe thou art helpe redemer god oh make 〈◊〉 tarienge lxx psalme lorde trust let neuer put cōfuciō 〈…〉 rydde delyuer thorow thy rightuousnesse▪ encline thine eare vnto helpe thou stronge holde vnto maye allwaye fle thou hast promised helpe thou art house defence castell delyuer god ye hā de vngodly hande • rightuous cruell man thou lorde god art thinge lōge 〈…〉 thou art hope euen fro youth haue • eaned vpō ye euer sen borne thou art toke mother wombe therfore prayse allwaye become wonder vnto multitude sure trust oh let mouth fylled thy prayse honoure daye lō ge cast awaye myne olde age forsake strength fayleth myne enemy speake agaynst laye wayte soule take co •• cell together sayenge god hath forsakē p̄ersecute take none helpe go farre fro god god haist helpe let cō founded perish agaynst soule let thē couered shame dishonoure seke euell wil paciētly abyde allwaye wil euer encrease thy prayse mouth shal speake thy rightuousnesse sauynge health daye lōge knowe ende therof let go lorde god wil make mencion thy power rightuousnesse thou god hast lerned fro youth vp vntill therfore wil tell ye wonderous workes forsake god myne olde age gray headed vntill haue shewed thyne arme vnto childers child 〈…〉 thy power yet come thy rightuousnes god hie thou doest greate thinges god like vnto greate trouble aduersite hast thou shewed yet didest thou turne refresh yee broughtest depe earth agayne thou hast brought greate honoure comforted euery syde therfore wil prayse thy faith fulnesse god playē ge vpon lute vnto wil synge vpon harpe thou holy one israel lippes wolde fayne synge prayses vnto wolde soule thou hast delyuered tonge talketh thy rightuousnesse daye longe confounded brought vnto shame yt sought euel lxxi psalme salomon geue kinge thy iudgmēt god thy rightuousnesse vnto kynges sonne maye gouerne thy people acordinge vnto right defende thy poore mountaynes maye brynge peace litle hilles rightuousnes vnto people shal kepe symple folke right defende childrē poore punysh wrongeous doer thou shalt feared longe ye sonne moone endureth one generacion another shal come downe like rayne flese woll like droppes water ye earth tyme shal rightuousnesse florish yee abundaū ce peace longe moone endureth dominion shalbe one see floude vnto worldes ende dwell wildernes shal knele enemy shal licke dust kynges see iles shal brynge presentes ye kinges araby saba shall offre giftes kynges shal worshipe heithē shal seruyce shal deliuer poore whē crieth nedy yt hath helpe shall fauorable symple poore shal preserue soules soch aduersite shal deliuer soules extorcion wronge deare shal bloude sight shal lyue vnto shalbe geuē ye golde arabia prayer shal made euer vnto daylie shal praysed shalbe heape corne earth hye vpon hilles frute shal shake like libanus shal grene cite like grasse vpō earth name shal endure euer name shal remayne vnder sonne amonge posterites shal blessed thorow heithen shal prayse blessed lorde god euen god israel doth wō derous thinges blessed name maiesty euer londes fulfilled glory amen amen ende prayer dauid sonne iesse lxxii psalme asaph louynge god vnto israel soch clene hert ne • erthelesse fete allmost gone treadinges wel nye slipte greued ye wicked aba 1 c iere 12 iob •• se vngodly soch prosperite parell death stonde fast like palace come misfortune like folke nether plaged like men cause puft vp pryde ouerwhelmed cruelte vnrigthuousnesse eye swell fatnesse euen lyst corrupte speake blasphemy maliciously proude presumptuous wordes stretch forth mouth vnto heauen tonge goeth thorow worlde therfore fall people vnto sucke small auauntage psal 93▪ • tush saye shulde god perceaue knowlege hyest lo vngodly prospere worlde haue rich possession shulde clense hert vayne thought wash hondes innocency wherfore shulde punyshed daylie chastened euery mornynge▪ yee allmost also sayde euen lo shulde haue condemned generacion thy child thought vnderstonde harde vntill wēte ye sanctuary god considered ende men namely thou hast set thē slippery place thou maiest cast thē downe headlynges destroye thē sodenly consume perish come fearfull ende yee euen like dreame one awaketh makest thou ymage vanish cite thus hert greued wente euen thorow reynes foolish ignoraunt beest neuerthelesse allwaye thou hold est right hande thou ledest thy coū cel afterwarde receauest vnto glory prepared heauen nothinge vpō earth desyre comparison flesh herte fayleth god strength hert porcion euer lo num 18 c psal 118 h tren 3 c forsake shal perishe thou destroyest committe fornicacion agaynst good holde fast god put trust lorde god speake thy workes lxxiii psalme asaph god wherfore doest thou cast v cleane spoyle thē together thus haue brent vp house god londe se oure token nomore one prophet one vnderstondeth enymore oh god lōge shal aduersary dishonoure lōge shal enemie blaspheme thy name foreuer withdrawest thou thine honde pluckest thou thy right hōde thy bosome consume thine enemy god kynge olde helpe done vpon earth doth thou deuydest ye see thorow thy power thou breakest heades dragōs lightes sonne thou hast set ye border earth thou hast made sommer wynter remembre lorde enemie rebuketh foolish people blaspheme thy name delyuer soule thy turtle doue vnto beestes forget congregacon poore euer loke vpon couenaunt darcke house earth full wickednesse let symple go awaye ashamed poore nedy geue prayses vnto thy name aryse god manteyne thine owne cause remembre foolishmā blasphemeth daylie forget voyce thine enemy presumpcion hate increaseth euer lxxiiii psalme asaph unto god geue thākes yee vnto wyll geue thankes seynge thy name sonye tell thy wonderous workes maye get conuenient tyme shal iudge acordinge vnto right earth weake therin beare vp hir pilers sela sayde vnto madde people deale madly vngodly set vp youre horne set vp youre horne hye speake stiff necke promociō commeth nether east ner west ner yet frō wyldernesse god iudge putteth downe one setteth vp another honde lorde cuppe full stronge wyne poureth dregge • therof ye vngodly earth shal drynke sucke wil talke god iacob prayse euer horne vngodly breake ye horne rightuous shalbe exalted lxxv psalme asaph iuda god knowne name greate israel salem tabernacle dwellinge sion breaketh arowes bowe ye shylde swerde whole batta • sela thou art honoure might thē hilles robber proude shalbe robbed slepe slepe ye mightie shalbe able nothinge hōdes whē thou rebukest god iacob charettes horsmen shal fall slepe thou art feareful maye abyde ye sight thou art angrie thou lattest thy iudgment herde heauen erth trembleth still yee god aryseth geue iudgment helpe aduersite vpon earth sela thou punyshest one man must knowlege thou art redy punysh mo loke ye promyse vnto lorde youre god se kepe ye roūde aboute brynge presentes vnto yt ought feared taketh awaye breth prynces wonderfull amōge kynges earth lxxvi psalme asaph cried vnto god voyce yet euen vnto god cried voyce herde tyme trouble sought lorde helde vp hondes vnto night season soule refused comforte heuynesse thought vpō god whē hert vexed dyd speake sela thou heldest myne eye wa ••• ge feble coude speake remembred tymes olde yeares past called remembraunce songe night commoned myne owne herte sought sp • ete wil lorde cast euer wil nomore intreated mercy cleane gone promyse come vtterly ende euermore hath lorde forgotten gracious hath shut vp louynge kyndnesse displeasure sela last came poynte thought art thou foolish right honde hyest chaunge therfore wil remembre workes lorde call mynde thy wonder olde tyme wil speake thy workes talkynge shalbe thy doinges thy waye god holy greate mightie god thou art god doth wonder thou hast declared thy power amonge people thou thine arme hast delyuered thy people euen sonnes iacob ioseph sela water sawe ye god ye water sawe ye afrayed ye depthes moued thicke cloudes poured water ye cloudes thōdered thy arowes wente abrode thy thonder herde rounde aboute lighteninges shone vpon grounde earth moued shoke withall thy waye see thy pathes greate water yet coude man knowe thy fotesteppes thou leddest thy people like flocke shepe honde moses aaron lxxvii psalme asaph heare lawe people encline yor eares vnto ye wordes mouth wil open mouth parable 〈…〉 thou earth psal 2 b heithen thine enheritaunce lxxxii psalme asaph holde thy tonge god kepe still sylēce refrayne yi self god lo psal 2 thy enemy make murmuringe yt hate lift vp heade▪ ymagin euer let thē put shame perish maye knowe thou art alone thy name lorde thou art hyest ouer earth lxxxiii psalme child corah amiable yt dwellīges thou lorde hoostes soule hath desyre lōginge ye courte ye lorde hert flesh reioyse ye lyuynge god sparow hath founde hir house swalowe nest maye laye hir yōge euē ye aulters lorde hoostes kynge god blessed dwell thy house allwaye praysinge ye blessed ye men whose strēgth ye whose herte yt wayes goinge thorow vale mysery vse well pole fylled water go strength strength god god apeareth vnto thē sion lorde god hoostes heare prayer herken worshipe good thinge shal witholde lyue godly life lorde god hoostes blessed man yt putteth trust lxxxiiii psalme child corah lorde thou barest loue vnto thy londe thou didest bringe agayne captiuyte iacob thou diddest forgeue offence thy people 〈…〉 couerdest synnes sela thou tokest awaye thy displeasure turnedest thy self thy wrothful indignacion turne v god sauioure let thine anger ceasse v wilt thou displeased v euer wilt thou stretch thy wrath one generacion another wilt thou turne agayne quycken v thy people maye reioyse wil herken lorde god wil saie shal speake peace vnto people sayntes turne selues vnto foolishnes saluacion nye feare glory shal dwell oure londe mercy trueth met together rightuousnesse peace kysse ech trueth shal ryse ye earth rightuousnesse shal loke downe heauen soule holy god helpe thy seruaunt putteth trust mercifull vnto lorde call daylie vpon cō forte soule thy seruaunt vnto lorde lift vp soule 〈…〉 thou lorde art good gracious greate mercy vnto call vpon geue eare lorde vnto prayer pondre humble desyre tyme trouble call vpon thou hearest amonge goddes none like lorde one cā thou doest nacions thou hast made shall come worshipe lorde shal glorifie thy name thou art greate thou doest wonderous thinges thou art god alone lede thy waye lorde maye walke thy trueth let hert delyte fearynge thy name thanke lorde god wil prayse thy name euer greate thy mercy towarde 〈…〉 thou hast delyuered soule ye nethermost hell god proude rysen agaynst cō gregacion ye mightie seketh soule set ye eye 〈…〉 thou lorde god art full compassion mercy longe suffrynge greate goodnesse trueth turne vnto haue mercy vpō geue thy strength vnto thy seruaunt helpe sonne thy handmaydē shewe tokē vpon good hate maye se ashamed thou lorde hast helped comforted lxxxvi psalme child corah hir foundacions vpō holy hilles 〈…〉 lorde loueth gate sion thē ye dwellīges iacob excellēt thīges spokē ye thou cite god▪ sela wil thinke vpō rahab • abilō shal knowe yee child corah lorde god sauyor crie daye night oh let prayer entre thy presence encline thine eare vnto callynge soule full trouble life draweth nye vnto hell coūted one thē go downe vnto pytte euē mā hath strēgth fre amōge deed like vnto thē yt lye graue remembraū ce cutt awaye thy honde thou hast layed lowest pytte ye darcknesse depe thy indignacion lieth hard vpon thou vexest thy floudes sela thou hast put awaye myne acquātaunce farre fro made abhorred fast preson get forth sight fayleth trouble lorde call daylie vpō stretch hondes vnto 〈…〉 doest thou shewe wonder amonge deed physiciās rayse vp agayne maye prayse 〈…〉 maye thy louynge kyndnes shewed graue thy faithfulnesse destruccion maye thy wonderous workes knowne darcke thy righteousnes londe thinges forgottē vnto crie lorde early cō meth prayer lorde puttest thou awaye soule wherfore hydest thou thy face fro strength gone sorow misery fearfulnesse beare thy burthen thy wrothfull displeasure goeth ouer feare oppresseth come rounde aboute daylie like water compase together euery syde louers frē de hast thou put awaye fro turned awaye myne acquantaunce lxxxviii psalme ethan esrahite songe shal allwaye louynge kyndnesse lorde psal 100 wt mouth wil euer shewinge thy faithfulnesse frō one generacion another haue sayde mercy shal set vp euer thy faithfulnesse shalt thou stablish heauens haue made couenaun • chosen haue sworne vnto daui • seruaunt thy sede wil stablish e • uer set vp thy trone one generacion another sela lorde heauēs shal prayse th • wonderous workes yee thy faithfulnes ye congregacion sayntes amonge cloudes maye cōpared vnto lorde yee amonge goddes like vnto lorde god greatly feared councell sayntes reuerence thē aboute lorde god hoostes like vnto power thy trueth rounde aboute thou rulest pryde see thou stillest wawes therof whē arise thou breakest proude like one wounded▪ thou scatrest thine enemy abrode thy mightie arme heauēs thine earth thine thou hast layed foundaciō roū de worlde therin thou hast made north south tabor hermon shal reioyse thy name thou hast mightie arme stronge thy hande hye thy right hande rightuousnes equite habitacion thy seate mercy trueth go thy face blessed people lorde reioyse walketh light thy countenaunce delite thy name daye longe thorow thy rightuousnesse shalbe exalted thou art glory strength thorow thy fauoure shalt thou lift vp oure horne esa 1 abac 1 c lorde oure defence holy one israel oure kynge thou spakest somtyme visiōs vnto thy sayntes saydest haue layed helpe vpon one mightie haue exalted one chosen people1 16 2 reg 5 haue founde dauid seruaūt holy oyle haue anoynted honde shal holde fast arme shal strength enemie shal ouercome sonne wickednesse shal hurte shal smyte downe foe face plage hate trueth also mercy shalbe name shal horne exalted wil set honde see right honde floudes • reg • shal call thou art father god strength saluacion wil make firstborne • yer kinges earth mercy wil kepe euermore couenaunt shall stonde fast sede wil make endure euer yee trone dayes heauen yf childrē forsake lawe walke iudgmentes yf breake myne ordinaunces kepe commaundementes wil vyset offence rodde synnes scourge neuerthelesse louynge kyndnesse wil vtterly take ner suffre trueth fayle couenaunt wil breake ner disanulle thinge yt gone lippes haue sworne holynesse wil fayle dauid sede shal endure euer seate also like sonne •• al 71 shal stonde fast euermore moone faithfull witnesse heauen sela thou forsakest abhorrest thyne anoynted art displeased thou hast turned backe couenaunt thy seruaunt cast crowne grounde psal 79 b thou hast ouer throwne hedge brokē downe stronge holdes al go spoyle become rebuke vnto neghbours thou settest vp right hā de enemy makest aduersaryes reioyse thou hast taken awaye strength swerde geuest victory battayll thou hast put glory cast trone downe grounde dayes youth hast thou shortened couered dishonoure sela lorde longe wilt thou hyde thy self euer shal thy wrath burne like fyre remembre shorte tyme hast thou made men naught gen 2 c heb 9 man lyueth shal se death maye mā delyuer owne soule honde hell sela lorde thy olde louynge kyndnesses thou sworest vnto dauid thy trueth remēbre lorde rebuke ye multitude people vnto thy seruauntes haue borne bosome wher wt thine enemy blaspheme 〈…〉 slaū der ye fotesteppes ye anoynted thankes lorde euermore amen amen lxxxix psalme prayer moses man god lorde thou art oure refuge one generacion another mountaynes brought forth euer earth worlde made thou art god euerlastinge worlde ende thou turnest man destruccion agayne thou sayest come agayne ye child men thousande yeares thy sight yesterdaye past like night watch soone thou scatrest euen slepe fade awaye sodenly like grasse 〈…〉 mornynge grene groweth vp euenynge cutt downe wythered consume awaye thy displeasure afrayed thy wrothfull indignacion thou • ettest oure miszdedes oure secrete synnes light thy countenaunce thou art angrie dayes gone brynge yeares ende▪ tayle tolde daye oure age iij score yeares ten though men stronge come iiij score yeares yet strength laboure sorowe soone passeth awaye gone regardeth power thy wrath thy fearfull terrible displeasure teach v nombre oure dayes maye applie oure hertes vnto wyszdome 〈…〉 turne agayne lorde last gracious vnto thy seruauntes satisfie v thy mercy soone shal reioyse glad dayes oure life comforte v agayne tyme thou hast plaged v yeares wherin haue suffred aduersite shewe thy seruauntes thy worke child thy glory glorious maiesty lorde oure god vpon v prospere thou worke oure hondes vpon v prospere thou oure hondy worke xc psalme dwelleth vnder ye defence hyest abydeth vnder ye shadowe ye allmightie shal saye vnto ye lorde hope stronge holde god whō wil trust shal deliuer frō snare hunter frō noysome pestilence shal couer vnder wynges thou mayest safe vnder fethers faithfulnesse trueth shal thy shylde buckler yt thou shalt nede afrayed eny bugges night ner arowe flyeth daye pestilēce crepeth ye darcknesse ner sicknesse yt destroyeth noone daye thousande shal fall besyde ten thousande thy right honde shal come nye yee thyne eye shalt thou beholde se rewarde vngodly thou lorde art hope thou hast set thy house defence hye shal euell happen vnto nether shal eny plage come nye thy dwellinge 〈…〉 shall geue angel charge ouer kepe thy wayes shal beare hondes thou hurte thy fote agaynst stone thou shalt go vpō lyon adder yonge lyon dragon shalt thou treade vnder thy fete hath set loue vpon shal delyuer shal defende hath knowne name 〈…〉 calleth vpon shall heare yee trouble wher wil delyuer brynge honoure lōge life wil satisfie shewe saluacion xci psalme good thinge geue thankes vnto lorde 〈…〉 synge prayses vnto ye name hyest tell thy louynge kyndnesse early mornynge thy trueth night season vpon instrumēt ten strynges vpon lu • e songe vpon harpe 〈…〉 thou lorde hast made glad thorow thy workes▪ wil reioyse ouer operacion thy hondes lorde glorious thy workes thy thoughtes depe vnwyse man wil knowe 〈…〉 foole wil vnderstōde vngodly grene grasse workes wickednes florish destroyed euer thou lorde hyest abydest worlde without ende lo thy enemy lorde lo thy enemy shal perishe worker wickednes shalbe scatred abrode horne shalbe exalted like horne vnicorne 〈…〉 shal anoynted fresh oyle myne eye also shal se lust myne enemy myne eare shall heare desyre wicked yt ryse vp agaynst rightuous shal florish like palme tre growe like cedre libanus soch planted house lorde frutefull plenteous grene maye shewe true lorde strēgth vnrightuousnesse xcii psalme lorde kynge hath put glorious apparell lorde hath put apparell gyrded strēgth psal •• hath made rounde worlde sure moued tyme forth hath ye seate bene prepared thou art euerlastinge floudes aryse lorde floudes lift vp noyse ye floudes lift vp wawes wawes see mightie rage horribly yet lorde dwelleth hye mightier thy testimony lorde sure holynesse becommeth thyne house euer xciii psalme lorde god vengeaunce belōgeth thou god vengeaunce belongeth shewe thy self arise thou iudge worlde rewarde proude deseruynge lorde longe shal vngodly longe shal vngodly tryumphe longe shal wicked doer speake diszdaynedly make soch proude boastynge smyte downe thy people lorde trouble thine heretage murthur widdowe straunger put fatherlesse death yet saie tush esa 29 c eze • b 9 b iob 22 b ecclī 23 • lorde seyth god iacob regardeth take hede ye vnwise amonge people ye fooles wil ye vnderstonde planted eare shal heare made eye shal se nurtureth heithen teacheth man knowlege gen 7 19 exo 14 • 1 cor 3 c baruc 4 shal punysh lorde knoweth thoughtes men vayne blessed mā thou lernest lorde teachest thy lawe thou mayest geue pacience tyme aduersite vntill pytte dygged vp vngodly lorde wil fayle people nether wil forsake inheritaunce iudgment shalbe turned agayne vnto rightuousnesse soch true hert shal folowe ryseth vp agaynst wicked taketh parte agaynst euell doer yf lorde helped soule allmost bene put sylence • ob 13 b • ioh 1 b psal 31 • cor 1 sayde fote hath slipped thy mercy lorde helde vp ye multitude sorowes herte thy comfortes haue refreshed soule wilt thou haue eny thinge stole wickednesse ymagineth myschefe lawe gather together agaynst soule rightuous condemne innocent bloude lorde refuge god strēgth confidēce shal recompence thē wickednesse destroye owne malice yee lorde oure god shal destroye xciiii psalme come let v prayse lorde let v hertely reioyse strength oure saluacion • phe 5 b let v come presence prayse thākfull vnto speake good name lorde gracious 〈…〉 mercy euerlastinge treuth endureth generacion generacion c psalme thākesgeuynge dauid songe shalbe mercy iudgment 〈…〉 yee vnto lorde wil synge let haue vnderstondinge waye godlynesse vntill tyme thou come vnto shal walke house wt innocent herte wil take wicked thinge honde hate synne vnfaithfulnesse shal cleue vnto frowarde herte shal departe fro wil knowe wicked personne preuely slaundreth neghboure wil destroye hath proude loke hye stomacke maye awaye myne eye shal loke soch faithfull londe yt maye dwell ledeth godly life shal seruaunt shall disceatfull personne dwell house telleth lye shal tary sight shal soone destroye vngodly londe wicked doer maye roted cite lorde ci psalme heare prayer lorde let criēge come vnto psal 142 hyde thy face fro tyme trouble enclyne thine eares vnto call heare right soone dayes consumed awaye like smoke bone brent vp fyre brande hert smyttē downe wythered like grasse forget eate bred voyce gronynge bone wil scarse cleue flesh become like pellicane wildernes like oule broken wall wake euen sparow sittinge alone vpon house toppe myne enemy reuyle daye longe laugh scorne sworne together eate ash bred mengle drynke wepynge ye indignacion wrath thou hast taken vp cast awaye dayes gone like shadowe wythered like grasse thou lorde endurest euer thy remembraunce thorow generacions arise therfore haue mercy vpon sion tyme haue mercy vpon yee tyme come why2 pa 36 • iere 25 b 29 b 1 esd 1 67 thy seruauntes haue loue hir stone pitieth se dust heithen shal feare thy name euery place dominion prayse thou lorde soule ciii psalme prayse lorde soule lorde god 〈…〉 thou art become exceadinge glorious thou art clothed maiesty honoure thou deckest thy self light wt garment thou spredest heauen like curtayne thou voltest aboue water thou makest cloudes thy charet goest vpon wynges wynde thou makest thine angel spretes 〈…〉 thy minister flammes fyre thou hast layed ye earth vpon hir foundacion neuer moueth eny tyme thou couerest depe like garmēt 〈…〉 water stonde aboue hilles thy rebuke fle voyce thy thonder afrayed hilles sene alofte valley beneth place thou hast appoynted thē 〈…〉 thou hast set boundes maie passe turne agayne couer ye earth thou causest welles sprynge vp amonge valley water runne amonge ye hilles beastes felde maye haue drynke wylde ass maye quench thyrste aboue vpon hilles haue foules ayre habitacion synge amonge braunches thou watrest hylles aboue erth fylled ye frutes thy workes thou bryngest forth grasse catell grene herbe seruyce men 〈…〉 thou bryngest fode earth wyne make glad ye herte mā oyle make chearfull countenaunce bred strength man herte tree lorde full sappe euen tree libanus hath planted make byrdes nestes fyrre tree dwellinge storcke hilles refuge wylde goates stony rockes ye conyes thou hast appoynted moone certayne season sonne knoweth goinge downe thou makest darcknesse maye night wherin beastes forest moue yee yonge lyon roare praye seke meate god sonne ariseth get awaye together lye downe dennes goeth man forth worke till londe vntill euenynge lorde manifolde thy workes right wysely hast thou made thē yee earth full thy rich greate wyde see also wherin thinges crepinge innumerable small greate beastes go shippes • uer leuiathan thou hast made take pastyme therin wayte vpō thou mayest geue meate due season whē thou geuest gather whē thou openest thine honde fylled good thou hydest thy face soroufull yf thou takest awaye breth dye turned agayne dust agayne thou lattest thy breth go forth made thou renuest face earth glorious magesty lorde endureth euer lorde reioyseth workes 〈…〉 earth trē bleth loke doth touch ye hilles smoke synge vnto lorde longe lyue wil prayse god whyle haue beinge wordes might please • oye lorde synners shal cōsumed earth vngodly shal come ende prayse thou lorde soule halleluya ciiii psalme geue thankes vnto lorde call vpon name tell people thinges hath wonderous workes londe ham fearfull thinges reed see sayde wolde haue destroyed moses chosen stonde ye gappe turne awaie wrothfull indignacion lest shulde destroye thē yee thought scorne yt pleasaunt londe gaue credence vnto worde murmured tentes herkened vnto voyce lorde lift vp honde agaynst ouerthrowe wildernes cast sede amonge nacions scater londes ioyned themselues vnto baal peor ate offeringes deed thus prouoked vnto anger owne invēcions plage greate amonge stode vp phineas excuted iustice plage ceased counted vnto rightuousnesse amonge posterites euermore angerd also water strife moses punyshed sake prouoked sprete tolde thē planely lippes nether destroyed heithen lorde commaunded mengled amon • ge heithen lerned workes moch worshipped ymages turned owne decaye yee offred sonnes doughters vnto deuels shed innocent bloude sonnes doughters offred vnto ymages canaan londe defyled wi •• bloude thus stayned wt •• owne workes wente whoringe owne invencions therfore wrath lorde kyndled agaynst people moch abhorred owne enheritaunce gaue ouer honde heithē hated lordes ouer enemy oppressed thē subieccion many tyme dyd delyuer prouoked owne invē cions brought thy ryghtuousnesse א wyll kepe thy statute forsake vtterly ב beth ב withall shall yonge man clense waye euen rulynge hym selfe thy worde ב whole herte seke let go wrōge thy cōmaundemētꝭ ב thy reioyse rydde helpe god frō ieopardy wherevnto nye 〈1 paragraph〉 songe steares lorde bene oure syde maye israel saye lorde bene oure syde whē men rose vp agaynst v swalowed v vp quycke wrathfully dyspleased v yee water drowned v ye streame gone ouer oure soule depe water proude gone euen vnto oure soule praysed lord whych hath geuen v ouer praye vnto teeth oure soule escaped euē byrde snare fouler snare broken delyuered oure helpe standeth name lorde hath made heauen earth ¶the cxxv psalme ¶the churche congregacyon safetye lorde defendeth shalbe prosperous fauoreth purgeth wycked theroute songe steares put trust lorde euen mount syon may remoued standeth fast euer hylles stande ierusalem euē standeth lorde rounde people tyme forth euermore rodd vngodly come lot ryghtuous lest ye ryghtuous put hande vnto wyckednesse well lorde vnto yt good 〈1 paragraph〉 true herte soche turne backe vnto awne wyckednesse lorde shall leade thē forth euyll doer peace vpō israel ¶the cxxvj psalme ¶he descrybeth gladnes people returning agayne babylon vnder fygure herof reioysynge christen sonne god hath made fre captiuyte synne deeth songe steares vvhen lorde turneth agayne captyuyte sion shall lyke vnto dreame shall oure mouth fylled wyth laughter oure tonge ioye shall sayd amonge heathē lorde hath done greate thinges thē yee lorde hath done greate thynges v ready wherof reioyse turne oure captyuyte lorde ryuers south yt sowe teares shall reape ioye goeth waye wepynge beareth forth good sede shal come agayne ioye bringe sheaues hym ¶the cxxvij psalme ¶by liberalyte gyft god house housholde geuen cytye defended • meate mynystred chyldren toward thryftye obtayned 〈…〉 songe steares except lorde buylde house labour lost buylde except lorde kepe cytye watchman waketh vayne lost labour ye rise vp early take rest eate bredde carefulnesse loke pleaseth geueth slepe lo chyldren frute wombe herytage gift yt cōmeth ye lorde lyke arowes hande gyaunt euen yonge child happy man hath quyuer full shal ashamed speake enemyes gate ¶the cxxviij psalme ¶he feareth god shall well fortunately ceasons songe steares blessed feare ye lorde walke hys wayes thou shalt eate laboures thyne awne handes well happy art thou thy wyfe shalbe ye frutefull vyne vpō walles thy house thy chyldren lyke olyue braunches rounde aboute thy table lo thus shall man 〈…〉 blessed feareth lorde lorde shall blesse siō thou shalt se ierusalem prosperyte thy lyfe longe yee thou shalt se thy chylders chyldren peace vpon israel ¶the cxxix psalme ¶althoughe wycked longe greatly persecute godly yet shall preuayle ouer yee shall length perish godly shal safetye songe steares many tyme haue fought agaynst fro youth vp maye israel saye yee many tyme haue fought agaynst fro youth vp haue laboures thine owne hondes well happie art thou thy wife shalbe frutefull vyne vpon walles thy house thy child like olyue braunches roūde aboute ye table lo thus shal ye mā blessed yt feareth lorde 〈…〉 lorde shal blesse sion thou shalt se ierusalē prosperite thy life longe yee thou shalt se thy childers childrē peace vpō israel cxxviii psalme many tyme haue fought agaynst fro youth vp maye israel saie yee many tyme haue fought agaīst fro youth vp haue ouercome plower plowed vpō backe made lōge forowes rightous lorde hath hewen ye yocke ye vngodly peces let confounded turned backwarde many haue euell sion 〈…〉 let thē euē haye vpon house toppes wythereth afore pluckte vp wherof mower fylleth hande nether byndeth vp sheaues bosome go saye moch lorde prospere wish good lucke name lorde cxxix psalme ovt depe call vnto lorde lorde heare voyce oh let thine eares considre well voyce complaynte 〈…〉 yf thou lorde wilt extreme marcke done amysse oh lorde maye abyde mercy thou mayest feared loke lorde soule doth wayte worde trust soule doth paciently abyde lorde frō one mornynge let israel trust lorde ▪ lorde mercy plenteous redempcion 〈…〉 shal redeme israel synnes cxxx psalme euermore cxxxi psalme lorde remembre dauid trouble swore vnto ye lorde vowed vowe vnto ye mightie one iacob wil come within tabernacle house ner clymme vp ī bedde wil suffre myne eye slepe ner myne eye lyddes slōber vntill fynde place lorde habitaciō mightie one iacob lo herde ephrata foūde ye wod wil go tabernacle▪ fall downe fotestole2 par 6 g arise lorde thy restinge place thou ye arke ye strēgth let thy prestes clothed rightuousnesse let thy sayntes reioyse exo 28 ephe 6 b thy seruaunte dauids sake turne awaye presence thine anoynted lorde hath made faithfull ooth vnto dauid2 7 c 1 par 18 b psal 88 act 2 shal shrenke frute thy body shal set vpon thy seate yf thy child wil kepe couenaunt testimony yt shal lerne thē childrē also shal syt vpō thy seate euermore lorde hath chosen siō habitaciō self hath chosen shalbe rest wil dwel haue delite therin blesse hir vytales wt increase wil satisfie hir poore bred psal 2 esa • wil decke hir prestes health hir sayntes shal reioyse ierusalem let right hande forgotten yf remembre let tonge cleue rofe mouth yee yf preferre ierusalem myrth 〈…〉 remembre childrē edom lorde daye ierusalem sayde downe downe euē grounde doughter babilō 〈…〉 thou shalt come misery thy self yee happie shal rewardeth ye thou hast serued v blessed shal taketh thy child throweth agaynst stone cxxxvii psalme dauid wil geue thākes vnto lorde whole hert euen goddes wil synge prayses vnto wil worshippe towarde thy holy tēple prayse thy name thy louynge kyndnesse treuth thou hast magnified thy worde acordynge vnto thy greate name call vpō thou hearest endewest soule moch strēgth kynges earth shal prayse lorde heare wordes thy mouth yee shal synge wayes lorde greate glory lorde though lorde hye yet hath respecte vnto ye lowly ye proude beholdeth afarre though walke ī ye myddest trouble yet shalt thou refresh thou shalt stretch forth thine hā de vpō furiousnes myne enemy ye righthande shal saue lorde shal make good yee thy mercy lorde endureth euer despyse worke thine owne handes cxxxviii psalme dauid lorde thou searchest knowest thou knowest downe syttinge vprisynge thou vnderstōdest thoughtes afarre thou art aboute path aboute bedd spyest wayes lo worde ī tōge thou lorde knowest alltogether thou hast fashioned behinde layed thine hōde vpon soch knowlege wonderfull excellēt atteyne vnto whither shal go thy sprete whither shal fle thy presence yf clymme vp heauen thou art yf go downe hell thou art also yf take wynges mornynge remayne vttemost parte see euen also shal thy honde lede thy right hande shal holde yf saye peraduēture darcknesse shal couer shal night turned daye yee darcknesse darcknesse night cleare daye darcknesse light alike reynes thyne thou hast couered mother wombe wil geue thākes vnto wōderously made maruelous thy workes soule knoweth right well bone • hyd though made secretly fashioned beneth earth thine eye se myne vnparfitnesse ston • e writtē ī thy boke dayes fashi • ned yet one deare ye coūcels vnto god greate summe yf tell mo nombre ende wake vp present • wilt thou slaye ye wicked oh god • hat bloudethyrstie mighte departe fro •• e speake vnright thine •• emies exalte selues presumptuously hate lorde hate maye awaye ryse vp • gaynst yee hate right sore •• erfore myne enemy trye • god seke grounde myne hert proue examen 〈…〉 well yf eny waye 〈…〉 lede waye 〈…〉 cxxxix psalme dauid▪ delyuer lorde 〈◊〉 men oh preserue wicked men ymagin myschefe hertes stere vp strife daye longe sharpen tonges like serpent adder poyson vnder lippes sela kepe lorde hande vngodly preserue wicked men purposed ouerthrowe goinges proude haue layed snare spred nett abrode coardes yee sett trappes waye sela sayenge vnto lorde thou art god heare voyce prayer lorde lorde god thou strength health thou hast couered heade ye daye battayll let ye vngodly haue desyre lorde let haue purpose lest proude sela let myschefe owne lippes fall vpon ye head thē yt cōpase aboute psal 7 b men lest eate soch thinges please thē let rightuous rather smyte frendly reproue wil take though poured oyle vpō heade shal hurte heade yee wil praye yet • wickednesse iudges stōble stone yet heare snare loke vpon right honde se man wil knowe haue place fle vnto man careth soule therfore crie vnto lorde saye thou art hope porcion londe lyuynge cōsidre complaynte brought lowe oh delyuer fro persecuters stronge brynge soule preson maye geue thākes vnto thy name thinge yf thou wilt graūte shal rightuous resorte vnto cō pany cxlii psalme dauid heare prayer lorde considre desyre answere thy treuth rightuousnesse sake entre iudgment thy seruaunt thy sight shal man lyuynge iustified enemie persecuteth soule smyteth life downe grounde layeth darcknesse deed men worlde therfore sprete enemy resorte vnto teach thinge pleaseth thou art god let thy louynge spre • e lede forth vnto londe rightuousnesse quyckē lorde thy name sake thy rightuousnesse sake brynge soule trouble thy goodnesse scater myne enemy abrode destroye vexe soule thy seruaunt cxliii psalme dauid blessed lorde refuge teacheth hādes warre fyngers fight hope castell defence delyuerer shylde trust gouerneth people vnder lorde mā thou hast soch respecte vnto sonne man thou regardest man like thinge naught tyme passeth awaye like shadowe bowe thy heauēs lorde come downe touch mountaynes yt maye smoke withall▪ sende forth lightenynge scater thē shute thine arowes consume sende downe thine hande aboue delyuer take ye greate water hande straunge childrē whose mouth talketh vanite right hāde chap wysdome god calleth v mouth salomō exorteth v geueth v warnynge eschue wicked whose vn godly cōuersacion worde worke punyshment also descrybed chap ii wisdome maye gotten profit commeth chap iii exorteth u feare god pacience commendeth wyszdome • requyreth u cleue vnto chap iiii fatherly exortacion vnto wisdome profit therof ought refrayne mēbres oure body frō euell chap v exorteth vnto wyszdōe warre harlottes telleth harme • ye folowe therout whē men medle soch h • teacheth men louyngly cleue vnto • ried wyues descrybeth ende vn • godly chap vi warneth men bewarre ••• tishipe exorteth slouthfull laboure sheweth wikednesse false tonges requyreth men bewarre aduoutry perlo • theft felony chap vii exorteth vnto wiszdome sheweth condicions harlottes hurt happeneth vnto soch enclyne prouocaciōs desyres flesh chap viii wyszdome calleth men swetely vnto telleth treasure power hath cōmendacion prayse wiszdome wherout euery mā exorted cleue vnto chap ix wyszdome crieth vpō ignoraūt promiseth greate thinges foolish maner light woman chap x chapter forth vnto xxxi described many swete louely wyse sentence teach men wyszdome profit commeth agayne men maye auoyde foolishnesse hurte therof chap xxxi wyszdome warneth u bewarre euell woman descrybeth cōuersacion maner behauoure honest maried wyfe prouerbes salomon sonne dauid kynge israel lerne wyszdome nurtoure vnderstondinge prudence rightuousnesse iudgment equite babe might haue wyt yonge men might haue knowlege vnderstondinge hearinge wyse mā shal cōme wysdome experience shal apte vnderstonde parable interpretacion therof wordes wyse darcke speaches feare lorde begynnynge wysdome 〈…〉 fooles despyse wysdome nurtoure first chapter sonne heare thy father doctryne forsake lawe ye mother shal brynge grace vnto thy heade shal • cheyne aboute thy necke 〈…〉 sonne cō sente vnto synners yf entyse saye come wyth u let u laye wayte bloude lurke preuely innocēt wyth cause 〈…〉 let u swalowe thē vp like ye hell let u deuoure thē quycke whole go downe pytt shal fynde maner costly rich fyll oure house wyth spoyles cast thy lott amonge u shal haue one purse sonne walke thou wt refrayne ye fote frō wayes 〈…〉 fete rūne euell haistie shed bloude vayne ye net layed forth byrdes eye yee thē selues laye wayte one anothers bloude one thē wolde slaye another wayes soch couetous one wolde rauysh anothers life wyszdome crieth without putteth forth hir voyce stretes calleth ye congregacion ye open gate sheweth hir wordes thorow ye cite sayenge ye childrē lōge wil ye loue childyshnesse longe wil ye scorner delyte scornynge ye vnwyse enemy vnto knowlege turne vnto correccion lo wil expresse mynde vnto make vnderstōde wordes seinge haue called ye refused haue stretched honde mā regarded coū cels haue ye despysed set correcciōs naught therfore shal also laugh yor destruccion mocke ye thinge ye feare cōmeth vpon euen whē ye thinge ye afrayed falleth sodenly like storme yor misery like tempest yee whā trouble heuynesse cōmeth vpon shal call vpō wil heare shal seke early shal fynde yt hated knowlege receaued ye feare ye lorde abhorred councell despysed correccion therfore shal eate ye frutes owne waye fylled wt owne councels ye turnynge awaye ye vnwyse shal slaye thē ye prosperi fooles shalbe owne destrucciō harkeneth vnto shal dwell safely pro 3 c haue ynough without eny feare euell ii chapter sonne yf thou wilt receaue wordes kepe cōmaundemē te thine eare maye herken vnto wysdome applie thine herte vnderstōdinge yf thou criest wyszdome callest knowlege yf thou sekest money dyggest treasure thē shalt thou vnderstonde ye feare lorde fynde ye knowlege god iaco 1 eccls 1 • 7 c iob 28 b 3 reg 3 • 4 c lorde geueth wyszdome mouth commeth knowlege vnderstondinge preserueth ye welfare rightuous defendeth yt walke innocently kepeth ye right path preserueth ye waye sayntes shalt thou vnderstonde rightuousnesse iudgment equite yee euery good path yf wyszdome entre thine herte ye soule delyte knowlege shal councell preserue vnderstondinge shal kepe thou mayest delyuered frō ye euell waye man yt speaketh f • owarde thinges soch leaue hye strete walke ī ye wayes darcknesse reioyse doynge euell delyte ī wicked thinges whose wayes croked pathes slaunderous thou mayest delyuered also straunge woman pro 7 5 thine owne geueth swete wordes forsaketh huszbande hir youth forgetteth couenaunt hir god hir house enclyned vnto death hir pathes vnto hell go vnto come agayne nether take holde waye life thou mayest walke ye good waye kepe pathes
