sight god men put thy trust ye lorde thine herte leane vnto thine owne vnderstondinge thy wayes haue respecte vnto shal ordre thy goinges esa 5 c rom· 12 c wyse thine owne conceate feare ye lorde departe euell shal thy nauel whole thy bone stronge honoure lorde wt ye substaunce wt ye firstlinges thine encrease • ob 4 b deut 26 mala 3 b exo 23 c 34 c pet 4 b tob 12 c heb 12 apo 3 shal thy barnes fylled plenteousnesse thy press shal flowe ouer swete wyne sonne despyse chastenynge ye lorde nether faynte thou art rebuked whō lorde loueth chasteneth yet delyteth euen father owne sonne well fyndeth wyszdome opteyneth vnderstondinge gettinge better eny marchaundise syluer profit better golde pro • wyszdome worth thē precious stone ye thinges yt thou canst desyre compared vnto vpon hir right hande longe life vpon hir left hande rich honor hir wayes pleasaunt wayes hir pathes peaceable gen 2 b tre life laye holde vpon blessed kepe fast wyszdome hath ye lorde layed foūdacion ye earth thorow vnderstondinge hath stablished ye heauēs thorow wiszdome ye depthes breake vp ye cloudes droppe downe dew sonne let thinges departe thyne eye kepe lawe councell shal life vnto thy soule grace vnto ye mouth shalt thou walke safely ye waye thy fote shal stomble yf thou slepest thou shalt afrayed shalt take thy rest slepe swetely pro 3 c thou neddest afrayed eny sodane feare nether violent russhinge vngodly commeth lorde shal besyde kepe thy fote yt thou taken refuse good vnto shulde haue lon •• thine hande able saye • vnto thy neghboure go thy waye come agayne tomorow wil geue • hou hast geue intende hurte vnto thy neghboure seynge hopeth dwell rest stryue lightly wt eny man hath done yt harme folowe wicked man 〈…〉 chose none wayes lorde abhorreth frowarde secrete amonge righteous curse lorde house vngodly blesseth dwellinges righteous scornefull shal laugh thē scorne shal geue grace vnto lowly wyse shal haue honor possession shame promociō fooles shal haue iiii chap heare ye child fatherly exortaciō take good hede ye maye lerne wyszdome yee shal geue good rewarde yf ye wil forsake lawe father deare sonne tenderly beloued mother taught also sayenge let thine herte receaue wordes kepe commaundementes thou shalt lyue get wyszdome get vnderstondinge forget ye wordes mouth shrē ke forsake shal preserue loue shal kepe chefe poynte wyszdome thou wyllynge opteyne wyszdome thy goodes get vnderstondynge make moch shal promote yee yf thou embracest shal brynge vnto honoure shal makethe gracious heade garnish ye crowne glory heare sonne receaue wordes yeares thy life maye many wil shewe ye waye wyszdome lede right pathes yf thou goest therin shal straytnesse hynder thou runnest thou shalt fall take fast holde doctryne let go kepe thy life come path vngodly walke waye wicked eschueit go therin departe asyde passe ouer slepe e • cepte haue first done myschef • nether take eny rest excepte haue first done harme eate bred wickednesse drīke wyne robbery path rightuous shyneth light euer brighter brighter vnto parfecte daye ye waye vngodly darcknesse wherin mē fall awarre sonne marcke wordes enclyne thine eare vnto saynges 〈…〉 let departe thine eye kepe euen myddest thine herte life vnto finde thē health vnto body kepe thine hert diligence vpon hangeth life put awaye frowarde mouth let lippes slaunder farre let thine eye beholde thinge yt right let thine eye lyddes loke straight pōdre path thy fete shal ye wayes sure 〈…〉 turne asyde nether right hande ner lefte witholde thy fote euell v chapter sonne geue hede vnto wysdome bowe thine eare vnto prudē ce yt thou mayest regarde good councell thy lippes maye kepe nurtoure 〈…〉 lippes harlot droppinge hony combe hir throte softer oyle ye last bitter worm wod sharpe two edged swerde hir fete go downe vnto death hir steppe pearse thorow vnto hell regardeth path life vnstedfast hir wayes thou canst knowe heare therfore sonne departe frō wordes mouth kepe thy waye farre come nye ye dores hir house thou geue thine honor vnto another thy yeares cruell men fylled thy goodes thy labour come straunge house yee thou mourne last thou hast spent thy body goodes saye ala hated nurtoure dyd hert despyse correccion wherfore obedient vnto voyce teacher herkened vnto infourmed come almost mysfortune myddest multitude congregacion drinke water thine owne well ryuers runne thine owne sprīges let ye welles flowe brode maye ryuers water stretes let thine owne straungers let thy well blessed glad wife thy youth louynge hynde frendly roo eccle 9 let brestes alwaye satisfie holde euer content hir loue sonne wilt thou haue pleasure harlot embrace bosome another womā iob 31 34 euery mās wayes open sight lorde pōdereth goinges wickedness vngodly shal catch snare owne synnes shal trapped wolde refourmed shal dye greate foolishnesse shal destroyed vi chapter sōne yf thou suertie ye neghboure pro 21 • 17 c 20 • thou hast fastened thine hōde wt another mā yee thou art boūde thine owne wordes taken wt thine owne speach therfore sonne discharge thy self thou art come ī ye neghbours daunger go thy waye soone intreate thy neghboure let thyne eye slepe ner thine eye lyddes slomber saue thy self doo frō ye honde byrde frō hōde fouler go emmet thou slogarde cōsidre hir wayes lerne wyse hath gyde teacher leder pro 24 • 0 c pro 13 • yet sommer prouideth hir meate gathereth hir foode together ī ye haruest lōge wilt thou slepe thou slogish mā whā wilt thou aryse thy slepe yee slepe still litle slōber litle folde thine handes together yet litle thou mayest slepe shal pouerte come vnto one yt trauayleth waye necessite like wapened man dissemblynge person wicked man goeth frowarde mouth wyncketh eye tokeneth wt fete poynteth wt fyngers euer ymageninge myschefe frowardnesse hert causeth discorde therfore shal destruccion come hastely vpō sodenly shal broken healed sixe thinges lorde hateth seuenth vtterly abhorreth proude loke dyssemblynge tonge psal 17 pro 12 hādes shed innocent bloude herte yt goeth aboute wt wicked ymaginaciōs pro 1 fete swift rennynge myschefe false wytnesse yt bringeth vp lye soch one soweth discorde amonge brother sonne kepe thy father cōmaundemētes forsake ye lawe thy mother put thē vp together thine herte bynde thē aboute thy necke maye lede thou goest preserue thou art aslepe yt thou awakest psal 118 thou mayest talke thē commaundement lanterne lawe light yee chastenynge nurtoure ye waye life maye kepe frō euell woman pro 5 7 flaterynge tonge harlott yt thou lust beuty thine herte lest thou takē wt hir fayre lokes harlot wil make mā begg bred maried woman wil hunt ye precious life maye man take fyre bosome clothes brent one go vpon hote coales fete hurte euen euer goeth neghbours wife toucheth vngiltie men vtterly despyse thefe • xo 22 stealeth satisfie soule hongerie yf maye gotten restoreth agayne seuen tymes asmoch el maketh recompence good house cōmitteth aduoutrie womā foole bryngeth life destruccion getteth self also shame dishonor soch shal neuer put gelousy wrath mā ītreated though thou woldest ofre greate giftes make amendes receaue vii chapter sonne kepe wordes laye vp cōmaundemētes • eut 11 nū 15 kepe cōmaundemētes lawe euē aple thine eye thou shalt lyue bynde vpon thy fyngers wryte thē table thine hert saye vnto wysdome thou art sister call vnderstondinge thy kynswoman pro 2 b 5 maye kepe ye frō ye straūge womā frō ye harlot geueth swete wordes wyndowe house loked thorow trelies behelde simple people amonge yonge folkes spyed one yonge foole goinge ouer stretes corner waye towarde harlottes house twylight euenynge begāne night darcke beholde mett womā harlottes apparell disceatfull wāton vnstedfast womā whose fete coude abyde ye house without ī ye stretes lurketh ī euery corner caught ye yōge mā kyssed ashamed sayēge vowe paye daye perfourme therfore came forth mete might seke thy face haue founde haue deckte bed coueringes clothes egipte bed haue made smell myrre aloe cynamom come let v lye together take oure pleasure till daye light good man home gone farre hath taken bagg moneye tell whē cōmeth home thus many swete wordes ouercame 〈…〉 hir flateringe lippes wanne immediatly foloweth oxeled slaughter like stockes fooles punyshed longe till hath wounded lyuer hir darte like yf byrde haisted snare knowinge parell life lyeth vpō heare therfore sonne marcke wordes mouth let thine herte wandre hir wayes thou disceaued hir pathes many one hath woūded cast downe yee many stronge mā hath slayne hir house waye vnto hell men go downe chamber death viii chapter doth wysdome crie doth vnderstondinge put forth hir voyce stondeth hye place stretes wayes doth crie whole cite gate men go ye men sayeth call vnto ye childrē mē lift vp voyce take hede vnto knowlege ye ignoraūt wyse herte ye fooles geue eare wil speake greate matter open lippes tell thinges right throte shal talkynge ye trueth lippes abhorre vngodlynesse wordes mouth rightuous frowardnesse ner falsede therin playne soch wil vnderstō de right thē fynde knowlege receaue doctryne therfore syluer knowlege fyne golde wysdome worth precious stone ye • thinges thou cāst desyre compared vnto wysdome haue dwellynge wt knowlege prudent councell myne owne feare lorde ye eschuynge euell pryde disdayne euell waye mouth speaketh wicked thīges vtterly abhorre thē geue councell gyde haue vnderstondinge haue strength thorow kynges reigne thorow pace make iust lawes thorow lordes beare rule iudges ye earth execute iudgmēt louynge vnto loue seke early shal fynde rich honoure wt yee excellent goodes rightuousnes frute better thē golde precious stone myne encrease worth fyne syluer walke ye waye rightuousnes strete iudgment maye sende prosperite loue encrease treasure lorde possessiō begynnynge wayes euer begame workes aforetyme haue bene ordened frō euerlastīge 〈…〉 frō ye beginnynge euer earth made borne nether depthes ner springes water foundacions ye mountaynes▪ layed yee hilles borne earth vpon earth yet made grounde self 〈…〉 made heauens present whā set depthes ordre whan hanged cloudes aboue whan fastened sprynges depe 〈…〉 whan shutt see within certayne bowndes ye water shulde go ouer marckes layed foundacions earth ordringe thinges delytinge daylie reioysynge waye roūde cōpase worlde make ioyfull▪ delyte amōge child men 〈…〉 therfore harken vnto ye child blessed kepe wayes▪ geue eare vnto nurtoure wyse refuse blessed ye man heareth watchinge daylie gate geuynge attendaunce postes dores fyndeth fyndeth life shal optayne fauoure lorde offendeth agaynst hurteth owne soule hate louers death ix chapter wysdome hath buylded house hewen seuen pilers hath slaughted poured hir wyne prepared hir table hath sent forth hir maydens crie vpō hyest place cite ignoraūt let come hither vnwise sayde come youre waye eate bred drynke wyne haue poured forsake ignoraūce ye shal lyue se ye go waye vnderstondinge reproueth scornefull personne getteth self dishonoure rebuketh vngodly stayneth reproue scorner lest owe euell wil rebuke wyse man wil loue geue discrete man occasion wilbe wyser▪ teach rightuous man wil increase feare lorde begynnynge wysdome iob 28 c psal 110 • eccli 1 c pro 4 b knowlege holy thinges vnderstondinge thorow ye dayes shalbe prolonged yeares thy life shal many yf thou wyse yi wysdome shal yi selfe good yf thou thynkest scorne therof shalbe thine owne harme foolish restlesse woman full wordes soch one hath knowlege sytteth dores hir house vpō stole aboue cite call soch go walke straight wayes ignoraunt sayeth let come hither vnwyse sayeth stollen water swete bred preuely eaten hath good taist cōsider death hir gestes go downe hell x chapter prouerbes salomon wyse sonne maketh glad father vndiscrete sonne heuynesse mother pro 15 c pro 11 eccli 5 b treasure wickedly gotten profit nothinge rightuousnesse delyuereth death pro 12 • lorde wil let soule rightuous suffre hōger putteth ye vngodly frō desyre ydle hande maketh poore quycke laboringe hande maketh riche gathereth sommer wyse slogish haruest bringeth confucion louynge fauorable face rightuous ye fore heade vngodly past shame presumptuous psal 111 memoriall iust shall haue good reporte name vn godly shal stynke wyse man wil receaue warnynge foole wil sooner smytten face leadeth innocent life walketh surely psal 22 pro 28 • eccl 27 goeth wrōge waye shalbe knowne yt wynketh eye wil harme hath foolish mouth shalbe beaten mouth rightuous man well life ye mouth vngodly past shame presumptuous euell stereth vp strife loue couereth ye multitude synnes1 pet 4 ye lippes yt hath vnderstōdinge mā shal fynde wysdome ye redde belō geth ye backe ye foolish wyse mē laye vp knowlege ye mouth ye foolish nye destrucciō rich mās goodes strō ge holde pouerte oppresseth poore rightuous laboureth good vngodly vseth increase vnto synne take hede vnto ye chastenynge nurtoure ye waye life refuseth refourmed goeth wrōge dissemblynge lippes kepe hatred secretly speaketh eny slaunder foole moch bablinge must nedes offence refrayneth lippes wysest innocent tonge noble treasure herte vngodly nothinge worth lippes rightuous fede whole multitude fooles shal dye owne foly 〈◊〉 42 c • ccli 11 • sal 126 • 6 c blessynge lorde maketh rich mē carefull trauayle doth nothinge therto foole doth wickedly maketh sporte neuertheles wysdome man bewarre soch thinge vngodly afrayed shal come vpon rightuous shal haue desyre vngodly like tempest passeth ouer nomore sene rightuous remayneth sure euer vyneger teth smoke vnto ye eye euē slogish personne sende forth feare ye lorde maketh lōge life ye yeares ye vngodly shal shortened pacient abydinge rightuous shalbe turned gladnesse hope vngodly shal perish waye lorde geueth corage vnto ye godly feare wicked doer rightuous shal neuer ouerthrowne • sa 124 • sal 36 ye vngodly shal remayne londe mouth iust wilbe talkynge wysdome tonge frowarde shal perish lippes rightuous occupied acceptable thinges mouth vngodly taketh worst xi chapter false balaunce abhominacion vnto lorde • ro 16 b 〈◊〉 b true weight pleaseth pryde shame also confucion lowlynes wysdome innocent dealynge iust shal lede vnfaithfulnesse despysers shalbe owne destruccion rich helpe daye vengeaunce • rou 10 • ccli 5 b rightuousnesse delyuereth frō death rightuousnes ye innocent ordreth waye vngodly shal fall owne wickednesse rightuousnesse iust shal delyuer despysers shalbe taken owne vngodlynesse vngodly man dyeth hope gone confydence rich shal perish rightuous shalbe delyuered trouble vngodly shal come steade thorow ye mouth ye dyssembler neghboure destroyed thorow knowlege shal iust delyuered 〈…〉 goeth well rightuous cite mery vngodly perish gladnesse iust wealth cite prospereth whan vngodly haue rule decayeth foole bryngeth vp slaunder neghboure wyse man wil kepe secrete 〈…〉 dyssemblynge person wil discouer preuy thinges faithfull hert kepe councel 〈…〉 good councel people decaye many geue councell wealth 〈…〉 suertye straunger hurteth medleth suerteshippe sure gracious womā manteyneth honestie mightie manteyne ryches yt hath gentle liberall stomacke mercifull hurteth neghbor tyraūt laboure vngodly prospereth soweth rightuosnes shal receaue sure rewarde like rightuousnes bryngeth life euē cleue vnto euell bryngeth death lorde abhorreth fayned hert hath pleasure vndefyled shal helpe ye wicked though laye hondes together sede rightuous shalbe preserued fayre woman without discrete maners like rynge golde swynes snoute iust laboure peace trā quylite vngodly disquyetnesse man geueth goodes richer ye nygarde hauynge ynough wil departe nothinge yet euer pouerte lyberall geuynge shal haue plenty watereth shal watered also hoordeth vp corne shalbe cursed amonge people blessynge shal light vpon heade selleth laboureth honesty fyndeth desyre seketh myschefe shal happē vnto trusteth rich shal haue fall ye rightuous shal florish grene leaf maketh disquyetnesse owne house shal haue wynde heretage foole shal seruaunt wyse frute rightuous tre life wyse man also wynneth men soules yf ye rightuous recōpēsed vpō earth moch thē vngodly ye synner▪ xii chapter loueth wyszdome wil content refourmed hateth reproued foole good man acceptable vnto lorde ye wicked wyl condempne man cā endure vngodlynesse ye rote ye righteous shal moued stedfast woman crowne vnto hir huszbonde behaueth vnhonestly corrupcion bone thoughtes ye righteous right ymaginacion vngodly disceatfull talkynge vngodly maye laye wayte bloude mouth ye righteous wil delyuer euer thou canst turne aboute vngodly shal ouerthrowne house righteous shal stōde man shalbe commended wyszdome foole shal despysed simple man laboureth worketh better thē one gorgious wanteth bred righteous man regardeth life catell vngodly haue cruell hertes tilleth lōde shal haue plenteousnesse bred yt foloweth ydylnes foole desyre ye vngodly hunteth myschefe rote righteous bryngeth forth frute wicked falleth snare thorow ye malyce owne mouth iust shal escape parell euery man shal enioye good acordinge innocency mouth workes hādes shal rewarded loke foole taketh honde thinketh well done wyse wyl coūceled foole vttereth wrath haist discrete man forgeueth wronge iust man tell trueth shewe thinge yt right false wytnesse disceaueth slaunderous personne pricketh like swerde wyse man tonge wholsome true mouth euer constāt dyssemblinge tōge soone chaunged ymagin euell mynde wil disceaue councelers peace shal heaue ioye folowinge thē shal mysfortune happen vnto iust vngodly shal fylled misery lorde abhorreth disceatfull lippes laboure treuth please hath vnderstōdinge hyde wysdome vndiscrete herte telleth foolishnesse diligēt hande shal beare rule ydle shal vnder tribute heuynesse discorageth ye herte man pro • 5 b 17 eccli • 0 c good worde maketh glad agayne righteous liberall vnto neghboure waye vngodly wil disceaue selues disceatfull man shal fynde vaū tage content wt hath2 〈◊〉 6 b heb 13 worth thē golde waye righteousnesse life eny waye path vnto death xiii chapter wyse sonne wyll receaue father warnynge yt scornefull wyll heare reproued good mā shal enioye frute mouth hath frowarde mynde shalbe spoyled kepeth mouth kepeth life speaketh vnaduysed fyndeth harme slogarde wolde fayne haue get desyre soule diligent shal haue plenty righteous man abhorreth lye vngodly shameth righteousnesse kepeth innocēt waye vngodlynesse shal ouerthrowe synner men riche though haue nothinge agayne pro 11 c mē poore hauynge greate rich goodes euery man delyuereth life poore wyl reproued light righteous maketh ioyfull pro • 4 c▪ candle vngodly shal put amonge proude euer strife amonge thinges aduysement wyszdome hastely gottē goodes soone spent gathered together hande shal increase longe tarienge thinge dyfferred greueth ye herte desyre commeth tre life despyseth worde destroyeth feareth cō maundement shal haue peace lawe wel life vnto wyse maye kepe snare death good vnderstondinge geueth fauoure harde waye despysers wyse man doth thinges discrecion foole wil declare foly vngodly messaū ger bryngeth myschefe faithfull embassitoure wholsome thinketh scorne refourmed commeth pouerte shame receaueth correccion shal come honoure desyre brought passe delyteth soule sap 2 c fooles abhorre eschueth euell goeth company wyse men shal wyse cōpanyō fooles shal hurte myschefe foloweth vpon synners rightuous shal haue good rewarde childers childrē shal haue possessiō rich synner layed vp ye iust iob 27 c plenteousnesse fode feldes poore shalbe increased measure eccli 30 psal 23 b hebr 12 b psal 33 b spareth rodde hateth sonne loueth holdeth euer nurtoure rightuous eateth satisfied ye bely vngodly hath neuer ynough xiiii chapter wyse womā vpholdeth hir house foolish wife plucketh downe feareth lorde walketh right path regardeth abhorreth wayes lorde mouth foolish boostinge lordshipe ye lippes ye wyse wilbe warre soch ox crybb emptie ox laboure moch frute faithfull wytnesse wyl dyssemble false recorde wil make lye scornefull body seketh wyszdome fyndeth knowlege easy come vnto wil vnderstonde se yt thou medle foole pro 8 though thou haddest knowlege wyszdome hath vnderstondinge take hede vnto waye foolishnesse vnwyse disceaueth fooles make sporte synne fauourable loue amō ge rightuous herte hath vnderstondinge wil nether dispare eny sorow ner presumptuous eny sodane ioye house vngodly shalbe ouerthrowne tabernacle ye righteus shal florishe deu 12 pro 16 c waye men thinke right ende therof ledeth vnto death herte soroufull euen laughter ende myrth heuynesse vnfaithfull personne shal fylled owne wayes good mā wyl bewarre soch ignoraūt body beleueth thinges hath vnderstondinge loketh well goinges wyse man feareth departeth euell foole goeth presumptuously vnpacient man handeleth foolishly well aduysed doth wayes ignoraūt haue foolishnes possessiō wyse crowned knowlege euell shal bowe selues ye good vngodly shal wayte •• re rightuous poore hatch euen owne neghbours riche hath many frendes despyseth neghbor doth amysse blessed hath pyte poore ymagin wickednes shalbe disapoynted muse vpō good thinges vnto soch shal happen mercy faithfulnesse diligēt labor bryngeth rich many vayne wordes truly scarcenesse rich ornament vnto wyse ignoraunce fooles foolishnesse faithfull wytnesse delyuereth • le lyar dysceaueth fear • lorde strōge holde vnto wyl sure defence feare lorde well life auoyde snare death increase prosperite comons kynges honoure decaye people confuciō prynce pacience token wiszdome wrath haistie displeasure token foolishnesse mery herte life body rancoure consumeth awaye bone doth poore man wrō ge blasphemeth maker hath pitie poore doth honoure vnto god vngodly afrayed euery parell rightuous hath good hope euē death wyszdome resteth herte hath vnderstondinge wyll teach vnlerned rightuousnes setteth vp people wyckednesse bryngeth folke destruccion discrete seruaunt pleasure vnto ye kynge one yt honest prouoketh vnto wrath xv chapter softe āswere putteth downe displeasure frowarde wordes prouoke vnto anger wyse tonge commendeth knowlege foolish mouth blabbeth nothinge foolishnesse eye lorde loke euery place vpon ye good badd wholsome tonge tre life abuseth hath broken mynde foole despyseth father correccion yt taketh hede whan reproued shal haue ye vnderstōdinge house rightuous greate rich increase vngodly mysordre wyse mouth poureth knowlege ye herte foolish doth lorde abhorreth ye sacrifice vngodly prayer rightuous acceptable vnto waye vngodly abhominaciō vn • ye lorde foloweth righteousnes loueth forsaketh ye • ight strete shalbe sore punyshed hateth correccion falleth death hell wt hir payne knowne vnto lorde moch hertes men scornefull body loueth one yt rebuketh nether wil come amonge ye wyse mery herte maketh chearfull countenaunce vnquyet mynde maketh heuy wyse herte wil seke knowlege ye mouth fooles medleth foolishnesse dayes poore miserable quyete herte cōtynuall feast better litle feare lorde greate treasure without sorowe better meace potage loue fat oxe wt euell angrie man stereth vp strife yt pacient stilleth discorde waye ye slouthfull full thornes ye strete rightuous well clensed wyse sonne maketh glad father vndiscrete body shameth mother foole reioyseth foolish thinges wyse man loketh well owne goinges vnaduysed thoughtes shal come naught men yt geue councell stedfastnesse ioyfull thinge man geue conuenient answere pleasaunt worde spoken due season waye life ledeth vnto heauē yt man shulde warre hell beneth lorde wyl breake downe ye house ye proude shal make fast ye border ye wyddowe lorde abhoreth ye ymaginacions ye wicked pure wordes pleasaunt vnto couetous man wr • tteth vp owne house hateth rewardes shal lyue rightuous mā museth mynde good ye mynde vngodly ymagineth maye harme lorde farre vngodly heareth ye prayer rightuous like ye clearnesse ye eye reioyseth ye herte doth good name fede ye bone eare yt harkeneth vnto wholsome warnynge enclyneth therto shall dwell amonge ye wyse refuseth • e refourmed despyseth owne soule submytteth correccion wyse xvi chapter feare ye lorde ye right scyē ce wyszdome lowlynes goeth honor man maye well pur • ose thinge harte ye answere ye tonge cōmeth ye lorde pro 21 psal 32 b mā thinketh way clene ye lorde yt fashioneth ye myndes psal 36 commytte thy workes vnto ye lorde loke thou deuysest shal prospere lorde doth thinges owne sake yee kepeth ye vngodly ye daye wrath lorde abhorreth presumptuous proude hertes maye nether strength ner power escape louynge mercy faithfulnesse synnes forgeuen feareth ye lorde eschueth euell man wayes please ye lorde maketh enemy frendes better haue litle thinge wt rightuousnes thē greate rente wrongeously gotten mā deuyseth waye herte pro 19 c ye lorde yt ordreth goinges ye prophecy ye lippes ye kynge mouth shal go wrōge iudgment true measure true balaūce ye lordes pro 11 20▪ b maketh weightes greate abhominaciō kynges wycked kynges seate shulde holden vp wt righteousnesse righteous lippes pleasaūt vnto kynges loue yt speaketh ye trueth kynges displeasure messaunger death wyse man wyl pacifie cherefull countenaūce ye kynge life louynge fauor euenynge dewe pro 8 haue wyszdome possession better golde get vnderstondynge worth syluer path ye righteous eschueth euell loketh well wayes kepeth owne soule presumptuousnes goeth destruccion proude stomake foloweth fall better humble mynde wt lowly deuyde ye spoyles wt ye proude yt handleth matter wysely opteyneth good blessed psal 2 b yt putteth trust ye lorde hath wyse vnderstondinge called councell yt speake fayre getteth rich vnderstondinge well life vnto yt hath ye chastenynge fooles foolishnesse herte wyse enfourmeth mouth amendeth ye doctryne lyppes fayre wordes hony combe refreshinge ye mynde health ye bone waye yt men thinke right pro 14 b deut 12 esa 55 b ende therof leadeth vnto death troublous soule disquyeteth hir selfe hir owne mouth hath brought therto vngodly personne stereth vp euell lippes whote burnynge fyre frowarde body causeth strife yt blabbe tonge maketh deuysion amonge prynces wicked mā begyleth neghbor ledeth ye waye yt good wyncketh wt eye ymagineth myschefe yt byteth lippes wyl harme leui 19 g age crowne worshipe yf founde waye righteousnes pacient man better one strōge rule selfe worth yt wynneth cite lotte cast lappe fall stōdeth lorde xvii chapter better drye morsell wt quyetnesse thē full house many fatt catell wt stryfe eccl • 10 discrete seruaūt shal haue rule sonnes yt haue wysdome shal haue like heretage wt brother sap 3 1 pet 1 b like syluer tried fyre golde fornace euen doth lorde proue hertes wicked body holdeth moch false lippes dyssemblynge persone geueth eare disceatfull tōge pro 14 iob 31 c pro 24 c laugheth ye poore scorne blasphemeth maker yt glad another man hurte shal vnpunyshed childers child worshipe vnto elder father honor child eloquent speach becōmeth foole dyssemblinge mouth also besemeth prynce liberalite precious stone vnto hath euer becōmeth prospereth couereth another man offence seketh loue yt discloseth faute setteth frendes variaunce one reprofe doth good yt hath vnderstōdinge c stripe vnto foole sedicious personne seketh myschefe • ut cruell messaunger shal sent agaynst better come agaynst bere robbed hir whelpes agaynst foole foolishnes • reg 24 c 26 b rewardeth euell good plage shal departe frō house2 reg 12 c yt soweth discorde strife like one yt dyggeth vp water broke open enemie like water yt breaketh rē • eth abrode lorde hateth well yt iustifieth ye vngodly yt condempneth innocēt helpeth geue foole money hōde hath mynde bye wyszdome frende waye loueth aduersite man shal knowe brother pro 6 11 b promiseth hande suertie another foole yt loueth strife delyteth synne setteth dore hye seketh fall hath frowarde herte opteyneth good yt hath ouērth •••• tonge shal fall myschefe 〈◊〉 body bryngeth himselfe sorowe ye father foole haue ioye •• herte maketh lusty age sorowfull ••• de dryeth vp ye bone vngodly taketh giftes bosome wraist waye •• iudgment wyszdome shyneth ye face yt hath vnderstondinge ye eye •• fooles wandre thorow lōdes 〈◊〉 discrete sonne grefe vnto father 〈◊〉 heuynesse vnto mother yt bare 〈◊〉 punysh ye innocent smyte ye prynces • geue true iudgmēt euell 〈◊〉 discrete yt tempereth wordes 〈◊〉 mā vnderstōdinge yt maketh mo •• sprete yee foole hol • deth tonge counted wyse 〈◊〉 vnderstōdinge shutteth lippes xviii chapter hath pleasure sowe dis •• de piketh quarell euery thing • ▪ foole hath delyte vnder •••• dinge thinges wherin 〈◊〉 herte reioyseth vngodlynes • also diszdayne foloweth sha • dishonor wordes mās 〈◊〉 like depe water well wyszdo • like full streame good 〈◊〉 regarde ye personne vngodly 〈◊〉 backe ye righteous iudgmēt fooles lip • pe euer brawlinge mouth pro • uoketh vnto batayll fooles mouth 〈◊〉 owne destruccion lippes ye 〈◊〉 owne soule wordes slaun • derer woūdes go thorow vnto ynmost partes body • slouthfull slacke labor ye brother yt waister name ye lord • stronge castell ye righteous flyeth vnt • shalbe saued ye rich mās good •• stronge holde yee taketh 〈◊〉 hye wall roūde aboute 〈◊〉 cōmeth destrucciō honor lowlyne • geueth sentēce matter 〈◊〉 heare foole worthy confou •• ded good stomacke dryueth awaye 〈◊〉 disease whā ye sprete vexed may • abyde wyse herte laboureth know • lege prudent eare seketh vnderstondi •• ge liberalite bryngeth man honor worshipe setteth amonge greate 〈◊〉 ▪ righteous accuseth hī self first yf neghbor come shal fynde th • lot pacifieth ye variaūce parteth ye might • asunder vnite brother stronge • castell holde together like barre palace man bely shalbe satisfied frute owne mouth increase lippes shal fylled death life stonde power tonge loueth shal enioye frute therof 〈…〉 fyndeth wife fyndeth good thynge receaueth wholsome benefite lorde poore maketh supplicacion prayeth mekely riche geueth rough answere frende delyteth loue doth man frēdshipe sticketh faster vnto brother xix chapter better poore lyueth godly thē blasphemer foole 〈…〉 discrecion soule well swifte fote stombleth hastely foolishnesse maketh man go waye herte vnpacient agaynst lorde rich make many frendes poore forsakē owne frendes 〈…〉 false wytnesse shal remayne vnpunyshed speaketh lye shal escape multitude hāgeth vpō greate men euery man fauoureth geueth rewardes poore hated amonge brother yee owne frendes forsake geueth credēce vnto wordes getteth nothinge wyse loueth owne soule hath vnderstondinge shal prospere false wytnesse shal remayne vnpunyshed yt speaketh lye shal perishe delicate ease becōmeth foole moch vnsemely bonde man haue ye rule prynces wyse man putteth displeasure honor let fautes passe 〈…〉 kynges disfauor like ye roaringe lyō frēdshpe like dewe vpō ye grasse 〈…〉 vndiscrete sonne ye heuynes father braulynge wife like topp house thorow euer droppynge house rich maye mā haue ye heretage elder 〈…〉 discrete womā gifte lorde slouthfulnes bryngeth slepe ydell soule shal suffer hō ger kepeth cōmaundemēt kepeth owne soule yt regardeth waye shal dye yt hath pitie vpon poore lēdeth vnto ye lorde loke layeth shalbe payed agayne chastē ye sonne whyle hope let ye soule moued slaye hī greate wrath bryngeth harme therfore let go mayest thou teach nurtoure geue eare vnto good councell content refourmed thou mayest bewyse many deuices mās herte pro 16 b neuertheles coūcell ye lorde shal stō de man worshipe good better poore mā dyssembler feare lorde preserueth life yee geueth plēteousnes without visitaciō plage pro 26 • slouthfull body shuteth honde bosome yt put mouth yf thou smytest scorneful personne pro 21 b ignoraūt shal take better hede yf thou reprouest one yt hath vnderstondinge wil ye wyser yt hurteth father shuteth mother shamefull vnworthy sonne· sonne heare nomore doctrine yt leadeth awaye wordes vnderstondinge false wytnes laugheth iudgmēt scorne mouth vngodly eateth vp wickednes punyshmentes ordened scornefull stripe fooles backes xx chapter wyne voluptuous thinge drōckennes causeth sedicion ephe 5 • 3 esd 3 • delyte • h therin shal neuer wyse kynge ought feared roaringe lyon pro 24 • prouoketh vnto anger offendeth agaynst owne soule man honoure kepe strife yt haue pleasure braulinge fooles eueryone slouthfull body wyl go plowe colde therfore shal go abegginge sommer haue nothinge wyse councell herte man like water depe earth hath vnderstondinge bryngeth forth many called good doer shal one fynde true faithful mā ledeth godly innocent life happie shal child psal 36 leaueth behynde kynge sytteth iudgment loketh well aboute dryueth awaye euell saye hert cleane1 ioh 1 b innocent synne vse two maner weightes two maner measure abhominable vnto lorde childe knowne conuersacion whether workes pure right hearinge eare sight ye eye ye lorde hath made thē delyte thou slepe lest thou come vnto pouerte opē thine eye thou shalt haue bred ynough naught naught saye men whan haue whan gone geue good worde mouth vnderstōdinge worth golde many precious stone costly iewels 〈◊〉 6 〈◊〉 27 b take garment suertie straunger take pledge ye vnknowne man sake euery mā liketh bred gotten disceate last mouth shalbe fylled grauell thorow councell thinges men deuyse go forwarde discrecion ought warres taken honde medle bewrayeth secretes slaunderer disceaueth lippes curseth father mother 〈◊〉 20 b 〈◊〉 20 b 〈◊〉 21 b • eu 27 c 15 〈◊〉 5 e 〈◊〉 12 c light shalbe put myddest darcknesse heretage commeth haistely first shal praysed ende saye thou recompence euell put ye trust lorde shal defende ye 〈◊〉 20 b lorde abhorreth two maner weightes false balaūce euell thinge 〈◊〉 10 lorde ordreth euery mās goinges vnderstondeth owne wayes snare man blaspheme holy go aboute wt vowes reg 15 wyse kynge destroyeth ye vngodly bryngeth whele • uer lanterne ye lorde ye breth man goeth thorow inwarde partes body 〈◊〉 29 b mercy faithfulnes preserue kynge louynge kyndnes feate holden vp strength yonge men worshipe gray heade honor vnto ye aged woundes dryue awaye euell stripe inwarde partes body xxi chapter kynges hert hande lorde • reg 1 c like ryuers water maye turne whyther euer wyll euery man thinketh owne waye right lorde iudgeth ye hertes mich 6 b rightuousnesse iudgmēt acceptable lorde thē sacrifice presumptuous loke proude stomacke lanterne vngodly synne deuyses one diligent brynge plenteousnes yt vnaduysed commeth vn pouerte hoordeth vp rich wt ye disceatfulnes tonge foole like vnto seke owne death robbery vngodly shalbe owne destruccion wolde thynge right wayes frowarde straunge • 1 c 〈◊〉 25 ye workes yt cleane right better dwell corner vnder ye house toppe braulinge woman wyde house soule vngodly wysheth euell hath pitie vpon neghboure scornefull punyshed ignoraunt take ye better hede wyse man warned wil receaue vnderstondinge rightuous enfourmeth house vngodly ye vngodly go still owne wickednesse stoppeth eare criēge poore shal crie herde 〈…〉 preuy rewarde pacifieth displeasure gifte bosome stilleth furiousnesse iust delyteth doynge thynge right worker wickednesse abhorre man wandreth cut waye wyszdome shal remayne cōgregacion ye deed yt hath pleasure banckettes shal poore man 〈…〉 delyteth wyne delicates shal riche vngodly shalbe geuen rightuous wicked iust better dwell wyldernesse 〈…〉 thē chydinge angrie woman wyse man house greate treasure plenteousnesse foolish body spendeth vp foloweth rightuousnesse mercy fyndeth life rightuousnesse honor wyse man wynneth cite mightie strength yt trust bryngeth downe kepeth mouth tonge 〈…〉 kepeth soule trouble yt proude presumptuous called scornefull mā wrath darre worke maliciously voluptuousnesse slouthfull owne death hādes wyll labor coueteth desyreth daye longe rightuous allwaye geuynge kepeth nothinge backe 〈…〉 sacrifice vngodly abhominacion offre thinge yt gotten wt wickednes 〈…〉 false wytnesse shal perishe yt wilbe content heare shal allwaye haue power speake vngodly man goeth forth rashly iust refourmeth owne waye wyszdome 〈…〉 vnderstondinge councell agaynst lorde horse prepared agaynst ye daye battayll lorde geueth victory xxii chapter good name worth greate rich 〈…〉 louynge fauor better syluer golde whether rich pouerte mete v commeth god wyse man seyth plage hydeth foolish go still punyshed ende lowlynes feare god rich honor prosperite health speares snare ye waye frowarde yt wil kepe soule let fle frō soch yf thou reachest childe youth waye shulde go shall leaue olde rich ruleth poore ye borower seruaunt ye lender yt soweth wickednesse shal reape sorowe rodde plage shal destroye 〈…〉 louynge eye shalbe blessed geueth bred vnto ye poore cast ye scornefull man shal strife go wt yee variaunce slaunder shal cease delyteth clene herte gracious lyppes ye kynge shal frende eye ye lorde preserue knowlege ye wordes ye despyteful bryngeth naught slouthfull body sayeth lyō wt might slayue ye strete mouth harlot depe pytt 〈…〉 wherin falleth ye lorde angrie withall foolishnes sticketh herte ye lad ye rod correccion driueth awaye doth poore man wronge increase owne rich geueth comōly vnto rich last commeth pouerte sonne bowe downe thine eare herken vnto wordes wyszdome applye ye mynde vnto doctryne pleasaunt thinge yf thou kepe thine herte practise thy mouth thou mayest allwaye put ye trust lorde haue warned ye oft councell lerninge yt might shewe ye treuth thou wt verite mightest answere yt laye eny thinge ye se yt thou robbe ye poore weake oppresse ye simple iudgment ye lorde wyl defende cause violence vnto yt haue vsed violence make frēdshipe angrie wylfull man kepe company wt ye furious lest thou lerne wayes receaue hurte vnto thy soule 〈…〉 thou one yt bynde • r hande vpō promyse suertie dett yf thou hast nothinge paye shal take awaye thy bed vnder thou shalt remoue lande marcke 〈…〉 thy fore elder haue sett seist thou yt diligent busines stonde kynges amonge symple people xxiii chapter thou syttest table eate wt lorde ordre thy self manerly wt ye thinges set ye measure thine appetite yf thou wilt rule thine owne self ouer gredy meate meate begyleth disceaueth take ouer greate trauayle labor riche bewarre soch purpose eccl 27 iere 17 b 1 tim 6 • wilt thou set thine eye vpon ye thinge sodenly vanisheth awaye rich make selues wynges take flight like aegle ye ayre eate thou wt ye envyous desyre meate hath maruelous herte sayeth vnto ye eate drynke herte wt ye yee ye morsel thou hast eaten shalt thou perbreake lese swete wordes tel nothinge ye eares foole wyl despyse wyszdome thy wordes remoue ye olde lande marke pro 22 come within ye felde fatherlesse yt deliuereth mightie euen shal defende cause agaynst applie thine herte vnto lernynge thine eare wordes knowlege pro 13 c • ccl • 30 witholde correccion ye childe yf thou beatest wt rodde shal dye therof thou smytest wt rodde thou delyuerest soule hell sonne yf ye herte receaue wyszdome herte also shal reioyce yee myreynes shal glad yf ye lyppes speake thinge yt right pro 24 • c let thine herte gelous folowe synners kepe ye still feare lorde daye lōge ende yet come thy pacient abydinge shal vayne sonne ne eare wyse shal thine hert prospere waye kepe company wt wyne bebbers ryotous eater flesh soch dronckardes ryotous pro 22 c shal come pouerte geuen moch slepe shal go wt ragged cote geue eare vnto thy father begat despyse thy mother whan olde labor get ye treuth sell awaye wyszdome nourt vnderstōdinge righteous father maruelous glad wyse sonne delyteth hī shal thy father glad thy mother bare shal reioyse sonne geue thyne herte let thine eye haue pleasure wayes whore depe graue pro 22 b harlot narow pytt lurketh like thefe awarre brīgeth vnto wo sorow strife braulynge woundes without cause reed eye euen amonge euer wyne seke best loke thou vpon wyne reed color geueth glasse goeth downe softly last byteth like serpēt styngeth adder shal thine eye loke vnto straunge woman thine herte shal muse vpon frowarde thinges yee thou shalt though thou slepte ye myddest ye see vpō ye toppe mast wounded shalt thou saie hath hurte smote felt whē wel wakened wil go ye drynke agayne xxiiii chapter thou gelous ouer wicked mē desyre thou amonge pro 23 b • 4 c herte ymagineth hurte lippes talke myschefe thorow wyszdome house shalbe buylded wt vnderstondinge shalbe set vp thorow discrecion shal ye chābers fylled wt costly pleasaunt riches▪ wyse mā strōge yee mā vnderstōdinge better thē yt mightie strēgth discrecion must warres takē honde many yt geue councell ye victory wyszdome hie thinge yee euē ye foole darre opē mouth ye gate yt ymagineth myschefe maye wel called vngracious personne thoughte ye foolish synne ye scornefull abhominacion vnto mē yf thou ouersene necligēt tyme nede thē thy strēgth small delyuer thē yt go vnto death led awaie slaine necligēt therin yf thou wilt saye knewe thynkest thou yt made ye hertes doth cōsidre yt regardeth ye soule seith shal recōpence euery man acordinge workes sonne thou eatest hony ye swete hony cōbe good swete thy mouth euen shall ye knowlege wysdome vnto ye soule soone thou hast gottē good hope yee ye hope shal vayne laye preuy waite wickedly vpon ye house ye rightuous disquiete restinge place psal 33 c 3 • iust mā falleth seuen tymes ryseth vp agayne ye vngodly fall wickednes reioyce thou ye fall thine enemie pro 17 let thine herte glad whan stombleth lest ye lorde seyth angrie turne wrath vnto pro 23 b 24 let ye wrath gelousy moue ye foolow ye wicked vngodly ye wicked hath nothinge hope iob 21 b pro 13 pro 20 ye cādle vngodly shall put sonne feare thou ye lrode ye kinge kepe cōpany wt ye slaunderous destruccion shal come sodenly knoweth ye fall thē also ye saiēges ye wyse good 〈…〉 haue respecte personne iudgmēt yt saieth ye vngodly thou art rightuous shall people curse yee ye comōtie shal abhorre yt rebuke ye vngodly shalbe cōmended riche blessinge shal come vpō thē maketh self well loued geueth good answere first make vp ye worke yt wt loke well vnto yt thou hast ye felde thē buylde thine house false wytnesse agaynst ye neghbor hurte wt ye lyppes saye 〈…〉 wil hādle euē hath dealte wt wil rewarde euery mā acordinge dedes wente ye felde ye slouthfull ye vynyarde foolish mā lo couered wt nettels stode full thistle ye stone wall brokē downe sawe cōsidered wel loked vpō toke warnynge yee slepe still litle 〈…〉 slōbre litle folde thine hōdes together yet litle shall pouerte come vnto one yt trauayleth ye waye necessite like wapened man xxv chapter also salomon prouerbe • men ezechias kinge iuda gathered together honor god kepe thinge secrete 〈…〉 ye kinges honor search thinge heauen hie ye earth depe ye kinges hert vnsearcheable take ye drosse ye syluer shalbe cleane vessell therof take awaye vngodlinesse frō ye kynge seate shal stablished wt rightuousnes put forth yt self ye presence ye kynge prease ye place greate men better yt sayde vnto ye 〈…〉 come vp hither thou set downe ye presence ye prynce thou seyst thine eye haistie go lawe lest happlie thou ordre yi self ye last yt thy neghbor put ye shame handle thy matter wt yi neghbor discouer another man secrete lest whan men heare therof turne ye dishonor lest thine euell name ceasse worde spoken due season like apple golde syluer dyshe correccion wyse obedient eare golden cheyne iewel golde like wynter coole haruest faithfull messaunger sent refreszsheth master mynde maketh greate boastes geueth nothinge like cloudes wynde without rayne pacience maye prynce pacified wt soft tonge maye rigorousnes brokē yf thou findest hony eate moch sufficiēt ye lest thou ouer full per breake againe withdrawe ye foote frō thy neghbours house lest weery abhorre beareth false wytnesse agaynst neghboure speare swearde sharpe arowe hope vngodly tyme nede like rotten toth slippery foote syngeth songe wicked herte clotheth hī ragges colde poureth vyneger vpon chalke yf thine enemie honger fede 〈…〉 yf thyrst geue drynke shalt thou heape coales fyre vpō heade lorde shal rewarde north wynde dryueth awaye rayne euen doth earnest sober countenaūce back byters tonge better syt corner vnder rofe 〈…〉 wt braulynge woman wyde house good reporte farre countre like colde water thyrstie soule righteous man fallynge downe vngodly like troubled well sprynge yt destroyed like good eate moch hony 〈…〉 euen wyll search hye thynges shal heuy rule like cite broken downe hath walles xxvi chapter like snowe mete sommer ner rayne haruest euen worshipe vnsemely foole like ye byrde swalowe take flight fle curse geuen vayne shal light vpon man vnto horse belongeth whyppe 〈…〉 asse brydle rodde fooles backe geue foole answere foolishnesse lest thou become like vnto make ye foole answere foolishnesse lest wyse owne cōceate lame fete yee droncken vanite cōmitteth eny thinge foole like vnsemely thīge haue legges yet halte euē parable ye fooles mouth yt setteth foole hye dignite yt euē yf man dyd cast precious stone vpō ye galous parable fooles mouth like thorne yt pricketh droncken man ye hande man experience discerneth thinges well hyreth foole hyreth soch one wyl take hede like dogg turneth agayne vomite 〈…〉 euen foole begynneth foolishnesse agayne fresh yf thou seyest man yt wyse owne conceate hope foole hī 〈…〉 slouthfull sayeth leoparde ye waye lyon ye myddest stretes like dore turneth aboute vpon tresholde euen doth slouthfull • ter bedd slouthfull body thrusteth hōde bosome pro 19 greueth put agayne mouth slogarde thinketh self wyser vij men sytt teach goeth medleth men strife like one yt taketh dogg ye eares like one shuteth deadly arowes dartes preuy place psal 10 euen doth dyssembler neghboure sayeth dyd sporte wodd fyre goeth eccli 28 bacbyter taken awaye strife ceaseth cole kyndle heate wodd ye fyre euen doth braulinge felowe stere vp variaunce· slaunderers wordes like flatery pearse ye inwarde partes ye body venymous lippes wicked herte like potsherde couered wt syluer drosse enemie dyssembleth lippes meane season ymagineth myschefe whā speaketh fayre beleue seuen abhominaciōs herte kepeth euell secretly hurte malyce shalbe shewed whole congregacion eccl • 10 eccli 27 dyggeth vp pytt shal fal therin yt weltreth stone shal stomble vpon hymselfe dyssemblynge tonge hateth one rebuketh flaterīge mouth worketh myschefe xxvii chapter take thy boost tomorow thou knowest maye happen todaye eze 28 luc 12 b iaco 4 let another mā praysethe thine owne mouth yee folkes lippes thyne eccli 22 stone heuy sonde weightie fooles wrath heuyer wrath cruell thīge furiousnesse tempest yee able abyde envye open rebuke better secrete loue psa 14 • luc 22 faithfull woundes louer ye ky enemie disceatfull full abhorreth hony combe vnto hōgrie euery sower thinge swete oft tymes flytteth like byrde yt forsaketh hir nest herte glad swete oyntment sauoure stomacke cā geue good councell reioyseth man neghboure thyne owne frende thy father frende se thou forsake go thy brother house tyme thy trouble better frende hōde brother farre sonne wyse thou shalt make glad herte shal make answere vnto rebuker wyse man seynge plage wyl hyde self fooles go still pro 10 c suffer harme take garment suertie straunger take pledge vnknowne man sake hastie praise neghboure aboue measure shalbe taken one yt geueth euell reporte pro 19 b brawlynge woman rofe house droppynge raynie daye maye well compared together refrayneth refrayneth wynde holdeth oyle fast hōde like one yrō whetteth another doth one man comforte another kepeth fyge tre shal enioye frutes therof wayteth vpon master shal come honoure like one water apeare dyuerse face euē dyuerse men haue dyuerse hertes pro •• ▪ • eccls 1 • cclī 14 • ccī 27 b like hell destruccion neuer full euen eye mē neuer satisfied syluer tryed moulde golde fornace man whan openly praysed face though thou shuldest bray foole wt pestell morter like otemeell yet wil foolishnesse go se yt thou knowe nombre thy catell thy self ioh 10 loke well thy flockes rich abyde allwaye crowne endureth euer hay groweth ye grasse cōmeth vp herbes gathered ye mountaines lambes shal clothe goates thou shalt haue money ye huszbondry thou shalt haue goates mylck ynough fede vpholde thy husholde susteyne thy maydens xxviii chapter vngodly flyeth man chasynge • eui 26 c rightuous stondeth stiff lyon synne ye londe doth oft chaunge hir prynce thorow men vnderstondinge wyszdome realme endureth longe one poore man oppressinge another violence like contynuall rayne destroyeth ye frute forsake lawe prayse ye vngodly soch kepe lawe abhorre wicked men discerne thinge yt right cor 2 b seke lorde discusse thinges pro 19 poore man ledynge godly life better riche goeth frowarde wayes kepeth lawe childe vnderstondinge yt fedeth ryotous men shameth father increaseth rich vaūtage wynnynge let gather helpe poore withall 〈…〉 turneth awaye eare hearinge ye lawe prayer shalbe abhorred ledeth ye rightuous euell waye shal fall owne pytt ye iust shal haue good possession rich man thynketh self wyse poore hath vnderstondinge cā perceaue wel ynough 〈…〉 rightuous men prosperite thē doth honoure florish vngodly come vp ye state men chaungeth hydeth synnes shall prospere knowlegeth forsaketh shall haue mercy well stōdeth waye awe hardeneth herte shal fall mischefe like roaringe lyon hongrie beer euen vngodly prynce ouer poore people prynce without vnderstondinge greate oppression wronge yf soch one hateth couetousnesse shal longe raigne 〈…〉 violēce sheddeth eny man bloude shal rennagate vnto graue man shal able sucor 〈…〉 leadeth godly innocēt life shalbe safe goeth frowarde wayes shall haue fall yt tylleth londe 〈…〉 shal haue plenteousnesse bred foloweth ydilnesse shal haue pouerte ynough faithfull man greatly commēded maketh moch haist riche 〈…〉 shal vngiltie haue respecte personnes iudgment good wronge yee euen pece bred rich soone hath euell eye considereth pouerte shall come vpon rebuketh man shall fynde fauoure ye last thē flatreth robbeth father mother 〈…〉 sayeth synne like vnto mortherer proude stomacke stereth vp strife putteth trust ye lorde shalbe well fedd trusteth owne hert foole 〈…〉 dealeth wisely shalbe safe geueth vnto poore shal wante turneth awaye eye soch necessite shall suffre greate pouerte whan vngodly come vp 〈…〉 men fayne hyde selues whē perish rightuous increase xxix chapter stiffnecked wyll refourmed shal sodenly destroyed wt eny helpe ye rightuous haue ouer hande 〈…〉 ye people prosperite vngodly beareth rule ye people mourne loueth wyszdome 〈…〉 maketh father glad man yt kepeth harlottes spēdeth awaye yt hath true iudgment ye kynge setteth vp londe yf man yt taketh giftes turneth vpsyde downe flatreth neghbor layeth nette fete synne ye wicked owne snare ye righteous shal glad reioyse righteous considreth cause poore vngodly regardeth vnderstondynge wicked people brynge cite decaye wyse men set vp agayne yf wyse man go lawe foole whether deale frendly roughly getteth rest bloudethyrstie hate rightuous iust seke soule foole poureth sprete alltogether wyse man kepeth till afterwarde yf prynce delyte lye seruauntes vngodly poore lender mete together lorde lighteneth eye seate kinge yt faithfully iudgeth poore 〈…〉 shal continue sure euermore rodde correccion mynistre wyszdome yf childe loked vnto bryngeth mother shame vngodly come vp wickednesse increaseth rightuous shall se fall nurtoure thy sonne correccion shal comforte yee shal good thine hert prophet people perishe well kepeth lawe seruaūt wil better wordes though vnderstonde yet wil regarde yf thou seyst man haistie speake vnaduysed thou mayest trust foole delicately bryngeth vp seruaunt childe shal make master length angrie man stereth vp strife beareth euell wyll mynde doth moch euell pryde commeth fall 〈…〉 lowly sprete bryngeth greate worshipe kepeth company wt thefe hateth owne soule heareth blasphemy telleth forth feareth men shal haue fall putteth trust lorde shal come honor many seke ye prynces fauoure euery man iudgment commeth lorde rightuous abhorre vngodly ye right waye ye wicked hate xxx chapter wordes agur sonne iake prophecie true faithfull man whō god hath helped god hath cōforted norished though ye leest haue mās vnderstō dīge neuer lerned wiszdome yet haue vnderstōdinge wel enfourmed godly thinges hath clymmed vp ī heauen hath come downe thence hath holden ye wynde fast hā de hath cōprehended ye water garment hath set endes ye worlde name sonnes name canst thou tell psal 17 c 1 • b 118 • wordes god pure cleane shylde vnto put trust 〈…〉 put thou nothinge therfore vnto wordes lest reproue thou founde lyar two thinges requyre thou wilt denye dye remoue fro vanite lye geue nether pouerte ner rich graunte necessary lyuynge lest yf full denye ye saye deut 8 c 31 e exo 5 iob 21· b ecclī 27 • felowe ye lorde lest beinge constrayned thorow pouerte fall vnto stealinge forsweare name god accuse seruaunt vnto master lest speake euell also thou hurte bryngeth vp euell reporte vpō generacion father mother worthy commended generacion thynke selues cleane shal clensed fylthynesse people yt haue proude loke cast vp eye lyddes people tethe swerdes chaft bone consume deuoure symple earth poore amonge mē generacion like horsleche hath two doughters ye one called fetch hither brynge hither thre thinges neuer satisfied fourth saieth neuer hoo hell woman wombe pro· 27 c earth hath neuer water ynough fyre sayeth neuer hoo laugheth father scorne exo 21 b deu ▪ 27 setteth mother commaū dement naught rauens pycke eye valley deuoured yongle aegles thre thinges hye sap 5 b fourth passeth knowlege waye aegle ye ayre ye waye serpent ouer ye stone ye waye shippe ye see ye waye mā wt yonge womā soch waye also wyfe yt breaketh wedlocke wypeth hir mouth like whā hath eatē sayeth haue done harme thorow thre thinges earth disquieted fourth maye beare thorow seruaūt yt beareth rule thorow foole yt hath greate rich thorow ydle houswife thorow handmayden yt heyre hir mastres foure thinges earth litle wyszdome exceade wyse emmettes weake people • ro 6 yet gather meate together ye haruest conyes feble folke yet make couch amonge rockes greshoppers haue gyde yet go forth together heapes spyder laboureth wt hir hādes yt ye kynges palace thre thinges yt go stiftly goinge fourth goodliest lyon kynge beastes geueth place man cock ready fight rā kynge yt goeth forth wt people yf thou foolish magnifie ye self medlest wt eny soch thinge thē laye thine hā de vpon ye mouth chyrneth mylck maketh butter rubbeth nose maketh blede causeth wrath bryngeth forth strife xxxi chapter wordes kynge lamuel ye lesson yt mother taught sonne thou sonne body deare beloued sonne geue ouer thy substaunce mynde vnto woman destrucciō euē kynges lamuel geue kinges wyne geue kynges prynces stronge drynke lest beinge dronken forget lawe regarde ye cause poore soch aduersite geue stronge drynke vnto soch condempned death wyne vnto yt mourne maye drynke forget misery aduersite thou aduocate stonde iudgment thyself speake soch dōme sucourles ye mouth defende ye thinge yt laufull right ye cause ye poore helplesse fyndeth honest faithful womā moch worth thē perles herte hir husbande maye safely trust shal haue nede spoyles wil good euel ye dayes hir life occupieth woll flax laboureth gladly wt hir handes likē marchauntes shippe bryngeth hir vytayles farre vp ye night season prouyde meate hir housholde foode hir maydens considreth lō de byeth wt frute hir handes planteth vynyarde gyrdeth hir loynes strength courageth hir armes yf perceaue hir houswifrie doth good hir candle goeth night layeth hir fyngers spyndle hir hande taketh holde ye rocke openeth hir hande ye poore yee stretcheth forth hir hādes soch haue nede feareth yt colde wynter shal hurte hir house hir housholde folkes duble clothed maketh hir self fayre ornamētes hir clothīge whyte sylke purple hir huszbāde moch set ye gate whē sytteth amonge ye ruler ye londe maketh cloth sylke selleth delyuereth gyrdle vnto ye marchaūt strēgth honoure hir clothinge latter daye shal reioyse openeth hir mouth wyszdome hir tō ge lawe grace loketh wel wayes hir housholde eateth hir bred ydilnes hir child arise call hir blessed hir huszbande maketh moch many daughter yt gather rich together thou goest aboue thē fauor disceatfull beutie vayne thinge woman feareth lorde worthy praysed geue frute hir handes let hir owne workes prayse gate ende prouerbes salomon ecclesiastes boke conteyneth chap thinges yf mā wyl cōsidre wel vanite neuertheles amō ge nothīge weaker vnstedfast man self chap ii chapter also maketh oft tymes mēsion wordes cōuersaciō vngodly meanes maye better cause men despyse creature respecte euerlastinge god chap iii euery thinge hath tyme thīge god hath put tedyousnesse trauayle exercise men withall euer man enioyeth laboure gift god geuen intent men shulde feare chap iiii cōsideracion diuerse thinges nothinge excellent hye yf deuty office vnto ordened shalbe brought lowe chap v agaynst foolish temerarious vowes let man maruayle moch euell done wicked many agaynst riche agaynst rich chap vi agaynst riche mē dar • e enioye rich mad foolish chap vii man knoweth come worthy thīge haue good name profit wyszdome chap viii obediēce men owe vnto god heades lōge sufferaunce god despised possible eny mā cōprehende workes worlde chap ix like thinges happen vnto men therfore myrth thankfulnesse shulde men enioye giftes god wyszdome passeth thinges chap xxi two chapter many wyse profitable sentence wel worthy considered euery man chap xii chapter preacher sheweth whole meanynge though wolde saye thinges vnder sonne wher haue spoken haue cō sidered proued metely wel experience conclucion nothynge stedfast durable god whō men ought feare haue cōmaundementes eye euen youth vp first chapter wordes preacher sonne dauid kynge ierusalem vanite saieth ye preacher playne vanite eccl • 12 b el hath mā labor yt taketh vnder sonne one generaciō passeth awaye another commeth earth bydeth still sōne aryseth sonne goeth downe returneth place yt maye ryse vp agayne wynde goeth towarde ye south fetcheth cōpase aboute vnto north turneth agayne floudes runne see iob 14 b yet see fylled loke vnto place •• ters runne thence come agayne thinges harde yt mā expresse eye satisfied wt sight pro 27 c ecclī 14 eccls 3 • eare fylled wt hearinge thinge yt hath bene cōmeth passe agayne ye thinge yt hath bene done done agayne new thinge vnder sonne eny thinge wherof maye sayde new lōge agoo tymes yt haue bene v thinge yt past remēbraunce euē thīges come shal thought vpō amōge thē come ye preacher beynge kynge israel ierusalē applyed mynde seke search knowlege thīges yt done vnder heauē soch trauayle labor hath god geuē vnto ye childrē mē exercyse thē selues therī thus haue considered thinges come passe vnder sōne lo vanite vexacion mynde croked mayde straight fautes cā nōbred cōmoned wt myne owne herte sayēge lo • pet 3 b 4 c come greate estate haue gottē wyszdome thē yt haue bene ierusalem yee hert greate experiēce wyszdome knowlege vnto applyed mynde yt might knowe wyszdome vnderstōdinge error foolishnes perceaued yt also vexacion mynde moch wyszdome also greate trauayle disquietnes ye knowlege man hath care ii chapter thē sayde thus hert go wil take myne ease haue good dayes lo vanite also moch sayde vnto laughter thou art madd myrth doest thou thought herte withdrawe flesh wyne applye mynde vnto wyszdome comprehēde foolishnes vntill tyme amonge ye thinges vnder ye sonne might se best men longe lyue vnder heauen • eg 34 67i made gorgious fayre workes buylded house planted vynyardes made ortchardes garden pleasure planted tree maner frutes made pole water water ye grene frutefull tree withall • eg 49 bought seruauntes maydēs greate housholde catell shepe substaunce yt ierusalem gathered syluer golde together euen treasure kynges londes prouided syngers womē coude playe instrumentes make men myrth pastime gat drynkynge cuppes also glass shortly greater worshipe predecessours ierusalē wyszdome remayned loke euer myne eye desyred let haue wherin euer herte delyted eny pleasure helde frō thus hert reioysed yt dyd toke porcion trauayle whan considered workes yt handes wrought labour taken therin lo vanite vexacion mynde nothinge eny value vnder ye sonne turned considre wyszdome erroure foolishnesse amonge men might compared ye kynge soch workes sawe wyszdome excelleth foolishnesse farre light doth darknesse wyse man beareth eye aboute heade foole goeth darknesse perceaued also one ende thought mynde yf happen vnto foole doth vnto nedeth laboure eny wyszdome confessed within harte also vanite wyse euer litle remembraunce foolish dayes come shalbe forgotten yee wyse man dyeth aswell ye foole thus begāne weery life moch coude awaye nothinge done vnder sonne vanite vexacion mynde yee weery laboure taken vnder sonne shulde fayne leaue vnto another man cō meth knoweth whether shalbe wyse mā foole yet shal lorde labour soch wyszdome haue taken vnder sonne vayne thinge 〈…〉 turned refrayne mynde soch trauayle toke vnder sonne moch man shulde weery self wyszdome vnderstondinge opportunite yet fayne leaue labour vnto another yt neuer swett also vayne thinge greate misery getteth mā ye labor trauayle mynde yt taketh vnder sonne heuynesse sorowe disquyetnes ye dayes life moch herte rest night also vayne thinge better mā eate drynke soule mery laboure yee sawe also gifte god 〈…〉 maye eate drynke brynge eny thīge passe without geueth vnto mā pleaseth whether wyszdome▪ vnderstondinge gladnesse vnto synner geueth weerynes sorow maye gather heape together ye thinge yt afterwarde shalbe geuen vnto pleaseth god vayne thinge yee disquietnesse vexaciō mynde iii chapter every thinge hath tyme yee vnder heauen hath conuenient season tyme borne tyme dye 〈…〉 tyme plā te tyme plucke vp thinge yt planted tyme slaye tyme make whole tyme breake downe tyme buylde vp tyme wepe tyme laugh tyme mourne tyme daunse tyme cast awaye stone tyme gather stone together tyme enbrace tyme refrayne enbracynge tyme wynne tyme lese tyme spare tyme spende tyme cutt peces tyme sowe together tyme kepe sylēce tyme speake 〈…〉 tyme loue tyme hate tyme warre tyme peace hath mā el doth eny thinge weerynesse laboure touchinge trauayle carefulnesse god hath geuen vnto mē se hath geuen exercised hath ordened maruelous goodly euery thinge due tyme hath plāted ignoraunce also hertes men yt shulde fynde ye grounde workes doth ye beginninge ye ende perceaued yt thinges nothinge better man thē mery well longe lyueth yt man eateth drynketh yee euer mā enioyeth labor ye gift god cōsidered also yt euer god doth cōtinueth euer yt nothinge put vnto ner takē yt god doth ye intent yt men shulde feare 〈…〉 thinge yt hath bene thinge yt come hath bene afore tyme god restoreth agayne thinge past morouer sawe vnder ye sonne vngodlynesse steade iudgment iniquite steade rightuousnesse thought mynde god shal separate rightuous vngodly shal tyme iudgmēt councels workes cōmoned wt myne owne herte also cōcernynge childrē men god hath chosen yet letteth thē apeare though beastes happeneth vnto men doth vnto beastes one dyeth dyeth ye yee haue one maner breth yt man hath preemynence aboue beest subdued vnto vanite go vnto one place dust shal turne vnto dust againe 〈…〉 knoweth sprete man yt goeth vpwarde breth beest yt goeth downe earth wherfore perceaue yt nothyinge better man ioyfull laboure porcion wil brynge se thinge shal come iiii chapter turned considered violent wronge done vnder sonne 〈…〉 beholde teares soch oppressed man comforte wolde delyuer defende violence oppressours wherfore iudged deed happie soch alyue yee yet vnborne better ease thē seith miserable workes done vnder sonne agayne sawe trauayle diligence laboure hated euery man also vaine thinge vexacion mynde foole foldeth handes together eateth vp owne flesh one handfull saieth better wt rest thē ye handes full labor trauayle morouer turned beholde yet another vanite vnder sonne one man mo alone hauynge nether childe ner brother yet ende carefull trauayle eye satisfied rich yet doth remembre saye take soch trauayle whose pleasure thus consume awaye lyfe also vayne miserable thinge therfore two better one maye well enioye profit laboure yf one fall companyon helpeth vp againe wo alone yf fall hath another helpe vp agayne two slepe together warme body warme alone one maye ouercome two maye make resistaūce thre folde cable lightly broken poore childe beynge wyse better olde kinge doteth bewarre tyme come gen▪ 41 b 1 16 c 3 12 c 2 par 33 c 4 25 one commeth preson made kynge another borne kyngdome commeth vnto pouerte perceaued yt men lyuynge vnder sonne go wt seconde childe commeth vp steade people haue bene come innumerable yet ioye greater thorow also vayne thinge vexacion mynde whan thou commest house god kepe thy fote drawe nye thou mayest heare better offeringes fooles1 reg 15 c knowe euell v chapter hastie thy mouth let thine hert speake eny thīge rashly god god heauen thou vpon earth therfore let thy wordes fewe moch carefulnesse many dreames many wordes men maye heare fooles deu 23 baruc 6 • yf thou make vowe vnto god slacke perfourme foolish vowes hath pleasure yf thou promyse eny thinge paye better thou make vowe thou shuldest promise paye vse thy mouth cause ye flesh synne yt thou saye angell foolishnesse ye faute thē god wil angrie thy voyce destroye ye workes thine handes many dreames many wordes also dyuerse vanity eccl • 4 loke yt thou feare god yf thou seyst poore oppressed wrongeously dealt withall ye equite right lawe wraisted londe maruell thou soch iudgmēt one greate mā kepeth touch another mightie helpe thē selues together whole londe also feldes therin subieccion bondage vnto ye kinge loueth money wil neuer satisfied money delyteth rich shal haue profit therof also vayne thinge▪ many rich many also spende awaye pleasure hath possesseth sauynge maye loke vpon eye labouringe man slepeth swetely whether litle moch eateth iob 20 c abundaunce riche wil suffre slepe yet sore plage haue sene vnder sonne namely rich kepte hurte yt hath possession iob 1 c oft time perishe greate • sery trouble yf haue childe getteth nothinge like came naked mother wombe goeth thither agayne carieth nothinge awaye laboure miserable plage yt shal go awaye euen came helpeth yt hath labored wynde day life also must eate darcke greate carefulnesse sicknesse sorow eccls 2 therfore thinke better fayrer thinge man eate drynke refreshed laboure yt taketh vnder sonne dayes life god geueth porcion vnto euer god geueth rich goodes power geueth enioye take porcion refreshed laboure gifte god thinketh moch longe shal lyue moch god fylleth hert gladnesse vi chapter yet plage vnder ye sonne generall thinge amonge mē god geueth man rich goodes honoure wanteth nothinge herte desyre yet god geueth leue enioye another man spēdeth vayne thinge miserable plage yf man begett hundreth child lyue many yeares dayes many nombre yet enioye good nether buried saye vntymely byrth better cōmeth naught goeth waye darcknes name forgotten morouer seyth sonne knoweth rest nether ner yee though lyued two thousande yeares yet hath good life come one place laboure man taketh yet desyre neuer fylled mynde hath wyse foole helpeth poore knoweth walke lyuynge sight eye better soule shulde departe awaye howbeit also vayne thinge disquietnesse mynde excellent man yet lawe get victory mightier thē vayne thinge cast many wordes hath man el vii chapter knoweth good man lyuynge ye dayes vayne life shadowe or▪ wil tell man shal happen vnder sonne 〈…〉 good name worth precious oyntment daye death better thē ye daye byrth better go house mournynge bancket house ende men lyuinge taketh herte better sory laugh whē countenaunce heuy herte ioyfull herte ye wyse mournynge house hert foolish house myrth better geue eare chastenynge wyse man heare songe fooles laughinge fooles like ye crackynge thornes vnder pott yt vayne thinge doeth wronge maketh wyse man go witt destroyeth gentle hert ende thinge better begynnynge pacient sprete better hie mynded haistely angrie ye mynde wrath resteth bosome foole saye thou cause ye dayes ye olde tyme better yt now▪ wyse question wyszdome better rich yee moch worth eye sight wyszdome defendeth well moneye excellent knowlege wyszdome geueth life vnto hath possession considre worke god man make thinge straight maketh croked vse well tyme prosperite remembre tyme mysfortune god maketh one man fynde nothinge el ij thīges also haue cōsidred ye tyme vanite yt iust man perisheth rightuousnes sake vngodly liueth wickednesse therfore thou nether rightuous ner ouer wyse 〈◊〉 11 c yt thou perish nether vnrightuous also ner foolish lest thou die thy tyme good take holde let yt go thy hande yt feareth god shal escape 〈◊〉 20 c 〈◊〉 7 〈◊〉 6 f 〈◊〉 • 7 wyszdome geueth corage vnto wyse ten mightie men citie one iust vpō earth yt doth good sinneth take hede vnto euery worde yt spoken lest thou heare thy seruaunt curse thine owne hert knoweth thou thy self also hast oft tymes spokē euell men thinges haue proued wyszdome 〈◊〉 28 b thought wyse wente farther fro yee depe might reach vnto applied mynde also vnto knowlege seke sciēce wisdome vnderstondinge knowe foolishnesse vngodly erroure dotinge fooles 〈…〉 founde woman bytterer death angle hir hert nett hir handes cheynes pleaseth god shal escape synne • taken wt beholde sayeth ye preacher haue diligently searched proued yt might come knowlege yet seke fynde amonge thousande men haue founde one one woman amonge 〈…〉 lo onely haue founde god made man iust right seke dyuerse sotylties man hath wyszdome vnderstōdinge geue answere vnto viii chapter wyszdome maketh mās face shyne 〈…〉 malice putteth fauoure kepe kynges commaundemēt warne ooth yt thou hast made vnto god haistie go sight se thou cōtynue euell thinge euer pleaseth yt doeth like kynge geueth charge commaundement mightie euen maye saye vnto doest thou iob • leui • kepeth commaundement shall fele harme wyse man herte discerneth tyme maner euery thinge wil haue opportunite iudgment thinge maketh men full carefulnes sorowe man knoweth come wyll tell nether eny mā yt hath power ouer ye sprete kepe stil ye sprete ner haue eny power tyme death also make ende batayll nether maye vngodlynes delyuer yt medleth withall thinges haue considered applied mynde vnto euery worke vnder sonne one man hath lordshipe vpon another owne harme haue oft sene ye vngodly brought graues psal 3 • fallen downe hye glorious place moch yt forgotten cite hye greate reputacion also vayne thinge euell workes haistely punyshed hert man geueth self ouer vnto wickednesse though euell personne offende hundreth tymes haue longe life yet sure shal go well thē feare god haue eye agayne vngodly shall well nether shal prolōge dayes euen shadowe shall feareth god yet vanite vpon earth iust men vnto happeneth though workes vngodly agayne vngodly goeth though workes ye rightuous thinke also vaine thinge therfore commende gladnesse man hath better thinge vnder sonne eate drynke mery shal haue laboure day life god geueth vnder sonne applied mynde lerne wyszdome knowe trauayle worlde soch fashion yt suffred myne eye slepe nether daye ner night vnderstode ye workes god possible man attayne vnto ye workes done vnder ye sonne though bestowe laboure seke yet reach vnto thē yee though wyse man wolde vndertake knowe yet might fynde ix chapter thinges purposed mynde seke righteus wyse yee workes also hande god man knoweth ether loue hate thinge hath happeneth vnto one vnto another goeth rightuous vngodly 〈…〉 good cleane vncleane offereth offereth like goeth vertuous goeth also synner happeneth vnto periured happeneth also vnto afrayed man sworne amonge thinges yt come passe vnder sonne misery happeneth vnto alyke cause also hertes men full wickednesse madd foolishnesse hertes longe lyue vntill dye longe man lyueth careles quyck dogg saye better thē deed lion lyuynge knowe yt shall dye yt deed knowe nothinge nether deserue eny memoriall forgottē yt nether loued hated ner envyed nether haue eny parte ye worlde yt done vnder sonne go thou ye waye eate thy bred ioye drynke yt wyne wt gladnesse thy workes please god let thy garmētes allwaye whyte let ye heade want oyntmēt 〈◊〉 6 b vse thy self lyue ioyfully wt thy wife thou louest 〈◊〉 5 c ye day thy life vayne yt god hath geuē vnder sonne ye dayes thy vanite yt thy porcion life thy labor trauayle yt thou takest vnder sonne euer thou takest hande thy power amōge deed thou goest vnto nether worke councell knowlege ner wyszdome turned vnto thinges vnder ye sonne sawe runnynge helpeth swift batayll helpeth stronge fedynge helpeth wyse rich helpeth sutyll fauoure helpeth connynge lyeth tyme fortune • uc 21 man knoweth tyme like fyshe takē angle byrdes catched wt snare euē men taken perilous tyme commeth sodenly vpon wiszdome haue sene also vnder ye sōne thought greate thinge litle cite mē within came greate kynge beseged made greate bulworkes agaynst cite founde poore man wyse wt wyszdome delyuered cite yet body yt eny respecte vnto soch symple man sayde wyszdome better strength 〈…〉 neuertheles symple man wyszdome despysed wordes herde wise man councell folowed sylence farre aboue crienge captaine amōge fooles wyszdome better harnesse 〈…〉 one vnthrift alone destroyeth moch good x chapter deed flyes yt corruppe swete oyntment make styncke somthinge worth wyszdome honor foole wyse man hert vpon right hande fooles hert vpon left dotinge foole thinketh yt euery mā doth foolishly yf principall sprete geuē beare rule 〈…〉 negligēt thē thine office shal greate wickednesse put downe wt medecyne another plage haue sene vnder sonne namely ye ignoraunce yt comonly amonge prynces yt foole sytteth greate dignite rich sett downe beneth se seruauntes ryde vpon horse prynces goinge vpon fete seruauntes 〈…〉 yt dyggeth vp pytt shall fall therin breaketh downe hedge serpent shal byte remoueth stone shall haue trauayle withall heweth wod shalbe hurt therwith yron blont ye poynt sharpened must whett againe might euen doth wiszdome folowe diligence babler tonge better serpent styngeth without hyssynge wordes wyse man mouth gracious lippes foole wil destroye begynnynge talkynge foolishnes last worde mouth greate madnesse foole full wordes man tell ende wyll make wyl warne make conclucion laboure ye foolish greuous vnto thē knowe go cite wo vnto thou realme londe whose kynge childe whose prynces early banckettes well thou realme londe whose kinge come noble whose prynces eate due season strength lust thorow slouthfulnesse balkes fall downe thorow ydle hādes rayneth house meate maketh men laugh wyne maketh mery 〈…〉 vnto money thinges obedient wysh kynge euell ye thought speake hurte ye ryche thy preuy chambre byrde ayre shal betraye thy voyce wt hir fethers shal bewraye thy wordes xi chapter sende thy vytayles ouer water shalt thou fynde thē many yeares geue awaye amonge seuen eight thou knowest misery shal come vpō earth whē cloudes full poure rayne vpon earth whē ye tre falleth whether towarde south north place euer fall lyeth regardeth ye wynde shal sowe hath respecte vnto cloudes shal reape like thou knowest waye wynde ner ye bone fylled mother wombe euen thou knowest workes god workemaster cease thou therfore thy handes sowe thy sede whether ye mornynge euenynge thou knowest whether shall prospere yf take better light swete pleasaunt thinge eye loke vpon sonne yf man lyue many yeares glad let remembre dayes darcknesse shal many come thinges shal vanite glad thou yonge man thy youth lat thine hert mery thy yonge dayes folowe wayes thine owne hert lust thine eye thou sure god shal bringe iudgment thinges xii chapter pvt awaye displeasure ye hert remoue euell thy body childehode youth vanite remembre thy maker thy youth euer dayes aduersite come yeares drawe nye thou shalt saye haue pleasure sonne ye light ye moone starres darckened cloudes turne agayne rayne kepers house shall tremble stronge men shal bowe selues myllers stonde still fewe sight wyndowes shal waxe dymme whan dores stretes shal shutt whan ye voyce myller shall layed downe whan men shall ryse vp voyce byrde whan ye doughters musyck shalbe brought lowe whan men shal feare hye place afrayed stretes whan almonde tre shalbe despysed greshopper borne whan greate pouerte shall breake man goeth longe home mourner go aboute stretes euer syluer lace taken awaye golden bende broken pott broken well whele vpon cisterne eccls 3 • dust turned againe vnto earth whence came sprete returne vnto god gaue eccls 1 vanite sayeth preacher playne vanite preacher wyse alone taught people knowlege also gaue good hede sought groūde set forth many parable diligence fynde acceptable wordes right scripture wordes trueth heb 4 c wordes ye wyse like prickes nales go thorow wherwith men kepte together geuen one shepherde onely therfore bewarre sonne aboue thou make many innumerable bokes take dyuerse doctrynes hande weery thy body withall lat v heare conclucion thinges feare god kepe comaundementes toucheth men god shall iudge workes secrete thinges whether good euell ende ecclesiastes called preacher salomon balettes called cantica canticorum first chapter thy mouth wolde geue kysse ye brestes
