well loue black ye doughters ierusalē like tentes cedarenes 〈◊〉 25 b par 3 c hanginges salomon yet faire wel fauoured withal maruell yt black ye sonne hath shyned vpō whan mother childrē euell wil made ye keper vynyarde thus fayne kepe vynyarde myne owne tell thou soule loueth thou fedest thou restest noone daye lest go wronge come vnto flockes thy companyons yf thou knowe yi self thou fayrest amōge woman thā go ye waye forth ye fotesteppes shepe though thou woldest fede ye goates besyde ye shepherdes tentes wil tary loue wt myne hoost charettes shal fewer pharaos • xo 〈◊〉 14 b shal thy chekes thy neck made fayre hanged wt spāges goodly iewels neck bande golde wil make ye wt syluer bottons kynge sytteth table shal smell nardus bōdell myrre beloued lyeth betwixte brestes cluster grape cypers vynyardes engaddi art thou vnto beloued • ant 4 fayre art thou loue fayre art thou▪ thou hast doues eye fayre art thou beloued well fauored art thou oure bed decte floures ye sylinges oure house cedre tre ou • e balkes cypresse ii chapter floure felde lylie valley rose amonge thornes loue amonge daughter like aple tre amonge tree wodd beloued amonge sonnes delite sitt vnder shadowe frute swete vnto throte bryngeth wyne seller loueth specially well refresh wt grape cōforte apple sick loue 〈…〉 left hāde lyeth vnder heade right hande enbraceth charge ye doughters ierusalem roe hyndes felde yt ye wake vp loue ner touch till content thynke heare voyce beloued lo commeth hoppinge vpon ye mountaynes leapinge ouer litle hilles beloued like roo yonge hart beholde stondeth behynde wall loketh wyndowe pepeth thorow grate beloued answered sayde vnto stōde vp loue doue beutyfull come lo wynter past rayne awaie gone floures come vp felde twystinge tyme come voyce turtle doue herde oure londe fyge tre bryngeth forth hir fyges vynes beare blossom haue good smell stōde vp loue beutyfull come doue caues rockes hole wall let se thy countenaunce heare thy voyce swete thy voyce fayre thy face gett v fox yee litle fox hurte ye vynes oure vynes beare blossom loue myne 〈…〉 fedeth amōge lyly vntill daye breake till shadowes gone come agayne preuely beloued like roo yonge harte vnto mountaynes iii chapter night bedd sought soule loueth yee diligently sought founde wil get vp thought go aboute cite vpon market ye stretes seke soule loueth whan sought founde watchman go aboute ye cite founde sawe ye soule loueth whan litle past foū de soule loueth haue got ten holde vpon wyl let go vntill brynge mother house hir chambre bare charge ye doughters ierusalē roe hyndes felde ye wake vp loue ner touch till content commeth ye wyldernesse like pilers smoke smell myrre frankencense maner spyces apotecary beholde aboute salomōs bedsteade stonde lx valeaunt men mightie israel holde swerdes euery one experte warre euery man hath swerde vpō thee feare night kynge salomon hath made bedsteade wodd libanus pilers syluer coueringe golde ye seate purple ye grounde pleasauntly paued doughters ierusalem go forth ye doughters sion beholde kynge salomon crowne wherwith mother crowned daye mariage daye gladnesse hert iiii chapter fayre art thou loue fayre art thou 〈…〉 thou hast doues eye besyde lyeth hid within thy hayrie locke like flocke shepe clypped go first vp washinge place euery one beareth two twyns one vnfrutefull amōge thy lippes like rose coloured rybende thy wordes louely thy chekes like pece pomgranate besydes lyed hyd within thy neck like tower dauid buylded bulworkes wher vpon hāge thousande sheldes yee weapēs giaūtes thy two brestes like two twyns yonge roe 〈…〉 fede amōge lily might go mountayne myrre hyll frankynsense till the▪ daye breake till shadowes past awaye thou art fayre loue spott come libanus spouse come libanus come soone next waye toppe amana toppe sanir hermon lyon dennes mountaynes ye leopardes thou hast woūded hert sister spouse thou hast wounded hert one thine eye one cheyne thy neck fayre louely thy brestes sister spouse▪ thy brestes pleasaunt wyne smell thy oyntmentes passeth spice thy lippes spouse droppe hony combe yee mylck hony vnder thy tonge smell thy garmentes like smell frankynsense thou art well kepte garden sister spouse thou art well kepte water sprynge sealed well frutes sproute like paradyse pōgranates wt swete frutes cypresse nardus saffron calmus tree libanus myrre aloe best spyces thou art well knocked open sayde sister loue doue derlinge heade full dew ye locke hayre full night droppes haue put cote cā agayne haue washed fete shal fyle agayne whan loue put hande hole hert moued towarde euer fallinge awaye whole heade sick herte heuy 〈…〉 sole foote vnto heade whole parte yor body woundes botch sore strypes nether helped bounde vp molified ner eased eny oyntment youre londe lieth waist youre city brent vp youre enemy deuoure youre londe ye must fayne stonde loke vpon desolate enemy batell morouer ye doughter syonis left alone like cotage vynyearde like watchouse tyme warre like beseged citie excepte lorde hostes left u alyue shulde haue bene sodoma like vnto gomorra heare worde lorde ye tyrauntes sodoma herken vnto lawe oure god thou people gomorra offre ye many abyde though ye holde yor hondes yet turne myne eye zach 7 b mat 6 b esa 59 though ye make many prayer yet heare nothinge youre hondes full bloude wash make clene put awaye yor euell thoughtes sight god iacob yt maye shewe u waye psal 49 acto 1 yt maye walke pathes ye lawe shal come syon worde god ierusalem shal geue sentence amonge heithen shal reforme multitude people shal breake swerdes speares make sythes sycles sawes therof ioel 3 b tyme forth shal one people lift vp wapen agaynst another mich 4 b nether shal lerne fight thensforth crie house iacob vp let u walke light lorde thou art scatred abrode thy people house iacob ye go farre beyonde yor father whether sorcerer ye haue phylistynes calkers men byrthes wherof ye haue many deut 8 c 17 soone youre londe ful syluer golde ende youre treasure soone youre londe ful stronge horse ende youre charettes inmediatly ful idol also euen workes youre owne hondes esa 44 b ye youre selues haue facioned youre fyngers haue made kneleth man falleth man downe yt thou canst bringe awaye thence therfore get ye soone rock vnd hyde grounde sight fearful iudge2 te 1 b ye glory magestie casteth downe ye high lokes presumptuous personnes bryngeth lowe pryde mā esa 5 b shall exalted ye daye daye ye lorde hostes shal go ouer pryde presumpciō vpon thē exalte thē selues shal bringe downe vpō high stoute cedre tree libanus vpon okes basan vpon high hilles vpon stoute mountaynes vpon costly towres vpon stronge walles vpon shippes see vpon euery thinge yt glorious pleasaunt loke vpon shall bringe downe pryde man 〈…〉 〈…〉 laye man presumptuousnesse full lowe lorde shal haue victory daye 〈…〉 idol shal utterly roted men shal crepe hole stone caues earth sight fearfull iudge glory magesty 〈…〉 tyme shal make vp shake earth thē shal mā cast awaye goddes syluer golde neuertheles made honoure thē vnto molle backes maye better crepe caues rockes cliffes hard stone ye sight fearful iudge glory magesty thirde chapter every man eschue persone moued anger doth wysely▪ euen shal ye lorde hoostes take awaye frō ierusalē iuda possessiōs power meat drinke ye captayne soudyare ye iudge prophete wyse aged mā worshipful fiftie yeare olde honorable senatours men vnderstondinge master craftes oratours shal geue child youre prynces saieth lorde babe shall haue rule one shall euer doinge violence wronge another boye shal presume agaynst elder vyle persone agaynst honorable yee one shal take frende kynred ye bosome saye thou hast clothinge thou shalt oure heade thou mayest kepe u fall parell shall sweare saye helpe morouer nether meate ner clothinge house make ru • ler people ierusalem iuda must decaye wordes councels agaynst lorde prouoke presence magestyrs anger chaunginge countenaunce bewrayeth yee declare owne synnes selues sodomite hyde thē wo vnto soules shalbe heuely rewarded shal saye happie godly maye enioye frutes study wo ye vngodly vnrightuous shalbe rewarded workes 〈…〉 people rybaudes oppresse ye woman haue rule people thy leders deceaue treade waye thy footsteppes 〈…〉 lorde comon matter stondeth geue iudgment people lorde shal come forth reason senatours prynces people shal saye thus vnto ye th̄at haue burnt vp vynyearde robbery poore youre house wherfore ye oppresse people marre ye face innocentes thus shal god hoostes reuyle morouer thus saieth ye lorde seinge doughters sion become proude come stretched neckes vayne wanton eye seinge come trippinge nycely fete therfore shal lorde shaue heades doughters sion make bewtie bare daye daye shal lorde take awaye gorgiousnes ierusalem besege wanne house dauid ahas herde worde therof yt siria ephraim confederate together herte quaked yee ye hertes also people like tre felde moued wynde sayde god vnto esay go mete ahas thou thy sonne sear iasub heade ye ouer pole fote path fuller grounde saye vnto take hede thy self still feare nether faynt harted two tale two smokynge fyre brandes wrath furiousnes rezin sirian romelies glory 〈…〉 thought herde moūtaynes noyse like bene greate people ruszshinge though kyngdomes nacions come together lorde hoostes captayne whole armye come farre countrees also endes heauēs euē lorde minister wrath destroye whole lōde mourne therfore daye lorde honde commeth destroyer ye allmighty shall hondes letten downe men hertes shal melt awaie shal stonde feare carefulnesse sorowe shal come therof starres planetes heauen shal geue light sonne shalbe quenched rysinge 〈…〉 mone shal shyne light wil punysh wickednesse worlde synnes vngodly sayeth lorde hye stomackes proude take awaye laye downe boostinge tyrauntes make man dearer thē fyne golde man worth thē golden wedge ophir morouer shake heauē earth shall remo hir place thus shall go wt babilon wrath lorde hoostes ye daye fearfull indignaciō babilon shalbe hunted chased doo flocke wt shepherde euery mā shal turne owne people fle echone owne londe founde alone shalbe shot thorow gather together shalbe destroyed wt swerde child shalbe slayne eye house spoyled wyues rauyshed lo shall bringe vp ye medes agaynst thē shal regarde syluer desyrous golde shall yonge men bowes knapped asunder medes shal haue pitie vpō shall crie palace one another dragōs shalbe pleasaūt perlours babilons tyme honde hir dayes maye longe absent xiiii chapter bvt ye lorde wilbe mercyfull vnto iacob wyll take vp israel agayne set thē owne lōde straūgers shal clene vnto thē get thē ye house iacob shal take ye people abdie 1 zach 2 b cary thē home wt thē ye house israel shal haue thē possession seruaūtes maydēs ye lōde ye lorde shal take prisoner whose captyues bene afore rule yt oppressed thē ye lorde shal bringe ye rest frō ye trauayle feare harde bondage yt thou wast laden shalt thou vse mockage vpon ye kinge babilon saye happeneth yt ye oppressour leaueth ye golden tribute come ende doutles lorde hath broken staff vngodly cepter ye lordly whē wroth smyteth ye people wt durable stroke wōders persecuteth thē tameth thē cōtinually therfore ye whole worlde rest quyetnesse men synge ioye yee euen fyrre tree cedres libanus reioyse thy fall sayenge yt thou art layde downe come mo vp destroye v hell also trembleth thy commynge mightie men prynces earth steppe forth kynges earth stonde vp frō seates maye one another synge speake vnto art thou wounded also art thou become like vnto v thy pompe thy pryde gone downe hell mothes shalbe layde vnder luc 10 c wormes shalbe thy coueringe art thou fallen heauen lucifer thou faire mornīge childe apo 12 hast thou gotten fall euen grounde thou withstondinge dyddest subdue people yet thou thoughtest thine harte clymme vp heauen make seate aboue starres god wyll syt vpon glorious mount toward north wyll clymme vp aboue cloudes wilbe like highest yet darre laye yt thou shalt brought downe depe hell eze 31 c eze 32 c se shal narowly loke vpō thinke selues sayenge man brought londes feare made ye kingdomes afrayde made worlde maner waist layde city grounde let prisoner go home happeneth kynges people lie euery one home owne palace worshipe thou art cast thy graue like wilde braunch like dead men rayment shott thorow swerde go downe stone depe dead coarse tr • den vnder fete art buried wt euen thou hast waisted thy lō de destroyed thy people generacion wicked shalbe without honor euer shal waye sought destroye childrē father wickednes shal come vp agayne possesse londe fyll worlde ful castels townes wil stonde vp agaynst sayeth lorde hoostes root ye name generacion babilon saieth lorde wil geue otter wil make water poddels wil swepe besome destruccion sayeth lorde hoostes lorde hoostes hath sworne ooth sayēge shal come passe haue determined shalbe fulfilled haue deuysed esa 37 assirians shalbe destroyed londe vpon mountaytaines wyll treade vnder fote wherthorow yocke shall come burthen shalbe taken youre shulders deuyce hath god taken thorow whole worlde thus honde stretched ouer people yf lorde hoostes determe thinge wyl dysanulle yf stretch forth honde wil holde agayne yeare kynge achas dyed god threatned esay maner 〈…〉 reioyse thou whole palestina though ye rod yt beateth broken ye serpentes rote shal waxe k • c katrice frute shalbe fyrie worme poore shall fede best thinges symple shal dwell safetie 〈…〉 thy rote wil destroye wt honger shall slaye ye remnaunt mourne ye porte wepe ye city feare thou whole palestina shal come frō north smoke whose power man maye abyde shall maynteyne message gentyles lorde stablisheth syon poore people shall put trust xv chapter ye heuy burthē vpō moab ar moab destroyed thought night season 〈…〉 walles moab perished night vanished awaye wēte baith dibon hie place wepe moab mourne frō nebo medba heades colled al beardes shauen 〈…〉 stretes gyrded aboute sack cloth toppes house stretes nothinge mournynge weping • hesebon eleale cried voyce herde vnto iahaz worthy also moab bleared cried sorow myndes wo hert moabs sake fled vnto cite zoar like fayre fruteful bullock went vp luhith wepinge waye toward horonaim ful lamentacion ye hurte water nimrim dried vp grasse wythred herbes destroyed necessary grene thinge besyde like maner thinge yt left substaunce caried water araby crie went ouer whole londe moab eglaim vnto beer nothinge mournynge water dimon full bloude ye enemie sent thither bonde men lyon layde waite remnaunt londe yt escaped xvj chapter sent lordes lōde mā warre rocke lieth toward deserte vnto hill doughter sion doughters moab bene trymblinge byrde yt put hir nest fery arnon messaunger sayde gather youre councel come together couer v youre shadowe myddaye 〈…〉 night doth hyde chased bewraye thē fled let persecuted moabites dwel amōge oure open refuge agaynst destroyer aduersary oppresseth v robber vndoeth v tyraunte dryueth v oure londe ye trone youre kingdome ful grace therfore sytteth vpon wt faitfulnesse treuth house dauid knowe thinge diligence helpe shortly▪ acordinge equite rightuousnes moabs pride shal answere wel knowne though excellent 〈…〉 proude arrogant hie mynded yet strength nothinge like therfore moab complayneth vnto moab wher thorow come mourne yt smytten take deuyce beneth bryckwall make cō playnte suburbes also hesebon made waist prince gentyles hewed downe ye vynyardes sibma planted noble grape spred vnto iazer went vnto ende deserte whose braunches stretched selues forth beyonde see therfore mourned iazer ye vynyardes sibma wt greate sorow poured teares vpon hesebon eleale songes layde downe haruest gatheringe grape myrth chere gone ye felde vynyardes moch man glad ner sunge wēte treader wynepresse mery chere layde downe wherfore bely rōbled bene lute moabs sake myne inwarde membres bryckwalles sake happened thus also whē moab sawe turned vpsyde downe 〈…〉 went vp hie hir sanctuary make hir prayer might 〈◊〉 helped deuyce lorde toke honde tyme agaynst moab lorde sayeth thus thre yeare shal ye power moab wt pōpe greate minished like ye burthē hyred seruaunte ye remnaunt shalbe lesse fewe rekened moch worth xvij chapter heuy burthē vpō damascus beholde iere 49 amos 1 damascus shal nomore cite heape broken stone city aroer shalbe waist catel shal lie nomā shal fraye thē awaye ephraim shal strōge damascus shal kyngdome ye glory ye remnaunt ye sirians shalbe glory childrē israel saieth ye lorde hoostes tyme also shal ye glory iacob poore fatnes leane shal happē thē one sheareth haruest cutteth handful wt sickle one gathreth ye sheaues together valley rephaim remayneth yet ear ouer whē one shaketh olyue tre esa 24 b fyndeth two thre olyue beries aboue toppe foure fyue braunches thus lorde god israel hath spoken shal man cōuerte agayne vnto maker turne eye holy one israel shal turne aulters ye worke owne hōdes nether shal loke vpon groaues ymages fyngers haue wrought tyme shal stronge city desolate like ye forsakē plowes corne forsoke feare ye child israel4 7 b shalt thou damascus desolate thou hast forgottē god ye sauioure hast called remēbraunce ye rock thi strēgth wherfore thou hast also set fayre plāte grafted straunge braunch daye thou diddest plante greate gaue soone frute thi sede daye haruest thou shalt reape heape sorowes misery wo multitude moch people russh like see heape folke renne ouer like greate water though many people increase flowinge water esa 37 • though armed yet fle farre vanish awaye like dust wynde vpon hill whyrle wynde thorow storme though fearful night yet morninge gone thē porcion v harme heretage robbe v xviij chapter wo londe flienge shippes syde ye floude ethiopia sendeth hir message ouer see shippes redes vpō ye water sayeth go soone yor message vnto straunge harde folke fearful people people yt desperate pylled folke whose londe deuyded v ryuers water yee ye yt fyt compasse worlde dwell vpon earth token shalbe geuen vpō mountaynes loke vp home bloweth herken thus hath ye lorde sayde vnto layde downe pondred matter house noone daye hote fel myslinge shower like dew happeneth haruest frutes yet ripe cut grape yonge grene one smote grape hoke yee hewed downe also buwes braunches dyd cast thē awaye thus layde waist foules mountaynes ye beastes earth together yt foules sat ther vpon beastes earth wyntered shal present brought vnto lorde hoostes euen harde folke fearful folke thē yt desperate pylled folke whose londe deuyded v floudes water vnto place name lorde hoostes deut 12 euen vnto hill sion xix chapter heuy burthen vpon egipte beholde iere 46 eze 29 luc 21 lorde wil ryde vpon swifte cloude come egipte goddes egipte shal trymble cōmynge hert egipte shal quake within thus saieth lorde wil stere vp egiptians one agaynst nother amonge selues mar 13 one shalbe euer agaynst brother neghboure yee one cite agaynst another one kyngdome agaynst another egipte shalbe choked hir self whē axe councel goddes prophetes soythsayers witch bringe councel naught wil delyuer egipte also hondes greuous ruler cruel kinge shal haue rule water see shalbe drawē nilus shal synke awaye dronke vp ryuers also shalbe drawen welles shal decreace drie awaye rede rush shal fayle grasse water syde vpon ye ryuers bancke yee euer sowen water shalbe wythered destroyed brought naught fyshers shall mourne soch cast angle water shal complayne sprede nettes water shalbe faynt harted soch laboure vpon flax sylcke shal come pouerte also weeue fyne workes poundes egipte policie moates diches shal come naught yee vndiscrete prynces zoan 〈…〉 councel wyse senatours pharao 〈…〉 shal turne foolishnesse darre boast saye pharaos behalfe come wyse people come ye olde regall progeny thy wyse mē let tel shewe lorde hoostes hath taken honde agaynst egypte fooles prynces zoan proude prynces noph yee dysceaue egypte mith nobilite stocke 〈…〉 lorde hath made egypte dronckē sprete erroure shal vse matter euē like dronkē mā goeth spewinge aboute egipte shal lacke good councel yt shal knowe nether beginnynge ende nether vpon lōde water thē shal ye egiptiās like vnto womē afrayde astō • ed liftinge vp hōde ye lorde hoostes shal lifte vp ouer londe iuda also shal make egiptians afrayde doth speake vpon shal put feare cause councel ye lorde hoostes hath devysed agaynst shal fyue city egipte speake canaanite • nge ande sweare lorde hoostes heliopolis shalbe one tyme shal lorde hoostes haue aulter myddest londe egipte title ther vnto lorde shalbe token testimony vnto lorde hoostes londe egipte shal crie vnto oppresse shal sende captayne sauioure delyuer morouer egipte shalbe bought vnto lorde egiptians also shal knowe lorde tyme shal reuerence peace offringes meat offringes shal promyse offringes yee paye also thus lorde shal smyte egipte heale agayne shal turne ye lorde also shal haue mercy vpō saue shal comon waye egipte assiria assirians shal come egipte egypcians assiria egipcians also assirians shal haue one god seruyce shal israel honoure thirde egipte assur lorde hoostes shal blesse sayenge blissed people egipcians assur worke hō de israel myne enheritaunce xx chapter yeare harthan came aschod sargē kinge assirians sent tyme also seged aschdod wāne ye season thē spake lorde vnto esaye ye sonne amos sayenge go lowse yt sack cloth frō thy loynes put ye shues thy fete dyd goinge naked barefote sayde lorde seruaunt esaye goeth naked barefote token signifienge thinge thre yeare shal come vpō egipte ethiopia euen thus shal kinge as • rians driue yonge olde prisoner naked barefote egipte ethiopia shal dyscouer ye shame egipte shalbe also wittes ende ashamed one another egipcians moryans morians egipcians sight glory morouer dwel ye iles shal saye euen daye beholde oure hope fled seke helpe might delyuered kinge ye assirians escape xxj chapter heuy burthē waist see greuous visiō shewed vnto like storme wynde rayne russheth wyldernesse terrible londe maye disceaue sayde voyce let disceaue maye distroye let distroye vp elam besege madai still gronynges raynes backe ful payne • sa 13 〈◊〉 13 panges came vpon vpon woman hir trauayle herde abasshed whē loked vp afrayde myne herte paunted trembled feare darcknesse made fearfull mynde yee soone make redy table sayde voyce kepe watch eate drynke vp ye captaynes take youre shylde thus lorde hath charged go thy waye set watchmā maye tell seyth whē wayted diligētly sawe two horsmen one rydinge vpon asse vpon camel lyon cried lorde haue stonde waytinge whole daye haue kepte watch night yt came one rydinge vpon charet answered sayde babilon fallen iere 51 apo 14 b 1 • turned vpsyde downe ye ymages hir goddes smytten ye grounde felowe throsshers fanners haue herde lorde hoostes god israel shewe vnto heuy burthen duma one seir cried vnto watchman iere 49 b hast thou espied night watchman hast thou espied night watchman answered daye breaketh night cōmynge yf youre request earnest axe come agayne heuy burthen vpon arabia euen ye shal abyde wod waye toward dedanim esa 16 mete thurstie water ye citisens hema mete b • ed fled thei shal runne awaye weapen drawē swerde bēt bowe greate batell thus hath lorde spoken vnto ouer yeare shal power cedar gone like office hyred seruaunte goeth remnaunt good archer cedar shalbe iere 49 e lorde god israel hath spoken xxij chapter heuy burthen apon valley vision hast thou thou clymnest vp house toppe thou citie miracle sedicious wilfull seinge thy slayne mē nether killed wt swerde ner deed batel thy captaynes gat horse ordinaunce yee altogether rydden awaye fled farre perceaued yt sayde awaye fro yt maye wepe bytterly take laboure cōforte iere 9 lucae 19 touchinge destruction people ye daye lorde hoostes wherin plage treade downe wede valley visiōs breake downe walles soch crack shal geue sownde mountaynes sawe elamite take quyuers carte horse walles bare harnesse thy goodly valley ful charettes horse men made soone besege gate coueringe iuda put thence sene sege tymbre house shal ye se riftes walles cite dauid2 peg 5 b wherof shalbe many ye shal gather together water lower pole tel house ierusalē break thē kepe ye walles ye shal make pyt betwyxte ye twayne walles water olde pole nothinge regarde toke honde made tyme shal ye lorde hoostes cal mē wepinge mourninge baldnesse puttinge sack clothe fulfil lust wilfulnes slaugter oxē kyll shepe eate costly meate sap 2 b 1 cor 15 c drynke wyne let v eate drinke tomorow shal die neuertheles whē lorde hoostes herde sayde yee yf wickednes shalbe remitted ye must die hath ye lorde god hoostes spoken thus sayeth lorde god hoostes go treasury vnto sobna gouernoure esa 36 saye vnto hast thou whēce comest thou thou hast made graue caused costly tombe stone made place lye hewen rock beholde lorde shal cast violence deck another fashion put vpon straunge clothe shal carie ye farre coū tre like ball hondes shalt thou die shal pompe thy charettes haue ende thou vylleyne house thy lorde wil shute thine office put thine estate wil cal seruaunt eliakim ye sonne helkia araye thy cote gyrde thy gyrdle wil geue thy power honde shalbe father citisens ierusalem apo 1 iob 12 b kynred iuda also laye keye dauids house vpon shulders yf open man shal shit yf shyt man shal open wil fasten nale place hie faithfulnesse zach 10 shalbe vpon glorius trone father house shal hā ge vpon glory father house child childers childrē apparel small great instrumentes measure musike shal come passe saieth lorde hoostes nale yt fastened place highest faithfulnesse shalbe pluckt whē weight hangeth vpon shal fall broken hewen peces lorde hath sayde xxiij chapter heuy burthen vpon tirus mourne ye shippes tharsis 〈…〉 throwne downe grounde conquered come cithim indweller ilondes marchauntes sidon occupied see thou wast ful somtyme poynte see frutes brought vnto maner corne water thou wast comon marcket al people sidō sory yee ye power see cōplaneth saieth yt neuer traueled childe neuer borne eny yt nether norished boye ner brought vp doughter soone egipte perceaueth wilbe sory tirus self go ouer see mourne ye yt dwel iles glorious cite hath bene longe antiquite whose natyues dwellinge farre commende greatly▪ hath deuysed soch thinges vpon tirus crowne al city whose marchaūtes captaynes highest principal worlde euē lorde hoostes hath deuysed maye put downe al pompe minish glory worlde go thorow thy londe thou doughter see men go ouer water 〈…〉 gyrdle thus lorde remoueth kingdomes 〈…〉 hath taken hande agaynst mightie canaan rote hath stretched honde ouer see sayde hence forth shalt thou make myrth thou doughter sidon thou shalt put downe cethēs stonde vp therfore go enemie wil carie thou shalt also haue rest beholde thyne ensample caldees soch people man like assur buylded set vp castels palace broke downe agayne therfore mourne ye shippes see youre power shalbe throwne downe shal lxx yeares tirus euen longe kinges life beforgotten lxx yeares shal happē tirus harlot playeth vpon lute take thy lute saie men go aboute citie thou art yet vnknowne wensche make pastyme dyuerse balettes wherby▪ thou mayest come acquantaunce thus shal happen lxx yeares 〈…〉 ▪ • 1 lorde shal uiset citie tirus shal come agayne hyr marchaundyse shal occupie al kingdomes worlde hir occupiēge wynnynge shalbe halowed vnto lorde 〈◊〉 ▪ 4 • c shal laye vp nothinge behinde vpon heapes marchaūdise tirus shal belōge vnto citisens lorde fedinge susteninge hūgrie clothinge aged xxiiij chapter beholde ye lorde shal waist plage worlde 〈◊〉 ▪ 4 b shal make face earth desolate scatre abrode ye inhabitours therof shal prest people master seruaunt dame like mayde seller like byer lēdeth vpon vsury like yt boroweth vpō vsury creditoure detter yee miserably shal ye worlde waysted clene destroyed ye lorde hath determed earth shalbe heuye decaye face ye earth shal perish fal awaye proude people ye worlde shal come naught ye earth corrupte hir indweller haue offended ye lawe chaunged ordinaūces made euerlastinge testamēt none effecte therfore shal curse deuoure earth yt dwel therō haue synned wherfore shal brent also remayne shalbe swete wyne shal mourne grape shalbe weake yt haue bene mery harte • po 1 • c shal sighe myrth tabrettes shalbe layde downe chere ioyful shal ceasse pleasure lute shal haue ende shal wyne bedronke myrth beer shal bytter thē drinke wicked city shalbe broken downe house shalbe shut man maye come stretes shal lift vp crie wyne men chere shal vanish awaye ioye earth shal passe desolacion shal remayne city gate shalbe smytten waistnesse shal happen vnto londes people like mā smyteth downe ye olyues yt left vpon tre esa 17 b seketh grape wyne gatheringe remayne shal lift vp voyce glad shal magnifie glory lorde euen see prayse name lorde god israel valeis ilōdes heare songes sunge prayse rightuous frō al endes worlde therfore must speake vnfrutfulnesse pouerte wo ful synneres offende purpose malice therfore thou dwellest vpon earth hōde feare pyt snare escapeth terrible crie shal fall pyt iere 4 • g yf come pyt shalbe takē snare wyndowes aboue shalbe opened foundacion earth shal moue earth shal geue greate crack shal haue asore ruyne take horrible fall earth shal stacker like dronken man takē awaye like tent hir misdedes shal lie heuye vpō yt must fall neuer rise vp agayne tyme shal lorde mustre together hie hooste aboue ye kynges worlde vpon earth shalbe coupled together prisoner shalbe shut one warde punished innumerable day moone sonne shalbe ashamed luc 21 c lorde hoostes shal rule ierusalem vpon mount sion excellent councel xxv chapter lorde thou art god wil prayse magnifie ye name thou bringest marvelous thinges passe acordinge thine olde councels truly stedfastly thou makest townes • sa 26 heapes stone head city broken walles palace wicked destroyest thou citie shal neuer buylded againe therfore rude people must magnifie city cruel heithen must feare thou art poore man helpe strēgth neadful necessite thou art defence agaynst euel wether schadowe agaynst hete vnto presumptuous thou art like strō ge whyrle wynde casteth downe boostinge vngodly thou kepest men heate shadow cloudes thou cuttest braunches tyrauntes morouer lorde hoostes shal prepare feast people vpō hill luc 14 plenteous costly pleasaunt feast fat welfed beastes swete pure thinges vpon hill shal take awaye syde vale yt hāgeth ye face al people ose 13 e 1 co 15 g apo 7 21 coueringe wherwith gentile couered death shal vtterly cōsume lorde god shal wipe awaye teares face take awaye confuciō people thorow ye whole worlde ye lorde hath sayde tyme shal sayde lo oure god whō put oure trust ephe 2 hath healed v lorde haue wayted let v reioyse delyte health hōde ye lorde ceaseth vpō hil moab shalbe throsshē downe vnder like straw trodē vnder fete dōge hill shal stretch hōdes vpon like swimmer doth swymme wt power hondes shal cast downe hie pompe strōge holdes hie walles shal bur • e cast thē downe fell thē grounde dust xxvj chapter shal songe sunge londe iuda pro 1 • b zac 2 psal 117 b haue strōge citie walles • e ordinaūce shal kepe v opē ye gate yt good people maye go laboureth treuth thou art doer hast matter honde shalt prouyde peace euē peace yt mē hope rom 5 esa 12 b esa 25 hope stil lorde lorde god euerlastinge strēgth yt bringeth lowe hie mynded citesyns casteth downe proude city casteth thē groūde yee euē ye myre yt maye trodē vnder fete symple steppe poore pro 16 iere 10 thou lorde cōsidrest path ye rigtuous whether right whether waye ye rightuous right therfore lorde haue respecte vnto waye thy iudgmentes thy name thy remē braunce reioyse soule psal 62 142 soule lusteth night lōge mynde haisteth frely soone thy iudgment knowne worlde thē inhabitours earth lerne rightuousnesse vngodly though haue recaued grace yet lerneth rightuousnesse place punished offendeth feareth glory lorde lorde wil se thine hie honde shal se confounded whē thou shalt deuoure wrath people fyre thine enemy vnto v lorde prouyde peace thou workest v workes 〈…〉 lorde oure god though soch lordes haue dominacion vpon v knowe yet graūte maye hope kepe thy name remembraunce malicious tyrauntes whē die 〈…〉 nether life resurrectiō thou visitest thē rootest thē destroyest memoryall agayne thou increacest people lorde thou increacest people thou shalt praysed magnified ye endes worlde people seke vnto trouble aduersite complane vnto thē chastenynge like wife wt childe whē hir trauayle cōmeth vpō ashamed 〈…〉 crieth suffreth payne euē lorde thy sight childe trauayle beare 〈…〉 sprete bringe forth health thorow earth vndestroyed inhabitours worlde perish thy dead men 〈…〉 departed life resurrection lie earth wake haue ioye yt dew dew life light ye place malicious tyrauntes fallē awaye go people thy chābre 〈…〉 shut doore suffre ye twīcklinge eye 〈…〉 till wrath ouerpast beholde lorde wil go habitacion 〈…〉 vyset wickednes thē dwell vpon earth wil discouer bloude hath deuoured shal neuer hyde thē hath murthured xxvij chapter lorde heuye great lōge swearde shal vyset leuiathā invincible serpēt euē leuiathā yt croked serpent shal slaye wallfish ye see tyme shal mē synge vynyarde muscatel lorde kepe water due season watch daye night man breake beare euel wil mynde compell greatly forgettinge faith fulnesse shulde burne vp wt thornes bush enforce kepe make peace wil come poynte yt iacob shalbe rooted againe israel shalbe grene beare floures shal fyll ye whole worlde wt frute smyteth smyter euel smyttē self destroieth ye murtherers murthured euery mā recōpenseth wt ye measure yt receaueth museth vpō sore wynde vpō dayes extreme heate therfore shal iniquite iacob thus reconciled shal take awaye ye frute synnes 〈◊〉 9 c aulter stone shal make stone beaten poulder groues idol shal stonde stronge city shalbe desolate ye fayre city shal left like wildernes catel shal fede lie shepe shal eate vp haruest shal brent wyues bewtie came forth 〈…〉 26 〈◊〉 32 b shalbe defyled people without vnderstōdinge therfore yt created shal fauoure yt made shal merciful thē yt tyme shal ye lorde shute ye swifte water euphrates vnto ye ryuer egipte shal child chosen one one shal greate trompet blowen haue bene destroyed assirians londe scatred abrode egipte shal come worshipe lorde ierusalē vpō holy mount xxviij chapter wo ye crowne pryde ye dronkē ephraemites 〈◊〉 3▪ faydinge floure glory pōpe yt vpō toppe plēteous valley mē ouerladen wt wyne beholde strength power lorde shal breake londe euery syde like tempest hale beareth downe stronge holdes like horrible mightie ouer flowinge water proude crowne dronken ephraemites shal troden vnderfoote 〈◊〉 ▪ 10 faydinge floure glory pompe vpon toppe plenteous valley shal happen vnto vntymely frute haruest come soone sene deuoured euer come well man honde shal lorde hoostes ioyful crowne glorious garlāde vnto remnaunt people vnto lowly shalbe sprete iudgment vnto dryue awaye enemy ye gate shalbe sprete strēgth go wronge ye reason wyne fall stacker strōge drynke yee euē prestes prophetes selues go amisse esa 3 c dronken wyne weake braned thorow stronge drynke erre seinge judgmēt fayle table ful vomyte fylthynes yt place clene amonge yt teach instructe enfourme childrē weened suck taken brestes eny fashion esa 10 mat 23 b commaunde yt maye commaunded byd yt maye byddē forbyd maye forbyddē kepe backe yt maye kepte backe litle litle1 cor 14 c therfore lorde also shal speake wt lispinge lippes wt straunge lāguage vnto people spake afore maner shal bringe rest yf one refresh weery ye shal bringe rest heare therfore lorde shal answere stubbournes cōmaunde yt maye cōmaunded byd yt maye bydden forbyd yt maye forbyddē kepe backe yt maye kepte backe litle litle maye go forth fall backwarde brussed snared taken wherfore heare worde lorde ye mocker rule lordes people ierusalē ye cōforte yor selues thus tush death poynte hell haue made cōdicion though breake eny sore plage shal come vpon v amos 9 disceate wil escape nymblenes defende selues psal 117 c ro▪ 9 g 1 pet 2 luc 20 b therfore thus saieth lorde god beholde wil laye stone sion greate stone costly corner stone sure foundacion yt putteth trust shal confouded rightuousnes wil set vp agayne ye balaunce iudgment weightes1 cor 13 b tēpest hale shal take awaye yor refuge ye haue disceaue withal ye ouerflowinge water shal breake downe yor strōge holdes dissimulaciō thus appoyntmēt ye haue made wt death shalbe done awaye cōdicion ye made hell shal stōde greate destructiō goeth thorow shal treade shal take quyte awaye shal go forth early mornynge contynue yt daye yt night feare shal teach ye heare ye bedde shal narow yt mā cā lye vpon coueringe small mā maye wynde self therin lorde shal steppe forth dyd vpon mount perazim esa 37 f 2 5 iosue 10 b 1 par 14 shal take dyd vpō dale gabaon maye bringe forth deuyce straunge deuyce fulfil worke wonderful worcke therfore make mockes youre captiuyte increase haue herde lorde hoostes saye shal come soden destruction plage vpon whole earth take hede heare voyce pondre merck wordes wel goeth husbonde man euer due season earnestly londe moweth ploweth grounde sowe whē hath made playne soweth fitch comyn soweth ye wheate barlye place milium rye also place yt maye right god teacheth sheweth treadeth fitch wayne nether bringeth cart ouer comyn throssheth ye fitch flale comyn rod wheate gryndeth make bred therof moch bringe passe wt treadinge nether brussinge cart wheles make ner beastes grynde soch like thinges come lorde hostes maruelous councel greate rightuousnesse xxix chap wo vnto ariel ariel thou cite dauid wāne eze 43 c 2 reg 5 take yet yeares let feastes yet passe ouer shal ariel beseged shal heuy sorouful shal vnto euen lyon wil laye sege rounde aboute kepe ye tower graue vp dyke agaynst ye thou shalt brought lowe speake earth thy wordes shal go humbly ye grounde thy voyce shal come earth like voyce witch thy talkinge shal groane myre multitude thine enemy shalbe like mealdust psal 1 b nombre tyrauntes shalbe ye dust wynde taketh awaye sodenly thou shalt visited lorde hoostes thondre earth quake greate crack whyrle wynde tempest flame consumynge fyre multitude people went agaynst ariel whole hooste stronge holdes sege like dreame apeareth night psal 72 c like hungrie man dreameth eatynge awaketh hath nothinge like thurstie man dreameth drinkinge awaketh faynt soule vnpacient multitude people mustre selues agaynst hill sion ye shalbe youre wittes ende ye shalbe abasshed ye shal stackre rele fro ye shalbe dronken wyne ye shal fall thorow dronkenes lorde shal geue hard slepinge sprete holde downe youre eye namely yor prophetes heades shulde se shal couer 〈…〉 vision shalbe vnto wordes stonde sealed lettre one offreth man lerned sayeth rede v lettre thē answereth cā rede shutt yf geuē one yt lerned sayde vnto rede lettre sayeth rede therfore thus sayeth lorde moch people draweth nye wt mouth 〈…〉 prayseth highly lippes herte neuertheles farre fro feare owe vnto turne men lawes doctrynes therfore wil also shewe vnto people maruelous terrible greate thinge namely 〈…〉 wil destroye wisdome wise vnderstōdinge lerned men shal perish wo vnto seke depe 〈…〉 hyde ymaginacion fore lorde rehearce coūcels ye darknes saye seith v knoweth v ymaginacion euen potter claye taketh advisemēt though worke might saye ye worke master make erthen vessel saieth potter vnderstondeth se ye hard 〈…〉 libanus shalbe turned charmel charmel shalbe taken wodde shal deaf men vnderstonde wordes boke eye blynde shal se without eny cloude darknes oppressed shal holde mery feast lorde poore people shal reioyse holy one israel shal furious people ceasse ye mocker shal put awaye yt wronge shalbe rooted soch laboure drawe mē vnto synne 〈…〉 yt disceaue reproueth gate soch turne good personnes vanite therfore lorde euen defender abraham saieth thus vnto house iacob 〈…〉 shal iacob ashamed face cōfounded seith amonge child hondes haue made soch halowe name amonge maye sancifie holy one iacob feare god israel afore tyme erroneous sprete haue vnderstondinge yt soch coude speake lerned lawe xxx chapter wo shrenkinge child saieth lorde seke councel 〈…〉 take webbe honde maye heape one synne vpon another go downe egipte axe councel seke helpe power pharao cō forte shadowe egipciās pharaos helpe shalbe youre cōfucion comforte egipcians shadowe shalbe youre owne shame youre ruler haue bene zoan yor messaungers came vnto hanes 〈◊〉 29 〈◊〉 ▪ 1 • 〈◊〉 16 b ye shal ashamed people yt maye helpe shal bringe strength comforte shame confucion youre beastes haue borne burthen vpō backes towarde south thorow waye ful parell trouble lyō lyones cockatrice shutynge dragon yee mule bare youre substaunce camel brought yor treasure vpon croked backes vnto people helpe egipcians helpe shalbe vane lost therfore tolde also yt youre pryde shulde haue ende 〈…〉 wherfore go hē ce write table note booke maye remayne posterite stil kepte obstinate people • sa 1 vnfaithful child child heare lawe lorde 〈◊〉 11 〈◊〉 7 b darre saye prophetes intro mitte youre selues nothinge vnto ye soythsayers tell u nothinge come speake frendly wordes vnto v preach v false thinges treade waye go path turne holy one israel v therfore thus saieth holy one israel moch ye haue cast youre bewtie conforted youre selues power nymblenesse put youre confidence therin therfore shal ye haue myschefe agayne youre destruction fall like hie wall falleth rift blast whose breakinge cometh sodenly youre destruction shalbe like erthē pot • sal 2 b breaketh man touchinge yee breaketh sore man shal fynde sheuer fetch fyre take water pyt lorde god exo 14 2 par 20 c euen holy one israel hath promised thus stilsittinge rest shal ye healed quyetnesse hope shal youre strength lie notwithstondinge ye regarde ye saie thus cōstrayned fle vpō horse therfore shall ye fle must ryde vpon swift beastes therfore youre persecutours shal yet swifter leui 26 h iosu 23 c thousand shal fle one fyue geue euell wordes vntil ye desolate ship mast vpon hie mountayne beaken vpon hill yet stondeth lorde waitinge ro 2 maye haue mercy vpon lifteth self vp maye receaue grace lorde god rightuous happie thei wate thus thou people sion ye citisens ierusalem shal ye neuer heuynes doutlesse haue mercy vpon soone heareth voyce thy crie helpe lorde geueth bred aduersite water trouble thine instructer fleyth farre yf thine eye loke vnto thine instructer thine eares harken worde crieth saieth deut 4 waye go turne nether right honde leffte morouer yf ye destroye syluer workes youre idol cast awaye golden coapes ye deckt withall fylthynes saie get hence thē wil geue rayne sede ye shal sowe earth geue breade encrease earth shalbe plenteous abundaunt psal 36 b thy catel also shal fede brode medowes yee thyne oxē mu • e till grounde shal eate good fodder pourged wt ye fanne goodly ryuers shal flowe mountaynes hilles daye greate slaughter tower shal fall2 pet 3 b moone shal shyne sonne ye sōne shyne shalbe seuē folde haue moch shyne seuen dayes beside daye shal lorde bynde vp ye brussed sore people heale woundes beholde glory lorde shal come farre face shal burne man shalbe able abyde lippes shal wagge indignacion tunge shal consumynge fyre breath like vehement floude water goeth vp throte maye take awaye ye people haue turned selues vnto vanite brydle erroure lieth folkes chawes ye shal synge vse ye night holy solempnite ye shal reioyse youre hert come pipe go vp mount lorde vnto ye rock israel lorde also shal set vp power voyce declare terrible arme angrie countenaunce yee flame consumynge fyre earth quake tempest wynde esa 10 hale stone shal assirian feare also voyce lorde shal smyte rodde rodde lorde wil sende vpon shal moue whole foundacion trompet noyse warre batell destroye mat 25 hath prepared fyre payne begynnynge yee euen kynges also hath made depe wyde ye norishinge therof fyre wodde innumerable breath ofte lorde kyndleth match brymstone xxxj chapter wo vnto go downe egipte helpe trust horse conforte selues charettes many horse mē lustie stronge regarde holy one israel aske question lorde neuertheles plageth ye wicked yet goeth worde whā steppeth forth taketh victory agaynst housholde frauwerde helpe euel doer egiptians men god horse flesh sprete soone lorde stretcheth honde shal helper fall shulde haue bene helped shal altogether destroyed thus hath lorde spokē vnto apo 5 〈◊〉 49 b like lyon lyōs whelpe roareth vpon pray hath gotten afrayde though ye multitude shepardes crie vpon nether abashed heape shal lorde hoostes come downe mount sion defende hill like byrdes flotre aboute nestes shal lorde hoostes kepe deut 32 b saue defende deliue ierusalem therfore ye childrē israel turne agayne like ye hahaue exceaded youre goinge back yt daye euery man shal cast idol syluer golde 〈…〉 ye haue made youre synful hondes assur also shalbe slayne swerde wt man swerde▪ swerde shal deuoure 〈…〉 man swerde shal fle slaughter seruauntes shalbe taken prisoners▪ shal go feare stronge holdes prynces shal fle badge hath ye lorde spokē whose light burneth sion fyre ierusalem xxxij chapter beholde kinge shal gouerne ye rule rightuousnes ye prince shal rule acordinge balaunce equite shalbe vnto mē defence wynde refuge tempest like ryuer water thurstie place ye schadowe greate rock drie lōde eye seinge shall dymme eares heare shal take diligēt hede hert vnwise shal attayne knowlege vnparfite tūge shal speake planely distinctly shal nygarde called gentle ner churle lyberall churle wil churlishly mynded hert wil worke euell playe ypocrite ymagyn abhominaciōs agaynst god make hungrie leane holde drinke thurstie perlous weapon cuvetous shameful councels maye begyle poore disceatful workes yee euen shulde geue sentence poore 〈…〉 liberall person ymagineth honest thinges commeth vp honesty vp ye rich ydle city harken vnto voyce ye careles city marcke wordes yeares dayes shal ye brought feare ye carelesse city haruest shalbe grape gatheringe shal come ye rich ydle city ye feare parell ye shalbe abashed remoued ye se barennesse nakednesse preparinge warre ye shal knock vpō youre brestes pleasaunt felde fruteful vynyarde people felde shal bringe thornes thistels euery house voluptuousnes city wilfulnes palace also shalbe broken greatly occupide city desolate tower bulwerckes shalbe become dennes euermore pleasure mule shalbe turned pasture shepe vnto tyme ye sprete poured vpon v aboue shal wildernesse fruteful felde plenteous felde shalbe rekened wodde shal equyte dwel deserte rightuousnesse fruteful londe rewarde rightuousnesse shalbe peace 〈…〉 hir frute rest quietnesse euer 〈…〉 people shal dwel ynnes peace tabernacle pleasure ynough thē whē hale falleth shal fall wodde citie happy shal ye whē ye shal safely sowe youre sede besyde water dryue thither fete youre oxē ass xxxiij chapter therfore wo vnto robber shalt thou robbed also 〈◊〉 26 c vnto laiest wait saye shulde waite layde 〈…〉 wo vnto doest hurte euen shalt thou hurt also thou layest waite shal wait layde also lorde merciful vnto v wait thine arme poynte vyset v thou oure health tyme trouble 〈…〉 graūte people maye fle anger thy voyce thy vpstondinge gentile maye scatred abrode spoyle maye gathered greshoppers comonly gathered together pyt stonde vp lorde thou dwellest hie let siō fylled equyte rightuousnesse let treuth faithfulnesse hir tyme power health wisdome knowlege feare god hir treasure beholde aungels crie messaungers peace wepe bytterly cōsidre glory ye honde synners sion frayde sodane fearfulnesse come vpon ypocrytes amonge u saye dwell consumynge fyre v maye abyde euerlastinge heate 〈◊〉 14 ledeth godly life saye speaketh treuth abhorreth violence disceate kepeth hōde touch rewarde stoppeth eares heare councel agaynst innocent holdeth downe eye se euel shal dwel hie whose sauegarde shalbe true rocke shalbe geuen right true sale lorde shalbe oure capteyne iaco 4 c lorde shalbe oure lawe geuer lorde shalbe oure kinge shalbe oure sauioure coardes layd abrode cā better mast set vp soch fashion bāner ner sale hāgeth therō dealed greate spoyle yee lame men runne pray lieth mā saieth sick euel taken awaye people dwel xxxiiij chapter come ye heithen heare take hede ye people herkē thou earth therin thou rounde cōpasse al groweth ther vpon lorde angrie al people displeasure kindled agaynst multitude curse slaye slayne shalbe cast body stincke euē hilles shalbe wet bloude starres heauen shalbe consumed heauen shal folde together like roll starres therof shall fall2 pet 3 b like leaues fall vynes fygetrees swearde saieth shalbe bathed heauen shal immediatly come downe vpon idumea vpon people haue cursed vengeaunce lordes swearde shalbe full bloude rustie fatnesse bloude lambes gootes fatnesse neeres wether lorde shal kyl great offringe bosra londe idumea shal vnicornes fall bulles giauntes londe shalbe washed bloude grounde corrupte fatnesse vnto also sion shal come daye vengeaunce god esa 63 yeare thyne owne iugdmentes shalbe recompensed thy floudes shalbe turned pytch thine earth brymstone therwith shal londe kyndled shal quenched daye ner night smoke euermore forth lie waist man shal go thorow thy londe euer pellicanes soph 2 b storkes great oules rauens shall haue possession dwell therein god shal sprede lyne desolacion vpon weye stone emptynes kinges called vpō shalbe none prince shalbe awaye thornes shal growe palace nettels thistle stronge holdes yt dragon maye haue pleasure therin maye courte estriches shal straunge visures monstruous beastes mete one another tren 4 b wylde kepe company together shal lamia lye haue hir lodginge shall hedghogge buylde digge home bringe forth yongeones shal kytes come together ech one like ioh 5 b deut 28seke thorow scripture lorde rede shal none thinges left shal one ner soch like fayle▪ mouth commaundeth doth sprete gather together fulfilleth vpon euer ye lot fallet dealeth line shal possesse enheritaunce generacion generacion dwel therin xxxv chapter bvt deserte wildernesse shal reioyse ye waist grounde shal glad florish lilly shal florish pleasauntly ioyful euer geuynge thankes ye glory libanus bewty charmel sarō shalbe geuen shal knowe honoure lorde magesty oure god therfore strength ye weake hō de heb 12 b deut 30 31 b conforte feble knee saye vnto fearful hert good chere feare beholde youre god cometh take vengeaunce rewarde god cometh owne self wil delyuer 〈…〉 shal eye blinde lightned eares deaff opened shal lame man leape herte domme mās tūge shal geue thankes wildernesse also shal welles springe floudes water deserte 〈…〉 drie grounde shal turne ryuers thurstie springes water dragon dwelt afore shal growe swete floures grene russhes shalbe footpathes comon stretes shalbe called holy waye vnclene person shal go thorow lorde shal go thē waye ignoraūt shal erre shalbe lyon rauyshinge beast shall come therin men shal go fre safe redemed lorde shal conuerte 〈…〉 come sion thankesgeuinge euerlastinge ioye shal haue pleasure gladnesse shalbe amōge sorow heuynes shal vanish awaye xxxvj chapter xiiij yeare kinge ezechias 〈…〉 came sennacherib kinge assirians downe laye sege vnto stronge city iuda kinge assiriās sent rabsaches lachis toward ierusalem agaynst kinge ezechias greuous hooste▪ set condite ouerpole waye goeth thorow ye fuller lōde came forth vnto eliachim helchias sonne presydent sobna scribe 〈…〉 ioah asaphs sonne secretary rabsaches sayde vnto te • ezechias greate kinge assiria sayeth thus vnto presumpcion thou trustest vnto thou thinkest peraduēture thou hast councel power ynough mayntene warre el wher trustest thou thou castest thi self fro lo thou puttest thy trust broken staff rede meane egipte leaneth vpon 〈…〉 goeth honde shuteth thorow euen pharao kinge egipte vnto thē trust yf thou woldest saye trust ye lorde oure god goodly god indede whose hie place aulteres ezechias toke downe commaunded iuda ierusalem worshipe aulter abyde thou hast made condicion lorde kinge assiriās shulde geue two thousande horse art thou able set mē vp seinge thou canst resist power smallest prynce lorde hath darrest thou trust yt charettes horse men egipte morouer thinkest thou yt come downe hither destroye londe lordes lorde sayde vnto go downe londe thou mayest destroye sayde eliachim sobna iohah vnto rabsaches speake v thy seruauntes praye sirians language vnderstonde well speake v iewes tunge lest folcke heare lieth vpon wall answered rabsaches thinke ye yt kinge sent speake vnto hath sent thē also lie vpō wall cōpelled eate owne donge drinke owne stale rabsaches stode stiff cried loude voyce iewes tūge sayde take hede greate kinge assiriās geueth warnynge thus saieth kinge let ezechias disceaue shal able delyuer morouer let ezechias comforte lorde saieth lorde doute shal defende v shal geue ouer cite hondes kinge assiriās beleue thus saieth kinge assiria opteyne fauoure enclyne maye euery mā enioye vynyardes fygetrees drinke water cisterne vnto tyme come bringe londe yt like youre owne wher wheat wyne sowen sede planted vynyardes let ezechias disceaue sayeth vnto lorde shal delyuer u might goddes gentile kepe euerymans londe 〈…〉 power kinge assirians wher god hemath arphad god sepharnaim able defende samaria honde goddes lōdes hath deliuered countre power lorde shulde delyuer ierusalem fro honde vnto ezechias messaungers helde tunges answered one worde kinge charged shulde geue none answere came eliachim elchias sonne presidēt sobna scrybe ioah asaphs sonne secretary vnto ezechias rente clothes tolde wordes rabsaches xxxvij chapter ezechias herde rente clothes put sack cloth4 19 went temple lorde sent eliachim presidēt sobna scrybe wt eldest prestes cloothed sack ione 3 vnto prophet esay sonne amos sayde vnto thus saieth ezechias daye trouble plage wrath like childe cometh byrth woman hath power bringe forth lorde thy god doute hath well considered wordes rabsaches lorde ye kinge assirians hath sent defie blaspheme lyuynge god soch wordes lorde ye god hath herde rightwell therfore lift vp ye prayer remnaunt yet left seruauntes kinge ezechias came esay esay gaue answere saie thus vnto youre lorde thus saieth lorde afrayde wordes thou hast herde wherwith kinge assiriās seruauntes haue blasphemed beholde cause wynde go ouer esa 31 b soone heareth shal go agayne countre distroye swerde rabsaches returned1 23 c founde ye kinge assiria layenge sege lobna vnderstonde departed lachis came rumoure yt taracha kinge ethiopia come forth warre agaynst kinge assiria herde yt sent messaungers kinge ezechias commaundement saye thus ezechias kinge iuda let thy god disceaue thou hopest sayest ierusalē shal geuē hondes kinge assiria thou knowest well kinges assiria haue handled londes haue subuerted hapest thou escape people gētiles progenitours cōquered deliuered eny tyme thorow goddes namely gozan haran rezeph4 17 childrē eden dwell thalassar kinge hemath kinge arphad kinge citie sepharnaim ena aua ezechias receaued ye lettre messaungers red went vp house lorde opened lettre ye lorde ezechias prayed lorde maner lorde hoostes thou god israel dwellest vpō cherubin batuc 2 c thou art god exo▪ 25 c gene 1 god kingdomes worlde thou hast created hauē earth encline thine eare lorde cōsidr • open thine eye lorde se pondre wordes sēnacherib hath sent embassage blaspheme lyuynge god true lorde kinges assiria haue cōquered kingdomes londes cast goddes fyre notwithstōdinge goddes workes men hondes wodd stone therfore haue destroyed delyuer v lorde oure god hondes sennacherib yt kingdomes earth maye knowe thou art ye lorde esay sonne amos sent vnto ezechias sayenge thus saieth ye lorde god israel thou hast made thy prayer vnto touchinge sennacherib answere lorde hath geuen concernynge despised art thou mocked doughter sion hath shaken heade doughter ierusalem zac 2 b matt 25 b thou sennacherib hast thou defied blaspemed agaynst whō hast thou lifted vp thy voyce act 9 exalted thy proude lokes euen agaynst holy one israel thou thy seruauntes hast blasphemed lorde thus holdest thou thy self couer hie mountaynes sydes libanus horsmen wil cut downe hie cedre tree fayrest fyrre tree vp heyth chefest timbre woddes yf water wil graue drynke water defence shal drie vp fete myne hooste yee saiest thou hast thou herde haue taken honde brought passe olde tyme wil also waist destroye bringe stronge city vnto heapes stone inhabitours shalbe like lame men brought feare confounded shalbe like grasse grene herbes felde like hay vpō house toppes wythereth fore growne vp knowe thy wayes thy goinge forth thy cōmynge home yee thy madnesse agaynst therfore thy furiousnesse agaynst thy pryde come wil put rynge ye nose bridle byt chawes turne aboute euē waye thou camest wil geue also token ezechias yeare shalt thou eate kepte stoare next yeare soch groweth thirde yeare ye shal sowe reape yee ye shal plante vynyardes enioye frutes therof soch house iuda escaped shal come together remnaunt shal take rote beneth bringe forth frute aboue escaped shal go ierusalē remnaunte mount sion shal gelousy lorde hoostes bringe passe therfore thus saieth lorde cōcernynge kinge assirians shall come citie shal shute arowe shall shilde hurte nether shal graue aboute waye came shal returne come citie saieth lorde wil kepe saue citie saieth myne owne seruaunte dauids sake thus angel went forth 〈…〉 slewe assirians hooste 〈…〉 clxxxv thousande men arose vp early ierusalē beholde laye ful deed body sennacherib kinge assirians brake vp dwelt niniue afterwarde chaunsed prayed tēple nesrah god adramalech sarazer owne sonnes slewe swearde fled londe ararat esarhadon sonne reigned xxxviij chapter longe afore ezechias deadsick 〈…〉 prophet esay sonne amos came vnto sayde thus commaundeth lorde set thyne house ordre thou must dye shalt escape ezechias turned face towarde wall prayed vnto lorde sayde remembre lorde haue walked treuth stedfast hert haue done thinge pleasaunt ezechias wepte sore thē sayde god vnto esay go speake vnto ezechias lorde god dauid thy father sendeth ye worde 〈…〉 haue herde thy prayer considred thy teares beholde put xv yeares mo vnto thy life delyuer citie also honde kinge assiria defende cite take token lorde 〈…〉 yt hath spoken beholde returne shadowe achas diall yt layed sonne bringe ten degree bacward sonne turned ten degree bacward descended afore thankesgeuynge ezechias kinge iuda wrote bene sicke recouered thought shulde haue gone gate hell best age haue wanted residue yeares spake within self shal neuer viset lorde god life shal neuer se man amonge dweller worlde myne age folden vp together taken awaye fro like sheperdes cotage lyfe hewen like weeuer cutteth webb whyl yet takinge rest hewed made ende one daie 〈◊〉 4 thought wolde haue lyued vnto morow brussed bone like lyon made ende one daye chatred like swalowe like crane mourned doue lift vp myne eye ye hight lorde sayde violence done vnto thou suertie shal speake say ethat maye doo yt maye lyue yeares yee bytternesse life verely lorde men must lyue bytternesse life must passe ouer therin thou raysest vp wakest lo wilbe wel content bytternes neuertheles cōuersacion hath pleased ye thou woldest make ende life thou hast cast synnes behynde thy backe 〈…〉 hell prayseth death doth magnifie go downe graue prayse thy treuth lyuynge yee lyuynge acknowlege like daye father telleth child thy faithfulnesse delyuer v lorde wil synge prayses thy house dayes oure life esay sayde take playster fyges laye vpon sore shal whole saide ezechias greate thinge shal go vp house lorde xxxix chapter tyme merodach baladā baladās sonne kinge babilon 〈…〉 sent lettres presentes ezechias vnderstode bene sick recouered agayne 〈…〉 ezechias glad therof shewed cōmodities treasure syluer golde spyces rootes precious oyles cubboordes treasure house one thinge ezechias house thorow kingdome let se thē came esay prophet kinge ezechias sayde vnto haue ye men sayde whence came vnto ezechias answered came farre countre vnto babilon esay sayde haue looked vpon thyne house ezechias answerde myne house haue sene thinge treasure shewed sayde esay vnto ezechias4 2 c vnderstōde worde lorde hoostes beholde tyme wil come euery thinge thine house thy progenitours haue layde vp stoare vnto daye shalbe caried babilon nothinge left behinde sayeth lorde yee parte thy sonnes shal come thou shalt get shalbe caried hence become gelded chamberlaines kinge babilons courte sayde ezechias esay god prospere owne councel thou hast tolde sayde morouer peace faithfulnesse tyme xl chapter good chere people good chere saieth youre god conforte ierusalem tell hir trauale ende hir offence pardoned hath receaued lordes honde sufficient correction hir synnes voyce crieth matt 3 mar 1 luc 3 c esa 57 e ioh 1 prepare ye waye lorde wyldernesse make straight ye path oure god deserte let valleis exalted euery mountayne hill layde lowe croked let made straight let rough place made playne feldes ioh 1 b glory lorde shal apeare flesh shal se ye mouth lorde hath spoken voyce spake crie psal 89 eccī 14 • iaco 1 b 1 pet 1 sayde shal crie spake flesh grasse bewtie rof floure felde grasse wytthered floure falleth awaye euen people grasse breath lorde bloweth vpon neuerthelesse whether grasse wyther matt 5 psal 32 b iaco 1 b 1 pet 2 b floure fade awaye yet worde oure god endureth euer morouer voyce cried thus go vp vnto hill sion thou bringest good tidinges lift vp thy voyce power thou preacher ierusalem lift vp without feare say vnto city iuda beholde youre god esa 6 • c beholde lorde euen almightie sha • come power beare rule arme beholde bringeth treasure workes go shal fede flock like hirdman esa 34 shal gather lambes together arme carie bosome shal kindly intreate beare yonge hath holden water fist hath ye herde ye neuer hath bene preached vnto sence begynnynge haue ye bene enfourmed sence foundacion ye earth layde sytteth vpon circle worlde inhabitours worlde cōparison greshoppers • sa 44 e spredeth heauēs coueringe stretcheth as▪ tent dwell bringeth prince nothinge iudges earth dust planted sowen agayne nether stocke rooted agayne earth soone bloweth vpon wither fade awaye like strawe whirle wynde wil ye licken shal like saieth holyone lift vp youre eye hie considre hath made thinges come greate heapes call name 〈…〉 nothinge hyd vnto greatnesse power strength might maye iacob thinke maye israel saye wayes hyd lorde god knoweth iudgmentes knowest thou hast thou herde euerlastinge god lorde made corner earth nether weery faynt wisdome comprehended geueth strength vnto weery power vnto faynte child weery faynt strongest men fall vnto haue lorde eye shal strength encreased 〈…〉 aegles wynges shal growe vpon runne shal fall go shal weery xlj chapter still ye londes herken vnto stronge ye people come hither shew youre cause go lawe together rayseth vp ye iuste rysinge sonne calleth go forth casteth downe people subdueth kinges maye throwe groūde swearde scatre like stuble bowe foloweth vpon goeth safely cometh footpath fete hath made created called generacions begynnynge euen lorde 〈…〉 first last beholde ye iles ye maye feare ye endes earth ye maye abasshed draw nye come hither euery man hath exorted neghboure brother bydden stronge smyth conforted moulder ironsmyth hammerman sayenge shalbe good fasten cast worke fastened nales shulde moued thou israel seruaunt iacob electe sede abrahā beloued led endes earth honde called farre saide vnto thou shalt seruaunt 〈…〉 haue chosen cast ye awaye afrayde wil ye lake behinde ye wil thy god strēgth ye helpe ye kepe ye right hōde myne beholde resist shal come confucion shame thine aduersaries shalbe destroyed brought naught seketh shal fynde thy destroyer shal perish shall vndertake make batell agaynst thy lorde god wil strength thy right honde euen saye vnto feare helpe afrayde thou litle worme iacob thou despysed israel helpe saieth lorde holyone israel thine avenger beholde wil make treadinge cart new flale yt thou mayest throsshe grynde mountaynes bringe hilles poulder thou shalt fanne wynde shal carie awaye whyrlwynde shal scatre thē thou shalt reioyse lorde shalt delite praysinge holyone israel thurstie poore seke water fynde none 〈…〉 tunge drie thurst 〈◊〉 3 • b 〈◊〉 ▪ 4 • c 〈◊〉 ▪ 44▪ geue saieth lorde god israel forsake bringe forth floudes hilles welles playne feldes turne ye wildernes ryuers drie londe condytes water plante wayst grounde tree cedre boxe myrre olyues drie set fyrre tree elmes hawthorne together yt altogether maye se marcke perceaue hertes considre honde lorde maketh thinges holyone israel bringeth passe stonde youre cause saieth lorde bringe forth youre strōgest grounde counceleth kinge iacob let goddes come forth selues shewe v thinges yt past let thē declare thē vnto v yt maye take herte knowe herafter ether let thē shewe v thinges come tel v shalbe done herafter shal knowe goddes shewe somthinge ether good bad wil knowlege ye tel beholde ye goddes naught yor makinge naught abhomination hath chosen neuertheles haue waked vp one north shal come another east shal call vpō name shal come prynces potter claye ye potter treadeth downe myre tolde yt afore wil confesse saye rightuous none sheweth declareth eny thinge none also heareth youre wordes beholde first graūte thē sion ierusalem euangelistes cōsidre one amonge thē yt prophecieth nether axe yt answereth one worde lo wicked vayne thinges also take honde yee wynde emptynesse ymages together xlij chapter beholde therfore seruaunt kepe self matt 3 • matt 12 • matt 17 • electe soule shalbe pacified geue sprete maye shewe forth iudgment equyte amonge gentile shal outcryer ner hie mynded person voyce shall herde ye stretes brussed rede shal breake smokinge flax shal quench faithfully truly shal geue iudgmēt shal nether ouersene ner haistie maye restore rightuousnesse vnto earth gētiles also shal kepe lawes esa 44 • esa 40 f thus saieth god lorde vnto euen made heauens spred abrode set forth earth hir encrease geueth breath vnto people dwel therin lorde haue called ye rightuousnesse led honde therfore wil also defende geue couenaunt people light gētiles thou mayest open eye blinde let prysoners esa 49 • luc 2 c zac 9 b syt darknesse dongeon house self whose name lorde geue power none nether myne honoure goddes shewe new tidinges tel come olde thinges also come passe synge therfore vnto lorde psa 149 • new songe thākes geuynge blow prayse vnto ende worlde vpon see therin prayse iles dwel let wildernes hir city lift vp hir voyce townes also cedar let glad syt vpon rockes stone let crie downe hie mountaynes ascribinge almightynes vnto lorde magnifienge amonge gētiles lorde shal come forth gyaunte take stomacke like fresh man warre shal roare crie ouercome enemy haue longe holden peace saieth lorde shulde therfore still kepe sylence euer crie like trauelinge woman wil destroye deuoure wil make waist mountayne hill drie vp euery grene thinge groweth theron wil drie vp floudes water drinke vp ryuers wil bringe blinde strete knowe lede fotepath ignoraunt shal make darknesse light thē thinge yt croked straight thinges do▪ forget therfore let conuerte esa 44 b shamed earnestly hope idol saye fashioned ymages ye oure godes heare ye deaf men sharpen youre sightes se ye blinde matt 15 b blynder thē seruaunt deaf messaungers sent vnto blynde people yt haue rule like yf thou vnderstodest moch keptest nothinge yf one herde well obedient lorde merciful vnto rightuousnesse sake worde might magnified praysed myscheuous wiked people yonge men belonge snare shalbe shut preson house shal caried awaye captyue man shal lowse deut 28 shal trodē vnder fote • sa 44 man shal laboure bringe thē agayne amonge yt pondreth mynde yt considreth taketh warnynge tyme come suffred iacob trodden vnder fote • aruc 1 • obi 3 dan 9 israel spoyled dyd lorde haue synned agaynst haue delite walke wayes nether bene obedient vnto lawe therfore hath poured vpon v wroothful displeasure strōge batell maketh v haue euery syde yet vnderstōde burneth v vp yet syncketh oure harte xliij chapter bvt lorde made iacob fashioned israel saieth thus • sa 41 b • 17 g deut 7 deu 26 ose 1 b • xo 14 • dan 3 feare defende ye haue called ye thy name thou art myne owne thou wentest water strō ge floudes shulde pluck ye awaye thou walkest fyre shal burne ye flame shall kindle vpon lorde thy god holyone israel thy sauioure gaue egipte ye delyueraunce moryās sabees thou wast deare sight set loued 〈…〉 pilled men delyuered vp people thy sake thou shuldest feare 〈…〉 wil bringe thy sede east gather together west wil saye north let go south kepe backe bringe sonnes farre doughters endes worlde namely called name thē haue created fashioned made myne honoure bringe forth people whether haue eye blynde deaf haue eares 〈…〉 nacions shal come one gathered one people amonge yonder goddes shall declare soch thinges tell v come let bringe witness shal fre thē men shal heare saye truth bringe witness saith lorde euen seruauntes haue chosen intent ye might certified geue faithful credence yee cō sidre neuer eny god shalbe none lorde 〈…〉 without sauioure geue warnynge make whole teach shulde straunge god amonge recorde must ye beare youre selues saieth lorde god euen begynnynge none 〈…〉 take eny thinge honde man chaunge thus saieth lorde holyone israel youre redemer 〈…〉 youre sake sende babilon bringe strongest thence namely caldees boost shippes euen lorde youre holy one haue made israel youre kinge morouer thus saieth lorde euen maketh waye see 〈…〉 footpath mightie water bringeth forth charettes horse hooste power maye fall slepe neuer ryse extincte like tow quenched ye remembre thinges olde 〈…〉 regarde nothinge past therfore beholde shal make new thinge shortly shall apeare ye shall well knowe tolde afore tell agaane make stretes deserte ryuers water wildernesse wilde beastes shal worshippe dragon estrich shall geue water ye wildernesse 〈…〉 streames deserte maye geue drīke people chose people haue made self shal shewe forth prayse thou iacob woldest call vpon thou haddest vnlust towarde israel thou gauest thy yonge beastes burnt offringes nether didest honoure thy sacrifice thou boughtest deare spice thi money nether pouredest fat thy sacrifice vpon howbeit haue bene chargeable vnto offrī ge • b 〈…〉 〈◊〉 4 • b 〈◊〉 • 2 c 〈◊〉 ▪ 43 b avenger ye lorde hoostes first last without god euer like euerlastinge let shewe name wherthorow maye lickened vnto let tell forth planely thīges past come yee without eny feare stoppe haue euer tolde hytherto warned ye beare recorde youreselues eny god excepte eny maker shulde knowe wherfore caruers idol vayne laboure lost must beare recorde selues seinge nether se ner vnderstonde shalbe confounded shulde make god esa 42 b fashiō idol profitable nothinge beholde felashippe thē must brought confucion psal 113 b sap 13 c let workmasters come stonde together amonge men must abashed confoūded one another smyth taketh yron tempreth hote cole fashioneth hammer maketh wt strength armes yee somtyme faynt hunger thurstie hath power carpenter ymage caruer taketh tymbre spredeth forth lyne marketh coloure playneth ruleth ād squareth maketh ymage man acordinge bewtie man maye stonde temple morouer goeth hewe downe cedre tree bringeth home elmes okes tymbre wodd el fyrretrees planted ād soch rayne hath swelled wodde serueth mē burne taketh warmeth withall maketh fyre bake bred warde maketh god honoure idol knele one pece burneth fyre another rosteth flesh maye eate roste bely full thirde warmeth saieth ha well warmed haue bene fyre residue maketh god idol kneleth worshippeth prayeth vnto sayeth delyuer thou art god yet men nether considre ner vnderstonde eye stopped esa 42 • se hertes perceaue pondre myndes haue nether knowlege ner vnderstōdinge thinke thus haue brēt one pece fyre haue baked bred wt ye 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 cole haue rosted flesh withall eaten shal residue make abhominacion fall downe rotten pece wodd kepinge dust folishnesse herte hath turned syde none haue fre conscience thinke maye ierre cōsidre iacob israel thou art seruaūt haue made thou mightest serue israel forget thyne offence • sa 43 dryue awaye like cloudes thy synnes myst turne ye agayne vnto delyuer ye glad ye heauens lorde hath made let yt beneth vpon earth ioyfull reioyse ye mountaynes woddes tree ye lorde shal redeme iacob shewe glory vpon israel thus saieth lorde thy redemer euen fashioned thy mother wombe • om 11 gen 1 • sa 4 c lorde thinges self alone haue spred heauens haue layde foundacion earth destroye token witch make sothsayers go wronge wise turne bacward make conninge folishnesse set vp purpose seruauntes fulfil councel messaūgers saye ierusalē turne agayne city iuda ye buylded agayne repayre decayed place saye grounde drie drie vp thy water floudes saye cirus thou art myne hyrd man shal fulfill thinges • saye ierusalem thou buylded tēple thou fast grounded xlv chapter thus saieth lorde vnto cirus anoynted esd 1 ledeth ye right hō de people maye fall downe wil lowse gyrdle kinges yt shal open gate thy face shut dores wil go make croked straight shal breake brasen dores burst yron barres shall geue hyd treasure thinge secretly kepte thou mayest knowe yt god israel haue called thy name • en 39 iacob seruaunt sake israel chosen called ye name ordened euer thou knewest • sa 43 b euen lorde none wt god haue prepared euer thou knewest • ere 1 might knowne risynge sonne goinge downe nothinge without lorde el none 〈…〉 yt created light darcknes make peace trouble yee euen lorde thinges heauens aboue shal droppe downe cloudes shal rayne rightuousnes earth shal open self brynge forth health therby shal rightuousnes florish euen lorde shal bringe passe wo vnto chydeth wt maker potsherde potter 〈…〉 saieth ye claye potter makest thou yi worke serueth nothīge wo vnto yt saieth father begettest thou mother bearest thou thus saieth lorde euen holy one maker israel axe thinges come concernynge sonnes put remē braunce touchinge workes hō de haue made earth created mā vpon hondes haue spred forth heauen geuen commaundment hooste therof shal wake vp rightuousnesse ordre wayes 〈…〉 shal buylde cite let prisoner nether gift rewardes saieth lorde hoostes lorde hath sayde morouer occupier egipte marchauntes moryans sabees shal come vnto tribute shabethine shal folowe go cheynes vpon fete shal fall downe make supplicacion vnto god wt whō none god shal 〈…〉 profounde art thou god thou god sauioure israel confounded ye put dishonoure go hence together shame ye workmasters erroure worshipper idol israel shalbe saued lorde euerlastinge saluaciō shal come shame ner confucion worlde without ende thus sayeth lorde euen created heauen god yt made earth 〈…〉 fashioned set forth haue made naught made enhabited euen lorde without none 〈…〉 haue spoken secretly nether darcke place earth naught sayde vnto sede iacob seke lorde whē speake declare thinge rightuous true let thē gathered come together let thē drawe nye hyther yt escaped people haue eny vnderstondinge set vp without none god true god sauioure 〈◊〉 44 b el none therfore turne vnto ye endes earth shal ye saued god el none sweare mouth cōmeth ye worde rightuousnesse maye man turne knee shal bowe vnto tunges
