〈◊〉 5 neuertheles bel shal fall nabo shalbe broken whose ymages burthē beastes catell ouerlade thē make weery shal syncke downe fall together maye ease burthen therfore must go captiuyte herken vnto house iacob ye remayne yet housholde israel haue borne youre mother wombe brought vp yor byrth till ye growen shall beare vnto youre last age haue made also norish beare saue ye make like fashion ymage 〈◊〉 44 • 〈◊〉 3 • maye like ye fooles doute wil take syluer golde youre purse weye hyre goldsmyth make god men maye knele downe worshipe yet must taken men shulders borne 〈◊〉 44 c 〈…〉 c set place maye stonde moue ala men shulde crie vnto geueth answere delyuereth man calleth vpon trouble considre well ashamed go youre owne selues ye runnagates remembre thinges past sence begynnynge worlde god el god yee yt nothinge like vnto begynnynge thinge shewe ende therof tel thinges yet come passe one worde deuyce accomplished fulfilleth pleasure call byrde east exo 16 c take honde farre countrees soone commaunde bringe hither soone thinke deuyse thinge psal 148 32 b heare ye hie stomack farre rightuousnesse shal bringe forth rightuousnesse farre health shal tarie longe awaye wil laye health siō geue israel glory xlvij chapter bvt doughter thou virgin babilon thou shalt syt dust thou shalt syt vpon groūde atr one thou mayden chaldea thou shalt nomore called tender pleasaūt thou shalt bringe forth querne grynede meel put downe thy stomacher make bare thy knee shalt wade thorow water ryuers thy shame shalbe discouered eze 16 nau 3 b ād thy preuyties shal sene wil auenge man shal let saieth oure redemer called lorde hoostes holy one israel syt still holde thy tunge get darcke corner doughter caldea thou shalt nomore called lady kyngdomes wroth people yt punyshed myne enheritaunce pro 21 b iere 50 b gaue thy power neuertheles thou shewdest mercy euen aged men thē didest thou oppresse right sore thy yock thou thoughtest thus shalbe lady euer besyde thou hast regarded thinges nether cast shulde come heare therfore thou wilful syttest carelesse esa 10 b apo 18 c speakest thus thine herte alone without none shal neuer wydow ner desolate agayne yet thīges shal come vpō one daye twincklinge eye namely wyddowhead desolacion dani 5 c shal mightely fall vpon ye multitude thy witch greate heape thy coniurers thou hast conforted thy self thy disceatfulnes hast sayde mā seith thyne owne wisdome connynge haue disceaued esa 29 c thou hast sayde alone without none therfore shal trouble come vpō ye thou shalt knowe whēce shal arise myschefe shal fall vpō ye thou shalt able put sodane misery shal come vpon euer thou awarre go thy coniurers multitude thy witch thou hast bene acquanted withal thi youth yf maye helpe strengthē thou hast hither many councels let heauengasers beholder starres come delyuer yee let thē shewe new thinges shall come vpon beholde shalbe like strawe yf kindled fyre man maye rydde vehemence flame yet geueth zynders warme mā ner cleare fyre syt euen shal vnto thou hast vsed occupide thy youth euery one shal shewe yt erroneous waye yet shall none defende xlviij chapter heare thou house iacob ye yt called name israel come one stocke wt iuda sweare name lorde • phe 2 b • sa • 1 c • erem 3 f beare witnesse god israel wt treuth right called fre men holy citie loke conforth god israel whose name lorde hoostes thinges shewed euer sence begynnynge haue brought thē passe immediatly came mouth declared come howbeit knewe thou art obstinate thy neck hath yron vane thy brow brasse neuertheles haue euer sence begynnynge shewed thinges come declared thē vnto euer came passe thou shuldest saye myne idol hath done carued cast ymage hath shewed heare considre thinges whether ye prophecied thē tolde begynnynge new secrete thinges yt thou knewest done olde time esa 37 f wherof thou neuer herdest brought passe thou canst saye knewe morouer wherof thou hast nether herde ner knowne nether haue bene opened vnto thine eares afore tyme knew thou woldest maliciousli offende therfore haue called transgressoure euen thy mother wombe neuertheles name sake haue withdrawen wrath myne honoursake haue ouersene haue rooted beholde haue pourged moneye haue chosen fyre pouerte myne owne sake 〈…〉 geue myne honoure none thou shuldest despise herken vnto iacob 〈…〉 israel whō haue called euen ye first last 〈…〉 honde foundacion earth right honde spanneth ouer heauens soone called thē gather together ād herken yonder goddes hath declared lorde wil kinge babilon loueth fauoureth caldees arme▪ self alone haue tolde yee shal call bringe forth geue prosperous iourneye come nye heare 〈…〉 haue spokē eny thīge darckly sence begynnynge whē thīge begynneth wherfore lorde god sprete hath sent thus saieth lorde thine avenger holyone israel 〈…〉 ye lorde thy god teach profitable thinges lede ye waye thou shuldest go yf thou wilt regarde cōmaundement thy welthynes shalbe water streame thy rightuousnes wawes flowinge see thysede shalbe like sonde see frute thy body like grauel stone therof thy name shal roted destroyed ye shal go awaye babilon escape caldees mery voyce 〈…〉 shalbe spoken declared abrode go forth vnto ende worlde shalbe sayde lorde hath defended seruaunte iacob suffred thurste 〈…〉 whē trauayled wildernesse claue rockes sonder water gusshed vngodly haue peace 〈…〉 saieth lorde messias xlix chapter herken vnto ye iles take hede ye people farre lorde hath called fro byrth made mēcion name fro mother wōbe hath made mouth like sharpe swerde 〈…〉 vnder ye shadowe honde hath defended hyd quyuer good arowe sayde vnto thou art seruaunt israel wilbe honoured 〈…〉 answerde shal lese laboure shal spende strength vayne neuertheles wil commytte cause worke vnto lorde god saieth lorde euē fashioned fro mother wombe seruaūte maye bringe iacob agayne vnto howbeit israel gathered vnto hī agayne whose sight greate also lorde god strēgth let smal thinge thou art seruaunt set vp kinreddes iacob restore destructiō israel 〈…〉 yf make also light gentile thou mayest health vnto ende worlde morouer thus saieth lorde avē ger holy one israel abhorringe despisinge amonge gentile concernynge seruaunt yt beare rule kynges prynces shal se arise worshipe lorde faithfull holy one israel hath chosen 〈…〉 thus saieth lorde tyme apoynted wil present houre health wil helpe delyuer wil make pledge ye people yt thou shalt helpe vp earth agayne chalenge agayne scatred heretages 〈…〉 thou mayest saye ye presoners go forth darknesse come light maye fede hie wayes get lyuynge place shal nether hunger ner thirste heate sonne hurte 〈…〉 fauoureth shal lede geue drī ke springe welles make wayes vpon mountaynes fote pathes shalbe exalted beholde shal come farre lo seme north west 〈…〉 south reioyse ye heauens synge prayses thou earth talke ioye ye hilles god wil cōforte people haue mercy vpon yt trouble shal sion saye god hath forsaken lorde hath forgottē doth wife forget childe hir wombe 〈…〉 ād sonne whō hath borne though forget yet wil forget beholde haue written vp vpon hondes thy walles euer sight haue broken downe shal make haist buylde vp agayne made waist shal dwell lift vp thine eye loke aboute 〈…〉 shal gather together come truly lyue saieth lorde thou shalt put vpō apparell gyrde thē bryde doth hir iewels thy londe lieth desolate waisted destroyed shalbe narow thē shal dwell yt wolde deuoure shalbe farre waye childe whō ye barē shall bringe forth vnto ye shal saye thine eare place narow syt nye together yt maye haue rowme shalt thou thinke thy self hath begottē seinge barē alōe captyue outcast hath norished thē vp desolate alone frō whēce come therfore thus saieth lorde god beholde stretch myne honde gentile set vp token people shal bringe thy sonnes lappes carie thy doughters vnto ye vpon shulders kinges shalbe thy noursinge father quenes shalbe thy noursinge mother shal fall wt face flat vpon earth lick vp dust thy fete thou mayest knowe lorde ro 9 putteth trust shal confounded spoyleth giaunte pray taketh presoner mightie therfore thus saieth lorde prisoner shalbe taken giaunte spoyle delyuered violēte wil maynteyne thy cause agaynst thine aduersaries saue thy sonnes wil fede thine enemy owne fleshe make thē drinke owne bloude swete wyne flesh shal knowe iacob lorde thy sauioure stronge auenger chap thus saieth lorde bill yor mother deuorcemēt sent vnto vsurer iere 3 whō solde beholde youre owne offēces ye solde youre transgression esa • 9 youre mother forsakē wolde mā receaue came called man gaue answere hōde clene smytē might helpe power delyuer lo exo 14 c iosu 3 worde drī ke vp see water floudes make drie lōde yt want water fish corruppe die thurst heauen exo 10 • clooth darcknesse put sack vpon lorde god hath geuē wel lerned tūge conforte troubled yee yt due season2 cor 1 • waked myne eare vp tymes ye mornynge ye scolemasters yt might herkē lorde god hath opened myne eare therfore cā saye naye ner wtdrawe psal 39 b iob 30 mat 26 g heb 13 • offre backe vnto ye smyters chees nyppers turne face frō shame ād spittinge lorde god helpeth therfore shal cōfounded haue hardened face like flynt stone sure shal come confucion myne aduocate speaketh wil go lawe let v stō de one agaynst another yf eny wil reason let come forth ro • f beholde lorde god stondeth condempne lo shalbe like olde cloth ye mothes shal eate vp psalm 101 therfore feareth lorde amō ge let heare voyce seruaūt walketh darcknesse light shyneth vpō let hope lorde holde god take hede ye haue kyndled fyre gyrded youre selues flame ye walke glistrī ge youre owne fyre flame ye haue kyndled cometh vnto fro honde namely yt ye shal slepe sorowe li chapter herken vnto ye holde rightuousnes ye seke lorde take hede vnto stone wherout ye hewen graue wherout ye digged considre abraham youre father sara bare gen 21 rom 4 gen 12 called alone prospered wel encreased lorde heauens layde foundacion earth thou art euer afrayde sight thyne oppressoure ready harme wrath oppressoure cometh fast maketh haist apeare shal perish yt shulde able destroye nether shal fayle faute art people awake awake stonde vp ierusasalem 〈…〉 thou honde lorde hast dronkē cuppe wrath thou hast supped sucked slombringe cuppe botome amonge sonnes thou hast begotten one maye holde vp one lede honde sonnes thou hast norished thinges happened vnto sory yee destruction waistinge hunger swerde hath conforted thy sonnes lie comfortles ye heade euery strete like takē venyson ful ye te • rible wrath ye lorde punyshmēt thy god therfore thou miserable dronkē howbeit wt wyne heare thus saieth thy lorde thy lorde god ye defender people beholde wil take ye slō brīge cuppe thy hōde euē ye cuppe wt dregges wrath yt frō hence forth thou shalt neuer drinke wil put ī hōde trouble haue spoken thy soule stoupe downe maye go ouer make thy body eauē grounde strete go vpon lij chapter vp sion vp take thy strength vnto put thine honest rayment ierusalē thou citie holy one tyme forth shal vncircumcised ner vncleane person come shake frō dust arise stonde vp ierusalē pluck thy neck bōde thou captyue doughter sion thus saieth lorde ye solde naught 〈…〉 therfore shal ye redemed also without eny money thus hath lorde sayde people wēte downe afore tyme egipte 〈…〉 straungers afterwarde dyd kinge assirians oppresse thē naught profit saieth ye lorde yt people frely caried awaye brought heuynes ruler 〈…〉 name euer still blasphemed saieth lorde yt people maye knowe name 〈…〉 self speake daye beholde bewtiful fete embassitoure yt bringeth message frō mountayne 〈…〉 proclameth peace yt brīgeth good tydinges preacheth health saieth vnto sion thy god kinge thy watchmē shal earth maketh frutefull grene maye geue corne breade vnto sower worde also commeth mouth shal turne agayne voyde vnto shal accōplish wil prospere thinge wherto sende shal ye go forth wt ioye led peace wryth heade aboute like hoke hairy cloth lye vpon earth shulde called fastinge daye yt pleaseth ye lorde fastinge pleaseth deu 15 till ye tyme thou lowse bondage thy daunger thou breake ooth wicked bargaynes thou let oppressed go fre take maner burthen pleaseth till thou deale thy bred hongrie eze 18 b mat 25 b brynge poore fatherlesse home thy house thou seist naked thou couer hyde thy face shortened yt helpe 〈…〉 nether eare stopped yt maye heare yor myszdedes haue separated yor god yor synnes hyde face yt heareth yor hondes defyled bloude 〈…〉 yor fyngers wt vnrighteousnesse yor lippes cockatrice egges weeue ye spyders webb eateth egges dieth yf one treade vpon thē cōmeth vp serpent webbe maketh clothe maye couer thē wt labour dedes ye dedes wickednes ye worke robbery hōdes fete runne euell make haist shed innocēt bloude 〈…〉 coū cels wicked coūcels harme destrucciō wayes ye waye peace knowe goinges equyte wayes croked yt euer goeth therin knoweth nothinge peace ye cause yt equite farre frō v yt rightuousnes cōmeth nye v 〈…〉 loke light lo darknesse ye mornynge shyne se walke ye darke grope like ye blynde vpon ye wall grope euen one yt hath none eye stomble ye noone daye though toward night ye fallinge place like men yt half deed roare like beeres mourne stil like doues loke equite none health farre frō v offence many ye synnes testifie agaynst v yee must downe ye fote thou shalt called cite lorde holy sion israel thou hast bene forsakē hated noman went thorow wil make glorious euer euer ād ioyful thorow posterity thou shalt sucke mylck gentile esa 49 • kinges brestes shal fede thou shalt knowe lorde thy sauioure defender mighty one iacob brasse wil geue golde yron syluer wod brasse stone yron wil make peace thy ruler rightuousnes thyne officer violence robbery shal neuer herde thy londe nether harme destruction thy border thy walles shalbe called health apo 21 g thy gate prayse god sonne shal neuer thy daye light ād light moone shal neuer shyne vnto apo 22 b ye lorde shalbe thy euerlastinge light thy god shalbe thy glory thy sonne shal neuer go downe thy moone shal taken awaye lorde shalbe thy euerlastinge light ād thy sorouful dayes shalbe rewarded ye thy people shalbe godly possesse londe euer floure plantinge worke hondes wherof wil reioyce yongest leest shal growe thousande symplest stronge people lorde shal shortly bringe thinge passe tyme lxj chapter sprete lorde god wt luc 7 c luc 4 c esa 11 ye lorde hath anoynted sent esa 66 esa 57 c preach good tydīges vnto poore yt might bynde vp ye wounded hertes yt might preach delyueraunce ye captyue open preson thē bounde yt might declare ye acceptable yeare ye lorde daye ye avēgeaunce oure god might comforte heuynesse matt • matt 11 might geue vnto yt mourne sion bewty steade asshes ioyful oyntmēt sighinge pleasaunt raymēt heuy mīde might called excellent rightuousnesse plātinge lorde reioyce esa 60 shal buylde lōge rough wildernes set vp ye olde deserte shal repayre waist place soch haue bene voyde thorow many generaciōs straūgers shal stōde fede yor catel aleauntes shalbe yor plowmē reaper ye shalbe named prestes lorde mē shall call seruaūtes oure god esa 66 iere 33 ye shall enioye goodes ye gētiles tryūphe substaūce yor greate reprofe shame shal haue ioye yt ye maye haue parte wt thē shal haue dubble possession ī lōde euerlastinge ioye shalbe wt luc 2 lorde loue right ād hate robbery though offred shal make workes ful faithfulnes make euerlastinge couenaunt sede also generacion shal knowne amōge gentile amōge people se shall knowe hie blessed sede ye lorde therfore ioyful lorde soule reioyseth god psal 131 b shall put vpon garmēt health couer mātle rightuousnes shal decke like brydegrome bryde hath hir apparell vpō like ye grounde bringeth forth frute gardē shuteth forth sede shal lorde god cause rightuousnes feare god florish forth heithen lij chapter sion sake therfore wil holde tūge ierusalēs sake ceasse vntill rightuousnes breake forth ye shyninge light health burnynge lampe shal gētiles se thy rightuousnesse kinges thy glory thou shalt named new name mouth ye lorde shal shewe thou shalt crowne honde lorde glorious garlāde hōde thy god tyme forth thou shalt neuer called forsakē thy lōde shal nomore called wildernesse thou shalt called hephziba beloued ye londe beula maried womā 〈…〉 ye lorde loueth ye thy lōde shalbe inhabited like yonge mā taketh doughter mariage shal god mary vnto ye sonnes brydegrome glad bryde shal god reioyse ouer wil set watchmē vpō thy walles ierusalem shall nether ceasse daye night preach ye lorde ye also shall kepe close leaue speake hī vntill ierusalē set vp made prayse worlde lorde hath sworne right honde stronge arme frō hence forth wil geue thy corne meate thine enemy ner ye wyne wherī thou hast laboured drynke ye straungers haue gathered corne shal eate geue thankes lorde haue borne wyne shall drynke court sanctuary stōde back departe sunder ye yt stonde vnder ye gate make rowme ye people repayre strete take awaye ye stone set tokē people beholde ye lorde proclameth endes worlde 〈…〉 tel ye doughter siō se thy saluaciō cometh beholde bringeth treasure wt workes go whō ye lorde delyuereth shalbe called holy people thou shalt named greatly occupied forsaken lxiij chapter cometh edom stayned reade clothes bosra costly cloth cometh neēbly strēgth yt teacheth rightuousnes power helpe wherfore thē thy clothinge reade thy raymēt like yt treadeth ye wyne presse haue troddē presse self alone people one 〈…〉 thus haue trodē downe myne enemy wrath set fete vpō indignacion bloude sprange vpō cloothes haue stayned rayment daye vengeaūce haue takē honde yeare delyueraunce come loked aboute mā shewe eny helpe fel downe man helde vp thē helde myne owne arme feruētnesse susteyned thus haue troden downe people wrath bathed displeasure moch haue shed bloude vpon earth declare goodnesse lorde 〈…〉 yee prayse lorde hath gyuen v greate good yt hath done israel hath gyuen owne fauoure acordinge multitude louynge kindness sayde doute wilbe people shrēkinge child sauioure 〈…〉 trouble forsoke thē angel went forth presence delyuered loue kindnesse vnto redemed hath borne caried vp euer sence worlde begāne prouoked wrath vexed holy minde enemie fought agaynst self yet remēbred olde tyme moses people brought water see 〈◊〉 14 c 〈◊〉 76 b shepherde doth shepe geuen holy sprete amonge led moses right honde glorious arme deuyded water wherby gat self euerlastinge name led depe horse led playne shulde stomble sprete lorde led tame beast goeth felde thus god hast thou led thy people make thy self glorious name loke downe heauē 〈…〉 beholde dwellinge place thy sanctuary thy glory yt thy gelousy thy strength multitude thy mercy thy louynge kyndnesse wyl entreated v yet art thou father 〈…〉 abraham knoweth v nether israel acquanted v thou lorde art oure father redemer 〈…〉 thy name euer lastinge lorde wherfore hast thou led v thy waye wherfore hast thou hardened oure hertes feare one v agayne thy seruauntes sake yt generaciō thy heretage thy people hath litle thy sanctuary possessiō oure enemy haue takē become euen beginnynge thou art lorde haue called vpon thy name lxiiij chapter thou woldest cleue heauen sonder come downe mountaynes might melt awaye thy presence like hore fyre malicious might boyle water doth vpon fyre wherby thy name might knowne amō ge thine enemy yt gētiles might trē ble ye thou mightest come downe thy wonderous straunge workes shulde hilles melt thy presence sence begynnynge worlde none excepte thou god herde perceaued1 cor 2 b▪ nether hath eny eye sene thou dost thē put trust thou helpest doth right cherefulnesse thynke vpon thy wayes lo thou art angrie offende haue bene euer synne one whole ro 3 b psal 13 vnclene thinge oure rightuousnesses clothes stayned floures woman fall euerychone leaf oure synnes carie v awaye like wynde man calleth vpon thy name stondeth vp take holde therfore hydest thou thy face v consumest v oure synnes lorde thou father matt 6 b iere 18 b ro 9 c eccī 33 b iere 10 psal 78 iere 26 claye thou art oure potter worke thy hondes sore displeased lorde kepe oure offence lōge thy remembraunce considre thy people city thy sanctuary lye waist sion wildernesse ierusalem deserte mich 3 c oure holy house oure bewty oure father praysed brent vp yee oure cōmodities pleasure waysted awaye wilt thou intreated lorde wilt thou holde thy peace scourge v sore lxv chapter shal seke hitherto haue axed shal fynde esa 52 ro 10 hither haue sought shal saye immediatly people neuer called vpon name thus longe haue euer holden hondes vnfaithful people go right waye owne ymaginacions people euer defyenge face deut 12 deut 14 b seruauntes shall drynke ye shal suffre thurste beholde seruauntes shal mery ye shal cō founded beholde seruauntes shal reioyse quietnesse herte •• cob 4 b ye shal crie sorow hert cōplayne vexacion mynde youre name shal sworne amonge chosen god lorde shal slaye call seruauntes another name •• 9 • cor 1 • cor 11 reioyseth vpō earth shall reioyse true god sweareth vpō earth shal sweare true god olde enemite shalbe forgotten taken awaye sight lo shal make new heauē • pet 3 b • po 21 new earth olde shall neuer thought vpō ner kepte mynde mē shalbe glad euermore reioyse thinges shall beholde shal make ioyfull ierusalē yee reioyse ierusalem • po 21 glad people voyce wepinge waylinge shall herde thēce forth shall neuer childe ner olde man haue full dayes whē childe cometh hūderth yeare olde shall dye yf hūderth yeare age wronge shalbe cursed 〈…〉 shal buylde house dwel shal plante vynyardes eate frute shall buylde another possesse shall plante another eate 〈…〉 life people shalbe like tre shal worke hondes chosen shal lyue longe shall laboure vayne ner beget wt trouble hie blessed sede lorde frutes shalbe euer call shal answere 〈…〉 whyle yet thinkinge speake shal heare wolff lambe shal fede together lyon shal eate haye like bullocke earth shalbe serpētes meate 〈…〉 shal man hurte ner slaye another holy hill saieth lorde lxvj chapter thus saieth lorde heauē seate earth fote stole 〈…〉 shal house stonde yt ye buylde vnto shal place yt wil dwel thinges hōde hath made created saieth lorde shal regarde euē lowly troubled sprete stōdeth awe wordes slayeth oxe doth greate dishonoure yt kylleth mā kylleth shepe choketh dogge bringeth meat offringes offreth swynes bloude maketh memoriall incense prayseth thinge yt vnright yet take soch wayes honde soule deliteth abhominacions therfore wil also haue pleasure laughinge scorne 〈…〉 thinge feare wil bringe vpon thē called man gaue answere spake wolde heare dyd wickednesse myne eye chose thinges displease heare worde god ye feare thinge speaketh youre brother hate cast name sake saye let lorde magnifie maye se youre gladnesse yet shalbe cōfounded touchinge cite temple 〈…〉 heare voyce lorde rewarde recompēce enemy like wife bringeth forth man childe euer suffre payne byrth anguysh ye trauayle euer herde sawe soch thinges doth grounde beare one daye people borne sion beareth sonnes thussayeth lorde maketh beare beare self beareth maketh baren 〈…〉 saieth thy god reioyse ierusalem glad ye loue ioyful ye mourned ye shal sucke cōforte hir brestes satisfied ye shal taist haue delite plenteousnesse hir power thus sayeth lorde beholde wil let peace ī like water floude yt might heithē like flowinge streame shal ye sucke ye shal borne vpon hir sydes ioyful vpō hir knee like childe comforted mother shal conforte ye shalbe comforted ierusalem 〈…〉 ye se youre herte shal reioyse youre bone shal florish like herbe thus shal honde lorde knowne amonge seruauntes indignacion amonge enemy beholde lorde shal come wt fyre charet shal like whyrlwynde maye recompence vengeaunce wrath indignacion flame fyre ye lorde shal iudge flesh fyre swerde shalbe greate nombre slayne lorde soch haue made themselues holy cleane garden haue eaten swyne flesh myce abhominaciōs shal betaken awaye together saieth lorde wil come gather people tonges workes ymaginacions shal come se glory vnto shal geue tokē sende certayne thē delyuered amonge gentile celicia africa lidia men handle bowes italie also greke londe iles farre esa 61 52 60 65 haue herde speake haue sene glory shal preach prayse amonge gentile shal bringe youre brethrē offringe vnto lorde al people vpō horse charettes horse lytters vpō mooles carte ierusalem holy hill saieth lorde like child israel bringe offringe offended miszfortune fell vpon saieth lorde heare therfore worde lorde thou house iacob generacion house israel thus saieth ye lorde vnto vnfaithfulnesse founde youre father wente farre awaye fro fallinge lightnesse beinge vayne thought hertes haue left lorde yt brought v lōde egipte exo 14 c yt led v thorow wildernesse thorow deserte roughlonde thorow drie deedly londe yee londe man gone people hath geuen ouer hie honoure thinge maye helpe astonished ye heauens afrayde abashed soch thinge saieth lorde people hath done two euels haue forsakē well water life ba • uc 3 b iere 17 c ioh 4 taphanes haue defyled thy necke cōmeth vnto thou hast forsaken lorde thy god iere 32 c euer sence led waye hast thou ye strete egipte drinke foule water ether makest thou waye assiria drinke water good rote esa • ▪ art thou turned bytter vnfrutefull straunge grape yee sore though thou wasshest nitrus makest thiself sauoure swete smellinge herbe borith yet sight thou art stayned thy wickednesse saieth lorde thy god saye vnclene haue folowed goddes • ere 3 b • 17 b • ere 5 b isa 5 • 〈◊〉 16 b loke vpō thyne owne way woddes valleis dennes shalt thou knowe thou hast done thou art like swift dromedary goeth easely waye thy wantonnes like wilde asse vseth wildernesse snoffeth bloweth wil tame seke shal fayle fynde thyne owne vnclennes thou kepest thy fote nakednes thy throte thurste thinkest thus thy self tush wil take sorowe wil loue straunge goddes hange vpon like thefe taken dede commeth shame euē house israel come confucion comon people kinges ruler prestes prophetes saye stock 〈…〉 thou art father stone thou hast begotten yee haue turned back vpon face tyme trouble saye stonde vp helpe v shal answere thē 〈…〉 thy goddes thou hast made byd stonde vp helpe tyme nede loke many city thou hast iuda many goddes hast thou also wherfore thē wil ye go lawe seinge ye synners agaynst saieth lorde lost laboure smyte youre child receaue correction 〈…〉 youre owne swearde destroyeth youre prophetes like deuouringe lyon yf ye people lorde herkē vnto worde thē become wildernesse vnto people israel londe hath light wherfore saieth people fallē wil come vnto doth mayden forget hir raymēt bryde hir stomacher▪ doth people forget lōge boostest thou thy wayes hylie optayne fauoure thorow thou hast yet stained wt blasphemy vpon thy wynges founde bloude poore innocent people 〈…〉 corner hole opēly place yet darrest thou saye giltlesse tush wrath come vpō beholde wil reason ye thou darrest saye haue offended euel wil abyde shall knowne 〈…〉 oft thou hast gone bacwarde thou shalt confounded wel egipte assirians yee thou shalt go thy waye thē smyte yine hondes together vpon thy heade lorde shal bringe confidence hope thine naught thou shalt prospere iii chapter comonly man putteth awaye wife 〈◊〉 24 goeth marieth another question shulde resorte vnto eny felde defyled vnclene 〈…〉 thou hast played harlot many louers yet turne agayne saieth lorde lift vp thine eye euery syde loke yf thou defyled thou hast waited stretes murtherer wildernesse thorow thy whordome shamefull blasphemy londe defyled 〈…〉 cause rayne euenynge dew hath ceased thou hast gotten whore foreheade canst ashamed el woldest thou saye vnto father thou art hast brought vp led fro youth wilt thou put awaye cast foreuer wilt thou withdrawe thy self clene fro neuertheles thou speakest soch wordes thou art euer doinge worse worse lorde sayde also vnto tyme iosias kinge hast thou sene shrēkinge israel hath done hath runne vp vpon hie hilles 〈◊〉 2 〈◊〉 17 b amonge thick tree played harlot hast thou sene also done sayde vnto shulde turne agayne vnto yet returned 〈◊〉 • 3 b iuda vnfaithfull sister hirs also sawe namely affter well sene aduoutrye shrenkinge harlot israel put awaye gaue byll deuorcement hir vnfaithfull sister iuda ashamed wente backe played whore also yee noyse hir whordome hath defyled whole lōde hath committed hir aduoutrie stone stockes neuerthelesse hir vnfaithfull sister iuda turned vnto agayne hir whole herte 〈◊〉 3 faynedly saieth lorde lorde sayde vnto bacslyder israel rightuous 〈…〉 thē vnfaithfull iuda therfore go preach wordes towarde north saye thou shrenkinge israel turne agayne saieth lorde turne face merciful saieth lorde allwaye beare displeasure agaynst condicion thou knowe thy greate blasphemy namely thou hast vnfaithfully forsaken lorde thy god iere 5 b esa 57 hast made thy silf partaker straunge goddes vnder grene tree hast wil heare voyce saieth lorde ye shrenkinge child turne agayne eze 2 e osee 14 eze 14 osee 2 saieth lorde wilbe maried take one citie two one generacion amōge bringe sion geue hyrdmē myne owne mynde shal fede lernynge wyszdome morouer ye increased multiplied londe saieth lorde shall nomore boost made arke lordes testament man shall thinke vpon nether shall eny man make mencion thence forth shall nether visited ner honoured giftes shall ierusalem called lordes seate heithen shalbe gathered vnto name lorde sake shalbe set vp ierusalem tyme forth shall folowe nomore ymaginacion owne frauwerde herte thē yt house iuda shal go vnto house israel shal come together north matt 8 b londe haue geuen youre father haue shewed also toke vp beinge childe gaue pleasaunt londe thine heretage yee goodly hooste heithen commaunded matt 23 c thou shuldest call father shrencke fro like woman fayleth hir louer ye vnfaithfull vnto ye house israel saieth lorde therfore voyce child israel herde euery side wepinge waylinge iere 31 c haue defyled waye forgotten god lorde ye shrenkinge child turne agayne saynge lo thine thou art lorde oure god shal heale youre bacturnynges hilles fall hie pryde mountaynes health israel stondeth vpon god oure lorde confucion hath deuoured oure father vnto daye haue synned agaynst lorde oure god▪ hahaue obeyed voyce lorde oure god • esd 9 10 b iiii chapter israel yf thou wilt turne turne vnto saieth lorde yf thou wilt put awaye thy abhominaciōs sight thou shalt moued iere 5 12 shalt sweare lorde lyueth treuth equite rightuousnesse all▪ people shall fortunable ioyfull thus saieth lorde iuda ierusalem plowe youre londe sowe amonge thornes iere 6 b 9 circumcided lorde cut awaye foreskynne youre hertes ye iuda iere 21 c indweller ierusalem indignacion breake like fyre kyndle man maye quench wickednes youre ymaginacions preach iuda ierusalem crie speake esa 58 blowe trompettes londe crie euery man maye heare saye gather together go stronge city set vp token sion spede make tarienge bringe greate plage greate destruction north iere 1 c spoyler gentile broken vp place lyon dēne maye make londe waist destroye city man maye dwell therin wherfore gyrde youre selues aboute wt sack cloth mourne wepe fearfull wrath lorde shal withdrawen you▪ tyme saieth lorde hert kinge prynces shal gone prestes shalbe astonished prophetes shalbe sore afrayed sayde lorde god hast thou disceaued people ierusalem sayenge ye shall haue peace deut 28 swearde goeth thorow lyues shal saide people ierusalem iere 1 b commeth warme wynde north thorow waye people nether fanne ner clēse shall come vnto stronge wynde wil also geue sentence vpon lo commeth downe like cloude charettes like stormy wynde tren 4 dan 7 horsmen swifter aegle wo vnto v destroyed ierusalem wash thine hert wickednesse esa 1 c thou mayest helped longe shal thy noysome thoughtes remayne voyce dan ye hill ephraim speaketh telleth destruction beholde heithen geue ierusalem warnynge preach vnto hir destroyer cōmynge farre countrees tell city iuda also shall geue warnynge euery place like watch men felde haue prouoked wrath 〈…〉 saieth lorde thy wayes thy thoughtes 〈…〉 haue brought vnto thyne owne wickednesse disobediēce hath possessed thyne hert ah bely ah bely shalt thou crie hert sore hert paunteth within still haue herde crienge trompettes peales warre crie murthur vpon murthur whole londe shal perish immediathly tentes destroyed hanginges twincklinge eye longe shall se token warre heare noyse trompettes neuertheles shall come vpon people become foolish 〈…〉 hath vterly vnderstondinge child foolishnes 〈…〉 without eny discreciō euell haue witt ynough well haue wiszdome haue loked vpon earth se wayst voyde loked towarde heauen shyne behelde mountaynes trembled hilles feare loked aboute body byrdes ayre awaye marked well plowed felde become waist yee city broken downe presence lorde indignacion wrath thus hath lorde sayde whole londe shalbe desolate yet haue done therfore let earth mourne let heauen sory aboue thinge haue purposed taken vpon shal repente go whole londe shal fle noyse horsmen bowman shall runne dennes woddes clymme vp stony rockes city shalbe voyde man dwellinge therin wilt thou thou beinge destroyed 〈…〉 though thou clothest thy self scarlet deckest ye gold though thou payntest thy face wt colour 〈…〉 yet shalt thou trymme thy self vayne hither haue bene thy greate fauourers shal abhorre go aboute slaye ye thinke heare noyse like woman trauelinge one laboringe hir first childe euen voyce doughter sion casteth hir armes swowneth sayenge ah wo sore vexed faynte herte slayne v chapter loke thorow ierusalem beholde se seke thorow hir stretes also within yf ye fynde one man doth equall right laboureth faithfull shall spare saieth lorde though saye 〈…〉 lorde lyueth yet sweare disceaue thou lorde lokest vpon faith treuth thou hast scourged toke repentaunce thou hast correcte amendemēt refused thy correction made face harder stone wolde amende therfore thought self peraduenture symple folish vnderstonde nothinge lordes waye 〈◊〉 17 iudgmentes oure god therfore go vnto heades ruler talke yf knowe waye lorde iudgmētes oure god like maner haue broken yock bursten bondes sonder wherfore lyon wod shal hurte 〈◊〉 • 2 wolfe euenynge shal destroye cat mountayne shal lie lurkinge city teare peces come therout offence many departinge awaye greate 〈◊〉 1 shulde haue mercy vpon thy child haue forsaken sworne goddes albeit bounde mariage yet fell aduoutrie haunted harlottes house desyre vnclenly lust become like stoned horse euery man neyeth neghbours wife 〈◊〉 22 b shulde correcke saieth lorde 〈◊〉 9 shulde avenged euery people like vnto clymme vp vpon walles beate downe destroye vtterly cut braunches lordes vnfaithfully hath house israel iuda forsaken saieth lorde 2 pet 2 iere 14 • deu 29 • soph 1 • ier 23 c haue denied lorde sayde tush shall miszfortune come vpon v shall se nether swearde ner honger warnynge prophetes take wynde iere 6 b yee none tell soch thinges shal happen vnto wherfore thus saieth lorde god hoostes ye speake soch wordes beholde esa 33 b wordes thy mouth turne fyre make people wod maye consume lo deut 28 • baru 4 • bringe people vpō farre house israel saieth lorde mightie people olde people people whose speach thou knowest nether vnderstō dest saye arowes sodane death yee selues giauntes people shal eate vp thy frute thy meate yee shal deuoure thy sonnes thy doughters thy shepe thy bullockes shall eate vp thy grape fyges thy stronge well fensed city wherin thou didest trust shal destroye swearde neuertheles haue done saieth lorde yf saye wherfore doth lorde oure god vnto v answere like ye haue forsakē iere 16 b deu 28 g serued straunge goddes youre owne londe euen shall ye serue goddes also straunge londe preach vnto house iacob crie iuda saye thus heare thou folish vndiscrete people esa 6 b ioh 9 ye haue eye ye se eares haue ye ye heare feare ye saieth lorde ye ashamed loke face iob 26 b 28 bynde see sonde passe boundes though rage yet nothinge though wawes therof swell yet maye go ouer people hath false obstinate herte departed gone awaye fro thinke harte let v feare lorde oure god geueth v rayne early late nede kepeth euer still haruest v yearly neuertheles youre miszdedes haue turned esa 59 youre synnes haue robbed herof amonge people founde wicked personnes priuely laye snare waite men take destroye like net full byrdes house full haue gotten falsede disceate herof cō meth greate substaunce rich fat welthy runne awaye fro shamefull blasphemy ministre lawe • sa 1 e make ende fatherlesses cause iudge poore acordinge equite • ere 9 • ere 5 b shulde punysh thinges saieth lorde shulde avenged soch people horrible greuous thinges done londe prophetes teach falsely prestes folowe people hath pleasure therin come therof last vi chapter come ierusalem ye stronge childrē ben iamin blowe vp trompettes ye tecuites • 14 set vp token vnto bethacarem plage greate misery pepeth north licken doughter sion fayre tendre woman shall come shepherdes flockes tentes shal pitch rounde aboute euery one shal fede honde make batell agaynst shal saye arise let v go vp yet daye ala daye goeth awaye night shadowes fall downe arise let v go vp night destroye hir stronge holdes thus hath lorde hoostes commaunded hew downe hir tree set vp bulworkes agaynst ierusalē cite must punished maliciousnes like cōdyte aboundeth water euē citie aboūdeth wickednes robbery vnrightuousnesse herde sorow woundes euer sight amēde ierusalem lest drawe herte make desolate thy londe also yt man dwel thus saieth lorde hoostes residue israel shalbe gathered remnaunt grape therfore turne thine honde agayne baszket like grape gatherer vnto shal speake shal warne • ere 4 9 maye take hede eares vncircumcised maye heare beholde 〈…〉 take worde god scorne haue lust therto therfore full thy indignacion lorde maye suffre longer shed thy wrath vpon child without vpon yonge men yee man must taken presoner wife aged crepel •• us londes wiues shal turned vnto straungers whē stretchout myne hō de vpon inhabitours londe saieth lorde leest vnto 〈…〉 hange vpon covetousnes prophet vnto prest go aboute falsede lye besyde 〈…〉 heale hurte people swete wordes sayenge peace peace peace 〈…〉 therfore must ashamed haue cō mitted abhominacion shulde ashamed knowe nothinge nether shame ner good nurture therfore shal fall amonge slayne 〈…〉 houre shall viset shal brought downe saieth lorde thus saieth lorde go stretes considre make inquisicion olde waye yf good right waye go therin ye maye fynde rest youre soules saye walke therin set watchman ouer therfore take hede vnto voyce trompet saye take hede heare therfore ye gentile thou congregacion shalt knowe haue deuysed heare thou earth also beholde 〈…〉 cause plage come vpon people euen frute owne ymaginacions haue bene obedient vnto wordes lawe abhorred wherfore bringe ye incense saba 〈…〉 swete smellinge calamus farre countrees youre burnt offeringes displease reioyse youre sacrifice therfore thus saieth lorde beholde make people fall shal fall amonge father wt child one neghboure shal perish another morouer thus saieth ye lorde beholde shal come people north 〈…〉 greate people shal arise ye endes ye earth wt bowes wt dartes shal weapened rough fearce people vnmerciful people voyce roareth like see ride vpō horse wel apointed ye batell agaynst doughter sion shal crie herde oure armes feble heuynes sorow come vpon v vpon woman trauelinge childe noman go forth felde man come vpon hie strete swearde feare enemie shalbe euery side wherfore gyrde sack cloth aboute thou doughter people sprynkle thy self aszshes 〈…〉 mourne wepe bitterly vpon thy beloued sonne destroyer shal sodenly fall vpon v haue set prouer harde people seke trye wayes vnfaithful fallen awaye hange vpon shameful lucre clene brasse yron hurte destroye euery man bellous brent fyre leade consumed melter melteth vayne euel taken awaye therfore shal called naughty syluer brought graues layed agaynst sonne deut 4 e • ap 21 moone heauenly hooste loued serued ranne sought worshipped shal nether gathered together ner buried shal lye vpō earth shame despisinge remayne wicked generacion luc 23 c shal desyre rather dye thē lyue euer remayne scatre saieth lorde hoostes shalt thou saye vnto also thus saieth lorde men fall arise vp agayne turne farre awaye yt neuer conuerte wherfore people ierusalem gone farre backe turne againe▪ euer longer obstinate conuerted haue loked considered mā speaketh good worde 〈…〉 man taketh repētaunce synne moch saye wherfore haue done euery man soone turned backe runneth forth still like wilde horse battayl storke knoweth apoynted tyme turtledoue ye swalow crane cōsidre tyme trauayle 〈…〉 people knowe tyme punyshment lorde darre ye saye wise haue lawe lorde amonge v beholde disceatfull penne scrybes setteth forth lie therfore shal wise confounded shalbe afrayed taken lo 〈…〉 haue cast woorde lorde wyszdome amonge wherfore geue wyues vnto aleauntes feldes destroyer lowest vnto hyest folowe shamefull lucre prophet vnto prest deale lie neuertheles 〈…〉 heale hurte people swete wordes sayenge peace peace peace fye shame abhominable thinges yet ashamed yee knowe shame wherfore tyme visitacion 〈…〉 shal fall amonge deed body saieth lorde morouer gather saieth lorde shal one grape vpon vyne nether one fyge vpon fyge tre leaues shalbe plucte cause departe saye prolonge tyme let v gather oure selues together go stronge cite shall rest lorde oure god hath put v sylence geuen v water myxte gall drynke haue synned agaynst loked peace fayre better 〈…〉 wayted tyme health lo nothinge trouble shall noyse horse herde dan whole londe shall afrayed neyēge stronge horse shal go deuoure londe city dwell therin morouer sende cockatrice serpētes amonge charmed shal byte 〈◊〉 • 6 sayeth lorde sorowe come vpon heuynes vexeth herte lo voyce criē ge people herde farre countre lorde sion kinge wherfore haue greued shall lorde saye ymages foolish straunge fashion haruest gone sōmer hath ende helped sore vexed hurte people heuy abashed triacle galaad phisician cā heale hurte people ix chapter geue heade water ynough well teares myne eye maye wepe night ād daye slaughter people wolde god cotage farre folke might leaue people go thē aduoutrers shrenckinge sorte bēde tū ge like bowes shute lie treuth maye nothinge awaye worlde go one wickednes another holde nothinge saieth lorde yee one must kepe another man maye safely trust owne brother one brother vndermyneth another 〈◊〉 12 b 〈◊〉 • 0 c 〈◊〉 7 • one neghboure begyleth another yee one dissembleth another deale treuth 〈◊〉 2 • haue practised tunges lye taken greate paynes myschefe haue set stole myddest disceate dissemblinge falsede wil knowe saieth lorde therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes beholde wil melte trie thē shulde el people tunges like sharpe arowes 〈◊〉 1 • • sal 17 speake disceate mouth speake peaceably neghboure preuely laye waite shulde punysh thinges saieth lorde shulde auenged eny soch people 〈…〉 vpon mountaynes take vp lamentacion soroufull crie mournynge vpon fayre playnes wildernes namely brente vp man goeth eny yee man shal heare one beast crie byrdes catell gone thē ce psal 78 mich 3 c make ierusalem also heape stone denne venymous wormes wil make city iuda waist man shal dwell therin man wise vnderstonde hath lorde spoken mouth maye shewe saye thou londe osee 14 • perishest thou wherfore art thou brent vp like wildernesse mā goeth thorow yee lorde tolde vnto forsoke lawe kepte thynge gaue commaundement nether lyued therafter folowed wickednes owne hertes deu 29 • iosu 24 • serued straunge goddes father taught therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde fede people wormwod geue thē gall drynke deu 32 c ierē 23 c scatre also amonge heithen nether ner father haue knowne sende swearde amonge persecute deu 28 c vntill bringe naught morouer thus saieth lorde hoostes loke ye call mournynge wyues sende wise woman come shortly singe mournynge songe teares maye fall oure eye oure eye lyddes maye guszhe water lamentable noyse herde sion sore destroyed piteously confounded must forsake oure owne naturall countre shot oure owne lodgīges yet heare worde lorde ye woman set youre eares regarde wordes mouth ye maye lerne youre doughters mourne euery one maye teach hir neghbouresse make lamentacion namely thus deeth clymmē vp oure wyndowes come oure house destroye childe dore ye yonge man strete tell thou planely thus saieth ye lorde deed body men shal lye apon ye grounde donge vpon felde iere 7 • b hay mower shal man take vp morouer thus saieth lorde let wise man reioyse wisdome ner stronge man strength nether rich man rich 〈◊〉 65 c cor 1 g co 10 wil reioyse 44 b vanite hewe downe tre wod hondes worke man fashion axe couer ouer golde syluer fasten wt nales hammer moue stō deth stiff palme tre nether speake ner go •• ruc 6 17 g must borne ye afrayed soch cā nether good ner euel none like vnto ye lorde thou art greate greate name yi power • po 15 wolde feare the▪ kī ge gentile wolde obeye amonge wysemen gentile kingdomes none maye lickened vnto alltogether vnlerned vnwise connynge vanite namely wod syluer brought tharsis beatē plate • reg 9 golde ophir worke yt made honde craftesman caster clothed yalow sylck scarlet euen worke wyse men together lorde true god lyuinge god euerlastinge kinge yf wroth • aum 1 earth shaketh gētiles maye abyde indignacion goddes maye well sayde thē goddes made nether heauē ner earth therfore shal perish frō earth thinges vnder heauen • en 1 • 51 c oure god made earth power wisdome hath fynished whole compasse worlde discrecion hath spred heauens voyce water gather together ayre draweth vp ye cloudes vttemost partes ye earth 〈…〉 turneth lighteninge rayne brīgeth forth wyndes treasury 〈…〉 wisdome maketh men fooles confunded caster ymages cast 〈…〉 vayne thinge hath life vayne craftes men workes vanite haue made shall perish one another tyme visitacion▪ neuertheles iacobs porciō soch hath made thinges israel rodd inheritaūce lorde hoostes name put awaye thy vnclennesse londe thou art stronge city thus saieth lorde beholde wil thrust inhatours londe greate waye trouble soch fashiō shal founde ala hurte ala panefull scourge vnto cōsidre sorow self must suffre tabernacle destroyed coardes broken child gone fro ād founde haue none sprede tente set vp hanginges hyrdmen haue done folishly haue sought lorde therfore haue dealt vnwisely catell scatred abrode beholde noyse harde honde greate sediciō north make city iuda wyldernesse dwellinge place dragon 〈…〉 knowe lorde mās power ordre owne way rule owne steppe goinges therfore chastē thou v lorde fauoure thy wrath 〈…〉 bringe v vtterly naught poure thy indignacion rather vpon gētiles knowe ye vpon people call thy name haue consumed deuoured destroyed iacob haue roted glory xi chapter another sermon lorde commaunded ieremy preach sayenge heare wordes couenant speake vnto iuda dwel ierusalem saye thou vnto thē thus saieth lorde god israel cursed euery one obedient vnto ye wordes couenaūt commaunded vnto youre father tyme brought egipte yron fornace sayenge obedient vnto voyce 〈◊〉 19 accordinge commaunde shal ye people wil youre god 〈◊〉 6 b kepe promyse yt haue sworne vnto youre father 〈◊〉 • 5 c 〈…〉 c namely wolde geue londe floweth mylke hony ye se come passe vnto daye answered sayde amen euen lorde thou sayest lorde sayde vnto agayne preach ye city iuda rounde aboute ierusalem saye heare wordes cō uenaunt ye maye kepe haue diligently exorted youre father euer sence tyme brought londe egipte vnto daye gaue warnynge tymes sayenge herken vnto voyce 〈◊〉 11 b neuertheles wolde obeye enclyne eares vnto 〈…〉 folowed wicked ymaginaciōs owne hertes therfore haue accused transgressours wordes conuenaunt gaue kepe notwithstōdinge haue kepte lorde sayde vnto foū de whole israel citisens ierusalem gone backe haue turned selues blasphemy fore father lust heare worde euen likewise haue also folowed straunge goddes worshipped house israel iuda haue broken couenaunt made wt father therfore thus saieth lorde beholde sende plage amonge ye shal able escape though ye crie vnto heare thē shal townes iuda citisens ierusalem go 〈◊〉 7 b call vpon goddes vnto made oblaciōs able helpe tyme trouble 〈◊〉 32 c • 2 many city thou hast iuda many goddes hast thou also loke many stretes ierusalem many shameful aulters haue ye set vp 〈◊〉 7 c 〈◊〉 1 • offre vpon vnto baal praye thou people byd nether prayse ner prayer though crie vnto trouble yet heare thou beloued doest thou shamefull greate blasphemy house euen though holy flesh might absolue 〈…〉 specially thou hast made thy boost thy wickednes lorde called grene olyue tre fayre one frutefull one iere 17 b matt 7 b ro 11 c goodly one contrary reporte abrode burne vp ād destroye thy braunches esa 12 lorde hoostes plāted hath deuysed plage thou house israel iuda ye euel ye haue done prouoke wrath ye dyd seruyce vnto baal lorde haue lerned vnderstonde thou hast shewed ymaginacions esa 53 b meke lambe caried awaye slayne knowinge deuysed soch councel agaynst sayenge iere 18 b destroye meate wod dryue londe lyuynge name shal neuer thought vpon therfore beseke lorde hoostes thou rightuous iudge iere 20 c 17 b thou tryest reynes hertes let se auenged vnto haue committed cause lorde therfore spake thus citesens anothot sought slaye sayēge esa 30 b amo 7 b preach vnto v name lorde el thou shalt dye oure hondes thus saye spake lorde hoostes beholde viset youre yonge mē shal perish swearde yor sonnes youre doughters shal vtterly dye honger none shal remayne vpon citesyns anathot wil bringe plage yeare visitacion xii chapter lorde thou art rightuous shulde dispute neuertheles let talke thinges reasonable happeneth iob 21 aba 1 c waye vngodly prosperous goeth wel eny shame offēde lyue wickednesse thou plantest take rote growe bringe forth frute boost moch yet doest thou punysh thou lorde well knowne thou hast sene proued herte take awaye like flock caried slaughter house2 pet 2 • apoynte daye slaughtinge longe shall londe mourne herbes felde perish wickednes dwell therin catell byrdes gone iere 14 b deu 29 c soph 1 c iere 5 b •• c yet saye tush god destroye v vtterly seinge thou art weery runnynge fote men wilt thou runne wt horse peaceable sure londe thou mayest safe wilt thou furious pryde iordane thy brother ād thy kynred haue altogether despised cried vpon thine absence iere 9 beleue though • eake fayre wordes saye haue forsaken myne owne dwellinge place left myne heretage life also loue wel haue geuen hōdes myne enemy myne heretage become vnto lyon wod cried vpon therfore haue forsaken esa 19 • myne heretage vnto spreckled byrde byrde dyuerse coloures vpon go hence gather beastes felde together maye eate vp dyuerse hyrdmē haue broken downe vynyarde esa • 6 c esa 5 troden vpon porcion pleasaunt porcion haue made wildernes deserte haue layed waist waist sigheth vnto yee whole londe lieth waist man regardeth distroyers come ouer heeth euery waye swearde lorde shal consume one ende ye lōde pro 22 flesh shal haue rest shal sowe wheat reepe thornes shal take heretage possession shal good ye shalbe confounded youre owne wynnynges greate wrath lorde thus saieth lorde vpon myne euel neghbours laye honde myne heretage haue geuen people israel beholde wil plucke namely israel londe put house iuda amonge whē haue rooted thē deu 4 e 30 esa 54 b 1 esd 1 wil one thē agayne wil haue mercy vpon brynge agayne euery man owne heretage lōde yf namely trouble people wil lerne ye wayes sweare name lorde lyueth like lerned people sweare baal thē shal rekened amōge people yf wil obeye thē rote folke mat 22 b destroye saieth lorde xiii chapter morouer thus saied lorde vnto go thy waye get lynnen breche gyrde aboute thy loynes let wet got brech acordinge commaundemēt lorde put aboute loynes lorde spake vnto agayne take breche thou hast prepared put aboute get vp go vnto euphrates hyde hole rock wēt hydde • lorde commaunded happened longe lorde spake vnto vp get euphrates fet breche thence commaunded hyde went euphrates digged vp toke brech place hyd beholde brech corrupte profitable nothinge sayde lorde vnto thus saieth lorde euen corruppe pryde iuda▪ hie mynde ierusalē people wicked people heare worde 〈…〉 folowe ye wicked ymaginacions owne hert hange vpon straūge goddes thē haue serued worshipped therfore shalbe brech serueth nothinge strately brech lieth vpon mās loynes strately dyd bynde ye whole house israel whole house iuda vnto saieth lorde 〈…〉 might people might haue glorious name yt might honoure wolde obeye therfore laye ryddle saye thus saieth lorde god israel euery pot shal fylled wyne shal saye thinkest thou knowe yt euery pot shalbe fylled wyne shalt thou saye vnto thus saieth lorde beholde shal fyll inhabitours lōde wt dronckēnes kynges syt vpō dauids stole prestes prophetes yt dwell ierusalem shute one agaynst another yee ye father agaynst sonnes saieth lorde wil pardon wil spare ner haue pitie vpon destroye obedient geue eare take diszdayne lorde speaketh honoure ye lorde youre god herein take light euer youre fete stomble darknesse ye hill lest whē ye loke light turne ye shadowe darknesse death yf ye wil heare geue secrete warnynge mourne fro whole herte youre stubburnesse piteously wepe 〈…〉 teares shall guszhe myne eye lordes flocke shalbe caried awaye captiue tell kinge ruler humble yor selues set downe lowe ye crowne yor glory shal fall youre heade city towarde south shalbe shut vp man shal open thē iuda shal caried awaye captyue none shall remayne lift vp youre eye beholde thē come north like fat flocke shal fall vpon wilt thou make thy mone come vpon thou hast taught thē thy self made thē master ouer 〈◊〉 10 〈◊〉 13 b 〈◊〉 21 shal sorowe come vpō woman trauelinge childe yf thou woldest saye thē thine hert wherfore come thinges vpō euē multitude thy blasphemy 〈◊〉 • 5 b shall thy hynder partes thy fete discouered like man iude maye chaunge skynne cat mountayne hir spottes maye yet exercised euell good therfore scatre lyke ye stobble takē awaye ye south wynde shal youre porcion porcion youre measure wher ye shal rewarded saieth lorde ye haue forgotten put youre trust disceatful thinges therfore shall turne thy clothes ouer thy heade 〈◊〉 2 b discouer thy thees thy preuyties maye sene ye aduoutrie thy deedly malice thy beastlynes thy shamefull whordome vpon feldes hilles haue sene thy abhominacions wo vnto ierusalē whē wilt thou euer clensed enymore xiiii chapter worde lorde shewed vnto ieremy cōcernynge ye derth frutes ivda shal mourne men shall go moch thorow gate londe shal nomore reputacion crie ierusalē shal breake lordes shall sende seruauntes fetch water come welles shal fynde water shal carie vessel home emptie shal ashamed ād confounded 〈◊〉 ▪ 23 b shal couer heades groūde shalbe dried vp cō meth rayne vpon plowman also shalbe ashamed ād shal couer heades hynde shal forsake yonge fawne se brīgeth forth ye felde shalbe grasse wilde ass shall stonde mosse drawe wynde like dragōs eye shal fayle wāt grasse doutles oure owne wickednesse rewarde v lorde thou acordinge yi name though oure transgression synnes many esa 49 b iere 16 c 17 c thou art comforte helpe israel tyme trouble wilt thou straunger londe one goeth ouer felde ād cōmeth remayne night wilt thou make thy self cowarde giaūte yet maye helpe thou ar • lorde beare thy name therfore forsake v spake lorde concernynge people yt haue pleasure go nembly wt fete leaue therfore displease lorde moch bringe agayne remembraunce myszdedes ād punysh synnes yee euen thus sayde lorde vnto thou shalt praye people good iere 7 b esa 1 b though fast heare prayer though offre burnt offrīges sacrifice yet wil accepte destroye swearde honger pestilence answerde lorde god prophetes saye vnto tush iere 5 b soph 1 c iere 14 b 23 c ye shal se swearde honger shall come vpon lorde shal geue continuall rest place lorde sayde vnto prophetes preach lie vnto name haue spoken iere 23 nether gaue eny charge nether dyd sende thē yet preach vnto false vision charmynge vanite disceatfulnesse owne herte therfore thus saieth lorde prophetes preach name neuertheles haue sent y• saye tush shal nether batel ner honger londe swearde ād honger shal prophetes perish zach 13 people haue preached shal cast ierusalem dye honger ād slayne swearde shal man burie ād wyues sonnes doughters iere 16 thus wil 〈◊〉 wickednes vpon thē shalt tho • saye also vnto myne eye shal wepe without ceass • nge daye night thren 2 f tren 1 people shalbe dtstroyed greate harme shall perish greate plage yff go felde lo lieth full slayne men yff come cite lo fameshed honger yee prophetes also prestes shal led vnknowne londe hast thou vtterly forsaken iuda sayde dost thou abhorre siō hast thou plaged v healed iere • c loked peace cōmeth good tyme health lo nothinge trouble knowlege lorde oure myszdedes synnes oure father haue offended ye displeased lorde thy name sake forget thy louynge kyndnes esa 49 c remembre ye trone thyne honoure breake couenaūt iere 5 thou hast made v eny amonge goddes gentile sende rayne geue shower heauen dost thou lorde oure god whō trust yee lorde thou dost thinges xv chapter spake lorde vnto ād sayde iere 7 b 11 c 14 b eze 14 c though moses samuel stode yet haue herte people dryue awaye maye go sight yf saye vnto zach 11 b eze 5 c whyther shal go thē tell thē lorde geueth answere vnto death swearde honger captiuyte bringe foure plage vpon saieth lorde swearde shal strāgle iere 16 dogges shal deuoure foules ayre ād beestes earth shal eate vp destroye scatre aboute also kingdomes londes plaged manasses sonne ezechias kinge iuda4 21 thinges dyd ierusalem shal haue pite vpon ierusalem shal sory shal make intercession opteyne peace seinge thou goest fro ād turnest bacwarde saieth lorde therfore stretch myne honde agaynst destroye intreated scatre abrode fanne euery side londe waist people destroye iere 6 c haue lust turne owne wayes make wyddowes mo nombre sondes see vpon ye mother child shal bringe destroyer noone daye1 te 5 sodenly vnawarres shal sende feare vpon city hath borne vij child shal haue none hir herte shal ful sorowe sonne shall fayle cleare daye shalbe confounded faynte heuynesse amo 8 b yt remayne wil delyuer vnto swearde enemy saieth lorde mother ala euer thou dydest beare 〈…〉 enemie hated whole londe though neuer lente ner receaued vpon vsury yet euery man speake euell vpon ye lorde answered lede vnto good come thou art trouble helpe ye thine enemie oppresseth doth one yron hurte another one metall cōmeth north another youre rich treasure wil geue pray 〈…〉 eny money youre synnes ye haue done ī youre coastes wil brī ge youre enemy londe 〈…〉 yt ye knowe fyre kyndled indignacion shal burne vp lorde sayde thou knowest thinges therfore remembre ād viset delyuer fro persecuters receaue cause yi lōge wrath yet thou knowest thy sake suffre rebuke 〈…〉 founde thy wordes vp gredely haue made hert ioyfull glad call vpon thy name lorde god hoostes dwell amonge scorner nether delyte therin dwell feare thy honde thou hast fylled bytternes shall heuynes endure euer plage greate yt maye neuer healed wilt thou water falleth contynue vpon wordes thus sayde lorde vnto yf thou wilt turne agayne shal set seruyce yf thou wilt take thinge precious vyle thou shalt euen myne owne mouth shal conuerte vnto 〈…〉 turne thou vnto thē shal make strō ge wall stele agaynst people 〈…〉 shal fight agaynst shal preuayle self helpe delyuer saieth lorde ryd hondes wicked delyuer honde tirauntes xvi chapter morouer thus sayde lorde vnto thou shalt take ye wife ner beget child place child borne place mother haue borne father haue begotten londe thus saieth lorde 〈…〉 shal dye horrible deeth mā shal mourne ner burie shal lye dō ge vpon earth shal perish thorow swearde honger body shal meate foules ayre • sal 7 • • ere • 5 beestes earth agayne thus saieth lorde go vnto come together mourne wepe haue taken peace frō people saieth lorde yee fauoure mercy londe shal dye olde yonge shall buried man shall wepe man shall clippe shaue himselff shal one viset another mourne deed comforte one shall offre another cuppe consolacion forget heuynes father mother thou shalt go feast house cor 5 b syt downe moch lesse eate drynke thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde 〈◊〉 7 25 b shall take awaye place voyce myrth ād gladnesse voyce brydegrome bryde yee youre dayes ye maye se 〈…〉 thou shewest people wordes saye vnto wherfore hath lorde deuysed greate plage v offence synne haue done agaynst lorde oure god make thou answere youre father haue forsaken saieth lorde haue cleued vnto straunge goddes 〈◊〉 4 haue honoured worshipped haue forsakē haue kepte lawe ye wt youre shamefull blasphemy 〈◊〉 7 haue exceaded wickednes youre father euery one foloweth frawerde euel ymaginacion owne hert obedient vnto therfore wil cast londe 〈◊〉 28 c 〈◊〉 23 b londe ye youre father knowe shall ye serue straunge goddes daye night shewe fauoure beholde therfore saieth lorde day come shall nomore sayed 〈◊〉 • 3 b lorde lyueth brought child israel lō de egipte shall sayde lorde lyueth brought child israel north londes scatred wil bringe thē agayne lōde gaue vnto father beholde saieth lorde sende many fiszhers take 〈◊〉 4 c yt wil sende many hunter hunte thē mountaynes hilles ād caues stone myne eye beholde wayes hyd fro face nether wicked dedes kepte close sight first sufficiently rewarde shamefull blasphemy synnes wherwith haue defyled londe namely stinckinge idol abhominacions wherwt haue fylled myne heretage lorde iere 14 17 c strength power refuge tyme trouble gentile shall come vnto endes worlde saye verely oure father haue cleued vnto lie idol vayne vnprofitable man make goddes able goddes therfore teach saieth ye lorde wil shewe honde power maye knowe yt name ye lorde xvii chapter youre synne ye trybe iuda writtē table yor hertes grauē vpon edge yor aulters wt penne yron adamāt clawe yt youre child also maye thynke vpon youre aulters woddes thicke tree hie hilles mountaynes feldes wherfore iere 1 • c 20 b make youre substaunce treasure spoyled greate synne ye haue done vpon youre hie place thorow ye coostes youre lōde ye shal cast also heretage gaue wil subdue vnder heuy bōdage youre enemy londe ye knowe ye haue ministred fyre indignacion shal burne euermore thus saieth lorde psal 48 • iere 46 • 48 pro 11 • c eze 29 • cursed man putteth trust man ād taketh flesh arme whose herte departeth ye lorde shall like heeth groweth wildernes good thinge come shall se dwell drie place wildernes salt vnoccupied londe blissed man putteth trust lorde psal 2 b pro 22 c psal 1 117 12 • whose hope lorde shalbe tre planted water syde spredeth rote vnto moystnesse heate harme commeth leaues grene though growe litle frute drouth yet carefull neuer leaueth bringe forth frute amonge thinges lyuynge man hath disceatfull vnsercheable hert shall knowe euen lorde ripe grounde hert 〈◊〉 2 〈◊〉 11 〈◊〉 2 〈◊〉 23 〈◊〉 51 b 〈◊〉 12 b ād search reynes rewarde euery mā acordinge wayes acordinge frute councels disceatfull maketh nest bringeth forth yonge commeth rich rightuously myddest life must leaue behinde last founde foole thou lorde whose trone glorious excellent antiquite dwellest place oure holy rest thou art comforte israel forsake • ere 2 b • oh 4 b • ze 36 shalbe confounded departe shalbe written earth haue forsaken lorde condite water life heale lorde shall whole saue thou shalbe saued thou art prayse beholde men saye vnto worde lorde let come neuertheles ledinge flock thy wayes haue compelled none violence neuer desyred eny mās deeth knowest thou well wordes also right iere 14 16 c terrible vnto lorde thou art hope parell let persecuters confounded let afrayed thou shalt bringe vpon thē tyme plage shalt destroye right sore agayne thus hath lorde sayde vnto iere 7 26 go stonde vnder gate thorow people kinges iuda go yee vnder gate ierusalem saye vnto heare worde lorde ye kinges iuda thou people iuda ye citesyns ierusalem go thorow gate thus lorde commaundeth deu 4 b deu 5 b exo 20 b take hede youre lyues ye carie burthen vpon sabbath bringe thorow gate ierusalem ye shall beare burthen also youre house sabbath ye shall laboure halowe sabbath commaunded youre father obeyed nether herkened vnto eze 20 b obstinate stubburne ād nether obeyed ner receaued correccion neuertheles yf ye heare saieth lorde beare burthen ye cite thorow gate vpon sabbath yf ye halowe sabbath ye worke exo 20 b shal go thorow gate cite kinges prynces shall syt vpon stole dauid shall caried vpon charettes ryde vpon horse prince yee whole iuda citesyns ierusalem shall go thorow cite shall euer inhabited shall come men also city iuda aboute ierusalem ād ye londe ben iamin playne feldes mountaynes wildernesse shall bringe burnt offringes sacrifice oblacions incense offre vp thankesgeuynge house lorde yff ye obedient vnto halowe sabbath ye beare youre burthen thorow gate ierusalem vpon sabbath shall set fyre vpon gate ierusalem ād shal burne vp house ierusalem man shal able quench xviii chapter another communicacion god ieremy sayenge arise go downe potter house shall tell mynde came potter house founde makinge worke vpon whele vessel potter made claye brake amonge hō de beganne new made nother vessell acordinge mynde sayde lorde thus vnto 〈…〉 maye wt potter doth ye house israel saieth lorde beholde ye house israel ye honde euen claye potter honde take honde rote 〈…〉 destroye waist awaye eny people kīgdome yff people agaynst haue thus deuysed cōuerte wickednes immediatly repente plage deuysed bringe vpon thē agayne 〈…〉 whē take honde buylde plante people kingdome yff people euell heare voyce immediatly repente good deuysed speake therfore vnto whole iuda dwell ierusalem thus saieth lorde beholde deuysinge plage takinge thinge honde agaynst therfore 〈…〉 let euery man turne euell waye 〈◊〉 35 c take vpon thinge good right saye 〈◊〉 13 b folowe oure owne ymaginacions euery mā acordinge wilfulnesse owne mynde therfore thus saieth lorde axe amonge heithen yf eny man hath herde soch horrible thinges doughter sion hath done shal ye snowe yt melteth vpon stony rockes libanus moysture feldes maye springes water grauen awaye runne geue moystnesse ner make frutefull people hath forgotten yt haue made sacrifice vnto vayne goddes whyle folowed owne wayes come hie strete gone fote waye vsed troden thorow haue brought londe euerlastinge wildernesse scorne 〈◊〉 19 b 49 c yt euer trauayleth ther shalbe abashed wagge heades east wynde scatre thē enemy destruction cō meth turne backe vpō face 〈◊〉 11 sayde come let v ymagin somthinge agaynst ieremy yee dyd euen prestes ye lawe commytted senatours yt wyfest prophetes wanted ye worde god come sayde let v cut tūge let v regarde wordes considre lorde heare voyce myne enemy recompence euell good 〈…〉 108 〈◊〉 34 b dygg pyt soule remembre stode speake thē ād turne awaye thy wrath 〈◊〉 • 0 therfore let childrē dye hunger let oppressed swearde 〈◊〉 3 f let wyues robbed childrē come wyddowes 〈…〉 let huszbōdes slayne let yonge men kylled swearde felde let noyse herde house murtherer cōmeth sodenly vpon haue digged pit take layed snare fete 〈…〉 yet lorde thou knowest coūcell haue deuysed slaye therfore forgeue wickednes let synne put thy sight let iudged giltie shalt thou vnto thē ye tyme thy indignacion xix chapter morouer thus saide lorde vnto ieremy go thy waye bye erthen pytcher bringe forth senatours chefe prestes valley child ennon lieth porte made brick shewe wordes shall tell saye thus vnto heare worde lorde ye kinges iuda ād ye citesyns ierusalem thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde bringe soch plage vpon place ye eares heare shal glowe haue forsakē me4 21 • iere 6 c vnhalowed place haue offred vnto straunge goddes whō nether father ner kinges iuda haue knowne deu 12 28 b eze 20 psal 105 • eze 16 b haue filled place also wt bloude innocentes haue set vp aulter vnto baal burne child burnt offringe vnto baal nether commaunded ner charged nether thought vpon beholde therfore ye tyme cōmeth saieth lorde yt place shal nomore called tophet iere 7 ner ye valley ye childrē ennō ye valley slaughter place wil slaye senatours iuda ierusalē kill thē downe wt swearde ye sight enemy ād seke lyues deed carcase wil geue meate foules ayre beestes felde wil make cite desolate ād despysed3 9 b iere 18 b 49 c 50 b goeth shal abaszhed geast vpon hir plage fede also wt flesh sonnes doughters tre 4 b yee euery one shal eate vp another beseginge straytnesse deu 28 b wher wt enemy yt seke lyues shal kepe thē pitcher shalt thou breake sight mē yt shalbe wt saye vnto thē thus saieth lorde hoostes iere 18 euē wil destroye people cite potter breaketh vessel made whole agayne tophet shal buried iere 7 b shal haue none place thus wil vnto place also saieth lorde thē yt dwell yee wil cite vnto tophet house ierusalē house kinges iuda defyled like tophet house whose parlers dyd sacrifice vnto hooste heauē poured drynke offringes vnto straunge goddes ieremy came tophet lorde sent prophecie stode courte house lorde spake people thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde bringe vpon cite vpon euery towne aboute plage haue deuysed agaynst haue bene obstinate iere 7 c 13 b ād wolde obeye warnynges xx chapter pashur preast sonne emmer chefe house ye lorde herde ieremy preach stedfastly act 23 ioh 18 c smote ieremy put stockes hie gate ben iamin house ye lorde nexte daye folowinge pashur brought ieremy stockes agayne sayde ieremy vnto lorde shall call nomore pashur excellent increasinge magor fearfull ād afrayed euery thus saieth lorde beholde make afrayed thy self fauoure ye shal perish swearde enemy euen yt face wil geue whole iuda vnder power kinge babilon shall carie vnto babilon presoners slaye swearde morouer ye substaunce londe4 20 c iere 15 c 17 precious gorgeous workes costlynesse treasure kinges iuda wil geue hōdes enemy shal spoyle carie vnto babilon pashur thou shalt caried vnto babilon thine housholde babilō shalt thou come thou shalt die buried thou thy fauourers thou hast preached lie lorde thou makest weake thou refreszhest makest stronge agayne daye longe despysed tre 3 b laughed scorne euery man haue preached longe agaynst malicious tyranny iere 6 b shewed destruccion ye cause cast worde lorde teth take euer worst wherfore thought hence forth speake ner preach eny name worde lorde burnynge fyre hert bone wolde haue stopped might herde many derisiōs blasphemy yee euen myne owne companyons psal • 0 b soch conuersaunte wente aboute make afrayed sayenge vpon let v go vpon feare make holde tonge yt maye ouercome avenged lorde stode like mightie giaunte therfore persecuters fell coude nothinge shal sore confoū ded haue done vnwisely shall haue euerlastinge shame lorde hoostes 〈…〉 thou rightuous sercher knowest reynes hertes let se punyshed vnto committe cause synge vnto lorde prayse hath delyuered soule oppressed honde violent cursed daye wherein borne 〈…〉 vnhappie ye daye mother brought forth cursed man brought father tidinges make glad sayenge thou hast gotten sonne let happen vnto man 〈…〉 city ye lorde turned vpside downe longe herde wicked rumoure slewe soone came mother wombe mother graue hirselff byrth might haue come remayned still wherfore came forth mother wombe 〈…〉 haue experience laboure sorowe lede life shame xxi chapter wordes lorde spake vnto ieremy tyme kinge sedechias sent vnto pashur sonne melchia sophonias sonne▪ maasia prest sayenge axe councell lorde praye oure behalfe nabuchodonosor kinge babilon besegeth v yff lorde peraduenture deale v acordinge maruelous power take v spake ieremy geue sedechias answere 〈…〉 thus saieth lorde god israel beholde turne backe weapens ye haue youre hondes wherwith ye fight agaynst kinge babilō caldees besege rounde aboute ye walles wil brīge thē together myddest cite selff fight agaynst outstretched honde ād mightie arme greate displeasure terrible wrath smyte dwell cite yee mē ād catell shal dye pestilence saieth lorde shall delyuer sedechias kinge iuda seruauntes people soch escaped cite pestilence swearde honger power nabuchodonosor kinge babilon • ere • 9 yee hōdes enemy hōdes yt folowe vpon lyues shall smyte ye swerde shal pite thē shal spare shall haue mercy vpon vnto people thou shalt saye thus saieth lorde 〈◊〉 30 c 〈◊〉 38 〈◊〉 27 beholde laye waye life deeth abydeth cite shal perish ether wt swearde honger pestilēce goeth holde ye caldees parte yt besege shal saue life shall wynne soule pray haue set face agaynst cite saieth lorde plage 〈◊〉 32 good must geuē honde kinge babilon brent fyre vnto house kinge iuda saye thus heare worde ye lorde thou house dauid thus saieth lorde 〈◊〉 7 b 〈◊〉 22 esa 1 c • ere 4 • ach • c ministre rightuousnes soone delyuer oppressed frō violent power euer terrible wrath break like fyre▪ burne man maye quēch wickednes youre ymaginacions 〈◊〉 48▪ beholde saieth lorde wil come vpō dwel valleis rockes feldes saye 〈◊〉 12 〈◊〉 • 9 c 〈◊〉 5 b 〈◊〉 23 c •• ph 1 c tush make v afrayed come oure house vyset saieth lorde wickednes youre invencions kyndle soch fyre youre wod shall cōsume aboute xxii chapter thus sayde lorde also go downe house kinge iuda speake wordes saye heare worde lorde thou kinge iuda syttest kyngly seate dauid thou thy seruauntes ād ye people go gate thus lorde commaundeth esa 1 c 〈◊〉 21 •• ch 7 b • c kepe equite rightuousnesse delyuer oppressed frō power violent greue ner oppresse straunger fatherlesse ner wyddowe ād shed innocēt bloude place yff ye kepe thinges faithfully shall come dore house kynges syt vpō dauids seate shal caried charettes ryde vpon horse seruauntes ād people yf ye wil obedient vnto commaundementes iere 51 c esa 45 c heb 6 b sweare myne owne self saieth ye lorde house shal waist thus hath lorde spoken vpon kinges house iuda thou art heade galaad libanus wilt thou laye yf make waist thy city also man shal dwell prepare destroyer weapēs hew downe thy special cedre tree cast fyre people go cite shall speake one another wherfore hath lorde done thus vnto noble cite shall answered haue broken couenaunt lorde god deu 29 • 3 9 b 4 23 haue worshipped serued straūge goddes mourne ouer deed wo sory departeth awaye commeth agayne ād seeth natyue countre thus saieth lorde touchinge sellum sonne iosias kinge iuda2 par 3 reygned father caried place shal neuer come hither agayne shal dye place vnto led captyue shall se londe nomore esa 5 c agg 1 wo worth buyldeth house vnrightuousnes ād perlers good hath gotten violence neuer recompenseth neghburs laboure ner payeth hyre thinketh wil buylde wyde house ād gorgeous perlers causeth wyndowes hewen sylinges geastes maketh cedre paynteth zenober thinkest thou reigne thou prouokest wrath yt cedre tree dyd thy father eate drynke prospere well lōge dealt equite ād rightuousnesse yee helped ye oppressed poore right prospered well whence came eye saieth lorde neuertheles thine eye thine herte loke vpon covetousnesse shed innocent bloude wronge violence therfore thus saieth lorde agaynst ioachim4 2324 iere 36 ye sonne iosias kynge iuda shall mourne vse ala brother ala syster nether shall saye vnto ala syr ala noble prynce asse shall buried corrupte cast gate ierusalem clymme vp hill libanus thou doughter sion lift vp thy voyce vpon basan crie partes thy louers destroyed gaue warninge whyle thou wast yet ī prosperite thou saydest wil heare maner hast thou vsed thy youth thou woldest neuer heare voyce thy hyrdmen shalbe dryuen wynde thy derlinges shalbe caried awaye captiuyte shalt thou brought shame confucion thy wickednes thou dwellest vpon libanus ād makest thy nest cedre tree esa 13 b 21 iere 13 30 greate shal yi mournynge thy sorowes come vpon woman trauelinge childe truly lyue saieth lorde though iechonias sonne ioachim kinge iuda signet right honde4 reg 24 b yet plucke wil geue ye power thē seke slaye power thou fearest power nabuchodonosor kinge babilon power caldees morouer sende the▪ thy mother bare straunge londe ye borne ād shall ye dye londe ye desyre returne vnto ye shall neuer come agayne mā iechomas shal like ymage robbed torne peces pleaseth man apparell wherfore sede shalbe sent awaye cast lōde knowe thou earth earth earth heare worde lorde wryte man amonge outlawes prosperite shall man haue life longe nether shall eny sede happie syt vpon seate dauid beare rule iuda xxiii chapter wo vnto shepherdes destroye ezec 34 scatre flocke saieth lorde wherfore cō maundemēt lorde god israel vnto shepherdes fede people ye scatre ād thrust flocke loke vpon therfore vyset wickednes youre ymaginacions saieth ye lorde gather together remnaunt flocke londes ha • dryuen vnto 〈…〉 bringe agayne pasture maye growe increace set shepherdes also oue • shall fede shall feare drede shall none lost saieth lorde beholde tyme commeth saieth lorde wil rayse vp rightuous braunch dauid 〈…〉 shall beare rule discusse matter wyszdome 〈…〉 shall set vp equyte rightuousnes agayne earth tyme shall iuda saued israel shal dwell without feare 〈…〉 name shall call euen lorde oure rightuous maker 〈…〉 therfore beholde tyme commeth saieth lorde shall sayde lorde lyueth brought child israel londe egipte lorde lyueth brought forth ād led sede house israel north londe countrees scatred shal dwell owne londe agayne herte breaketh body false prophetes bone shake become like droncken man reason wyne take rest feare lorde holy wordes londe full aduoterers thorow destroyed mourneth ye pleasaunt pasture deserte dryed vp yee waye men take wicked 〈…〉 gouernaunce nothinge like holy worde lorde prophetes prestes selues poluted ypocrytes ād wickednes haue founde house saieth lorde wherfore waye shall slippery darcknesse maye stacker fall bringe plage vpon euen yeare visitacion saieth lorde haue sene foly amonge prophetes samaria yt preched baal ād disceaued people israel haue sene also amonge prophetes ierusalem foule aduoutery presumptuous lie take shamefull men hōde flatringe cā returne wickednes citesyns vnto sodom inhabitours gomorre therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes concernynge prophetes beholde 〈…〉 wil fede worm wod make dryncke water gall frō prophetes ierusalem sicknes ypocrisie come londe therfore lorde hoostes geueth warnynge 〈◊〉 27 b 〈◊〉 2 • b heare wordes prophetes preach vnto disceaue speake meanynge owne herte mouth lorde 〈…〉 c 〈◊〉 5 b 〈◊〉 14 b 〈◊〉 29 c saye vnto despyse lorde hath spoken tush ye shal prospere right well vnto walke lust owne herte saye tush shall myszfortune happen hath sytten councell lorde hath herde vnderstonde aboute hath marcked deuyce 〈…〉 herde beholde stormy wether lorde indignacion shal go forth shal fall downe vpon heade vngodly wrath lorde shal turne agayne vntill perfourme fulfull thoughte herte 〈◊〉 30 latter dayes ye shall knowe meanynge haue sent prophetes saieth lorde yet ranne haue spoken 〈◊〉 14 b yet preached yf continued councell herde wordes turned people euell wayes wicked ymaginacions 〈…〉 thē god seeth thinge nye honde farre saieth lorde maye eny man hyde self shal se saieth lorde 〈◊〉 138 〈◊〉 9 〈◊〉 66 〈◊〉 7 f 〈◊〉 17 fulfill heauen earth saieth lorde haue herde well ynough prophetes saye preach lye name sayēge haue dreamed haue dreamed longe wil cōtynue prophetes hertes tel lye preach craftie sotylte owne herte whose purpose dreames euery one tell make people forget name fore father dyd whē baal came vp prophet hath dreame let tell vnderstondeth worde 〈◊〉 4 b 〈◊〉 4 let shewe faithfully hath chaffe wheat together saieth lorde worde like fyre saieth lorde like hammer breaketh harde stone therfore thus saieth lorde beholde wil vpō prophetes steale worde priuely euery man beholde saieth lorde agaynst prophetes take vpon tunges speake lorde hath sayde beholde saieth ye lorde agaynst prophetes darre prophecy lie disceaue people vanity miracle neuer sent ner commaunded shal people greate harme saieth lorde yf people ether eny prophete prest axe saye burthen lorde thou shalt saye vnto burthen therfore cast fro saieth lorde ye youre selues burthen prophet prest people vseth terme burthen lorde viset
