house also thus shall ye saye euery one another answere hath lorde geuen lordes commaundement burthen lorde ye shal speake nomore euery man owne worde burthen ye haue altered wordes lyuynge god lorde hoostes oure god thus shall euery man saye prophetes answere hath lorde geuen saieth lorde name burthen lorde therfore thus saieth lorde moch ye haue vsed terme burthen lorde notwithstondinge sent vnto forbade speake lordes burthen beholde therfore repute burthen cast presence yee cite also gaue youre father bringe euerlastinge confucion soch shame shal neuer forgotten xxiiii chapter lorde shewed visiō beholde stode two maundes figes ye tēple lorde yt nabuchodonosor kynge babilō led awaye captyue iechonias sonne ioachim kinge iuda4 reg 24 mightie men also iuda workemasters cō nynge men ierusalem vnto babilon one maunde good fyges euen like first ripe maunde naughtie figes o • 9 b might eaten euell sayde lorde vnto seist thou ieremy sayde fyges good euel man maye eate came worde lorde vnto maner thus saieth ye lorde god israel like thou knowest good fyges shal knowe men led awaye haue sent place londe caldees profite set myne eye vpon best bringe agayne londe buylde vp breake downe plante rote deu 29 iere 31 f 30 32 c geue herte knowe lorde shalbe people wilbe god shal returne vnto whole herte iere 29 c like thou knowest naughtie fyges maye eatē euel euen wil saieth lorde let sedechias kinge iuda ye prynces residue ierusalem remayne ouer londe also dwell egipte vexed plaged kingdomes londes make reprofe psal 78 baru 3 comon byworde laughinge stocke shame place shal scatre sende swearde honger pestilence amonge vntill haue clene consumed londe gaue vnto father xxv chapter sermone geuen vnto ieremy vpon people iuda fourth yeare ioachim sonne iosias kinge iuda first yeare nabuchodonosor kinge babilon sermone ieremy prophet made vnto people iuda ye inhabitours ierusalē maner xiij yeare iosias sonne amon kinge iuda vnto present daye euen xxiij yeare worde lorde hath bene committed vnto haue spokē • ere 29 c • 4 35 c haue rysen vp early haue geuē warnynge season ye wolde heare though lorde hath sent seruauntes • par 86 c prophetes vnto season yet wolde ye obeye ye wolde encline yor eares heare sayde turne agayne euery man euell waye4 17 c youre wicked ymaginacions shal ye dwell euer londe lorde promised youre fore father go straunge goddes serue worshipe angre workes youre hōdes punysh neuertheles ye wolde heare saieth lorde haue defied workes youre hō de youre owne greate harme wherfore thus saieth lorde hoostes ye haue herkened vnto worde lo sende call people 〈…〉 yt dwell north saieth lorde wil prepayre nabuchodonosor kinge babilon seruaunt 〈…〉 wil bringe vpon londe vpon yt dwell therein vpon people aboute vterly rote make wildernesse mockage continuall deserte morouer take voyce gladnesse solace 〈…〉 voyce brydegrome bryde voyce anoynted creszshettes whole londe shal become wildernes shall serue sayde people kinge babilon thre score yeares ten 〈…〉 lxx yeares expyred wil viset also wickednesse kinge babylon people saieth lorde yee londe caldees wil make perpetuall wildernes wil fulfil wordes vpon londe haue deuysed agaynst yee written boke ieremy hath prophecied people also shal subdued vnto dyuerse nacions greate kynges wil recompense acordinge dedes workes owne hondes 〈…〉 thus hath lorde god israel spoken vnto 〈…〉 take wyne cuppe indignacion fro honde thou mayest cause people sende drinke haue dronkē thereof maye madd wyttes swearde commeth wil sende amōge toke cuppe lordes honde made people drynke vnto lorde sent first cite ierusalem city iuda kinges prynces make thē desolate waist despysed cursed acordinge come passe daye yee pharao ye kinge egipte seruauntes prynces people altogether one wt another kinges londe hus kinges philistynes londe ascalon gaza accaron remnaunt aszdod▪ edomites moabites ammonite kinges tirus sidon kinges iles beyonde see dedan thema buz shauen ismaelites 〈…〉 kinges araby generally kinges dwell deserte kinges simri kinges elam ye kinges meedes kinges towarde north whether farre nye euery one neghbours yee kingdomes vpon whole earth kinge sesach sayde shal drinke also saye thou vnto commaundement lorde hoostes god israel drinke droncken spewe fall ye neuer ryse thorow swearde wil sende amonge yf receaue cuppe thy honde drinke tell thus doth lorde hoostes threaten 〈◊〉 49 b 〈◊〉 9 b 〈◊〉 4 c drynke ye shal shortly lo begynne plage cite name geuen vnto thynke ye leaue vnpunyshed ye shall go quyte call swearde vpō inhabitours earth saieth lorde hoostes therfore tell wordes saye vnto 〈◊〉 3 c 〈◊〉 1 lorde shal crie aboue let voyce herde holy habitacion greate noyse shall crie courte regall shal geue greate voyce like grape gatherer sounde thereof shalbe herde vnto endes worlde lorde hath iudgment geue vpon people holde courte iustice flesh punyshe vngodly saieth lorde 〈…〉 thus sayeth ye lorde hoostes beholde miserable plage shall go one people another greate stormy water shal arise endes earth daye shall lorde slaye one ende earth another shall mone made eny none gathered vp none buried shall lie dunge vpon grounde mourne ye shepherdes crie sprinckle youre selues aszshes ye rammes flocke tyme youre slaughter fulfilled ye shal fall like vessel connyngly made pleasure 〈◊〉 • 41▪ shepherdes shall haue waye fle rammes flocke shall escape shal shepherdes crie horribly rammes flocke shal mourne lorde shal consume pasture best feldes shal lie deed horrible wrath lorde shall forsake foldes like lyon londes shalbe waist wrath destroyer fearfull indignacion xxvi chapter begynnynge reigne ioachim sonne iosias kynge iuda came worde lorde sayenge thus saieth lorde iere 7 17 stonde courte lorde house speake vnto city iuda come worshippe lordes house wordes yt commaundethe saye loke thou kepe one worde backe det 4 12 b yf perauenture herkē turne euery man wicked waye maye also repente plage haue determed brynge vpon wicked invencions maner shalt thou speake vnto thus saieth lorde yf ye obeye walke lawes haue geuen heare wordes seruauntes prophetes sent vnto rysynge vp tymely still sendinge yf ye folowe thē saye house dyd vnto silo make cite abhorred people earth iere 7 prestes prophetes people herde ieremy preach wordes house lorde spoken wordes lorde commaunded preach vnto people prestes prophetes people toke holde vpon sayde thou shalt dye darrest thou bolde saye name lorde shal happen house dyd vnto silo cite shalbe waist man shal dwell people gathered aboute ieremy house lorde prynces iuda herde rumoure came soone kinges palace house lorde sat downe new dore lorde 4 15 g iere 36 b spake prestes prophetes vnto ruler people wordes man worthy dye ioh 19 hath preached agaynst cite ye youre selues haue herde youre eares sayde ieremy vnto ruler people lorde hath sente preach agaynst house agaynst cite wordes ye haue herde iere 7 therfore amende youre wayes youre advysementes obedient vnto voyce lorde youre god shal lorde repēt plage yt deuysed agaynst forme youre hondes ye thinke expediēt good shall ye knowe yf ye put death ye shal make youre selues cite inhabitours mat 23 e giltie innocent bloude treuth lorde hath sente vnto speake wordes youre eares sayde ruler people vn prestes prophetes man maye condemned death hath preached vnto v name lorde oure god elder also londe stode vp sayde thus vnto people mich 1 micheas morascite prophet vnder ezechias kinge iuda spake people iuda thus saieth lorde hoostes mich 3 c sion shalbe plowed like felde ierusalē shalbe heape stone hill lordes house shalbe turned hie wod dyd ezechias ye kinge iuda people iuda put deeth verely rather feared ye lorde made praier vnto cause also ye lorde repented plage yt deuysed agaynst shulde soch shamefull dede agaynst oure soules prophet also preached stiffly name lorde called vrias sonne semeia cariathiarim mā preached also agaynst cite agaynst lōde3 22 acordinge ieremy saieth ioachim kinge estate prynces herde wordes kinge went aboute slaye vrias perceaued that2 19 matt 2 c afrayed fled departed egipte ioachim kinge sent seruauntes lōde egipte namely elnathā sonne achbor certayne men wt egipte fetched vrias egipte brought vnto kinge ioachim slewe swearde cast deed body ye comō people graue ahicam sonne saphan helped ieremy came hondes people slayne xxvii chapter begynnynge reigne ioachim sonne iosias kynge iuda came worde vnto ieremy lorde spake thus vnto make bondes chaynes put aboute thy neck sende thē kinge edom kinge moab kinge amon kinge tirus kinge sidon messaungers shal come ierusalem vnto sedechias kinge iuda byd saye vnto master thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel speake thus vnto yor master made earth 〈…〉 men ye catell vpon grounde greate power outstretched arme haue geuen vnto pleased 〈…〉 delyuer londes power nabuchodonosor kinge babilon seruaunt beestes also felde shal geue seruyce people shal serue sonne childes child vntil tyme lō de come also yee many people greate kinges shal serue morouer people kingdome wil serue nabuchodonosor wil put neckes vnder ye yock kinge babilon people viset swearde honger pestilence vntill haue consumed hondes saieth lorde therfore 〈…〉 folowe youre prophetes soythsayers expounder dreames charmer witch saye vnto ye shal serue kinge babilon preach lie bringe farre youre londe might cast destroye people put neckes vnder yock kinge babilon serue willet remayne still owne lōde saieth lorde shal occupie dwell thinges tolde sedechias kinge iuda sayde 〈…〉 put youre neckes vnder yock kinge babilon serue people ye maye lyue wilt thou thy people perish swearde honger pestilence like lorde hath deuysed people wil serue kinge babilon therfore geue eare vnto prophetes tell ye shall serue kinge babilon preach lie 〈…〉 nether haue sent saieth lorde bolde falsely prophecie name might ye sooner dryue ye might perish yor preacher spake prestes also people thus saieth lorde 〈…〉 heare wordes prophetes preach vnto saye beholde vessel lordes house shall shortly brought hither agayne babilon prophecie lie vnto heare serue kinge babilon yt ye maye lyue wherfore ye make cite destroyed yf true prophetes dede yf worde lorde commytted vnto let praye lorde hoostes remnaunt ornamentes house lorde remayne yet house kinge iuda ierusalem caried babilon also thus hath lorde hoostes spoken concernynge pylers lauer seate residue ornamentes yet remayne citie nabuchodonosor kinge babilon toke caried awaye iechonias sonne ioachim kinge iuda power iuda ierusalem ierusalem vnto babilon captyue yee thus hath lorde hoostes god israel spoken touchinge residue ornamentes lordes house▪ kinge iudaes house ierusalem shalbe caried vnto babilon shall remayne vntil vyset saieth lorde wil bringe hither agayne done yeare euē begynnynge reigne sedechias kinge iuda xxviii chapter bvt fourth yeare reigne sedechias kinge iuda fifth moneth happened hananias ye sonne assur prophet gabaon spake house lorde presence prestes people sayde thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel haue brokē yock kinge babilon two yeare bringe agayne place 〈…〉 ornamentes lordes house yt nabuchodonosor kinge babilon caried awaye place vnto babilon yee bringe agayne iechonias sonne ioachim kinge iuda presoners iuda yt caried vnto babilon euē place saieth ye lorde wil breake ye yock kinge babilō prophet ieremy gaue answere vnto prophet hananias prestes people present house lorde prophet ieremy sayde 〈…〉 amen lorde graunte thinge thou hast prophecied maye bringe agayne ornamentes lordes house restore presoners babilon 〈◊〉 place neuertheles herken thou also saye thou people maye heare prophetes v tymes past prophecied warre trouble pestilence ether peace vpon many nacions grea • e kingdomes proued yf god sende dede thinge came passe prophet tolde hananias prophet toke chayne prophet ieremias neck deu 18 nu 16 brake sayde hananias people might heare thus hath lorde spoken euen breake yock nabuchodonosor kinge babilō neck nacions yee within two yeare prophet ieremy wente waye hananias prophet taken chayne prophet ieremies neck broken worde lorde came vnto prophet ieremy sayenge go tell hananias wordes thus saieth lorde thou hast broken chayne wodd steade wodd thou shalt make chaynes yron thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel wil put yock yron vpon neck people maye serue nabuchodonosor kinge babilon yee shal wil geue ye beestes felde iere 29 c sayde prophet ieremy vnto ye prophet hananias heare praye hananias lorde hath sent thou bringest people false beleue therfore thus saieth ye lorde beholde wil sende lō de within yeare thou shalt die thou hast falsely spokē agaynst lorde hananias prophet died yeare seuenth moneth xxix chapter copie lettre yt ieremy prophet sent ierusalem vnto presoners senatours presies prophetes people nabuchodonosor led vnto babilō ye tyme yt kinge iechonias quene chambrelaynes prynces iuda ierusalē workmasters ierusalē departed thither lettre elasa ye sonne saphā gamaria ye sonne helchia dyd beare whō sedechias kinge iuda sent vnto babilō nabuchodonosor ye kinge babilō ye wordes ieremias lettre th • hath ye lorde hoostes ye god israel spokē vnto presoners yt • ed frō ierusalē vnto babilō iere • 5 〈…〉 house dwell therein plāte you▪ 〈◊〉 yt ye maye enioye frutes thereof gene 1 • take wyues beare sonnes doughters prouyde wyues youre sonnes huszbondes youre doughters maye get sonnes doughters ye maye multiplie laboure fewe seke peace prosperite cite ye presoners baru 1 e 1 tim 2 praye vnto god peace shal yor peace thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel iere 23 c 27 b let prophetes soythsaiers yt amonge disceaue beleue youre owne dreames iere 14 e preach lie name haue sent saieth lorde thus saieth lorde ye haue fulfilled lxx yeares babilon2 pa 36 iere 25 b 1 esd 1 wil bringe home myne owne goodnes carie hither agayne vnto place knowe haue deuysed saieth lorde thoughtes geue peace trouble geue redie ye might haue hope agayne deu 4 e 30 ye shall crie vnto ye shal go call vpō shal heare ioan 7 ye shal seke fynde yee yf ye seke youre whole herte founde saieth lorde delyuer preson gather together agayne place haue scatred saieth lorde wil bringe agayne place whence caused caried awaye captyue ye saye god hath raysed vp prophetes babilon thus hath lorde spoken concernynge kinge sytteth stole dauid ye people dwell cite youre brother gone captiuyte4 reg 24 thus saye speaketh lorde hoostes beholde wil sende swearde honger pestilence vpon iere 24 b wil make like vntymely fyges maye eatē bytternes wil persecute swearde honger death delyuer vp vexed kingdomes cursed abhorred laughed scorne put confucion people amonge haue scatred haue bene obedient vnto commaundementes saieth lorde sent vnto seruauntes prophetes stode vp early sent vnto iere 25 44 wolde heare saieth lorde heare therfore worde lorde ye presoners sent ierusalē vnto babilon thus hath lorde hoostes god israel spoken achab ye sonne colaias sedechias sonne maasia prophecie lie vnto name beholde wil delyuer honde nabuchodonosor kinge babilon maye slaye youre eye ye presoners iuda babilon shal take vpō terme cursinge saye god vnto dyd vnto sedechias achab kinge babilon rosted fyre synned shamefully israel haue onely defiled neghbours wyues also preached lyenge wordes name haue commaunded testifie assure saieth lorde semeia nehela •• te thou shalt speake vnto thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel thou hast sealed lettres vnder thy name vnto people ierusalem sophonias sonne maasia prest yee sent prestes thou wrytest thus vnto lorde hath ordened prest steade ioiada prest thou shuldest chefe house lorde aboue prophetes preacher thou mightest put preson ye stockes happeneth thou hast reproued ieremy anathot neuer leaueth prophecienge beside hath sent v worde vnto babilon tolde v planely oure captiuyte shal longe endure shulde buylde v house dwell therin plante v garden might enioye frutes therof lettre sophonias prest dyd rede let ieremy prophet heare came worde lorde vnto ieremy sayenge sende worde captiuyte maner thus hath lorde spoken concernynge semeia ye nehelamite semeia hath prophecied vnto without commyssion brought false hope therfore thus lorde doth certifie beholde wil vyset semeia nehelamite sede none shall remayne amonge people none shall se good yt people saieth lorde hath preached falsely lorde xxx capter wordes lorde shewed vnto ieremy saienge thus saieth lorde god israel 〈…〉 wryte vp diligently wordes haue spoken vnto boke lo tyme commeth saieth lorde bringe agayne presoners people israel iuda saieth lorde restore vnto londe gaue father shall haue possession agayne wordes spake lorde cōcernynge israel iuda thus saieth lorde heare terrible crie feare disquietnesse el doth signifie se namely stronge men smyte euery man honde vpon loynes woman payne hir trauayle euer sawe man trauayle childe 〈…〉 enquere therafter se yee face maruelous pale ala daye dredefull none maye lickened vnto ala tyme iacobs trouble shall yet delyuered daye saieth lorde take yock thy neck breake thy bondes shall nomore serue straunge goddes vnder shall seruyce vnto god lorde 〈◊〉 34 〈◊〉 46 e dauid kinge rayse vp vnto seruaunt iacob feare saieth ye lorde afrayed 〈◊〉 9 b israel lo helpe also farre thy sede londe captiuyte iacob shall turne agayne shalbe rest haue prosperous life man shall make afrayed helpe saieth lorde though shal destroye people amonge haue scatred yet destroye correcke discrecion 〈◊〉 10 〈◊〉 34 〈◊〉 1 knowe thou art wise without faute therfore thus saieth ye lorde sory thy hurte woundes man medle thy cause bynde vp thy woundes maye man helpe thy louers haue forgotten care nothinge haue geuen cruell stroke chastened roughly multitude thy myszdedes 〈◊〉 13 thy synnes haue ouer hande makest thou mone thy harme self haue pite thy sorowe multitude thy myszdedes synnes haue done vnto • ere 2 〈◊〉 therfore deuoure shalbe deuoured thine enemy shal led captiuyte make waist shalbe waisted selues robbe make also robbed geue thy health agayne make thy woundes whole saieth lorde reuyled one cast awaye vnd despised sion thus saieth lorde beholde nu 24 set vp iacobs tentes agayne defende dwellinge place cite shalbe buylded hir olde estate house shal haue right foundacion shall go thankesgeuynge voyce ioye multiplie shall mynishe shall endue honoure man shall subdue child shalbe fore tyme congregacion shal cōtinue sight vexe viset captayne also shall come mich 5 • prynce shall springe myddest chalenge self shall come vnto ioan 6 • geueth ouer herte come vnto saieth lorde ye shalbe people also iere 13 • 24 b 3 f iere 23 • 25 wilbe youre god beholde syde shall wrath lorde breake stormy water mightie whyrle wynde shal fall vpō heades vngodly terrible displeasure lorde shall leaue vntill haue done perfourmed intent herte iere 23 • latter dayes ye shal vnderstonde tyme saieth lorde shal god generacions israel shalbe people xxxi chapter thus saieth lorde people israel escaped ye wildernes swearde nu 14 c founde grace come rest euen shal lorde also apeare vnto farre saye loue euerlastinge loue therfore sprede mercy eze 16 repayre agayne thou doughter israel thou mayest fast sure thou shalt take thy tabrettes agayne go forth lede daunce thou shalt plante vynes agayne vpon ye hilles samaria grape gatherer shall plante synge tyme watchman vpon mount ephraim shall crie arise esa • let v go vp vnto sion ou • e lorde god▪ thus saieth lorde reioyce gladnes iacob crie vnto heade gentile speake synge saye lorde shall delyuer people remnaunt israel make whole beholde bringe agayne north lōde gather endes worlde blynde lame amonge woman greate childe soch also delyuered company come agayne shal greate departed hence heuynes ioye bringe hither agayne lede ryuers water straight waye shall stomble •• ut 32 〈◊〉 48 israel father epraim shalbe firstborne heare worde lorde ye gentile preach iles lie farre saye hath scatred israel shall gather together agayne shall kepe shepherde doth flocke lorde shall redeme iacob ryd honde violent shal come reioyce vpon hill sion shall haue plenteousnes goodes lorde shall geue namely wheate wyne oyle yonge shepe calues conscience shalbe well watred garden shall nomore hongrie shal mayde reioyce daunce yee yonge olde folkes turne sorow gladnesse comforte make ioyfull euen hertes poure plenteousnes vpon hertes prestes people shalbe satisfied good thinges saieth lorde •• 3 e • att 2 c thus saieth lorde voyce heuynes wepynge lamentacion came vp heauen euen rachel mournynge hir child wolde comforted awaye saieth lorde leaue wepynge crienge witholde thyne eye teares thy laboure shalbe rewarded saieth lorde shall come agayne londe enemy yee euen thy posterite shall haue consolacion saieth lorde thy child shall come agayne owne londe morouer herde ephraim led awaye captyue complayne maner • ze 20 f lorde thou hast correcte thy chastenynge haue receaued vntamed calfe conuerte thou 〈…〉 shalbe conuerted thou art lorde god yee soone thou turnest shall refourme self vnderstonde shall smyte vpon thee verely haue cōmitted shamefull thinges let youth beare reprofe confucion vpon complaynte thought thus self ephraim deare sonne 〈…〉 childe haue myrth pastyme sence tyme first cōmoned haue euer remembraunce therfore herte dryueth vnto gladly louyngly haue mercy vpon saieth lorde get watchman prouyde teacher set thine herte vpon right waie thou shuldest walke turne agayne thou doughter israel turne agayne city thyne longe wilt thou go astraie thou shrēkinge doughter lorde worke new thynge vpon earth woman shall compasse man thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel come therto haue brought iuda captiuyte wordes shalbe herde ye londe city lorde 〈…〉 fayre brydegrome rightuousnesse make frutefull thou holy hill shall dwell iuda hir city shepherdes huszbonde men 〈…〉 shall fede hongrie soule refresh faynte hertes herde came agayne self mused like bene waked swete slepe beholde saieth lorde dayes come sowe house israel house iuda men catell yee shall come therto 〈…〉 like haue gone aboute tymes past r • te scatre breake downe destroye chastē euen also go diligently aboute buylde vp agayne plante saieth lorde shall sayde 〈…〉 ye father haue eaten sower grape childrens teth set edge euery one shal dye owne myszdede eateth sower grape teth shalbe set edge beholde 〈…〉 dayes come saieth lorde yt make new couenaunt ye house israel ye house iuda couenaunt made father toke honde led londe egipte couenaunt brake wherfore punyshed sore saieth lorde shal couenaunt make house israel dayes 〈…〉 saieth lorde plante lawe inwarde partes write hertes wilbe god shalbe people thēce forth shall man teach neghboure brother saye knowe lorde shall knowe lowest vnto hyest saieth lorde forgeue myszdedes wil neuer remembre synnes eny thus saieth lorde gaue sonne light daye 〈…〉 moone starres shyne night moueth see floudes therof waxe fearce name lorde hoostes like ordinaunce shal neuer taken sight saieth lorde shal sede israel neuer ceasse waye people morouer thus saieth lorde like heauen aboue measured foundacions earth beneth maye sought 〈…〉 also cast whole sede israel haue commytted saieth lorde beholde day come saieth lorde yt cite ye lorde shalbe enlarged towre hananeel vnto ye gate corner wall 〈…〉 thence shal right measure taken vnto hill toppe gareb shal come aboute gaatha whole valley deed carcase ash 〈…〉 seremoth vnto broke cedron thence vnto corner horsgate towarde ye east sanctuary lorde also shal set buylded set vp fashion shall neuer broken ner cast downe eny xxxii chapter wordes spake lorde vnto ieremy tenth yeare sedechias kinge iuda ye xviij yeare nabuchodonosor tyme kinge babilons hooste layed sege vnto ierusalem ieremy prophet laye bounde ye courte preson kinge iudaes house sedechias kinge iuda caused layed prophecied maner 〈…〉 thus saieth lorde beholde delyuer cite hondes kinge babilon shal take iere 34 27 38 39 sedechias kinge iuda shal able escape caldees surely shall come hondes kinge babilon shall speake mouth mouth one shall loke another face sedechias shalbe caried vnto babilon shall vntill tyme vyset saieth lorde yf thou takest hōde fight agaynst caldees thou shalt prospere ieremy sayde thus hath lorde spoken vnto beholde hananeel sonne sellum thine vncles sonne shall come vnto requyre redeme ye londe lieth anathot vnto thy self reason kynred thy parte rede bye leui 25 nu 27 36 ruth 4 hananeel myne vncles sonne came courte preson acordinge worde lorde sayde vnto bye londe praye lieth anothot countre ben iamyn heretage thou hast right lowse thy self therfore redeme preceaued commaundement lorde lowsed londe hananeel anathot myne vncles sonne weyed moneye euen seuen sycles ten syluer pen caused also make writinge seale called recorde weyed money vpon waightes toke euydence copie orderly sealed red ouer gaue euydence vnto baruch sonne nerias sonne maasia sight hananeel cosen presence witness named euydence iewes therby courte preson charged baruch also saienge lorde hoostes god israel commaundeth take sealed euydence copie laye erthen vessell maye longe continue lorde hoostes god israel hath determed house feldes vynyardes shalbe possessed agayne londe delyuered euydence vnto baruch ye sonne nerias besought lorde sayenge lorde god gene 1 iere 10 b thou hast made heauen earth thy greate power hie arme nothinge harde ye thou shewest mercy vpon thousandes thou recompēcest wickednes father exo 34 besome child come thou art greate mightie god whose name lorde hoostes greate councell infinite thought thine eye loke vpon wayes men child ro 2 rewarde euery one waye acordinge frutes inuencions thou hast done greate token wonder londe egipte se daye vpon people israel vpon men make thy name greate come passe daye exo 7 vnto 15 chapter thou hast brought thy people israel londe egipte token wondres mightie honde stretched arme greate terriblenes hast geuen londe like thou haddest promysed vnto father namely thou woldest geue lōde floweth mylke honye iudi 23468now came therin possessed folowed thy voyce walked thy lawe thou commaundedest haue done therfore come plage vpon beholde bulworckes made agaynst cite take shalbe wonne caldees besege swearde honger death loke thou hast spoken shal come vpon lo thinges present vnto yet sayest thou vnto lorde god commaundest shall loose pece londe vnto self take witness therto yet meane season cite delyuered power caldees came worde lorde vnto sayenge beholde lorde god flesh eny thinge harde therfore thus sayde lorde beholde shal delyuer cite power caldees power nabuchodonosor kinge babilon iere 25 b 39 b shall take caldees shall come wynne cite set fyre vpon burne gorgeous house whose parlers haue made sacrifice vnto baal poured drynke offeringes vnto straunge goddes prouoke vnto wrath seinge child israel child iuda haue wrought wickednes euer youth vp haue el done prouoked workes owne hondes saieth lorde hath cite bene el prouokinge wrath euer sence daye buylded vnto houre wherin cast sight cause greate blasphemy childrē israel iuda haue done prouoke yee kinges prynces prestes prophetes whole iuda citesyns ierusalem stode vp early 〈…〉 taught instructe turned backes face wolde heare refourmed correcte haue set goddes ye house 〈…〉 halowed vnto name defyle haue buylded hie place baal valley child ennon vowe sonnes doughters vnto moloch neuer commaūded nether came euer thought make iuda synne soch abhominacion morouer thus hath lorde god israel spoken concernynge cite ye youre selues confesse shalbe delyuered honde kinge babilon wonne swerde honger pestilence beholde 〈…〉 gather together londes wherin haue scatred wrath fearfull greate displeasure bringe agayne vnto place shal dwell safely shalbe people wilbe god geue one herte one waye 〈…〉 maye feare day life child maye prospere 〈…〉 set vp euerlastinge couenaunt namely neuer ceasse good put feare hertes shall runne awaye fro yee haue lust pleasure good 〈…〉 faithfully plante londe whole herte soule thus saieth lorde like haue brought greate plage vpon people also bringe vpon good haue promysed men shall haue possession londe wherof ye saye shal nether inhabited people ner catell deliuered hōdes caldees yee londe shalbe bought money euydē ce made ther vpon sealed witness countre ben iamin rounde aboute ierusalem city iuda city vpō mountaynes lie beneth yee city deserte wil bringe presoners hither agayne saieth lorde xxxiii chapter morouer worde lorde came vnto ieremy maner 〈◊〉 20 whē yet bounde courte preson thus saieth lorde fulfilleth thinge speaketh lorde perfourmeth thinge taketh honde euen whose name lorde thou hast cried vnto haue herdethe haue shewed greate hie thinges vnknowne vnto thus saye spake lorde god israel concernynge house cite house kinges iuda shalbe broken thorow ordinaunce weapens caldees come sege shalbe fylled deed carcase men slaye wrath displeasure whē turne face cite hir wickednes beholde saieth lorde heale woundes make whole open treasure peace treuth returne captiuyte iuda israel 〈◊〉 43 set vp agayne afore myszdedes wherin haue offended agaynst clēse blasphemy haue done agaynst regarded forgeue shal get name prayse honoure amonge people earth shall heare good shewe vnto yee shall afrayed astonnied good dedes benefites morouer thus saieth lorde 〈◊〉 7 place wherof ye saye shalbe wildernesse wherin nether people ner catell shal dwell like maner city iuda without ierusalem also shalbe voyde nether people ner catell shall dwell shal voyce gladnesse herde agayne voyce brydegrome bryde voyce shall synge prayse lorde hoostes1 4 psal 117 • louynge mercy endureth euer voyce shall offre vp giftes house lorde restore captiuyte londe afore saieth lorde thus saieth lorde hoostes shall come yet therto londe voyde men catell city londe shal set vp shepherdes cotages city vpon mountaynes city lie vpon playne deserte londe ben iamin feldes ierusalem city iuda shal shepe nombred agayne vnder honde telleth saieth lorde beholde iere 23 tyme commeth saieth lorde wil perfourme good thinge haue promised vnto house israel house iuda day tyme bringe forth vnto dauid braunch rightuousnes shall equite rightuousnesse londe day shall iuda helped esa 32 ierusalem shall dwell safe shall call euen god oure rightuous maker thus lorde promyseth2 7 e dauid shal neuer want one syt vpon stole house israel1 2 • nether shall prestes leuites want one offre allwaye burnt offeringes kyndle meat offeringes prepare sacrifice worde lorde came vnto ieremy maner thus saieth lorde gene 8 • maye couenaunt haue made daye night broken shulde daye night due season maye couenaunt also broken made dauid seruaunt haue sonne reigne trone1 pet 2 shall also prestes leuites neuer fayle serue like starres heauen maye nombred gen 15 22 c nether sonde see measured multiplie sede dauid seruaunt leuites minister morouer worde lorde came ieremy saienge cōsidrest thou people speaketh two kynreddes saye lorde chosen two hath cast awaye farre people come yt haue hope come together eny one people agayne therfore thus saieth lorde yf haue made couenaunt daye night geuē statute vnto heauen earth also cast awaye sede dauid seruaunt wil take prynce sede rule posterite abrahā isaac iacob yet turne agayne captiuyte mercifull vnto xxxiiii chapter wordes lorde spake vnto ieremy •• 39 tyme nabuchodonosor kinge babilon hoostes kingdomes yt vnder power people fought agaynst ierusalem city therof thus saieth lorde god israel go speake sedechias kinge iuda tell lorde sendeth worde 25 • ere 32 〈◊〉 beholde delyuer cite hōde kinge babilon shal burne thou shalt escape hondes shalt led awaye presoner delyuered power thou shalt loke kinge babilon face shal speake mouth mouth shalt thou go babilon yet heare worde lorde sedechias thou kinge iuda thus saieth lorde vnto thou shalt slayne swearde shalt die peace like ye fore father kinges • 3 • c thy progenitours brente shalt thou brente also mournynge shal saye oh lorde thus haue determed saieth lorde spake ieremy prophet wordes vnto sedechias kinge iuda ierusalem tyme kinge babilons hooste beseged ierusalem remnaunt city namely lachis azecha • par 11 yet remayned stronge defensed city iuda wordes lorde spake vnto ieremy prophet sedechias agreed people ierusalem shulde proclamed liberte exo 21 leuit 25 f deut 15 b euery man shulde let fre go seruaunt handemayde hebrue hebruesse iewe holde brother bonde man consented euen obedient let go fre afterwarde repented toke agayne seruauntes handemaydens letten go fre made bonde agayne cause worde lorde came vnto ieremy lorde self sayenge thus saieth lorde god israel made couenaunt youre father brought egipte shulde bondman sayenge seuen yeares 〈…〉 euery man shal let go fre bought seruaunte hebrue yf haue serued sixe yeares yor father obeied herkened vnto ye turned dyd right yt ye proclamed euery mā let neghboure go fre yt ye made couenaunt temple beareth name yet ye haue turned youre selues agayne blasphemed name yt euery man hath requyred seruaunt hand • mayden agayne ye letten go quyte fre compelled serue agayne youre bonde men therfore thus saieth lorde ye haue obeyed euery man proclame fredome vnto brother neghbor wherfore call vnto fredome saieth lorde euen vnto swearde pestilence honger make plaged kyngdomes earth yee men haue brokē couenaunt kepte wordes apoyntmēt made hewed calfe two 〈…〉 wente thorow two halfes therof prynces iuda prynces ierusalem gelded men prestes people londe wēte thorow two sydes calfe men wil geue power enemy hondes folowe vpon lyues deed body shall meate foules ayre 〈…〉 beestes felde sedechias kinge iuda prynces delyuer power enemy desyre slaye honde kynge babilons hooste 〈…〉 departed thorow commaundement saieth lorde shal come agayne cite shall fight agaynst wynne burne morouer laye city iuda waist man shall dwell therin xxxv chapter wordes lorde spake vnto ieremy reigne ioachim sonne iosias kinge iuda go vnto ye house rechabites 〈…〉 call bringe thē ye house lorde commodious place geue wyne drynke toke iasanias sonne ieremy sonne habazania brethrē sonnes whole housholde rechabites brought house lorde closet child hanan sonne igdalia man god closet prynces aboue closet maasia sonne sellum chefe tresury sonnes kynred rechabites set pottes full wyne cuppes sayde vnto drynke wyne sayde drynke wyne ionadab sonne rechab oure father commaunded v sayenge ye youre sonnes shall neuer drynke wyne buylde house 〈◊〉 • 9 b sowe sede plante vynes yee ye shall haue vynyardes youre tyme ye shall dwell intētes yt ye maye lyue lōge lōde wherin ye straūgers thus haue obeyed cōmaundemēt ionadab ye sonne rechab oure father yt hath charged v drynke wyne oure lyue longe oure wyues sonnes oure doughters nether buylde eny house dwell therin haue also amonge v nether vynyardes ner corne lōde sowe dwell tentes obeye acordinge vnto ionadab oure father commaunded v yt nabuchodonosor kinge babilō came vp lōde sayde come let v go ierusalē yt maye escape hooste caldees ād assiriās dwell ierusalē came ye worde lorde vnto ieremy sayenge thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel go tell whole iuda inhabitours ierusalē wyll ye refourmed obeye wordes saieth lorde wordes ionadab sonne rechab cōmaunded sonnes yt shulde drynke wyne fast surely kepte vnto daye drynke wy • e obeye father cōmaundement 〈◊〉 18 25 haue stōde vp early haue spokē vnto geuen earnest warnynge yet haue ye bene obediēt vnto yee haue sent seruaūtes prophetes vnto rose vp early sent worde sayenge turne euery man wicked waye amēde yor lyues go straū ge goddes worshippe thē yt ye maye cō tinue lōde haue geuen vnto youre father ye wolde nether heare ner folowe childrē ionadab rachabs sonne haue stedfastly kepte father cōmaū dement yt gaue people obedient vnto therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes ye god israel beholde wil bringe vpō iuda vpō euery one yt dwelleth ierusalē trouble yt haue deuysed agaynst thē haue spokē vnto thē wolde folowe pro 1 c esa 65 b iere 7 b haue called vnto neuertheles wolde geue answere ieremy also spake vnto housholde rechabites thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel moch ye haue obeyed ye cōmaundemēt ionadab yor father kepte preceptes done acordinge vnto yt hath bydden therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel ionadab sonne rechab shal fayle haue one stocke iere 33 c stōde allwaye xxxvi chap fourth yeare ioachim sonne iosias kynge iuda came ye worde lorde vnto ieremy sayege take boke write therin ye wordes yt haue spokē israel iere 30 iuda people frō tyme yt begāne speake vnto ye reigne iosias vnto daye house iuda heareth plage haue deuysed thē maye peraduēture turne euery man frō wicked waye iere 18 maye forgeue offence synnes dyd ieremy call baruch sonne nerias iere 45 baruch wrote boke ye mouth ieremy wordes lorde spoken vnto ieremy commaunded baruch sayenge preson maye come house ye lorde therfore go thou thither rede boke thou hast writtē mouth namely wordes lorde rede thē lordes house vpon fastinge daye people whole iuda come city maye heare peraduenture praye mekely face lorde turne euery one wicked waye greate wrath displeasure lorde hath taken agaynst people baruch sonne nerias dyd acordinge vnto ieremy prophet cōmaūded readinge wordes lorde boke lordes house done fyfth yeare ioachim ye sonne iosias kinge iuda ione 3 ix moneth commaunded ione 3 people ierusalem shulde fast lorde also come city iuda vnto ierusalem red baruch wordes ieremy boke within house lorde ye treasury gamarias sonne saphan scrybe iere 26 besyde hyer loffte new dore lordes house ye people might heare whē micheas sonne gamarias sonne saphan herde wordes lorde ye boke wēte downe kinges palace ye scrybes chābre ye prynces set elisama scrybe dalias sonne semei elnathā sonne achbor gamaria sonne saphan sedechias sonne hananias prince micheas tolde wordes yt herde baruch rede boke people prynces sent iehudi ye sonne nathanias sonne salamia sonne chusi vnto baruch sayenge take thine honde boke wherout thou hast red people come baruch sonne nerias toke ye boke honde came vnto sayde vnto syt downe rede boke yt maye heare also baruch red yt might heare herde wordes abaszhed one vpon another sayde vnto baruch wil certifie kinge wordes examined baruch sayenge tell v didest thou wryte wordes mouth baruch answered spake wordes vnto mouth alone wrote boke sayde prynces vnto baruch go thy waye hyde ieremy man knowe ye went kinge courte kepte boke chambre elisama scrybe ād tolde kynge wordes might heare kynge sent iehudi fetch ye boke brought elisama ye scrybes chambre iehudi red kynge prynces aboute might heare kynge sat wynter house moneth good fyre whē iehudi red thre foure leaues therof cut boke peces penne knyfe acto 19 b cast fyre vpō herth vntil boke brente fyre vpon herth yet man abashed therof rente clothes nether kynge himselffe ner seruauntes though herde wordes neuertheles elnathan dalias ād gamarias besoughte king wolde burne boke notwithstondinge ye kynge wolde heare commaunded ieramyhel sonne amalech sarias sonne esriel selamia ye sonne abdiel laye hondes vpon baruch scrybe vpon ieremy prophet lorde kepte sight kynge brente boke ād ye sermōs baruch wrote ye mouth ieremy worde lorde came vnto ieremy sayenge take another boke write forsayde sermon written first boke ioachim kynge iuda hath brente tell ioachim kynge iuda thus saieth lorde thou hast brente ye boke thoughtest within thy selff hast thou written therin kynge babilon shal come make lōde waist shall make people catel 〈…〉 therfore thus lorde saieth ioachim kynge iuda shal none generacion syt vpon trone dauid deed corse shalbe cast heat daye 〈…〉 frost night maye come vpon vyset wickednes sede seruauntes morouer euell haue promised thē though herde bringe vpon vpon ye inhabitours ierusalem vpon iuda toke ieremy another boke gaue baruch scrybe sonne nerias wrote therin mouth ieremy sermon first boke ioachim kynge iuda dyd burne added vnto many mo sermon xxxvii chapter sedechias ye sonne iosias made kynge thorow nabuchodonosor kynge babilon reigned londe iuda 〈…〉 steade iechonias sonne ioachim nether ner seruauntes ner people lōde wolde obeye wordes ye lorde spake prophet ieremy 〈…〉 neuertheles sedechias kynge sent iuchal sonne selamia sophonias sonne maasia prest prophet ieremy sayenge praye thou vnto lorde oure god v ieremy walked fre amonge people tyme put preson yet 〈◊〉 17 b pharaos hooste also come egipte caldees beseged ierusalem perceaued departed thence came worde lorde vnto ieremy prophet sayēge thus saieth ye lorde god israel answere shal ye geue kynge iuda sent vnto councell 〈◊〉 46 beholde pharaos hooste come forth helpe shall returne egipte owne londe caldees shall come agayne fight agaynst cite wynne set fyre vpon thus saieth lorde disceaue yor owne myndes thinkynge maner tush caldees go waye v shall go waye though ye slayne whole hooste caldees▪ besege euery one slayne laye tent yet shulde stonde vp set fyre vpon cite whē hooste caldees brokē vp ierusalē feare egipcians armye ieremy went ierusalē towarde lōde ben iamin certayne busynesse amōge ye people whē came vnder ben iamyns porte porter called ierias sonne selamia ye zōne hananias 〈…〉 fell vpō toke sayēge ye mynde runne caldees sayde ieremy go caldees neuertheles ierias wolde beleue brought ieremy boū de prince wherfore prince angrie ieremy causinge beaten layed preson house ionathas scrybe ruler preson thus ieremy put dongeon preson laye longe tyme 〈◊〉 33 c sedechias kynge sent called axed quietly owne house sayenge thinkest thou busynes honde cōmeth lorde ieremy answerde yee yt doth thou sayde shalt delyuered kynge babilons power morouer ieremy sayde vnto kynge sedechias haue offended agaynst ye agaynst thy seruaūtes agaynst people ye haue caused put preson youre prophetes 〈◊〉 2829 haue prophecied vnto sayde ye kynge babilō shulde come agaynst lōde therfore heare lorde kynge let prayer accepte sende nomore ye house ionathas scrybe dye sedechias kynge commaunded put ieremy fore entrie preson dayly geuen cake bred el dighte meate vntill bred cite eaten vp thus ieremy remayned ye fore entre preson xxxviii chapter saphatias sonne mathā gedolias sonne pashur iuchal sonne selamia pashur sonne malchias perceaued wordes yt ieremy spokē vnto people namely maner thus saieth lorde remayneth cite shall perish ether swearde iere 21 b 27 honger pestilence falleth vnto caldees shal escape wynnynge soule pray shal lyue thus saieth lorde cite doute must delyuered ye power kīge babilō iere 32 also shal wynne thē sayde prynces vnto ye kynge syr besech let man put death thus discorageth hōdes soudyers yt cite hōdes people whē speaketh soch wordes vnto thē mā verely laboureth peace ye people mischefe sedechias kinge answered sayde lo yor hōdes ye kīge maye denye nothinge toke ieremy cast dongeon malchias sonne amalech dwelt fore entre preson let downe ieremy wt coardes dongeon water myre ieremy stack fast myre abdemelech morian beynge chamberlayne kynges courte vnderstode cast ieremy dongeon went kynges house spake kynge thē sat vnder porte ben iamin wordes lorde kynge men medle ieremy prophet wronge namely haue put preson dye honger bred cite thē kynge commaūded abdemelech morian sayde take hēce xxx men thou wilt drawe vp ieremy prophet dongeon dye abdemelech toke men wt went ye house amalech vnder almery gat olde ragges worne cloutes let thē downe coarde dongeon ieremy abdemelech morian sayde vnto prophet ieremy put ragges cloutes vnder thine arme hole betwixte thē coardes ād ieremy dyd drewe vp ieremy coardes toke dongeon remayned fore entrie preson thē sedechias kynge sent caused ieremy prophet called vnto thirde entrie house lorde iere 37· c kynge sayde vnto ieremy wil axe somwhat hyde nothinge fro thē ieremy answerde sedechias yf playne vnto thou wilt cause suffre death yf geue coūcell thou wilt folowe kynge swore ooth secretly vnto ieremy sayenge truly lorde lyueth made v soules slaye ner geue hō de seke thy life sayde ieremy vnto sedechias thus saieth ye lorde hoostes god israel yf case thou wilt go forth vnto kynge babilons prynces thou shalt saue thy life cite shall brēt iere 27 b yee thou thy housholde shall escape youre lyues yff thou wilt go forth kynge babilons prynces shal cite delyuered hondes caldees shal set fyre vpon thou shalt able escape sedechias sayde vnto ieremy afrayde iewes fled vnto caldees lest come hōdes haue derision ieremy answerde shal betraye herken vnto voyce lorde beseke ye speake vnto shalt thou well saue thy life yf thou wilt go forth lorde hath tolde planely beholde woman left kynge iudaes house shal go kynge babilons prynces thynke yt thou art disceaued▪ ye men thou didest put thy trust haue gotten vnder set thy fete fast myre gone waye therfore thy wyues child shall fle vnto caldees thou shalt escape hondes shalt ye kynge babilons presoner cite shall brent sayde sedechias vnto ieremy loke yt body knowe wordes thou shalt dye yf prynces perceaue haue talked come vnto sayenge speake sayde kynge hyde v wil put death tell v praye sayde ye kynge se thou geue answere haue humbly sought kynge let lye ionathas house dye came prince vnto ieremy axed tolde maner kynge bad 〈…〉 helde peace perceaued nothinge ieremy abode still fore entrie preson vntill daye ierusalem wonne xxxix chapter cite ierusalē taken ix yeare sedechias kynge iuda tenth moneth 〈…〉 came nabuchodonosor kynge babilon hooste beseged ierusalem xi yeare sedechias fourth moneth ye ix daye ye moneth brake cite kynge babilons prynces came sat thē downe vnder porte nergall sarezer samgarnebo sarsechim rabsaris nergal sarezer rabmag prynces kynge babilon sedechias kynge iuda soudyers sawe fled 〈…〉 departed ye cite night thorow kynges gardē thorow porte betwene two walles wente towarde wildernesse caldees hooste folowed fast toke sedechias felde iericho brought presoner nabuchodonosor kynge babilō vnto reblatha lieth londe hemath gaue iugdment vpon kynge babilon caused child sedechias noble iuda slayne face reblatha made sedechias eye put boūde chaynes sent babilon morouer caldees brēt vp kynges palace ye house people 〈…〉 brake downe walles ierusalem remnaunt people cite soch come helpe euer left comē sorte nabuzaradan chefe captayne caried babilon nabuzaradā chefe captayne let rascall people nothinge dwell still lōde iuda gaue vynyardes corne feldes tyme nabuchodonosor also kynge babilon gaue nabuzaradā chefe captayne charge cōcernynge ieremy sayenge take cherish make moch • se thou harme intreate owne desyre nabuzaradā ye chefe captayne nabusaszbā chefe chamberlayne nergalsarezer treasurer kynge babilons lordes 〈…〉 sent ieremy caused fet fore entrie preson committed vnto godolias sonne ahicam sonne saphan shulde carie home dwelt amonge people 〈…〉 whyle ieremy laye yet bounde fore entrie preson ye worde lorde came vnto sayenge go tell abdemelech morian thus saieth lorde hoostes ye god israel beholde cruell sharpe plage haue deuysed cite brynge vpon thou shalt se wil delyuer sayeth lorde thou shalt come hondes men thou fearest doutles saue thou shalt perish swearde thy life shalbe saued thou hast put thy trust saieth lorde xl chap maner lorde intreated ieremy nebuzaradan chefe captayne let go fre rama 〈…〉 whither led bounde amonge presoners caried ierusalem iuda vnto babilon chefe captayne called ieremy sayde vnto lorde thy god spake mightely mysery vpon place lorde hath sent perfourmed promised ye haue synned agaynst lorde haue bene obedient vnto voyce therfore commeth plage vpon beholde lowse bondes thy hōdes daye yf thou wilt go vnto babilon vp thē se prouyde yf thou wilt go babilon remayne beholde londe thy loke thou thinkest conveniēt good abyde 〈…〉 dwell yf thou canst content dwell alone remayne wt godolias sonne ahicā sonne saphā kynge babilō hath made gouernoure ouer ye city iuda 〈…〉 dwell wt amonge people remayne euer pleaseth ye chefe captayne gaue expēses wt rewarde let go wēte ieremy vnto godolias ye sonne ahicā masphat 〈…〉 dwelt wt amonge people left londe ye captaynes hooste iuda wt felowes scatred abrode euery syde ye lōde vnderstode yt kynge babilō made godolias ye sonne ahicā gouernoure lōde yt man wife childe yee poore men londe yt led captyue babilon shulde vnder iurisdictiō came godolias vnto masphat namely ismael sonne nathanias iohāna ionathas sonnes carea sareas sonne tanhorneth sonnes opheus ye netophetite iesanias ye sonne machati wt cōpanyons godolias sonne ahicam sonne saphā swore vnto thē felowes maner afrayed serue caldees dwell lōde4 25 c kynge babilon seruyce shal ye prospere beholde dwell masphat officer caldees behalfe satisfie soch corne v therfore gather wyne corne oyle kepe youre ware house dwell youre city ye haue kepinge yee iewes also yt dwelt moab vnder ye ammonite idumea ye coūtrees whē herde yt kinge babilō made godolias sonne ahicā sonne saphā gouernoure vpō thē yt left iuda iewes saye returned place fled vnto came lōde iuda godolias vnto masphat gathered wyne frutes moch morouer iohanna sonne carea ye captaynes ye hooste yt scatred euery syde londe came godolias masphat sayde vnto knowest thou yt baalis kinge ye ammonite hath sent ismael ye sonne nathanias slaye godolias ye sonne ahicā beleued thē thē sayde iohāna sonne carea vnto godolias masphat wordes secretly let go praye slaye ismael sonne nathanias yt body shal knowe wherfore kyll yt iewes resorte vnto might scatred remnaunt iuda perishe thē sayde godolias sonne ahicam iohanna sonne carea thou shalt lie men saye ismael xli chap bvt seuenth moneth happened 4 25 yt ismael sonne nathanias ye sonne elisama one ye kynges bloude came wt thē greatest aboute kynge ten men sworne vnto godolias sonne ahicam masphat eate together ismael ye sonne nathanias wt ten men sworne starte vp smote godolias sonne ahicam sonne saphan wt swearde slewe hym kynge babilō made gouernoure londe ismael also slewe iewes godolias masphat caldees founde waitynge vpon nexte daye slayne godolias matter yet vnknowne came certayne men sichem frō silo samaria nombre lxxx shauen beerdes rent clothes heuye bringinge meatoffringes incense hondes offre house lorde ismael sonne nathanias went forth masphat wepinge mete whē met sayde go youre waye godolias sonne ahicam came myddest cite ismael sonne nathanias sworne vnto slewe euē myddest pyt amonge lxxx mē ten yt sayde vnto ismael oh slaye v haue yet greate treasure felde wheate barley oyle hony spared thē slewe brother pyt wherin ismael dyd cast deed body mē slewe godolias kynge asa caused made • 15 feare baasa kynge israel pit dyd ismael fyll slayne men rē naunt th people kynges doughters people yet left masphat vpon nabusaradan chefe captayne made godolias sonne ahicam gouernoure4 25 c ismael sonne nathanias caried awaye presoners towarde ammonite iohā na sonne carea bene captaynes ouer kynges hooste gen 14 c • 30 b herde wickednes ismael sonne nathanias done toke companyons wente fight ismael sōne nathanias founde water rabim gabaon people ismael led captyue sawe iohāna ye sonne carea captaynes hooste glad people ismael caried awaye frō masphat brought agayne whē returned came iohanna sonne carea ismael sonne nathanias fled iohāna wt eight sworne companyons wente ammonite iohanna sonne carea captaynes hooste wt toke remnaūt people ismael sonne nathanias led awaye slayne godolias sonne ahicā also rescued fightinge men woman child gelded men brought agayne gabaon wente thence sat downe geruth chimham lieth besyde bethleē might go egipte feare caldees afrayed ismael sonne nathanias slayne godolias ahicams sonne kynge babilon made gouernoure londe 〈…〉 xlii chapter ruler iohāna sonne carea iesanias sonne osias came people frō leest vnto sayde vnto ieremy prophet heare oure peticiō 〈…〉 thou mayest praye v vnto lorde ye god remnaunt wherof left many thou seist v lorde thy god maye shewe v waye go tell v shulde ieremy prophete sayde vnto haue herde beholde praye vnto god youre lorde ye haue requyred loke answere lorde geueth shall certifie theroff kepe nothinge back frō sayde vnto ieremy 〈…〉 lorde treuth faithfulnes oure recorde wil lorde thy god commaundeth v whether good euell herken vnto voyce oure lorde god sendethe maye prospere haue folowed voyce lorde oure god ten dayes came worde lorde vnto ieremy called iohanna sonne carea captaynes people yee people leest sayde vnto thus saieth lorde god israel vnto ye sent laye forth youre prayer yf ye wel dwell londe shall buylde vp breake downe shall plante rote pacified cōcernynge trouble haue done feare kynge babilon ye stonde awe afrayed saieth lorde helpe delyuer honde pardon wil haue mercy vpon brynge agayne youre owne londe neuertheles yf ye purpose dwell londe ner folowe voyce lorde youre god saye thus dwell go egipte shall nether se warre heare noyse batell ner suffre honger dwell wherfore heare worde lorde ye remnaunt iuda thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel 〈◊〉 27 yf ye whole purposed go egipte ād straūgers swearde ye feare 〈◊〉 41 c shall ouertake egipte honger wheroff ye afrayed shall hange vpon egipte ye shall dye set purpose vndertake go egipte ease selues mysery shall perish swearde honger pestilence one shall remayne shal none escape plage wil bringe vpon thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel like wrath indignacion come vpon inhabitours ierusalē shall displeasure go forth vpon also yf ye go egipte ye shalbe reuyled abhorred brought shame confucion place ye shall neuer se lorde forbyddeth ye remnaūt iuda ye shall go egipte forget haue warned earnestly daye el shal ye begyle youre selues 〈◊〉 41 ye sent vnto lorde youre god sayde praye thou lorde oure god v loke answere lorde oure god geueth bringe v agayne ād shall thereafter haue shewed declared vnto voyce lorde youre god cause hath sent 〈◊〉 2 • c yf ye folowe sure yt ye shall perishe swearde honger pestilence euen place youre lust go dwell xliii chapter ieremy ended ye wordes ye lorde god vnto ye people sake god sent asarias sonne osias iohāna ye sonne carea proude personnes sayde vnto ieremy thou lyest iere 42 • lorde oure god hath sent ye speake vnto v shulde go egipte dwell baruch sonne nerias prouoketh agaynst v might bringe v captyuyte caldees might slaye v carie v awaye presoners vnto babilon iohanna sonne carea captaynes hooste people folowed commaundement lorde namely dwell londe iuda iohanna sonne carea captaynes hooste caried awaye remnaunt iuda come together agayne heithen amōge bene scatred dwell londe iuda men woman childrē iere 41 c kynges doughters nabusaradan chefe captayne left godolias sonne ahicam caried awaye also prophet ieremy baruch sonne nerias came egipte obedient vnto commaundement god thus came taphnis taphnis worde lorde happened vnto ieremy sayenge take greate stone thine hōde hyde brick wall vnder dore pharaos house taphnis men iuda maye se saye vnto thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde iere 46 • sende call nabuchodonosor kynge babilon seruaunt set seate vpon stone haue hyd shall sprede tente ouer commeth shal smyte lōde egipte slaughter presonment swearde shall set fyre vpon temple egipciās goddes burne vp take selues presoners morouer shall araye himselff wt lōde egipte like shepherde putteth cote shall departe awaye thence peace pilers also temple sonne egipte shal breake peces burne tempels egipcians goddes lxiiii chapter worde yt shewed ieremy cōcerninge ye iewes dwelt egipte magdal taphnis memphis londe patures thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel ye haue sene ye mysery yt haue brought vpon ierusalem vpon city iuda daye desolate man dwellinge therin yt greate blasphemy committed prouoke vnto anger wente backe sacrifice ād worshipe vnto straunge goddes nether ner ye ner yor father haue knowne howbeit sent vnto seruaūtes prophetes • ere 25 29 c rose vp early sent vnto gaue warninge soch abhominable thinges thinges hate wolde folowe ner herkē turne wickednes sacrifice vnto straunge goddes wherfore indignacion wrath kyndled 〈…〉 brente vp city iuda feldes stretes ierusalem made waist desolate come passe daye▪ therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel happeneth ye greate euell vnto youre owne soules thus destroye men woman childrē babe iuda none left ye prouoke vnto wrath workes youre owne hondes whē ye offre vnto straunge goddes londe egipte ye gone dwell ye might vtterly perishe ye might reuyled shamfully intreated nacions haue ye forgotten wickednes yor forefather wickednes ye kynges iuda wyues ye wickednes ye youre selues ād youre wyues haue done londe iuda cite londe ierusalem yet ye sory daye ye feare nether walke ye lawe commaundementes haue geuē vnto youre forefather therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel stedfastly advysed determed amo 9 b punysh rote iuda remnaunt iuda purposly wente egipte iere 42 c 43 ease mysery take shall destroyed ye londe egipte shall perishe beynge consumed swearde honger ye leest vnto ye shal perishe swearde honger morouer shalbe reuyled abhorred shamed confounded viset dwell egipte 〈…〉 haue visited ierusalem swearde honger pestilence none remnaunt iuda gone dwell egipte shall left come agayne ye londe iuda though thynke come thither agayne dwell none shal come agayne soch fled awaye men knewe wyues offred vnto straunge goddes greate sorte wyues stode yee people dwelt egipte cite patures answerde ieremy sayde wordes thou hast spoken vnto v name lorde wyse heare euer goeth oure owne mouth wil sacrifice offre oblacions vnto quene heauen iere▪ 〈…〉 like forefather oure kynges oure heades haue done city iuda stretes feldes ierusalem plenteousnesse vytales prosperite myszfortune came vpon v sen left offre sacrifice vnto quene heauen 〈…〉 haue scarcenes thinges perish wt swearde honger last womē sacrifice offred vnto quene heauē make cake ād poure vnto drink offeringes seruyce without oure huszbondes wylles sayde ieremy vnto people men woman fol •• geuen answere dyd lorde remembre sacrifice ye yor forefather 〈…〉 youre kīges ruler wt people haue offred city iuda stretes londe ierusalem hath considered mynde moch lorde might longer suffre wickednes youre inuencions abhominable thynges ye dyd 〈…〉 youre londe desolate voyde yee abhorred mā dwelleth therin eny come passe daye dyd happen vnto 〈…〉 ye made soch sacrifice synned agaynst lorde ye haue folowed voyce walke lawe 〈…〉 ordinaunces statute yee cause mysfortune happened vnto come passe daye morouer ieremy spake vnto people woman heare worde lorde iuda ye londe egipte thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel ye youre wyues haue spoken youre owne mouth thinge ye haue fulfilled dede yee thus haue ye sayde fayle thynge pleaseth v wil sacrifice poure drynk offringes quene heauen 〈◊〉 44 c purposly haue ye set vp youre owne good meanynges hastely haue ye fulfilled youre owne intente therfore heare worde lorde iuda ye dwell londe egipte 〈◊〉 22 beholde haue sworne greate name saieth lorde name shal rehearsed thorow eny man mouth iuda londe egipte saye lorde god lyueth wil watch plage wealth men iuda lōde egipte 〈◊〉 42 c shal perish swearde hō ger vntill vtterly destroyed neuertheles fled awaye ye swearde shal come agayne lōde iuda shal fewe remnaunt iuda gone egipte dwell shall knowe whose wordes shalbe founde true myne take token wil viset place saieth lorde ye maye knowe without doute wil perfourne purpose vpon punysh beholde saieth lorde wil delyuer pharao ophram kynge egipte hondes enemy yt seke life euen gaue sedechias kynge iuda hondes nabuchodonosor kīge babilō 25 •• 39 b sought life xlv chapter wordes yt ieremy prophet spake vnto baruch sonne nerias • ere 36 written sermōs boke mouth ieremy fourth yeare ioachim sonne iosias kynge iuda thus saieth lorde god israel vnto baruch moch thou thoughtest thus thou wast writinge wo lorde hath geuen payne trauayle haue weeried self wt sighinge shall fynde rest therfore tell ieremy yt lorde saieth thus beholde thīge haue buylded wil breake downe agayne rote thinge haue planted yee whole londe sekest thou yet promociō loke desyre bringe miserable plage vpō flesh saieth lorde iere 21 • thy life geue pray euer thou goest xlvi chapter folowe wordes lorde prophet ieremy spake vnto gentile esa 19 • 30 eze 29▪ 3031 4 • b wordes folowinge preached egipciās concernynge hoost pharao necho kynge egipte charcamis besyde water euphrates tyme nabuchodonosor kynge babilon slewe fourth yeare ioachim sonne iosias kynge iuda ye make redy buckler shylde iere 36 ye go forth fight yee harnesse youre horse set youre selues vpon ye set youre salettes fast ye bringe forth speares ye scoure youre sweardes put youre brest plate ala happeneth se afrayed shrēcke ye backe fore youre worthy slayne yee runne fast awaye none loketh behynde fearfulnesse fallen vpon euerychone saieth lorde lightest fote shall fle awaye worthy shall escape towarde north water euphrates shall stomble fall swelleth vp floude roaringe raginge like streames water egipte ryseth vp like floude casteth water greate noyse saye go vp couer earth wil destroye ye city dwell therin get horse backe roll forth ye charettes come forth ye worthy ye morians ye libeans youre buclers ye lideans youre bowes shall daye vnto lorde god hoostes daye vēgeaunce maye avēge enemy swearde shal deuoure shal satisfied bated bloude lorde god hoostes shall haue slayne offringe towarde north water euphrates go vp galaad bringe triacle vnto doughter egipte vayne shalt thou go surgery thy wounde shall stopped heithen shall heare thy shame londe shalbe full thy confucion one stronge man shall stomble vpon another shulde fall together wordes lorde spake prophet ieremy •• 45 b concernyge ye hoost nabuchodonosor kynge babilon destroye londe egipte preach thorow londe egipte cause proclamed migdal memphis taphnis saye stonde still make redie swearde shal consume rounde aboute happeneth thy mightie worthy fallen stode fast euen lorde thrust downe slaughter greate one fell euer still vpon another one cried vpon another vp let v go agayne oure owne people oure owne naturall countre swearde oure enemie crie euen pharao kynge egipte tyme bringe sedicion truly lyue saieth kynge • sa▪ 48 11 • whose name lorde hoostes shall come ye mount thabor libanus yf stode see thou doughter egipte make redy thy geer flyt memphis shalbe voyde desolate mā shal dwell therin londe egipte like goodly fayre calfe one shall come north dryue forwarde hir wagied souldyers like fat calues also shall fle awaye together abyde daye slaughter tyme visitacion shall come vpon crie enemy shall make noyse blast trompet shall entre hooste come wt ax hewer downe wod shall cut downe hir wod saieth lorde eny discrecion shal mo nōbre greshoppers man shalbe able tell thē doughter egipte shalbe confoūded whē shalbe delyuered hondes people north morouer thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde vyset restlesse people alexandria pharao egipte yee goddes kynges euen pharao yt litten vnto 〈…〉 yee delyuer hondes seke lyues namely power nabuchodonosor kynge babilon power seruaūtes 〈…〉 thinges shalbe inhabited afore tyme saieth lorde thou afrayed seruaunt iacob feare thou israel lo 〈…〉 wil helpe farre thy sede londe thy captiuyte iacob also shall come agayne rest shall rich man shall harme 〈…〉 feare thou iacob seruaunt saieth lorde destroye nacions amonge haue scatred neuertheles consume chasten correcke yee discrecion nether wil spare one fautlesse xlvii chapter wordes lorde spake vnto ieremy prophet agaynst phylistines 〈…〉 pharao smote cite gaza thus saieth lorde beholde shall water arise north shall growe greate floude runnynge ouer couerynge londe city dwell therin men shall crie dwell londe shall mourne noyse stampynge stronge barded horse shakynge charettes remblinge wheles father shall loke child feable weery shall hondes tyme shal destroye whole londe phylistynes shall make waist tirus sidon ād sworne vnto lorde destroye palestina iles deuyded frō countre baldnesse come vpon gaza ascalon hir valley shall kepe hir peace longe wilt thou slaye thou swearde lorde turne agayne ye sheeth reste leaue ceasse lorde himselff hath geuen charge agaynst ascalon raysed vp agaynst city see coast xlviii chapter thus saieth ye lorde hoostes ye god israel moab 〈…〉 wo ye cite nebo shal layed waist 〈◊〉 25 b 〈◊〉 • b 〈◊〉 1 • c brought confucion taken yee ye strōge cite cariatharim shalbe brought shame afrayed moab shall nomore • e honoure wicked councell shalbe taken vpon hesebon come shall saye let v rote maye nomore amonge nombre gentile yee maye nomore thought vpon thus swearde shall persecute ye voyce shall crie horonaim greate waistinge destruction moab made desolate crie shalbe herde hir city goinge vp vnto luhtih shall arise lamētacion downe towarde horonaim shall herde cruell deedly crie get awaye saue youre lyues like vnto heeth ye wildernes 〈◊〉 17 b 〈◊〉 ▪ • 9 • sa • b thou hast trusted thy stronge holdes treasure thou shalt taken chamos prestes prynces shall go awaye captiuyte destroyer shal come vpon city none shall escape valley shalbe destroyed feldes shall layed waist like lorde hath determed make token vnto moab get hir awaye spedely hir city shalbe made desolate man shall dwell therin cursed doth worke lorde necligently cursed kepeth backe swearde sheddynge bloude 〈◊〉 47 b moab hath euer bene rich carlesse hir youth vp hath sytten takē hir ease hir treasure neuer yet put one vessell another yt neuer wente awaye captyuyte therfore hir taist remayneth hir sauoure yet chaunged lo tyme commeth saieth lorde shall sende hir trussers trusse vp prepare season hir vessel yee hir tankerdes rattell shake fro moab shalbe ashamed chamos like israel ashamed bethel wherin put hir trust wherfore ye thinke thus mightie re▪ 13 • stronge men warre moab shal destroyed • e 11 g hir city brente vp hir chosen yonge men shall slayne saieth kinge whose name lorde hoostes destruction moab commeth pace hir fall honde hir neghbours shall mourne knowe hir name shal saye happeneth stronge staff goodly rod thus broken thou doughter dibō come downe thy glory syt pouerte destroyeth moab shall come vp also breake downe thy stronge holdes thou dwellest aroer get ye strete loke aboute axe fled escaped saye thynge happened moab confounded ouercome mourne crie tell arnon moab destroyed mysery shall come vpon playne londe namely vpō holon iaza vpon mephat dibō vpon n • bo house diplathaim vpon cariatharim bethgamul vpon bethniaon carioth vpon bosra city lōde moab whether lye farre neare horne moab shal smyttē downe hir arme broken saieth lorde make hir dronken magnified hir self aboue lorde men maye clappe hondes hir vomyte also maye laughed scorne israeli▪ shalt thou laugh scorne taken amōge theues nu 27 yee thy wordes thou hast spoken agaynst thou shalt dryuen awaye ye moabites shal leaue city dwell rockes stone become like doues make nestes hole moabs pryde haue herde hie mynded esa 16 b iere 49 • knowe hir stoutnesse hir boostinge hir arogācy pryde hir stomack saieth lorde hir furiousnes maye nether vpholde wt strength ner dede therfore shal mournynge made moab euery mā shal crie moabs sake lamentacion shalbe made men stonde vpon wall mourne also iazer thou vynyarde sybma thy wyne braūches shal come ouer ye see braunches iazer vnto see destroyer shall breake thy haruest grape gatheringe myrth cheare shalbe taken awaye tymbre felde whole londe moab shall swete wyne presse treader shall haue stomacke crie yee shall none crie vnto afore tyme herde hesebon eleale ioaz lifted vp voyce zoar vnto horonaim bullock thre yeare olde water also nemrim shalbe dried vp morouer make moab ceasse saieth lorde offringes censinge hath made vnto hir goddes hie place wherfore herte mourneth moab like crowde playenge heuy songe men sake bricke wall herte mourneth also esa 15 euen pype pipeth dolefull songe shalbe fewe destroyed heades shall shauen beerdes clipped hondes bounde loynes gyrded aboute sack cloth vpō house toppes stretes moab shalbe mournynge breake moab like vnprofitable vessell saieh lorde fearfull mourneth doth moab hange downe hir heade ashamed thus shall moab laughinge stocke derision rounde aboute deu 28 c • ere 49 thus saieth lorde beholde enemie shal come flyenge aegle sprede wynges vpon moab shall clymme ouer walles wynne stronge holdes mighty men hertes moab •• 49 shalbe like herte woman trauelinge childe moab shalbe made desolate shal nomore people hath set vp selfe agaynst lorde feare pyt snare shall come vpō moab saieth lorde escapeth feare shal fall pyt getteth pyt esa 24 c shall betaken snare bringe yeare visitacion vpon moab saieth lorde able fle shall stonde vnder shadowe hesebon shall go fyre hesebon flame sion shall burne vp proude people moab behynde wo vnto moab thou people chamos shalt perish yee thy sonnes doughters shall led awaye captyne yet last bringe moab captiuyte agayne saieth lorde thus farre plage moab xlix chapter concerninge ammonite thus lorde saieth eze 21 25 • mo 1 hath israel child without heyre hath youre kynge taken gad wherfore doth people dwell city beholde therfore tyme commeth saieth ye lorde brynge noyse warre rabath ammonite lahel shalbe desolate hir city brent vp israelite shall lordes ouer thē possession afore saieth lorde hesebon shall mourne shal roted grounde saieth lorde city rabath shall crie gyrde selues sack cloth shall mourne runne aboute walles kynge shall led awaye presoner yee preestes prynces wherfore trustest thou water streames flowe fro thou fearce doughter thynkest thou art safe reason thy treasure man shal come beholde brynge feare vpon saieth lorde god hoostes aboute ye shall scatred euery man another mā shall gather together agayne fled bringe ammonite also captyuyte agayne vpon edomites hath lorde hoostes spoken maner 〈…〉 wyszdome theman good councell amonge people wyszdome turned clene naught get hence turne youre backes crepe downe depe ye citesyns dedan bringe destructiō vpon esau yee daye visitacion yff grape gatherer came vpon shulde leaue grape yff night robber came vpon shulde take moch thought ynough make esau bare discouer secretes shall able hyde sede shalbe waisted awaye yee brother neghbours ād himselff shall left behinde thou shalt leaue thy fatherlesse child behinde 〈…〉 kepe thy wydowes shall take comforth thus hath lorde spoken beholde men thought vnmete drinke cuppe haue dronken first thynkest thou fre thou shalt nether quyte fre thou must drynke also haue sworne selff saieth lorde bosra shall become wyldernesse open shame laughinge stocke cursynge hir city shalbe continuall deserte perfectly infourmed lorde hath sent message ready vnto hiethen gather together go forth agaynst make ready battayle 〈◊〉 1 〈◊〉 47 b 〈◊〉 4 • lo make small amonge heithen litle regarded amonge men thy hie stomack pryde thy herte haue disceaued ye thou wilt dwell hole stony rockes haue hie mountaynes possession neuertheles though thy nest hie aegles yet wil cast downe saieth lorde morouer idumea shall wildernesse goeth 〈◊〉 1 • b 〈◊〉 • 0 b 〈◊〉 19 c shalbe abashed wondre hir miserable plage like sodom gomor city laye aboute turned vpsyde downe saieth ye lorde shal body dwell idumea man shal haue habitacion beholde like lyon cōmeth vp pleasaunt medowes iordane vnto ye grene pasture ethā wil dryue make runne agaynst yonge man ordene therto like vnto stryue shepherde maye stonde hondes therfore heare councell lorde 〈◊〉 136 b hath taken vpon idumea purpose hath deuysed vpon cite syns theman leest flocke shal teare peces loke fayre thynge haue shal make waist selues also noyse fall ye earth shal quake crie voyce shalbe herde vnto reed see beholde ye enemie shall come fle vp hither like aegle sprede wynges vpon bosra shal hertes worthy edom herte woman trauelinge childe 〈◊〉 48 f 〈◊〉 7 c 〈◊〉 1 vpon damascus hemath arphad shall come confucion shall heare euell tydinges shal tossed fro like see stonde still damascus shalbe sore afrayde shal fle tremblinge shal come vpon sorowe payne shal ouer take woman trauelinge childe shulde worshipfull glorious cite forsaken heare therfore hir yonge men shal fall stretes hir men warre shal takē awaye tyme saieth lorde hoostes kyndle fyre walles damascus shal cōsume palace benadad cedar kyngdome hasor esa 21 c nabuchodonosor kynge babilon smote downe lorde hath spoken thus vpon arise get vp vnto cedar destroye people towarde easte tentes flockes shal take awaye yee hanginges vessell camel also shall carie awaye shall come aboute euery syde fearfull crie fle get soone awaye crepe caues ye maye dwell ye inhabitours hasor saieth lorde nabuchodonosor ye kinge babilon hath holden councel concernynge concluded deuyce agaynst arise get vp agaynst yonder rich carelesse people saieth lorde haue nether gate ner dore barres dwell together camel shalbe stollen droues catell dryuen awaye morouer shauen wil scatre towarde wyndes bringe destruction yee thorow owne familiers saieth lorde hasor also shall dwellinge dragon euerlastinge wildernesse body shal dwell man shal haue habitacion wordes lorde spake prophet ieremy concernynge elam eze 32 dan 8 begynnynge reigne sedechias kinge iuda thus saieth lorde hoostes beholde wil breake bowe elam take awaye strength vpon elam wil bringe foure wyndes ye foure quarter heauen wil scatre agaynst foure wyndes shal people elam shal fle vnto wil cause elam afrayed enemy seke lyues wil bringe vpō indignacion wrath saieth lorde wil persecute swearde longe til haue brought naught wil set stole elam wil destroye kinge ye prynces thence saieth lorde processe tyme wil bringe elam captiuyte agayne saieth lorde l chapter wordes yt lorde spake vnto prophet ieremy concernynge babilon londe caldees esa 15 47 iere 25 • 31 esa 46 dan 5 preach amonge gentile let youre voyce herde make tokē crie kepe sylence saye babilon shal wonne bel shalhe cō founded merodach shalbe ouercome yee goddes shal brought shame ymages shall stonde feare north shal come people agaynst shal make hir londe waist body shal dwell therin nether man ner beast shall fle departe thence dayes tyme saieth lorde childrē israel shall come esd 1 child iuda wepinge makinge haist shal seke lorde god shall axe waye sion thyther shall tu •• e face come hange vpon couenaunt neuer shal broken • ere 25 • ze▪ 36 f people hath bene lost flocke shepherdes haue disceaued haue made go astraye vpon hilles haue gone mountayne litle hill forgotten folde yt came vpon haue deuoured thē enemy sayde haue made faute agaynst haue displeased lorde yee euen lorde bewtie rightuousnes ye defended father yet shal ye fle babilon departe ye londe caldees ye shall rammes go flocke •• 50 g lo wake vp hoost people ye northren londe bringe vpon babilon shal laye sege wynne arowes shal mysse like connynge archer shuteth wronge caldees shalbe spoyled spoyle shalbe satisfied • sa 47 saieth lorde ye chearfull glad treade downe myne heretage fulfilled youre pleasure calues grasse triumphed ouer like bulles ye gotten victory youre mother shalbe sore confounded bare shal come shame shall leest set amonge nacions vyode waist dried vp man shal able dwell feare ye lorde shal whole desolate go babilon •• 18 b 〈◊〉 b 49 c shall stonde still abashed shal wondre hir plage go forth yor araye agaynst babilon rounde aboute ye hādle bowes shute spare arowes hath synned agaynst lorde crie vpon vpon agaynst roūde aboute shal yelde herselfe foundaciōs shal fall hir walles shall come downe shalbe vengeaunce lorde • xo 21 b • eu 24 • hel • b yee vēgeaunce shalbe taken hath done shal dealt withall shal rote sower babilon yt handleth sickle haruest feare swearde enemie euery man shall get owne people euery man shal fle owne londe israel scatred flocke lyon haue dispersed 〈…〉 first kinge assirians deuoured last nabuchodonosor kynge babilon hath brussed bone therfore thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel beholde viset kinge babilon kingdome 〈…〉 haue visited kinge assirians bringe israel agayne pleasaunt pasture maye fede vpon charmel basan satisfied vpon mount ephraim galaad dayes tyme saieth lorde yf offence israel sought 〈…〉 shal none founde yf men enquere synne iuda shal none wil mercifull vnto suffre remayne ouer go downe thou avenger enemy londe viset dwell therin downe smyte vpon backes saieth lorde acordinge haue commaunded gone aboute londe crie slaughter greate murthur namely maner happeneth hammer whole worlde thus broken brussed sonder chaunceth babilon become wildernes amonge heithen maner self haue layed wayte thou art taken vnawarres art thou trapped snared thou hast prouoked ye lorde vnto anger lorde hath opened house ordinaunce brought forth weapens wrath thinge done londe caldees lorde hoostes worke thinges shal come vpon last shal breake hir preuy chābres shall leaue bare stone layed together vpon heapes shall destroye yt nothinge shal left shal slaye hir mightie souldyers put death wo vnto thē daye tyme visitacion honde thinke heare already crie fled escaped londe babilon shewe sion vengeaunce lorde oure god vengeaunce temple yee voyce crie agaynst babilon call vp archer agaynst babilon pytch youre tentes rounde aboute none escape recompence 〈…〉 hath deserued acordinge hath done deale agayne hath set vp self agaynst lorde agaynst ye holy one israel therfore shal hir yonge men fall downe stretes hir men warre shal roted yt daye saieth lorde beholde speake vnto thou proude saieth lorde god hoostes thy daye shal come euē tyme ye visitaciō proude shal stomble fall man shal helpe vp wil burne vp city fyre shal consume rounde aboute thus saieth lorde hoostes child israel iuda suffre violence together haue captiuyte kepe fast wil let go avēger redemer mightie whose name lorde hoostes shal manteyne cause shal make londe shake iudge dwell therin one another swearde shall come vpon caldees saieth lorde vpon dwell babilon vpon prynces vpō wyse mē swearde vpon soythsayers shall become fooles swearde vpō worthy shal stonde feare swearde vpon horsmen charettes vpon comon people dwell vnder thē shal become like woman swearde vpon treasure shal stollen awaye swearde vpon water shalbe dried vp londe worshippeth ymages delyteth straunge wondrefull thinges therfore shal wilde beestes ape estriches dwell therin shal neuer man dwell nether shal eny man haue habitacion euermore 〈◊〉 19 like god destroyed sodom gomorre city laye aboute saieth lorde shal noman dwell also nether shal eny mā haue habitacion 〈◊〉 • 0 b 〈◊〉 28 c beholde shal come people north greate bonde men many kinges shal stonde vp endes earth beare bowes buclers cruell vnmercifull voyce roareth like raginge see ryde vpon horse come weapened fight agaynst babilon soone kinge babilon heareth tell hondes shal waxe feable sorowe heuynes shall come vpon woman trauelinge childe beholde like lyon commeth vp pleasaunt medowes iordane vnto grene pasture ethan 〈◊〉 49 c wil dryue thē forth make runne agaynst shal chose ordene soch thinge iob 41 like wil stryue shepherde maye stonde agaynst therfore heare councel lorde hath geuen vpon babilon deuyce hath taken vpon londe caldees leest amōge people shal teare peces loke pleasaunt thinge haue shal laye waist▪ noyse ye wynnynge babilon sh •• moue earth crie shalbe herde amonge gētiles li chapter thus hath lorde sayde beholde iere 25 b 50 rayse vp perlous wynde agaynst babilon hir citesens yt beare euell agaynst wil sende also babilō fanners fanne destroye hir londe daye hir trouble shal aboute euery syde morouer lorde hath sayde vnto bowe men yt clymme ouer walles brest plate ye shal spare hir yongemē kyll downe hir hoost thus slayne shal fall downe londe caldees wounded stretes iere 50 israel iuda shall forsakē god lorde hoostes holyone israel though haue fylled londe full synne fle awaye babilon esa 48 euery man saue life let man holde tunge hir wickednes tyme lordes vengeaunce come yee shal rewarde agayne babilon hath bene lordes honde golden cuppe iere • 5 c yt maketh londes droncken hir wyne haue people droncken therfore wittes sodenly babilon fallen esa 21 b apo 18 14 b destroyed mourne brynge plaster hir woundes yf maye peraduenture healed agayne wolde haue made babilon whole saye recouered therfore wil let alone go euery mā owne countre hir iudgmēt come heauen gone vp cloudes therfore come shewe sion worke lorde
