oure god make sharpe arowes fyll quyuers iud 2 c 3 11 c lorde shall rayse vp sprete kynge meedes hath allready desyre destroye babilon shalbe vengeaunce lordes vengeaunce temple set vp token vpon walles babilon make youre watch stronge set yor watch men araye yee holde preuye watch yet shall lorde go forth deuyce hath taken vpon dwell babilon thou dwellest greate water thou hast greate treasure rich thyne ende come rekenynge thy wynnynges amos 6 c iere 22 lorde hoostes hath sworne wil ouerwhelme men like greshoppers nombre corage shall crie alarum alarum agaynst iere 10 b yee euen lorde hoostes power made earth wiszdome prepayred ye rounde worlde discrecion spred heauens soone letteth voyce herde water ayre waxe fearce draweth vp cloudes endes earth psal 134 b turneth ye lightenynges rayne bringeth wyndes secrete place reason wyszdome men become fooles esa 44 c baru 6 confounded caster ymages ye thinge make disceate hath breath vayne worthy laughed tyme visitacion shal perish neuertheles porcion iacob none soch made thinges whose name lorde hoostes rodde enheritaunce thou breakest weapens warre yet thorow haue scatred nacions kyngdomes thorow haue scatred horse horse man yee charettes soch sat vpon thorow haue scatred man woman olde yonge bacheler mayden thorow haue scatred shepherde flocke husbond man catell prynces ruler therfore wil rewarde cite babilon hir citesyns caldees euell haue done vnto sion yee ye youre selues shall se saieth lorde beholde come vpon thou noysome hill saieth lorde thou destroyest londes wil stretch honde ouer cast downe stony rockes wil make brente hill nether corner stone ner pinnacle ner foundacion stone shalbe taken eny waist desolate shalt thou lie foreuermore saieth lorde set vp tokē londe blowe trompettes amonge heithen prouoke nacions agaynst call kyngdomes ararat menni ascanes agaynst nombre taphsar agaynst bringe greate sorte horse agaynst yf greshoppers prepare agaynst ye people meedes wt kynges prynces chefe ruler yee whole londe vnder londe also shal shake afrayed deuyce lorde shall come forth agaynst babilon make londe babilon waist mā shal dwell eny therin worthy babilon shal leaue batell kepe selues stronge holdes strength hath fayled shalbe like woman dwellinge place shal brent vp barres shalbe broken one purseuaunt shal mete another yee one poste shal come another bringe kinge babilon tydinges cite taken euery syde foordes occupyde fennes brent vp souldyers sore afrayed thus saieth lorde hoostes god israel doughter babilon hath bene hir tyme like threszshinge floore shortly shal hir haruest come nabuchodonosor kinge babilon hath deuoured distroyed hath made emptie vessell swalowed vp like dragon fylled bely delicates hath cast hath takē substaunce awaye thinge left hath caried vnto babilon saieth doughter dwelleth sion yee bloude also vnto caldees saieth ierusalem therfore thus saieth lorde beholde wil defende thy cause avenge drynke vp hir see drye vp hir water sprynges babilon shal become heape stone 〈…〉 dwellinge place dragon fearfulnes wondringe man dwelleth shall roare together like lyon yonge lyon angrie shal bēde selues heate shal set drynke thē shalbe droncken ioye shal slepe euerlastinge slepe neuer wake 〈…〉 saieth lorde shal carie downe slayne like shepe like wether gootes sesah wonne glory ye whole londe taken happeneth babilon wondred amonge heithē see rysen ouer babilon hath couered greate wawes hir city layed waist londe lieth vnbuylded voyde londe man dwelleth mā traueleth thorow morouer▪ wil vyset bel babilō 〈…〉 thinge hath swalowed vp shal plucke mouth gentile also shall runne nomore vnto yee walles babilon shal fall 〈…〉 people come babilon euery man maye saue life fearfull wrath lorde faynte herted feare euery rumoure shalbe herde londe euery yeare bringeth new tydinges yee straunge wickednes lordshipe lo tyme commeth wil vyset ymages babilō whole londe shalbe confounded yee hir slayne shal lie myddest heauen earth therin 〈…〉 shall reioyce ouer babilon destroyer shal come vpon north saieth ye lorde 〈…〉 like babilō hath beaten downe slayne many israel shal fall many slayne hir kyngdome ye haue escaped swearde haist stō de still remembre lorde afarre thinke vpon ierusalem ashamed heare blasphemy oure face couered shame straunge aleauntes came sanctuary lorde wherfore beholde saieth lorde tyme commeth wil vyset ymages babilon thorow whole lōde shal mourne fall 〈…〉 though babilon clymmed vp heauē kepte power hie yet shal sende destroyer saieth lorde piteous crie shall herde babilon greate mysery londe caldees lorde destroyeth dryueth hie stomack proude boostinge haue bene furious wawes greate water floudes made greate crake wordes destroyer shall come vpon euen vpon babilon shal take hir worthy brake bowes god disposed avenge self vpon sufficiently recompence thē yee saieth lorde make prynces wyse men chefe ruler worthy dronckē shal slepe euerlastinge slepe neuer wake thus saieth kinge whose name ye lorde hoostes morouer thus saieth lorde hoostes thicke wall babilon shal broken hir proude gate shalbe brente vp thinge gētiles people haue wrought greate trauayle laboure shal come naught consumed fyre charge ieremy gaue vnto sarias sonne nerias sonne maasia wente towarde babilon sedechias kinge iuda fourth yeare reigne sarias peaceable prynce ieremy wrote boke misery shulde come vpon babilon yee sermon written agaynst babilon gaue sarias charge thou commest vnto babilon se thou rede wordes saye lorde thou art determed rote place nether people ner catell shal dwell eny lie waist euer thou hast redde boke bynde stone cast myddest euphrates saye apoc 18 • euē thus shal babilon syncke thrust downe burthen trouble bringe vpon shal neuer come vp agayne thus farre ye preachinges ieremy lii chap sedechias xxj yeare olde made kynge4 24 2 par 36 b raigned xj yeare ierusalem mother name hamithal ieremies doughter lobna lyued wickedly lorde euen ioachim dyd wherfore lorde angrie ierusalem iuda longe till cast thē presence sedechias fel kynge babilon ye ix yeare raigne iere 39 4 25 tēth moneth tenth daye moneth happened nabuchodonosor kynge babilon hooste came ierusalem beseged made bulworkes rounde aboute beseginge cite endured vnto xj yeare kynge sedechias fourth moneth ix daye moneth greate honger cite vitayles people londe iere 38 b 39 souldyers brake awaye fled cite night thorow waye porte betwene two walles kynges garden ye caldees cōpassed cite rounde aboute yet wente men waye towarde wildernesse caldees folowed vpon toke sedechias kinge felde iericho hoost runne caried kynge awaye presoner reblatha vnto kinge babilon londe hemath gaue iudgment vpon iere •• b kinge babilō also caused sedechias sonnes slayne face yee put prynces iuda death reblatha morouer put eye sedechias caused bounde cheynes caried vnto babilon let lie preson till dyed ye tenth daye fyfth moneth xix yeare nabuchodonosor kynge babilon nabusaradan chefe captayne kinge babilons seruauntes came vnto ierusalem brent vp house lorde brent vp also kinges palace house gorgeous buyldinges ierusalē whole hoost caldees yt chefe captayne brake downe walles ierusalem rounde aboute poore people soch folke yet left cite also fallen kinge babilon yee people yet remayned nabusaradan chefe captayne caried awaye presoners ye poore people countre dyd nabusaradan chefe captayne leaue londe occupie vynyardes feldes caldees also brake brasen pilers house lorde yee seate brasen lauer house ye lorde caried metall vnto babilon toke awaye also cauldron shouels flesh hokes sprinkler spones brasen vessell occupide seruyce basens colepannes sprinkler pottes candilstickes spones cuppes wherof golde syluer chefe captayne toke also two pilers lauer xij brasen bullockes yt stode vnder ye seate3 7 kinge salomon made house lorde vessell conteyned moch metall might weyed euery piler xviij cubites hie rope went aboute xij cubites foure finger thick rounde vpon rope brasen knoppes euery knoppe fyue cubites hie vpon knoppes whopes pomgranates rounde aboute clene brasse maner pilers fashioned pomgranates wherof hundreth xcvj hanged vpon whoopes rounde aboute chefe captayne also toke sarias yt hie pre •• sophonias chefe next thre kepers treasury toke cite chamberlayne captayne souldyers seuen men kinges seruauntes founde cite sepher captayne vsed muster men warre lx men countre taken cite nabusaradan chefe captayne toke caried kinge babilon vnto reblatha kinge babilon caused put death reblatha londe hemath thus iuda ledde awaye captyue owne londe summe people nabuchodonosor ledde awaye captyue seuenth yeare reigne caried awaye ye iewes thre thousande thre twenty xviij yeare nabuchodonosor caried awaye ierusalem eight hunderth xxxij personnes xxiij yeare nabuchodonosor nabusaradan chefe captayne toke awaye seuen hundreth xlv iewes presoners whole summe presoners foure thousande 〈◊〉 hundreth xxxvij yeare ioachi • kinge iuda caried awaye xxv daye xij moneth euilmerodach kinge babilon yeare yt reigned gaue ioachim kinge iuda pardon let preson spake louyngly set trone aboue ye trones kinges babilon chaunged also dothes preson yee att life longe cōtinuall lyuynge geuen kinge babilon euery daye certayne thinge alowed dayes life vntill dyed ende prophet ieremy lamentatacions ieremy came passe israel brought captiuyte ierusalem destroyed ieremy oure cō fucion oure enheritaunce turned straungers oure house aleauntes become carefull fatherlesse oure mother wydowes fayne drynke oure owne water moneye oure owne wod must bye moneye oure neckes vnder persecucion weery haue rest afore tyme yelded oure selues egipcians assirians might haue bred ynough oure father gone haue synned 〈◊〉 31 e 〈◊〉 18 must beare wickednesse seruauntes haue rule v man delyuereth v hōdes must get lyuynge parell oure lyues drouth wildernesse oure skynne bene brent ouen sore honger wyues raueshed sion maydens city iuda prynces hanged vp honde enemy haue spared olde sage men haue taken yonge men lyues boyes hanged vp vpon tree elder syt vnder gate yonge men vse playenge musick ioye oure herte gone oure mery quere turned mourninge garlande oure heade fallen ala euer synned sore therfore oure hert full heuynesse oure eye dymme ye hill sion destroyed moch fox runne vpon thou lorde remaynest euermore thy feate worlde ende wherfore wilt thou still forget v forsake v longe lorde turne thou v vnto shal turned renue day olde tyme iere 31 e thou hast banished v longe ynough bene sore displeased v ende lamentacions ieremy prophet baruch baruch conteyneth people exortacion pacience chap v conforteth sheweth vocacion heithen chap vi copie epistole ieremy sent iewes led awaye presoners vnto babilon wordes boke baruch sonne nerias sonne maasia sonne sedechias sonne sedei sonne helchia wrote babilon fifth yeare seuēth daye moneth4 2 tyme caldees wanne ierusalem brent first chapter baruch dyd rede wordes boke iechonias sonne ioachim kynge iuda might heare presence people come heare boke yee noble kinges sonnes ye lordes councell elder whole people ye lowest vnto hyest dwelt babilon ye water sodi herde wepte fasted prayed lorde made colleccion also money acordinge euery man power sent ierusalem vnto ioachim sonne helchia sonne salon prest ye prestes people wt ierusalē tyme gotten ornamentes temple ye lorde taken awaye temple might brynge agayne londe iuda x daye moneth siban namely syluer vessel sedechias sonne iosias kinge iuda made nabuchodonosor kinge babilon takē iechonias prynces lordes people led captyue ierusalem vnto babilon sayde beholde haue sent money • e • 14 c bye burnt offerynges incense withall make vnleuended bred offre synne vpon aulter lorde oure god •• 29 b tim • praye prosperite nabuchodonosor kinge babilon balthasar sonne yt dayes maye vpon earth dayes heauen god also maye geue v strength lighten oure eye maye lyue vnder defence nabuchodonosor kinge babilon vnder proteccion balthasar sonne maye longe seruyce fynde fauoure sight praye v also vnto lorde oure god haue synned agaynst lorde oure god vnto daye wrath turned yet awaye v se ye rede boke haue sent vnto rehearced temple lorde vpon hye dayes tyme conuenient thus shal ye saye lorde god rightuous 〈…〉 b 〈…〉 worthy cōfucion shame like come passe daye vnto iuda euery one yt dwelleth ierusalem kinges prynces prestes prophetes oure father haue synned lorde oure god haue put oure trust ner geuen credence haue obeyed haue herkened vnto voyce lorde oure god walke commaundementes gaue v sen daye brought oure forefather londe egipte vnto present daye haue bene euer mysbeleuynge vnfaithful people vnto ye lorde oure god destroyenge oure selues vtterly shrenckinge backe shulde heare voyce wherfore come vpon v greate plage dyuerse curse 〈…〉 like lorde deuysed moses seruaūt brought oure forefather lōde egipte geue v lōde floweth mylcke hony like se daye neuertheles haue herkened vnto voyce lorde oure god acordinge wordes prophetes sent vnto v oure ruler euery man folowed owne mynde wicked ymaginacion offre vnto straūge goddes euel sight lorde oure god ii chapter cause lorde oure god hath perfourmed deuyce 〈…〉 wherof certified v oure heades ruled ierusalē yee oure kynges oure prince israel iuda soch plage hath ye lorde brought vpō v neuer came passe vnder heauē like fulfilled hierusalem acordinge written lawe moses 〈…〉 man shulde eate ye flesh owne sonne flesh owne doughter morouer hath delyuered hondes kinges yt rounde aboute v confounded desolate scatred thē abrode londes naciōs thus brought beneth aboue haue synned lorde god bene obedient vnto voyce therfore ye lorde god rightuous 〈…〉 father reason brought opē shame se daye plage yt come vpon v allready ye lorde deuyced thē v yet wolde praye vnto ye lorde oure god yt might euery mā turne frō vngodly wayes ye lorde hath caused soch plage come vpon v rightuous workes hath cōmaunded v also haue done ner harkened vnto voyce walke ye cōmaundemētes ye lorde yt geuē vnto v lorde god israel thou hast brought thy people londe egipte mightie honde 〈…〉 token wōdres thy greate power ād outstretched arme hast gotten thy selff name come passe daye lorde oure god haue synned haue done wickedly 〈◊〉 9 c haue behaued oure selues vngodly thy rightuousnesses turne thy wrath frō v beseke left amonge heithen thou hast scatred v heare prayer lorde oure peticiōs bringe v captiuyte 〈…〉 thine owne sake get v fauoure sight thē haue led v awaye yt lōdes maye knowe thou art lorde oure god israel generacion calleth vpon thy name 〈…〉 lorde loke downe frō thy holy house vpon v enclyne thine eare heare v deed yt gone downe graues whose soules body 〈…〉 ascribe vnto lorde nether prayse ner rigtuousmakynge soule vexed multitude hir synnes goeth heuely weakely whose eye begynne fayle yee soch soule ascrybeth prayse rightuousnesse vnto lorde lorde poure oure prayer requyre mercy thy sight lorde oure god eny godlynesse oure forefather thou hast sent thy wrath indignacion vpon v acordinge thou dydest threaten v thy seruaūtes prophetes sayenge 〈…〉 thus sayeth lorde bowe downe youre shulders neckes serue kynge babilon shal ye remayne still londe gaue vnto youre father yff ye ner heare voyce ye lorde youre god serue kynge babilon shall destroye city iuda within ierusalem without also take voyce myrth voyce ioye voyce brydegrome voyce bryde ād shal man dwell londe wolde herken vnto thy voyce kynge babilon seruyce therfore hast thou perfourmed wordes thou spakest thy seruauntes prophetes namely bone oure kynges bone oure father shulde trāslated place lo layde heate ye sonne colde ye night ād deed greate mysery wt hunger wt swearde wt pestilence clene cast forth tēple wherin thy name called vpon thou hast layde waist se daye yt wickednes house israel house iuda▪ lorde god thou hast intreated v thy goodnes acordinge ye greate louinge mercy thyne like thou spakest thy seruaunte moses daye thou didest cōmaū de wryte thy lawe child israel sayenge yf ye herkē vnto voyce deu 4 28 thē shal greate multitude turned smal people wil scatre thē abrode withstōdinge sure folke heare hardnecked people ye lōde captiuyte shall remembre selues lerne knowe yt lorde god geue thē herte vnderstōde eares heare shal prayse lōde captiuyte thynke vpon name shall turne frō harde backes vngodlynes shal remembre thynges yt happened vnto forefather synned agaynst bringe agayne londe promised wt ooth vnto father abrahā isaac iacob shal lordes yee wil increace thē minysh thē wil make another couenaūt heb 8 c zach 8 b apoc 2 • • soch one shal endure euer namely yt god shalbe people wil nomore dryue people child israel londe yt haue geuē thē iii chapter lorde allmightie thou god israel soule yt trouble sprete yt vexed crieth vnto heare v lorde haue pite vpon v thou art mercifull god gracious vnto v haue synned ye thou endurest euer shulde thē vtterly perishe▪ lorde almightie thou god israel heare ye prayer ye deed israelite childrē haue synned ye ephe 2 herkened vnto voyce lorde god dani 3 c iere 〈◊〉 3 c 5 e cause plage hange vpō v lorde remēbre ye wickednes forefather thinke vpō thy power name tyme thou art ye lorde god ye lorde wil prayse thou hast put ye feare ī harte ye intēt yt shulde call vpon ye name prayse ye oure captiuyte nu 1 • psal 77 yt might turne wickednesse oure forefather yt synned 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 beholde yet daye oure captiuyte thou hast scatred v abhominacion curse synne like hath happened vnto oure father also psal 78 wickednesse departynge israel heare commaundementes life pondre well thine eares thou mayest lerne wysdome happeneth israel thou art thyne enemy lōde thou art waxen olde straū ge countre defyled deed art thou become like go downe graues euē thou hast forsaken well wysdome iere 2 b yf thou haddest walked waye god truly thou shuldest haue remayned still safe ī thine owne londe lerne discrecion vertu pro 1 3 vnderstōdinge thou mayest knowe also frō whence cōmeth longe life psal 18 b 118 r necessary lyuynge light eye quyetnes euer foūde hir place came euer hir treasure ye prynces heithen become soch ruled beestes vpon earth pastyme foules ayre hoorded vp syluer golde wherin men trust moch made ende gatheringe worth coyned siluer carefull coude bringe workes passe roted gone downe hell men come vp steade yonge men haue sene light dwelt vpon earth waye reformacion haue knowne ner vnderstonde pathes therof nether haue child receaued yee right farre frō thē hath bene herde lōde canaan nether hath bene sene theman agarenes sought wisdome earthly like marchauntes lōde theman connynge also laboure wisdome vnderstondinge ye waye true wisdome knowe nether thynke vpon pathes therof israel greate house god large place possession deu 4 f iere 23 psa 144 greate hath none ende hye vnmeasurable become famouse giauntes greate bodyes worthy men warre lorde chosen nether haue founde waye reformacion therfore destroyed moch wisdome perished foolishnesse hath gone vp heauen take wisdome brought downe frō cloudes hath gone ouer see fynde hath chosen aboue golde brought hither man knoweth wayes wisdome nether eny yt seke hir pathes woteth thynges knoweth hath founde foreknowlege 〈…〉 prepared earth begynnynge fylled maner foules beestes sendeth light goeth whē calleth agayne obeyeth hī wt feare starres kepe watch geue light yee yt gladly calleth saye chearfulnes shewe light vnto yt made thē oure god ād shall none cōpared vnto yt hath founde wisdome 〈…〉 hath geuen vnto iacob seruaunt israel beloued 〈…〉 afterwarde dyd shewe vpon earth dwelt amonge men iiii chapter boke commaundemētes god lawe ye endureth euer yt kepe shall come life soch forsake shall come death turne iacob take holde walke waye thorow brightnesse shyne geue thyne honoure another thy worshipe straunge people israel happie 〈…〉 seīge god hath shewed v soch thynges pleasaūt vnto good cheare thou people god thou awnciēt israel ye solde amonge heithen howbeit youre vtter destruccion ye prouoked god lorde wrath displeasure therfore ye delyuered vnto vnto youre enemy ye displeased euerlastinge god made offerynge vnto deuels god ye haue forgottē brought vp ād youre nurse haue ye greued ierusalem sawe wrath god commynge vpon sayde herkē ye dwell aboute sion god hath brought greate heuynesse ād se captyuyte people sonnes doughters euerlastynge god brynge vpon ioye dyd norish must leaue wepynge sorow let man reioyce ouer wyddowe ād forsaken synnes child desolate euery man departed lawe god wolde knowe rightuousnes ner walke waye cōmaundementes pathes treuth godlynesse lust go ye dweller aboute sion come let v call remembraunce captiuyte euerlastinge god hath brought vpon sonnes doughters hath brought people vpon farre vncurteous people 〈…〉 straunge lāguage nether regarde olde ner pyte yonge haue caried awaye deare beloued wyddowes leauynge alone desolate childlesse ala helpe yt hath brought plage vpon delyuer also frō hondes youre enemy go youre waye child go youre waye desolate forsaken haue put clothinge peace put vpon sack cloth prayer tyme call vpon hyest good cheare 〈…〉 child crie vnto lorde shal delyuer power prynces youre enemy verely haue euer good hope youre prosperous health yee gladnesse come vpon holy one mercy ye shall haue oure euerlastinge sauioure mournynge wepinge dyd let go fro ioye perpetuall gladnesse shall lorde brynge agayne vnto like neghbours sion sawe youre captyuite god euē shal also se shortly youre health god shal come greate honoure euerlastinge worshipe child suffre paciētly wrath shal come vpon enemie hath persecuted shortly thou shalt se destruccion shalt treade vpon necke derlinges haue gone rough harde wayes led awaye flocke scatred abrode enemy good cōforte child crie vnto lorde led awaye hath yet remembraūce like ye haue bene mynded swarne yor god shal ye endeuoure youre selues x tymes 〈◊〉 ▪ 33 b turne agayne seke hath brought plage vpō shal brynge euerlastinge ioye agayne youre health take good herte vnto ierusalē gaue ye name exorteth wicked doer put trouble shall perish iere 50 b c soch haue reioysed thy fall shalbe punyshed city thy child serue haue caried awaye thy sonnes shal correcte like glad yi decaye shal mourne owne destruccion ioye multitude shalbe taken awaye ād cheare shalbe turned sorowe fyre shal fall vpon euerlastinge god longe endure shalbe inhabited deuels greate season v chapter ierusalem loke aboute towarde east beholde ioye commeth vnto god lo thy sonnes thou hast forsakē scatred abrode come gathered together east west reioysinge worde holy one vnto honoure god put thy mournynge clothes ierusalem thy sorow decke worshipe honoure commeth vnto god euerlastinge glory god shal put cloake rightuousnesse vpon set crowne euerlastinge worshipe vpon thine heade vpon god declare brightnes vnder heauen yee euerlastinge name shalbe geuen god peace rightuousnesse ye honoure god feare arise ierusalem stōde vp hye loke aboute towarde east beholde thy child gathered east vnto west reioyce holy worde hauynge god remembraunce departed fote led awaye enemy shal lorde bringe caried honoure child ye kyngdome god purposed brynge downe stoute moūtaynes yee hye rockes fyll valley make eauen grounde yt israel maye diligēt lyue vnto ye honoure god woddes pleasaūt tree shal ouershadowe israel cōmaundement god hyther shal god brynge israel ioyfull myrth light magesty mercy rightuousnesse cō meth himselff copie epistle ieremy prophet sende vnto iewes led awaye presoners kynge babilō wherin certifieth thinge cō maunded god vi chapter synnes ye haue done agaynst god • er 25 b ye shal led awaye captyue vnto babilon euen nabuchodonosor kynge babilon ye come babilon ye shall remayne many yeares longe season namely vij generacions wil bringe awaye peaceably thē ce shal ye se babilō goddes golde syluer wodd stone borne vpon men shulders cast fearfulnes heithen loke ye ye afrayed let feare ouercome therfore ye se multitude people worshippinge behinde saye ye youre hertes lorde thou oughtest worshipped myne angel also shal deu 6 c wil care youre soules tymbre goddes ye carpēter hath polisshed yee gylted layed ouer syluer yet vayne thinges speake like wench yt loueth peramours trymly deckte euen made hanged wt golde crownes golde verely haue goddes vpon heades prestes themselues take golde syluer put owne v yee geue vnto harlottes ād trymme whore withall agayne take whore decke goddes therwith yet goddes delyuer selues rust mothes iere 10 whē haue couered clothynge purple wype face dust temple wherof moch amōge thē one hath sceptre honde though iudge countre yet slaye soch offende another hath swearde axe honde nether able defende selfe batayll ner f • murtherers ye maye vnderstonde goddes therfore se yt ye nether worshipe ner feare like vessel yt man vseth nothinge worth broken euen goddes set vp temple eye full dust thorow fete come like ye dores shut roū de aboute vpō yt hath offended kinge deed body kepte besyde graue euen prestes kepte dores barres locke lest goddes spoyled robber set vp cā dels thē yee verely yt many wherof se one euen blockes stonde temple sayde yt serpentes wormes come earth gnawe hertes eatinge clothes also yet fele face blacke thorow smoke yt temple oules swalowes byrdes fle vpon yee cattes runne ouer heades ye maye sure goddes therfore feare golde haue make beutifull excepte body dight rust wil geue shyne cast fourme felt bought money haue breth life within must borne vpon men shulders haue fete wherby declare vnto men nothynge worth confounded worshipe yf fall grounde ryse vp agayne thē selues yee though one helpe vp set right yet able stonde alone must haue proppes set vnder like deed men thinge offred vnto prestes sell ād abuse yee prestes wyues take therof vnto sicke poore geue nothinge woman childe mēstruous laye hondes offerynges ye maye sure goddes therfore ye afrayde whence cōmeth thē called goddes woman syt goddes syluer golde wodde prestes syt temple hauynge open clothes whose heades beerdes shauen haue nothige vpon heades roaringe cryenge vpon goddes men feast one deed prestes also take awaye garmentes ymages decke wyues child withall whether good euell yt eny man vnto able recompence nether set vp kynge ner put downe like maner maye nether geue rich ner rewarde euell though man make vowe vnto ād kepe wil requyre restore blynde mā sight ner helpe eny mā nede cā shewe mercy wyddowe ner good ye fatherles goddes wodd stone golde syluer euen stone yt hewē ye mountayne yt worshipe thē shal cōfounded shulde taken goddes yee darre men call thē goddes though caldees worshiped thē hearinge yt domme coude speake yet selues offre vnto bel wolde fayne haue speake saye coude fele yt maye moue mē come vnderstōdinge shall forsake goddes haue felinge greate sorte woman gyrded coardes syt stretes burne olyue beries yf one conveyed awaye lye wt eny soch come casteth hir neghburesse teth worthely reputed ner hir coorde broken euer done vayne ād lost maye thē thought sayde yt goddes carpenter goldsmythes make thē nether eny thinge euen worke men wil make yee goldsmithes selues make thē longe cōtynuaunce shulde thī ge made goddes vayne therfore thinges yee shame leaue behinde thē posterite soone cōmeth eny warre plage vpon thē prestes ymagyn maye hyde thē selues thē men thynke goddes nether maye defende selues warre ner delyuer thē fro mysfortune seynge wodd stone syluer golde people kynges shal knowe herafter vayne thinges yee shalbe openly declared goddes euen workes mēs hōdes god hath nothinge thē set kynge londe ner geue rayne vnto men geue sentence matter nether defende londe frō wronge able moch crowe flyeth betwixte heuen earth whē happeneth fyre house goddes wodde syluer golde prestes wil escape saue thē selues goddes burne balkes therin withstōde eny kynge batell maye thought graunted goddes morouer goddes wodde stone golde syluer maye nether defende thēselues theues ner robber yee ye wicked stronger thē strype apparell clothed withall take golde syluer frō thē get thē awaye yet cā helpe thēselues therfore moch better man kinge shewe power el profitable vessel house wherin yt oweth might haue pleasure yee dore house kepe soch thinges safe therin thē soch vayne god sōne mone starres geue shyne light obedient men good lightenynge glistreth cleare wynde bloweth euery countre whē god cōmaundeth cloudes go rounde aboute whole worlde bydden fyre sent downe frō aboue cōmaunded burneth vp hilles ād woddes goddes like one thynges nether beuty ner strēgth wherfore mē shulde thynke ner saye goddes seynge cā nether geue sentence iudgment ner men good moch ye sure goddes feare nether speake euell ner good kynges cā shewe token heauē ye heithen nether shyne sōne ner geue light mone yee ye vnreasonable beastes better get thē vnder rofe selues good ye certified maner meanes goddes therfore feare thē like frayboggarde garden cucumber kepeth nothinge euen goddes wod syluer golde like whyte thorne orcharde euery byrde sytteth vpon yee like deed body cast darcke euen goddes wodde syluer golde purple scarlet haue vpon thē ād soone faydeth awaye ye maye vnderstonde goddes yee selues shal cōsumed last shal greate cōfucion londe blessed godly man yt hath ymages worshippeth none shalbe farre reprofe ende prophet baruch canon hebrue prophet ezechiel ezechiel conteyneth chap vision iiij beestes wheles chap ii sendinge prophet temple wherby descrybed mystery church christ saluacion faithfull hi • ▪ first chapter chaūsed xxx yeare fifth daye fourth moneth amonge presoners ryuer cobar heauens opened sawe vision god fifth daye moneth made fyfth yeare kynge ioachims captiuyte tyme came ye worde lorde vnto ezechiel sonne buzi prest londe caldees water cobar honde lorde came vpō 〈…〉 loked beholde stormy wynde came north greate doude full fyre wt glistre lightened rounde aboute ye myddest fyre cleare licknesse foure beastes fashioned like man sauynge euery one foure face foure wynges legges straight fete like bullockes fete glistred bene fayre scoured metall vnder wynges vpon foure corner men hondes face wynges towarde foure corner yet wynges one euer touched another wente turned aboute 〈…〉 ech one wente straight forwarde vpon rightside foure face like face man fa lyon vpon left side face oxe face aegle face also wynges werespred aboue two wynges one touched euer two wynges another two couered bodie euery one wente wente straight forwarde sprete led thither wente turned aboute goynge 〈…〉 fashion countenaūce beestes like hote coales fyre euen though burnynge cresshettes bene amonge beestes fyre gaue glistre fyre wente lighteninge whē ye beestes wēte forwarde backwarde one wolde haue thought lightened whē well considered beestes sawe worke wheles vpon earth foure face also like beestes fashion worke wheles like see foure wheles ioyned made loke vpon bene one whele another one wente forwarde wente foure turned thē aboute ī goinge large greate horrible loke vpon body full eye rounde aboute foure whē beestes wē te wheles wente also beestes lift selues vp ye earth wheles lift vp also whyther euer sprete wente thither wente also ye wheles lift vp folowed thē ye sprete life wheles ye beestes wēte forth stode still lift selues vp earth wheles also wente stode still lift vp ye breth life wheles aboue ouer ye heades beestes firmament fashioned bene pure christall spred aboue vpon heades vnder firmament wynges layed abrode one towarde another two wynges couered body euery beest thy wente forth herde noyse wynges like noyse greate water bene voyce greate god russhinge together hoost men stode still let downe winges stode still letten downe wynges thondred firmament aboue heades aboue firmament ouer heades fashion seate bene made saphir apon seate sat one like mā behelde like cleare light bene fyre loynes vpwarde beneth loked vpon vnder ye loynes thought like shyninge fyre geueth light euery syde yee shyne glistre yt lightened rounde aboute like raynbowe raynie daye apeareth cloudes euē similitude wherin glory lorde apeared whē sawe fell vpon face herkened vnto voyce spake ii chapter sayde vnto stonde vp vpon thy fete thou sonne mā talke • ze 3 commonynge sprete came set vp vpon fete marcked thinge sayde vnto sayde beholde thou sonne man sende child israel runnagates obstinate people haue takē parte agaynst runne waye fro forefather exo 32 vnto daye yee sende ye vnto people yt haue rough vysages stiff stomackes vnto thou shalt saye maner lorde god himselff hath spoken yt whether obedient frauwarde housholde maye knowe yet hath bene prophet amonge therfore thou sonne man feare thē nether afrayed wordes shall rebell agaynst iere 1 c despise ye yee thou shalt dwell amonge scorpion feare wordes abashed lokes frauwerde housholde se thou speake wordes vnto whether obediēt obstinate therfore thou sonne man obeye thou thinges saye vnto ye thou stiffnecked like stiffnecked housholde open thy mouth eate geue lokynge vp beholde sent vnto hande wherin closed boke hande opened apo 5 written within without full carefull mourninges ala wo iii chapter sayde vnto thou sonne mā eate euer yee eate closed boke go thy waye iere 15 c 4 e 14 • apo 10 b speake vnto child israel opened mouth gaue boke eate sayde vnto thou sonne man thy bely shal eate thy bowel shalbe fylled ye boke geue dyd eate boke 〈…〉 mouth sweter hony sayde vnto thou sonne mā get soone vnto house israel ād shewe thē ye wordes cōmaunde 〈…〉 sende people hath straūge vnknowne harde speache vnto house israel many nacions haue diuerse speaches harde language whose wordes thou vnderstōdest neuertheles 〈…〉 yf sent people wolde folowe house israel wil folowe ye folowe 〈…〉 yee house israel haue stiff foreheades harde hertes beholde therfore make thy face preuayle agaynst face harden thy foreheade agaynst foreheades thy foreheade shall harder adamāt flynt stone thou mayest feare yt lesse 〈…〉 lesse afrayed frauwerde housholde sayde morouer vnto thou sonne man take diligent hede thine eares ye wordes speake vnto fasten thine herte go presoners thy people speake vnto ād saye maner thus lorde god hath spokē whether ye heare heare sprete toke vp herde noyse greate russhinge remouynge blissed glory lorde place herde also noyse wynges beestes russhed one agaynst another yee ratlynge wheles russhinge noyse greate sprete toke vp caried awaye 〈…〉 wente heuy soroufull mynde honde ye lorde comforted right soone begynnynge moneth abib came presoners dwelt water cobar remaȳ ned place 〈…〉 continued amonge seuen dayes beinge sory seuen dayes expyred lorde sayde vnto thou sonne man 〈…〉 haue made watch man vnto house israel therfore take good hede wordes geue warnynge commaundement yff saye vnto concernynge vngodly mā without doute must dye thou geuest warnynge ner speakest vnto maye turne euell waye lyue shall vngodly man dye owne vnrightuosnes bloude requyre thyne honde neuertheles yff thou geue warnynge vnto wicked yet forsake vngodlynesse shall dye owne wickednesse thou hast discharged thy soule yf rightuous mā go frō rightuousnesse 〈…〉 thinge euell laye stomblinge blocke shall dye thou hast geuen warninge yee dye shall owne synne vertue shall thought vpon bloude requyre thine honde neuertheles yf thou exhortest rightuous synne ye rightuous synne shall lyue hath receaued thy warnynge thou hast discharged thy soule came hō de lorde vpon sayde vnto stonde vp go felde yt maye talke rysen vp gone forth felde beholde glory lorde stode 〈…〉 like sawe afore water cobar 〈◊〉 1 g fell downe vpon face ye sprete came set vp vpon fete sayde thus vnto go thy waye sparre thy selff thyne house beholde thou sonne man shall chaynes brought bynde wt thou shalt escape thē make thy tunge cleue rofe thy mouth thou shalt domme chider obstinate housholde speake vnto open thy mouth saye thus saieth lorde god heareth let heare let leaue frauwarde housholde iiii chapter thou sonne man take tyle stone laye descrybe vpon cite ierusalem beseged bulworkes strō ge diches grauen euery syde descrybe also tentes hoost men rounde aboute morouer take yron panne set betwixte ye cite steade yron wall set thy face towarde besege laye ordinaunce agaynst wynne shal token vnto house israel thou shalt slepe vpon thy left syde laye synne house israel vpon certayne dayes apoynted thou shalt slepe vpon syde beare synnes dan 9 neuertheles apoynte tyme put synnes nombre day thre hundreth xc dayes must thou beare wickednesse house israel thou hast fulfilled dayes lye downe agayne slepe vpon thy right syde xl dayes beare synnes house iuda daye yeare daye saye yeare euer laye vpon nu 14 • therfore set thy face agaynst beseged ierusalem discouer thine arme thou mayest prophecie agaynst beholde laye chaynes vpon thou shalt turne one syde another till thou hast ended dayes thy sege wherfore take vnto wheate barly beanes growell sede milium fitch put together vessell make loaues bred therof acordinge nombre dayes thou must lye vpon yt syde thou mayest haue bred eate thre hundreth xc dayes meate thou eatest shall haue certayne waight apoynted namely twentie sycles euery daye apoynted meate shalt thou eate daylie beginnynge ende thou shalt dryncke also certayne measure water namely sixte parte hin shalt thou drynke daylie begynnynge ende barly cake shalt thou eate yet shalt thou first strake thē ouer mās donge yt maye se sayde lorde osec 9 euen thus shal child israel eate defyled bred myddest gentile amonge scatre sayde oh lorde god beholde soule yet neuer stayned fro youth vp vnto houre dyd neuer eate deed carcase slayne wilde beestes nether came euer eny vnclene flesh mouth vnto answered sayde well graunte take cowes donge donge man strake bred ouer thē sayde vn beholde thou sonne man eze 5 eze 14 25 mynishe prouysion bred ierusalem shall ye bred eate scarcenesse water shall haue litle measure theroff drynke haue nomore bred ner water one shal destroyed another famish awaye wickednesse v chapter take sharpe knyfe thou sonne man namely rasoure take shaue hayre thy heade beerd take scoales waight deuyde hayre sunder burne thirde parte therof fyre myddest cite cut thirde parte peces knyfe iere 2 thirde parte remayneth cast wynde shewe bare knyfe yet afterwarde take litle bynde cote lappe take curtesy cast myddest ye fyre burne fyre fyre shall go flame vpon whole house israel morouer thus sayde lorde god ierusalem set middest heithen nacions rounde aboute hath despised iudgmētes ye gentile thē selues broken cōmaundementes nacions lye rounde aboute haue cast myne ordinaunces walked lawes therfore thus saieth lorde god leui • 8 moch ye wt youre wickednesse farre exceade heithē dwell rounde aboute ye haue walked lawes nether haue ye kepte myne ordinaūces therfore thus saieth ye lorde god also come vpon myddest syt iugdmēt sight heithen handle soch fashion neuer dyd neuer wil tyme forth thy abhominacions father shal fayne eate owne sonnes deu 28 e tren 4 b 4 reg 6 f sonnes owne father soch courte kepe whole remnaunt scatre wyndes wherfore truly lyue saieth lorde god seynge thou hast defyled sanctuary maner abhominacions thy shamefull offence cause also destroye the▪ myne eye shall ouersee nether spare one thirde parte within 〈…〉 shall die pestilence honger another thirde parte shall slayne downe rounde aboute swearde thirde parte remayneth scatre abrode towarde wyndes drawe swearde thus wil perfourme indignacion set wrath agaynst ease self haue fulfilled myne anger agaynst shall knowe lorde wt feruent gelousy haue spoken morouer make waist abhorred heithen dwell aboute sight go punysh wrath myne anger plage whote displeasure thou shalt abhominacion shame gasinge wondringe stocke amonge heithen lye aboute euen lorde haue spoken shall come passe shute amonge perlous dartes hōger shalbe death 〈…〉 yee therfore shall shute destroye encrease hunger mynish prouysion bred amonge plage mysery sende yee wilde beestes also destroye pestilence bloud sheddinge shall come vpon swearde wil bringe ouer euen lorde haue sayde vi chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man turne thy face mountaynes israel 〈…〉 thou mayest prophecie vnto saye heare worde lorde god ye mountaynes israel thus hath lorde god spoken moūtaynes hilles valley dale beholde brynge swearde ouer destroye youre hie place wil cast downe youre aulters breake downe youre temple youre slayne men laye youre goddes deed carcase child israel cast ymages youre bone wil strowe rounde aboute youre aulters dwellinge place city shalbe desolate ye hill chapel layed waist youre aulters destroyed broken youre goddes cast downe taken awaye yor tēpels layde eauē groūde youre owne workes clene roted youre slayne men shall lie amonge ye maye lerne knowe yt lorde yt amōge haue escaped swearde leaue amonge gentile scatre amonge nacions escape 〈…〉 shall thinke vpon amonge heithen shalbe captiuyte whorish vnfaithfull herte wherwith runne awaye frome breake yee put eye committe fornicacion idol shall ashamed displeased selues wickedness ād abhominacions haue done shal lerne knowe vayne lorde spake bringe soch mysery vpon lorde sayde morouer vnto smyte thine hondes together stampe thy fete saye wo worth abhominacions wickedness house israel thē shal perish swearde hōger pestilence farre shall dye pestilence nye hande shall perish swearde ye beseged shall dye honger thus wil satisfie wrothfull displeasure vpon shall ye lerne knowe lorde whē youre slayne men lye amōge youre goddes aboute youre aulters vpon hie hilles toppes mountaynes amōge grene tree amonge thicke okes euen place dyd sacrifice idol stretch myne honde vpon make londe waist shall lye desolate voyde wildernesse deblat forth thorow habitacions lerne knowe lorde vii chapter worde lorde came vnto maner call thou sonne man thus saieth lorde god vnto londe israel ende commeth yee verely ende commeth vpon foure corner earth shall ende come vpon sende wrath vpō wil punysh acordinge thy wayes rewarde thy abhominaciōs myne eye shall ouersee eze 7 b 9 c nether spare rewarde acordinge thy way declare thy abhominacions shall ye knowe lorde thus saieth lorde god beholde one mysery plage shall come another ende ende saye waiteth come already ye houre come agaynst dwellest londe tyme honde daye sediciō hard glad tidinges vpō moū taynes therfore shortly poure sore displeasure ouer fulfill wrath vpon iudge thy way recompence thy abhominacions myne eye shal ouersee eze 7 b 9 c nether wil spare rewarde thy way shewe thy abhominacions lerne knowe yt lorde yt smyteth beholde daye daye come houre runne rodde florisheth wylfulnesse waxeth grene malicious violēce growne vp vngodly waxen staff yet shall complaynte made ner trouble shall come thinges tyme cōmeth daye draweth nye byeth let reioyce1 cor 7 • selleth let sory trouble shall come myddest rest2 te 5 iere 15 b seller shall come agayne byer nether shall lyue vision shal come greatly ouer yt shal hyndered mā also wt wickednesse shall able saue owne life trompettes shall ye blowe make ready man shall go batell wroth whole multitude swearde shalbe without pestilence honger within felde shalbe slayne swearde cite deu 32 shall perish honger pestilence soch escape fle amonge shal vpon hilles like doues felde euery one shalbe afrayed owne wickednesse esa 15 e hondes shalbe letten downe knee shalbe weake water shall gyrde selues sack cloth feare shal fall vpon face shall confoū ded heades balde syluer shall lye stretes golde shalbe despised soph 1 c ecc 5 b yee syluer golde maye delyuer daye fearfull wrath lorde shall satisfie hongrie soules nether fyll emptie belies therwith become owne decaye thorow wickednesse made therof costly ieweles pompe pryde osee 8 also abhominable ymages idol cause make abhorred morouer geue ye hondes straungers spoyled ye wicked robbed shall destroye face wil turne thē treasury shall defyled theues shall go suspende wil make clene ryddaunse londe whole defyled vnrightuous iudgment innocent bloude cite full abhominacions wherfore bringe cruell tyrauntes amonge heithen take house possession make pompe proude ceasse ād shal take sanctuary trouble cōmeth shal seke peace shal haue none one myschefe sorowe shal folowe another one rumoure shal come another shall seke vision vayne prophetes lawe shal gone prestes ere 38 c wyszdome elder kynge shall mourne prince shalbe clothed heuynesse ye hō de people londe shall tremble feare vnto owne way acordinge owne iudgmentes iudge lerne knowe lorde viii chapter happened sixte yeare fifth daye sixte moneth sat house lordes councell iuda honde lorde god fell euen vpō loked vp sawe licknesse fyre loynes downwarde loynes vpwarde shyned maruelous cleare eze 3 b 11 symilitude stretched honde toke hayrie locke heade sprete lift vp betwitte heauen earth god brought vision ierusalem courte inwarde porte lieth towarde north stode ymage hath thinges power wroth beholde glory god israel place 〈…〉 euē sene afore felde sayde vnto thou sonne man lift vp thine eye loke towarde north lift vp myne eye towarde north beholde besyde porte northwarde aulter made vnto ymage prouocacion entrynge sayde furthermore vnto thou sonne man seist thou seist thou greate abhominacions house israel commytte place ought done sanctuary turne aboute thou shalt se yet greater abhominacions brought courte gate whē loked beholde hole wall sayde vnto thou sonne man dygge thorow wall dygge thorow wall beholde dore sayde vnto go thy waye loke wicked abhominacions wente sawe beholde maner ymages wormes beastes idol abhominacions ye house israel paynted euerychone rounde aboute wall stode also ymages lxx lordes councell house israel 〈…〉 myddest stode iaasanias sonne saphan euery one censoure honde incense wente smoke bene cloude sayde vnto thou sonne man 〈…〉 hast thou sene senatours house israel secretly euery one chambre saye tush lorde seth v lorde regardeth worlde sayde vnto turne yet agayne thou shat se greate abhominacions brought dore porte lordes house towarde north beholde sat woman mournynge thamus sayde vnto hast thou sene thou sonne mā turne ye aboute thou shalt se yet greater abhominacions brought inwarde courte lordes house beholde porte lordes house betwixte fore entrie aulter fyue twenty men turned backes vpon temple lorde face towarde easte worshipped sonne sayde vnto hast thou sene thou sonne man thinketh house israel trifle abhominacions shulde fyll londe full wickednesse vndertake prouoke vnto anger yee purposly cast vp nose vpon therfore wil also thinge wrothfull displeasure myne eye shall ouersee nether wil spare 〈◊〉 1 c 〈◊〉 1 • c 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 3 yee though crie myne eares loude voyce yet wil heare ix chapter cried also loude voyce myne eares sayenge come ye ruler cite euery man weapened honde slaughter came sixe men strete vpper porte towarde north euery man weapen honde slaughter one amongst lynninge rayment wryters ynckhorne syde wente stode beside brasen aulter 〈◊〉 • 0 e 〈◊〉 9 c 〈◊〉 1 b glory lorde gone awaye cherub come downe thresholde house called mā lynnynge rayment vpon writer ynckhorne syde lorde sayde vnto go thy waye thorow cite ierusalem set marck 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 thau vpō foreheades 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 mourne sory abhominacions done therin sayde might heare go ye thorow cite slaye ouersee none 〈◊〉 2 spare none kyll destroye olde men yonge maydens child wyues 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 haue marck 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 thau vpō se ye touch begynne sanctuary 〈◊〉 25 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 4 c begāne elder temple sayde vnto ye haue defyled temple fylled courte slayne go youre waye forth wēte slewe downe thorow ye cite done ye slaughter yet escaped fell downe vpon face cried sayenge lorde wilt thou destroye resydue israel thy sore displeasure thou hast poured vpō ierusalem sayde vnto wickednesse house israel iuda greate lōde full bloude iob 22 b esa 29 c eccī 23 c ezec 7 ye cite full vnfaithfulnesse saye tush ye lorde regardeth earth seyth v therfore vpon myne eye shall ouersee nether spare recompence wickednesse vpon heades beholde mā lynnynge rayment vpon writer ynck horne syde tolde matter happened sayde lorde thou hast commaunded haue done x chapter loked beholde firmament aboue cherubins apeared similitude stole saphir vpō eze 9 sayde sat therin lynnynge rayment vpon crepe betwene wheles vnder cherubins take thine honde full hote coales betwene cherubins cast ouer cite crepte might se cherubins stode vpō right syde house man wēte cloude fylled ynnermer courte2 par 7 glory lorde remoued cherubins came vpon thresholde house temple full cloudes courte full shyne lordes glory yee sounde cherubins wynges herde forecourte like bene voyce almightie god speaketh bydden man yt clothed lynnynge go take hote coales myddest ye wheles vnder cherubins wente stode besyde wheles one cherub reached forth honde vnder cherubins vnto ye fyre betwene cherubins toke therof gaue vnto lynnynge rayment honde toke wente vnder wynges ye cherubins apeared licknes mās hō de sawe also foure wheles besyde cherubins euery cherub stode whele wheles loke vpon ye fashion ye precious stone tharsis yet vnto sight fashioned like yf one whele bene another wente forth wēte iiij together turnynge aboute goinge first wente thither wente also turned aboute goinge • ze 1 b whole body backes hōdes wynges yee wheles also full eye rounde aboute foure herde call ye wheles galgal rounde boull euery one foure face one face face cherub seconde man thirde lyon fourth aegle lifted vp aboue beest sawe water cobar cherubins wente wheles wente cherubins shoke wynges lift selues vpwarde wheles remayned behynde also shortly stode stode also lift vp ye wheles lift vp also thē sprete life wheles • ze 11 • glory lorde lift vp thresholde temple remayned vpon cherubins cherubins flackred wynges lift thē selues vp earth sawe went wheles stode east syde porte house lorde glory lorde vpon beest sawe vnder god israel water cobar perceaued cherubins euery one foure face euery one foure wynges vnder winges mēs hondes figure face euen sene water cobar countenaunce thē euery one goinge wente straight forwarde xi chapter morouer sprete lorde lift vp brought vnto ye east porte lordes house beholde xxv men vnder dore amōge sawe iaasanias sonne asur pheltias sonne banias ruler people sayde lorde vnto thou sonne man men ymagin myschefe wicked councel take cite sayenge tush destruccion honde let v buylde house ierusalem cauldron flesh therfore shalt thou prophecie vnto yee prophecie shalt thou vnto sonne man fell sprete lorde vpon sayde vnto speake thus saieth lorde maner haue yee spokē ye house israel knowe ymaginaciōs youre hertes many one haue ye murthured cite filled stretes full slayne therfore thus saieth lorde god slayne men ye haue layed grounde cite flesh cite cauldron 〈…〉 wil bringe ye haue drawē ye swearde euē wil also bringe swearde ouer saieth ye lorde god dryue cite delyuer youre enemy honde wil condemne ye shal slayne coastes israel wil avenged lerne knowe lorde cite shal youre cauldron nether shal ye flesh therin coastes israel wil punysh ye maye knowe lorde whose commaundementes ye haue walked ner kepte lawes 〈…〉 haue done customes heithen lie rounde aboute preached pheltias sonne banias dyed fell downe vpō face cried loude voyce lorde god wilt thou vterly destroye remnaunt israel worde lorde came maner thou sonne man thy brother thy kynsfolke ye whole house iuda dwell ierusalem saye gone farre lorde londe geuen v possession therfore tell thus saieth lorde god wil sende farre amōge gentile scatre amonge nacions wil halowe litle londes ye shall come tell also thus saieth lorde god wil gather agayne nacions bringe countrees ye scatred geue londe israel agayne thither shal ye come impedimentes youre abhominacions take awaye wil geue one herte wil plante new sprete within yor bowel 〈…〉 stony herte wil take youre body geue fleshy herte ye maye walke commaundementes kepe myne ordinaunces ye maye people youre god loke whose hertes disposed folowe abhominacions wicked lyuynges men dedes bringe vpon owne heades saieth lorde god dyd cherubins lift vp winges wheles wente glory lorde vpon 〈…〉 glory lorde wente vp myddest cite 〈…〉 stode vpon mount cite towarde east wynde toke vp vision came sprete god brought agayne caldea amonge presoners vision sene vanyshed waye fro spake vnto presoners wordes lorde shewed xii chapter worde lorde came vnto 〈…〉 sayenge thou sonne mā thou dwellest myddest frauwerde housholde haue eye se yet se eares haue heare yet heare obstinate housholde therfore thou sonne man make thy gere redy flit go forth fayre daye light yt maye se yee euē sight shalt thou go thy place another place yf peraduenture wil considre yt vnobedient housholde thy gere thou hast made redy flit withall shalt thou beare fayre daye light maie se thou yi self shalt go forth also euē sight mā doth whē flitteth dygge thorow wall maye se beare thorow thinge thou tokest vp sight thy self thou shalt go forth darcke hyde thy face thou se ye earth haue made shew tokē vnto house israel ye lorde cōmaunded dyd ye gere made redy brought daye euen brake downe hole thorow wall honde darcke toke gere vpō shulders bare sight mornynge came worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man yf israel yt frauwerde housholde axe saye dost thou tell thus saieth lorde god punyshment toucheth chefe ruler ierusalem house israel dwell amonge tell youre shew token like haue done shal happen vnto flyt shal ye also go captiuyte 〈◊〉 21 b chefest amonge shall lade shulders darcke get awaye shal breake downe wall carie stuff thorow shal couer face se grounde eye lyne sprede vpon catch net eze 17 c 3 • carie babilon lōde caldees shal se yet shal dye helper hoostes aboute scatre towarde wyndes drawe swearde haue scatred amonge heithen strowed londes eze 1 • b b 22 shal knowe ye lorde leaue litle nombre swearde hunger pestilence tell abhominacions amonge heithen come maye knowe lorde morouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man fearfull trēblinge shalt thou eate thy bred carefulnesse sorowe shalt thou drynke thy water vnto people londe speake thou maner thus saieth lorde god dwell ierusalem londe israel ye shall eate youre bred sorowe drynke youre water heuynesse yee londe fulnesse therof shalbe layde waist ye wickednesse dwell therin city well occupied shal voyde londe desolate ye maye knowe lorde yet came worde lorde vnto agayne sayenge thou sonne man maner byworde ro 2 ye vse londe israel sayenge tush seynge day slacke commynge2 pet 3 b visiōs none effecte tell therfore thus saieth lorde god wil make byworde ceasse shall nomore comonly vsed israel saye vnto day honde euery thinge hath bene prophecied shalbe fulfilled shall vision vayne nether eny prophecie fayle amonge child israel lorde speake euer ye lorde speake shal perfourmed slacke commynge yee euen youre dayes ye frauwarde housholde deuyse thinge bringe passe saieth lorde god worde lorde came vnto sayenge beholde thou sonne man house israel saye maner tush vision hath sene many daye come passe farre yet thinge prophecieth therfore saye vnto thus saieth lorde god wordes shal nomore slacke loke speake shal come passe saieth lorde xiii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayēge thou sonne man speake prophecie agaynst prophetes preach israel sayeth thou vnto prophecie owne • e heare worde lorde thus saieth lorde god eze 34 wo vnto folish prophetes folowe owne sprete speake se nothinge israel thy prophetes like fox vpon drie felde stonde gappes nether make hedge house israel iere 27 mē might abyde parell daye lorde vayne thinges se tell lie mayntene preachinges withall lorde saye hath spokē dede lorde hath sent vayne visiōs haue ye sene spokē false prophecy ye saye lorde hath spoken neuer sayde therfore thus saieth lorde god youre wordes vayne ye seke lie beholde wil vpon saieth ye lorde myne hondes shal come vpon prophetes loke vayne thinges preach lie shal councell people ner written boke house israel nether shal come londe israel ye maye knowe lorde god cause iere 8 b haue disceaued people tolde peace peace one setteth vp wall dawbe lowse claye matt 7 c therfore tell dawbe vntempered morter shall fall shal come greate shuwer rayne greate stone shall fall vpon fore storme wynde shal breake shal ye wall come downe shal sayde vnto morter ye dawbed withall therfore thus saieth lorde god breake wrothfull displeasure stormy wynde myne anger shal come mightie shuwer rayne hale stone wrath destroye withall ye wall ye haue dawbed vntempered morter wil breake downe make eauen grounde foundacion therof shal remoue shal fall yee ye youre selues shall perish myddest therof lerne knowe lorde thus wil perfourme wrath vpon wall vpon haue dawbed vntempered morter saye vnto wall gone dawbers awaye prophetes israel prophecie vnto cite ierusalem loke vision peace peace saieth lorde god wherfore thou sonne mē set thy face agaynst doughters ye people prophecie owne hertes speake thou prophecie agaynst saye thus saieth lorde god wo vnto sowe pilowes vnder arme hole bolster vnder heades yonge olde catch soules withall ye haue gotten soules people youre captiuyte 〈…〉 ye promyse life dishonoure people handfull barly pece bred ye kyll soules dye promyse life lyue thus ye dyssemble people yt beleueth yor lie wherfore thus saieth lorde god beholde wil also vpō pillowes wherwith ye catch soules flyenge thē take youre armes let soules go ye catch flyenge youre bolster also wil teare peces delyuer people youre honde shal come nomore youre hōdes spoyled ye shal knowe lorde seinge yt youre lye ye discomforte herte rightuous haue discomforted agayne 〈…〉 moch ye corage honde wicked maye turne wicked waye lyue therfore shall ye spie nomore vanyte ner prophecie youre owne gessinges wil delyuer people youre honde ye maye knowe lorde xiiii chapter resorted vnto certayne ye elder israel sat downe 〈…〉 came worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man men beare idol hertes go purposly vpon stomblinge block owne wickednesse darre councell therfore speake vnto saye thus saieth lorde god euery man house israel beareth idol herte purposynge stomble owne wickednesse commeth prophet enquere eny thinge vnto man wil lorde geue answere acordinge multitude idol house israel maye snared owne hertes clene gone fro idol sake wherfore tell house israel thus saieth lorde god 〈…〉 conuerted forsake youre idol turne youre face yor abhominacions euery man whether house israel straunger sogeourneth israel departeth fro carieth idol herte purposinge go still stomblinge owne wickednesse commeth prophet axe councell thorow vnto yt man wil lorde geue answere myne owne self wil set face agaynst man wil make example yee comon byworde wil rote people maye knowe yt lorde 〈…〉 yf prophet disceaued telleth worde lorde haue disceaued prophet wil stretch forth myne honde vpon rote people israel shall punyshed wickednesse acordinge ye synne axeth shal synne prophet ye house israel led nomore fro thorow erroure nomore defyled wickednesse maye people god saieth lorde god worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man londe synneth agaynst goeth forth wickednesse stretch myne hōde vpon destroye prouysion bred sende derth vpon destroye man beest londe 〈…〉 though noe daniel iob thre men amonge 〈…〉 yet shal rightuousnesse delyuer owne soules saieth lorde god yf bringe noysome beestes londe waist vp desolate man maye go therin beestes yf thre men also londe truly lyue saieth lorde god shal saue nether sonnes ner doughters delyuered selues londe shal waist yf bringe swearde londe charge go thorow londe slaye downe man beest yf thre men therin truly lyue saieth lorde god shal delyuer nether sonnes ner doughters saued selues yf sende pestilence londe poure sore indignacion vpon bloude rote man beest yf noe daniel iob therin truly lyue saieth lorde god shal delyuer nether sonnes ner doughters saue owne soules rightuousnesse morouer thus saieth lorde god though sende foure trublous plage vpon ierusalem swearde honger iere 27 b perlous beestes pestilence destroye man beest yet shal remnaunt saued therin shal bringe forth sonnes doughters beholde shal come forth vnto ye shall se waye take honde ye shal cōforted touchinge plage haue brought vpon ierusalem shall comforte ye se waye workes ye shal knowe yt without cause haue done agaynst ierusalem dyd saieth lorde god xv chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man commeth vyne amonge tree wyne stocke amōge tymbre groaue mē take wodd make eny worke withall maye nale made hange eny thinge vpon beholde cast fyre brent fyre consumeth endes myddest brent aszshes mete eny worke seinge mete worke beinge whole moch lesse maye eny thinge made fyre hath consumed brent therfore thus saieth lorde god like cast vyne fyre brent tree wod euen wil dwell ierusalem set face agaynst shall go fyre yet fyre shall consume eze 1 • • 2 • b shal ye knowe lorde set face agaynst make londe waist haue sore offended saieth lorde god xvi chapter agayne worde lorde spake vnto sayenge thou sonne man shewe cite ierusalem abhominacions saye thus saieth lorde god vnto ierusalem thy progeny kynred came londe canaan thy father amorite thy mother cethite ye daye thy byrth thou wast borne ye stringe thy nauel cut thou wast bathed water make clene▪ thou wast nether rubbed wt salt ner swedled cloutes man regarded moch eny thinges ye shewe soch fauoure thou wast vtterly cast vpon ye felde yee despised wast thou daye thy byrth came sawe troden downe thine owne bloude sayde vnto thou shalt pourged thine owne bloude frō thine owne bloude saye shalt thou clensed esa 5 iere 11 c planted blossome thy felde thou art growen vp waxē greate thou hast gotten maruelous pleasaunt beutie thy brestes come vp thy hayre goodly growen thou wast naked bare afore wente ye loked vpon beholde thy tyme come yee euē tyme wowe spred clothes ouer couer thy dishonestie yee made ooth vnto iere 3 ose 2 c maried self saieth lorde god thou becamest myne owne waszshed water pourged thy bloude anoynted oyle gaue chaunge raymentes made shues taxus lether gyrthed ye aboute wt white sylcke clothed kerchues decked wt costly apparell put rynges vpon thy fyngers chayne aboute thy necke spāges vpō thy foreheade eare rynges vpon thyne eares set beutifull crowne vpon thine heade thus wast thou deckte syluer golde thy rayment fyne white sylke nedle worke dyuerse colour thou didest eate nothinge symnels honny oyle maruelous goodly wast thou beutifull yee euen quene wast thou moch thy beuty spoken amonge heithen thou wast excellēt beuty put vpō saieth lorde god thou hast put confidēce thine owne beuty played harlot thou haddest gotten name thou hast committed whordome wente hast fulfilled desyres yee thou hast taken thy garmētes dyuerse colour deckte thine aulters therwith 〈…〉 vpon thou mightest fulfill thine whordome soch fashion neuer done ner shalbe 〈…〉 goodly ornamētes iewels gaue myne owne golde syluer hast thou takē made mēs ymages therof committed whordome withall thy garmentes dyuerse colour hast thou taken deckte therwith myne oyle incense hast thou set meate gaue symnels oyle hony fede withall hast thou set swete sauoure came also passe saieth lorde god▪ thou hast takē thine owne sonnes doughters thou haddest begotten vnto me▪ 〈…〉 hast thou offred vp vnto meate small whordome thine thinkest thou thou slayest child geuest ouer br •• vnto yet thy abhominacions whordome thou hast remembred dayes thy youth naked bare thou wast tyme troden downe thine owne bloude thy wickedness wo wo vnto saieth ye lorde thou hast buylded thy stewes bredel house euery place yee heade euery strete hast thou buylded aulter thou hast made thy beuty abhorred thou hast layed thy legges euery one came multiplied thine whordome 〈…〉 thou hast committed fornicacion egipcians thy neghbours moch flesh thus hast thou vsed thine whordome anger beholde stretch myne honde ouer wil mynish thy stoare fode delyuer ouer willes philistynes thine enemy ashamed thy abhominable waye 〈…〉 thou hast played whore also assirians might satisfie yee thou hast played harlot ynough thus hast thou still cōmitted thy fornicacion londe canaan vnto caldees yet thy lust satisfied shulde circumcide thine herte saieth lorde god seinge thou doest thinges thou precious whore buyldinge thy stewes heade euery strete thy brodel house place thou hast bene whore yt maketh booste hir wynnynge wife yt breaketh wedlocke taketh steade hir huszbōde giftes geuen whore thou geuest rewardes vnto thy louers offrest giftes come vnto place committe fornicacio come passe thy whordomes contrary vse woman yee hath soch fornicacion bene committed seinge thou profrest giftes vnto rewarde geuen contrary thinge therfore heare worde lorde thou harlot thus saieth lorde god moch thou hast spēt thy moneye discouered thy shame thorow thy whordome thy louers idol thy abhominacions bloude thy child thou hast geuen 〈…〉 beholde therfore wil gather together thy louers vnto thou hast made thy self comon yee thou fauourest euery one thou hatest 〈…〉 discouer thy shame thē maye se thy fylthines morouer wil iudge breaker wedlocke murthurer recompence thine owne bloude wrath gelousy wil geue ouer power shal breake downe thy stewes destroye thy brodel house shal stripe thy clothes thy fayre beutifull iewels shal take let syt naked bare 〈…〉 yee shal bringe comon people vpon shal stone slaye downe sweardes shall burne vp thy house punysh sight many womē thus wil make thy whordome ceasse thou shalt geue mo rewardes shulde make wrath still take gelousy content nomore displeased seinge thou remembrest dayes thy youth hast prouoked wrath thinges beholde therfore wil bringe thine owne wayes vpon thine heade saieth lorde god neuer dyd vnto acordinge thy wickednesse thy abhominacions beholde yt vse comon prouerbes shall vse prouerbe also agaynst soch mother soch doughter thou art euen thy mother owne doughter hath cast hir houszbonde hir child yee thou art sister thy sister forsoke huszbōdes child 〈…〉 youre mother cethite youre father amorite thine eldest sister samaria hir doughters dwel vpō thy left honde thy yongest sister dwelleth ye right hōde sodoma hir doughters yet hast thou walked wayes ner done abhominacions thy wayes thou hast bene corrupte truly lyue gen 18 • saieth lorde god sodoma thy sister hir doughters hath done euel thou thy doughters beholde synnes thy sister sodoma pryde fulnesse meate abundaunce idilnesse thinges hir doughters besydes reached honde poore nedy proude dyd abhominable thinges gene 19 therfore toke awaye sene iere 3 c nether hath samaria done half thy synnes yee thou hast exceaded wickednesse moch comparison abhominacions thou hast done thou hast made thy sister good woman therfore beare thine owne shame thou synne hast ouercome thy sister seinge thou hast done abhominably better thou ashamed therfore saye beare thine owne confucion thou makest thy sister good woman captiuyte namely captiuyte sodoma hir dougters captiuyte samaria hir doughters wil bringe agayne also bringe agayne thy captiuyte amōge thou mayest take thine owne confucion vpon ashamed thou hast done comforte thus thy sister namely sodoma hir doughters samaria hir doughters ye self thy doughters shalbe brought agayne youre olde estate whē thou wast thy pryde thy wickednesse came light thou woldest heare speake thy sister sodoma vntill tyme sirians townes philistynes lye rounde aboute brought shame confucion thou mightest beare thine owne fylthynes abhominacion saieth lorde thus saieth lorde god shulde right deale thou hast done thou hast despysed ooth broken couenaunte neuertheles wil remembre couenaunt made thy youth moch shall euerlastinge couenaunt thou also remembre thy wayes ashamed thē shalt thou receaue thy elder yonger sister wil make thy doughters besyde thy couenaunt 〈◊〉 31 c 〈◊〉 8 b wil renue couenaunt yt thou mayest knowe lorde thou mayest thincke vpō ashamed excuse thine owne confucion nomore haue forgeuen thou hast done saieth lorde god xvii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man put forth darcke speakynge parable 〈◊〉 24 vnto house israel saye thus saieth lorde god 〈◊〉 7 came greate aegle greate wynges yee wt mightie longe wynges full fethers dyuerse colour vpon mount libanus toke braunch cedre tre brake toppe twygge caried londe canaan set cite marchauntes toke also braunch londe planted frutefull grounde brought vnto greate water set ye tre therby dyd growe greate wyne stocke lowe grounde thus came vyne brought forth blossomes spred braunches another aegle greate one greate wynges many fethers beholde ye rote vyne hūger spred braunches towarde water frutes neuertheles plāted vpon good grounde besyde greate water reason shulde haue brought braunches frute haue bene goodly vyne speake thou therfore thus saieth lorde god shal vyne prospere shal rote pluckte frute broken grene braunches wythereed fade awaye yee without ether stronge arme many people shal plucked vp rote beholde planted shall prospere therfore shall dryed vp withered yee euen shutinge blossomes soone ye east wynde bloweth morouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge • 24 c speake frauwarde housholde knowe ye thinges signifie tell beholde kinge babilon came ierusalem toke kinge prynces ledde babilon toke kinges sede made couenaunt toke ooth prynces londe toke also londe might holden subieccion rebelle kepe couenaunt fulfill fell sent embassitours egipte might haue horse moch people shulde prospere shulde kepte safe doth soch thinges shulde escape breaketh couenaunt truly lyue saieth lorde god shal dye babilon ye place kinge dwelleth made kinge whose ooth hath despised whose couenaunt hat broken nether shall pharao greate hoost multitude people maynteyne warre cast vp diches set vp bulworkes destroye moch people seinge hath despysed ooth broken couenaunt yet gaue honde thervpon done thinges shall escape therfore thus saieth lorde god truly lyue bringe myne ooth hath despysed couenaunt hath broken vpon owne heade 〈…〉 wil cast net aboute catch yarne babilon cary punysh greate offence made yt fle ye hoost shalbe slayne swearde residue shalbe scatred towarde wyndes ye shal knowe lorde haue spoken thus saieth lorde god also take braunch hie cedre tre set take vppermost twygge yet tendre plante vpon hie hill namely vpon hie hill sion plante maye bringe forth twygges geue frute greate cedre tre maner foules maye byde make nestes vnder shadowe braunches tree felde shall knowe lorde haue brought downe hie tre set lowe tre vp haue dryed vp grene tre made drye tre florish euen lorde yt spake haue also brought passe xviii chapter worde lorde came vnto maner meane ye comon prouerbe ye vse londe israel sayenge father haue eaten soure grape 〈…〉 childrēs teth set edge truly lyue saieth ye lorde god ye shal vse worde nomore israel 〈◊〉 23 beholde soules myne like father myne ye sonne myne also soule synneth 〈◊〉 1 • shal dye yf man godly thinge equall right eateth vpon hilles lifteth eye vp idol israel defyleth neghbours wife medleth wt menstruous woman greueth body geueth detter pledge agayne taketh none man good violēce parteth mete hongrie clotheth naked lendeth nothinge vpon vsury 〈◊〉 25 c 〈◊〉 • 4 taketh nothinge ouer murthurer shedder bloude yf one thinges though eateth vpon hilles 〈◊〉 2 b defyleth neghbours wife greueth poore nedy robbeth spoyleth geueth detter pledge agayne lifteth vp eye vnto idol medleth abhominable thinges lendeth vpon vsury taketh ouer shal man lyue shal lyue seinge hath done abhominacions shall dye bloude shalbe vpon yf man get sonne also seith father synnes hath done feareth nether doth soch like namely eateth vpon mountaynes lifteth eye vp idol israel defyleth neghbours wife vexeth man kepeth man pledge nether spoyleth ner robbeth eny man dealeth meate hungrie clotheth naked oppresseth poore receaueth vsury ner eny thinge ouer kepeth lawes walketh commaundementes man shal dye father synne shall lyue without fayle father oppressed spoyled brother dyd wyckedly amonge people lo deed owne synne yet saye ye wherfore thē shulde sonne beare father synne therfore sonne hath done equyte right hath kepte commaundementes done therfore shall lyue dede 〈◊〉 24 c 〈◊〉 14 c lyonesse amōge lyon norished hir yonge one amōge lyon 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 whelpes one hir whelpes brought vp became lyon lerned spoyle deuoure folke heithen herde toke nettes waist moch whole londe euery thinge therin vtterly desolate thorow voyce roaringe came heithen together euery syde countrees agaynst layed nettes toke pytte • e 25 • e 39 c 〈◊〉 bounde chaynes brought made staues therof officer grew hie hir stalkes men sawe exceaded ye heith multitude hir braunches roted displeasure cast downe grounde east wynde dryed vp hir frute hir stronge stalkes broken wythered brent fyre planted wildernesse drye thurstie grounde fyre gone hir stalkes hath brēt vp hir braunches hir frute hath mo stronge stalkes staues officer piteous miserable thinge xx chapter israel lift vp myne honde vpon sede house iacob shewed self vnto londe egipte yee lifte vp myne honde ouer thē sayde lorde youre god euen daye lift vp myne honde ouer bringe londe egipte londe vnto wolde bringe londe egipte caried londe egipte brought wildernesse gaue commaundementes 〈…〉 shewed thē lawes kepeth shal lyue gaue also holy dayes token betwixte therby knowe lorde haloweth yet
