vnto sayenge thou sonne mā set thy face towarde south speake south wynde saye wodde towarde souht heare worde lorde thus saieth lorde god beholde wil kyndle fyre yt shal cōsume grene tree wt drye man shal able quench flame • oketh south north shal brent therin flesh shal se lorde haue kyndled man maye quench sayde lorde 〈◊〉 20 b wil saye tush fable telleth xxi chapter worde lorde came sayenge thou sonne man set thy face towarde ierusalem speake agaynst sanctuary prophecie agaynst londe israel saye lōde israel thus saieth lorde god beholde wil vpon wil drawe swearde ye sheth rote ye rightuous wicked seinge rote rightuous wicked therfore shal swearde go sheth agaynst flesh north south flesh maye knowe lorde haue drawen swearde sheth shal put agayne mourne therfore thou sonne man yt thy loynes crack withall yee mourne bytterly yf saye wherfore mournest thou tell tydinges commeth hertes shall melt hondes shal letten downe stomackes shal faynte knee shall waxe feble beholde commeth shal fulfilled saieth lorde god agayne worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man prophecie speake thus saieth lorde god speake swearde sharpened wel scoured sharpened slaughter scoured yt maye bright 〈◊〉 ▪ 10 destroyenge staff sonne shal bringe downe wodde hath put swearde ye dightinge yt good holde maye takē swearde sharpened dight yt maye geuen honde manslayer crie thou sonne man howle swearde shal smyte people ruler israel people shall slayne downe grounde thorow swearde smyte thou vpō thy thee wherfore shulde plage staff indgmēt come prophecy thou sonne man smyte thine hōdes together make swearde two edged yee make thre edged yt manslayer swearde swearde greate slaughter shal smyte euen preuy chambres make abaszshed faynte hertes gate make fall bright sharpe wel dight mete ye slaughter get place alone ether vpon right honde lefte whither euer thy face turneth wil smyte hondes together also satisfie wrothfull indignacion euen lorde haue sayde worde lorde came yet vnto agayne sayenge thou sonne man make two stretes swearde ye kinge babilō maye come stretes shall go one londe shal set vp place heade strete shal chose corner make ye strete swearde maye come towarde rabath ammonite stronge cite ierusalem kinge babilon shall stonde turnynge waye heade two stretes 〈…〉 axe councell soythsayers castinge lotte arowes axe councell idol loke lyuer soythsayenge shall poynte right syde vpon ierusalem maye set men warre smyte greate noyse crie alarum set batellrammes agaynst gate graue vp dyches make bulworkes neuertheles ye soythsayenge shall holde vanite euen though iest tolde yee selues remembre wickednesse right must takē wonne therfore saieth lorde god moch ye youre selues shewe youre offence haue opened youre wickednesse youre workes men maye se youre synnes yet moch saye ye youreselues haue made mencion therof ye shalbe taken violence thou shameful wicked gyde israel whose daye come▪ euen tyme wickednesse shall haue ende thus saieth lorde god take awaye mytre put crowne awaye humble exalted proude brought lowe punysh punysh yee punysh destroye shall fulfilled vntill come iudgment belongeth haue geuē thou sonne man prophecy speake 〈…〉 thus saieth lorde god child ammon blasphemy speake swearde swearde drawen forth alredy slaughter •• ured glistreth thou hast loked vanity prophecied lye yt maye come vpon thy necke like vpō vngodly slayne whose daye came wickednesse full though put vp agayne sheath yet punysh londe thou wast norished borne poure indignacion vpon blowe vpon fyre wrath delyuer vnto cruell people lerned destroye thou shalt fede fyre yt bloude shall shed londe thou mayest put remembraunce euen lorde haue spoken xxii chapter morouer worde ye lorde came vnto sayde thou sonne man wilt thou reproue bloudthurstie cite shewe thē abhominaciōs tell thus saieth lorde god thou cite yt sheddest bloude ye myddest yt thy tyme maye come also makest idol defyle withall thou hast made thy self gilty ye bloude yt thou hast shed defyled ye ī ye ydols thou hast made thou hast caused thy day drawe nye made tyme thy yeares come therfore make ye confounded amōge heithē despised lōdes whether nye farre frō shal laugh ye scorne thou yt hast gottē foule name art full myschefe 〈◊〉 • 5 c 〈◊〉 • 5 c beholde ruler israel haue brought euery man power shed bloude haue despised father mother haue oppressed straūger haue vexed wyddowe fatherlesse thou hast despysed sāctuary 〈…〉 vnhalowed sabbath murtherers shed bloude eate vpon hilles vse vnhappynesse ye haue discouered father shame haue vexed woman sicknesse 〈◊〉 3 • f 〈◊〉 5 euery mā hath dealte shamefully neghbours wife abhominably defyled doughter lawe hath euery man forced owne sister 〈◊〉 27 c 〈◊〉 • 3 〈…〉 c euen father doughter yee giftes haue bene receaued shed bloude thou hast taken vsury encreace thou hast oppressed thy neghbours extorcion forgotten saieth lorde god beholde haue smytten hondes vpō thy couetousnesse thou hast vsed vpon bloude hath bene shed thy herte able endure maye thy hondes defende selues tyme shall bringe vpon euen lorde speake bringe also passe scatre amonge heithen eze 1 • c 15 b strowe aboute lōdes wil cause thy fylthynesse ceasse yee haue possession sight heithen thou mayest knowe lorde worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man house israel turned drosse esa 1 c shulde brasse tynne yrō leade fyre become drosse therfore thus saieth lorde god moch ye turned drosse beholde brynge together vnto ierusalem like syluer brasse yron tynne leade put together fornace fyre blowen vnder melt euen gather put together melt wrath indignacion brynge together kyndle fyre cruell displeasure vnder ye maye melted therin like syluer melted fyre shall ye also melted therin ye maye knowe lorde haue poured wrath vpon worde lorde came vnto sayēge thou sonne mā tell thou art vn clene londe rayned vpon daye cruell wrath mich 3 c thy prophetes sworne together deuoure soules like roaringe lyon lyueth pray receaue rich good make many wyddowes ye thy prestes breake lawe defyle sanctuary leui 10 • put dyfference betwene holy vnholy nether discerne betwene clene vnclene turne eye fro sabbathes vnhalowed amonge thy ruler like rauyshinge wolues shed bloude mich 3 soph • • eze 13 b destroye soules owne covetous lucre thy prophetes dawbe vntempered claye se vanities▪ prophecie lie vnto sayenge lorde god sayeth lorde hath spoken people londe vseth wicked extorciō robbery exo 2 • • vexe poore nedy oppresse straunger agaynst right sought londe man wolde make vp hedge see self gappe lōdes behalfe yt shulde vtterly destroye it▪ coude fynde none therfore wil poure cruell displeasure vpon burne fyre wrath owne wayes recompence vpō heades saieth lorde god xxiii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man two womē one mother eze • 0 yonge beganne playe harlottes egipte brestes brussed pappes maydenheade destroyed eldest called oola hir yongest sister ooliba two myne bare sonnes doughters name samaria oola ierusalem ooliba oola beganne go whorynge takē set fyre vpon hir louers assirians euen prynces lordes deckte costly araye • 15 fayre yonge men lusty ryders horse thus thorow hir whordome cleued vnto yonge men assiria yee madde vpon defyled herselff idol nether ceassed frō fornicaciō vsed egipcians hir youth laye wt brussed brestes hir maydenheade poured wordome vpon • 17 • wherfore delyuered ye hōdes hir louers euen assirians loued discouered hir shame toke hir sonnes doughters eze 16 b slewe swearde euell name gat people ād punyshed hir sister ooliba sawe ād destroyed wt inordinate loue iere 3 b • 16 b exceaded hir sister whordome loued ye assirians also laye wt namely prynces greate lordes clothed wt maner gorgious apparell lusty horsmen fayre yonge personnes sawe defyled like increased still whordome sawe men paynted vpon wall ymages caldees set forth fresh colour fayre gyrdles aboute goodly bonettes vpon heades lokynge like prynces ye maner babiloniās caldees owne londe borne inmediatly soone sawe brent loue vpon sent messaūgers londe caldees babiloniās came laye defyled whordome poluted hir lust abated 〈…〉 hir whordome shame discouered sene herte forsoke like herte gone hir sister also neuertheles vsed hir whordome en • longer remembred dayes hir youth wherin played harlot londe egipte brent lust vpon 〈…〉 whose flesh like ye flesh ass sede like sede horse thus thou hast renued fylthynesse thy youth thy louers bressed ye pappes marred thy brestes egipte therfore ooliba thus saieth ye lorde god rayse vp thy louers thou hast satisfied thy lust agaynst gather together rounde aboute namely babilonians caldees pecod schoa coa assirians yonge fayre louers prynces lordes knyghtes gentleman good horsmen shall come vpon horse charettes greate multitude people shal harnessed aboute euery syde wt brestplates sheldes helmettes punysh yt yee thē selues shal punysh acordinge owne iudgmēt put gelousy vpon shall deale cruelly shal cut thy nose thine eares remnaunt shall fall thorow swearde shall cary awaye thy sonnes doughters resydue shalbe brent fyre thy shal strype thy clothes cary thy costly iewels awaye thus make ende thy fylthynesse whordome thou hast brought lōde egipte thou shalt turne thine eye nomore cast thy mynde nomore vpon egipte thus saieth lorde beholde delyuer ye hōdes thou hatest yee euen hondes whō thou hast fulfylled thy lust shall deale cruelly ye thy laboure shal take leaue naked bare thus shame thy filthy whordome shal come light thinges shal happen vnto thy whordome thou hast vsed amonge gentile whose idol thou hast defyled yt self thou hast walked waye thy sister therfore geue hir cuppe thy honde thus saieth lorde god thou shalt drynke thy sister cuppe depe farre euer botome thou shalt laughed scorne greatly derision possible thou shalt full dronckennes sorowe cuppe ye sister samaria cuppe destruccion waistinge shalt thou drynke suppe euē ye dregges yee thou shalt eate vp broken peces teare thine owne brestes euen haue spoken saieth lorde god therfore thus saieth ye lorde god moch thou hast forgottē cast asyde beare thine owne fylthinesse whordome lorde sayde morouer vnto thou sonne mā wilt thou reproue oola ooliba shewethē abhominaciōs namely yt haue brokē wedlocke stayned hōdes wt bloude yee euen wt idol haue committed aduo • try 〈…〉 offred owne child deuoured whō borne vnto yee haue done vnto also 〈…〉 haue defyled sāctuary daye haue vnhalowed sabbath slayne childrē idol came daye sanctuary defyle lo haue done house besyde thou hast sent yt messeungers men farre coūtrees whē came thou hast bathed trymmed set forth thy selff best fashion thou sattest vpō goodly bed 〈…〉 table spred whervpon thou hast set myne incense myne oyle greate cheare wt men yt sent frō farre coūtrees ouer deserte vnto gaue bracelettes vpon hondes set glorious crownes vpon heades thought imodonte wil vse harlotry also wt yōder olde whore wente vnto comon harlot euen wente also oola ooliba filthy woman ye loue vertue rightuousnes 〈…〉 iudge thē punysh aduoutrers murtherers ought iudged punyshed breaker wedlocke bloude hondes wherfore thus saieth lorde god bringe greate multitude people vpon make scatred spoyled shal stone gorre sweardes shal slaye sonnes doughters burne vp house fyre thus destroye soch fylthynes londe woman may lerne youre vnclēnesse shall laye youre fylthinesse vpon youre owne selues ye shalbe punyshed synnes ye haue committed youre idol ye shall knowe lorde xxiiii chapter ix yeare x moneth x daye moneth came worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man wryte vp name daye yee euē ye houre present daye kynge babilon set agaynst ierusalē eze 17 eze 11 b shewe yt obstinate housholde parable speake vnto thē thus sayet lorde god get pot set poure water put peces together good peces loyne shulder fyll best bone take one best shepe heape bone withall let boyle well let bone seyth well therin sayde lorde god maner wo vnto bloudy cite ye pot nau 3 • aba 2 whervpon rustynesse hāgeth yet scoured awaye take peces one another nede lotte case therfore bloude yet vpon playne drye stone hath poured vpon grounde might couered dust therfore haue letten poure hir bloude vpon playne drye stony rocke shulde hid might bringe wrothfull indignacion vengeaunce vpon wherfore thus saieth ye lorde god wo vnto bloudthurstie cite whō wil prepare heape wodde beare thou ye bone together kyndle thou fyre seeth flesh let well soddē bone maye suckte morouer set potemptye vpon coales maye warme metall hote fylth rustynesse maye consumed go moch rustinesse must brent thy filthinesse abhominable wolde haue clensed thou woldest clensed thou canst pourged thine vnclennesse till haue poured wrothfull indignacion vpon euen lorde haue deuysed yee come therto allredy go backe spare wil intreated acordinge thy wayes ād ymaginacions thou shalt punyshed saieth lorde god worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man beholde take awaye pleasure thine eye wt plage yet shalt thou nether mourne ner wepe ner water thy chekes therfore thou mayest mourne thy selff alone vse deadly lamentacion holde thy bonet put thy shues vpon thy fete couer thy face eate mourner bred spake vnto people bytymes mornynge euen wyfe dyed vpon nexte morow dyd cō maunded ye people sayde vnto wilt thou tell v signifieth thou doest answered worde lorde came vnto sayēge tell house israel thus saieth ye lodde god beholde wil suspende sanctuary evē glory youre power pleasure yor eye thinge ye love youre sonnes doughters ye haue left shal fall thorow swerde like haue done shall ye also ye shal hyde youre face ye shal eate mourner bred youre bonettes shal ye haue vpon youre heades shues vpon youre fete ye shal nether mourne ner wepe youre synnes ye shal soroufull one repēte another thus ezechiel youre shew tokē loke hath done commeth ye shall also ye maye lerne knowe ye lorde god beholde thou sonne man daye take power ioye honoure lust eye burthē body namely sonnes doughters thē shall one escape come vnto shewe daye shal yi mouth opened escaped thou mayest speake nomore domme yee thou shalt shew tokē maye knowe lorde xxv chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man set thy face agaynst ye ammonite prophecy vpon 〈◊〉 21 • ere▪ 49 saye vnto ammonite heare worde lorde god thus saieth lorde god moch thou speakest ouer sanctuary ha trow suspended ouer londe israel trow desolate yee ād ouer house iuda trow led awaye presoners beholde delyuer ye people east yt maye haue possession shal set castels house shall eate thy frute drynke vp thy mylcke rabath wil make stall camel ammon shepefolde ye shal knowe lorde thus saieth lorde god moch thou hast clapped thine hondes stamped thy fete yee reioysed thine herte ouer londe israel despyte beholde wil stretch myne hō de ouer also delyuer spoyled heithen rote amonge people cause destroyed londes yee make layed waist thou mayest knowe lorde thus saieth ye lorde god 〈…〉 moch moab seir saye house iuda like gētiles therfore beholde make city moab weapenlesse take awaye strength city chefe coastes londe pleasure countre namely betiesimoth baalmeō cariathaim open vnto thē east yt maye fall vpon ammonite geue possession ammonite shal remēbraunce amonge heithen euen thus punysh moab also maye knowe lorde morouer thus sayeth lorde god edom hath avenged eased vpon house iuda 〈…〉 therfore thus saieth lorde reach myne honde vpon edom take awaye man beest themā vnto dedan wil make desolate shalbe slayne swearde thorow people israel wil avenge agayne vpō edō 〈…〉 shal hādle acordinge wrath indignaciō shal knowe vengeaunce saieth lorde god thus saieth ye lorde god moch philistynes haue done namely 〈…〉 taken vengeaunce despitefull stomackes olde euell set selues destroye therfore thus saieth lorde god beholde wil stretch myne hōde ouer philistynes destroye destroyer cause remnaunt see coast perish greate vengeaunce take vpon punysh cruelly maye knowe lorde haue avenged xxvi chapter happened xi yeare first daye moneth worde lorde came vnto sayenge 〈…〉 thou sonne man tyre hath spoken vpon ierusalem ha trow porte people broken turned vnto haue destroyed bely full yee therfore saieth ye lorde god beholde tyre vpō wil bringe greate multitude people agaynst ye like whē see aryseth wawes shal breake walles tyre cast downe hir towres wil scrape grounde mate bare stone yee dryenge place fyshers hange vp nettes see syde euen haue spoken sayeth lorde god gē tile shal spoyle hir doughters vpon felde shall perish swearde yt maye knowe lorde thus saieth lorde god beholde brynge hither nabuchodonosor kynge babilon kynge kynges north vpō tyre horse charettes horsmen greate multitude people thy doughters londe shal slaye ye swearde agaynst ye shall make bullworkes graue vp dyches aboute lift vp shylde agaynst ye slynges batelrā me shal prepare thy walles wt wrapēs breake downe thy towres dust horse shal couer ye shalbe many yi walles shal shake noyse ye horse men charettes wheles cōmeth thy porte men open cite hoffes horse fete shal treade downe thy stretes shal slaye thy people wt swearde breake downe pilers thy strength shal waist awaye thy rich spoyle yi marchaūdise thy walles shal breake downe destroye thy house pleasure thy stone thy tymbre foundacions shall cast water thus wil brynge melody thy songes 〈…〉 voyce thy mynstrelsy ende shal herde wil make bare stone yee dryenge place nettes shalt neuer buylded agayne euē ye lorde haue spoken sayeth lorde god thus hath lorde god spoken concernynge tyre iles shall moued noyse thy fall crie slayne yt shal murthured kynges see shall come downe seates regall shal laye awaye roabes put costly clothinge yee tremblinge shal clothed shall syt vpō grounde shal afrayed thy sodane fall abasshed shal mourne saye vnto thou noble cite yt hast bene greatly occupyed olde tren 1 thou hast bene strongest vpon see wt thine inhabitours men stode feare art thou vtterly destroyed tyme thy fall inhabitours iles yee iles selues shall stonde feare thine ende thus sayeth lorde god make desolate cite city man dwell brynge depe vpon yt greate water maye couer cast downe vnto descende ye pytte vnto people hath bene lō ge deed set londe yt beneth like olde wyldernes go downe graues yt mā shal dwell wil make honor lōde lyuynge wil make ende ād thou shalt gone though thou sought yet shalt thou founde euermore saieth ye lorde god xxvii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou • ane mā make lamentable cōplaynte vpon tyre saye vnto tyre porte see yt occupieth moch people eze 2628 many iles thus speaketh ye lorde god tyre thou hast sayde noble cite thy border myddest see thy buylders haue made maruelous goodly yi table haue made cip • e tree mount senir frō libanus haue takē cedre tree make mastes okes basan make rower thy boordes haue made yuery costly wod ile cethim thy sale whyte small nedle worke londe egipte hāge vpō thy mast thy hanginges yalow sylcke purple ye iles elisa sidō arnad thy maryners wysest tyre thy shypmasters eldest wysest gebal mended stopped thy shippes shippes see shipmē occupied marchaundies perses lydian lybians thyne hoost helped fight hanged vp shildes helmettes the▪ set forth thy beuty arnad thine hoost roūde aboute thy walles thy watchman vpon thy towres hanged vp shildes roūde aboute thy walles made maruelous goodly tharsis occupide maner ware syluer yron tynne lead made thy market greate iauan tubal mesech thy marchauntes brought men ornamentes metall thy occupyenge house thogarma brought vnto tyme thy marte horse horsmen mule dedan thy marchaūtes eze 25 • many iles occupyed brought wether elephāt bone paycockes present sirians occupied thy dyuerse workes increased thy marchaundies smaragdes scarlet nedle worke wt whyte lynninge cloth sylcke christall iuda londe israel occupide brought vnto thy markettes wheate balme hony oyle triacle damascus also vsed marchaūdies best wyne whyte woll thy occupienge greate thy ware many dan iauan meusal haue brought vnto thy markettes yron redy made casia calamus acordinge thyneoccupienge dedan occupied infayre tapestry worke quyszhyns arabia prince cedar haue occupied wt shepe wether goates marchauntes seba rema haue occupied also costly spice precious stone golde brought vnto thy marckettes haran chene eden marchauntes saba assiria chelmad doer ye occupied costly rayment yalow sylke nedle worke precious therfore packte boūde together wt roapes yee ced • e wodde tyme ye marckettes shippes tharsis chefe thy occupienge thus thou art full greate worshipe euen myddest see thy maryners euer brynginge vnto many water ye easte wynde shal ouerbeare myddest see yt thy ware thy marchaūdies thy ryches thy maryners thy shipmasters thy helper thy occupier brought thinges necessary men warre yee thy comons shall perish myddest see daye thy fall suburbes shall shake loude crieoff thy shippmen whirry men maryners vpō see shall leape bootes set selues vpon lōde shal lift vp voyce make lamentable crye shall cast dust vpon heades ād lye downe asshes shal shaue selues put sacke cloth vpon thy sake shall mourne hertfull sorow heuy lamentacion yee child also shall wepe forthe ala cite hath bene destroyed see tyre thy ware marchaundies came frō see thou gauest people ynough kynges earth hast thou made rich thorow multitude thy ware occupienge art thou cast downe depe see thy resorte people perished dwell iles abasshed kynges afrayed yee face haue chaunged coloure marchauntes nacions wondre thou art clene brought naught cōmest nomore vp xxviii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man tell prynce tyre 〈…〉 thus saieth lorde god thou hast proude hert hast sayde god 〈…〉 haue seate myddest see like god thou art man god yet stondest thine owne cōceate thou art god beholde thou thynkest thy selfe wyser daniel secretes hyd ye thy wiszdome thy vnderstō dinge thou hast gottē greate welthynesse gathered treasure syluer golde thy greate wiszdome occupienge hast thou increased thy power thy greate rich thy hert proude therfore thus saieth ye lorde god moch thou hast lift vp thine herte though thou werst god beholde bringe enemy vpon euen tyrauntes heithē shal drawe sweardes vpon thy beuty wiszdome shall defyle thy glory shal cast downe pytte thou shalt dye middest see slayne let se yff thou wilt saye thē slaye ye god thou art man god hondes slaye dye shalt thou euen vncircumcised hōdes ye enemy haue spoken saieth lorde god morouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man make lamentable complaynte ouer kynge tyre tell thus saieth lorde god thou art seale licknesse full wyszdome excellent beuty thou hast bene ye pleasaūt gardē god thou art decte maner precious stone ruby topas christall iacyncte onyx iaspis saphir smaragde carbūcle golde thy beuty ye hole yt ye set forth daye ye creacion thou art fayre cherub stretched wyde couer haue set vpon holy mount god hast thou bene walked amō ge fayre glisteringe stone tyme thy creacion thou hast bene right excellent tyll wickednesse founde thy greate marchaundise 〈◊〉 ▪ 2 b thy hert full wickednesse thou hast offended therfore wil cast mount god thou coueringe cherub destroye amōge glisteringe stone thy hert proude ye fayre beuty thorow thy beuty thou hast destroyed thy wiszdome cast ye downe grounde yt ye sight kynges thou hast defyled thy sāctuary wt greate wickednesse thy onrightuous occupyenge wil bringe fyre myddest consume ād wil make asshes sight thē yt loke vpon haue bene acquaunted amonge heithē shal abasshed seinge thou art clene brought naugth cōmest vp worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man set thy face agaynst sidō prophecie vpō speake thus saieth lorde god 〈◊〉 3 〈◊〉 9 beholde sidon wil vpō get honoure maye knowne ye lorde punysh get honoure sende pestilence bloud sheddinge hir stretes yt slayne swerde shal lye rounde aboute myddest shal knowe lorde shal prickinge thorne hurtinge brere vnto house israel ner vnto thē lye rounde aboute hate shal knowe lorde thus saieth lorde god gather housholde israel together agayne nacions amonge scatred shal sanctified thē ye sight gētiles shal dwell lōde yt gaue seruaunt iacob shal dwell safely therin buylde house deu 28 c esa 65 plante vynyardes yee safely shal dwell therin haue punyshed despyse rounde aboute shall knowe yt lorde god xxix chapter x yeare vpon xij daye x moneth worde lorde came vnto sayēge esa 19 20 iere 46 eze 303132 thou sonne mā set thy face agaynst pharao kynge egipte prophecye agaynst agaynst whole lōde egipte speake tell thus saieth lorde god beholde pharao thou kinge egipte wil vpō thou greate whall fysh yt lyest yi water thou yt sayest water myne haue made wil put hoke thy chawes hāge fish thy water vpō thy skales yt wil drawe thy water yee fish ye water hange vpon thy skales wil cast vpon dry lōde fish thy water thou shalt lye vpon felde thou shalt gathered ner taken vp shalt meate beestes felde foules ayre dwell egipte maye knowe lorde thou hast bene staff rede house israel4 18 • esa 30 31 36 toke holde ye wt hōde thou brakest prycdest euery syde yff leaned vpō thou brakest ād hurtdest reynes backes therfore thus sayeth lorde god beholde brynge swearde vpon rote man beest yee londe egipte shalbe desolate waist shal knowe lorde sayde water mine self haue made beholde therfore wil vpon vpon thy water make londe egipte waist desolate towre syenes vnto border moriās londe xl yeares shall fote man walke nether fote catell go nether shal inhabited wil make londe egipte desolate amonge waist countrees city lye voyde xl yeares amonge voyde city wil scatre egipcians amonge heithen nacions agayne thus sayeth lorde god whē xl yeares expyred wil gather egipcians together agayne iere 46 • naciōs amonge whō scatred wil bringe presoners egipte agayne londe pathures owne natyue 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 councre maye lowly small kyngdome yee shal smallest amonge kyngdomes lest exalte selues aboue heithen mynish shall nomore rule heithen shall nomore hope vnto house israel nether prouoke thē enymore wickednesse cause turne backe folowe ād shal knowe lorde god xxvij yeare first daye first moneth came ye worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man nabuchodonosor kynge babilon hath made hoost greate trauayle laboure come tyre euery heade maye balde euery shulder bare yet hath tyre geuen nether ner hoost eny rewarde ye greate trauayle yt hath taken therfore thus saieth ye lorde god beholde wil geue lōde egipte vnto nabuchodonosor kynge babilō yt maye take awaye hir substaūce robbe hir robbery ād spoyle hir spoyles paye hoost wagies withall wil geue londe egipte laboure toke tyre tyme wil cause horne house israel growe forth open thy mouth agayne amonge maye knowe lorde xxx chapter morouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man prophecy speake thus saieth lorde god mourne wo worth daye eze 293132 daye daye ye lorde come darcke daye ye heithē houre honde swearde commeth vpon egipte wounded men fall downe egipte hir people taken awaye hir foundaciōs destroyed morians londe shal afrayed yee morians londe lybia lydia comon people chub yt confederate vnto thē shal fall wt thē thorow ye swearde thus saieth ye lorde maynteyners lōde egipte shal fall pryde hir power shal come downe euē vnto tower syenes shall slayne downe wt swearde saieth ye lorde god amonge desolate countrees shal made desolate amōge waist city shalbe waisted shal knowe yt ye lorde kyndle fyre egipte hir helper destroyed tyme shal messaungers go forth frome shippes make ye carelesse morians afrayed sorowe shal come vpon daye egipte doutles shal come thus saieth lorde god wil make ende people egipte thorow honde nabuchodonosor kynge babilon people yee cruell tyrauntes heithen shalbe brought destroye londe shal drawe sweardes vpon egipte fyll londe full slayne men drye vp floudes water ād sell lō de hondes wicked people lō de yt therin wil destroye thorow enemy euē lorde haue sayde thus saieth lorde god destroye idol brynge ymages noph ende 〈…〉 shal nomore prynce egypte fearfulnesse sende egipcians londe pathures wil make desolate ād kyndle fyre zoan alexandria punysh poure wroth full indignaciō vpō sin strength egipte sustaunce alexandria destroye kyndle fyre egipte sin shalbe greate heuynesse alexandria shalbe roted noph shall haue daylie sorowe best men heliopolis bubasto shalbe slayne swearde ād caried awaye captyue taphnis daye shalbe darke breake scepter londe egipte ye pompe hir powr shal haue ende clonde shal couer hir doughters shalbe led waye captyuyte thus punysh egipte maye knowe lorde happened xi yeare vpon seuēth daye ye first moneth yt lordes worde came vnto sayēge beholde thou sonne mā wil breake ye arme pharao kynge egipte lo shal boūde vp healed nether shal eny play • layed vpon ease make strōge holde swearde therfore thus saieth lorde god beholde vpon pharao ye kinge egipte brusse strō ge arme yet broken one smyte swearde honde egipcians wil scatre amonge heithen strowe thē londes aboute agayne wil strength ye arme kinge babilō geue swearde hōde wil breake pharaos arme yt shal holde piteously like wounded man yee stablish kynge babilōs arme armes pharao shal fall downe maye knowne lorde geue kynge babilon swearde hōde maye drawe vpon londe egipte scatre egipcians amonge gentile strowe ye lōdes aboute maye knowe yt lorde xxxi chapter morouer happened xi yeare ye first daye thirde moneth worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man speake vnto pharao kynge egipte 〈◊〉 29· 〈◊〉 ▪ 32 ād people art thou like yt greatnesse beholde assur like cedre tre vpō mount libanus fayre braū ches thicke gaue shadowes shot hye toppe reached vnto cloudes water made greate depe set vp hye roūde aboute rote rāne floudes water sent litle ryuers vnto tree felde therfore hyer thō tree felde thorow ye multitude water sent frō optayned many longe braunches foules ayre made nestes braū ches vnder bowes gēdred beastes ye felde vnder shadow dwelt people fayre beutifull greatnesse length braunches rote stode besyde greate water cedretre might hyde pleasaūt garden god fyrre tre like braūches playne tree like ye bowes tree garden god might cōpared vnto beuty fayre goodly made multitude braunches moch yt tree pleasaūt gardē god envye hī therfore thus saieth lorde god moch hath lift vp hie stretched toppe cloudes seinge hert proude highnesse wil delyuer ye hondes ye mightiest amōge ye heithē shall rote acordīge wickednes cast awaye enemy shal destroye mighty men heithen shall scatre braunches shal lye vpon mountaynes valley bowes shall broken downe grounde thorow londe people londe shal go shadowe forsake fallē ye foules ye ayre shal syt vpon wilde beestes felde shal go aboute amonge braū ches hence forth tre water shall attayne hyenesse reach toppe vnto cloudes nether shall eny tre water stonde hye hath done vnto death shall delyuered vnder earth go downe ye graue like men morouer thus saieth lorde god daye goeth downe graue wil cause lamentacion made couer depe vpon staunch floudes greate water shalbe restrayned shall cause libanus soroufull sake tree felde shall smyttē esa 14 c eze 32 c wil make heithen shake sounde fall cast downe hell yt descende pytte tree eden wt chosen besttrees libanus yee planted vpon water shal mourne also lower habitaciōs shal go downe hell wt vnto thē slayne swearde dwelt afore vnder shadow arme amōge heithē shalt thou lickened art glorious greate amonge tree eden yet art thou cast downe vnder ye earth amonge tree eden thou must lye amonge vncircumcised slayne wt swearde euen thus pharao people saieth lorde god xxxii chapter xij yeare first daye xij moneth worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man take vp lamentacion vpō pharao kynge egipte saye vnto eze 293031 thou art reputed lyon heithen whalfish see thou castest yt water aboute thou troublest water wt thy fete stampest floudes thus sayeth lorde god eze 12 b 17 c wil sprede net ouer ye namely greate multitude people shal dryue yarne cast vpō lōde let lye vpō felde foules ayre maye syt vpō wil geue beastes felde ynough thy flesh cast vpō hilles fyll valley thy hyenesse water londe abundaunce thy bloude euen moū taynes ye valley shal full thou art put couer heauen make starres dymme eze 13 • loc 3 c sprede cloude ouer sonne ād moone shall geue hir light lightes heauen put ouer bringe darcknesse vpon thy londe saieth ye lorde god wil trouble hertes many people bringe thy destruccion amō ge heithen countrees thou knowest yee make many people kynges afrayed thorow ye hayre shal stonde vp whē shake swearde face sodenly shal astonnyed euery man self ye daye thy fall thus saieth lorde god kynge babilons swearde shal come vpon ye ye sweardes worthy smyte downe thy people mightie amonge gētiles shal waist proude pompe egipte brynge downe hir people catell also egipte wil destroye shal come nomore vpō water nether mās fote ner beastes clawe shal stere eny wil make water cleare cause floudes runne like oyle sayeth lorde god make londe egipte desolate ye countre therin shalbe layde waist whē smyte thē dwell maye knowe lorde mournynge doughters heithen shall make yee sorow lamentaciō shal take vp vpon egipte hir people saieth lorde god xij yeare xv daye moneth came worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man take vp lamentacion vpon people egipte cast downe yee ād mightie people heithē also esa 14 c eze 31 c euen thē dwell beneth go downe graue downe fayre euer thou laye vncircircumcised amōge slayne swearde shal lye swearde geuen alredy▪ shal drawen forth people mightie worthy helper yt gone downe lye vncircumcised slayne ye swearde shal speake hell assur also company ād graues rounde aboute slayne ād fell swearde whose graues lye besyde lowe pytte comōs buried rounde aboute graue alltogether wounded slayne swearde men afore tyme brought feare ye londe lyuynge elam also people 〈…〉 graues rounde aboute beynge wounded slayne swearde gone downe vncircumcised vnder earth neuertheles somtyme brought feare londe lyuynge beare shame gone downe ye graue buryall geuen people amonge slayne graues rounde aboute vncircumcised slay▪ thorow swearde seynge tymes past made londe lyuynge afrayed must beare owne shame go downe pytte lye amonge slayne mesech also tubal people graues rounde aboute amonge vncircūcised slayne swearde afore tyme made londe lyuynge afrayed shulde lye also amonge ye worthy vncircumcised giauntes wt weapens gone downe hel whose sweardes layed vnder heades whose wickednesse vpon bone worthy haue brought feare ye lōde ye lyuinge yee amōge vncircūcised shalt thou destroyed slepe perished thorow swearde lōde edom hir kynges prynces also wt strēgth layed slayne swearde yee amonge vncircumcised 〈…〉 gone downe pytte morouer prynces north sidoniās gone downe slayne feare strength come confucion lye vncircumcised amonge slayne swearde beare owne shame gone downe ye pytte pharao seyth shal comforted ouer people slayne swearde pharao hoost saieth ye lorde god haue geuē feare lōde lyuynge pharao people shall ye amōge vncircumcised amonge slayne swearde saieth lorde god xxxiii chapter agayne worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man speake childrē thy people tell sende swearde vpon londe yf people londe take man countre set watchman ye man whā seyth swearde come vpon londe shall blowe trompet 9 warne people yff man heare noyse trompet warned swearde come ād take awaye bloude shall vpō owne heade herde soū de trompet wolde take hede therfore bloude vpon yff receaue warnynge shal saue life agayne yf watch man se swerde come shewe trompet yt people warned yff swearde come take eny man amōge thē shall taken awaye owne synne bloude requyre watchman honde thou sonne man haue made watchman vnto house israel • ze 3 c thou hearest eny thinge mouth thou mayest warne behalfe yff saye vnto wicked thou wicked thou shalt surely dye thou geuest warnynge maye bewarre vngodly waye shall wicked dye owne synne bloude requyre thy honde neuertheles yf thou warne wicked waye turne yet wil turned shal dye synne thou hast delyuered thy soule therfore thou sonne man speake vnto house israel ye saye thus oure offence synnes lye vpon v webe corrupte shulde restored vnto life tell truly lyue saieth lorde god haue pleasure death wicked • ze 18 • moch rather wicked turne waye lyue turne turne yor vngodly wayes ye house israel oh wherfore ye dye thou sonne man tell child thy people • ze 18 rightuousnes rightuous shall saue whan euer turneth awaye vnfaithfully agayne wickednesse wicked shal hurte whan euer conuerteth vngodlynesse ye rightuousnesse rightuous shal saue life euer synneth yff saye vnto rightuous shall surely lyue trust owne rightuousnesse synne shall rightuousnesse nomore thought vpon wickednesse hath done shall dye agayne yff saye wicked esa 55 b iere 1 • thou shalt surely dye turne frō synnes thinge laufull right moch wicked mā geueth pledge agayne restoreth taken awaye robbery walketh cōmaundementes life doth wrō ge shall surely lyue dye yee synnes done shal neuer thought vpon moch doth thynge laufull right shall lyue yet child thy people saye tush waye lorde right owne waye rather vnright rightuous turneth rightuousnesse doeth thynge wicked shall dye therfore yf wicked turne wickednesse doinge thinge laufull right eze 18 ro 2 shall lyue therfore yet ye saye▪ waye ye lorde equall ye house israel wil iudge euery one wayes xij yeare v daye x moneth oure captyuyte happened one fled ierusalem came vnto sayde ye cite destroyed honde lorde bene vpon euenynge afore man escaped came vnto opened mouth vntyll mornynge came yee opened mouth yt nomore domme came worde ye lorde vnto sayde thou sonne man dwell waisted londe israel saye abraham one man ād londe possessiō many londe geuen v possesse also therfore tell thus saieth lorde bloude haue ye eaten youre eye haue ye lift vp idol leui 17 • deu 3 • haue shed bloude shal ye haue londe possession ye leane vpon youre sweardes ye worke abhominacions euery one defyleth neghbours wife shal ye possesse londe saye thou wordes vnto thē thus saieth lorde god truly lyue ye dwell wildernesse shall slayne wt swearde vpon felde geue vnto beestes deuoured stronge holdes dennes shall dye pestilēce wil make londe desolate waist ye pō pe hir strength shall come ende mountaynes israel shal waiste man shall trauayle therby shall lerne knowe lorde eze 25 c whē make lōde waist desolate abhominacions haue wrought thou sonne man child thy people yt talke walles ād dores house sayenge one another come let v heare worde gone forth lorde come vnto ye maner greate people yee people syt downe heare thy wordes therafter esa 29 c mat 15 mouthes shewe themselues though feruent herte goeth owne couetous lucre balet yt hath swete tune ād pleasaūt synge shalt thou vnto thy wordes shal heare therafter whē commeth passe lo cōmeth dede shal knowe hath bene prophet amonge xxxiiii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne mā prophecye agaynst shepherdes israel prophecy speake vnto thus saieth lorde god wo vnto shepherdes israel eze 13 • 14 b 23 a▪ fede selues shulde shepherdes fede ye flockes ye haue eaten vp fatte ye haue clothed woll best fedde haue ye slayne ye flocke haue ye norished weake haue ye holden vp • uc 4 b sicke haue ye healed broken haue ye bounde together outcaste haue ye brought agayne ye lost haue ye sought churlishly cruelly haue ye ruled thē • pe 5 thus scatred without shepherde yee beastes felde deuoure go astraye shepe go wandringe vpon moū taynes vpon euery hye hill yee scatred abrode feldes man careth seketh therfore ye shepherdes heare worde lorde thus sayeth lorde god truly lyue moch shepe robbed deuoured wylde beestes felde hauynge shepherde seynge shepherdes take regarde shepe fede selues shepe therfore heare ye worde lorde ye shepherdes thus sayeth lorde god beholde myselff vpon shepherdes requyre shepe hondes make thē ceasse fedynge shepe yee shepherdes shall fede selues nomore delyuer shepe mouthes shall deuoure thus saieth lorde god beholde loke shepe myselff 〈…〉 seke like shepherde amōge flocke seketh shepe scatred abrode euen seke shepe gather together place haue bene scatred cloudy darcke daye bringe people gather together londes bringe thē owne londe fede vpon mountaynes israel ryuers place countre fede right good pasture vpon hie mountaynes israel shall foldes shal lye good folde ād fat pasture shall fede euen vpon mountaynes israel fede shepe myselff bringe rest sayeth lorde god soch lost seke 〈…〉 soch go astraye wil brynge agayne soch woūded bynde vp soch weake make stronge soch fat well lykinge preserue fede ye thinge laufull shepe sayeth lorde god put difference amonge shepe 〈…〉 amonge wether ād goates ynough eat vp good pasture ye must treade downe residue youre pasture wt youre fete also ynough drynke cleare water ye must trouble residue also youre fete thus shepe must fayne eate ye thinge ye haue troden downe yor fete drynke ye youre fete haue defyled therfore thus sayeth lorde god vnto beholde seuer fat shepe leane moch ye haue shot weake shepe apō ye sydes shulders runne vpon youre home longe till ye haue vtterly scatred abrode wil helpe shepe yt shal nomore spoyled yee wil discerne one shepe another wil rayse vp vnto one shepherde euen seruaunt dauid 〈◊〉 30 b 〈◊〉 c 〈◊〉 5 shal fede thē shal shepherde lorde wil god seruaunt dauid shal prince euen lorde haue spoken morouer wil make couenaunt peace dryue euell beastes londe maye dwell safely wildernesse slepe woddes good fortune prosperite wil geue vnto rounde aboute hill prosperous shower rayne wil sende due season 〈…〉 b tree wodde maye bringe forth frutes ye grounde hir increase shalbe safe londe shal knowe lorde haue brokē yocke delyuered hondes helde subieccion shal nomore spoyled heithen ner deuoured beastes lō de safely shal dwell man shall fraye wil set vp excellēt plāte yt shal suffre hunger londe nether beare reprofe ye heithen eny thus shal vnderstonde lorde god wt yt euen house israel people saieth lorde god ye men flocke 〈◊〉 • 4 b ye shepe pasture youre god saieth lorde god xxxv chapter morouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man turne thy face towarde mount seir prophecy vpon saye vnto 〈◊〉 4 〈…〉 49 b 〈◊〉 • 5 b 〈◊〉 • 6 thus saieth lorde god beholde thou mount seir vpon reach myne hōde ouer yee waist desolate wil make thy city wil breake downe thou shalt lye voyde thou mayest knowe lorde moch thou bearest olde enemyte agaynst child israel 〈◊〉 20 c 〈…〉 cruel honde hast made afrayed tyme troubled punyshed synne therfore truly lyue saieth ye lorde god wil prepare vnto bloude yee bloude shal folowe vpon seinge thou layest waite bloude 〈◊〉 5 therfore shall bloude persecute thus wil make mount seir desolate waist bringe passe shall man go thither ner come thence mountaynes wil fyll wt slayne men thy hilles dale valley shallye full slayne ye swearde wil make perpetuall wildernesse noman shal dwell thy city yt ye maye knowe yt lorde thou hast sayde nacions londes must myne wil haue possession exo 25 c lorde therfore thus saieth lorde god truly lyue hādle acordinge thy wrath gelousy like thou hast dealt cruelly maye knowne amōge haue punyshed yee thou also mayest sure lorde haue herde thy despyteful wordes thou hast spokē agaynst mountaynes israel sayenge lo made waist geuen v deuoure thus youre mouthes ye haue made youre boost agaynst yee multiplied youre pronde wordes agaynst haue herde altogether vnto thus saieth ye lorde god whole worlde wealth wil make waist eze 22 • 26 like thou mount seir wast glad heretage house israel destroyed euen wil vnto also thou whole edom shall destroyed knowe lorde xxxvi chapter thou sonne man prophecie vpon mountaynes israel speake eze 6 c heare worde lorde ye mountaynes israel thus saieth lorde god yor enemie hath sayde vpon ha ye hie euerlastynge place become prophecy therfore speake thus saieth ye lorde god seinge ye waisted trodē downe euery syde become possession vnto ye resydue ye gētiles haue b • ought mēs mouthes vnto euel name amonge ye people therfore heare worde lorde god ye mountaynes israel thus saieth lorde god vnto mountaynes hilles valley dale voyde wilderness desolate city spoyled de • ision euery syde amonge resydue heithē yee euē thus saieth lorde god • yre gelousy haue taken deuyce agaynst resydue gētiles agaynst edom ez • 35 haue takē lō de vnto thē selues possession also reioysed frō whole herte wt despiteful stomacke waist spoyle prophecy therfore vpon londe israel speake vnto ye mountaynes hilles valley dale thus saieth lorde god beholde haue deuysed gelousy terrible wrath moch ye haue suffred reprofe heithen therfore thus saieth lorde god haue sworne gentile lye aboute shal beare youre confucion selues mountaynes israel ye shall shute youre braunches bringe forth youre frute people israel harde wil come beholde come vnto vnto turne ye maye tylled sowen wil sende moch people shalbe house israel city shalbe inhabited ye decayed place shal repayred againe wil prouyde moch people catell shal increase bringe frute wil restore also youre olde estate shewe kindnes thē euer ye wherby ye shal knowe yt lorde yee people wil sende vnto folke israel shal haue possession thou shalt inheritaunce thou shalt nomore without agayne thus saieth lorde god moch saye vnto thou art eater vp men waister thy people therfore thou shalt eate mo men nether destroye thy people eny saieth lorde god wil suffre heare thine owne confucion amonge gentile hensforth thou shalt beare reprofe nacions ner cast thine owne people enymore saieth lorde god morouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne mā house israel dwelt vpon owne grounde defyled selues owne wayes ymaginacions sight waye like vnclennesse menstruous woman wherfore poured wrothfull displeasure vpon bloude shed londe idol wherwith defyled selues scatred also amonge heithen strowed aboute lōdes acordinge wayes owne inuencions dyd punysh gone vnto hetthen 〈◊〉 2 c 〈◊〉 52 b come amonge dishonoured holy name sayde people god must go owne londe spared holy name ye house israel dishonoured amonge gentile came therfore tell ye house israel thus saieth lorde god yor sake house israel holy name sake ye dishonoured amō ge heithen ye came therfore wil halowe greate name agayne amonge gētiles euel spoken ye youre selues haue dishonoured amō ge gentile shal knowe lorde honoured eye saieth ye lorde god wil take amonge heithen gather together countrees bringe agayne youre owne londe 〈…〉 poure cleare water vpon ye shalbe clene yee youre vnclennesse yor idol shal clense new herte also wil geue 〈…〉 new sprete wil put stony hert take youre body geue fleszshy herte 〈…〉 wil geue sprete amonge se walke commaundemētes kepe lawes fulfill ye shall dwell londe gaue yor forefather ye shal people wil youre god wil helpe youre vnclēnesse wil call corne wil increase wil let haue honger multiplie frutes tree ye increase felde ye shal beare reprofe honger amōge heithē shal ye remēbre yor owne wicked wayes youre ymaginaciōs good ye shal take displeasure youre owne selues reason youre synnes abhominacions wil youre sake saieth lorde god ye sure therfore ye house israel ashamed youre synnes morouer thus saieth lorde god tyme shal clēse youre offence wil make city occupied agayne wil repayre place decayed desolate londe shal buylded agayne afore tyme laye waist sight wēte shal sayde waist lōde become like garden pleasure voyde desolate brokē downe city stronge fensed agayne residue heithen lye rounde aboute shal knowe lorde repayre broken downe plant • agayne made waist euen lorde haue spoken wil dede thus saieth lorde god wil yet founde agayne ye house israel shal increase flocke men 〈…〉 like holy flocke flocke ierusalem hie solempne feastes shal also wilde waisted city fylled flockes men shal knowe lorde xxxvii chapter honde lorde came vpon caried sprete lorde let downe playne felde laye full bone led rounde aboute them▪ beholde bone laye vpon felde many maruelous drye also sayde vnto thou sonne man thinkest thou benes maye lyue agayne answered lorde god thou knowest sayde vnto prophecy thou vpon bone speake vnto ye drye bone heare worde lorde thus saieth lorde god vnto bone beholde put breth ye maye lyue wil geue synowes make flesh growe vpon couer ouer skynne geue breth 〈…〉 ye maye lyue knowe lorde 〈◊〉 15 prophecied cōmaunded prophecienge came noyse greate mocion bone ranne euery one another whē loked beholde synowes flesh grewe vpon aboue couered skynne breth sayde vnto thou sonne man prophecie thou towarde wynde prophecy speake wynde thus saieth lorde god come thou ayre foure wyndes blowe vpon slayne maye restored life prophecied commaunded came brethtn receaued life stode vp vpon fete maruelous greate sorte morouer sayde vnto thou sonne man bone whole house israel 〈…〉 beholde saye oure bone dryed vp oure hope gone clene cut therfore prophecie thou speake vnto thus saieth lorde god beholde wil open youre graues people take youre sepulcres bringe londe israel agayne shall ye knowe yt lorde open youre graues bringe sprete also wil put ye shal lyue wil set agayne youre owne londe ye shal knowe lorde haue sayde fulfilled dede worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man take sticke wryte vpon vnto iuda child israel companyons take another sticke wryte vpon vnto ioseph stocke ephraim housholde israel companyons take together thine honde shal one stycke therof yf childrē thy people saye vnto wilt thou shewe v thou meanest geue answere thus saieth lorde god beholde osee • b wil take stocke ioseph honde ephraim trybes israel felowes wil put stocke iuda make one stocke shal one honde two stickes vpon thou wrytest shalt thou haue thine honde maye se shalt saye vnto thus saieth lorde god beholde wil take awaye childrē israel amonge heithen vnto gone wil gather together euery syde bringe agayne owne londe yee wil make one people thē ye londe vpon mountaynes israel shal haue one kinge shall nomore two people hensforth nether deuyded two kingdomes shal also defyle thē selues nomore abhominacions idol wickeddoinges wil helpe thē dwellinge place wherin haue synned clense shalbe people god dauid seruaunt shalbe kinge eze 34 • ioh 10 b shal haue one shepherde shal walke lawes commaundementes shal kepe fulfill shal dwell londe gaue vnto iacob seruaunt youre father also haue dwelt yee euē londe shal child childers child dwell euermore seruaunt dauid shal euerlastynge prynce morouer make bonde peace shal vnto euerlastinge couenaunt wil sattle thē also multiplie sanctuary wil set amonge thē euermore dwellinge shalbe wt yee wil god shalbe people thus heithen also shal knowe lorde ye holy maker israel whē sanctuary shal amonge euer xxxviii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man turne thy face towarde gog londe magog chefe prynce mesech tubal prophecy agaynst saye • ze 39 thus saieth lorde god gog thou chefe prynce mesech tubal • po 20 c beholde wil vpon wil turne aboute put bytt thy chawes wil bringe forth thine hoost horse horsmen weapened best fashion greate people handle altogether speares shyldes swerdes perses moryans lybians beare shyldes helmettes gomer hoostes house thogorma north quarter hoostes yee moch people therfore prepare set thy self araye thy people come vnto heapes thou defence many dayes thou shalt visited latter yeares thou shalt come lōde hath bene destroyed swearde replenished agayne wt dyuerse people vpon mountaynes israel haue lōge lyen waist yee brought nacions dwell safe thou shalt come vp like stormy wether couer lō de darcke cloude thou thine hoostes greate multitude people morouer thus saieth lorde god tyme shal many thinges come thy mynde thou shalt ymagyn myschefe saye wil vp yonder playne londe seinge syt ease dwell safely dwell without eny walles haue nether barres dores spoyle robbe thē laye honde vpon wel inhabited wilderness agaynst people yt gathered together amonge heithē haue gotten catell good dwell myddest londe shal saba dedan marchauntes tharsis wt worthy saye vnto art thou come robbe hast thou gathered thy people together thou wilt spoyle take syluer golde cary awaye catell good haue greate pray therfore thou sonne man thou shalt prophecie saye vnto gog thus saieth lorde god daye thou shalt knowe people israel dwelleth safe shalt come thy place north partes thou moch people wt ryde vpon horse wherof greate multitude innumerable sorte yee thou shalt come vpon people israel cloude couer lōde shal come passe latter dayes wil bringe vp londe heithen maye knowe get honoure vpon gog eye thus saieth lorde god thou art haue spoken afore tyme seruauntes ye prophetes israel prophecied dayes yeares shulde bringe vpon tyme gog commeth vp londe israel saieth lorde god shal indignaciō go forth wrath gelousy hote displeasure haue deuysed 〈…〉 shalbe greate trouble londe israel tyme fyszshes see foules ayre beestes felde men yt vpon earth shal tremble feare hilles also shalbe turned vp side downe stayres stone shal fall walles shal syncke grounde wil call swearde vpon mountaynes saieth lorde god euery man swearde shal vpon another pestilē ce bloude wil punysh stormy rayne hale stone fyre brymstone wil cause rayne vpon heape yee vpon greate people thus wil magnified honoured knowne amonge heithen maye sure yt ye lorde xxxix chapter therfore thou sonne man prophecie agaynst gog speake thus saieth lorde god beholde gog 〈…〉 thou chefe prynce mesech tubal wil vpon turne aboute carie forth lede yt north partes bringe vp mountaynes israel thy bowe wil smyte thy left honde cast thine arowes thy right honde thou thine heape people must fall vpon mountaynes israel wil geue vnto ye foules wilde beastes felde deuoured must thou lye vpon felde euē lorde haue spoken saieth lorde god magog amonge sit carelesse iles wil sende fyre shal knowe yt lorde wil make also name holynesse knowne amonge people israel let holy name euel spoken enymore heithen also shal knowe lorde holy one israel beholde commeth shalbe fulfilled dede saieth lorde god daye wherof haue spoken dwell ye city israel shal go forth set fyre vpon weapens burne shyldes speres bowes arowes bylles clubbes seuen yeares shall burnynge therof shall el bringe stickes ye felde nether haue nede hew downe eny wodde shall haue weapens ynew burne shal robbe robbed spoyle spoyled saieth ye lorde god tyme geue vnto gog place buried israel euē valley thorow men go east see warde trauayle therby shal abhorre shal gog people buried shalbe called valley people gog seuen monethes longe shall house israel burienge maye clense lōde yee people londe shal burie shal glorious daye get honoure saieth lorde god shal ordene men also deed buriers euer goinge thorow lōde appoynte certayne place bury remayne vpon felde londe maye clensed ende ende shal seke v • monethes lōge go thorow londe se man bone shall set vp token till deed buriers haue buried also valley people gog name cite shalbe called hamona thus shall make londe clene thou sonne man thus saieth lorde god speake vnto foules euery byrde yee wilde beastes felde heape together come gather roūde aboute vpō slaughter haue slayne euen greate slaughter vpon mountaynes israel eate flesh 〈◊〉 19 drynke bloude ye shal eate ye flesh worthy drynke bloude prynces londe wether lambes goates ox slayne basan eate ye fat youre bely full drynke bloude till ye droncken slaughter haue slayne vnto fyl table horse stronge horsmen captaynes mē warre saieth lorde god bringe glory also amonge gentile heithen maye semy iudgment haue kepte honde haue layed vpon ye house israel maye knowe ye lorde god daye forth heithen shal knowe house israel led captiuyte wickednes sake offended cause hyd face delyuered hondes enemy might slayne 〈…〉 acordinge vn clennesse 〈◊〉 vnfaithfull dealinges haue entreated hyd face therfore thus saieth ye lorde god bringe agayne captyues iacob haue mercy vpon whole house israel gelous holy name sake confucion offence haue done agaynst shal taken awaye safely shal dwell londe man shal make frayed haue brought thē agayne amonge people haue gathered together enemy londes praysed many heithen shall knowe lorde god suffred led captiuyte amonge heithen haue brought agayne owne londe left one yonder hyde face nomore poure sprete vpon house israel eze 36 saieth lorde god xl chapter xxv yeare oure captiuyte begynnynge yeare x daye moneth xiiij yeare ye cite smytten downe daye came honde lorde vpon caried forth euen londe israel brought heme vision god set downe vpō maruelous hie mountayne whervpon buyldinge bene cite towarde north thither caried beholde man whose similitude like brasse threde flax honde meterodde also stode dore sayde vnto marcke well thine eye herken thine eares fasten thine hert whatso euer shal shewe intent might shewed therfore art thou brought hither soeuer thou seyst thou shalt certifie house israel therof beholde wall outsyde rounde aboute house meterodde honde six cubites longe spanne measured bredth buyldinge meterodde heyth also meterodde came vnto eastdore wente vp stare • measured postes dore 〈…〉 meterodde sydes chambres six cubites wyde either syde measured ye dore rygge one chābre another whose wydenesse xxv cubites one dore stode agaynst another made pilers also lx cubites hie rounde aboute courte sixe cubites chambres yt stode rounde aboute ye house euery one foure cubites wyde one stode harde vpō another wherof xxxiij stode postes beneth walles rounde aboute house beare thē vp ye wall ye house fastened syde chambres hyer wyder steppe thorow rounde aboute ye house thus wyder aboue lowest men might go hyest mydde chābers▪ sawe also house hye rounde aboute foundacion syde chambres balkes like house xlii chapter caried ••• fore courte towarde north brought chambre stode ouer agaynst backe buyldinge northwarde length 〈◊〉 cubites whose dore turned towarde north wydenesse conteyned l cubites ouer agaynst xx cubites ynnermer courte agaynst paued worke fore courte besyde thre stode pilers one ouer another chā bre walkinge place x cubites wyde within waye one cubite wyde dores towarde north thus hyest chambres allwaye narower lowest myddelmost ye buildinge bare chambre vpon chambre stode thre together one vpon another hauynge pilers like fore courte therfore smaller beneth myddest reken grounde vpwarde wall without stode ye chambres towarde vttemost courte vpon fore syde chambres l cubites lō ge lēgth ye vttemost chamber fore courte l cubites also length therof temple thresholdes postes almost postes bare wall betwixte thus haue defyled holy name abhominacions haue cōmitted wherfore haue destroyed wrath shal put awaye whordome deed body kinges sight maye dwell aulter daye whē made offre burnt offringes sprenkle bloude ther vpon 〈◊〉 44 c prestes ye leuites sede sadoch treade seruyce saieth lorde god vnto geue thou yonge bullocke syn offringe take bloude sprenkle foure horne withal foure corner aulter coueringe ledge goeth rounde aboute leui 16▪ • shalt thou clense reconcile thou shalt take bullock also synoffringe burne seuerall place sanctuary nexte daye take gootbuck without blemish syn offringe reconcile aulter withall like reconciled ye bullocke thou hast made clene offre yonge bullocke without blemish ramme flocke without blemish also offre lorde leui 22 c let prest cast salt thervpon leui 2 b geue vnto lorde burntoffringe seuen dayes shalt thou bringe euery daye gootbucke yonge bullocke ramme flocke without blemish shal offre seuen dayes shal reconcile clense aulter offre vpon dayes expired vpon viij daye forth prestes shal offre burnt offringes health offringes vpō ye aulter wil mercifull vnto saieth lorde god xliiii chapter brought agayne ye outwarde dore sanctuary east syde shut sayde lorde vnto dore shal stil shut opened eny mā go thorow lorde god israel yee shal go thorow el shal shut still prynce shal come thorow maye eate bred lorde porche shal come shal go agayne exo 40 • 24 nu 9 c 3 reg 8 b 2 par 7 • brought dore vpon north syde house loked aboute beholde glory lorde fylled house fell downe vpon face lorde spake vnto thou sonne man fasten thine herte beholde take diligēt hede wil saye vnto concernynge ordinaunces lorde lawes pondre well thine herte commynge house goinge forth sanctuary tell obstinate housholde israel thus saieth lorde god house israel ye haue done ynough youre abhominaciōs seynge ye haue brought sanctuary straungers hauynge vncircumcised hertes flesh thorow sāctuary defiled whē ye offre bred fat bloude thus youre abhominacions ye haue broken couenaunt kepte holy ordinaunces sanctuary▪ set kepers sanctuary euen youre owne mynde therfore thus saieth ye lorde god straungers dwell amōge childrē israel straunger whose herte flesh circumcised shal come within sanctuary ner leuites gone backe fro haue disceaued people israel erroures goinge idol therfore shal thei beare owne wickednes shulde set ordened ministre vnder dores house sanctuary seruyce house slaye burnt offringes sacrifice ye people stōde serue seynge seruyce idol cause house israel stomble thorow wickednesse • reg 2 f cause haue pluckte myne honde ouer saieth lorde must beare owne iniquyte come nye serue preasheade sanctuary holyest maye beare owne shame abhominacions haue done shulde vse porter house seruyce yt done therin prestes ye leuites sonnes sadoch eze 43 48 b kepte holy ordinaunces sanctuary child israel gone fro shal come seruyce stonde offre fat bloude saieth lorde god shall go sanctuary treade table seruyce waite vpō myne ordinaunces whē go dores ynnermer courte shal put lynnynge clothes wollyne come vpon whyle seruyce vnder dores ye ynnermer courte within shal haue fayre lynnynge bonettes vpon heades lynnynge breches vpon loynes laboure shal put aboute go forth people outwarde courte shal put clothes wherin haue ministred laye habitacion sanctuary put apparell lest onhalowe ye people clothes shal shaue heades ner norish bushe hayre leui 19 f 21 roūde heades prestes go ynmost courte leui 10 c • 1 b ose 1 3 shall drynke wyne shall mary wydowe nether one put hir huszbonde mayde sede house israel wydowe hath prest shal shewe people difference betwene holy vnholy 〈…〉 betwixte clene vnclene yf eny discorde aryse shal discerne geue sentence iudgmentes solempne feastes lawes ordinaunces shal kepe halowe sabbathes 〈…〉 shal come deed persone defyle selues excepte father mother sonne doughter brother sister hath yet husbonde soch maye defyled clensed shal rekened vnto vij dayes yf go sanctuary agayne seruyce shal bringe syn offringe saieth lorde god shall haue heretage 〈…〉 yee self wilbe heretage el shall ye geue thē possession israel possession meat offringe syn offringe trespace offringe shal eate euery dedicate thinge israel shalbe firstlinges first frutes fre offringes shal prestes ye shall geue vnto prest also firstlinges youre dowe god maye prospere resydue 〈…〉 deed carion shall prest eate ner soch deuoured wilde beestes foules catell xlv chapter ye deuyde lōde lott ye shal put asyde one parte lorde 〈…〉 holy londes namely xxv meteroddes longe x brode shalbe holy wyde rounde aboute parte shalbe longe vnto sanctuary v c meteroddes foure corner l cubites wyde rounde aboute suburbes meausre namely xxv metteroddes longe x brode thou shalt measure wherin sanctuary holiest maye stonde resydue holy grounde shall prestes seruyce sanctuary lorde go lorde serue maye haue rowme dwell sanctuary shal stonde self leuites serue house shalbe geuen xx habitacions xxv lēgth x bredth ye shal geue also vnto cite possessiō v meteroddes brode xxv longe besyde parte ye sanctuary shal whole house israel 〈…〉 vpon sydes sanctuary parte cite shalbe geuen vnto prynce euer lyeth ouer agaynst cite farre reacheth westwarde eastwarde shalbe longe one parte frō ye west vnto ye east shalbe owne lōde israel prince nomore chargeable vnto people soch remayneth yet ouer londe shalbe geuen house israel acordinge trybes thus saieth lorde god ye prince ye haue oppressed destroyed ynough leaue handle acordinge thinge equall laufull thrust people nomore sayeth ye lorde god ye shal haue true weight true epha true bat •• ui 19 g •• ut 25 c 〈◊〉 20 b epha bat shalbe like one bat shal cōteyne ye tēth parte homer shal one epha measure shal ye homer one sycle maketh xx geras 〈◊〉 10 b 〈◊〉 ▪ 27 〈…〉 g xx sycles xxv xv sycles make pounde heaue offrynge ye shal geue heaued namely xvj parte epha homer wheat xvj parte epha homer barlie oyle shal measured bat euen x parte one bat cor ten battes make one homer one homer maketh ten battes one lābe two hundreth shepe pasture israel meat offrynge burnt offrynge health offrynge recōcile house israel syn offrynge meat offerynge brent offerynge health offringe shal geue recō cile house israel thus sayeth ye lorde god first daye first moneth thou shalt take yōge bullocke without blemysh clense sanctuary prest shal take bloude ye syn offrynge sprenkle vpon postes house vpon foure corner aulter dore postes ynnermer courte thus shalt thou also seuenth daye ye moneth soch haue synned ignoraunce beynge disceaued reconcile house withall vpon ye xiiij daye first moneth ye shal kepe easter seuē dayes shal feast contynue • xo 12 〈◊〉 ▪ 23 〈◊〉 16 wherin shal sower ner leuēded bred eatē vpon daye shal ye prynce geue people londe bullocke syn offringe feast seuen dayes shal offre euery daye bullocke ram blemysh burnt offrynge vnto lorde gaote daylie syn offrynge meat offrynges shall geue euer epha bullocke epha ram hin oyle epha vpon ye xv daye seuenth moneth shal kepe seuen dayes holy one another euē vij dayes syn offrynge burnt offringe meat offrynge oyle xlvi chapter thus sayeth lorde god ye dore ynnermer courte towarde east shall shut vj worke dayes sabbath daye new moone shalbe opened shal prynce come vnder dore porche stonde still without dore cheke ye prestes shall offre vp burnt healthoffrynges shal worshipe dore poste go waye forth agayne ye dore shal nomore shut till euenynge maner shal people londe also worshipe lorde without dore vpon sabbathes new moones burntoffrynge prynce shall bringe vnto lorde vpon sabbath sixe lambes without blemysh ram without blemysh epha meat offringe ye ram lambes maye geue many meat offrynges wil hin oyle epha daye new moneth shalbe yonge bullocke blemysh sixe lambes ram also without blemysh bullocke shal geue epha ram epha also meatofferinge ye lambes maye come euer hin oyle epha prynce cōmeth shall go vnder dore porche euen departe forth agayne people londe come lorde hye solempne feast many come north dore worshipe shal go agayne south dore come south dore shal go forth agayne ye north dore shal none go dore came shal go forth right ouer syde prynce shall go amonge vpon solempne hie feaste dayes shalbe meatofferynge epha bullock epha ram lambes many wil euer hin oyle epha prynce bryngeth burntofferynge health offerynge fre wil vnto lorde east dore shalbe opened vnto yt maye burnt healthofferynges doth vpō sabbath goeth forth dore shal shut agayne shal daylie brynge vnto lorde lambe yeare olde without blem • sh burntofferynge shall euery mornynge meatofferynge shal geue sixte parte epha thirde parte hin oyle myngle cake euery mornynge yee shalbe daylie meatofferinge vnto lorde euerlastinge ordinaunce thus shal lambe meatofferynge oyle geuen euery mornynge dailie burntofferinge morouer thus sayeth lorde god yf prynce geue gifte vnto eny sonnes shall sonnes heretage perpetuall yt maye possesse yf wil geue one seruauntes heretage 〈◊〉 25 b 〈◊〉 36 c shall fre yeare thē returne agayne vnto ye prynce heretage shalbe sonnes 〈◊〉 21 〈◊〉 9 b prynce also shal take none people enheritaunce ner put thē possession owne sonnes shal geue possession people scatred abrode euery man maye haue owne brought thorow intraunce syde dore ye habitacion sanctuary belongeth ye prestes stode towarde north beholde place vpon west syde sayde vnto place prestes shall dight trespace synofferynges bake ye meatofferynges nede beare thē outwarde courte vnhalowe people brought vttemost courte rounde aboute foure corner beholde euery corner ye fore courte yet litle courte yee foure corner courte made litle courte xl cubites longe xxx cubites brode foure litle courtes one like measure went rygge wall rounde aboute foure vnder harthes made rounde aboute sayde vnto kechin minister house shal dight slayne offerynges people xlvii chapter brought agayne dore house beholde guszshed water vnder ye postes house eastwarde house stode towarde east ranne downe vpō right syde house lyeth aulter south warde thē caried north dore brought forth rounde aboute vttemost dore yt turneth eastwarde beholde 〈…〉 came forth water vpon right syde whan man yt meterodde honde wente vnto east dore measured cubites thē brought thorow ye water euē ancles measured yet thousande brought thorow ye water agayne vnto knee yet measured thousande brought thorow water vnto loynes measured thousande agayne soch ryuer yt might wade thorow water depe nedefull haue swymmed might waded ouer sayde vnto hast thou sene thou sonne man brought ryuer banck agayne came stode many tree vpon ether syde ryuer bācke sayde vnto water floweth towarde east runneth downe playne felde commeth see see runneth maketh water whole yee liue moue vnto ryuer commeth shal recouer water cōmeth shalbe many fysh commeth water shall lusty whole riuer shal fyszshers stonde engaddi vnto en eglaim sprede nettes shalbe greate heapes fysh like mayne see claye pyttes shal whole shalbe occupide salt ryuer vpon sydes shore shall growe maner frutefull tree whose leaues shall fall nether shal frute perish 〈…〉 euer rype monethes water runneth sanctuary frute good eate leaf profitable medycine thus sayeth lorde god let border wherin ye shall deuyde londe vnto xij trybes israel lyne parte indifferently vnto one vnto another 〈…〉 lōde swore vnto youre father shulde fall youre enheritaunce border londe vpon northsyde mayne see men go zadada namely hemath berotha sabarim border damascus hemath vnto hazar tichon lieth vpon coastes hauerā thus border frō see forth shalbe hazar euan border damascus north border hemath north parte east syde shal ye measure haueran damascus galead londe israel iordane forth see coast lieth eastwarde east parte south syde thamar forth water strife vnto cades 〈◊〉 10 b 〈◊〉 17 b ryuer mayne see south parte west parte namely greate see border therof till man come vnto hemath west parte londe shal ye parte amonge acordinge trybes israel deuyde heretage straūgers dwel amōge begette child 〈◊〉 19 g 〈◊〉 10 〈◊〉 24 c ye shal take amonge childrē israell like though youre owne housholde countre shal haue heretage amonge childrē israel loke trybe straunger dwelleth trybe shal ye geue heretage saieth lorde god xlviii chapter ye name trybes lye vpon northsyde waye hetlon tyll thou commest vnto hemath hazar enam border damascus towarde north besyde hemath dan shal haue porciō east quarter vnto west vpon border dan east syde vnto west shal asser haue porcion vpon border asser frō east parte vnto west shal nephtali haue porcion vpon border nephtali east quarter vnto west shal manasses haue porcion vpon border manasses east syde vnto west shal ephraim haue porcion vpon border ephraim east parte vnto west shal ruben haue porcion vpō border ruben east quarter vnto west shal iuda haue porcion vpon border iuda east parte vnto west ye shal set syde one porciō xxvm meteroddes longe brode like another porcion east syde vnto west wherin sanctuary shal stōde porcion ye shal separate lorde shalbe xxvm longe eze 45 xm brode separated holy porcion shal belonge vnto namely prestes towarde north xxvm towarde west xm brode towarde east xm brode also towarde south xxvm longe wherin sanctuary lorde shal stonde yee place shal prestes yt childrē sadoch eze 43 44 haue kepte holy ordinaunce wente astraye erroure child israel like leuites gone astraye separated pece haue londe shalbe holy harde vpon border leuites nexte vnto prestes shal leuites haue xxvm lō ge xm brode shalbe euery syde xxvm longe xm brode porciō shal sell nothinge ner make eny permutacion therof lest chefe londe fall vnto halowed vnto lorde vm bredth yt lyeth xxvm shalbe comon shal belonge cite suburbes habitacions ye cite shal stonde myddest therof let measure towarde ye north parte vc iiijm towarde south parte vc iiijm towarde east parte vc iiijm towarde ye west parte vc iiijm suburbes harde vpon cite shall haue towarde north l ijc towarde south l two c towarde east l two c towarde west also l two c residue length lyeth hard vpon separated holy grounde namely xm towarde east xm towarde west next vnto holy porciō increase therof shal serue meate laboure cite laboure welth cite shall manteine also tribe euer israel separated xxvm longe xxvm brode foure partes yt shall ye put syde separated porcion sanctuary possession ye cite resydue vpon sydes sanctuary possession cite eze 45 shall belonge prynce place ye xxvm vnto east ende place ye xxvm westwarde vnto border ye cite shalbe ye prynces porciō shalbe holy place house sanctuary shal stonde myddest morouer leuites city possession yt lye myddest prynces parte loke remayneth betwixte border iuda border ben iamin shal prynces trybes frō east parte vnto west shal ben iamin haue porcion vpon border ben iamin frō east syde vnto ye west shal symeon haue porcion vpon border symeō east parte vnto west shal isachar haue porcion vpō border isachar east syde vnto west shal sabulon haue porcion vpon border sabulon east parte vnto west shal gad haue porcion vpon border gad southwarde coastes shal reach frō thamar forth vnto water strife cades floude euen vnto mayne see • ume 32 • 1314this ye lōde wt porciōs ye shal distribute vnto trybes israel saieth ye lorde god thus wyde shal cite reach vpon north parte v c iiij measure porte cite shal haue name trybes israel thre porte ye northsyde one ruben another iuda thirde leui vpō ye east syde v c iiij measure wt ye thre porte one ioseph another bē iamin thirde dan vpon south syde v c iiij measure thre porte one symeon another isachar thirde sabulon vpon west syde v c iiij measure thre porte also one gad another asser thirde nephtali thus shal haue xviij measure roūde aboute tyme forth ye name cite shal lorde ende prophet ezechiel prophet daniel daniel conteyneth chap daniel ananias misael asarias chosen lerne caldeish stōde kynge chap ii daniel expoūdeth kynges dreame chap iii thre child wil worshipe ymage cast fyre god delyuereth chap iiii another dreame expounded chap v daniel readeth writinge wall declareth chap vi daniel cast lyon 〈◊〉 chap vii vision foure beestes chap viii ramme gote chap ix prophecy seuentie • e christ chap x another vision shewed daniel chap xixii certayne reuelacions thinges come delyueraunce frō captiuyte babilon destruccion ierusalem concernynge latter dayes first chapter ye thirde yeare ye raigne ioachim kynge iuda came nabuchodonosor kynge babilon vnto ierusalem 〈◊〉 24 〈◊〉 • 6 c beseged lorde delyuered ioachim kynge iuda honde certayne ornamentes house god caried awaye vnto londe sennar house god brought god treasury kynge spake vnto asphenes ye chefe chamberlayne shulde brynge certayne child israel come kynges sede prynces yōge spryngaldes eny blemish fayre ād wel fauored instructe wisdome connynge vnderstōdinge able stonde kynges palace reade lerne speake caldeish vnto kinge appoynted certayne porcion owne meate wine drancke himselff norish thē thre yeare afterwarde might stonde kynge amonge certayne child iuda namely daniel ananias misael azarias vnto chefe chamberlayne gaue name called daniel balthasar ananias sydrac misael misac asarias abdenago daniel poynt wt wolde defyled thorow kynges meate 〈◊〉 43 f 〈◊〉 1 b 〈◊〉 1 • ner ye wyne drō ke desyred chefe chāberlayne lest shulde defyle himselff god gaue daniel fauoure grace ye chefe chamberlayne sayde vnto afrayed lorde kynge hath appoynted youre meate drynke lest spye youre face worse lykynge spryngaldes youre age ād ye shal make loose heade vnto ye kynge daniel answered melassar chefe chamberlayne set ouer daniel ananias misael asarias sayde proue ten dayes thy seruauntes let v haue potage eate water drynke loke vpon oure face eate kinges meate thou seyst deale thy seruauntes consented matter ād proued thē x dayes ye ten dayes face better lykinge fatter yonge spryngaldes ate kinges • te thus melassar toke awaye meate wyne gaue potage therfore god gaue foure spryngaldes connynge lernynge scripture wisdome vnto daniel specially gaue vnderstondinge vision dreames tyme expyred kynge appoynted brynge yonge springaldes vnto chefe chamberlayne brought nabuchodonosor kynge commoned amonge founde none soch daniel ananias misael asarias therfore stode kynge wisdome matter vnderstōdinge enquered founde ten tymes better thē soythsayers charmer realme daniel abode still vnto first yeare kynge cyrus ii chapter secōde yeare raigne nabuchodonosor nabuchodonosor dreame iob 7 b dan 4 5 thorow sprete vexed slepe brake kynge cōmaunded call together ye soythsayers charmer witch caldees shewe kynge dreame came stode kynge kynge sayde vnto haue dreamed dreame sprete troubled therwith yt haue clene forgotten dreamed vpon caldees answered kynge syrian speach kynge god saue thy life euer shewe thy seruauntes dreame shal shewe meaneth kynge gaue caldees answere ād sayde gone fro yf ye wil make vnderstonde dreame interpretacion theroff ye shal dye youre house shal prysed yff ye tell dreame meanynge therof ye shall haue giftes rewardes greate honoure shewe dreame significacion answered agayne sayde kynge must shewe seruauntes dreame shal declare meaneth kynge answerde sayenge perceaue treuth ye prolōge ye tyme moch yese thinge gone fro therfore yff ye wil tell dreame ye shal haue one iudgment ye fayne dyssemble vayne wordes ye speake put tyme therfore tell dreame ād shall know▪ yff ye shewe meaneth vpon caldees gaue answere kynge sayde man vpon earth tell thinge ye kynge speaketh yee nether kynge prynce ner lorde euer axed soch thinges soythsayer charmer caldeer harde matter kynge requyreth nether eny certifie kynge theroff excepte goddes whose dwellinge amonge creature ye cause kynge wroth greate indignaciō cōmaunded destroye wyse men babilon ye proclamacion wēte forth wyse mē shulde slayne sought also slaye daniel cōpanyons daniel enquered arioch kynges stewarde iudgment sentence gone forth alredy kyll soch wyse babilon answered sayde vnto arioch beinge kinges debyte hath kynge proclamed cruell sentence arioch tolde daniel matter vpon wente daniel vp desyred kinge ye might haue leysoure shewe kynge interpretacion came home agayne shewed thinge vnto ananias misael asarias companiōs yt shulde beseke god heauen grace secrete daniel felowes soch wyse babilon perished mystery shewed vnto daniel visiō nyght daniel praysed ye god heauē daniel also cryed loude sayde name god might praysed euer euer wisdome strength owne chaungeth tymes age dan 7 luc 1 c iob 34 b iere 27 dan 4 c iob 32 b putteth downe kynges setteth vp kynges geueth wyszdome vnto wyse vnderstōdinge vnderstōde openeth depe secretes knoweth ye thynge lyeth darcknesse light dwelleth him1 ioh 1 b thanke prayse thou god father thou hast lent wyszdome strength hast shewed thinge desyred thou hast opened kynges matter vnto vpon wente daniel vnto arioch kinge ordened destroye wyse babilon wente vnto sayde destroye soch wyse babilon bringe vnto kynge shal shewe kynge interpretacion arioch brought daniel kynge haist sayde vnto haue founde man amonge presoners iuda yt shal shewe kinge interpretacion thē answered kynge sayde vnto daniel whose name balthasar art thou yt cāst shewe ye dreame haue sene interpretacion therof daniel answered kynge face sayde secrete kinge maketh inquisicion nether wyse sorcerer charmer ner deuell coniurer certifie kynge god heauē cā open secretes 〈…〉 sheweth kinge nabuchodonosor come latter dayes thy dreame thou hast sene thyne heade vpon thy bed this▪ kynge thou didest cast thy mynde shulde come herafter opener mystery telleth come secrete shewed eny wiszdome haue eny
