lyuynge might shewe kynge interpretacion might knowe thoughtes owne herte thou kynge sawest beholde stode greate ymage whose fygure maruelous greate vysage grymme ymage heade fyne golde brest armes syluer body ād loynes copper legges yron fete parte yron parte earth thou sawest till tyme without eny hondes hewen stone smote ymage vpon fete 〈…〉 yron earth brake thē poulder yron earth copper syluer golde broken altogether peces became like chaffe corne wynde bloweth awaye ye somer floores cā nomore foū de stone smote ymage became greate mountayne fulfylleth whole earth dreame shewe kynge meaneth kynge thou art kynge kynges 〈…〉 god heauē hath geuē kingdome ryches strength maiesty hath delyuered thinges amōge ye child men beastes felde ād foules vnder heauē geuen dominion ouer thou art goldē heade yt shal aryse another kingdome shal lesse thyne thyrde kingdome shal belyke copper haue dominacion lōdes fourth kingdome shal stronge yron like yron brusseth breaketh thinges yee euen yron beateth euery thinge downe shal beate downe destroye thou sawest fete toe parte earth parte yron deuyded kyngdome neuertheles shal haue yron grounde mixte much thou hast sene yron mixte claye toe fete parte yron parte claye signifieeh shalbe kyngdome partely stronge partely weake thou sawest yron myxte claye shall myngle selues wt ye sede symple people yet contynue one another like yron wil souldered potsherde 〈◊〉 9 b dayes kynges shall god heauen set vp euerlastinge kyngdome shall perish kyngdome shall geuen ouer another people yee shall breake destroye kyngdomes shall endure euer thou sawest without eny hondes cut mount stone 〈◊〉 12 c brake yron copper ye earth syluer golde peces hath ye greate god shewed kynge wyl come true dreame interpretacion sure kynge nabuchodonosor fell downe vpon face bowed self vnto daniel commaunded shulde offre meat offrynges swete odoures vnto kynge answerde daniel sayde yee treuth youre god god aboue goddes lorde aboue kynges opener secretes seynge thou canst discouer mysterie kynge made daniel greate man gaue many greate giftes made ruler countrees babilon lorde noble babilon daniel intreated kynge sydrac misac abdenago made ruler ouer offyces londe babilon daniel remayned still courte kynge iii chapter nabuchodonosor kynge caused goldē ymage made lx cubites hye sixe cubites thicke made set vp valley duran londe babilon sent gather together duke lordes noble iudges officer debites ād shreues ruler londe yt might come dedicacion ymage nabuchodonosor kynge set vp duke lordes noble iudges officer debytes shreues ruler londe gathered together came vnto dedicatynge ye ymage nabuchodonosor kinge set vp stode ymage nabuchodonosor set vp bedell cried wt might ye people kynreddes tunges sayde whē ye heare noyse trompettes shalbe blowne wt yt harpes shawmes psaltery symphony maner musick ye fall downe worshipe golden ymage yt nabuchodonosor kynge hath set vp falleth downe boweth shal euen houre cast hote burnynge ouen therfore folke herde noyse trompettes blowne harpes shawmes psaltery symphony kynde melody thē people kynreddes nacions fell downe bowed selues vnto golden ymage nabuchodonosor kynge set vp certayne men caldees went euen accused ye iewes sayde vnto kynge nabuchodonosor kynge god saue thy lyfe euer thou beynge kynge hast geuen acommaū demēt men heare noyse trompettes harpes shawmes psaltery symphony melody shall fall downe bowe selues towarde golden ymage thē fell downe worshipped shulde cast hote burnynge ouen certaine iewes thou hast set ouer office londe babilon namely sydrac dan 2 g misac abdenago men kynge regarde thy cō maundemēt yee serue thy goddes ner bowe selues golden ymage thou hast set vp nabuchodonosor cruell wrath displeasure commaunded yt sidrac misac abdenago shulde brought vnto men brought kynge nabuchodonosor spake vnto sayde sidrac 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 misac abdenago ye serue goddes bowe youre selues golden ymage haue set vp wel redy herafter ye heare noyse trōpettes blowne harpes shawmes psaltery symphony ye melody ye fall downe worshipe ymage haue made yff ye worshipe ye shal cast immediatly hote burnynge ouen let se god yt maye delyuer hondes sydrac misac abdenago answered kynge sayde nabuchodonosor ought cōsente vnto ye matter oure god serue able kepe v hote burnynge ouen kynge right wel delyuer v thy hondes nu 16 g though wil yet shalt thou knowe kynge serue thy goddes ner reuerēce ymage thou hast set vp nabuchodonosor full indignacion ye countenaunce face chaunged vpō sidrac misac abdenago therfore charched commaunded ouen shulde made seuen tymes hoter wōte spake vnto strongest worthy hooste bynde sidrac misac abdenago cast hote burnynge ouen men bounde cote hosen shues garmentes ād castin hote burnynge ouen kinges commaundement strate ouen exceadynge hote men put sydrac misac abdenago flame fyre destroyed thre men sydrac misac abdenago fell downe ye hote burnynge ouen esa 43 beinge fast bounde nabuchodonosor kynge marueled stode vp haist spake vnto councel sayde dyd ye cast thre men bounde fyre answered sayde vnto kynge yee kynge answered sayde lo yet se foure men goinge lowse myddest fyre actu 9 dan 10 b nothinge corrupte fourth like angel loke vpon vpon wēte nabuchodonosor vnto mouth hote burnynge ouen speake also sayde sydrac misac abdenago ye seruauntes hye god go forth come hither sydrac misac abdenago wente fyre duke lordes noble kynges councell came together se men vpon fyre maner power body 〈…〉 moch hayre heade burnt clothes vnchaunged yee smell fyre felt vpon spake nabuchodonosor sayde blessed god sidrac 〈…〉 misac abdenago hath sent angel 〈◊〉 defended seruaūtes put trust yt haue altered kynges commaundement ioperde body ther vpon •• ther wolde serue worshipe eny god excepte owne god therfore wil commaūde people kynreddes tunges▪ speake eny blasphemy agaynst god sydrac misac abdenago shal dye house shalbe prysed 〈…〉 god yt maye saue kynge promoted sidrac misac abdenago londe babylon nabuchodonosor kynge vnto people 〈…〉 kynreddes tunges dwell vpon whole earth peace multiplied amōge thought good shewe tokēs maruelous workes yt ye hye god hath wrought vpon greate tokēs 〈…〉 mightie wonder kyngdome euerlastinge kyngdome power lasteth euer euer iiii chapter nabuchodonosor beynge rest myne house ād florishinge palace sawe dreame made afrayed ād thoughtes vpō bed vision myne heade troubled sent commission 〈…〉 wiszdome babilō shulde brought tell interpretacion dreame came soythsayers charmer caldees coniurers deuels tolde dreame betokened coude shewe till last came one daniel otherwyse called balthasar acordinge name god hath sprete holy goddes tolde dreame sayenge balthasar thou prynce saythsayers moch knowe thou hast sprete holy goddes secrete hyd tel therfore ye visiō dreame yt haue sene maye signifie sawe vision heade vpon bed beholde stode tre vpon grounde hye greate mightie ye heyth reached vnto heauē bredth extended endes earth leaues fayre moch frute yt euery mā ynough eate therin beastes felde shadowes vnder foules ayre dwelt bowes therof shortly creature fed sawe heade vision vpon bed beholde watcher euē holy angel came downe heauen cryed mightely sayenge hew downe tre breake braunches shake leaues scatre frute abrode beestes maye get awaye vnder foules braunches neuertheles leaue grounde rote still earth bynde vpon playne felde cheynes yron stele dew heauen shall wet shall haue parte herbes grounde wylde beastes man herte shall taken beastes herte shall geuen till seuen yeares come gone vpon erande watcher cōmaundemēt grounded sought councel holy lerne men vnderstonde hyest hath power ouer kyngdomes men ād geueth liketh bryngeth outcaste men ouer dreame yt kynge nabuchodonosor haue sene therfore balthasar tell thou signifieth moch wyse men kyngdome able shewe meaneth thou canst ye sprete holy goddes daniel whose name balthasar helde peace space houre ād thoughtes troubled kynge spake sayde balthasar let nether dreame ner interpretacion theroff feare balthasar answered sayenge lorde dreame happen thyne enemy interpretacion thyne aduersaries tre thou sawest greate mightie whose heyth reached vnto heauen bredth worlde whose leaues fayre ād frute moch vnder beastes felde habitacion vpon whose braunches foules ayre dyd syt euen thou kynge art tre greate strōge thy greatnesse increaseth reacheth vnto heauen doth thy power endes ef earth kynge sawe watcher euen holy angel came downe heauen sayde hew downe tre destroye yet leaue grounof rote earth bynde vpon playne felde cheynes yron stele shall wet dew heauen parte shalbe beestes felde till seuen yeares come gone vpon kynge ye interpretaciō yee deuyce yt hyest toucheth lorde kynge thou shalt cast fro men thy dwellinge shalbe beestes felde grasse shalt thou fed like oxe thou must wet dew heauen yee seuen yeares shall come go vpon till thou knowe hyest hath power vpon kyngdomes men geueth lyst morouer dan 2 c iere 27 sayde rote tre shulde left still grounde betokeneth yt thy kyngdome shall remayne whole vnto ye thou hast lerned knowe power commeth heauen wherfore kinge contēt councel thou mayest lowse thy synnes rightuousnesse ād thyne offence mercy poore people soch thinges shall prolonge thy peace thynges touch kynge nabuchodonosor xij monethes kynge walked vp downe paalace kyngdome babilon sayde greate cite babilō power strength haue made kynges courte honoure magesty whyle wordes yet kynges mouth fell voyce heauē sayengt kinge nabuchodonosor spokē thy kyngdome shall departe thou shalt cast men company thy dwellinge shalbe beestes felde thou shalt eate grasse like oxe till seuen yeares come gone ouer euen vntill thou knowest hyest hath power vpon kyngdomes men maye geue vnto pleaseth houre matter fulfylled vpō nabuchodonosor cast mēs cōpany ate grasse like oxe body wet dew heauen till hayres greate aegles fethers nales like byrdes clawes tyme past nabuchodonosor lift vp myne eye vnto heauen myne vnderstondinge restored vnto agayne gaue thankes vnto hyest magnified praysed lyueth euermore whose power endureth waye kyngdome one generacion another comparyson dwell vpon earth reputed nothinge dan 3 f handleth acordinge amō ge ye power heauen amonge inhabitours earth psal 134 none maye resiste honde iob 42 b saye doest thou tyme myne vnderstondynge geuen agayne restored honoure kingdome dignite myne owne shappe agayne greatestates prynces sought vnto set kyngdome agayne yet greater worshipe thē dyd nabuchodonosor loaue magnifie prayse kynge heauen workes true wayes right go proudly able brī bringe downe v chapter balthasar kynge made greate bancket thousande lordes withall thousande made greate cheare dronken wt wyne commaunded brynge ye golden syluer vessel father nabuchodonosor taken temple ierusalem • par 46 c kynge lordes quene concubynes might drī ke therout brought golden vessel takē temple lordes house ierusalem kynge lordes quene concubine dronke dronke wyne praysed idol golde syluer copper yron wodde stone houre appeared fyngers bene man honde writynge right ouer agaynst candelsticke vpon playne wall kynges palace kynge sawe palme ye honde yt wrote iere 50 chaunged kynge countenaunce thoughtes troubled ioyntes body shoke knee smote one agaynst wherfore kynge cryed mightely dan 2 thy shulde brynge charmer caldees coniurers deuels kynge spake also wysemen babilon sayde rede wrytynge shewe playne meanynge theroff shall clothed purple haue cheyne golde aboute necke rule thirde parte kyngdome vpon came kynges wyse men coude nether rede wrytinge 〈◊〉 shewe kynge signified thē kynge sore afrayed moch coloure chaunged lordes sorevexed reason matter yt happened kynge lordes quene went vp bancket house spake vnto kynge sayenge kynge god saue thy life euer let yt thoughtes trouble let thy countenaunce chaunged man ye kyngdome hath sprete holy goddes within sene thy father dayes hath vnderstondinge ād wysdome like goddes yee kynge nabuchodonosor thy father made man chest soythsayers charmer caldees deuel coniurers soch abundaunt sprete knowlege wisdome expoū de dreames open secretes declare harde dowtes founde yee euen daniel kynge named balthasar let daniel sente shall tell meaneth daniel brought kinge kynge spake vnto daniel sayde art thou daniel one presoners iuda father kynge brought iewry haue herde speake thou hast sprete holy goddes experience vnderstōdinge hath bene greate wisdome founde haue bene brought wise connynge charmer rede wrytynge shewe meanynge theroff coude tell matter signified herde saye yt thou canst expounde darcke thinges declare harde doutes well yf thou canst rode writinge shewe meaninge therof thou shalt clothed wt purple haue cheyne golde aboute thy necke rule thirde parte kyngdome daniel answered sayde ye kynge thy rewardes kepe thy self geue ye rych giftes another 〈…〉 yet thelesse wil rede wrytynge vnto ye kinge shewe interpretacion therof kinge god hyest gaue vnto nabuchodonosor thy father ye dignite kynge 〈…〉 wt worshipe honor yt people kynreddes tunges stode awe feare reason hye estate lent slewe wolde smoke pleased agayne wolde set vp list put downe 〈◊〉 4 herte proude stomack set fast vnto wylfulnesse deposed kyngly trone magesty taken shot amonge men herte like beestes herte dwellynge wylde ass fayne eate grasse like oxe body wet dew heauen till knewe hyest power vpon kyngdomes men setteth ouer list thou sonne balthasar hast submitted thine hert though thou knewest thinges hast magnified thy selff aboue lorde heauen vessel house brought thou thy lordes thy quene concubynes might drynke wyne therout hast praysed idol syluer golde copper yron wodde stone god whose honde consisteth thy breth ād thy wayes thou hast loaued 〈◊〉 17 c therfore palme honde sent hither token vp wrytinge scripture written vp mane thetel phares interpretacion thynge mane god hath nombred thy kyngdome brought ende thetel thou art weyed balaunce art founde light phares thy kyngdome delt partes geuen medes perses commaunded balthasar cloth daniel purple hange cheyne golde aboute necke make proclamacion concernynge shulde ruler thirde parte kyngdome 〈◊〉 7 b 21 • night balthasar kynge caldees slayne darius medium toke kyngdome beynge lxij yeare age vi chapter pleased darius set ouer kīgdome c xx lordes shulde kingdome aboute aboue set thre prynces daniel one lordes might geue accomptes vnto kynge vndiseased daniel exceaded prince ād lordes sprete god plenteous kynge mynded set ouer whole realme wherfore prynces lordes sought pyke daniel quarel agaynst kyngdome yet coude fynde none occasion ner fawte vpon faythful yt blame ner dishonesty founde sayde men get quarell agaynst daniel excepte lawe god vpon wente prince lordes together vnto kynge sayde thus vnto kynge darius god saue thy life euer great estate realme ye prynces duke senatours iudges determed put commaundement ye kynge make sure statute namely desyreth eny peticion ether eny god man xxx dayes excepte kynge person maye cast lyon denne wherfore kynge confirme thou stature make writynge thynge medes perses haue ordened altered ner broken darius made wrytynge confirmed daniel vnderstode wrytynge made wente house wyndowes hall towarde ierusalem stode open kneled downe vpon knee thre tymes daye made peticion praysed god like maner afore tyme men made searche founde daniel makynge peticion prayenge vnto god came kynge spake concernynge commaundement sayenge kynge hast thou subscribed statute within xxx dayes requyreth peticion eny god man thy self kynge shalbe cast denne lyon kynge answered ād sayde yee true must lawe ye medes perses maye broken answered sayde vnto kynge daniel one presoners iuda kynge regardeth nether ner thy statute thou hast made maketh peticion thre tymes daye kynge herde wordes sore greued wolde haue excused daniel delyuer put matter vnto sonne wē te downe intent might saue men perceauynge kynges mynde sayde vnto knowe kynge lawe medes perses commaundement statute kynge maketh • ani 14 c maye altered kynge bad brynge daniel cast lyon denne kynge also spake vnto daniel ād sayde thy god thou allwaye seruest euen shall defende brought stone layed vpon hole denne kynge sealed owne rynge ye signet prynces kynges commaundement concernynge daniel shulde broken kynge wente palace kepte sober night table spred nether coude take eny slepe tymes mornynge breake daye kynge arose wente haist vnto denne lyon came ny • vnto ye dēne cried wt piteous voyce vnto daniel yee ye kī ge spake sayde vnto daniel daniel thou seruaunt lyuynge god thy god thou allwaye seruest able delyuer lyon daniel sayde vnto kynge kynge god saue thy life euer dan 3 e act 12 c iud 14 c • 17 e heb 11 f god hath sent angel hath shut lyon mouthes might hurte myne vngiltynesse founde kynge neuer offended kynge exceadinge glad ād commaunded take daniel denne daniel brought dēne maner hurte founde vpō put trust god men accused daniel kī ge commaunded bringe cast lyon denne hest 2 b dani▪ 14 g child wyues lyon mastry brake bone sonder euer came grounde dan 3 f wrote kynge darius vnto people kynreddes tunges dwelt londes peace multiplied commaundement dominiō kyngdome men feare stonde awe daniel god dani 14 f 7 c lyuinge god abydeth euer kyngdome shall fayle power euerlastynge delyuereth esa 43 b osee 13 b dan 3 f saueth doth wonder maruelous workes heauen earth hath preserued daniel power lyon 〈…〉 daniel prospered raigne darius cirus persia vii chapter first yeare balthasar kynge babilon sawe daniel dreame vision heade vpon bedde dreame wrote summe matter daniel spake sayde sawe vision nyght beholde foure wyndes ye heauen stroue vpon see foure greate beestes came vp see one vnlike another first lyon yet aegles wynges sawe 〈…〉 wynges plucte taken awaye earth stode vpon fete man 〈…〉 geuen man herte beholde seconde beest like beer stode vpon one syde 〈…〉 amonge teth mouth iij greate lōge teth sayde vnto arise eate vp moch flesh loked beholde another like vnto leoparde wynges foule euen foure vpon backe beest foure heades ād power geuen 〈…〉 sawe vision night beholde fourth beest grymme horrible maruelous stronge greate yron teth deuoured destroyed stamped residue vnder fete farre vnlike beestes •• ten horne 〈…〉 wheroff toke good hede beholde came vp amonge thē another like horne thre first horne pluckte awaye beholde horne eye like mā mouth speakynge presumptuous thinges 〈…〉 loked till seates prepared ād till olde aged sat downe clothinge white snowe hayres heade like pure woll trone like firie flame wheles burnynge fyre drew forth firie streame wente thousand tymes thousande serued xm tymes ten thousande stode iudgmēt set bokes opened toke hede vnto voyce proude wordes horne spake behelde till beest slayne body destroyed 〈◊〉 1 • 〈◊〉 19 20 c geuen ouer brent fyre power beestes also taken awaye lyues prolonged tyme season sawe vision night beholde came one cloudes heauen like sonne man 〈◊〉 13 c • ct 1 b 〈◊〉 1 wente vnto olde aged brought gaue power ād dignite regall 〈◊〉 2 〈◊〉 28 c 〈◊〉 12 people trybes tunges shulde serue power euerlastinge power shal neuer put downe kyngdome endureth vncorrupte herte vexed daniel troubled sprete within 〈◊〉 • 4 f ād vision heade made afrayed till gat vnto one stode 〈◊〉 9 knowe treuth concerninge thinges tolde made vnderstōde interpretaciō thinges foure greate beastes foure kinges shal aryse earth shal take kyngdome sayntes hyest possesse still longe season requyred diligently knowe treuth concerninge fourth beest farre vnlike beestes horrible whose teth yron nales brasse deuoured destroied stamped resydue vnder fete 〈◊〉 13 17 c desyred also knowe treuth touchinge ten horne vpon heade came vp afterwarde whose face • fell downe thre horne eye mouth spake presumptuous thinges loked grimmer visage felowes behelde horne made battail agaynst sayntes yee ād gat victory vntill tyme olde aged came iudgment geuē chefest sayntes till tyme ye sayntes kyngdome possession gaue • swere fourth beest shalbe fourth kingdome vpō earth shalbe kyngdomes shall deuoure treade downe ād destroye londes • ach 1 e ten horne ten kynges shal aryse kyngdome whō shall stonde vp another shall greater first shall subdue thre kynges shall speake wordes agaynst hyest shall destroye sayntes hyest thynke maye chaunge tymes lawes shall geuen vnder power vntill tyme two tymes dan 2 c apoc 12 • halff tyme iudgment shalbe kepte power shalbe taken shal destroyed perish last kyngdome power might vnder heauen shal geuen holy people hyest luc 1 c dan 14 f whose kyngdome euerlastinge yee power shall serue obeye thus farre extēde ye wordes neuerthelesse daniel vexed thoughtes countenaunce chaunged luc 2 c wordes kepte still herte viii chapter thirde yeare raigne kinge balthasar apeared visiō vnto daniel sene first sawe vision sawe susis chefe cite dan 2 lyeth londe elam ye vision thought ryuer vlai loked vp sawe beholde stode ryuer ramme horne horne hye one hyer another hyest came vp last sawe ramme puszhed horne agaynst west agaynst north agaynst south beestes might stonde ner defende power dyd listed waxed greatly toke hede vnto came hegoate west ouer whole earth touched grounde goate maruelous goodly horne betwixte eye came vnto ramme two horne sene fore ryuer syde ranne fearcely vpon might sawe drawe nye vnto ramme beynge fearce vpon yee gaue soch stroke brake two horne nether ramme moch strength stonde kest downe trodde vnder fete man able delyuer ramme power goate waxed exceadinge greate strongest greate horne broken also grewe foure soch like steade towarde foure wyndes heauen dan 7 11 mac 1 yee one leest horne came vp yet another horne waxed maruelous greate towarde south towarde east towarde fayre pleasaunt londe grewe vp hoost heauen wherof dyd cast downe grounde starres also trode vnder fete yee grewe vp vnto prynce hoost daylie offeringe taken place sanctuary casten downe certayne season geuen vnto agaynst daylie offeringe wickednesse might cast downe verite grounde prospere thinges went aboute vpon herde one sayntes speakynge saynte sayde vnto one axed question longe shall vision daylie sacrifice waistinge abhominacion endure sanctuary power shall troden vnder fote answered vnto euenyinge morninge euen two thousande thre hūdreth dayes shall sanctuary clensed agayne daniel sene vision sought vnderstondinge beholde stode thinge like vnto man herde man voyce ryuer vlai cryed sayde gabriel make man vnderstonde vision came stode afrayed cōminge fell downe vpon face sayde vnto thou sonne man marcke well last tyme shall vision fulfylled speakynge vnto waxed faynte suncke downe grounde toke holde vpon set vp agayne sayenge beholde shewe shall happen last wrath tyme appoynted shal fulfilled ramme thou sawest two horne kynge medes ād perses goate kynge greke londe greate horne stode betwixte eye pryncipall kynge brake foure rose vp steade signifieth people shall stonde vp foure kyngdomes mightie kyngdomes whyle vngodnesse growinge shall aryse kynge vnshamefast face shall wyse darcke speakinges shalbe mightie stronge owne strength shall destroye aboue measure goeth aboute shall prospere shall slaye stronge holy people thorow craftynes falsede shall prospere honde herte shall proude many one shall put death welthynesse shal stonde vp agaynst prynce prynces shalbe destroyed without honde 〈…〉 vision shewed vnto sure evenynge mornynge therfore wryte thou vp sight 〈…〉 wylbe longe come passe vpon daniel faynte laye sicke certayne dayes whan rose vp wente aboute kynges busynesse marueled vision neuerthelesse man knewe ix chapter first yeare darius sonne ahasuerus 〈…〉 sede medes made kynge ouer realme caldees yee euen first yeare raigne daniel desyred knowe yearly nombre bokes 〈…〉 wherof lorde spake vnto ieremy prophet ierusalem shulde lie waist lxx yeares ād turned vnto god lorde 〈…〉 praye make myne intercessiō fastinge sack cloth ād ash prayed lorde god knowleged sayenge lorde thou greate fearfull god thou kepest couenaunt mercy loue thy commaundementes haue synned haue offended 〈…〉 haue bene disobedient gone backe yee haue departed thy preceptes iudgmentes wolde neuer folowe thy seruauntes prophetes spake thy name oure kynges prynces oure forefather people londe 〈…〉 lorde rightuousnesse belongeth vnto vnto v pertayneth nothynge open shame come passe daye vnto euery man iuda dwell ierusalem yee vnto israel whether farre nye thorow londes wherin thou hast strowed offence done agaynst yee lorde vnto v oure kinges prynces oure forefather euen v haue offended 〈◊〉 105 belongeth open shame vnto lorde oure god pertayneth mercy forgeuenesse v gone backe haue obeyed voyce lorde oure god walke lawes layed v seruauntes prophetes 〈◊〉 1 〈◊〉 7 b yee israel haue transgressed gone backe thy lawe haue herkened vnto thy voyce 〈…〉 wherfore curse ooth written law moses seruaūt god haue offended poured vpon v hath perfourmed wordes 〈…〉 spake agaynst v agaynst oure iudges iudged v bringe vpon v soch greate plage neuer vnder heauen like come passe ierusalem yee plage written lawe moses come vpon v yet made oure prayer lorde oure god might turne agayne oure wickednesse lerned thy verite therfore hath ye lorde made haist bringe plage vpon v lorde oure god rightuous workes doth wolde harken vnto voyce lorde oure god thou mightie honde hast brought thy people egipte 〈◊〉 2 b 〈◊〉 14 get thy self name remayneth daye haue synned lorde done wickedly agaynst thy rightuousnes yet let thy wrothfull displeasure turned awaye beseke thy cite ierusalem thy holy hill oure synnes sake wickednesse oure forefather ierusalem thy people abhorred aboute v therfore oure god heare prayer thy seruaunt intercession let thy face shyne ouer thy sanctuary lieth waist god enclyne thine eare herken leest thine owne sake open thine eye beholde desolated yee cite also called thy name cast oure prayer oure owne rightuousnesse thy greate mercy lorde heare forgeue lorde lorde considre tary ouerlonge thine owne sake god thy cite thy people called thy name yet speakinge prayer knowleginge myne owne synnes ye synnes people makinge myne intercession lorde god holy hils sake god yee whyle yet speakinge prayer beholde mā gabriel sene afore vision came flyenge dan 2 c 8 touched aboute ye offeringe tyme euenynge infourmed spake vnto daniel sayde come make vnderstonde soone thou begannest make thy prayer diuysed therfore come shewe dā 10 c thou art man greatly beloued wherfore pondre matter wel thou mayest lerne vnderstonde vision lxx wekes determed ouer thy people ouer thy holy cite wickednesse maye consumed synne maye haue ende offence maye reconciled bringe euerlastinge rightuousnesse fulfill ye vision prophetes anoynte holy one vnderstōde marcke well1 par 36 1 esd 1 tyme shalbe concluded go repayre ierusalem agayne vnto christ anoynted prynce shalbe seuen wekes shall stretes walles buylded agayne lxij wekes harde troublous tyme afther lxij wekes shal christ slayne shal haue pleasure shal come people prynce destroye cite sanctuary ende shal come water floude desolacion shall continue till ende batell shall make stronge bonde many space weke weke half gone shal put downe slayne meat offringe matt 2413 mar 13 b temple shalbe abhominable desolaciō till haue destroyed concluded yt waistinge shal continue vnto ende x chapter thirde yeare kinge cirus persia shewed vnto daniel otherwise called balthasar matter yee true matter yet longe tyme vnto vnderstode matter well perceaued vision tyme daniel mourned space thre wekes lust eate bred flesh wyne came none within mouth dyd one anoynte self till whole thre wekes vpon xxiiij daye first moneth greate floude called tigris lift vp myne eye loked beholde man clothed lynnynge • 7 b apo 1 c whose loynes gyrded vp fyne golde araby body like chrisolite stone face loke vpon like lightenynge eye flame fyre armes fete like fayre glisteringe metall voyce wordes like ye voyce multitude dan 3 e act 9 daniel alone sawe vision men sawe greate fearfulnesse fell vpon fled awaye hyd selues left self alone sawe greate vision longe til remayned nomore strength within yee lost coloure clene waisted awaye strength gone yet herde voyce wordes soone herde fayntnesse came vpon fell downe flat grounde vpon face beholde hande touched set vp vpon knee vpon palmes hondes sayenge vnto daniel dan 9 b thou well beloued man take good hede wordes shal saye vnto ye stōde right vp vnto yt sent sayde wordes stode vp tremblinge saide vnto feare daniel sence first daye thou set thine herte vnderstonde didest chasten thy self thy god thy wordes haue bene herde come vnto whē thou begannest speake prynce ouer kingdome the▪ perses wt stonde xxj dayes lo michael one chefe prynces • osu 5 dan 12 came helpe haue left kinge persia come shewe shal happen vnto thy people latter dayes wilbe lō ge yet vision fulfilled spoken wordes vnto kest downe heade ye grounde helde tunge beholde touched lippes one like vnto man opened mouth sayde vnto stode lorde ioyntes lowsed vision strēgth within maye lordes seruaunt talke lorde seinge strength take breth vpon touched agayne one moch like man conforted dan 9 b sayenge thou man wel beloued feare content take good herte vnto stronge spoken vnto recouered sayde speake lorde thou hast refreszshed thē sayde knowest thou wherfore come vnto ye wil go agayne fight prynce perses soone go forth lo prynce grekelonde shal come neuertheles wil shewe thinge yt fast noted scripture treuth yonder matter none helpeth michael youre prynce xi chapter first yeare darius medium stode conforte strength wil shewe treuth beholde shal stonde vp yet thre kinges persia ye fourth shal farre richer chefest power rich shal prouoke euery man agaynst realme grekelonde shal arise yet mightie kinge shal rule greate dominion list 〈…〉 soone kingdome commeth vp shalbe destroyed 〈…〉 deuyded towarde ye foure wyndes heauen yt come shall haue soch power dominion kingdome shalbe scatred yee euen amonge thē kynge ye south shalbe migthier prynces agaynst shal one make strō ge shal rule dominiō wt greate power certayne yeares shalbe ioyned together kynges doughter south shall come kynge north make frēdshipe shal optayne power arme nether shall she▪ able endure thorow might soch brought yee yt begat conforted tyme shalbe delyuered vp ye braunches hir rote shal one stonde vp steade power armes shal go thorow kynges londe north handle acordinge strength idol prynces costly iewels golde syluer shal cary awaye captyues egipte shal preuayle agaynst kynge north certayne yeares come ye kynges realme ye south shal fayne turne agayne owne londe wherfore sonnes shalbe displeased shal gather together mightie greate hoost people one shal come go thorow like waterfloude▪ shal returne go forth defyenge boostinge vnto owne londe thē kinge ye south shalbe angrie shal come forth fight agaynst kinge north yee shall bringe greate multitude people together greate heape shalbe geuē honde shal cary awaye wt greate pryde moch hath cast downe many thousandes neuertheles shall preuayle ye kinge ye north shal gather new greater heape people afore come forth certayne tyme yeares mightie hoost exceadinge greate good tyme shall many stonde vp agaynst kinge south ye wicked child thy people also shal exalte selues fulfill vision fall kinge north shall come laye sege take strōge fensed city power thē ye south shal able abyde best men people shall stronge resist shortly commeth shall handle list man shalbe hardy stonde agaynst shal stōde pleasaunt countre thorow shalbe destroyed shal set face wt power optayne kingdome like yee shal geue vnto doughters amōge woman destroye shal fayle nether shal optayne purpose shall set face vnto iles take many thē prynce shal stoppe shame besyde confucion el shal come vnto thus shal turne agayne owne londe stomble fall nomore founde came vpon dyd violence shal stonde place haue pleasaunt kingdome dayes shal destroyed nether wrath ner batell steade shal aryse vyle person holdē worthy kinges dignite shall come craftely optayne kingdome fayre wordes shal fight agaynst armes mightie destroye yee agaynst prynce couenaunt yt hath taken truce shal hādle disceatfully maye get vp ouer come small flocke craftynesse get ye fattest place londe deale otherwise ether father graūd father dyd shal destroye thinge ye robbed spoyled yee substaunce ymagenynge thoughtes agaynst strōge holdes tyme power herte shalbe sterred vp wt greate armye agaynst kinge south thorow kinge south shalbe moued vnto batell greate mightie hoost also neuerthelesse shal able stonde shall conspyre agaynst yee yt eate meate shal hurte hoost shal fall many slayne downe two kinges shalbe mynded myschefe talke disceate one table shal prospere why2 mac 5 • ende shal come yet vnto tyme apoynted thē shall go home agayne owne londe greate good set herte agaynst holy couenaunt shalbe busy agaynst returne home tyme appoynted shal come agayne go towarde south shall happen otherwise first yet one agayne shippes cythim shal come vpon maye smytten turne agayne nu 24 yt maye take indignacion agaynst couenaunt holynes medle agaynst yee shal turne drawe soch vnto leaue holy couenaunt shal set mightie men vnhalowe sanctuary strēgth put downe day lie offeringe set vp abhominable desolacion soch breake couenaunt shal flatre fayre wordes ye people wil knowe god shal haue ouerhāde prospere also haue vnderstondinge amonge people shal enfourme multitude alonge season shalbe persecuted swearde fyre captyuyte takynge awaye goodes whē fall shalbe set vp litle helpe many shal cleue vnto faynedly yee haue vnderstondynge shal persecuted also yt maye betryed purified clēsed till tyme yet another tyme appoynted kinge shal list shal exalte magnifie agaynst god2 • 2 yee shall speake maruelous thinges agaynst god goddes wherin shal prospere apoc 15 longe till wrath fulfilled conclusion deuysed alredy shal regarde god father lust shall vpon womē yee shal care eny god shal magnifie aboue place shal worshipe mightie idol god father knewe shal honoure golde syluer precious stone pleasaunt iewels shal sekinge helpe sucoure mightie idol straunge goddes soch wil receaue take god shal geue greate worshipe power yee make lordes multitude geue londe rewardes latter tyme shal kinge south stryue kinge north like maner shall come agaynst charettes horsmen greate nauy shippes shal come londes destroye go thorow shal entre also fayre pleasaunt londe many city countrees shal decaye apo 12 c excepte edom moab best child ammon shal escape honde shall stretch forth hōdes vpon countrees londe egipte shal escape thorow goinge shal haue dominion ouer treasure syluer golde ouer precious iewels egipte lybia ethiopia neuerthelesse tydinges east north shall trouble apo 11 c cause shal go forth destroye curse greate multitude tentes palace shall pytch betwixte two see vpon hill noble sanctuary • po 19 〈◊〉 c shal come ende shal man helpe xii chapter tyme wil come also greate prynce michael • po 19 c stondeth thy people syde shal aryse vp shal come tyme trouble • 24 b soch neuer sen begāne eny people vnto tyme shal thy people delyuered yee foūde written boke • oh 5 c • cor 15 c many slepe dust earth shal awake euerlastinge life perpetuall shame reprofe • att 13 c wyse soch haue taught shal glister shyninge heauen haue instructe multitude vnto godlynesse shalbe starres worlde without ende thou daniel shut vp wordes seale boke till last tyme many shal go aboute thē shal knowlege increase daniel loked beholde stode two one vpon shore water vpon yonder syde one thē sayde vnto clothed lynnynge stode aboue vpon water floude longe shall ende wonderous workes herde man lynnynge clothes 〈◊〉 10 stode aboue vpon water floude helde vp right left honde vnto heauen sware lyueth euer 〈…〉 shal tary tyme two tymes half tyme power holy people clene scatred abrode thē shal thinges fulfilled herde well vnderstode sayde lorde shal happen answered go thy waye daniel wordes shal closed vp sealed till last tyme many shalbe purified clensed tried vngodly shall lyue wickedly wicked many thē shal haue vnderstondinge soch haue vnderstondinge 〈…〉 shal regarde ye tyme forth daylie offerynge shalbe put downe abhominable desolacion set vp shalbe thousande two hūdreth xc dayes well waiteth commeth thousande iijc xxxv dayes go thou thy waye till ended take thy rest byde thy lot till dayes haue ende ende prophet daniel prophet oseas oseas conteyneth chap god refuseth iewes • eth gentile chap ii plage ouer iewes amende promyse mercy wil repente chap· iii mercifull loue god towarde vnthankful people chap iiii synnes prestes people reprofe chap v prestes disceaue people chap vi vnthankfulnes people agayne louynge kyndnesse god chap vii medycine helpe sore wounded ydolatry chap viii idolatry samaria israel chap ix punyszhment vpon israel idolatry chap x vnthankfulnesse israel calfe samaria soch like abhominacions telleth destruccion cha xixii god calleth agayne rehearsinge benefites done afore chap xiii sheweth wickednesse punyszhment chap xiiii crieth exorteth people conuerte promisynge swetely louyngly receaue worde lorde came vnto oseas sonne beeri 〈…〉 dayes osias ioathan achas ezechias kinges iuda tyme ieroboam sonne ioas kynge israel first chapter first lorde spake vnto oseas saide vnto go thy waye 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 4 take harlot thy wife get childrē • ode hath cōmitted greate whordome agaynst lorde wente toke gomer ye doughter deblaim conceaued brought forth sonne lorde sayde vnto 〈…〉 call name iesrael wil shortly auenge bloude iesrael vpon house iehu bringe kingdome house israel ende breake bowe israel valley iesrael conceaued yet agayne bare doughter sayde vnto call hir name loruhama opteyninge mercy ofr wil haue pyte vpon house israel 〈…〉 forget put clene remembraunce 〈…〉 neuerthelesse wil haue mercy vpon house iuda wil saue euen thorow lorde god wil delyuer thorow eny bow swearde batel horse horsmen weened loruhama conceaued agayne bare sonne sayde call name lo ami saye people ye people therfore though nombre child israel sonde see 〈…〉 nether measured ner tolde yet place sayde vnto ye people euen shall thus reported ye childrē lyuynge god shal child iuda childrē israel gathered together agayne 〈…〉 chose selues one heade departe londe greate shalbe daye iesrael ii chapter tell youre brother people youre sisteren haue optayned mercy youre mother ye shal chyde reproue wife iere 3 nether hir huszbōde vnlesse put awaye hir whordome sight hir aduoutry hir brestes yf shal strype naked set euen came ye worlde eze 16 yee shal laye hir waist make like wildernesse slaye thyrste shal haue pite also vpon hir child ioh 8 child f • rnicacion mother hath broken hir wedlocke bare come cōfucion4 17▪ sayde wil go louers geue water bred woll flax oyle drynke hedge hir waye thornes stoppe shal fynde hir fotestoppes though runne hir louers yet shall get shal seke leui 15 c fynde shal saye well go turne agayne first huszbonde yt tyme better ease wolde knowe yet gaue corne wyne oyle syluer golde hath hanged vpon baal wherfore go take corne wyne agayne season eze 16 b fet agayne woll flax gaue couer hir shame iere 13 c dyscouer hir foolishnesse euen sight hir louers man shal delyuer hondes morouer wil take awaye hir myrth hir holy dayes hir newmoones deu 16 c hir sabbathes hir solempne feastes destroye hir vynyardes fyge tree though saieth lo rewardes louers haue geuen wil make wodde wylde beestes shall eate vp punysh also dayes baal wherin censed iud • b 10 b deckynge hir earynges cheynes folowed hir louers forgat saieth lorde wherfore beholde wil call againe bringe wildernes speake frendly vnto wil geue hir vynyardes agayne iosu 7 yee valley achor also shewe hir hope comforte shal synge tyme hir youth like daye came londe egipte iudic 5 exo 15 saieth lorde shal saye vnto houszbande shal call nomore baal wil take awaye name baal hir mouth yee shal neuer remembre name eny leui 26 make couenaunt wylde beastes foules ayre euerythinge crepeth vpon earth esa 2 bowe swerde batel destroye soch londe wil make slepe safely eze 16 b thus wil mary vnto myne owne self euermore yee euen self wil mary rightuousnesse equyte louynge kyndnesse mercy faith also mary vnto self thou shalt knowe lorde tyme wil shewe self frendly gracious vnto ye heauens saieth lorde heauens shal helpe earth earth shal helpe corne wyne oyle shal helpe iesrael wil sowe vpō earth sede myne owne self wil haue mercy vpon yt without mercy thē people ro 9 c 1 pet 2 b wil saye thou art people shal saye thou art god iii chapter sayde ye lorde go yet ye waye wowe aduouterous womā eze 44 whō thy neghboure loueth ye lorde doth childrē israel haue respecte straunge goddes esa 28 amos 6 loue wyne kannes gat xv syluerlinges homer half barlye sayde vnto thou shalt byde alonge season se thou playest harlot loke thou medle none man wil kepe self thus childrē israel shal syt greate whyle without kinge prynce2 par 25 dan 3 without offerynge aulter without prest reuelacion afterwarde shal child israel conuerte seke lorde god eze 34 dauid kinge ye latter dayes shal worshipe lorde louynge kyndnesse iiii chapter heare ye worde lorde ye child israel lorde must punysh thē yt dwel londe faith fulnesse mercy knowlege god lō de swearinge lyēge māslaughter ft aduoutry haue gotten ouerhande one bloud giltynesse foloweth another therfore shal londe miserable case dwell therin shal mourne beastes felde foules ye ayre fish see shall dye yet none wil chastē reproue another prestes shulde refourme mē become like people therfore stomblest thou ye daye tyme ▪ prophet night wil bringe thy mother sylence 〈…〉 people perish haue knowlege seinge thou hast refused vnderstondinge therfore wil refuse ye also shalt nomore prest moch thou hast forgotten lawe thy god wil also forget thy childrē increased multitude synned agaynst therfore wil chaurge honoure shame eate vp synnes people corage wickednesse 〈…〉 thus prest become like people wherfore punysh wicked wayes rewarde acordinge owne ymaginacions▪ shal eate haue ynough haue vsed whordome therfore shall prospere haue forsaken lorde regarded whordome wyne dronckennesse take herte awaye people axe councel stockes staffe must tell whorish mynde hath disceaued yt cōmitte fornicacion agaynst god make sacrifice vpon hie mountaynes burne incense vpon hilles yee amonge okes groues buszshes good shadowes therfore yor doughters become harlottes youre spouse haue brokē wedlocke wil punish yor doughters beinge defyled yor brydes became whore 〈…〉 seinge father themselues haue medled harlottes offered vnthriftes people wil vnderstonde must punyshed though thou israel art disposed playe ye harlot yet shuldest thou haue offended iuda 〈…〉 thou shuldest haue runne galgala ner haue gone vp bethauē haue sworne lorde lyueth israel gone backe like wāton cowe lorde therfore shal make hir fede ye lābe yt go • eth astraye ephraim become partaker idol wel let go dronckēnesse hath put thē backe brought whordome ruler loue rewardes brynge saye owne shame wynde shall take holde fethers shal cōfounded offeringes v chapter heare ye prestes take hede thou housholde israel geue eare thou kingly house punyshment wil come vpon become snare vnto myspa spred net vnto mount thabor kyll sacrifice heapes begyle people therwith therfore wil punysh eze 8 b 〈◊〉 23 knowe ephraim well ynough israel hyd fro ephraim become harlot israel defyled mynded turne vnto god haue whorish herte yt knowe lorde 〈◊〉 7 b pryde israel wil rewarded face yee israel ephraim shal fall wickednesse iuda also 〈◊〉 3 b 〈◊〉 4 〈…〉 14 shall come shepe bullockes seke ye lorde shal fynde gone lorde haue refused brought vp bastarde child moneth therfore shall deuoure porcions blowe shawmes gabea trumpet rama crie bethauen vpon yonside ben iamin tyme ye plage shal ephraim layed waist therfore dyd faithfully warne trybes israel 〈◊〉 19 〈◊〉 • 7 b yet prynces iuda become like remoue londemarckes therfore wil poure wrath vpon like water ephraim oppressed haue right lawe folowe ye doctrynes men therfore vnto ephraim moth house iuda caterpiller 〈◊〉 1 • b 〈◊〉 28 c ephraim sawe sicknesse iuda disease ephraim wente vnto assur sent vnto kinge iareb yet coude helpe ner ease youre payne vnto ephraim lyon lyon whelpe house iuda euen wil spoyle go waye wil take man shal rescue wil go returne place till waxe faynt seke vi chapter aduersite shall seke saye come let v turne agayne lorde 〈…〉 hath smytten v shal heale v hath wounded v shal bynde v vp agayne two dayes shal quycken v thirde daye shal rase v vp shal lyue sight shal haue vnderstondinge endeuoure oure selues knowe lorde shal go forth sprynge daye come vnto v euenynge mornynge rayne vpon earth pro 16 ephraim shal vnto iuda shal intreate seynge youre loue like mornynge cloude like dew yt goeth early awaye therfore haue cut downe prophetes letten slayne wordes sake thy punyshment shal come light haue pleasure louynge kyndnesse offerynge matt 912 yee knowlege god burnt sacrifice euen like adam dyd gen 3 b haue broken couenaunt set naught galaad cite wicked doer malicious people bloudshedders multitude prestes like heape theues murtherers bloud thurstie haue wrought abhominacion iere 1 • b horrible thinges haue sene house israel playeth ephraim harlot israel defyled iuda shall haue haruest returne captiuyte people vii chapter vndertake make israel whole vngraciousnesse ephraim wickednes samaria commeth light go aboute lye home theues without fall robbynge cōsidre hertes remēbre wickednes go aboute wt owne ynuenciōs se wel ynough make kinge prince haue pleasure wickednes lye burne aduoutry ouen yt baker heateth whē hath lefte kneadinge till dowe leuended euen goeth daye oure kinges prynces begynne woode droncken thorow wyne vse familiarite soch disceaue thē ymaginacion herte like ouē slepe ye night like slepe baker mornynge hote flame fyre altogether hote ouen haue deuoured owne iudges kinges fallē yet none thē yt calleth vpon therfore must ephraim mixte amonge ye heithen ephraim become like cake yt man turneth straungers haue deuoured strength yet regardeth waxeth ful gray haires yet wil knowe ye pride israel cast downe face osee • yet wil turne lorde god ner seke 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 ephraim like doue begyled hath herte • re▪ 1 • b call vpon egipcians go assirians whyle goinge shal sprede net ouer drawe downe ye foules ayre acordinge haue bene warned punysh esa 1 wo vnto haue forsakē must destroyed haue set naught • pet 2 matt 15 esa 29 eze 33 f haue redemed yet dyssemble wt call vpon harte lye youlinge vpon beddes come together meate drincke obeye haue taught defended arme yet ymagin myschefe agaynst turne selues right become broken bowe prynces shalbe slayne wt swearde malice tunges soch blasphemy haue lerned londe egipte viii chapter set horne thy mouth blowe get swiftly aegle vnto house lorde deu 31 haue broken couenaunt transgressed lawe israel saye vnto thou art god knowe hath refused thinge good therfore shall enemye folowe vpon • 12 c haue ordened kinges thorow haue made prynces must knowe syluer golde haue made ymages • ze 7 bringe selues destruccion • 12 thy calfe samaria shalbe taken awaye wrothfull indignacion gone forth agaynst longe wil clensed calfe came israel worke man made therfore god euen spyders webbe shal ye calfe samaria turned haue sowne wynde therfore shal reepe storme sede shal beare corne shal meel made increase though ye yet shall straungers deuoure vp israel shall perish gentile shall entreate foule vessel sen went vp assirians become like wylde asse deserte • • 7 eze 16 b ephraim geueth rewardes get louers therfore scatred amōge heithē wil gather vp shal soone weery burthen kinges prynces ephraim hath made many aulters wickednes therfore shal aulters turne synne though shewe thē lawe neuer moch counte straunge doctrine sacrifice offeringe flesh eatinge lorde haue pleasure therin remembre wickednes punysh synnes israel turneth agayne egipte 〈…〉 haue forgotten made buylde church 〈…〉 iuda maketh many stronge city therfore wil sende fyre city shal consume place ix chapter thou triumphe israel make boostinge heithen thou hast cōmitted aduo • try agaynst ye god straunge rewardes hast thou loued thē corne floores 〈…〉 therfore shall nomore enioye cornefloores wyne press swete wyne shal fayle thē wil dwel lordes londe 〈…〉 ephraim turneth agayne egipte eateth vncleane thinges amonge assirians poure wyne drinkofferinge vnto lorde nether geue slayne offeringes vnto mourner meates wherin eate defyled bred haue soch lust vnto shal come house lorde wil ye solempne dayes feast lorde lo shall get awaye destruccion egypte shal receaue noph shal bury nettle shall ouergrowe pleasaunt goodes burres shalbe tabernacle ye sure israel tyme visitacion come dayes recompencinge honde prophet ye holde foole rich sprete mad man greate youre wickednes malice ephraim hath made watchman god prophet yt become snare hurte euery strete abhominacion house god gone farre 〈…〉 haue destroied thē selues like dyd afore tyme gabaa therfore wickednes shal remē bred synnes punyshed fande israel like grape wildernes sawe father first fyges ye toppe ye fyge tre gone baal peor 〈…〉 runne awaie fro yi shame full idoll become abhominable louers ephraim flieth like byrde shal glory also moch yt shal nether begette cōceaue ner beare child though bringe vp eny yet make childlesse amonge men yee wo shall come departe ephraim thinke planted welthinesse 〈…〉 like tyrus must bringe hir owne child forth man slayer lorde thou shalt geue shalt thou geue geue vnfrutefull wombe drye brestes 〈◊〉 4 wickednesse done galgal abhorre vngraciousnes owne inuencions wil dryue house loue nomore prynces vnfaithfull ephraim hewen downe rote dryed vp yt shal bringe nomore frute yee though bringe forth eny yet wil slaye euen best beloued frute body god shall cast awaye haue bene obediēt vnto therfore shal go astraye amonge heithen x chapter israel goodly vyne hath brought forth vnprofitable frute 〈…〉 yee frute mo aulters made ye good dyd londe frendshipe shewed ymages herte deuyded therfore wil destroyed lorde shall breake downe ymages shal destroye aulters shal saye haue kinge haue feared lorde shal kinge v comon together sweare vayne oothes cōfederate together therfore groweth punyshment wedes forowes londe dwell samaria haue worshipped calfe bethauē therfore shall people mourne ouer yee prestes also welthynesse reioysed shal passe awaye shalbe brought assirian present vnto kinge iareb ephraim shal receaue full punishment israel shal confounded owne ymaginacions samaria wt kinge shall vanish awaye scomme vpon water hye place auen israel synne shal cast downe thistle thornes shal growe vpon aulters shal saye ye mountaynes 〈…〉 couer v hilles fall vpon v israel thou hast synned gabaa dyd afore tyme 〈◊〉 • 9 remayned shulde batel come vpon wicked child wel vpon gabaonites wil chasten euen myne owne desyre people shal gathered together ouer whē punysh greate wickednesse ephraim vnto cow vsed go plowe therfore loued fell vpon fayre neck droue ephraim iuda plowed matt 11 • iacob played huszbōde man might sowe vnto rightuousnes reape frutes weldoynge yt might plowe vp fresh londe seke lorde till came lerned rightuousnes haue plowed wickednesse therfore shal reepe synne eate frute lye seinge thou puttest thy cō fidence thine owne wayes leanest ye multitude thy worthy shal growe sedicion amonge thy people ye strō ge city shalbe layed waist iud 8 c euen salmana destroyed familiers thorow auenged baal daye batel ye mother perished hir childrē euen shal go bethel youre malicious wickednes like mornynge goeth awaye shal kinge israel passe xi chapter israel yōge loued called sonne londe egipte exo 3 b 6 b matt 2 c ye called wente backe offerynge vnto idol censynge ymages exo 32 b 3 12 e 4 16 • lerned ephraim go bare myne armes regarded wolde haue helped led coardes frendshipe bondes loue euen layed yocke vpon neckes gaue fodder exo 16 c yt shulde go agayne egipte assur kinge wolde turne vnto therfore shal ye swearde begynne city stoare haue lickened vnto shall destroyed eaten vp owne ymaginacions people hath lust turne vnto prophetes laye yocke vpon thē esa 10 28 b matt 2 • luc 11 ease burthen greate thinges haue geuen ephraim faithfully haue defended israel gen 19 e deu 29 haue dealt adama haue intreated like seboim hert otherwise mynded yee mercy feruent therfore haue turned destroye ephraim wrothful displeasure god man euen holy one myddest though came within cite lorde roareth like lyon maye folowe 〈◊〉 5 yee lyon roareth maye afrayed like child see maye scarred awaye egipte men scarre byrdes frayed awaye doues vse assiriās londe wolde haue tary home saieth lorde ephraim goeth aboute lie house israel dyssembleth iuda holdeth god true holy thinges xii chapter ephraim kepeth ayre foloweth east wynde euer increasinge lye destruction confederate assirians oyle caried egipte • 16 b •• 57 b lorde hath courte holde iuda wil punysh iacob owne way acordinge owne inuencions shal recompence toke brother hele yet mother wombe • en 25 • en 32 • en 35 b strength wrestled god stroue angel gat victory prayde desyred fande bethel talked wt v yee lorde god hoostes euen ye lorde self remembred turne thy god kepe mercy equyte hope still thy god marchaunt hath false weight honde hath pleasure occupie extorcion • po 3 c ephraim thinketh thus tush rich haue good ynough workes shal one fawte founde haue offended yet lorde thy god euē brought londe egipte set thy tentes hye feast dayes haue spokē thorow prophetes shewed dyuerse vision declared self ministracion ye prophetes galaad abhominacion fallen vanyte galgal haue slayne ox deu 12 • 4 b many heapes stone lōde forowes many aulters haue made iacob fled londe siria israel serued wife wife kepte shepe gen 28 prophet lorde brought egipte prophet preserued thē ephraim hath prouoked displeasure thorow abhominacions therfore shal bloude poured vpon self lorde god shal rewarde blasphemy xiii chapter abhominacion ephraim come also israel gone backe baal therfore must dye esa 〈…〉 eze▪ 〈…〉 osee 〈…〉 osee 〈…〉 synne syluer make molten ymages like idol heithen yet nothinge worke craftesman withstōdinge preach wil kysse calues offreth men therfore shalbe mornynge cloude dew early passeth awaye like dust ye wynde taketh awaye floore smoke goeth ye chymney lorde thy god 〈…〉 brought londe egipte thou shuldest knowe god thou shuldest haue sauioure 〈…〉 toke diligent hede wildernesse drye londe wel fedde ynough waxed proude forgat 〈…〉 therfore vnto lyon leoparde ye waye assirians wil come vpon beer robbed hir welpes wil breake stubburne herte wil deuoure lyon yee wylde beastes shal teare israel thou doest destroye thy self 〈…〉 thy helpe thy kinges shulde helpe thy city yee thy iudges thou saydest geue kinge prynces well 〈…〉 gaue kinge wrath displeasure take agayne wickednesse ephraim bounde together synne lieth hyd therfore shall sorowes come vpon vpon woman traualeth vndiscrete sonne considreth shulde haue bene able haue endured tyme byrth defended graue delyuered death death wil thy death hell 〈…〉 wil thy stynge yet se comforth goodliest amonge brother east wynde euen wynde lorde shal come downe wildernesse drye vp condytes drynke vp welles shal spoyle treasure pleasaunt vessel samaria shalbe made waist 〈…〉 disobedient vnto god shal perish swearde child shalbe slayne woman bygg childe shalbe rypte vp xiiii chapter tvrne israel vnto ye lorde thy god 〈…〉 thou hast taken greate fall thorow thy wickednesse take wordes ye turne lorde saye vnto forgeue v oure synnes receaue v graciously wil offre ye bullockes oure lyppes vnto 〈◊〉 13 c • sal 91 assur shalbe oure helper nether ryde vpon horse eny workes oure hondes wil nomore call vpon thou art oure god thou shewest euer mercy vnto fatherlesse yf wolde shulde heale sore yee herte wolde loue yt wrath shulde clene turned awaye yee wolde vnto israel dewe shulde growe ye lylie rote shulde breake libanus braunches shulde sprede abrode fayre olyue tre smel libanus dwel vnder shadowe shulde come agayne growe vp corne florish vyne shulde haue good name wyne libanus ephraim haue idol eny wil graciously heare lede forth wil vnto grene fyrre tre vpon shalt thou fynde thy frute wyse shal vnderstonde yt right enstructe wil regarde ye wayes lorde rightuous soch godly wil walke wicked wil stomble therin ende prophet oseas prophet ioel ioel conteyneth chap sheweth israel glory outwarde ceremony shal put downe ceasse chap ii plage greate wherfore wolde haue mourne yet yf amende maye hope grace chap iii people brought agayne enemy punished first chapter worde lorde came vnto ioel sonne phatuel heare ye elder pōdre wel ye dwell lō de yf euer happened soch thinge youre dayes ye dayes youre father tell youre child let shewe vnto child certifie posterite therof exo 10 • loke caterpiller hath lefte yt hath greshopper eaten vp greshopper lefte hath locuste eaten vp locuste hath lefte hath blastinge consumed wake vp ye dronckardes wepe mourne ye wyne supper youre swete wyne shal taken awaye youre mouth yee mightie innumerable people shall come vp londe haue teth like teth lyon chaftbones like lyones deu 32 s shal make vinyarde waist shal pyll barckes fygetrees strype bare cast awaye make braunches whyte make ye mone virgin doth yt gyrdeth selfe sacke hir bryde grome meate drynkofferynge shalbe taken awaye house lorde prestes ye lordes minister shal mourne felde shalbe waisted londe shalbe miserable case corne shalbe destroyed swete wyne shal come confucion oyle vtterly desolate huszbō de men wyne gardener shal loke piteously make lamentacion wheate wyne barley haruest vpon felde clene destroyed grape gatherer shal make greate mone vynyarde fygetrees vtterly waisted yee pomgarnettes palmtrees apletrees tree felde shall wyther awaye thus mery cheare child men shal come confucion gyrde make yor mone ye prestes mourne ye ministres aulter go youre waye slepe sack cloth ye officer god meat drynkofferynge shal taken awaye house yor god proclame fastynge call cōgregacion gather elder inhabiters londe together house lorde yor god crie vnto lorde ala ioel 2 c ala daye daye lorde honde commeth destroyer allmightie shal ye meates taken awaye oure eye myrth also ioye house oure god sede shal perish grounde garner shall lye waist floores shalbe broken downe corne shalbe destroied3 18 sighinge make catell bullockes euel likynge haue pasture shepe fameszshed awaye lorde crie fyre hath consumed goodly pasture wyldernesse flame hath brent vp tree felde yee wylde beestes crie also vnto water ryuers dryed vp fyre hath consumed pasture wyldernesse ii chapter blowe ye trompet sion crie vpō holy hill yt soch dwel londe maye trēble ye daie lorde commeth •• ph 1 c • mo 5 c harde honde darcke daye gloomynge daye cloudy daye yee stormy daye like mornynge spredeth vpō hilles namely great mightie people soch haue bene sen ye begynnynge nether shal euermore shal consumynge fyre behynde burnynge flame londe shal garden pleasure behinde shal waist wildernesse man shal escape loke vpon like bayrded horse runne like horse men skyppe vp vpon ye hilles sounde charettes flame fyre consumeth strawe mightie people redy batell folke shalbe afrayed face shal blacke pot shal rū ne like giauntes leape ouer walles like men warre euery mā goinge shal kepe araie go path shal one dryue another ech shal kepe owne waye shal breake wyndowes hurte shal come cite runne vpon walles shal clymme vp vpon house slyppe wyndowes like thefe earth shal quake yee heauens shalbe moued 〈◊〉 3 c • att 24 c sonne moone shal darckened starres shal withdrawe shyne lorde shal shewe voyce hoost hoost greate stronge mightie fulfill commaundement ye greate maruelous fearfull daye lorde able abyde therfore saieth lorde turne vnto youre hertes • poc 6 c 〈◊〉 4 c • fastinge wepynge mournynge rente youre hertes youre clothes turne vnto lorde youre god •• al 85 〈◊〉 4 gracious mercifull longe sufferynge greate compassion redy pardone wickednes doute also shal turne forgeue chastenynge shall let youre increase remayne meat drynck offerynges vn lorde youre god ioel 〈…〉 blowe trōpet sion proclame fastynge call congregacion gather people together warne congregacion gather elder bringe child suclynges together let ye brydegrome go forth chā bre bryde closet let prestes serue lorde betwixte porch ye aulter wepinge sayenge fauourable lorde fauourable vnto thy people let thine heretage brought soch confucion lest heithen lordes therof wherfore shulde saye amonge heithen 〈…〉 god shal lorde gelous ouer londe spare people yee ye lorde shal answere saye vnto people beholde wil sende corne wyne oyle ye shal haue plenty wil nomore geue ouer reprofe amonge heithen agayne north shal dryue farre shute drye waist londe face towarde east see hynder partes towarde vttemost see stynke shall go vp fylthy corrupcion shal fall vpon hath dealte proudly feare londe glad reioyse lorde wil greate thinges ye afrayed nether ye beastes felde pasture shal grene tree shal beare frute fygetrees vinyardes shal geue increase glad ye child sion reioyse lorde youre god hath geuen teacher rightuousnes yt shal sende downe shuwers rayne early late first moneth 〈…〉 ye garner shal full corne press plenteous wyne oyle yeares ye greszshopper locuste blasstinge caterpiller greate hoost sent amonge haue eaten vp shal restore agayne ye shal haue ynough eate satisfied prayse name lorde youre god maruelously hath dealte people shall neuer confounded eny ye shall well knowe myddest israel youre god yee none people shall nomore brought confucion poure sprete vpon flesh 〈…〉 yor sonnes yor doughters shal prophecy yor olde mē shal dreame dreames youre yonge men shal se vision 〈…〉 yee dayes poure sprete vpon seruauntes maydens shewe wonder heauen aboue tokēs earth beneth bloude fyre vapoure smoke sonne shalbe turned darcknesse ye moone bloude ye greate notable daye lorde come tyme shal come yt euer calleth name lorde 〈◊〉 10 b shalbe saued vpon mount sion ierusalem shalbe saluacion like lorde hath promised yee amonge remnaunt lorde shall call iii chapter take hede dayes ye tyme turne agayne captyuite iuda ierusalē shal gather people together brynge thē valley iosaphat wil reason thē people heretage israel whō haue scatred aboute nacions parted lōde yee haue cast lotte people yonge mē haue set brodel house solde damsel wyne yt might haue drī ke 〈◊〉 • 6 • 728 〈◊〉 ▪ 1 b thou tirus sidō ye border philistynes haue ye ye defye well yf ye nedes defye shall recōpence euen vpon youre heade yt right shortly ye haue takē awaye syluer golde fayre goodly iewels brought youre god house child also iuda ierusalem haue ye solde vnto grekes ye might brynge thē farre frō ye border • rowne countrees beholde therfore rayse place 〈…〉 ye haue solde rewarde euen vpon youre heade youre sonnes youre doughters sell thorow hondes childrē iuda shal geue forth sell vnto thē saba people farre coūtre lorde hath sayde crie thinges amonge gentile proclame warre wake vp giauntes let drawe nye let thē come vp lusty warryours thē make sweardes youre ploweshares 〈…〉 speares youre syckles sythes let ye weake man saye stronge mustre come ye heithē roūde aboute gather together shall lorde laye thy giauntes grounde let people aryse get valley iosaphat wil syt iudge heithē roū de aboute laye youre sythes apo 14 haruest rype come get downe wynepresse full yee wynepresses runne ouer wickednesse waxen greate valley appoynted shalbe many many people daye lorde nye ye valley appoynted sonne moone shall darckened ioel 2 b esa 13 b starres shal withdrawe light lorde shal roare sion crie ierusalē iere 25 heauens earth shal quake withall lorde shal defence vnto owne people ād refuge fo • childrē israel thus shal ye knowe yt lorde youre god dwell vpō holy mount sion shal ierusalē holy shal straungers go thorow eny shal moūtaynes droppe swete wyne hylles shall flowe mylcke amos 9 c ryuers iuda shal haue water ynough lordes house shal flowe sprynge water ye broke sitim egipte shalbe layed waist edō shal desolate iere 46 iere 49 b haue dealte cruelly childrē iuda shed innocent bloude londe agayne iuda shalbe inhabited euermore ierusalē generacion generaciō wil leaue bloude vnauenged lorde shal dwell sion ende prophet ioel prophet amos amos conteyneth chap prophecyeth agaynst damascus gasa tyre edom ammon chap ii punyshment vpō moab iuda israel chap iii god warneth punysh chap iiii sheweth wickednesse plage fo exorteth thē amende chap v complayneth captyuyte israel chap vi reproueth welthy ydyll delicate people tellinge destruccion chap vii punyshment people shewed dyuerse vision chap viii vision agaynst covetous people false waightes hunger god worde chap ix plage vpon iuda power god receauynge heithen conuersion iewes first chapter sermon shewed vnto amos one shepherdes thecua vpon israel tyme osias kynge iuda tyme ieroboā ye sonne ioas kynge israel4 15 4 14 c two yeare ye earthquake sayde lorde shal roare sion iere 25 ioel 3 c shewe voyce frō ierusalē ye pasture shepherdes shal miserable case ye toppe charmel dryed vp thus sayeth lorde thre foure wickedness damascus esa 17 iere 49 spare haue throszhed galaad wt yrō f • ale wil sende fyre ye house hazael shal consume palace benadab thus wil breake barres damascus rote inhabiter frō felde auen yt holdeth scepter ye pleasunt house yt people shalbe dryuen fayre siria▪ sayeth lorde thus saieth lorde thre foure wickedness gaza wil spare zach 9 c make presoners yet captyue haue dryuen thē lōde edom therfore wil sende fyre ye walles gaza shal deuoure hir house wil rote thē yt dwell asdod yt holdeth scepter ascalon stretch myne honde ouer accaron remnaunt philistine shal perish saieth lorde thus sayeth lorde thre foure wickedness cite tyre spare ioel 3 haue increased ye captiuyte edomites haue remembred brotherly couenaunt therfore sende fyre walles tyre3 5 shal consume hir pallaces thus sayeth lorde thre foure wickedness edom wil spare ab • 1 iere 49 b gen 27 g persecuted brother swerde destroyed mother wombe bare hatred longe kepte indignacion waye therfore sende fyre themā shal deuoure pallaces bosra thus sayeth lorde thre ād foure wickedness child ammon • ere 49 eze 21 25 spare rypte vp womē greate childe galaad make border londes wyder therfore wil kyndle fyre walles rabbath shall consume hir palace greate crie daye batel tempest daye storme kynge shal go captiuyte prī ce together sayeth lorde ii chapter thus sayeth lorde thre foure wickedness moab • sa •• 16 ier 〈…〉 spare brent bone kynge edom asshes therfore sende fyre moab shal cōsume ye pallaces carioth yt moab shal perish noyse sounde shawme rote iudge amōge slaye prynces sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde 〈…〉 thre ād foure wickedness iuda wil spare hath cast asyde lawe lorde kepte commaundementes wolde nedes disceaued lye forefather folowed therfore sende fyre iuda shal consume palace ierusalem thus sayeth lorde thre foure wickedness israel wil spare hath solde rightuous money poore shues treade vpon poore men heades dust earth croke wayes meke sonne father go harlot dishonoure holy name lye besyde euery aulter vpon clothes taken pledge house goddes drynke wyne oppressed 〈…〉 yet destroyed amorite hie cedre tree stronge okes notwithstōdinge destroyed frute frō aboue rote vnder agayne brought londe egipte 〈…〉 led xl yeares thorow wyldernesse ye might haue amoriters londe possession raysed vp prophetes amonge youre child absteyners amonge youre yōge men ye child israel sayeth lorde ye gaue absteyners wyne drynke 〈…〉 yee ye cō maunded prophetes sayenge prophecy beholde wil crasshe sonder like wayne crassheth yt full sheaues ye swifte shall escape nether stronge able eny thynge giaunte shal saue owne life archer shall abyde swifte fote shall escape horsmā shal saue life māly stomack giaunte shall daye fayne runne waye naked sayeth lorde iii chapter heare lorde speaketh vn ye child israel namely vnto ye trybes whō brought egipte sayde haue accepted generacions earth therfore vyset youre wickedness maye twaine walke together excepte agreed amonge selues doth lyon roare wodde excepte haue pray crieth lyon whelpe denne 〈◊〉 6 excepte haue gotten somthī ge doth byrde fall snare vpō ye earth fouler taketh man snare vp grounde afore catche somwhat crie alarum trompet cite people afrayed commeth eny plage cite without lordes doinge doth lorde god maner thinge telleth secrete vnto seruauntes ye prophetes lyon roareth afrayed seynge lorde god speaketh prophecy preach palace asdod palace londe egipte saye gather together vpon moūtaynes samaria shall ye se greate murthur violent oppression amonge regarde thinge right sayeth lorde gather together euell gotten goodes laye vp robbery house therfore thus sayeth lorde god londe shalbe troubled beseged roū de aboute thy strength shalbe plucte thy palace robbed thus saieth lorde like hyrdeman taketh two legges pece eare lyon mouth euen child israel dwell samaria hauynge couch corner beddes damascus shalbe plucte awaye heare beare recorde house iacob sayeth lorde god hoostes begynne vyset wickednesse israel 〈…〉 vyset ye aulters bethel also horne aulter shalbe broken fall groū de wynter house sommer house smyte downe house yuery yee many house shal perish destroyed sayeth lorde iiii chapter heare worde ye fat kyne vpon hill samaria ye poore mē wronge oppresse nedy ye saye youre lordes brynge hyther let v drynke therfore lorde hath sworne holynesse dayes shall come vpon ye shalbe lift vp vpō speares youre posterite caried awaye fyssher pannes ye shall get gappes one another armon shal ye cast awaye sayeth lorde ye came bethel worke vngraciousnes haue increased youre synnes galgal iosu 16 3 12 c osee 4 c osee 9 c 12 b ye brought youre sacrifice mornynge youre tythes vnto thirde daye ye made thākofferinge leuen ye promised frewillofferinges proclamed soch lust ye ye child israel sayeth lorde god therfore haue geuen ydle teth youre city scarcenesse bred youre place yet ye turne vnto sayeth lorde whē thre monethes vnto ye haruest withelde rayne deu 11 b 28 b iere 14 • ioel 3 c yee rayned vpō one cite vpō another one pece grounde moystured rayne grounde rayned vpon drye wherfore two yee thre city came vnto one drynke water satisfied yet ye turne vnto sayeth ye lorde haue smyten drouth blastinge loke many orchardes vinyardes fygetrees olyuetrees ye ye catirpiller hath eaten vp yet ye turne vnto sayeth lorde pestilence haue sent amōge dyd egipte exo 9 b youre yonge men haue slayen wt ye swerde caused youre horse taken captyue made stynckinge sauoure youre tentes come vp youre nostrels yet wil ye turne vnto sayeth lorde haue ouerthrowen gen 19 b 2 pet 2 b ouerthrewe sodome gomorre ye brande plucte fyre yet ye turne vnto sayeth lorde therfore thus handle agayne israel ye euen thus handle make ready mete thy god israel lo maketh mountaynes ordeneth wynde sheweth man aboute maketh mornynge darcknesse treadeth vpō hye place earth ye lorde god hoostes name v chapter heare word ye house israel must make mone vyrgin israel shall fall neuer ryse vp agayne shall cast downe vpon hir owne grounde man shal helpe hir vp thus sayeth ye lorde god dwelt one cite shalbe left scarce c therin ye dwelt c shal scarce ten left house israel neuertheles thus sayeth lorde vnto ye house israel seke ād ye shal lyue seke bethel come galgal go bersaba galgal shall caried awaye captyue bethel shal come naught seke lorde yt ye maye lyue lest house ioseph brent fyre cōsumed lest none quench bethel ye turne lawe wormwod cast downe rightuousnes vnto grounde lorde maketh vij starres oryons iob 9 turneth night daye daye maketh darcknesse calleth ye water see poureth vpon playne grounde 9 b lorde name herayseth destruccion vpon mightie people bryngeth downe stronge holde owe euel yt reproueth openly telleth thē playne treuth abhorre moch thē ye oppresse ye poore deu 28 c soph 1 c robbe best sustenaunce therfore whereas ye haue buylded house square stone ye shall dwell maruelōs pleasaunt vynyardes shall ye plante wyne thē shal ye drynke multitude youre wickedness youre stoute synnes exo 23 mich 3 knowe right well enemy ye rightuous ye take rewardes ye oppresse poore iudgment therfore wyse must fayne holde tūge wicked tyme seke thinge good euell shall ye lyue yee lorde god hoostes shal acordinge youre owne desyre hate euell loue good psal 96 b deu 17 ro 12 b set vp right agayne porte doute lorde god hoostes shall mercifull vnto remnaunt ioseph yff sayeth lorde god god hoostes shal mourninge stretes yee shal saye ī euery strete ala ala shall call housbonde man lamentaciō soch mourne mournynge vynyardes shal heuynesse come amonge sayeth lorde wo vnto desyre daye ye lorde wherfore wolde ye haue daye lorde shalbe darcke ād cleare yee like mā rūneth frō lyon beer meteth whē commeth house leeneth honde vpon wall serpent byteth him▪ shall daye lorde darcke 〈…〉 cleare shal cloudy shyne hate abhorre youre holy dayes ād ye cense ye come together accepte 〈…〉 though ye offre brentofferinges meatofferinges yet haue pleasure therin youre fat thankofferynges wil loke vpon awaye noyse thy songes wil heare thy playes musick se equyte flowe water rightuousnesse mightie streame ye house israel gaue ye offeringes sacrifice xl yeares longe wyldernesse 〈…〉 yet haue ye set vp tabernacle youre moloch ymages youre idol yee ād starre youre god rempha 〈…〉 figure ye made worshipe therfore wil cause caried awaye beyonde damascus sayeth lorde whose name god hoostes vi chapter wo proude welthy siō soch thinke thē sure vpon ye mount samaria 〈…〉 holde selues best worlde rule house israel euē list go vnto calne se thence get hemath greate cite go downe gath philistine better ease kyngdomes border ir londe wyder ye taken euel daye euen ye syt stole wylfulnesse ye lye vpon beddes yuery vse youre wantonnesse vpon youre couch ye eate best lambes ye flocke fattest calues droaue ye synge lute 〈…〉 playenge instrumentes compare youre selues vnto dauid ye drynke wyne goblettes anoynte youreselues best oyle man sory ioseps hurte therfore shall ye first shal led awaye captyue lusty chere wylfull shall come ende lorde god hath sworne euen sayeth lorde god hoostes 〈…〉 hate pryde iacob abhorre palace wil geue ouer cite wt therin though remayne ten men one house shal dye nexte kynszfolckes deed buriers shall take cary awaye bone saye vnto ynnermer house yet eny mo ye shal answere gone holde thy tunge shall saye wolde remembre name lorde 〈…〉 beholde lorde mynded smyte greate house shall decaye ād litle house shall cleue sunder runne horse plowe wt ox vpon harde rockes stone ye haue turned true iudgment bytternesse frute rightuousnesse wormwod yee euen ye reioyse vayne thynges ye saye haue optayned horne oure owne strength well take hede ye house israel sayeth lorde god hoostes brynge people vpō shall trouble waye goeth towarde hemath vnto broke medowe vii chapter lorde god shewed soch vision beholde stode one made greszshoppers euen corne shutynge forth kynge clipte shepe vndertoke eate vp grene thinges ye lōde sayde lorde god mercifull beseke shulde el helpe vp iacob brought lowe lorde gracious therin lorde sayde well shall agayne ye lorde shewed vision beholde lorde god called fyre punysh withall deuoured greate depe yee consumed parte allredy sayde lorde god holde thy ne honde shulde el helpe vp iacob brought lowe lorde merciful therin lorde god sayde well shal morouer shewed vision beholde lorde stode vpon plastered wall 〈…〉 mason trowell hōde lorde sayde vnto amos seist thou answered mason trowell sayde lorde beholde laye trowell amō ge people israel nomore ouersee hye hilchapels isaac must layed waist church israel made desolate house ieroboam stonde vp agaynst swerde 〈◊〉 17 vpon sent amasias prest bethel vnto ieroboam kinge israel 〈◊〉 17 sayenge amos maketh house israel rebell agaynst londe cā awaye wordes amos sayeth ieroboam shall dye swerde israel shall led awaye captyue owne londe amasias sayde vnto amos get hence thou cāst se well fle londe iuda get thy lyuynge prophecy esa • 0 b prophecy nomore bethel kynges chapel kynges courte amos answered sayde amasias nether prophet ner prophetes sonne keper catell zach 13 breakynge downe molberies goynge catell lorde toke sayde vnto go thy waye prophecy vnto people israel therfore heare thou worde lorde thou saiest prophecy agaynst israel speake nothinge agaynst house isaac wherfore thus sayeth lorde thy wife shalbe defyled ye cite yt sonnes doughters shalbe slayne swerde thy londe shalbe measured lyne thou thy self shalt dye vnclene londe israel shalbe dryuen owne countre viii chapter lorde god shewed vision beholde maū de sommer frute sayde amos seist thou answered maū de sommer frute sayde lorde vnto ende commeth vpon people israel wil nomore ouersee daye shall songes temple turned sorow sayeth lorde god many deed bodyes shal lye euery place cast forth secretly heare ye yt oppresse poore esa 5 b destroye nedy ye londe sayenge whan new moneth gone maye sell vytale ye sabbath maye haue scarcenesse corne make buszshel lesse sycle greater shall set vp false waightes yt maye get poore vnder v money nedy also shues yee let v sell chaffe corne lorde hath sworne agaynst pryde iacob 6 b workes neuer forget shal londe tremble dwell therin mourne shal destruccion come vpon like water streame flowe ouer thē floude egipte tyme sayeth lorde god shall cause ye sō ne go downe noone iere 15 b londe darcke cleare daye youre hye feastes tob 2 turne sorow youre songes mournynge wil brynge sack cloth vpō backes baldnes vpō euery heade yee soch mournynge wil sende iere 6 made vpon begotten sonne shall haue miserable ende beholde tyme commeth sayeth lorde god yt shal sende hūger ye earth hunger bred ner thyrst water hunger heare worde lorde shal go one see yee ye north vnto ye cast runnynge aboute seke worde ye lorde shal fynde tyme shal fayre virgin yonge men perish thyrst yee euen sweare offence samaria saye truly thy god lyueth dan truly ye god lyueth bersaba shal fall neuer ryse vp agayne ix chapter sawe lorde stondinge vpon aulter sayde smyte dore cheke postes maye shake withall couetousnesse shal fall vpon heades posterite shalbe slayne swerde shall fle awaye shall one escape ner delyuered though buryed hell honde shal fetch thence psal 138 abd 1 though clymme vp heauen yet shal cast downe though hyde selues vpō toppe carmel yet shal seke brynge thence though crepe downe fro sight depe see shal cōmaū de serpente euen byte yff go awaye enemy ī captyuyte shall commaunde swerde slaye thus wil set myne eye vpon harme wealth lorde god hoostes toucheth londe cōsumeth awaye dwell therin must nedes mourne destruccion shal aryse euery streame runne ouer 8 • 8 g floude egipte hath dwellinge heauen ād groundeth tabernacle earth calleth water see amos 5 b poureth vpon playne grounde name lorde ye child israel ye vnto euen morians sayeth lorde haue brought israel londe egipte philistynes capthor gen •• b sirians frō cyr beholde eye lorde vpon realme synneth 〈…〉 rote clene earth neuertheles vterly destroye house iacob saieth lorde lo promyse though siffte ye house israel amonge nacions like vse sifte syue yet shall ye smallest grauel stone fall vpō earth wicked doer people saye tush plage nye come hastely vpon v shal perish swerde tyme wil buylde agayne tabernacle dauid 〈…〉 fallen downe hedge vp gappes loke brokē shal repayre yee shal buylde agayne afore tyme yt maye possesse remnaunt edom yee soch people call vpon name wt thē saieth lorde doth thinges▪ beholde tyme commeth saieth lorde plowman shal ouertake ye mower ye treader grape soweth sede 〈…〉 mountaynes shall droppe swete wyne hilles shall frutefull wil turne captyuyte people israel shal repayre waist city haue thē possessiō shal plante vinyardes ād drynke wyne therof shal make garden enioye frutes thē wil plāte vpō owne groū de neuer rote agayne londe haue geuen thē sayeth lorde thy god ende prophet amos prophet abdy abdy conteyneth chap prophecyeth agaynst proude stomackes edomites vexed israelite aduersite sheweth plage shal come vpon first chapter
