vision shewed vnto abdy thus hath ye lorde god spokē vpō edō 〈…〉 haue herde lorde yt embassage sent amonge heithen vp let v aryse fight agaynst beholde make ye small amōge heithen thou shalt vtterly despised 〈◊〉 49 c pryde thine herte hath lift vp thou dwellest ye strō ge holdes stone hast made hye seate thou sayest thyne herte shal cast downe grounde though thou wentest vp hye aegle 〈◊〉 9 〈◊〉 2 b maydest thy nest aboue amonge starres yet wolde plucke downe thēce yf ye theues robber came ye bynight thou takinge thy rest shulde steale till ynough yf grape gatherer came vpon wolde leaue grape shall rype esau seke treasure yee men sworne vnto shal dryue border thyne owne londe one shal disceaue ouercome ye euē eate thy bred shall betraye euer thou perceaue shal tyme destroye wyse men edom • sa 29c • cor 1 c ād haue vnderstondinge mount esau thy giauntes theman shalbe afrayed thorow slaughter shalbe ouer throwne vpon moūt esau shame shal come vpon ye malice thou shewedest thy brother iacob yee euermore shalt thou perish tyme 〈◊〉 17 c 〈◊〉 20 c thou didest set thyself agaynst euen enemy caried awaye hoost aleauntes came porte cast lotte vpon ierusalem thou thyself wast one thou shalt nomore se daye thy brother thou shalt nomore beholde tyme captiuyte thou shalt nomore reioyse ouer child iuda daye destruccion thou shalt tryumphe nomore tyme trouble thou shalt nomore come gate people tyme decaye thou shalt se mysery daye fall thou shalt sende man agaynst hoost daye aduersite nether shalt thou stōde wayringe enymore ye corner stretes murthur soch fled take presoners remayne daye trouble daye lorde harde vpon heithen like thou hast done 〈◊〉 • 0 c 〈◊〉 3 b shalt thou dealte withall yee thou shalt rewarded euen vpon thine heade like wyse ye haue droncken vpon myne holy hill shal heithen dryncke continually yee dryncke shall swalowe vp ye shall though ye neuer bene vpon mount sion shall remnaunt escape shalbe holy zach 2 house iacob shal possesse euen selues afore possessiō morouer house iacob shalbe fyre iere 5 c house ioseph flame house esau shalbe strawe shal kyndle cō sume nothinge shalbe left house esau lorde hath sayde south shal haue mount esau possession loke lieth vpon grounde shal philistynes haue playne feldes shal ephraim samaria possesse mountaynes galaad shal ben iamin haue hoost shalbe childrē israel presoners lieth canaan vnto sarphad sepharad shal vnder subieccion ierusalem city south shall enheret thus escape vpon hill sion shall go vp punysh mount esau zac 14 b kyngdome shalbe lordes ende prophet abdy prophet ionas ionas conteyneth chap god sendeth ionas vnto niniue fleyth cast see chap ii fysh swaloweth vp ionas crieth vnto god prayseth hym fysh casteth agayne vpon londe chap iii god sendeth agayne niniue shewe punyshment come yf wil repent amende god mercifull chap iiii ionas angrie complayneth god refourmeth first chapter worde lorde came vnto ionas sonne amithai sayenge aryse4 14 ione 3 gen 10 • get niniue greate cite preach vnto gen 18 • yt wickednesse come vp ionas made ready fle vnto tharsis presence lorde gat downe ioppa founde shippe ready go vnto tharsis payde fare wente aborde might go vnto tharsis presence lorde lorde hurled greate wynde see mightie tempest see shippe ioperdy goinge peces maryners afrayde cried euery man vnto god goodes shippe cast see lighten ionas gat vnder ye hatch layed downe slombred master shippe came sayde vnto slomberest thou vp call vpon thy god yf god happly wil thynke vpon v peryshe sayde one another come let v cast lotte maye knowe whose cause thus troubled • osu 7 c cast lotte lot fell vpon ionas thē sayde vnto tell v whose cause thus troubled thine occupacion whence commest thou countre man art thou nacion answered ebrue feare lorde god heauen made see drie londe ye men exceadingly afrayed sayde vnto didest thou knewe fled presence lorde tolde sayde morouer vnto shall vnto see maye ceasse troublinge v see wrought troublous answered take cast see shal let rest wote sake greate tempest come vpon neuerthelesse men assayed rowinge brynge shippe lōde wolde see wrought troublous agaynst wherfore cried vnto lorde sayde lorde deu 21 b let v perish man death nether laye thou innocent bloude vnto oure charge thou lorde hast done euen thy pleasure toke ionas cast see see lefte ragynge men feared lorde exceadingly doynge sacrifice ād makynge vowes vnto lorde ii chapter bvt lorde prepared greate fyshe swalow vp ionas ionas bely fysh matt 12 thre dayes thre nightes ionas prayed vnto lorde god fysshes bely sayed 〈…〉 trouble called vnto ye lorde herde bely hell cried thou herdest voyce thou haddest cast downe depe ye middest see floude compased aboute 〈…〉 yee thy wawes rowles water went ouer thought bene cast awaye thy sight wil yee agayne loke towarde thy holy temple water compased euen soule depe laye aboute wedes wrapte aboute myne heade wente downe botome hilles barred earth euer thou lorde god hast brought vp lyfe agayne corrupcion soule faynted within thought vpon lorde prayer came vnto euen thy holy temple holde vayne vanyties wil forsake mercy wil sacrifice voyce thankesgeuynge wil paye haue vowed saluacion commeth lorde ye lorde spake vnto ye fysh cast ionas agayne vpon drye londe iii chapter came worde lorde vnto ionas agayne sayenge vp get niniue greate cite 〈…〉 preach vnto preachinge bade ionas arose wente niniue lordes commaundement niniue greate cite vnto god namely thre dayes iourney ionas wente entred ye cite euen dayes iourney cried sayenge yet xl dayes shal niniue ouerthrowen 〈…〉 people niniue beleued god proclamed fastinge▪ arayed selues sack cloth well greate small tydinges came vnto ye kinge niniue arose seate dyd apparell put sack cloth sate downe asshes cried commaunded niniue auctorite kīge lordes sayenge se nether man beest 〈…〉 oxe shepe taist ought nether fede ner drincke water put sack cloth man beest crye mightely vnto god yee se euery man turne frō euell waye wickednesse 〈…〉 yt hath honde tell god maye turne repē te cease fearce wrath perish god sawe workes turned wicked wayes 〈◊〉 ▪ 38 b repented euell sayde wolde vnto dyd iiii chapter wherfore ionas sore discontēt angrie prayed vnto lorde sayde lorde sayenge praye yet countre therfore haisted rather fle vnto tharsis knowe well ynough thou art mercifull god full compassion lōge sufferinge greate kyndnesse repentest thou shuldest take punyshment lorde take life fro beseke rather dye lyue 〈◊〉 19 sayde lorde art thou angrie ionas gat cite sat downe ye east syde therof made bothe sat vnder shadow till might se shulde chaunce vnto cite lorde god prepared wylde vyne sprange vp ouer ionas might haue shadowe aboue heade delyuer payne ionas exceadinge glad wylde vyne vpō nexte morow agaynst springe daye lorde ordened worme smote wylde vyne wethered awaye sōne vp god prepared feruent east wynde sonne bete ouer heade ionas faynted agayne wyszshed vnto soule might dye sayde better dye thē lyue god sayd vnto ionas art thou angrie wylde vyne sayde yee angrie euen vnto deeth lorde sayde thou hast compassion vpon wylde vyne wherō thou bestowdest laboure ner may dest growe sprange vp one night perished another shulde haue compassion vpon niniue greate cite wherin aboue c xx thousande personnes yt knowe right hōde frō lefte besydes moch catell ende prophet 32 esa 1 marcke well earth therin yee lorde god witnesse amonge euen ye lorde holy temple beholde lorde shal go place come downe treade vpon hie thinges earth moūtaynes shall consume vnder esa 26 • valley shal cleue asunder like wax cōsumeth fyre ye water runne downwarde shal wickednesse iacob synnes house israel wickednesse iacob samaria3 12 • 3 11 4 16 21 hye place iuda ierusalē therfore touched ye porte people ierusalē allredy wepe lest geth perceaue • 1 • thou betaphra welter thy self dust asshes thou dwellest sephir get hence shame proude shall boost nomore sorowe hir neghboure tender child make cleane balde aegle shalbe caried awaye captyue ii chapter wo vnto ymagyn harme deuyse vngraciousnesse vpon beddes perfourme ye cleare daye power agaynst god covet haue londe take violence • 21 robbe men house thus oppresse mā house euery man heretage therfore thus sayeth lorde beholde agaynst housholde haue deuysed plage 5 b wherout ye shal plucke youre neckes ye shal nomore people doth contrary therfore must take parte agaynst take awaye cote cloke symple ye haue turned youre selues fight woman people haue ye shot frō good house taken awaye excellent giftes child vp get hence shall ye haue rest idolatry corrupte shall myserably perish yff fleshly felowe preacher lye tolde might syt bebbinge bollynge droncken prophet people gather dede iacob dryue remnaunt israel whole worlde dwell therin iere 10 b esa 34 abac 3 soph • b maye endure wrath able abyde grymme displeasure anger taketh like fyre harde rockes burst sunder ful gracious lorde stronge holde tyme trouble knoweth thē put trust floude renneth ouer destroyeth place darcknesse foloweth still vpon enemy ye ymagin agaynst lorde maner tush hath made ende shal come nomore trouble like thornes sticke together drye strawe shal dronckardes consumed together euen full come ye soch ymagin myschefe geue vngracious councell agaynst lorde therfore thus saieth lorde let thē wel prepared yee many yet shal rote house thy god mich 5 • thy graue shal prepare thou shalt confounded ii chapter beholde vpon mountaynes come fete esa 52 b ro 10 c bryngeth good tydinges preacheth peace iuda kepe thy holy dayes agayne glory iacob like ye glory israel destroyer haue broken downe marred wyne braunches shylde giauntes glistereth men warre clothed purple charettes fyre maketh forwarde archer wel deckte trimmed charettes rolle vpon stretes welter hye wayes loke vpon like cressettes fyre go swyftly lightenynge doth warne giauntes fall araye haistely clymme vp walles yee engyns warre prepared ready water porte shal opened kinges palace shall fall quene hir self shal beled awaye captyue hir gentilwomen shal mourne doues • ob 14 b • oph 2 c grone within hertes niniue like pole full water shal fayne fle stonde greshoppers thy marchauntes haue bene mo starres heauē shal sprede abrode locustes fle waye thy lordes greshoppers thy captaynes multitude greshoppers whē colde remayne ye hedge sonne vp fle awaye fayne bowe selues goinges euerlastinge sure sawe pauilions morians tentes londe madian vexed weerynesse wast thou angrie lorde water thy wrath floudes thy displeasure see yes whē thou sattest vpon thine horse thy charettes victory thou shewdest thy bowe opēly like thou haddest promised ooth vnto trybes sela 〈…〉 thou didest deuyde water earth mountaynes saw afrayed ye water streame wēte awaye depe made noyse liftinge vp thine honde 〈…〉 sonne mone remayned still habitacion thine arowes wente glisteringe thy speares shyne lightenynge 〈…〉 thou trodest downe londe thine anger didest thro •• heithen thy displeasure thou c •• mest forth helpe thy people helpe thi •• anoynted thou smotest downe heade house vngodly discoueredest foundacions euē vnto ye necke sela thou cursest septers captayne men warre come stormy wynde • atre abrode glad maye eat vp ye poore secretly thou makest waye thine horse see euen mudde greate water whē heare body vexed lippes tremble ye voyce therof bone corruppe afrayed stonde might rest daye trouble might go vp vnto oure people alredy prepared fyge tree shal grene vynes shal beare frute laboure ye olyue shalbe lest londe shall br • nge corne shepe shalbe taken ye folde shalbe catell ye stalles wil glad lorde reioyce god sauioure 〈…〉 lorde god strength shall make fete fete hertes geueth ye victory shal bringe hye place synginge vpon psalmes ende prophet abacuc prophet sophony sophony conteyneth chap prophecieth plage come vpon iuda chap ii exorteth amēde maye escape wrath god sheweth gentile punyshment chap iii punyshment wickednesse iewes god therfore refused chose heithen first chapter worde lorde came vnto sophony sonne chusi sonne gedolias sonne amarias ye sonne hezechias tyme iosias sonne amonkinge iuda 〈…〉 gather vp thinges londe saieth lorde wil gather vp man beest wil gather vp foules ayre fysh see greate decaye wicked wil vtterly destroye men londe saieth lorde wil stretch myne honde vpon iuda vpon soch dwel ierusalem thus wil rote remnaunt baal place name kemuryns prestes yee soch vpon house toppes worshipe bowe selues vnto hoost heauen sweare lorde 〈…〉 malchom also starte backe ye lorde nether seke lorde ner regarde straū ge clothinge daye also wil vyset treade ouer thresholde proudly fyll lordes house wt robbery falsede ye tyme saieth lorde shall herde greate crie fyshporte howlinge ye porte greate murthur hilles howle ye dwel myll marchaunt people gone laden syluer roted tyme wil seke thorow ierusalem lanternes 〈…〉 vyset contynue dregges saye hertes tush lorde wil nether good ner euell goodes shalbe spoyled house layed waist amo • 5 b shall buylde house dwel shal plante vynyardes drynke wyne therof ioel 2 greate daye lorde honde harde commeth pace horrible ye tydinges lordes daye shall giaunte crie daye daye wrath daye trouble heuynesse daye vtter destruccion mysery darcke glomynge daye cloudy stormy daye daye noyse trompettes shawmes agaynst stronge city hie towres wil bringe ye people soch vexacion shal go aboute like blinde mē haue synned agaynst lorde bloude shalbe shed dust body myre eze 7 nether syluer ner golde shalbe able delyuer thē wrothfull daye lorde whole londe shalbe cōsumed thorow fyre gelousy soph 3 b shall soone make clene ryddaunce dwell londe ii chapter come together gather ye frauwerde people ye thinge go forth concluded tyme passed awaye dust fearfull ye lorde gaza shal destroyed esa 14 • iere 47 eze 25 c ascalon shall layed waist shal cast aszdod noone daye accaron shal pluckte vp rote wo vnto yt dwel vpon see coost ye murthurous people worde ye heithen shal worshipe euery man place ye moriās also shal perish swerde yee shall stretch honde ouer north destroye assur niniue shal make desolate drye waist flockes beastes people shall lye myddest iust lorde doth vnright amonge euery mornynge shewinge lawe clearly ceassed vngodly lerne aszshamed therfore wil rote people destroye towres yee make stretes voyde man shall go therin city shall brokē downe body shal left ner dwel eny sayde vnto feare cō tent refourmed dwellinge shulde destroyed shulde happen vnto none thinges wherwith shal vyset thē neuertheles stonde vp early folowe filthynes owne ymaginacions therfore ye shal waite vpon saieth lorde vntil tyme stonde vp determed gather people bringe kingdomes together maye poure myne anger yee wrothfull displeasure vpon 〈…〉 iuda • ere 25 b 〈◊〉 b 〈◊〉 1 thou hast bene displeased lxx yeares lorde gaue louynge confortable answere vnto angel talked angel commoned sayde vnto crie thou speake thus saieth lorde hoostes exceadynge gelous ouer ierusalem sion sore displeased carelesse heithen litle angrie dyd best might destroye therfore thus saieth lorde •• ch • wil turne agayne mercy towarde ierusalem house shalbe buylded saieth lorde hoostes yee plommet shal layed abrode ierusalem saieth lorde hoostes crie also speake thus saieth lorde hoostes city shall good prosperite agayne lorde shall yet conforte sion chose ierusalem lift vp myne eye sawe beholde foure horne sayde vnto angel talked answered 〈…〉 ye horne haue scatred iuda israel ierusalem abrode ye lorde shewed iiij carpenter sayde wil answered ouer whole earth sayde get hence go thorow worlde wēte thorow worlde cried vpon spake vnto sayenge beholde go towarde ye north shal still wrath north countre worde lorde came vnto sayenge take lordes trone haue dominacion 〈◊〉 109 •• b 56 • ▪ 8910a prest shall also vpon trone peaceable councell shalbe betwixte crownes shal temple lorde remembraunce vnto helem tobias idaia hen sonne sophony lorde came vnto zachary sayenge thus saieth ye lorde hoostes execute true iudgment shewe mercy louynge kyndnesse zach • exo 22 leui 19 iob 24 iere 7 euery man brother wyddowe fatherlesse straunger poore wronge let man ymagen euell agaynst brother hert iere 7 • neuertheles wolde take hede turned backes stopped eares shulde heare yee made hertes adamant stone lest shulde heare lawe wordes2 pet 1 • lorde hoostes sent holy sprete prophetes afore tyme wherfore lorde hoostes wroth thus come passe iere 11 • like spake wolde heare euen cried wolde heare saieth lorde hoostes scatered amonge gentile knewe thus londe made desolate yt traualed man nether ner fro pleasaunt londe vtterly layed waist viii chapter worde lorde came vnto sayenge thus saieth lorde hoostes greate gelousy ouer sion yee haue bene gelous ouer greate displeasure thus saieth lorde hoostes wil turne agayne vnto sion wil dwel myddest ierusalem esa 1 ierusalem shalbe called faithfull true cite hill lorde hoostes yee holy hill thus saieth lorde hoostes shall yet olde men woman dwel agayne stretes ierusalem yee soch go staues hondes age stretes cite also shalbe full yonge boyes damselles playnge vpon stretes thus saieth lorde hoostes yf residue people thynke vnpossible dayes shulde therfore vnpossible sight mat 1 • sayeth lorde hoostes thus saieth lorde hoostes beholde wil delyuer people londe east west wil brynge agayne maye dwel ierusalem shalbe people iere 3 f heb 8 • apo 21 • god trenth rightuousnesse thus saieth lorde hoostes let youre hondes stronge ye heare wordes mouth prophetes dayes foundacion layed vpon lorde hoostes house temple maye buylded agg 1 • dayes nether men ner catel coude wynne eny thinge nether might eny man come rest trouble let euery man go agaynst neghboure neuerthelesse wil intreate residue people nomore afore tyme saieth lorde hoostes shalbe sede peace • gg 2 c vynyarde shal geue hir frute grounde shal geue hir increase heauens shal geue dew shal cause remnaunt people haue possession shall come passe like ye curse amonge heithen ye house iuda ye house israel euen wil delyuer ye shalbe blessynge feare let youre hō de stronge thus saieth lorde hoostes like deuysed punysh tyme youre father prouoked vnto wrath sayeth lorde hoostes spared euen determed dayes wel vnto house iuda ierusalem therfore feare ye thinges ye shal • e 4 c ch 7 b • 2 b speake euery man treuth vnto neghboure execute iudgment truly peaceably within youre porte none ymagyn euell hert agaynst neghboure loue false oothes thinges hate sayeth lorde worde lorde hoostes came vnto sayenge thus sayeth lorde hoostes fast fourth moneth fast fifth fast seuenth fast tenth shal ioye gladnesse prosperous hye feastes vnto house iuda loue treuth peace thus saieth lorde hoostes shall yet come people inhabiters many city dwell one cite 〈…〉 shal go another sayenge▪ vp let v go praye lorde •• v seke lorde hoostes wil go yee moch people mightie heithen shal come seke lorde hoostes ierusalem praye lorde thus saieth lorde hoostes tyme shal ten men maner language gentile take one iewe hemme garment saye wil go haue herde god amonge ix chapter worde lorde shalbe receaued adrach damascus shal offerynge eye mē trybes israel shall loke vp vnto lorde border hemath shal harde therby tyrus also sidon wise 〈…〉 tyrus shal make hirself stronge heape vp syluer sonde golde claye stretes beholde lorde shal take haue possession shal smyte downe hir power see 〈…〉 shalbe consumed fyre shal ascalon se afrayed gaza shalbe sory shal accaron also 〈…〉 hir hope come confucion kinge gaza shall perish ascalon shal man dwel straūgers shall dwel aszdod ye pryde ye philistynes shal rote bloude take awaye mouth 〈…〉 abhominaciōs amonge teth thus shal left oure god yee shalbe prynce iuda accaron like iebusi compase house rounde aboute men warre goinge fro oppressoure come vpon eny haue sene myne eye reioyce thou greatly doughter sion glad doughter ierusalem lo esa 〈…〉 ioh 〈…〉 thy kinge commeth vnto euen rightuous sauioure lowly symple rydeth vpon asse vpō foale asse wil rote charettes frō ephraim horse ierusalem batel bowes shalbe destroyed shall geue doctryne peace vnto heithen psal 〈…〉 dominion shalbe one see floudes endes worlde thou also thorow bloude thy couenaunt esa 〈…〉 apo 〈…〉 shalt let thy presoners pytte wherin water turne stronge holde ye preson 〈…〉 longe sore delyuered daye bringe worde wil rewarde dubble agayne iuda haue bent bowe ephraim haue fylled thy sonnes siō wil rayse vp agaynst grekes make giauntes swearde lorde god shalbe sene aboue thē dartes shall go forth lightenynge lorde god shall blowe trompet shal come forth storme south lorde hoostes shall defende thē 〈…〉 shall consume deuoure subdue slynge stone shal drynke rage thorow wyne shalbe fylled like ye basens ye horne ye aulter lorde god shal delyuer thē ye daye flock people stonēs sanctuary shalbe set vp lā de prosperous goodly thynge shall corne shall make yonge men chearefull new wyne maydens x chapter praye lorde bytymes geue latter rayne shall lorde make cloudes 〈…〉 geue rayne ynough increace felde vayne answere idol soythsayers se lye tell vayne dreames comforth geue nothynge worth therfore go astraye like flocke shepe ād troubled haue shepherde 〈…〉 wrothfull displeasure moued shepherdes vyset goates lorde hoostes wil graciously vyset flocke house iuda holde goodly fayre horse batell 〈◊〉 12 〈◊〉 1 • b iuda shal come helmet nale batelbowe prince together shalbe giauntes batell treade downe myre vpon ye stretes sha • fight ye lorde shalbe horsmen shalbe confounded wil cōforte house iuda preserue house ioseph wil turne also pytie shal like cast lorde god wil heare ephraim shalbe giaunt herte shalbe cherefull thorow wyne yee child shal se glad herte shal reioyce lorde wil blowe gather together wil redeme shall increace increased afore wil sowe thē amonge people yt maye thinke vpō farre countrees shal lyue wt childrē turne agayne wil bringe agayne also londe egipte gather assiria wil carye ye londe galaad libanus shal wante nothynge shall go vpon see trouble▪ smyte see wawes yt depe floudes shalbe dryed vp proude boostinge assur shalbe cast downe 〈◊〉 10 • 29 scepter egipte shall taken awaye comforte lorde maye walke name saieth lorde xi chapter open thy dores libanus fyre maye consume thy cedre tree howle ye fyrre tree cedre fallē yee ye proude waisted awaye howle ye oke tree baasan ye mightie stronge wod cut downe men maye heare shepherdes mourne glory destroyed mē maye heare lyon whelpes roare pryde iordane waisted awaye thus sayeth lorde god fede shepe ye slaughter shalbe slayne possesse yet take synne yt sell thē saye lorde thanked rich yee owne shepherdes spare therfore wil nomore spare dwell londe sayeth lorde lo delyuer people euery man neghbours honde hōde kynge maye smyte londe hondes wil delyuer fedde ye slaughter shepe poore flocke verely ād toke vnto two staues one called louynge mekenesse called wo kepte shepe thre shepherdes destroyed one moneth might awaye wt apo 22 • nether eny delyte sayde fede nomore thinge dyeth let dye wil perishe let perish let rē naunt eate euery one flesh neghboure toke also louynge meke staff ād brake might disanuil conuenaunt made people broken daye poore symple shepe respecte vnto knewe therby worde lorde sayde vnto yff ye thynke good brynge hither pryce yf leaue wayed downe xxx syluer pen ye value prysed lorde sayde vnto matt 27▪ • cast vnto potter goodly pryce valued toke xxx syluers pen cast potter house lorde brake staff also namely wo might lowse brother heade betwixte iuda israel lorde sayde vnto take also staff foolish shepherde lo rayse vp shepherde londe shall seke thinges lost ner care soch go astraye shall heale wounded shal norish thinge whole shall eate flesh soch fat teare clawes peces idol shepherde leaueth flocke swerde shal come vpon arme vpon right eye arme shalbe clene dried vp right eye shalbe sore blynded xii chapter heuy burthen ye lorde hath deuysed israel thus saieth lorde spred heauēs abrode esa 40 c 4 c 45 b gen 2 b layde foundacion earth geueth man ye breath life beholde make ierusalem cuppe surfet vnto people yt rounde aboute yee iuda also shalbe sege agaynst ierusalem zac 14 c tyme make ierusalem heuy stone people soch lift vp shalbe toarne rēte people earth shalbe gathered together agaynst daye sayeth ye lorde wil make horse abasshed ryde vpon wyttes open myne eye vpon house iuda ād smyte horse people blyndnesse prynces iuda shall saye hertes inhabiters ierusalem shall geue consolacion lorde hoostes god tyme make prynces iuda like hote burnynge ouen wodd abd 1 • mo • 1 like cress het fyre amonge strawe shal cō sume people roūde aboute vpon right honde left ierusalē also shalbe shall fete stōde vpō mount oliuete lieth vpon east syde ierusalē ye mount olyuete shal cleue two eastwarde westwarde yt shal greate valley halff mount shal remoue towarde north half towarde south ye shall fle vnto valley hilles valley hylles shal reach vnto asal yee fle shall ye like yefled earthquake dayes osias kynge iuda 〈◊〉 • 1 lorde god shal come sanctes daye shal light 〈…〉 c colde frost continue somer wynter lorde shalbe kynge ouer earth 〈…〉 tyme shal one lorde name shalbe one men shal go aboute whole earth vpon felde gibea remmon ye south ierusalem▪ shalbe set vp inhabited hir place lorde wil smyte people haue fought agaynst ierusalem namely flesh shall consume awaye though stonde vpon fete eye shall corruppe hole tunge shal consume mouth daye shall lorde make greate sedicion amōge one mā shal take another honde laye hondes vpon hondes neghboure iuda shal fight also agaynst ierusalem zach 12 ād goodes heithen shalbe gathered together rounde aboute golde syluer greate chapter heuy burthen lorde sheweth agaynst israel malachy haue loued sayeth ye lorde ād yet ye saye wherin hast thou loued v esau iacobs brother sayeth lorde yet haue loued iacob gen 25 c ro 9 b iosu 24 gen 36 hated esau yee haue made hilles waist heretage wyldernesse dragōs though edom sayde well destroyed wil go buylde vp agayne place waisted yet sayeth ye lorde hoostes buylded brake downe called cursed londe abd 1 people lorde hath euer bene angrie withall youre eye haue sene ād ye youre selues must confesse ye lorde hath brought londe israel greate honoure shulde sonne honoure father seruaūt master yf father myne honoure exo 20 deu 32 yf lorde feared sayeth lorde hoostes prestes despise name yf ye saye wherin haue despised thy name ye offre vnclene bred vpō myne aulter yf ye wil saye wherin haue offred eny vnclene thynge vnto ye saye aulter lorde regarded yf ye offre ye blynde yt euell yf ye offre lame sick leu 22 • eze 43 c euell yee offre vnto thy prynce shal cōtent accepte thy personne sayeth lorde hoostes make youre prayer god maye haue mercy vpon v soch thinges haue ye done shal regarde youre personnes thynke ye sayeth lorde hoostes yee amonge wil moch shut ye dores kyndle ye fyre vpō myne aulter naught haue pleasure sayeth lorde hoostes meatofferinge wil accepte youre honde 〈…〉 rysinge vp ye sonne vnto ye goinge downe 〈…〉 name greate amonge gentile yee euery place shal sacrifice done clene meatofferinge offred vp vnto name name greate amonge heithē sayeth lorde hoostes ye haue vnhalowed ye saye aulter ye lorde regarded thinge set thervpon worthy eaten saye ye laboure trauayle thus haue ye thought scorne sayeth lorde hoostes offerynge robbery yee lame sicke ye haue brought meatofferynge shulde accepte youre honde sayeth lorde cursed dyssembler hath flocke one male maketh vowe offereth spotted one vnto lorde greate kynge sayeth lorde hoostes name fearfull amonge heithen ii chapter ye prestes commaundement toucheth yf ye heare ner regarde geue glory vnto name sayeth lorde hoostes wil sende curse vpon 〈…〉 curse youre blessinges yee curse yf ye take hede beholde shal corruppe youre sede cast donge youre face euen donge youre solempne feastes shal cleue fast vpon ye shall knowe haue sent commaundement vnto couenaunt made leui might stonde sayeth ye lorde hoostes made couenaunt life peace wt gaue might stonde awe dyd feare ād name reuerence lawe treuth mouth wickednesse founde lippes walked peace ād equyte 〈…〉 dyd turne many one awaye synnes prestes lippes shulde sure knowlege men maye seke lawe mouth messaunger lorde hoostes ye gone clene waye haue caused multitude offended lawe ye haue broken couenaunt leui 〈…〉 sayeth lorde hoostes therfore wil also make despised reputacion amonge ye people ye haue kepte wayes bene parciall lawe haue one father hath one god made v 〈◊〉 4 〈◊〉 7 b • c doth euery one v despyse owne brother breake couenaunt oure father hath iuda offended yee abhominacion done israel ierusalē 〈◊〉 9 〈◊〉 ▪ • 1 c iuda hath defyled sāctuary lorde loued hath kepte doughter straunge god lorde shal destroye mā doth yee master scolar tabernacle iacob offreth vp meatofferynge vnto lorde hoostes haue ye brought poynte agayne aulter lorde couered teares wepynge mournynge nomore regarde meatofferynge nether wil receaue accepte eny thinge youre hō de yet ye saye wherfore euen lorde made couenaūt betwixte ye wife thy youth thou hast despysed yet thyne owne cō panyon maried wife dyd 〈…〉 one yet excellent sprete dyd one sought sede promised god therfore loke well youre sprete let man despyse ye wife youth yf thou hatest put awaye sayeth lorde god israel geue clothinge scorne sayeth lorde hoostes loke well youre sprete despyse ye greue lorde youre wordes yet ye saye wherwithall haue greued ye saye euell good sight god soch please el god punysheth iii chapter beholde wil sende messaunger shal prepare waye 〈…〉 lorde ye wolde haue shal soone come temple yee euen messaunger couenaunt ye longe beholde commeth sayeth lorde hoostes maye abyde daye commynge shalbe able endure appeareth like goldsmythes fyre ād like wasshers sope shall syt downe trye clense ye syluer shal pourge child leui purifie like golde syluer maye brynge meatofferinges vnto lorde rightuousnes shall offeringe iuda ierusalem acceptable vnto lorde like begynninge yeares afore tyme come punysh self wil swift wytnes agaynst witch agaynst aduouterers agaynst false swearer yee ād agaynst wrōgeously kepe backe hyrelynges dewty vexe wyddowes fatherlesse oppresse straunger feare sayeth lorde hoostes lorde yt chaunge ye child iacob wil leaue ye gone awaye fro myne ordinaūces deu • 1 f 4 17 c sen ye tyme youre forefather haue ye kepte turne vnto wil turne vnto sayeth lorde hoostes zach 1 ye saye wherin shal turne shulde man vse falsede disceate god ye vse falsede disceate yet ye saye wherin vse disceate tythes heaue offerynges leui 27 agg 1 b therfore ye cursed penury ye dyssemble sorte brynge euery tythe barne yt maye meat myne house proue withall sayeth lorde hoostes yf wil open wyndowes heauen vnto poure blessinge plenteousnesse yee shal reproue consumer youre sake shall eate vp frute youre grounde nether shal ye vynyarde baren felde sayeth ye lorde hoostes moch people shal saye ye blessed ye shall pleasaunt lōde sayeth lorde hoostes ye speake hard wordes agaynst sayeth lorde yet ye saye haue spoken agaynst ye haue sayed lost laboure serue god profit haue kepynge commaundementes iob 21 b psal 72 b walkinge humbly lorde hoostes therfore maye saye iob 21 iere 12 • proude happie deale vngodlynesse set vp tempte god yet escape feare god saye thus one another lorde cōsidreth heareth yee memoriall boke written soch feare lorde remembre name daye wil make saieth ye lorde hoostes shalbe myne owne possession fauoure like man fauoureth owne sonne doth seruyce turne therfore considre difference betwixte rightuous vngodly betwixte serueth god ād serueth marck daye commeth shall burne ouē psal 17 proude yee soch wickednesse shalbe straw daye come shall burne thē vp sayeth lorde hoostes shal leaue nether rote ner braunch vnto feare name shall sōne rightuousnesse aryse cursynge ende prophet malachy apocripha bokes treatise amonge father olde rekened like authorite bokes byble nether foūde canon hebrue thirde boke eszdras fourth boke eszdras boke tobias boke iudith certayne chapter hester boke wyszdome ecclesiasticus storye susanna storye bell first boke machabees seconde boke machabees vnto also belongeth baruc haue set amōge prophetes next vnto ieremy scrybe tyme transzlatoure vnto reader bokes good reader called apocrypha iudged amonge doctours like reputacion scripture thou mayest perceaue ierome epistola ad paulinum chefe cause therof many place seme repugnaunt vnto open manyfest trueth bokes byble neuertheles haue gathered together intent wolde haue despysed litle sett shulde thinke false able proue yee doute verely yf equally conferred open scripture tyme place circumstaunce thinges considered shulde nether seme contrary ner vntruly peruersly aledged treuth mās face sene wel water fayre glasse nether cā shewed clearly water stered moued styll water many darck place scripture haue bene sore stered myxte blynde cuvetous opynions men haue cast soch myst afore eye ye symple longe cō ferred place scripture shall seme wyse vnderstonde cuvetousnes expoundeth euer thou readest scripture let holy goost thy teacher let one text expounde another vnto soch dreames vision darck sentence hyd thy vnderstondinge commytte vnto god make article let playne text thy gyde sprete god author therof shal lede trueth prayer salomō thou findest herin ye prayer azarias swete songe two felowes songe fyre first namely prayer salomon readest thou eight chapter thirde boke kynges appeareth apocryphum prayer songe namely thre child haue founde amonge eny interpreter onely olde latyn texte reporteth theodotios translacion neuertheles yt weake scrupulous sake also loue soch swete songes thankesgeuinge haue left intent one shulde haue cause complayne also might haue occasion geue thankes vnto god aduersite thre child dyd fyre grace amen thirde boke eszdras boke conteyneth chap vertuous kynge osias renueth seruyce god setteth prestes ordre holdeth feast easter death iechonias sonne kynge ioachim sedechias chap ii god moueth kinge cyrus delyuer presoners like promysed prophet ieremy kynge artaxerses whose auctorite iewes forbydden buylde vp ierusalem chap iii feast kinge darius made thre yonge men wrote euery one sentence proue might saye best first sheweth mynde chap iiii seconde goeth aboute proue sentence wisest zorobabel getteth victory trueth beareth euer bell darius cōmaundeth buylde vp ierusalem agayne chap v many come agayne ierusalem captiuyte babilon tēple altare buylded agayne heithen withstonde chap vi officer syria laboure vnto kynge darius forbyd buyldinge temple ierusalem commaundeth kepe ordinaunce kynge cyrus made chap vii aduersaries myndes satisfied buyldinge fynished passeouer holden chap viii eszdras beinge discharged letter commaūdemēt kinge artaxerses go vp ierusalem complaynte concernynge defyled vncleane chap ix councell taken touchinge vncleane mariage first chapter iosias helde feast easter ierusalem vnto lorde 〈◊〉 23 23 c slewe ye passeouer xiiij daye first moneth set ye prestes also ordre acordīge daylie course beynge arayed longe garmētes tēple lorde spake vnto leuites holy minister israel shulde halowe selues vnto lorde set holy arke lorde house kynge salomō sonne dauid buylded sayde ye shal nomore beare arke vpon yor shulders serue yoor lorde take charge people israel youre vyllagies youre trybes acordinge kynge dauid kynge israel hath ordened acordinge salomon sonne hath honorably prepared yee loke yt ye seruyce temple acordinge ordringe distribucion pryncipall mē appoynted trybes seruyce childrē israel 〈◊〉 12· kyll ye passeouer prepare offeringes yor brother accordinge commaundemēt ye lorde gaue vnto moses vnto ye people yt foūde iosias gaue xxx thousande shepe lambes kyddes goates thre thousande oxē kynge kyngly liberalite gaue vnto people acordinge promysed prestes passeouer gaue two thousande shepe hundreth oxē morouer iechonias semeias nathanael brother hasabias iehiel iosabad gaue passeouer fyue thousande shepe fyue hundreth bullockes whan thinges brought passe prestes leuites stode goodly ordre vnleuended bred thorow ye trybes ordringe pryncipall men trybes offred vnto lorde sight people acordinge wrytten boke moses exo 12▪ rosted easterlambe acordinge thākofferinges dight thē kettels pottes sett people wt good afterwarde selues prestes prestes offred fatt vntyll tyme expyred leuites prepared selues brother childrē aaron syngers also ye child asaph stode ordre acordinge dauid deuysed dyd asaph zachary iedithū appoynted kynge morouer porter dorekepers stode dores yt diligently yt none wente stondinge seruyce brother leuites prepared thus thinges perfourmed belonged offringe lorde daye helde passeouer offred thankofferinges besyde ye sacrifice ye lorrde acordinge ye cōmaundement kynge iosias child israel thē present helde honorable passeouer feast swete bred vij dayes lōge yee soch passeouer kepte israel ye tyme prophet samuel kynges israel helde soch easter kynge iosias helde ye prestes ye leuites ye iewes israel thē yt ierusalē ye xviij yeare ye raigne iosias passeouer kepte wt parfecte hert dyd kynge iosias ordre workes ye lorde ye thinges yt wryttē hī tymes past cōcernynge yt synned vngodly agaynst ye lorde people yt sought worde ye lorde vpon israel actes kynge iosias pharao ye kynge egipte wēte vp4 2 • • par 25 came towarde carcamis euphrates iosias wēte mete hī sent kynge egipte vnto iosias sayenge haue wt ye kynge iuda sent ye lorde fight agaynst ye warre vpō euphrates go thou ye waye home agayne ye haist iosias wolde turne agayne vpon charet vndertoke fight agaynst herkened vnto ye worde ye prophet tolde mouth god pitched battaill agaynst ye felde mageddo prynces preassed kynge iosias sayde kynge vnto seruauntes 〈◊〉 2 • f cary awaye battayll sore wounded immediatly seruauntes toke awaye front battayll satt vp vpon secōde charett came ierusalē dyed buried father sepulcre iewry mourned iosias yee ruler also wt wyues made lamētacion vnto daye done euer still israel thinges written boke story ye kynges iuda namely actes workes kynge iosias kyngly power maiesty vnderstandinge lawe god dyd yee thinges wryttē boke kynges israel iuda ye people toke iechonias sonne iosias 〈◊〉 23 f 〈◊〉 36 made kynge ye steade iosias father whan xxxiij yeare olde raigned ouer israel thre monethes kinge egipte put downe yt shulde raigne ierusalē raysed vp taxinge people namely c talentes syluer one talēt golde kinge egipte also made ioachim brother kynge iuda ierusalē thē kinges councell wt kynge zaraceles brother toke thē caried thē awaye presoners egipte fyue twentie yeare olde ioachim whan made kynge londe iuda ierusalem dyd euell lorde nabuchodonosor ye kynge babylō came vp bounde wt bandes yron reg • c caried vnto babilō nabuchodonosor also toke ye vessell yt halowed tēple lorde ye iewels caried thē vnto babilon brought thē owne tēple babilon vnclennes vngodlynes writtē ye boke actes ye kynges ioachim sonne raigned steade made kynge beinge xviij yeare olde raigned thre monethes x dayes ierusalē dyd euell lorde yeare nabuchodonosor sent caused brought vnto babilon wt ye holy vessel ye lorde made sedechias brother kynge iuda ierusalē whan xxj yeare olde raigned xj yeare dyd euell also ye sight ye lorde cared ye wordes yt spokē vnto hī ye prophet ieremy ye mouth lorde iere 〈…〉 made • oth vnto kynge nabuchodonosor manswor • fell frō hauynge stiff neck hert trāsgressed ye statute ordinaunces lorde god israel ruler also heades ye people lorde dyd moch euell became vngodly thē heithen beynge defyled maner abhominaciōs yee defyled ye holy tēple lorde ierusalē god father sent messaungers vnto thē turne backe call thē agayne frō synnes wolde fayne haue spared thē holy tabernacle sake neuertheles messaungers derision loke god spake vnto thē prophetes made sporte drew longe tyll lorde wroth wt people vngodlynes tyll caused kinges ye caldees come vp slew yonge men wt swerde yee euen compasse holy tēple spared body nether yonge ner olde nether mayden ner yonge man delyuered power kynges ye caldees holy vessel lorde kynges treasure toke caried vnto babilon house lorde 〈…〉 brēt brake downe walles ierusalē set fyre vpon hir towres destroyed hir noble buyldinges brought naught people slayne swerde caried vnto babilon thus became ye presoners bōdemē ye kynge babilon tyll delyuered raygned selues wordes lorde fulfilled promysed mouth prophet ieremy tyll londe hir rest namely tyme yt laye wayest 〈…〉 rest quyetnes lxxvij yeares ii chapter whā kynge cyrus raigned ouer persian 〈…〉 whā lorde wolde perfourme worde yt promysed mouth prophet ieremy lorde raysed vp sprete cyrus kynge persiās yt caused wrytinge proclamed thorow whole realme sayenge thus sayeth kynge ye persian lorde israel hye lorde hath made kynge lōde commaunded buylde house ierusalem iewry yf eny youre people ye lorde go vp ierusalem dwell rounde aboute yt place shal helpe thē whether golde syluer giftes horse necessary catell thinges brought wt fre wyll house lorde ierusalē pryncipall mē trybes vyllages iuda ben iamin stode vp dyd prestes also leuites whō lorde moued go vp buylde house lorde ierusalē aboute helped wt maner golde syluer catell also many liberall giftes dyd many one whose mynde stered vp therto kynge cyrus also brought forth vessel ornamentes halowed vnto lorde nabuchodonosor kynge babilon caried awaye ierusalem consecrated idoll ymage delyuered mithridatus treasurer delyuered salmanasar ye debyte iewry nōbre two thousande iiijc syluer boule xxx syluer basens xxx basens golde ijm iiijc vessel syluer thousande besyde vessel golde syluer vmviijc lx nombred vnto salmanasar come agayne ierusalē captiuyte babilon tyme kynge artaxerses kynge persia men balemus mithridatus sabellius rathimus balthemus semelius ye scrybe dwelt samaria place vnder ye dominion therof wrote letter vnto kynge artaxerses wherin complayned vnto kynge iewry ierusalem letter made maner syr thy seruauntes rathimus story wryter sabellius scrybe iudges thy courte celosyria phenices knowne manifest lorde kyn iewes come vp frō vnto v rebellious wicked cite begynne buylde agayne walles aboute set vp tēple new yf cite walles therof sett vp agayne shal refuse geue trybutes taxinges also rebell vtterly agaynst kynge moch take hande aboute temple thought reason thinke scorne shewe vnto lorde kynge certifie therof intent yt yf please kinge maye cause sought bokes olde thou shalt fynde soch warnynge wrytten shalt vnderstonde cite hath allwaye bene rebellious disobedient hath subdued kynges city iewes dwell therin haue euer bene rebellious obstinate vnfaithfull fightinge people cause cite waysted wherfore certifie oure lorde kynge yf cite buylded occupied agayne walles therof set vp new thou canst haue passage celosyria phenices wrote kynge rathimus story wryter balthemus sabellius ye scrybe officer dweller syria phenices maner haue red epistle thou sentest vnto haue commaunded make diligent search haue founde cite hath euer resisted kynges people dishobedient haue caused moch warre mightie kynges haue raigned ierusalem also haue raysed vp taxinges syria phenices wherfore haue commaūded people shal buylde cite make procede buyldinge moch might cause warre displeasure vnto kynges whan rathymus sabellius scrybe ruler londe red wrytinge kynge artaxerses gatt together came haist ierusalem hoost horseman moch people fote forbad buylde left buyldinge temple vnto seconde yeare kynge darius iii chapter kynge darius made greate feast vnto seruaūtes vnto courte officer medium persia yee debytes ruler vnder india vnto ethiopia hundreth xxvij countrees whan eaten dronken beinge satisfied gone home agayne darius kynge wente chambre layed downe slepe awaked thre yonge men kepte kynges personne watched body commoned amonge selues spake one another let euery one v saye thinge loke whose sentence wyser excellent vnto shal kinge darius geue greate giftes clothe purple shal geue vessel golde drynke clothes golde coueringes shall make costly charett brydle golde shall geue bonet whyte sylke chayne golde aboute neck yee shal seconde pryncipall nexte vnto kynge darius wyszdome shalbe called ye kynges kynsman euery one wrote meaninge sealed layed vnder kinges pelowe sayde whan kynge aryseth geue oure wrytinges loke whose worde kynge chefe lordes iudge wysely spoken shall haue victory one wrote wyne stronge thinge secōde wrote kynge strō ger thirde wrote wemen haue yet strength aboue thinges ye trueth beareth awaye victory whan kynge rysen vp toke wrytinges delyuered vnto hered sent forth call chefe lordes debytes ruler countrees medium persia whan sett downe councell wrytinges red commaunded call ye yonge mē yt might declare meanynges thēselues mouth sent came ye kynge sayde vnto shew v make v vnderstōde thinges ye haue wrytten beganne first spokē strength wyne sayde ye men wyne maruelous strōge • ro 20 ouercōmeth ye drynke disceaueth mynde bryngeth poore man ye kynge dotage vanite thus doth also wt bondman fre poore rych taketh awaye vnderstondinge maketh careles mery none remembreth eny heuynes dett dewtie causeth man thinke also ye thinge doth honest good remembreth kynge yt auctorite yt ought soch thinges morouer whan men drynckinge forgett frendshipe brotherly faithfulnes loue soone dronckē drawe swerde wil fight whā layed downe frō wyne rysen vp agayne tell dyd iudge ye wyne strongest wolde el take hande soch thinges whan spoken helde tonge iiii chapter seconde sayde yt kynge stronger beganne speake sayēge ye men strongest excellent yt cōquere lōde see yt ye see earth kynge lorde thinges hath dominion thē loke cō maūdeth done yf sende mē forth warfare go breake downe hilles walles towres slayne slaye oher men selues ouer passe ye kynges worde yf get victory brynge kynge spoyle likewyse yt medle wt warres fightinge tyll grounde whan reape brynge trybute vnto ye kynge yf ye kynge alone cōmaunde kyll kyll yf cō maunde forgeue forgeue yf cōmaunde smyte smyte yf byd dryue awaye dryue awaye yf commaunde buylde buylde yf cōmaūde breake downe breake downe yf cōmaunde plante plāte comon people ye ruler obedient vnto ye kynge meane season sytteth hī downe eateth drynketh taketh rest thē kepe watch roūde aboute ye kinge one thē darre gett ye waye owne busynes must obediēt vnto ye kinge worde iudge ye ye men shulde go farre aboue vnto men thus obediēt whan spokē helde tonge thirde whose name zorobabel spokē wemen ye trueth begāne saye maner ye mē ye greate kynge multitude mē nether wine yt excelleth thē yt hath ye lordshipe ouer thē haue wemen borne kynge ye people yt rule thinges haue wemē borne thē brought thē vp yt plante vynes wher ye wyne cōmeth make garmē te mē geue honor vnto men wt wemen men lyue yf gather golde syluer precious thinges se fayre wel fauoured womā leaue together turne eye onely vnto woman gape vpon haue desyre vnto vnto syluer golde eny maner precious thinge 〈…〉 mā leaueth father yt brought vp leaueth owne naturall coūtre cleueth vnto woman yee ioperdeth life woman remembreth nether father ner mother ner countre ye must nedes knowe yt wemen haue ye domynion ouer doth greue mā taketh swerde goeth waye steale kyll murther sayle vpon see seyth lyon goeth darcknes hath stollen disceaued robbed bringeth vnto loue agayne man loueth wyfe better father mother yee many one renne wyttes become bondman wyues sake many one also haue perished haue bene slayne haue synned wemen beleue knowe kynge greate power lōdes stō de awe man darre laye hande vpon yet dyd se yt apame ye daughter greate kynge bartacus kynges cōcubine satt besyde kynge vpō right hāde toke crowne heade set vpon hir owne heade smote kynge hir left hande morouer kynge loked vpō wt open mouth yf laughed vpon laughed also yf toke eny displeasure kynge fayne flater geue good wordes till gotten hir fauoure agayne ye men wemen stronger greate earth hie heauen thinges kynge prynces loked one vpon another beganne speake trueth ye men wemē stronger greate earth hye heauen swyft course sonne compaseth heauen rounde aboute 〈◊〉 1 fetcheth course againe owne place one daye excellent doth yee greate trueth stronger thinges earth calleth vpon trueth heauen prayseth workes shake tremble vnrighteous thinge wine vnrighteous kynge vnrighteous wemen vnrighteous child men vnrighteous yee workes vnrighteous trueth vnrighteousnes also shall destroyed perish 〈◊〉 40 〈◊〉 116 ye trueth endureth allwaye stronge lyueth cōquereth euermore worlde without ende trueth accepteth personnes putteth difference betwixte rych poore betwixte ye mightie symple doth right vnto euery mā whether euel good men louyngly dealt withall workes iudgment vnrighteous thinge strength kingdome power maiesty euermore blessed god trueth helde tōge ye people cried sayde greate trueth aboue sayde kynge vnto axe thou wilt appoynted wrytinge shal geue thou art founde wyser thy companyons thou shalt sytt nexteme kynsman sayde vnto kynge remembre thy promyse vowe thou hast vowed promysed daye whan thou camest kyngdome buylde vp ierusalem sende againe vessel iewels taken awaye ierusalem cyrus separated whan offred babilon wolde sende agayne thy minde buylde vp temple edomites brēt whan ierusalem destroyed caldees onely kynge thinge requyre ye maiesty desyre axe thou perfourme vowe thou thine owne mouth hast made vnto kynge heauen darius kynge stode vp kyssed him2 esd 2 • 3 esd 6 • wrote letter vnto debytes shreues ye lordes noble yt shulde conveye forth yt wolde go vp wrote letter also vnto ye shreues yt celosyria phenices vnto libanus yt shulde harle cedre tree libanus vnto ierusalem buylde ye cite withall morouer wrote vnto ye iewes gone realme iewry fredome yt officer ruler ner shreue shulde come dores londe▪ conquered shulde fre tributary edomytes shulde geue ouer city vyllagies iewes taken yee shulde yearly geue xx talētes ye buyldinge temple vntill tyme fynished daylie halowinge brent offeringes commaunded ten talentes yearly also yt come babilon buylde cite shulde haue fre lybertie child prestes wrote greatnesse also commaunded holy garment shulde geuen thē wherin ministred wrote commaundementes shulde geuen leuites vntill daye house fynished ierusalem buylded vp cō maunded watched cite shulde haue porcions wagies gaue ouer also vessell yt cyrus separated babilon yt cyrus geuē cōmaundement ye charged also yt shulde done sent vnto ierusalem whan yonge mā gone forth turned face towarde ierusalē praysed ye kinge heauē sayde ye cōmeth victory 〈◊〉 1 cōmeth wyszdome clearnesse thy seruaunt blessed art thou hast geuen wyszdome wyll prayse lorde thou god oure father toke letter wente vnto babilon whan came tolde vnto brethrē yt babilō praysed ye god father yt geuē refreszshinge lyberte go vp buylde ierusalē temple called name lorde reioysed instrumentes gladnesse seuen dayes longe v chapter prynciall mē ye vyllagies chosen trybes kinreddes shulde go vp wiues child seruauntes maydens catell substaunce darius kynge sent thousande horsmen conveye safely vnto ierusalem brethrē glad playenge vpon instrumētes synginge name mē wente vp vyllagies acordinge trybes prestes sonne phineas sonne aaron iesus sonne iosedec • att 1 b ioachim sonne zorobabel sonne salathiel kynred dauid kynred phares trybe iuda spake wonderfull thinges vnder darius kynge persia esd 4 b ye seconde yeare raigne first moneth nisan also iewry came vp turned agayne vnto ierusalem captiuyte nabuchodonosor ye kynge babilon brought vnto babilon euery man sought porcion agayne iewry cite came wt zorobabel iesus nehemias saraias raelaias elimeus emmanius mardocheus beelserus mechpsa rochor oliorus emonias one prynces nōbre thē acordinge kynreddes ruler childrē phares two thousande hundreth lxxij child are iijm c lvij child femo c xlij sonnes iesus ioabes miijc two sonnes beniu ijmiiijc lxx sonnes choroba ijc v sonnes banica c lxviij sonnes rebech iiijc thre sonnes archad iiijc xxvij sonnes cham xxxvij sonne zoroar ijm lxvij sonnes adinu iiijc
