salomon euen iiijc lxxxij folowinge yt wēte vp frō chelmellat thelarsa whose prynces carmelā careth might shewe forth city kynreddes israel sonnes dalarus ye sonnes tubē ye sonnes ef nechodaicus ye prestes yt executed ye office ye presthode founde sonnes obia ye sonnes achisos sonnes addin maried one ye daughter phargeleu named writinge ye kynred sought ye register generacion foūde therfore forbyddē execute ye office ye presthode vnto sayde nehemias astharas yt shulde haue porcion ye sanctuary tyll rose vp hie prest yt well instructe playne clearnes trueth israel besyde seruauntes maydens xlijmiijc xl seruauntes maydens vijmiijc xxxvj synginge mē synginge wemen ijc lxv foure hundreth xxxv camel seuen thousande xxxvj horse two hundreth thousande xlv mooles fyue thousande xxxv ass heades also ruler trybes whan came ierusalem wolde buylde sett vp ye tēple god againe place gaue abylite vnto tēple ye treasure ye seruyce sāctuary xijm poundes golde v thousande syluer hundreth prestes garmētes dwelt prestes leuites people yt wente ierusalē countre aboute syngers also porter euery one israel owne lande whan seuenth moneth came whan childrē israel euery man busines1 esd • came one cōsent courte ye east dore stode iesua sonne iosedec brother ye prestes zorobabel sonne salathiel brother settinge vp aulter offre brent sacrifice vpon written ye lawe moses came people also countrees heithen londes set vp aulter place offred sacrifice brent offerynges vnto lorde mornynge helde feast tabernacle commaunded lawe leu • 23 f daylie offred acordinge made sacrifice appoynted offeringes also sabbathes new moones holy feastes1 esd 3 b vowed offerynges vnto lorde beganne new moone ye seuēth moneth offre vnto god temple lorde yet buylded gaue vnto mason carpēters money meate drynke chearfulnesse vnto sydon also tyre gaue carte yt shulde cary cedre tree libanus ieastes beames shulde make shippes hauen ioppa acordinge appoynted ordeyned cyrus kynge persian seconde yeare came temple god ierusalem seconde moneth beganne zorobabel sonne salathiel eccl • 49 c iesua sonne iosedec brother prestes leuites come vnto ierusalem captiuyte babilon layed foundacion temple new moone seconde moneth seconde yeare yt come iewry ierusalem appoynted leuites aboue xx yeare olde vnto seruyce lorde iesua sonnes brother leuites stode together perfourmed lawe ordinaunce house lorde prestes stode garmentes trompettes leuites sonnes asaph cymbal geuynge thankes prayses vnto lorde acordinge dauid kynge israel ordeyned1 par 17 b songe dyd synge vnto lorde maner synge vnto lorde psal 135 gracious goodnes vpon israel endureth euer people blew trompettes sunge loude voyce praysynge lorde together rearinge vp house lorde came also amonge prestes leuites ruler elder acordinge trybes kynreds soch sene house afore buyldinge temple greate crye greate mournynge many also trompettes greate ioye moch trompettes might wel herde wepynge mournynge comon people blew goodly vpō trompettes came enemy trybes iuda ben iamin • esd 4 knowe trōpettynge noyse shawmes might perceaued yt come agayne captiuyte wolde buylde temple new vnto lorde god israel wente zorobabel iesua ruler vyllages sayde vnto shal buylde wt also like wyse haue herde youre lorde walke maner dayes aszbazareth kinge assiria brought v hither zorobabel iesua ruler village israel sayde vnto mete ye shulde buylde temple oure god wt v oure selues alone wil buylde vnto lorde esd • like cyrus kynge persian hath commaūded v heithen londe layed selues iewry helde vp buyldinge layed wayte vpō preuely stopped soch brought eny thinge forbad buylde hyndered made thē passage buyldinge shulde fynished contynued longe kynge cyrus lyued put buyldinge space two yeare vntill ye raigne kynge darius vi chapter wt stondinge seconde yeare raigne darius e 5 aggeus zachary sonne addo prophecied vpon iewry ierusalem name god israel zorobabel sonne salathiel iesua sonne iosedec stode vp 〈…〉 beganne buylde house lorde ierusalem prophetes lorde helped tyme came sysennes vnder shreue syria phenices landlordes companyons sayde vnto hath bydden commaunded buylde house make rofe thinges agayne worke men buylde neuertheles elder iewes soch grace lorde wolde lett though prouoked therto buylded still vntill tyme kynge darius certified therof answere receaued letter men sent vnto kynge darius maner sysennes vnder shreue syria phenices landlordes cō paniōs head ruler syria phenices sende salutacion vnto darius kynge certifie oure lorde kynge came londe iewry wente ierusalem founde buyldinge greate house god tēple greate costly frestone goodly tymbre walles yee make greate haist worke helpe one another goeth forth prosperously handes greate diligence worshipe made axed elder cōmaunded make vp house buyldinge dyd ye intēt might certifie perfectly wryte vnto name yt ye ruler worke gaue v answere seruauntes lorde made heauen earth house 〈…〉 hath bene buylded set vp afore tyme greate mightie kynge israel whan oure father prouoked god vnto wrath synned agaynst god israel 〈…〉 gaue thē ouer power nabuchodonosor kynge babilon kynge caldees brake downe ye house brēt caried awaye people presoners vnto babilon neuertheles first yeare kynge cyrus reigned babilon 〈…〉 cyrus kynge wrote commaunded buylde vp house agayne ornamentes nabuchodonosor caried awaye ierusalem vnto babilon appropriated vnto owne temple brought cyrus forth agayne delyuered zorobabel salmanasar vndershreue commaundynge yt shulde brynge ornamentes agayne ierusalē ye tē ple begynne yt tyme forth buylde tēple agayne owne place thē salmanasar layed foundacion ye lordes house ierusalem euer sence haue buylded yet ended therfore kynge yf thou thynkest good let sought lybraries rolles kynge cyrus yf founde thē done wt councell cōsent kynge cyrus yf oure lorde ye kynge mynded let wryte vnto v therof cōmaunded kinge darius seke lybraries 〈…〉 egbathanis litle cite medium founde soch wrytinge first yeare raigne cyrus kynge cyrus cōmaunded yt house lorde ierusalem shulde buylded agayne odoures made contynually vnto lorde whose heyth shalbe ten cubites ye bredth lx cubites iiij square wt thre hewen stone wt lofte tymbre countre yee wt new loft expense therof geuen ye house kynge cyrus ornamētes golde syluer yt nabuchodonosor toke house lorde ierusalem shalbe set agayne temple ierusalē afore sysennes also vndershreue syria phenices ye prynces companyons yt head ruler syria phenices shall medle ner haue eny thinge place cyrus haue cōmaunded also shal buylde house lorde whole vp haue ordeyned helpe yt come captiuyte tyll house lorde fynished trybute taxinge yearly raysed vp syria phenices diligently geue certayne summe offerynge lorde delyuered vnto zorobabel officer therwithall maye ordeyne ox rammes lambes corne salt wyne oyle contynually euery yeare expences prestes ierusalem shew made daylie 〈…〉 shalbe geuen vnto without delaye maye offer sacrifice daylie hyest god kynge seruauntes praye lyues let proclamed also euery syde euer breaketh despyseth cōmaundement ye kynge shalbe hanged vpon galow made owne good goodes shalbe seasoned vnto ye kynge lorde therfore whose name called vpon rote destroye ye kynges people vndertake violence hynder deale vncurteously wt house lorde ierusalem darius kinge haue ordeyned thinges shalbe done diligence vii chapter sysennes ye vndershreue celosyria phenices landlordes companyons obeyed thinges kynge darius ordened diligent holy workes felow helper olde ruler iewes worke sanctuary wente forth prospered whan aggeus zachary prophecied perfourmed thinges thorow commaundement lorde god israel deuyce cyrus darius artaxerses kynges persia thus oure house fynished vnto xxiij daye moneth addar ye vj yeare kynge darius child israel prestes leuites come captiuyte soch ioyned vnto dyd acordinge wrytten boke moses dedicacion temple offred hundreth ox c rammes iiijc lambes xij goates synnes people israel ye nombre trybes israel prestes also leuites stode arayed prestly garmētes ye trybes ouer ye workes lorde god israel acordinge ye boke moses porter dores child israel wt yt come captiuyte helde passeouer xiiij daye first moneth whan prestes leuites sanctified came captiuyte sanctified together leuites sanctified together came captiuyte kylled easter lambe brethrē prestes selues childrē israel yt came captiuyte escaped frō ye abhominacions heithē sought lorde kepte feast vnleuended bred vij day longe eatinge drynkynge mery lorde yt lorde turned deuyce kynge assiria comforted handes workes ye lorde god israel viii chapter whan artaxerses kynge ye persiās raigned1 esd 7 wē te vnto eszdras sonne saraias sonne azarias sonne helchia ye sonne sallū sonne sadoc ye sonne achitob sonne amarias ye sonne azarias sonne boccus ye sonne abisu ye sonne phineas sonne eleazar ye sonne aaron ye first prest eszdras wēte vp babilon good vnderstondinge ye lawe moses yt geuē lorde god israel taught done dede ye kinge fauoured dyd greate worshipe honoure desyres wente vp also certayne ye child israel prestes ye leuites syngers porter mynisters ye temple ierusalem vij yeare raigne kynge artaxerses v moneth yt vij yeare raigne wente babilon newmoone v moneth came hye waye ierusalē commaundement like lorde prospered iourney eszdras gat greate instruccion yt shulde leaue none ye thinges behynde ye lawe cōmaundementes god taught whole israel righteousnes iudgment came secretary kynge artaxerses delyuered ye wrytinges yt come frō artaxerses kynge eszdras prest reder lawe lorde ye copye ye letter kynge artaxerses sendeth gretinge vnto eszdras prest reder lawe ye lorde frendshipe good haue ordeyned charged yf eny iewes ye prestes leuites realme desyreth contēt go wt vnto ierusalē yt maye therfore yf eny mynded beare cōpany let thē come together go wt like contēt vij frendes coūcelers se ierusalē iewry kepe ye thinges acordinge thou hast ye lawe lorde bringe giftes vnto god lorde israel yt frendes haue promysed ierusalē syluer golde yt ye countre babilon vnto ye lorde ierusalē wt thinge yt geuē people lordes temple ierusalem yee syluer golde maye gathered ox rammes shepe goates belōge thinges maye offer sacrifice vnto lorde vpon aulter lorde ierusalem euer thou thy brethrē wyl wt syluer golde yt ye mynde cōmaundement lorde thy god like wyse wt holy vessel yt geuē seruyce house lorde thy god thinges soeuer necessary worke temple yt shalbe geuē kynges treasure loke thou thy brethrē wilt golde syluer ye wil lorde kynge artaxerses haue commaunded kepers ye treasure syria phenices soeuer eszdras prest reder lawe lorde doth wryte shalbe geue • tyll c talentes syluer golde lyke maner corne also c measure tyll hūdreth vessel wyne plenteous thinges without nombre let thinges done lawe ye hyest god wrath god aryse realme kynge sonnes commaunde also ye requyne taxinge ner tribute prestes leuites syngers mynisters temple ner wryters man haue auctorite medle eny thinge eszdras set thou iudges arbitrers whole lande syria phenices wyszdome god lerne soch ignoraunt lawe god thy lorde let offende agaynst lawe punyshed whether death payne condemned money banyshed sayde eszdras ye wryter blessed ye god oure father hath geuen good mynde wyll hert kynge magnifie house yt ierusalem hath made accepted sight ye kynge councell frē de noble stedfast mynde acordinge lorde god helped chose men israel go vp heades kynreds house father wente vp babilon esd • kyngdome artaxerses sonnes phares gersonius ye sonnes siemarith amenus sonnes dauid accus sonne cecilia sonnes phares zachary turned agayne hundreth fiftie men sonnes captayne moabilon zaraei ijc l men sonnes zachnes iechonias zecholi ijc l men sonnes salamaasias gotholie lxx sonnes zaphacia zaria miheli lxxx sonnes iob abdias ieheli ijc xij men sonnes bania salimoth sonne iosaphia c lx men sonnes beer zachary bebei ijc viij men sonnes esead iohannes ezechan cx men sonnes adonicā last name eliphalam ye sonne gebel semeias lxx men called together water thia pitched oure tentes thre dayes mustered 〈…〉 sonnes prestes leuites founde none sent vnto eleazar eccelom masman malobam enaathan samea ioribimathan eunagan zachary mosollamū leders men experiēce sent worde shulde come vnto loddeus place treasury commaunded shulde speake vnto loddeus brother treasury sende v soch mē might execute prestes office house lorde oure god wt mightie hāde oure lorde god brought vnto v mē good experience amōge sonnes moolius sonne leui ye sonne israel sebebeiam sonnes brethrē aszbin anim xviij amō ge child sonnes cananeus sonnes xx men yt serued temple dauid ordeyned pryncipall men ministred worke vnto leuites temple ijc xx men whose name tokened vp wrytinge commaunded fastynge vnto ye yonge men lorde 1 esd 8 • yt might desyre prosperous iourney good waye v yee v oure child catell layenges awayte durst require kynge men horse fote conveye v safely agaynst oure enemy sayde vnto kynge ye power lorde oure god shulde seke wt whole hert therfore besought god oure lorde earnestly thinges mercifull vnto v herde oure prayer separated amonge ye ruler people ye prestes ye temple xij men sebeia asania ten men brother weied thē golde syluer ye prestly ornamētes house god kynge coūcell prynces whole israel geuē whan weyed gaue thē cl talētes syluer c talentes syluer vessell c talentes golde goldē vessell seuē tymes twentie vessel metall yee good metall xij glisteringe golde saide vnto thē ye also holy vnto lorde vessel holy golde syluer promised vnto lorde god father diligent kepe vntill tyme yt ye delyuer ruler people yt prestes leuites ye pryncipall mē city israel ierusalem chambre house oure god ye prestes leuites receaued golde syluer vessell1 esd 8 brought ierusalē tēple lorde thia brake vp xij daye first moneth tyll came ierusalē whan thirde daye past weyed golde syluer delyuered ye house lorde fourth daye vnto marimoth sonne ior prest wt eleazar ye sonne phineas thē iosabdus ye sonne iesnet medias sonne banus certayne leuites nombre waighte waight writtē vp tyme come captiuyte offred sacrifice vnto lorde god israel euē xij ox israel lxxxvj rammes lxxij shepe xij goates synne xij kyne thankofferinge sacrifice lorde ye kinges cōmission delyuered vnto ye stewardes debytes kynge vndershreues celosyria phenices 1 esd 9 whan thinges done ruler came vnto sayde generacion israel prynces ye prestes leuites straunge people indweller londe haue put awaye vnclennesse cananites hethites pheresites moabites egipcians edomites sonnes haue mengled selues daughter holy sede mixte outlandish heithen sen begynnynge raigne haue ruler heades bene partaker wickednesse soone herde thinges immediatly rent holy garmentes pulled ye hayre heade beerd sat downe soroufull heuy moued thorow worde god israel came vnto sat still full heuines vntill euenynge sacrifice stode vp frō fastinge hauynge rente clothes holy garmēt kneled downe vpon knee helde hādes vnto ye lorde sayde lorde confounded ashamed thy face oure synnes become many vpon oure heades wickedness exalted vnto heauē sen ye tyme father greate sinne vnto daye synnes v father wt oure brother wt oure prestes haue bene deliuered vnto kinges earth swerde captiuite became spoyle confucion shame vnto daie lorde god greate mercy yt haue gottē yt thou hast left v rote name place thy sanctuary discouer oure light house ye lorde god geuē v meate tymes ministracion whan captiuyte forsaken lorde oure god made kynges persia gracious fauourable vnto v yt gaue v vytayles meate yee leue buylde vp tē ple oure lorde god agayne repayre waisted place sion dwell iewry ierusalem lorde shall saye hauynge thinges possession haue broken thy cō maundementes thou gauest vnto v handes thy seruauntes prophetes sayenge londe yt ye go vnto yt geuen heretage haue possession defyled vnclennes fylthynes heithen abhominacion haue poluted alltogether therfore shal ye ioyne youre daughter vnto sonnes 〈…〉 ner mary yor sonnes vnto daughter morouer ye shall neuer seke make peace wt yt ye maye increase eate best lande yt ye maye denyde ye inheritaunce lande vnto yor child euermore thinge yt happeneth vnto v commeth wicked workes greate synnes yet hast thou geuen v soch rote yt come againe owne londe wicked yt haue brokē thy statute cōmaundementes agayne mengled selues wt vnclēnes outlandish heithen lorde art thou angrie v wilt thou rote v cleane yt oure rote name remayne nomore lorde god israel thou art true oure rote endureth yet vnto present daye beholde ye synnes stonde whan eszdras prayer knowleged synne wepinge 〈…〉 lyēge flatt vpon grounde tēple gathered vnto ierusalem greate multitude men wemen yonge men maydens greate wepinge mournynge cōgregacion whan iechonias sonne ieheli one child israel cried sayde vnto eszdras haue synned agaynst lorde haue maried outlandish woman heithē art thou ouer israel wil sweare ooth therfore vnto ye lorde yt shal put awaye wyues haue takē heithē wt childrē like appoynted fore elder stonde vp open thou declare playnely vnto v acordīge lawe ye lorde matter belongeth vnto ye wyll helpe quyte thy self manly eszdras arose toke ooth ruler ye prestes ye leuites israel thinges sware ix chapter eszdras stode vp courte tēple without 〈…〉 wente chāber ionathas sonne nasabus remayned ate meate ner dronke drynke multitude wickednes people made proclamacion iewry ierusalem soch gathered ierusalē captiuyte yt ouer came ierusalē within two thre dayes acordinge iudgment olde lordes councell goodes shulde taken excluded cōgregacion captiuyte thre dayes trybe iuda ben iamin gathered together ierusalem xx daye ye ix moneth ye whole multitude sat trē blinge courte temple wynter eszdras arose vp sayde vnto ye haue done vnrighteously ye haue taken outlandish wyues mariage increase synnes israel knowlege geue prayse vnto lorde god oure father perfourme wil departinge heithen londe outlandish wyues cried whole multitude loude voyce sayde like thou hast spokē wil moch people many ye wynter maie stōde without ye house agayne worke thinge yt fynished daye two many yt haue synned thinges ordene therfore yt ruler multitude dwell v many haue outlandish wyues prestes also iudges euery place maye stonde tyme appoynted tyll lowse vp wrath lorde busynes ionathas sonne ezeli ozias thecam receaued ye charge matter bozoramus leius sabatheus helped thē therto stode vp yt come captiuyte eszdras prest chose vnto pryncipall men amonge father acordinge name new moone tenth moneth sat together examen matter matter determynge concernynge men yt outlandish wyues vntill new moone first moneth prestes yt mixte thē selues wt outlandish wyues founde 〈◊〉 10 sonnes iesu sonne iosedec brother mazeas eleazer ioribus ioadeus offred selues put awaye wyues offre ramme ignoraunce sonnes semmeri masseas es ieelech azarias ye sonnes fosera limosias hismaen nathanea iussio ieddus talsas leuites iosabdus semeis colnis caletas facteas colnas elionas syngers sāctuary eliarib zackarus porter sallumus tolbanes israel child foro osi remias geddias melchias michelus eleazarus iēmebias bannas childrē iolaman chanias zachary ietzrelus ioddius erimoth elia ye sonnes iathoim eliadas liasamus zochias larimoth sabdis tebedias ye sonnes zebes iohānes amanias zabdias emeus sonnes bannus olammus maluchus ieddus iasub asabus ierimoth ye sonnes addin naatus moosias caleus raanas maasuas mathathias besel bannus manasses sonnes naue none afeas melchias sameas simō ben iamin malchus marras sonnes asom carianeus mathathias bannus eliphalach manasses semei sonnes bannus ieremy moodias abramas iohel baneas peliaas iona marimoth eliasib mathaneus eliasis orizas dielus semedius zambris ioseph ye sonnes nobeus idelus mathathias sabadus zecheda sedmi iesseus baneas takē outlādish wemē mariage put thē awaye wt childrē prestes leuites yt israel dwelt ierusalem thorow ye londe new moone seuenth moneth childrē israel dwellynges ye whole multitude came together vpon ye floore ye east syde holy porte ye tēple2 esd 8 spake vnto eszdras ye hie prest reder yt wolde brynge ye lawe moses geuē ye lorde god israel eszdras hie prest brought lawe vnto whole multitude man woman prestes yt might heare lawe new moone seuenth moneth red ye floore yt ye holy porte ye tēple mornynge early vntill euenynge men wemen applied mynde vnto lawe eszdras prest reder ye lawe stode vp vpon scaffolde wodd made therfore vpon right hande stode mathathias samus ananias azarias vrias ozechias balsamus vpon lefte hāde stode faldeus misael malachias abuschas sabus nabadias zachary toke eszdras ye boke whole multitude ye pryncipall honor thē whā red ye lawe stode straight vp vpon fete eszdras praysed lorde hye god allmightie god hoostes ye people answered amen helde vp hādes fell downe flat vpon earth praysed ye lorde iesus beneas sarebias iaddimus accubus sabbatheus calithes azarias ioradus ananias philia leuites taught lawe lorde red lawe lorde cōgregacion euery man sett yt vnderstode lawe spake atharathes vnto eszdras hye prest reder leuites yt taught multitude sayenge daye holy vnto lorde yt herde lawe wepte▪ eszdras sayde • esd 8 c departe yor waye eate best drynke swetest sende giftes vnto yt haue nothinge daye holy vnto lorde ye sory wente waye euerychone ate dronke mery sent rewardes vnto thē yt nothinge yt also might eate gladnesse exceadingly reioysed thorow wordes red vnto lawe gathered together ierusalem holde feast acordinge couenaunt ye lorde god israel ende thirde boke eszdras iiii boke eszdras boke conteyneth chap god reproueth people vnthankfulnes rehearseth vnto owne louynge mercy maye bringe thē agayne yf wyl amende wil chose another people chap ii synagoge cōplayneth vpō hir children▪ callynge heithen chap iii eszdras sheweth excellent workes god done vnto people hath frendly contencion god suffreth babilonians haue dominion ouer yet sinner also chap iiii angel rebuketh eszdras takinge hāde seke grounde god iudgment instructeth fayre symilitudes chap v communicaciō eszdras angel together chap vi angel enfourmeth eszdras answereth question chap vii angel sheweth eszdras many secrete matter thinges come chap viii eszdras prayeth people god wyll rather loke vpon owne louynge mercy godlynes thē vpon wycked synnes many chap ix token tyme punyshment come vision shewed vnto eszdras chap x communicacion betwixte eszdras woman appeared vnto chap xixiixiii certayne vision interpretacions therof chap xiiii god appeareth vnto eszdras bush talketh cōmaundeth shal doo chap xv god sheweth eszdras punyshmēt wyl sende vpon synfull people commaundeth tell chap xvi punyshment vpon heithen people god shal behaue selues therin first chapter seconde boke ye prophet eszdras ye sonne saraias 〈…〉 sonne azarias ye sonne helchia ye sonne sallū sonne sadoc sonne achitob sonne amerias sonne azarias sonne maraioth sonne sarahias sonne vzi sonne boccus sonne abisu sonne phineas sonne eleazar sonne aaron trybe leui presoner lande meedes raigne artaxerses kynge persia worde lorde came vnto sayenge 〈…〉 go thy waye shew people synfull dedes child wickedness haue done maye tell childers childrē synnes father increased haue forgotten haue offred vnto straunge goddes euen brought lande egipte house bondage haue prouoked vnto wrath despysed councels pull thou hayre thy heade cast euell ouer haue bene obedient vnto lawe people without lernynge nourtoure longe shal forbeare vnto haue done moch good many kynges haue destroyed sake 〈…〉 pharao wt seruaūtes power haue smytten downe slayne 〈…〉 ye nacions haue destroyed roted ye east haue brought two landes people naught euen tyre sydon haue slayne enemy speake thou therfore vnto sayenge thus sayeth lorde 〈…〉 led thorow see haue geuen sure stretes sence begynnynge gaue moses youre captayne aaron prest 〈…〉 gaue light piler fyre greate wōders haue done amōge yet haue ye forgotten sayeth lorde thus sayeth allmightie lorde gaue quales eate exo 16 c tentes youre sucoure neuertheles ye murmured ascrybed ye victory youre enemy vnto name yee daie ye yet murmoure benefites haue done whan ye hongrie wildernes 〈◊〉 14 dyd ye crie vnto hast thou brought v wildernes kill v bene better v haue serued ye egipcians dye wildernesse thē pitie vpon youre mourninges gaue manna eate ye ate angel foode whā ye thyrstie dyd hew ye hardstone 〈◊〉 • 0 b caused water ynough flowe thereout heate couered ye leaues tree good pleasaunt fatt londe gaue cast cananites pheresites philistynes shal saieth lorde thus sayeth allmightie lorde whan ye wildernes exo 15 water amorites beynge thyrst blasphemynge name gaue fyre youre blasphemy cast tre ye water made ryuer swete shall vnto iacob thou iuda woldest obeye 〈◊〉 32 b wil turne another people vnto geue name maye kepe statute seinge ye haue forsakē wil forsake also whan ye desyre gracious vnto shal haue mercy vpon 〈…〉 whan ye call vpō wil heare ye haue defyled youre hādes bloude youre fete swift commytt manslaughter ye haue forsaken maner youre owne selues sayeth lorde thus sayeth allmightie lorde haue prayed father sonnes mother hir daughter norsse hir yonge babe ye wolde people shulde youre god ye wolde child shulde youre owne father 〈◊〉 • 3 gathered together henne gathereth hir chekens vnder hir wynges shal vnto shal cast fro face 〈…〉 whan ye offre vnto shal turne face youre solempne feast dayes youre new moones youre circumcision haue forsaken sent vnto seruauntes prophetes ye haue taken slayne torne body peces whose bloude wyll requyre youre handes sayeth lorde thus sayeth allmightie lorde youre house must desolate wil cast wynde doth ye strawe youre child shal frutefull haue despysed commaundement done ye thinge yt euell youre house wil geue vnto people yt shal come esa 65 rom 10 yt neuer herde shal beleue vnto whō neuer shewed token shal thinge yt cōmaunde thē haue sene prophetes yet shal call synnes remembraunce knowlege thē reporte vnto grace wil people come whose child reioyse gladnes though haue sene wt bodely eye yet sprete beleue thinge saye brother beholde greate worshipe esa 41 c luc 13 • matt • se ye people commeth east vnto wyll geue dukedome abraham isaac iacob oseas amos micheas ioel abdy ionas naum abacuc sophony aggeus zachary malachy called also angel messaūger lorde ii chapter thus sayeth lorde brought people bondage gaue thē cōmaundementes seruaūtes ye prophetes wolde heare despysed coūcels mother bare sayeth vnto go youre waye ye child wyddow forsaken brought vp gladnesse sorow heuynes haue lost ye haue synned lorde yor god done ye thinge euell shall vnto wyddow forsakē go youre waye child axe mercy lorde father call vpon wytnesse ouer mother childrē wolde kepe couenaunt yt thou brynge cōfucion mother spoyle beare let name scatred abrode amonge heithen let put earth haue thought scorne couenaunt wo vnto assur thou hydest vnrighteous thou wicked people gen 19 c remembre dyd vnto sodom gomorre whose land turned pitch aszshes euen also wyll vnto heare sayeth allmightie lorde thus sayeth lorde vnto eszdras tell people yt geue kyngdome ierusalem wolde haue geuen vnto israel glory also wyl take vnto geue euer lastynge tabernacle prepared tre life shalbe vnto swete smellynge oyntment shal nether laboure ner weery go ye youre waye ye shall receaue praye yor selues dayes maye dwell therin kingdome prepared therfore watch take heauē earth wytnesse haue broken euell peces created good lyue sayeth ye lorde mother enbrace thy child brynge vp gladnes make fete fast piler haue chosen sayeth lorde deed wyll rayse vp agayne place brynge ye graues haue knowne name israel feare thou mother child haue chosen sayeth lorde thy helpe shal sende seruauntes esay ieremy whose councell haue sanctified prepared xij tree dyuerse frutes many welles flowinge mylck hony seuen mountaynes whervpō growe rose lily wherin wyl fyll child ioye execute iustice wyddowe iudge fatherlesse geue ye poore defende cōfortlesse clothe naked heale wounded sick laugh lame man scorne defende crepell lat blinde come ye sight clearnes kepe olde yonge within thy walles • obi 1 euer thou fyndest deed tokē burye shal geue first place resurreccion holde styll people take ye rest thy quyetnes come fede thy child thou good norsse stablish fete seruauntes haue geuen shal one perishe wyl seke thē thy nombre vexe thy self whan daye trouble heuynes commeth shal wepe soroufull thou shalt mery plenteous heithen shalbe gelous shalbe able nothinge agaynst sayeth lorde handes shal couer thy child shal se fyre euerlastinge ioyfull thou mother thy childrē wyll delyuer sayeth lorde remembre thy deed childrē shal brynge earth shew mercy vnto mercifull sayeth lorde allmightie enbrace thy childrē vntyll come shew mercy vnto welles runne ouer grace shal fayle eszdras receaued charge lorde vpon mount oreb shulde go vnto israel whan came vnto thē set naught despysed commaundement ye lorde therfore saye vnto ye heithen heare vnderstonde loke youre shepherde shal geue euerlastinge rest nye hande shal come ende worlde ready rewarde kyngdome euerlastinge light shall shyne vpon euermore fle shadowe worlde receaue ioyfulnes youre glory testifie sauioure openly receaue gift yt geuen glad geuynge thankes vnto hath called heauenly kyngdome aryse vp stonde fast beholde nombre sealed feast lorde departed shadowe worlde haue receaued glorious garmētes lorde take thy nombre sion shutt vp thy purified haue fulfilled lawe lorde nombre thy child thou longedest fulfilled beseke power lorde thy people haue bene called begynnynge maye halowed eszdras sawe vpon mount sion greate people coude nombre 〈…〉 praysed lorde songes thankesgeuynge myddest thē yonge mā hye stature • excellent vpon euery one heades sett crowne euer hygher hygher marueled greatly axed ye angell sayde syr answered sayde vnto haue put mortall clothinge put immortall haue testified knowleged name god crowned receaue rewarde sayde vnto angell yonge personne crowneth geueth palmes handes answered sayde vnto ye sonne god haue knowleged worlde beganne greatly commende stode stifly name lorde angell sayde vnto go thy waye tell people maner thinges greate wonder lorde thy god thou hast sen • iii chapter thirtie yeare fall cite babilon laye troubled vpō bed thoughtes came vp ouer hert sawe ye desolacion sion plenteous wealth yt dwelt babilon sprete sore moued begāne speake fearfull wordes hyest sayde lorde lorde thou spakest begynnynge whan thou plantedst ye earth thy self alone gauest commaundement vnto ye people body vnto adam creature thy handes 〈◊〉 2 b hast brethed breth life lyued thou leddest paradyse gardē pleasure thy right hande planted euer earth made vnto thou gauest commaundemēt loue ye waye transgressed immediatly thou appoyntedest death generacions came nacions trybes people kynreddes nombre 〈◊〉 6 b euery people walked owne wil dyd nyce thinges thy commaundementes despysed processe tyme thou broughtest water floude 〈◊〉 7 b vpon dwelt worlde destroydest like death adam water floude also neuertheles one thou leftest namely noe housholde come righteous mē happened whan yt dwelt vpon earth beganne multiplie gotten many child greate people beganne vngodly first whan lyued wickedly 〈◊〉 1215 thou didest chose man amonge whose name abram thou louedest vnto thou shewdest thy wyll maydest euerlastinge couenaunt promisinge thou woldest neuer forsake sede vnto thou gauest isaac 〈◊〉 21 〈◊〉 25 c 〈…〉 vnto isaac also thou gauest iacob esau iacob thou didest chose put backe esau iacob became greate multitude happened whā thou leddest sede egipte thou broughtest thē vp mount sion 〈◊〉 19 〈…〉 4 b bowinge downe heauens settinge fast earth mouynge grounde makynge depthes shake troublynge worlde thy glory wente thorow foure porte fyre earth quake wyndes colde thou mightest geue lawe vnto sede iacob diligence vnto generaciō israel yet tokest thou awaye thē wicked hert thy lawe might brynge forth frute first adam bare wicked hert transgressed ouercome yt borne thus remayned weaknes lawe hert people rom • wickednesse rote good departed awaye euell abode still tymes passed awaye yeares brought ende1 16 c 2 reg 5 didest thou rayse vp seruaunt called dauid thou commaundedst buylde cite vnto thy name offre vp incense sacrifice vnto therin done many yeares inhabiters cite forsoke thinges dyd euē adam generacions done also wicked hert thou gauest thy cite ouer handes thine enemy babilon better righteous thy people yt shal therfore haue domynion sion whan came sawe vngodlynes greate wickednesse coude nōbred yee whan soule sawe many euell doer ye xxx yeare hert fayled sawe thou suffrest soch vngodlynes sparest ye wicked doer thine owne people hast thou roted preserued thine enemy hast thou shewed perceaue happeneth babilon better sion eny people yt knoweth sauynge people israel generacion hath beleued ye couenaū te iacob yet rewarde appeareth labo hath frute haue gone thorow heithē se yt rych wealthy thynke vpon ye commaundementes weye thou therfore oure wickednesse ye balaunce also dwell worlde shal thy name nowhere founde israel people vpon earth yt hath synned people hath kepte thy commaundementes thou shalt fynde israel name hath kepte thy preceptes people heithen iiii chapter angell sent vnto whose name vriel gaue answere sayde thy hert hath takē moch vpon worlde thou thinkest comprehende waye hyest sayde yee lorde answered sayde sent shewe thre wayes sett forth thre symilitudes wherof yf thou canst declare one wil shewe also waye thou desyrest se shal shewe whēce wicked hert commeth sayde tell lorde sayde vnto go thy waye weye weight fyre measure blast wynde call agayne daye past answered sayde man borne able requyrest thou soch sayde vnto yf shulde axe depe dwellinges see greate water springes vpon ye firmamēt greate water sprynges begynnynge depe goinges paradise peraduēture thou woldest saye vnto neuer wente downe yet ye depe ner hell nether dyd euer clymme vp heauen neuertheles haue axed onely fyre wynde daye thorow thou hast trauayled thou canst separated yet canst thou geue answere sayde morouer vnto thine owne thinges soch growne vp ye canst thou knowe shulde thy vessel able cōprehende waye hyest outwardly corrupte worlde vnderstōde corrupcion yt euydent sight thē sayde vnto better thē shulde lyue wickednesse suffre knowe wherfore answered sayde wēte wod tree toke soch deuyce sayde iud 9 b par 25 c come let v go fight agaynst see maye departe awaye v maye make v yet woddes floudes see also lyke maner toke deuyce sayde come let v go vp fight agaynst tree wodd maye make oure londe wyder thought deuyce wodd vayne nothinge worth fyre came consumed wod thought floudes see came likewyse naught also sonde stode vp stopped yf thou iudge betwyxte two woldest thou iustifie woldest thou cōdemne answered sayde verely foolish thought haue deuysed grounde geuen vnto wod see also hath place beare floudes answered sayde thou hast geuen right iudgment iudgest thou thy self also like grounde geuen vnto wod see floudes 〈…〉 euen dwell vpon earth maye vnderstonde nothinge vpon earth dwelleth aboue heauens maye onely vnderstō de thinges aboue heauens answered sayde beseke lorde let haue vnderstondinge mynde curious thy hye thinges soch daylie medle namely wherfore israeli blasphemed heithen cause people thou euer hast loued geuen ouer punyshed vngodly naciōs lawe oure father brought naught wrytten couenauntes come none effecte passe awaye worlde greshopers oure life feare worthy optayne mercy wyl vnto name called vpon ouer v thinges haue axed question answered sayde thou searchest thou shalt maruel worlde hasteth fast passe awaye comprehende thinges promysed righteous tyme come 〈…〉 worlde full vnrighteousnes weaknes concernynge thinges wherof thou axest wyl tell euell sowne destruccion therof yet come yf euell sowne turned vpsyde downe yf place ye euell sowne passe awaye thinge come yt sowne ye good corne euell sede hath bene sowne hert man begynnynge moch vngodlynes hath brought vp vnto tyme moch shal yet brynge forth vntyll come barne pondre thyself whā ye corne euell sede cutt downe greate barne shal fyll answered sayde whā shal thinges come passe wherfore yeares euell answered sayēge haist thou moch vpon hyest thy haistynes aboue vayne thou makest moch doo dyd ye soules also righteous axe question thinges holynes sayenge longe shal hope fashion whan commeth frute barne rewarde vpō ieremiel archangel gaue answere sayde • poc 6 b euē whan nombre sedes fylled hath weyed worlde balaunce measure nombre hath measured tyme moueth vntyll measure fulfylled answered sayde lorde lorde full synne oure sake peraduenture barne righteous shall fylled synnes thē dwell vpon earth answered sayde go yt waye woman childe axe hath fulfilled hir ix monethes yf hir childeszbed maye kepe ye byrth eny lōger within thē sayde lorde sayde vnto hell secrete place soules like ye preuy chamber woman like woman trauayleth maketh haist whan tyme necessite byrth hande euē doth haist delyuer commytted vnto loke thou desyrest se shalbe shewed begynnynge answered sayde yf haue founde fauoure thy sight yf possible yf mete therfore shewe whether come thē past past come past knowe come knowe saide vnto stonde vp vpō ye right syde shal expounde symilitude vnto stode beholde whote burnynge ouē wente ouer happened yt whan flamme gone smoke vpper hande wēte ouer watery cloude sent downe moch rayne wt storme whan stormy rayne past droppes remayned still sayde vnto like rayne droppes fyre exceadeth smoke euen ye measure thinges past hath vpper hande wente droppes smoke aboue prayed sayde maye lyue thynkest thou vntyll tyme shall happen dayes answered sayde tokēs wherof thou axest maye tell thē parte touchinge 〈…〉 ye life maye shewe sent therfore v chapter neuerthelesse concernynge token mark beholde dayes shal come dwell vpon earth shalbe takē greate nombre waye trueth shalbe hyd lō de shalbe baren faith mat 〈…〉 iniquyte shal haue vpper hande like thou hast sene thou hast herde lōge agoo londe thou seist haue rule shalt thou shortly se waist yf god graunte lyue thou shalt se ye thirde trompet sonne shal sodenly shyne agayne night moone thre tymes daye bloude shal droppe wodd stone shal geue voyce people shalbe vnquyete euen shal rule hope dwell vpon earth foules shal flyt sodomitysh see shal cast fish make noyse night many shal knowe shal heare voyce therof shalbe cōfucion also many place fyre shal oft sent agayne wylde beastes shal go waye menstruous wemen shal beare monster salt water shalbe founde swete one frende shal fight agaynst another shal wyt vnderstandinge hyd put asyde secrete place shalbe sought many yet founde shal vnrighteousnes volupteousnes haue vpperhande vpon earth one lande also shal axe another saye righteousnes gone thorow shal saye tyme shal men hope nothinge optayne shal laboure wayes shall prospere shewe soch token haue leue yf thou wylt praye agayne wepe fast seuen dayes thou shalt heare yet greater thinges awaked fearfulnes wente thorow body mynde feble carefull allmost swowned withall angell come talke helde comforted sett vp vpon fete seconde night happened yt salathiel captayne people came vnto sayenge hast thou bene thy countenaunce heuy knowest thou yt israel commytted vnto londe captyuyte vp eate forsake v shepherde leaueth flock handes wicked wolues sayde vnto go thy waye fro come nye herde sayde wēte waye fro fasted seuen dayes mournynge wepynge like vriell angell commaunded seuen dayes happened ye thoughtes hert greuous vnto agayne soule receaued ye sprete vnderstandynge begāne talke wt hyest agayne sayde lorde lorde euery wod ye earth tree therof thou hast chosen ye one onely vynyarde londes whole worlde thou hast chosen one pytt floures groūde thou hast chosen one lylie depthes see thou hast fylled one ryuer builded city thou hast halowed sion vnto thy self ye foules created thou hast named one doue catell yt made thou hast prouyded ye one shepe amōge ye multitude folkes thou hast gotten one people vnto people thou louedest thou gauest lawe yt proued lorde hast thou geuē one people ouer vnto many vpon one rote thou hast prepared hast thou scatred ye one onely people amonge many treade thē downe yee haue euer withstonde ye promyses neuer beleued ye couenaūtes though thou werest enemye vnto ye people yet shuldest thou punysh thē wt thine owne handes whā spokē wordes angell yt came ye night afore sēt vnto sayde vnto heare herkē ye thinge yt saye shal tell ye sayed speake lorde thē sayde vnto thou art sore vexed troubled israel sake louest thou yt people better yt made sayde lorde grefe cōpassion haue spokē reynes payne euery houre wolde haue experience waye hyest seke parte iudgment sayde vnto thou mayest sayde wherfore lorde vnto borne mother childesbed graue sene mysery trouble iacob trauayle people israel sayde vnto nōbre ye thinges yt yet come gather together ye droppes scatred abrode make ye floures grene agayne▪ yt wythered opē thinge closed bringe forth wyndes shutt vp shewe ymage voyce shal declare thinge thou labourest knowe sayde lorde lorde maye knowe thinges hath dwellynge wt mē vnwyse maye thē speake thinges wherof thou axest thē sayde vnto like thou canst none thinges yt haue spoken euen canst thou fynde iudgment ende loue haue promysed vnto people sayde beholde lorde yet art thou nye vnto haue ende shal haue bene shal come v sayde vnto wyl lycken iudgment vnto rynge like slacknesse last euen swiftnesse first answered sayde coudest thou make haue bene made fo • come one thou mightest shewe thy iudgment sooner answered heme sayde creature maye haist aboue maker nether maye worlde holde thē shalbe created sayde hast thou sayde vnto thy seruaunt thou lyuynge maker hast made creature lyuynge creature bare euē might also beare present sayde vnto axe childeszbed womā saye vnto yf thou bringest forth childrē doest thou together one another praye therfore brynge forth ten child sayde must one another sayde vnto euen haue geuen childeszbed vnto earth sowne vpon processe tyme like yonge childe maye brynge forth thinges belonge aged euen haue ordened worlde made axed sayde seynge thou hast geuē waye wyl speake ye oure mother whō thou hast tolde yet yonge draweth nye vnto age answered sayde axe woman beareth child shal tell saye vnto wherfore thou hast brought forth like lesse stature shal answere yt borne youth strēgth one fashion borne tyme age whan childeszbed fayleth wyse cōsidre thyself ye lesse stature come lesse ye creature begynne olde haue passed ouer strength youth sayde lorde beseke yf haue founde fauoure thy sight shewe thy seruaunt doest thou vyset thy creature vi chapter sayde vnto begynnynge whan grounde made worlde stode euer ye wyndes blew thondred lightened euer foundacions paradise layed fayre floures sene euer moueable power stablished ye innumerable multitude angel gathered together euer ye highness ye ayre lifted vp afore ye measure firmament named euer ye chymneys sion hote presente yeares sought euer invencions yt synne put asyde sealed gather faith treasure dyd cōsidre pondre thinges made thorow thorow none also ended none answered sayde shal partynge asunder tymes whan shalbe ende first begynnynge foloweth sayde vnto abrahā vnto isaac whā iacob esau borne iacobs hande helde first hele esau esau ende worlde iacobis begynnynge foloweth hande man betwixte hele hande question eszdras axe thou answered sayde lorde lorde yf haue founde fauoure thy sight beseke shewe thy seruaunt ende thy tokēs wherof thou shewdest parte last night answered sayde vnto stōde vp vpon thy fete heare perfecte voyce sounde shal come greate mocion ye place thou stōdest shal moued therfore whan thou hearest wordes afrayed ende shal worde foundacion ye earth vnderstonde worde therof trembleth quaketh knoweth must chaunged ende happened whā herde stode vp vpon fete herkened beholde voyce yt spake sounde like sounde many water sayde beholde ye dayes come yt wyl begynne drawe nye vyset dwell vpō earth wyl begynne make inquysicion yt haue hurte equyte wt vnrighteousnes whan lowe estate sion shalbe fulfylled whan worlde shal vanish awaye shalbe ouersealed wyl token bokes shalbe opened firmament shal se together child yeare olde shal speake wt voyces womē childe shal brynge forth vntymely child thre foure monethes olde shall lyue raysed vp sodēly shal sowne place appeare vnsowne full store house shal sodenly founde emptie trompett shal geue sounde whā euery man heareth shalbe haistely afrayed mat 10 c mich 7 tyme shall frendes fight one agaynst another like enemy earth shal stonde feare sprynges welles shal stonde styll thre houres shal renne euer remayneth thinge • haue tolde shal escape se saluacion ende youre worlde men receaued shal se haue taisted death frō byrth hert indweller shalbe chaunged turned another meanynge euell shalbe put disceate shal quenched faith shal florish corrupcion shalbe ouercome trueth hath bene longe without frute shal declared happened whan talked wt loked demurely vpō whō stode wordes sayde vnto come shewe ye tyme ye night come yf thou wilt praye yet fast seuē dayes agayne shal tel thinges greater thy voyce herde hyest mightie hath sene thy righteous dealynge hath sene also thy chastite thou hast euer sence thy youth therfore hath sent shewe thinges saye vnto good comforte feare haist ye tymes past thynke vayne thinges make haist latter tymes happened yt wepte agayne fasted seuen dayes like maner might fulfill thre wekes tolde eight night hert vexed within agayne beganne speake hyest sprete greatly set fyre soule distresse sayde lorde thou spakest vnto thy creature begynnynge euen first daye saydest gen 1 let heauen earth made thy worde perfecte worke sprete darcknesses yet euery syde sylence man voyce yet commaundedst thou fayre light come forth thy treasure thy worke might appeare sene vpon seconde daye thou maydest sprete firmament commaundedst parte asunder make deuysion betwixte water one parte might remayne aboue beneth vpon thirde daye thou broughtest passe yt water gathered seuenth parte earth sixe partes hast thou dryed vp kepte intēt yt men might sowe occupie huszbandrie therin soone thy worde wente forth worke made immediatly greate numerable frute many dyuerse pleasure desyres temptacion floures chaungeable coloure smell done thirde daye vpon fourth daye thou cōmaundedst sonne shulde geue shyne ye moone hir light starres didest thou sett ordre gauest charge seruyce euen vnto man made deu 4 c vpō fifth daye thou saydest vnto seuenth parte water gathered shulde bringe forth diuerse beastes foules fish came passe domme water without soule brought forth lyuynge beastes commaundement god people might prayse thy wonderous workes didest thou preserue two soules ye one thou calldest enoch leuiathan didest separate one seuenth parte namely water gathered together might holde vnto enoch thou gauest one parte dryed vp thirde daye shulde dwell parte wherin thousande hilles vnto leuiathā thou gauest seuenth parte namely moyst hast kepte deuoure th •• wylt whan vpon sixte daye thou gauest cōmaundement vnto earth shulde brynge forth beastes catell ye crepe besydes adam also thou maydest lorde thy creature come people also thou hast chosen specially vnto thy self haue sayde spoken might shewe worlde made oure sake people also come adam thou hast sayde nothinge like spetle hast lickened abundaūce vnto droppe falleth rofe house lorde heithē haue euer bene reputed nothinge haue begō ne lordes ouer v deuoure v thy people thou hast called ye first borne thy begotten thy feruent louer geuen handes power yf worlde made oure sake haue inheritaunce possession worlde longe shal endure vii chapter happened spoken wordes sent vnto angell bene also nightes afore sayde vnto vp eszdras heare wordes come tell sayde speake lorde god thē sayde vnto see sett wyde place yt might depe greate intraūce narow small like ryuer wolde go see loke vpon rule yf wente thorow narow might come brode item another cite buylded sett vpon brode felde full goodes intraunce narow sodane like yf fyre right hande depe water left onely one strate path betwixte thē small coude one man go yf cite geuen heyre neuer wente thorow parlous waye wolde receaue inheritaūce sayde lorde sayde euen israel also porcion sake haue made worlde whan adam trāsgressed statute ye thinge iudged done▪ ye intraunces worlde made narow full sorow trauayle euell full parels laboure intraunces fore worlde wyde sure brought immortall frute yf entred worlde maye comprehende strayte vayne thinges moch lesse maye cō prehende vnderstonde secrete thinges disquietest thou thy self seynge thou art corruptible mā woldest thou knowe thou art mortall hast thou receaued thine hert thinge come present thē sayde lorde lorde thou hast ordened thy lawe • eut • righteous shulde inheret thinges vnfaithfull vngodly shulde perishe neuertheles righteous shall suffre strayte thinges hope wyde haue lyued vngodly suffred strayte thinges shal se wyde saide vnto iudge aboue god none hath vnderstondinge aboue hyest many yt perish despyse ye lawe god sett god hath geuen strayte commaundement soch come knowe shulde lyue yf kepte shulde punyshed neuertheles obedient vnto spake agaynst ymagined vayne thinges purposed synne sayde morouer god god regarded wayes haue knowne lawe haue despysed denyed promyses statute ordinaunces haue bene faithfull stedfast haue perfourmed workes therfore eszdras vnto full plenty emptye emptynesse beholde tyme shal come yt token haue tolde shal come passe bryde shall appeare earth yt passeth awaye shalbe shewed whoso euer delyuered ye foresayde euels shal se wō ders sonne iesus shal openly declared wt yt wt yt remayne shal mery foure hundreth yeares yeares shall sonne christ dye men haue life ye worlde shalbe turned olde sylence seuen dayes like fore iudgmentes man shall remayne seuē dayes worlde yet awaketh shalbe raysed vp shal dye corrupte earth shal restore haue slepte shall dust dwell sylēce secrete place shal delyuer committed vnto ye • ost hyest shal openly declared vpon seate iudgment misery shal vanysh awaye lōge suffringe shalbe gathered together iudgment shall contynue ye trueth shal 3 17 4 18 19 moses father yt synned wyldernes yt came israel ye tyme achas samuel dauid ye destruccion salomon came sanctuary helias receaued rayne deed might lyue ezechias ye people tyme senna cherib dyuerse like maner haue prayed many euē seynge ye corrupte growne vp wickednes increased righteous haue prayed vngodly wherfore shal also answered sayde present worlde ye ende remayneth moch honoure therfore haue prayed weake daye dome shalbe ende tyme ye begynnynge immortalite come wherin corrupcion vanysheth volupteousnes lowsed myszbeleue taken awaye righteousnes growne verite spronge vp shall man able saue destroyed ner oppresse yt hath gottē ye victory answered thē sayde first last sayenge yt bene better haue geuen earth vnto adam el whan geuē kepe shulde synne profit men present tyme lyue heuynes death loke punyszment thou adā hast thou done though thou yt synned thou art fallē alone yt come profit vnto v yf promysed v immortall tyme medle wt deadly workes promysed v euerlastinge hope selues euell vayne yt layed vp v dwellynges health fredome haue lyued euell worshipe ye hyest kepte defende haue led pacient life haue walked ye wicked wayes shalbe shewed paradyse whose frute endureth euer wherin fredome medycyne shal go haue walked vnpleasaunt place face haue absteyned shal shyne aboue starres oure face shalbe black darcke whyle lyued dyd vnrighteously considered shulde suffre therfore death thē answered sayde consideracion thought battayl man hath vpon earth yf ouercome shall suffre thou hast sayde yf gett victory shall receaue thinge saye life wherof moses spake vnto people whyle lyued • eut • 0 sayenge chose life thou mayest lyue neuertheles beleued nether prophetes ner haue spoken vnto heuynes shulde reach vnto destruccion like ioye come ouer haue suffred thē selues enfourmed saluacion answered sayde knowe lorde hyest mercyfull yt hath mercy vpon yet worlde vpon also walke lawe 〈◊〉 2 pacient longe sufferinge towarde haue synned workes liberall geue requyreth greate mercy multiplieth louynge kyndnesses towarde present past come yf multiplie mercy worlde shal made lyuynge dwell therin geueth also yf gaue goodnesse haue done euell might eased ten thousande parte men shulde made lyuynge yf iudge forgaue yt healed worde yf wolde destroye ye multitude stryueth shulde left innumerable multitude viii chapter answered sayēge hyest made worlde many worlde come wyl tell symilitude eszdras whan thou axest earth shal saye vnto geueth moch moulde wherof erthen vessel made litle yt golde cōmeth euen worke worlde many created 〈…〉 shall preserued answered sayde swalowe vp witt thou soule deuoure vnderstondinge thou art agreed herken geue eare wyllinge prophecie thou hast longer space geuen lyue lorde wilt thou geue thy seruaunt leue yt maye praye thou mayest geue sede vnto oure hert buylde oure vnderstondinge maye come frute euery one corrupte beareth state place man maye lyue thou art alone one workmanshipe thy handes like thou hast sayde like body fashioned childeszbed thou geuest membres thy creature preserued fyre water ix monethes doth thy worke suffre thy creature fashioned thinge preserueth yt preserued shal kepte together whan tyme childeszbedd delyuereth ye thinge kepte growne thou hast commaunded brestes geue mylck vnto frute thinge created fashioned maye norished tyme thou disposest ordrest thy mercy bryngest vp thy righteousnes nurturest thy lawe refourmest thy vnderstondinge mortifiest thy creature makest lyuynge thy worke seinge thou destroyest wt greate labour created fashioned thorow thy commaundement thou coudest lyghtly ordene also thinge made might preserued speake men generall thou knowest thy people whose sake sory thy inheritaunce whose cause mourne israel wofull iacob whose sake greued therfore begynne praye self se fall v euen v dwell vpon earth haue herde swiftnes iudge come therfore heare voyce vnderstōde wordes shal speake begynnynge wordes eszdras receaued lorde thou dwellest euerlastyngnesse whose eye lift vp ayre whose stole exceadinge hye whose glory maiesty maye comprehēded hoostes heauen stonde tremblinge whose kepinge turned winde fyre whose worde true whose talkynge stedfast whose commaundement stronge whose ordynaunce fearfull whose loke dryeth vp depthes whose wrath maketh mountaynes melt awaye whose trueth beareth wytnes heare ye prayer thy seruaunt marck thine eares peticion thy creature whyle lyue wil speake lō ge haue vnderstondinge answere loke vpō synnes thy people serue yt trueth haue respecte vnto wicked study heithen desyre kepe thy testimony sorowes thinke vpon haue walked faynedly vpon wyll haue knowne thy feare let thy wyll destroye haue beastly maners loke vpon haue clearly taught thy lawe take thou indignacion worse beastes loue allwaye put trust ye righteousnes glory oure father haue sicknes disease oure synnes thou shalt called mercifull yf thou hast mercy vpon v thou shalt called mercifull haue workes righteousnes ye righteous haue layed vp many good workes together shall dedes receaue rewarde man thou shuldest take displeasure corruptible mortall generacion thou shuldest rough towarde 〈◊〉 8 g pa • 6 f • oh 1 b trueth man amonge borne hath dealt wickedly amonge faithfull none hath done amysse lorde thy righteousnes thy goodnes shalbe praysed declared yf thou mercifull vnto rych good workes answered sayde thinges hast thou spoken right acordinge vnto thy wordes shal wil verely cōsidre worke haue synned death iudgment 〈◊〉 4 destrucciō wyll reioyse ouer worke thought ye righteous wil remembre also pilgramege holymakynge rewarde like haue spoken shall come passe huszbād man soweth moch sede vpon grounde planteth many tree yet allwaye thinge sowne plā ted kepte safe nether doth take rote euen sowne worlde shal preserued answered sayde yf haue founde grace let speake like husbāde man sede perisheth yf receaue rayne due season yf come moch rayne vpon euen perisheth man also created thy handes like vnto thine owne ymage thy self whose sake thou hast made thinges lickened vnto huszbande man sede wroth v lorde spare thy people haue mercy vpon thine owne inheritaunce mercifull vnto thy creature answered sayde thinges present present thinges come soch come thou wā test yet moch seynge thou mayest loue creature aboue haue oft time drawne nye vnto neuer vnrighteous also thou art maruelous hyest thou hast humbled thy self becommeth hast regarded thine owne self yt thou art soch honoure amonge righteous therfore shal greate wrechidnes mysery come vpon latter tyme shal dwell ye worlde haue walked greate pryde vnderstonde thou thy self seke glory soch like vnto paradyse opened tre life plā ted tyme come prepared plenteousnes made ready cite builded rest prepared yee perfecte goodnes wyszdome rote euell marked weaknes moth hyd hell flyeth corrupcion forgetfulnes sorowes vanyshed awaye ende shewed treasure immortalite therfore axe thou question cō cernynge multitude perishe haue taken libertie despysed hyest thought scorne lawe forsaken wayes morouer haue troden downe righteous sayde hert psal 13 god yee wittingly dye like thinge haue spoken made ready euē thyrst payne prepared wil man shulde come naught created haue defyled name made vn full vnto prepared life therfore iudgment hande thinges haue shewed vnto men vnto namely vnto soch like answered sayde beholde lorde hast thou shewed multitude token thou wilt begynne last tyme whan thou hast shewed ix chapter answered saide measure thou tyme diligenly self whan thou seist one parte token come passe haue tolde ye shalt thou vnderstonde tyme wherin hyest wil begynne vysit worlde made whā shalbe sene earthquake vproure people worlde shalt thou well vnderstonde hyest spake thinges dayes euen begynnynge like made worlde hath begynnynge ende ende manyfest euen tymes also hyest haue playne begynnynges wonder signes ende workynge token euery one shalbe saued shall able escape workes faith wherin ye haue beleued shall preserued saide parels shal se sauioure londe within border haue halowed worlde shall carefulnesse haue abused way haue cast despytefully shall dwell paynes soch life haue receaued benefites haue knowne haue abhorred lawe whyle yet fredome whan yet open rowme amendemēt conuersion vnderstode despysed ye must knowe death payne therfore thou nomore carefull vngodly shalbe punyshed righteous shalbe saued whose worlde worlde whan answered sayde esd • haue talked speake wyl speake also herafter many moo perish shal saued like floude greater droppes answered sayenge like felde also sede floures colour also soch workman soch also ye worke huszband man huszbandrye also tyme worlde whan prepared euer worlde made wher shulde dwel man withstode whan euery one maker also worlde prepared moneth ceaseth lawe vnsearcheable maners corrupte considered worlde beholde parell ye thoughtes come sawe spared thē greatly haue kepte wynebery grape plante amonge many generacions let multitude perish thē growne vp vayne let grape wynebery kepte euen plante greate laboure haue made vp neuertheles yf thou wilt take vpon yet seuen dayes mo thou shalt fast go thy waye ye felde floures house buylded eate onely floures felde taist flesh drinke wine eate floures onely praye vnto hyest contynually come talke wente waye came felde called ardath like commaunded sat amonge ye floures ate herbes felde ye meate satisfied seuen dayes sat vpon grasse hert vexed within like afore opened mouth beganne talke hyest saide lorde thou yt shewest thy self vnto v 〈…〉 thou hast declared opened thy self vnto oure father wyldernes place man dwelleth baren place whan came egipte thou spakest sayēge heare israel marke wordes thou sede iacob beholde sowe lawe shal brynge frute ye shalbe honoured euer oure father receaued lawe kepte obserued thy ordinaunces statute frute ye lawe declared might thine receaued perished 〈…〉 kepte ye thinge sowne custome whan grounde receaueth sede see shipp vessell meate drynke whan perisheth broken wherin thinge sowne wherin eny thinge put thinges also perishe broken sowne putt therin vnto v hath happened yt haue receaued lawe perish synne oure hert also receaued lawe notwithstondinge lawe perisheth 〈◊〉 40 • tim 2 remayneth laboure whan considered thinges hert maner loked aboute myne eye 〈◊〉 10 vpon right syde sawe woman mourned sore made greate lamentacion wepte loude voyce hir clothes rent peces aszshes vpon hir heade thē let thoughtes go yt turned vnto sayde wherfore wepest thou art thou sory discomforted sayde vnto syr let bewayle take yet sorowe sore vexed mynde brought lowe saide vnto ayleth yt hath done eny thinge ye tell sayde haue bene vnfrutefull baren haue huszband thirtie yeares xxx yeares nothinge el daye night houres make prayer ye hyest thirtie yeares god herde thy handmayden loked vpon misery considred trouble gaue sonne glad huszbād also neghbours gaue greate honoure vnto ye mightie norished greate trauayle whan grewe vp came tyme shulde haue wife made feast x chapter happened whan sonne wente chamber fell downe dyed thē ouethrew lightes neghbours rose vp cō forte thē toke rest vnto secōde daye night whan rested yt might comforte rested also rose vp night fled come hither felde thou seist purposed come cite remayne nether eate ner drynke continually mourne fast vntill dye let meditacions thoughtes fall spake displeasure thou foolish woman seist thou oure heuynes mournynge happeneth vnto v sion mother wofull sory cleane brought downe misery seinge heuynes make oure mone soroufull heuynes thou takest one sonne demaunde earth shal tell ought reason mourne fall many growe vpon begynnynge men borne shal come beholde walke allmost destruccion many shalbe roted shulde reason make mournynge hath lost greate multitude thou art sory one yf thou woldest saye vnto mournynge like mournynge earth haue lost frute body bare heuynes earth acordinge ordynaunce ye earth onely many gone awaye come passe saye vnto like thou hast borne trauayle sorowe euen earth also begynnynge geueth hir frute vnto man yt made therfore witholde thy sorowe heuynes thy self loke happeneth vnto ye beare strōgly heb 12 • yf thou iudgest marck ende god righteous good receauest councell tyme thou shalt commended therin go thy waye cite thy husbande sayde vnto wyll go cite heare dye commoned sayde coūceled folowe many falles hath sion good comforte sorowe ierusalem thou seist oure sanctuary layed waist oure aulter broken oure temple destroyed oure playenge instrumentes synginge layed downe thankesgeuynge put sylence myrth vanished awaye light oure candelstick quenched ye arke couenaunt takē v oure holy thinges defyled name called vpon ouer v dishonoured oure child put shame oure prestes brent oure leuites caried awaye captiuyte oure virgin defyled oure wyues rauyshed oure righteous men spoyled oure childrē destroyed oure yonge men brought bōdage oure strōge worthy become weake sion seale ye greatest lowsed vp hir worshipe deliuered handes hate v therfore shake ye greate heuynes putt awaye multitude sorowes mightie maye mercyfull vnto hyest maye geue rest ye laboure trauayle happened whan talkynge hir face dyd shyne glyster afraied mused might immediatly cast greate voyce fearfull ye earth shoke noyse woman loked beholde woman appeared vnto nomore cite buylded place shewed grounde foundacion afrayed cried loude voyce sayde vriel angell e 4 came first hath caused come many consideracions hye thoughtes myne ende turned corrupcion prayer rebuke speakynge wordes came vnto loked vpon laye one bene deed myne vnderstandinge altered toke right hande comforted set vp vpon fete sayde vnto ayleth thine vnderstandinge vexed vnderstondinge thy hert wherfore art thou sory sayde thou hast forsaken haue done acordynge vnto thy wordes esd 9 wente felde haue sene thinges able expresse saide vnto stōde vp manly shal geue exortacion sayde speake lorde forsake lest dye vayne haue sene knewe herde knowe shall vnderstondynge disceaued mynde seke thou wilt shewe thy seruaunt wōder answered thē sayde heare shall enfourme tell wherfore thou art afrayed hyest hath opened many secrete thynges vnto hath sene thy waye right thou takest sorowe continually thy people makest greate lamentacion sion therfore vnderstonde vision thou sawest litle whyle agoo maner thou sawest woman mournynge thou hast comforted neuertheles seist thou licknes woman nomore thou thoughtest cite buylded like tolde fall sonne answere woman thou sawest sion tolde hath ne thirtie yeares vnfrutefull baren xxx yeares wherin offeringe made xxx yeares salomon buylded offred bare baren sonne tolde norished laboure dwellynge ierusalem sonne dyed hir chamber fall ierusalem thou sawest hir lickenesse mourned hir sonne el happened vnto haue shewed ye god seyth thou art sory thy mynde suffrest ye hert hath shewed hir clearnesse faymes hir bewtye therfore bad remayne felde house buylded knew yt hyest wolde shew vnto therfore commaunded go felde foundacion ner buyldinge place hyest wyll shewe cite shall man buyldinge therfore feare let thine hert afrayed go thy waye se glorious fayre buyldinge greate greate thou thinkest measure thine eye shalt thou heare moch thine eares maye comprehēde thou art blessed aboue many art called hyest ye tomorow night thou shalt remayne shal ye hyest shewe vision hye thinges wyll vnto dwell vpon earth ye last dayes slepte night like cōmaunded xi chapter sawe dreame beholde came vp ye see aegle xij wynges thre heades sawe beholde spred wynges ouer earth wyndes ayre blew put together agayne behelde fethers grew litle contrary fethers heades rested head myddest greater yet rested residue morouer sawe aegle flew wt wynges raigned vpon earth ouer dwell vpon earth sawe yt thinges vnder heauen subiecte vnto man spake one creature vpon earth sawe also aegle stode vp vpon clawes gaue sounde wt fethers voyce sayē ge maner watch together slepe euery mā owne place watch tyme let heades preserued last neuertheles sawe yt voyce wente heades myddest body nombred cōtrary fethers beholde eight loked beholde vpon right syde arose one fether raigned ouer earth happened yt whan raigned ende came place therof appeared nexte folowinge stode vp raigned greate tyme happened yt whan raigned ende came also like first appeared nomore came voyce vnto sayde heare thou yt hast kepte earth lōge saye vnto thou begynnest appeare nomore shal none ye atteyne vnto thy tyme arose thirde raigned afore appeared nomore also wēte residue one another yt euery one raigned thē appeared nomore thē loked beholde processe tyme fethers yt folowed set vp vpō right syde yt might rule also thē ruled within appeared nomore thē set vp ruled loked beholde ye xij fethers appeared nomore two wynges nomore vpon aegles body two heades rested sixe fethers sawe also yt sixe fethers parted two remayned vnder heade yt vpon right syde foure cōtynued place loked beholde vnder wynges thought set vp selues haue rule one set vp shortly appeared nomore seconde sooner awaye first behelde lo two thought also thē selues raigne whā thought beholde waked one heades rest namely myddest greater two heades sawe two heades fylled heade turned yt ate vp ye two vnder wynges yt wolde haue raigned heade put ye whole earth feare bare rule ouer yt dwelt vpon earth moch laboure gouernaunce worlde ouer foules haue bene loked beholde heade middest sodenly appeared nomore like ye wynges came two heades ruled vpon earth ouer dwelt therin behelde lo heade vpon right side deuoured vpon left syde herde voyce sayde vnto loke considre thinge thou seist sawe beholde lyon roareth rennynge haistely ye wod sent man voybe vnto aegle sayde heare thou wyl talke hyest shal saye vnto thou hast victory foure beastes made raigne vpon earth worlde ye ende time might come thorow thē fourth came ouerwanne beastes past power ouer worlde greate fearfulnes ouer whole compasse earth wt wicked laboure longe time dwelt vpon earth disceate earth hast thou iudged trueth thou hast troubled meke thou hast hurte peaceable quyete thou hast loued lyers destroyed dwellynges brought forth frute hast cast downe walles soch dyd harme therfore thy wrongeous dealynge blasphemy come vp vnto hyest thy pryde vnto mightie hyest also hath loked vpō proude tymes beholde ended abhominacions fulfilled therfore appeare nomore thou aegle thy horrible wynges thy wicked fethers thy vngracious heades thy synfull clawes thy vayne body earth maye refreshed come agayne whan deliuered thy violence maye hope ye iudgment mercy made xii chapter happened whā ye lyō spake wordes vnto ye aegle rede sawe beholde ye heade yt afore ye vpperhāde appeared nomore nether dyd ye foure wynges appeare eny yt came hī sett vp raigne kyngdome small full vproure sawe beholde appeared ye whole body ye aegle brēt earth greate feare awaked traunce mynde greate feare sayde vnto sprete lo hast thou geuen yt thou searchest wayes hyest lo yet weary minde weake sprete litle strēgth greate feare receaued night therfore wil beseke hyest yt wyl comforte vnto ende sayde lorde lorde yf haue founde grace thy sight yf iustified ye many yf prayer come vp thy face cō forte shew thy seruaunt interpretacion playne differēce horrible sight thou mayest perfectly cōforte soule thou hast iudged worthy shew ye last oftymes sayde vnto interpretacion sight aegle thou sawest come vp see kingdome sene vision thy brother daniel dan 7 expounded vnto declare vnto beholde dayes come shal ryse vp kyngdome vpō earth shal feared aboue kyngdomes yt kyngdome shal xij kynges raigne one another secōde shal begynne raigne shal haue tyme thē ye xij wynges signifie thou sawest voyce spake thou sawest go heades ye body betokeneth tyme kyngdome shall aryse greate stryuynges shal stonde parell fallynge neuertheles shal yet fall bot shal set beginnynge ye eight vnderwynges thou sawest hā ge vnto ye wynges hī betokē yt hī shal aryse eight kynges whose tyme shalbe small yeares swift two shal beare whan middest tyme commeth shal foure kepte tyme whan tyme begynneth come maye ended two shal kepte vnto ye ende thou sawest thre heades restynge interpretacion last shal hyest rayse vp thre kyngdomes call many agayne thē shal haue dominion earth dwell therin moch labor aboue yt thē therfore called ye heades aegle yt shal bringe forth wickednes agayne yt shal perfourme fynish last thou sawest ye greate heade appeared nomore signifieth one shal dye vpō bed yet payne two remayne shalbe slayne swerde swerde one shal deuoure last shal fall thorow swerde thou sawest two vnder ••• ge vpon heade right syde signifieth whō hyest hath kepte vnto ende small kyngdome full trouble lyon whō thou sawest rysinge vp wodd roaringe speakinge vnto aegle rebukynge vnrighteousnesse wynde hyest hath kepte wickednesse vnto ende shal reproue rente asunder shal sett lyuynge iudgment shal rebuke residue people shal delyuer trouble yt preserued ouer myne endes shal make ioyfull vntyll commynge daye iudgment wherof haue spoken vnto begynnynge dreame thou sawest interpretacion thou hast bene mete knowe secrete hyest therfore wryte thinges yt thou hast sene boke hyde teach thē wyse people whose hertes thou knowest maye comprehēde kepe secretes wayte thou yi self yet seuen dayes moo maye shewed euer pleaseth hyest declare vnto wente waye whan people perceaued yt seuen dayes past come agayne ye cite gathered alltogether least vnto came vnto sayde haue offended euell haue done agaynst yt thou forsakest v syttest place people thou art left v grape vyne candell darcke place hauen shippe preserued ye tēpest haue el aduersite ynough thou must forsake v better v bene brent sion better yt dyed wepte wt loude voyce answered thē sayde good cōforte israel heuy thou house iacob ye hyest hath remēbraūce ye mightie hath forgottē tētaciō haue forsakē nether departed come place praye ye mysery israel might seke mercy ye lowe estate yor sāctuary go yor waye home euery mā dayes wyl come vnto people wēte waye cite like commaunded remayned still felde seuen dayes ye angell bad ate onely floures felde meate herbes dayes xiii chapter happened seuē dayes yt dreamed dreame night beholde arose wynde see moued floudes therof loked beholde man stronge increased cloudes heauen whan turned countenaunce cō sider thinges trembled sene vnder whan voyce wente mouth brent herde like earth whan feleth fyre sawe beholde gathered together multitude mē nombre foure wyndes heauē fight agaynst ye man came ye see loked beholde graued self greate moūtayne flew vp vpon wolde haue sene border place wherout hill grauen coude sawe yt came fight agaynst sore afrayed yet durst fight neuertheles whan sawe fearsnesse violence people nether lift vp hande ner helde swerde ner eny weapen onely sawe sent mouth bene blast fyre lippes ye wynde flamme tōge cast sparkes stormes myxte together blast fyre wynde flā me ye greate storme fell russhe vpon ye people prepared fight brēt thē vp euerychone innumerable multitude nothinge sene onely dust smoke whan sawe afrayed afterwarde sawe man come downe mountayne callinge vnto another peaceable people came moch people vnto glad sory bounde caried brought forth sick thorow greate feare awaked sayde thou hast shewed ye seruaunt ye wōders frō ye begynnynge hast counted worthy yt thou mightest receaue prayer shewe yet interpretacion dreame thus cōsidre vnderstandinge wo vnto shal left dayes moch wo vnto thē left behynde left heuynes vnderstonde ye thinges layed vp latter dayes shal happen vnto left behynde therfore come greate parells many necessity like dreames declare yet easier yt suffreth hurte come passe awaye cloude worlde se ye thinges yt shal happen ye last answered sayde interpretacion sight shall shewe open vnto thinge yt thou hast requyred thou hast spoken left behynde interpretacion taketh awaye parell tyme hath kepte fallen harme soch haue workes saith vnto mightie knowe therfore left behynde blessed deed meanynge vision thou sawest man commynge vp depe see ye god hyest hath kepte greate season owne self shall delyuer creature shal ordre thē left behynde thou sawest yt mouth came blast wynde fyre storme yt lift vp nether swerde ner weapen yt ruszshinge destroyed whole multitude yt came fight agaynst signifieth dayes come whan god wyll delyuer thē yt vpon earth traunce mynde shall come vpon thē yt dwell earth one shal vndertake fight agaynst another one cite agaynst another one place agaynst another mat 24 • one people agaynst another one realme agaynst another whan commeth passe shal token come shewed thē shal sonne declared whō thou sawest clymme vp mā whan ye people heare voyce euery man shal owne lōde leaue battayll yt haue one agaynst another innumerable multitude shall gathered together willinge come ouer come fightinge shal stōde vpon toppe mount sion neuertheles sion shall come shall shewed beynge prepared buylded men like thou sawest hill grauen forth without eny hā de sonne shal rebuke people yt come wickednes tempest euell ymaginacions paynes wherwith shal punyshed lickened vnto flamme eny laboure shal destroye euen lawe cōpared vnto fyre thou sawest gathered another peaceable people vnto hī ten trybes caried awaye presoners owne londe tyme oseas kynge4 17 salmanasar kinge assiria toke presoner caried ouer ye water came another londe gaue councell yt shulde leaue multitude heithē go forth farther countre neuer mankynde dwelt might kepe statute neuer kepte owne lande entred narow passage water euphrates • xo 14 e •• su 3 god shewed token thē helde styll floude tyll passed ouer thorow countre greate waye namely yeare half iourney region called asareth dwelt vnto latter tyme come forth agayne ye hyest shall holde styll sprynges streame agayne maye go thorow therfore sawest thou multitude peace left behynde thy people founde within border whan destroyeth multitude gathered together shal defēde people remayne shal shew greate wonder sayde lorde lorde shew wherfore haue sene man commynge vp depe see sayde vnto like thou cāst nether seke ner knowe thinges depe see euen maiest thou se sonne tyme daye interpretacion dreame thou sawest therfore thou onely art lightened thou hast forsaken thine owne lawe applied thy diligence vnto myne sought thy life hast thou ordred wyszdome reg 3 •• ou 7 hast called vnderstondinge thy mother therfore haue shewed ye treasure hyest thre dayes wil shew talke large yee heuy wonderous thinges wyl declare vnto wente forth ye felde geuynge prayse thankes greatly vnto god wonder dyd tyme gouerneth soch 〈◊〉 tyme satt thre dayes xiiii chapter vpon thirde daye satt vnder oke tre came voyce vnto bush sayde eszdras eszdras sayde lorde stode vp vpon fete 〈…〉 thē spake vnto bush dyd appeare vnto moses talked wt whā people serued egipte sent led people egipte brought vpō ye mount sion helde longe season tolde wonderous workes shewed ye secretes tymes ende commaunded sayēge wordes shalt thou declare hyde thē saye vnto thou laye vp thine hert dreames thou hast sene interpretacions haue shewed thou shalt receaued thou shal turned remayne wt councell soch like vntyll ye tymes ended worlde hath lost youth tymes begynne waxe olde tyme deuyded twolue partes ten partes gone ready half tenth parte yet remayneth ye half ye tenth parte therfore prepare ordre thy house refourme thy people comforte soch thou trouble tell destruccion let go mortall thoughtes cast awaye burthen man put weake nature laye vp place ye thoughtes heuy vnto haist flyt tymes soch euell wickednesse thou hast sene happē shal yet moch worse weaker worlde tyme 〈…〉 shal 〈…〉 wickednesse increase dwell vpō earth trueth fled farre awaye lesynge hard hande ha •• teth vision come thou hast sene answered sayde beholde lorde wyl go thou hast commaunded refourme people present yt shal borne afterwarde wyl exhorte rebuke thē thus worlde set darcknes yt dwel therin without light thy lawe kyndled bec • use man knoweth thinges done shalbe done yf haue foū de grace sende holy goost shall wryte hath bene done worlde sene begynnynge wrytten thy lawe men maye fynde path wyl lyue latter dayes maye lyue answered sayēge go yt waye gather thy people together saye vnto thē seke xl dayes loke thou gather many boxe tree take sarea dabria selemia echanus asial fyue ready wryte swiftly come hither shal light cādle vnderstōdinge thine hert shal put tyll thinges perfourmed thou shalt begynne wryte shalt thou declare thinges openly vnto perfecte thinges shalt thou shew secretly vnto ye wyse tomorow houre shalt thou begynne wryte wēte forth commaūded gathered ye people together sayde heare wordes israel oure father begynnynge straunges egipte whēce delyuered receaued lawe life 〈…〉 kepte ye also haue trāsgressed thē londe londe sion parted amōge lot possesse yor father ye yor selues also haue done vnrighteousnes haue kepte wayes hyest cōmaunded moch righteous iudge toke tyme thinge geuen ye yor brother amōge therfore yf ye wil subdue yor owne vnderstandinge refourme youre hert ye shal kepte aliue death shal ye opteyne mercy death shall iudgment come whan shal lyue agayne shal name righteous manifest ye name vngodly workes shalbe declared let mā therfore come vnto ner axe eny question xl dayes toke fyue men commaunded wente felde remayned next daye voyce called sayēge eszdras open thy mouth drynke geue 〈…〉 thē opened mouth beholde reached full cuppe full water color like fyre toke dranke whā dronken hert vnderstondinge wyszdome grew brest sprete kepte remembraunce mouth opened shut nomore hyest gaue vnderstondinge vnto fyue men yt wrote ye hye thīges night vnderstode night ate bred spake daye helde tonge night xl dayes wrote two hundreth foure bokes happened whā xl dayes fulfilled hyest spake sayenge first thou hast wryttē speake openly yt worthy vnworthy maye rede kepe ye lxx last yt thou mayest shew onely soch wyse amonge thy people sprynge vnderstōdinge fountayne wyszdome
