streame knowlege dyd xv chapter behelde speake thou eares people wordes prophecie wyll put ye mouth saieth lorde cause wrytten letter trueth feare ymaginaciōs yt let ye vnfaithfulnes trouble speake agaynst vnfaithfull shal dye vnfaithfulnes beholde saieth lorde wil brynge plage vpon worlde ye swerde honger death destruccion wickednes hath vpper hande ye earth shamefull workes fulfilled therfore saieth lorde wil holde tonge nomore vnto wickednesse vngodly nether wil suffre thinges deale wickedly beholde apo 6 b 19 innocent bloude troubled crieth vnto soules righteous complayne cōtynually therfore saieth lorde wil surely auē ge receaue vnto innocēt bloude amonge beholde people psal 43 c rom 8 c 1 co 4 b led flock shepe slayne wil suffre dwel egipte wyl brynge ou • mightie hande stretched arme smyte plage afore wyl destroye londe egipte shal mourne foundacions shalbe smytten plage punyshment yt god shal brynge vpon tyll ye groūde shal mourne sedes shal destroyed thorow blastinge hale horrible starre wo worth ye worlde dwell therin ye swerde destrucciō draweth nye one people shal stōde vp fight another swerdes hādes mē shal vnstedfast shal violence vnto shal regarde kynge prynces wayes doinges hā delinges power man shal desyre go cite shal able 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 pryde ye city shalbe brought feare ye house shal shake men shalbe afrayed man shal haue pitie vpon neghboure one shal prouoke another vnto battayll spoyle goodes honger bred greate trouble beholde gather call together kynges ye earth vprysinge south east libanus turne vnto restore thinges haue geuē like yet daye vnto chosen wil also recōpense thē bosome thus sayeth ye lorde god right hande shal spare ye synners swerde shal ceasse ouer shed innocēt bloude vpon earth feare gone frō wrath hath cōsumed foundacions earth synners like strawe kindled wo worth synne kepe commaundementes saieth lorde wil spare go youre waye ye child violence defyle sanctuary lorde knoweth thē synne agaynst therfore delyuereth vnto death destrucciō plage come vpon worlde ye shal remayne thē god shal delyuer ye haue synned agaynst beholde horrible vision commeth frō east generacions dragon shal come people arabes many charettes multitude shalbe wynde vpō earth heare ragynge wrath maye feare afrayed wylde bore ye wod shal go greate power shal come stonde fightinge thē shal waist porcion londe assirians shal dragon haue vpper hande remembringe byrth shal turne aboute swearinge together greate power persecute shalbe afrayed kepe sylence power shal fle one londe assirians shal besege thē consume one thē hoost shal feare drede strife amonge kynges beholde cloudes east north vnto south horrible loke vpon full wrath storme shal smyte one vpon another shal smyte ye greate starre vpon earth starre bloude shalbe swerde vnto bely smoke mā vnto ye camel lytter shalbe greate fearfulnes tremblinge vpō earth se wrath shal afrayed tremblinge shal come vpon shal come greate raynes ye south north parte west stormy wynde east shal shutt vp agayne cloude raysed vp wrath starre cause feare towarde ye east west wynde shalbe destroyed greate cloudes shalbe lift vp ye mightie cloudes full wrath starre maye make earth afrayed thē yt dwell therin maye poure ouer place horrible starre fyre h • le flyenge swerdes many water yt feldes maye full ryuers shal breake downe city walles mountaynes hylles tree wod grasse medowes frute shal go stedfast vnto babilon • ke afrayed shal come besege starre wrath shal poure vpon shal dust smoke go vp vnto heauen aboute shal bewayle remayne vnder shal seruyce vnto haue put feare thou asia yt cōfortest thyself also vpō hope babilon art worshipe hir personne wo vnto thou wretch thou hast made thyself like vnto hast decte ye daughter ī • dome might tryumphe please thy louers haue allwaye desyred cō mytte whordome wt thou hast folowed abhominable cite hir workes invencions therfore sayeth god wyl sende plage vpon wyddowhode pouerte hōger warres pestilence waist thy house destruccion death glory thy power shal dryed vp floure whan ye heate aryseth yt sent ouer thou shalt sick poore wife plaged beatē wemen yt mightie louers shal able receaue wolde hat • saieth lorde yf thou haddest allwaye slayne chosen exaltinge stroke thy handes sayde ouer death whan thou wast dronkē set forth betw •• thy countenaunce rewarde thy whordome shalbe recompensed thy bosome therfore shalt thou receaue 〈…〉 rewarde like thou hast done vnto chosen sayeth lorde euen shal god vnto shal delyuer plage thy childrē shal dye honger thou shalt fall thorow ye swerde thy city shalbe broken downe thine shal perish wt swerde ye felde yt ye moūtaynes shal dye honger eate owne flesh drinke owne bloude hōger bred thyrst water thou vnhappie shalt come thorow see receaue plage agayne passage shall cast downe slayne cite shal rote one parte ye londe cōsume porcion thy glory shal treade downe like stuble shal thy fyre shal consume thy city thy londe thy wod thy frutefull tree shal burne vp fyre thy child shal cary awaye captyue loke thou hast shal spoyle marre bewtie thy face xvi chapter wo vnto babilon asia wo vnto ye egipte syria gyrde yor selues wt clothes sack hayre mourne youre childrē sory yor destruccion honde swerde sent vpon wil turne back fyre kyndled amōge wil quench plage sent vnto wil dryue awaye maye eny man dryue awaye hōgrie lyon wod maye eny mā quench fyre stubble whan hath begonne burne maye one turne agayne arowe yt shot stronge archer mightie lorde sendeth plage wil dryue awaye fyre kyndled gone forth wrath quench shall cast lightenynges shal feare shal thonder shall afrayed lorde shal threaten shal vtterly beaten poulder presence earth quaketh foundacions therof ye see aryseth vp wt wawes depe floudes vnquyete fish therof also lorde glory power stronge right hande holdeth bowe arowes shuteth sharpe shall mysse whan begynne shot ye endes worlde beholde ye plage sent shal turne agayne tyll come vpon earth fyre kyndled shall put tyll consume foundacions earth like arowe shot mightie archer returneth bacwarde euen ye plage yt shal sent vpon earth shal turne agayne wo wo wyl delyuer dayes begynnynge sorowes greate mourninge begynnynge derth greate death begynnynge warres power shal stonde feare • begynnynge euels shal tremble euery one shal thinges whan plage come beholde hōger plage trouble anguysh sent scourge amendement thinges shal turne frō wickedness ner allwaye myndefull ye scourge beholde vitayles shalbe good cheape vpon earth yt shal thinke themselues good case euen shal myschefe growe vpō earth warres derth greate disquietnes many dwell vpō earth shall perish hōger escape honger shal swerde destroye deed shalbe cast donge shalbe man cōforte ye earth shalbe waisted city shalbe cast downe shalbe man left tyll ye earth sowe tree shal geue frute shal plucke thē gather grape shal ripe shal treade thē place shalbe desolate mē one man shal desyre se another heare voyce one whole cite shalbe ten left two felde shall hyde thēselues thicke buszshes clyffes stone like whan remayne thre foure olyues vpon olyue tre whan vynyarde gathered left grape diligētly sought thorow vynyarde euen dayes shalbe thre foure left thē yt search house wt swerde earth shalbe left waist feldes therof shall waxe olde hir wayes hir pathes shal growe full thornes man shal trauayle thorow daughter shal mourne hauinge brydegromes wemen shal make lamentacion hauynge huszbandes daughter shal mourne hauinge helpe brydegrome warres shall destroyed huszbandes shal perish honger ye seruauntes lorde heare thinges marck thē beholde worde lorde receaue beholde plage drawe nye slack tarienge like trauaylinge woman ye ix moneth brīgeth forth sonne whan houre byrth come houre two thre afore paynes come vpō hir body whan childe cōmeth byrth tary twincklynge eye euē shall ye plage slack come vpon earth worlde shal mourne sorowes shal come vpō euery syde people heare worde make redy battayll euell euen pylgrems vpon earth yt selleth let flyeth waye yt byeth one wil lese cor 7 occupieth marchaūdies wynneth buyldeth shall dwell therin soweth one yt shal reape twysteth vynyarde shal gather grape mary shall get child yt mary • sal 126 • ro 10 c • ccli 11 b wyddowes therfore yt laboure labor vayne straungers shall reape frutes spoyle goodes ouer throwe house take childrē captyue captiuyte honger shal get child occupie marchaundies wt robbery longe decke city house possession personnes wil punysh synnes sayeth lorde like whore enuyeth honest woman shall righteousnes hate iniquyte whan decketh hir self shall accuse hir face whan cōmeth defendeth shal make inquysiciō synne vpō earth therfore ye like vnto ner workes therof euer longe iniquite shalbe taken awaye earth righteousnes shal raigne amonge let synner saye hath synned cole fyre shal burne vpon heade saieth lorde god glory haue synned beholde lorde knoweth ye workes men ymaginacions thoughtes hertes gene 1 spake worde let earth made made let heauē made made worde ye starres made knoweth nombre searcheth grounde depe treasure therof hath measured see conteyneth hath shut see myddest water wt worde hath hanged earth vpon water spredeth heauen like vowte vpon water hath founded deserte drye wyldernes hath made sprynges water pole vpō toppe mountaynes yt floudes might poure downe ye stony rockes water earth made man put hert myddest ye body gaue breth life vnderstandinge yee sprete ye allmightie god made thinges hath searched groūde secretes earth knoweth youre ymaginacions inuē cions ye thynke whan ye synne wolde hyde youre synnes therfore hath ye lorde searched sought yor wo • kes shal bewraye whan yor synnes brought forth ye shalbe ashamed men youre owne synnes shal youre accuser daye wil ye ye hyde youre synnes god angel beholde god iudge feare leaue youre synnes forget youre vnrighteousnesses medle nomore shal god lede forth delyuer trouble beholde heate greate multitude kyndled ouer shal take awaye certayne fede ydle wt idol cōsent vnto shal derision laughed scorne trodden vnder fote vnto place shalbe place next city greate insurreccion vpon feare ye lorde shal like mad men shall spare man shall spoyle waist soch feare lorde goodes shall take shute house shall knowne chosen shalbe tryed golde fyre heare ye beloued saieth lorde beholde dayes trouble honde wil delyuer ye afraied dispayre god youre captayne kepeth cōmaundementes preceptes sayeth lorde god let youre synnes weye downe let youre vnrighteousnesses lift vp wo vnto thē subdued vnto synnes tangled wickedness like felde hedged buszshes path therof couered thornes yt man maye trauayle thorow taken cast fyre brent ende iiii boke eszdras boke tobias boke conteyneth chap kynred life godly conuersacion tobias chap ii louynge compassion tobias sheweth buryēge deed cause hated persecuted god nurtoureth blyndnes wyfe casteth teth chap iii tobias prayeth hertely vnto god trouble captiuyte people sara daughter raguel chap iiii tobias teacheth sonne feare god chap v sonne obeyeth father goeth earāde god prouydeth mercifully sendeth angell gyde chap vi iourney take fish wherof angell commaundeth kepe hert gall leuer telleth wherto good chap vii come raguel receaueth louyngly marieth daughter sara vnto tobias chap viii tobias goinge bed wyfe ordreth self angell bad wyfe preserued euell chap ix tobias sendeth angell vnto gabelus money chap x tobias father mother lōge sore commynge raguel seynge kepe longer sendeth awaie wife chap xi returne home welcommed ioyfully olde tobias hath sight agayne reioyse alltogether geue thā kes vnto god chap xii father sonne wolde fayne rewarde angell wil haue nothinge sheweth chap xiii tobias elder prayseth god exorteth mē thankfull vnto chap xiiii tobias beynge olde prophecieth destrucciō niniue prosperous health israel sonne forsaketh sinfull cite father bad goeth father lawe first chapter tobias trybe cite nephtali lyeth hye countrees galile aboue naason waye towarde west hauynge cite sephet vpon left syde though taken presonner dayes salmanasar kynge assirians 〈◊〉 17 neuertheles beynge captiuyte forsoke ye waye trueth moch euer might gett parted dailie felowpresoners brother kynred though yonger thē trybe nephtali yet dyd behaue childeshly workes whan wente ye goldē calues3 12 • ieroboam kynge israel made alone fled company gat ierusalem vnto temple lorde worshipped ye lorde god israel exo 22 23 c deut 12 18 26 faithfully offeringe first frutes tithe thirde yeare ministred tithe vnto straungers conuertes soch like thinges dyd acordinge lawe god whan yet yonge whan man toke owne trybe wyfe called anna nu 36 c begat sonne called owne name taught youth vp feare god refraine synne whan wife sonne kynred come captiuite vnto niniue tyme meates heithē gen 43 • iudit 12 • kepte soule neuer defyled meates moch myndefull lorde hert iere 40 • god gaue fauoure presence salmanasar kynge gaue power go wolde liberte list wente tobias vnto preson comforted matt 25 gaue wholsome exortacions whan came rage cite medes hauynge reade ten tal •• te golde ten talētes syluer ye thinges wher kynge honoured sawe amonge greate company people kinred one gabelus owne trybe beynge necessite gaue sayde weight syluer vnder handwritinge longe season whan salmanasar kynge deed sennacherib sonne reigned steade hated child israel tobias wente daylie thorow kynred comforted gaue goodes euery one thē moch might fed hongrie clothed naked buried deed slaine diligently whan sennacherib kynge came agayne fled iewry tyme4 19 • god punyshed blasphemy wrath slew many child israel tobias buried bodies4 esd 2 c whan tolde kynge commaunded slaye toke awaye goodes neuertheles tobias sonne wife fled waye hyd naked many loued xlv dayes kynge slayne owne sonnes came tobias againe house goodes restored vnto ii chapter thinges vpon solempne daye lorde tobias made good feast house sayde vnto sonne go yt waye brynge hither oure trybe soch feare god maye make mery v whā gone came agayne tolde father one child israel laye slayne vpon strete immediatly leape table left feast came fastinge deed coarse toke bare preuely house yt whan sonne downe might safely burye whā hyd coarse ate meate mournynge feare remembrynge ye wordes lorde sayeth prophet amos • mo 8 b • mac 1 b youre hye feastes shalbe turned sorowe heuynes whan ye sonne downe wente waye buried neghbours reproued sayenge lōge sen commaunded slaye matter • obi 1 hast scarce escaped daunger death buriest thou deed againe neuertheles tobias fearinge god kynge toke body slayne hyd house buried mydnight happened vpō daye buried ye deed weery came home layed downe wall slepte whyle slepe fell downe vpō eye warme donge swalowes nest yt blynde • eu 8 〈◊〉 13 〈◊〉 9 〈…〉 tentacion dyd god suffre happen vnto came might haue example paciēce like holy iob moch euer feared god youth vp kepte commaundementes heuy god plage blyndnes chaūsed vnto remayned stedfast feare god thanked god dayes life like blessed iob derision kynges euen laughed scorne elder kynsfolkes sayde vnto thy hope iob 4 • ye thou hast done allmes buried deed tobias rebuked thē spake saye child holy men tobi▪ • loke life god shal geue vnto neuer turne beleue anna wife wente daylie weeuynge worke ephe • loke lyuinge coude get wt labor hir handes brought happened yt toke kyd brought home whan hir huszband herd crie sayde loke yt stollen 〈…〉 restore agayne owner laufull v eate touch eny thinge theft wife angrie sayde iob 1 • thy hope become vayne openly thy allmes dedes manifest soch like wordes dyd cast tethe iii chapter tobias toke heuely wt teares beganne make prayer sayē ge lorde thou art righteous thy iudgmētes true yee ye wayes mercy faithfulnes iudgmēt psal •• lorde myndefull take vengeaunce synnes nether remembre myszdedes ner ye myszdedes elder haue bene obediēt vnto ye cōmaundemētes therfore spoyled brought captiuyte death derision shame vnto nacions amōge whō thou hast • catred v lorde ye iudgmentes greate haue done acordīge ye cōmaundemētes nether haue walked innocētly ye lorde de • le acordinge thy wil cōmaunde sprete receaued peace mere erpediēt dye thē lyue tyme happened sara daughter raguel rage cite ye medes slaundred one hir father handmaydes namely shulde haue seuen huszbandes soone gone vnto hir slayne deuell called asmodeus therfore whan reproued mayden hir faute answerde sayenge god let v neuer se sonne ner daughter vpon earth thou kyller thy huszbandes wilt thou slay also thou hast slayne seuen men voyce wēte sara hye chamber hir house thre dayes thre nightes nether ate ner drāke cō tynued prayer besought god teares wolde delyuer rebuke vpon thirde daye chaunced whan made ende hir prayer praysed lorde sayenge blessed thy name god father whan thou art wroth shewest mercy tyme trouble thou forgeuest synnes call vpon vnto lorde turne face vnto lift vp myne eye beseke ye lorde lowse bondes rebuke el take vtterly awaye frō ye earth thou knowest lorde neuer desyre vnto man haue kepte soule cleane vnclenly lust haue kepte company passe tyme sporte nether haue made self partaker walke lighte behauoure neuertheles huszbande haue consented take pleasure thy feare peraduenture either haue bene vnworthy el vnmete thou happly hast kepte another huszband 〈…〉 thy councell ye power man euer loueth serueth right sure yf life tempted proued stādeth tryenge yf endure pacience shal haue rewarde hylie crowned yf trouble god doute shal delyuer yf life chastenynge shall haue leue come vnto thy mercy thou hast pleasure oure dampnacion storme thou makest ye wether fayre still wepinge heuynes thou geuest greate ioye thy name god israel praysed euer tyme prayer herde sight magesty hyest god raphael holy angel lorde sent helpe thē whose prayer came together god iiii chapter whā tobias thought prayer herde might dye called vnto sonne tobias sayde vnto sonne heare wordes mouth laye thē thine hert foundacion whan god taketh awaye soule 〈…〉 burie thou body holde thy mother honoure dayes hir life thou oughtest remembre greate parels suffred ye hir wōbe whā also hath fulfilled tyme hir life bury besyde haue god thy thought dayes thy life bewarre lest eny tyme thou cōsent vnto synne rom 6 b lest thou let slippe commaundemētes lorde oure god geue allmes thy goodes turne neuer thy face poore shal come passe face lorde shal turned awaye mercifull ye power yf thou hast moch geue plē teously yf thou hast litle thy diligence gladly geue litle gatherest thou thy self good rewarde daye necessite allmes delyuereth reader frō synne •• ath frō death suffreth soule come darcknes greate comforte allmes hye god vnto sonne kepe well whordome1 te 4 • besyde thy wife se faute knowne let neuer pryde haue rule thy mynde ner thy worde gen 3 pryde beganne destruccion euer worketh eny thinge immediatly geue hyre deu 24 • loke thy hyred seruaunte wagies remayne ouer night matt 7 loke thou neuer vnto another man thinge thou woldest another mā shulde vnto eate thy bred hongrie poore luc 14 • couer naked thy clothes set thy bred wyne vpon buryall righteous thou eate drynke therof synners axe euer councell ye wyse allwaye thankfull vnto god seke ordre thy wayes euer thou deuysest takest hande maye remayne certifie also sonne whan thou wast yet bab delyuered ten talentes syluer vnto gabelus rage cite medes tobi 1 • handwritinge haue therfore seke meanes thou mayest come receaue ye sayde weight syluer geue handwritynge agayne sonne afrayed trueth lede poore life rom 8 • greate good shall haue yf feare god departe synne well v chapter answered tobias father sayde father thou hast commaunded wil diligently shal requyre money tell nether doth knowe ner token shal geue him▪ waye thither neuer knew father answered sayde haue handwritinge whan thou shewest immediatly shall paye go thy waye get faithfull man go ye hyre thou mayest receaue ye money whyle yet lyuynge wente tobias vpon strete founde fayre yonge man stondinge gyrded vp one ready take iourney knew angell god saluted sayde whence art thou thou good yonge man answered child israel tobias sayde vnto knowest thou waye ledeth vnto countre ye medes answered knowe well stretes haue gone oft tymes haue lodged oure brother gabelus dwelleth rage cite ye medes lyeth vpon mount egabthanis tobias sayde vnto praye tary tyll haue tolde father thinges wēte tobias tolde father ye father marueled prayed wolde come vnto whan angell came saluted sayde ioye euermore olde tobias saide ioye haue syt darcknes se light heauen yonge man sayde vnto good cheare god shal helpe shortly tobias sayde vnto canst thou brynge sonne gabelus vnto cite rage medium whan thou commest agayne shal paye thy hyre angell sayde vnto shal lede thy sonne brynge agayne tobias answered tell praye house trybe art thou angell raphael sayde vnto axest thou kynred hyrelinge sekest thou gyde thy sonne go make carefull azarias sonne greate hananias tobias answered thou art come greate kynred praye ye displeased desyred knowe thy kynred angell sayde vnto thy sonne shal lede forth safely brynge whole agayne answered tobias sayde well go youre waie god youre iourney angell beare company whan prepared thinges yt wolde take iourney tobias bad father mother fare well wente waye together whan gone mother beganne wepe sayde 〈…〉 staff oure age hast thou taken awaye sent v wolde god money neuer bene thou hast sent awaye yf bene content wt pouerte bene greate rich vnto v sawe oure sonne sayde tobias vnto wepe oure sonne shall come v agayne safe sounde thine eye shall se trust ye good angell god shal beare cōpany ordre well thinges doth shal come v agayne ioye wordes mother left frō wepynge helde hir tonge vi chapter tobias wente waye dogg folowed ye first night abode water tigris wente wash fete beholde came forth horrible fish deuoure tobias afrayed cried loude voyce sayenge lorde commeth vpon angell sayde vnto take cheke blade drawe dyd drew vpō londe fish beganne leape fete thē sayde angell vnto take bowel fish hert gall leuer kepe thinges necessary good medicyne tobias dyd rosted fish toke iourney residue salted moch sufficient till came rage tobias axed angell sayde vnto praye ye brother azarias tell wher thinges good fish thou hast bydden kepe angell answered sayde yf thou layest pece hert vpon coales smoke therof dryueth awaye maner euell spretes whether man woman thence forth ye shal come nomore vnto gall good anoynte strake ye eye withall eny blemish shal whole tobias sayde vnto wilt thou remayne 〈…〉 angell answered saide nye kinsman thine one raguel name hath daughter called sara hath nether sonne ner daughter good belōgeth vnto thou must mary daughter therfore desyre father shal geue wife answered tobias sayde vnderstonde hath bene maried vnto seuen huszbandes deed haue herde saye deuell slew afrayed therfore lest soch thinges happen vnto also yf came passe seinge onely sonne father mother shulde brynge thē age wt sorow graues sayde ye angell raphael vnto heare tell deuell hath power namely receaue mariage soch fashiō shut god thē hert • es 4 〈…〉 b geue selues owne lust euen horse moole haue vnderstondinge vpon soch hath ye deuell power whan thou takest art come chamber witholde thy self thre dayes geue thy diligence vnto nothinge vnto prayer • obi 8 b first night rost leuer fish deuell shalbe dryuē awaye secōde night shalt thou receaued company holy patriarkes thirde night shalt thou opteyne blessinge god whole child shalbe borne thirde night take mayden feare god desyre child eny fleshly lust sede abraham thou mayest optayne blessinge child vii chapter wente raguel receaued ioyfully whan raguel loked vpon tobias sayde vnto anna wife like yonge man vnto sister sonne whan spoken saide whence ye good brother saide trybe nephtali captiuyte niniue sayde raguel vnto knowe ye brother tobias saide yee knowe well whan spoken moch good angell sayde vnto raguel tobias thou axest yonge mās father raguel bowed self downe wepte toke aboute neck kyssed • obi 9 b sayde god blessynge haue thou sonne thou art sonne good vertuous man anna wyfe sara daughter wepte also whā talked together raguel bad kyll wether make feast whā prayed thē sytt downe dyner tobias sayde wil nether eate ner drinke daye excepte thou first graunte peticion promyse geue thy daughter sara whan raguel herde astonnyed knew happened vnto seuen men wē te vnto begannne feare shulde chaunce vnto also like maner whyle stode doute gaue yonge man answere angell sayde vnto feare geue thy daughter vnto man feareth god belōgeth thy daughter wife therfore might none haue thē sayde raguel doute god hath accepted prayer teares sight trust caused come vnto intent daughter myne might maried hir owne kynred acordinge lawe moses dowte thou tob 6 wil geue vnto toke righthande daughter gaue right hāde tobias sayde god abrahā god isaac god iacob ioyne together fulfill blessynge toke letter made wrytinge mariage made mery praysed god raguel called anna wife vnto bad prepare another chamber thither brought sara daughter wepte sayde vnto good cheare daughter lorde heauen geue ioye heuynesse thou hast suffred viii chapter yt supped brought yōge man thē thought tobias vpon wordes angell toke bagg pece leuer fish layed vpon hote coales angell raphael toke holde deuell sent awaye bounde wyldernes hyer egipte thē spake tobias vnto virgin sayde vp sara let v make oure prayer vnto god daye tomorow1 cor • ouermorow thre nightes wil reconcyle oure selues god whan thirde holy night past shall ioyne together ye deutye mariage child holy men maye come together heithen yt knowe god stode vp together sought god earnestly 〈◊〉 6 yt wolde preserue tobias sayde lorde god father praysed thou heauē earth see welles floudes crea tures therin thou maydest adam moulde earth 〈◊〉 2 b gauest eua helper lorde thou knowest voluptuousnes take sister myne wyfe onely loue childen thy name blessed euer sara sayde haue mercy vpon v lorde haue mercy vpon v let v come whole sounde good age aboute cocke crowe happened raguel called seruauntes wēte make graue sayde chaunced vnto peraduēture dyd vnto seuen men wente vnto whā made graue raguel came agayne wyfe sayde vnto sende one thy maydēs loke yf deed maye burye afore light daye sent mayden se whan came chamber founde whole sounde slepynge together came agayne brought good tydinges raguel anna wife praysed ye lorde sayde praysed thou lorde god israel happened vnto v thought thou hast dealte mercifully v put awaye v enemye persecuted v hast shewed mercy vnto yonder two beloued lorde cause thē magnifie perfectly offre sacrifice thy prayse health people maye knowe yt thou onely art god earth immediatly raguel commaunded seruauntes fyll graue made earth afore light bade wife prepare feast make ready thinges necessary meate soch wente ye waye caused two fatt kyne also foure wether slayne meates prepared neghbours frendes raguel charged tobias remayne two wekes good yt gaue tobias ye one half made wrytinge half remayned shulde fall vnto tobias death ix chapter tobias called vnto angell thought haue bene man sayde vnto brother azarias praye herkē vnto wordes yf shulde geue ye seruaunt shal deserue ye prouydence neuertheles beseke thou wylt take beastes seruauntes go vnto gabelus rage cite meedes delyuer handwrytinge receaue money praye come mariage thou knowest thy self father telleth ye dayes yf tary one daye longe wyl sory mynde seist thou earnestly raguel hath requyred saye nay toke raphael foure raguels seruauntes two camel wente vnto rage cite medes whan founde gabelus gaue handwrytynge receaued ye money tolde also tobias ye sonne toby thī ge happened caused come wt ye mariage whan came house raguel foūde tobias syttinge ye table leape vp kyssed one another gabelus wepte praysed god sayde blessynge god israel haue thou tob • thou art sonne right verteous iust man one yt feareth god geueth greate allmes blessynge haue ye wife yor elder ye maye se yor child youre childers childrē vnto thirde fourth generaciō youre sede maye blessed ye god israel reigneth worlde without ende whan sayde amen wente feast feare lorde helde feast mariage x chapter whyle yōge tobias made lōge tarienge reason ye mariage father full care heuynes thought shulde cause sonne tarieth longe shulde kepte longe peraduenture gabelus deed man wyl geue money thus begāne soroufull anna wife beganne wepe together sonne come agayne vnto daye appoynted mother wepte discomfortable teares sayde wo sonne oh ayled v sende awaye straunge countre thou light oure eye thou staff oure age tob • thou comforte oure life thou hope oure generacion seinge ye thinges haue onely shulde haue sent awaye v tobias comforted sayde holde thy tonge discomforted oure sonne whole sounde man yt sent withall faithfull ynough neuertheles might wyse cōforted daylie wente loked aboute wente aboute stretes wherby thought shulde come againe yf possible might se cōmynge afarre raguel saide vnto sonne ī lawe tary shall sende messaūger vnto thy father tobias tell yt thou art good health tobias sayde vnto sure father mother counte euery daye hertes sory whan raguel prayed tobias wt many wordes wolde wyse heare delyuered sara vnto half parte good seruauntes handmaydēs shepe camel kyne moch money sent awaye peace ioye sayde holy angell lorde youre iourney brynge forth safe sounde ye maye fynde thinges good case youre elder myne eye maye se youre child afore dye elder enbraced daughter kyssed let go exortinge honoure hir father mother lawe loue hir huszbande rule well hir huszsholde kepe hir house good ordre shew hir self fautlesse xi chapter goinge homewarde againe vpon ye xj daye came charra lyeth half waye towarde niniue angell sayde brother tobias thou knowest thou hast left thy father therfore yf please two wyll go let husholde thy wife ye catell come soft fayrly v whan tobias content shulde go raphael sayde vnto take gall fish shal necessary tobias toke g • wente waye anna mother tobias sat daylie waye syde vpon ye toppe hill whence might se farre aboute whyle waytinge cōmynge loked farre anone perceaued hir sonne comminge ranne tolde hir buszbande sayenge beholde thy sonne commeth raphael sayde vnto tobias soone thou commest house immediatly worshipe lorde thy god geue thankes vnto go thy father kysse strake eye ouer wt gall ye fish thou hast brought sure eye shal straight waye opened thy father shal se light heauen shal reioyse sight dogg bene iourney rāne came messaūger wagged tayle gladnesse ye blynde father arose beganne renne stombled fete gaue seruaunt hande ranne mete sonne receaued kyssed wife beganne wepe ioye whan worshipped thanked god satt downe toke tobias fish gall anoynted father eye taried half houre beganne blemysh go eye like bene whyte szkynne egg tobias toke drew eye immediatly receaued sight praysed god wife knew tobias sayde lorde god israel geue prayse thankes thou hast chastened made whole lo se sonne tobias seuen dayes came sara sonnes wife also whole sounde ye housholde catell camel moch money wyues money receaued gabelus tolde father mother benefites god done man led achior also nabath tobias sister sonnes came glad reioysed reason good god shewed vnto ye space seuen dayes made mery right ioyfull euerichone xii chapter thē tobias called sonne vnto sayde maye geue holy man wente tobias answered father sayde father rewarde shal geue thinge deserue benefites hath bene gyde brought safe agayne receaued money gabelus caused get wife droue euell sprete hath bene occasiō gladnesse hir father mother delyuered deuoured fish hath made se light heauen yee haue receaued greate good shulde worthely deserue thinges vnto praye father thou wilt desyre yf happlie wil voutsafe take half haue brought father sonne called toke asyde beganne praye wolde content take good worth half parte brought sayde secretly vnto prayse ye god heauen geue thankes vnto men lyuynge hath shewed mercy rede vnto vnto v good hyde kynges secrete shew prayse ye workes god honorable thinge prayer good fastinge geue allmes better hoorde vp treasure golde tob 4 b dani 4 allmes delyuereth death clenseth synne causeth fynde euerlastinge life synne vnrighteousnes ye enemy owne soules wherfore tell trueth wyll hyde nothinge tob 2 whan thou praydest teares burydest deed leftest thy dyner hyddest deed thy house vpon daye tyme thou mightest burye night offred thy prayer lorde thou wast accepte beloued god necessary tentacion shulde trye hath lorde sent heale prou 3 b delyuer sara ye sonnes wife euell sprete raphael angell one seuen stonde god whā herde sore afrayed trembled fell downe vpon face vnto grounde sayde angell peace feare haue bene wt god geue prayse thankes vnto thought dyd eate drinke gen 18 19 iud 13 c vse meate invisible drynke sene men therfore ye tyme must turne agayne vnto sent ye thankfull vnto god tell wonderous workes whan spoken wordes taken awaye sight yt sawe nomore fell downe flat vpon face space thre houres praysed god whan rose vp tolde wōderous workes xiii chapter olde tobias opened mouth praysed lorde sayde greate art thou lorde euermore thy kyngdome worlde without ende thou scourgest healest 〈…〉 thou ledest vnto hell bryngest agayne none yt maye escape thy hande geue thankes vnto ye lorde ye child israel prayse sight heithē amonge heithen knowe hath scatred intēt ye shulde shew forth maruelous workes cause knowe none god allmightie hath chastened v oure myszdedes owne mercy sake shal saue v considre hath dealt wt prayse feare drede magnifie euerlastinge kynge yor workes wil prayse euen londe captiuyte hath shewed maiesty vnto synfull people turne therfore ye synners righteousnes god ye sure wyl shew mercy vpon soule wil reioyse god prayse lorde ye chosen holde dayes gladnesse thankfull vnto 〈…〉 ierusalem thou cite god lorde hath punyshed workes thine owne handes prayse lorde thy good thinges geue thankes euerlastinge god maye builde vp tabernacle agayne ye maye call agayne vnto soch captiuyte thou mayest haue ioye euermore fayre light shalt thou shyne ye endes ye worlde shal honoure 〈…〉 people shal come vnto farre 〈…〉 shal bringe giftes worshipe ye lorde thy londe shal haue sanctuary shal call vpon greate name cursed shal despyse blaspheme shal condēpned blessed shal yt buylde vp thou shalt reioyse yi childrē shalbe blessed gathered together vnto lorde blessed yt loue ye glad thy peace prayse thou lorde soule lorde oure god hath delyuered cite ierusalem hir trouble wil counte self happie yf sede remayne se ye clearnes ierusalē gate ierusalem shalbe buylded saphyre smaragde cōpase hir walles precious stone 〈…〉 hir stretes shalbe paued wt whyte marblestone hir stretes shal alleluya sunge praysed ye lorde hath exalted yt kyngdome maye vpon euermore amen tobias made ende talkynge xiiii chapter tobias gottē sight agayne 〈◊〉 42 c 〈…〉 lyued two xl yeares sawe childers child whan hundreth two yeare olde dyed buried honorably niniue whan sixe fiftie yeares age lost sight eye whā thre score yeare olde gat sight agayne residue life led ioye increased well feare god departed peace ye houre death called vnto sonne tobias seuen yonge springaldes sonnes child sayde vnto destruccion niniue hande 〈◊〉 23 〈…〉 c worde lorde fayle oure brother scatred londe israel shal come thither agayne whole londe hath bene waist 〈…〉 shalbe fylled house god brent shalbe buylded againe soch feare god shall returne thither heithen also shal forsake idol come ierusalem dwell kynges earth shalbe glad worshipe lorde god israel therfore child heare youre father 〈…〉 serue lorde faithfulnes seke thinge pleaseth commaunde youre child yt right geue allmes myndefull god euer thankfull vnto trueth power heare therfore childrē abyde daye euer ye haue buried youre mother besyde gett hence se wickednes shal brynge destruccion ende ye death mother tobias departed awaye niniue wife child childers child came agayne father mother lawe founde whole good age toke care thē closed eye heyre vnto raguels goodes sawe fifth generacion childers childrē whan xcix yeare age dyed feare lorde kynsfolkes buried posterite continued good life holy conuersacion loued accepted god men people londe ende boke tobias boke iudith boke conteyneth chap noble cite egbathanis nabuchodonosor kynge assirians victory power chap ii vnsaciable desyre nabuchodonosor raigne hoost tyrānye chap iii dyuerse kynges prynces yelde themselues feare tyranny holofernes pryde kynge chap iiii iewes afrayed carefull ierusalem temple make londe strōge prepare selues battayll call vpon god eliachim prest comforteth chap v holofernes taketh indignacion child israel go aboute defende selues achior beareth wytnesse trueth chap vi achior tellynge trueth takē ▪ delyuered vnto people iewes vnto telleth matter moueth people crye vpon god chap vii holofernes layeth sege bethulia child israel crye vpon god holofernes taketh water cite haue greate thyrst vnpacient osias comforteth appoynteth fyue dayes grace god chap viii iudith reproueth elder set • tyme mercy god exorteth people amēdemēt praier rehearseth benefites god telleth hir deuyce chap ix iudith goeth hir oratory prayeth feruently vnto god deliueraū ce hir people chap x iudith decketh best fashiō taketh hir maydē goeth forth night holofernes tent chap xi iudith telleth holofernes cause hir cōmynge pleaseth well chap xii holofernes commaundeth intreate hir well geueth hir liberty go hir prayer maketh greate supper byddeth hir dronken chap xiii iudith seketh oportunite prayeth vnto god strēgth smyteth heade drō ken holofernes bryngeth cite people reioyse prayse god chap xiiii holofernes heade stickte vp vpon walles child israel fall vpon enemy take flight achior cōmeth nombre people god chap xv holofernes hoost wyttes death israelite folowe vpō thē city israel helpe wynne greate spoyles cōmēde iudith chap xvi iudith syngeth prayse vnto lorde people come together vnto ierusalē geue thankes prayse vnto lorde iudith made hir ende first chapter arphaxat kynge medes subdued many people vnto dominion buylded noble strōge cite called egbathanis walles made fre stone foure squared seuētie cubites hye thirtie cubites brode made towres therevpon hundreth cubites hye vpon foure corner euery syde twentie fote brode made porte heith like towres kynge trusted mightie hoost glorious charettes ye twolft yeare raigne happened nabuchodonosor ye kynge assirians raigned greate cite niniue fought agaynst arphaxat ouercame hī ye greate felde called ragau besyde euphrates tigris iadason felde erioth kinge elikes kyngdome nabuchodonosor exalted • mac 1 hert lift vp sent vnto dwelt celicia damascus libanus vnto heithen dwelt carmel cedar soch dwelt galile greate felde eszdrelō samaria beyonde water iordane vnto ierusalem whole londe iesse vnto mountaynes ethiopia vnto dyd nabuchodonosor kynge ye assirians sende messaungers wt one consent wolde agree vnto sent messaungers agayne emptie put thē awaye without honoure nabuchodonosor kynge toke indignaciō londes sware trone kyngdome wolde auenged countrees ii chapter xiij yeare kynge nabuchodonosor vpon xxij daye ye first moneth deuysed courte nabuchodonosor ye kynge assiriās wolde defende called vnto ye elder captaynes men warre shewed secrete councell tolde purpose brynge whole earth vnder domynion whan content sayenge nabuchodonosor kinge called holofernes chefe captayne warres saide vnto go thy waye forth agaynst kyngdomes west specially agaynst haue despysed commaundement 〈…〉 thou shalt spare realme stronge city shalt thou brynge subieccion vnto holofernes called together captaynes ruler power assiria mustred soudyers vnto hoost like kynge commaunded namely hundreth twētye thousande fightinge men vpon fote twolue thousande archer vpon horsebacke ordinaunce sent innumerable multitude camel hoost well prouyded ox small catell yt without nombre caused corne prepared syria hoost moch golde syluer also toke kynges house toke iourney hoost charettes horsmen archer many couered grounde lande like greshoppers whan gone past border assirians came towarde greate mountaynes ange lye vpon left syde celicia wente vp castels wanne euery strōge holde ye welthy cite melothus brake downe spoyled childrē tharsis ismaelites laye towarde wyldernes vpon south syde ye londe chelon wente ouer euphrates also came mesopotamia brake downe hye city broke mambre tyll man come see toke border celicia vnto coastes iaphet towarde south caried awaye madianites spoyled goodes euer withstode slew swerde wente downe felde damascus tyme haruest brent vp corne tree caused vynes cutt downe feare fell vpon dwelt ye earth iii chapter kynges prynces city londes sent embassitours namely syria mesopotamia syria sobal lybia celicia came holofernes sayde let thy wrath ceasse towarde v better v serue greate kynge nabuchodonosor oure lyues subiecte vnto shulde dye slayne receaue greater hurte oure city possession mountaynes hilles feldes greate small catell shepe goates horse camel oure goodes housholdes thy power vnder thy subieccion alltogether oure selues also oure child wylbe thyne owne come vnto v peceable lorde vse oure seruyce thy pleasure came holofernes downe mountaynes horsemē greate power conquered stronge fensed city dwelt londe city toke stronge men soch mere ye warre helpe came soch feare also vpon countrees dweller city prynces ruler people together 〈◊〉 5 wēte forth mete came receaued honorably garlandes torch daunses tabrettes pipe neuertheles though dyd yet might swage rigorous stomak destroyed city hewed downe woddes nabuchodonosor kynge commaunded shulde rote goddes londe ye intent onely might called taken god nacions holofernes power brought vnder wente thorow syria sobal thorow appamia mesopotamia came idumeans lōde gabaa septopoli toke city remayned thirtie dayes wherin caused whole multitude hoost gathered together iiii chapter whan child israel yt dwelt iewry herde sore afrayed came soch tremblinge also feare vpon sorowed shulde vnto cite ierusalem temple lorde done city temple sent samaria roūde aboute vnto iericho toke occupied toppes mountaynes made fast townes walles prepared corne agaynst battayll eliachim also ye prest wrote vnto thē dwelt towarde eszdrelon lyeth ouer agaynst ye greate felde dotha im vnto men might haue passage vnto shulde take wayes mountaynes wherby might eny waye passage ierusalem yt shulde holde diligent watch eny strate waye betwixte ye moū taynes child israel dyd eliachim prest lorde commaunded people eccli 35 cried earnestly humbled soules fastinges prayer wyues prestes put hayrie clothes layed yonge babe temple lorde couered aulter lorde hayrie clothe one acorde cried vnto lorde god israel child shulde geuen pray wyues spoyle yt city shulde layed waist yt sanctuary shulde vnhalowed shame rebuke vnto heithen eliachim hye prest lorde wente rounde aboute israel spake vnto sayenge ye sure yt lorde wil heare youre peticions yf ye cōtynue stedfast fastinges prayer ye sight lorde remembre moses seruaunte lorde exo 17 ouerthrew ye amalechites trusted might power hoost shildes charettes horsmen weapens holy prayer euen shal enemy israel yf ye contynue worke ye haue begonne vpon exortacion contynued prayer lorde moch offred brent sacrifice vnto lorde • ffred offringes vnto ye lorde beynge arayed hayrie clothes aszshes vpon heades besought god whole hert yt wolde vyset people israel v chapter worde came holofernes prynce warres assyriās yt childrē israel prepared selues make resistaunce▪ stopped wa • e betwixte mountaynes exceadinge wroth▪ called prynces moab captaines ammon sayde vnto tell people yt kepeth moūtaynes maner city power maner hoost haue captayne despyse v dwell east come forth mete v iudit • b yt might receaue v peace iudit 11 b achior captayne ammonite answered sayde syr yf please heare wil tell trueth concernynge people dwell mountaynes shal lye go mouth people generacion caldees gen 11 dwelt first mesopotamia wolde folowe ye goddes father londe caldees forsoke customes forefather many goddes worshipped one god made heauē earth also commaunded shulde go thence dwell haran gen 41 g • nd 46 exodi 1 • nd 12 f galat 3 c whan came derth ye whole londe wente downe egipte dwelt foure hundreth yeares ye multiplied greatly hoost might nombred whan kynge egipte oppressed • xodi 1 b • nd 5 b subdued thē buyldinge city makynge claye brick cried vnto god lorde punyshed whole londe egipte dyuerse plage whan kynge egipte let thē go waye • xo 12 c • nd 14 b plage ceassed folowed thē take thē brynge thē agayne seruyce whyle flyenge awaye god heauē opened ye see yt water stode fast vpon sydes wall wente thorow botome see drye shod place whā innumerable people egipcians folowed vpon ouerwhelmed water remayned one tell thē came happened whan people passed thorow reed see came wildernes mount synai neuer man might dwell afore sonne mā neuer rested • xo 15 • xo 1 • f • eut 8 ye bytter water made swete thē might drynke xl yeares meate heauē euer wente without bowe arowe without bukler swerde god fought thē caused thē haue victory yee man able hurte people excepte yt departed vnfaithfully ye worshippinge lorde god 〈…〉 oft worshipped eny besyde god gaue ouer spoyled slayne put confucion neuertheles oft sory departynge worshipe god god heauen gaue power strēgth withstōde enemy morouer slew kynge cananites iebusites pherezites ethites eu • te amorites ye mightie hesebon 〈…〉 toke lōdes city possession longe synned ye sight god wēte well god hateth vnrighteousnesse tymes past whan wente ye waye 〈…〉 god geuen yt shulde walke destroyed dyuerse battayles many nacions many caried awaye presoners straūge coūtre lately haue turned thēselues agayne vnto lorde god 〈…〉 come together agayne countrees scatred abrode thus haue cōquered mountaynes dwell therin ierusalem sanctuary haue againe possession therfore lorde make diligēt inquisicion yf people haue done wickednesse sight god let v go vp agaynst doutles god shal delyuer thy handes subdue vnto yt power yf people haue displeased god shal able withstande 〈…〉 god shal defende thē shall shame ye worlde whan achior spoken wordes prynces holofernes wroth thought slaye sayde one another darre saie yt ye childrē israel able withstōde nabuchodonosor kynge hoost vnwapened people without strēgth vnderstōdinge ye fettes warre achior therfore maye knowe yt hath disceaued v wil go vp ye moū taynes whan mightie men thē taken also shalbe stickte swerde yt people maye knowe nabuchodonosor god earth none without vi chapter whan left speakinge holofernes toke sore indignacion sayde vnto achior moch thou hast prophecied vnto v sayenge 〈…〉 people israel shalbe defended god shew god nabuchodonosor yee whan slaye one man 〈…〉 thou also shalt perish thorow swerde assirians israel shal destroyed thē shalt thou fele nabuchodonosor lorde whole earth thē shal swerde knyghthode go thorow ye sydes thou shalt fall downe stickte amonge wounded israel shalt come thy self agayne vtterly destroyed thē yf thou thynkest thy prophecy true dost thou chaunge thy coloure art thou afrayed thynkest thou wordes able perfourmed thou mayest knowe thou shalt fele thinges thē beholde houre forth wyll sende vnto yonder people whan punyshment swerde haue worthely deserued falleth vpon thou mayest punyshed holofernes cōmaunded seruauntes take achior cary vnto bethulia delyuer handes child israel holofernes seruaūtes toke wēte thorow playne felde whan drew nye vnto mountaynes slynge caster came agaynst neuertheles gat awaye syde mountayne bounde achior hand fote tre left bounde wythies turned agayne vnto lorde notwithstōdinge child israel wente downe frō bethulia came vnto lowsed brought bethulia set myddest people axed matter assiriās left bounde osias sonne micha trybe symeon charmim also called gothoniel pryncipall ruler tyme whan achior stode myddest senatours thē tolde 〈◊〉 5 b answere gaue holofernes thinge axed holofernes people wolde haue slayne sayenge holofernes wroth cōmaunded cause delyuered vnto ye israelite whan ouer came childrē israel might commaunde achior also put death dyuerse tormentes sayde 〈◊〉 5 f god heauen defender whā achior playnely tolde thinges people fell downe vpon face praysinge lorde poured prayer together vnto lorde generall complaynte wepynge sayde lorde god heauen earth beholde pryde loke vpon oure lowlynes cōsidre standeth thy sayntes make knowne yt thou forsakest holde fast yt thou bringest thē lowe yt presume thē selues make boast owne strength whan wepinge prayer people made whole daye longe ended cōforted achior sayēge god oure father whose power strength thou hast praysed shall rewarde yt thou shalt rather se destruccion whan ye lorde god shall geue seruauntes liberte god also amonge v yt yf please yt thou wt thyne mayest dwell wt v whan osias ended councell toke house made greate supper called elder refreszshed selues fastinge afterwarde people called together made prayer night longe congregacion sought god israel helpe vii chapter next daye holofernes commaunded hoost go vp agaynst bethulia iudit 2 • c xx thousande fightinge men fote two twentie thousande horsmē besyde preparynge yt wonne came euery syde countrees city takē prepared selues vnto battayll agaynst israelite came hyll syde vnto topp loketh ouer agaynst dothaim place called belma vnto chelmon yt lyeth towarde eszdrelon whan childrē israel sawe greate multitude assirians fell downe flat vpon ye grounde strowed aszshes vpon heades prayed wt one acorde yt god israel wolde shew mercy vpon people toke weapens sat betwixte mountaynes ye narow place kepte waye daye night whyle holofernes goinge aboute founde water springe south syde conueyed cite condyte cōmaunded directe another waye cut condite sunder welles also farre walles vsed secretly pleasure necessite wente ammonite moabites vnto holofernes sayde child israel trust nether speare ner arowe haue taken kepe mountaynes hilles thou mayest ouercome therfore without ye strykynge eny battayll sett mē kepe welles drawe water shalt thou destroye thē without swerde least shall feble must fayne geue ouer cite thinke able wōne moch lieth moūtaynes wordes pleased holofernes well men warre set hundreth men euery well rounde aboute iudit 16 whan watch endured twentye dayes cisternes water fayled dwelt cite bethulia ye whole cite drynke ynough one daye people water geuen daylie measure came men woman yonge personnes child vnto osias sayde one voyce exo 17 god iudge betwixte v thou hast dealt euell v thou woldest speake peaceably kynge assirians therfore hath god solde v handes man helpe v brought downe eye thirst greate destruccion therfore gather together people cite maye yelde oure selues wyllingly vnto ye people holofernes better yt captyue prayse lorde oure lyues slayne perishe laughed scorne shamed euery man whan se oure wyues child dye oure eye take heauen earth daye recorde god oure father punysheth v acordinge deseruynge oure synnes geue warnynge yt ye geue vp cite ye power holofernes hoost oure ende maye shorte swerde el shal endure longe wante water thirst whan spokē wordes greate wepynge howlynge whole congregacion euery man cryed whole houre longe vnto god one voice sayenge haue synned oure father haue done amysse • sal 105 haue dealt wickedly thou yt art gracious haue mercy vpon v punysh oure vnrighteousnes thine owne scourge geue ouer knowlege vnto people knoweth lest saye amonge heithen psal▪ 〈…〉 god whan weery crienge wepynge helde tunges osias stode vp watrye eye sayde 〈…〉 take good hertes vnto deare brother good cheare let v wayte yet fyue dayes mercy lorde peraduenture shal cut awaye indignacion geue glory vnto name yf helpe v whan fyue dayes past shall ye haue sayde viii chapter happened whan wordes came eares iudith wyddow daughter merari sonne idox sonne ioseph sonne osias sonne elai ye sonne iammor sonne iedeon sonne raphoim sonne achitob sonne melchia sonne euam ye sonne nathania sonne salathiel ye sonne symeon sonne ruben hir huszbande called manasses dyed dayes barlye haruest whyle byndinge ye sheeues together felde heate came vpon heade dyed bethulia cite buried beside father iudith desolate wyddow thre yeares six monethes hyer partes hir house made hirself preuy chambre dwelt beynge closed hir maydēs ware smock hayre fasted dayes hir life excepte sabbathes new moones solempne dayes people israel kepte fayre beutyfull personne hyr husbande also left greate rich plenteous housholde greate vnmoueable possession many catell iudith woman good reporte euery one feared lorde greatly body speake euell worde whā iudith herde osias promised people 〈…〉 fyffte daye wolde geue vp ye cite vnto assirians sent elder chambri charmin whan came sayde thinge wherin osias hath consented yt yf god helpe within fyue dayes wil geue ouer cite assirians ye ye tempte lorde deuyce optayneth mercy god prouoketh vnto wrath displeasure wyl ye set mercy ye lorde tyme appoynte daye youre wyll neuertheles moch lorde pacient let v rather amende oure selues pouringe teares besekynge grace 〈…〉 god threateneth mā nether wyll prouoked vnto wrath child men therfore let v hertely fall downe serue meke sprete wepynge eye saye vnto lorde deale v acordinge owne wyll mercy like oure hert vexed brought lowe thorow pryde maye comforted thorow grace moch folowe synnes oure father forsoke god worshipped goddes 〈…〉 synne perished swerde spoyled brought shame enemy v knowe none god onely whose cō forte let v tary mekenesse shall requyre make inquisicion oure bloude vexacions oure enemy 〈…〉 shal brynge downe heithen ryse vp agaynst v put dishonoure euē lorde oure god therfore deare brother seinge ye honorable elder people god vnto ye people haue respecte vpon life people stondeth lift vp hertes youre exortacion yt maye call remembraunce oure father also tymes past tempted 〈…〉 〈◊〉 32 f yt might proued yf worshipped god right ought remēbre oure father abraham beinge tempted 〈◊〉 17 〈◊〉 1 • tryed thorow many tribulacions founde louer frende god isaac 〈…〉 28 b 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 • 2 iacob moses pleased god beinge tryed thorow many trouble foūde stedfast faith agayne receaued tentacions feare god put thē selues forth vnpaciency murmurynge agaynst god 〈◊〉 11 〈…〉 〈◊〉 1 • perished destroyer slayne serpentes therfore shulde vndertake auenged thinge done vnto v considre punyshmentes farre lesse oure synnes myszdedes beleuynge also correccion commeth vnto v seruauntes god amendment • om 5 oure destruccion sayde osias elder vnto iudith thou speakest true mā reproue ye wordes praie thou v therfore vnto god thou art holy womā fearest god iudith sayde vnto seynge ye knowe1 cor 14 1 ioh 4 1 te 5 c wordes god proue councell deuice yf god beseke god wyll brynge councell good ende thus haue deuysed iudit 10 b ye shal stōde night porte wyll go forth abra maydē praye ye therfore vnto god wyl graciously remēbre people israel within fyue day ye haue sayde thinge go hande withall axe ye question tyll iopen vnto ye nothinge el praye vnto lorde youre god osias prynce people iuda sayde vnto go thy waye peace lorde maye auenged oure enemy wente agayne ix chapter whā gone way iudith wente hir oratory put hayrie smock strowed aszhes vpon hir heade fell downe lorde cryed vnto sayenge lorde god father symeon gen 34 • gauest swerde defence agaynst enemy vsed violence wilfulnes rauyshed ye vyrgin put dishonesty thou gauest wiues praye daughter captiuyte praye spoyle vnto thy seruauntes bare zele vnto helpe wyddow lorde god beseke ye thou hast done thinges begynnynge loke thou hast taken hande deuysed came euer passe thy wayes prepared thy iudgmentes done thy euerlastinge fore knowlege loke vpon armyes assirians like thy pleasure somtyme loke vpon hoost egipcians whan beynge weapened exo 14 • persecuted thy seruauntes put trust charettes horsmen multitude men warre thou lokedest vpon hoost castinge thick darcknes whan came depe water ouerwhelmed euē lorde let go trust ye power multitude men warre psal 45 b charettes arowes speares knowe thou onely art oure god destroyest warres begynnynge thou art lorde lift vp thine arme like euer ye begynnynge thy power brynge power naught cause might fall thy wrath make boast yt wyl vnhalowe defyle thy sanctuary waist tabernacle ye name cast downe horne thine aulter swerde brynge passe lorde yt pryde enemye maye cut downe owne swerde maie taken snare eye yt thou mayest smyte lippes loue geue stedfast mynde maye despyse strength maye destroye shal brynge thy name euerlastinge remēbraunce • udic 4 5 • par 14 c 16 b 20 • udic 7 psal 146 b yf hande woman ouerthrowe thy power lorde stondeth ye power men nether hast thou eny pleasure strēgth horse neuer proude personne pleased prayer humble meke hath thy pleasure bene euermore thou god heauens thou maker water lorde creature heare poore woman callynge vpon puttynge trust thy mercy remembre thy couenaunt lorde • ccli 36 mynister wordes mouth stablysh deuyce hert thy house maye contynue still holynes heithen maye knowe vnderstōde thou art god none thou x chapter whan left cryenge vnto lorde rose vp place lyen flat lorde called hir mayde wente downe hir house layed ye hayrie cloth • udit 16 b put garmentes hir wyddowhode waszshed hir body anoynted hir self precious thinges swete sauoure broyded plated hir hayre sett hooue vpon hir heade put soch apparell belongeth vnto gladnesse slipper vpon hir fete armelettes spanges earynges fynger rynges deckte hir best araye lorde gaue also speciall beutye fayrnesse deckinge hir self done eny volupteousnesse pleasure flesh right discrecion vertue therfore dyd lorde increase hir bewtye yt exceadinge amyable welfauoured men eye gaue hir mayde also bottell wyne pot oyle pottage cake bred chese wente hir waye whan came porte cite founde osias elder cite waitinge whan sawe astonnyed marueled greatly bewty neuertheles axed question let go sayenge god oure father geue ye grace power perfourme deuyce thy hert ierusalem maye reioyse ouer thy name maye nombre holy righteous yt sayde wt one voyce iudith made hir prayer vnto ye lorde wente ye porte hir mayde goinge downe mountayne happened aboute sprynge daye spyes ye assirians met wt toke sayenge whence commest thou whither goest thou answered daughter ye hebrues fled knowe shalbe geuē vnto spoyled thought scorne yelde thē selues vnto might fynde mercy youre sight therfore haue deuysed self maner wyll go prynce holofernes tell secretes wyll shew maye come wynne one man hoost shall perish whan men herde hir wordes considered hir fayre face astonnyed wondred hir excellent bewtye sayde vnto thou hast saued ye life fyndinge deuyce yt thou woldest come downe lorde thou sure whā thou cōmest vnto shal intreate well thou shalt please ye hert brought holofernes pauylion tolde whan came immediatly ouercome taken hir bewtye saide seruauntes wolde despyse ye people ye iewes yt haue fayre wemē shulde reason fight thē whā iudith sawe holofernes syttinge canapye yt wrought purple sylke golde smaragde precious stone loked fast vpō fell downe vpō earth holofernes seruaūtes toke hir vp agayne lordes commmaundement xi chapter sayde holofernes vnto good chere feare thine hert neuer hurte man wolde serue nabuchodonosor kynge thy people yf despysed shulde haue lift vp speare agaynst thē tell cause yt thou art departed wherfore art thou come vnto v iudith sayde vnto syr vnder stonde wordes thy handmayden yf thou wilt ye wordes thy hādmayden lorde shall brynge thy matter prosperous effecte truly nabuchodonosor lorde londe lyueth truly power lyueth punyshment men go wronge men shall onely subdued vnto thorow beestes also ye felde people speake thy prudēt actiuyte hath euer bene reported thou onely art good mightie kyngdome thy discrecion commēded londes thinge manifest also achior spake 〈◊〉 5▪ wel knowne thou commaūdedst vnto plaine suretye oure god wroth v reason oure synnes hath shewed prophetes vnto people synnes wyl delyuer ouer vnto enemie moch child israel knowe haue displeased god sore afrayed suffre greate honger also wante water deed maner morouer appoynted slaye catell maye drynke bloude purposed spende holy ornamentes god hath forbyddē thē touch corne wyne oyle seinge thinges playne case yt must nedes destroyed whan thy handmayden perceaued fled lorde hath sent vnto ye shew thinges thy handmayden worshipe god euen besyde thy honde mayden shal go forth wil make praier vnto god shal tell whan wyl rewarde thē synne shal come shew brynge thorow myddest ierusalem thou shalt haue ye people israel shepe without shepherde shal moch one dogg barck agaynst thinges shewed prouydence god moch god displeased hath sent tell wordes pleased holofernes seruauntes marueled wysdome sayde one another soch woman vpon earth bewtye discrecion wordes holofernes sayde vnto god hath done well hath sent hither thy people thou mayest geue oure handes moch ye promyse good yf thy god perfourme vnto shall god also thou shalt excellent greate courte nabuchodonosor thy name shalbe spoken londe xii chapter commaunded go treasure laye charged shulde haue hyr dwellynge appoynted shulde geuen frō table iudith answered sayde gen 34 f meate thou hast commaunded geue maye eate lest displease god wyl eate soch haue brought sayde holofernes vnto yf thinges thou hast brought fayle shal vnto iudith sayde truly thou lyuest lorde thy hande mayden shall spende tyll god haue brought passe hande thinges haue deuysed seruauntes brought tent appointed goinge desyred might haue leue go forth night daye hir prayer make intercession vnto lorde commaunded holofernes chamberlaynes shulde go hir pleasure praye vnto hir god thre dayes night season wēte forth valley bethulia wasszhed hirself wellwater wente vp besought lorde god israel wolde prospere hir waye delyueraunce people wente remayned cleane hir tent till toke hir meate euenynge vpon ye fourth daye happened yt holofernes made costly supper vnto seruaū te sayde vnto vagao chamberlayne go yi waye councell hebruesse maye wyllynge consent kepe company shame vnto assirians woman shulde laugh man scorne come vnmedled withall wente vagao vnto iudith sayde let good daughter afrayed come lorde maye honoured maye eate drynke wyne mery vnto iudith answered shulde saye lorde naye euer good eye shal loke pleasure shal thinke well done longe lyue stode vp deckte hirself hir apparell wente stode holofernes hert whole moued brent desyre towarde holofernes sayde vnto drynke sytt downe mery thou hast founde fauoure sayde iudith syr wil drynke mynde meryer daye euer life toke ate dranke thinges hir mayden prepared holofernes mery wt dranke wyne euer dyd afore life xiii chapter whan late night seruauntes made haist euery mā lodginge vagao shutt chamber dores wente waye ouerladen wyne • ccli 31 c iudith alone chamber holofernes laye vpon bed droncken dronkennes fell slepe commaunded iudith hir mayden stōde without dore wayte iudith stode bed makynge hir prayer teares moued hir lippes secretly sayde strength lorde god israel haue respecte vnto workes handes houre thou mayest set vp thy cite ierusalem like thou hast promysed graunte maye perfourme thinge haue deuysed thorow beleue haue whan spoken wente bedsteade lowsed swerde hanged vpon drew toke holde hairie locke heade sayde strength lorde god houre gaue two stroke vpon neck smote heade toke canapy awaye rolled deed body asyde immediatly gat forth delyuered head holofernes vnto hir mayden bad hir put hir walett two wente forth together custome though wolde praye passed hoost came thorow valley vnto porte cite iudith cried farre vnto ye watch men vpon walles open gate sayde god v hath shewed power israel whan herde hir voyce called elder cite together came mete litle greate yonge olde thought shulde haue come soone lighted candels gathered aboute hir euaerichone wente vp hye place caused sylence proclamed whan euery man helde tonge iudith sayde prayse lorde oure god hath despysed ner forsaken put trust honde mayden hath perfourmed mercy promysed vnto house israel yee hāde night hath slayne enemy people toke forth heade holofernes walett shewed sayenge beholde heade holofernes captayne assiriās canapy wherin laye dronkennes lorde oure god hath slayne hande woman truly lorde lyueth angell hath kepte goinge thither remayninge commynge hither agayne thence lorde hath suffred handmayden defyled without eny fylthynes synne hath brought agayne vnto yt greate victory escaped ye delyuered geue thankes vnto euerychone 〈…〉 gracious mercy endureth euer praysed lorde alltogether gaue thākes vnto sayde lorde hath blessed power thorow hath brought oure enemy naught ozias ye chefe ruler people israel sayde vnto blessed art thou lorde hye god aboue wemen vpon earth blessed lorde maker heauen earth hath gyded ye right wounde smyte heade captayne oure enemy daye hath made thy name honorable thy prayse shall neuer come mouth mē shal waye remembre ye power lorde seinge thou hast spared thine owne self put ieoperdy consideringe anguysh trouble thy people hast helped fall god lorde people sayde amē amen achior also called came sayde iudith vnto god israel vnto whō thou gauest wytnes wolde auenged enemy euen hath night thorow hande smyttē head vnfaithfull thou mayest se beholde ye heade holofernes presumptuous pryde despysed god people israel threatened ye destruccion sayenge whan people israel takē shall cause also stickte swerde 〈◊〉 ▪ 16 whan achior sawe holofernes heade▪ fell downe vpon face grounde anguish feare yt swowned come agayne fell downe praysed sayēge blessed art thou thy god tabernacle iacob people heare thy name shall prayse god israel xiiii chapter ivdith saide vnto people brother heare styck vp heade vpon oure walles whan sonne aryseth take euery man weapen fall violently though ye wolde go besyde renne vpon violence whan spyes tētes se shall necessite cōpelled fle bacwarde rayse vp captayne battayll whā captaynes come holofernes pauylion fynde deed body wrapped bloude fearfulnes shall fall vpon whan ye perceaue fle folowe without care god shal delyuer vnto destroyed achior seynge power god shewed vnto people israel fell heithenish beleue put trust god let self circumcided nombred amonge people israel posterite vnto daye soone daye stickte vp holofernes heade vpon walles euery man toke weapen wente horrible crye whan spyes sawe ranne vnto holofernes tent within tēt came chamber made greate russzhinge wake vp thought noyse haue raised durst one assirians knocke go ner open whan captaynes prynces chefe kynge assirians hoost came together saide vnto chamberlaynes go youre waye wake vp myse crepte hole darre prouoke v vnto battayll1 14 • wente vagao chamber stode bed clapped handes thought bene slepynge iudith whā herkened perfectly eares coude perceaue sterynge wente nyer bed lift vp sawe deed body holofernes lyenge without heade weltred bloude vpon earth cried loude voyce wepynge rent clothes wente iudiths tent founde leapte vnto people sayde one womā ye iewes hath brought nabuchodonosors people shame lo holofernes lyeth vpō grounde hath heade whan chefe assirians hoost herde rente clothes fell intollerable feare tremblinge vpō yt theyr myndes sore afrayed exceadynge greate crye whole hoost xv chapter whan hoost herde holofernes headed mynde councell fell soch feare came vpon vndertoke defende themselues flyenge awaye one spake another hanged downe heades left behynde made haist escape hebrues herde haistinge come weapens fled wayes feldes thorow fote pathes dale whan ye child israel sawe fled folowed vpon wente downe trōpettes blowinge makynge greate crie thē assirians ordre kepte thē selues together fled waye neuerthelesse child israel fell vpon one company ordre discomfited many might gett osias sent messaungers vnto city coūtrees israel region euery cite sent best men harnesse smote swerde tyll came ye vttemost parte border bethulia came tē te assirians toke fled left behynde founde greate good came agayne bethulia battayll toke soch thinges bene nōbre catell costly iewels lowest vnto hyest made riche spoyles ioachim hye prest ierusalē came bethulia elder might se iudith whan came vnto beganne prayse one voyce sayenge thou worshipe cite ierusalem thou ioye israel thou honor oure people thou hast done manly thy hert comforted thou hast loued clenlynes chastyte hast knowne man thine owne huszbande therfore hath hā de lorde comforted blessed shalt thou euer people sayde thirtie dayes coude people israel scarse gather vp spoyles assirians belonged vnto holofernes bene specially whether golde syluer precious stone clothinge ornamentes gaue vnto iudith people reioysed wemen maydens yonge people pipe harpes xvi chapter sange iudith songe vnto lorde begynne vnto lorde vpon tabrettes singe vnto lorde vpon cymbal synge vnto new songe thankesgeuynge ioyfull call vpon name psal 〈…〉 lorde destroyeth warres euen lorde name hath pitched tentes myddest people might delyuer v hande oure enemy assur came mountaynes multitude strength
