awaie h • r widdowes garment put appared gladnesse reioysinge child israel anoynted hir face bounde vp hir hayre hooue begyle hir slipper rauyshed eye hir bewtye captyuated mynde 〈…〉 swerde smote neck persian astonnyed hir sted fastnesse medes hir boldnes howled armyes ye assirians whan symple appeared drye thyrst sonnes daughter haue pearsed thorow slayne fugityue childrē peryshed battayll feare lorde god let v synge songe thākesgeuynge vnto lorde new songe prayse wyl synge vnto oure god lorde lorde thou art greate god mightie power man maye ouercome thy creature shulde serue thou spakest worde 〈…〉 made thou sente thy sprete created man maye withstonde thy voyce mountaynes shal moue foundacions water stony rockes shal melt like waxe feare shal greate ye thinges wo vnto people ryse vp generacion allmightie lorde wyll auenge self daye iudgmēt wyl vyset shall geue fyre wormes flesh maye burne fele euermore happened victory people came ierusalem geue prayse thankes vnto lorde whā purified offred brent sacrifice promysed offerynges iudith offred holofernes weap • n iewels ye people geuē 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 13 b canapy toke bed hanged vp vnto lorde people ioyfull vse ioye reason victory iudith endured thre monethes dayes euery man wente home agayne iudith greate reputacion bethulia right honorably taken londe israel vnto hir vertue also chastite ioyned yt hir huszbonde manasses dyed neuer knew man dayes hir life vpon hye solempne dayes wente greate worshipe dwelt hir huszbandes house hundreth fyue yeare left hir hond • mayden fre dyed buried besyde hir huszbande bethulia people mourned seuen dayes 〈…〉 longe lyued none troubled israel many yeares also hir death daye wherin victory gotten solemply holden rekened iewes nombre holy dayes yet greatly holden iewes euer sence vnto daye ende boke iudith chapter boke hester founde text hebrue greke latyn xi chapter latyn chapter descrybed dreame mardocheus mardocheus sonne iair sonne semei 〈…〉 ye sonne cisei ye trybe ben iamin iew dwelllynge susis man greate reputaciō excellent amonge kynges courte neuerthelesse one presoners4 reg 24 iere 24 nabuchodonosor kynge babilō caried awaye ierusalem vnto babilon wt iechonias kynge iuda seconde yeare raigne greate artaxerses first daye ye moneth nisan mardocheus soch dreame thought herde greate tēpest horrible thonder clappes erthquakes greate vpror ye londe yt sawe two greate dragōs ready fight one agaīst another crye greate roaringe crye heithen vp fight agaynst ye righteous people ye daye full darcknes vncleare full trouble anguysh yee greate fearfulnes londe righteous amased feared ye plage euell yt deuysed ouer thē poynte wt selues dye cried vnto god cryenge litle well grew greate ryuer many water yt daye sonne rose vp agayne ye lowly exalted deuoured glorious proude whan mardocheus sene dreame awoke mused stedfastly hert god wolde desyred knowe matter mynde vpon vntyll night xii chapter chapter declared mardocheus vttereth treason two seruauntes agaynst kynge therfore doth kynge rewarde tyme dwelt mardocheus bagatha thares kynges chamberlaynes porter palace whan herde deuyce diligently considered ymaginacions perceaued wente aboute hest 2 6 laye cruell handes vpon kynge artaxerses certified kinge therof caused kynge examen ye two gelded tormentes whan graunted put death kynge caused put ye cronicles euerlastinge remembraūce mardocheus wrote vp matter kynge commaunded mardocheus shulde seruyce courte faithfulnesse gaue rewarde aman sonne amadathu agagite holden greate honoure reputacion kynges courte vndertoke hurte mardocheus people two chamberlaynes put death xiii chapter copie commaundement kīge artaxerses entisinge amā sent countres destruccion iewes prayer mardocheus greate kynge artaxerses raigneth india vnto ethiopia hest 1 16 ouer hundreth seuen twē tye londes sendeth frendly salutacion vnto prynces debytes countrees subiecte vnto dominion whan made lorde ouer many people subdued whole earth vnto dominion mynde crueltye wronge exalte reason power purposed wt equyte allwaye gentylnes gouerne vnder iuriszdiccion wholy set peaceable life therby brynge kingdome vnto tranquylite men might safely go thorow euery syde renue peace agayne men desyre whan axed councelers thines might brought good ende one v excellēt wyszdome whose good wyll trueth faithfulnes hath oft bene shewed proued also ye pryncipall next vnto ye kīge amā name certified v yt lōdes crepte rebellious folke yt made statute lawes agaynst people haue allwaye despysed proclamed commaundementes kynges cause suffred soch rule shulde contynue put downe seinge perceaue people alone contrary vnto euery man vsynge straunge maner lawes withstonde oure statute doinges go aboute stablish shrewd matter oure kyngdome shulde neuer come good estate stedfastnes therfore haue commaū ded appoynted wrytinge shewed vnto aman ordened set ouer oure busynes pryncipall next vnto kynge maner father shal wiues child destroyed roted swerde enemy aduersaries yt shalbe mercy shewed man spared shalbe done ye xiiij daye moneth called adar yeare olde also haue euer bene rebellious maye one daye violence thrust downe hell intēt maner oure empyre maye haue peace tranquylite mardocheus thought vpon workes noble actes ye lorde made prayer vnto sayenge lorde lorde thou valeaunt allmightie kynge thinges thy power yf thou wilt helpe delyuer israel mā withstōde ner lett thou hast made heauen earth wonderous thinge euer vnder heauen thou art lorde thinges man yt resist lorde thou knowest thinges thou wotest lorde nether malyce ner presumpcion ner eny desyre glory wolde bowe downe ner worshipe yonder proude presumptuous aman wolde haue bene cō tent yt good wyll yf might haue done israel eny good haue kyst euē fotesteppes dyd wolde sett honoure mā steade glorye god wolde worshipe none onely ye lorde haue done pryde ner presumpcion therfore lorde thou god kinge haue mercy vpon thy people ymagyn maye bringe v naught yee mynde desyre destroye ouerthrowe people hath euer bene thine enheritaunce olde despyse thy porciō thou hast delyuered brought egipte thine owne self heare prayer mercifull vnto ye people whō thou hast chosen heretage vnto thyself turne oure complaynte sorow ioye maye lyue lorde prayse thy name lorde suffre ye mouthes praise destroyed ye people israel like maner cried earnestly coude vnto lorde death destruccion stode eye xiiii chapter sorowe complaynte prayer quene hester qvene hester also beynge battayll death resorted vnto lorde layed awaye hir glorious apparell put garmētes serued sighinge mournynge steade precious oyntment scatred ash dō ge vpon hir heade hir body humbled brought lowe place wōte haue ioye afore fylled ye hayre yt pluc •• hirself prayed also vnto lorde god israel wordes lorde thou onely art oure kynge helpe desolate womā haue helper ye misery destruccion harde hande fro youth vp haue herde kynred father 〈◊〉 4 c 〈◊〉 7 thou tokest israel amōge people haue oure father fore elder shulde thy perpetuall inheritaunce loke thou didest promise thē thou hast made good vnto thē well lorde haue synned 〈◊〉 12 c therfore hast thou geuen v hādes oure enemy worshipped goddes lorde thou art righteous neuertheles satisfieth thē bytter heuy captiuyte oppressed amonge thou hast layed hondes vpon hondes goddes begynne take awaye thinge thou thy mouth hast ordened appoynted destroye thyne inheritaunce shut stoppe ye mouthes prayse quēch glory worshipe thy house thine aulter open mouthes heithen yt maye prayse power vertue goddes magnifie fleshly kynge euer lorde geue thy cepter vnto thē nothinge lest laugh v scorne oure misery fall turne deuyce vpō selues punysh hath begonne ouer v set exampls thinke vpon v lorde shew thy self ye tyme oure distres oure trouble strength thou kynge goddes thou lorde power geue eloquēt pleasaunt speach mouth lyon 〈…〉 turne hert ye hate oure enemie destroye soch consent vnto delyuer v thy hande helpe desolate woman haue defence ner helper onely ye lorde thou knowest thinges thou wotest loue glory worshipe vnrighteous hate abhorre bed vncircū cyded heithen thou knowest wotest necessite yt hate token preemynence worshipe beare vpon heade tyme must shew self sene abhorre vncleane cloth weere whā quyete alone self thou knowest also thy honde mayden haue eaten amās table haue pleasure ner delyte kynges feast haue dronke drynk offeringes thy honde mayden haue ioye sen ye daie brought hither vnto daye onely lorde thou god abraham thou mightie god aboue heare voyce haue none hope delyuer v hande ye wicked delyuer feare xv chapter quene hester appeareth kynge heuy hert trouble hir people god turneth kynges hert vpon ye thirde daye happened hester layed awaye ye mournynge garmētes hester 5 put hir glorious apparell decte hirself goodly called vpon god beholder sauioure thinges toke two maydes wt vpon one leaned hir self one yt tender folowed bare trayne hir vesture shyne hir bewtye made hir face rose coloured similitude hir face chearfull amyable hir hert soroufull greate feare wente thorow dores stode kynge kynge sat vpon trone kingdome clothed goodly araye golde sett wt precious stone terryble lift vp face shone clearnes loked grymly vpon fell quene downe pale faynt leaned hir self vpon heade mayde wente neuertheles god turned ye kynges mynde gentle prou 21 leape seate feare gat armes helde hir vp tyll came agayne gaue louynge wordes also sayde vnto hester matter ye brother good cheare thou shalt dye oure commaundement toucheth comons come nye helde vp golden wande layed vpon hir neck enbraced frendly sayde talke thē sayde gen 33 b 2 19 c sawe lorde angell god hert troubled feare thy maiesty clearnesse excellent wonderfull art thou lorde thy face full amyte thus speakynge vnto fell downe agayne fayntnes cause kynge afrayed seruauntes comforted xvi chapter copye commaundement kinge artaxerses caused proclamed countrees domynion wealth iewes greate kynge artaxerses raigneth frō india vnto ethiopia ouer hundreth xxvij londes sendeth vnto prynces ruler londes soch loue frendly salutacion many sondrye frendshipes benefites diuersly • vnto worshipe euer ye proude hye mynded vndertake onely hurte oure subiectes plenteous benefites maye suffre begynne ymagin thinge agaynst good take onely vnthankfulnes awaye fro men pryde presumpcion vnmyndefull vnthākfull good dedes go aboute escape iudgment god yt seyth thinges iudgment hateth punysheth wickednes happeneth oft also yt set office hyer power vnto busynes cause subiectes cōmytted handled waxe proude defyle thē selues sheddynge innocent bloude bryngeth intollerable hurte also false disceatfull wordes lyenge tale disceaue betraye innocent goodnes prynces profitable good take hede make search therafter consider onely hath happened vnto v olde shamefull vnhonest noysome thinges debites haue taken hande oure eye therby bewarre tyme come maye make kyngdome quyete peaceable men might tyme drawe chaunge ye thinge present oure eye withstande put downe frendly maner hester 3 tyme aman sonne amadathu ye macedonyan straunger verely persian bloude farre oure goodnes come amōge v aleaunt optayned frendshipe beare towarde people called oure father hye honoure euery man next pryncipall vnto kynge coude forbeare self pryde hath vndertaken onely robbe v kyngdome oure life manyfolde disceate also hath desyred destroye mardocheus oure helper preseruer hath done v good thinges innocent hester like partaker oure kyngdome hir people mynde whan takē waye robbed v meanes translate kyngdome persian vnto thē macedonia fynde iewes accused ye wicked yt might destroyed euell doer vse reasonable right lawes child hye lyuynge god kyngdome v oure progenitours hath bene well ordred hither wherfore letter cōmaundementes put forth aman sonne amadathu ye shal well yf ye holde none effecte set vp inuented thē hangeth susis porte kinred god hath thinges power hath rewarded deseruynge vpon ye shal publish set vp copy letter place iewes maye frely without hinderaunce holde selues owne statute maye helped vpō ye xiij daye ye xij moneth adar may • auenged tyme anguysh trouble wolde haue oppressed thē god gouerneth thinges hath turned ioye daye wherin ye chosen people shulde haue perished morouer amōge hye solempne dayes ye haue ye shall holde daye also wt gladnesse tyme come daye maye remembraūce good soch loue prosperite persian remembraunce destruccion sedicious vnto v city lōdes shal horribly perish destroyed wt swerde fyre shall onely nomore inhabited men abhorred also ye wilde beastes foules boke wyszdome boke conteyneth chap exortaciō iudges ruler loue wyszdome sprete wyszdome hateth falsede disfimulacion ypocrysie rebuketh vnrighteousnesse abhorreth wicked doer chap ii ymaginaciōs thoughtes vngodly geue thē selues ouer vnto synne persecute vertue trueth chap iii felicite health godly people though put trouble intraūce worlde yet calleth vpon god wyszdome shal haue desyre profit cō meth wyszdome passeth thinges chap viii wiszdome shulde receaued youth marieth vnto shall optayne loue god men chap ix prayer cor 15 man gone hath nomore ioye ner pleasure nether knowe eny man yt turneth agayne death borne naught shal herafter though neuer bene oure breth smoke oure nostrels ye wordes sparck moue oure herte therfore let v enioye ye pleasure yt let v soone vse ye creature like youth wil fyll oure selues wt good wyne oyntment shal floure tyme go v wil crowne selues wt rose afore wythered shal fayre medowe lust shall go thorow let euery one partaker oure volupteousnes let v leaue token pleasure euery place yt oure porcion el gett nothinge let v oppresse poore righteous let v spare wyddowe ner olde man c though grene braunches tyme yet shal shakē wt wynde stonde fast thorow vehemence wynde shalbe roted vnparfecte braunches shalbe broken frute shalbe vnprofitable sower eate yee mete nothinge child yt borne wicked must beare recorde wickednesse agaynst father mother axed though righteous ouertaken wt death yet shal rest age honorable thinge neuertheles stondeth lenth tyme ner multitude yeares man wyszdome graye hayre vndefyled life olde age pleased god beloued lyued amō ge synners 〈◊〉 11 trāslated yee sodēly taken awaye intent yt wickednesse shulde alter vnderstōdinge yt ypocrisye shulde begyle soule ye craftie bewitchinge lye make good thinges darck ye vnstedfastnesse also wickednes voluptuous desyre turne asyde ye vnderstondinge ye symple though soone deed yet fulfilled moch tyme soule pleased god therfore haisted take awaye frō amonge ye wicked people se vnderstonde laye vp soch thinges hertes yt ye louynge fauor mercy god vpō saintes yt hath respecte vnto chosen thus ye righteous yt deed cōdemneth vngodly lyuinge ye youth yt soone brought ende ye lōge life ye vnrighteous se ye ende ye wyse vnderstōde god hath deuysed wherfore ye lorde hath taken awaie se despyse therfore shall god also laugh thē scorne yt thē selues shal dye without honor yee shame amonge ye deed euermore without eny voyce shal burst yt puft vp remoue thē frō ye foundacions yt shalbe laied waist vnto hyest shal mourne memoriall shall perishe beynge afrayed shall remembre synnes owne wickednesse shal bewraye thē v chapter shal ye righteous stonde greate stedfastnesse agaynst soch haue dealt extremely wt thē matt 19 takē awaye labour se shalbe vexed wt horrible feare shal wonder haistynesse ye sodane health groninge distresse mynde shall saye within selues nether ye path floudes byrde yt flyeth thorow ye ayre man se eny token flowen heareth noyse hir wynges beatinge light wynde partinge ayre thorow vehemēce hir goinge flyeth shakynge hir wynges thē floudes shal renne roughly together yee mightie wynde shal stōde vp agaynst storme shall scater thē abrode thus vnrighteous dealinge thē shal bringe lōde wyldernes wickednes shall ouerthrowe dwellinges mightie vi chapter wyszdome better strength mā vnderstādinge worth thē one yt strōge eccls 9 heare therfore ye kinges vnderstonde lerne ye yt iudges endes earth geue ye yt rule ye multitude delite moch people rom 13 power geuē lorde strēgth hyest shal trie yor workes search yor ymaginaciōs ye beynge officer kyngdome haue executed true iudgment haue kepte lawe righteousnes ner walked horribly right soone shall appeare vnto harde iudgmēt shal haue yt beare rule mercy graūted vnto symple eccl • 〈…〉 auctorite shalbe sore punyshed god lorde ouer shall excepte mās personne nether shal stande awe eny man greatnesse hath made ye small greate careth alyke mightie shal haue ye sorer punyshmēt vnto therfore ye kinges speake yt ye maye lerne wyszdome go amysse yt kepe righteousnes shalbe righteously iudged yt lerned righteous thinges shal finde make answere wherfore set yor lust vpon wordes loue thē shal ye come nurtor wyszdome noble thinge neuer faydeth awaie yee easely sene thē loue founde soch seke preuēteth yt desyre yt maye first shewe vnto thē awaketh vnto tymes shal haue greate trauayle shal fynde syttinge ready dores thinke vpon parfecte vnderstandinge watcheth shalbe safe soone goeth aboute sekynge soch mete sheweth self cherefully vnto goynges meteth wt diligēce ye vnfained desyre refourmacion hir begynnynge care nurtor loue loue kepinge hir lawes 〈…〉 kepinge ye lawes perfeccion vncorrupte life vncorrupte life maketh man familier wt god desyre wyszdome ledeth ye kingdome euerlastinge yf yor delyte thē royall seates cepters ye kynges people set youre lust vpō wyszdome 〈…〉 yt ye maye raigne euer loue light wyszdome ye yt ruler people wyszdome came vp wil tell hyde misteries god wil seke ye begynnynge natiuyte brynge 6 b one goinge like maner wherfore desyred vnderstandinge geuē called sprete wyszdome came set thē kingdomes royall seates counted rich nothinge cōparison 〈…〉 precious stone compared vnto golde grauell vnto syluer shalbe counted claye hir sight loued aboue welfare beutie purposed take light hir shyne quenched good thinges came wt 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 6 innumerable rich thorow hir hādes glad thē wyszdome wē te knew yt mother good thinges lerned vnfaynedly make men partaker hyde rich man infinite treasure vnto men vse become partaker loue frendshipe god accepted vnto giftes wyszdome god hath graunted talke wysely conueniētly hādle thinges yt hath graciously lent yt ledeth vnto wyszdome teacheth vse wyszdome right hāde wordes yee wyszdome 〈◊〉 3 vnderstandinge knowlege workes hath geuē ye true sciē ce thinges knowe ye worlde made power ye elemē te ye begynnynge endinge myddest ye tymes tymes alter one goeth another fulfilled ye course yeare ordinaunces starres nature kindes beastes furiousnesse beastes power ye wyndes ymaginacions mē deuersities yonge plantes vertues rootes soch thinges secrete loked haue lerned worckmaster thinges hath taught wyszdome hir ye sprete vnderstādinge holy manifolde one onely sotyll curteous discrete quyck vndefyled playne swete louynge thinge yt good sharpe forbyddeth well gētle kynde stedfast sure fre hauynge vertues circūspecte thinges receauinge spretes vnderstādinge beīge cleane sharpe wiszdome neembler thē neēble thīges goeth thorow attayneth thīges hir clennes ye breth ye power god pure cleane expressinge ye clearnes allmightie god therfore vndefyled thinge come heb 1 ye bryghtnes ye euerlastīge light ye vndefiled myrror ye maiesty god ye ymage goodnesse moch one maie thinges beinge stedfast renueth amōge ye people cōveyeth ye holy soules maketh god frendes p • ophetes god loueth mā whō wyszdome dwelleth beutyfull sonne geueth light starres daye cōpared vnto vpō ye daye cōmeth night wickednesse ouer come wyszdome foolishnes maye wt viii chapter wyszdome reacheth frō one ende another mightely louīgly doth ordre thinges haue loued laboured euē fro youth vp dyd diligēce mary self wt soch loue vnto hir beutye hath ye cō pany god cōmēdeth hir nobilyte yee lorde thinges loueth ye scolemastresse ye nurtor god ye choser workes yf man wolde desyre rich life richer wiszdome ye worketh thīges thou wilt saye vnderstādinge worketh amōge thinges yt worketh thē wyszdome yf man loue vertue righteousnes let labor wyszdome hath greate vertues teacheth sobernes prudence righteousnes strēgh soch thinges mē haue nothinge profitable life yf mā desyre moch knowlege cā tell ye thinges yt past discerne thinges come knoweth ye sotilties wordes cā expoūde darcke sentēces tell tokēs wōderous thinges euer come passe endes tymes age purposed maner take vnto cōpany comō louīgly wt doute shal geue good coūcell speake cōfortably vnto carefulnes grefe hir sake shal well honestly taken amōge comōs lordes ye councell though yonge yet shal haue sharpe vnderstandinge yt shal maruelous ye sight greate mē ye face prynces shal wōder whā holde tōge shal byde leysure iob 2 • • whā speake shal loke vpō yf talke moch shal laye handes vpō mouth morouer meanes shal optayne immortalite leaue behinde euerlastinge memoriall amōge thē yt come shal set ye people ordre nacions shalbe subdued vnto horrible tyrauntes shal afrayed whan heare amonge multitude shal counted good mightie battayll whā come home shal fynde rest wt hir cōpany hath bytternes hir felashipe hath tediousnesse myrth ioye whan cōsidered thinges pondered hert yt ioyned vnto wyszdome immortalite greate pleasure haue hir frendshipe yt workes hir handes infinite rich kepeth company wt shalbe wyse talketh shal come honoure wente aboute sekynge gett vnto ladd rype wytt good vnderstandinge whan grewe vnderstādinge came vndefyled body neuertheles whan perceaued coude kepe chaist excepte god gaue yt poynte wyszdome also knowe whose gift stepte vnto lorde besought whole hert sayde maner ix chapter god father lorde mercies3 reg 3 b gen 1 thou yt hast made thīges wt yi worde ordeyned mā thorow thy wyszdome yt shulde haue dominiō ouer ye creature thou hast made yt shulde ordre ye worlde acordinge equite righteousnes execute iudgmēt wt true hert geue wyszdome euer aboute ye seate put frō amōge ye child thy seruaunt sonne ye handmayden psal 115 b feble personne shorte tyme yō ge vnderstandinge iudgment ye lawes though man neuer parfecte amonge child men yet yf thy wyszdome shal nothinge regarded1 par 29 b 2 par 1 thou hast chosen kynge vnto ye people iudge thy sonnes daughter thou hast cōmaunded buylde temple vpon ye holy mount aulter cite wherin thou dwellest licknesse thy holy tabernacle thou hast prepared frō beginnynge thy wyszdome ye knoweth ye workes p • 8 c 〈◊〉 1 also wt ye whan thou maydest ye worlde knew acceptable thy sight right thy commaundementes sende thy holy heauens trone thy maiesty maye laboure maye knowe acceptable ye sight knoweth vnderstandeth thinges shal lede soberly workes preserue hir power shal workes acceptable shal gouerne thy people righteously worthy syt father seate man 〈…〉 maye knowe councell god thinke god thoughtes mortall men miserable oure forecastes vncertayne mortall corruptible body heuy vnto soule 〈…〉 earthy mansion kepeth downe vnderstandinge yt museth vpon many thinges hardly discerne thinges vpon earth greate labor haue fynde thinges oure eye seke groūde thinges done heauē oh lorde cā haue knowlege ye vnderstandinge meaninge excepte thou geue wyszdome sende thy holy goost frō aboue wayes vpon earth maye refourmed yt men maye lerne ye thinges pleasaunt vnto preserued thorow wyszdome x chapter wyszdome preserued ye first mā whō god made father worlde 〈…〉 whā created alone brought offence toke moulde ye earth gaue power rule thinges whan vnrighteous wente awaye wrath wyszdome ye brotherheade perished thorow ye wrath murthur agayne 〈…〉 whā ye water destroyed ye whole worlde 〈…〉 wyszdome preserued righteous thorow poore tre wherof gouerner morouer whā wickednes gotten ye vpperhande yt nacions puft vp pryde 〈…〉 knewe ye righteous preserued fautlesse vnto god layed vp sure mercy child preserued righteous 〈…〉 whan fled vngodly yt perished tyme ye fyre fell downe vpon ye v city like yet daye vnfrutefull waist smokinge lō de geueth testimony wickednesse yee vnripe vntymely frutes growe vpon tree tokē remembraunce vnfaithfull soule standeth piler salt soch regarded wyszdome gat hurte knewe thinges good also left behinde vnto mē memoriall foolishnes yt thinges wherin synned coude hydd soch take hede vnto wyszdome shal delyuer sorowe whan righteous fled brother wrath 〈…〉 wyszdome led right waye shewed ye kyngdome god gaue knowlege holy thinges made riche laboures brought passe thinges wente aboute ye disceatfulnes soch defrauded stode made ryche saued enemy defended ye disceauers made stronge battayll gaue victory yt might knowe wyszdome stronger thinges 〈◊〉 • 7 c 〈◊〉 7 b whan righteous solde forsoke delyuered frō synners wente downe dongeon fayled bandes 〈◊〉 41 f tyll brought cepter ye realme power agaynst oppressed accused declared lyers brought perpetuall worshipe delyuered righteous people fautlesse sede 〈◊〉 1 b 〈◊〉 45 nacions oppressed entred soule seruaunt god stode wonder token agaynst horrible kynge gaue ye righteous rewarde labour led forth maruelous waye daye tyme shadowe vnto light starres night season 〈◊〉 • 4 f brought thorow reed see caried thorow greate water drowned enemy see brought depe righteous toke spoyles vngodly praysed thy holy name lorde magnified thy victorious hād one acorde 〈…〉 wyszdome openeth mouth ye domme maketh ye tonges babe speake xi chapter ordred workes hādes holy prophet 〈◊〉 1 • yt wente thorow ye wyldernes yt inhabited pitched tētes ye waist deserte stode agaynst enemy auenged aduersaries 〈◊〉 17 b 〈…〉 whā thirstie called vpō ye water geuē ye rok thirst slockened ye harde stone ye thinges thorow enemy punished helped nede vnto enemy thou gauest mās bloude steade lyuynge water scarcenesse ye rebuke whan child slayne thou gauest vnto thine awne plenteous water vnloked declaringe thyrst yt tyme thou woldest bringe thine awne vnto honor slaye aduersaries whan tryed nourtured wt fatherly mercy deut 8 knowleged vngodly iudged punyshed thorow ye wrath god hast thou exorted father proued thē vnto ye thou hast bene boysteous kynge layed hard charge condēned thē whether absent present punyshmēt alyke grefe dubble namely mournynge ye remēbraunce thinges past whā perceaued yt punishmētes dyd thē good thought vpon lorde wondered ye ende last helde moch whō ye castinge thought scorne abiecte neuerthelesse ye righteous dyd thirstie euenlike ye thoughtes ye foolish also wickednes certayne mē thorow error dyd worshipe dommeserpentes vayne beestes sap 12 e rom 1 c thou sendedst multitude domme beastes vpon vengeaunce yt might knowe loke withall mā synneth also shal punyshed vnto thy allmighty hande made worlde naught vnpossible leui 26 sap 16 iere 8 c sende amonge heape beeres woode lyōs cruell beastes straū ge kynde soch vnknowne spoute fyre cast smokinge breth shote horrible sparkes eye might destroye hurtinge also kyll horrible sight yee without beestes might haue bene slayne one winde beynge persecuted awne workes scatered abrode thorow breth thy power neuertheles thou hast ordred thinges measure nōbre weight thou hast euer greate strēgth might maye withstōde ye power thine arme like ye small thynge yt ye balaunce weyeth ye worlde ye yee droppe ye morninge dew falleth downe vpon earth thou hast mercy vpon thou hast power thynges makest though thou sawest sinnes mē rom 2 • shulde amende thou louest thinges hatest none thē whō thou hast made nether didest thou ordeyne make eny thinge euell might eny thinge endure yf wer ye coude eny thinge preserued excepte called ye thou sparest thine lorde thou louer soules xii chapter lorde gracious swete thy sprete thinges therfore chastenest thou thē measurably go wrōge warnest concernynge thinges wherin offende thou speakest vnto lorde exortest thē leaue wickednes put trust deut 9 12 18 b olde inhabiters thy holy londe thou mightest awaye commytted abhominable workes agaynst wytch craft sorcery idolatry slew owne child without mercy ate vp men bowel deuoured bloude yee soch abhominaciōs myszbeleues offeringes thou slewest father desolate soules handes oure father ye londe thou louest aboue might dwellinge childrē god neuertheles thou sparedest thē also mē sendedst ye forerūners thyne hoost euē hornettes destroye thē lytle litle yt thou wast vnable subdue ye vngodly vnto ye righteous battayll exo 23 deut 7 cruell beestes wt one rough worde destroye thē together ye mynde dryue thē lytle litle geuinge thē time place amende knowinge well yt vnrighteous nacion wicked nature yt thought might neuer altered cursed sede ye begynnynge feared mā yet hast thou pardoned synnes wyl saye vnto hast thou done yt wyl stōde agaynst thy iudgmēt wil come ye face auēger vnrighteous mē wil blame ye yf ye people perish whō thou hast made1 pet 5 none god thou yt carest thinges yt thou mayest declare yt ye iudgmēt vnright darre nether kīge ner tyraūt ye sight requyre accōptes whō thou hast destroyed moch thē thou art righteous ye self thou ordrest thīges righteously punishest euē hī yt hath deserued punyshed • ob 9 b takest straūger aleaunt ye lōde ye power ye power ye beginnynge righteousnes thou art lorde thinges therfore art thou gracious vnto whan men thinke ye full strength thou declarest ye power boldly delyuerest thou ouer yt knowe ye thou lorde power iudgest quyetly ordrest u greate worshipe thou mayest thou wilt soch workes hast thou taught thy people mā also shulde iust louynge hast made thy childrē good hope euen thou iudgest thou geuest rowme amende synnes moch thou hast punyshed wt soch diligence delyuered ye enemy thy seruaū te worthy dye thorow thou gauest thē tyme place amēdement yt might turne frō wickednes wt greate diligence punyshest thou thine awne childrē vnto whose father thou hast sworne made couenaūtes good promise thou doest chasten v thou punyshest enemy dyuerse wayes ye intēt yt whā punysh shulde remē bre ye goodnesse whan selues punyshed put oure trust thy mercy wherfore men haue lyued ignoraūtly vnrighteously thou hast punyshed thē sore 〈…〉 euē thorow ye thinges worshipped wente astraye lō ge ye waye error helde ye beestes euē enemy despysed goddes lyuynge child vnderstandinge therfore hast thou sent scornefull punyshment amonge amonge chidrē ignoraunce soch wolde refourmed scornes rebuke felt worthy punishmēt god ye thinges yt suffred bare thē vnpaciētly beinge contēt vnwyllinge whan peryshed ye thinges toke goddes knowleged one true god afore wolde knowe therfore came ye ende dampnacion vpon xiii chapter vayne men haue ye knowlege god good thinges sene knewe 〈…〉 euerlastinge nether toke moch regarde workes made knowe craftesman toke fyre wynde ayre ye course ye starres ye water toke sonne moone lightes heauen rule ye earth goddes 〈…〉 though soch pleasure beuty thought haue bene goddes yet shulde haue knowne moch fayrer made maker beuty hath ordened thinges yf marueled power workes thē shulde haue perceaued therby yt made thinges mightier greatnesse beutye creature ye maker therof maye playnely knowne notwithstondinge lesse blamed sought god wolde haue founde yet myssed moch wēte aboute workes sought tokē regarded helde moch workes yt sene howbeit wholy excused yf vnderstondinge knowlege greate yt coude discerne worlde ye creature dyd rather fynde ye lorde therof vnhappie amonge deed hope call thē god workes men handes golde syluer thinge founde connynge similitude beastes eny vayne stone hath bene made hande olde 〈◊〉 44 b 〈◊〉 10 whan carpenter cutteth downe tre wodd pareth barck connyngly one parte maketh vessell vsed dighteth meate residue parte left profitable nothinge croked pece wodd full knobbes carueth diligently thorow vanite acordinge knowlege connynge geueth proporcion fashioneth similitude man maketh like beest straketh ouer reed paynteth loke foule spot casteth coloure vpon maketh conueniēt tabernacle setteth wall maketh fast yron prouydinge lest happē fall well knowne helpe self ymage must necessite helped goeth offreth goodes vnto child wife seketh helpe axeth councell ashamed speake vnto yt hath soule health maketh peticion vnto sicke life prayeth vnto deed calleth vpon helpe able helpe self sende good iourneye prayeth maye go thinges yt taketh hande whether optayne eny thinge worke prayeth vnto maner good xiiii chapter agayne another mā purposinge sayle begīnynge take iourney thorow ye raginge see calleth helpe vnto stock yt farre weaker thē ye tre yt beareth coueteousnesse moneye hath founde ye craftesmā made wt connynge ye prouydence father gouerneth thinges frō ye begynnynge thou hast made waye ye see exo 14 sure path myddest ye wawes declaringe therby yt thou hast power helpe thinges yee though man wente see without shippe neuerthelesse yt ye workes ye wyszdome shulde vaine thou hast caused arke made gen 6 c therfore men commytte lyues small pece wod passinge ouer see shyppe saued olde tyme also whā proude giauntes perished gen 7 b whō hope left increase ye worlde wēte shippe gouerned thorow thy hande left sede behinde vnto ye worlde happie ye tre thorow righteousnes cōmeth cursed ymage wod yt made wt hādes yee yt made made called god frayle thinge vngodly vngodlynes like abhominable vnto god psal 7 euen ye worke yt made also shal punyshed together therfore shal plage come vpon ymages heithen creature god become abhominacion temptacion vnto soules men snare fete vnwyse sekinge ymages beginnynge whordome bringinge vp destruccion life begynnynge nether shall cōtinue euer welthy ydilnes men hath founde vpon earth therfore shal come shortly ende whē father mourned sonne yt taken awaye frō made ymage ye haist deed sonne begāne worshipe god deed mā ordened seruauntes offre vnto thus processe tyme thorow lōge custome error kepte lawe tyraū te cōpelled mē violēce honor ymages yt farre yt mē migt worshipe presently picture brought frō farre like ymage kynge whō wolde honoure intent greate diligence might worshipe farre though bene present agayne syngular connyn craftesman gaue ignoraunt also greate occasiō worshipe ymages workman wyllinge pleasure sett worke laboured connynge make ymage best fashion thorow beuty worke comon people disceaued moch toke god litle afore honored man erroure man life whan men ether serue owne affeccion pleasure vnto kinges ascrybed vnto stone stockes name god ought geuen vnto man morouer ynough erred knowlege god lyued greate warres ignoraunce many greate plage called peace deut 1 • b • ere 7 • nd 19 ether slewe awne child offred dyd sacrifice night season el helde vnreasonable watch kepte nether life ner mariage cleane ether one slewe another death maliciously el greued neghboure wt aduoutrie thus thinges myxte together bloude manslaughter theft dissimulacion corrupcion vnfaithfulnesse sedicion periury disquyetinge good men vnthākfulnes defylinge soules chaū ginge byrth vnstedfastnesse mariage mysordre aduoutrie vnclennesse honouringe abhominable ymages cause begynuynge ende euell yt worshipe idol either madd whā mery prophecie lye lyue vngodly el lightly mansweare selues moch trust ye idol haue nether soule ner vnderstondinge though sweare falsely yet thinke shal hurte therfore commeth greate plage vpon worthely haue euell opiniō god geuinge hede vnto idol swearinge vniustly disceaue dispysinge righteousnes swearinge vertue plage synne goeth euer offence vngodly xv chapter bvt thou god art swete longe sufferinge true mercy ordrest thou thinges though synne yet thine knowe thy strength yf synne sure thou regardest v knowe parfecte righteousnes yee knowe ye righteousnes power rote immortalite thinge men haue founde thorow theyr euell science hath disceaued v payntinge picture vnprofitable laboure carued ymage diuerse colour whose sight entiseth ignoraunt honoureth loueth picture deed ymage hath soule neuertheles loue soche euell thinges worthy death trust make loue honoure potter also taketh tempereth soft earth laboureth geueth fashion vessell euer serueth oure vse one pece claye maketh cleane vessel seruice contrary euery vessell serueth knoweth ye potter vayne laboure maketh god claye doth euen litle afore made earth within litle whyle whan dyeth turneth earth agayne notwithstandinge careth ye shal labor ner life shorte stryueth excell goldsmythes ye syluer smythes copper smithes taketh honor make vayne thinges hert ash hope vaine earth life vyle claye moch knoweth awne maker gaue soule worke brethed breth life counte oure life pastyme oure conuersacion butt market men shulde euer gettinge yee euell meanes yt earth maketh frayle vessell ymages knoweth offende aboue enemy thy people yt holde subieccion vnwyse vnhappie exceadinge proude vnto owne soules 〈…〉 iudge idol heithē goddes nether haue eyesight se ner nose smell ner eares heare ner finger handes grope fete slowe go man made hath borowed sprete fashioned man make god like vnto seinge mortall mortall maketh vnrighteous handes better worshippeth lyued though mortall dyd neuer yee worshippe beestes also▪ miserable compare thinges fele vnto worse yet one beestes sight cā beholde eny good thinge nether haue geuen prayse ner thankes vnto god xvi chapter soch thinges haue suffred worthy punyshment thorow ye multitude beestes roted insteade ye punishmentes thou hast graciously ordred thine awne people geuen desyre lōged new straunge taist preparinge quales meate 〈◊〉 11 g intent yt thinges shewed sent vnto yt gredy meate might withdrawen euen desyre necessary within shorte tyme brought vnto pouerte taisted new meate requisite yt without eny excuse destruccion shulde come vpō vsed tyrāny shewe onely vnto enemy destroyed 〈◊〉 • 1 whan cruell woodnesse beestes came vpon peryshed thorow stinges cruell serpentes▪ notwithstōdinge yi wrath endured perpetually put feare litle season yt might refourmed hauynge token saluacion remembre cōmaundement thy lawe yt cōuerted healed thinge yt sawe sauio thou shewdest thine enemy yt thou deliuerest frō euell thē whan bytten wt greshoppers flyes 〈◊〉 10 died worthy perish soch nether teth dragon ner venymous wormes ouer came ye child thy mercy euer helped thē therfore punyshed remēbre thy wordes hastely healed agayne lest shulde fall depe forgetfulnesse might vse thy helpe nether herbe ner plaster yt restored thē health thy worde lorde healeth thinges thou lorde yt hast power life death 〈◊〉 32 f 〈…〉 b thou ledest vnto deathes dore bringest vp agayne man thorow wickednes slayeth owne soule sprete goeth forth turneth agayne nether maye call agayne ye soule yt takē awaye possible escape yi hande ye vngodly yt wolde knowe ye punyshed ye strēgth thine arme 〈◊〉 9 c wt straūge water hale raynes persecuted thorow fyre cōsumed wonderous thinge fyre might water quēcheth thinges ye worlde ye auēger righteous tyme ye fyre tame yt beestes sent punysh ye vngodly brent yt shulde se knowe yt persecuted wt punyshmēt god somtyme brent fyre water euery syde yt might destroye ye vnrighteous naciō earth againe thou hast fed thine awne people wt angel fode exo 16 • sent thē bred ready heauē without labo beynge pleasaūt well gusted shewe thy rich swetnesse vnto thy childrē thou gauest euery one desyre yt euery man might take liked best snowe yse abode violēce fyre melted yt might knowe yt fyre burninge hale rayne destroied ye frute ye enemy ye fyre also forgatt strēgth agayne yt ye righteous might norished ye creature yt serueth ye art ye maker fearse punyshinge ye vnrighteous easy gētle good vnto soch put trust therfore dyd thinges alter tyme obediēt vnto thy grace ye norse thinges acordinge ye desyre thē yt nede therof yt ye childrē lorde whō thou louest deut 8 • matt 4 • might knowe yt nature growinge frutes yt fedeth mē yt ye worde preserueth thē yt put trust loke might destroyed wt fyre soone warmed wt litle sonne beame melted yt men might knowe yt thankes ought geuen vnto ye ye sonne ryse yt thou oughtest worshipped ye daye sprynge ye hope ye vnthankfull shal melt awaie wynter yse perishe water yt necessary xvii chapter greate thy iudgmētes lorde thy councels expressed rom 11 • therfore men erre yt wil refourmed wt thy wyszdome whan vnrighteous thought haue thy holy people subieciō bounde wt bandes darcknes longe night shutt vnder ye rofe exo 10 • thinkinge escape ye euerla • tinge wiszdome whyle thought hyd ye darcknesse synnes scatered abrode ye myddest darck coueringe forgetfulnes put horrible feare wonderously vexed corner might kepe feare ye sounde came downe vexed yee many terryble straunge vision made afrayed power fyre might geue light nether might cleare flāmes starres lightē yt horrible night appeared vnto thē sodane fyre dredeful ye whan sawe nothinge afrayed thought ye thinge sawe fearfull sorcery enchauntemēt yt vsed •• od 7 b came derisiō proude wyszdome brought shame yt promysed dryue awaie fearfulnes drede frō ye weake soules sick feare thē selues wt scorne though none ye wōders feared thē yet afrayed beestes came vpon thē ye hissynge serpētes moch trēblinge swowned sayde sawe ye ayre mā yet maye escape heuy thinge whā man owne consciēce beareth recorde wickednes condēpneth vexed wounded consciēce taketh euer cruell thinges hāde 〈◊〉 45 fearfulnes nothinge el declaringe yt mā seketh helpe defence answere self loke moch lesse hope within ye vn certaynte matter punished yt came ye mightie night slepte ye slepe yt fell vpō thē frō vnder frō aboue somtyme afrayed thorow ye feare ye wonder somtyme weake yt swowned withall hastie sodane fearfulnes came vpon thē afterwarde yf eny thē fallē kepte shutt preson without chaynes yf eny dwelt vyllage yf bene hyrd huszbandman suffred intollerable necessite bounde one chayne darcknesse whether blasynge wynde swete songe ye byrdes amonge thicke braunches tree vehemence haistie rūnynge water greate noyse ye fallynge downe stone playenge rūnynge beastes whō sawe ye mightie noyse roaringe beestes ye sownde yt answereth agayne hye mountaynes made thē swowne feare earth shyned wt cleare light mā hyndered labor onely vpon thē fell heuy night ymage darcknesse come vpon yee vnto selues heuy horrible darcknesse xviii chapter neuertheles thy sayntes greate light enemy herde voyce sawe figure suffred ye thinges magnified yt vexed afore hurte thanked besought ye god yt might difference therfore burnynge piler fyre lede vnknowne waye 〈…〉 thou gauest sonne fre gift without eny hurte reason shulde want light put preson darcknes kepte thy childrē captiuyte vncorrupte light lawe ye worlde geuen whan thought slaye babe righteous one beinge laied 〈…〉 yet preserued leder vnto thou broughtest whole multitude child 〈…〉 destroydest mightie water night oure father certified afore knowinge vnto oothes geuen credē ce might good cheare thus thy people receaued ye health righteous vngodly destroied like thou hast hurte oure enemy hast thou promoted v thou calledest afore righteous child good men offred secretly ordred lawe righteousnes vnto vnite yt iust shulde receaue good euell like maner singinge prayses vnto ye father men agayne herde vnconuenient voyce enemy piteous crie childrē bewayled master seruaūt punyshed alike meane man kynge suffred like maner together innumerable dyed one death nether ye lyuinge sufficient bury ye deed ye twincklinge eye 〈…〉 noblest nacion thē destroyed oft god helped thē afore yet wolde make thē beleue ye destruccion ye first borne knowleged ye people god whyle thinges still whā ye night ye myddest hir course thy allmightie worde lorde leapte downe frō heauē ye royall trone rough mā warre ye myddest ye londe yt destroyed ye sharpe swerde perfourmed yi straite cōmaundemēt stādinge fyllinge thinges wt death yee stode vpō ye earth reached vnto heauen sight euell dreames vexed sodenly fearfulnesse came vpon vnawarres laye one another half deed half quyck shewed cause death vision vexed thē shewed thē thinges afore ignoraunt wherfore perished tentacion death touched righteous also amonge multitude wyldernesse insurreccion thy wrath endured longe fautlesse man wente haist 〈◊〉 16 g toke battayll vpon brought forth weap • ministracion euen prayer ye cēsours recōcilinge set agaynst ye wrath brought misery ende declaringe therby thy seruaunt ouercame multitude bodely power ner weapēs might worde subdued vexed puttinge remembraunce ooth couenaūt made vnto father whan deed fallen downe heapes one vpon another stode myddest pacified wrath parted ye waye vnto lyuynge 〈…〉 b c • longe garmēt beuty foure rowes stone glory father grauē thy maiesty written crowne heade vnto destroyer gaue place afrayed tentacion worthy wrath xix chapter vngodly wrath came vpō without mercy vnto ende knew shulde happē vnto whan cōsented lett go sent greate diligence wolde repente folowe vpon whan yet mournynge makinge lamētacion graues deed 〈◊〉 ▪ 14 deuysed another foolishnes persecuted flienge cast afore wt prayer worthy necessite also brought vnto ende cleane forgotten thinges yt happened vnto afore thinge wantynge punyshment requysite fulfilled vpon tormētes thy people might haue maruelous passage thorow might fynde straunge death thē euery creature fashioned agayne new acordinge wyll maker obeyenge thy commaundementes yt thy child might kepte without hurte cloude ouershadowed tentes drye earth appeared afore water yt reed see waye without impediment greate depe became grene felde thorow ye people wente defended thy hande seinge thy wonderous maruelous workes ye horse fedd leapte like lābes praysinge lorde haddest delyuered yet myndefull thinges happened whyle dwelt londe grounde brought forth flyes insteade catell ye ryuer scrauled multitude frogges steade fyszshes last sawe new creacion byrdes exo 16 c nu 11 g tyme disceaued lust desyred delicate meates whan speakinge appetite quales came vp vnto see punyshmentes came vpon ye synners without tokēs came passe afore vehemēce ye streames suffred worthely acordinge wickedness dealt abhominably churlishly straungers receaued vnknowne gestes brought ye straungers bondage dyd good besyde thinges receaued straungers wylles persecuted also • • oh b dyd thē moch euell receaued thē gladly therfore punyshed blyndnesse like couered sodane darcknesse dores righteous gen 19 • 4 6 • yt euery one sought ye intraunce dore thus elementes turned selues like whan one tune chaunged vpon instrument musick yet residue kepe melody maye easely perceaued sight thinges come passe drye lōde turned watery ye thinge afore swamme water wente vpon drye grounde fyre power water cōtrary awne vertue water forgatt awne kynde quench agayne flammes noysome beastes hurte flesh wēte nether melted yse el melteth lightly thinges hast thou promoted thy people lorde brought honoure thou hast despysed allwaye place hast thou stonde ende boke wyszdome ecclesiasticus called iesus syrac prologe iesus sonne syrac vnto boke many greate mē haue declared wyszdome vnto v ye lawe ye prophetes folowed thē thinges israel ought commended reason doctrine wiszdome therfore haue reade shulde onely thē selues wyse thorow serue also teachinge wrytinge graundfather iesus geuen diligent laboure reade lawe prophetes bokes left v oure father wel exercised therin purposed also wryte thinge wyszdome good maners intēt wyllinge lerne wyse might haue vnderstandinge apte lede good conuersacion hath measured heyth heauē ye bredth earth depenesse see hath sought grounde god wiszdome hath bene thinges wiszdome hath bene thinges rom 11 vnderstandinge prudence euerlastinge god worde heyth well wyszdome euerlastinge cōmaundementes intraunce vnto hath ye rote wyszdome bene decla • red hath knowne hir wyt vnto hath doctrine wyszdome bene discouered shewed hath vnderstande many folde entraūce one euē hyest maker thinges ye allmightie ye kynge power men ought stonde greatly awe sytteth vpon trone beinge god dominion hath created thorow ye holy goost hath sene nombred measured hath poured vpon workes vpon flesh acordinge gift geueth richely vnto loue feare lorde worshipe triūphe gladnesse ioyfull crowne feare lorde maketh mery hert geueth gladnesse ioye longe life feareth lorde shal go well last daye death shal blessed loue god honorable wiszdome loke vnto appeareth loue se wōderous thinges doth feare lorde begynnynge wyszdome •• al 110 b 〈◊〉 9 b made faithfull mother wombe shall go chosen wemen shalbe knowne ye righteous faithfull feare lorde ye right god seruyce preserueth iustifieth hert geueth myrth gladnesse feareth lorde shal happie whan hath nede comforte shal blessed feare god wiszdome maketh rich bringeth good fylleth whole house hir giftes garner treasure feare lorde crowne wyszdome geueth plenteous peace health hath sene nombred knowlege vnderstandinge wyszdome hath poured rayne helde fast hath brought vnto honor feare lorde rote wyszdome hir braunches longe life treasure wyszdome vnderstondinge deuocion knowlege wyszdome abhorred synners feare lorde dryueth synne without feare made righteous wilfull boldnes owne destruccion paciēt man wyl suffre vnto tyme thē shal haue ye rewarde ioye good vnderstōdinge wil hyde wordes tyme many mēs lippes shal speake wyszdome treasure wyszdome declaracion doctrine synner abhorreth worshipe god sonne yf thou desyre wiszdome kepe commaundement god shal geue vnto feare lorde wyszdome nurtoure hath fall brynge thy soule dishonoure god discouer thy secretes cast downe myddest congregacion thou woldest receaue feare god thy hert full faynednes disceate ii chapter sonne yf thou wilt come ye seruyce defraude poore almes deut 15 mat 25 c turne awaye thine eye hath nede despise hongrie soule defye poore necessite greue hert helplesse withdrawe gift ye nedefull refuse prayer one trouble turne awaye soule vnto elder bowe downe ye heade man worshipe let greue bowe downe thine eare vnto poore paye thy dett geue frendly answere yt wt mekenesse delyuer yt suffreth wrōge frō ye hāde ye oppressor bretheth life hir child receaueth thē yt seke wyll go thē ye waye righteousnes yt loueth loueth life yt seke diligētly shal haue greate ioye yt kepe shal haue heretage life entreth blessinge god confesse thine erroure submitte thyself vnto euery man synne withstande ye face mightie stryue agaynst streame trueth stryue thou vnto death god shal fight agaynst thine enemy haystie thy tonge nether slack negligent thy workes lyon thine owne house destroyinge thy housholde folkes oppress • nge yt vnder let thine hande stretched receaue act 20 c shutt whan thou shuldest geue v chapter trust vnto hir lynckes 〈◊〉 11 c take hir yock vpon thy neck bowe downe thy shulder vnder beare hir paciently weery hir bandes come vnto ye whole hert kepe hir wayes thy power seke shalbe shewed whā thou hast forsake last thou shalt fynde rest shal turned thy greate ioye shal hir fetter stronge defence hir yock glorious rayment bewtye life hir bandes couplinge together saluacion yee glorious rayment thou shalt put crowne ioye shalt thou weere sonne yf thou wilt take hede thou shalt haue vnderstādinge yf thou wilt applye ye mynde thou shalt wyse yf thou wilt bowe downe thine eare thou shalt receaue olde age waxe olde also glad death thine enemie remembre must dye sorte v fayne wolde come ioye 〈…〉 despyse sermon soch elder haue vnderstandinge acquaunte thy self wt wyse sentence thou shalt lerne wyszdome doctrine vnderstandinge serue greate men without complaynte go ye doctryne elder haue lerned father thou shalt lerne vnderstandinge yt thou mayest make answere ye tyme nede kyndle ye coales synners lest thou brent fyrie flammes synnes resist face blasphemer laye wayte thy mouth lende vnto mightier thyself 〈…〉 yf thou lendest counte lost suertie aboue ye power yf thou thynke surely paye go lawe wt iudge wyl iudge acordinge owne honoure trauayle waye wt yt branelesse lest euell 〈…〉 foloweth awne wilfulnes shalt thou perish thorow foly stryue angrie cruell 〈…〉 go ye wyldernes bloude nothinge sight helpe shal murthur ye take councell fooles 〈…〉 loue nothinge thinges please themself make coūcell straunger thou canst tell wyll come opē thine hert vnto euery man lest vnthā full put reprofe ix chapter gelous ouer ye wyfe thy bosome yt shew shrewed poynte wicked doctryne vpō geue power thy lyfe vnto w • man lest come yi strength thou confounded loke vpon womā desyrous many men lest thou fall hir snare vse company womā player daūser heare hir lest thou perish thorow hir entysinge beholde maydē thou hurt hir bewtye 〈◊〉 5 cast thy mynde vpon harlottes eny maner thinge lest thou destroye thy self thine heretage go aboute gasinge euery layne cite nether wādre thou abrode stretes therof turne awaye thy face beutyfull woman 〈◊〉 5 c loke vpon fayrnesse many man hath perished thorow bewty woman 〈◊〉 34 〈◊〉 11 〈◊〉 10 〈…〉 12 thorow desyre kyndled fyre aduouterous woman shalbe trodden vnder fote myre euery one goeth waye many man wonderinge bewtye straūge woman haue bene cast hir wordes kyndle fyre sytt wt another man wyfe eny meanes lye vpon bedd make wordes ye wyne lest thine hert consent vnto thou thy bloude fall destruccion forsake olde frende new shal like new frende new wine let olde thou shalt drynke pleasure desyre ye honoure rich synner thou knowest destruccion come vpon delyte thou thinge vngodly haue pleasure beinge sure vngodly shall accepted vntyll graue kepe man hath power slaye nedest thou afrayed death yf thou commest vnto make fawte lest happen take awaye thy life remembre thou goest myddest snare vpon bulworkes ye cite bewarre thy neghboure nye thou canst 〈…〉 c 〈◊〉 2 b medle soch wyse haue vnderstandinge let iust men thy gestes let thy myrth feare god let remembraūce god thy mynde let thy talkynge commaundementes hyest handes craftesmen shall workes commended shal prynces people wyszdome talkynge man full wordes perlous cite temerarious past shame talkinge abhorred x chapter wyse iudge wil ordre people discrecion man vnderstandinge beareth rule goeth well iudge people euē officer loke maner man ruler cite soch dwell therin also • 12 vnwise kinge de • royeth people auctorite men vnderstandinge cite prospereth power earth hande god whan tyme shal set profitable ruler vpon hande god power man vpō scrybes shal laye honoure remembre wronge thy neghboure leui 19 c medle thou wt vnrighteous workes pryde hatefull god men wickednes heithen abhorred iere 27 dan 4 c vnrighteous dealinge wronge blasphemy diuerse disceate realme shal trāslated frō one people another nothinge worse cuvetous man prydest thou thou earth aszshes wicked thinge loue moneye soch one hath soule sell yet fylthie dō ge whyle lyueth though phisician shewe helpe neuer longe yet conclucion goeth maner daye kynge tomorow deed whan man dyeth heyre serpentes beastes wormes begynnynge man pryde fall awaye god hert gone maker pryde origenall synne taketh holde therof shalbe fylled cursinges ye last shal ouer throwe therfore hath lorde brought cōgregacions wicked dishonor destroyed vnto ende god hath destroyed seates proude prynces sett vp meke steade sap 6 b luc 1 14 b 18 b god hath wythered rote proude heithen planted lowly amonge god hath ouerthrowne londes heithen gen 19 • destroyed grounde hath caused wyther awaye hath brought naught made memoriall ceasse earth god hath destroyed name proude left name ye humble mynde pryde made man nether wrothfulnes men child sede men feareth god shalbe brought honoure ye sede transgresseth commaundementes ye lorde shalbe shamed yt ruler amōge brother holdē honoure amōge regardeth soch feare lorde glory riche honorable poore feare god despyse thou iust poore man magnifie ye rich vngodly greate iudge mightie hono yet none greater yt feareth god vnto ye seruaunt disceete pro 17 shal fre seruyce wyse well nurtoured wyll grudge whan refourmed ignoraūt body shal come honoure2 12 c proude thy worke dispare tyme aduersite pro 12 b better yt laboureth hath plenteousnes thinges yt gorgious wanteth bred sonne kepe thy soule mekenes geue hir due honoure shal iustifie synneth agaynst wil honoure dishonoureth owne life poore honoured faithfulnes trueth ye rich reputaciō goodes ordreth honestly pouerte moch shal behaue honestly rich ordreth vnhonestly rich moch shal behaue vnhonestly pouerte xi chapter wyszdome yt brought lowe gen 41 f dan 6 shal lift vp heade shal make sytt amonge greate mē commende man bewtye nether despyse man vtter appearaūce bey small beast amonge foules yet hir frute exceadīge swete proude thy rayment exalte thyself daye thy honoure acto 12 ye workes hyest onely wonderfull yee glorious secrete vnknowne workes many tyrauntes haue bene fayne syt downe vpō earth1 reg 15 f hest 67 ye vnlickly hath worne ye crowne many mightie mē haue bene brought lowe honorable haue bene delyuered men handes deut 13 b 17 b iosu 7 c 22 c condemne man thou haue tryed matter whan thou hast made enquisicion refourme righteously geue sentēce thou hast herde cause pro 18 b first let men tell tayles stryue matter toucheth thyself stonde iudgment synners sonne medle many matter mat 19 c 1 ti 6 b yf thou wylt riche thou shalt gett though thou rennest ye waye afore yet shalt thou escape mā laboureth pro 10 c weerieth lesse hath agayne man slouthfull hath nede helpe wāteth strēgth hath greate pouerte god eye loketh vpon good setteth vp lowe estate 〈…〉 lifteth vp heade many men maruell geue honoure vnto god prosperite aduersite life death pouerte rich come lorde 〈…〉 wyszdome nurtoure knowlege ye lawe god loue ye wayes good erroure darcknes made synners exalte selues euell waxe olde euell gift god remayneth righteous good wyl shal geue prosperite euer man rich lyuynge nygardly yt porcion rewarde sayeth haue gotten rest wyl eate drynke goodes alone 〈…〉 yet considereth tyme draweth nye yt must leaue thinges vnto men dye stonde thou fast thy couenaunt exercyse thy self therin remayne worke vnto ye age contynue workes synners put thy trust god byde thine estate easy thīge ye sight god make poore man riche sodenly blessinge god haisteth ye rewarde rightous maketh frutes soone florish prospere saye helpeth shal haue ye whyle agayne saye haue ynough wante whan thou art welfare forget aduersite 〈…〉 whan goeth well haue good hope shal better small thinge vnto god daye death rewarde euery mā acordinge wayes aduersite houre maketh one forgett pleasure whan man dyeth workes discouered prayse body death man shalbe knowne child bringe euery man thine house disceatfull layeth wayte dyuersly like partrich maūde hert proude like spye loketh vpon fall neghbo turneth good vnto euell slaundreth chosen one sparck made greate fyre vngodly mā layeth wayte bloude bewarre disceatfull ymagineth wicked thinges bringe yt perpetuall shame yf thou takest aleaūt vnto ye shal destroye vnquietnes dryue thine owne wayes xii chapter whan thou wylt good knowe thou doest shalt thou greatly thanked thy benefites good vnto righteous • alat 6 b • tim 5 thou shalt fynde greate rewarde though yet doute lorde self shal rewarde stōdeth good case allwaye occupied euell geueth allmes hyest hateth synners hath mercy vpon shew workes repētaunce geue thou vnto soch feare god receaue synner vngodly synners shall recompense vengeaūce vnto kepe daye wrath geue thou vnto good receaue synner well vnto lowly geue vngodly let bred geuen mightier thy self therin shalt thou receaue twyse moch euell good thou doest vnto hyest hateth synners shal rewarde vengeaunce vngodly prosperite frende shal knowne aduersite enemye shal hyd whan mā wealth greueth enemy heuynes trouble man shal knowe frende trust neuer thine enemy like yron rusteth doth wikednes though make moch croutchinge knelinge yet kepe well thy mynde bewarre sett yt nether let sytt thy right hāde lest turne gett thy place take thy rowme seke thy seate thou last remembre wordes pricked sayenges bynde two synnes together shal one vnpunyshed 〈◊〉 7 wil haue pite charmer stynged ye serpēt soch come nye ye beastes euē wt yt kepeth cōpany wicked mā lappeth self synnes season wil byde wt yf thou stomble 〈◊〉 4 • b tarieth enemy swete lippes make many wordes speake many good thinges yee wepe wt eies herte ymagineth throwe pytte yf maye fynde oportunyte wil satisfied wt bloude yf aduersite come vpon thou shalt fynde first though pretēde ye helpe yet shal vndermyne ye shal shake heade clape handes ouer yt gladnes whyle maketh many wordes shall dysguyse countenaunce xiii chapter toucheth pitch shalbe fyled withall 〈◊〉 7 famyliar wt ye proude shal clothe pryde taketh burthen vpon accompanyeth honorable man self therfore kepe familiarite one richer thy self agree ketell pott together yf ye one smytten agaynst shal brokē rich dealeth vnrighteously threateneth withall ye poore beinge oppressed wrōgeously dealt withall suffreth scarcenesse geueth fayre wordes yf thou profit vseth yf thou haue nothinge shal forsake longe thou hast eny thinge thine owne shal good felowe yee shal make bare man sory yf haue nede shall defraude preuy mock shal put hope geue good wordes saye wantest thou thus shal shame yt meate vntill haue supte cleane vp twyse thryse last shal laugh scorne afterwarde whan seyth thou hast nothinge shal forsake shake heade bewarre thou disceaued brought downe thy symplenesse humble thy wyszdome lest whan thou art brought lowe thou disceaued thorow foolishnes yf thou called mightie man absent thy self shal call oft preasse thou vnto thou shott go thou farre lest forgett withdrawe yi self frō speach beleue many wordes wt moch cōmunicacion shall tempte wt preuy mock shall question ye thy secretes vnmercifull mynde shal marck ye wordes shal spare ye hurte put yt preson bewarre take good hede yi self thou walkest parell yt ouerthrowinge whā thou hearest wordes make though thou werest dreame wake vp loue god thy life longe call vpon thy nede euery beast loueth like euen let euery man loue neghboure flesh wil resorte like euery man kepe company soch ye wolfe agreeth lambe doth vngodly ye righteous2 cor 6 • felishippe shulde holy man haue dogg ryche poore agree together wilde asse lyon pray wildernesse euen poore men meate ryche like proude maye awaye lowlynes euen doth riche abhorre poore yf rich man fall frendes sett vp agayne whan poore falleth frendes forsake yf rich mā fall erroure hath many helper speaketh proude wordes yet men iustifie yf poore man go wronge punyshed yee though speake wisely yet haue place whan riche man speaketh euery body holdeth tōge loke sayeth prayse vnto cloudes yf poore man speake saye felowe yf amysse shal destroye rich good vnto hath synne conscience pouerte wicked thinge mouth vngodly h • rt man chaungeth countenaunce whether good euell chearfull countenaunce tokē good hert el harde thinge knowe thought xiiii chapter blissed man hath fallen ye worde mouth • ccli 19 c • nd 25 c 〈◊〉 • pricked conscience synne happie hath heuynes mynde fallen hope becommeth cuvetous man nygarde ryche shulde nygarde golde carefulnes heapeth together vnrighteously gathereth folkes another mā shal make good chere goodes yt wicked vnto self shulde good vnto mē soch one haue eny pleasure goodes thinge worse whan one disfauoureth rewarde wickednes yf eny good doth knowinge therof agaynst last declareth vngraciousnes nygarde hath wicked eye turneth awaye face despyseth owne soule couetous man eye hath neuer ynough porcion wickednes 〈◊〉 27 c • ccl • 1 vntyll tyme wither awaye haue lost owne soule wicked eye spareth bred scarcenesse vpō table sonne good ye self yt thou hast geue ye lorde due offeringes remembre yt death tarieth yt couenaunt graue shewed vnto couenaunt worlde shal dye death eccli 4 • obi 4 b • uc 16 b good vnto yt frende thou dye acordinge thy abylite reach thine hande geue vnto ye poore dispoynted ye good daye let ye porcion ye good daie ouerpas shalt thou leaue thy trauayles labour vnto men deuydinge heretage geue take sanctifie thy soule worke thou righteousnes thy death ye hell meate fynde flesh shal fade awaye like grasse esa 4 • • pet • iacob • like florishinge leaf grene tre growe cast downe euen ye generacion flesh bloude one commeth ende another borne transitory thinges shall fayle last worker therof shal go withall euery chosen worke shall iustified yt medleth withall shal haue honoure therin blessed man yt kepeth wyszdome exercyseth vnderstandinge discrecion shal thinke vpon fore knowlege god considereth ye wayes wyszdome hert hath vnderstandinge hir secretes goeth one seketh hir contynueth hir wayes loketh hir windowes herkeneth hir dores taketh rest besyde hir house festeneth stake hir walles shall pitch tent nye vnto hir hande tent shal good thinges rest euermore shal sett child vnder hir coueringe shal dwell vnder hir braunches vnder hir coueringe shal defended heate hir glory shall rest xv chapter feareth god wil good kepeth lawe shal optayne wyszdome honorable mother shal mete vyrgin shall receaue 〈…〉 ye bred life vnderstandinge shall fede 〈…〉 geue water wholsome wyszdome drynke yf constant shall moued yf holde fast shal come cōfucion shall brynge honoure amonge neghbours myddest congregacion shall open mouth sprete wyszdome vnderstādinge shal fyll clothe garment glory shal heape treasure myrth ioye vpō geue euerlastinge name heretage foolish men wyll take holde vpon soch haue vnderstandinge wil mete farre pryde disceate men go aboute lye wil remembre men trueth shall founde euen vnto beholdinge god prayse semely mouth ye vngodly sent ye lorde god commeth wyszdome prayse shall stonde wyszdome god shal plenteous faithfull mouth lorde shal geue vnto saye thou lordes faute gone thou shalt ye thinge god hateth saye thou hath caused go wronge hath faithfulnes euer shal preserue ye hath set water fyre 〈…〉 reach thine hande vnto thou wilt man life death good euell loke liketh shalbe geuen wyszdome god greate mightie power beholdeth men contynually 〈◊〉 33 b eye lorde vpon feare knoweth workes man▪ hath commaūded man vngodly nether hath geuen eny man leue synne xvi chapter delyte thou multitude vngodly child haue pleasure yf feare god trust thou life regarde labour one sonne yt feareth god better thē thousande vngodly better man dye without childrē thē leaue behynde soch child vngodly one yt hath vnderstandinge maye whole cite vpholden though vngodly many yet shal waysted thorow many soch thinges hath myne eye sene greater thinges haue herde myne eares congregacion vngodly shal fyre burne 〈…〉 amonge vnfaithfull people shal wrath kyndled olde giaūtes optayned grace synnes 〈…〉 destroyed trustinge owne strēgth nether spared amōge loth straunger smote abhorred pryde wordes 〈◊〉 19 c pitie vpō destroyed people stoute synne 〈◊〉 • 4 c 〈◊〉 2 • f moch ouersawe sixe hundreth thousande gathered selues together ye hardnesse hert maruell yf one beynge hardnecked shulde fre mercy wrath 〈…〉 mightie forgeue poure displeasure like mercy greate euē punyshment also iudgeth man acordinge workes vngodly shal escape spoyle longe pacience sheweth mercy shal byde behynde mercy shall make place vnto euery man acordinge deseruynge workes vnderstandinge pilgremage saye thou wyl hyde self god wyl thinke vpon aboue shal knowne greate heape people soule amonge many creature beholde heauen yee heauen heauens depe earth therin shall moued presence mountaynes hilles foundacions earth shal shake feare whan god vysiteth thinges doth hert vnderstonde vnderstandeth euery hert vnderstandeth wayes man seyth storme parte workes secrete wil declare workes righteousnes shal able abyde couenaunt farre tryenge men fulfillynge humble hert thinketh vpon soch thinges vnwyse erroneous man casteth mynde vnto foolish thinges sonne herken thou vnto lerne vnderstādinge marck wordes thine hert wyll geue sure doctrine planely shal enstrucke god hath sett workes good ordre begynninge parte hath sundered hath garnyshed workes euerlastinge begynnynges acordinge generacions none thē hyndered another nether eny dishobedient vnto worde god loked vpō earth fylled goodes maner lyuinge beastes hath couered grounde shalbe turned vnto earth agayne xvii chapter bod shope man earth turned vnto earth agayne gene 1 c gaue nombre dayes certayne tyme yee gaue power thinges vpō earth clothed strength made owne licknes made flesh stonde awe dominion beastes foules gen 2 made helper like vnto self gaue discrecion tonge eye eares hert vnderstande fylled instruccion vnderstandinge created also knowlege sprete fylled hert vnderstandinge shewed good euell sett eye vpō hertes declaringe vnto greate noble workes shulde prayse holy name together reioyse wonder tellinge noble actes • xo 20 • eut 45 • nd 9 besydes gaue instruccion lawe life heretage made euerlastinge couenaunt shewed righteousnes iudgmentes sawe glory eye eares herde maiesty voyce saide vnto bewarre vnrighteous thinges gaue euery man also commaundement concernynge vnto wickedness open sight mercy yt man sheweth purse wt • ccli 29 b man good dede preserueth apple eye last shall awake • att 25 c rewarde euery man vpon heade hath deserued shal turne together lesse offence turne agayne vnto lorde forsake thine vnrighteousnes vtter enemy abhominacion lerne knowe righteousnes iudgmentes god stonde porcion sett forth prayer hye god go porcion holy worlde soch cleare thē sonne yet shal fayle wicked thinge flesh bloude hath ymagined shall reproued lorde seyth power hye heauen earth aszshes xviii chapter lyueth euermore made thinges together 〈…〉 god onely
