done ye sight god wyse man feareth god thinges dayes transgression kepeth self synne discrete man hath pleasure wyszdome fyndeth maketh moch haue vnderstandinge haue dealt wysely wordes haue vnderstonde trueth righteousnes haue sought wyse sentēces iudgmentes 〈◊〉 6 b 〈◊〉 13 b folowe thy lustes turne ye thine owne yf thou geuest thy soule hir desyres shal make thine enemy laugh scorne take thy pleasure greate volupteousnes medle moch withall make greate cheare thinge thou hast wonne avauntage lest thou fall pouerte haue nothinge thy purse xix chapter labourynge man geuen vnto dronckennes shall riche maketh moch small thynges 〈◊〉 19 g • • eg 11 shal fall litle litle wyne woman make wyse men rēnagates put men vnderstādinge reprofe accompanieth aduouterers shal become wicked man mothes wormes shall haue heretage yee shall sett vp greater example soule shalbe roted nombre 〈◊〉 22 c haistie geue credence light mynded doth agaynst reioyseth wickednes shal punished hateth refourmed life shalbe shortened abhorreth bablinge wordes quencheth wickednes offendeth agaynst owne soule shal repent reioyseth wickednes shalbe punyshed rehearse wicked churlish worde twyse thou shalt hyndered shew thy secretes nether frende ner foo yf thou hast offended tell shal herken vnto marck whan fyndeth oportunyte shall hate eccli 22 • 7 yf thou hast herde worde agaynst ye neghboure lett deed within sure thou shalt haue harme therby foole trauaileth worde like woman payned bearinge childe like arowe shott dogges thye worde fooles hert leui 19 matt 18 tell thy frende faute lest ignoraunt saye haue done yf haue done nomore reproue thy neghboure kepe tonge yf haue spokē saye nomore tell thy neghboure faute oft tymes offence made geue credē ce euery worde man falleth somtyme tonge eccli 14 25 • iacob • yt hath offended tonge geue thy neghboure warnynge thou threaten geue place vnto lawe lorde feare god wyszdome right wyse man kepeth lawe doctrine wickednes wyszdome prudence synners good vnderstondinge wickednesse abhominacion blasphemynge wyszdome symple man small vnderstandinge feareth god better one hath moch wyszdome transgresseth lawe hyest craftye sotell man wyse vnrighteous giftes wraysteth open manyfest lawe wicked man behaue humbly douke heade yet disceauer within hydeth face matt 6 • disguyseth shulde knowne preuenteth though weake harme yet whan maye fynde oportunyte shall euell man maye knowne face one hath vnderstondinge maye perceaued loke countenaunce man garment laughter goynge eccli 21 declare xx chapter man reproueth neghbo oft tymes due season eccli 31 • agayne man holdeth tonge wyse discrete moch better geue warnynge reproue beare euell knowlegeth self openly shalbe preserued hurt destruccion like whan chamberlayne thorow desyre lust defyleth mayden euen vseth violence vnrighteousnes ye lawe good thinge man yt reproued shewe openly repentaunce shalt thou escape wylfull synne man kepeth sylence founde wyse ashamed sayeth hatefull man holdeth tonge hath vnderstandinge language man kepeth sylence 〈◊〉 3 • ccli 32 waytinge conuenyent tyme wyse man wyll holde tonge tyll se oportunyte wanten vndiscrete body shal regarde tyme vseth many wordes shal hurte owne soule taketh auctorite vpō vnrighteously shalbe hated man hath oft tymes prosperite wicked thinges agayne man getteth moch hath harme losse gift nothinge worth againe gift whose rewarde dubble man getteth fall beynge proude commeth worshipe lowe estate man bieth moch litle pryce must paye seuen folde wyse man wordes maketh self loued 〈◊〉 6 fauours fooles shalbe poured gift vnwyse shal good eye seuen folde • ccli 18 c shal geue litle saye gaue moch openeth mouth crieth one crieth wyne daye lendeth tomorow axeth agayne soch man hated foole sayeth haue frende haue thanke good dedes yee euen eate bred speake good oft many shal laughed scorne taketh perlous fall soch wordes yf fell vpon grounde euen shal falles wicked men come haistely mouth vntaught many vnconuenient vnmete wordes wyse sentence shall alowed mouth foole speaketh due season man synneth hath wherwithall rest shall stynged man destroyeth owne soule shame vnwyse bodyes sake destroieth acceptinge personnes shal vndoo self man promiseth frende gift shame getteth enemye naught lye wicked shame man yet shall euer mouth vnwyse thefe better man accustomed synne shal haue destruccion heretage condicions lyers vnhonest shame euer wyse man shall brynge honoure wordes 〈…〉 hath vnderstondinge shall sett amonge greate men tylleth londe pro 〈…〉 shal increase heape corne worketh righteousnes shall exalted pleaseth greate men shall escape moch euell 〈…〉 rewardes giftes blynde eye wyse make domme tell mē fautes wyszdome hyd treasure hoorded vp 〈…〉 profit better kepeth ignoraunce secrete man hydeth wyszdome xxi chapter sonne yf thou hast synned nomore 〈…〉 praye thy foresynnes maye geuen fle synne euen serpent yf thou commest nye wyll byte teth therof teth lyon slaye soules men wickednes man sharpe two edged swerde maketh soch woundes healed stryfe wrongeous dealinge shall waist awaye man goodes thorow pryde rich house shalbe brought naught rich proude shalbe roted prayer poore goeth mouth commeth vnto eares 〈…〉 vengeaunce defence shall come yt haistely hateth refourmed token vngodly personne feareth god wyl remembre mightie man knowne afarre tonge hath vnderstondinge perceaueth shal haue fall buyldeth house men cost like one gathereth stone wynter 〈…〉 congregacion vngodly like stubble gathered together ende flamme fyre waye vngodly sett stone ende hell darcknes paynes kepeth lawe wyll holde fast vnderstandinge therof ende feare god wyszdome wyse wyll taught good vnwyse man aboundeth wickednes bytternes vnderstōdinge knowlege wyse shall flowe like water renneth ouer councell like fountayne life hert foole like brokē vessell kepe wyszdome whan man vnderstondinge heareth wyse worde shal commende make moch yf volupteous man heare shall haue pleasure therin cast behynde back talkynge foole like heuy burthen waye heare wyse man speake pleasure doute congregacion axed mouth wyse shal pondre wordes hertes like house destroyed euen wyszdome vnto foole knowlege vnwyse darck wordes doctryne vnto yt hath vnderstandinge euen fetter aboute fete like mannicles vpon right hande 〈◊〉 19 foole lifteth vp voyce wt laughter wyse man shall scarse laugh secretly lernynge vnto wyse man iewell golde like armlett vpō right arme foolish man foote soone neghbours house one hath experience shall ashamed personne mightie foole wyll pepe ye wyndow house well nourtured wyll stonde without foolish man stondeth herkenynge dore wyse wyll ashamed lippes vnwyse wylbe tellynge foolish thinges ye wordes soch haue vnderstandinge shalbe weyed balaunce hert fooles mouth mouth wyse hert whan vngodly curseth blasphemer curseth owne soule 〈◊〉 19 preuy accuser men shal defyle owne soule hated euery man kepeth tonge discrete shall come honoure xxii chapter slouthfull body moulded stone claie toucheth must wash handes agayne mysnurtored sonne dishonoure father foolish daughter shalbe litle regarded wyse daughter heretage vnto hir husbande commeth dishonesty bringeth hir father heuynes daughter past shame dishonoureth hir father hir huszbande vngodly shal regarde shal despise playenge musick mete heuynes euen correcciō doctryne wyszdome euer vnpleasaunt vnto fooles teacheth foole euen one gleweth potsherde together one telleth tayle heareth one rayseth mā heuy slepe telleth foole wyszdome euen man speaketh one yt slepe whā hath tolde tayle sayeth matter whā one dyeth lamentacion made light fayleth euē let mē mourne ouer foole wanteth vnderstandinge make litle wepinge deed come rest life foole worse death gen 50 b seuen dayes men mourne deed lamentacion ouer vnwyse vngodly shulde endure dayes life talke moch foole go hath vnderstondinge bewarre lest turne trauayle thou shalt defyled synne departe thou shalt fynde rest shalt drawē back foolishnes heuyer leade shulde foole called el leade sōde pro 27 salt lōpe yron easier beare vnwyse foolish vngodly man like band wodd bounde together foundacion house belowsed euē ye hert yt stablished ye thought coūcell thought wyse shal nether feare ner offended eny tyme like fayre playstred wall winter house hye buyldinge maye abyde ye wīde storme euē fooles hert afraied ymaginacion feareth euery thinge endure nyppeth man eye bryngeth forth teares pricketh hert bringeth forth ye meanynge thought casteth stone byrdes frayeth awaye yt blasphemeth frēde breaketh ye frēdshipe▪ though thou drewest swerde thy frende yet dispayre thou mayest come agayne ye frende yf speake sowerly feare ye maye agreed together agayne excepte thou blaspheme dyszdayne opē secretes wounde tratorously soch thinges shal dryue awaye frende faithfull vnto ye neghbo pouerte thou mayest reioyse also prosperite abyde stedfast vnto ye tyme trouble thou maiest heyre wt heretage like vapor smoke goeth ouen ye fyre euen euell wordes rebuke threatenynges go bloudsheddinge ashamed defende yi frende wyl hyde face though shulde harme euer heareth shal bewarre shal set watch mouth •• al 140 sure seale vpon lippes yt fall wt thē yt tonge destroye xxiii chapter lorde father gouernoure life leaue ymaginaciō councell oh let fall soch reprofe wyll kepe thought ye scourge doctryne wyszdome myne herte spare myne ignoraunce fall lest myne ignoraunces increase myne offence many nombre synnes exceade lest fall myne enemyes aduersary reioyse lorde thou father god life leaue ymaginacion let haue proude loke turne awaye volupteousnes fro take fro lustes body let desyres vnclennes take holde vpon geue ouer vnshamefast obstinate mynde heare ye child geue doctryne ye shal ordre yor mouth kepeth shal perish thorow lippes ner hurt thorow wicked workes synner shalbe taken owne vanite proude cursed shal fall therin • xo 20 b • ccli 27 • att 5 let thy mouth accustomed swearinge many falles let namynge god continually ye mouth like seruaunt oft punyshed without sore euen euer yt sweareth nameth god shal cleane pourged frō synne man vseth moch swearinge shalbe fylled wickednes plage shall neuer go house yf begyle brother faute shalbe vpon yf knowlege synne maketh dubble offence yf sweare vayne shall founde righteous house shalbe full plage wordes ye swearer bringeth death god graunte yt founde house iacob • eui 24 c yt feare god eschue soch lye weltringe synne vse ye mouth vnhonest fylthye talkynge worde synne ephe 〈…〉 remembre yi father thy mother whā thou art set amonge greate men lest god forget yt sight lest •• ou dotinge thy custome suffre rebuke wyshe haue bene borne curse daye thy natiuite man accustomed wordes blasphemy 〈…〉 wyl neuer refourmed ye dayes life synne twyse moch thirde bringeth wrath destruccion whote stomack quenched euē like burnynge fyre tyll haue swalowed vp somthīge euē vnchaste mā hath rest flesh tyll haue kyndled fyre bred swete whoremonger wyl leaue tyll haue purpose man breaketh wedlock regardeth soule sayeth tush seyth esa 〈…〉 compassed aboute darcknes walles couer body seyth nede feare hyest wyl remembre synnes vnderstondeth eye se thinges soch feare mē dryueth awaye feare god feareth onely eye men considereth eye lorde clearer sonne beholdinge ye wayes men grounde depe lokynge euen men hertes secrete place lorde god knewe thinges euer made brought passe also loketh vpon 〈…〉 mā shalbe opēly punyshed ye stretes ye cite shalbe chased abrode like yonge horse foale whan thinketh leest vpon shalbe takē thus shal put shame euery man wolde vnderstonde feare lorde thus shal go also wt euery wyfe yt leaueth hir huszbande getteth enheretaunce straūge mariage first hath bene vnfaithfull vnto lawe ye hyest secō dly hath forsaken hir owne huszbande 〈…〉 thirdly hath played ye whore aduoutry gottē hir childrē another man shalbe brought ye cōgregaciō hir childrē shalbe loked vpō hir childrē shal take rote frute hir braūches shal brī ge forth none shamefull reporte shal leaue behynde hir dishono shal put yt remayne shal knowe yt nothīge better thē ye feare god yt nothinge sweter take hede vnto commaundementes lorde greate worshipe folowe ye lorde longe life shalbe receaued xxiiii chapter wyszdome shal prayse hirself honoured god reioyse ye myddest people cōgregacions hyest shal open hir mouth tryumphe ye beholdinge power ye myddest hir people shal exalted wondred holy fulnesse multitude chosen shalbe commended amonge soch blessed shalbe praysed shal saye come mouth ye hyest first borne creature caused ye light yt fayleth aryse heauen couered earth cloude dwellinge aboue ye heyth seate piler cloude self alone haue gone rounde aboute compasse heauen pearsed grounde ye depe haue walked floudes ye see haue stonde landes domynion euery people euery nacion power haue troden downe hertes hye lowe thinges also sought rest dwellinge enheritaunce ye creator thinges gaue commaundement made appoynted tabernacle saide vnto let thy dwellinge iacob thy inheritaunce israel rote thy self amōge chosen created begynninge worlde 〈…〉 shal leaue vnto worlde come 〈…〉 holy habitacion haue serued stablished sion 〈◊〉 13 • b ye holy cite rested like maner ierusalem power toke rote honourable people euen porcion ye lorde heretage kepte ye fulnes sayntes sett vp hye like ceder vpō libanus cypers tre vpon mount hermon exalted like palme tre cades rose plāte iericho fayre olyue tre felde exalted like plantayne tre water syde haue geuen smell stretes ye cynamom balme hath good sauoure yee swete odoure haue geuen myrre best haue made dwellinges smell rosyn galbanum clowes incense libanus whan hewē downe mine odoure pure balme terebynte haue stretched tigris whan new frutes growinge bringeth plenteous vnderstandinge like euprates fylleth vp iosu 3 • iordane time haruest maketh nurtor breake forth light water gihon ye haruest first hath knowne perfectly nomore shal last seke ye grounde hir thought fuller thē see hir councell profounder greate depe wyszdome haue cast floudes greate waterbroke ye riuer ryuer dorix water condyte come garden pleasure sayde wyl water garden yonge plantes fyll frute byrth waterbroke became exceadinge greate ryuer approched vnto see make doctryne vnto mē light fayre mornynge shall make euer clearer pearse thorow lower partes earth wyll loke vpon soch slepe lighten thē put trust lorde shal yet poure doctrine like prophecy leaue vnto soch seke wyszdome generacions shal neuer fayle vnto holy euerlastinge worlde beholde haue laboured self onely yt seke ye trueth eccli • 3 b xxv chapter thre thinges yt sprete fauoureth • en 13 b • om 12 also alowed god men vnyts brother loue neghbours man wyfe agree well together • ccl 40 thre thinges soule hateth vtterly abhorre life poore man proude rich mā lyar • en 18 b olde body doteth vnchaste yf thou hast gathered nothinge thy youth wylt thou fynde thē feareth lorde feare god hath sett aboue thinges blessed ye man vnto whō graunted haue feare god vnto whō shal lickened yt kepeth fast feare god begynnynge loue begynnynge faith cleue fast vnto manerly woman gyft aboue giftes waight compared vnto mynde rule self like sonne whan aryseth ornament hye heauen ye lorde vertuous wife ye bewtye hir house like cleare light vpon ye holy cādelstick bewtye face vpō honest body 〈◊〉 5 like goldē pilers vpon sockettes syluer fayre legges vpon woman hath cōstant mynde perpetuall foūdacions laied vpon whole stonye rocke ye commaundementes god vpon holy woman two thinges yt greue hert thirde displeasure come vpon experte man warre suffreth scarsenes pouerte whan men vnderstondinge wyszdome set whan one departeth righteousnes vnto synne doth soch like nale wall sticketh fast betwixte two stone euen doth synne sticke betwixte ye byer seller yf holde diligently ye feare lorde house shall soone ouerthrowne like whan one sifteth fylthynes remayneth syue remayneth vncleane thinge thought man ouen proueth potter vessell 〈…〉 doth tentacion trouble trye righteous men tre felde knowne frute thought mās hert knowne wordes prayse mā excepte thou haue harde man knowne wordes yf thou folowest righteousnes thou shalt get put vpon yt fayre garment thou shalt dwell shal defende euer ye daye knowlege thou shalt fynde stedfastnesse byrdes resorte vnto like doth trueth turne vnto occupied withall lyon wayteth ye praye synnes lurke vpon workes wickednes talkinge feareth god nothinge wyszdome foole chaungeth ye moone yf thou amonge vndiscrete kepe thy worde conuenient tyme amonge soch wyse speake hardely ro 12 b col 4 talkinge fooles abhominaciō spo • te volupteousnesse mysnurtoure moch swearynge maketh hayre stonde vp stryue soch eccli 23 b stoppeth eares stryfe proude bloudsheddynge blasphemynge heuy heare discouereth secretes eccli 19 b 22 leseth credence fyndeth frende loue thy frende bynde thyself faithfulnes yf thou bewrayest secretes thou shalt get agayne like mā destroyeth enemye also dealeth falsly frendshipe neghboure like one letteth byrde go honde take agayne euen thou yf thou geue ouer thy frende thou canst get agayne yee thou cāst come farre vnto roo escaped snare soule wounded woundes maye bounde vp agayne euell worde maye reconcyled bewrayeth secretes frende hope vnto wyncketh eye pro 10 b ymagineth euell man shal take whan thou art present shal hylie commende prayse thy wordes last shall turne tayle slaūder thy sayenge many thinges haue hated nothinge euell lorde also abhorreth soch synnes forgeuen also whan thou prayest man beareth hatred agaynst another darre desyre forgeuenesse god sheweth mercy mā like darre axe forgeuenesse synnes yf flesh beareth hatred kepeth wyl intreate synnes remembre ende let enmyte passe seketh death destruccion abyde thou ye commaundementes remembre ye commaundement shalt thou rigorous ouer ye neghboure thynke vpō couenaunt ye hyest forgeue thy neghbours ignoraū ce eccli 8 bewarre strife thou shalt make ye synnes fewer angrie man kyndleth variaunce vngodly disquyeteth frē de putteth discorde amonge peace wodd vehement fyre pro 26 c mightier yt men greater wrath longer strife endureth burneth haistie brawlinge kyndleth fyre haistie strife sheddeth bloude yf thou blowe sparke shal burne yf thou spytt vpō shal go forth go thy mouth eccli 21 slaunderer dubble tō gued cursed many one frendes setteth variaunce thirde tonge hath disquieted many one dryuen one londe another stronge city hath broken downe ouerthrowne house greate men thirde tōge hath cast many honest woman robbed labour harkeneth vnto soch shal neuer fynde rest neuer dwell safely stroke ye rod maketh yedders stroke tonge smyteth bone sunder many haue perished swerde many mo thorow tonge wel kepte frō euell tonge commeth ye anger therof draweth yock soch boū de bondes yock therof yron ye bonde stele death therof euell death hell better one soch tonge fyre maye oppresse feare god ye flamme therof maye burne thē soch forsake lorde shal fall therin shal burne man shal able quench shal fall vpon thē lyō deuoure leparde thou • gest ye goodes wt thornes doest thou rather make dores barres ye mouth thou weiest thy golde syluer doest thou weye thy wordes also vpon balaunce bewarre thou slyde thy tonge fall thine enemy laye wayte xxix chapter wil shewe mercy let lende vnto neghboure 〈…〉 able let kepe commaundement lende vnto thy neghboure tyme nede paye thou thy neghboure agayne due season kepe thy worde deale faithfully thou shalt allwaye fynde thinge yt necessary haue bene many whan thinge lent rekened founde made trauayle laboure helped whyle receaue eny thinge kysse handes soch geue neghbours good hūble voyce whan shulde paye agayne kepe back geue euell wordes make many excuse reason tyme though able yet geueth scarse half agayne rekeneth ye founde yf olde moneye yet hath enemye vndeserued payeth cursinge rebuke geueth euel wordes good dede many one glad lende euell feare lese thinge lende yet haue thou pacience symple wt holde mercy helpe poore commaundementes sake let go emptye necessite lese thy money yi brother neghbours sake burye vnder stone wher rusteth corruppeth 〈…〉 gather thy treasure commaundement ye hyest shal bringe profit thē golde laye vp allmes hand poore shal kepe 〈◊〉 man allmes purse 〈◊〉 shall kepe man fauoure apple eye afterwarde shall aryse paye euery man rewarde vpon heade shal fight agaynst thine enemy better shylde giaunte speare mightie good honest mā suertye neghboure wicked personne letteth come shame forget frendshipe thy suertye hath geuē soule ye vngodly despyseth ye good dede suertye vnthankfull ignoraunt leaueth suertie daunger man promyseth neghboure whan hath lost honesty shal forsake suertishipe hath destroyed many ryche man remoued wawes ye see mightie people hath dryuen awaye caused thē wandre straunge countrees vngodly man transgressynge commaundement lorde shal fall euell suertishipe though force get yet shal fall iudgment helpe thy neghboure thy power bewarre yt thou thy self fall soch dett chefe thinge kepeth life 〈…〉 water bred clothinge lodginge couer shame better haue poore lyuynge man owne house 〈◊〉 36 b 〈◊〉 6 b 〈◊〉 13 thē delicate fayre amōge straunge litle moch yt thou hast holde contēt withall thou shalt blamed vagabounde myserable life go house house mā fremde darre opē mouth though one lodged haue meate drynke yet shall taken vnworthy heare many bytter rough wordes namely thus go thy waye thou straunger prepare casteth teth xxx chapter loueth childe holdeth still vnder correccion 〈◊〉 • 3 c 〈◊〉 2 • b maye haue ioye afterwarde grope neghbours dores 〈◊〉 6 yt teacheth sonne shall haue ioye nede ashamed amōge behinde auenger agaynst enemy good doer vnto frendes life childrē shal binde woundes together hert greued euery crye vntamed horse wylbe harde wanton childe wyl wylfull yf thou brynge vp thy sonne delicatly shal make ye afrayed yf thou playe shal brynge heuynes laugh lest thou wepe wt also lest thy teth sett edge last geue liberte youth excuse foly eccli 7 • bow downe neck whyle yonge hytt vpon sydes whyle yet childe lest waxe stubburne geue force ye shalt thou haue heuynes soule teach thy childe diligēt therin lest thy shame better poore beynge whole stronge thē man riche haue health health welfare aboue golde whole body aboue treasure rich aboue sounde body ioye aboue ioye hert death better wretched life contynuall sicknes good thinges yt put close mouth like whan meate layed vpon ye graue good doth offeringe vnto idoll nether eate taist ner smell bel • euē also riche god maketh seke seith eye groneth therafter euen gelded man lyeth vyrgin sygheth pro 12 15 b 17 eccli 38 pro 14 geue ouer thy mynde heuynes vexe thy self thine owne councell ioye chearfulnes hert life man man gladnes prolonginge dayes loue thine owne soule comforte thine hert sorow heuynes dryue farre ye2 cor 7 heuynes hath slayne many man bryngeth profit zele anger shorten dayes life carefulnes sorow brynge age tyme vnto mery hert euery thinge hath good taist eateth xxxi chapter trauayle carefulnes rich taketh awaye slepe1 tim 6 b maketh flesh cōsume whan one lyeth taketh care waketh euer vp like greate sicknes breaketh slepe rich hath greate labor gatheringe rich together pleasure rich taketh rest refreshed laboureth prospereth poore though leaue yet begger loueth rich shall iustified foloweth corrupciō shal haue ynough therof eccli 8 many one come greate mysfortune reason golde haue founde destruccion tre fallynge vnto offre vp soch foolish fall therin blessed rich founde without blemysh hath gone golde ner hoped money treasure soch one shal commende call blessed greate thinges doth amonge people tryed founde perfecte soch thinges shalbe commended praised might offende hath offended coude euell hath done therfore shal good stablished whole congregacion shal declare allmesses yf thou sytt greate man table open thy mouth wyde vpon make many wordes remembre euell eye shrew thinge created worse wicked eye therfore wepeth euery mās face laye thine hand vpon euery thinge thine eye seyth stryue dyshe • att 7 ponder thy self thy neghboure wolde fayne haue descrete euery poynte eate thinge set manerly becommeth man • ccli 37 eate moch lest thou abhorred leaue thou first nurtoure lest thou man maye satisfie maye turne thy decaye whā thou syttest amonge many men reach thine hāde first well contēt wyse man wt litle wyne yt slepe thou shalt seke therof ner fele eny payne swete wholsome slepe shal soch one haue fele inwarde grefe ryseth vp tymes ye mornynge well ease self vnsaciable eater slepeth vnquyetly hath ache payne body yf thou felest thou hast eaten moch aryse go thy waye cast thy stomack take thy rest sonne heare despyse last thou shalt fynde haue tolde • om 12 b thy workes diligent quycke shal sicknes happen vnto • ro 22 liberall dealynge meate many men shall blesse prayse lippes sure token loue faithfulnes yt vnfaithfull meate whole cite shall complayne sure experiēce infidelite wickednes • phe 5 b • udit 13 thou wine bebber wyne hath destroyed many man fyre proueth ye hard yron euen doth wyne proue hertes proude whan droncken wyne sorbely droncken quyckeneth life mā yf thou drynckest measurably psal 〈…〉 pro 〈…〉 thou shalt temperate life yt maye contynue without wyne wyne made begynnynge make men glad dronkennes wyne measurably dronkē reioysinge soule body yf dronken excesse maketh bytternes sorowe vnto mynde dronkēnes fylleth mynde foolish shame ruyne mynisheth strēgth maketh woundes 〈…〉 rebuke thy neghboure ye wyne despyse myrth geue despytefull wordes preasse vpon contrary sayenges xxxii chapter yf thou made ruler pride thy self therin 〈…〉 thou one people take diligent care 〈…〉 loke well therto whan thou hast done thy dewtye syt downe thou mayest mery receaue crowne honoure talke wysely honestly wyszdome becommeth right well hynder musyck speake audyence 〈…〉 poure forth wyszdome tyme importunyte like carbuncle stone shyneth set golde doth songe garnysh wyne feast ye smaragde set golde swetnes musyck ye myrth wyne thou yonge mā speake becommeth profitable yet scarse whan thou art twyce axed comprehende moch wordes many thinges one ignoraunt geue eare holde thy tonge withall yf thou amonge men hyer auctorite desyre compare thy self vnto whā elder speaketh make thou many wordes therin thonder goeth lightenynge nurtoure shamefastnesse goeth loue fauoure stōde vp tymes last get home soone take thy pastyme thou wilt yt thou euell defye mā thinges geue thankes vnto hath made replenished goodes feareth lorde wyl receaue doctryne get tymes shall fynde grace seketh lawe shall fylled withall yt fayned wyll offended therat feare lorde shal fynde iudgment righteousnes shalbe kyndled light vngodly man refourmed helpe self example purpose man vnderstondinge despyseth good councell wylde proude body hath feare sonne nothinge without advisement shal repēt ye dede go waye thou mayest fall ner thou mayest stomble stone geue yi self laborious slypery waye bewarre thine owne child thy workes put thy trust god thy whole hert kepinge cō maundementes beleueth god worde taketh hede commaundementes putteth trust ye lorde shal wante nothinge xxxiii chapter shall euell happen vnto feareth god whan tentacion lorde shall delyuer wyse man hateth ye lawe ypocryte shyp raginge water man vnderstondinge geueth credence vnto lawe god ye lawe faithfull vnto sure matter talke therof first wel instructe thē maiest thou geue answere hert ye foolish like cartwhele thoughtes renne aboute like axell tre like wylde horse neyeth vnder euery one yt sytteth vpon scornefull frende doth one daie excell another seynge dayes yeare come sonne wyszdome lorde hath parted sunder hath ordened tymes solempne feastes hath chosen halowed dayes men made grounde earth adam multitude scyence hath ye lorde sundered made wayes dyuerse fashion hath blessed made moch halowed claymed thē hath cursed brought thē lowe put thē estate 〈◊〉 9 c like ye claye potter hande ordrynge therof pleasure men also hande yt made thē maye geue liketh best agaynst euell good agaynst death life vngodly agaynst soch feare god beholde thus workes hyest euer 〈…〉 two agaynst two one set agaynst another awaked vp last one gathereth haruest giftes god blessynge increased haue fylled wyne presse like grape gatherer beholde ecclesia •• tici 24 • haue laboured onely self soch loue nurtoure wyszdome heare ye greate men people harken wt yo eares ye ruler ye congregacion geue ye sonne wyfe ye brother frende power ouer whyle thou lyuest geue awaye thy substaunce good another lest repent thou fayne begg therfore thy self longe thou lyuest hast breth let man chaunge better thy child praye yt thou shuldest fayne loke handes thy workes excellent thy honoure neuer stained tyme whan thou shalt ende thy dayes fynish thy life distribute thine inheretaūce fodder whyppe burden belongeth vnto asse meate correccion worke vnto seruaunt yf thou set thy seruaunt laboure thou shalt fynde rest yf thou let go ydel shal seke libertye yock ye whyppe bowe downe neck tame thou thy euell seruaunt bōdes correccion sende laboure go ydle idylnesse bryngeth moch euell sett worke belongeth vnto becōmeth well yf obedient bynde fete moch vnto anye wyse without discrecion nothinge yf thou haue faithfull seruaūt eccli 7 c let vnto thine owne soule bloude hast thou gotten yf thou haue seruaunt holde thy self thou hast nede thy self yf thou intreatest euell kepest harde makest proude renne awaye ye thou canst tell waye thou shalt seke xxxiiii chapter vnwyse people begyle selues wt vayne disceatfull hope fooles trust dreames regardeth dreames like wil take holde shadowe folowe wynde euen appearinges dreames face licknes face clensed ye vncleane treuth spoken lyar soythsayenge witchcraft sorcery dreaminge vanyte like whan womā trauayleth wt chylde hath many fantasyes hir herte soch vision come god set thine herte vpon dreames haue disceaued many mā fayled put truste therin lawe shalbe fulfilled without lye wyszdome sufficient faithfull mouth wyse man yt well instructe vnderstonstondeth moch yt hath good experiēce talke wyszdome yt hath experiē ce knoweth litle yt erreth causeth moch wickednes whan yet erroure lerned moch also yee lerned coude expresse came oft parell death therouer tyll delyuered se feare god haue right sprete hope stō deth helpe thē feareth lorde stōdeth awe man afrayed lorde hope comforte blessed soule yt feareth lorde whō putteth trust strēgth eye lorde haue respecte vnto loue mightie proteccion strōge grounde defence heate refuge hote noone daye sucore stomblynge helpe fallynge setteth vp soule lighteneth ye eye geueth health life blessynge geueth offeringe vnrighteous good offerynge refused scornefull dealinges vnrighteous please god god hath delyte offerynges ye vngodly • ro 15 nether maye synne reconcyled multitude oblacions bryngeth offerynge ye goodes ye poore doth euē one yt kylleth ye sonne ye father eye bred nedefull life ye oppressed 〈…〉 despyseth ye desyre ye fatherles ner ye wyddow whan poureth hir prayer doth god se ye teares yt renne downe ye chekes wyddow heareth complaynte ouer soch make wep • ▪ serueth god pleasure shalbe accepted prayer reacheth vnto cloudes prayer yt humbleth 〈…〉 goeth thorow ye cloudes tyll come nye wyl comforted ner go hir waye tyll ye hyest god haue respecte vnto geue true sentēce perfourme ye iudgmēt ye lorde wil slack cōmynge ner tary longe tyll haue smyttē sonder ye backes ye vnmercyfull auenged ye heithen tyll haue takē awaye ye multitude ye cruell brokē cepter vnrighteous tyll geue euery man workes rewarde haue deserued tyll haue delyuered people mayntened cause reioysed mercy fayre thinge mercy tyme anguysh trouble like cloude rayne yt cōmeth ye tyme drouth xxxvi chapter haue mercy vpon v lorde thou god thinges haue respecte vnto v shew v light thy mercy sende ye feare amōge ye heithē straū gers seke yt maye knowe yt god thou yt maye shew thy wonderous workes lift vp thine hande ouer outlādish heithen yt maye lerne knowe thy might power like thou art halowed v brynge passe yt thou mayest magnified also v yt maye knowe like knowe none god onely thou lorde renue token chaunge wonderous workes shewe thine hāde thy right arme gloriously rayse thy indignacion poure thy wrath take awaye aduersary smyte enemye make ye tyme shorte remembre thy couenaunt ye wonderous workes maye praysed let wrath fyre consume lyue careles let perish ye people hurte smyte sonder heade prynces oure enemy saye none gather ye trybes iacob together againe yt maie knowe yt none god onely thou yt maie shew thy wonderous workes thy people heretage like begynninge lorde haue mercy vpon people yt hath ye name 〈◊〉 4 f vpō israel thou hast lickened first borne sonne merciful vnto ierusalē cite thy sanctuary ye cite thy rest 〈◊〉 6 g fyll sion thy vnspeakeable vertues yi people wt thy glory geue wytnes vnto ye creature thou maydest begynnynge rayse vp prophecy yt haue bene shewed thy name rewarde yt wayte yt thy prophetes maye founde faithfull lorde heare prayer thy seruauntes acordinge ye blessinge aaron ouer thy people dwell vpon earth 〈◊〉 6 maye knowe thou art lorde eternall god euerlastinge bely deuoureth meates yet one meate better another like tonge taisteth venyson 〈◊〉 2 b doth hert vnderstondinge marck false wordes frowarde hert geueth heuynes man experience lifteth vp agayne woman receaueth euery man yet one daughter better another fayre wife reioyseth hir huszbande man loueth nothinge better yf louynge vertuous withall hir huszbande like men hath gotten vertuous woman hath goodly possession vnto helpe piler wher vpon resteth hedge goodes spoyled houszwife ye frēdles mourneth like credence geuen robber yt goeth one cite another ye man beleued hath nest must turne maye abyde night xxxvii chapter every frende sayeth wil frendly vnto also frende onely frende name remayneth heuynes vnto death whan companyon frende turned enemye wicked presumpcion frō whence art thou spronge vp couer earth falsede disceate eccli 6 b companyon prosperite reioyseth frēde tyme trouble taketh parte agaynst cō panyon mourneth frende bely sake whan trouble commeth taketh holde shylde forget thy frende thy mynde thynke vpon yi rich euery counceler bryngeth forth councell neuertheles yt counceleth owne profit eccli 8 • 9 c bewarre ye counceler aduysed afore wherto thou wilt vse wil geue coūcell self lest cast lott vpon saye vnto thy waye purpose good afterwarde stande agaynst loke shal become axe coūcell yt suspecketh ye enemie hyde ye councell soch hate ye axe councell woman cōcernynge ye thinges yt lōgeth ner fearful fayntharted body matter warre marchaunt deare wil cheape thy ware towarde byer sellynge envyous man thankesgeuynge vnmercifull louynge kindnes ye slouthfull workinge hyrelynge hath house profit wealth ydle body wolde gladly heare speake moch labo take soch folkes coūcell diligēt seke coūcel vertuous man yt feareth god soch one thou knowest keper ye cōmaundemētes hath minde thine owne minde sory ye whā thou stōblest holde thy councell fast thine hert man faithful kepe thou thy self mās mynde somtyme disposed tell seuen watchman sytt aboue hye place lokynge aboute aboue praye hyest wil lede thy waye faithfulnes trueth thy workes axe councell first euer thou doest eny thinge well aduysed foure thinges declare chaunged hert wherout springeth euell good death life masterfull tonge bableth moch man apte well instructe many thinges yet vnprofitable vnto man geue wyse prudent councell yet hated contynueth begger grace geuē god accepted another robbed wiszdome yet wise vnto self frute vnderstōdinge faithfull mouth wyse man maketh people wyse ye frutes wiszdome fayle wyse taketh awaye paynes soch doth apotecary make confeccion yet man perfourme workes ye lorde commeth prosperous wealth ouer ye earth sonne despyse thy sicknes praye vnto lorde esa 38 • pa • 16 c shal phisician▪ ye lorde hath created let go thou hast nede houre maye come yt seke maye helped thorow whan praye vnto ye lorde yt maie recouer get health lyue lō ger synneth maker shall fall handes remembraunce deed ceasse rest 〈…〉 cō forte thy self agayne ouer seynge sprete departed wyszdome scrybe cōuenyent tyme rest yt ceasseth exercyse labo shalbe wyse holdeth ye plough hath pleasure proddynge dryuynge ye ox goeth aboute wt soch workes speake ox setteth hert make forowes diligent geue ye kyne fodder euery carpenter also work master laboureth still night daye carueth graueth cutteth desyre sondrye connynge thinges hert ymagineth maye conyngly cast ymage diligence also watchinge perfourmeth worke yronsmyth like maner bydeth stythie doth diligence laboure yron vapoure fyre brenneth flesh must fight heate fornace noyse hammer soundeth euer eares eye loke still vpon thinge yt maketh hath set minde vpon wyll make worke therfore watcheth maie set brynge ende doth potter syt worke turneth ye whele aboute fete diligent carefull doynges laboure worke without nombre fashioneth claye arme wt fete tēpereth hert ymagineth maye make pleasaunt diligence clense ouen hope hādes euery one thinketh connynge worke without maye city manteyned inhabited ner occupied yet come hye congregacion vnderstande couenaunt ye lawe declare equyte iudgment fynde darck sentē ce thorow shal kepeth ye sayenges famous men preasseth vnderstandinge darck sentēces wyszdome seketh ye mysterye secrete sayēges exercyseth self therin cōtynually doth seruyce amonge greate men appeareth prynce goeth straunge countre trauaileth thorow loke good euell amōge men proueth seketh purposeth hert resorte early vnto lorde yt made praye hyest god openeth mouth prayer prayeth synnes greate lorde wil profit thē man hydeth foolishnes better man hydeth wyszdome therfore ye turned wordes good thinges allwaie ashamed true faith must proue measure ashamed whordome father mother ashamed lesynge prynce de whan thou geuest eny thinge cast teth withall xlii chapter eehearse thinge twyse disclose wordes thou hast herde secrete shamefast well manered dede shall euery man fauoure thinges thou ashamed frendes diligent kepe true measure weight content whether thou gettest moch litle deale truly wt temporall goodes byenge sellynge brynge vp child diligence correcke euell seruaunt kepe thine frō euell wife set lock many handes thou delyuerest geuest kepte tell weye wryte vp geuynge receauynge enfourme ye vnlerned vnwyse aged iudged yonge yf thou diligēt thinges truly thou shalt lerned wyse accepted men daughter maketh ye father watch secretly carefulnes hath taketh awaye slepe yee youth lest shulde ouergrowe whan hath huszbande lest shulde hated lest shulde defyled rauyshed hir yt euell reporte • hou fayne heare thy shame euery man confounded ye people eccli 25 beholde euery body bewtye haue moch dwellynge amonge wemen like worme moth commeth clothinge gen 3 b doth wickednes come wemen better euell man wt frendly wife yt putteth one shame rebuke wyl remembre workes lorde declare thinge yt haue sene ye wordes ye lorde workes sōne ouerloketh thīges wt shine workes full ye clearnes therof hath lorde brought passe sayntes shulde tell wōderous workes allmightie lorde hath stablyshed thinges endure glory seketh grounde depe hert knoweth ymaginacion wyszdome ye lorde knoweth scyence loketh ye token time declareth thinges yt past come iob 24 esa 29 c discloseth thinges secrete thought maye escape nether maye eny worde hyd hath garnyshed hye excellent workes wyszdome frō euerlastinge euerlastinge vnto maye nothinge added nether mynished hath nede also eny councell amiable workes sparke loke vpon lyue endure euer whan euer nede obedient vnto dubble one agaynst another hath made nothinge hath faute blemysh deut 3 • hath stablyshed goodes euerychone maye satisfied glory whan seith xliii chapter glory heyth fayre cleare firmament • sal 8 bewtye heauen glorious clearnes sonne whan appeareth declareth daye ye goinge maruelous worke hyest noone burneth ye earth maye abyde heate therof kepeth ouen whan hote thre tymes doth sonne burne vpon ye mountaynes whan bretheth fyrie beames shyneth brightnes blyndeth eye greate lorde made commaundement causeth renne haistely gen 1 b moone also conuenient season sheweth tymes token tyme token solempne feast taken moone • xo 12 light mynisheth increaseth againe moneth called moone groweth wonderously hir chaunginge armye heauen also heith firmament heauen geueth cleare glorious shyne clearnes starres bewtifull apparell heauen apparell lorde lighteneth heyth holy worke continue ordre one fayleth watch gen 9 b loke vpon ye rayne bowe prayse made bewtifull shyne compaseth heauen aboute clearnes glory handes hyest haue bēded thorow commaundement maketh snowe fall thonder iudgment smyte hastely thorow commaundement treasure opened cloudes fle foules power hath strengthened cloudes brokē hayle stone mountaynes melt ye sight wynde bloweth accordinge wyll sounde thonder beateth ye earth doth storme north whirle wynde also lighteth downe fethered foule casteth spredeth snow abrode greshoppers destroye falleth downe eie marueleth ye bewtye whytenesse therof hert afraied raine poureth frost vpon earth like salt whan frosen sharpe prycke thistle whan colde northwynde bloweth harde christall commeth water lighteth downe vpon gatheringes together water putteth ye water brest plate deuoureth mountaynes burneth wyldernesses loke grene putteth like fyre medycine whan cloude commeth hastely whan dew commeth vpon heate shalbe refreszshed agayne worde stylleth wynde councell setteth depe lorde iesus planted sayle ouer see tell parels harmes whan heare oure eares maruell therat straūge wonderous workes dyuerse maner nyce beestes whall fish thorow thinges set good ordre perfourmed worde thinges endure speake moch sufficiently attayne vnto onely perfeccion wordes shulde prayse lorde power greate workes psa • • lorde feared yee greate maruelous power prayse lorde magnifie moch ye maye yet doth farre farre exceade prayse 〈…〉 magnifie wt youre power laboure earnestly yet ye wyse able sufficiently prayse hath sene 〈…〉 might tell v magnifie greatly hyd yet greater thinges thē v haue sene workes lorde hath made thinges geuen wyszdome soch feare god xliiii chapter commendacion olde vertuous father let v commende noble famous men generacion oure foreelders father many glorious actes hath lorde done shewed greate power euer sen ye begynnynge noble famous men raigned kyngdomes bare excellent rule wyszdome vnderstondinge folowed councell shewed prophecy 〈…〉 led folke thorow councell wyszdome scrybes people wyse sentence founde instruccion sought swetenes melody musick brought forth pleasaunt songes scripture riche also coude comforte pacifie dwelt noble honorable men generacions well reported tymes haue left name behynde prayse shal allwaye spokē afterwarde whose remembraunce gone 〈…〉 came naught perished though neuer bene became though neuer bene borne yee child also neuertheles louynge men whose righteousnes shal neuer forgotten contynue posterite child holy good heretage sede endured fast ye couenaunt sake shal childrē sede contynue euer prayse shal neuer put downe body buried peace name lyueth euermore people speake wyszdome forth right soone good wyll pacifie wrath lorde towarde israel therfore couenaūt peace made yt shulde principall amonge righteous people posterite shulde haue office presthode euer like made euer xlvi chapter manly stronge battaill iesus ye sonne naue 〈…〉 steade moses ye prophet geuen captayne people acordinge vnto name greate sauioure vnto electe god punysh enemy rose vp agaynst israel yt israel might optayne inheritaunce greate noble excellent 〈…〉 whan lift vp hande drew swerde agaynst city stode manly lorde brought enemy 〈…〉 stode sonne styll commaundemēt one daye longe two called vpon hyest mightie whā ye enemy preassed vpon euery syde lorde herde hayle stone smote ye heithenish people mightely fallinge downe slew ye aduersaries heithē knewe hoost defence lor fought folowed vpon mightie men tyme moses also caleb sonne iephune dyd good worke 〈…〉 stode agaynst enemy withelde people synne stylled ye wicked murmurynge sixe hundreth thousande people fote two preserued thinge obedient vnto lorde iudges ruler euery one name whose hert wente whoringe ner departed ye lorde forsake lorde vnfaithfully whose remembraūce hath good reporte yee bone florish place name shal faithfulnes faithfulnes vision knowne called vpon ye lorde mightie 〈…〉 whā enemy preassed vpon euery syde tyme offred suckynge lambes lorde thondred heauen mayde voyce herde wt greate noyse remembraunce shalbe swete hony mouthes playenge musick wyne appoynted turne people agayne take awaye abhominacions ye vngodly directed hert vnto lorde tyme vngodly set vp worshipe god agayne kynges therof laye desolate waist intreated ieremy euell neuertheles prophet ordeyned mother wombe might rote breake destroye 〈…〉 might buylde vp plante agayne ezechiel sawe glory lorde vision shewed vpon people adam aboue beastes whā created l chapter symon sonne onias hye prest 〈…〉 life set vp house agayne dayes made fast tēple heyth ye temple also founded dubble buyldinge hye walles temple dayes welles water flowed exceadinge full see toke care people delyuered destruccion kepte cite made stronge shulde beseged dwelt honoure worshipe amonge people enlarged intraunce house courte geueth light mornynge starre myddest cloudes ye moone whan full shyneth sonne temple god bright ye rayne bowe ye fayre cloudes florisheth floures rose sprynge ye yeare lily ryuers water like braunches vpon mount libanus tyme sommer fyre incē se kyndled like whole ornament pure golde set maner precious stone olyue tre frutefull cypre tre groweth vp hye whan put garment honoure clothed withall bewtye whan wente holy altare garnysh couerynge sanctuary whan toke ye porcions prestes hande stode herth altare brother rounde aboute ordre braunches cedre tre vpon mount libanus stode rounde aboute braunches olyue tre stode ye sonnes aaron glory yt might sufficiently perfourme seruyce vpon altare garnysh offrynge hyest god stretched hande toke drynk offerynge poured wyne poured vpon botome aulter good smell vnto hyest prynce beganne ye sonnes aaron synge blowe trompettes make greate noyse remembraūce prayse vnto lorde people afrayed fell downe earth vpō face worshipe lorde god geue thankes allmightie god sunge goodly also voyces pleasaunt noyse ye greate house lorde people prayer besought lorde hyest wolde mercyfull tyll honoure ye lorde perfourmed thus ended mynistracion seruyce wente downe stretched handes ouer whole multitude people israel shulde geue praise thankes lippes vnto ye lorde reioyse name beganne yet also praye might openly shew thankesgeuynge hyest namely thus geue prayse thankes ye vnto lorde oure god hath euer done noble greate thinges hath increased oure dayes mother wombe dealt v acordinge mercy wyl geue v ioyfulnes hert peace oure tymes israel faithfully kepeth mercy v euermore allwaye delyuereth v due season two maner people abhorre fro hert thirde hate people syt vpon mountayne samaria philistynes foolish people dwell sichimis iesus sonne sirac eleazarus ierusalem haue tokened vp informacions documētes wyszdome vnderstādinge boke poured wyszdome hert blessed exerciseth self therin taketh soch hert shal wyse yf thinges shal stronge light lorde ledeth li chapter prayer iesus sonne sirac thanke lorde kynge praise god sauioure wil yelde prayse vnto ye name thou art defender helper hast preserued body destruccion ye snare traytorous tōges lippes occupied leyes thou hast bene helper soch stode vp agaynst hast delyuered multitude thy mercy thy holy name sake thou hast delyuered roaringe prepared selues deuoure ye handes soch sought life multitude yt troubled wente aboute set fyre vpon euery syde yt brent myddest fyre depe hell vncleane tōge lyenge wordes wicked kynge vnrighteous tonge soule shal prayse ye lorde vnto death life drew nye vnto hell cōpased rounde aboute euery syde mā helpe loked aboute yf eny man wolde socoure none thought vpon thy mercy lorde vpon thy actes thou hast done euer olde namely yt thou delyuerest soch putt trust ryddest ye handes heithen thus lift vp prayer earth prayed delyueraunce death called vpon lorde father wolde leaue wt helpe daye trouble tyme proude praysed thy name contynually yeldinge honoure thākes vnto prayer herde thou sauedest destruccion delyueredest frō ye vnrighteous tyme therfore wil aknowlege praise magnifie ye name lorde whā yet yonge euer wē te astraye desyred wyszdome openly prayer came therfore temple sought vnto last florished vnto grape soone rype hert reioysed wente fote right waye yee youth vp sought bowed downe myne eare receaued founde moch wyszdome prospered greatly therfore wyll iascrybe glory vnto geueth wyszdome aduysed therafter gelous cleue vnto thinge yt good shal cōfounded soule hath wrestled haue bene diligent occupied lift vp myne handes hye soule lightened thorow wiszdome knowleged foolishnes ordred soule one hert begynninge founde clennesse therfore shal forsaken hert longed gat good treasure thorow ye lorde hath geuen new tonge wherwith wil praise come vnto ye vnlerned dwell ye house wyszdome withdrawe youre selues talke comon thinges youre soules thirstie opened mouth esa 35 spake come bye wyszdome without money bowe downe youre neck vnder hir yock youre soule shall receaue wyszdome harde hande content founde beholde youre eye eccli 6 c haue litle laboure yet haue founde moch rest receaue wyszdome ye shall haue plenteousnes syluer golde possession let youre mynde reioyse mercy ashamed prayse wyrke worke tymes shal geue youre rewarde due tyme ende ecclesiasticus wyse called iesus sonne syrac prayer azarias songe ye thre child theodotios translacion wordes wryten ye thirde chapter daniel olde text latyn walked myddest flamme praysynge god magnifienge ye lorde asarias stode vp prayde maner euen myddest fyre opened mouth saide blessed thou lorde god father right worthy praysed honoured yt name thine euermore thou art righteous ye thinges yt thou hast done v yee faithfull ye workes ye wayes right ye iudgmētes true ye thinges yt thou hast brought vpon v vpon holy cite father euen ierusalem thou hast executed true iudgment yee acordinge right equyte hast thou brought thinges vpō v oure synnes haue offended done wickedly departynge thinges haue trespaced 〈…〉 obeyed thy cōmaundementes ner kepte thē nether done thou hast bydden v yt might prospere wherfore yt thou hast brought vpon v 〈…〉 euery thinge yt thou hast done v thou hast done true iudgment delyueringe v hondes oure enemy amōge vngodly wicked abhominacions vnrighteous kinge yee ye frowarde vpō earth maye opē mouthes become shame reprofe vnto ye seruauntes thē yt worshipe yet thy name sake beseke geue v vp euer breake thy couenaunt take awaye thy mercy v thy beloued abraham sake thy seruaunt isaac sake thy holy israel sake thou hast spoken promysed yt thou woldest multiply sede ye starres heauen londe yt lieth vpon ye se • shore lorde become lesse thē eny people kepte vnder daye worlde oure synnes ther haue nether prynce duke prophet burnt offerynge sacrifice oblaciō incēse ••• sanctuary neuerthelesse contrite herte humble sprete let v receaued yt maie opteyne thy mercy like burnt offerynge rammes bullockes like thousandes fat lambes let offrynge thy sight daye 〈…〉 yt maye please ye cōfucion vnto yt put trust folowe herte feare seke thy face put v shame deale wt v thy louynge kyndnesse acordinge multitude thy mercy delyuer v thy miracle lorde get thy name honoure thy seruauntes euell maye confoūded let ashamed thorow thy allmightie power let strength broken maye knowe thou art lorde god honor worthy thorow worlde kynges seruātes yt put ceassed make ouen hote wylde fyre drye strawe pitch fagottes flamme wente ouen vpon xlix cubites yee toke awaye brent vp caldees yt gat holde vpon besyde ouen angel lorde came downe ouen asarias felowes smote ye flamme fyre ouen made myddest ouen bene coole wynde blowinge fyre nether touched greued ner dyd hurte thre ye lorde kynde harted mercy endureth euer ye deuoute men speake good lorde euen god goddes prayse geue thankes mercy endureth worlde without ende story susanna xiii chapter daniel latyn dwelt man babilō called ioachim yt toke wife whose name susanna ye doughter helchias fayre woman soch one feared god hir father hir mother also godly people taught doughter acordinge ye lawe moses ioachim hir huszbonde greate rich man fa • orcharde ioyninge vnto house resorted iewes comonly man reputacion amonge yeare made two iudges soch lorde speaketh wickednesse babilon cōmeth ye elder yt ye iudges seme rule people came offt ioachims house soch eny thinge lawe came thither vnto people came agayne noone susanna wente hir huszbō de orcharde walke elder seynge went daylie walked burned lust yee allmost wittes cast downe eye shulde se heauē ner remembre yt god righteous iudge woūded wt loue nether durst one shewe another grefe shame durst tell inordynate lust yt wolde fayne haue wt yet layed wayte earnestly daye daye might leest haue sight one sayde ye vp let v go home dyner tyme wente waye returned agayne came together enqueringe ye matter betwixte selues yee one tolde ye wicked lust thē apoynted tyme whē might take susanna alone happened also yt spyed conueniēt tyme wente forth walke hir maner body two maydēs 〈…〉 thought wash self garden hote season one person excepte two elder yt hyd selues beholde sayde hir maydens go set oyle sope shut orcharde dore yt maye wash dyd bad shut orcharde dore wente selues backe dore fet thinge yt cōmaunded susanna knewe yt ye elder laie hyd within maydens gone forth ye two elder gat vp ranne vpon sayenge orcharde dores shut man se v haue lust vnto therfore consent vnto v lye v yf thou wilt shall bringe testimoniall agaynst yonge felowe thou hast sent awaye thy maydens cause susanna sighed sayde ala trouble euery syde though folowe youre mynde wyll death yf consent vnto escape youre hondes wel better fall youre hondes without dede doinge synne sight lorde cried loude voyce elder also cried agaynst ranne one orcharde dore smote open seruauntes house herde ye crie ye orcharde ruszshed backe dore se matter elder tolde seruauntes greatly ashamed neuer soch reporte made susanna morow came people ioachim hir houszbonde ye two elder came also full myscheuous ymaginacions agaynst susanna bringe vnto death spake thus people sende susanna ye daughter helchias ioachims wife immediatly sent came wt father mother hir child kynrede susanna tender person maruelous fayre face therfore wicked men cōmaunded take clothes face couered yt leest might satisfied hir beutie hir frēdes yee yt knewe begāne wepe two elder stode vp myddest people 〈…〉 layed hondes vpon ye heade susanna wepte loked vp towarde heauen hir herte sure trust lorde elder sayde walkinge orcharde alone woman came wt hir two maydēs sent awaye sparred ye orcharde dores yonge felowe hyd came vnto laye wt v stode corner orcharde whē sawe wickednes rāne perceaued yt medled together coude holde stronger thus opened ye dore gat awaye whē takē womā axed yōge felow wolde tell v ye matter witness ye comon sorte beleued yt elder iudges people condemned death susanna cried wt loude voyce sayde euerlastinge god 〈…〉 thou sercher secretes thou yt knowest thinges fore come passe thou wotest yt haue borne false wytnes agaynst beholde must dye neuer dyd eny soch thinges men haue maliciously inuented agaynst ye lorde herde hir voyce whē led forth death ye lorde raised vp ye sprete yōge childe whose name daniel 〈…〉 cried wt loude voice clene frō bloude thē ye people turned thē towarde saide meane wordes yt thou hast spokē ▪ daniel stode ye myddest thē sayde ye soch fooles ye childrē israel yt ye cā discerne ye haue condēned daughter israel vnto death knowe trueth wherfore go syt iudgment agayne haue spoken false witnesse agaynst wherfore people turned agayne haist elder principall heades sayde vnto come sit downe amonge v shewe v matter seynge god hath geuen greate honoure elder daniel sayde vnto them3 reg 3 put two asyde one another shal heare put sunder one another called one sayd vnto thou olde canckerde carle hast vsed thy wickednesse longe thine vngracious dedes thou hast done afore come light thou hast geuen false iudgmentes thou hast oppressed innocent letten giltie go fre yet lorde saieth exo 23 pro 17 c innocent righteous se thou slaye wel yf thou hast sene tel vnder tre sawest thou talkynge together answered vnder molbery tre daniel sayde wel thou leist euen vpon thine heade lo messaunger lorde hath receaued sentence cut ye two put asyde called sayde vnto thou sede canaan iuda fayrnesse hath disceaued lust hath subuerted thine herte thus dealte ye afore daughter israel feare consented vnto daughter iuda wolde abyde youre wickednesse tell vnder tre didest thou take speakinge together answered vnder pomgranate tre sayde daniel vnto wel thou leyst also euen vpō thine heade messaunger lorde stondeth waytinge swerde cut two slaye whole multitude gaue greate shoute praysed god allwaye delyuereth yt put trust came vpon two elder psal 1 • daniel conuicte owne mouth geuen false witnesse dealte deu 19 prou 19 euen likewyse wolde haue done neghbouresse yee dyd acordinge lawe moses put death thus innocent bloude saued daye thē helchias wife praysed god daughter susanna ioachim hir huszbonde ye kinrede dishoneste founde daye forth daniel greate reputaciō sight ye people ende story susanna story bel xiiij chapter daniel latin babilon ymage called bel spent vpon euery daye xij cake xl shepe sixe greate pottes wine dyd kynge worshipe wente daylie honor daniel worshiped owne god kynge sayde vnto dost thou worshipe bel deut 4 c 5 exo 20 deut 6 matt 4 answered sayde maye worshipe thinges made wt hondes lyuynge god made heauen earth hath power vpon flesh kynge sayde vnto thinkest thou yt bel lyuynge god seist thou moch eateth drynketh euery daye daniel smyled sayde kynge disceaue thyselfe made claye within metall without nether eateth euer eny thinge eccle 30 e kynge wroth called prestes sayde vnto yf ye tell eateth vp expense ye shal dye yf ye certifie bel eateth daniel shall dye leu 24 c hath spoken blasphemy agaynst bel daniel sayde vnto kynge let acordinge thou hast sayde prestes bel lxx besyde wyues child kynge wente daniel temple bel bel prestes sayde lo wil go set thou ye meate kynge poure wyne shutt dore fast seale thine owne signet tomorow thou commest yf thou fyndest bel hath eaten vp wil suffre death el daniel hath lyed vpon v prestes thought selues sure ynough vnder ye altare made preuy intraunce wente euer ate vp gone forth kynge set meates bel daniel cōmaunded seruauntes bringe aszshes siffted thorow temple kynge might se wente sparre dore sealinge ye kynges signet departed ye night came prestes wyues child wonte ate dronke vp mornynge tymes breake daye kynge arose daniel kynge sayde daniel seales whole yet answered yee kynge whole soone opened dore kinge loked vnto ye altare cried loude voyce great • art thou bel disceate laughed daniel helde kynge shulde go sayde beholde pauement marcke well whose fotesteppes kynge sayde se fotesteppes men woman child therfore kynge angrie toke prestes wyues childrē shewed ye preuy dores came ate vp soch thinges vpon ye altare 〈…〉 cause ye kynge slewe delyuered bel daniel power destroyed temple place greate dragon babilon worshipped ye kynge sayde vnto daniel sayest thou yt god metall also lo liueth eateth drinketh yt thou cāst saye lyuinge god therfore worshipe daniel sayde vnto ye kinge wil worshipe lorde god 〈…〉 ye truelyuynge god god life geue leaue kynge shal destroye dragon without swearde staff kynge sayde geue ye leaue daniel toke pitch fatte hairie woll seyth together made lompes therof put ye dragōs mouth ye dragon barst sonder daniel sayde lo ye worshipped babylon herde toke greate indignacion gathered together agaynst kynge sayenge kynge become iewe also hath destroyed bel hath slayne ye dragon put prestes death came ye kynge sayde let u haue daniel el w • l destroye thine house whan ye kynge sawe russhed sore vpon necessite constrained 〈…〉 deliuered daniel vnto cast lyon denne sixe dayes denne seuen lyon geuen euery daye two body two shepe geuē might deuoure daniel iewry prophet called abacuc made potage broker bred depe platter goinge felde brynge ye mower angell lorde sayde vnto abacuc go cary meate thou hast babilon vnto daniel ye lyōs denne abacuc sayde lorde neuer sawe babilon denne knowe 〈…〉 angel lorde toke toppe bare hayre heade thorow mightie wynde set babilon vpon denne abacuc cried sayenge daniel thou seruaunt god 〈…〉 haue take breakfast yt god hath sent ye daniel saide god hast thou thought vpon wel thou neuer faylest loue daniel arose ate angel lorde set abacuc owne place agayne immediatly vpon seuenth daye kynge wente bewepe daniel whan came denne loked beholde daniel sat myddest lyon cried ye kynge loude voyce sayenge greate art thou 〈…〉 lorde god daniel drewe denne ye cause destrucciō 〈…〉 dyd cast thē denne deuoured moment face wrote kynge vnto people kynreddes tunges dwelt countrees sayenge peace multiplied commaundement dominyon realme men feare stonde awe daniel god 〈…〉 lyuynge god endureth euer kyngdome abydeth vncorrupte luc 1 c esa 43 b ose 13 b dan 3 f power euerlastinge delyuer saue doth wonder maruelous workes heauen earth hath saued daniel power lyon ende storye bel first boke machabees boke conteyneth chap power alexander kynge macedonia certayne vnfaithfull israelite greate tyranny antiochus miserably destroyeth ierusalē god suffreth plaged haue forsaken chap ii feruently matathias sonnes stryue honoure god welfare people swetely exorteth sonnes euē houre death sted fast lawe god chap iii iudas machabeus worthy captayne noble actes agaynst antiochus chap iiiiv glorious victory god gaue iudas gorgias lisias wynne cite clense temple agayne fyght afterwarde heithen chap vi antiochus besegeth elymas persia iudas layeth sege castelar ierusalem kynge goeth aboute helpe thē therin chap vii tyranny demetrius take truce people god kepe chap viii iudas hearinge reasonable romaynes seketh make peace chap ix iudas slaine bataill came vp derth death ionathas captayne gatt victory bachides chap x alexāder sonne antiochus demetrius maketh peace ionathas doth alexander afterwarde ptolomy geueth doughter cleopatra vnto alexāder demetrius defyeth ionathas chap xi ptolomy ryseth agaynst alexander ionathas promyseth geue demetrius daughter geuen allredy vnto alexander death alexander ptolomy▪ raigne demetrius demetrius ionathas frendes alexander sonne taketh kyngdome vpon chap xii iewes wryte vnto romaynes sparcians renue olde frendshipe triphon receaueth ionathas fayre wordes causeth slayne chap xiii death ionathas symon brother made captaine people goeth forth agaynst triphon burieth brother triphon slayeth antiochus haynously symon maketh peace demetrius layeth sege gaza chap xiiii demetrius seketh helpe triphō demetrius takē peace iewry simō ruleth well romaine sparta renue peace symon chap xv antiochus wryteth louyngly vnto iewes persecuteth triphon breaketh bonde iewes chap xvi faithfulnes symō sonnes ptolomy szlayeth disceatfully betrayeth londe first chapter alexander sonne philippe kynge macedonia wente forth londe cethim slewe darius kynge persiās meedes happened toke greate warres honde wanne many stronge city slew many kinges ye earth goinge thorow ye endes worlde gettinge many spoyles people moch yt worlde stode greate awe therfore proude herte • udit 1 b whē gathered mightie strōge hoost subdued ye lōdes people prynces became tributary vnto hī fell sick whē perceaued must nedes die called noble estate bene brought vp child parted kyngdome amonge • 7 • nd 8 b whyle yet alyue alexāder raygned xij yeare dyed death fell kyngdome vnto prynces optayned euery one rowme caused selues crowned kynges dyd childrē many yeares moch wickednesse increaced worlde came yt vngracious rote noble antiochus ye sonne antiochus kynge bene pledge rome raigned ye cxxxvij yeare raigne grekes • mac 8 dayes wēte israel wicked men moued moch people wt coūcel deut 7 • udic 2 sayēge let v go make couenaunt heithen yt rounde aboute v sence departed haue moch sorow • ere 44 c deuyce pleased well certayne ye people toke vpon thē go vnto ye kynge gaue licence ordinaūce heithen 〈…〉 set vp open scole ierusalem lawes heithē nomore circumcised forsoke ye holy testamente ioyned selues ye heithē cleane solde myschefe 〈…〉 antiochus beganne mightie kyngdome wente aboute optayne ye londe egipte also might haue dominion two realmes vpon entred egipte stronge hoost charettes elephantes 〈…〉 horsmen greate nombre shippes beganne warre agaynst ptolomy kynge egipte ptolomy afrayed fled many people wounded death thus antiochus wāne many strō ge city toke awaye great good londe egipte antiochus smytten egipte turned agayne cxliij yeare wente towarde israel 〈…〉 came vp ierusalem mightie people entred proudly ye sanctuary toke awaye golden altare candilsticke ye ornamētes therof table shewbred pouringe vessel charger golden spones vale crownes golden apparel temple brake downe toke also syluer golde precious iewels secrete treasure foū de taken awaye alltogether caused greate murthur men fulfilled malicious pryde departed owne londe thus arose greate heuinesse misery londe israel prynces elder people mourned yō ge men maydens defyled fayre beutye woman chaunged brydegrome bryde toke mournynge londe dwelt therin moued house iacob brought confucion two yeares kynge sent chefe treasurer vnto city iuda 〈◊〉 5 c came ierusalem greate multitude people speakīge peaceable wordes vnto thē disceate geuen credence fell sodēly vpon cite smote sore destroyed moch people israel 〈…〉 spoyled cite set fyre castinge downe house walles euery syde 〈…〉 woman child toke captiue led awaye catell buylded castel dauid greate thicke wall mightie towres made stronge holde besyde sett wicked people vngodly men kepe stoared weapens vytales gathered goodes ierusalem layed thē vp thus became theuysh castell done laye waite people wente sanctuary cruell destruccion israel thus shed innocent bloude euery syde ye sanctuary defyled moch citesyns fayne departe cite became habitacion straungers beynge desolate hir owne sede hir owne natyues fayne leaue hir sāctuary clene waisted hir holy dayes turned mournynge 〈…〉 hir sabbathes derision hir honor brought naught loke greate hir glory afore greate hir confucion hir ioye turned sorow antiochus also kynge sent commission vnto kyngdome 〈…〉 people shulde one left euery man lawe heithen agreed cōmaundement kynge antiochus yee many israelite consented vnto offerynge vnto idol defylinge sabbath kynge antiochus sent messaungers commission vnto ierusalem ye city iuda shulde folowe ye lawes heithē bad ether burnt offerynge meat offerynge peace offerynge made temple god shulde sabbath ner hye feast daye kepte commaunded sanctuary holy people israel shulde defyled commaunded also shulde set vp altares temple idol offre vp swynes flesh vnclene beastes men shulde leaue child vncircumcised defyle soules maner vnclennesse abhominacions might forget lawe chaūge holy ordinaunces god euer wolde acordynge commaundement kynge antiochus shulde suffre death like maner commaunded thorow realme sett ruler ouer people compell thynges commaundinge city iuda sacrifice vnto idol wente people vnto heithen heapes forsoke lawe lorde committed moch euell londe yee chaced secrete israelite hyd selues corner preuy place xv daye moneth casleu cxlv yeare set kynge antiochus abhominable idol desolacion vpon altare god buylded altares thorow city iuda euery syde dores house stretes brent incense dyd sacrifyce bokes lawe god iere 36 c brent fyre rente peces euer boke testament lorde founde hym yee euer endeuored kepe lawe lorde kynges commaundement yt shulde put death thorow anctorite executed thinges euery moneth vpon people israel founde city fyue twentye daye moneth2 • b tyme dyd sacrifice vpon altare stode steade altare lorde acordinge commaundement kynge antiochus put certayne woman death caused child circumcised hanged vp child neckes thorow house slewe circumcisers yet many people israel determed selues wolde eate vncleane thinges chose rather suffre death defyled vncleane meates wolde breake blessed lawe god cruelly slayne greate tyranny increased sore vpon people israel ii chapter dayes dyd stōde vp one matathias sonne symeon prest kynred ioaris frō ie ierusalem dwelt vpon mount modin v sonnes ihō called gaddi symon called thasi iudas wyse called machabeus eleazer wyse called abaron ionathas whose surname apphus sawe euell yt done amonge people iuda ierusalem matathias sayde wo ala euer borne se misery people ye piteous destrucciō holy cite thus syt styll beynge delyuered hondes enemy hir sanctuary come power straungers1 mac 1 b hir temple man yt hath lost good name hir precious ornamentes caried awaye captyue hir olde men slayne stretes hir yonge men fallen thorow swearde enemy people hath possession hir kyngdome hath gotten hir spoyles hir glory taken awaye quene become handmayde beholde oure sanctuary oure bewtye honoure waisted awaye defyled gentile helpeth v lyue matathias rente clothes sonnes put sack cloth vpon mourned sore came men thither sent kynge antiochus compell soch fled cite modin sacrifice burne incense vnto idol forsake lawe god many people israel consented enclyned vnto matathias sonnes remayned stedfast spake commissioner kynge antiochus sayde vnto matathias thou art noble man hye reputacion greate cite hauinge fayre child brother come thou therfore first fulfill kynges commaundemēt like heithen haue done yee ye men iuda soch remayne ierusalem shalt thou thy child ye kynges fauoure enriched golde syluer greate rewardes matathias answered spake loude voyce though nacions obeye kynge antiochus fall awaie euery man frō kepynge ye lawe father though consente commaundementes yet wil sonnes brother fall lawe oure father god forbyd shulde good v shulde forsake lawe ordinaunces god agre vnto commaundement kynge antiochus therfore soch sacrifice nether breake statute lawe go another waye 〈…〉 whē spoken wordes came one iewes openly sight dyd sacrifice vnto idol vpon aulter cite modin acordinge kynges commaundement matathias sawe greued herte raynes sho • e withall wrath kindled zele lawe gaue szkippe forth kylled iew besyde aulter yee slewe ye kynges commissioner cōpelled sacrifice destroyed aulter time soch zele vnto lawe god 〈…〉 like phinees dyd vnto zambri sonne salomi matathias cried loude voyce thorow ye cite sayenge feruent lawe wil kepe ye couenaunt let folowe sonnes fled mountaynes left euer ye cite 〈…〉 many godly men also departed wyldernesse child wyues catell remayned tyranny increaced sore vpon kynges seruauntes hoost ierusalem cite dauid herde certayne mē broken kynges commaundement gone waye wyldernesse secrete place many departed folowed vpon fight agaynst sabbath daye sayde wyll ye yet rebell get hence commaundement kynge antiochus ye shall lyue answered wil go forth nether wil kinges cōmaundement defyle ye sabbath daye 〈…〉 beganne fight agaynst neuerthelesse gaue none answere nether cast one stone ner made fast preuy place sayde wil dye oure innocency heauen earth shal testifie v ye put v death wrongeously thus fought agaynst vpon sabbath slewe men catell wyues child nombre thousande people matathias frendes herde mourned right sore sayde one another yf oure brethrē haue done fight oure lyues oure lawes agaynst heithen shall sooner rote v earth cōcluded amonge thē selues tyme sayenge euer cōmeth make battayll wt v vpon sabbath daye wyll fight agaynst dye brother yt murthured haynously vpō came synagoge iewes vnto thē stronge men israel soch feruent lawe fled persecucion came helpe stonde moch gathered hoost men slewe wicked doer gelousy vngodly men wrath wicked fled vnto heithen escaped thus matathias frendes wente aboute destroyed aulters circumcided child yet receaued circumcision many founde within ye coostes israel folowed mightely vpon child pryde acte prospered hondes moch kepte lawe agaynst power gentile kynges gaue ouer dominion vnto wicked doer tyme drew fast matathias shulde dye sayde vnto sonnes pryde persecucion increased tyme destruccion wrathfull displeasure wherfore sonnes ye feruent lawe ioperde youre lyues testament father call remembraunce actes oure father dyd tyme shall ye receaue greate honoure euerlastinge name 〈◊〉 • e 〈◊〉 11 〈◊〉 4 〈◊〉 •• 〈◊〉 44 c 〈◊〉 41 f 〈◊〉 21 c 〈◊〉 4 • f remembre abraham founde faithfull tentacion reckened vnto righteousnesse ioseph tyme trouble kepte commaundement made lorde egipte phinees oure father feruent honoure god optayned couenaūt euerlastinge presthode 〈◊〉 • 7 〈◊〉 1▪ iosue fulfillinge worde god made captayne israel 〈◊〉 14 caleb bare recorde cōgregacion receaued heretage 〈◊〉 24 c dauid also mercifull kyndnesse optayned trone euerlastinge kyngdome 〈…〉 elia beynge gelous feruent lawe taken vp heauē hananias asarias misael remayned stedfast faith 〈…〉 delyuered fyre like maner daniel beynge vngiltie 〈…〉 saued mouth lyon thus ye maye considre thorow age sen worlde beganne heb 11 b euer put trust god ouer come mat 10 • esa 51 c 40 • 1 pet 1 iacob 1 • eccll 14 • psal 26 30 feare ye wordes vngodly man glory donge wormes daye set vp morow gone turned earth memoriall come naught wherfore sonnes take good hertes vnto quyte youre selues like men lawe yf ye thinges commaunded lawe lorde youre god ye shal optaine greate honoure therin beholde knowe youre brother symon man wyszdome se ye geue eare vnto allwaye shall father vnto iudas machabeus hath euer bene mightie strōge youth vp let youre captayne ordre battayll ye people thus shall ye brynge vnto fauoure lawe se ye auenge wronge youre people recompence heithen agayne applie youre selues whole commaundement lawe gaue blessinge layed father dyed cxlvj yeare modin sonnes buried father sepulcre israel made greate lamentacion iii chapter stode vp iudas machabeus father steade iosephus cap 89 • 12 antiq brethrē helped dyd helde father fought cherefulnesse israel iudas gat people greate honoure put brest plate giaunte arayed self harnesse defended hoost swearde actes like lyon lyon whelpe roaringe praye enemie wicked psal 100 • 2 mac 8 • hūted brent vp vexed people enemy fled feare worker vngodlynes put trouble soch lucke prosperite honde greued dyuerse kynges iacob greatly reioysed thorow actes gat self greate name euer wente thorow city iuda destroyenge vngodly turnynge awaye wrath israel receauynge soch oppressed fame wente vnto vttemost parte ye earth appollonius prynce syria gathered mightie greate hoost heithen samaria fight agaynst israel iudas perceaued wente forth mete fought slewe greate multitude remnaunte fled toke substaunce iudas also toke appollonius owne swearde fought wt life longe seron another prynce siria herde saye iudas gathered vnto congregacion church faithfull sayde get name prayse thorow realme go fight iudas many haue despised kynges commaundement made ready wente greate mightie hoost vngodly stonde auenged childrē israel came nye vnto bethoron iudas wente forth agaynst small company people sawe soch greate hoost thē sayde vnto iudas able beynge fewe fight agaynst greate multitude stronge seinge weery haue fasted daye 14 iudas sayde small matter many ouercome fewe yee difference god heauen delyuer greate multitude small company par 25 b victory battell stondeth multitude hoost strength commeth heauen beholde come agaynst v presumptuous proude multitude destroye v oure wyues oure child robbe v fight oure lyues oure lawes lorde shall destroye thē oure face therfore ye afrayed soone spoken wordes leapte sodenly vpon thē thus seron smytten hoost put flight▪ iudas folowed vpon beyonde bethoron vnto playne felde slayne eight hundreth men residue fled londe philistynes heithen euery syde afrayed iudas brother yt rumoure came vnto kynges eares gentile coude tell warres iudas whan kynge antiochus herde tidinges angrie mynde wherfore sente forth gathered hoost whole realme stronge army opened treasury gaue hoost yeares wagies honde commaundynge ready tymes neuerthelesse sawe moneye ynough treasury thorow discorde persecucion made ye londe put downe ye lawes bene olde tyme customes tribute londe niszshed feared able beare costes charge eny lenger ner haue soch giftes geue liberally dyd fore kynges wherfore heuy mynde thought go persides 〈…〉 take tribute ye londe gather moch moneye left lysias noble man kynges bloude ouersee kynges busyness water euphrates vnto border egipte kepe well sonne antiochus till came agayne morouer gaue half hoost elephantes committed vnto euery thinge mynde concernynge dwelt iuda ierusalem shulde sende army agaynst destroye rote power israel remnaunt ierusalem put memoriall place set straungers inhabit quarter parte londe amōge 〈…〉 thus kynge toke parte hoost departed antioch cite realme ouer water euphrates hundreth xlvij yeare wente thorow hye countrees lysias chose vnto ptolomy sonne doriminus 〈…〉 nycanor gorgias mightie men kynges frendes sent xl thousande fote men vij thousande horsmen go ye londe iuda destroye kynge commaunded wente forth power came emmaus playne felde marchaūtes herde rumoure seruauntes toke moch siluer golde bye child israel bonde men came vnto also yet moo men warre euery syde syria palestynes iudas brethrē sawe trouble increased hoost drew nye vnto border consideringe ye kynges wordes commaunded vnto people namely shulde vtterly waist destroye sayde one another let v redresse decaye oure people let v fight oure folke oure sanctuary congregacion soone ready gathered fight praie make supplicacion vnto god mercy grace •• ac 3 ierusalem laye voyde bene wyldernesse wente man sanctuary troden downe aleauntes kepte castell habitacion heithen myrth iacob taken awaye pype harpe gone amonge israelite gathered together came maspha ierusalem maspha place prayed aforetyme 〈◊〉 7 b fasted daye put sack clothes vpō cast aszshes vpon heades rente clothes layde forth bokes lawe wherout ye heithen sought licknesse ymages brought prestes ornamentes firstlinges tythes set also absteyners fulfilled dayes god 〈◊〉 6 cried loude voyce towarde heauen sayenge shal whither shall cary awaye thy sanctuary troden downe defyled thy prestes come heuynesse dishonoure beholde heithen come together destroye v thou knowest thīges ymagyn v maye stonde excepte thou god oure helpe blewe trompettes also aloude voyce iudas ordened captaynes ouer people 〈◊〉 1 • ouer thousandes ouer hundredes ouer fiftie ouer ren soch buylded house maried wyues planted vynyardes fearfull deu 20 iudic 7 commaunded euery man go home acordinge ye lawe hoost remoued pitched vpon south syde emmaus iudas sayde arme youre selues stronge child make ready agaynst tomorow mornynge ye maye fight people agreed together destroye v oure sanctuary better v dye battayll se oure people oure sanctuary soch miserable case neuerthelesse matt 6 • luc 11 ye heauen iiii chapter toke gorgias fyue thousande men fote iosephu ubisupr • thousande best horsmen remoued night come nye ye iewes hoost laye slaye sodenly men kepte castell cōueyers arose iudas smyte chefe pryncipall kinges hoost emmaus army yet come together meane season came gorgias night iudas tentes founde man sought moūtaynes thought bene fled awaye whē daie iudas shewed ye felde thre thousande men nether harnesse ner sweardes myndes syde sawe heithen mightie wel harnessed horsmen aboute wel experte fettes warre sayde iudas ye men feare ye multitude deu 20 afrayed violente runnynge remembre oure father delyuered reed see exo 14 • pharao threatned greate hoost euen let v also crie towarde heauen1 mac 9 • lorde shall haue mercy vpon v remembre couenaunt oure father yee destroye hoost oure face daye heithen shal knowe god delyuereth saueth israel heithen lift vp eye sawe
