commynge agaynst wente tentes battayll wt iudas blewe vp trompettes buckled together mac 8 heithen discomfited fled ouer playne felde hynmost slayne folowed vpon vnto assaremoth feldes idumea towarde azot iamnia slayne vpon thre thousande men iudas turned agayne hoost sayde vnto people gredy ye spoyles haue yet battayll fight gorgias hoost v mountaynes stonde ye fast agaynst oure enemy ouercome maye ye safely take spoyles iudas speakynge wordes apeared one parte vpon mount gorgias sawe partie fled tentes brent vp smoke might vnderstonde done perceauynge sore afrayed sawe also iudas hoost ye felde ready stryke battayll fled euerychone londe heithen iudas turned agayne spoyle tentes gat moch golde syluer precious stone purple greate rich thus wente home sunge psalme thankesgeuynge praysed god heauen • udit 13 c • sal 106 17 135 • nd 105 gracious mercy endureth euer israel greate victory daye heithen escaped came tolde lysias euery thinge happened wherfore lysias sore afrayed greued mynde israel gottē soch mysfortune wolde shulde • mac 3 c nether kynge commaunded nexte yeare folowinge gathered lysias thre score thousande chosen men fote fyue thousande horsmen fight agaynst came iewry pitched tentes bethoron iudas came agaynst ten thousande men sawe greate mightie hoost made prayer sayde blessed thou sauioure israel diddest destroye violent power giaunte • 7 g honde thy seruaunt dauid gauest hoost heithē honde ionathas sonne saul weapen bearer 〈…〉 put hoost honde ye people israel let confounded multitude horsmen make afrayed discomforth boldnes strength yt maye moued thorow destruccion cast downe thorow swearde thy louers shal knowe thy name prayse thankesgeuynge stroke batell slayne lysias hoost fyue thousande men lysias seynge discomfetynge men manlynesse iewes ready ether lyue dye like men wente vnto antioche chose men warre gathered together might come agayne iewry sayde iudas brother beholde oure enemy discomfited let v go vp clēse repayre sanctuary vpon hoost gathered together wente vp vnto mount sion 〈…〉 sawe sanctuary laied waist aulter defyled dores brent vp shrubbes growinge courtes like wod vpon mountaynes yee prestes celles broken downe rente clothes made greate lamentacion cast aszshes vpon heades fell downe flat grounde made greate noyse trompettes cried towarde heauen iudas apoynted certayne men fight castel till clensed sanctuary chose prestes yt vndefyled soch pleasure lawe god clensed sanctuary bare defyled stone vncleane place moch aulter burn offerynges vnhalowed toke aduysement might withall thought best destroye lest shulde happen eny shame heithen defyled therfore brake downe stone layed vp vpon mountayne house conuenient place till came prophet shewe shulde done toke whole stone acordinge lawe 〈◊〉 • 0 〈◊〉 27 〈◊〉 • g buylded new aulter soch one made vp sanctuary within without halowed courtes made new ornamentes brought ye candilsticke aulter incense table temple incense layed vpon aulter lighted lampes vpon candilsticke might burne temple set shewbred vpon table hanged vp vale set vp ye temple afore vpon xxv daye ix moneth called moneth casleu c xlviij yeare 〈◊〉 10 rose vp tymes mornynge sacrifice acordinge lawe vpon new burnt offrynge aulter made tyme season ye heithen defyled daye set vp agayne songes pipe harpes cymbales people fell vpon face worshippynge thankynge god heauen geuen victory kepte dedicacion aulter viij dayes 〈◊〉 7 b offerynge burntsacrifices thank offeringes gladnesse deck temple also crownes shyldes golde halowed porte celles hanged dores vpon thus greate gladnes amonge people blasphemy heithē put awaye iudas brother whole cōgregacion israel ordened tyme dedicacion ye aulter shulde kepte season yeare yeare 〈◊〉 10 c space viij dayes xxv daye moneth casleu yee wt myrth gladnesse tyme buylded vp ye mount sion hye walles stronge towres rounde aboute lest ye gentile shulde come treade downe dyd afore 〈…〉 therfore iudas set men warre kepe made stronge defende bethsura people might haue refuge agaynst edomites v chapter happened also ye heithen rounde aboute herde iosephu • cap 12 • bro 12 aulter sanctuary set vp olde estate displeased sore wherfore thought destroye generacion iacob amonge moch beganne slaye persecute certayne ye people iudas fought child esau idumea eze 25 c 35 agaynst arabathane dwelt rounde aboute ye israelite slewe spoyled greate multitude thē2 10 thought also vpon malice vnfaithfulnes child bean snare stoppe vnto ye people layed waite hie waye wherfore shut vp tower came vnto condemned brent vp towres afterwarde wente agaynst child ammon wherof founde mightie power greate multitude people tymothy captayne stroke many battayls distroyed slayne wanne gazer cite townes belonginge therto turned agayne iewry heithen also galaad gathered together agaynst israelite quarter slaye fled castel datheman sent letter vnto iudas brother sayenge heithen gathered agaynst v euery syde destroye v make thē come laye sege ye castel whervnto fled timothy captayne hoost come therfore delyuer v hondes greate multitude v slayne ready yee oure brother tubin slayne destroyed wel nye thousande men wyues child goodes haue enemy led awaye captyue whyle letter yet readinge beholde came messaūgers galilee rente clothes tolde euen tydinges sayde ptolomais tirus sidon gathered agaynst galilee fylled enemy destroye israel iudas ye people herde came together greate congregacion deuyse2 mac▪ 8 might brother trouble beseged enemy iudas sayde vnto symon brother chose ye certayne men go delyuer thy brother galilee brother ionathas wyl go galaadithim left iosephus ye sonne zachary asarias captaynes people kepe remnaunt hoost iewry commaunded sayenge take ouersight people se ye make warre agaynst heithen vntill tyme come agayne vnto simon gaue thre thousande men go galilee iudas eight thousande galaadithim wente symon galilee stroke dyuerse batels wt heithen discomfited folowed vpon vnto porte ptolomais slayne heithen allmost iij thousande men toke spoyles caried awaye israelite galilee arbatis wyues child brought iewry greate gladnesse iudas machabeus also brother ionathas wente ouer iordane trauayled iij dayes iourney wyldernesse nebuthees met receaued louyngly tolde thē euery thinge happened vnto brother galaadithim many beseged barasa bosor alimis casphor mageth carnaim stronge walled mightie greate city yt kepte city galaad also tomorow apoynted brynge hoost vnto city take wynne one daye iudas hoost turned haist wildernesse towarde bosor wanne cite slewe male swearde toke goodes set fyre vpon cite night toke iourneye thence came castell tymes mornynge loked vp beholde innumerable people bearynge laders instrumētes warre take castell ouercome iudas sawe battayll beganne noyse therof wente vp range heauen greate crie cite sayde vnto hoost fight daye youre brother came behynde enemy thre company blewe vp trompettes cried prayer god soone tymothis hoost perceaued machabeus fled ye slewe downe right sore kylled daye allmost eight thousande men departed iudas vnto maspha layed sege vnto wanne slewe male spoyled set fyre vpon thence wente toke casbon mageth bosor city galaad gathered timothy another hoost 〈…〉 pitched tentes raphon beyonde water iudas sent spye hoost brought worde againe sayenge heithen rounde aboute v gathered vnto hoost greate yee haue hyred arabian helpe haue pitched tentes beyonde water ready come fight agaynst iudas wente mete timothy sayde vnto captaynes hoost iudas hoost come nye ryuer yf go ouer first shall able withstonde wil stronge v yf darre come ouer pitch tente beyonde water go ouer shalbe stronge ynough agaynst soone iudas came ryuer appoynted certayne scrybes people commaunded sayenge se ye leaue none behynde vpon syde ye ryuer let euery man come battayll wente first ouer vnto people heithen discomfited let weapens fall ranne temple carnaim cite iudas wanne brent temple yt carnaim subdued might withstōde iudas iudas gathered israelite galaadithim ye leest vnto wyues child greate hoost come londe iuda came vnto ephron mightie greate stronge cite 〈…〉 laye waye coude go nether right honde ner left must go thorow neuerthelesse cite wolde let go thorow walled vp porte stone iudas sent vnto thē peaceable wordes sayenge let v passe thorow youre londe 〈◊〉 10 c maye go oure owne coū tre shal body harme wil go thorow wolde let wherfore iudas commauded proclamacion made thorow hoost euery man shulde kepe ordre dyd best like valeaunt men iudas beseged cite daie night wanne slewe many male •• troyed cite spoyled wēte thorow cite ouer slayne wente ouer iordane playne felde bethsan iudas helped forwarde came behynde gaue people good exortacion ye waye thorow till come londe iuda thus wente vp vnto mount sion offred myrth thankesgeuynge 〈…〉 none slayne came home agayne peaceably tyme iudas ionathas londe galaad symon brother galilee ptolomais iosephus sonne zachary asarias captaynes hearinge actes done battels stroken sayde let v get v name also go fight agaynst heithen rounde aboute v gaue hoost commaundement wente towarde iamnia came gorgias men cite fight agaynst iosephus also asarias chased vnto ye border iewry slayne yt daye ye people israel ijm men yt greate misery amōge ye people obediēt vnto iudas brother thought shulde quyte selues man fully 〈◊〉 5 b neuertheles came sede men israel helped men iudas greatly commended sight israel heithen euer name herde vpō people came vnto byddinge welcome wente iudas forth brother fought agaynst child esau londe yt lieth towarde south wanne cite hebron townes lye besyde walles towres rounde aboute brent vp remoued go lō de philistine wente thorow samaria tyme many prestes slaine ye battayll wilfully without advysement wente fight get honoure iudas came azot philistynes londe brake downe altares deut 7 brent ymages idol spoyled city came agayne londe iuda vi chapter kynge antiochus trauayled thorow hye countrees iosephu • cap 13 • 12 anti 2 9 herde elymas persia noble plenteous cite siluer golde rich temple clothes cote armoures shyldes golde alexander sonne philippe kynge macedonia left behynde wherfore wente aboute take cite spoyle able ye citisēs warned fought fled departed greate heuynesse came agayne babilon morouer came one brought tidinges perside1 mac 3 4 yt hoostes londe iuda dryuen awaye lisias wente forth first greate power dryuen awaye iewes wonne victory gotten greate goodes hoostes peryshed broken downe abhominacion set vp vpon altare ierusalem1 mac 1 fenced sanctuary hye walles like afore yee bethsura cite also chaunced kinge herde wordes afrayed greued sore wherfore layed downe vpon bed fell sicke sorowe happened deuysed continued longe grefe euer yt sawe must nedes dye therfore sent frendes sayde vnto ye slepe gone fro mine eye ye sorowe vexaciō herte yt haue considre mynde ye greate aduersite yt come vnto floudes heuynesse afore tyme mery greatly set reason power againe cōsideringe ye euell yt haue done ierusalē whence toke ye rich golde syluer yt sent fetch awaye inhabitours iewry without eny reason knowe yt trouble come vpon cause beholde must dye greate sorow straū ge londe called one philippe frende made ruler realme gaue crowne robe rynge shulde take sonne antiochus vnto brynge vp till might raigne mac 9 b c e kynge antiochus dyed cxlix yeare lysias knewe kynge deed •• sephus •• pi 14 〈◊〉 12 mac • ordened antiochus sonne brought vp raigne father steade called eupator castel ierusalem kepte iewes rounde aboute sāctuary sought euer styll harme strengthenynge heithen wherfore iudas thought destroye called people together yt might laye sege vnto came together cl yeare beseged thē layenge forth ordinaunce instrumentes warre certayne yt beseged wente forth vnto vngodly men israel ioyned thē selues also wente vnto kynge sayēge longe wil thou punysh avenge oure brother haue bene euer mynded thy father seruyce walke statute obeye commaundementes therfore oure people fell v euer founde eny v slewe haue medled v oure countrees beholde daye beseginge castell ierusalem haue made vp stronge holde bethsura 4 g yf thou doest preuente right soone wil thou shalt able ouercome kynge herde angrie 13 called frendes captaynes fote men horse men together hyred men warre also realmes iles see came vnto nombre hoost hundreth thousande fote men twentye thousande horsmē xxxij elephantes wel exercised battayll came thorow idumea vnto bethsura beseged longe season 〈…〉 made dyuerse instrumentes warre agaynst iewes came brent fought like men departed iudas castell ierusalem remoued ye hoost towarde bethza carā ouer agaynst kynges armye kynge arose daye brought power hoost ye waie bethzacaran hoostes made battayll blowynge trompettes 〈…〉 prouoke elephantes fight shewed sappe reed grape molberies deuyded elephantes amonge hoost euery elephante stode men wel harnessed helmettes stele vpon heades yee vnto euery one elephantes also ordened vc horsmen best waited elephante goinge euer wente departed euery elephant couered wt strō ge tower wod vpon xxxij valeaunt men wt weapens fight within man inde rule beest remnaunt horsmen set vpon sydes two partes trompettes prouoke hoost stere vp soch slowe armye sonne shone vpon shyldes golde stele mountaynes glistered agayne bright creszshettes fyre kynges hoost also deuyded one parte vpon hie mountaynes lowe beneth wente takynge good hede kepinge ordre dwelt londe afrayed noyse hoost multitude wente forth weapens smote together hoost greate mightie iudas also hoost entred battayll slewe vjc men kynges armye eleasar sonne saura dyd se one ye elephantes deckte wt kynges badge goodly beest thē thought ye kinge shulde vpō ioperde delyuer people get perpetuall name wherfore ranne corage vnto elephante myddest hoost smytinge downe sydes slewe many aboute wente elephantes fete gat vnder slewe fell elephante downe vpon dyed iudas also men seinge power kinge mightie violence hoost departed kynges armye wente vp agaynst towarde ierusalem pitched tentes iewry besyde mount sion morouer kynge toke truce bethsura 〈◊〉 4 g came cite vytales within 〈…〉 londe laye vntylled kynge toke bethsura set men kepe turned hoost place sanctuary layed sege greate whyle made maner ordinaunce handbowes fyrie dartes rackettes cast stone scorpion shute arowes slynges iewes also made ordinaunce agaynst fought longe season cite vytayles seuenth yeare warres heithen remayned iewry eaten vp stoare sanctuary men lefte hunger came vpon scatered abrode euery man owne place lysias herde philippe antiochus kynge whyle yet lyuinge 〈…〉 ordened bringe vp antiochus sonne might kynge come agayne persia medium kynges hoost thought optayne kyngdome gat kynge haist captaynes hoost sayde decrease daylie oure vytales small agayne place laye sege vnto stronge oure parte se realme let v agre men take truce people graunte lyue lawe dyd fore greued thinges agaynst v haue despysed lawe kynge prynces content sent vnto make peace receaued whē kynge prynces made ooth vnto came castel kynge wēte vp mount sion sawe ye place wel fenced brake ooth made commaunded destroye wall rounde aboute departed haist returned vnto antioche founde philippe hauynge dominion cite fought agaynst toke cite agayne hondes vii chapter clj yeare came demetrius ye sonne seleucus ye cite rome wt small company men2 14 • vnto cite see coast bare rule chaunced came antioch cite progenitours hoost toke antiochus lysias b • ynge vnto tolde saide let se face hoost put death demetrius set vpon trone kyngdome came vnto wicked vngodly men israel whose captayne alcimus wolde haue bene made hye prest men accused people israel vnto kynge sayenge iudas brother haue slayne thy frendes dryuen v oure owne londe wherfore sende man thou geuest credence maye go se destruccion hath done vnto v kynges londe let punished frēdes fauourers kynge chose bachides frende man greate power realme beyonde greate water faithfull vnto kynge sent se destruccion iudas done wicked alcimus made hye prest commaunded auenged child israel stode vp came greate hoost ye londe iuda sendinge messaūgers iudas brethrē speakinge vnto wt peaceable wordes vnder disceate therfore iudas people beleued saiēge1 mac 1 • sawe yt come wt greate hoost came ye scribe together vnto alcimus bachides trustinge best vnto first ye assideans requyred peace sayenge alcimus ye prest come sede aarō disceaue v gaue louīge wordes swore vnto sayde wil harme nether youre frendes beleued daye toke lx men slewe thē acordinge ye wordes yt writtē psal 78 • haue cast ye flesh ye sanctes shed bloude roūde aboute ierusalē nomā yt wolde bury thē came greate feare drede amonge people sayenge nether treuth righteousnesse haue brokē appoyntment ooth made bachides remoued hoost ierusalem pitched tente bethzecha sent forth toke many forsaken slewe many people also cast greate pytt committed londe vnto alcimus left men warre helpe bachides wente vnto kynge thus alcimus defended hie presthode soch vexed israel resorted vnto moch optayned lō de iuda dyd moch euell vnto israelite iudas sawe myschefe alcimus company done yee heithē selues vnto israelite wente forth rounde aboute border iewry punyshed vnfaithfull rennagates came countre whē alcimus sawe iudas people gotten vpperhande able abyde wente agayne kynge sayde worst coude kynge sent nicanor one chefe prynces bare euell wyl vnto israel commaunded shulde vtterly destroye people nicanor came ierusalem greate hoost sent vnto iudas brother frendly wordes vnder disceate sayenge • 15 shal warre betwixte wil come men se ye frenshipe vpon came vnto iudas saluted one another peaceably enemy appoynted take iudas violence neuertheles tolde iudas yt came vnto vnder disceate wherfore gat awaie wolde se face nomore nicanor perceaued yt councell bewrayed wente fight agaynst iudas besyde capharsalama slayne nicanors hoost vm men residue fled vnto castell dauid came nicanor vp vnto moūt sion prestes elder people wente forth salute peaceably shewe ye burnt sacrifice yt offered kynge laughed thē scorne mocked thē defyled offeringes spake diszdanedly yee swore wroth sayenge yf iudas hoost delyuered hondes 〈…〉 soone euer come agayne fayre well shal burne vp house wente greate anger prestes came stode aulter tē ple wepinge sayenge moch thou lorde hast chosen house 〈…〉 thy name might called vpon therin yt shulde house praier peticion vnto thy people 〈…〉 avenged mā hoost let slayne ye swearde remembre blasphemy suffre continue eny longer nicanor gone ierusasalem pitched tente bethoron hoost met hī siria iudas came adarsa iijm mē made prayer vnto god sayenge lorde messaungers kynge senacherib blasphemed angel wente forth slewe clxxxv thousande 〈…〉 euen destroye thou hoost v daie people maye knowe hath blasphemed thy sanctuary punysh acordinge maliciousnesse hoostes stroke felde thirtente daye moneth adar nicanors hoost discomfited first slayne battayll nicanors men warre sawe kylled 〈…〉 cast awaye weapens fled iewes folowed vpon whole dayes iourney adazer vnto gazara blowinge trompettes makinge token iewes came forth townes aboute blewe horne vpon turned agaynst thus slayne one lefte toke substaunce pray smote nicanors heade right honde helde vp proudly brought 〈…〉 hāged vp afore ierusalem wherfore people exceadingly reioysed passed ouer daye greate gladnesse iudas ordened ye daye namely xiij daye ye moneth adar shulde kepte myrth euery yeare thus londe iuda rest litle whyle viii chapter ivdas herde also fame romaynes mightie valeaunt men agreable thinges requyred make peace men come vnto doughty men strength besydes tolde battayls noble actes dyd galacia conquered brought vnder tribute greate thinges done spayne wyszdome sober behauoure wonne mynes syluer golde optayned londe place farre thē discomfited slayne downe kynges came vpon vttemost parte earth people geue tribute euery yeare slayne ouercome philippe perses kynge cethim mo battayll brought ordinaunce agaynst discomfited greate antiochus kynge asia wolde nedes fight wt hauynge hundreth xx elephantes horsmen charettes greate hoost toke self alyue ordened soch shulde raigne paye thē greate trybute 〈…〉 yee fynde thē good suerties plege besydes takē india medium lydia best londes geuen kynge eumenus agayne perceauynge yt grekes cōmynge vexe sent thē captaine hoost gaue thē battayll slewe many thē led awaye ther wyues child captyue spoyled thē toke possession londe destroyed stronge holdes subdued thē bonde men vnto daye morouer yt kyngdomes iles somtyme withstode thē destroyed brought vnder dominion helped euer owne frendes yt confederate conquered kyngdomes farre nye yt euer herde renowne afrayed wolde helpe kyngdomes raigned whō lyked raigne put downe come greate preeminence hauynge kynge amonge thē nether eny man clothed purple magnified thorow ordened thē selues perlament sat iijc xx senatours daylie vpon councell dispatch euer busynesse people kepe good ordre yt euery yeare chose mayre haue gouernaunof londe euery man obedient yt nether euell ner discencion amonge iudas chose eupolemus sonne ihon sonne iacob iason sonne eleazar sent thē vnto rome make frenshipe bonde loue wt yt might take frō bondage ye grekes ye iewes sawe yt grekes wolde subdue kyngdome israel wēte vnto rome greate iourney came ye perlamēt saide iudas machabeus wt brethrē people ye iewes hath sent v vnto make bonde frendshipe peace wt ye note v yor louers frendes ye matter pleased ye romaine right well wherfore writtē vp ye ye romaynes made wrytinge table latō sent ierusalē yt might haue thē memoriall ye peace bōde frēdshipe maner god saue ye romaine ye people iewes see lōde kepe ye swearde enemy frō thē euermore yf come first eny warre vpō ye romaynes eny frēdes thorow dominyō ye people ye iewes shal helpe thē ye tyme requireth yt wt hertes also shal nether geue sēde vnto enemy vitales weapēs money ner shippes fulfil charge romaynes pleasure take nothinge therfore againe yf people iewes happē first haue warre romaynes shal stonde thē good wil acordinge tyme wil suffre nether shal geue vnto iewes enemy vytales weapens money ner shippes thus romaynes content shal fulfill charge without eny disceate acordinge article romaynes made bonde iewes article sayde yf eny party wyll put take eny thinge shal consente euer adde vnto take shall stonde fast touchinge euell demetrius hath done vnto iewes haue wrytten vnto sayenge wherfore layest thou thy heuy yocke vpon iewes oure frendes louers yf make eny complaynte agayne vnto v shall defende fight see londe ix chapter ye meane season demetrius herde nicanor hoost slayne felde1 mac 7 f • ose ca 17 libro 32 proceded sende bachides alcimus againe iewry right wynge hoost wē te forth waye ledeth vnto galgala pitched tentes mesaloth arbellis wanne cite slewe moch people ye first moneth clij yeare brought hoost ierusalem rose vp came berea xxm fote men ijm horsmen iudas pitched tente laisa thre thousande chosen men sawe multitude army yt greate sore afrayed many conveyed selues hoost moch yt abode mo viijc men iudas sawe hoost fayled must nedes fight brake herte yt tyme gather together wherfore man extreme trouble neuerthelesse sayde vnto yt remayned vp let v go agaynst oure enemy peraduanture shal able fight wolde haue stopped sayenge shall able therfore let v saue oure lyues turne agayne brother wil fight agaynst thē fewe iudas sayde god forbyd shulde fle wherfore yf oure tyme come let v dye manfully oure brother let v stayne oure honoure hoost remoued tentes stode agaynst horsmen deuyded two partes slynge caster archer wente hoost mightie men formest felde bachides right wynge batell hoost drewe nye two partes blewe trompettes iudas syde blewe ye trompettes also earth shoke noyse hoostes stroke felde morow till night iudas sawe yt bachides hoost strongest right syde toke hardy mē brake right wynge ordre folowed vpon vnto mount azot lefte wynge sawe right side discomfited persecuted iudas wt sore battayll many slayne wounded party iudas also kylled remnaunt fled ionathas symō toke iudas brother buried father sepulcre cite modin people israel made greate lamentacion mourned longe sayenge ala worthy shulde slayne delyuered ye people israel thinges pertayninge ye battayls iudas noble actes worthynesse writtē many death iudas wicked mē came vp coastes israel 〈…〉 arose soch worke vngodlynesse dayes greate derth londe countre gaue ouer selues vnto bachides bachides wicked men made lordes londe sought made search iudas frendes brought vnto bachides auenged vpon thē greate despite came greate trouble israel sen time prophet sene came iudas frendes together sayde vnto ionathas moch thy brother iudas deed none like go forth agaynst enemy agaynst bachides soch aduersaries vnto oure people wherfore daye chose oure prynce captayne ordre oure batell ionathas toke gouernaunce vpon tyme ruled steade brother iudas bachides gat knowlege therof sought slaye ionathas symon brother perceauynge fled ye wildernesse thecua company pitched tētes water pole asphar bachides vnderstode came ouer iordane hoost vpon ye sabbath daye ionathas sent brother ihon captayne people praye frendes nabuthites yt wolde lende ordinaunce moch child iambry came madaba toke ihon yt wente waye withall came worde vnto ionathas symon brother yt child iambri made greate mariage brought ye bryde madaba greate pompe doughter one noblest prynces canaan wherfore remembred bloude ihon brother wente vp hyd selues vnder shadowe mountayne lift vp eye loked beholde moch doo greate repayre brydegrome came forth frēdes brother met tympanys instrumentes musick many weapēs ionathas rose skoukinge place agaynst slewe many remnaunt fled ye mountaynes toke substaunce thus mariage turned mournynge ye noyse melody lamentacion auenged bloude brother turned agayne vnto iordane bachides hearinge came vnto ye border iordane greate power vpon sabbath daye ionathas sayde company let v get vp fyght agaynst oure enemy stondeth v daye tymes past beholde enemy oure waye ye water iordane vpon one syde v banckes fennes woddes ye syde yt place v departe vnto 〈◊〉 • 0 〈◊〉 4 b wherfore crie vnto heauen ye maye delyuered power youre enemy stroke batell ionathas stretched honde smyte bachides fled bacwarde ionathas yt leapte iordane swymmed ouer iordane vnto slayne bachides syde daye thousande men therfore bachides wt hoost turned againe ierusalem buylte vp ye castels stronge holdes iewry iericho emaus bethoron bethel thānata phara thopo wt hye walles wt porte locke set men kepe yt might vse malice vpon israel walled vp bethsura gazara castell ierusalē also prouyded wt men vytales toke also chefest men sonnes countre pledge put castel ierusalem kepte afterwarde cliij yeare seconde moneth alcimus cōmaunded ye walles ynmost sanctuary shulde destroyed buyldinges ye prophetes also beganne destroye thē ye thinges yt wēte aboute hyndered smytten wt palsey mouth shutt yt coude nomore speake ner commaunde eny house cōcerninge busynesse thus dyed alcimus greate misery tyme whē bachides sawe yt alcimus deed turned agayne ye kynge londe rest ij yeares vngodly men helde councell sayenge beholde ionathas cōpany ease dwell without care wherfore let v brynge bachides hither shall take one night wēte gaue bachides councell arose come wt greate hoost sent letter priuely adherentes iewry take ionathas yt might gotten knowlege deuyce ionathas toke l men countre ryngleders slewe ionathas symon wt cōpany departed vnto cite bethbessen lieth wyldernesse repayred decaye therof made stronge bachides knewe gathered hoost sent worde iewry thē came layed sege bethbessen fought longe season made instrumentes warre ionathas lefte brother symon cite wente forth countre came certayne nombre slewe odares brother child phaseron tentes yt beganne stronge increase power symon company wente cite brēt vp instrumētes warre fought agaynst bachides discōfited bachides sore vexed councell trauayle vayne wherfore wroth ye wicked men gaue councell come londe slew many purposed company go awaye owne countre wherof whē ionathas knowlege sent embassitours vnto make peace yt shulde deliuer presoners againe bachides cōsented gladly dyd acordinge desyre yee made ooth shulde neuer harme dayes life restored vnto presoners taken londe iuda thē turned wente waye owne londe nether proceded eny come vnto ye border iuda thus israel warre ionathas dwelt machmas beganne gouerne people destroyed vngodly men israel x chapter clx yeare came alexander ye sonne noble antiochus • osephus • ap 23 li • ro 13 toke ptolomais whose citisens receaued raigned demetrius herde therof gathered exceadinge greate hoost wēte forth agaynst fight wherfore demetrius sent letter vnto ionathas louynge wordes praysed greatly sayde wyll first make peace bynde selfe alexander agaynst v el shall remembre euell haue done brother people gaue ionathas leue gather hoost make weapens mac 9 c confederate wt commaunded pledge castell delyuered vnto came ionathas ierusalem red letter audience people ye castell therfore sore afrayed herde kynge geuē licence gather hoost thus pledge delyuered vnto ionathas restored elder ionathas also dwelt ierusalem begāne buylde vp repayre cite commaundinge worke men wall mount sion rounde aboute fre stone stronge holde dyd heithen ye castels bachides made vp fled euery man left place wēte owne countre onely bethsura remayned certayne iewes forsaken lawe cō maundementes god bethsura refuge kynge alexander herde ye promise yt demetrius made vnto ionathas tolde ye batels noble actes brother done greate trauayles taken saide shal fynde soch man wel make oure frende confederate vpon wrote lettre vnto wt wordes kinge alexāder saluteth brother ionathas haue herde yt thou art valeaunt man mete frende wherfore daye ordene hye prest thy people called kynges frende vpon sente purple clothinge crowne golde yt thou mayest considre oure profit kepe frendshipe towarde v vij moneth clx yeare vpon solempne feast daye tabernacle ionathas put holy rayment vpon gathered hoost made many weapēs demetrius herde maruelous sory sayde ala haue done yt alexander hath preuented v gettinge frendshipe iewes owne defence yet wil wryte louingly vnto also yee promise dignity rewardes yt maye syde whervpon wrote vnto thē wordes kinge demetrius sendeth gretinge vnto ye people iewes ye haue kepte yor couenaunt towarde v cōtinued frendshipe enclyninge oure enemy glad herde therof wherfore remayne still faithfull v shal wel recōpense thinges yt ye haue done partie shall release many charge geue rewardes discharge ye iewes tribute forgeue customes salt release crowne tax thirde parte sede half frute tree myne owne dewty leaue daye forth shall taken londe iuda ner thre city added thervnto samaria galilee daye forth euermore ierusalē also thinges belōginge therto shal holy fre yee yt tithe tribute shal pertayne vnto power ye castell ierusalem remytte geue vnto hye prest maye set soch men shall chose kepe frely delyuer iewes presoners thorow realme euery one shalbe fre payenge eny tribute yee euen catell solēpne feastes sabbathes new mones dayes appoynted thre day feast shall fre iewes realme man shal haue power eny thinge moue eny busynesse agaynst eny eny maner cause shal xxxm also iewes written vp kynges hoost haue wage payed men warre kynges shulde haue shalbe ordened certayne kepe kynges stronge holdes yee shalbe set ouer kynges busynesse maye faithfully deale iewes also shal haue prynces owne walke owne lawes kynge hath commaunded londe iuda thre city fallen vnto iewry countre samaria galilee shalbe taken iewry vnder one nether subiecte eny straunge lorde hye prest ptolomais londe pertayninge therto geue vnto sanctuary ierusalem necessary expēces holy thinges morouer geue euery yeare xvm sycles syluer ye kynges checker pertayneth vnto worke temple yee loke remayneth yt oure matter honde tymes past haue payed shal geue vnto also besydes vm sycles toke yearly rētes sanctuary shal belonge vnto prestes seruyce item euer fle vnto temple ierusalem within liberty therof fallen kynges daunger eny maner busynes shall pardoned goodes haue realme shalbe fre buyldinge also repayringe worke sanctuary expense shalbe geuen kynges checker yee makinge walles rounde aboute ierusalem breakinge downe olde settinge vp stronge holdes iewry shal ye costes charge geuen kynges checker ionathas people herde wordes1 mac 7 b gaue credence vnto nether receaued remembred greate wickednesse done vnto israel sore vexed wherfore agreed vnto alexander prynce dealte frendly stode allwaye thē gathered kynge alexā der greate hoost brought armye agaynst demetrius ye two kynges stroke battayll together iosephus ca 5 lib 1 • demetrius hoost fled alexander folowed fell vpon mightie sore felde continuynge till sonne wente downe demetrius slayne daye alexander sente embass • tour vnto ptolomy kynge egipte wordes sayenge moch come agayne realme set trone progenitours haue gotten dominion ouer come demetrius conquered londe striken felde haue discomfited hoost syt trone kyngdome let v make frendshipe together geue thy daughter wife shall thy sonne lawe geue rewardes hir greate dignite ptolomy kynge gaue answere sayenge happy daye wherin thou art come agayne londe thy progenitours set trone kyngdome fulfill thy writynge mete ptolomais yt maye se one another maye mary doughter vnto acordinge thy desyre ptolomy wēte egipte doughter cleopatra came vnto ptolomais ye clxij yeare kynge alexā der met gaue alexander doughter cleopatra maried ptolomais greate worshipe like maner kynges wrote kynge alexander vnto ionathas shulde come mete wente honorably vnto ptolomais met two kinges gaue greate presentes golde syluer founde fauoure sight came together agaynst ionathas certayne wicked men vngracious personnes israel makynge complayntes kynge regarded ionathas kynge commaunded take garmentes clothe purple dyd kynge appoynted syt sayde vnto prynces go myddest cite make proclamacion man complayne agaynst eny matter man trouble eny maner cause happened accuser sawe worshipe proclamed yt clothed purple fled euerychone kynge made moch wrote amonge chefe frendes made duke partaker dominion thus ionathas wente agayne ierusalem peace gladnesse iosephus • ap 6 lib 〈◊〉 antiq clxv yeare came demetrius sonne demetrius creta father londe wherof alexander herde tell right sory returned vnto antioche demetrius chose appollonius gouernaunce celosyria captayne • mac 3 gathered greate hoost came vnto iamnia sende worde vnto ionathas hye prest sayenge darrest thou wt stonde v thy self alone laughed scorne shamed thou prouest thy strength agaynst v mountaynes therfore yf thou trustest thyne owne strength come downe v playne felde let v proue oure strength together thou shalt fynde haue valeaunt men warre shalt knowe stonde saye youre fote able stonde oure face thy father haue bene twyse chaced owne londe wylt thou able abyde greate hoost horsmen fotemen felde nether rocke stone ner place fle vnto ionathas herde wordes appollonius moued mynde wherfore chose x thousande men wente ierusalem symon brother met helpe pitched tentes ioppa cite kepte forth ioppa holde appollonius ionathas layed sege cite feare let ionathas wanne ioppa appollonius hearinge toke thre thousande horsmen greate hoost fote wente though wolde go azotus came immediatly playne felde many horsmē put trust thē ionathas folowed vpon azotus stroke battayll appollonius lefte horsmen behynde pryuely tētes ionathas knewe soch waite layed behynde wēte rounde aboute enemy hoost shot dartes people mornynge euenynge ionathas people kepte ordre commaunded enemy horse euer labouringe brought symon forth hoost set agaynst fote men horsmē weery allready discomfited fled scatred felde gat azotus came temple dagon idol yt might saue lyues ionathas set fyre vpon azotus city rounde aboute toke goodes 〈…〉 brēt vp temple dagon fled thus slayne brēt well nye viij thousande men ionathas remoued hoost thence brought ascalon ye men cite came forth met greate worshipe wente ionathas hoost agayne ierusalem greate substaunce good kynge alexander herde se thinges thought ionathas worshipe sent colar golde vse geuen vnto soch kynges nexte bloude gaue also ye cite accaron londes belongynge therto possession xi chapter ye kynge egipte gathered hoost 〈…〉 like sonde yt lieth vpon see shore many shippes wente aboute thorow disceate optayne ye kingdome alexāder ioyne vnto owne realme vpon toke iourneye syria letten city mē came forth mete kinge alexā der cōmaunded father lawe ptolomy entred eny cite lefte mē warre kepe dyd thorow ye city came azotus shewed temple dagon azotus brent vp mac 10 thinges destroyed deed body cast abrode ye graues made waye syde soch slayne felde tolde kynge ionathas done thinges intēt might get euell kynge sayde worde therto ionathas met kynge greate honor ioppa saluted one another toke rest ionathas gone ye kynge vnto water called eleutherus turned agayne ierusalem ptolomy gotten dominion city vnto selencia vpon see coost ymaginynge wicked councels agaynst alexander sent embassitours vnto demetrius sayenge come let v make bonde betwixte v shall geue doughter alexander hath thou shalt raigne thy father kyngdome repente gaue alexander doughter goeth aboute slaye thus slaundred alexander wolde haue realme thus toke doughter gaue vnto demetrius forsoke alexander malice openly knowne ptolomy came antioche set two crownes vpon owne heade crowne egipte asia meane season kynge alexander cilicia dwelt place rebelled agaynst alexāder herde came warre agaynst kinge ptolomy brought forth hoost met mightie power chaced awaye fled alexander araby defended kynge ptolomys honoure increased zabdiel arabian smote alexander heade sent vnto ptolomy thirde daye died kynge ptolomy set stronge holdes slayne within ye city demetrius raigned ye hundreth seuen sixtie yeare tyme gathered ionathas iewry laye sege vnto castell ierusalem made many instrumentes warre agaynst wente certaine vngodly personnes hated owne people vnto kynge demetrius tolde ionathas beseged ye castell herde angrie immediatly came ptolomais wrote vnto ionathas shulde laye sege castell come speake haist neuerthelesse ionathas herde commaunded besege chose also certayne elder prestes israel put self parell toke golde syluer clothinge diuerse presentes▪ wente ptolomais vnto kynge founde gracious though certayne vngodly men owne people made complayntes vpon yet kynge intreated him1 10 • like predecessours done promoted sight frendes confirmed hye presthode worshipe yt afore made chefe frende ionathas also desyred kynge wolde make iewry fre thre head city samaria londes pertayninge therto1 10 vpon dyd ionathas promyse thre c talentes vnto kynge consented gaue ionathas wrytinge conteyninge wordes kynge demetrius sendeth gretinge vnto brother ionathas people ye iewes sende copy lettre dyd wryte vnto oure elder lasthenus concernynge ye shulde knowe kynge demetrius sendeth gretinge vnto lasthenus elder faithfulnes oure frendes people iewes kepe vnto v louynge kyndnesse beare towarde v determed good wherfore ordene ye coostes iewry thre city lyda ramatha added vnto iewry samaria ye lōdes pertayninge vnto frely separated soch sacrifice ierusalē concernynge paymētes kynge toke yearly afore tyme ye frutes also earth tree tithe tribute yt belonged vnto v discharge thē therof tyme forth like maner graū te vnto thē customes salt crowne tax brought vnto v fredome shal haue firme stedfast frō tyme forth euermore therfore se yt ye make copy letter delyuer vnto ionathas maye kepte vpon ye holy mount cōuenient place demetrius kynge sawe londe rest resistaunce made sent awaye hoost euery man owne place excepte armye straungers brought iles heithen wherfore father hoost euell wyll • mac 12 c one triphon bene alexander parte afore sawe hoost murmured agaynst demetrius wente emalcuel arabian brought vp antiochus sonne alexander laye sore vpon delyuer yonge antiochus might raigne father steade tolde also greate euell demetrius done mē warre loued remayned lōge season ionathas sent vnto kynge demetrius dryue castell ierusalem refugies dyd israel greate harme demetrius sent worde vnto ionathas sayenge wil thinges thy people tyme conueniēt wil thy people greate worshipe thou shalt pleasure yf thou wilt sende men helpe myne armye gone fro ionathas sent iijm stronge men vnto antioche came vnto kynge wherfore kynge glad commynge cite euen cxx thousande mē gathered together wolde haue slayne kynge fled courte citesyns kepte stretes cite beganne fight kynge called iewes helpe came vnto together wente abrode thorow cite slewe daye cm men set fyre vpon cite gat many spoyles daye delyuered ye kynge citesyns sawe iewes gotten wyll cite selues dispoynted purpose made supplicacion vnto kynge sayēge graunte v peace let iewes ceasse troublinge v cite vpon cast awaye weapens thus made peace ye iewes gat greate worshipe sight kynge sight realme spoken thorow kyngdome came agayne ierusalem greate goodes kynge demetrius sat trone kyngdome peace lōde neuertheles dyssembled euer spake drewe ionathas nether rewarded acordinge benefites done troubled sore came triphon agayne yonge antiochus raigned crowned kynge gathered vnto ye men warre whō demetrius put awaye fought agaynst demetrius fled turned backe triphon toke elephantes wanne antioche yōge antiochus wrote vnto ionathas sayenge confirme thy presthode make ye ruler iiij countrees yt thou mayest frende ye kinges vpon sent golden vessel serued gaue leue drynke golde clothed purple weere colar golde made brother symon also captayne coostes tyrus vnto border egipte ionathas toke iourney wente thorow ye city beyō de water iordane men warre syria gathered thē vnto helpe came vnto ascalon cite receaued honorably thence wente vnto gaza wolde let wherfore layed sege vnto burnynge vp spoylinge place aboute cite citesyns gaza submytted thē selues vnto ionathas made peace toke sonnes pledge sent thē ierusalē wente thorow countre vnto damascus ionathas herde demetrius prince come cades galile • greate hoost purposinge put demetrius medlinge realme came agaynst lefte symon brother londe came bethsura layed sege longe season discomfited desyred haue peace wt graunted afterwarde put thence toke cite set mē kepe ionathas hoost came water genesar tymes mornynge gat playne felde azor beholde hoostes heithen met thē felde layed watch thē mountaynes yt ionathas came agaynst thē layed watch rose place fought ionathas syde fled euery man one thē lefte excepte matathias sonne absalomus iudas sonne calphi captayne hoost thē ionathas rente clothes layed earth vpō heade made prayer turned againe thē ye felde fought together put flight owne mē yt fled sawe turned agayne vnto helped folowe vpon enemy vnto tentes cades slayne heithen daye iijm men ionathas turned agayne ierusalem xii chapter ionathas seynge ye tyme mete chose certayne men sent vnto rome stablish renue frendshipe wt thē sent lettres also vnto sparta 〈…〉 place like maner wēte vnto rome entred ye councell sayde ionathas ye hye prest people ye iewes sent v vnto renue ye olde frēdshipe bonde loue vpō ye romaynes gaue thē fre pasportes yt mē shulde lede thē home ye lōde iuda peaceably ye copy lettres ionathas wrote vnto sparcians ionathas ye hye prest wt ye elder prestes people ye iewes sende gretinge vnto ye sparciās brethrē lettres sente lōge agoo vnto onias ye hye prest arius raigned amonge ye oure brother wrytinge made thervpon specifieth onias intreated embassitoure sent honorably receaued ye lettres wherin mencion made bonde loue frendshipe v nede soch writinges haue holy bokes scripture oure hondes oure comforte neuerthelesse rather sende vnto • uynge ye brotherhode frendshipe lest shulde straunge vnto longe sen ye tyme yt ye sent worde vnto v wherfore ye sacrifice yt offre ceremony vpon ye hye solempne dayes allwaye remembre without ceassynge like reason becommeth v thynke vpon oure brother yee right glad youre prosperous honoure though haue greate trouble warres kynges aboute v haue foughten agaynst v yet wolde greuous vnto ner oure louers frendes warres haue helpe frō heauē delyuered oure enemy subdued wherfore chose numenius sonne antiochus antipater sonne iason sente vnto romaynes renue olde bonde frendshipe loue commaunded also come vnto salute delyuer lettres concerninge renouacion brotherhode ye shal right wel geue v answere vnto copy wrytinge arius kynge sparta sente vnto onias arius kinge sparcians sendeth gretynge vnto onias hye prest founde wrytynge sparcians iewes brother come generacion abraham moch come oure knowlege ye shal wel wryte vnto v youre prosperite v haue wrytten mynde vnto oure catell goodes thinges haue cō maunded shewed vnto ionathas herde demetrius prīces come forth fight greater hoost thē afore wente frō ierusalem met thē lōde hemath gaue space come owne countre sent spyes vnto tentes came agayne tolde appoynted come vpō night season wherfore sō ne gone downe ionathas cōmaunded men watch ye night ready wt weapens fight set watchman rounde aboute hoost aduersaries herde ionathas •• wt men battayll feared afrayed hertes kyndled fyres tentes brake vp gat awaye neuertheles ionathas company knewe till morninge sawe fyres burnynge ionathas folowed vpon thē might ouertake gone ouer water eleutherus ionathas departed vnto ye arabiās called zabadei slewe toke goodes proceded furthur also came vnto damascus wente thorow countre simon brother toke iourney came ascalon nexte stronge holdes departinge vnto ioppa wanne herde wolde stonde demetrius partie wherfore sent mē warre cite kepe came ionathas home agayne called elder people together deuysed thē buylde vp strōge holdes iewry walles ierusalem set vp hye wall betwixte castell ye cite separate cite might alone men shulde nether bye sell vpō came together buylde vp cite moch wall vpō broke west syde called caphetheta fallen downe repayred symon set vp adiada sephela made stronge settinge porte locke vpō triphon purposed raigne asia • 11 c • osephus • api 19 •• bro 13 crowned slaye kynge antiochus afrayed ionathas wolde suffre fight wherfore wente aboute take ionathas kyll departed came vnto bethsan wente ionathas forth battayll fourtye thousande chosen men came vnto bethsan also whē triphon sawe ionathas came greae hoost destroye afrayed therfore receaued honorably commended vnto frendes gaue rewardes commaunded men warre obediēt vnto saide vnto ionathas hast thou caused people take soch trauayle seynge warre betwixte v therfore sende home agayne chose certaine mē waite vpon come thou wt ptolomais wil geue wt strō ge holdes men warre officer must departe ye cause cōmynge ionathas beleued dyd sayde puttinge awaye hoost wente ye londe iuda kepte iijm wherof sente ijm galilee one wente soone ionathas entred ptolomais citesyns sparred gate cite toke slewe swerde came sent triphon hoost fote mē horsmen galilee greate playne felde destroye ionathas company knew ionathas taken slayne wayted vpon toke councell together came forth ready battayll folowed vpon sawe matter life turned backe agayne wente ye londe iuda peacealy bewayled ionathas right sore israel made greate lamentacion thē heithen yt rounde aboute sought destroye thē sayde haue captayne eny man helpe therfore let v ouercome rote name amonge men xiii chapter whan symon herde triphon gathered greate hoost come ye londe iuda destroye sawe yt people greate fearfulnesse care came vp ierusalem gathered people together gaue thē exortacion sayenge ye knowe greate battayls brother father house haue stryken lawe sāctuary maner trouble haue sene thorow occasion wherof brother slayne israel sake 〈…〉 left alone let spare myne owne life eny maner trouble better brother wil avenge people sanctuary oure child oure wyues heithen gathered together destroye v malice wordes harte people kyndled together cried loude voyce sayenge thou shalt captayne steade iudas ionathas thy brother ordre thou oure batell euer thou commaundest v shall gathered men warre makinge haist fynish walles ierusalem made stronge rounde aboute sent ionathas sonne absalomus wt fresh hoost vnto ioppa droue yt castell remayned triphon also remoued ptolomais greate armye come londe iuda ionathas warde simon pitched tentes addus playne felde triphon knewe symon stode vp steade brother ionathas wolde warre agaynst sent messaungers vnto sayenge haue kepte ionathas thy brother money owynge kynges accompte concernynge busynesse yt honde wherfore sende c talētes syluer two sonnes suertie lettē forth shal forsake v shal sende agayne neuerthelesse symon knewe dyssembled wordes yet commaunded money child delyuered vnto lest shulde greater enemye agaynst ye people israel saye sent money child therfore ionathas deed symon sent child hundreth talentes dyssembled wolde let ionathas go afterwarde came triphon londe destroye wente rounde aboute waye yt ledeth vnto ador euer wente thither wente symon hoost also castell sent messaungers vnto triphon shulde make haist come wyldernesse sende vytales triphon made ready horsmen come night neuerthelesse greate snowe came galaadithim whē drewe nye baschama slewe ionathas sonnes turned go home owne londe thē sente symon fet brother deed coarse buried modin father cite israel bewayled greate lamentacion mourned longe symon made vpon sepulcre father brethrē buyldynge hye loke vnto fre stone behynde set vp seuen pylers one agaynst another father mother foure brother set greate pilers roū de aboute armes vpon perpetuall memory carued shippes besyde armes yt might sene mē saylinge see sepulcre made modin stondeth yet vnto daye triphō wente forth walke wt ye yōge kynge antiochus iosephus capite 10 • libro 1 • slewe trayterously raigned steade crowned kynge asia dyd moch euell londe symon also buylte vp castels iewry makynge stronge hye towres greate walles porte locke layed vp vytales stronge holdes symon chose certayne men sente kynge demetrius desyre yt wolde discharge londe bondage triphon spoyled sore vpon demetrius kynge answered wrote vnto maner demetrius ye kīge sendeth gretinge vnto symon hye prest frende elder people iewes golden crowne precious stone yt ye sente vnto v haue receaued ready make stedfast peace yee wryte vnto oure officer release concernynge thinges wherin made fre appoyntment yt make shalbe firme stable stronge holdes ye haue buylded shal youre owne eny ouer sight fawte committed vnto daye forgeue crowne taxe ye ought v also eny tribute ierusalem shal tribute loke mete amonge oure courte let written vp maye peace betwixte v thus yock heithen taken israel hundreth seuentie yeare peple iewes beganne write lettres actes maner ye first yeare symon hye prest1 mach • 14 prynce iewes dayes wente symon vnto gaza beseged rounde aboute set vp ordinaunce warre wanne towre toke gat towre leapte cite greate feare moch people cite rente clothes clymmed vp vpon walles wyues child besekynge symon one sayenge rewarde v wickednes gracious vnto v shal ye seruyce symon pite wolde fight nomore agaynst put cite caused house wherin ymages clensed entred cite psalmes prayse geuinge thankes vnto lorde cast abhominaciōs cite set soch men kepte lawe god made cite stronge builded dwellinge place castell ierusalem kepte strately coude come forth ner countre might nether bye ner sell hungrie many famished death moch besought symon one graunted put thence clensed castell fylthynesse vpon xxiij daye seconde moneth clxxj yeare entred thankesgeuynge braunches palme tree harpes crowdes cymbal lute synginge psalmes songes prayse vnto god greate enemy israel ouer come symon ordened daye shulde kepte euery yeare gladnesse made stronge hyll temple besyde castell dwelt self company symon also perceauynge ihon sonne mightie man armes made captayne hoostes caused dwell gaza xiiii chapter clxxij yeare gathered kynge demetrius hoost departed vnto medium gett helpe fight agaynst triphon arsaces kynge persia medium herde demetrius entred within border sente one prynces take alyue brynge vnto wente slewe demetrius hoost toke himselfe brought arsaces kepte warde londe iuda rest longe symon lyued sought wealth people therfore glad haue ruler worshipe allwaye symon wanne cite ioppa also hauen towne made intraunce iles see enlarged border people cōquered londe gathered vp many people presoners dominiō gaza bethsura castell clensed fylthines mā resisted euery man tylled grounde peace londe iuda tree gaue frute encreace elder sat iudgment toke deuyce wealth londe yonge men put worshipe harnesse vpon prouyded vytayles city made goodly stronge holdes fame worshipe spoken vnto ende ye worlde 〈…〉 made peace thorow londe israel full myrth ioye euery mā sat vnder vyne fyge tree man fraye awaye none ye londe fight agaynst kinges ouercome helped aduersite amonge people diligent se ye lawe kepte soch vngodly wicked toke thē awaye set vp ye sanctuary encreased holy vessel temple ye romaynes sparcians gotten worde yt ionathas deed right sory herde yt symon brother made hye prest steade wonne londe agayne wt city wrote vnto table laton renue frendshipe bonde loue made afore iudas ionathas brethrē 〈…〉 writinges red congregacion ierusalem copy lettres sparcians sent senatours citesyns sparta sende gretinge vnto simō ye greate prest wt elder prestes ye people iewes brethrē whē yo embassitours sente vnto people certified v youre worshipe honoure prosperous wealth glad cō minge haue written earande spake councell people namely numenius sonne antiochus antipater sonne iason iewes embassitours come vnto v renue olde frendshipe v vpon people consented men shulde honorably intreated copy earande shulde written speciall bokes people perpetuall memory vnto sparcians yee shulde sende copy vnto symon greate prest dyd symon sende numenius vnto rome golden shylde thousande pounde weight confirme frendshipe romaynes vnderstode saide thākes shal recompence agayne vnto symon child hath stablished brethrē ouercome enemy israel wherfore graūted fre wrote iewes table laton naled vnto pilers vpon mount sion copy writinge xviij daye ye moneth elul clxxij yeare thirde yeare symon hye prest greate congregacion ye prestes ruler people elder countre asaramel wordes openly declared moch moch warre oure londe therfore symon ye sonne matathias come child iareb brother put selues parell resisted enemy people sanctuary lawe might manteyned dyd people greate worshipe ionathas like maner gouerned people bene hye prest dyed lyeth buried besyde elder wolde enemy haue trodden holy thinges vnder fote destroyed londe vtterly waisted sanctuary symon withstode fought people spent moch owne money weapened valeaunt men people gaue wage made stronge ye city iuda bethsura lieth vpon border iewry ordinaunce enemy laye somtyme set iewes kepe made fast ioppa also lieth vpon see gaza bordreth vpon azotus enemy dwelt afore set iewes kepe euer mete subduynge aduersaries layed therin whē people sawe noble actes symon worshipe purposed godly behauoure faithfulnesse kepte vnto sought way ye wealth people dyd therfore chose prynce hye prest tyme prospered wel yt heithē takē londe also cite dauid ierusalē castell wente defiled thinges aboute sanctuary greate harme vnto clenlynes symon put men iewes defence londe cite set vp walles ierusalem kynge demetrius confirmed hye presthode made frende dyd greate worshipe herde romayns called ye iewes frendes louers brother honorably receaued symons embassitours ye iewes prestes consented shulde prynce hye prest perpetually till god raysed vp true prophet shulde captayne care sanctuary set officer vpon workes therof ouer londe ouer weapens ouer house defence make prouysion holy thynges obeyed euery man writynges ye londe made name shulde clothed purple golde shulde laufull none people prestes breake eny thynges withstonde wordes ner call eny congregacion londe without shulde clothed purple weere colar golde yf eny disobeyed brake ordinaunce shulde punyshed people consented alowe symon acordynge wordes symon also toke vpon contente hye prest captayne prynce iewes prestes gouerne commaunded make writinge table laton fasten vnto compasse sanctuary open place laye vp copy treasury symon posterite might haue xv chapter morouer kynge antiochus sonne demetrius sente lettres iles see vnto symon hye prest prynce iewes people conteyninge wordes antiochus kynge sendeth gretinge vnto symon hye prest people iewes moch certayne wicked men haue gotten kyngdome oure progenitours purposed chalenge realme agayne restore olde estate wherfore haue gathered greate hoost made shyppes warre maye go thorow countre auenged haue destroyed oure londe waysted many city realme therfore make fre also tribute wherof kynges progenitours haue discharged customes wher haue released euer yee geue leaue smyte money thine owne within thy londe ierusalem wil holy fre weapens house defence thou hast buylded kepest thine hondes shal thine eny thinge shal owynge vnto kynge forgeue tyme forth euermore haue optayned oure kyngdome shal thy people temple greate worshipe youre honoure shal knowne thorow ye whole worlde clxxiiij yeare wente antiochus father londe men warre came together vnto fewe left triphon kynge antiochus folowed vpon fled vnto dora lieth see syde sawe yt myschefe comminge vnto hoost forsaken came antiochus vnto dora wt hūdreth twentye thousande men armes vpon fote eight thousande horsmen compased cite rounde aboute ye shippes came see thus vexed cite londe water moch suffred man go meane season came numenius bene cite rome1 14 hauynge lettres written vnto kynges prouyncies wherin conteyned wordes lucius mayre rome sendeth gretinge vnto ptolomy kynge embassitours iewes oure frē de beinge sent symon hye prest people iewes came vnto v renue olde frendshipe bonde loue brought shylde golde weyenge thousande pounde contente receaue wherfore thought good wryte vnto kynges prouincies harme take parte agaynst thē city ner countrees nether mayntene enemy agaynst yf eny wicked personnes therfore fled countre vnto delythem vnto symon hye prest yt maye punysh acordinge owne lawe wordes wrote romaynes also vnto demetrius kynge atta • u araba arsaces region samsanes sparta delo mio • sydon caria samos pamphilia lycia alicarnassum ye rhodes faselis coo sida arado gortyna gnydum cypre cyren euery lettre sent copy symon hye prest people iewes antiochus kynge brought host vnto dora seconde tyme take made diuerse ordinaū ce warre kepte triphon yt shulde come forth symon sent antiochus two thousande chosen mē helpe golde syluer plenteous ge •• neuerthelesse wolde receaue brake ye couenaunt made wt symon afore withdrewe frō sent athenobius also frende vnto symon reason sayenge ye witholde fro ioppa gaza wt castell ierusalē city realme whose border ye haue destroyed done greate euell londe hauynge dominaciō many place kyngdome wherfore delyuer ye city ye haue takē wt ye tribute ye place yt ye haue rule vpon without border iewry el geue fyue hūdreth talentes syluer yee harme ye haue done city tribute fyue hundreth talētes yf shal come fight agaynst athenobius kynges frende came ierusalē sawe ye greate worshipe honoure symō golde syluer greate plenty ornamentes marveled tolde symon kynge commaunded answered symon saide vnto v 〈…〉 haue nether taken mēs londe ner witholdē oure father heretage oure enemy vnrighteously possession certayne tyme heretage oure father haue chalenged processe tyme thou cōplaynest concernynge ioppa gaza dyd greate harme people londe yet wyll geue c talentes neuertheles athenobius answered one worde turned agayne wrothfully vnto ye kynge tolde wordes greate dignite symon sene kinge angrie meane tyme fled triphon shippe vnto orthosaida kynge made cendebeus captayne see coost gaue hoost fote men horsmen cōmaundinge remoue ye hoost towarde iewry buylde vp cite cedron make vp ye porte warre agaynst ye people iewes kynge folowed vpon triphon cendebe u came vnto iamnia beganne vexe ye people treade downe iewry take people presoners 〈◊〉 16 b slaye thē buylde vp cedron set horsmē men warre might come forth go thorow stretes iewry like kynge commaunded xvi chapter came ihon vp gaza tolde symon father 〈◊〉 13 f cendebeus done amonge people vpon called symon two eldest sonnes iudas ihon sayde vnto brother father house haue euer oure youth vp vnto daye foughten agaynst enemy israel god gaue v good fortune delyuer israel oft tymes moch olde ye steade brother go forth fight oure people helpe god wt chose xxm fightingemen countre horsmen also wente forth agaynst cendebeus rested modin mornynge arose wēte ye playne felde beholde mightie greate hoost came agaynst thē fotemen horsmen water broke betwixte ihon remoued hoost towarde sawe people afrayed go ouer ye water broke wente ouer first self men seynge folowed ihon set horsmen fote men ordre one enemy horsmen many blewe vp prestes trompettes cendebeus fled wt hoost wherof many slayne remnaunt gat stronge holde iudas also ihōs brother whas woū ded ye tyme ihon folowed still vpon ye enemy till came cedrō buylded1 • enemy fled also vnto towres yt ye feldes azotus dyd ihon burne vp thus slayne ijm men ihon turned agayne peaceably iewry felde iericho ptolomy sonne abobus made captayne abundaunce syluer golde maried doughter symon hye prest waxed proude mynde thought conquere lōde ymageninge falsed agaynst symō sonnes destroye thē symon goynge aboute thorow city yt yt coū tre iewry carynge came downe iericho matathias iudas sonnes clxxvij yeare ye xj moneth called sabat ptolomy ye sonne abobus receaued wt disceate stronge house called doch buylded made bancket symon sonnes mery dronken well ptolomy stode vp wt men whō hyd toke weapens entred banckethouse slewe symon wt two sonnes certayne seruaūtes soch greate vnfaithfulnesse dyd ptolomy israel recōpensed euell good wrote ptolomy ye vnto kynge antiochus requyringe shulde sende hoost helpe shulde delyuer londe wt city tribute sent men also vnto gaza take ihon wrote vnto captaynes come shulde geue syluer golde rewardes ierusalem sent take sanctuary thē ranne one tolde ihon gaza father brother slayne ptolomy sent slaie also whē ihon herde sore abaszshed layed hōdes come destroye slewe knowe wente aboute kyll thinges concernynge ihon warres noble actes wherin behaued self manfully buyldinge walles made dedes written cronicles presthode tyme forth yt made hye prest father ende first boke machabees seconde boke machabees boke conteyneth chap iewes wryte vnto aristobolus clensynge temple feast tabernacle fyre hyd pyt chap ii ieremy requyred iewes preson story chap iii heithē kynges helde temple ierusalem honoure variaunce betwixte simon onias appollonius heliodorus dyd ierusalem punyshment heliodorus chap iiii wickednes symon faithfulnesse onias iason laboureth hye prest wickednesse dryuen awaye alteracion presthode andronicus destroyeth onias god striketh therfore chap v wonderous thinges done ierusalem iason falleth vpon cite handleth abhominably yet fayne fleat last kynge egipte taketh cite agayne greate bloudsheddynge chap vi kynge procedeth forth tyranny well city lawe god kepte ierusalem sendeth god wickednes people stedfastnesse eleazar chap vii death vij brethrē mother constante suffre rather obeye wicked kynge chap viii manlynesse iudas machabeus philippe medleth iudas conforteth people ouercommeth nicanor chap ix antiochus pryde god punyshed chap x machabeus wynneth holy cite agayne clenseth eupator foloweth father antiochus iudas machabeus ordreth self well chap xi lysias purposeth iudas stondeth god taketh parte lysias iudas one chap xii timotheus appolonius ymagin treason iudas machabeus punysheth wynneth caspin city chap xiii antiochus lysias make thē forth agaynst iewes iudas gathereth people byddeth call vpon god goeth besyde modin striketh greate batell chap xiiii demetrius sonne seleucus trayterous dealinge alcimus nicanor breaketh falsely bonde made iudas machabeus mālynes razis chap xv nicanors wicked purpose iudas geueth people godly consolacion dreames vision nicanor perished first chapter brethrē ye iewes ierusalem londe iewry wish vnto brethrē ye iewes thorow egipte good fortune health peace god lorde gracious vnto thynke vpon couenaunt yt made wt abraham isaac iacob faithfull seruauntes geue soch herte 〈…〉 ye maye loue serue yee perfourme wyll whole herte wyllinge mynde opē youre hertes lawe commaundementes sende peace heare youre prayer one neuer forsake tyme trouble heare oure prayer tyme demetrius raigned clxix yeare iewes wrote vnto ye trouble violence came vpon v yeares iason departed holy londe kyngdome brent vp porte shed innocent bloude made oure prayer vnto ye lorde herde offred lighted candels settinge forth cake bred come ye vnto feast tabernacle moneth casleu 〈…〉 clxxxviij yeare ye people yt ierusalem iewry councell iudas sent wholsome salutaciō vnto aristobolus kynge ptolomys master came generacion anoynted prestes iewes egipte moch god hath delyuered v greate parels thanke hylie resisted mightie kynge brought men persis heapes fight agaynst v holy cite persis namely ye captayne wt greate hoost perished temple naneas beynge disceaued thorow deuyce naneas prestes purposed haue dwelt antiochus frēdes came thither receaue moch moneye dowry whē naneas prestes layed forth ye moneye entred small company compasse temple shut temple antiochus entred openynge preuy intraunce temple ye prestes stoned ye captayne death hewed thē peces smote heades threwe thinges god praysed hath delyuered wicked oure hondes purposed kepe purificacion temple vpon ye xxv daye moneth casleu thought necessary certifie therof ye also might kepe tabernacle feast daye daye fyre geuen v nehemias offred set vp ye temple aulter tyme father led awaye vnto persis ye prestes sought honor god toke ye fyre priuely ye aulter hyd valley depe drye pyt therin kepte place vnknowne euery man many yeares pleased god yt nehemias shulde sent kynge persia sent childers child prestes hyd fyre seke 〈◊〉 6 〈◊〉 16 c tolde v founde fyre thicke water thē cōmaunded drawe vp brynge ye offerynges withall ye sacrifice layed ordred prest nehemias commaunded sprenkle wod wt water whē done tyme come yt sonne shone afore hyd cloude greate fyre kyndled moch yt euery man marueled prestes prayed whyle sacrifice makynge ionathas prayed first ye gaue answere nehemias prayer maner lorde god maker thinges thou fearfull stronge thou righteous mercifull thou yt art onely gracious kynge onely lyberall onely iust allmightie euerlastinge thou yt delyuerest israel trouble thou yt hast chosen father halowed receaue offeringe whole people israel preserue thine owne porcion halowe gather together yt scatred abrode v delyuer yt vnder heithēs bondage loke vpon despysed abhorred yt heithen maie knowe se yt thou art god punyshe yt oppresse proudly put v dishonoure set ye people agayne thy holy place 〈…〉 like moses hath spokē prestes songe psalmes thankesgeuynge lōge sacrifice endured sacrifice brent nehemias commaunded greate stone sprenkled wt resydue water 〈…〉 done kyndled flamme thē also consumed thorow light yt shyned aulter whē matter knowne tolde kynge persia place prestes led awaye hyd fyre apeared water steade fyre nehemias company purified sacrifice withall kynge considerynge ponderynge ye matter diligently made temple proue thinge yt done whē founde dede gaue prestes many giftes dyuerse rewardes yee toke wt owne hōde gaue thē nehemias called place nephthar moch saye clensynge many men call nephi ii chapter founde also writinges ieremy prophet yt commaunded caried awaye take fyre sayde afore2 mac 1 cōmaunded also iere 29 b yt shulde forget lawe cōmaundementes lorde yt shulde erre myndes baruc 6 whē se ymages syluer golde wt ornamentes soch thinges commaunded exorted shulde lett lawe god go hertes wrytten also prophet ye commaundement god charged take tabernacle arke wt wente forth vnto mountaine moses clymmed vp sawe ye heretage god deu • 4 ieremy came founde open caue wherin layed tabernacle ye arke aulter incense stopped hole came certayne men together also folowinge marck place coude fynde ieremy perceaued reproued thē sayenge place shalbe vnknowne vntill ye tyme god gather people together againe receaue thē vnto mercy shal god shewe thinges maiesty lorde shall appeare cloude also like shewed vnto moses exo 13 like salomon desyred yt place might sanctified shewed him3 8 b beynge wyse man handled honorably wysely offerynge vnto god ye halowinge temple fynisshed leui 9 like moses prayed vnto lorde fyre came downe heauen consumed burnt offeringe euen prayed salomon also2 par 7 fyre came downe heauen cōsumed burnt offeringe moses sayde syn offerynge eaten therfore cōsumed like maner salomon kepte dedicacion halowynge eight dayes ye annotacions wrytynges reade nehemias ieremy thinges put also made lybrary gathered countrees bokes prophetes dauid epistle kynges presentes euen iudas also loke lerned experiēce warre soch thinges hath happened vnto v gathered thē together haue v yf ye desyre haue sende body fetch vnto whereas thē aboute celebrate purificacion haue written vnto therfore ye shall well yf ye kepe dayes hope also god delyuered people gaue ye heretage kyngdome presthode sanctuary yt promised lawe shal shortly haue mercy vpō v • eut 30 gather v together vnder heauē holy place hath saued v frō greate parels hath clensed place concernynge iudas machabeus brother purificacion greate temple dedicacion aulter yee warres yt cōcerne noble antiochus eupator sonne mac 6 shyninges yt came downe heauen vpon manfully defended iewes though fewe yet defended whole londe droue awaye ye enemy hoost recouered agayne temple yt spoken thorow worlde delyuered cite doynge best yt lawe lorde put downe might wt tranquilite restored agayne vnto lorde yt mercifull vnto thē touchinge iason also cyren haue vnder takē cō pendiously brynge one boke thinges yt cōprehended fyue cōsideringe multitude bokes harde shulde yt wolde medle story actes dyuerse matter haue vnder taken comprehende story soch disposed reade might haue pleasure pastyme therin diligent soch thinges might better thinke vpon yee euer red might haue profit therby neuerthelesse oure selues haue medled matter shortenynge haue taken small laboure greate diligence watchynges trauayle like make feast wolde fayne men pleasure euen also many men sake wel content take laboure maye shortly comprehēde thynges men haue truly wrytten▪ yt buyldeth house new must prouyde many thynges ye whole buyldinge paynteth afterwarde seketh comly mete conuenient garnysh withall euen also like maner begynneth wryte story first must vnderstondinge gather matter together set wordes ordre diligently seke euery parte afterwarde wyll shorten vseth wordes toucheth matter largiest let sufficient prologe wyll begynne shewe matter foolish thinge make longe prologe shorte story self iii chapter tyme holy cite inhabited peace wealth lawes yet well kepte ordened onias hye prest godly men enemy wickednesse came therto euen kynges prynces thē selues dyd place greate worshipe 〈…〉 garnyshed ye temple greate giftes inso moch seleucus kynge asia owne rente bare costes belonginge seruyce offerynges 〈…〉 symon trybe ben iamin ruler temple laboured worke myschefe cite hye prest resisted neuerthelesse might ouercome onias 〈…〉 gat appolonius sonne thersa thē chefe lorde celosyria phenices tolde yt treasury ierusalem full innumerable money comons goodes belonged vnto offeringes exceadinge greate also yee possible might come vnder kynges power appollonius shewed kynge moneye tolde ye kinge called heliodorus stewarde sent commaundement brynge sayde money immediatly heliodorus toke iourney vnder coloure though wolde go thorow celosyria phenices vyset city purpose fulfill kynges pleasure came ierusalem louyngly receaued hye prest cite tolde determed concernynge moneye shewed cause commynge axed also yf dede hye prest tolde soch money layed vp vpholdinge weddowes fatherlesse childrē certayne belonged vnto hyrcanus tobias noble man moneye wicked symon bewrayed iiij hundreth talentes syluer ij hundreth golde yee vnpossible men meaninge disceaued layed vp moneye place temple worshipe thorow whole worlde mayntenaunce honoure ye whervnto heliodorus answered yt kynge commaunded eny wyse brynge moneye daye appoynted heliodorus entred temple ordre matter small feare thorow whole cite prestes fell downe aulter vestimentes called vnto heauen vpon made lawe concernynge stuffe geuen kepe 〈◊〉 22 b shulde safely preserued soch cō mitte vnto kepynge loked hye prest face wolde haue greued herte countenaunce chaunginge coloure declared inwarde sorowe mynde mā heuynesse body feare wherby loked vpon might perceaue grefe herte people also came house heapes vnto comon prayer place like come confucion woman came together thorow stretes hayrie clothes aboute brestes virgin also kepte ranne onias walles loked wyndowes yee helde vp hondes towarde heauē prayed miserable thinge loke vpon comon people hye prest beynge soch trouble besought almightie god goodes committed vnto thē might kepte whole deliuered vnto kepynge neuertheles thinge heliodorus determed perfourmed place self personally beynge aboute treasury men warre sprete allmightie god shewed self openly presumed obeye heliodorus fell thorow ye power god greate fearfulnesse drede apeared vnto horse2 10 • 11 b terrible man syttinge vpon deckte goodly araye horse smote heliodorus fore fete sat vpon ye horse harnesse golde vpon morouer apeared ij fayre beutifull yonge men goodly araye stode scourged sydes gaue many stripe without ceassinge fell heliodorus sodenly vnto grounde2 mac 5 • toke vp beynge compased aboute greate darcknesse bare vpō beare thus came many runner men warre ye sayde treasury borne man might helpe power god manifest knowne laye still domme also power god destitute hope life praysed lorde shewed power vpon place temple litle afore full feare trouble thorow reuelacion allmightie lorde fylled ioye gladnesse thē certaine heliodorus frēdes praied onias haist wolde call vpon god graunte life geuynge vp goost hye prest considered matter lest kynge shulde suspecte iewes done heliodorus euell offred health offerynge whē ye hye prest opteyned peticion yonge mē clothinge apeared stode besyde heliodorus sayenge thanke onias ye hye prest sake hath ye lorde graunted yi life therfore seynge yt god hath scourged ye act 27 c geue prayse thankes shewe euery man might power whē spoken wordes apeared nomore heliodorus offred vnto god made greate vowes vnto graūted life thāked onias toke hoost wēte againe ye kinge thē testified vnto euery mā ye greate workes god yt sene wt eye whē kynge axed heliodorus mete sent yet agayne ierusalem sayde yf thou hast eny enemy aduersary vnto thy realme sende thither thou shalt haue punished yf escape wt life yt place doute speciall power workinge god yt dwelleth heauē vysiteth defendeth yt place yt come harme punysheth plageth thē ye matter cōcerninge heliodorus ye kepinge ye treasury ierusalē iiii chapter symon spake afore beynge bewrayer money owne naturall countre • • reported worst onias though moued heliodorus vnto though bene brynger vp euell thus ashamed call enemie ye realme faithfull ouerseer defender cite people yee feruent lawe god malice symon increased farre yt thorow frendes certayne manslaughter cōmitted onias considered parell yt might come thorow strife appollonius namely chefe lorde celosyria phenices set vpon tyranny symons malice increased gat kynge accuser citesyns one self intended comon wealth whole multitude sawe possible lyue peace nether symon leaue foolishnesse excepte kynge dyd loke therto death seleucus antiochus called noble toke ye kyngdome iason brother onias laboured hye prest came vnto kynge promised thre hundreth lx talentes syluer rētes lxxx talentes besydes promised yet c l yf might haue ye scole ye child might call ierusalem antiochians kynge graunted gotten superiorite begāne immediatly drawe kinsman custome heithen put downe thinges iewes set vp loue ihon father eupolemius sent embassitoure vnto rome make bonde frendshipe loue put downe iawes lyberties iewes set vp wicked statute durst make fightinge scole vnder ye castell set fayre yonge men lerne maners whore brodels begynnynge heithenish straunge cōuersacion brought thorow vngracious vnherde wickednesse iason shulde called prest vngodly personne moch prestes nomore occupide aboute seruyce aulter despysed temple regarded offrynges yee gaue diligēce lerne fight wristle leape daunce put ye stone settynge ye honor ye father liked ye glory grekes best all▪ strous perlously gredy folowe statute yee lust thinges like thē afore enemy destroyer howbeit wickedly agaynst ye lawe god shal escape vnpunyshed shal speake tyme 〈1 paragraph〉 olympiades sportes played tyrus kynge selfe beinge presente vngracious iason sent wicked men bearinge ierusalem called antiochians iijc drachma syluer offerynge hercules caried desyred vnder soch fashiō though shulde haue bene offred bestowed v neuertheles sent sent intent shulde offred vnto hercules present geuen makynge shippes appollonius sonne nesteus sent egipte noble men kynge ptolomy philometor antiochus perceaued yt put medlinge realme sought owne profit departed thence came ioppa ierusalem honorably receaued iason cite brought wt torche light greate prayse turned hoost vnto phenices iij yeare iason sent menelaus fore sayde symons brother beare money vnto ye kynge 〈…〉 bringe answere necessary matter praysed ye kynge magnifienge power turned ye hye presthode vnto self layenge vp iijc talētes syluer iason whē gotten cōmaundemētes ye kynge came hauinge nothinge yt becōmeth prest bearinge ye stomack cruell tyraunte wrath wylde brute beest 〈…〉 iason disceaued owne brother seynge yt self begyled also fayne fle ye lōde ye ammonite menelaus gat ye dominiō ye moneye yt promised vnto kynge dyd nothinge therin sostratus ruler ye castell requyred sostratus man yt gathered ye customes wherfore called kynge thus menelaus put ye presthode lysimachus brother came steade sostratus also made lorde cyprian happened ye meane season yt ye tharsians mallocians made insurreciō geuen present vnto kynge antiochus concubyne came ye kinge ye haist still agayne pacifie matter leauynge andronicus debyte one mete therfore menelaus supposinge gotten right convenient tyme stole certayne vessel golde temple gaue thē andronicus present solde tyrus city therby onias knewe suertye reproued kepte santuary besyde daphnis lyeth antioche wherfore menelaus gat andronicus prayed wolde slaye onias came onias counceled craftely come santuary geuynge honde ooth suspecte thē slewe onias without eny regarde rightuousnesse cause iewes nacions also toke indignacion displeased vnrightuous death godly man kynge come agayne cilicia iewes certaine grekes wente vnto complayninge vnrightuous death onias yee antiochus also sory mynde onias yt pitied wepte remembringe sobernesse manerly hauoure wherfore kyndled mynde yt cōmaunded andronicus striped purple clothinge led thorow cite yee ye vngracious man slayne ye place committed wickednes vpon onias thus ye lorde rewarded punyshment deserued lysimachus done many wycked dedes ye temple thorow councell menelaus voyce came abrode multitude gathered thē together agaynst lisimachus caried moch golde people arose full displeasure lisimachus armed iijm vnthriftes defende certayne tyraunte beynge captayne growen age woodnesse people vnderstode purpose lysimachus gat stone good stronge clubbes cast aszshes vpon lisimachus thus many thē wounded beynge slayne chaced awaye yt wicked churchrobber kylled besyde treasury matter therfore kepte courte agaynst menelaus ye kinge came tyrus made cōplaynte vnto menelaus concerninge busynesse ye embassitours thre menelaus wente promised ptolomy geue moch money yf wolde persuade kynge ptolomy wēte kinge courte set coole brughte yt mynde moch yt discharged menelaus frō ye accusacions yt withstondinge cause myschefe poore men yf tolde cause yee scythian shulde
