haue iudged innocēt thē cōdēned death thus one punyshed folowed vpō ye matter ye cite ye people ye holy vessell wherfore tyrus toke indignacion buried thē honorably thorow ye covetousnesse power menelaus remayned still authorite increasinge malyce hurte citesyns v chapter ye tyme antiochus made ready go againe egipte thē sene ierusalem xl dayes lōge horsmē runninge fro ayre rayment golde speares sene also whole hoostes mē weapened horse runnynge ordre came together helde forth shildes ye harnessed men drew sweardes shot dartes shyne ye goldē weapēs sene maner armure wherfore euerymā prayed yt token might turne good whē gone forth false rumo though antiochus bene deed iason toke mē came sodēly vpō ye cite citesyns rā ne vnto ye walles ye last ye cite taken menelaus fled castell iason spared owne citesyns slaughter nether considered greate euell destroye ye prosperite owne kynsmen dyd one gotten victory enemy frendes gatt superiorite last receaued confucion malice fled agayne like vagabunde londe ammonites2 4 fynally rewarde wickednesse accused aretha kynge arabian moch fayne fle cite cite beynge despysed euery man forsaker lawes abhominable personne ye last open enemy owne naturall countre citesyns dryuen egipte thus yt afore put many owne natyue londe peryshed home self wente lacedemon thinkinge haue gotten sucoure reason kynrede afore casten many one vnburied throwen self man mournynge ner puttinge graue nether enioyed ye buriall straunger nether partaker father sepulcre done kinge suspecte yt iewes wolde haue fallen wherfore came greate displeasure egipte toke cite violence cōmaunded men warre also mac 1 c shulde kyll spare slaye downe soch wt stode clymmed vp vpō ye house thus greate slaughter yonge men olde men woman child virgin iij dayes slayne lxxx fourty thousande put preson lesse solde yet cōtent wt durst go holy temple menelaus traytoure ye lawes owne naturall countre beynge gyde wicked hondes toke ye holy vessell kynges city geuen thither ye garnishinge hono ye place thē toke hōdes vnworthely defyled madd antiochus considered god litle wroth synnes dwelt cite soch confucion came vpon place • dit 5 yf happened haue bene lapped many synnes antiochus soone come sodenly bene punished shot presumpciō • like heliodorus seleucus kynge sente robbe ye treasury neuertheles god hath chosen people place sake place people sake therfore place become partaker people trouble afterwarde shall enioye wealth like forsaken wrath allmighty god greate god reconcyled shal set vp hye worshipe agayne antiochus taken viij c talentes temple gat antioche haist thinkinge pryde might make mē sale vpon drye londe go vpon ye see soch hye mynde lefte debites vexe people ierusalem left philippe phrigian maners cruell thē yt set garisim left andronicus menelaus greuous citisyns thus set malyce agaynst ye iewes sent appollonius hated prynce wt xxijm cō maundinge slaye yt perfecte age sell womē maydes child came ierusalem fained peace kepte still vntill ye sabbath daye cōmaunded men take weapens ye iewes kepte holy daye slewe yt gone forth open playe runninge thorow cite men wapened murthured greate nombre iudas machabeus tenth fled wyldernesse1 mac •• led life company amonge wylde beestes vpon mountaynes dwellinge eatinge grasse lest shulde partaker fylthynesse vi chapter longe sent kynge messaunger antioche1 mac •• compell ye iewes altre ye ordinaunces ye father lawe god defyle temple yt ierusalem call tē ple iupiter olimpius yt shulde gazarim dwell ye place iupiter harberous wicked sediciō ye vngodly heuy vpon ye people ye temple full voluptuousnes bebbinge bollinge ye heithē ribaudes harlottes together womē wente ye holy place bare laufull aulter also full vnlaufull thinges ye lawe forbyddeth laye vpō sabbathes kepte solempne feastes ye londe regarded plaine durst mā knowne iewe daye kynges byeth compelled perforce offre ye feast bachus kepte cōstrayned weere garlandes yven go aboute honoure bachus morouer thorow councell ptolomy wente commaundement ye nexte city heithen yt shulde intreate iewes like maner namely cō pell thē sacrifice ye lawes ye gentile wolde put death piteous thinge se ij woman accused haue circumcided sonnes • mac 1 f led rounde aboute cite babe hanginge brestes cast downe headlinges ouer walles yt crepte dennes kepte sabbath accused vnto philippe brent fyre feare god kepte commaūdement stiffly wolde defende selues beseke reade boke refuse falles aduersite iudge thinges yt happened destruccion chastenynge people whē god suffreth synners longe folowe owne mynde 〈◊〉 3 b shortly punysheth tokē greate louynge kyndnes grace haue god people yt suffreth v longe synne vnpunyshed like nacions daye iudgment commeth maye punysh thē fulnes synnes yf synne correcketh v neuer withdraweth mercy frō v though punysh wt aduersite yeth doth neuer forsake people let haue spokē wt wordes warninge exortaciō ye heithē wil come declaringe matter eleazar one ye principall scribe aged mā welfauored coūtenaūce cōstrained gape wt opē mouth eate swynes flesh 〈…〉 desyringe rather dye gloriously thē liue wt shame offred willīgly ye martirdome whē sawe yt must nedes go toke paciētly poynte wt yt wolde consente vnlaufull thynge eny pleasure life yt stode beynge moued wt pyte right ye olde frendshipe man toke asyde priuely prayed yt wolde let soch flesh brought laufull eate thē make coūtenaūce though eaten ye flesh ye sacrifice like kynge commaunded might delyuered death olde frendshipe ye man shewed kindnes beganne considre discrete honorable age noble worshipfull stocke yt frō youth vp bene honest good conuersacion yee constantly kepte ye ordinaunces lawes commaūded god wherfore gaue answere sayde yet rather first layed graue1 te 5 c becommeth myne age sayde eny wyse dyssemble wherby many yonge personnes might thinke eleazar beinge lxxx yeare olde ten gone straunge life thorow myne ypocrisy litle tyme transitory life might disceaued meanes also shulde defyle myne age make abhominable though delyuered tormentes men yet shulde escape honde allmightie god amos 1 nether alyue ner deed wherfore dye manfully becommeth myne age wherby maie peraduenture leaue exāple stedfastnesse soch yonge yf wt ready mynde manfully dye honest death worthy holy lawes sayde wordes immediatly drawen tormēte led mylde litle afore beganne take displeasure wordes yt sayde thought spokē hye mynde whē martirdome mourned sayde thou lorde hast holy knowlege knowest openly might delyuered frō death suffre sore paynes body mynde wel contente suffre feare thus man dyed leauynge ye memoriall death example vnto yonge men vnto ye people stedfast manly vii chapter happened also vij brother mother taken leuit 11 • compelled kynge agaynst lawe eate swynes flesh namely wt scourge lethren whippes one ye chefe sayde sekest thou requyrest thou v v ready rather suffre death offende lawes god father kynge angrie bad heare cauldron brasen pottes made hote immediatly commaunded ye tonge spake first cut pull skynne ouer heade payre edge handes fete yee sight mother brother cleane marred commaunded fyre made whyle eny breath fryed caudron bene longe payned brother mother exorted dye manfully sayēge lorde god shal regarde treuth comforte v like moses testifieth declareth songe deut 18 • sayenge wyl haue compassion seruauntes whē first deed maner brought seconde haue derision pulled skynne hayre ouer heade axed yf wolde eate swynes flesh payned ye membres also thorow body answered boldly sayde tormented like ye first whē euē ye geuinge vp ye goost sayde thou vngracious personne puttest v death kynge ye worlde shall rayse v vp dye lawes ye resurreccion euerlastinge life thirde derision requyred putt tonge right soone holdinge forth hondes manfully spake stedfast faith haue heauē lawe god despyse trust shall receaue agayne moch kynge marueled yonge man boldnesse nothinge regarded paynes deed also vexed fourth tormentes like maner death sayde better beynge put death mē haue oure hope trust god shal rayse v vp agayne ioh 5 c thou shalt haue resurreccion life spoken fifth tormēted loked vnto ye kinge sayde thou hast power amōge mē thou art mortall man also yi self thou wilt thinke yt god hath forsaken generacion abyde tary styll whyle thou shalt se greate power god wil punysh thy sede brought sixte beynge poynte death sayde disceaued kynge suffre oure owne sake haue offended oure god therfore marvelous thinges shewed vpon v thinke thou takest honde stryue agaynst god thou shalt escape vnpunyshed excellent mother worthy well reported remembraunce sawe hir seuen sonnes dye one daye suffred paciētly hope god yee exorted euery one especiall boldly stedfastly wt parfite wyszdome wakynge vp hir wyuysh thought manly stomacke sayde vnto tell ye came wombe nether gaue breth ner soule ner life yt ioyned yt mēbres yo body together ye maker ye worlde fashioned ye byrth mā begāne thinges euen also owne mercy shall geue breath life agayne like ye regarde youre owne selues lawes sake thought antiochus despysed therfore let go hir reproues beganne exorte yongest sonne yet left wt wordes swore vnto wt ooth yt shulde make rich welthy man yf wolde forsake ye lawes father yee yt shulde geue euer necessary whē yonge man wolde moued thinges called mother counceled saue hir sonnes life exorted many wordes promised shulde speake vnto hir sonne turned vnto laughinge ye cruell tyraunte scorne spake wt boylde voyce sonne haue pite vpon yt bare ye ix monethes wombe gaue sucke norished brought vp vnto age beseke sonne loke vpon heauen earth therin considre god made man generacion naught shalt thou feare hangman suffre death stedfastly like thy brother haue done maye receaue agayne mercy thy brother whyle yet speakynge wordes yonge man sayde loke ye for▪ wherfore ye tary wil obeye kynges commaundement lawe god gaue v moses 〈…〉 ymaginest myschefe agaynst iewes thou shalt escape honde god suffre thinges oure synnes though god angrie v litle whyle chasteninge reformacion yet shal one agayne wt seruauntes thou shamefull abhominable personne pryde thy self thorow vayne hope beynge malicious vpon ye seruauntes god thou hast yet escaped iudgmēt god mighty seyth thinges brother yt haue suffred litle payne vnder couenaunt euerlastinge life thorow iudgment god thou shalt punyshed righteously thy pryde like brethrē haue done offre soule body ye lawes father callinge vpon god yt soone mercifull vnto people yee wt payne punyshment make graunte 〈…〉 yt god brethrē ye wrath allmighty god ende righteously fallē vpon people ye kynge beynge kyndled anger cruell vpon vpon ye toke indignaciō yt lighty regarded yonge mā dyed vndefiled put trust stil ye lorde last ye sonnes ye mother put death also let ynough spoken concernynge ye offringes extreme cruelnesse viii chapter iudas machabeus yt wt wēte pryuely ye townes called kinsfolkes frendes together toke vnto soch contynued yet faith lawe ye iewes brought forth vjm men called vpon lorde yt wolde haue eye vnto people troddē downe euery mā gracious vnto ye tēple yt defyled vngodly haue cōpassion vpon ye destruccion cite shortly like laied waist heare ye voyce ye bloude yt cried vnto remē bre ye vnrighteous deathes yonge innocent child blasphemy also done vnto name punysh thē whē machabeus gathered multitude together 〈…〉 mightie heithen ye wrath ye lorde turned mercy fell vpon townes city vnawarres brent toke cōmodious place slewe many enemy specially made soch chase night moch manlynesse spoken euery philippe sawe man increased litle litle matter prospered parte wrote vnto ptolomy captayne celosiria phenices helpe ye kinges busynes thē sent nicanor patrocli speciall frende ye haist1 mac 3 • gaue ye comon sorte heithen lesse xx harnessed men rote ye whole generacion iewes hauinge helpe one gorgias man warre matter concernynge battayls greate experience nicanor ordened also tribute romaynes shulde haue geuen vnto kynge captiuyte iewes namely ijm talentes immediatly sent ye city ye see coost requyringe thē bye iewes seruauntes bonde men promisynge sell lxxx ten one talente considered wrath allmighty god yt come vpon iudas knewe tolde iewes yt wt nicanors cōmynge fearfull trustinge vnto rightuousnes god fled waye yt remayned came together besought lorde delyuer thē frō yt wicked nicanor solde thē euer came nye though wolde sake yet couenaunt made wt father called vpon holy glorious name1 mac 5 b machabeus called men together namely aboute vim exortinge agree vnto enemy nether afrayed ye multitude aduersaries cōmynge agaynst vnrighteously fight manly deut • 0 • 2 pa • 0 c consideringe ye reprofe done holy place without cause despysed oppressed cite yee destroyed ye lawes father sayde trust weapens boldnesse iere 17 b psal 19 b oure confidence allmighty lorde twincklinge eye maye destroye come agaynst v worlde exorted also call remēbraū ce helpe god shewed vnto fathers4 19 g esa 37 f 1 mac 7 • whē perished c lxxxvm sennacherib people ye battaill yt babilō agaynst ye galacians yt macedoniās yt came helpe thē stode feare beynge vjm slewe c xxm thorow ye helpe yt geuen heauen wherby also receaued many benefites thorow wordes ye mē toke good hertes vnto thē ready dye lawe coūtre set vpon euery cōpany captayne one owne brother simon ioseph ionathas geuynge ech one xvc men caused eszdras also reade holy boke vnto geue token helpe god beinge captaine ye fore front battayll1 4 b buckled nicanor god helpe moch slewe aboue ixm mē compelled ye parte nicanors hoost fle wounded feable thus toke money came bye thē folowed vpon euery syde whē tyme came vpon returned sabbath therfore folowed nomore vpon toke weapens spoyles kepte sabbath geuynge thankes vnto lorde delyuered daye shewed mercy sabbath distributed spoyles sicke ye fatherlesse num 31 1 30 e deu 20 b wyddowes residue selues whē done made generall prayer besought mercifull lorde one seruauntes also timotheus bachides fought agaynst slewe xxm wanne hye stronge holdes deuided moo spoyles euer geuynge equall porcion vnto ye sicke ye fatherles wyddowes aged person diligently gathered weapēs together layed convenient place remnaunt ye spoyles brought ierusalem slewe philarches wicked personne timotheus vexed many iewes helde thankesgeuyng▪ ierusalem victory brent set fyre porte temple namely calisthenes fled house gat worthy rewarde wickednesse vngracious nicanor brought thousande marchaūtes bye iewes thorow ye helpe lorde brought downe euen regarded moch put glorious raymēt fled see came alone antioche wt greate shame dishonor gat thorow destruccion hoost thus yt promysed romaynes paye thē tribute toke ierusalem beganne saye planely god ye defender iewes therfore possible wounde folowed ye lawes god made ix chapter tyme came antiochus agayne dishonoure persis 〈…〉 came persepolis vndertoke robbe temple subdue cite people ranne together defended selues moch yt fayne fle shame flight happened antiochus came agayne dishonoure came egbathana gat knowlege happened vnto nicanor timotheus auauncinge wrath thought able avenge iniury done vpon iewes therfore commaunded make ready charet haistinge iourney without ceassinge iudgmēt god prouokynge spokē proudly wolde come ierusalem make graue iewes lorde god israel seith thinges 〈…〉 smote invisible plage man coude heale soone spoken wordes came vpon horrible payne bowel sore grefe tharmes yt right martired men bowel dyuerse straū ge tormentes wolde wyse ceasse malice yee yet prouder malicious agaynst iewes whyle commaundinge make haist matter happened yt fell downe violently charet yt brussed body dyd greate payne thought might commaunde ye floudes see proude beyonde condiciō man weye hye mountaynes payre scoales brought downe grounde caried vpon horszlytter knowlegynge ye manyfest power god vpon yt wicked body full wormes 〈…〉 payne fell quyck flesh moch yt hoost greued smell styncke thus litle afore thought might reach starres heauen might man abyde ner beare vehemence styncke therfore beynge brought greate pryde begāne come ye knowlege self punyshment god warned payne increased euer self might abyde owne styncke sayde wordes reason obedient vnto god man desyre like vnto wicked personne prayed also vnto lorde shulde haue optained mercy cite came vnto haistely brynge downe grounde make graue deed men desyreth delyuer fre touchinge ye iewes iudged worthy buried wolde haue cast thē deuoured foules wylde beastes sayenge wolde haue destroyed olde yonge promiseth make thē like ye citesyns athens spoyled holy temple afore maketh promyse garnish greate giftes increase holy ornamētes owne rente beare costes charge belonginge offerynges yee wolde also become iewe self go thorow euery place worlde preach power god paynes wolde ceasse righteous iudgmet god come vpon despayre wrote vnto iewes lettre intercession cō teyninge wordes kynge prynce antiochus wysheth vnto vertuous citesyns iewes moch health good prosperite yf ye youre child fare well yf thinges go youre mynde geue greate thankes sicknesse also remembre louyngly came persia taken sore disease thought necessary care comon wealth nether despare self haue good hope escape sicknes considerynge father led hoost tyme ye hyer place shewed shulde raigne yf happened eny cōtrouersy eny harde thinge declared londe might knowe chefe lorde yt shulde insurreccion agayne pondre self ye mightie men neghbours rounde aboute layēge waite loke oportunyte harme haue ordened sonne antiochus shall raigne oft commended many hyer kyngdomes haue wrytten vnto foloweth herafter therfore praye requyre remembre benefites haue done vnto generally especiall hope shall sober louynge behauoure yf folowe deuyce shal indifferent vnto thus murthurer blasphemer god sore smyttē 〈…〉 like intreated men dyed myserable death straunge countre vpon mountayne body dyd philippe wē te cary awaye fearynge sonne antiochus wente egipte ptolomy philometor x chapter machabeus company thorow helpe lorde wanne temple cite agayne1 mac 4 destroyed aulters chapel heithē buylded thorow stretes exo 20 clensed temple made another aulter bricke stone ij yeares offered sacrifice set forth incense lightes shewe bred done fell downe flat vpon grounde besought lorde might come nomore soch trouble yf synned eny agaynst self chasten mercy come hondes aleauntes blasphemous men vpon daye ye straungers poluted temple happened daye clensed agayne namely1 mac 4 • xxij daye moneth called casleu kepte viij dayes gladnesse like feast tabernacle remembrynge longe afore helde feast ye tabernacle vpon mountaynes dennes like beastes ye token bare grene bowes braunches palmes geuen good fortune clense place agreed also together made statute yt euery yeare dayes shulde solemply kepte people iewes antiochus called noble dyed sufficiently tolde wil speake nicanor sonne wicked antiochus happened wordes comprehende aduersite chaunsed ye warres taken kyngdome made one lysias bene captayne hoost phenices syria ruler ouer matter realme ptolomy called macron beynge ruler iewes specially syt iudgment soch wronge done vnto vndertoke deale peaceably cause accused frendes eupator suspecte traytoure left cypers philometor committed vnto departed noble antiochus come vnto poysoned dyed gorgias gouernoure place toke straungers vndertoke oft tymes warre ye iewes morouer idumeans helde strō ge holdes receaued dryuen ierusalem toke honde warre also machabeus besought prayed vnto lorde • mac 5 wolde helper fell stronge holdes idumeans wanne many place strength soch came agaynst slew kylled lesse together twentye thousande neuerthelesse lesse nyn • thousande fled two stronge towres hauynge maner ordinaunce withstonde machabeus leauynge symon iosephus zachaus many wente besege thē fight nede symon beynge led couetousnesse intreated money thorow certayne laye tower toke lxxm drachma let escape tolde machabeus happened called ye captaynes people together accusynge personnes solde brother money let enemy go slewe traytours immediatly wente honde ij tower ordred selues manly weapens hondes slewe ye two castels moo thē twētie thousande timotheus iewes ouercome afore 〈…〉 gathered multitude straunge people brought hoost also horsmen asian wynne iewry strength drewe nye machabeus wt fell prayer sprencled aszshes vpon heades 〈…〉 beynge gyrded wt hayrie cloth aboute loines fel downe ye aulter besought lorde wolde mercifull enemie vnto enemy take parte agaynst aduersaries acordinge promised lawe prayer 〈…〉 wente cite came nye enemy prepared selues agaynst tymes mornynge ye breake daye hoostes buckled together one parte lorde refuge 〈…〉 geuer prosperite strēgth victory mā ly stomack captayne warre battayll beynge greate apeared vnto enemy heauen v men • eg 6 〈◊〉 3 〈◊〉 1 • b vpon horszback brydels golde ledinge iewes two hauynge machabeus betwixte yt kepte safe euery syde wt weapēs shot dartes lighteninges vpon enemy thorow confounded blyndnesse sore afrayed fell downe slayne fote men twenty thousande fyue hundreth sixe hū dreth horsmen timotheus self fled vnto gazar strōge holde wherin cereas captayne machabeus company layed sege cherfully iiij dayes within trustinge strength place cursed banned exceadingly made greate crakynge wicked wordes neuerthelesse vpon fifth daye mornynge xx yongemen machabeus cōpany beynge set fyre myndes blasphemy came manfully vnto wall bolde stomackes companyons clymmed vp vpon towres vndertakynge set fyre vpon porte burne blasphemous personnes quycke two dayes destroyenge castell founde timotheus crepte corner kylled slewe cereas brother like maner appollophanes done sunge psalmes prayses thankesgeuynges vnto lorde done greate thinges israel geuen victory xi chapter longe lysias kynges stewarde kynsman gouernaunce matter toke sore displeasure thinges happened gathered lxxxm men fote hoost horsmen came agaynst iewes thinkynge wynne cite make habitacion heithen temple wolde haue house lucre 〈…〉 like goddes house heithē sell ye prestes office euery yeare consideringe power god wylde mynde trustinge ye multitude fote mē 〈…〉 thousandes horsmē lxxx elephantes came iewry bethsura castell defence lyenge narow place v furlonges ierusalē wanne machabeus company knew stronge holdes taken2 10 e fell prayer wepynge teares lorde people like maner besought wolde sende good angell delyuer israel machabeus self first made ready battayll exortynge ioperde selues helpe brethrē goyenge forth ierusalem together ready wyllynge mynde2 mac 3 apeared thē vpon horszbacke mā whyte clothinge harnesse golde shakinge speare praysed ye lorde together shewed mercy conforted myndes moch ready fight men ye cruell beestes yee runne thorow walles yron thus wente wyllingly hauynge helper heauē lorde mercifull vnto fell mightely vpon enemy like lyon brought downe xjm fote men xvjc horsmen put ye flight many beynge wounded gat awaye naked yee lysias self fayne fle shamefully escape neuerthelesse man vnderstondinge considered self power mynished pondred ye iewes beynge defended helpe allmighty god able ouercome wherfore sent worde promised wolde consente thinges reasonable make kynge frēde prayer lysias machabeus agreed sekynge thinges comon wealth euer machabeus wrote vnto lysias cōcernynge iewes kynge graunted lettres writtē vnto ye iewes lysias conteynynge wordes lysias sendeth gretinge people iewes ihon absalon sent delyuered wrytinges requyred fulfill thinges concernynge earande therfore loke might graunted certified ye kynge therof euer conuenient agreed therto yf ye wyll faithfull matter shal endeuer self herafter also good concernynge thinges euery article therof haue committed youre messaungers sent vnto comon fare ye well hūdreth xlviij yeare xxiiij daye moneth dioscorinthius kynges lettre conteyned wordes kynge antiochus sendeth gretinge vnto brother lysias2 9 b moch oure father deed oure wyll oure realme lyue without eny insurreccion euery man diligent owne matter vnderstonde also iewes wolde consent oure father brought vnto custome gentile stiffly kepe owne statute cause requyre v also let remayne still owne lawes wherfore oure minde people shalbe rest haue concluded determed also restore temple agayne maye lyue acordinge vse custome forefather thou shalt v pleasure therfore yf thou sende vnto agre certified oure mynde maye good chere loke owne wealth lettre kynge wrote vnto iewes kynge antiochus sendeth gretinge vnto councell people iewes yf ye fare well haue oure desyre v good health menelaus came tolde v yt youre desyre come downe youre people v wherfore wyll come geue fre lyberte vnto xxx daye moneth aprill maye vse ye meates iewes owne lawes like afore none eny maner wayes haue harme thinges done ignoraunce menelaus haue sent vnto shal comon large fare ye well cxlviij yeare xv daye moneth aprill romaynes also sent lettre conteynynge wordes quintus mennius titus mamlius embassatours romaynes sende gretinge vnto people iewes loke lysias kynges kynsman hath graunted graunte also concernynge thinges referred vnto kynge sende hither spede pōdre mat • er diligētly amonge youre selues maye cast ye best youre profite must departe vnto antioche therfore wryte shortly agayne maye knowe youre mynde fare well hundreth xlviij yeare ye xv daye moneth aprill xii chapter couenauntes made lysias wente vnto kynge ye iewes tylled grounde timotheus appollonius sonne gemei ierome demophon ye proude nicanor ye captayne cypers laye place wolde let lyue rest peace ioppa also dyd euen soch shamefull dede prayed ye iewes dwelt amōge go wyues child shippes prepared dyd though ought euell wyll moch gone forth generall proclamaciō thorow ye cite peace consented therto suspecte nothinge gone forth depe drowned lesse ijc whē iudas knew cruelte shewed vnto people commaunded make ready exortinge call vpon god righteous iudge wēte forth agaynst murthurers brethrē set fyre ye hauen night brent vp ye shippes escaped fyre slewe swearde done departed though wolde come agayne rote ioppa gottē worde iamnites mynded like maner vnto ye iewes dwelt amonge came vpon iamnites night set fyre hauen shippes light fyre sene ierusalem vpon iic xl furlonges gone thence ix furlonges iourney towarde timotheus v thousande men fote v hundreth horsmen arabian fought batell earnest prospered iudas thorow helpe god ye residue arabian beynge ouercome besought iudas one promised geue certayne pasture good thinges iudas thynkynge shulde indede profitable concernynge many thynges promised peace whervpon shoke hondes departed tentes iudas wente also vnto cite fast kepte wt brydges fensed rounde aboute walles dyuerse kyndes people dwellinge therin called caspin within put soch trust strength walles stoare vytales slacker doynges cursinge reuylinge iudas blasphemy speakynge soch wordes becommeth machabeus callynge vpon greate prynce ye worlde without eny battayll rammes ordinaunce warre dyd cast downe walles iericho 〈…〉 tyme iosue fell manfully vpon walles toke cite thorow helpe lorde made exceadinge greate slaughter moch lake ij furlōges brode laye therby semed flowe bloude slayne departed thence vijc l furlonges came taraca vnto ye iewes called tubianei timotheus coude get one matter dispatched departed thence lefte certayne men stronge holde dositheus sosipater captaynes machabeus slewe yt timotheus lefte house defence euen xm men machabeus prepared ye vjm men yt aboute set ordre company wente forth agaynst timotheus c xxm men fote ijm vc horsmē timotheus knowlege iudas commynge sent woman child baggage vnto castell called carnion coude wonne harde come vnto wayes place narow iudas cō pany came first sight enemy smytten feare thorow presence god seyth thinges moch yt fleynge one another rather discomfited owne people iudit 7 f 1 14 • 2 pa 20 • woūded wt stroke owne sweardes iudas also earnest folowinge vpon punyshinge vngodly slewe xxxm men timotheus also fell hondes dositheus sosipater besought many prayer let go life many iewes father brother preson yf put death might disapoynted promised faithfully delyuer agayne acordinge condicion made let go without harme health ye brother iudas slayne xxvm wente carnion yt chased awaye slayne enemy remoued hoost towarde ephron strōge cite1 mac 5 • wherin dwelt many dyuerse people heithen ye stronge yonge men kepte walles defendinge thē mightely cite moch ordinaunce prouysion dartes2 10 • iudas company called vpon allmighty god wt power breaketh strength enemy wanne cite slew xxvm yt within thence wente cite scythian lieth vjc furlonges ierusalem ye iewes cite testified cite syns dealte louyngly yee intreated kyndly ye tyme aduersite iudas company gaue made people euer defended owne porcion euydent token wolde preserue still commaundement captayne remoued thence came towne called dessasan symon iudas brother fell honde nicanor thorow sodane commynge enemy afrayed neuertheles nicanor hearinge manlynes iudas ye bolde stomackes fight naturall countre durst proue matter bloudsheddinge wherfore sent possidonius theodocius mathias geue take peace taken longe advysement vpon captayne shewed vnto multitude agreed one mynde haue peace appoynted daye syt vpon matter quyetly amonge selues ye stole also brought set forth neuerthelesse iudas cōmaunded certaine men armes waite conueniēt place lest shulde sodenly aryse eny euell thorow enemy commoned reasonably together nicanor whyle abode ierusalem ordred vnreasonably sent awaye people gathered together loued iudas euer hert fauoured prayed also take wyfe brynge forth child maried lyued rest led comon life alcimus perceauynge loue betwixte agreed together came demetrius tolde nicanor taken straunge matter honde ordened iudas enemy realme kynges successoure kinge sore displeased thorow wicked accusation alcimus made nicanor prouoked wrote vnto nicanor sayenge angrie frendshipe agrement made machabeus neuertheles commaunded haist shulde take machabeus presoner sende antioche lettres nicanor sene wittes ende sore greued shulde breake thinges wherin agreed specially seynge machabeus man neuer dyd harme might withstonde kynge sought oportunite fulfil commaundement notwithstondinge machabeus sawe nicanor beganne churlish vnto intreated rughly wonte perceaued soch vnkyndnes came good therfore gathered men withdrewe frō nicanor knewe machabeus manfully preuented came greate holy temple commaunded prestes doynge vsuall offeringes delyuer man sware coude tell mā whō sought stretched honde made ooth sayenge yf ye wyll delyuer iudas captyue 〈…〉 shall remoue temple god playne felde shal breake downe aulter consecrate tēple vnto bachus wordes departed prestes lift vp hondes towarde heauen besought euer defender people sayenge thou lorde hast nede nothinge woldest temple thy habitacion shulde amonge v therfore holy lorde kepe house euer vndefyled lately clensed 〈…〉 accused vnto nicanor one razis alderman ierusalem louer whole cite man good reporte kynde hert bare vnto people called father ye iewes man oft tymes iewes mynded kepe selues vndefyled defended delyuered beynge content stedfastly spende body life people nicanor wyllinge declare hate bare iewes sent fyue hundreth men take thought yf gat shulde brynge iewes greate decaye people beganne ruszshe house breake dores set fyre beynge taken wolde haue defended swearde chosinge rather dye manfully yelde himselfe wicked doer noble stocke rather haue bene put extreme cruelte notwithstondynge tyme myssed stroke haist multitude fell violently betwixte dores rāne boldly ye wall cast downe manfully amonge heape gaue soone place fall fell vpon bely neuerthelesse whyle yet breath within kyndled mynde whyle bloude guszshed exceadingly sore wounded ranne thorow myddest ye people gat toppe rocke bloude gone toke owne bowel hondes threw vpon people callinge vpon lorde life sprete rewarde agayne dyed xv chapter nicanor knewe iudas countre samaria 〈…〉 thought power strike felde vpon kepte sayde yee lyuynge god mightie lorde heauen commaunded seuenth daye kepte 〈…〉 sayde mightie vpon earth commaunde arme selues perfourme kynges busynesse notwithstondinge might haue purpose nicanor deuysed greate pryde ouercome iudas brynge awaye ye victory machabeus euer fast confidēce parfecte hope god wolde helpe exorted people afrayed commynge heithen allwaye remembre helpe bene shewed vnto heauen yee sure also yt allmightie god wolde geue victory spake vnto lawe prophetes puttinge remembraunce battayls striken afore made good corage harte plucte vp shewed also disceatfulnesse heithen wolde kepe couenaunt ner ooth thus weapened thē armoure shylde speare wholsome wordes exortacions shewed dreame also wherthorow made glad thought sawe onias bene hye prest vertuous louynge man sad honest conuersacion well spoken nee bene exercised godlynes frō childe holdinge vp hōdes towarde heauen prayenge people apeared vnto another mā aged honorable glorious onias sayde louer brother generacions byrth christ thys wyse mother mary maried ioseph 〈◊〉 befo •• 〈◊〉 hom •• togethe • came together luc 1 b foūde chylde ye holy goost ioseph huszbande perfect man wolde bringe shame mynded put awaie secretely neuertheles whyle thus thought beholde angell lorde appered vnto dreame saynge ioseph thou sonne dauid feare take vnto mary thy wyfe cōceaued ye holy goost shall brynge forth sonne thou shalt call name iesus phi 2 act 4 • shall saue people synnes done yt thinge might fulfilled spoken lorde prophet saynge beholde mayde shall chylde esa 7 c shall brynge forth sonne shall call name emanuel interpretacion god wt v whan ioseph awoke slepe angell ye lorde bade hym toke wyfe vnto hym knewe tyll brought forth hir fyrst borne sonne called name iesus luc 2 • ii chapter iesus borne bethleē iury tyme herode▪ kynge beholde came wysemen east ierusalē saynge new borne kynge iues haue sene starre east come worship herode ye kynge herde thys troubled ierusalē hym gathered hye prestes scribe ye people axed christ shulde borne sayde vnto hym bethleem iury thus written prophet thou bethleem londe iury mich 5 art leest amonge prince iuda • ohan 7 ye shall come vnto captayne shall gouerne people israel herod preuely called wyse men dyligently enquyred tyme starre appered sent bethleem sainge go searche dyligently chylde ye haue founde hym bringe worde agayne maye come worshippe hym also heard kynge departed lo starre sawe east went tyll came stode ouer place chylde sawe starre maruelously glad went house found chylde mary mother kneled downe worshipped hym opened ther treasure psal 71 b • sa 60 offred vnto hym gyftes gold franckynsence myrre warned god dreame shuld go ageine herod returned awne countre another waye departed beholde angell lorde appered ioseph dreame sayinge aryse take chylde▪ mother flye egypte abyde tyll brynge worde • xo 4 rod wyl seke chylde destroye hym thē arose toke chylde mother night departed egypte vnto ye deeth herod thinge might fulfylled spokē lorde prophet sayeth • zeae 11 • u • 4 b egypte haue called sonne herod perceauynge yt disceaued wyse men excedynge wroth sent forth slue chyldren bethleem coastes many two yere olde vnder accordynge tyme diligently searched wyse men • ere 31 c yt fulfilled spoken ye prophet ieremy sayinge ye hilles voyce herde greate mournynge wepynge lamentacion rachel wepynge chyldren wolde conforted herode deed beholde angell lorde appered dreame ioseph egypte sayinge arise take chylde mother go ye londe israel deed sought chyldes life arose vp toke ye chylde mother came londe israel whē herde archelaus raygne iury ye rowme father herode afrayde go thither notwithstondinge warned god dreame turned asyde party galile went dwelt cite called nazareth 〈…〉 fulfill yt spoken prophetes shalbe called nazarite iii chapter dayes ihon baptyst came preached wildernes iury saynge amēde youre selues kyngdome heuen honde •• •• ioha • •• esai 〈…〉 spokē ye prophet esay sayeth voyce cryer ye wyldernes prepare lordes waye make pathes straight ihon garment camel heer lethrē gerdell aboute loynes 〈…〉 hys meate locustes wylde hony went hym ierusalem iury region rounde aboute iordan baptised iordan cō fessynge synnes sawe many pharises ye saduces come hys baptim 〈…〉 sayde vnto ye generaciō viper hath certified ye shal escape ye vengeaunce come bewarre brynge forth due frutes pennaunce thinke saye selues haue abraham oure father saye vnto god able stone rayse vp chyldren vnto abraham euen axe put vnto ye rote tree 〈…〉 therfore euery tre bringeth forth good frute shalbe hewē downe cast fyre baptise water repentaunce cōmeth 〈…〉 myghtier thē whose shues worthy beare shall baptise ye holy goost wt fyre hath also fan hond pourge floore gadre wheet garner burne ye chaffe vnquencheable fyre luc •• came iesus galile iordan 〈…〉 vnto ihon baptised hym ihō forbade hym saynge haue nede baptysed commest thou iesus answered sayd vnto hym let thus becommeth v fulfyll righteousnes suffred hym • •• luc •• ioha •• •• iesus assone baptised came straight water lo heuē opē ouer hym ihon sawe spirite god descende lyke doue lyght vpon hym lo 〈◊〉 4 • • 17 • ac 9 • pet 1 came voyce frō heuē sayng thys y beloued sonne delyte iiii chapter iesus ledd awaye spirite wildernes tempted deuyll fasted fourtye dayes fourtye nightes afterward hungred 〈◊〉 1 b • uc 4 tēpter came sayde yf thou sonne god commaunde stone made breed answered sayde yt wryttē 〈…〉 man shall lyue bred onlye euery worde proceadeth mouth god deuyll toke hym vp holy cite set hym pynacle temple sayde vnto hym yf thou ye sonne god 〈◊〉 • 0 b cast thy sylfe downe wrytten shall geue angel charge ouer handes shal holde vp thou • dashe thy fote agaynst stone iesus sayde vnto hym y wrytten also 〈◊〉 • c thou shalt tempte thy lorde god agayne deuyll toke hym vp led hym excedynge hye mountayne shewed hym kyngdomes worlde glorie sayde vnto hym wil geue yf thou wilt fall downe worship 〈◊〉 • taken departed galile left nazareth went dwelt capernaum cite apon see coostes zabulon neptalim yt thinge might fulfilled whiche spoken esay prophet 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • sayinge londe zabulon neptalim waye see beyonde iordan galile gentyls people sat darknes sawe greate lyght sat region shadowe deeth lyght begōne shyne tyme forth beganne iesus preach saye amende youre selues ye kingdome heauen honde iesus walked see galile sawe two brother simon called peter andrew brother castynge net ye see fiszhers sayde vnto folowe make fiszhers mē iere 16 c eze 47 • strayght waye lefte nettes folowed hym whan wēt forth thence sawe two brother iames sonne zebede ihon brother ship zebede father mendynge nettes called without tarynge lefte ye shyp father mat 19 luc 5 b folowed hym iesus went aboute galile marc 1 c teachyng synagoges preachynge gospel kyngdome healed maner siknes maner dyseases amonge people fame spred abrode siria brought vnto hym sick people taken diuers disease gripinges thē yt possessed deuils lunatyke palsie healed thē ther folowed hym greate nombre people galile ten city ierusalem marc 3 luc 6 b region lye beyonde iordan v chapter sawe people went vp mountayne set brother racha daunger ye coū sell whosoeuer sayeth thou foole daunger hell fyre 〈◊〉 42 b • ala 2 b therfore thou offrest thy gift altare remembrest thy brother hath ought agaynst leaue thyne offrynge altare go thy waye first reconcyle thy selfe thy brother come offre thy gyfte agre thine aduersary quicklye whyle thou art waye hym • uc 12 f • rou 25 b lest aduersary deliuer iudge iudge deliuer minister thou cast preson saye vnto verely thou shalt come thēce till thou haue payed vtmost farthinge • xo 20 c • ccl 41 c •• b 31 ye haue herde sayde olde tyme thou shalt committe aduoutrie saye vnto whosoeuer loketh wife lustinge hath committed aduoutrie hir already hert wherfore yf thy right eye offende plucke hym cast better • eut 13 • arc 9 c one thy membres periszhe thy whole body shulde cyte ye greate kinge nether shalt thou sweare thy heed thou canst make one heer whyte blacke communicacion shalbe yee yee nay nay ephe • •• soeuer commeth euel ye haue herde howe sayde eye eye toth toth exod •• deu •• leui •• luc •• saye vnto ye resist euell whosoeuer geueth blowe thy right cheke turne also yf eny man sue lawe take awaye thy coate let haue thy cloake also compelleth go myle go wt hym twayne geue hym axeth hym wolde borowe turne awaye ye haue herde saide leui 4 • thou shalt loue thyne neghboure hate thyne enemy saye vnto loue youre enemy blesse thē cursse good thē hate rom •• praye thē wronge persecute ye maye chyldern youre father heauen deut •• maketh sonne aryse euel good sendeth rayne iust vniuste luc •• yf ye loue loue rewarde shall ye haue publican euē yf ye frendly youre brother onlye singuler thynge ye publican also lyke wyse ye shall therfore perfecte leui •• euen youre father heauē perfecte vi chapter take hede youre almes ye geue syght men luc •• intent ye wolde sene el ye get rewarde youre father heauen soeuer therfore thou geuest thine almes thou shalt make trompet blowen ypocrites synagoges stretes praysed mē verely saye vnto haue rewarde whē thou doest almes let thy lefte hande knowe thy righte hande doth thine almes maye secrete thy father seith secrete shall rewarde openly • 18 esa 29 c 〈…〉 thou prayest thou shalt ye ypocrytes loue stō de praye synagoges corner stretes sene men verely saie vnto haue rewarde thou prayest entre thy chamber • 4 〈◊〉 1 • shut thy dore praye thy father secrete thy father seith secrete shall rewarde openly ye praye bable moch ye hethen thinke shal herde 〈…〉 moch bablynges sake ye lyke therfore youre father knoweth ye haue nede rom 8 ye axe thys maner therfore shall ye praye 〈…〉 oure father art heauen halowed thy name thy kyngdome come thy wyll fulfilled vpon earth heauen geue v daye oure dayly bred forgeue v oure dettes also forgeue oure detters lede v tēptacion delyuer v euell thyne kyngdome power glorye euer amen yf ye forgeue men treaspases youre heauenly father shall also forgeue ye wyll forgeue mē trespases 〈…〉 • 8 〈◊〉 • 1 c nomo shall youre father forgeue youre trespases 〈…〉 moreouer ye fast sad ye ypocrytes disfigure face myght sene men fast verely saye vnto haue rewarde thou whē thou fastest annoynte thyne heed wash thy face appeare vnto men thou fastest vnto thy father secrete thy father seyth secrete shal rewarde openly seth ye gather treasure vpon earth 〈…〉 〈◊〉 29 b 〈…〉 〈…〉 rust mothes corrupte theues breake steale gather treasure together heauen nether rust mothes corrupte theues nether breake vp yet steale youre treasure youre herte also 〈…〉 eye light body yf thyne eye syngle thy body shalbe ful light yf thyne eye wycked thy body shalbe full darckenes wherfore yf light darckenes greate shall darckenes mā serue two master ether shall hate one loue luc 16 b el shall leane one despise ye serue god mammon luc 12 c psal 54 c 1 pet 5 therfore saye vnto ye carefull lyfe ye shall eate ye shall drinke yet youre body ye shal put y lyfe worth thē meate body value raymēt beholde foules ye ayer sowe nether reepe yet cary barnes yet youre heauēly father fedeth thē ye moch better thē though toke thought therfore coulde put one cubit vnto stature care ye rayment considre lyly felde growe laboure nether spynne yet saye vnto euen salomon royalte arayed lyke vnto one wherfore yf god cloth grasse daye felde morowe shalbe cast fornace shal moch vnto ye lytle fayth therfore take thought sayinge shall eate shall drinke shall clothed soch thynges heithen seke youre heauenly father knoweth ye haue nede thynges seke ye fyrst kyngdome heauen righteousnes therof3 reg 3 shal thynges ministred vnto care morow morow shall care self euery daye hath ynough owne trauayll vii chapter ivdge ye iudged ye iudge shal ye iudged luc 6 rom 2 marc 4 measure ye meete shall measured agayne seist thou moate thy brother eye perceauest beame yt yn thine awne eye saiest thou ye brother holde wil plucke moate thyne eye beholde beame thyne awne eye ypocryte fyrst cast beame thyne awne eye prou 18 shalt thou se clearly plucke moate thy brother eye geue holy dogges nether cast ye youre pearles swyne 〈◊〉 136 c lest treade vnder fete turne agayne rente 〈◊〉 29 c • 16 c axe shalbe geuen seke ye shall fynde knocke shalbe opened vnto youre chyldren good gyftes moche shall youre father heauen geue good thynges axe hym therfore soeuer ye wolde mē shulde 〈◊〉 31 b b 4 c 〈◊〉 6 c euē ye y lawe prophetes enter strayte gate wyde gate vnto lorde lorde shall enter kyngdome heauen doth father y heauen 〈◊〉 19 b many shall saye daye lorde lorde haue prophecied thy name haue cast deuyls thy name haue done many greate dedes thy name knowlege vnto 〈◊〉 6 b •• th 25 neuer knewe departe fro ye worker iniquite whosoeuer therfore heareth sayinges 〈◊〉 6 e 〈◊〉 2 b doeth wyll lyckē hym vnto wyse man buylthys house vpon rocke whan abundaunce rayne descended wyndes blewe bet vpon house fel grounded rocke soeuer heareth sayinges doth thē shalbe lyckened vnto folysh mā buylt housse apon sonde iaco • b whan abūdaunce rayne descēded wyndes blewe bet vpon yt housse eze 1 • b f • great fall came passe marc • b luc 4 c iesus ended saynges people astonnyed hys doctryne taught one hauynge power scribe viii chapter come downe mountayne marc • • luc 4 b moch people folowed lo came leper worsheped sayinge lorde yf thou wylt thou canst make cleane iesus put forth hys honde touched sayinge wyl thou cleane immediatly leprosie clensed iesus sayde vnto hym se thou tell mā go shew thy selfe preste offer gyfte moses cōmaunded 〈…〉 witnes iesus entred capernaum came vnto captayne luc • iohan •• besought hym sayinge syr seruaunt lyeth sicke home palsye y greuously payned iesus sayd vnto hym wil come heale captayne answered sayde syr worthy thou shuldest come vnder rofe psal •• speake worde seruaunt shalbe healed myselfe also mā subiect ye auctorite another haue sowdiers vnder yet whā saye one go goeth another come commeth seruaunt doeth iesus hearde marueled sayde folowed hym verely say vnto haue founde greate fayth ī israel say vnto many shall come east west esa •• luc •• shall rest abraham isaac iacob kyngdome heauen chyldren kyngdome shalbe cast vtter darcknes shalbe wepinge gnaszhing teth iesus sayd vnto ye captayne go thy waye thou beleuest vnto seruaunt healed houre iesus went peter housse 〈…〉 sawe hys wyues mother lyinge sicke feuer touched hande feuer left hir arose ministred vnto euen come 〈…〉 brought vnto many possessed deuylls cast ye spirites worde healed sicke ye thinge might fulfilled spoken esay prophet sayinge toke oure infirmity 〈…〉 bare oure •••• ne whē iesus sawe moch people commaunded go ouer water 〈◊〉 9 f came scribe sayde vnto hym master wyll folowe whyther euer thou goest iesus sayde vnto fox haue hole byrddes ayer haue nestes ye sonne mā hath wheron rest heede another one disciple 〈…〉 sayde vnto hym syr geue leue fyrst go burye father iesus sayde vnto folowe thou let deed burie deed entred shyppe disciple folowed 〈…〉 beholde arose greate tempest see moch shippe couered wawes slepe disciple came vnto awoke hym sayinge lorde saue v perishe sayde vnto ye fearfull ye lytell faithe arose 〈…〉 rebuked wyndes see folowed greate calme men marueyled sayde mā wyndes see obey hym come ye syde countre gergesites 〈…〉 met two possessed deuyls came graues measure fearce man myght go waye beholde cryed sayinge oh iesu thou sonne god haue wt 〈…〉 art thou come hyther tormēt v tyme come good waye greate heerd swyne fedinge 〈…〉 deuyles besought sayinge yf thou cast v suffre v go oure waye heerd swyne sayde vnto go youre wayes went departed heerd swyne beholde ye whoale heerd swyne caryed violēce headlinge see perished water thē heerdmen fled wente way cyte tolde euery thinge fortuned vnto possessed deuyls beholde cyte came met iesus sawe hym besought hym 〈…〉 departe coostes ix chapter entred shipp passed ouer came awne cite lo marc 2 luc 5 c iohan 5 brought vnto man sicke ye palsie lyinge bed iesus sawe faith thē sayde sicke ye palsie sonne good cheare thy sinnes forgeuē beholde certeyne scribe sayde selues man blasphemeth iesus sawe thoughtes sayde wherfore thinke ye euill youre hertes whether y easier saye thy synnes forgeuē ye saie arise walke ye maye knowe sonne man hath power forgeue sinnes earth thē sayde vnto sicke ye palsye arise take vp thy bed go home act 9 • arose wente home ye people sawe marueyled glorified god geuē soch power vnto men iesus passed forth thence mar 2 b luc 5 15 sawe man syt receyuinge custome named mathew sayde vnto folowe arose folowed came passe sat meate house beholde many publican synners came sat downe also iesus hys disciple pharises sawe sayde hys disciple eateth youre master publican synners iesus herde sayde vnto whole nede ye phisiciō sicke go learne meaneth haue pleasure mercy offerynge ose 6 b math 1 • 1 tim 1 c come call righteous ye synners repentaunce came disciple ihon hym sayinge ye pharises fast oft mar 2 b luc 5 c thy disciple fast iesus sayde vnto thē weddynge chyldrē mourne lōge bridegrome tyme come bridegrome shalbe taken thē shall fast man peceth olde garment pece newe clothe taketh awaye pece agayne garment rent y made greater act 2 b nether men put new wyne olde vessel vessel breake wyne runneth ye vessel peryshe poure newe wyne newe vessel saued together whyle thus spake vnto beholde came certayne ruler marc • c luc 8 c worshipped sayinge doughter euē deceased come lay ye honde shall liue iesus arose folowed hym hys disciple • ar 5 c • uc 8 e • euit 15 beholde woman diseased wt yssue bloude xij yeres came behynde hym touched hem hys vesture sayde silfe yf maye touche euen vesture shalbe safe iesus tourned aboute behelde sayinge doughter good conforte thy faith hath made yt safe made whole euen houre iesus came ruler house mar • luc • f sawe minstrel people raginge sayde vnto get hē ce ye mayde deed slepeth laughed hym scorne iohā 11 b whan people put forth went toke honde mayde arose noysed londe iesus departed thence two blynde mē folowed hym cryinge sayinge thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpon v come home blynde came hym iesus sayde vnto beleue ye able thys sayde vnto hym yee lorde touched eye sayinge acordinge youre fayth mat 8 b vnto eye opened iesus charged thē sayinge se mā knowe departed spred abroade name londe whan gone beholde brought hym domme man possessed deuyll mar 7 luc 11 b whan deuyl cast domme spake people merueled sayinge neuer sene israel ye pharises sayde casteth deuyls thorow chefe deuyll mat 12 c mar 3 b iesus wente aboute city townes mar 6 luc 13 b teachinge synagoges preachyng ye gospel ye kyngdome healinge maner sicknes maner desease amōge people sawe people compassion thē mar 6 pyned awaye scattered abroade euen shepe hauinge shepherd sayde hys disciple ye heruest greate ye laborer fewe wherfore praye lorde haruest luc 10 2 te 3 sende forth laborer hys haruest x chapter called xii disciple vnto hym mar 3 b luc 6 b 9 10 gaue power ouer vncleane spretes cast heaale maner sickness maner deseases name xii apostels fyrst simon called peter andrew brother iames sonne zebede ihon brother philip bartlemew thomas mathew publican iames sonne alphe lebbeus wyse called taddeus simon cane iudas iscarioth also betrayed hym twolue sent iesus commaunded sayinge luc •• go wayes yt leade heithen city samaritās enter ye go rather lost shepe housse israel 〈…〉 go preach sayinge kyngdome heuē hande heale sicke clense leper rayse deed cast deuils act •• • lu 5 • •• frely ye haue receaued frely geue againe posse golde siluer brasse yn youre gerdels yet scrip towardes iorney nether two cote nether shues yet staffe 〈…〉 workman worthy meate soeuer cite towne ye shall come enquyre mete abyde tyll ye go thence whē ye come house salute ye yf housse mete yo peace shal come vpō yf mete yo peace shal turne againe yf man wil receaue ner heare youre preachinge departe house cite shake dust youre fete truly saye vnto 〈…〉 shall easyer ye londe sodoma gomorra ye daye iudgment cite beholde sende forth shepe amō ge wolues ye therfore wyse serpentes innocent doues beware men 〈…〉 shall deliuer vp coūsels shal scourge synagoges ye shall brought prynces kynges sake witnes gentyls delyuer vp take thought ye shall speake 〈…〉 yt shalbe geuen euen houre ye shall saye ye speake sprete father speaketh brother shall delyuer brother deeth father sonne chyldren shall aryse agaynst father mother shall helpe deeth ye shall hated men name sake yt endureth ende shalbe saued 〈…〉 persecute one cite 〈…〉 flye another tell treuth ye shall fynysshe city israel tyll sonne man come disciple aboue master 〈…〉 nether seruaunt aboue lorde ynough disciple master seruaunt lorde yf haue called good mā house beelzebub moch shal call housholde feare therfore nothinge hyd shal openly shewed 〈…〉 nothinge secrete shall knowne tell darcknes speake ye light ye heare eare preach ye vpon house toppes feare ye kyll body 〈…〉 able kyll soule rather feare hī able destroye soule body hell two sparowes solde farthinge yet doth none thē light vpon groūde without youre father ye hayres youre heade tolde feare ye therfore ye value many sparowes 〈…〉 therfore whosoeuer knowlegeth mē wil knowlege also father heauen soeuer denyeth mē wil also denie father heauen thynke come sende peace vpon earth 〈…〉 came sende peace swerde come set mā variaunce ageynst father doughter ageynst hir mother 〈…〉 doughter lawe ageynst mother lawe man foe shalbe owne housholde 〈…〉 loueth father mother mete loueth sonne doughter mete yt taketh crosse foloweth mete fyndeth life 〈…〉 shal lose loseth life sake shal fynde receaueth receaueth receaueth receaueth yt sent receaueth prophet name prophet 〈…〉 shal receaue prophetes rewarde yt receaueth righteous man name righteous man shal receaue righteous man rewarde soeuer geueth vnto one least cuppe colde water onely drinke 〈◊〉 4 c ye name disciple verely saie vnto shal lose rewarde xi chapter came passe whā iesus made ende cōmaundinge twolue disciple departed thence teach preach city whan ihon beinge preson herde workes christ luc 7 b sent two disciple sayde vnto him▪ art thou yt shal come shal loke another iesus answered sayde vnto thē go youre waye tell ihon agayne ye se heare blynde se lame go esa 35 leper clensed ye deaf heare deed aryse ageyne esa 61 gospell preached poore blessed offended whan wente waye luc 7 c iesus beganne speake vnto people concernynge ihon ye gone se wyldernes wolde ye se rede shaken wynde ye gone se wolde ye se man clothed soft rayment beholde weare soft clothinge kinges house ye gone se prophet yee saye vnto thē prophet whō written beholde mal 3 marc 1 sende messaūger thy face shal prepare thy waye verely saye vnto amonge ye child wemen arose greater ihon baptist withstondinge reade least lesse kyngdome heauen greater tyme ihon baptist hither ye kyngdome heauen suffreth violence luc 16 c violent plucke vnto prophetes lawe prophecied vnto ihon also yf ye wil receaue helias luc 1 mala 3 ihon 1 b luc 7 shulde come hath eares heare let hī heare vnto shal lickē generacion like vnto childrē syt market call vnto felowes saye haue pyped vnto ye wolde daunse haue morned vnto ye wolde wepe ihon came nether eatinge drynkinge saye hath deuyll sonne man came eatinge drynkinge saye lo glutton wyne bebber mā companyon publican synners wiszdome iustified hir child beganne vpbrade city miracle done amended luc 10 b wo vnto chorasin wo vnto bethsaida yf miracle haue bene shewed amō ge bene done tyre sidon repented longe agoo sack daye neuertheles saye vnto shalbe easyer londe sodome daye iudgment thē ye tyme iesus answered sayde luc 10 c prou 11 prayse father lorde heauen earth thou hast hid thinges wyse prudent opened thē vnto babe euen father pleased mat 28 c luc 10 c iohan 3 e iohā 7 c 8 b 10 b thinges geuen ouer vnto father mā knoweth sonne father nether knoweth eny man father saue sonne sonne wil open come vnto man heare voyce stretes brosed rede shal breake flax beginneth burne shal quench tyll sende forth iudgment vnto victory name shal heithen trust brought vnto one possessed deuell blynde domne healed euery kyngdome deuyded within self shalbe desolate euery cite house deuyded self maye contynue yf one sathan cast another thē variaunce within self maye kyngdome endure yf cast deuils thorow plucketh awaye sowne hert yt sowne waye syde yt sowne stonye grounde whā one heareth worde anone ioye receaueth neuertheles hath rote ī endureth season whā trouble persecucion aryseth worde bringeth forth frute geueth hūdreth folde sixtie folde thirtie folde another parable put forth vnto thē sayde kyngdome heauē like vnto man • arc 4 c yt sowed good sede felde whyle mē slepte came whēce thē hath tare sayde vnto thē hath enemye done thē sayde ye seruaūtes wilt thou yt go wede thē sayde lest whyle ye wede ye tare ye plucke vp wheate also wt thē let thē growe together tyll haruest tyme haruest wil saye vnto reaper gather ye tare first bynde thē sheeues brēt gather wheate barne another parable put forth vnto thē sayde kyngdome heauen like vnto grane mustarde sede man wente tolde iesus whan iesus hetde yt departed thence shippe desert place alone marc 6 〈◊〉 9 b • ohā 6 whā people herde therof folowed fote ye city iesus wē te forth sawe moch people pytie vpon healed sicke euen disciple came vnto saide deserte place ye night falleth omlet ye people departe maye go townes bye vytayles iesus sayde vnto nede go awaye geue ye thē eate thē saide vnto haue fyue loaues two fyshes sayde bringe thē hither cōmaunded ye people syt downe vpon grasse toke ye fyue loaues two fiszhes loked vp towarde heauen gaue thankes brake gaue loaues vnto disciple disciple gaue people ate suffised gathered vp broken meate remayned ouer twolue baszkettes full yt ate aboute fyue thousande men besyde wemen child straight waye iesus made disciple entre shippe marc 6 c 〈◊〉 6 b go ye night iesus came vnto thē walkinge vpon see whan disciple sawe goinge vpon see afrayed sayenge sprete cried feare straight waye iesus spake vnto sayde good cheare afrayed peter answered saide lorde yf thou byd come vnto vpon ye water sayde come ye waye peter stepte shippe wēte vpon water come vnto iesus whan sawe mightie wynde afrayed begāne synke cried sayenge lorde helpe īmediatly vnderstondinge perceaue ye yt soeuer goeth ye mouth descēdeth downe ye bely cast draught thinge proceadeth mouth cōmeth frō ye hert defyleth ye mā ye hert come euell thoughtes murthur breakynge 19 vnto lost shepe house israel notwithstondinge came fell downe sayde lorde helpe answered sayde good take childrens bred cast vnto dogges trueth lorde sayde neuertheles whelpes eate crommes fall name receaueth offendeth one litle one beleue marc 9 c luc 17 better mylstone hanged aboute neck drowned depth see wo vnto worlde slaūders yee must slaunders come • cor 11 b wo vnto man slaunder commeth yf thy hande thy fote offende mat 5 marc 9 c cut cast better yt entre vnto life lame crepell thē yt thou shuldest haue two hōdes two fete cast euerlastinge fyre yf thyne eye offende deu 13 plucke cast better entre vnto life one eye thē haue two eye cast hell fyre take hede yt ye despyse one litle one saye vnto angel alwaye beholde face father heauen sonne man come saue lost thinke ye yf man haue hundreth shepe one thē gone astraye luc 15 doth leaue nyentie nyene mountaynes goeth seketh one gone astraye yf happen fynde verely saye vnto reioyseth ouer ouer nyentie nyene wēte astraye euen youre father heauen one litle one shulde perishe yf thy brother trespace agaynst go tell faute betwene alone luc 17 eccli 17 b deut 19 yf heare thou hast wōne thy brother yf heare take father heauē two thre gathered together ī name luc • 4 b myddest amonge came peter vnto sayde lorde oft shal forgeue brother mat 〈…〉 marc 〈…〉 luc 1 • yt trespaceth agaynst seuē tymes iesus saide vnto hī saye vnto ye seuē tymes seuētie tymes seuen tymes therfore ye kingdome heauē lickened vnto kynge wolde reken wt seruauntes whan beganne rekē one brought vnto ought ten thousande poūde whā nothinge paye lorde cōmaunded solde wife childrē yt payment made seruaunt fell downe besought sayenge syr haue paciēce wt wil paye lorde pytie seruaunt discharged forgaue det • seruaunt wēte foūde one felowes ought hū dreth pen layed hande vpon toke throte sayde paye thou owest thē felowe fell downe besought sayenge haue paciēce wt wil paye neuertheles wolde wente cast preson tyll shulde paye dett whan felowes sawe done sory came tolde lorde happened lorde called sayde vnto iaco 4 • thou wicked seruaūt forgaue dett thou praydest shuldest thou haue compassion also vpon thy felowe euen pytie vpon lorde wroth delyuered vnto iaylers tyll payed ought mat • • marc • • shal heauenly father also vnto yf ye euery one frō youre hertes forgeue brother trespaces xix chapter came passe whā iesus ended sayenges 〈…〉 gat frō galile came ī ye coastes iewry beyonde iordane moch people folowed healed came vnto pharises tēpted sayde vnto laufull man put awaye wife eny maner cause put sunder yt god hath coupled together sayde dyd moses cōmaunde geue testimonyall deuorsement 〈◊〉 24 〈…〉 〈…〉 c put awaye sayde vnto thē moses ye hardnes yo hertes suffred put awaye youre wyues neuertheles frō begynnynge hath bene 〈◊〉 3 •• c 10 〈◊〉 16 saye vnto whosoeuer putteth awaye wife excepte fornicacion marieth another breaketh wedlocke marieth yt deuorced commytteth aduoutrye sayde disciple vnto yf ye matter betwene mā wife thē good mary sayde vnto mē cōprehende yt sayenge saue whō geuē 〈…〉 gelded borne mother wombe gelded gelded men gelded haue gelded thē selues kyngdome heauens sake cōprehende let comprehende •• rc 10 b 〈…〉 b brought vnto yōge child yt shulde put hondes vpon thē praye ye disciple rebuked iesus sayde suffre ye childrē forbyd thē come vnto vnto soch belōgeth kyngdome heauen whā layed hōdes vpō thē departed thēce beholde one came vnto sayde 〈◊〉 10 b 〈◊〉 11 c good master good shal yt maye haue euer lastinge life sayde vnto callest thou thy waye sell thou hast 〈…〉 geue vnto poore thou shalt haue treasure heauen 〈…〉 come folowe whan ye yonge man herde yt worde wente awaye sory greate possession iesus sayde vnto disciple verely saie vnto marc 10 c luc 1 • c shalbe harde rich man entre kyngdome heauē morouer saye vnto easier camell go thorow eye nedle thē rich man entre kyngdome heauen whan disciple herde exceadingly amased sayde thē saued neuertheles iesus behelde sayde vnto men vnpossyble god thinges possyble zach 8 answered peter sayde vnto marc 10 c luc 18 c mat 4 c beholde haue forsakē folowed shal haue therfore iesus sayde vnto thē verely saye vnto sonne man shal sytt seate maiestye luc 21 b ye haue folowed new byrth shal syt also vpon twolue seates iudge ye twolue trybes israel sap 5 euer forsaketh house brethrē sister father mother wife deu 33 b child londes name sake shal receaue hundreth folde inheret euerlastinge life many first shalbe last mat 20 b luc 13 c last shalbe first xx chapter kyngdome heauen like vnto housholder wēte early mornynge hyre labourer vyniarde whā agreed labourer peny daye sent thē vynyarde aboute ye thirde houre wente sawe stondinge ydle market place sayde vnto go ye also vynyarde euer right wil geue wēte waye agayne wēte aboute sixte nyenth houre dyd likewyse aboute eleuenth houre wē te founde stōdynge ydle sayde vnto stonde ye daye ydle sayde vnto man hath hyred u saide vnto thē go ye also vinyarde loke right ye shal haue whan euen come lorde vynyarde sayde vnto stewarde call labourer geue hyre begynnynge last vnto ye first hyred aboute eleuenth houre came receaued euery man peny whan first came supposed shulde receaue also receaued euery man peny whan receaued murmured agaynst housholder sayde last haue wrought one houre thou hast made thē equall vnto u haue borne burthen heate daye answered sayde vnto one frende ye wronge diddest thou agree peny take thine go thy waye wil geue vnto last also like vnto haue power rom 11 c listeth myne owne thine eye euell good last shalbe first first last mat 19 marc 10 c luc 13 c mat 22 b many called chosen iesus wente vp ierusalem toke twolue disciple asyde waye mar 10 luc 18 sayde vnto beholde go vp ierusalem sonne man shalbe delyuered vnto hye prestes scribe shal condemne death shal delyuer vnto ye heithen mocked scourged crucified thirde daye shal ryse agayne came vnto mother zebedes childrē hir sonnes fell downe mar 10 desyred certayne thinge hī saide vnto wilt thou sayde vnto let two sonnes myne syt thy kyngdome one vpon thy right honde vpon thy left honde iesus answered sayde ye wote ye axe maye ye drynke cuppe shal drynke baptised baptyme shalbe baptysed withall sayde vnto yee maye sayde vnto cuppe truly shal ye drynke baptyme yt shal baptysed withall shal ye baptysed neuertheles syt vpon right honde left myne geue vnto thē whō prepared father mat 25 c whan ten herde disdayned two brother marc 9 10 e luc 9 c • 2 b iesus called vnto sayde ye knowe ye prynces worlde haue domynacion people greatest reade greatest deale violence exercise power amonge thē shal amonge euer wyl greate amonge let youre mynister soeuer wyl chefe let youre seruaunt euen sonne man came serued vp therfore ye ready also houre ye thynke shal sonne man come 〈…〉 faithfull wyse seruaūt lorde hath made ruler ouer houszholde maye geue meate due season 〈…〉 blessed yt seruaūt lorde whan cōmeth shal fynde doynge verely saye vnto shal set ouer goodes yf euell seruaūt shal saye hert tush wil longe lorde come begynne smyte felowes yee eate drynke dronken seruaūtes lorde shal come daye whā loketh houre ware shal hew peces geue rewarde ypocrytes shal waylinge gnaszhinge teth xxv chapter shal kyngdome heauen like vnto ten virgin toke lāpes wente forth mete brydegome fyue foolish fyue wyse foolish toke lāpes neuertheles toke none oyle wyse toke oyle vessel lampes whyle brydegrome taried slombred slepte mydnight crye made beholde brydegrome commeth go youre waye mete virgin arose mariage gate shut vp ye last came ye virgin also sayde lorde lorde 〈◊〉 7 b opō vnto v answered sayde verely saye vnto knowe luc 6 c • 24 marc 13 luc 12 •• od 2 • watch ye therfore ye knowe nether daye ner yet houre whan ye sonne man shal come like wyse certayne mā ready take iourney straunge countre called seruaūtes 〈◊〉 13 • uc 19 delyuered goodes vnto thē vnto one gaue fyue talentes another two another one vnto euery man abilyte straight waye departed receaued fyue talentes wente occupied wanne fyue talentes likewyse yt receaued two talentes wāne two also receaued ye one wente dygged pyt earth hyd lordes money longe season lorde seruauntes came rekened came receaued fyue talentes brought fyue talentes sayde syr thou delyuerdst vnto fyue talentes beholde haue wonne fyue talētes mo sayde lorde vnto hī 〈◊〉 24 wel thou good faithfull seruaunt thou hast bene faithfull ouer litle wil set ouer moch entre thou ioye thy lorde thē came also receaued two talentes sayde syr thou delyuerdst vnto two talentes beholde haue wonne two talētes thē lorde sayde vnto wel thou good faithfull seruaūt thou hast bene faithfull ouer litle wil set ouer moch entre thou ioye thy lorde receaued one talēt came sayde syr knew thou artan hard man thou reapest thou hast sowen gatherest thou hast strowed afrayed wē te hyd thy talent earth lo thou hast thine owne lorde answered sayde vnto thou euell slouthfull seruaunt knewest thou reape sowed gather strawed thou shuldest therfore haue money chaungers commynge shulde haue receaued myne owne vauntage therfore take talent frō geue vnto hath ten talentes hath • 13 marc 4 luc 8 19 shalbe geuen shal haue abundaunce hath frō shalbe takē awaye euen hath cast vnprofitable seruaunt vtter darcknes mat 13 shalbe waylinge gnaszhinge harbourlesse esa 58 b ezec 18 ye lodged naked ye clothed sicke ye vysited preson eccli 7 2 tim 1 ye came vnto shal righteous answere saye lorde whē sawe hōgrie fed thirstie gaue drynke sawe herbourlesse lodged naked clothed ye whē sawe ye sicke preson came vnto kynge shal answer saye vnto verely saye vnto loke ye haue done vnto one least brother haue ye done vnto shal saye also vnto shalbe left hande 〈◊〉 6 b 〈◊〉 7 b 〈◊〉 13 c 〈◊〉 30 f 〈◊〉 7 b 〈◊〉 19 〈◊〉 20 c departe fro ye cursed euerlastinge fyre prepared deuell angel hōgrie ye gaue meate thirstye ye gaue drynke herbourlesse ye lodged naked ye clothed sicke preson ye vysited shal also answere hī saye lorde sawe hōgrie thyrstie herbourlesse naked sicke preson haue mynistred vnto thē shal answere saye verely saye vnto 〈◊〉 2 b 〈◊〉 30 c 〈◊〉 14 p 〈◊〉 17 •• hā 5 c loke ye haue done vnto one leest haue ye done vnto shal go euerlastinge payne righteous euerlastinge life xxvi chapter came passe whā iesus fynished wordes sayde vnto disciple ye knowe two dayes shalbe easter 〈◊〉 14 〈◊〉 22 •• hā 18 sonne man shalbe delyuered crucified assembled together hye prestes scrybes •• hā 11 e elder people palace hye prest called caiphas helde councell might take iesus disceate kyll sayde holy daye lest vproure people mar 14 • uc 7 • ohā 12 iesus bethany house symon leper came vnto hī woman • eade glas • ith pre • iou wa • er boxe precious oyntment poured vpon heade sat table whan disciple sawe diszdayned sayde serueth waist oyntmēt might haue bene wel solde geuē poore whē iesus perceaued sayde vnto trouble ye woman hath wrought good worke vpon ye haue allwaye poore shal ye haue allwayes deut 15 b hath poured oyntmēt vpon body dyd bury verely saye vnto euer gospell shalbe preached thorow worlde shal also hath done tolde memoriall one twolue called iudas iscarioth wente vnto hye prestes sayde wil ye geue mar 14 b luc 2 • iohā 13 • shal delyuer vnto offred hī thirtie syluer pen tyme forth sought oportunyte betraye first daye swete bred came disciple iesus sayde vnto marc 14 • luc 〈…〉 wilt thou prepare eate easter lambe sayde go cite soch man saye vnto master sendeth worde tyme • honde wil kepe myne easter disciple disciple dyd iesus appoynted made ready easter lambe euen sat downe table twolue ate sayde marc 14 • luc 〈…〉 iohā 〈…〉 verely saye vnto one shal betraye exceadinge soroufull beganne euery one saye vnto syr answered sayde deppeth honde dyszhe shal betraye sonne man goeth forth wrytten wo vnto man whō sonne man shalbe betrayed bene better mā yf neuer bene borne thē iudas betrayed answered sayde master sayde vnto thou hast sayde ate iesus toke bred gaue thankes brake marc 〈…〉 luc 〈…〉 1 cor 〈…〉 gaue disciple sayde take eate body toke cuppe thanked gaue thē sayde drynke ye therof bloude new testament shalbe shed many remission synnes saye vnto wil drynke hence forth frute vyne tre vntill daye shal drynke new father kyngdome whan sayde grace • 〈…〉 luc 〈…〉 iohā 〈…〉 vnto though shulde dye yet wil denye likewyse also sayde disciple came iesus felde called gethsemane sayde vnto disciple 〈◊〉 14 syt ye whyle go yonder praye toke peter two sonnes zebede beganne wexe soroufull agonye sayde iesus vnto soule heuy euen vnto death •• hā 1 • c tary ye watch wente forth litle luc • 2 c fell flat vpon face prayed sayenge father yf possible let cuppe passe fro neuertheles wil thou wilt came disciple founde thē slepe sayde vnto peter coude ye watch one houre watch praye ye fall temptacion 〈…〉 sprete wyllinge flesh weake agayne wēte forth seconde tyme prayed 〈◊〉 14 c sayenge father yf cuppe passe awaye fro excepte drynke thy fulfilled came founde slepe agayne eye heuy left wente forth agayne prayed thirde tyme sayenge wordes came disciple sayde vnto slepe take youre rest beholde houre come yt sonne man shalbe delyuered hondes synners aryse let u goynge beholde hō de betrayeth whyle yet spake lo iudas one twolue came greate multitude swerdes staues 〈◊〉 • 4 b 〈◊〉 22 ••• ā • 8 sent frō hye prestes elder people betrayed geuen tokē sayenge euer kysse laye hōdes vpō forth withal came iesus sayde hayle master kyssed iesus sayde vnto frende wherfore art thou come came layed hondes vpon iesus toke beholde one iesus stretched honde drue swerde stroke seruaunt hye prestes smote eare sayde iesus vnto put vp ye swerde place 〈◊〉 9 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 1 dayes iohā 2 c hye prest stode vp mar 14 • sayde vnto answerest thou nothinge vnto testifie agaynst neuertheles iesus helde tonge hye prest answered sayde vnto luc 22 • charge ye lyuynge god thou tell u yf thou christ sonne god iesus spake thou hast sayde neuerthelesse saye vnto iohā 6 g act 1 b tyme forth shal come passe ye shal se sonne man syttinge vpon right hande power god commynge cloudes heauen hye prest rente clothes sayde hath blasphemed mar 14 g luc 22 e nede eny mo wytnesses lo haue ye herde blasphemy thinke ye answered sayde gyltie death leui 24 • esa 50 b • ohā 18 c spytted face smote fistes smote vpon face sayde prophecie vnto v thou christ smote peter mar 14 g luc 22 • iohā 18 b sat without palace came vnto damsell sayde thou wast iesus galile also neuertheles denyed thē sayde tell thou sayest whan wēte dore another damsell sawe sayde vnto also iesus nazareth denyed agayne sware also knowe mā litle whyle stode stepte forth sayde vnto peter trueth thou art one also thy speach wrayeth begāne curse sweare knowe man immediatly cock crew thought peter vpon wordes iesus sayde vnto mat 26 c cock crow thou shalt denye thryse wente wepte bytterly xxvii chapter vpon morow hye prestes elder people helde councell agaynst iesus mal 2 marc 15 luc 23 • ohā 19 might put death bounde led forth delyuered vnto pontius pilate debyte • ct 3 b iudas betrayed sawe condemned vnto death repented brought agayne thirtie syluer pen hye prestes elder sayde haue done euell haue betrayed innocēt bloude sayde haue yt se thou therto cast syluer pen tē ple gat awaye wente hanged self • 17 act 1 c hye prestes toke syluer pen sayde laufull put god chest bloudmoney neuertheles helde councell bought thē potter felde burye straū gers wherfore felde called bloudfelde vnto daye fulfylled spoken ieremy prophet sayenge • ere 32 b zach 11 c toke thirtie syluer pen pryce solde bought child israell gaue potter felde lorde commaunded iesus stode debyte debyte axed marc 15 luc 23 iohā • 8 sayde art thou kynge iewes iesus sayde vnto thou sayest whā accused hye prestes elder answered nothinge sayde pylate vnto hearest thou sore accuse esa 53 b answered one worde moch debyte marueled exceadingly feast debyte wōte delyuer presoner fre vnto people marc 15 luc 23 b iohā 18 e wolde tyme notable presoner called barrabas whan gathered together pylate sayde vnto whether wil ye geue lowse vnto barrabas iesus called christ knewe well delyuered enuye whā sat vpō iudgmēt seate wife sent vnto sayenge haue thou nothinge righteous man haue suffred many thinges daye dreame hye prestes elder persuaded people mar 〈…〉 shulde axe barrabas destroye iesus answered debyte sayde vnto thē luc 〈…〉 whether two wyl ye yt geue lowse vnto sayde barrabas pylate say •• vnto 〈…〉 shal iesus called christ sayde let crucified debyte saide euell hath done thē neuertheles cried yet sayde let crucified whan pilate sawe coude helpe greater vproure toke water waszhed handes people sayde vngiltie ye bloude righteous man se ye therto answered people sayde bloude come vpon v vpon oure child 〈…〉 gaue barrabas lowse vnto thē caused iesus scourged delyuered crucified▪ debites soudyers toke iesus comon hall 〈…〉 gathered whole multitude ouer stryped clothes put purple robe vpō plated crowne thorne set vpon heade rede hāde kneled mocked sayde hayle kynge iewes magdalene mary mother iames io mother child zebede euen came rich man arimathia called ioseph also disciple iesus marc 15 c luc 23 c • ohā 19 c wēte vnto pylate axed body iesus commaunded pylate
