dayes 〈◊〉 4 〈◊〉 4 tempted sathan wylde beestes angel mynistred vnto ihon taken iesus came galile mat 4 b luc 4 b preached gospell kyngdome god sayde tyme fulfylled kyngdome god hande amende youre selues beleue gospell walked see galile mat 4 c luc 5 sawe symon andrew brother castinge nettes see fyszhers iesus sayde vnto thē folowe wil make fyszhers mē iere 16 c eze 47 b immediatly left nettes folowed gone lytle thence sawe iames sonne zebede ihon brother shyppe mendynge nettes anone called left father zebede shyppe hyred seruauntes folowed wente capernaum luc 4 iohā 2 b immediatly vpon sabbathes entred synagoge taught astonnyed doctryne mat 7 c taught one hauynge power scrybes synagoge man possessed foule sprete luc 4 cried sayde oh haue thou iesus nazareth art thou come destroye u knowe thou art euen yt holy one god iesus reproued sayde holde thy tonge departe foule sprete tare cried loude voyce departed astonnyed moch axed one another amonge thē selues sayde new lernynge cōmaundeth foule spretes power obedient vnto immediatly fame noysed rounde aboute coastes border galile forth wente synagoge mat 8 b luc 4 came house symō andrew wt iames ihon symons mother lawe laye feuers anone tolde came set vp toke ye hande feuer left immediatly mynistred vnto euen whan sonne gone downe mat 8 b luc 4 e brought vnto sick possessed whole cite gathered together dore healed many diseased dyuerse sickness cast many deuels suffred deuels speake knew mornynge daye arose wente iesus departed deserte place prayed peter also folowed whan founde sayde vnto euery man seketh sayde vnto let u go next townes maye preach also therto come preached ī synagoges galile droue deuyls mat 8 luc 5 b came vnto leper besought kneled sayde vnto yf thou wilt thou canst make cleane pitied iesus stretched forth honde touched sayde wyll thou cleane whā spoken immediatly leprosy departed frō marc 7 9 clensed iesus forbad strately forth sent awaye sayde vnto take hede thou saye nothinge eny man go thy waye shew thy self vnto prest offre thy clensynge moses commaunded leui 14 wytnesse vnto whan departed beganne speake moch made dede knowne moch iesus coude go cite openly without deserte place came vnto frō quarter ii chapter certayne dayes wente agayne vnto capernaum mat 9 luc 5 c iohā 5 noysed ye house immediatly gathered greate multitude moch rowme without dore spake worde vnto thē came vnto certaine brought one sicke palsye borne foure coude come nye ye people vncouered ye rofe ye house made hole let downe bed coardes wherin sicke ye palsy laye iesus sawe faith sayde vnto sicke palsye sonne thy synnes forgeuen neuertheles certayne scrybes sat thought hertes speaketh man soch blasphemy forgeue synnes esa 43 onely god immediatly iesus knew sprete thought thē selues saide vnto thynke ye soch thinges youre hertes whether easier saye sicke palsye thy synnes forgeuē saye aryse take vp thy bed walke ye maye knowe ye sonne man hath power forgeue synnes vpon earth sayde vnto sicke ye palsye saye vnto aryse take vp thy bed go home immediatly arose toke bed wente forth act • moch astonnied praysed god sayde neuer sawe soch wente forth agayne vnto see people came vnto 〈…〉 taught iesus passed sawe leui sonne alpheus syttinge receate custome sayde vnto folowe arose folowed came passe sat table house sat many publican synners table iesus disciple many yt folowed whan scrybes pharises sawe ate publican synners sayde vnto disciple doth eate dryncke ye publican synners whan iesus herde sayde vnto thē whole nede ye phisician sycke come call righteous synners repētaunce 〈…〉 disciple ihon ye pharises faste • came certaine 〈…〉 sayde vnto fast disciple ihon ye pharises thy disciple fast iesus sayde vnto weddinge child fast whyle brydegrome longe ye brydegrome cannot fast tyme wyl come brydegrome shalbe taken shal fast man soweth pece new cloth vnto olde garment el taketh awaye new pece olde rēt worse man putteth new wyne olde vessel el new wyne breaketh vessel wyne spylt ye vessel perishe new wyne must put new vessel chaunsed vpon ye sabbath wente thorow corne feldes 〈…〉 disciple begāne make waye thorow plucke eares ye corne pharises sayde vnto beholde thy disciple laufull vpō sabbath sayde vnto thē haue ye neuer red dauid dyd whā nede anhongred wt wente house god tyme abiathar hye prest ate shewbreds laufull man eate 〈◊〉 21 b prestes gaue vnto sayde vnto sabbath made man sake man sabbathes sake therfore sonne man lorde euen ouer sabbath iii chapter wente agayne also synagoge mā wythred hande 〈…〉 marked whether wolde heale sabbath might accuse sayde vnto ye mā wythred hāde steppe forth sayde vnto thē laufull good sabbath laufull euell saue life kyll helde tonge loked rounde aboute vpon wrath sory harde hertes thē sayde vnto man stretch thine hande stretched hande made whole like ye 〈◊〉 15 b pharises wēte straight waye helde councell herodes officer agaynst 〈◊〉 12 b 〈◊〉 10 might destroye iesus departed awaye disciple vnto see folowed moch people galile 〈…〉 frō iewry ierusalē idumea beyonde iordan dwelt aboute tyre sydon greate multitude herde noble actes came vnto spake vnto disciple yt shulde kepe shyppe people lest shulde thrunge healed many moch plaged preased vpon might touch whan foule spretes sawe 〈◊〉 4 c fell downe cried sayde thou art sonne god charged strately shulde make knowne 〈◊〉 10 〈◊〉 6 b 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 b wente vp mountayne called vnto wolde came vnto ordeyned ye twolue shulde might sende preach might haue power heale sickness cast deuyls vnto symon gaue name peter iames sonne zebede ihon brother iames gaue thē name bonarges saye child thonder andrew philippe bartylmew mathew thomas iames ye sonne alpheus taddeus symon cana iudas iscarioth betrayed came house assembled people together agayne moch leysure eate aboute herde wente holde sayde reade wil go witt taketh moch vpon scrybes come downe ierusalem sayde hath belzebub thorow chefe deuell casteth deuyls called together mat 9 12 c luc 11 b spake vnto symilitudes one sathan dryue another yf realme deuyded self endure yf house deuyded agaynst self contynue yf sathan ryse agaynst self variaunce self endure ende man entre stronge man house take awaye goodes excepte first bynde stronge man spoyle house verely saye vnto mat 12 c luc 12 1 ioh 5 c synnes shalbe forgeuen child men blasphemy also wherwith blaspheme blasphemeth holy goost hath neuer forgeuenes giltie euerlastinge iudgment sayde hath vncleane sprete came mother brethrē stode without sente vnto mat 12 c luc 8 c called people sat aboute sayde vnto beholde thy mother thy brethrē axe without answered sayde mother brother loked rounde aboute vpon disciple sat rounde compasse aboute sayde beholde mother brother euer doth god brother sister mother iiii chapter begāne agayne teach ye see side mat 1 • luc 8 b gathered moch people vnto wente shippe sat vpon water people stode vpon londe see syde preached longe vnto thē parable sayde vnto thē doctryne herken beholde wente sower sowe happened whyle sowinge fell waye syde came foules vnder heauen ate vp fell vpon stonye grounde moch earth anone came vp depe earth whā sonne arose caught heate moch rote wythred awaye fel amonge thornes thornes grew vp choked gaue frute fell vpon good grounde gaue frute came vp grew bare thirtie folde sixtie folde hundreth folde sayde vnto hath eares heare let heare whan alone aboute wt twolue mat 1 • b luc 8 b axed concernynge parable sayde vnto thē vnto geuen knowe mystery kyngdome god vnto without thinges happen parable esa 6 b iohā 12 c act 28 rom 11 b seynge eye maye se discerne hearinge eares maye heare vnderstōde lest eny tyme turne synnes forgeuen sayde vnto vnderstonde ye parable wyl ye vnderstonde parable sower soweth worde waye syde worde sowne mat 13 c soone haue herde immediatly commeth sathā taketh awaye worde sowen hertes likewyse sowen stonye grounde haue herde worde receaue ioye haue rote endure tyme trouble persecucion aryseth ye wordes sake immediatly offended sowen amōge thornes heare worde ye carefulnes worlde disceatfulnes rich many lustes entre choke worde made vnfrutefull yt sowen vpō good grounde heare ye worde receaue brynge forth frute thirtie folde sixtie folde hundreth folde mat 5 b luc 8 b 11 c sayde vnto thē candle lighted put vnder buszhell vnder table lighted set vpon candelsticke nothinge hyd shal openly shewed nothinge secrete yt shal knowne mat 10 • luc • 12 • hath eares heare let heare sayde vnto take hede ye heare measure ye mete shal measured vnto agayne vnto heare mat 7 • luc • • shal geuen hath vnto shal geuen hath • • • luc • • shalbe taken awaye euen hath sayde kyngdome god maner man casteth sede vpon londe slepeth stondeth vp night daye mat • sede spryngeth vp groweth knowinge earth bryngeth forth frute selfe first grasse afterwarde eare full wheate eare whan hath brought forth frute putteth syckell haruest come sayde vnto wyl welicken kyngdome god symilitude wyl compare mat▪ • luc▪ • like grayne mustarde sede whā sowē vpō londe leest amonge sedes earth whā sowen groweth vp greater herbes getteth greate braunches yt foules vnder heauē maye dwell vnder ye shadowe therof many soch parable spake worde vnto thē might heare 〈…〉 without parable spake nothinge vnto vnto disciple expounded thinges pryuately daye euen sayde vnto mat • luc▪ • let u passe ouer let people go toke shippe mo shippes arose greate storme wynde daszhed wawes shippe shippe full behynde shippe slepte vpon pelowe awoke sayde vnto master carest thou perishe arose rebuked ye wynde sayde vnto see peace styll wynde layed folowed greate calme sayde vnto ye fearfull ye haue faith feared exceadingly sayde one another wynde see obedient vnto v chapter came ouer vnto syde see countre gaderenites 〈…〉 whan wēte shippe met mā possessed vncleane sprete dwellinge graues man coude bynde hym cheynes oft bounde fetter cheynes pluckte cheynes sunder brake fetter peces man coude tame allwaye daye night vpon mountaynes graues crienge beatinge self stone whan sawe iesus afarre ranne fell downe cried loude sayde 〈…〉 haue iesus thou sonne ye hyest god charge god thou torment neuertheles sayde vnto go man thou foule sprete axed thy name answered sayde name legion many v prayed instantly wolde sende awaye countre euen mountaynes greate heerd swyne fedynge 〈…〉 deuyls praied sayde let v departe swyne anone iesus gaue leue foule spretes wente intred swyne heerd swyne ranne heedlinges ye see storme aboute two thousande swyne drowned see swyne herdes fled tolde cite countre wente se happened came iesus sawe hym possessed ye legion sat clothed right mynde afrayed sene tolde happened possessed swyne beganne praye wolde departe coastes whan came shyppe possessed prayed might neuertheles iesus wolde suffre hī saide vnto hī go ī ye house thine awne tell thē greate benefites lorde hath done ye hath mercy vpon wente waye beganne publish ten city greate benefites iesus done euery man marueyled whan iesus passed ouer agayne shippe gathered moch people vnto 〈…〉 see syde beholde came one ruler synagoge whose name iairus whan sawe fell downe fete besought greatly sayde doughter poynte death let thy pleasure come laye thine honde vpon maye whole lyue wente moch people folowed thronged woman bloude yssue twolue yeares mat 9 c luc 8 c suffred moch many phisicians spent helped rather worse case whan herde iesus came behynde amonge people touched garment sayde yf maye touch clothes shal whole immediatly ye fountayne hir bloude dryed vp felt hir body yt healed plage forth iesus felt power gone turned aboute amōge people sayde hath touched clothes disciple sayde vnto thou seist people thrusteth sayest hath touched loked aboute se done woman feared trembled knew done came fell downe tolde whole trueth sayde vnto doughter luc 7 c thy faith hath made whole go thy waye peace whole thy plage whyle yet spake mat 9 c luc 8 f came certayne ruler synagoges house sayde thy doughter deed troublest thou master eny iesus herde right soone worde spoken sayde vnto ruler synagoge thou afrayed beleue onely suffred mā folowe peter iames ihon thinges wyszdome yt geuē soch actes done handes carpenter sonne mary brother iames io iude symon sister v also offended iesus saide vnto thē prophet nowhere lesse set mat 13 g luc 4 c iohā 4 c thē awne countre home amonge awne coude shew one miracle layed handes vpon sicke healed marueyled vnbeleue wente aboute townes euery syde taught called twolue begāne sende two two gaue power ouer vncleane spretes commaunded thē shulde take nothinge towarde iourney saue onely rodde scrippe bred money gerdell shulde shod sandales shulde put two cote sayde vnto euer ye shal entre house abyde tyll ye go thence euer wyll receaue ner heare mat 10 b luc 9 departe thence shake dust youre fete wytnesse vnto saye vnto verely shal easyer sodome gomorra daye iudgment mat 11 luc 10 cite mat 10 wēte forth preached men shulde amēde selues cast many deuyls many sicke anoynted oyle healed thē came kynge herod eares name knowne sayde mat 14 luc 9 ihon baptist rysen agayne deed therfore dedes sayde vnto herode 〈…〉 laufull haue ye brother wife herodias layed wayte wolde haue slayne coude notwithstōdinge herode feared ihō knew iust holy man kepte herkened vnto many thinges herde gladly came conuenient daye herode byrth daye made supper lordes 〈…〉 captaynes chefe estate galile daughter herodias came daunsed pleased herode sat table sayde kynge vnto ye damsel axe thou wilt wil geue sware vnto soeuer thou shalt axe wil geue euen vnto ye one half kyngdome wente forth sayde vnto hir mother shal axe sayde ihon baptistes heade immediatly wēte kinge haist sayde thou geue straight waye platter heed ihon baptist kynge sory yet oothes sake thē sat table wolde saye nay immediatly sent hangman commaunded heade brought wēte heeded preson brought heade platter gaue vnto damsell damsell gaue vnto hir mother whan 〈◊〉 herde came toke body layed graue apostle came together vnto iesus tolde hī 〈…〉 done taught sayde vnto let v go waye wyldernes rest litle many cō mers goer tyme ynough eate passed shippe ye waye deserte place people sawe thē departynge awaye many knewe ranne thither together fote city came thē came vnto iesus wente 〈…〉 sawe moch people cōpassion vpon 〈…〉 shepe haue shepherde begāne lōge sermon whan daye farre past disciple came vnto sayde deserte place 〈◊〉 14 b let departe maye go vyllagies townes rounde aboute bye themselues bred haue nothinge eate iesus answered sayde vnto geue ye eate sayde vnto shal go bye two hundreth peny worth bred geue eate sayde vnto 〈◊〉 8 many loaues haue ye go se searched sayde fyue two fiszhes commaunded syt downe table fulles vpon grene grasse sat downe arowe arowe hundred fifty toke fyue loaues two fiszhes loked vp vnto heauen gaue thankes brake loaues gaue disciple set two fiszhes parted amonge ate satisfied toke vp twolue baskettes full ye broken peces fiszhes ate aboute fyue thousande men anone caused disciple go shippe 〈◊〉 • 4 c 〈◊〉 6 b passe ouer vnto bethsaida whyle sent awaye people euen shippe myddest see alone vpon londe sawe parell rowynge wynde agaynst aboute fourth watch ye night came vnto walked vpon see wolde haue gone ouer thē whan sawe walkinge vpon see thought bene asprete cried sawe afrayed immediatly talked sayde vnto good comforte 〈◊〉 14 afrayed wēte vnto shippe wynde ceassed astonnyed marueled exceadingly forgotten 〈◊〉 6 e loaues hert blynded whan passed ouer came lande genezareth drue vp hauen whan thy come shippe immediatly knewe ranne thorow region aboute beganne euery syde brynge vnto beddes soch sicke herde whither euer entred townes city vyllagies layed sicke market place prayed might touch hemme garment many touched made whole vii chapter came vnto pharises certayne scrybes mat 15 come ierusalē whā sawe certayne disciple eate bred comon vnwashen handes complayned pharises iewes eate excepte wash handes oft tymes obseruynge tradicions elder whan come market eate excepte waszhe many thynges haue taken vpon obserue washinge cuppes crus brasen vessel table pharises scrybes axed walke thy disciple tradicions elder eate bred vnwaszhen handes answered sayde vnto full well hath esay prophecied ypocrytes wryttē esa 29 c people honoureth wt lippes hert farre fro vayne serue whyle teach soch doctrynes nothinge commaundemētes mē ye leaue cōmaundement god kepe tradicions men wasshynge crus cuppes many soch thinges ye saide vnto thē goodly haue ye cast asyde cōmaundement god manteyne youre owne tradicions exo 20 b deut 5 moses sayde honoure father mother exo 21 b curseth father mother shal dye death ye saye mā shal saye father mother corban thinge yt shulde helpe withall geuē vnto god thus ye suffre nomore ought father mother make god worde none effecte thorow youre owne tradicions ye haue set vp many soch thinges ye called vnto people mat 15 b sayde vnto herken vnto ye vnderstonde nothinge without man defyle whan entreth goeth maketh man vncleane yf eny man haue eares heare let heare whan came people ye house disciple axed symilitude sayde vnto ye without vnderstondinge perceaue ye yet yt euery thinge without goeth mā defyle entreth hert ye bely goeth draught purgeth meates sayde thinge goeth man defyleth man within hert man proceade euell thoughtes aduoutrye whordome murthur theft coueteousnes wickednes disceate vnclennes wicked eye blasphemy pryde foolishnes euell thinges go within defyle man mat 15 c arose wente thence border tyre sydon entred house wolde let man knowe yet coude hyd certayne woman whose doughter foule sprete herde came fell downe fete heithē woman syrophenices besought wolde dryue deuell hir doughter iesus sayde vnto let child fed first mete take childrēs bred cast vnto dogges answered sayde vnto yee lorde neuertheles whelpes also eate vnder ye table ye childrēs crōmes sayde vnto sayenge go thy waye deuell departed thy doughter wente vnto house founde deuell departed hir doughter lyenge bed mat 9 luc 11 b whan wente agayne coastes tyre sydon came vnto see galile thorw myddes ye coastes tē city brought vnto one deaf impediment speach prayed wolde laye hande vpon toke syde people put fyngers eares dyd spyt touched tonge loked vp vnto heauen sighed sayde vnto ephatha opened immediatly eares opened bonde tōge lowsed spake right charged marc 1 9 shulde tell noman forbad published marueyled measure sayde gen 1 eccli 39 c hath done thinges well deaf hath made heare domme speake viii chapter tyme whan moch people nothinge eate iesus called disciple sayde vnto haue compassion vpon people haue taried wt thre dayes haue nothinge eate yf let go home fro fastynge shulde faynte waye tob 〈…〉 esa 〈…〉 come farre disciple answered shulde get bred wyldernes satisfie axed thē marc • many loaues haue ye sayde seuen commaunded people syt downe vpon grounde toke seuen loaues gaue thākes brake gaue thē vnto disciple set people set thē people small fyshes whan geuen thankes bad set people ate satisfied toke vp seuē baszkettes full ye brokē meate left yt ate vpō foure thousande sent thē awaye forth wente shippe disciple 〈…〉 came coastes dalmanutha pharises wente begāne dispute tempted desyred token heauē sighed sprete sayde 〈…〉 doth generacion seke token verely saye vnto shal tokē geuē vnto generacion left wēte againe shippe passed ouer forgat take bred 〈…〉 nomore shippe one loaf cōmaunded sayde take hede bewarre leuen pharises leuen herode myndes wauered sayde amonge selues haue bred iesus vnderstode sayde vnto trouble ye youre selues ye haue bred ye yet without vnderstondinge haue ye yet blynded hert haue ye eye se haue ye eares heare remē thou art christ charged strately shulde tell man begāne teach 〈◊〉 16 c 〈◊〉 20 b sonne man must suffre many thinges cast elder hye prestes scrybes put death thre dayes ryse agayne worde spake fre charged mat 17 • shulde tell man sene tyll sonne man rysen agayne deed kepte sayenge axed one another rysinge agayne deed axed sayde saye scrybes mala 3 • elia must first come answered sayde vnto elia eny thinge haue mercy vpon v helpe v iesus sayde vnto yf thou couldest beleue thinges possible vnto beleueth immediatly father childe cried teares sayde lorde beleue helpe thou myne vnbeleue whan christ mat •• verely saye vnto shal lose rewarde mat •• luc • offendeth one litle one beleue better mylstone hāged aboute neck cast see mat 5 • •• yf thy hāde offende cut better entre life lame thē hauynge two hondes go hell euerlastinge fyre worme dyeth fyre goeth yf thy fote offende cut better entre life crepell thē hauynge two fete cast hell fyre euerlastynge worme dyeth fyre goeth yf thine eye offende cast better entre ye kyngdome god one eye hauynge two eye cast fyre hell esa • eze • • worme dyeth fyre goeth euery mā must salted wt fyre 〈1 paragraph〉 euery offerynge shalbe seasoned wt salt • • 〈◊〉 • salt good yf ye salt vnsauery wherwith shal salted haue salt peace amonge yo selues one another x chapter rose vp came thence place iewry beyonde iordan people wēte agayne vnto heapes hir huszbande maried another cōmitteth aduoutrie brought childrē vnto might touch 〈◊〉 19 b 〈◊〉 1 • b disciple reproued brought thē neuertheles whan iesus sawe displeased sayde vnto suffre child shalt kyll thou shalt steale thou shalt beare false wytnesse thou shalt begyle man honoure thy father mother answered sayde vnto master haue kepte fro youth vp iesus behelde loued sayde vnto thou wantest one thinge go thy waye 〈◊〉 2 c 〈◊〉 4 sell thou hast geue vnto ye poore shalt thou haue treasure heauen come folowe take crosse vpon ye disconforted sayenge wente awaye sory greate possession iesus loked aboute sayde vnto disciple 〈◊〉 19 c 〈◊〉 1 • c hardly shal ryche come ye kyngdome god disciple astonnyed wordes iesus answered agayne sayde vnto deare child harde trust rich come kyngdome god easier camell go thorow eye nedle rich man entre ye kyngdome god yet astonnyed ye sayde amonge thē selues thē saued iesus behelde sayde men vnpossyble god god thinges possyble 〈…〉 sayde peter vnto beholde haue forsaken 〈◊〉 19 〈◊〉 1 • c folowed iesus answered sayde verely saye vnto man forsaketh house brother sister father mother wife child londes sake gospel shal receaue hundreth folde tyme house brethrē sister mother child londes persecucions worlde come euerlastinge life many first shal last last first luc 1 • c waye goinge vp ierusalem iesus wente mat 20 b luc 18 astonnyed folowed afrayed iesus toke twolue agayne tolde shulde happē vnto beholde go vp ierusalem sonne man shalbe delyuered vnto hye prestes scrybes shal condemne death delyuer vnto heythē shal mocke hī scourge spyt vpon put death thirde daye shal ryse agayne wēte vnto iames ihon ye sonnes zebede sayde master mat 10 c desyre whatsoeuer axe thou wilt v sayde vnto thē desyre ye shal sayde vnto graunte v maye syt one thy right hande one thy left hande thy glory iesus sayde vnto thē ye wote ye axe maye ye drynke cuppe yt shal drynke baptysed baptyme shal baptysed withall sayde vnto yee yt maye iesus sayde vnto cuppe drynke shal ye drynke dede baptysed baptyme shall baptysed withall neuertheles syt right hande left myne geue vnto prepared whā ten herde disdayned iames ihon iesus called sayde vnto ye knowe prynces ye worlde haue domynacion people mat 20 • marc 9 • luc 9 c 22 b ye mightie exercise auctorite amonge shal amonge euer wil greate amō ge shal youre mynister wyl chefest amonge shalbe seruaunt sonne man also came serued seruyce ioh 10 • geue life redempcion many came vnto iericho mat 20 luc 18 whan wente iericho disciple moch people sat one blynde barthimeus sonne thimeus ye waye begged whā herde iesus nazareth beganne crie saye iesu thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpon many reproued shulde holde tunge cried moch thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpō iesus stode styll bad call called blynde sayde vnto good conforte aryse calleth cast awaye garment stode vp came iesus iesus answered sayde vnto wilt thou vnto blynde sayde vnto master might se iesus sayde vnto go yt waye thy faith hath helped ye immediatly sight folowed waye xi chapter whan came nye ierusalem bethphage bethanye vnto mount oliuete mat 21 luc 19 c sent two disciple sayde vnto go towne lyeth soone ye come ye shal fynde foale bounde wher vpon man hath syttē lowse brynge hither yf eny man saye vnto wherfore ye saye ye lorde hath nede therof forth shal sende hither wēte waie founde foale tyed ye dore without partynge waye lowsed certayne yt stode axed ye ye lowse foale sayde vnto thē like iesus commaunded let alone brought foale vnto iesus layed clothes theron sat theron many spred garmētes waye • ohā 12 c cut downe braunches frō tree strowed thē waye wente folowed cried sayde hosyanna blessed psal 117 c commeth name lorde blessed kyngdome oure father dauid commeth name lorde hosyanna height lorde entred ierusalem wente temple loked vpon euen wente vnto bethany twolue morow whā departed bethanye hūgred sawe fygge tre afarre mat 21 b leaues came nye se yf coude fynde eny thinge theron luc 13 whan came founde nothinge leaues tyme fygges yet iesus answered sayde vnto neuer mā eate frute euermore disciple herde came ierusalem iesus wente temple beganne dryue seller byers prayer people ye haue made denne murthurers scrybes hye prestes herde mat •• iohā •• sought might destroye afrayed people marueled doctryne euen wente cite morow passed mat •• sawe fygge tre wythred vnto rote peter thought theron sayde vnto master beholde fygge tre yt thou cursedest wythred awaye iesus answered sayde vnto mat •• luc • haue faith god verely saye vnto euer saieth vnto mountayne avoyde cast thy self see 〈1 paragraph〉 douteth hert beleueth thinges shal come passe saieth loke sayeth shal come passe therfore saye vnto iohā •• 15 •• euer ye desyre youre prayer beleue ye shal receaue ye shal haue mat •• 1 • c • luc •• whan ye stonde praye forgeue yf ye haue ought ageynst eny man youre father also heauen maye forgeue youre trespaces came agayne vnto ierusalem whan wente temple mat •• luc •• came vnto hye prestes scrybes elder sayde vnto auctorite dost thou thinges gaue auctorite soch iesus answered sayde vnto thē wil axe worde also answere wyl tell auctorite baptyme ihon heauen men answere thought selues yf saye heauen shal saye dyd ye beleue yf saye men feare people helde ihon true prophet answered saide vnto tell iesus answered sayde vnto nether tell auctorite thinges xii chapter beganne speake vnto parable certayne mā planted vynyarde 〈◊〉 2 • 〈◊〉 20 made hedge aboute dygged wynne presse buylded tower let vnto huszbande men wente straunge countre whan tyme come sent seruaūt huszbande men might receaue huszbandmen frute vynyarde toke bet sent awaye emptye agayne sent vnto another seruaunt stoned brake heade sent awaye shamefully dealt withall agayne sent another slew many b • tt put death yet one sonne onely loued sent also vnto last sayde wyl stonde awe sonne huszbandmen sayde amonge themselues heyre come let v kyll shal inheritaunce toke slewe cast vynyarde shal lorde vynyarde shal come destroye huszbande men geue vynyarde vnto haue ye red scripture 〈◊〉 117 c stone buylders refused become headstone corner lordes doynge maruelous oure eye wente aboute take feared people perceaued 〈◊〉 22 b 〈◊〉 20 b spokē parable agaynst thē left wente waye sent vnto certayne pharises herodes officer take wordes 〈◊〉 20 c came sayde vnto hī master knowe thou art true carest man thou regardest outwarde appearaunce men teachest ye waye god truly laufull geue tribute vnto emperoure ought geue ought geue perceaued ypocrisye sayde vnto tempte ye saduces holde resurreccion axed • 12 c • uc 20 〈◊〉 2 • sayde master moses wrote vnto v yf eny man brother dye deut 25 leaue wife leaue child brother shal take wife rayse vp sede vnto brother seuen brother first toke wife dyed left sede seconde toke dyed left sede also thirde like maner seuen toke left sede last wyfe dyed also resurreccion whan shal ryse agayne whose wife shal seuen wife answered iesus sayde vnto ye erre ye knowe scryptures ner ye power god whan shal ryse agayne deed shal nether mary ner maried angel heauen touchinge deed shal ryse agayne haue ye red boke moses god spake vnto bush sayde exod 3 act 7 god abraham god isaac god iacob yet god god deed lyuynge therfore ye erre greatly came vnto one scrybes mat 22 herkened vnto thē disputed together sawe answered well axed chefest cōmaundement iesus answered chefest commaundemēt commaundementes deut 6 • 30 b heare israel lorde oure god one god thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy hert thy soule thy mynde thy strength chefest commaundement seconde like vnto thou shalt loue thy neghboure thy self leui 19 ro 13 b none greater commaundement scrybe sayde vnto master verely thou hast sayde right one god none without loue hert mynde soule strength loue man neghboure brent sacrifice offerynges whā iesus sawe answered discretly sayde vnto thou art farre kyngdome god durst man axe eny mo question iesus answered sayde whan taught temple saye scrybes mat 22 luc 20 c yt christ sonne dauid dauid saieth thorow holy goost lorde sayde vnto lorde psal 109 syt thou right honde tyll make thine enemy ye fotestole dauid calleth lorde thē sonne many people herde gladly taught thē sayde vnto thē bewarre scrybes mat 23 luc 20 c loue go longe garmentes loue saluted market syt gladly aboue synagoges table deuoure wyddowes house vnder coloure make longe prayer shal receaue damnacion luc 21 iesus sat ouer agaynst 4 reg 12 b god chest behelde people put money god chest many riche put moch came poore wyddowe put two mytes make farthinge called vnto disciple sayde vnto verely saye vnto poore wyddowe hath put ye godschest haue put haue put ī superfluyte hir pouerte hath put euen hir whole lyuynge xiii chapter whan wēte temple one disciple sayde vnto mat 24 luc 21 master se stone buyldinge iesus answered sayde vnto seist thou greate buyldinge shal one stone left vpō another yt shal broken downe whan sat vpon mount oliuete ouer ageynst temple peter iames ihon andrew axed pryuatly tell v whan shal come passe shalbe tokē whā shalbe fulfilled iesus answered beganne saye take hede man disceaue shal many come vnder name saye christ shal disceaue many whan ye shal heare noyse warres ye afrayed must ye ende yet one people shal ryse ageynst another isa 19 one realme ageynst another shal earth quake derth shal trouble begynnynge sorowes take ye hede youre selues shal delyuer vp • eade coūcell • ouse councels mat 10 b synagoges ye shal beaten shalbe brought prynces kynges namessake wytnesse vnto thē ye gospel must first preached amōge people nowwhan shal lede delyuer vp mat •• luc •• •• take ye thought afore ye shal saye ymagyn ye nothinge afore hande euer shal geuē houre speake ye speake holy goost one brother shal delyuer another vnto death father sonne child shal ryse ageynst father mother shal helpe death ye shal hated men name sake endureth ende shalbe saued whan ye shal se abhominaciō desolacion wherof spokē •• •• luc •• •• •• daniel prophet stonde ought readeth let marck well let thē iewry flye vnto mountaynes let house toppe descēde house ner come therin fetch eny thinge house let felde turne backe fetch clothes wo vnto childe geue suck dayes neuertheles praye ye youre flight wynter dayes shal soch trouble begynnynge ye creature god created vnto tyme nether shal yf ye lorde shortened dayes shulde man saued electes sake hath chosen hath shortened dayes yf eny man shal saye vnto yt tyme lo christ lo 〈…〉 luc •• beleue shal aryse false christes false prophetes shal token wonder disceaue euen chosen yf possyble take ye hede beholde haue tolde tyme trouble •• •• luc •• io •• •• sonne mone shal lose light starres shall fall heauen disdayned sayde serueth waist oyntment might haue bene solde thre hundreth pen bene geuē ye poore grudged agaynst iesus sayde let rest trouble ye hath done good worke vpō ye haue allwaye poore whā euer ye wil ye maye thē good haue ye allwaie hath done coulde come anoynte body buriall verely saye vnto euer gospell shal preached worlde shal also hath done tolde remembraunce iudas iscarioth one twolue wente vnto hye prestes 〈◊〉 2 • b 〈◊〉 22 〈◊〉 13 betraye vnto whan herde yt glad promysed wolde geue money sought might cōueniently betraye vpon ye first daye swete bred whā easter iambe offered 〈◊〉 12 c 〈◊〉 25 b 〈◊〉 2 • disciple sayde vnto wilt thou yt go prepare yt thou mayest eate ye easter lābe sent two disciple sayde vnto go youre waye cite shal mete mā bearinge pitcher water folowe euer goeth saye ye good man house master sendeth worde gest house wherin maye eate easter lābe wt disciple shal shewe greate parlour paued prepared make readye v ye disciple wēte forth came ye cite foūde sayde vnto thē prepared ye easter lambe euen came wt twolue sat table ate iesus sayde mat 26 b luc 22 b iohā 13 c verely saye vnto one yt eateth wt shal betraye sory sayde vnto hī one another another sayde answered saide vnto thē one twolue euen ye yt dyppeth ye platter sonne man truly goeth forth wryttē hī wo vnto mā sonne man betrayed better man neuer bene borne ate iesus toke bred mat 26 c luc 22 b 1 cor 11 c gaue thankes brake gaue thē sayde take eate body toke cuppe thāked gaue thē dranke therof sayde vnto bloude new testament shalbe shed many verely saye vnto hence forth wil drynke frute vyne tyll ye daye yt drynke new ye kyngdome god whā sayde grace wēte forth vnto mount oliuete iesus sayde vnto night shal ye offended mat 26 c wrytten zac 13 b wil smyte sheperde shepe shal scatred abrode neuertheles yt rysen agayne wil go galile peter sayde vnto act 1 though men shulde offended yet wolde offended iesus sayde vnto verely saye vnto ye todaye night ye cock crowe two tymes shalt thou denye thryse saide yet yee though shulde dye wt ye yet wil denie ye saide ī like maner came ye felde called gethsemane saide vnto disciple syt ye tyll go yonder praye toke peter iames ihon begāne waxe fearefull agonye sayde vnto thē soule heuy euē vnto ye death tary ye watch wente forth litle fell vpon grounde prayed yf possyble ye houre might passe frō sayde abba father thinges possyble vnto take cuppe awaye fro neuertheles wyl thou wilt came vnto founde thē slepynge sayde vnto peter symon slepest thou couldest thou watch one houre watch praye ye fal temptacion sprete wyllinge ye flesh weake wēte forth agayne prayde spake wordes returned founde slepynge agayne eye heuy knewe shulde answere came thirde tyme sayde vnto slepe take youre rest ynough houre come beholde ye sonne man shalbe delyuered handes synners aryse let v goynge beholde hande betrayeth mat 26 luc 22 iohā 18 immediatly whyle yet spake came iudas one twolue greate multitude swerdes staues hye prestes scrybes elder traytoure geuen tokē sayde euer kysse laye handes vpon lede awaye warely whā come wente straight waye vnto sayde vnto master master kyssed layed handes vpon toke one thē stode drew swerde smote hye prestes seruaunt cut eare iesus answered sayde vnto thē ye come forth murthurer swerdes staues take mat 26 f luc 22 daylie temple taught ye toke esa 53 b marc 15 c done hat scrypture maye fulfilled disciple forsoke fled folowed yonge mā clothed lynnen vpon bare skynne yonge mē toke holde let lynnen go fled naked mat 26 f luc 22 ioh 18 b led iesus vnto hye prest ye hye prestes elder scrybes come together peter folowed afarre hye prestes palace sat seruauntes warmed mat 26 f hye prestes whole councell sought wytnesse agaynst iesus yt might brynge death founde none many gaue false wytnesse agaynst wytnesses agreed together stode vp gaue false wytnes agaynst sayde herde saye wil breake downe temple made hōdes iohā •• thre dayes buylde another made wt handes wytnesse agreed together hye prest stode vp amonge axed iesus sayde 〈…〉 answerest thou nothinge vnto testifie agaynst helde tunge answered nothinge 〈…〉 thē hye prest axed agayne sayde vnto art thou christ sonne blessed iesus sayde ye shal se sonne man syt right hande power 〈…〉 come cloudes heauē hye prest rent clothes sayde nede eny mo wytnesses ye haue herde blasphemy thynke ye cōdemned giltie death beganne spyt vpō couer face smyte fistes saye vnto prophecie vnto v 〈…〉 seruauntes smote face peter beneth ye palace thē came one wench hye prest 〈…〉 whā sawe peter warmynge loked vpō hī sayde thou wast iesus nazareth also denyed sayde knowe nether tell thou sayest wente fore courte cock crew damsell sawe beganne agayne saye vnto stode one denyed agayne litle whyle yt stode sayde agayne vnto trueth thou art one thou art galilean thy speach soundeth euen alike begāne curse sweare knowe man ye speabe cock crew agayne thought peter vpon worde bounde iesus led awaye delyuered vnto pylate pylate axed art thou kynge iewes answered sayde vnto thou sayest hye prestes accused sore pylate axed agayne sayde answerest thou nothinge beholde sore laye ye charge neuertheles iesus answered nomore moch yt pylate marueyled feast easter wonte delyuer vnto presoner 〈◊〉 17 b euer wolde desyre ī preson sedicious one called barrabas vproure committed scrypture fulfilled 〈…〉 14 f sayeth coūted amonge euell doer 〈◊〉 27 c 〈◊〉 23 wēte reuyled wagged heades sayde fye vpon goodly breakest thou downe ye tē ple buyldest agayne thre dayes helpe ye self come downe frō crosse hye prestes also like maner laughed scorne amonge thē selues scrybes sayde hath helped helpe yf christ ye kyge israel let come downe frō crosse yt maye se beleue yt crucified wt hī checked hī also whā aboute sixte houre darcknesse ouer whole lōde tyll aboute ye nyenth houre mat 27 c luc 23 aboute ye nyenth houre iesus cried loude sayde eli eli lamma asabthani interpreted god god hast thou forsaken stode psal 21 whan herde yt sayde beholde calleth elia rāne one fylled spōge wt vyneger stickte vpō rede mat 27 c ioh 19 c gaue hī drynke sayde holde styll let se whether elia wil come take downe iesus cried loude gaue vp goost vale tēple rent two peces aboue tyll beneth captayne stode thereby ouer agaynst mat 27 f luc 23 c whā sawe yt gaue vp goost soch crye sayde verely man god sonne wemen also behelde afarre iohā ▪ 19 c amōge whō mary magdalene mary iames ye litle mother io salome folowed whā galile mynistred vnto hī many yt wēte vp wt hī ierusalem euen moch daye preparinge mat 27 g luc 23 c iohā 19 fore sabbath came one ioseph arimathia worshipfull senatoure loked also kyngdome god wēte boldely vnto pilate axed ye body iesus pylate marueyled yt deed allready called ye captayne axed hī whether lōge bene deed whā gotten knowlege captayne gaue ioseph ye body bought lynnē cloth toke downe wrapped hī ye lynnē clothe layed sepulcre hewē rocke rolled stone ye dore ye sepulcre mary magdalene mary io behelde mat 27 g layed xvi chapter whan sabbath past mary magdalene mary iames mat 28 luc 24 iohā 20 salome bought spyces yt might come anoynte hī came sepulcre vpō daye ye sabbathes early whā ye sonne arose sayde one another shal rolle v ye stone frō ye dore sepulcre whan loked sawe stone rolled awaye greate one wente sepulcre right hande sawe yonge man syttinge longe whyte garmēt vpon abaszhed sayde vnto thē ye afrayed ye seke iesus nazareth crucified rysen beholde ye place layed go ye youre waye tell disciple peter wil go galile act 1 shal ye se mar 14 sayde vnto wente forth haist fled sepulcre tremblynge feare come vpon nether sayde eny thinge eny man afrayed iesus whan rysen vp early vpō first daye sabbathes mat 28 luc 24 • cor 15 appeared first vnto mary magdalene cast seuen deuels wēte tolde thē mourned wepte whan herde lyued appeared vnto beleued warde two thē walkynge shewed vnder another figure luc 24 b whan goynge vpon felde wente tolde beleued also last eleuen sat table shewed vnto luc 24 c rebuked vnbeleue ye hardnesse hert beleued thē sene rysen sayde vnto go ye youre waye worlde mat 28 c iohā 20 c preach gospell vnto creature beleueth baptysed shalbe saued beleueth shalbe damned token shal folowe thē beleue act 5 b • 216 c 19 name shal cast deuyls act 2 luc 10 b act 28 speake new tunges dryue awaye serpētes yf drynke eny deedly thinge shal hurte act 14 b 28 luc 24 act 1 b 7 g shal laye handes vpō sicke shal recouer lorde spoken vnto taken vp heauen sytteth right hāde god wente preached euery lorde wrought confirmed worde token folowynge ende gospell marke gospell luke luke conteyneth chap cōcepcion byrth ihon baptist concepcion christ thākfull songes mary zachary▪ chap ii byrth circūcision christ receaued tēple symeon anna prophecie founde tēple amōge doctours chap iii preachinge baptyme presonment ihon baptyme christ rehearsall generacion father chap iiii iesus led wyldernesse fasteth tyme temptacion ouercōmeth deuell goeth galilee preacheth nazareth caphernaū iewes despyse deuels knowlege cō meth peter house healeth mother lawe doth greate miracle chap v christ preacheth shippe disciple forsake folowe clenseth leper healeth man palsye calleth mathew customer eateth open synners chap vi excuseth disciple plucke eares corne healeth man wythred hande choseth twolue apostle maketh swete sermon teacheth good euell chap vii healeth captaynes seruaunt rayseth vp wyddowes sonne death life enfourmeth disciple ihon baptist sent vnto commendeth ihon reproueth iewes vnthankfulnesse eateth pharisee woman waszheth fete hir teares forgeueth hir synnes chap viii christ apostle goeth frō towne towne preacheth sheweth parable sede telleth mother brother stilleth raginge see delyuereth possessed dryueth deuels heerde swyne helpeth sick woman iairus daughter chap ix sendeth twolue apostle preach herode heareth tell hī fedeth fyue thousande men fyue loaues two fish disciple confesse sonne god transfigureth vpon mount delyuereth possessed teacheth disciple lowly desyre vēgeaunce reproueth chap x sendeth seuentye preach geueth thē charge behaue selues prayseth heauenly father answereth scrybe tempted him▪ example samaritane sheweth mās neghbour martha receaueth lorde hir house mary magdalene feruent hearinge worde chap xi teacheth disciple praye dryueth deuel rebuketh blasphemous pharises requyre sygnes token eateth pharisee reproueth ypocrisy pharises scrybes ypocrites chap xii leuen pharises christ conforteth disciple agaynst persecucion warneth bewarre cuvetousnesse symilitude certayne rich man wyll haue hange vpō earthly thinges watch ready agaynst commynge chap xiii galilean pilate slew dyed syloe symilitude fyge tre christ healeth sicke woman parable mustarde sede leuen entre kyngdome christ reproueth herode ierusalem chap xiiii iesus eateth pharisee healeth dropsye vpon sabbath teacheth lowly telleth greate supper warneth wyll folowe laye accomptes wyll cost thē salt earth chap xv louynge mercy god openly set forth parable hundreth shepe sonne lost chap xvi parable wicked mammon one title god worde shal perish rich man poore lazarus chap xvii christ teacheth disciple avoyde occasion euell one forgeue another stedfastly trust god man presume owne workes healeth ten leper speaketh latter dayes ende worlde chap xviii teacheth feruēt prayer cōtinually pharisee publican kyngdome god belongeth vnto childrē christ answereth ruler promiseth rewarde vnto soch suffre losse sake folowe blynde mā restored sight chap xix zacheus ten seruauntes whō ten talētes delyuered christ rydeth ierusalem wepeth ouer chap xx axe christ one questyon axeth another parable vynyarde tribute te geuē vnto emperoure christ stoppeth mouthes saduce • chap xxi christ commendeth poore wyddow telleth destruccion ierusalem false teacher tokēs trouble come ende worlde owne commynge chap xxii christ betrayed eate easter lambe institucion sacramēt stryue shalbe greatest reproueth prayeth thre tymes vpon mount take bringe hye prestes house peter denyeth thryse bringe councell chap xxiii iesus brought pilate herode wemē make lamētacion prayeth enemy forgeueth synner vpon right hande dyeth crosse buried chap xxiiii wemen come graue christ apeareth vnto two disciple go towarde emaus stondeth myddest disciple openeth vnderstondinge scripture geueth charge ascendeth vp heauen gospell luke prologe luke moch many haue taken hande set forth ye wordes actes come passe amonge v like delyuered thē vnto v begynnynge sawe selues mynisters worde thought good diligently searched begynnynge wryte orderly vnto good theophilus thou mightest knowe certēte ye wordes wherof thou art childe elizabeth baren well stricken age came passe executed prestes office god whan course came acordinge custome presthode fell lott burne incense exo 30 b heb 9 wente temple lorde whole multitude people without prayer whyle incense aburnynge angell lorde appeared vnto stode right syde altare incēse whan zachary sawe abaszhed came feare vpon angell sayde vnto feare zachary thy prayer herde ye wife elizabeth shal beare sonne whose name thou shalt call ihon thou shalt haue ioye gladnesse many shal reioyce byrth shal greate lorde wyne stronge drynke shal drynke shalbe fylled wt holy goost euen mother wombe many child israel shal turne vnto lorde god shal go sprete power mala 3 matt 11 b elia turne hertes ye father vnto child vnfaithfull vnto wyszdome righteous make people ready lorde zachary sayde vnto angel wherby shal knowe gen 17 c 18 b iud • c 13 b olde wife well stricken age angell answered sayde vnto gabriell stonde god sent speake vnto shewe glad tydinges beholde thou shalt domme able speake vntyll daye come passe thou hast 4 7 beleued wordes shalbe fulfylled season people wayted zachary marueyled taried longe tē ple whā wēte coude speake vnto perceaued sene vision tēple beckened vnto remayned speachlesse fortuned whā tyme office wente home house dayes elizabeth wife conceaued hyd hir self fyue monethes sayde thus hath ye lorde done vnto ye dayes wherin hath loked vpō take awaye frome rebuke amōge men matt 1 c sixte moneth angell gabriel sent god cite galile called nazareth vnto virgin spoused vnto man whose name ioseph house dauid virgin name mary angell came vnto sayde hayle thou full grace lorde blessed art thou amonge wemen whā sawe abaszhed sayenge thought maner salutacion angell sayde vnto esa 7 c mat 4 c feare mary thou hast foūde grace god beholde thou shalt cōceaue thy wōbe beare sonne luc •• shalt call name iesus shalbe greate shalbe called ye sonne hyest lorde god shal geue ye seate dauid father esa •• shal kinge ouer ye house iacob euer 〈…〉 shalbe ende kyngdome sayde mary vnto angell shal seinge knowe mā angell answered sayde vnto holy goost shal come vpon power hyest shal ouer shadowe therfore holy also shalbe borne shalbe called sonne god beholde thy cosen elizabeth also hath cōceaued sonne hir olde age sixte moneth reported barem 〈…〉 wt god nothinge vnpossyble mary sayde beholde hand 〈◊〉 lorde vnto thou hast sayde angell departed frō mary arose dayes wente moūtaynes haist 〈…〉 ye cite iewry came ye house zachary saluted elizabeth fortuned elizabeth herde salutacion mary babe sprange hir wombe elizabeth fylled holy goost cried loude sayde blessed art thou amō ge wemen blessed frute ye wombe happeneth ye mother lorde commeth vnto beholde whan herde voyce thy salutacion babe sprange wombe wt ioye blessed art thou hast beleued ye thinges shalbe perfourmed tolde ye frō ye lorde mary sayde soule magnifieth lorde 〈…〉 sprete reioyseth ī god sauioure hath loked vpō lowe degre hande mayde beholde frō hence forth shal generacions call blessed mightie hath done greate thinges vnto holy name mercy endureth thorow generacions vpon feare sheweth strength arme scatreth proude ymaginacion hert putteth downe mightie seate exalteth lowe degre 〈…〉 fylleth hongrie good thinges letteth riche go emptye remēbreth mercy helpeth vp seruaunt israel euen promysed vnto oure father 〈…〉 abraham sede foreuer mary abode aboute thre monethes returned home agayne elizabethes tyme come shulde delyuered brought forth sonne hir neghbours kynsfolkes herde yt lorde shewed greate mercy vpō reioysed fortuned vpon eight daye 〈◊〉 19 b 〈…〉 came circumcyse ye childe called zachary father mother answered sayde shalbe called ihon sayde vnto none ye kynne yt called made signes vnto father wolde haue called axed wrytinge table wrote sayde name ihon marueyled immediatly mouth tōge opened spake praysed god came feare vpon neghbours acte noysed abrode thorow hill countre iewry yt herde therof toke hert sayde maner man wil childe hande lorde zachary father fylled holy goost prophecied sayde blessed ye lorde god israel hath vysited redemed people hath set vp 〈…〉 horne saluacion house seruaunt dauid euen promysed afore tyme mouth holy prophetes wolde delyuer v frō oure enemy ye hande soch hate v yt wolde shewe mercy vnto oure father thynke vpō holy 〈◊〉 22 c couenaūt euen ooth yt sware vnto oure father abraham geue v 〈…〉 delyuered ye hāde enemy might serue without feare dayes oure life soch holynes righteousnes accepte thou childe shalt called prophet hyest thou shalt go ye lorde prepare wayes geue knowlege saluacion vnto people remyssion synnes thorow tender mercy oure god wherby daye sprynge hye hath vysited v might geue light vnto yt syt darcknesse shadowe death gyde oure fete waye peace childe grew waxed stronge sprete wyldernes tyll tyme shulde shewe self vnto people israel ii chapter fortuned tyme wēte cōmaundement frō augustus emperoure whole worlde shulde taxed taxynge first executed whan syrenius leftenaunt siria wente euery one owne cite taxed ioseph gat vp also frō galile cite nazareth iewry ye cite dauid 1 reg 1516 20 b called bethleem ye house lynage dauid might • axed wt mary spoused wife wt childe fortuned whyle ye tyme come shulde delyuered mat 1 c brought forth hir first begottē sonne wrapped inswadlinge clothes layed maunger el rowme ynne ye region shepherdes felde foldes watchinge flocke night beholde ye angell lorde stode thē ye brightnes lorde shone rounde aboute sore afrayed angell sayde vnto afrayed beholde brynge tydīges greate ioye shall happen vnto people vnto daye borne ye sauioure euē christ ye lorde cite dauid take token ye shal fynde babe swadled layed maunger straight waye angell multitude heauenly hoostes praysed god sayde glory vnto god hye peace vpon earth vnto men good wyll fortuned whā angel gone thē heauē shepherdes sayde one another let v go euen vnto bethleem se thinge happened ye lorde hath shewed vnto v came wt haist founde mary ioseph babe layed ye maunger whan sene published abrode sayenge yt tolde thē childe herde wondred wordes shepherdes tolde mary kepte sayenges pondred hir hert shepherdes returned praysinge laudinge god herde sene euen tolde whan eight dayes ended gen 17 b childe shulde circumcysed name called iesus luc 1 c named ye angell conceaued mother wombe whā dayes purificacion lawe moses leuit 12 b • reg 1 come brought ierusalē might present vnto lorde wrytten lawe lorde exo 13 num 8 c euery mā childe first openeth matrix shalbe called holy vnto ye lorde might geue offerynge wryttē lawe lorde namely payre turtle doues two yonge pigeon beholde man ierusalē whose name symeon mā iust feared god lōged consolacion israel holy goost answere geuē holy goost shulde se death sene ye lordes christ came inspiracion tēple whan elder brought childe iesus temple ye custome leui 12 b lawe toke vp armes praysed god sayde lorde lettest thou thy seruaūt departe peace acordinge thy promesse myne eye haue sene thy sauioure whō thou hast prepared people esa 49 b act 13 e light lightenynge heythē prayse ye people israel father mother marueyled thinges spokē symeon blessed sayde vnto mary mother beholde childe shalbe set fall vprysinge agayne many israel token shalbe spokē agaynst swerde shal pearse thy soule thoughtes many hertes maye opened prophetisse one anna doughter phanuel trybe aser greate age lyued seuen yeares hir huszbāde hir virginite bene wedowe aboute foure score foure yeares came neuer frō tēple seruynge god wt fastynge prayenge daye night came forth also houre praysed lorde spake vnto loked redempcion ierusalem whan perfourmed acordinge lawe lorde thy returned īto galile owne cite nazareth childe grewe wexed stronge sprete full wyszdome grace god elder wente ierusalem euery yeare feast easter whan twolue yeare olde wente vp ierusalem 〈…〉 custome feast whan fulfilled dayes gone home agayne 〈…〉 childe iesus abode styll ierusalem elder knewe thought bene company came dayes iourney sought hī amōge kynszfolkes acquā taunce whā founde wēte agayne ierusalē sought fortuned thre dayes yt founde temple syttinge amonge teacher hearynge thē opposynge herde wōdred vnderstondynge answeres 〈…〉 whan sawe astonnyed mother sayde vnto sonne hast thou done vnto v beholde thy father haue sought sorowynge sayde vnto ioh • •• ye haue sought wyst ye yt must go aboute father busynes 〈…〉 vnderstode sayenge yt spake vnto wente downe thē came nazareth obediēt vnto mother kepte wordes hir hert iesus increased wyszdome age fauoure god men iii chapter fiftenth yeare raigne tiberius emperoure whā pontius pilate leftenaūt iewry herode one foure prince galile 〈…〉 brother philippe one foure prynces iturea coastes traconites lysanias one foure prince abilene hannas caiphas hye prestes thē came ye worde god vnto ihon sonne zachary wyldernes came ye coastes aboute iordan preached baptyme repētaunce remyssion synnes 〈…〉 wryttē ye boke ye sayenges esaye prophet sayeth voyce cryer wyldernes 〈…〉 prepare waye lorde make pathes straight euery valley shalbe fylled euery mountayne hyll shalbe brought lowe croked shalbe made straight rough shalbe made smooth flesh shal se sauioure god sayde vnto people yt wente baptysed 〈…〉 ye generacion viper hath certified ye shal escape ye wrath come take hede brynge forth due frutes repētaūce begynne saye haue abrahā father saye vnto god able stone rayse vp child vnto abraham axe put vnto tre allready euery tre bryngeth forth good frute vnto master shal sayde vnto requyre nomore appoynted ye soudyours axed likewyse sayde shal sayde vnto thē man violence ner wronge content youre wage whan people doute thought hertes whether christ ihon answered sayde vnto thē baptyse water cōmeth one stronger thē whose shue lachet worthy lowse 〈◊〉 • b 〈◊〉 1 〈◊〉 1 c •• c 36 shal baptyse holy goost fyre whose fanne hande shal pourge floore 34 • 19 b dayes ate nothinge whan ended hongred afterwarde deuell sayde vnto yf thou ye sonne god cōmaunde stone yt bred iesus answered sayde vnto hī wrytten deut 8 b man shal lyue bred onely euery worde god ye deuell toke vp hye moūtayne shewed kyngdomes ye whole worlde ye twinckelinge eye sayde vnto power wil geue vnto glory therof geuē ouer vnto geue wil yf thou wilt worshippe shal thine iesus answered sayde auoyde fro thou satan wrytten thou shalt worshippe lorde thy god • eut 6 c onely shalt thou serue caried ierusalem set vpon pynnacle temple sayde vnto yf thou ye sonne god cast thy self downe hence wryttē shal geue angel charge ouer kepe • sal 90 b handes shal holde vp thou dashe thy fote agaynst stone iesus answered sayde vnto • eut 6 c sayde thou shalt tempte lorde thy 6 came vnto nazareth noursed custome wē te synagoge vpon ye sabbath stode vp rede delyuered esd 8 b boke ye prophet esay whan turned ouer boke founde place wrytten sprete lorde hath anoynted 〈◊〉 61 preach gospell vnto ye poore hath sent heale broken harted preach delyueraūce captyue sight blynde frely set liberty brused preach acceptable yeare lorde whan closed boke gaue agayne ye mynister sat downe eye synagoge fastened begāne saye vnto daye scripture fulfilled youre eares 〈…〉 gaue wytnesse wōdred gracious wordes proceaded mouth saide iosephs sonne iohā •• sayde vnto doutles ye wyl saye vnto prouerbe phisician heale thyself greate thinges haue herde done capernaū also thine owne countre saide •• •• •• •• iohā •• verely saye vnto prophet accepted owne countre neuertheles trueth saye vnto 〈1 paragraph〉 many wedowes israel ye tyme elia whā heauē shut thre yeares sixe monethes whan greate derth lande none thē elia sent onely vnto sarepta sydonyans wedowe 〈…〉 many leper israel tyme eliseus ye prophet none thē clensed saue onely naaman syria many synagoge whā herde yt fylled wrath rose vp thrust cite led vp edge hyll whervpō cite buylded might cast downe headlynge wente waye euen thorow myddest •• •• •• •• iohā •• came capernaum cite galile taught thē vpō sabbathes wondred doctryne •• •• luc •• preachinge power synagoge man possessed foule deuell cryed loude sayde let alone haue wt thou iesus nazareth •• •• art thou come destroye v knowe ye thou art euen holy god iesus rebuked sayde holde thy tūge departe deuell threw hī myddest amonge departed dyd harme came feare ouer thē spake amonge themselues sayde maner thinge commaundeth foule spretes auctorite power departe ye fame noysed thorow place ye countre rounde aboute rose vp synagoge •• •• •• •• came symons house symōs mother lawe takē greate feuer prayde wēte vnto cōmaunded feuer left īmediatly rose vp mynistred vnto thē whan sonne gone downe sicke dyuerse disease brought thē vnto • • b 〈◊〉 • c layed hā de vpon euery one thē made thē whole •• rc 3 b deuels also departed many criē ge sayenge thou art christ sonne god rebuked thē suffred speake knewe christ whā daye wēte deserte place people sought hī came vnto kepte yt shulde departe frō thē sayde vnto thē must preach gospell ye kyngdome god city also sent preached synagoges galile v chapter came passe yt people preassed vpon heare worde god 〈◊〉 4 c 〈◊〉 1 b stode lake genazereth sawe two shippes stōde ye lake syde ye fisher gone thē waszhed nettes wente one shippes symons prayed yt wolde thrust litle frō londe sat downe taught people ye shippe whan left talkynge sayde vnto symon launch depe let slyppe yo nettes make draught symon answered sayde vnto master haue laboured ye night taken nothinge vpō thy worde wil lowse forth nett whā done toke greate multitude fiszhes net brake made sygnes felowes ye shippe yt shulde come helpe thē came fylled shippes full yt soncke whan symon peter sawe yt fell downe iesus knee sayde lorde go frome synfull man astonnyed wt draught fish toke iames ihon also sonnes zebede symons companyons iesus sayde vnto symō feare frō hence forth thou shalt take men brought shippes londe 〈◊〉 4 c left folowed 〈…〉 〈◊〉 4 fortuned cite beholde man full leprosy whā sawe iesus fell vpō face besought sayde lorde yf thou wilt thou canst make cleane stretched hāde touched sayde wil thou cleane immediatly leprosy departed charged yt shulde tell mā go thy waye sayde shewe thy self vnto ye prest offre ye clensynge leui 14 moses cōmaunded witnesse vnto thē ye fame hī wēte farther abrode came moch people together heare healed hī frō sickness departed wyldernesses gaue prayer fortuned vpō daye yt taught sat ye pharises scrybes come townes galile mat 9 marc 2 iewry frō ierusalē power lorde wēte frō healed euery man beholde certayne men brought vpon bed man yt ye palsye sought might brynge laye whan coude fynde waye might bringe ye people clymmed vp ye toppe house let downe thorow tylinge wt bed amōge thē iesus whan sawe faith sayde vnto hī man yi synnes forgeuē ye scrybes pharyses begāne thynke saide yt speaketh blasphemy esa 45 44 • cā forgeue synnes onely god neuertheles whā iesus perceaued thoughtes answered saide vnto thē thynke ye yor hertes mat 9 marc 2 iohā 5 whether easier saye thy synnes forgeuē ye saye aryse walke ye maye knowe sonne mā hath power forgeue synnes vpon earth sayde vnto ye sicke palsie saye vnto ye aryse take vp ye bed go home immediatly rose vp thē toke vp bed yt lyen vpō wēte home praysed god astonnyed gaue god ye prayse fylled wt feare sayde haue sene maruelous thynges daye afterwarde wēte sawe publican named leui syttinge ye receate custome sayde vnto folowe mat 9 marc 2 b luc 15 left rose vp folowed leui made hī greate feast ī house many publican sat wt hī ye table scrybes pharyses murmured agaynst disciple saide wherfore ye eate drynke wt publicās synners luc 7 e 15 iesus answered sayde vnto thē whole nede ye phisician yt sicke come call ye righteous sinner repentaūce1 tim 1 c sayde vnto wherfore fast ye disciple ihō praye moch disciple pharises likewyse ye disciple eate drynke sayde vnto ye make weddynge childrē fast lōge brydegrome thē tyme wil come brydegrome shalbe takē frō thē shal fast sayde vnto symilitude man putteth pece new cloth olde garment el renteth new pece new agreeth olde man putteth new wyne olde vessel el ye new wyne barsteth vessel runneth self vessel perishe new wyne must put new vessel preserued man drynketh olde wolde straight waye haue new sayeth olde pleasaunter mat 12 • arc 2 cthe vi chapter fortuned vpon pryncipall sabbath wente thorow corne felde disciple plucked eares corne ate rubbed thē hādes certayne pharises sayde vnto wherfore ye laufull vpon sabbath iesus answered sayde vnto thē haue ye red dauid dyd whā hongrie wente house god toke reg 21 c exo 25 c shewbred ate gaue also vnto laufull man eate prestes onely sayde vnto sonne man lorde euen ouer sabbath mat 12 b marc 3 came passe vpō another sabbath wēte synagoge taught man whose right hande wythred ye scrybes pharises marked whether wolde heale vpon sabbath might fynde occasion agaynst neuertheles perceaued thoughtes sayde vnto mā wythred hande aryse steppe forth arose stepped forth sayde iesus vnto thē wil axe question laufull vpō sabbath good euell saue life destroye behelde thē rounde aboute sayde vnto mā stretch thine hande dyd hande restored right euen whole fylled full madnes commoned together wolde mat 14 marc •• fortuned tyme wente mountayne praye continued night prayer god mat •• marc •• •• luc •• act •• whā daye called disciple chose twolue called also apostle symon named peter andrew brother iames ihon phylippe bartylmew mathew thomas iames sonne alpheus symon called zelotes iudas sonne iames iudas iscarioth traytoure wente downe mat •• marc •• stode vpon playne felde company disciple greate multitude people iewry ierusalē tyre sydon see coast come heare healed disease vexed foule spretes healed people sought touch wente vertue frō healed thē •• •• lift vp eye vpō disciple sayde blessed ye poore kyngdome god blessed ye honger ye shalbe satisfied blessed ye yt wepe ye shal laugh blessed ye whan men hate put cōpanyes reuyle cast youre name euell thinge sonne man sake reioyse ye glad beholde youre rewarde greate heauen 〈…〉 euen thus dyd father vnto prophetes also wo vnto riche ye haue youre cōsolacion allready wo vnto full ye shal honger wo vnto laugh ye shal wepe wayle wo vnto whan euery man prayseth euen dyd father vnto false prophetes also saye vnto heare loue youre enemy good vnto hate blesse curse praye wrongfully trouble smyteth one cheke offre ye also taketh awaye thy cloake forbyd yt cote also euer axeth geue taketh awaye thyne axe agayne 〈1 paragraph〉 ye wolde men shulde vnto euen ye vnto likewyse 〈…〉 yf ye loue loue thāke haue ye therfore synners also loue louers yf ye good youre good doer thanke haue ye therfore synners also euen yf ye lende vnto whō ye hope receaue thāke haue ye ther fore synners also lende vnto synners maye receaue moch agayne rather loue ye yor enemy good lende lokynge nothinge therof agayne shal yor rewarde greate ye shalbe child hyest kynde euen vnthankfull euell 〈◊〉 7 〈◊〉 12 c ye therfore mercifull youre father also mercifull iudge ye shal iudged condēpne ye shal condempned forgeue ye shal forgeuen 〈…〉 geue shalbe geuē good measure pressed downe shaken together rūnynge ouer shal mē geue youre bosome measure ye meete shal measured agayne 〈◊〉 7 〈◊〉 4 c sayde symilitude vnto thē blynde shewe waye ye blynde 〈◊〉 15 b thē fall dyche disciple aboue master whosoeuer perfecte 〈◊〉 10 c 〈◊〉 13 b ye shalbe master seist thou moote ī thy brother eye considrest beame thine awne eye canst thou saye vnto thy brother holde styll brother wil plucke ye moate thyne eye 〈◊〉 7 thou thy self seist ye beame thine awne eye thou ypocryte fyrst cast beame thine awne eye thē shalt thou se clearly pull moote thy brother eye good tre yt bryngeth forth euell frute 〈◊〉 7 b 〈◊〉 • 2 euell tre yt bringeth forth good frute euery tre knowne frute mē gather fygges thornes ner grape buszhes good mā ye good treasure hert bryngeth forth yt good euell mā euell treasure hert bryngeth forth euell abundaunce hert mouth speaketh call ye lorde lorde saye vnto 〈◊〉 1 〈◊〉 7 b 〈◊〉 23 〈◊〉 7 c 〈◊〉 1 c euer commeth vnto heareth wordes doth thē wil shewe lyke like vnto man buylded house digged depe layed ye foundacion vpon rocke whan water came floudes bett vpon house coulde moue groūded vpō ye rocke heareth doth like vnto man buylded house vpō earth without foundacion streames bett vpō fell immediatly greate fall house vii chapter whan ended talkynge vnto people mat 8 iohā 4 f wente capernaum captaynes seruaunt laye deed sicke loued whā herde iesus sent elder iewes vnto prayed wolde come make seruaunt whole whā came iesus besought instantly sayde worthy yt thou shuldest shewe loueth oure people hath buylded v ye synagoge iesus wente wt whan farre ye house ye captaine sent frēdes vnto hī saiēge vnto oh lorde trouble thy self worthy yt thou shuldest enter vnder rofe therfore thought self worthy come ye speake ye worde seruaūt shalbe whole self also mā subiecte hygher auctorite haue soudyers vnder saye vnto one go goeth another come cōmeth seruaūt doeth whan iesus herde yt marueyled hī turned aboute sayde vnto ye people yt folowed hī saye vnto greate faith haue founde israel whā sent came home agayne founde seruaūt sicke whole fortuned afterwarde wē te cite called naim many disciple wente moch people whan came nye gate cite beholde caried one deed onely sonne mother wyddowe moch people cite wente whan lorde sawe cōpassion sayde vnto wepe came nye touched coffyn bare stode styll sayde yonge man saye vnto aryse 3 17 • 4 4 • • act 9 f 20 b deed sat vp beganne speake delyuered vnto mother came feare praysed god sayde iohā 4 6 b greate prophet rysen amonge v god hath vysited people fame noysed iewry ye region laye rounde aboute disciple ihō shewed thinges ihon called vnto two disciple sent thē vnto iesus sayenge art thou shal come shal loke another whan men came sayde ihon ye baptist hath sent v vnto sayenge art thou shal come shal loke another houre healed many sickness plage frō euell spretes vnto many blynde gaue sight iesus answered sayde vnto thē go yor waye shewe ihon ye haue sene herde • sa 35 blynde se halt go leper clensed deaf heare deed aryse esa 61 gospell preached vnto ye poore blessed offended mat 11 whan messaungers ihō departed iesus begāne speake vnto ye people cōcernynge ihō ye gone se ye wyldernesse wolde ye se rede shakē wt wynde ye gone se wolde ye se mā clothed soft rayment beholde gorgiously arayed lyue delycately kynges courtes ye gone se wolde ye se prophet yee saye vnto one thē prophet wrytten beholde sende messaunger ye face • al 3 • arc 1 shal prepare thy waye saye vnto amonge thē yt borne wemē greater prophet thē ihon baptist notwith stondynge lesse kyngdome god greater people herde ye publican iustified god baptysed baptyme ihon pharises scrybes despysed ye councell god thē selues baptised hī lorde saide vnto shal licken men generacion • 11 c like like vnto childrē syt market crye one another saye haue pyped vnto ye haue daunsed haue mourned vnto ye haue wepte ihon ye baptist came • 3 ate bred drāke wyne ye saye hath ye deuell sonne man come eateth drynketh ye saye man glutton wyne bebber frende publican synners wyszdome iustified hir child • 26 • ar 14 one pharises desyred yt wolde eate wente pharises house sat downe ye table •• hā 1 • beholde cite womā synner whē knewe iesus sat table pharises house brought boxe oyntment stode behynde fete wepte beganne water fete teares drye thē wt hayres hir heade kyssed fete anoynted thē oyntmēt whan pharise called sawe spake within 〈…〉 sayde yf mā prophet wolde knowe maner woman toucheth synner iesus answered saide vnto simō haue somewhat saye vnto sayde master saye certayne lender two detters one ought fyue hundreth pen fiftie whan thinge paye forgaue thē tell wyl loue symon answered sayde suppose whō forgaue sayde vnto thou hast iudged right turned woman sayde vnto symō seist thou womā come thine house thou hast geuē water vnto fete hath watred fete teares dryed thē wt hayres hir heade thou hast geuē kysse sen tyme came hath ceassed kysse fete thou hast anointed heade wt oyle hath anoynted heade oyntment therfore saye vnto many synnes forgeuen hath loued moch vnto lesse forgeuen loueth lesse sayde vnto thy synnes forgeuen sat table beganne saye within selues forgeueth synnes also sayde vnto woman thy faith hath saued go thy waye peace viii chapter fortuned afterwarde wente thorow city townes preached shewed ye gospell kyngdome god twolue wt certayne wemen also 〈…〉 whō healed frō euell spretes infirmity namely mary 〈…〉 called magdalene wente seuen deuels ioanna ye wife chusa herodes stewarde susanna many mynistred vnto substaunce whā moch people gathered together 〈…〉 haisted vnto city spake asymilitude wente sower sowe sede whyle sowynge fell waye syde troddē vnder fote foules ayre ate vp fell stone whan spronge vp wythred awaye moystnesse fell amonge thornes thornes sprange vp choked fell vpō good grounde sprange vp bare frute hundreth folde whā sayde cryed hath eares heare let heare disciple axed sayde symilitude 〈◊〉 • 3 b 〈◊〉 4 sayde vnto geuē knowe mysteryes kyngdome god vnto parable yt though se shulde se though heare shulde vnderstonde 〈…〉 parable sede worde god ye waye syde heare afterwarde commeth deuell taketh awaye worde hertes shulde beleue saued ye stone soch whan heare receaue worde ioye haue rote beleue whyle tyme temptacion fall awaye fel amonge thornes soch heare go forth amonge care rich volupteousnesses life choked brynge forth frute good grounde heare worde kepe pure good hert brynge forth frute pacience man lighteth cādell couereth vessell 〈…〉 putteth v • der table setteth vpon candelsticke soch go maye se light 〈…〉 nothinge hyd shal openly shewed nothinge secrete shal knowne come light take hede therfore ye heare 〈◊〉 13 b 〈◊〉 5 c 〈◊〉 4 c 〈◊〉 • c hath vnto shalbe geuē hath shalbe taken awaye euē thynketh haue wente vnto mother brother coude come people tolde thy mother thy brother stonde without 〈…〉 wolde se answered sayde vnto thē mother brother heare worde god 〈…〉 fortuned vpon certayne daye yt wente shippe disciple wt sayde vnto thē let v passe ouer syde ye lake thurst frō lōde sayled slepte came storme wynde vpon ye lake wawes fell vpon thē stode greate ioperdy wēte vnto waked vp sayde master master perishe arose rebuked wynde tēpest water ceassed waxed calme sayde vnto thē youre faith neuertheles afrayed wōdred sayde one another cōmaundeth wyndes water obedient vnto mat 8 marc 5 • sayled forth countre gadarenites ouer agaynst galile whan wente londe met ye cite mā deuell longe tyme ware clothes taried house graues neuertheles • whā sawe iesus cried fell downe cried loude sayde haue iesus thou sonne hyest god beseke thou wilt tormēte cōmaunded foule sprete shulde departe mā plaged hī lōge season bounde cheynes kepte wt fetter brake bondes sonder caried deuell wyldernesse iesus axed sayde thy name sayde legion many deuels entred besought wolde cōmaunde thē go depe mat 8 marc 5 b greate heerd swyne fedynge vpon mountayne besought wolde geue leue entre ye gaue thē leue departed ye deuels mā entred swyne heerd ruszhed headlynges storme lake drowned whā ye herdmen sawe chaunsed fled tolde cite vyllagies wente se done came iesus founde mā deuyls departed syttinge iesus fete clothed right mynde afrayed yt sene tolde thē possessed healed whole multitude ye countre gadarenites besought wolde departe greate feare come vpon thē marc 5 b gat ye shippe turned ag • yne man whō deuels departed besought yt might iesus sent awaye sayde go home agayne shewe greate thinges god hath done wente waye preached thorow ye cite greate thinges iesus done hī mat 9 c marc 5 c fortuned whā iesus came agayne people receaued wayted beholde came man named iairus ruler synagoge fell iesus fete mat 9 c marc 5 c besought wolde come house one doughter vpon twolue yeare age laye ye poynt death wente people thronged womā hauynge bloudyssue twolue yeares spent hir substaunte vpon phisicians coude healed none came behynde touched hemme garmēt immediatly hir yssue bloude staunched iesus sayde hath touched whan denyed peter sayde master people thronge thrust thou sayest hath touched iesus saide body hath touched ifele vertue gone fro whan woman sawe hyd came trēblynge mat 9 c marc 5 fell downe tolde people cause touched healed immediatly sayde vnto doughter good comforte thy faith hath made whole go thy waye peace whyle yet spake came one frō ye ruler ye synagoges house sayde vnto thy doughter deed disease master whan iesus herde answered iohā 11 b sayde feare beleue onely shal made whole whan came house suffred man go saue peter iames ihō father mother mayden wepte sorowed sayde wepe deed slepeth laughed hī scorne knowynge well deed thrust toke hande cryed sayde maydē aryse hir sprete came agayne arose straight waye cōmaunded geue meate mat 10 marc 3 b 6 luc 6 b hir elder astonnyed charged shulde tell man done mar 6 luc 10 athe ix chapter called twolue together gaue power auctorite ouer deuels might heale disease sent thē receaue departe cite shake dust youre fete wytnesse ouer departed wente thorow townes preachinge ye gospell healynge euery herode tetrarcha herde done toke care moch sayde ihō rysen agayne deed elia hath appeared 〈1 paragraph〉 one olde prophetes rysen agayne herode sayde ihō haue beheaded whō heare soch thinges desyred se apostle came agayne tolde greate thinges done toke wente asyde solytary sack cloth asshes neuertheles shalbe easyer tyre sidon iudgment thou capernaum art exalted vnto heauen shalt thrust downe vnto hell heareth heareth 〈…〉 despyseth despyseth despyseth despyseth yt sent
