scorpion ouer power enemye nothinge shall hurte neuertheles reioyce ye spretes subdued vnto reioyse 〈1 paragraph〉 youre name wrytten heauen houre reioysed iesus sprete sayde 〈…〉 prayse father lorde heauen earth thou hast hyd thinges wyse prudent hast opened vnto babe euen father pleased 〈…〉 thinges geuen ouer vnto father 〈1 paragraph〉 man knoweth sonne onely father nether father saue onely sonne whō sonne wil open turned vnto disciple sayde especiall blessed eye se ye se saye vnto many prophetes kynges 〈…〉 wolde haue sene thynges ye se haue sene haue herde thynges ye heare haue herde beholde stode vp scrybe tempted sayde master must inheret euerlastinge life sayde vnto wrytten lawe readest thou answered sayde 〈…〉 thou shalt loue thy lorde god thy hert thy soule thy strength thy mynde 〈…〉 thy neghboure thy self sayde vnto thou hast answered right thou shalt lyue wolde haue iustified sayde vnto iesus neghboure answered iesus sayde certayne man wente downe ierusalem vnto iericho fell amonge murthurers stryped clothes wounded wente waye left half deed chaūce came downe prest waye whan sawe passed likewyse leuite whā came nye vnto place sawe passed samaritane goynge iourney came waye whan sawe compassion vpon wente vnto bounde vp woundes poured oyle wyne therin lifte vp vpon beast brought ynne made prouysion vpon next daye whan departed toke two pen gaue oost sayde vnto take cure euer thou spendest wil paye whan come agayne thre thinkest thou neghboure vnto fell amonge murtherers sayde shewed mercy vpon sayde iesus vnto go thy waye thou likewyse fortuned wēte entred towne woman named martha receaued hir house sister called mary 〈◊〉 33 sat hir downe iesus fete herkened vnto worde martha made hir self moch serue srepte vnto sayde lorde carest thou sister letteth serue alone byd therfore helpe iesus answered sayde vnto martha martha thou takest thought combrest thy self aboute many thinges 〈◊〉 25 one thinge nedefull mary hath chosen good parte shal taken awaye xi chapter fortuned place prayed whan ceassed one disciple sayde vnto lorde teach v praye ihon also taught disciple sayde vnto thē whan ye praye saye oure father art heauen halowed thy name thy kyngdome come thy wil fulfilled vpon earth heauen geue v daye oure daylie bred forgeue v oure synnes also forgeue detters vnto v lede v temptacion delyuer v euell sayde vnto hath frende shulde go mydinght saye vnto frende lende thre loaues frende myne come waye haue nothinge set within shulde answere saye disquyete dore shutt allready child chamber ryse geue saye vnto though wolde aryse geue frende yet vnshame fast begginge wolde aryse geue many neded saye vnto also axe shal geuen seke ye shal fynde pro 8 b mat 7 iohā 14 • 15 16 c knocke shalbe opened vnto euer axeth receaueth seketh fyndeth knocketh shal opened yf sonne axe bred eny father wyl geue stone therfore yf axe fyszhe wyl fish offre serpent yf axe egg wyl profer scorpion yf ye euell geue youre child good giftes moch shal father heauen geue holy sprete vnto axe droue deuell domme mat 9 • 12 • came passe whan deuell departed domme spake people wondred sayde dryueth deuels thorow beelzebub chefe deuels marc • tempted desyred token heauen knewe thoughtes sayde vnto euery kyngdome deuyded within self shal desolate one house shal fall vpō another yf sathan variaunce within shal kyngdome endure ye saye dryue deuels thorow beelzebub yf dryue deuels thorow beelzebul thē youre child dryue therfore shall youre iudges yf cast deuels fynger god kyngdome god come vnto whan stronge harnessed man kepeth house possesseth peace mat 12 col 2 whan stronger commeth vpō ouercommeth taketh frō wapens wherin trusted deuydeth spoyle agaynst gathereth scatereth abrode mat 12 c whan vncleane sprete gone man walketh thorow drye place sekynge rest fyndeth none sayeth wil turne agayne house whence wente whan commeth fyndeth swepte garnished goeth taketh vnto seuen spretes worse thē whan entred dwell ende man worse begynnynge fortuned whan spake soch certayne woman amonge people lift vp hir voyce sayde vnto blessed ye wombe bare pappes thou hast sucked sayde yee blessed heare worde god kepe whan people gathered thicke together beganne saye euell generacion • arc 8 b desyre tokē shal token geuen tokē prophet ionas • onae 3 〈◊〉 3 b like ionas tokē vnto niniuytes shal sonne man vnto generacion▪ quene south shal aryse iudgmēt men generacion 10 par 9 • 12 shall condempne came ende worlde heare wyszdome salomon beholde one salomon men niniue shal aryse iudgment generacion shall condempne dyd pennaunce preachinge ionas beholde one thē ionas • 5 b • arc 4 b 〈◊〉 8 b man lighteth candell putteth preuy place nether vnder buszhell vpon candilsticke come maye se ye light mat 6 c eye light body yf thine eye syngle thy body shal full light yf thine eye wicked shal thy body full darcknesse take hede therfore light darcknesse yf thy body light haue parte darknesse shal full light shall light euen cleare lightenynge whyle yet spake certayne pharise prayed wolde dyne wente sat downe table whan pharise sawe marueyled waszhed first dyner lorde sayde vnto ye pharises make cleane syde cuppe platter 〈…〉 youre inwarde partes full robbery wickednesse ye fooles thinge made cleane within outsyde clensed neuertheles geue almesse ye haue beholde cleane vnto wo vnto pharises ye tythe mynt rewe maner herbes 〈…〉 passe ouer iudgmēt ye loue god ought haue bene done leaue vndone wo vnto pharises mat • • • luc • ye loue syt vppermost synagoges saluted market wo vnto scrybes pharyses ye ypocrites ye like couered sepulcres ouer men walke awarre answered one scrybes sayde vnto master wordes thou puttest v rebuke also saide wo vnto also ye scrybes ye lade men vntollerable burthen ye youre selues touch one yo fyngers 〈…〉 wo vnto ye buylde sepulcres prophetes 〈…〉 youre father put death doutles ye beare wytnesse consente vnto dedes yo father slewe ye buylde sepulcres therfore sayde wyszdome god 〈…〉 wil sende prophetes apostle vnto thē shal put death persecute bloude prophetes hath bene shed sen foundacion worlde layed maye requyred generacion 〈…〉 bloude abell vnto ye bloude 〈1 paragraph〉 zachary perished betwene altare ye temple yee saye vnto shalbe requyred generacion wo vnto scrybes 〈…〉 ye haue receaued ye keye knowlege ye come youre selues haue forbydden wolde haue bene whan spake thus vnto scrybes pharyses beganne preasse sore vpon stoppe mouth many question layed wayte sought hunte thinge mouth might accuse xii chapter gathered together innumerable multitude people moch trode one another beganne sayde first vnto disciple bewarre leuen pharises ypocrisye • 16 • arc 8 • ap 1 b • 10 • arc 4 b 〈◊〉 • b nothinge hyd shal discouered nether secrete shal knowne therfore soeuer ye haue spokē darknesse shal herde light ye haue spoken eare chābers shalbe preached vpon house toppes saye vnto frendes afrayed kyll body haue 〈◊〉 10 〈◊〉 • 0 c wil shewe ye shal feare feare hath sayde vnto master byd brother deuyde enheritaunce neuertheles sayde vnto man hath set iudge heretage parter ouer sayde vnto take hede bewarre couetousnesse man lyueth therof hath abundaunce goodes tolde symilitude sayde riche man whose felde brought forth frutes plenteously thought sayde shal haue nothinge wher gather frutes sayde wil wil breake downe barnes buylde greater therin wil gather myne increace goodes wil saye vnto soule soule thou hast moch goodes layed vp stoare many yeares 〈◊〉 • 1 c take thine ease eate drinke mery god sayde vnto thou foole iere 17 • night shal requyre thy soule psal 38 • whose shal thou hast prepared thus goeth yt gathereth treasure riche god sayde vnto disciple therfore saye vnto psal 54 mat 6 • 1 pet 5 take ye thought youre life ye shal eate nether youre body ye shal put life meate body raymēt consydre rauens nether sowe ner reape haue also nether stoarehouse ner barne yet god fedeth moch better ye foules though toke thought therfore coulde put one cubyte vnto stature mat 6 • seinge ye able least take ye thought considre lily vpō felde growe laboure spynne saye vnto euen salomen royalte clothed like one wherfore yf god cloth grasse yt daye ye felde tomorow shalbe cast fornace moch shal clothe ye litle faith axe ye therfore ye shal eate ye shal drynke clymme vp hye heithen worlde seke soch thinges seke ye kyngdome god shal mynistred vnto feare thou litle flocke youre father pleasure geue kyngdome deut 1 c 20 sell ye haue geue almesse make bagges waxe olde euen treasure neuer fayleth heauen thefe commeth mat 6 c 19 c moth corruppeth youre treasure wil youre hert also let youre loynes gerded aboute ephe 6 • 1 pet 1 c youre lightes burnynge ye like vnto men wayte lorde agaynst returne mariage whan cō meth knocketh maye straight waye open vnto blessed seruauntes lorde whan cōmeth shal fynde wakynge verely saye vnto luc 22 b shal gyrde vp self make syt downe table shal go mynister vnto yf come seconde watch thirde watch fynde blessed seruauntes sure mat 24 marc 13 yf good man house knewe houre thefe wolde come wolde surely watch suffre house broken vp therfore ye ready also houre whan ye thynke shal sonne man come • 25 peter sayde vnto lorde tellest thou symilitude vnto v men also lorde sayde greate thinge faithfull wyse stewarde lorde setteth ouer houszholde geue thē dewtye due season blessed seruaunt lorde whan cōmeth shal fynde doynge • po 16 c verely saye vnto shal set ouer goodes mat • 4 yf seruaūt shal saye hert tush wil longe lorde come shal begynne smyte ye seruauntes maydens yee eate drynke dronkē seruauntes lorde shal come daye whan loketh houre aware shal hew peces geue rewarde vnbeleuers • aco 4 b seruaunt knewe lordes wil prepared nether dyd acordinge shal • ten many strypes knewe yet dyd thinges worthy strypes shal beaten strypes loke vnto moch geuen shal moch sought loke moch commytted shal moch requyred come kyndle fyre vpō earth wolde rather thē kyndled allready notwithstōdinge must first baptised baptyme payned tyll ended thynke ye come brynge peace vpon earth mat 10 c mich 7 tell nay rather debate hence forth shal varyaūce one house thre agaynst two two agaynst thre father shal deuyded agaynst ye sonne sonne agaynst father mother agaynst doughter doughter agaynst mother mother lawe agaynst hir doughter lawe ye doughter lawe agaynst hir mother lawe sayde vnto people whan ye se cloude ryse ye west mat 1 • straight waye ye saye cōmeth shower whan ye se southwynde blowe ye saye wil hote commeth passe ye ypocrytes ye discerne fashion skye earth ye discerne tyme also yee iudge ye youre selues right whyle thou goest thine aduersary vnto prynce geue diligēce waye thou mayest quyte lest brynge iudge iudge delyuer iaylar iaylar cast preson tell thou shalt come thence tyll thou paye vttemost myte xiii chapter present season certayne shewed ye act 1 • galilean whose bloude pilate mē gled awne sacrifice iesus answered sayde vnto suppose ye galileās greater synners galilean suffred soch punyshment tell naye excepte ye amēde youre selues ye shal perishe likewyse thinke ye ye eightene vpon tower siloe fell slewe giltie aboue men dwell ierusalem tell naye excepte ye amende youre selues ye shal perishe likewyse tolde symilitude certayne mā fygge tre planted vynyarde came sought frute theron founde none sayde vnto wyne gardener beholde thre yeare longe haue come euery yeare sought frute vpon fygge tre fynde none cut downe hyndreth grounde answered sayde syr let alone yet yeare tyll dygge roūde aboute donge yf wyl brynge forth frute yf no▪ cut downe afterwarde taught synagoge vpon sabbath beholde womā sprete infirmyte eightene yeares croked coulde well loke vp whan iesus sawe called sayde vnto woman delyuered thy disease layed handes vpō immediatly made straight praysed god answered ruler synagoge toke indignacion iesus healed vpō ye sabbath sayde vnto people sixe dayes wherin men ought worke come healed sabbath lorde answered sayde thou ypocryte doth euery one lowse oxe asse frō crybbe vpō sabbath leade water shulde abraham doughter sathan hath bounde eightene yeares lowsed bonde vpō sabbath whan thus sayde aduersaries ashamed people reioysed ouer excellent dedes done 〈◊〉 13 〈◊〉 4 sayde kyngdome god like wher vnto shal cōpare like grayne mustarde sede man toke cast garden grewe waxed greate tre foules ayre dwelt amonge braunches 〈◊〉 13 c agayne sayde vnto shal licken kyngdome god like vnto leuen woman toke myxte amōge thre peckes meele 〈◊〉 1 • tyll leuended wēte thorow city townes taught toke iourney towarde ierusalem one sayde vnto lorde thinkest thou shalbe saued sayde vnto 〈◊〉 7 b stryue ye entre strayte gate many saye vnto shal seke come shal able tyme forth whan good man house rysen vp hath shut dore shal ye begynne stonde without knocke ye dore saye lorde lorde 〈◊〉 • 5 open vnto v shal answere saye vnto knowe whence ye shal ye begynne saye haue eaten dronken thou hast taught v vpon ye stretes shal saye tell knowe whence ye departe fro ye worker iniquyte 〈◊〉 6 b 〈◊〉 7 b 〈◊〉 25 shalbe wepynge gnaszhinge teth ye shal se abraham isaac iacob prophetes ye kyngdome god youre selues thrust whā shal come east west 〈…〉 north south shal syt ye table kyngdome god 〈◊〉 19 〈◊〉 20 b 〈◊〉 20 c beholde last shal fyrst first shalbe last vpon daye came certayne ye pharises sayde vnto get waye departe hence herode wyl kyll sayde vnto thē go ye tell foxe beholde cast deuels heale people todaye tomorow vpō thirde daye shal make ende prophet perishe without ierusalem 〈…〉 ierusalem ierusalē thou kyllest prophetes stonest thē sent vnto ye oft wolde haue gathered thy child together euen henne gathereth hir nest vnder hir wynges ye wolde beholde yo habitacion shal left vnto desolate saye vnto ye shal se tyll ye tyme come ye shal saye blessed luc 19 psal 117 • yt cōmeth ye name lorde xiiii chapter fortuned came house one ye chefe pharises vpō sabbath eate bred watched beholde mā ye dropsye iesus answered spake vnto scrybes pharises sayde luc 6 13 b mat 12 b marc 3 laufull heale sabbath helde tonge toke healed let go answered sayde vnto thē shal haue oxe asse fallen pytte exo 23 deut 22 • wil straight waye pull sabbath daye coude answere agayne tolde symilitude vnto ye gestes whā marked chose hyest seates sayde vnto thē whan thou art byddē eny man weddynge syt downe hyest rowme lest honorable man thē thou byddē bade come saye vnto ye geue mā rowme thou thē begynne shame take ye lowest rowme rather whā thou art byddē go syt ye lowest rowme whā bade cōmeth maye saye vnto frende syt vp hyer shalt thou haue worshipe presence syt table pro 25 euer exalteth shalbe brought lowe mat 23 b luc 18 b yt humbleth shalbe exalted sayde also vnto bydden whā thou makest dyner supper call thy frendes ner thy brother ner thy kynsfolkes ner ye riche neghbours lest call agayne recompēce made ye whā thou makest feast tob 4 • call poore crepell lame blynde art thou blessed recompēce ye shalbe recompensed resurreccion righteous whan one sat table herde sayde vnto blessed eateth bred ye kyngdome god sayde vnto mat 22 • apo 19 b certayne mā made greate supper called many ther ye houre supper sent seruaūte saye vnto thē yt byddē come thinges ready begāne together excuse thē selues one another first saide vnto hī haue bought ferme must nedes go forth se praye ye haue excused ye seconde sayde haue bought fyue yoke ox go proue praye haue excused thirde sayde haue maried wife therfore come seruaunt came brought lorde worde agayne therof good man house displeased sayde vnto seruaūt go quyckly stretes quarter ye cite brynge hither poore crepell lame blynde seruaūt sayde lorde done thou hast cōmaunded yet rowme lorde sayde vnto seruaunt go hye wayes hedge compell come house maye fylled saye vnto none men bydden shal taist supper wente moch people turned aboute sayde vnto • eut 13 b • 10 c • nd 16 yf eny man come vnto hate father mother wife childrē brethrē sister yee owne life also disciple whosoeuer beareth crosse foloweth disciple yt wil buylde tower sytteth downe first counteth ye cost whether haue sufficiēt perfourme lest hath layed foundaciō able perfourme se begynne laugh scorne saye man beganne buylde able perfurme kynge wil go make battayl agaynst another kynge sytteth downe first casteth mynde whether able ten thousande mete commeth agaynst twentye thousande el whyle yet greate waye sendeth embassage desyreth peace likewyse euery one forsaketh hath disciple mat 5 b marc 9 c salt good thinge yf salt vnsauery shal season withall nether good vpon lande ner donge hyll shal cast awaye hath eares heare let heare xv chapter resorted vnto publican synners might heare ye pharises scrybes murmured sayde mat 9 marc 2 b luc 5 luc 5 • nd 7 c man receaueth synners eateth tolde thē symilitude sayde man amonge hath hundreth shepe yf loose one thē leaueth nyne nyentye wyldernesse mat 〈…〉 goeth lost tyll fynde whan hath founde layeth vpon shulders ioye whan commeth home calleth frēdes neghbours sayeth vnto thē reioyce haue founde shepe yt lost saye vnto euē shal ioye heauen ouer one synner doth pennaunce ouer nyne nyentye righteous luc 〈…〉 nede repen • taunce woman hath ten grotes yf loose one lighteth candell swepeth house seketh diligently tyll fynde whan hath founde calleth hir frendes neghbouresses sayeth reioyce haue foūde grote lost euen tell shal ioye angel god ouer one synner yt doth pennaunce sayde certayne man two sonnes yonger sayde vnto father father geue porcion ye goodes belongeth vnto deuyded good vnto longe therafter gathered yonger sonne together toke iourney farre countre waisted goodes ryotous lyuynge whan spent greate derth thorow lōde begāne lacke wente waye claue cytesin countre sent felde kepe swyne wolde fayne haue fylled bely coddes swyne ate noman gaue came self sayde many hyred seruauntes hath father haue bred ynough perish honger wil get vp go father saye vnto father haue synned agaynst heauen nomore worthy called thy sonne make one thy hyred seruauntes gat vp came vnto father whan yet greate waye 〈…〉 father sawe cōpassion ranne fell aboute neck kyssed sayde sonne vnto father haue synned agaynst heauē worthy called thy sonne father sayde vnto seruauntes brynge forth best garment put vpon geue rynge vpon hande shues fete brynge hither fed calfe kyll lat v eate mery sonne deed alyue agayne lost founde beganne mery elder sonne felde whan came drewe nye house herde ye mynstrelsye daunsynge called one seruauntes vnto axed sayde vnto thy brother come thy father hath slayne fed calfe hath receaued safe sounde angrie wolde go wente father prayed answered sayde vnto father lo thus many yeares haue done seruyce nether haue yet broken thy commaundement thou gauest neuer one kydd yt might make mery frendes thy sonne come deuoured goodes harlottes thou hast slayne fed calfe sayde vnto sonne thou art allwaye myne thine thou shuldest mery glad ye brother deed alyue agayne lost founde agayne xvi chapter sayde also vnto disciple certayne riche man stewarde accused vnto waisted goodes called sayde vnto heare geue comptes ye stewardshipe thou mayest longer stewarde stewarde sayde within shal lorde wil take awaye stewardshipe fro cā dygge begg ashamed wote wil whā put stewardshipe maye receaue house called vnto hī lordes detters sayde vnto first moch owest thou vnto lorde sayde hundreth tonne oyle sayde take ye byll syt downe quyckly wryte fifti • sayde vnto another moch owest thou sayde hundreth quarter wheate sayde vnto take thy byll wryte foure score lorde cō mended vnrighteous stewarde done wysely child worlde kynde wyser thē child light saye vnto make frendes vnrighteous mammon yt whan ye shal haue nede maye receaue euerlastinge tabernacle faithfull least faithfull also moch vnrighteous least vnrighteous also moch yf ye haue bene faithfull vnrighteous mammon wyll beleue true yf ye haue bene faithfull anothers man busynesse wil geue youre awne seruaunt serue two master mat 6 c either shal hate one loue ye el shal leane one despyse ye serue god mammon thinges herde pharises couetous mocked hī sayde vnto ye iustifie yor selues men god knoweth youre hertes yt hye amonge men abhominacion god lawe ye prophetes prophecied vnto ihon mat 11 b tyme forth ye kyngdome god preached thorow ye gospell euery man p • easseth violence easier heauen earth perishe one tittle ye lawe fall euer putteth awaye wife marieth another breaketh matrimonye mat 5 19 b marc 10 marieth deuorced frō hir huszbande breaketh wedlocke also certayne riche man clothed self purple costly lynnen fared deliciously euery daye poore man named lazarus laye gate full sore desyred fylled crommes fell riche man table yet came dogges licked sore fortuned poore man dyed caried angel abraham bosome riche man dyed also buried whan hell lift vp eye payne sawe abraham afarre lazarus bosome cried sayde father abraham haue mercy vpon sende lazarus maye dyppe typpe fynger water coole tonge tormēted flāme abrahā saide remēbre sonne yt thou hast receaued good ye life contrary wyse lazarus receaued euell comforted thou art tormented beside greate space set betwene v yt wolde go downe hence vnto nether maye passe ouer thence vnto v sayde pray father thou wilt sende vnto father house haue yet fyue brother maye warne lest also come place torment abraham sayde vnto haue moses prophetes let heare sayde nay father abraham yf one wente vnto frō deed wolde pennaunce neuertheles sayde vnto yf heare moses prophetes shal beleue also though one rose agayne frō deed xvii chapter sayde vnto disciple vnpossible offence shulde come mat 18 marc 9 e wo vnto come better amylstone hanged aboute neck cast see shulde offende one litle one take hede youre selues yf thy brother trespace agaynst rebuke mat 18 b yf amende forgeue though synne agaynst seuentymes daye come seuen tymes daye ye agayne saye repenteth forgeue apostle sayde vnto ye lorde increace oure faith lorde sayde yf ye haue faith grayne mustarde sede mat 17 c 21 c saye vnto molbery tre plucke thy self vp rote plāte thy self see shalbe obediēt vnto hath seruaunt ploweth fedeth catell whā commeth home ye felde wil saye vnto go quyckly syt downe meate thus sayeth vnto make ready maye suppe gyrde vp thyself serue tyll haue eaten dronken afterwarde shalt thou eate drynke also thanketh seruaunt also dyd commaunded trowe likewyse ye whā ye haue done cōmaunded saye vnprofitable seruauntes haue done bounde fortuned whan toke iourney towarde ierusalem wente thorow myddest samaria galile came towne met ten leporous men stode afarre lift vp voyce sayde iesu master haue mercy vpon v whan sawe sayde vnto thē leuit 〈…〉 go shewe youre selues vnto ye prestes came passe wente clensed one whā sawe clensed turned backe agayne praysed god loude voyce fell downe face fete gaue thankes samaritane iesus answered saide ten clensed nyne el none founde turned agayne gaue god prayse saue onely straūger sayde vnto aryse go thy waye thy faith hath made ye whole whan demaunded ye pharises whan cōmeth kyngdome god answered sayde kyngdome god commeth outwarde appearaunce nether shal sayde lo beholde ye kyngdome god inwarde sayde disciple tyme shal come whā ye shal desyre se one daye sonne man shal se shal saye vnto se se 〈…〉 go ye nether folowe lightenynge shyneth aboue heauen lighteth ouer vnder heauē shal sonne mā daye first must suffre many thinges 〈…〉 refused generacion came passe tyme noe 〈…〉 shal come passe also ye dayes sonne man ate dranke maried maried euen vnto ye daye noe wente arke ye floude came destroyed likewyse also came passe tyme lot ate dranke bought solde planted buylded euen daye lot wente sodom 〈…〉 rayned fyre brymstone heauē destroyed maner also shal go daye whan sonne man shal appeare daye vpō rofe stuffe ye house 〈…〉 let come downe fetch likewyse felde let turne backe behynde 〈1 paragraph〉 remēbre lotte wife euer goeth aboute saue life shal lose euer shal lose shal saue saye vnto yt night shal two lye vpon one bed one shalbe receaued shalbe saken two shalbe gryndinge together 〈◊〉 ▪ 14 one shalbe receaued shalbe forsaken answered sayde vnto lorde sayde vnto thē euer ye deed carcase wil ye aegles gathered together xviii chapter tolde symilitude signifienge 〈◊〉 5 c yt men ought allwayes praye leaue sayde iudge cite feared god stode awe man cite wedowe came vnto sayde delyuer fro myne aduersary wolde greate whyle afterwarde thought within hīself though feare god stonde awe man yet seynge weddowe importune vpon wil delyuer lest come last rayle vpon sayde lorde heare ye vnrighteous iudge sayeth shall god also delyuer chosen crye vnto hī daye night though differre thē saye vnto shal delyuer shortly neuertheles whan sonne man cōmeth suppose ye shal fynde faith vpon earth vnto certayne trusted thē selues perfecte despysed spake symilitude wente vp two men tēple praye one pharise publican pharise stode prayed maner 〈…〉 thanke god men robber vnrighteous aduouters publican fast twyse weke geue tithe haue publican stode afarre wolde lift vp eye heauen smote vpon brest sayde god thou mercyfull vnto synner tell man wente downe house iustified thē 〈◊〉 23 b 〈◊〉 4 b euer exalteth shalbe brought lowe humbleth shalbe exalted 〈…〉 brought yonge child also vnto shulde touch whan disciple sawe rebuked neuertheles iesus called vnto sayde suffre childrē come vnto forbyd thē soch ye kyngdome god verely saye vnto whosoeuer receaueth ye kyngdome god childe shal enter therin certayne ruler axed sayde good master must mat 19 • mar 10 b maye enheret euerlastinge life iesus sayde vnto callest thou good man good god onely thou knowest cōmaundementes thou shalt breake wedlocke thou shalt kyll exo • 0 c thou shalt steale thou shalt beare false wytnesse honoure thy father ye mother sayde haue kepte fro youth vp whā iesus herde sayde vnto yet lackest thou one thinge sell thou hast geue vnto ye poore thou shalt haue treasure heauen come folowe whan herde sory riche whan iesus sawe sory sayde mat 19 c marc 10 c hardly shal riche come kyngdome god 20 b marc 10▪ shal fulfilled wrytten prophetes sonne man shal delyuered vnto ye heythen shalbe mocked despytefully intreated luc 23 spitted vpon whan haue scourged shal put death vpon thirde daye shal aryse agayne luc 2 g vnderstode nothinge thinges sayenge hyd perceaued thinges spoken came passe mat 20 marc 10 c whan came nye vnto iericho sat one blynde waye begged whan herde people passe axed sayde vnto iesus nazareth passed cryed sayde iesu thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpon people wente rebuked shulde holde tunge neuertheles cried moch thou sonne dauid haue mercy vpō iesus stode styl cōmaunded hī brought vnto hī whan come neare axed sayde wilt thou vnto sayde lorde maye receaue sight iesus sayde vnto receaue thy sight thy faith hath saued immediatly sawe folowed praysed god people sawe gaue god prayse xix chapter entred wente thorow iericho beholde man named zacheus ruler publican riche desyred se iesus shulde coulde people lowe stature ranne clymmed vp wylde fygge tre might se shulde come yt waye whan iesus came place loked vp sawe sayde vnto zache come downe haistely todaye must turne thy house came downe hastely receaued act 16 c ioye whan sawe murmured sayde yt gone synner zacheus stode forth sayde vnto lorde beholde lorde half goodes geue poore yf haue defrauded eny man restore foure folde iesus sayde vnto daye health happened vnto house moch also abraham sonne mat 15 c sonne mā come seke saue lost whyle herkened tolde symilitude also nye vnto ierusalem thought kyngdome god shulde appeare immediatly sayde certayn • noble mā wē te farre countre mat 25 marc 13 receaue hī kyngdome come agayne man called ten seruauntes delyuered ten pounde sayde vnto occupye tyll come agayne citesyns hated sent message sayde wil haue man raigne ouer v fortuned whan came agayne receaued kyngdome bade call seruauntes vnto geuē money yt might knowe euery one done came first sayde syr thy pounde hath wonne ten pounde sayde vnto well thou good seruaūt moch thou hast bene faithfull least thou shalt haue auctorite ouer ten city seconde came also sayde syr thy pounde hath wonne fyue pounde sayde thou shalt ouer fyue city ye thirde came sayde lo syr thy pounde haue kepte napkyn afrayed thou art harde man thou takest vp yt thou hast layed downe reapest thou hast sowne sayde vnto 〈…〉 thine awne mouth iudge thou euell seruaunt knewest thou thou harde man takynge vp layde downe reapynge dyd sowe wherfore hast thou delyuered money exchaunge banke commynge might haue requyred myne awne vauntage sayde vnto stode take ye pounde geue vnto hath ten pounde sayde vnto syr hath ten pounde already saye vnto whosoeuer hath 〈…〉 vnto shalbe geuē hath shal taken awaye euen hath myne enemy wolde shulde raigne ouer bringe hither slaye whan thus sayde wēte forwarde toke iourney vp ierusalem fortuned whan came nye bethphage bethany vnto mount oliuete sent two disciple sayde 〈…〉 go towne lyeth ouer agaynst assone ye come ye shal fynde foale tyed wheron yet neuer man satt lowse brynge hither yf eny mā axe wherfore ye lowse saye thus vnto lorde hath nede therof sent wēte waye founde euen sayde whā lowsed ye foale owner therof sayde vnto thē lowse ye foale sayde lorde hath nede therof brought vnto iesus cast clothes vpō foale set iesus theron wente 〈…〉 spred garmentes waye whan wēte downe fro mount oliuete ye whole multitude disciple begāne ioyfully prayse god loude voyce ouer miracle sene sayde blessed 〈…〉 cōmeth kynge name lorde 〈1 paragraph〉 peace heauen prayse height pharises amonge people sayde vnto master rebuke thy disciple answered sayde vnto tell 〈…〉 yf holde peace yet shal stone crye whan come neare behelde cite 〈◊〉 11 wepte vpō sayde yf thou knewest ye peace thou shuldest remēbre euen present daye thine hyd thine eye tyme shal come vpon 〈…〉 thine enimies shal cast vp bāke aboute aboute thy child besege ye kepe euery syde make eauen grounde shal leaue one stone vpon another thou hast knowne ye tyme wherin thou hast bene visited wente temple begā ne dryue bought solde therin 〈…〉 sayde vnto wrytten 〈…〉 house house prayer ye haue made denne murthurers taught daylie tēple hye prestes scrybes chefest ye people wente aboute destroye 〈…〉 founde vnto people stacke gaue audience xx chapter fortuned one dayes whan taught people tē ple 〈◊〉 • 1 c 〈◊〉 11 preached gospell hye prestes scrybes came elder spake vnto sayde tell v auctorite doest thou thinges gaue auctorite answered sayde vnto thē wil axe worde also tell baptyme ihō heauen men thought selues sayde yf saye heauen shal saye dyd ye thē beleue yf saye men shal people stone v persuaded ihon prophet answered coulde tell whence iesus sayde vnto nether tell auctorite thinges beganne tell people symilitude 〈…〉 certayne man planted vynyarde let vnto huszbādmen wente straunge countre greate season whan tyme come sent seruaūt huszbādmen might geue frute vynyarde huszbandmen bet sent awaye emptye agayne sent yet another seruaūt bet also intreated shamefully sent awaye emptye besydes sent thirde wounded also thrust sayde lorde vynyarde shal wil sende iohā 3 c rom 8 phil 2 deare sonne peraduenture wil stonde awe whan se whan huszbande men sawe sonne thought thē selues sayde heyre come gen 37 let v kyll yt inheritaunce maye oures thrust ye vynyarde slew shal lorde vynyarde vnto shal come destroye huszbandmen let vynyarde vnto whan herde sayde god forbyd behelde thē sayde wrytten psal 117 esa 28 c stone buylders refused become head corner stone euer falleth vpon stone shalbe broken sunder vpō whō euer falleth shall grynde poulder mat 21 c marc 12 luc 19 c hye prestes scrybes wente aboute laye handes vpon houre feared people perceaued spokē symilitude agaynst watched hī sent forth spyes shulde fayne thē selues perfecte mat 2 • marc 12 might take wordes delyuer vnto power auctorite ye debite axed sayde master knowe thou sayest teachest right regardest outwarde appearaūce man teachest waye god truly laufull geue tribute vnto emperoure perceaued craftynes sayde vnto tēpte ye shewe peny whose ymage superscripcion hath answered sayde emperours sayde vnto geue thē vnto emperoure emperours vnto god god coude reproue worde people marueyled answere helde peace came vnto certayne saduces holde resurreccion axed sayde master mat 22 c marc 12 • moses wrote vnto v yf eny man brother dye hauynge wife dyeth without childrē deut 25 shal brother take wife rayse vp sede vnto brother seuē brethrē first toke wife dyed childlesse seconde toke wife deyed without child also thirde toke likewyse seuē left child behynde thē dyed last woman dyed also resurreccion whose wife shal seuen wife iesus answered saide vnto childrē worlde mary maried yt shalbe worthy enioye worlde resurreccion deed shal nether mary ner maried dye nomore like vnto angel iohā 3 child god moch child resurreccion deed ryse agayne hath moses also signified besydes bush called lorde • xod 3 god abraham god isaac god iacob god god deed lyuynge lyue vnto answered certayne scrybes sayde master thou haist sayde well tyme forth durst axe mo question mat • 2 marc 12 sayde vnto saye christ dauids sonne dauid sayeth boke psalmes lorde sayde vnto lorde psal 109 syt thou right honde tyll make thine enemy thy fote stole dauid calleth lorde sonne mat 23 marc 12 • uc 11 whyle people gaue audience sayde vnto disciple bewarre scrybes wyl go longe garmentes loue saluted vpon market desyre syt hyest synagoges table deuoure wedowes house vnder culoure longe prayenge shal receaue greater dānacion xxi chapter loked vp behelde ye riche put offerynges god chest marc 12 sawe also poore wedowe put two mytes sayde verely saye vnto 1 cor 8 b poore wedowe hath put thē haue excesse put vnto offerynge god hir pouerte hath put hir lyuynge mat 24 marc 13 whā spake temple garnished goodly stone iewels saide3 9 b iere 7 b luc 19 time shal come wher ye se shal left one stone vpon another shal broken downe axed sayde master whā shal shalbe token whan shal come passe sayde take hede ye disceaued1 ioh 4 many shal come name saye tyme come hard folowe whan ye heare warres insurreccions ye afrayed soch must come passe ende yet soone sayde vnto one people shal ryse agaynst another esa • 9 one realme ageynst another shal greate earthquake pestilence derth fearfull thinges greate tokēs shal frō heauē mat 〈…〉 〈…〉 marc 〈…〉 wil geue mouth wyszdome exo • 〈…〉 esa 〈…〉 act 〈…〉 • gaynst youre aduersaries shal able speake ner resist ye shal delyuered vp euen youre elder brother mich 〈…〉 kynszfolkes frendes shal put vnto death ye shal hated euery man name sake yet shal one hayre youre heade perishe holde fast youre soules pacience whan ye shal se ierusalem beseged hoost vnderstonde 〈…〉 desolacion nye let iewry flye vnto mountaynes▪ • nd let soch myddest therof departe let soch countrees come therin dayes vengeaunce euery thinge wrytten maye fulfilled wo vnto childe geue sucke dayes shalbe greate trouble vpon earth wrath ouer people shal fall thorow edge swerde led captyue amōge nacions 〈…〉 ierusalē shalbe troden downe heithen▪ vntyll tyme heithen fulfilled shalbe token sonne mone starres 〈…〉 vpon earth people shalbe soch perplexite shal tell waye turne selues see water shal roare men shal pyne awaye feare lokynge thinges shal come vpō earth euen power heauen shal moue shal se sonne man commynge cloude power greate glory 〈…〉 whan thinges begynne come passe thē loke vp lift vpp youre heades youre redempcion draweth nye tolde symilitude beholde fygge tre 〈◊〉 • 4 c 〈◊〉 1 • tre tree whā shute forth buddes ye se perceaue sommer hande likewyse ye whan ye se thinges come passe sure kyngdome god nye verely saye vnto generaciō shal passe tyll fulfilled heauen earth shal passe wordes shal passe 〈…〉 easter lambe must offered sent peter ihon sayde go youre waye prepare v easter lambe maye eate sayde vnto wilt thou prepare saide vnto beholde whā ye come ye cite shal mete man bearinge pitcher water folowe house yt entreth saye vnto good man house master sendeth ye worde ye gesthouse wherin maye eate easter lābe disciple shal shewe greate parlour paued wente waye founde sayde vnto made ready easter lambe whan houre came sat downe twolue apostle sayde vnto haue hertely desyred • ate easter lābe suffre saye vnto hence forth wil eate nomore therof tyll fulfilled kyngdome god mat 26 mar 14 1 cor 11 toke cuppe gaue thankes sayde take deuyde amonge laye vnto wil drynke frute ye vyne vntyll kyngdome god come toke bred gaue thankes brake gaue sayde body iohā 6 f shalbe geuen remembraunce likewyse also cuppe supped sayde cuppe new testamēt bloude shalbe shed lo mat 26 mar 14 hande betrayeth table sonne man trulye goeth forth appoynted wo vnto man betrayed beganne axe amonge selues shulde shulde rose strife also amōge thē mat 20 marc 9 10 c luc 9 c shulde takē greatest sayde vnto kynges ye worlde haue domynion ouer ye people beare rule ouer thē called gracious lordes 1 pet 5 ye shal greatest amonge shalbe yongest chefest seruaunt greatest sytteth table serueth sytteth table luc 12 • amōge mynister ye haue byddē wt temptacions wil appoynte kyngdome vnto euen father hath faith fayle whan thou art cōuerted strength thy brother sayde vnto lorde mat 26 marc 14 iohā 13 • ready go preson death neuertheles sayde peter saye vnto cock shal crowe daye tyll thou haue thryse denyed yt thou knewest sayde vnto mat 10 marc 6 • luc 9 whan sent without wallet without scryppe without shues lacked ye eny thinge sayde sayde vnto hath wallet let take vp likewyse also scryppe hath let sell coate bye swerde saye vnto must yet fulfilled wryttē esa 53 c counted amonge euell doer loke wrytten hath ende sayde lorde beholde two swerdes sayde vnto thē ynough mat 26 c iohā 18 wente wonte vnto moūt oliuete disciple folowed vnto place whan came thither sayde vnto thē mat 6 b praye ye fall tēptacion gat aboute stone cast kneled downe prayed sayde father yf thou wilt take awaye cuppe fro neuerthelesse wyll thyne fulfylled appeared vnto angell frō heauen • ohā 6 conforted came wrestled death prayed longer sweate like droppes • loude runnynge downe grounde rose vp frō prayer came disciple founde slepinge heuynesse sayde vnto slepe ye ryse vp praye ye fall tentacion whyle yet spake beholde multitude mat 26 e marc 14 e • ohā 18 one twolue called iudas wente came nye vnto iesus kysse iesus sayde vnto iudas betrayest thou sonne mā kysse whan aboute sawe wolde folowe sayde vnto lorde shal smyte swerde one thē stroke seruaūt ye hye prestes smote eare iesus answered sayde suffre thē thus farre forth touched eare healed iesus sayde vnto prestes ruler temple mat 26 f marc 14 f elder come vnto ye come forth murthurer swerdes staues daylie temple ye layed handes vpon youre houre power darknesse neuerthelesse toke led iohā 18 b brought hye prestes house peter folowed hī farre kyndled fyre myddest palace sat downe together peter sat downe amonge damsell sawe syttinge light behelde well sayde vnto also denyed sayde womā knowe litle whyle another sawe sayde thou art one also peter sayde man aboute space houre another affirmed sayde verely also galilean peter saide mā wote thou sayest immediatly whyle yet spake ye cock crewe lorde turned aboute loked vpō peter peter remembred wordes ye lorde sayde vnto luc 〈…〉 mat 〈…〉 mar 〈…〉 cock crowe arose led vnto pilate 〈…〉 begā ne accuse sayde haue founde felowe peruertinge people forbyddinge geue trybute vnto emperoure sayeth christ kynge pilate axed sayde 〈…〉 art thou kynge iewes answered frendes together afore bene variaunce pilate called hye prestes ruler people together sayde vnto thē 〈◊〉 27 b 〈◊〉 • 5 〈◊〉 • 8 c ye haue brought man vnto one peruerteth people beholde haue examyned fynde mā none cause wherof ye accuse yet herode sent beholde brought vpon hī nothinge worthy death 〈◊〉 • 9 therfore wil chasten let lowse must haue let one lowse vnto custome feast 〈◊〉 27 c 〈◊〉 1 • b cried whole multitude sayde awaye delyuer vnto v barrabas insurreccion made cite murthur cast preson called pilate vnto agayne wolde haue let iesus lowse cried sayde crucifye crucifye yet sayde vnto thirde tyme euell thē hath done fynde cause death hī therfore wil chasten let go laye styll vpon greate crye requyred yt might crucified voyce thē hye preastes preuayled pilate gaue sentence shulde requyred 〈◊〉 • 7 c 〈◊〉 3 b let lowse vnto thē insurrecciō murthur cast preson desyred gaue iesus ouer vnto wyll led awaye 〈◊〉 •• 〈◊〉 19 b toke one simon cyren came felde layed ye crosse vpon beare come wherin shal sayde blessed baren wombes haue borne pappes haue geuen sucke 〈…〉 shal begynne saye vnto mountaynes fall vpon v hylles couer v yf done grene tre shal done drye 〈…〉 two myszdoers led worde carnall offended hī forsake chap vii iesus commeth ierusalē feast teacheth iewes reproueth thē pharises hye prestes hearinge people begynne fauour christ beleue sende officer take hī dyuerse opinion amōge people pharises rebuke officer haue taken chyde nicodemus takinge parte chap viii woman taken aduoutrie christ delyuereth fredome soch folowe christ accuse haue deuel within go aboute therfore getteth waye chap xii mary anoynteth christes fete iudas murmureth christ excuseth rydeth ierusalem louyngly receaued thankfull vtterly despysed vngodly chap xiii christ washeth disciple fete sayde beholde 〈…〉 lā god two disciple herde speake folowed iesus iesus turned aboute sawe folowinge sayde vnto thē seke ye sayde vnto rabbi saye interpretacion master art thou lodginge sayde vnto come se came sawe abode daye aboute tenth houre one two herde ihon speake folowed iesus andrew brother symon peter founde first brother symon sayde vnto haue founde messias interpretacion ye anoynted brought iesus whan iesus behelde sayde thou art symon sonne ionas 〈…〉 thou shalt called cephas interpretacion stone nexte daye wolde iesus go agayne galile founde philippe sayde vnto 〈…〉 folowe philippe bethsaida cite andrew peter philippe founde nathanael sayde vnto haue founde whō 〈…〉 moses lawe ye 〈…〉 prophetes haue wrytten euen iesus sonne ioseph nazareth nathanaell sayde vnto 〈…〉 good come nazareth philippe sayde vnto come se iesus sawe nathanael cōmynge sayde beholde righte israelite gyle nathanael sayde vnto whence knowest thou iesus answered sayde vnto yt philippe called whan thou wast vnder fygge tre sawe nathanaell answered sayde vnto hī rabbi thou art ye sonne god thou art ye kynge israel iesus answered sayde vnto sayde vnto sawe vnder fygge tre thou beleuest thou shalt se yet greater thinges thē sayde vnto verely verely saye vnto frō tyme forth shal ye se heauen open 〈…〉 c 〈…〉 angel god goinge vp downe ouer sonne man ii chapter vpon thirde daye mariage cana galile mother iesus iesus also disciple called vnto ye mariage whan wyne fayled mother iesus saide vnto haue wyne iesus sayde vnto 〈…〉 womā haue wt myne houre yet 〈◊〉 mother sayde vnto ye mynisters whatsoeuer sayeth vnto set sixe water pottes stone ye maner purifienge ye iewes euery one cōteyninge two thre measure iesus sayde vnto thē fyll water pottes water fylled thē vp ye brymme sayde vnto thē drawe brynge vnto master feast bare whā master ye feast taisted ye wyne bene water knewe whence came mynisters drue ye water knewe master feast called brydegrome sayde vnto euery man first geueth good wyne whan dronken thē worse thou hast kepte backe good wyne vntyll first token iesus dyd cana galile shewed glory disciple beleued afterwarde wente downe capernaum mat 4 b marc 1 b luc 4 mother brethrē disciple taried longe iewes easter hande mat 21 b marc 11 b luc 19 iesus wēte vp ierusalem founde syttinge tēple solde ox shepe doues chaungers money made scourge small cordes droue tēple shepe ox poured chaungers money ouerthrewe table sayde vnto solde doues haue thinges hēce make father house house marchaundyse disciple remembred wrytten psal 68 b zele thine house hath euen eaten answered iewes sayde vnto token shewest thou vnto v mat 16 iohā 6 thou mayest thinges iesus answered sayde vnto thē mat 26 f breake downe temple thre dayes wil set vp agayne sayde iewes 1 esd 56 sixe fourtye yeare temple abuyldinge wilt thou set vp thre dayes spake ye tēple body whā rysen agayne deed disciple remembred thus sayde beleued scripture wordes iesus spake whā ierusalē easter ye feast many beleued name whan sawe ye tokēs yt dyd iesus cōmytted vnto thē knewe thē neded yt eny mā shulde testifye man iere 17 b apo 2 knewe well • ▪ iii chapter man pharises named nicodemus ruler amōge iewes iohā 7 e 19 came vnto iesus night sayde vnto hī master knowe yt thou art come teacher frō god iohā 9 b mā tokēs yt thou doest excepte god iesus answered sayde vnto verely verely saye vnto excepte man borne new se kyngdome god nicodemus sayde vnto man borne whan olde entre mother wombe borne agayne iesus answered verely verely saye vnto • ohā 4 b • nd 7 tit 3 excepte mā borne water sprete come ye kyngdome god rom 8 borne flesh flesh borne sprete sprete maruell sayde vnto ye ye must borne new wynde bloweth wyl thou hearest sounde eccls 11 thou canst tell whēce commeth whither goeth euery one borne sprete nicodemus answered sayde vnto maye iesus answered sayde vnto hī art thou master israel knowest verely saye vnto ye speake knowe testifie haue sene ye receaue oure wytnesse yf ye beleue whan tell earthly thinges shulde ye beleue whā speake vnto heauenly thinges ephe 4 noman ascendeth vp heauen come downe heauē namely sonne man heauen like moses lift vp serpent wyldernes num 21 b iohā 8 c 12 euen must sonne man lift vp euer beleueth shulde perish haue euerlastinge life god loued worlde gaue onely sonne rom 5 • iohā 4 b euer beleueth hī shulde perishe haue euerlastinge life luc 19 god sent sonne ye worlde condempne worlde worlde might saued beleueth shal cōdemned beleueth cōdemned allready beleueth name onely sonne god ye cōdempnacion iohā 1 12 f light come worlde men loued darknesse thē ye light workes euell whosoeuer doth euell hateth light cōmeth light dedes shulde reproued doth trueth commeth light workes maye knowne done god afterwarde came iesus disciple lōde iewry beynge iohā 4 baptysed mat 3 marc 1 luc 3 mat 4 b ihon baptysed also enon besyde salem moch water came thither baptysed ihon yet put preson arose question amonge disciple ihon iewes aboute purifienge came vnto ihon sayde vnto master yt beyonde iordan thou barest wytnesse beholde baptyseth euery man cōmeth vnto ihon answered sayde man receaue nothinge excepte geuen heauē ye youre selues witness iohā 〈…〉 sayde christ sent hath bryde brydegrome frende brydegrome stondeth herkeneth vnto reioyseth greatly ou • r voyce brydegrome ioye myne fulfilled must increace must decreace commeth hye aboue earth earthly speaketh earth commeth frō heauen aboue testifieth hath sene herde man receaueth wytnesse receaueth hath set seale 〈…〉 god disciple 〈…〉 left londe iewry departed agayne galile must nedes go thorow samaria came cite samaria called sichar nye vnto ye pece lōde 〈…〉 yt iacob gaue vnto ioseph sonne iacobs well whan iesus weerye iourney satt hī downe vpō well aboute sixte houre came woman samaria drawe water iesus sayde vnto geue drynke disciple gone waye ye cite bye meate woman samaria sayde vnto thou axest drynke seynge thou art iewe woman samaria iewes medle 〈…〉 samaritan iesus answered sayde vnto yf thou knewest gift god sayeth vnto geue drynke thou woldest axe wolde geue water life 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 7 woman sayde vnto syr thou hast nothinge drawe withall well depe whence hast thou water life art thou greater oure father iacob gaue v well dranke therof child catell iesus answered sayde vnto euer drynketh water shal thyrst agayne whosoeuer shal drynke water shal geue shal neuer thyrst 〈…〉 〈…〉 water shal geue shalbe well water spryngeth vp euerlastinge life woman sayde vnto 〈…〉 syr geue water thyrst nether nede come hither drawe iesus sayde vnto go call huszbande come hither woman answered sayde vnto haue huszbande iesus sayde vnto thou hast sayde well haue huszbande thou hast fyue huszbandes thou hast thine huszbande saydest thou right womā sayde vnto syr se thou art prophet oure father worshipped vpon mountayne 〈◊〉 9 〈◊〉 7 c ye saye ierusalem place men ought worshippe iesus sayde vnto woman beleue tyme commeth ye shal nether vpon mountayne ner ierusalem worshippe father ye wote ye worshippe knowe worshippe 〈◊〉 • 1 c saluacion commeth iewes tyme commeth allready true worshipper shal worshippe father 〈◊〉 1 sprete trueth father wil haue soch worshippe 〈◊〉 3 c god sprete worshippe must worshippe sprete trueth womā sayde vnto wote messias shal come called christ whan commeth shal tell v thinges iesus sayde vnto speake vnto meane season came disciple marueyled talked woman yet sayde man axest thou talkest thou woman let hir pot stonde wente cite sayde vnto people come se man hath tolde euer▪ dyd christ wente cite came vnto meane whyle disciple prayed sayde master eate sayde vnto haue meate eate ye knowe sayde disciple amōge selues hath eny man brought meate iesus sayde vnto thē meate wyll sent fynish worke saye ye youre selues yet foure monethes commeth haruest beholde saye vnto lift vp youre eye loke vpon felde mat 9 luc 10 whyte allready vnto haruest reapeth receaueth rewarde gathereth frute euerlastinge life soweth reapeth maye reioyse together herin prouerbe true one soweth another reapeth haue sent reape wheron ye bestowed laboure haue laboured ye come laboures many samaritan cite beleued sayenge woman testified hath tolde euer dyd whan samaritan came besought wolde tary abode two dayes many mo beleued worde sayde vnto woman beleue hence forth thy sayenge iohā 17 b haue herde oureselues knowe trueth christ sauioure worlde two dayes departed thence wente galile mat 13 g mar 6 luc 4 c iesus testified prophet nothinge set home whā came galile galileās receaued sene dyd ierusalem feast also come thither feast iesus came agayne vnto cana galile iohā 2 turned water vnto wyne certayne ruler whose sonne laye sicke capernaum herde iesus came iewry galile wente vnto besought wolde come downe helpe sonne laye deed sicke iesus sayde vnto excepte ye se token wonder ye beleue ruler sayde vnto come downe syr euer childe dye iesus sayde vnto go thy waye thy sonne lyueth man beleued worde iesus sayde vnto wente waye goinge downe seruauntes mett tolde sayde thy childe lyueth enquyred houre wherin beganne amende sayde vnto yesterdaye aboute seuēth houre feuer left father perceaued aboute houre wherin iesus sayde vnto thy sonne lyueth act 18 beleued whole house seconde token iesus dyd whan came iewry galile v chapter afterwarde feast iewes iesus wente vp ierusalem ierusalem slaughter house pole hebrue called bethseda hath fyue porch wherin laye many sicke blynde lame wythred wayted whan water shulde moue angell wente downe tyme pole stered water euer wente downe first water stered ye made whole soeuer disease man lyen sicke eight thirtie yeares whan iesus sawe lye knewe lyen longe saide vnto wilt thou made whole sicke answered syr haue man whan water moued put pole whan come another steppeth downe iesus sayde vnto aryse take vp thy bed go thy waye immediatly man made whole toke vp bed wente waye mat 9 marc 2 • uc 5 c mat 12 marc 2 c • nd 3 • uc 6 •• b 14 • ohā 7 b • nd 9 b vpon daye sabbath sayde iewes vnto made whole daye ye sabbath laufull cary bed answered made whole sayde vnto take vp thy bed go ye waye axed man sayde vnto take vp thy bed go ye waye healed wyst iesus • ohā 6 b gottē self awaye moch people afterwarde founde iesus tē ple sayde vnto beholde thou art made whole • ohā 8 synne nomore lest worse thinge happen vnto mā departed tolde iewes iesus made hī whole therfore dyd ye iewes persecute iesus sought slaye done vpō ye sabbath iesus answered • cor 12 father worketh hither worke also therfore sought iewes slaye hī brake onely ye sabbath saide also god father made self equall god thē answered iesus sayde vnto verely verely saye vnto iohā 〈…〉 sonne nothinge seyth father soeuer doeth doeth ye sonne also father loueth sonne sheweth doth wyll shewe yet greater workes ye shal marueyle father rayseth vp deed maketh lyue euē sonne also maketh lyuynge wyll father iudgeth man 〈…〉 hath geuen iudgmēt vnto sonne might honoure sonne euen honoure ye father honoureth sonne honoureth father hath sent verely verely saye vnto heareth worde iohā 〈…〉 beleueth sent hath forth haue done good vnto resurreccion life haue done euell vnto resurreccion damnacion nothinge heare iudge iudgmēt iust seke myne owne wyll wyll father hath sent 〈…〉 yf beare wytnesse self wytnesse whyle light neuertheles haue greater wytnesse wytnesse ihon 〈…〉 workes father hath geuē fynish workes beare wytnesse father hath sent ye father self hath sent beareth wytnesse 〈…〉 ye haue nether ouer see vnto cite tiberias galilee 〈◊〉 • 4 b 〈◊〉 6 〈◊〉 9 b moch people folowed sawe token dyd vpon thē diseased iesus wēte vp mountayne sat disciple easter ye feast iewes nye iesus lift vp eye sawe yt came moch people vnto sayde vnto philippe whence shal bye bred yt maye eate sayde proue knewe wolde philippe answered two hundreth peny worth bred ynough amonge thē yt euery one maye take litle thē sayde vnto hī one disciple andrew ye brother symō peter lad yt hath fyue barlye loaues two fish amōge many 〈…〉 iesus sayde make people syt downe moch grasse place sat thē downe aboute fyue thousande men iesus toke loaues thanked gaue disciple disciple gaue set downe likewyse also fish moch wolde whan fylled sayde vnto disciple gather vp broken meate remayneth nothinge lost thē gathered fylled twolue baskettes brokē meate remayned fyue barlye loaues vnto eaten whan men sawe token yt iesus dyd saide luc 7 b ioh 4 c trueth prophet yt shulde come worlde whan iesus perceaued wolde come take vp make kynge iohā 5 gat awaye agayne mountayne alone euen wente disciple downe ye see entred shippe mat 14 c marc 6 • came syde ye see vnto capernaū darcke allready iesus come thē ye see arose thorow greate wynde whan rowed vpō fyue twētie thirtie furlonges sawe iesus goinge vpon see came nye shippe afrayed sayde vnto afrayed wolde haue receaued ye shippe immediatly ye shippe londe whither wente nexte daye people stode syde see sawe none shippe saue one wherinto disciple entred iesus wēte disciple shippe yt disciple gone awaie alone howbeit came shippes tiberias nye vnto ye place eatē bred yt lorde geuen thankes whan people sawe iesus nether disciple toke shippe also came capernaum sought iesus whan founde syde see sayde vnto master whan camest thou hither iesus answered thē sayde verely verely saye vnto ye seke ye sawe ye tokēs ye ate loaues fylled laboure meate perisheth yt endureth vnto euerlastinge life sonne mā shal geue hath god father sealed thē sayde vnto shal maye worke ye workes god iesus answered sayde vnto thē worke god ye beleue hath sent sayde vnto mat 16 marc 8 b iohā 2 c token doest thou thē maye se beleue ye workest thou oure father ate māna wyldernesse wryttē exo 16 psal 77 c gaue thē bred frō heauen eate sayde iesus vnto thē verely verely saye vnto moses gaue bred heauē father geueth true bred heauen bred god commeth heauen geueth life vnto worlde thē sayde vnto ioh 4 b syr geue v allwaye soch bred iesus sayde vnto thē yt bred life cōmeth vnto shal hūger beleueth shal neuer thyrst haue sayde vnto yt ye haue sene yet ye beleue father geueth cōmeth vnto cōmeth vnto wyl cast come downe heauē myne awne wyll wyll hath sent l • c 22 c ye father hath sent iohā 10 c 18 hath geuē shulde lose nothinge shulde rayse vp agayne last daye wyl hath sent soeuer seyth sonne beleueth iohā 5 c haue euerlastinge life shal rayse vp last daye thē murmured iewes therouer sayde yt bred come downe heauē sayde eateth bred shal lyue euer bred wil geue flesh luc 22 b wil geue ye life worlde stroue iewes amonge selues sayde cā folowe geue v flesh eate iesus sayde vnto thē verely verely saye vnto excepte ye people sayde good sayde doth disceaue people howbeit man spake frely 〈…〉 feare iewes myddes feast wēte iesus vp temple taught iewes marueyled sayde ye scrypture seynge hath lerned iesus answered sayde doctryne myne hath sent yf eny man wyl shal knowe whether doctryne god whether speake self speaketh seketh awne prayse seketh prayse sent true vnrighteousnes 〈…〉 hath moses geuen lawe none father yet ye circumcyse man vpon sabbath yf man receaue circūcision vpon sabbath lawe moses shulde broken diszdayne ye haue made mā euery whyt whole sabbath iudge vtter appearaūce 〈…〉 iudge man wente home viii chapter iesus wente vnto mount oliuete early mornynge came agayne temple mat 21 b marc 11 b people came vnto sat downe taught ye scrybes pharises brought vnto woman taken aduoutrye set openly sayde vnto master woman taken aduontrye euē dede adoynge leui 20 b moses lawe commaunded v stone soch sayest thou sayde tempte might haue wherof accuse iesus stouped downe wrote fynger vpō grounde whyle contynued axynge lift self vp sayde vnto amonge without synne let cast first stone stouped downe agayne wrote vpon grounde whan herde wente one another eldest first left iesus alone woman stondinge iesus lift vp whan sawe noman woman sayde vnto woman thine accuser hath noman condempned sayde lorde man iesus sayde nether cōdempne go thy waye synne nomore iohā 5 b spake iesus agayne vnto sayde ioh 1 • 1 • • light worlde foloweth shal walke darknesse shal haue light life sayde pharises vnto thou bearest recorde thy self thy recorde true iesus answered sayde vnto though beare recorde self yet recorde true knowe whence came whither go ye tell whence come whither go ye iudge flesh iudge man yf iudge iudgment true alone father hath sent wrytten also youre lawe deut 17 19 c testimony two men true one beare wytnesse self father sent mat 17 beareth wytnes also sayde vnto thy father iesus answered ye nether knowe ner yet father mat 11 e luc 10 c • oh 7 c yf ye knewe ye shulde knowe father also wordes spake iesus vpon god chest taught tēple noman toke ioh 7 c houre yet come ioh 7 13 sayde iesus agayne vnto go waye ye shal seke shal dye youre synnes whither go thither ye come sayde ye iewes wyl kyll self sayeth whither go thither ye come sayde vnto ye beneth aboue ye worlde worlde therfore haue sayde vnto ye shal dye youre synnes 〈…〉 ioh 〈…〉 yf ye beleue ye shal dye youre synnes sayde vnto art thou iesus sayde vnto thē euē thinge saye vnto haue many thinges saye iudge sent true loke haue herde ioh 〈…〉 speake worlde howbeit vnderstode spake father sayde iesus vnto whan ye haue lift vp hye sonne man shal ye knowe nothinge self ioh▪ 〈…〉 father hath taught euen speake sent father leaueth alone alwaie pleaseth whan thus spake ioh▪ 〈…〉 many beleued sayde iesus vnto iewes beleued yf ye contynue worde ye disciple ye shall knowe trueth trueth shal make 〈…〉 fre answered abraham sede neuer bonde eny man sayest thou ye shal fre iesus answered sayde verely verely saye vnto 〈…〉 euer doth synne seruaunt synne seruaunt abydeth house euer sonne abydeth euer yf sonne therfore make fre ye fre dede knowe ye abraham sede ye seke kyll worde taketh amonge speake haue sene father ye ye haue sene youre father answered sayde vnto abraham oure father iesus sayde vnto yf ye abraham child ye wolde dedes abraham ye go aboute kyll man haue tolde trueth 〈…〉 haue herde god dyd abraham ye dedes youre father sayde vnto borne fornicacion haue one father euen god iesus sayde vnto yf god youre father wolde ye loue proceaded forth come god come self hath sent knowe ye thē speach euē ye abyde hearinge worde ye father deuell lustes youre father wyl ye 〈…〉 murthurer begynnynge abode trueth trueth whan speaketh lye speaketh awne lyar father saye trueth ye beleue rebuke one synne yf saye trueth ye beleue 〈…〉 god heareth god worde therfore heare ye ye god answered iewes sayde vnto saye right thou art samaritane 〈…〉 hast deuell iesus answered haue deuell honoure father ye haue dishonoured seke myne awne prayse one seketh iudgeth verely verely saye vnto 〈…〉 yf eny man kepe worde shal neuer se death sayde iewes vnto knowe 〈…〉 thou hast deuell abraham deed prophetes thou sayest yf eny mā kepe worde shal neuer taist death art thou greater oure father abraham deed prophetes deed whō makest thou thy self iesus answered 〈…〉 yf prayse self prayse nothinge father prayseth ye saye youre god ye knowe hī knowe yf shulde saye knowe not▪ shulde lyar like vnto knowe kepe worde abraham youre father glad shulde se daye 〈…〉 sawe reioysed 〈…〉 sayde iewes vnto thou art yet fiftie yeare olde hast thou sene abraham iesus sayde vnto thē verely verely saye vnto euer abraham 〈◊〉 3 c toke vp stone cast iesus hyd wente temple ix chapter iesus passed sawe man borne blynde disciple axed sayde master hath synned elder borne blynde iesus answered nether hath synned ner elder 〈…〉 ye workes god shulde shewed must worke workes hath sent whyle daye night commeth whan man worke longe worlde iohā 1 8 b 12 e light worlde whan thus sayde spat grounde made claye spetle rubbed claye eye blynde sayde vnto go thy waye pole esa 8 b syloha interpretated sent wash wēte waye waszhed came seynge neghbours sene begger sayde sat begged sayde sayde like sayde euen sayde vnto thine eye opened answered sayde mā called iesus made claye anoynted myne eye sayde go thy waye pole siloha wash wente waye washed receaued sight sayde vnto sayde tell brought vnto pharises litle blynde mat 1 • marc 1 c luc 6 iohā 5 7 b sabbath whan iesus made claye opened eye agayne pharises also axed receaued sight sayde vnto thē put claye vpon myne eye waszhed se sayde pharises man god seynge kepeth ye sabbath iohā 7 10 b 12 b sayde synfull man soch token stryfe amonge thē sayde agayne vnto ye blynde sayest thou hath opened thine eye sayde prophet iewes beleued hī blynde receaued sight tyll called elder receaued sight axed sayde youre sonne ye saye borne blynde doth se elder answered sayde knowe▪ oure sonne borne blynde seyeth tell hath opened eye tell olde ynough 〈◊〉 let speake self sayde elder feared 〈…〉 therfore sayde elder olde ynough called mā agayne yt blynde sayde vnto iosue 7 c act 1 • geue god ye prayse knowe man synner answered sayde whether synner tell one thinge sure blynde se thē sayde vnto agayne dyd vnto opened thine eye answered tolde right herde ye wil ye heare agayne ye also disciple rayted sayde thou art disciple sure god spake wt moses felowe know whēce man answered sayde vnto thē maruelous thinge ye wote whence hath opened mine eye knowe god heareth ye sinner yf eny mā fearer god doth heareth sen ye worlde beganne herde eny man opened eye one borne blynde yf man god coulde haue done nothinge answered sayde vnto thou art alltogether borne synne teachest thou v thrust iesus herde yt thrust whā founde sayde vnto beleuest thou sonne god answered sayde lorde yt might beleue iesus sayde vnto thou hast sene talketh sayde lorde beleue worshipped iesus sayde come iudgmēt worlde se might se se might made blynde pharises yt herde sayde vnto blynde also iesus sayde vnto thē • ohā 15 c yf ye blynde ye shulde haue synne ye saye se therfore youre sonne remayneth x chapter verely verely saye vnto yt entreth dore shepefolde clymmeth vp waye thefe murthurer goeth dore shepherde shepe ye porter openeth shepe heare voyce calleth awne shepe name ledeth whan 〈…〉 forth • wne shepe 〈…〉 〈…〉 voyce straunger folowe flye knowe voyce straungers prouerbe spake iesus vnto vnderstode sayde vnto sayde iesus vnto agayne verely verely saye vnto ioh • dore shepe come theues murthures ye shepe harkened vnto dore yf eny man entre shalbe saued shal go fynde pasture thefe cōmeth steale kyll destroye come yt might haue life haue abundauntly good shepherde good shepherde geueth life shepe hyred seruaunt shepherde 〈…〉 nether shepe awne seyth ye wolfe cōmynge leaueth ye shepe flyeth wolfe catcheth scatereth ye shepe hyred seruaūt flyeth hyred seruaunte careth shepe good sheperde 〈…〉 knowe myne knowne myne euē father knoweth knowe ye father 〈…〉 geue life shepe haue yet shepe folde must brynge also shal heare voyce shalbe one flocke one shepherde therfore doth father loue leaue life maye take agayne nomā taketh fro leaue haue power leaue haue power take agayne commaundement haue receaued father discension amōge iewes sayenges many thē sayde 〈…〉 hath deuell madd heare ye sayde 〈1 paragraph〉 wordes one possessed deuell also open ye eye blynde dedicacion tēple ierusalē wynter 〈…〉 iesus walked 〈1 paragraph〉 salomōs porche thē came ye iewes rounde aboute hī saide vnto hī lōge dost thou make v doute yf thou christ tell v planely iesus answered thē tolde ye beleue workes yt father name beare wytnesse ye beleue ye shepe sayde vnto shepe heare voyce knowe thē folowe geue thē euerlastinge life shal neuer perishe nomā shal plucke thē hande father gaue thē greater thē noman able plucke father hande 〈…〉 〈…〉 ▪ c father one iewes toke vp stone agayne stone iesus answered thē many good workes haue shewed fro father thē stone ye iewes answered hī sayde good worke sake stone 〈…〉 blasphemy yt thou beynge man makest thy self god iesus answered thē wrytten youre lawe 〈…〉 haue sayde ye goddes yf call goddes vnto worde god came scripture brokē saye ye thē vnto hī whō ye father hath sanctified sent ye worlde thou blasphemest god sayde ye sonne god 〈◊〉 • 6 g 〈◊〉 14 b 〈…〉 c 〈…〉 〈…〉 c yf ye workes father beleue yf thē thē yf ye beleue yet beleue ye workes yt ye maye knowe beleue yt father ye father 〈…〉 3 〈…〉 b wente aboute agayne take escaped hādes wēte awaye agayne beyōde iordane ye place 〈…〉 ihō baptysed abode many came hī sayde ihō dyd tokēs yt ihon spake man true many beleued xi chapter laye one sicke named lazarus bethania ye towne mary hir sister martha 〈◊〉 7 c yt mary anoynted ye lorde wt oyntment dryed fete wt hir heer whose brother lazarus laye sicke thē sent sister vnto hī sayde lorde beholde whō thou louest lyeth sicke whā iesus herde sayde sicknesse vnto death prayse god 〈◊〉 ▪ 9 yt sonne god maye praysed thorow iesus loued martha hir sister lazarus whā herde sicke abode two dayes ye place warde sayde vnto disciple let v go agayne ī iewry disciple sayde vnto master 〈◊〉 ▪ 7 c 〈◊〉 10 c lately wolde iewes haue stoned wilt thou go thither agayne▪ iesus answered twolue houres ye daye yt walketh daye stombleth seyeth ye light worlde walketh night stōbleth light spake warde sayde vnto thē lazarus frende 〈…〉 slepeth go wake slepe thē sayde disciple lorde yf slepe shal well ynough howbeyt iesus spake death thought yt spokē ye bodely slepe thē sayde iesus vnto thē planely lazarus deed glad yo sake yt ye maye beleue neuertheles let v go vnto hī thē sayde thomas called didimus vnto ye disciple let v go also yt maye dye wt hī iohā 20 c thē came iesus founde yt lyen ye graue foure dayes allready bethanye nye vnto ierusalē aboute fiftene furlō ge many iewes come martha mary cōforte thē ouer brother whā martha herde yt iesus came wēte mete mary satt styl home thē sayde martha vnto iesus lorde yf thou haddest bene brother bene deed ioh 11 • neuertheles knowe also soeuer thou axest god god wyl geue iesus sayde vnto thy brother shal ryse agayne martha sayde vnto hī knowe yt shal ryse agayne resurreccion ye last daye iesus saide vnto resurreccion life rom 1 b ioh 3 b 6 f yt beleueth shal lyue though deed allready whosoeuer lyueth beleueth shal neuer dye beleuest thou saide vnto yee lorde beleue thou art christ sonne god shulde come worlde whā sayde wēte hir waye called mary hir sister secretly saide maister come calleth whan herde rose vp quyckly came vnto iesus yet come ye towne yet place martha met iewes wt house comforted whan sawe mary rose vp haistely wente folowed saide goeth graue wepe whā mary came iesus sawe fell downe fete sayde vnto hī lorde yf thou haddest bene brother bene deed ioh 11 c whā iesus sawe wepe iewes wepinge also yt came wt groned sprete sory wt sayde haue ye layed sayde lorde come se iesus wepte sayde ye iewes beholde loued thē saide▪ coulde opened eye ye blynde haue made also mā shulde haue dyed iesus groned agayne • came graue caue stone layed iesus saide take awaye ye stone martha sister • deed saide 〈…〉 allready 〈…〉 iesus sayde vnto sayde vnto yf thou dyddest beleue thou shuldest se glory god toke awaye stone deed laye iesus lift vp eye sayde father thāke ye thou hast herde howbeit knowe thou hearest allwaye iuh 12 ye people stonde sayde maye beleue thou hast sent whan sayde cryed loude lazarus come forth ye deed came forth bounde hande fote wt graue clothes face bounde wt napkyn iesus sayde vnto thē lowse let go many ye iewes mere come vnto mary sawe iesus dyd beleued thē wente waye vnto pharises tolde thē iesus done hye prestes pharises gathered counce • l sayde psal 2 act 4 b man doth many token yf let go thus mē wyl beleue • 9 c thē shal romaynes come take awaye oure londe people one named caiphas hye prest yeare sayde vnto ye knowe nothinge nether considre ye eny thinge 〈◊〉 18 b better u one mā dye people people shulde perishe spake moch hye prest yeare prophecied iesus dye people people onely shulde gather together child god scatered abrode daye forth toke coūcell might put death iesus walked nomore openly amonge iewes wente thence countre wyldernesse cite called ephraim beynge disciple iewes easter nye hande wente vp many ierusalē countre ye easter purifye selues stode vp axed iesus spake amonge selues temple thynke ye cō meth ye feast hye prestes pha • i geuen commaundement yf • ny man knewe shulde h • might take xii chapter sixe dayes easter came iesus vnto bethanye lazarus deed iesus 〈◊〉 deed made supper martha serued lazarus one sat table luc • toke mary pounde oyntment pure costly nardus anoynted iesus fete dryed fete hir heer house full sanoure oynment sayde one disciple iudas iscarioth symons sonne afterwarde betrayed oyntment solde thre hundreth pen geuen poore sayde cared poore thefe ioh 〈…〉 bagge bare geuē sayde iesus let alone hath kepte agaynst daye buryenge poore haue ye allwaye haue ye allwaye moch people iewes knowlege came iesus sake onely also yt might se lazarus 〈…〉 raysed deed ye hye prestes aduysed put lazarus death also yt sake many syr wolde fayne se iesus philippe came tolde andrew agayne philippe andrew tolde iesus iesus answered thē sayde houre come 〈…〉 sonne man must glorified verely verely saye vnto excepte wheatcorne fall grounde 〈…〉 dye bydeth alone yf dye beyngeth forth moch frute loueth life 〈…〉 shal lose hateth life worlde shal kepe vnto life euerlastinge wyl serue let folowe shal seruaunt also serueth shal father honoure 〈…〉 〈◊〉 • 4 〈◊〉 22 c soule heuy shal saye father helpe houre therfore come houre father glorifye thy name came voyce heauen haue glorified wyl glorifye agayne sayde people stode herde answered people haue herde 〈…〉 lawe christ endureth euer sayest thou sonne man must lift vp sonne man sayde iesus vnto light yet litle whyle 〈…〉 walke whyle ye haue light darknesse fall vpō walketh thou knowest thou shalt knowe herafter thē sayde peter vnto thou shalt neuer wash fete iesus answered yf wash ye thou shalt haue parte symon peter sayde vnto lorde fete onely handes also heade iesus sayde vnto waszhē nedeth saue washe ye fete cleane euery whytt ye cleane ioh 6 g knewe betrayer therfore sayde ye cleane whan waszhen fete taken clothes sat downe agayne sayde vnto thē wote ye haue leaned table iesus bosome iohā • 0 whō iesus loued beckened symon peter shulde axe spake leaued vpō iesus brest sayde vnto lorde iesus answered vnto dyppe soppe geue dypte soppe gaue vnto iudas
