shulde geue thinge vnto poore whan receaued soppe wente immediatly night whan gone forth iesus sayde sonne mā glorified • ohā 12 c 17 god glorified yf god glorified thē shal god glorifie also hīself straight waye shal glorifye deare childrē yet litle whyle ye shal seke ioh 7 • nd 8 b sayde vnto ye iewes whither go thither ye come saye vnto iohā 〈…〉 new cōmaundemēt geue ye loue together haue loued yt euen ye loue one another shal euery man knowe ye disciple yf ye haue loue one another 〈…〉 symon peter sayde vnto lorde whither goest thou iesus answered whither go thou canst folowe 〈…〉 thou halt folowe herafter peter sayde vnto lorde cānot folowe • ow wil geue life yt sake iesus answered wilt thou geue thy life sake verely verely saye vnto ye 〈…〉 cock shal crowe tyll thou haue denyed thryse xiiii chapter sayde vnto disciple let youre hert afrayed yf ye beleue god thē beleue also father house many dwellinges yf wolde haue tolde go prepare place though go prepare place yet wil come agayne receaue vnto yt ye maye whither go ye knowe waye knowe ye also thomas sayde vnto lorde knowe whither thou goest knowe waye iesus sayde vnto waye trueth life noman cōmeth father 〈…〉 yf ye knewe ye knewe father also frō hēce forth ye knowe hī haue sene philippe sayde vnto lorde shewe v father sufficeth v iesus sayde vnto thus longe hast thou knowne philippe seyth seyth father sayest thou shewe v father beleuest thou father 〈…〉 ye father 〈…〉 wordes speake vnto speake self father dwelleth doth workes beleue father ye father el beleue leest workes sake verely verely saye vnto beleueth shal workes shal greater go father 〈…〉 soeuer ye axe ye father name wyl father maye praysed sonne yf ye axe eny thinge name wyl yf ye loue kepe commaundementes wyl praye father shal geue another comforter maye byde wt euer euen ye sprete trueth ye worlde receaue seyth nether doth knowe ye knowe abydeth wt shalbe 〈…〉 wil leaue cōfortles come vnto yet litle whyle thē shal worlde se nomore 〈…〉 b 〈…〉 b ye shal se lyue ye shal lyue also yt daye shal ye knowe father ye hath cō maundementes 〈…〉 kepeth loueth loneth shalbe loued father wyl loue wyl shewe myne owne self vnto 〈…〉 iudas sayde vnto hī iscarioth lorde cause thē thou wilt shewe thy self vnto v vnto worlde iesus answered sayde vnto loueth wyl kepe worde father wyl loue wyl come vnto wyll make oure dwellynge loueth kepeth sayenges worde ye heare myne father hath sent haue spoken vnto whyle 〈…〉 comforter euen ye holy goost whō father shal sende name shal teache thinges bringe youre remembraunce soeuer haue tolde peace leaue vnto peace geue geue vnto worlde geueth let yo hert troubled nether let afrayed ye haue herde sayde vnto go come agayne vnto yf ye loued ye wolde reioyse saide go father ye father greater thē 〈…〉 haue tolde come whan come passe ye maye beleue wyl talke moch 〈…〉 prynce worlde cōmeth hath nothinge worlde maye knowe loue ye father father hath cōmaunded aryse let v go hence xv chapter true 〈◊〉 4 c vyne father huszbande man euery braunch bringeth forth frute shal cut euery one bryngeth forth frute shal pourge yt maye bringe forth frute ye cleane worde haue spokē vnto byde ye like ye braunch brynge forth frute self excepte byde vyne euen nether ye also excepte ye abyde vyne ye braunches abydeth bryngeth forth moch frute without ye nothinge abydeth cast vyne braunche wythereth men gather vp cast fyre burneth mat 21 e marc 11 c ioh 14 b 16 c yf ye abyde wordes abyde ye shal axe ye wyl shal done vnto herin father praysed ye brynge forth moch frute become disciple like father hath loued euē haue loued cōtynue ye ī loue ioh 14 yf ye kepe cōmaundementes ye shal cōtynue loue like haue kepte father cōmaundementes cōtynue loue thinges haue spoken vnto ioye might remayne yt youre ioye might perfecte ioh 13 1 ioh 3 c cōmaundement ye loue together haue loued man hath greater loue set life frende mat 12 e ye frendes yf ye commaunde hence forth call seruauntes seruaunt knoweth lorde doeth haue sayde ye frendes haue herde father haue shewed vnto ephe 1 ye haue chosen haue chosen ordeyned ye go col 1 bringe forth frute youre frute contynne soeuer ye axe father name shulde geue commaunde ye loue one another yf worlde hate knowe hath hated yf ye worlde worlde wolde loue owne howbeit ye worlde haue chosen worlde therfore worlde hateth remembre worde sayde vnto seruaunt • greater lorde mat 10 c luc 6 ioh 13 b yf haue persecuted shal persecute also yf haue kepte worde shal kepe also shal vnto name sake knowe yt sent yf come spokē vnto thē thē shulde haue synne haue nothinge cloake synne • ithall yt hateth hateth father also yf done amōge thē workes mā dyd shulde haue synne haue sene yet haue hated father neuertheles sayenge might fulfilled wrytten lawe haue hated without cause psal 34 c 68 whā comforter commeth whō shal sende father euē sprete trueth proceadeth father ioh 14 c 16 act 2 shal testifie act • • ye shal beare wytnesse also ye haue bene begynnynge xvi chapter thinges haue sayde vnto ye shulde offended shal excomunicate tyme commeth soeuer putteth death shal thynke doth seruyce vnto god act 9 iohā 15 c 1 cor 2 soch thinges shal vnto haue nether knowne ye father ner yet thinges haue sayde vnto ioh 13 b 14 c whan tyme cōmeth ye maye thynke theron tolde thinges haue sayde vnto begynnynge go vnto sent none axeth whither goest thou haue sayde thinges vnto youre hert full sorowe neuertheles tell trueth better yt go awaye yf go awaye comforter commeth vnto yf departe ioh 14 c 15 c wil sende hī vnto whan commeth shal rebuke worlde synne righteousnes iudgment synne beleue frighteousnes go father ye shal se nomore iudgmēt prynce worlde iudged allready ioh 12 haue yet moch saye vnto ye beare awaye howbeit whan sprete trueth commeth shal lede trueth ioh 14 c iohā 12 f shal speake soeuer shal heare shal speake shall shewe come shal glorifye shal receaue myne shal shewe vnto mat 11 e luc 10 c ioh 3 e father hath myne therfore haue sayde shal receaue myne shewe vnto litle whyle ye shal se agayne litle whyle ye shal se go father thē saide disciple amonge themselues sayeth vnto v litle whyle ye shal se agayne litle whyle ye shal se go father sayde sayeth litle whyle tell sayeth perceaued iesus wolde axe sayde vnto ye enquyre amonge youre selues sayde litle whyle ye shal se agayne litle whyle ye shal se verely verely saye vnto ye shal wepe lamente worlde shal reioyse ye shal sory youre sorowe shal turned ioye woman whan trauayleth hath sorowe hir houre come whan delyuered childe thinketh nomore anguyshe ioye man borne worlde haue ye sorowe also wil se agayne youre hert shal reioyse reioye shal noman take daye shal ye axe question 〈…〉 verely verely saye vnto yf ye axe ye father ought name shal geue hither haue ye axed nothinge name axe ye shal receaue yt youre ioye maye perfecte thinges haue spoken vnto 〈…〉 prouerbes neuertheles tyme commeth shal speake nomore prouerbes shal shewe planely father daye shal ye axe name saye vnto wyl praye vnto father father loueth ye haue loued beleued come god 〈…〉 wente father came worlde agayne leaue ye worlde go father disciple sayde vnto beholde talkest thou planely speakest prouerbe sure yt thou knowest thinges nedest eny mā shulde axe therfore beleue thou camest god iesus answered ye beleue beholde 〈…〉 houre draweth nye come allready ye shalbe scatred euery man awne shal leaue alone yet alone 〈…〉 father thinges haue spoken vnto ye might haue peace 〈…〉 ye worlde haue ye trouble good comforte haue ouercome worlde xvii chapter thinges spake iesus lift vp eye towarde heauen sayde father houre come 〈…〉 thou glorifye thy sonne thy sonne also maye glorifye like thou hast geuen power ouer fleshe 〈…〉 shulde geue euerlastinge life many thou hast geuen 〈…〉 life euerlastinge knowe thou onely art true god thou hast sent iesus christ haue glorified ye vpō earth 〈…〉 fynished ye worke yt thou gauest glorifye thou father thine awne self ye glory euer worlde haue declared thy name vnto ye men thou gauest worlde thine thou gauest vnto haue kepte thy worde knowe thinges euer thou hast geuen ye wordes thou gauest haue geuē vnto 〈…〉 haue receaued knowne trueth come forth haue beleued thou hast sent praye praye 〈…〉 worlde thou hast geuen thine myne thine thine myne glorifyed nomore worlde ye worlde come holy father kepe thy name thou 〈…〉 hast geuē maye one like whyle thē worlde kepte thy name yt thou gauest haue kepte none lost lost childe 〈…〉 〈◊〉 40 b 〈…〉 scripture might fulfylled come vnto speake worlde maye haue ioye perfecte haue geuen thy worde 〈…〉 b 〈…〉 c worlde hateth thē worlde euen also worlde praye thou shuldest take worlde 〈…〉 thou kepe thē frō euell worlde also worlde sanctifye thy trueth thy worde trueth like thou hast sent worlde haue sent worlde sake sanctifye self also maye sanctifyed trueth neuertheles praye onely also thorow worde shal beleue maye one like thou father art ye also maye 〈…〉 one v worlde maye beleue thou hast sent glory thou gauest haue geuen maye one like one thē thou maye perfecte one worlde maye knowe thou hast sent hast loued thou hast loued father wil ioh 12 e 14 thou hast geuen yt maye se glory thou hast geuē thou hast loued euer ye worlde made righteous father mat 11 e ioh 15 c 16 worlde hath knowne yt haue knowne ye haue knowne thou hast sent haue declared thy name vnto wyl declare yt loue wherwith thou hast loued maye thē xviii chapter whan iesus thus spokē wē te forth disciple ouer broke cedron mat 26 mar 14 • luc 22 • gardē iesus entred disciple iudas yt betrayed hī knewe place also iesus resorted thither oft tymes wt disciple mat 26 • mar 14 • luc 22 whan iudas takē vnto cōpany mynisters hye prestes pharises came thither creshettes wt lanternes weapens iesus knowinge yt shulde come vpon wēte forth sayde vnto thē seke ye answered iesus nazareth iesus sayde vnto iudas also betrayed stode thē whan iesus sayde vnto thē wēte bacwardes fell grounde axed thē agayne seke ye sayde iesus nazareth iesus answered haue tolde yf ye seke let go waye worde might fulfylled sayde ioh 17 b whō thou gauest haue lost one symon peter swerde drewe smote hye prestes seruaūt cut right eare ye seruaūtes name malchus sayde iesus vnto peter put vp thy swerde sheeth shal drynke ye cuppe father hath geuē company captayne officer iewes toke iesus bounde led awaye first vnto anna fatherlawe vnto caiphas hye prest yt yeare ioh 11 e caiphas gaue coūcell vnto ye iewes good one man shulde dye people symon peter another disciple folowed iesus disciple knowne vnto hye prest wēte iesus hye prestes palace peter stode without dore yt disciple knowne vnto hye prest wente spake damsell yt kepte dore brought peter damsell kepte dore sayde vnto peter art thou also one man disciple sayde seruauntes officer stode made fyre cole colde warmed thē selues peter also stode warmed self hye prest axed iesus disciple doctryne iesus answered ioh 7 b haue spoken openly worlde haue euer taught synagoge tēple whither iewes resorted secrete haue spokē nothinge axest thou axe thē yt haue herde haue spoken vnto thē beholde tell haue sayde whan thus spokē iere 30 mat 26 g act 33 one officer stode smote iesus face sayde answerest thou hye prest iesus answered yf haue euell spokē thē beare wytnesse euell yf haue well spoken smytest thou anna sent bounde vnto caiphas ye hye prest mat 26 g mar 14 g luc 22 symō peter stode warmed self thē sayde vnto art thou one disciple denyed sayde seruaūt hye prestes kynszmā whose eare peter smytten sayde vnto dyd se gardē peter denyed agayne immediatly cock crew ioh 13 mat 27 marc 15 luc 2 • led iesus caiphas comon hall early mornynge selues wēte comō hall lest shulde defyled yt might eate ye pascall lambe wente pilate vnto thē sayde accusacion brynge ye agaynst man answered sayde vnto yf euell doer delyuered vnto sayde pilate vnto thē take ye iudge yo lawe sayde ye iewes vnto laufull v put eny mā death ye worde iesus might fulfilled ioh 12 spake whan signified death shulde dye mat 27 b marc 15 luc 23 entred pilate comon hall agayne called iesus sayde vnto art thou kynge iewes iesus answered sayest thou thy self haue tolde pilate answered iewe thy people hye prestes haue delyuered vnto hast thou done iesus answered kyngdome worlde yf kyngdome worlde mynisters wolde fight therfore yt shulde delyuered vnto iewes ioh • kyngdome hence thē sayde pilate vnto hī art thou kynge thē iesus answered thou sayest kynge luc 〈…〉 soudyers platted crowne thornes set vpon heade put purple garment vpon sayde hayle kynge iewes smote face wente pilate forth agayne sayde vnto thē beholde brynge forth vnto yt ye maye knowe giltynesse iewes answered haue lawe 〈…〉 oure lawe ought dye 〈1 paragraph〉 made self sonne god whan pilate herde worde afrayed wente agayne comon hall sayde vnto iesus whence art thou iesus gaue hath synne tyme forth pilate sought meanes lowse iewes cryed sayde yf thou let go thou art emperours frē de whosoeuer maketh kynge 〈…〉 agaynst emperoure whan pilate herde yt worde 〈…〉 brought iesus forth sat hī downe vpō ye iugdmēt seate place called pauement hebrue gabbatha daye preparinge easter aboute sixte houre sayde vnto iewes beholde yo kynge cryed awaye wt awaye wt crucifie pilate place iesus crucified gardē garden new sepulchre neuer man layed layed iesus preparinge daye ye iewes sepulcre nye hande xx chapter vpon one daye sabbath came mary magdalene early whē yet darcke vnto sepulcre sawe stone takē sepulcre ranne came symon peter ye disciple ioh 13 c 19 c 21 iesus loued sayde vnto haue takē awaye lorde sepulcre tell haue layed thē wēte peter forth disciple came sepulcre rāne together disciple outrāne peter came first sepulcre loked sawe lynnen clothes layed wēte thē came symon peter wente sepulcre sawe lynnē clothes lye napkyn bounde aboute iesus heade layed lynnen clothes wrapped together place self thē wēte ī also yt disciple came first ye sepulcre sawe beleued yet knewe ye scripture psal 15 b act 2 c • 3 17 yt behoued hī ryse agayne frō ye deed thē wēte ye disciple againe together mary stode ye sepulcre wepte without wepte▪ loked sepulcre sawe two angel whyte garmentes syttinge ye one heade ye fete layed body iesus sayde vnto womā wepest thou saide vnto thē haue taken awaye lorde wote haue layed hī whan sayde yt turned self backe sawe iesus stondinge knewe yt iesus iesus sayde vnto woman wepest thou sekest thou thought yt bene ye gardener sayde vnto syr yf thou hast borne hence tell thou hast layed wil fetch hī iesus sayde vnto mary turned aboute sayde vnto rabboni yt saye master iesus sayde vnto touche yet ascended vnto father go thou ye waye vnto psal 21 c brethrē saye vnto thē ascēde vp vnto father yo father • ohā 16 god yo god mary magdalene came tolde ye disciple haue sene lorde luc 42 soch thinges hath spoken vnto sabbath euē whā ye disciple gathered together luc 24 c dores shut feare ye iewes came iesus stode ī yr myddes sayde vnto thē peace wt whā sayde shewed thē hādes syde ioh 16 c thē ye disciple glad yt sawe ye lorde thē sayde iesus vnto thē agayne peace esa 61 mar 16 b luc 4 ioh 17 c like father sent euē sēde whan sayde yt brethed vpō thē sayde vnto thē receaue holy goost whose synnes soeuer ye remytte remytted vnto thē whose synnes euer ye retayne retayned thomas one twolue ioh 11 b called didimus wt thē whā iesus came thē sayde disciple vnto haue sene lorde sayde vnto thē excepte se handes prynte nales put hāde syde wil beleue eight dayes agayne disciple thomas wt thē thē came iesus whā ye dores shutt stode myddes sayde peace wt yt sayde vnto thomas reach hither yi fynger se handes reach hither yi hāde put ī syde faithlesse beleue thomas answered sayde vnto lorde god iesus sayde vnto thomas thou hast sene thou hast beleued blessed se yet beleue many tokēs dyd iesus disciple wryttē boke wryttē yt ye shulde beleue yt iesus christ sonne god ye thorow beleue might haue life name xxi chapter shewed iesus agayne see tiberias wyse shewed together symō peter thomas called didimus ioh▪ • nathanael cana cite galile sonnes zebede two disciple symon peter sayde vnto thē go fyshinge sayde vnto hī also wil go wt wēte entred shippe straight waye yt night toke nothinge whā morow iesus stode shore disciple knewe yt iesus iesus sayde vnto thē childrē haue ye eny thinge eate answered hī sayde vnto thē 〈…〉 cast nett ye right syde shippe ye shal fynde thē cast coulde nomore drawe ye multitude fish thē sayde ye disciple 〈…〉 whō iesus loued vnto peter lorde whan simon peter herde lorde gyrde mantell aboute naked sprange ye see disciple came shippe farre frō londe two hundreth cubytes drewe net fiszhes whan come londe sawe cole layed fysh theron bred iesus sayde vnto thē bringe hither fyshes 〈…〉 ye haue taken symon peter stepped forth drew nett londe full greate fyszhes hundreth thre fyftie many yet net broken iesus sayde vnto come dyne none disciple durst axe art thou knewe lorde came iesus toke ye bred gaue thē fyszhe wynde fylled whole house sat appeared vnto clouen tunges like bene fyre sat vpon ech one fylled holy goost mat 16 c beganne preach tunges euen sprete gaue vtteraunce dwellinge ierusalem iewes men feared god euery nacion vnder heauen whan voyce came passe multitude came together astōnyed euery one herde spake awne tunge wondred marueyled sayde amonge themselues beholde speake galile heare thē euery one awne tunge wherin borne parthian medes elamite dwell mesopotamia iewry capadocia pontus asia phrigia pamphilia egipte partes lybia cyren straungers rome iewes mat 23 proselyte crete arabian heare speake oure awne tunges greate workes god amased wondred sayde one another wil mocked sayde full swete wyne stode peter vp eleuen lift vp voyce sayde vnto ye men iewry ye dwell ierusalē knowne vnto let wordes entre youre eares dronken ye suppose yet thirde houre ye daye spokē prophet ioel shal come passe last dayes sayeth god ioel • f poure sprete vpon flesh youre sonnes youre doughters shal prophecye youre yonge men shal se vision act 10 16 b youre olde men shall dreame dreames luc 2 f act 21 b seruauntes handmaydens wyll poure sprete dayes shal prophecye wil shewe wonder heauen aboue token earth beneth mat 27 f luc 23 bloude fyre vapoure smoke sonne shalbe turned darknesse moone bloude greate notable daye lorde come shall come passe • 10 b euer shal call vpō name lorde shalbe saued ye men israel heare wordes iesus nazareth ye man approued god amonge miracle wonder token god dyd myddes amonge ye yo selues knowe also mat 27 c delyuered determinate councell foreknowlege god haue ye taken handes vnrighteous personnes crucifyed slayne • ct 10 e whō god hath raysed vp lowsed sorowes death moch vnpossyble shulde holden • sal 15 b dauid speaketh afore honde haue set lorde allwayes right hōde shulde moued therfore dyd hert reioyse tunge glad flesh also shal rest hope thou shalt leaue soule hell nether shalt thou suffer ye holy se corrupcion thou hast shewed wayes life thou shalt make full ioye thy countenaunce ye men brother let frely speake vnto patryarke dauid deed buried reg 2 b sepulcre v vnto daye wherfore seinge yt prophet knewe god promised hande god • hilip 2 exalted hath receaued ye father ye promyse holy goost hath shed forth ye se heare dauid ascended heauen sayde •• al 109 lorde sayde vnto lorde syt thou righte hande vntyll make thine enemy yt fote stole therfore let house israel knowe suertye yt god hath made iesus ye haue crucified lorde christ • ach 1 • c whan herde hert pricked sayde vnto peter apostle ye men brethrē 〈◊〉 3 b • ct 9 〈◊〉 16 shal peter sayde onto amēde youre selues let euery one baptysed name iesus christ remyssion synnes ye shal receaue gifte holy goost • el • f promyse made vnto youre child farre whō euer lorde oure god shal call wt many wordes bare witnesse exorted sayde saue youre selues vntowarde generacion gladly receaued preachinge baptysed daye added vnto aboute thre thousande soules contynued apostle doctryne felashippe breakynge bred prayer feare came vpō euery soule many wonder token done ye apostle beleued together act • thinges commen solde goodes possession parted amonge acordinge euery mā nede contynued daylie one acorde tē ple esa • brake bred euery house toke meate ioye synglenesse hert praysinge god fauoure ye people lorde added congregacion daylie soch shulde saued iii chapter peter ihon wente vp together temple aboute nyenth houre praye certayne man halt mother wombe brought layed daylie gate tēple called bewtyfull might axe almesse wēte temple whan sawe peter ihon wolde temple desyred receaue almesse peter behelde ihon sayde loke v gaue hede vnto hopynge receaue somethinge howbeit peter saide syluer golde haue none soch haue geue act • name iesus christ nazareth ryse vp walke toke righte hande lifte vp immediatly legges ancle bone made strōge sprange stode walked entred tēple walkynge leapinge praysinge god people sawe walke prayse god knewe yt sat almesse bewtyfull gate temple fylled wondrynge astonnyed happened vnto hī halt healed helde peter ihon people ranne vnto 〈…〉 porche called salomōs wondred whan peter sawe answered vnto people ye men israel maruayle ye loke ye v though oure awne power deseruynge made man walke god abraham isaac iacob ye god oure father hath glorifyed childe iesus 〈…〉 ye delyuered denyed presence pilate whan iudged lowsed ye denyed holy iust desyred murthurer geuen ye slewe prynce life god hath raysed deed witness thorow ye faith name hath confirmed name vpon man ye se knowe faith thorow hath geuē man health youre eye deare brethrē knowe ye haue done 〈…〉 thorow ignoraunce dyd also youre ruler god mouth prophetes shewed yt christ shulde suffre hath fulfilled penaunce therfore turne youre synnes maye done awaye whan tyme refreshinge shal come presence lorde whan shal sende preached vnto euen iesus christ must receaue heauen vntyll tyme thinges god hath spoken mouth holy prophetes sence ye worlde beganne restored agayne moses sayde vnto ye father prophet shal lorde youre god rayse vp vnto 〈…〉 c 〈…〉 c euen amōge youre brother like vnto shal ye heare shal saye vnto shal come passe soule soeuer shal heare prophet shal destroyed amonge people prophetes samuel thence forth many haue spoken haue likewyse tolde dayes ye child prophetes couenaunt god made vnto father whan sayde vnto abrahā thorow ye sede shal ye naciōs ye earth blessed 〈◊〉 12 〈◊〉 22 c 〈◊〉 10 first vnto hath god raysed vp childe iesus sent hī vnto blesse yt euery one shulde turne frō wickednesse iiii chapter bvt spake ye people came vnto thē prestes ruler tēple saduces whō greued yt taught people preached iesu ye resurreccion frō deed layed handes vpon put thē holde tyll morow euentyde howbeit many thē herde worde beleued nombre ye men aboute fyue thousande chaunced ye morow ruler elder scrybes anna ye hye prest caiphas ihon alexander many hye prestes kynred gathered selues together ierusalem set axed auctorite name haue ye done mat • 1 c peter full holy goost sayde vnto ye ruler people ye elder israel yf daye examyned concernynge good dede vpon sicke mā meanes made whole knowne vnto people israel act 3 ye name iesus christ nazareth ye crucified whō god hath raysed vp deed stōdeth man whole psal 117 c mat 21 e 1 pet 2 stone refused buylders become heade corner stone nether saluacion eny mat 1 c phil 2 ner yet also geuē vnto mē eny name wherin must saued sawe boldnesse peter ihon marueyled sure yt vnlerned men laye people knewe thē also wt iesu man yt made whole sawe hī stōdinge thē coulde saye agaynst cōmaunded thē stōde asyde ye councell cōmened amōge thēselues saide ioh 11 c shal mē manyfest token done openly knowne vnto thē dwell ierusalem denye breake farther amōge people let v threatē earnestly hence forth speake name vnto noman called cōmaunded thē eny wyse shulde speake ner teache name iesu peter ihon answered sayde vnto thē iudge ye youre selues whether right god shulde obedient vnto vnto god chose speake haue sene herde threatened let go founde nothinge punyshe ye people praysed god act • ▪ done man vpon token health done aboue fourtye yeare olde whan let go came folowes tolde ye hye prestes elder sayde vnto whā herde lifte vp voyce wt one acorde vnto god sayde lorde thou art god made heauen earth see therin thou mouth dauid thy seruaūt hast sayde heythē rage ye people ymagin vayne thinges kynges earth stonde vp psal 2 prynces haue gathered selues together agaynst ye lorde agaynst christ trueth agaynst thy holy childe iesus thou hast anoynted herode pontius pilate heythen people israel haue gathered thēselues together soeuer thy hande thy councell determyned done lorde beholde threatenynges graunte vnto thy seruauntes stedfast boldnesse speake thy worde stretch thine hande healinge tokēs wonder maye done name thy holy childe iesus whā prayed place moued gathered together fylled ye holy goost spake worde god boldly multitude beleued one hert one soule also none sayde goodes awne thinges cōmen greate power gaue apostle witnesse resurreccion lorde iesu greate grace nether eny amonge lacked many possessers londes house solde thē brought ye money goodes solde layed apostle fete distribucion made vnto euery mā acordinge nede io also called ye apostle barnabas saye sonne consolacion leuite countre cypers londe solde brought money layed apostle fete v chapter bvt certayne man named ananias saphira wife solde possession kepte awaye parte money wife knowinge broughte one parte layed apostle fete peter sayde ananias wherfore hath sathan fylled thine hert thou shuldest lye vnto holy goost withdrawe awaye parte money lyuelod mightest thou haue kepte whan thou haddest whan solde money also thy power hast thou conceaued thinge thine hert thou hast lyed vnto mē vnto god whan ananias herde wordes fell downe gaue vp goost came greate feare vpon thē herde yonge men rose vp put asyde caried buried fortuned aboute ye space thre houres wife came knewe done peter answered vnto tell solde ye londe somoch sayde yee moch peter sayde vnto haue ye agreed together tempte sprete lorde beholde fete thē haue buried thy huszbande dore shal carye immediatly fell downe fete gaue vp goost came yonge men founde deed caried buried hir huszbā de came greate feare ouer whole congregacion ouer thē herde many token wonder done amonge people hādes apostle together one acorde 〈…〉 salomon porche durst man ioyne self vnto thē neuertheles people helde moch multitude men wemen beleued lorde grewe moch brought sycke stretes layed vpon beddes barowes leest waye shadowe peter whan came might ouershadowe thē came many also ye city rounde aboute vnto ierusalem brought sicke thē vexed vncleane spretes healed euery one hye prest rose vp yt 〈…〉 secte saduces full indignacion layed handes apostle put comon preson angell ye lorde night opened preson dores 〈…〉 brought thē sayde go youre waye steppe vp speake temple people wordes life whan herde entred temple early mornynge taught hye prest came yt called councell together ye elder child israel sent preson fet mynisters came founde preson • ame agayne tolde sayde preson founde shut diligence kepers stondinge without dores whā opened founde noman therin whan hye prest ruler temple hye prestes herde wordes douted whervnto wolde growe came one tolde beholde men ye put preson temple stondinge teachinge people wēte ye ruler mynisters fetched without violence 〈…〉 feared people lest shulde haue bene stoned whan brought set thē councell hye prest axed sayde dyd 〈…〉 cōmaunde strately ye shulde teache name beholde ye haue fylled ierusalem youre doctryne 〈…〉 ye intēde brynge man bloude vpon v peter apostle answered sayde ought obeye god men god oure father hath raysed vp iesus whō ye slewe hanged tre hath righte hande god exalted prynce sauioure geue repentaunce forgeuenesse synnes vnto israel recordes wordes holy goost whō god hath geuen vnto thē obeye whā herde wente thorow hertes thoughte slaye stode vp ye councell pharyse 〈…〉 named gamaliel scribe greate reputacion ye people bad put apostle asyde litle sayde vnto ye men israel take hede youre selues ye touchinge men dayes rose vp one theudas boostinge cleued vnto nōbre mē aboute foure hundreth slayne yt enclyned vnto scatred abrode brought naught 〈…〉 stode vp iudas galile ye dayes trybute drewe awaye moch people also perished enclyned vnto scatred abrode saye vnto refrayne yo selues frō men let thē go 〈…〉 yf councell worke mē wil come naught yf god ye able destroye lest ye founde men wil stryue agaynst god agreed vnto called apostle bet commaunded shulde speake nothinge name iesu let go departed presence councell reioysinge mat 5 • worthy suffre rebuke name sake daylie temple euery house ceassed teache preache gospell iesus christ vi chapter dayes whan nombre disciple increased arose grudge amōge grekes agaynst hebrues wyddowes loked vpon daylie handreachinge twolue called multitude disciple together sayde mete shulde leaue worde god serue table wherfore brother loke amonge seuē men 1 tim 3 b honeste reporte full holy goost wyszdome maye appoynte nedefull busynes wil geue oure selues vnto prayer mynistracion worde god sayenge pleased whole multitude chose steuen man full fayth holy goost philippe procorus nicanor thimon parmenas nicolas proselite antioche nu 27 act 1 1 ti 4 b 2 tim 1 b set ye apostle prayed layed handes vpon worde god increased nombre disciple multiplied greatly ierusalem many prestes also obedient vnto fayth steuen full faith power dyd wonder greate token amonge people arose certayne synagoge called synagoge ye libertynes cyrenites alexādrines thē yt celicia asia disputed steuē luc 21 b coulde resiste wyszdome sprete spake sent certayne men sayde mat 26 f haue herde speake blasphemous wordes agaynst moses agaynst god moued people elder scrybes came vpon caught brought councell set false witness sayde man ceasseth speake blasphemous wordes agaynst holy place lawe herde saye iesus nazareth shall destroye place chaunge ordinaunces moses gaue v sat councell loked vpō sawe face face angell vii chapter sayde hye prest euē sayde deare brother father herken god glorye appeared vnto father abrahā whyle yet mesopotamia dwelt haran sayde vnto get yt thy coūtre frō thy kynred come londe wil shewe ye thē wente lande caldees gen 11 dwelt haran gen 12 thēce whan father deed brought ouer londe ye dwell gaue enheritaūce therin ye bredth fote promysed wolde geue possesse gen 13 sede whan yet childe gen 15 c thus sayde god vnto thy sede shalbe straunger straunge londe shal make bonde men intreate thē euell foure hundreth yeares ye people shal serue wil iiudge sayde god shal go forth serue place gaue couenaūt circūcision gen 17 b begat isaac gen 21 gen 25 c circūcised eight daye isaac begat iacob gen 29 f iacob begat twolue patriarkes patriarkes indignacion ioseph money child hemor sichem gen 23 whā tyme promes druenye god sworne vnto abrahā people grewe multiplied egipte exod 1 psal 104 tyll rose another kynge knewe ioseph dealte suttely wt oure kynred intreated oure father euell made cast yonge child shulde remayne alyue tyme moses borne 〈…〉 proper childe god norished thre monethes father house whan cast pharaos doughter toke vp norished vp hir awne sonne moses learned maner wyszdome egipcians mightie dedes wordes whan fourtye yeare olde came mynde vyset brother child israel whan sawe one suffre wrōge helped delyuered harme done vnto slewe egipcian thoughte brother shulde haue vnderstonde god hande shulde saue thē howbeit vnderstode nexte daye shewed vnto stroue together wolde haue set one agayne sayde syrs ye brother hurte ye one another dyd neghboure wronge thrust awaye sayde 〈…〉 made ruler iudge ouer v wilt thou slaye also thou slewest egipcian yesterdaye moses fled sayenge straunger lande madian begat two sonnes fourtye yeares 〈…〉 angell ye lorde appeared vnto vpon mount sina flamme fyre buszhe whā moses sawe wondred sighte drue nye beholde ye voyce ye lorde came vnto god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob beit moses trēbled durst beholde ye lorde sayde vnto hī 〈…〉 put thy shues thy fete ye place thou stondest holy grounde haue well sene trouble people egipte haue herde gronynge come downe delyuer come wil sende egipte moses refused sayde made ye ruler iudge ouer v 〈…〉 god sent ruler delyuerer hande angell appeared vnto buszhe broughte dyd wonder token egipte reed see ye wyldernesse fourtye prophete 〈…〉 heauē seate earth fote stole house wilye buylde vnto sayeth lorde place rest hath hande made thinges 〈…〉 ye styffnecked vncircumcysed hertes eares ye allwaye resiste holy goost euē yo father dyd ye also prophetes haue yo father persecuted slewe thē tolde cōmynge yt righteous whose traytours murthurers ye become ye receaued lawe mynistracion angel 〈…〉 b 〈◊〉 15 b haue kepte whan herde wente thorow ye hertes thē gnaszhed vpō tethe beynge full holy goost loked vp towarde heauen mat 16 sawe glorye god iesus stōdinge righte hande god sayde beholde se heauens open sonne mā stondinge ye righte honde god cried loude voyce psal 57 stopped eares rāne violently vpon thrust cite stoned act 22 ye witness layed downe clothes fete yonge man called saul stoned steuen cryed sayde lorde iesu receaue sprete kneled downe cried loude voyce lorde luc 2 • laye synne charge whā thus spoken fell slepe viii chapter saul pleasure death ye tyme greate persecucion ouer congregacion ierusalē scatered abrode region iewrye samaria excepte apostle steuen men yt feared god dressed made greate lamentacion ouer act 9 • 22 26 1 cor • gal 1 b saul made hauocke congregacion entred euery house drue men wemen delyuered thē preson yt scatered abrode wēte aboute preached worde thē came philippe cite samaria preached christ vnto people gaue hede one acorde vnto ye thinges philip spake hearinge seynge tokēs dyd vncleane spretes cryed loude departed many yt possessed many sicke palsie lame healed greate ioye cite afore ye cite certayne mā called simon vsed witche craft bewitched ye people samaria sayenge man coulde greate thinges regarded leest vnto ye greatest sayde power god greate regarded longe tyme bewitched sorcery howbeit whan beleued philip preachinge ye kyngdome god name iesu christ baptysed mē wemē symon beleued also baptysed cleued vnto philippe whā sawe dedes token done wondred whan apostle ierusalem herde samaria receaued ye worde god sent vnto thē peter ihon whā come prayed thē yt might receaue holy goost yet come vpon none baptysed onely name christ iesu • ct 13 • nd 19 tim 4 b • nd 5 c tim 1 b layed hādes receaued holy goost whan simon sawe layenge apostle hādes yt holy goost geuen offred thē money sayde geue also power whomsoeuer put hōdes maye receaue holy goost howbeit peter sayde vnto perishe thou thy money mat 10 thou thinkest ye gifte god maye optayned money thou shalt haue nether parte ner felashipe worde ye hert righte god repente therfore ye wickednesse praye vnto god yf happly thought thy hert maye forgeuē ye se yt thou art full bytter gall wrapped wt vnrighteousnesse answered simon sayde 〈◊〉 21 b praye ye vnto lorde yt none thinges wherof ye haue spoken come vpon whā testified spokē worde lorde turned agayne ierusalem preached gospell many townes samaritanes angell lorde spake vnto philippe sayde aryse go towarde south vnto waye goeth downe ierusalem vnto gaza deserte rose wente beholde mā morians lōde chamberlayne auctorite candace ye quene londe morians rule hir treasury ye came ierusalē worshipe returned home agayne satt vpon charet red prophet esay sprete sayde vnto philippe go neare ioyne thy selfe yonder charet thē ranne philippe vnto herde rede prophet esay sayde vnderstōdest thou thou readest sayde excepte mā enfourme desyred philippe wolde come vp syt tenoure scripture red esa 53 b led shepe slayne lambe voycelesse sherer opened mouth humblenesse iudgment exalted shal declare generacion life taken awaye earth answered chamberlayne vnto philippe sayde praye speaketh prophet himselfe man philippe opened mouth beganne scripture preached gospell iesus wēte waye came water chamberlayne sayde beholde water hyndereth baptysed philippe sayde yf thou beleue thy whole herte thou mayest answered sayde beleue iesus christ sonne god commaunded holde styll charet wente downe water philippe chamberlayne baptysed whan come vp water sprete lorde toke philippe awaye chamberlayne sawe nomore wente waye reioysinge philippe founde aszdod walked aboute preached gospell vnto city tyll came cesarea ix chapter saul yet breathinge threatnynges slaughter agaynst disciple lorde act 〈…〉 1 cor • 〈…〉 wente vnto ye hye preste desyred letter damascon vnto synagoges yf foūde eny waye whether men wemen mighte brynge thē bounde vnto ierusalem goinge iourney fortuned came nye vnto damascō sodenly shyned rounde aboute hī light frō heauē fell earth herde voyce sayde vnto saul saul 〈…〉 persecutest thou sayde lorde art thou lorde sayde iesus whō thou persecutest shalbe harde ye kycke agaynst prycke tremblinge astonnyed sayde lorde 〈…〉 wilt thou shal lorde sayde vnto aryse go cite shal tolde thou shalt ye mē iourneyed wt stode amased herde voyce sawe noman saul rose earth whan opened eye sawe noman neuertheles toke honde broughte damascō thre dayes without sighte nether ate ner dranke damascon disciple named ananias vnto sayde lorde vision ananias sayde beholde lorde lorde sayde vnto aryse go strete called straight house iuda one called saul 〈…〉 tharsis beholde prayeth hath sene vision mā named ananias cōmynge vnto layenge hāde vpō mighte receaue sighte ananias answered lorde haue herde many man moch euell hath done thy sayntes ierusalē hath auctorite hye prestes bynde yt call vpon thy name lorde sayde vnto go thy waye 〈…〉 man chosen vessell vnto maye beare name heythen kynges child israel wil shewe greate thinges must suffre name sake ananias wente waye came house 〈◊〉 22 b layed handes vpon sayde brother saul lorde appeared vnto ye waye thou camest hath sent thou mightest receaue thy sight fylled holy goost immediatly fell eye bene scale receaued sighte rose baptysed toke meate conforted saul certayne dayes disciple damascon straight waye preached christ synagoges ye sonne god herde amased sayde ierusalem spoyled called name came hither intent shulde brynge bounde vnto hye prestes saul increased strength cōfounded ye iewes dwelt damascon affirmed yt christ many dayes iewes helde councell together kyll tolde saul layed wayte wayted ye gate daye night 〈◊〉 11 might kyll 〈◊〉 2 c 〈◊〉 19 c disciple toke nighte put thorow wall let downe baslrett 〈◊〉 2 b whan saul came ierusalem assayed ioyne ye disciple afrayed beleued yt disciple neuertheles barnabas toke broughte apostle tolde sene lorde waye spake done boldly damascon name iesu wente ierusalē quyte himselfe boldly ye name ye lorde iesu spake also disputed ye grekes wēte aboute slaye whan brother knewe yt act 22 b brought cesarea sent forth tharsis congregacions rest thorow iewry galile samaria edified walked feare lorde fylled comforte holy goost chaunced peter walked thorow quarter came also vnto ye sayntes dwelt lydda founde man named eneas lyen vpon bedd eight yeares sicke ye palsye peter sayde vnto eneas iesus christ make whole aryse make thy bedd ye self arose immediatly dwelt lydda sarona sawe turned vnto lorde ioppa certayne woman disciple named tabitha interpretacion called dorcas ye full good workes almesse dedes dyd chaunced tyme sicke dyed waszhed layed chāber moch lydda nye vnto ioppa disciple herde peter sent two men vnto desyred yt wolde take grefe come vnto peter rose came thē whā come broughte chamber wyddowes stode rounde aboute wepynge shewed cote garmētes dorcas made whyle whā peter put forth kneled downe made prayer turned vnto body sayde tabitha ryse vp opened hir eye whan sawe peter reade 〈◊〉 vp sat hir downe agayne gaue hande lifte vp called sayntes wedowes shewed alyue knowne thorow ioppa many beleued ye lorde fortuned yt taried lōge season ioppa one simō tanner x chapter man cesarea named cornelius captayne ye cōpany called ye • alianysh denoute man one feared god wt house gaue moch almesse ye people prayed god allwaye sawe vision openly aboute nyenth houre daye angell god entringe sayenge vnto cornelius loked vpon afrayed sayde lorde sayde vnto eccli 35 b thy prayer thine allmesses come vp remēbraunce god sende men vnto ioppa call simō whose syrname peter lodginge one symon tanner whose house lyeth ye see syde shal tell ye thou oughtest whā angell spake cornelius departed called two housholde seruauntes deuoute soudyer thē wayted vpon tolde sent thē ioppa nexte daye whan goinge iourney came nye vnto cite peter 4 4 mat 6 luc 6 b wente vp chamber praye aboute sixte houre whan hōgrie wolde haue eatē whyle made ready fell traunce sawe heauē open vessell cōmynge downe vnto bene greate lynnē clothe knytt foure corner let downe ye earth wherin maner foure foted beestes earth wylde beestes wormes foules ayre came voyce vnto ryse peter slaye eate peter sayde oh lorde leuit 11 deut 14 neuer ate eny commen vncleane thinge voyce spake vnto agayne ye secōde tyme mat 15 b ro 14 b • tim 4 tit 1 c god hath clensed yt make thou vncleane done thryse ye vessell receaued vp agayne heauen whyle peter combred himselfe maner vision shulde sene beholde men yt sent cornelius enquered simōs house stode dore called axed whether simon whose syrname peter lodged whyle peter musinge vision sprete sayde vnto beholde men seke aryse therfore get downe go thē doute haue sent wente peter downe men yt sent vnto cornelius sayde lo ye seke yt cause wherfore ye come sayde cornelius captayne iust man one feareth god good reporte amōge people iewes warned holy angell sende house heare wordes gen 19 24 • pet 4 b called lodged nexte daye wente peter forth certayne brother ioppa bare company ye daye folowinge came cesarea cornelius wayted thē called together kynszfolkes speciall frendes chaunced yt peter came cornelius mett fell downe fete worshipped peter toke vp sayde act •• apo •• •• stonde vp man also talked wt wente founde many come together sayde vnto ye knowe deu •• laufull man beynge iewe ioyne selfe come straunger god hath shewed yt shulde call mā cōmen vncleane therfore haue douted come soone sent axe therfore intent haue ye sent cornelius sayde foure dayes agoo fasted nyenth houre prayed house beholde stode mā bryghte clothinge sayde cornelius yi prayer herde thine allmesse dedes remēbraunce sighte god sende therfore ioppa call one simon whose syrname peter lodginge ye house simon ye tāner seesyde ye whā commeth shal speake vnto ye sent vnto immediatly thou hast done well thou art come presente god heare thinges commaunded god peter opened mouth sayde 〈…〉 perceaue trueth god hath respecte personnes 〈1 paragraph〉 people yt feareth worketh righteousnes accepted vnto ye knowe ye preachinge god sent vnto child israel preachinge thorow iesus christ lorde ouer preachinge published thorow iewry 〈…〉 begāne galile ye baptyme ihon preached god 〈…〉 anoynted • sus nazareth holy goost wt power wente aboute dyd good healed oppressed deuell god witness dyd londe iewes ierusalem slewe hanged tre god raysed vp thirde daye caused openly shewed people ye chosen witness god euen vnto v ate dronke 〈…〉 rysen vp deed commaunded v preach vnto people 〈…〉 testifye ordeyned god iudge lyuynge deed 〈◊〉 4 • 〈◊〉 53 c 〈◊〉 30 〈◊〉 4 beare prophetes wytnesse thorow name yt beleue shal receaue remyssion synnes whyle peter yet speakynge wordes holy goost fell vpō thē herkened vnto worde faithfull circūcision came peter astonnyed gifte ye holy goost shed also vpon heythen herde spake tunges magnified god thē answered peter 〈◊〉 3 maye eny man forbydde water shulde baptysed haue receaued holy goost well commaunded baptysed name lorde thē prayed wolde tary certayne dayes xi chapter apostle brother iewrye herde saye heythen also receaued worde god whan peter come vp ierusalem circūcision chode sayde 〈◊〉 7 thou wentest men vncircumcysed hast eaten peter beganne expounded thinge order vnto thē sayde ye cite ioppa prayē ge 〈◊〉 10 b traunce sawe vision vessell cominynge downe bene greate lynnen clothe foure corner let downe heauen came vnto loked considered sawe foure foted beestes earth wylde beestes wormes foules ayre herde voyce sayde vnto ryse peter slaye eate sayde oh lorde neuer entred eny commen vncleane thinge mouth neuertheles voyce answered agayne heauen god hath clensed call thou vncleane done thre tymes taken vp agayne heauen beholde immediatly stode thre men dore house sent cesarea vnto sprete sayde vnto shulde go thē doute nothinge • ct 10 c sixe brethrē also came entred mās house shewed v sene angell stondinge house sayde vnto sende men ioppa call simon whose syrname peter shal tell ye wordes wherby thou thy house shal saued whan beganne speake holy goost fell vpō act 2 like vpon v ye begynnynge thoughte vpon worde lorde sayde act 1 ihon baptysed water ye shalbe baptysed ye holy goost moch god hath geuen like giftes vnto v beleue lorde iesus christ shulde able withstōde god whan herde helde peace praysed god sayde hath god also heithen graunted repentaunce vnto life scatred abrode thorow ye trouble yt rose aboute steuen act 8 walked euerysyde vntyll phenices cipers antioche spake worde vnto noman onely vnto ye iewes neuertheles thē men cipers cyren came antioche spake also vnto grekes preached gospell lorde iesu ye hande lorde thē greate nombre beleued turned vnto lorde tydinges came ye eares cōgregacion ierusalem sent barnabas shulde go vnto antioche whan come thither sawe grace god glad act 13 exorted purpose hert wolde contynue lorde good man full holy goost faith greate multitude people added vnto lorde barnabas departed vnto tharsus seke saul whā foūde hī brought hī anthioche chaūced whole yeare cōuersaunte together cōgregaciō taughte moch people disciple antioche first called christen dayes came prophetes frō ierusalem vnto antioche one whose name act 21 b agabus stode vp declared sprete greate derth shulde come ouer whole compasse earth came passe vnder emperoure claudius disciple cōcluded euery one acordinge abylite sende 1 cor 16 2 cor 8 9 handreachinge vnto ye brother iewry thinge also dyd sent handes barnabas saul xii chapter tyme layed kynge herode handes vpon certayne congregacion vexe mat 4 c iames brother ihon slewe swerde whan sawe pleased iewes proceaded farther take peter also easter whan taken put preson delyuered vnto foure quaternion soudyers kepe thought easter bringe forth people peter kepte preson act 4 c prayer made without ceassinge congregacion vnto god whan herode wolde haue broughte vnto people nighte slepte peter betwene two soudiers bounde two cheynes kepers dore kepte preson beholde angell lorde presente lighte shyned habitacion smote peter syde waked vp sayde aryse vp quyckly cheynes fell hondes angell sayde vnto gyrde put thy shues dyd sayde vnto cast thy mantle aboute folowe wente folowed wyst trueth done ye angell thoughte sene vision neuertheles wente thorow first seconde watch came yron gate ledeth vnto cite opened thē awne acorde wente passed thorow one strete immediatly angell departed whan peter come sayde knowe trueth ye lorde hath sent angell delyuered honde herode waytinge people iewes considered thinge came house mary mother one ihon syrname called marke many gathered together act 1 b prayed peter knocked entry dore came forth damsell herken named rhoda whan knewe peter voyce opened entrye gladnes rāne tolde peter stode ye entrye sayde vnto thou art mad neuertheles abode sayde angell peter contynued knockinge whan opened dore sawe astonnyed act 13 b beckened vnto hande holde peace tolde lorde broughte preson sayde shewe vnto iames brother departed wēte another place whan daye litle doo amōge soudyers become peter whan herode called founde caused kepers examyned commaunded thē caried awaye wente downe frō iewry vnto cesarea abode displeased thē tyre sidō neuertheles came vnto one accorde made intercession blastus kynges chamberlayne desyred peace countre norished kynges londe vpon daye appoynted herode put ye kyngly apparell sat downe vpon iudgment seate made oracion vnto people cried therto voyce god man immediatly angell lorde smote gaue god honoure eaten vp wormes 〈…〉 gaue vp goost worde god grewe multiplyed barnabas saul came agayne ierusalem delyuered act 〈…〉 handreachinge toke ihon whose syrname marke xiii chapter antioche congregacion prophetes teacher barnabas simon called niger lucius cyren manahen herodes tetrachas norsfelowe saul serued ye lorde fasted holy goost sayde separate barnabas saul worke act 〈…〉 vnto haue called fasted prayed layed handes let go beynge sent holy goost came vnto seleucia thence sayled vnto cypers whan come cite salamin shewed worde god synagoges ye iewes 〈…〉 ihon mynister whan gone thorow yle vnto cyte paphos founde certayne sorcerer false prophete iewe whose name bariesu sergius paulus ruler countre mā vnderstondinge called barnabas saul vnto desyred heare ye worde god 〈…〉 sorcerer elimas name interpretacion withstode thē soughte turne awaye ruler frō faith saul also called paul beynge full holy goost loked vpon sayde thou childe deuell full suttyl • ie disceatfulnesse enemye righteousnes thou ceassest peruerte straight wayes ye lorde beholde hāde lorde commeth vpon thou shalt blynde se sonne season immediatly fell myst darknesse wente aboute soughte shulde lede hande whan ruler sawe done beleued wō dred doctryne lorde whan paul departed shippe frō paphos came perga londe pamphilia 〈…〉 ihon departed wente agayne ierusalem neuertheles wandred thorow perga came antioche londe pisidia wēte synagoge vpon sabbath daye sat downe lecture lawe prophetes ruler synagoge sent vnto sayenge good brother yf ye haue eny sermon exorte people saye stode paul vp 〈…〉 beckened hande shulde holde peace sayde yemen israel ye feare god herkē god people chose oure father exalted people whan straungers lōde egipte mightie arme broughte 〈…〉 space fortye yeares suffred maners wyldernesse destroyed seuen nacions lande canaan 〈◊〉 13 b parted londe amonge lott 〈◊〉 1 gaue iudges space foure hundreth fiftye yeares vnto prophet samuel desyred kynge 〈…〉 god gaue vnto saul sonne ci 〈…〉 man trybe ben iamin fortye yeares longe 〈…〉 whan put downe set vp dauid kynge reported sayenge 〈…〉 haue founde dauid sonne iesse man hert shal fulfyll wyll man sede hath god 〈◊〉 131 〈◊〉 7 c acordinge promesse broughte forth vnto people israel ye sauioure iesus whan ihon first preached cōmynge baptyme repentaunce vnto israel whan ihon fulfylled course sayde ye take beholde commeth one whose shues fete worthy lowse ye men brother ye child generacion abraham feare god amonge mat 10 vnto ye worde saluacion sent inhabiters ierusalem ruler somoch knewe ner yet voyces prophetes red euery sabbath haue fulfylled condemnynge him1 cor 2▪ luc 23 though founde cause death yet desyred pilate kyll whan fulfylled wrytten toke downe tre layed sepulcre luc 23 • ye thirde daye god raysed vp deed appeared many dayes vnto thē wente vp galile vnto ierusalem act 1 witness vnto people also declare vnto ye promes made vnto oure father god hath fulfylled vnto v child yt raysed vp iesus agayne wrytten seconde psalme thou art sonne daye haue begotten hath raysed vp frō deed nomore returne corrupcion sayde wyse grace promysed dauid esa 55 • wyl faithfully kepe vnto therfore sayeth also another place thou shalt suffre thy holy tose corrupcion dauid psal 15 b whan tyme serued wyll god 3 reg 2 b fell slepe layed father sawe corrupcion whō god raysed vp agayne sawe corrupcion knowne vnto therfore ye men brethrē yt thorow man preached vnto ye forgeuenesse synnes luc 24 frō ye thinges wherby ye mighte iustifyed lawe moses whosoeuer beleueth man iustifyed bewarre therfore come vpon spoken prophetes beholde ye despysers wonder perishe abac 1 worke youre tyme ye shal beleue yf eny man tell whan iewes gone synagoge heythen besoughte yt wolde speake ye worde vnto betwene sabbath dayes whā cō gregacion synagoge broken vp many iewes proselites yt serued god folowed paul barnabas spake act 11 c exorted shulde contynue grace god ye sabbath folowinge came almost whole cite together heare worde god whan iewes sawe people full indignacion spake agaynst spoken paul speakinge agaynst blasphemynge paul barnabas waxed bolde sayde mat 10 • nd 15 c behoued first worde god spoken vnto ye thrust frō counte youre selues vnworthy euerlastinge life lo mat • 1 c turne gentyles hath lorde cōmaunded v esa 49 b mat 5 b luc 3 c haue set lighte vnto ye gentyles yt thou ye saluacion vnto ende earth whan gentyles herde glad praysed worde lorde beleued euē many ordeyned euerlastinge life worde ye lorde spred abrode thorow region howbeit iewes moued deuoute honorable wemen1 tim • b chefemen citie raysed vp persecucion agaynst paul barnabas expelled coastes mat 10 b mar 6 b luc 9 shoke dust fete agaynst came iconium disciple fylled ioye holy goost xiiii chapter fortuned iconium wēte together synagoge iewes spake greate multitude iewes grekes beleued vnbeleuynge iewes moued disquyeted soules heythē agaynst brethrē beynge lōge season quyte themselues boldly lorde gaue testimony vnto worde grace caused token wonder done handes marc 16 c howbeyt multitude cite deuyded helde wt iewes apostle whan rose vp insurreccion heythē ye iewes ruler put shame stone thē perceaued mat 10 c fled vnto lystra derba city ye countre licaoni •• vnto ye region lyeth rounde aboute preached gospell amonge lystra man sat beynge impotent fete crepell frō mother womb • neuer walked herde paul speake whan behelde perceaued faith made whole sayde wt loude voyce stonde vprighte thy fete sprange vp walked whan people sawe paul done lifte vp voyce sayde ye speache lycaonia goddes become like vnto men come downe vnto v called barnabas iupiter paul mercurius preacher iupiters prest dwel • cite broughte ox garlandes gate wolde haue done sacrifice people whan ye apostle barnabas paul herde rent clothes ranne amonge people cryenge sayenge ye mē ye act 〈…〉 mortall mē also like vnto preach vnto ye gospell ye shulde turne vayne thinges vnto ye lyuynge god made heauē earth see 〈…〉 therin tymes past suffred ye heythen walke awne wayes neuertheles hath left hī selfe without wytnesse yt hath shewed benefites geuen v rayne heauen frutefull season fyllynge oure hertes fode gladnesse whan sayde scarse refrayned people dyd sacrifice vnto came thither certayne iewes antioche iconiū persuaded people 〈…〉 stoned paul drue cite supposinge bene deed howbeyt ye disciple stode rounde aboute rose vp came cite nexte daye departed barnabas vnto derba preached gospell vnto cite taughte many wēte agayne vnto lystra iconium antioche strengthinge soules ye disciple exortinge thē cōtynue faith thorow moch tribulacion must entre kyngdome god 〈…〉 whā ordeyned elder eleccion thorow congregacions prayed fasted cō mended vnto lorde beleued wente thorow pisidia came pamphilia spake worde perga wēte downe attalia frō thence departed shippe vnto antioche whence delyuered grace god vnto ye worke fulfylled whan came gathered congregacion together shewed greate thinges god done thē opened dore faithe vnto heithen abode longe tyme disciple xv chapter came certayne frō iewry taughte brother 〈…〉 excepte ye circumcysed maner moses ye saued whā rose discēsion paul barnabas set selues harde agaynst 〈…〉 ordeyned paul barnabas certayne shulde go vp ierusalem vnto apostle elder aboute questiō broughte waye ye cōgregacion wente thorow phenices samaria declared 〈…〉 conuersacion heythen brought greate ioye vnto brother whan came ierusalē receaued ye cōgregacion apostle elder tolde greate thinges god done thē rose vp certayne secte ye pharises beleued sayde must circumcysed cōmaunded kepe lawe moses apostle elder came together reason vpon matter whan moch disputinge peter rose vp sayde vnto thē ye men brother ye knowe good whyle agoo god chose amonge v yt heythē mouth shulde heare worde gospell beleue god knower hertes bare wytnesse ouer thē 〈…〉 gaue thē holy goost like vnto v put dyfference betwixte v purified hertes thorow fayth therfore tempte ye god layenge vpon ye disciple neckes yocke 〈…〉 nether father ner able beare beleue saued thorow grace lorde iesu christ 〈…〉 like also • ye multitude helde peace gaue audience vnto paul barnabas tolde greate token wonder god done thē amōge heythen afterwarde whan helde peace iames answered sayde ye men brother herkē vnto simō hath tolde god first vysited receaue people vnto name amonge heythen vnto agree ye wordes prophetes wryttē 〈…〉 wyl returne wyl buylde agayne ye tabernacle dauid fallen downe fallen decaye therof wyl buylde agayne wyl set vp residue men maye seke lorde also heythen vpō name named sayeth lorde doth thinges knowne vnto god workes begynnynge ye worlde wherfore sentence amonge heythen turned vnto god disquyeted wryte vnto absteyne selues fylthynesse exo 20 ephe 5 gen 9 idol exo 20 ephe 5 gen 9 whordome exo 20 ephe 5 gen 9 strangled bloude moses hath olde tyme euery cite preach red synagoges euery sabbath daye apostle elder whole congregacion thoughte good chose men sende vnto antioche paul barnabas namely ioh 14 b iudas whose syrname barsabas sylas chefe men amō ge brethrē gaue thē letter handes maner apostle elder brother wysh health vnto brethrē heythē antioche syria celicia moch haue herde certayne oures departed haue troubled combred youre myndes gal • • sayenge ye must circumcysed kepe ye lawe gaue soch commaundemēt semed good vnto v beynge gathered together one accorde chose men sende vnto oure beloued barnabas paul men haue act 13 e 14 • ioperded lyues ye name oure lorde iesus christ therfore haue sent iudas sylas shal also tell wordes pleased holy goost v laye charge vpon necessary poyntes ye absteyne 1 cor 8 10 c offeringes idol bloude strangled whordome yf ye absteyne youre selues ye shal well fare ye well whan sent forth came vnto antioche gathered multitude together delyuered epistle whan red glad cōsolacion iudas sylas prophetes also exorted ye brethrē moch preachinge strēgthed whan taried season let go brother peace vnto apostle notwithstondinge sylas thoughte good byde styll paul barnabas cōtynued antioche teachinge preachinge worde lorde many neuertheles certayne dayes paul sayde vnto barnabas let v go agayne vyset oure brother thorow city wherin haue shewed worde lorde barnabas gaue councell shulde take thē ihon whose syrname marke howbeit paul thoughte mete take act 1 • b departed pamphilia wente vnto worke sharpe strife betwene departed asunder ye one frō barnabas toke marke vnto sayled vnto cypers paul chose sylas departed beynge cō mytted brother vnto grace god wente thorow syria celicia stablishynge congregacions xvi chapter came vnto derba lystra beholde certayne disciple named timotheus sonne iewish woman beleued father greke ye good reporte amonge brethrē lystra iconium paul wolde shulde go forth toke gal 2 circumcysed iewes quarter knewe father greke wente thorow city delyuered sentence kepe act • 5 concluded apostle elder ierusalem thē congregacions stablyshed faith increased nombre daylie wente thorow phrygia londe galacia rom 1 b forbydden holy goost preache worde asia howbeit came mysia proued take iourney bithinia sprete suffred neuertheles whan passed thorow mysia came downe troada appeared act 18 23 b vision vnto paul night man macedonia stode prayed sayde come downe macedonia helpe v whan sene ye vision soughte immediatly go vnto macedonia beynge certified ye lorde called v thither preach gospell vnto thē departed troada came straight course vnto samothracia nexte daye neapolis thence philippi chefe cite londe macedonia fre cite cite abode certayne dayes daye sabbathes wēte cite besyde water men wonte praye sat downe spake vnto wemen resorted thither deuoute woman named lydia seller purple cite thiatira herkened whose hert lorde opened gaue hede vnto thinges paul spake whan baptysed hir housholde besoughte v sayde yf ye thynke beleue lorde come house byde 〈…〉 constrayned v fortuned whan wente prayer yt met v damsel sprete soythsayenge broughte hir master mastresse greate vauntage soyth sayenge ye folowed paul v cryed sayde men seruauntes hye god shewe v ye waye saluacion dyd many dayes paul content turned aboute sayde vnto sprete cō maunde name iesu christ thou departe 〈…〉 departed houre whā hir master mastresse sawe hope vauntage gone 〈…〉 toke paul sylas drue market place ye ruler broughte thē vnto officer sayde men trouble oure cyte iewes preach ordynaunce laufull v receaue ner obserue seynge romaynes people rāne officer rente clothes cōmaunded beaten roddes 〈…〉 whan beaten sore cast thē preson commaunded iayler kepe diligētly whan receaued soch commaundement cast thē ynner preson put fete stockes mydnight prayed paul sylas praysed god presoners herde sodenly greate earth quake foundacions preson shaken immediatly dores open bondes lowsed whā keper preson waked slepe sawe preson dores open drue swerde wolde haue kylled selfe thoughte ye presoners bene fled paul cryed loude sayde thy self harme called lighte sprange trembled fell fete paul sylas broughte sayde syrs must saued sayde 〈…〉 beleue lorde iesus shalt thou thy housholde saued preached worde lorde vnto house toke houre night waszhed strypes immediatly baptysed broughte house set table 〈…〉 reioysed housholde become beleuer god whan daye officer cite sent mynisters sayde let men go keper preson tolde sayenge vnto paul officer haue sent hither ye shulde lowse therfore get hēce go peace paul sayde vnto haue beaten v openly vncondempned yet romaynes haue cast v preson shulde thrust v preuely let come selues brynge v mynisters tolde wordes vnto officer feared whan herde romaynes came besoughte prayed thē departe cite wente preson entred house lydia whan sene brother comforted departed xvii chapter made iourney thorow amphipolis apollonia came thessalonica synagoge iewes paul maner wēte vnto vpon thre sabbathes spake vnto scripture opened vnto thē alleged 〈◊〉 4 〈…〉 c 〈…〉 christ must nedes haue suffred ryse agayne deed iesus preach vnto sayde ye christ thē beleued ioyned vnto paul sylas greate multitude also deuoute grekes chefe wemen fewe styffnecked iewes indignacion toke vnto certayne euell men vagabundes gathered company set cite rore preassed vnto house iason soughte brynge vnto comon people whan founde drue iason certayne brother vnto ruler cite cryed trouble worlde come hither also iason hath receaued preuely contrary decree emperoure sayenge ioh 18 • 19 another kynge one iesus troubled people ruler cite herde whan receaued sufficient answere iason let go brother immediatly sent awaye paul sylas night vnto berea whan came wēte synagoge iewes eldest amonge thē thessalonica receaued worde maruelous wyllingly ioh 5 searched scripture daylie whether euen beleued many worshipfull wemen grekes men fewe 1 te 2 c whan iewes thessalonica knowlege worde god preached paul berea came moued people also howbeit brother sent paul awaye immediatly go vnto see sylas timotheus abode styll conueyed paul brought vnto athens whan receaued commaundement vnto sylas timotheus shulde come vnto haist wente waye whyle paul wayted athens sprete moued whan sawe cite geuē worshippinge ymages spake vnto iewes deuoute personnes synagoge ye market daylie vnto thē came certayne philosopher ye epicurees stoikes disputed sayde babler saye sayde semeth tidinges brynger new reade deuyls goddes preached vnto thē gospell iesus resurreccion toke broughte councell house sayde maye knowe new doctryne thou teachest thou bryngest straūge tidinges oure eares wolde knowe therfore meaneth athens straungers gestes gaue thē selues nothinge el either tell heare newes paul stode myddes comon place sayde ye mē athens se thinges ye supersticious haue gone thorow sene youre god seruyce founde altare vpō wrytten vnknowne god shewe vnto ye ye worshippe ignorauntly god made ye worlde therin psal 145 act 14 c moch lorde heauen earth esa 66 act 7 f dwelleth temple made handes nether worshipped men handes though nede eny man seynge geueth life breth vnto men euery gen 2 b hath made one bloude generacion men dwell vpō face ye earth hath assygned border appoynted longe farre shulde dwell shulde seke lorde yf mighte fele fynde truly farre euery one v lyue moue haue oure beynge certayne youre awne poetes also haue sayde generacion moch generacion god oughte thinke godheade like vnto golde syluer ymagery worke crafte ymaginacion man rom 2 truly god hath ouersene tyme ignoraunce lu 24 commaundeth men euery repente hath appoynted daye wyl iudge cōpasse worlde righteousnesse one man whō hath appoynted offred faith vnto men raysed vp deed whan herde resurreccion deed mocked sayde wyl heare agayne matter paul departed amonge howbeit certayne men claue vnto beleued amonge dionisius one councell woman named damaris xviii chapter departed paul frō athens came corinthum founde iewe named ro 16 3 tim 4 c aquila borne pō tus lately come italy wife priscilla empero claudius commaunded iewes departe rome drue vnto thē crafte abode thē wroughte crafte make tentes preached synagoge euery sabbath daye exhorted iewes grekes whan sylas timotheus come fro macedonia paul constrayned sprete testifye vnto ye iewes iesus christ whā sayde cōtrary blasphemed 〈…〉 shoke rayment sayde vnto youre bloude vpon youre awne heade hence forth go blamelesse vnto gentyles departed thence came house man named iustus feared god house nexte vnto synagoge howbeit crispus chefe ruler synagoge beleued ye lorde housholde many corinthian gaue audience beleued baptysed lorde spake vnto paul vision ye nighte afrayed speake holde thy peace noman shal inuade shal hurte haue moch people cite contynued yeare sixe monethes taught worde god whan gallio ruler countre achaia iewes made insurreccion wt one acorde agaynst paul broughte iudgment seate sayde felowe counceleth men worshipe god cōtrary lawe whan paul aboute open mouth gallio sayde vnto ye iewes yf matter wronge euell dede ye iewes reason wolde shulde heare yf question wordes name ye lawe amōge loke ye youre selues thinke iudge ouer droue iudgmēt seate grekes toke sosthenes ruler sinagoge smote iudgment seate gallio cared none tho thinges paul yt taried good whyle toke leue brother sayled syria priscilla aquila bearinge company shore heade cenchrea 〈…〉 vowe came downe ephesus lefte himselfe wēte synagoge reasoned iewes desyred wolde tary longer season cōsented bad farwele sayde must nedes eny wyse kepe feast commeth ierusalem 〈…〉 yf god wyl wil returne agayne vnto departed ephesus came cesarea wente vp saluted ye congregacion toke iourney downe antioche taried certayne tyme departed walked thorow ye countre galatia phrigia ordre strengthed disciple came vnto ephesus certayne iewe named 〈…〉 b 〈…〉 b apollo borne alexādria eloquent man mightie scripture infourmed waye lorde spake feruently sprete taughte diligently thinges lorde knewe baptyme ihon onely beganne speake boldly synagoge whan aquila priscilla herde toke vnto thē expounded waye god vnto perfectly whan wolde go achaia brother wrote exorted disciple receaue whan come thither helped moch beleued thorow grace ouercame iewes mightely shewed openly ye scripture iesus christ xix chapter bvt fortuned whan apollo corinthum paul walked thorow vpper coastes came ephesus founde certayne disciple vnto sayde haue ye receaued ye holy goost sence ye beleued sayde vnto hī haue herde whether holy goost sayde vnto ye baptysed sayde baptyme ihon paul sayde ihon baptysed baptyme repentaunce 〈◊〉 3 b 〈…〉 〈…〉 ▪ c 〈…〉 ▪ c spake vnto ye people shulde beleue shulde come iesus christ whan herde baptysed name lorde iesu whan paul layed hādes thē holy goost came vpon spake tunges prophecied men aboute twolue wēte ye synagoge preached boldly thre monethes longe teachinge geuynge exortacions kyngdome god whan dyuerse waxed herde herted beleued spake euell waye lorde multitude departed separated disciple disputed daylye scole one called tyrannus done two yeares lōge dwelt asia herde worde lorde iesu iewes grekes god wroughte small miracle handes paul body broughte napkyns partlettes vnto sicke disease departed euell spretes wente certayne vagabounde iewes coniurers vndertoke name ye name lorde iesus ouer euell spretes sayde charge iesus paul preacheth seuen sonnes one sceua iewe hye prest dyd euell sprete answered sayde iesus knowe paul knowe ye mā whō euell sprete ranne vpon ouercame cast vnder fled house naked wounded knowne vnto iewes grekes dwelt ephesus fell feare vpon ye name lorde iesus magnified mat 3 many thē also beleued came cōfessed shewed workes many vsed curious craftes broughte bokes together burnte openly counted pryce founde money fiftye thousande pen mightely grewe ye worde lorde preuayled whan done paul purposed sprete take iourney thorow macedonia achaia go ierusalē sayde haue bene must se rome also sent macedonia two mynistred vnto timotheus erastus himselfe remayned asia season tyme rose litle doo aboute waye certayne man named demetrius goldsmyth made syluer shrynes diana broughte crafte small vauntage gathered together felowe workmē occupacion sayde syrs ye knowe craft • haue vauntage ye se heare onely ephesus almost also thorow asia paul turneth awaye moch people persuadynge sayeth psal 113 • goddes made hondes howbeit shal onely brynge oure occupacion poynte set naught also temple greate diana shal hence forth despysed hir maiestye also shalbe destroyed whō neuertheles asia worlde worshippeth whan herde gone amonge people disciple suffred certayne also ye chefe asia paul good frendes sent vnto desyred shulde preasse open place cried one thinge another congregacion quyete parte knewe wherfore come together people drue forth alexander whan ye iewes thrust forwarde alexāder beckened hande wolde haue geuen people answere whan knewe iewe arose shoute cried space two houres greate diana ephesian whan towne clarke stylled people sayde ye men ephesus man knoweth cite ye ephesiās worshipper greate goddesse diana heauenly ymage seinge sayde agaynst ye ought contente nothinge without aduysement ye haue broughte hither men nether churchrobbers ner blasphemer youre goddesse yff demetrius craftesmen haue ought saye vnto eny man lawe open ruler let accuse one another yf ye wil go aboute eny thinge maye determyned laufull congregacion stonde ioperdy accused dayes vproure yet man giltye mighte geue rekenynge vproure whan sayde let congregacion departe xx chapter whan vproure ceassed paul called disciple vnto toke leue departed 1 tim 1 go macedonia whan gone thorow partes exhorted many wordes came grekelonde abode thre monethes whan iewes layed wayte aboute sayle syria purposed turne agayne thorow macedonia accompanied asia sopater berrea thessalonica aristarchus secundus gaius derba timotheus asia tychicus act 〈…〉 tim 〈…〉 trophimus wente taried v troada sayled easter dayes philippos vnto ye fyfth daye came vnto troada taried seuen dayes vpon one sabbathes whan disciple came together breake bred paul preached vnto wyllinge departe morow contynued preachinge vnto mydnight many lightes chamber gathered together sat yonge man named eutychos wyndow fell depe slepe whyle paul speakinge ouercome slepe fell downe thirde lofte taken vp deed paul wente downe fell enbraced sayde make nothinge doo soule hī wente vp brake bred ate talked moch thē tyll daye brake departed yōge man broughte alyue litle conforted wente afore shippe sayled towarde asson wyllinge receaue paul appoynted wolde himselfe go fote whan come v vnto asson toke came mitylenes sayled thence came nexte daye ouer agaynst chios daye folowinge aryued samos taried tragilion nexte daye came mileton paul determed sayle ouer ephesus nede spende tyme asia haisted ierusalem vpō whitsondaye yf possible mileton sent vnto ephesus called elder congregacion whan come sayde vnto ye knowe sence first daye act▪ 〈…〉 came asia maner haue bene tyme serued ye lorde humblenesse mynde many teares tentacions happened vnto ye layenges wayte iewes yt haue kepte backe nothinge yt profitable haue shewed taughte openly priuately house house haue testifyed vnto iewes grekes repentaunce towarde god faith towarde oure lorde iesus beholde go bounde ye sprete vnto ierusalē knowinge shal happen vnto yt holy goost 〈…〉 witnesseth euery cite sayeth bondes trouble abyde 〈…〉 regarde none nether counte life bearer selfe maye fulfyll course ioye office yt haue receaued lorde iesu testifye gospell grace god beholde knowe ye shal se face nomore ye thorow haue gone preached kyngdome god wherfore take recorde daye pure bloude men haue kepte nothinge backe haue shewed councell god take hede therfore vnto youre selues flocke amonge holy goost hath set bishoppes fede congregacion god hath purchaced thorow owne bloude knowe 〈…〉 departinge shal enter amonge greuous wolues shal spare flocke yee euē 〈…〉 amonge youre awne selues shal men aryse speakynge peruerse doctryne drawe disciple therfore awake remembre space thre yeares ceassed warne euery one nighte daye teares brother commende vnto god ye worde grace mightie edifye geue enheritaunce amōge sanctified 〈…〉 haue desyred syluer golde rayment eny ye youre selues knowe 〈…〉 〈…〉 b 〈…〉 handes haue mynistred vnto necessity haue shewed thinges labouringe ye oughte receaue weake remembre worde lorde sayde blessed geue receaue whan sayde kneled downe prayed moch wepynge amonge fell aboute paul necke kyssed sory worde sayde shulde se face nomore accōpanied vnto shippe xxi chapter whan fortuned launched forth departed came straight course vnto coon daye folowinge vnto rhodes thence vnto patara whan founde shippe ready sayle vnto one another toke shippe turned agayne vnto v ended course tyre came ptolomaida saluted brother abode one daye nexte daye yt paul departed came vnto cesarea entred house act 6 • philippe euangelist one goost act 10 c man whose gerdell shal iewes bynde thus ierusalem shal delyuer handes heythē whan herhe place besoughte wolde go vp ierusalem answered paul sayde ye wepynge breakynge hert redye onely bounde also dye ierusalem ye name lorde iesu whā wolde persuaded ceassed sayde mat • b lorde fulfylled dayes ready wente vp ierusalem came v also certayne disciple cesarea broughte one cypers named mnason olde disciple shulde lodge whā came ierusalem brother receaued v gladly nexte daye paul wente v vnto iames elder came together whan saluted tolde order god done amō ge heythen mynistracion whan herde praysed lorde sayde vnto brother thou seyst many thousande iewes beleue zelous ouer ye lawe enfourmed agaynst thou teachest iewes amōge heythē forsake moses sayest oughte circumcyse child ner walke custome therfore multitude must nedes come together shal heare thou art come therfore saye vnto haue foure men haue num 6 b act 13 b vowe take vnto ye purifye thyselfe cost maye shaue heades shal knowe nothinge wherof enfourmed agaynst thou also walkest kepest lawe touchinge beleue amonge heythen act 15 haue wrytten concluded shulde obserue soch onely kepe selues offeringes idol bloude strā gled act 24 b whordome paul toke men vnto purified nexte daye entred temple declaringe fulfylled dayes purificacion tyll offeringe offred euery one whan seuen dayes allmost fulfylled iewes asia sawe temple moued people layed handes vpon cryed ye men israel helpe man teacheth men euery agaynst oure people lawe place hath broughte grekes also temple hath defyled holy place sene act 20 2 tim 4 moued immediatly toke soudyers captaynes vnto ranne amōge whan sawe captayne soudyers lefte smytinge paul whan captayne came nye toke commaunded act 〈…〉 bounde two cheynes axed done one cried another amonge people whan coulde knowe certente rumoure commaunded caried castell whā came steppe fortuned borne ye soudyers violence people multitude people folowed cryed luc 〈…〉 awaye whan paul caried citesyn famous cite celicia beseke suffre speake vnto people whan geuen lycence paul stode steppe beckened hande vnto people whan made greate sylēce spake vnto hebrue sayde xxii chapter ye men feruent mynded god warde ye also daye act▪ 〈…〉 1 co • 〈…〉 gal 〈…〉 persecuted waye vnto death bounde delyuered vnto preson men wemen ye hye prest also doth beare wytnesse ye elder receaued letter vnto brother wente towarde damascon mighte brynge bounde ierusalem punyshed fortuned made iourney came nye vnto damascon aboute noone sodenly shone greate lighte aboute heauen fell earth herde voyce sayde vnto saull saull persecutest thou answered art thou lorde sayde vnto iesus nazareth thou persecutest sawe ye lighte afrayed herde voyce spake sayde lorde shal lorde sayde vnto aryse go damascon shal tolde yt appoynted whan sawe nothinge bryghtnesse lighte led hande came damascon one ananias deuoute man lawe 〈◊〉 9 b good reporte iewes dwelt came stepte vnto sayde brother saul loke vp loked vp vpon houre sayde god oure father hath ordeyned thou shuldest knowe wyll se thinge yt rightfull heare voyce mouth thou shalt wytnesse vnto men tho thinges thou hast sene herde tariest thou aryse baptysed wasze awaye thy synnes 〈…〉 call vpon name lorde fortuned whan come agayne ierusalē prayed temple traunce sawe sayde vnto make haist 〈◊〉 • 0 b 〈◊〉 9 get soone ierusalem wyl receaue witnesse thou
