〈◊〉 1 c 〈◊〉 3 wil sende farre amonge heythen gaue audience vnto worde lifte vp voyce sayde awaye soch felowe earth reason shulde lyue cried cast clothes thrue dust ayre captayne bad brynge castell commaunded beaten roddes examyned mighte knowe cause cried vpon whan bounde thonges paul sayde vnto vndercaptayne stode laufull scourge man romayne vncondemned whan vndercaptayne herde wēte vpper captayne tolde sayde wilt thou man romayne came ye vpper captayne sayde vnto tell art thou romayne sayde yee vpper captayne answered greate summe optayned fredome paul sayde romayne borne thē straight waye departed shulde haue examyned ye chefe captayne afrayed whan knewe romayne bounde nexte daye wolde knowe certentye wherfore accused iewes lowsed bondes commaunded hye prestes councell come together broughte paul forth set amonge xxiii chapter paul behelde councell sayde ye men brother act 24 haue lyued good conscience god vnto daye iere 20 • ioh 18 hye prest ananias commaunded stode aboute smyte hī mouth sayde paul vnto god shal smyte thou paynted wall deut 17 syttest thou iudgest lawe commaundest smytten cō trary ye lawe stode aboute hī sayde reuylest thou god hye prest paul sayde brethrē wyst hye prest wryttē exo 22 ruler thy people shalt thou curse whan paul knewe one parte saduces parte pharises cried ye councell ye men brother pharise sonne pharise phil • act 4 26 28 hope resurreccion deed iudged whan sayde arose dissencion betwene ye pharises saduces multitude deuyded mat • 2 • marc 12 luc 20 • saduces saye resurreccion nether angell ner sprete pharises graūte made greate crye ye scrybes pharyses secte stode vp stroue sayde fynde euell mā yf sprete angell haue spokē vnto let v stryue agaynst god whan discension greate ye vpper captayne feared paul shulde haue bene pluckte sonder commaunded soudyers go downe take brynge castell nighte folowinge lorde stode sayde good cheare paul thou hast testified ierusalem ephe 3 2 tim 1 • must thou testifye rome also whan daye certayne iewes gathered selues together made vowe nether eate ner drynke tyll kylled paul mo fortye made conspyracion came hye prestes elder sayde haue bounde oure selues wt vowe wil eate nothinge tyll haue slayne paul therfore geue ye knowlege vpper captayne councell maye brynge forth vnto tomorow though ye wolde heare yet better v ready kyll euer come nye whan paul sister sonne herde layenge awayte came entred castell tolde paul paul called vnto one ye vnder captaynes sayde brynge yonge man vpper captayne hath somewhat saye toke broughte vpper captayne sayde paul presoner called vnto prayed brynge yonge man hath somwhat saye vnto hye captayne toke hande wente syde waye axed thou hast saye vnto sayde iewes agreed together desyre let paul broughte forth tomorow councell though wolde yet heare better folowe thou myndes laye wayte mo fortye men haue bounde selues vowe nether eate ner drynke tyll haue slayne paul euen redye loke thy promes vpper captayne let yonge man departe charged tell noman shewed called vnto two vndercaptaynes sayde make redye two hundreth soudyers maye go cesarea thre score ten horsmen two hundreth speare men thirde houre nighte delyuer thē beastes maye set paul theron brynge safe vnto felix debyte wrote letter maner claudius lysias vnto mightie debyte felix gretynge 〈◊〉 21 iewes taken man wolde haue slayne came soudyers rescued perceaued romayne whan wolde haue knowne cause wherfore accused hī broughte councell perceaued accused aboute question lawe accusacion worthy death bondes whan shewed certayne iewes layed wayte sent straight waye vnto commaunded accuser also loke agaynst shulde tell fare well soudyers commaunded toke paul broughte antipatras nexte daye lefte ye horse men go turned agayne castell came cesarea delyuered letter vnto debyte presented paul also whan debyte red letter axed countre whā vnderstode celicia sayde deut 〈…〉 wil heare whan thine accuser come also commaunded kepte herodes iudgment house xxiiii chapter fyue dayes hye prest ananias came downe elder wt oratour tertullus appeared debyte agaynst paul whan paul called forth tertullus begāne accuse sayde seynge lyue greate peace meanes yt many good thinges done people thorow thy prouydence mightie felix alowe euer place thankes notwithstondinge yt nomore tedious vnto praye thy curtesy thou woldest heare v wordes haue founde man pestilent felowe sterer vp sedicion amonge iewes thorow worlde manteyner secte nazaretes act 〈…〉 hath taken hande also suspende temple toke wolde haue iudged acordinge oure lawe lysias hye captayne came vpō v greate violence delyuered oure handes commaunded accuser come vnto yf thou wilt enquyre thou mayest haue knowlege thinges wherof accuse iewes likewyse affirmed sayde euen paul whan debyte beckened vnto shulde speake answered seynge knowe thou hast bene iudge many yeares amonge people wil afrayed answere selfe thou mayest knowe yet nomore twolue dayes sence came vp ierusalem worshippe nether founde temple disputinge eny man makynge eny vproure amonge people ner ye synagoges ner cite nether proue thinges wherof accuse 〈…〉 confesse vnto waye call heresye worshippe god father beleue wrytten lawe prophetes haue hope towarded god resurreccion deed selues loke also shalbe iust vniust therfore studye haue allwaye cleare conscience towarde god towarde men 〈…〉 many yeares came broughte allmesse vnto people offeringes 〈…〉 whervpon founde purifyed temple without eny maner rumoure vnquyetnesse howbeit certayne iewes asia shulde presente accuse yf oughte agaynst el let • saye yf haue founde eny vnrighteousnes whyle stonde ye councell excepte one worde cried stondinge amonge 〈…〉 resurreccion deed iudged daye whan felix herde dyfferred thē knewe well waye sayde whan lysias vpper captayne commeth downe wyl knowe ye vttemost youre matter 〈…〉 commaunded vndercaptayne kepe paul let haue rest shulde forbydde none acquauntaūce mynister vnto come vnto certayne dayes came felix wt wife drusilla iewesse called paul herde faith christ howbeit whan paul spake righteousnesse chastite iudgment come felix trembled answered go thy waye tyme whan haue conuenyent tyme wil sende hoped also money shulde haue bene geuen paul therfore called oft commened two yeares came portius festus felix rowme yet felix wyllinge shewe iewes pleasure left paul bounde xxv chapter whan festus come countre ouer thre dayes wente vp cesarea ierusalem appeared hye prestes chefe iewes agaynst paul intreated desyred fauoure agaynst wolde sende ierusalem layed wayte might slaye waye answered festus paul shulde kepte cesarea himselfe wolde shortly go thither agayne let therfore sayde able amonge come downe v accuse man yf ought whan taried amonge ten dayes wente downe cesarea nexte daye sat downe iudgment seate commaunded paul broughte whan come ye iewes come downe ierusalem stode rounde aboute broughte vp many greuous quarels agaynst paul coulde proue whyle answered himselfe haue nether offended ought agaynst lawe iewes ner agaynst tēple ner agaynst emperoure festus wyllinge shewe iewes pleasure answered paul sayde wilt thou go vp ierusalem iudged thinges paul sayde stonde emperours iudgmēt seate ought iudged iewes haue done harme thou also knowest well yf haue hurte eny man committed eny thinge worthy death refuse dye yf soch thinges accuse maye man delyuer vnto appeale vnto emperoure spake festus councell answered thou hast appealed vnto emperoure emperoure shalt thou go certayne dayes came kynge agrippa bernice cesarea welcome festus whan taried many dayes festus rehearsed paul cause vnto kynge sayde man left bounde felix whose cause hye prestes elder iewes appeared whan ierusalem desyred sentence agaynst vnto answered deut 17 • maner romaynes delyuer eny man shulde perishe accused haue accuser presente receaue libertye answere selfe accusacion whā come hither together made delaye sat nexte daye iudgment commaunded man broughte forth whan accuser stode vp broughte accusacion soch thinges supposed certayne question agaynst awne supersticions one iesus deed paul affirmed alyue howbeit vnderstode question axed hī whether wolde go ierusalē iudged matter whā paul appealed might kepte vnto knowlege emperoure cōmaunded kepte tyll mighte sende emperoure agrippa sayde vnto festus wolde fayne heare man also sayde tomorow shalt thou heare nexte daye came agrippa bernice greate pompe wēte comon hall captaynes chefe mē cite festus cōmaundement paul brought forth festus sayde kynge agrippa ye men v ye se man aboute multitude iewes haue entreated ierusalē also cried ought lyue eny lenger whan perceaued done nothinge worthy death himselfe also appealed vnto emperoure determyned sende whō haue certayne thinge • •• ryte vnto lorde therfore haue caused hī broughte forth specially kynge agrippa examinacion might haue somwhat wryte thynke vnreasonable thinge sende presoner shewe cause layed agaynst xxvi chapter agrippa sayde vnto paul thou hast leue speake thy selfe thē paul stretched forth hande answered himselfe thinke selfe happye kynge agrippa shal answere daye thinges wherof accused iewes specially forsomoch thou art experte customes question amonge iewes wherfore beseche heare paciently lyuynge truly youth vp led begynnynge amonge people ierusalē knowe iewes knewe afore first yf wolde testifye strayte secte oure iewysh lawe lyued pharise act 〈…〉 phil 〈…〉 stonde iudged hope 〈…〉 〈…〉 deut▪ 〈…〉 psal 〈…〉 promes made god vnto oure father vnto promes oure twolue trybes hope come seruynge god instātly daye nighte hope sake kynge agrippa accused iewes wherfore iudged amonge beleued god rayseth vp deed also verely thoughte selfe oughte many cōtrary thinges cleane agaynst name iesus nazareth act 〈…〉 〈…〉 dyd ierusalem whan shut vp many sayntes preson whervpon receaued auctorite ye hye prestes whā shulde put death broughte sentence thorow synagoges punyshed oft compelled thē blaspheme exceadinge mad vpon persecuted euen vnto straunge city aboute thinges wente towarde damascon auctorite lycence hye prestes euen myddaye kynge sawe waye lighte heauē clearer brightnesse sonne shyned rounde aboute iourneyed whan fallen downe earth herde voyce speakynge vnto sayēge hebrue saul saul persecutest thou shalbe harde kycke agaynst prycke sayde lorde art thou sayde iesus thou persecutest ryse vp stonde vpon thy fete therfore haue appeared vnto mighte ordeyne mynister witnesse thou hast sene wyll yet cause appeare vnto wil delyuer people heythen amonge whō wil sende opē eye maye turne darknesse vnto esa▪ 〈…〉 lighte power ye deuell vnto god maye receaue forgeuenesse synnes enheritaunce sanctified faith wherfore kynge agrippa faithlesse vnto ye heauēly vision shewed first vnto damascon ierusalē coastes iewry heythen shulde 〈…〉 pennaunce turne vnto god righte workes pennaunce cause iewes toke temple wente aboute kyll thorow helpe god lent vnto stonde vnto daye testifye vnto small greate saye thinge thē ye prophetes haue sayde shulde come passe moses christ shulde suffre first resurreccion deed shew light vnto people heythen whan thus answered himselfe festus sayde loude voyce paul thou art besydes thy selfe moch lernynge maketh ye madd paul sayde madd deare festus speake wordes trueth sobernesse ye kynge knoweth well vnto speake frely thinke none thinges hyd done corner beleuest thou prophetes kynge agrippa knowe thou beleuest agrippa sayde vnto paul thou persuadest parte become christen paul sayde wolde god onely parte alltogether mighte persuade onely heare daye soch bondes excepte whan spoken kynge rose vp debyte bernice sat wente asyde talked together sayde man hath done nothinge worthy death bondes agrippa sayde vnto festus man mighte haue bene lowsed yf appealed vnto emperoure xxvii chapter whan concluded shulde sayle italy delyuered paul certayne presoners vndercaptayne named iulius emperours soudyers whan entred shippe adramitium sayle asia lowsed londe v one 〈…〉 aristarchus macedonia thessalonica nexte daye came vnto sidon iulius intreated paul curteously gaue liberty go frendes refresh himselfe thence launched sayled harde cypers wyndes agaynst v sayled ouer see celicia pamphilia came myra lycia vndercaptayne founde shippe alexādria ready sayle italy put v therin whan sayled slowly many dayes scarcely come ouer agaynst gnydon wynde stode v sayled candy nye vnto cite salmo came scarcely beyonde came place called goodhauen nye vnto cite lasea whan moch tyme spent saylinge ioperdous also fasted ouerlonge paul exhorted sayde vnto syrs se saylinge wyl hurte moch dammage onely ladynge shippe also oure lyues neuertheles ye vndercaptayne beleued gouernoure shippe ye master spoken paul somoch hauē comodious wynter parte toke councell departe thēce yf eny meanes might come phenices wynter hauen candy towarde southwest northwest wynde whan south wynde blewe supposinge haue purpose lowsed vnto asson sayled past candy longe rose agaynst purpose flawe wynde called northeast whan shippe caught coulde resist ye wynde let go draue wedder came ile named claudia coulde scarce get bote toke vp vsed helpe bounde vnder harde shippe fearinge lest shulde haue fallen syrtes perlous place ī see syrtes let downe vessell caried whan bydden greate tēpest nexte daye made outcastinge thirde daye oure awne handes cast tacklynge shippe whā nether sonne ner starres appeared many dayes small tempest laye vpon v hope oure life taken awaye longe abstinence paul stode forth myddes thē sayde syrs ye shulde haue herkened vnto haue lowsed candy haue broughte v harme losse exhorte good cheare shal none oure lyues perishe shippe onely night stode angell god whose whō serue saide feare paul thou must broughte emperoure lo god hath geuen vnto thē sayle wherfore syrs good cheare beleue god yt shal come passe tolde howbeit must cast certayne ylonde whan fourtenth night came caried adria aboute mydnight ye shipmen demed appeared countre vnto cast leade founde twētye feddoms whā gone litle farther cast leade agayne founde fyftene feddoms fearinge lest shulde fall rocke cast foure anckers sterne wyszhed daye whan shipmen aboute flye shippe let downe bote see vnder coloure though wolde cast ankers fore shippe paul sayde ye vnder captayne soudyers excepte byde shippe ye saued soudyers cut rope bote let fall whan beganne daye paul exhorted take meate sayde daye fourtene daye ye haue taried contynued fastinge haue receaued nothinge wherfore praye take meate youre health mat 10 luc 12 shal one heer fall heade eny whan thus spoken toke bred mar 6 c 8 ioh 6 • tim 4 gaue thankes god brake begāne eate good cheare toke meate also together shippe two hundreth thre score sixtene soules whan eaten ynough lightened shippe cast wheate see whan daye knewe londe spyed hauen banke mynded yf possible thrust shippe whan takē vp anckers commytted selues see lowsed rudder bandes hoyssed vp mayne sayle wynde drue towarde londe whan chaunced place see sydes shippe daszhed vpon fore parte abode fast vnmoued hynder parte brake thorow violence wawes soudyers councell kyll ye presoners lest eny whan swymmed shulde flye awaye vndercaptayne wyllinge saue paul keped purpose commaunded coulde swymme shulde cast selues first see escape vnto londe bordes broken pe • e shippe came passe soules came safe vnto londe xxviii chapter whā escaped knewe ile called melite people shewed v litle kyndnesse kyndled fyre receaued v rayne come vpō v colde whan paul gathered bondell stickes layed fyre came vyper heate leape paul hande whan people sawe beest hange hande sayde amonge selues man must nedes murthurer whō vengeaunce suffreth lyue though haue escaped see shoke ye beest fyre luc▪ 〈…〉 felt harme howbeit wayted whā shulde haue swollen fallen downe deed sodenly whan loked greate whyle sawe yt happened harme vnto chaunged myndes sayde god quarter chefe man ile whose name publius lordshipe receaued v lodged v thre dayes curteously fortuned whā publius father laye sicke feuers bloudy fluxe paul wente vnto prayed layed handes healed whan done also disease ile came healed dyd v greate honoure whan departed laded v thinges necessary monethes sayled shippe alexandria wyntred ile badge castor pollux whan came syracusa taried thre dayes whan sayled aboute came rhegium one daye whan south wynde blewe came putiolus founde brethrē desyred tarye seuē dayes came rome thence whan brother herde v came forth mete v apiforum thre tauerns whan paul sawe thāked god waxed bolde whā came rome vndercaptayne delyuered presoners ye chefe captayne paul leue byde alone one soudyer kepte thre dayes fortuned yt paul called ye chefe ye iewes together whā come sayde vnto thē ye mē brethrē 〈…〉 ▪ b 〈…〉 ▪ b haue cōmytted nothinge agaynst people ner agaynst ye lawes ye father yet boūde delyuered ierusalē ye romaynes hādes whā examyned wolde haue let go moch cause death ī whā ye iewes spake ye cōtrary cōstrayned appeale vnto ye empero though ought accuse people cause haue called euē se speake wt yt 〈…〉 ye hope israel bounde wt cheyne sayde vnto hī haue nether receaued letter iewry cōcernynge nether came eny brethrē yt shewed spake eny harme ye wyl heare ye thou thinkest haue herde secte euery 〈…〉 spoken agaynst whā appoynted hī adaye came many vnto hī lodginge vnto whō expoūded ye kyngdome god preached vnto thē iesu ye lawe prophetes euē frō mornynge vntyll euē beleued ye thinge yt sayde beleued whā agreed amōge thē selues departed whā paul spokē one worde full well hath holy goost spokē ye prophet esay vnto father 〈…〉 sayde go vnto people saye eares ye shal heare vnderstōde eye shal ye se perceaue ye hert people waxed grosse heare hardly wt eares eye haue closed yt shulde se wt eye heare wt eares vnderstōde ī hertes cōuerted yt mighte heale thē knowne therfore vnto yt saluaciō god sent vnto ye heythē shal heare whā sayde yt ye iewes departed greate disputacion amonge thēselues paul abode two whole yeares owne hyred dwellinge receaued thē yt came vnto hī preachinge ye kyngdome god teachinge thinges concerne lorde iesus boldnesse vnforbydden ende actes apostle wrytten luke present ye doynges epistle apostle paul romaynes summe epistle chap paul declareth loue towarde romaynes sheweth gospell frute therof rebuketh beestlynesse flesh chap ii rebuketh iewes touchinge synne like heythē yee worse chap iii sheweth preferment iewes haue iewes gē tile vnder synne iustified grace god christ chap iiii declareth exāple abrahā faith iustifieth lawe ner workes therof chap v power faith hope loue▪ death raigned frō adā vnto christ▪ whō haue forgeuenesse synnes chap vi moch delyuered thorow christ synne must fashion oure selues lyue seruauntes god oure awne lustes vnlike rewarde righteousnes synne chap vii christ hath delyuered v lawe death paul sheweth flesh outwarde man calleth lawe membres chap viii lawe sprete geueth life sprete god maketh v god child heyres christ abundaunt loue god separated chap ix paul complayneth vpon hard hertes iewes wolde receaue christ heythē chosen steade chap x vnfaithfulnes iewes two maner righteousness chap xi iewes cast awaye therfore paul warneth gentile called hye mynded ner despyse iewes iudgmētes god depe secrete chap xii swete conuersacion loue workes soch beleue christ chap xiii obedience men vnto ruler loue fulfilleth lawe tyme folowe workes darknesse chap xiiii weake ought despysed man shulde offende anothers conscience agayne outward thinges shulde man condemne another chap xv infirmite fraylnesse weake ought borne loue kyndnesse ensample christ chap xvi chapter salutacions warneth bewarre men doctryne commendeth vnto certayne godly men louers brother trueth epistle apostle paul romaynes first chapter pavl seruaunte iesus christ called apostle act 13 put aparte preach gospell god deut 18 c act 26 promysed afore prophetes ye holy scripture sonne begottē mat 1 • tim 2 ye sede dauid flesh mightely declared sonne god sprete sanctifieth sence tyme rose agayne deed namely iesus christ oure lorde haue act 9 c receaued grace apostelshippe amonge heythen set vp obedience faith vnder name ye parte also called iesus christ rome beloued god sayntes callynge 1 cor 1 gal 1 grace wt peace frō god oure father lorde iesus christ first thanke god thorow iesus christ youre faith spoken thorow worlde god witnesse ioh 4 c 2 tim 1 serue sprete gospell sonne without ceassynge make mencion phil 1 col 1 besekinge allwayes prayer mighte haue prosperous iourney iere 10 god come vnto longe se mighte bestowe vpon spirituall gifte strēgth mighte conforted thorow yo faith myne haue together wolde ye shulde knowe brother haue often tymes purposed come vnto haue bene act 16 let hither mighte good amonge like amonge gentyles detter grekes vngrekes wyse vnwyse wherfore moch ī ready preach gospell vnto rome also ashamed gospell christ 〈…〉 power god saueth beleue theron iewe first also greke ye righteousnes value god opened cō meth faith ī faith wryttē iust shal lyue faith 〈…〉 ye wrath god declared heauen vpon vngodlynes vnrighteousnes mē witholde trueth god vnrighteousnes maye knowne god manifest thē god hath shewed vnto thē inuisible thinges god euerlastinge power godheade mighte sene 〈…〉 whyle considered workes creacion worlde without excuse moch knewe god haue praysed god ner thanked became vayne ymaginacions 〈…〉 foolish hert blynded whan counted selues wyse became fooles 〈…〉 turned ye glory incorruptible god ye symilitude ye ymage corruptible mā byrdes foure foted 〈…〉 crepinge beestes 〈…〉 wherfore god likewyse gaue vp vnto hertes lustes vnclennes defyle awne body selues turned trueth god vnto lye worshipped serued creature maker blessed euer amen therfore god gaue thē vp vnto shamefull lustes 〈…〉 wemen chaunged naturall vse vnnaturall likewyse ye mē also lefte naturall vse woman brent lustes one another man man wrought fylthines receaued selues rewarde erroure acordinge 〈…〉 regarded knowe god euen 〈…〉 god gaue thē vp lewde mynde thinges comly beynge full vnrighteousnes whordome wickednes couetousnes maliciousnes full enuye murthur strife disceate euell cōdicioned whisperer backbyters despysers god doer wronge proude booster bryngers vp euell thinges disobedient elder without vnderstondinge couenaunt breaker vnlouynge stubborne vnmercifull men though knowe righteousnes god soch worthy death yet onely also haue pleasure thē ii chapter therfore canst thou excuse thy selfe mā soeuer thou iudgest 〈…〉 loke wherin thou iudgest another thou condemnest thy selfe moch thou iudgest doest euen sure iudgment god acordinge trueth ouer soch thinkest thou thou man iudgest soch thinges doest euen thy selfe thou shalt escape yt iudgmēt god despysest thou rich goodnesse pacience lōge sufferinge 〈…〉 knowest thou ye louynge kyndnesse god leadeth repentaunce thou thine harde impenitent hert heapest vnto thy selfe treasure wrath agaynst daye wrath openynge righteous iudgment god 〈…〉 shal rewarde euery man acordinge dedes namely prayse honoure vncorrupcion vnto pacience doinge good seke euerlastinge life vnto contencious 〈…〉 obedient vnto trueth obeye vnrighteousnes shal come indignacion wrath trouble anguysh vpō soules mē euell iewe first also greke vnto thē good shal come prayse honoure peace vnto iewe first also greke 〈…〉 respecte personnes god euer haue synned without lawe shal perish also without lawe whosoeuer haue synned lawe shalbe iudged lawe 〈…〉 god righteous heare ye lawe lawe shalbe iustified yf gentyles haue lawe nature thinges conteyned lawe hauynge lawe lawe vnto selues shewe worke ye lawe wryttē hertes whyle conscience beareth witnesse vnto thē also thoughtes accuse excuse amonge selues daye whan god shal iudge secretes men iesus christ acordinge gospell take hede 〈…〉 thou art called iewe trustest lawe makest thy boost god knowest moch thou art enfourmed ye lawe thou prouest best presumest leader blynde lighte yt darcknes enformer ye vnwyse teacher ye symple hast ensample knowlege trueth lawe teachest thou teachest thy selfe thou preachest man shulde steale thou stealest thou sayest man shulde breake wedlocke thou breakest wedlocke thou abhorrest ymages robbest god honoure thou makest thy boost lawe thorow breakynge lawe thou dishonorest god thorow name god euell spoken amonge gentyles wrytten circūcision verely avayleth esa 52 eze 36 yf thou kepe lawe yf thou breake lawe thy circumcision become vncircumcision therfore yf vncircumcision kepe righte thinges conteyned lawe shal vncircumcision counted circumcision nature vncircumcision fulfilleth lawe shal iudge vnder letter circumcision trāsgressest lawe iew iewe outwa • de nether circūcision done outwardly ye flesh iewe ioh 8 rom 9 hydd within col • b circumcision ye hert circumcision done sprete letter whose prayse men god iii chapter furtheraunce haue iewes avauntageth circūcision surely moch first rom 9 vnto commytted god spake dyd beleue theron shulde vnbeleue make promes god none effecte god forbyd let rather thus god true psal 115 psal 50 mē lyers ioh 3 c wrytten thou mayest iustified thy sayenges shuldest ouercome whā thou art iudged yf oure vnrighteousnes prayseth ye righteousnes god shal saye god vnrighteous angrie therfore speake thus maner men god forbyd mighte god thē iudge ye worlde yf trueth god thorow lye excellent vnto prayse shulde thē iudged yet synner rather thus euell spoken reporte shulde saye let v euell yt good maye come therof whose dānaciō inste saye better wyse haue proued afore yt iewes grekes vnder synne psal 13 • nd 52 wryttē none righteous one none yt vnderstondeth none seketh god gone waye alltogether become vnprofitable none doeth good one psal 5 b throte open sepulcre tunges haue disceaued psal 139 poyson aspes vnder lippes mouth full cursynge bytternesse pro 1 • sa 59 fete swifte shed bloude destruccion wrechidnes wayes ye waye peace haue knowne psal 35 feare god eye knowe yt soeuer lawe sayeth sayeth vnto vnder lawe yt euery mouthe maye stopped yt worlde maye detter vnto god gal 2 c yt ye dedes lawe flesh maye iustified sighte heb 7 c lawe commeth knowlege synne without addinge ye lawe righteousnes avayleth god declared hauynge witnesse ye lawe prophetes speake ye righteousnes god cōmeth faith iesus christ vnto vpō beleue difference synners wāte prayse god shulde haue thē without deseruynge made righteous euē grace thorow redempcion done christ iesu god hath set forth exo 25 c heb 5 mercyseate thorow faith bloude shewe righteousnes avayleth forgeueth synnes done vnder sufferaunce god suffred tyme mighte shewe ye righteousnes avayleth yt onely mighte righteous righteous maker faith iesus thy reioysinge excluded lawe lawe workes nay lawe faith holde therfore man iustified • eade • aith onely faith without workes lawe god god iewes onely also god heythen yes verely god heythen also moch god onely iustifieth circumcision faith vncircūcision thorow faith destroys lawe thorow faith god forbyd mantayne lawe fourth chapter shal saye thē abrahā father pertayninge ye flesh dyd fynde saye yf abraham made righteous thorow workes hath wherin reioyse god sayeth ye scripture gen 〈…〉 gal • iacob▪ 〈…〉 abrahā beleued god yt counted vnto righteousnes vnto hī yt goeth aboute wt workes rewarde rekened fauoure dutye howbeit vnto yt goeth aboute workes beleueth yt iustifieth vngodly faith counted righteousnes euen dauid sayeth also blessednes onely man vnto whō god counteth righteousnes without addinge workes sayeth blessed whose vnrighteousnesses forgeuen psal 〈…〉 whose synnes couered blessed man vnto lorde imputeth synne blessednes goeth ouer circūcision ouer vncircumcision must nedes graunte yt abrahās faith coūted vnto hī righteousnes thē rekened vnto circūcision vncircumcision doutles gen 〈…〉 circūcision vncircumcision tokē circūcision gen 〈…〉 receaued seale righteousnes faith yet ye vncircūcision yt shulde father thē yt beleue beinge ye vncircūcisiō yt might coūted vnto thē also righteousnes might father circumcision onely thē ye circumcision also walke fotesteppes faith vncircumcision oure father abraham promes shulde ye heyre worlde made vnto abraham sede thorow lawe thorow righteousnes faith gal 〈…〉 yf lawe heyres thē faith vayne promes none effecte moch lawe causeth wrath lawe also transgression therfore promes made thorow fayth myght come fauoure wherby promesse myghte made sure vnto sede onely vnto lawe also vnto faith abrahā 〈◊〉 5 • 〈◊〉 ▪ 13 b 〈◊〉 19 〈◊〉 • c • al • ge 17 father v wrytten 〈◊〉 5 • 〈◊〉 ▪ 13 b 〈◊〉 19 〈◊〉 • c • al • ge 17 haue made father many heythē god thou hast beleued quyckeneth deed calleth maye beleued vpō hope nothinge hope shulde father many heythen acordinge sayde vnto 〈◊〉 1 • euen shal thy sede faynte faith nether cōsidred awne body deed allready whyle almost hundreth yeare olde nether deed wombe sara douted promes god thorow vnbeleue strōge faith gaue god prayse sure loke god promyseth able make good therfore rekened vnto righteousnes 〈◊〉 15 wryttē onely sake yt counted vnto also oure sake vnto whō shalbe counted yf beleue raysed vp oure lorde iesus deed 〈◊〉 2 geuen oure synnes raysed vp oure righteousnesse sake v chapter therfore iustified faith haue peace god thorow oure lorde iesus christ whō also haue intraunce faith vnto grace wherin stonde 〈◊〉 3 reioyse hope ye glorye come god shal geue onely yt reioyse also ī trouble moch knowe yt 〈◊〉 1 trouble bryngeth paciēce paciēce bryngeth experiēce experiēce bryngeth hope hope letteth v come cōfusion loue god shed abrode oure hertes holy goost geuen vnto v whan yet weake acordinge tyme christ dyed v vngodly dyeth scace eny man righteous sake 〈◊〉 3 〈◊〉 1 b 〈◊〉 3 b peraduenture good man durst one dye 〈◊〉 3 c 〈◊〉 3 c 〈◊〉 4 b 〈◊〉 9 cd therfore doth god set forth loue towarde v yt christ dyed v whan yet synners moch shal saued wrath seynge made righteous thorow bloude yf recōcyled vnto god ye death sōne whā yet enemy moch shal saued yt reconcyled onely reioyse also god thorow oure lorde iesus christ haue receaued attonement wherfore gen 3 one man synned entred worlde death ye meanes synne euen wente death also ouer men moch haue synned synne ye worlde vnto lawe lawe synne regarded neuertheles death reigned adam vnto moses euen ouer also synned like transgression dyd adam ye ymage yt come gifte synne yf thorow synne one many deed yet moch plenteously came grace gifte god vpon many ioh 1 b fauoure belonged vnto one man iesus christ gifte onely ouer one synne death came thorow one synne one synned iudgment came one synne vnto condempnacion gifte iustifye fro many synnes yf ye synne one death raigned meanes one moch shal receaue abūdaunce grace gifte vnto righteousnes raigne life ye meanes one iesus christ likewyse thē synne one condemnacion came men euen also righteousnes one came iustififienge life vpon men disobedience one many became synners euen obedience one shal many made righteous lawe meane tyme entred gal 3 • synne shulde increace luc 7 • neuertheles abundaunce synne yet plenteousnes grace like synne reigned vnto death euē mighte grace reigne also thorow righteousnes euerlastinge life meanes iesus christ vi chapter shal saye shal contynue synne maye abundaunce grace god forbyd shal lyue synne yt deed gal 3 col 2 b 1 pet 3 • knowe ye baptysed iesu christ baptysed death therfore buried wt baptyme death like christ raysed vp deed glory father ephe 4 col 3 heb 9 c euen also shulde walke new life yf grafted wt vnto like death shal like resurreccion also moch knowe oure olde man crucified synfull body mighte ceasse hence forth shulde serue synne nomore pet 4 deed made righteous frō synne yf deed christ beleue shal lyue also tim 2 b sure apoc 1 christ raysed deed dyeth nomore death shal haue nomore power ouer touchinge dyed dyed cōcernynge synne touchinge lyueth lyueth vnto god likewyse ye also counte youre selues euen deed concernynge synne lyue vnto god thorow iesus christ oure lorde let synne reigne therfore youre mortall bodye ye shulde obeye vnto lustes nether geue ye ouer youre membres vnto synne wapens vnrighteousnes geue ouer youre selues vnto god deed become lyuynge youre membres vnto god wapēs righteousnes synne shal haue power ouer moch ye vnder lawe vnder grace shal synne vnder ye lawe vnder grace god forbyd • oh 8 c pet 2 knowe ye loke vnto whō ye geue ouer youre selues seruauntes obeye seruauntes ye ye obey whether synne vnto death obediēce vnto righteousnes god thanked though ye haue bene seruauntes synne ye yet obedient herte ensample doctryne whervnto ye commytted ye made fre synne ye become seruauntes righteousnes wil speake grosly weaknes youre flesh like ye haue geuen ouer youre membres seruyce vnclennesse one wickednesse another euē also geue ouer youre membres seruyce righteousnesse maye holy whan ye seruauntes synne ye lowse righteousnes frute ye tyme thinges wherof ye ashamed ende soch thinges death ye fre synne become seruauntes god ye haue youre frute ye shulde holy ende euerlastinge life gen 2 c • om 5 b death rewarde synne gifte god euerlastinge life vii chapter knowe ye brother speake vnto knowe lawe ye lawe hath power vpon man longe lyueth1 cor 〈…〉 woman yt subieccion man bounde vnto lawe whyle man lyueth yf man dye lowsed lawe concerneth man nat 〈…〉 yf another man whyle manlyneth shal called wedlocke breaker yf man deed fre lawe wedlocke breaker yf another man euen brother ye also deed vnto lawe body christ ye shulde another namely wt raysed vp deed shulde brynge forth frute vnto god whan flesh synfull lustes stered vp lawe mightie oure membres brynge forth frute vnto death lowsed lawe deed vnto helde v captyue shulde serue new conuersacion sprete olde conuersacion letter shal saye lawe synne god forbyd neuertheles knewe synne ye lawe knowne nothinge lust yf lawe sayde exo 〈…〉 deut 〈…〉 thou shalt lust toke synne occasion commaundement stered vp maner lust without lawe synne deed lyued tyme without lawe howbeit whan commaundement came synne renyued deed commaundement geuen vnto life founde vnto occasion death synne toke occasion cō maundement disceaued slewe commaundement esa 〈…〉 lawe dede holy commaundement holy iust good good become death vnto god forbyd synne mighte appeare yt synne hath wroughte death thorow good synne mighte measure synfull commaundement knowe lawe spirituall carnall 〈…〉 solde vnder synne knowe yt hate yt yf wil thē graunte lawe good synne dwelleth knowe yt 〈…〉 flesh dwelleth good thinge wyll present wt perfourme yt good fynde ye good wyll euell wil yf wil synne dwelleth thus fynde lawe yt whan wyl good euell present delite lawe god inwarde man se another lawe membres stryueth agaynst ye lawe mynde taketh presoner ye lawe synne membres wretched man shal delyuer body death thanke god thorow iesus christ oure lorde wt mynde serue ye lawe god flesh lawe synne viii chapter damnacion vnto thē christ iesu walke flesh ye sprete ye lawe ye sprete yt bryngeth life ī christ iesu hath made 〈…〉 fre frō lawe synne death 〈…〉 vnpossible vnto ye lawe moch weake flesh yt perfourmed god sent sonne ye similitude synfull flesh cor 3 c synne dāned synne ye flesh righteousnes requyred lawe mighte fulfylled v walke flesh sprete fleshly fleshly mynded goostly goostly mynded fleshly mynded death goostly mynded life peace fleshly mynded enemyte agaynst god 〈…〉 syth subdued vnto ye lawe god also thē fleshlye please god howbeit ye fleshly goostly yf sprete god dwell hath sprete christ neuertheles yf christ body deed synne sprete life righteousnes sake wherfore yf sprete raysed vp iesus deed dwell shal euen also raysed vp christ deed quyckē youre mortal body yt sprete dwelleth therfore brethrē detters flesh lyue flesh yf ye lyue ye fleshe ye must dye yf ye mortyfye dedes body thorow sprete ye shal lyue euer led sprete god 〈◊〉 4 • tim 1 god childrē ye haue receaued sprete bondage feare eny ye haue receaued ye sprete adopcion wherby crye abba deare father 2 cor 1 5 eph 1 b sprete certifieth oure sprete childrē god yf childrē heyres also namely heyres god heyres annexed christ yf suffer together maye also glorified together suppose affliccions tyme worthy ye glorye2 cor 4 shalbe shewed vpon vs2 co • feruent lō ginge ye creature loketh appearinge child god creature subdued vnto vanyte agaynst hir wyll hath subdued vpon hope creature also shal fre bondage corrupcion vnto glorious libertye childrē god knowe euery creature groneth ioh 16 trauayleth v payne vnto tyme oure selues also haue first frutes sprete grone within oure selues childshippe loke ye delyueraunce oure bodye • ued ī dede howbeit ī hope ye hope sene hope man hope seyeth yf hope se thē thorow pacience abyde likewyse sprete also helpeth oure weaknesse knowe shulde desyre oughte esa 26▪ neuertheles ye sprete selfe maketh intercession mightely v vnoutspeakable gronynges howbeit yt searcheth hert knoweth mynde sprete maketh intercession sayntes acordinge pleasure god sure thinges serue best vnto loue god called purpose knewe hath ordeyned also yt shulde like fashioned vnto ye shappe sonne yt mighte first begottē amōge many brethrē hath ordeyned hath called also hath called thē hath also made righteous hath made righteous hath glorified also shal saye vnto thinges yff god oure syde nu 14 • esa 50 b agaynst v ge 22 esa 53 c maketh intercession v separate v loue god trouble anguysh persecuciō honger nakednesse parell swerde • al 43 c wrytten thy sake kylled daye longe counted shepe appoynted slayne neuerthelesse thinges one another eny iudge rather yt nomā put stomblinge blocke occasion fall brother waye1 cor 8 • knowe full certified ye lorde iesu yt nothinge cōmen selfe vnto yt iudgeth cōmen cōmen yf ye brother prepared loue god hath opened vnto v sprete 〈…〉 sprete searcheth thinges yee euen depenesses god heade mā knoweth man saue sprete mā euen man knoweth god saue ye sprete god v haue receaued sprete worlde sprete cōmeth god cā knowe geuē v god also speake connynge wordes mās wyszdome cōnynge wordes holy goost iudge spirituall matter spiritually howbeit naturall man perceaueth nothinge ye sprete god foolishnes vnto perceaue must spiritually discerned 〈…〉 spirituall discusseth thinges iudged noman 〈…〉 hath knowne ye mynde lorde shal enfourme haue mynde christ iii chapter brother coulde speake vnto vnto spirituall vnto carnall euen vnto babe christ 〈…〉 gaue mylke drynke meate ye mighte awaye withall nether maye ye yet euen moch ye yet fleshlye 〈…〉 seynge enuyenge stryfe discencion amonge you▪ ye fleshly walke ye maner men whan one sayeth holde paul another 〈…〉 holde apollo ye thē fleshlye paul is▪ apollo euē mynisters ye come beleue acordinge lorde hath geuen vnto euery man haue planted apollo hath watred ioh 6 g act 2 c god hath geuen increace nether planteth eny thinge nether watreth god geueth increace planteth watreth ye one yet shal euery one receaue rewarde acordinge laboure god labourer ye god huszbandry ye god buyldinge acordinge grace god geuen vnto wyse buylder haue layed foundacion another buyldeth theron yet let euery man take hede buyldeth theron mat 16 c foūdacion noman laye layed iesus christ yf enyman buylde vpon foundacion golde syluer precious stone tymber haye stobble euery mās worke shal shewed esa 28 c daye lorde shal declare shal shewed fyre 1 pet 1 b 4 b fyre shal trye euery mās worke yf eny man worke hath buylde theron abyde shal receaue rewarde yf eny man worke burne shal suffre losse shal saued himselfe neuertheles thorow fyre 1 cor 6 • 2 cor 6 • heb 3 knowe ye ye temple god sprete god dwelleth yf eny man defyle tēple god shal god destroye temple god holy ye let mā disceaue himselfe yf eny man thinke himselfe wyse concernynge thinges wherof ye wrote vnto answere good man touche woman neuertheles avoyde whordome let euery man haue awne wife let euery woman haue hir awne huszbande let mā geue vnto wife due operacions 〈…〉 yet one god worketh giftes sprete geuen vnto euery man profit cōgregacion one geuen thorow sprete vtteraunce wiszdome another geuen vtteraunce knowlege acordinge sprete another faith distributeth vnto euery man acordinge body one hath yet many membres 〈…〉 neuertheles membres body though many yet one body euen christ also baptysed one sprete one body whether iewes gentyles whether bonde fre haue esa 55 ioh 7 dronkē one sprete body also one membre many yf fote saye ye hande therfore membre body therfore membre ye body yf eare saye eye therfore membre body therfore membre body yf body eye hearinge yf hearinge smellinge hath god set membres euery one seuerally body hath pleased neuertheles yf mē bres one membre body membres many yet body one eye saye vnto hande haue nede agayne heade vnto fete haue nede rather greate deale mēbres body seme feble necessary vpon membres body thinke least honest put honestie oure vncomly partes haue beutye oure honest membres neade god hath measured ye body geuen honoure vnto mēbre nede shulde stryfe body membres shulde indifferently care one another yf one membre suffre membres suffre yf one membre honoure membres glad also ye body christ membres euery one another god hath ordeyned congregacion first mat 10 luc 9 ephe 4 apostle secōdly prophetes thirdly act 13 teacher doer miracle giftes healinge helper gouerners dyuerse tunges apostle prophetes teacher doer miracle haue giftes healinge speake tunges interprete covet ye best giftes yet shewe excellent waye xiii chapter though spake tunges men angel yet loue euen sowndinge brasse tynklinge cymball though coulde prophecy vnderstode secretes knowlege faith▪ coulde moue moūtaynes place yet loue nothinge though bestowed goodes fede ye poore though gaue body euen burned yet haue loue profiteth nothinge loue pacient curteous loue envyeth loue doth frowardly puft vp dealeth dishonestly phil 2 b seketh hir awne prouoked vnto anger thynketh euell reioyseth ouer iniquyt • reioyseth trueth beareth thinges beleueth thinges hopeth thinges suffreth thinges though prophecienges fayle tunges ceasse knowlege perishe yet loue falleth neuer awaye oure knowlege vnparfecte oure prophecienge vnparfecte whā perfecte commeth shal vnparfecte done awaye whan childe spake childe vnderstode childe ymagined childe soone man put awaye childishnes se thorow glasse darke speakynge thē shal se face face knowe vnperfectly thē shal knowe euē knowne abydeth faith hope loue thre greatest loue xiiii chapter laboure loue couet spirituall giftes specially ye maye prophecye yt speaketh tunges speaketh vnto men vnto god man heareth howbeit ye sprete speaketh misteries prophecieth speaketh vnto men edifienge exhortacion cōforte speaketh tunges edifieth himselfe prophecieth edifieth cōgregacion wolde ye spake tunges rather ye prophecied greater prophecieth speaketh wt tūges excepte also expounde congregacion maye haue edifienge brother yf come vnto speake tunges shal profet excepte speake vnto ether reuelacion knowlege prophecienge doctryne likewyse also ye thinges geue sounde yet lyue whether pype harpe excepte geue distyncte soundes shal knowne pyped harped yf trō pe geue vncertayne sounde wil prepare selfe battayll euen ye like wyse whan ye speake tunges excepte ye speake playne wordes shal knowne spokē ye shal speake ye ayre many kyndes voyces worlde none without significacion yf knowe ye voyce meaneth shalbe aleaunt vnto speaketh speaketh shalbe aleaūt vnto euē ye moch ye couet spirituall giftes seke yt ye maye haue plentye edifienge congregacion wherfore let speaketh wt tunges praye maye interprete also yf praye tunges sprete prayeth vnderstōdinge bryngeth man frute shal namely thus wil praye ye sprete wil praye vnderstōdinge also wil synge psalmes sprete wil synge spalmes yt vnderstondinge also whan thou geuest thankes ye sprete shal occupieth rowme vnlearned saye amē thy geuynge thankes seynge knoweth thou sayest thou geuest well thankes edifyed thanke god speake tunges ye yet leuer cōgregacion speake fyue wordes vnderstondinge yt maye enfourme also rather ten thousande wordes tunges 〈…〉 brother child vnderstondinge howbeit concerninge maliciousnes childrē vnderstondinge parfecte lawe wrytten 〈…〉 tunges lippes wyl speake vnto people yet shal heare sayeth lorde 〈…〉 therfore tunges token thē beleue beleue contrary wyse prophecienge beleue beleue yf whole cōgregacion came together one place spake tunges came vnlearned beleue shulde saye ye youre wyttes yff prophecied came one yt beleueth one vnlerned shulde rebuked iudged shulde secrete hert opened shulde fall downe vpon face worshippinge god knowleginge trueth god brother whan ye come together euery one hath psalme hath doctryne hath tunge hath reuelacion hath interpretacion let done edifyenge yf eny mā speake tunges let selfe beynge seconde selfe beynge ye thirde one another let one interprete yf interpreter let kepe sylence congregacion howbeit let speake himselfe god prophetes let two thre speake 〈◊〉 4 let iudge yf eny reuelacion made vnto another sytteth let first holde peace ye maye prophecye one another maye lerne vnto thē speake vnder obedience 〈…〉 ye lawe sayeth also yf wyll lerne eny thinge let axe huszbādes home becommeth wemē speake congregacion spronge worde god amonge come vnto onely yf eny man thynke himselfe prophet spirituall let knowe wryte vnto commaundementes lorde yf eny man ignoraunt let ignoraunt wherfore brother couet prophecye forbyd speake tunges let thinges done honestly order xv chapter declare vnto brother gospell haue preached vnto ye haue also accepted ye stōde also ye saued maner preached vnto yf ye haue kepte excepte ye haue beleued vayne first delyuered vnto also receaued christ dyed oure synnes acordinge scripture buried rose agayne ye thirde daye acordinge scripture sene cephas twolue sene mo fyue hundreth brother wherof yet many alyue fallen aslepe afterwarde sene iames apostle last sene also one borne due tyme 〈◊〉 3 b ye leest apostle worthy called apostle 〈…〉 persecuted congregacion god grace god grace hath bene vayne haue laboured howbeit faith also vayne yee founde false witness god haue testified agaynst god hath raysed vp christ hath raysed vp yf deed ryse agayne yf deed ryse agayne thē christ also rysen agayne yf christ rysen agayne youre faith vayne ye yet youre synnes also fallē slepe christ perished yf life onely hope christ men miserable christ rysen deed become col 1 b ye first frutes slepe one man commeth death one man resurreccion deed dye adam shal made alyue christ euery one order first christ belōge vnto christ whan commeth ende whā shal delyuer vp kyngdome vnto god father whan shal put downe rule superiorite power psal 109 • heb 2 b must raygne tyll haue put enemy vnder fete last enemye shal destroyed death hath put thinges vnder fete whā sayeth thinges put vnder manifest excepted put thinges vnder whan thinges shalbe subdued vnto shal sonne himselfe also subiecte vnto put thinges vnder god maye el baptised ouer ye deed yf deed ryse baptysed ouer deed stonde ioperdy euery houre oure reioysinge haue christ iesu lorde dye daylie haue foughte beestes ephesus ye maner men helpeth yf deed ryse agayne esa 22 b sap 2 let v eate drynke tomorow shal dye ye disceaued euell speakinges corruppe good maners awake righte vp synne haue ye knowlege god saye youre shame man mighte saye shal deed aryse maner body shal come thou foole ioh 12 c yt thou sowest quyckened excepte dye sowest thou thou sowest ye body shalbe bare corne namely wheate god geueth body wil vnto euery one ye sedes owne body fleszhe one maner fleszhe one maner fleszhe men another beastes another fiszhes another byrdes heauenly body earthy body heauenly haue one glory ye earthy another sonne hath one clearnes moone hath another clearnesse starres haue another clearnesse one starre excelleth another clearnesse euen resurreccion deed sowne corrupcion shal ryse vncorrupcion sowne dishonoure shal ryse glory sowne weaknesse shal ryse power sowne naturall body shal ryse spirituall body yf naturall body spirituall body also wrytten gen 2 b first man adam made naturall life last adā spiritual life howbeit spirituall body first ye naturall spirituall first man earth earthy ye seconde mā frō heauē christ whether haue trouble comforte done youre welth yf trouble done youre cōforte health health sheweth h • r power ye suffre affliccions suffre yf comforte done also youre comforte health therfore oure hope fast moch knowe like ye partaker afflicciōs shal ye partaker also consolacion brother wolde haue ignoraunt oure trouble act 19 c happened vnto v asia greued measure passynge strength euen haue oure conuersacion worlde wryte nothinge el vnto ye rede also knowe yee trust ye shal fynde v vnto ende euen ye haue founde v partly youre reioysinge euē ye also oure phil 2 b 1 te 2 c reioysinge vnto corinthum 1 pet • lordes ouer youre faith helper youre ioye ye stonde faith determyned wt selfe wolde come agayne heuynes yf make sory shal make glad made sory haue wrytten vnto lest whā come shulde take heuynes oughte reioyse somoch haue confidence ioye ioye greate trouble anguysh hert wrote vnto many teares yt ye shulde sory ye mighte perceaue loue haue specially vnto yf eny man haue caused sorowe hath made sory partely lest shulde greue sufficient 〈…〉 man rebuked many hence forth ye oughte forgeue comforte lest swalowed vp ouer moch heuynesse wherfore exhorte ye shewe loue vpō therfore dyd wryte vnto also mighte knowe profe whether ye obediēt thinges loke vnto whō ye forgeue eny thinge forgeue hī also also yf forgeue ought vnto eny mā forgeue youre sake rowme christ endeuoure oure selues please • 25 c 〈◊〉 14 b must appeare iudgment seate christ yt euery one maye receaue body acordinge yt hath done whether good bad seynge knowe lorde feared fare fayre men knowne kepe measure youre sake loue christ constrayneth v moch thus iudge yf one deed deed 1 te 5 b therfore dyed lyue shulde hence forth lyue vnto selues vnto dyed rose agayne therfore hence forth knowe noman ye flesh though haue knowne christ also flesh yet knowe nomore therfore yf eny man christ new creature olde thinges past awaye apoc 21 beholde become new neuertheles thinges god hath reconcyled good reporte disceauers yet true vnknowne yet knowne esa 〈…〉 dyenge beholde lyue chastened kylled sorowynge yet allwaye mery poore yet make many riche hauynge nothinge yet possessynge thinges ye corinthian oure mouth open vnto oure hert made large ye straytnesse oure behalfe ye straytnesse ye youre owne hertely meanynge speake childrē haue like rewarde v set youre selues therfore large beare straunge yock vnbeleuers 〈…〉 fellishippe hath righteousnes vnrighteousnes company hath lighte wt darknesse 〈…〉 agreeth christ belial▪ parte hath beleuer infydele acordeth ye tēple god ymages ye temple lyuynge god sayeth god wyl dwell walke 〈…〉 wyl god shalbe people wherfore come amōge separate youre selues 〈…〉 sayeth lorde touche vncleane thinge wyl receaue youre father ye shalbe sonnes doughters sayeth ye allmightie lorde vii chapter seynge haue soch promyses dearly beloued let v clense oure selues fylthynes flesh sprete growe vp full holynes ye feare god vnderstōde v right haue hurte mā haue corrupte man haue defrauded man speake cōdemne haue shewed ye oure hertes dye lyue wt bolde towarde make moch boost fylled comforte exceadynge ioyous oure tribulacion 〈…〉 whan come macedonia oure flesh rest troubled euery syde outwarde fightinge inwarde feare neuertheles god comforteth abiecte 〈…〉 comforted v cōmynge titus onely commynge also cōsolacion wherwith cōforted whan tolde v yor desyre youre wepynge yo feruēt mynde yt reioyse ye made sory letter repenteth though dyd repēte se epistle made sory though ceason reioyce ye sory ye sory repentaunce ye sorowed godly nothinge ye hurte v godly sorowe causeth repentaunce vnto saluacion repented 〈◊〉 • 0 c worldly sorowe causeth death beholde ye haue godly sorowe diligence hath wrought yee sufficiet answere displeasure feare desyre feruēt mynde punyshment poyntes ye haue shewed youre selues ye cleare matter wherfore though wrote vnto yet done cause dyd hurte nether cause hurte youre diligence ye haue v sighte god mighte manifest wt therfore comforted ye comforted exceadingly ioyed ioye titus sprete refreszhed therfore ashamed though boasted selfe vnto like true haue spokē vnto euen oure boastinge vnto titus founde true also inwarde affeccion abundaunt towarde whan remembreth obedience ye receaued feare trēblynge reioyse maye bolde ouer thinges viii chapter wit brother grace god geuē congregacions macedonia reioysinge abundaunt whan tryed moch trouble though exceadinge poore yet haue geuē exceadinge richely synglenesse power beare recorde yee beyonde power wyllinge awne acorde prayed v greate instaūce wolde receaue benefite fellishippe 〈…〉 c 〈◊〉 1 • 〈◊〉 16 〈◊〉 9 hādreachinge done sayntes loked gaue ouer selues first lodre afterwarde vnto v ye wyl god coulde desyre titus like begonne afore wolde euen accomplish beniuolence amonge ye riche poyntes faith worde knowlege diligence youre loue towarde v euen se ye plenteous also benyuolēce saye commaūdynge seynge diligent proue youre loue also whether perfecte ye knowe liberalite oure lorde iesus christ though riche yet youre sake became poore yt ye thorow pouerte mighte made riche councell herin geue profitable haue begonne yeare goo onely also wyll perfourme dede also like ready mynde wil maye ready mynde also perfourme dede pet 4 b pro 3 b ye haue luc 2 • yf wyllinge mynde accepted acordinge man hath acordinge hath done intent shulde haue ease ye cōbraunce lyke let youre abundaunce sucker lacke tyme derth abundaunce also herafter maye supplee youre lacke maye equalite wrytten yt gathered moch exo 10 gathered litle wanted nothinge thākes vnto god put hert titus diligence towarde accepted request dede yee rather well wyllynge awne acorde came vnto haue sent brother whose prayse gospell thorow congregacions onely chosen also congregacions felowe v oure iourney benyuolence mynistred v vnto prayse lorde stere vp youre prompte mynde bewarre lest eny mā reporte euell v plenteousnes mynistred v rom 12 therfore make prouision honest thinges onely lorde also men haue sent also brother oures haue oft proued diligēt many thinges moch diligent haue done greate hope towarde whether titus sake felowe helper amonge oure brethrē apostle cōgregacions prayse christ shewe profe youre loue oure boastinge vnto opēly sighte cogregacions •• 15 •• 16 •• 8 handreachinge vnto ye sayntes nede wryte vnto knowe youre redynesse mynde wherof boast selfe amonge macedonia saye achaia ready yeare agoo youre feruentnesse hath prouoked many neuertheles yet haue sent brother left oure reioysinge ouer shulde vayne behalfe ye mighte ready haue reported left whan macedonia come fynde vnprepared wyl saye ye shulde ashamed presumpcion boostinge wherfore thoughte necessary exhorte brother come hande vnto prepare blessynge promysed afore mighte ready blessynge defraudynge thynke 〈◊〉 11 c •• al 6 soweth litle shal reape litle also yt soweth plenteously shal likewyse reape plenteously euery one acordynge hath purposed hert grudgingly compulsion • od 25 〈◊〉 35 • cli 35 god loueth chearfull geuer god able make riche grace yt ye thinges hauynge sufficiet vttemost maye riche maner good workes wryttē • sal 111 b hath sparsed abrode geuē ye poore righteousnes remayneth euer geueth sede vnto sower shal mynistre bred also fode shal multiplye youre sede increase frutes yo righteousnes thinges ye maye made riche vnto singlenesse causeth thorow v thankesgeuynge vnto god hādreachinge colleccion onely suppleeth nede sayntes also abūdaunt herin laudable mynistracion many mighte geue thā kes vnto god prayse god yo obedient professynge gospell christ yor synglenesse distributynge vnto thē men prayer longe abundaunt grace god thankes vnto god vnoutspeakeable gifte x chapter paul selfe beseke mekenesse softnesse christ present amonge small reputacion bolde towarde beynge absent beseke nede bolde whan present vse yt boldnesse wherwith supposed bolde agaynst repute v though walked yo flesh though walke flesh yet fighte fleshly maner 〈…〉 wapens oure warre fleshly mightie god cast downe strōge holdes wherwith ouerthrowe ymaginacions euery hye thinge yt exalteth selfe agaynst knowlege god brynge captiuyte vnderstondinge obedience christ ready take vengeaunce disobedience whan youre obediēce fulfylled loke ye thinges ye vtter appearaūce yf eny man trust himselfe yt christes let thinke also himselfe yt like christes euē christes also though shulde boast selfe somwhat oure auctorite 〈…〉 ye lorde hath geuē v edifye destroye shulde shame saye lest shulde seme though wente aboute make afrayed letter pist • le saye sore stronge bodely presence weake speache rude let yt soche thinke wyse worde letter wh • absente soch also dede whan present darre reken compare oure selues vnto prayse selues neuertheles whyle measure selues selues holde onely selues vnderstonde nothinge howbeit wil boast selues aboue measure onely acordinge measure rule wherwith god hath distributed vnto v measure reach euen vnto stretche selues farre though reached vnto euen vnto haue come gospell christ boast oure selues measure men laboures yee hope whan youre faith increased wil come farther acordinge oure measure preach gospell vnto dwell beyonde reioyse prepared another man measure xi chapter let reioyseth reioyse lorde yt 〈…〉 prayseth selfe alowed whō ye lorde prayseth wolde god ye coulde suffre litle foloshnes yet ye forbeare gelous ouer wt godly gelousy haue maried vnto one mā brynge chaste virgin vnto christ feare left 〈…〉 ye serpēt begyled eue wt sutteltie euē yor wyttes shulde corrupte synglenesse christ yf commeth vnto preach another iesus haue preached yf ye receaue another sprete yt ye haue receaued another gospell ye haue accepted ye might right well haue bene cōtent suppose lesse thē hye apostle though rude speakynge yet rude knowlege howbeit amōge knowne vttemost dyd synne therin submytted selfe ye mighte exalted preached vnto gospell god 〈◊〉 9 b frely robbed cōgregacions toke wage thē preach vnto 〈◊〉 20 c whan present nede greuous man 〈◊〉 4 c yt lackynge vnto brother came fro macedonia suppleed thinges kepte myselfe yt shulde greuous wyl kepe selfe surely trueth christ reioysinge shal taken fro region achaia wherfore shulde loue god knoweth neuertheles wyl cut awaye occasion thē seke occasion mighte boast thē selues like vnto v soch false apostle disceatfull worker fashion selues like vnto apostle christ maruell sathan himselfe chaunged ye fashion angell light therfore greate thinge though mister fashion selues though preacher righteousnes 〈…〉 whose ende shalbe acordinge dedes saye agayne lest eny man thynke folish el take euen fole yt maye boast myselfe litle also speake speake lorde folishnes whyle come boastinge seynge many boaste selues ye flesh wil boast selfe also ye suffre foles gladly moch ye youre selues wyse ye suffre euen yf man brynge bondage yf man put dishonesty yf man take ought frō yf man exalte himselfe ouer yf man smyte face speake concernynge rebuke though weake wherin euer eny man darre bolde speake folishly therin darre bolde also hebrues israelite euen sede abraham mynisters christ speake fole laboures abūdaunt strypes aboue measure presonmentes plenteously death oft deut 25 iewes receaued fyue tymes fortye strypes one lesse act 16 • thryse beaten roddes act 14 • stoned act 27 • suffred thryse shypwracke nighte daye haue bene depe see haue oft iourneyed haue bene oft parels water parels amonge murthurers parels amonge iewes parels amonge heythen parels city parels wylderners parels vpon see parels amonge false brethrē laboure trauayle moch watchinges honger thyrst moch fastinges colde nakednesse besyde thynges outwarde namely daylie combraunce daylie care cōgregacions1 cor 8 • weake weake offended burne yf must nedes make boast wil boast selfe myne infirmyte god ye father oure lorde iesus christ blessed euer knoweth lye act 9 damascon gouernoure ye people vnder kynge aretas kepte ye cite damascene wolde haue taken wyndowe let downe basket thorow wall escaped handes xii chapter profiteth nothinge doute boaste neuertheles wil come ye vision reuelacions lorde knowe man christ aboue fourtene yeares goo whether ye body tell whether body tell god knoweth taken vp thirde heauen knowe man whether ye body body tell god knoweth takē vp paradise herde wordes spoken man vtter boast selfe wil make boast excepte myne infirmyties though wolde boast dyd foolishly wolde saye trueth refrayne selfe lest eny mā shulde thinke aboue yt seyth heareth iob 1 b lest shulde exalte selfe measure hye reuelacions warnynge geuen vnto flesh euen ye messaunger satan buffet shulde exalte selfe measure ye besoughte lorde thryse mighte departe fro sayde vnto grace sufficiēt strength made perfecte thorow weaknes glad therfore wil reioyse weakness strength christ maye dwell therfore contente infirmity rebuke necessity persecucions anguyszhes christes sake whā weake thē strōge become fole ī boastinge selfe ye haue cōpelled oughte cōmended cor 9 moch nothinge inferior ye hye apostle though nothinge yet ye token apostle wrought amōge paciēce signes wōders mightie dedes wherin ye inferiours congregacions excepte yt haue bene greuous vnto forgeue wrōge beholde ready thirde tyme come vnto wyl chargeable vnto act 20 c seke youres ye childrē ought gather treasure elder elder child wil gladly bestowe wyl bestowed youre soules though ye loue lesse loue • agayne let greued neuertheles moch craftye toke wt gyle haue defrauded eny thē whō sent vnto desyred titus sent brother dyd titus defraude haue walked one sprete wēte like fotesteppes agayne thynke ye yt excuse oure selues speake christ sighte god dearly beloued done yor edifyenge feare lest whan come shal fynde soch wolde lest ye shal fynde soch ye wolde lest amonge debate envyenges wrathes stryuynges bacbytinges whysperinges swellinges vproures lest whan come agayne god bringe lowe amōge lest constrayned bewayle many thē yt haue synned haue repented ouer ye vnclennesse whordome wantonnes haue cōmytted xiii chapter come thirde tyme vnto deut 19 c mat 18 b mouth two thre witness shal euery matter stabliszhed haue tolde tell present ye seconde tyme wryte beynge absent vnto thē tyme passed haue synned yf come agayne wil spare seynge ye seke experiēce 〈…〉 speaketh euen christ amonge weake mightie amōge though crucified weaknes yet lyueth power god though weake yet lyue power god amonge 1 cor 〈…〉 proue youre selues whether ye faith examē youre selues knowe ye yor selues yt iesus christ excepte ye cast awayes trust ye knowe yt cast awayes desyre god yt ye euell yt shulde seme comendable yt ye shulde yt good let v cast awayes maye nothinge agaynst ye trueth ye trueth glad whan weake ye stronge also wyszhe namely yor perfectnesse therfore wryte thinges beynge absent lest whā present shulde vse sharpnesse acordinge power 〈…〉 lorde hath geuē edifye destroye fynally brother reioyse parfecte cō forte yor selues one mynde peaceable god loue peace shalbe wt salute one another holykysse sayntes salute grace oure lorde iesus christ loue god fellishippe ye holy goost amen seconde epistle corinthian sent phillippos macedonia titus lucas epistle apostle paul galathians summe epistle chap paul rebuketh fallen awaye gospell sheweth awne cōuersion magnifieth office apostelshippe declareth equall hye apostle chap ii withstondeth peter face proueth lawe circumcision necessary saluacion chap iii rebuketh vnsted fastnesse galathians shewinge vnparfectnesse lawe declareth neuerthelesse geuen naught chap iiii paul sheweth thorow christ delyuered lawe rebuketh vnthankfulnesse galathians chap v laboureth drawe awaye circūcision iesus christ god father raysed vp frō ye deed brethrē wt vnto cō gregaciōs galacia 〈…〉 grace peace frō god father oure lorde iesus christ gaue selfe oure synnes mighte delyuer v present euel worlde acordinge wyll god oure father prayse euer euer amen maruell yt ye soone turned called grace christ vnto another gospell nothinge el besome 〈…〉 trouble intende peruerte gospell christ neuertheles though oure selues angell heauē preach vnto eny gospel thē yt haue preached vnto acursed haue sayde afore saye agayne yf eny mā preach vnto eny thinge thē yt ye haue receaued ye acursed preach men god go aboute please men yf shulde yet please men seruaunt christ certifye brother yt gospell preached men nether receaued ner lerned mā reuelacion iesus christ ye haue herde conuersacion afore tyme ieweshippe 〈…〉 beyōde measure persecuted cōgregacion god spoyled preuayled ieweshippe aboue many companyons nacion moch feruent manteyner tradicions father whan pleased god separated fro mother wombe called grace declare sonne shulde preach thorow gospell amonge heythen immediatly commened matter flesh bloude nether came ierusalem vnto apostle wente wayes arabia came agayne damascon thre yeare came ierusalē se peter abode fyftene dayes apostle sawe none saue iames lordes brother thinges wryte vnto beholde 2 cor 11 god knoweth lye wente coastes syria celicia face vnknowne ye christen congregacions iewrye neuertheles herde onely persecuted v tyme passed preacheth ye faith tyme destroyed praysed god ii chapter· fourtene yeares act 15 wente vp agayne ierusalē barnabas toke titus also wente vp reuelacion commened thē ye gospell preach amonge heythē specially thē reputacion lest shulde runne runne vayne act 16 1 cor 9 c titus also compelled circūcysed though greke certayne incommers beynge false brethrē came amōge spye oure libertye haue christ iesus mighte brynge v bondage gaue rowme space houre concernynge broughte subieccion yt trueth gospell mighte comtynue thē semed greate tyme passed maketh matter act 10 rom 2 b ephe 6 god loketh outwarde appearaunce men neuertheles semed greate taught nothinge contrary wyse whan sawe gospell ouer vncircumcision cō mytted vnto ye gospell ouer ye circū cision commytted vnto peter yt mightie peter apostleshippe ouer circumcision mightie also amōge heythen perceaued grace geuen vnto iames cephas ihon semed pilers gaue barnabas ye righte handes agreed v shulde preach amonge heythē amonge iewes onely shulde remēbre poore act 11 e 2 co 9 thinge also diligent whā peter come antioche withstode ye face worthy blamed afore came certayne iames ate heythē whā come withdrue separated himselfe fearinge thē circumcision iewes dyssembled likewyse moch yt barnabas brought symulacion also whan sawe walked right ye trueth gospell sayde vnto peter openly yf thou beynge iewe lyuest maner gentyles iewes causest thou gentyles lyue iewes phil 3 though iewes nature synners gentyles yet moch knowe rom 3 b man made righteous dedes lawe faith iesus christ haue beleued also iesus christ yt might made righteous faith christ dedes lawe dedes lawe flesh shal iustified yf seke made righteous christ shulde yet founde synners selues christ mynister synne god forbyd yf buylde agayne yt haue destroyed make selfe trespacer thorow lawe deed vnto lawe might lyue vnto god crucified christ yet lyue neuerthelesse christ lyueth ye life lyue ye fleszhe lyue faith ye sonne god phe 5 loued gaue himselfe cast awaye grace god yf righteousnes come lawe dyed christ vayne iii chapter ye folishe galathiās hath bewitched ye shulde beleue trueth whō iesus christ descrybed eye amonge crucified onely wolde lerne receaued ye sprete dedes lawe preachinge faith ye vnwyse ye beganne sprete wolde ye ende thē flesh haue ye suffred moch vayne yf el vayne geueth sprete doth soch greate actes amōge doth thorow dedes lawe ye preachinge faith 〈…〉 euen abrahā beleued god counted vnto righteousnes thus ye knowe faith abraham child scripture sawe afore hāde god iustifieth heythen thorow faith therfore shewed glad tydinges afore vnto abraham sayde 〈…〉 shal heythen blessed faith blessed faithfull abraham many go aboute workes lawe vnder ye curse wryttē 〈…〉 cursed euery man cōtynueth thinges wryttē boke lawe man iustified lawe sighte god euydēt 〈…〉 yt iust shal lyue faith lawe faith 〈…〉 mā doth ye shal lyue therin christ hath delyuered v ye curse lawe whan became curse v wryttē 〈…〉 cursed euery man hangeth tre yt blessynge abraham mighte come gentyles christ iesu yt might receaue ye promysed sprete thorow faith brother wil speake maner men though mās testamēt yet man despyseth addeth eny thinge therto 〈…〉 whan confirmed abraham sede promyses made sayeth sedes many thy sede one christ testament saye afore confirmed christ warde disanulled promes shulde made none affecte lawe 〈…〉 geuen beyonde foure hundreth thirtie yeares therafter 〈…〉 yf enheritaunce gotten lawe geuen promes god gaue frely vnto abraham promes wherfore thē serueth lawe 〈…〉 added trangression tyll sede came promes made 〈…〉 geuen angel hande 〈…〉 mediatoure mediatour mediatour one onely god one lawe agaynst promyses god god forbyd howbeit yf bene geuen lawe coulde haue geuē life thē doute righteousnes shulde come lawe 〈…〉 ye scripture hath shut vp vnder synne ye promes shulde come faith iesus christ geuē vnto thē beleue faith came kepte shut vp vnder lawe vnto faith shulde afterwarde declared thus ye lawe scolemaster vnto christ might made righteous faith faith come nomore vnder scolemaster 〈…〉 ye child god faith christ iesu 〈…〉 many baptysed haue put christ nether iewe ner greke nether bōde ner fre nether man ner woman ye 〈…〉 one christ iesu yf ye christes thē ye abrahās sede heyres acordynge promes iiii chapter bvt saye longe heyre childe difference betwene seruaunt though lorde ye goodes vnder tuters gouerners vntyll tyme appoynted father euen also whā child bondage vnder outwarde tradicions whan tyme fulfylled god sent sonne borne womā 〈…〉 put vnder lawe redeme vnder lawe mighte receaue ye childshippe 〈…〉 moch thē ye child god hath sent sprete sonne oure hertes cryeth abba deare father wherfore thou art seruaunt sonne yf thou sonne art thou heyre god thorow christ notwithstondinge whan ye knewe god ye dyd seruyce vnto nature goddes seynge ye knowe god yee rather knowne god • 〈…〉 ye turne backe agayne vnto weake beggerly tradicions wher vnto ye desyre agayne fresh bondage ye obserue dayes •• nethes tymes yeares feare lest haue bestowed laboure vayne brethrē beseke ye ye ye haue hurte ye knowe weaknes ye flesh preached ye gospell vnto first tentacion suffred flesh ye despysed nether abhorred receaued angell god yee euen christ iesus happy ye beare recorde yf bene possible ye plucked youre awne eye geuē vnto therfore become yor enemy tell ye trueth gelous ouer amysse yee wolde make fall backe ye might feruēt thē warde good feruent yt allwaye good thinge onely whan present wt litle child trauayle byrth agayne vntyll christ fashioned wolde wt coulde chaūge voyce stōdeī doute tell ye wylbe vnder lawe haue ye herde lawe wrytten abraham two sonnes gen 16 one bonde mayde gen 71 fre woman bōde mayde borne ye flesh fre woman borne promes wordes betoken somwhat wemen two testamentes one mount sina gendreth vnto bondage agar agar called arabia ye mount sina reacheth vnto ierusalem bondage hir child apoc 21 ierusalem aboue fre woman mother v wryttē esa 54 reioyse thou baren bearest childrē breake forth crye thou yt trauaylest desolate hath many mo childrē hath huszbande v brother child isaac acordinge promes gen 27 g like tyme borne flesh persecuted yt borne sprete euen also sayeth scripture gen 21 b put awaye bonde mayden hir sonne sonne ye bondmayde shal heyre ye sonne fre woman brother child bonde mayde fre woman v chapter stonde fast therfore libertye wherwith christ hath made v fre wrapped agayne yocke bondage beholde paul say • vnto yf ye circumcysed christ profiteth nothinge testifye aga •• ne vnto euery man circumcyse bounde kepe whole lar • ye gone quyte christ many • wylbe made righteous la •• fallen grace wa • sprete hope 〈…〉 faith 〈…〉 christ 〈…〉 circumcision eny thinge worth ner vncircumcision faith 1 co 13 loue might • e operacion ye ranne well let vnto ye shulde obeye trueth soch councell hath called 1 cor 5 litle leuen sowreth whole lompe dowe haue trust towarde ye lorde ye wylbe none otherwyse mynded troubleth shal beare iudgment euer brother yf yet preach circumcision suffre persecucion slaunder crosse ceassed wolde god roted frō amōge trouble brethrē ye called vnto liberty onely let youre libertie occasion vnto flesh loue serue one another lawe fulfylled one worde namely leuit 19 e ro 13 b loue thy neghboure thy selfe yf ye byte deuoure one another take hede ye consumed one another saye walke sprete shal ye fulfill 1 pet 2 b lustes fleshe flesh lusteth agaynst sprete sprete agaynst flesh contrary one ye ye wolde yf ye led sprete ye vnder lawe1 tim 5 c dedes ye flesh manifest aduoutrye whordome vnclēnes wantā ne idolatrye witchcraft hatred variaunce zele wrath stryfe sedicion sectes envyenge murthur dronkennes glotony soch like tell haue tolde tyme past 1 cor 6 b commytte soch shal inheret kyngdome god ephe 5 b frute sprete loue ioye peace longe sufferinge gētlenes goodnesse faithfulnes mekenesse tēperaunce 1 tim 1 b • ro 13 b 1 pet 2 b agaynst soch ye lawe1 tim 1 b • ro 13 b 1 pet 2 b christes haue crucified flesh lustes desyres vi chapter yf lyue sprete let v walke also sprete let v vayne glorious prouokinge one another envyenge another brother yf eny mā ouertaken faute ye spiri • uall enfourme meke sprete •• nsidre thine owne selfe thou also 〈◊〉 tempted 〈…〉 beare ye one anothers 〈…〉 shal ye fulfyll lawe christ 〈◊〉 yf eny man thinke himselfe 〈…〉 whan dede nothinge 〈…〉 h • mselfe let euery man proue 〈◊〉 owne wo •• e thē shal haue reioysinge awne selfe another 〈…〉 euery one shal beare owne burthen 〈…〉 let taughte worde mynister good thinges vnto teacheth disceaued god wil mocked 〈…〉 soeuer man soweth shal reape soweth vpon flesh shal flesh reape destruccion soweth vpon ye sprete shal sprete reape life euerlastinge 〈…〉 let v weery well doynge whā tyme come shal reape without ceassinge whyle haue tyme therfore let v good vnto men 〈…〉 specially vnto thē ye housholde faith beholde many wordes haue wrytten vnto myne awne hande wil please flesh constrayne circumcysed onely lest shulde persecuted crosse christ euē selues circumcysed kepe lawe wolde haue circūcysed mighte reioyse youre flesh god forbyd shulde reioyse saue onely crosse oure lorde iesus christ wherby worlde crucified vnto vnto worlde 〈…〉 christ iesu nether circūcision avayleth eny thinge ner vncircumcision new creature 〈…〉 many walke acordynge rule peace mercy vpon thē vpon israel god hence forth let man put busynesse 〈…〉 sauynge men thorow christ iesus sonne ordened vnto good workes dominion christ chap ii paul sheweth maner people conuersion christ chap iii sheweth cause presonment desyreth faynte trouble prayeth god make thē stedfast sprete chap iiii exhorteth vnto mekenes longe sufferinge vnto loue peace euery one serue edifie another gifte god hath geuē bewarre straunge doctrine laye asyde olde conuersacion gredy lustes walke new life chap v exhorteth vnto loue warneth bewarre vnclennes cuvetounesse foolish talkynge false doctryne circumspecte avoyde dronkennesse reioyse thankfull towarde god submytt
