sayntes ephesus thē beleue iesus christ 〈…〉 grace peace god oure father frō lorde iesus christ blessed god father oure lorde iesus christ hath blessed v wt maner spirituall blessynge heauenly thynges christ 〈…〉 acordinge chosen v euer foundacion worlde layed shulde holy without blame loue ordeyned v receaue v child thorow iesus christ acordinge pleasure vnto prayse glory grace wherby hath made v accepted mat 3 b 1 • beloued haue redempcion thorow bloude namely forgeuenes synnes acordynge ye rich grace hath shed vpon v abundauntly wyszdome prudēce hath opened vnto v mystery wil acordinge pleasure purposed himselfe yt shulde preached gal 4 whā tyme fullcome thinges shulde gathered together christ thinges heauen also thinges vpon earth euen also come inheritaunce rom • therto predestinate acordinge ye purpose worketh thinges ye councell owne wyll mighte prayse glory euen beleued christ whō also ye beleued ye herde worde trueth namely ye gospell youre saluacion wherin whan ye beleued ye 2 cor • e 5 sealed holy sprete promes ernest oure inheritaunce oure redempcion mighte owne prayse glory wherfore also moch haue herde faith ye haue ye lorde iesu youre loue vnto ye sayntes ceasse geue thankes make mencion prayer ye god oure lorde iesus christ father glory maye geue vnto sprete wyszdome open vnto knowlege himselfe lighten eye youre vnderstondinge ye maye knowe hope youre callynge rich glorious enheritaunce vpon sayntes exceadinge greatnesse power towarde v beleue acordinge ye workynge mightie power wroughte christ whan raysed vp frō deed psal 109 set righte hāde ī heauēly thinges aboue rule power mighte dominaciō aboue maye named onely worlde also ye worlde come psal 8 b hath put thinges vnder fete hath made aboue thinges ephe 4 5 c col 1 c heade cōgregacion body fulnesse fylleth ii chapter quyckened also whan ye deed thorow trespaces synnes tyme past ye walked acordinge course worlde prynce ruleth ayre namely ye sprete worketh child vnbeleue col 3 amonge also oure conuersacion tyme past lustes oure flesh dyd wyll flesh mynde naturally child wrath euen well god riche mercy thorow greate loue wherwith loued v euē whā deed synnes hath quyckened v christ esa 25 b act 15 b grace ye saued hath raysed v vp set v heauēly thinges thorow christ iesus yt tymes come mighte shewe exceadinge rich grace kyndnesse v warde christ iesu grace ye saued thorow faith youre selues ye gifte god workes lest eny mā shulde boast selfe workmanshippe created christ iesu tit 2 b vnto good workes yt god ordeyned v shulde walke wherfore remēbre ye afore tyme gentyles flesh called vncircumcision thē called phil 3 col 2 b circumcision flesh circumcision made hande ye tyme without christ reputed aleauntes comen welth israel straungers testamentes promes therfore ye hope without god worlde ye christ iesu afore tyme farre made nye bloude christ esa 9 b col 1 b peace hath made one hath broken downe wall stoppe betwene v hath also thorow flesh put awaye cause hatred namely lawe commaundemētes contayned lawe wrytten twayne mighte create one new man selfe make peace reconcyle vnto god one body thorow crosse slewe ye hatred thorow owne selfe came esa 57 c preached peace gospell vnto afarre thē nye thorow haue intraunce • ne sprete vnto father therfore ye nomore gestes straungers citesins sayntes housholde god buylded vpon cor 3 b ye foundacion ye apostle prophetes pet 2 iesus christ ye heade corner stone euery buyldinge coupled together groweth holy temple lorde ye also buylded together habitacion god sprete iii chapter cause paul 〈…〉 presoner iesus christ heythen acordinge ye haue herde ye office grace god geuen warde 〈…〉 reuelacion mystery shewed vnto wrote abou • fewe wordes wherby whan ye rede 〈◊〉 maye perceaue myne vnderstondynge ye mystery christ mystery tymes past opened vnto childrē mē declared holy apostle prophetes sprete namely heythen shulde inheritours also body partaker promes christ gospell wherof made mynister acordynge gifte grace god geuē acordinge workynge power vnto 〈…〉 leest sayntes grace geuen shulde preach amonge heythē ye vnsearcheable rich christ make men se fellishippe 〈…〉 mystery frō begynnynge worlde hath bene hyd god made thīges thorow iesus christ intent vnto ruler power heauē mighte knowne congregacion manifolde wyszdome god acordinge ye eternall purpose hath shewed christ iesu oure lorde haue boldnesse intraunce confidēce thorow faith wherfore desyre ye faynte tribulacions yt 〈…〉 suffre youre prayse cause bowe knee vnto father oure lorde iesus christ true father ouer called father heauen earth graunte acordinge ye rich glory strengthed power sprete ye inwarde mā christ maye dwell youre hertes faith ye beynge roted grounded loue maye able cōprehende sayntes bredth length deepth heyth knowe loue christ loue yet passeth knowlege ye maye fylled maner fulnesse god vnto able exceadinge abundauntly aboue axe vnderstonde acordinge ye power worketh v prayse congregacion christ iesu tymes euer euer amen iiii chapter therfore presoner lorde exhorte ye walke becōmeth yor callinge wherin ye called humblenes mynde mekenes longe sufferinge forbearinge one another loue diligent kepe vnite sprete thorow bonde peace one body one sprete euē ye called one hope youre callynge one lorde one faith one baptyme one god father v aboue thorow 〈…〉 vnto euery one v geuen grace acordinge measure gifte christ therfore sayeth 〈…〉 gone vp hye hath led awaye captiuyte captyue hath geuē giftes vnto men wente vp first came downe ye lowest partes ye earth 〈…〉 came downe euen gone vp aboue heauens fulfill 〈…〉 ye hath set apostle prophetes euangelistes shepherdes teacher wherby sayntes mighte coupled together thorow comen seruyce edifienge ye body christ tyll come vnto one maner faith knowlege sonne god become perfecte man measure perfecte age christ 〈…〉 nomore child 〈…〉 waueringe caried aboute euery wynde doctryne thorow wickednes men craftynes wherby laye awayte v disceaue v let v folowe trueth loue thinges growe 〈…〉 heade euen christ body coupled together one membre hangeth another thorow ye ioyntes 〈…〉 wherby one mynistreth vnto another acordinge operacion euery membre hath measure maketh ye body groweth edifienge selfe loue saye therfore testifye lorde ye walke nomore ye heythen walke vanite mynde blynded vnderstondinge beynge straungers frō life god thorow ignoraunce blyndnes hert beynge past repentaunce haue geuē selues ouer vnto wantonnes worke maner vnclennes euen gredynesse ye haue learned christ yf ye haue herde taught euen trueth iesu concernynge conuersacion tyme past rom 6 col 3 laye olde man marreth himselfe thorow disceauable lustes ye renued sprete youre mynde put new man shapen god true righteousnes holynes zach • c 1 pet 2 wherfore put awaye lyenge speake euery man trueth vnto neghboure moch membres one another psal 4 angrie synne let ye sonne go downe vpō youre wrath nether geue place bacbyter hath stollen let steale nomore 2 te 3 let laboure rather good hondes maye haue geue vnto nedeth let filthy communicacion proceade youre mouth mat 12 ephe 5 good edifye withall whā nede gracious heare greue holy sprete god wherwith ye 2 cor 1 c sealed vnto ye daye redempcion let bytternes fearsnes wrath roaringe cursed speakynge farre frō maliciousnes ye curteous one another mercifull mat 6 • forgeue one another euē god hath forgeuen christ v chapter ye mat 5 e ioh 13 b gal 1 folowers therfore god deare child walke loue euen christ loued v mat 5 e ioh 13 b gal 1 gaue selfe v offerynge sacrifice swete sauoure vnto god whordome vnclennes couetousnes let named amōge becommeth sayntes ecclī 23 c nether fylthines ner folish talkynge ner ieastynge comly rather geuynge thākes1 cor 6 b col 3 sure whore monger vncleane person couetous person worshipper ymages hath inheritaunce kyngdome christ god col 2 let man disceaue vayne wordes commeth wrath god vpon child vnbeleue ye therfore companion sometyme ye darknesse 1 te 5 • ye lighte lorde walke child lighte gal 5 c 〈◊〉 frute sprete maner goodnes righteousnes tru • th proue pleasinge vnto lorde haue fellishippe ye vnfrutefull workes darknes rather rebuke thē shame euen name thinges done secrete thinges manifest whan rebuked lighte euer manifest lighte therfore sayeth esa 60 rom 13 b awake thou slepest stonde vp frō deed christ shal geue lighte col 4 take hede therfore ye walke circumspectly vnwyse ye wyse redeme tyme miserable tyme wherfore ye vnwyse vnderstonde wil lorde ecclī 31 c dronken wyne wherin excesse full sprete col 3 b talke amōge youre selues psalmes ymnes spirituall songes synginge makynge melody vnto lorde youre hertes 1 te 5 c geuynge thankes alwayes thinges vnto god father name oure lorde iesus christ submyttinge youreselues one another feare god let wemen submytte selues vnto huszbandes col 3 c 1 pet 3 vnto lorde 1 co 11 huszbande wyues heade euē christ also heade congregacion sauioure body therfore congregacion subieccion christ likewyse let wyues subieccion huszbandes thinges ye huszbandes loue youre wyues even christ loued congregacion ephe 5 gal 2 c gaue himselfe sanctifye tit 3 1 pet 3 c clensed fountayne water worde make vnto himselfe glorious congregacion hauynge spot ner wrynkle ner eny soch thinge shulde holy without blame oughte men nourtoure informacion lorde 〈…〉 ye seruauntes obey youre bodely master feare tremblynge synglenes youre hert euen vnto christ seruyce onely eye sighte men pleaser seruauntes christ doynge wyll god hert good wyll thynke ye serue lorde mē sure good soeuer man doth shal receaue agayne lorde whether bonde fre ye master 〈…〉 euen vnto thē puttynge awaye threatenynges knowe euen youre master also heauen 〈…〉 nether eny respecte personnes fynally brother stronge lorde power mighte put armo god ye maye stonde stedfast agaynst craftie assautes deuell wrestle agaynst flesh bloude agaynst rule agaynst power namely agaynst ruler worlde darknesse worlde agaynst ye spretes wickednes vnder heauen cause take ye armoure god yt ye maye able resiste euell daye stonde perfecte thinges 〈…〉 stonde therfore youre loynes gyrde aboute trueth hauynge brest plate righteousnes shod vpō yo fete gospell peace ye maye prepared aboue thinges take holde shylde faith wherwith ye maye quenche fyrie dartes christ manifest thorow ye iudgmēt hall place moch many brother lorde boldened thorow bōdes darre largely speake worde without feare doute preach christ enuye stryfe good wil one parte preacheth cōtynue one sprete one soule labourynge mayntayne faith gospell nothinge fearinge youre aduersaries token perdicion vnto saluacion god vnto geuen onely ye shulde beleue christ also suffre sake haue euen fighte ye haue sene heare ii chapter yf amonge eny consolacion christ yf eny comforte loue yf eny fellishippe sprete yf eny compassion mercy fulfyll ioye ye drawe one waye hauynge one loue beynge one accorde one mynde nothinge done thorow stryfe vayne glory thorow mekenesse mynde euery man esteme another better himselfe let euery mā loke awne profet profet let mynde christ iesu beyinge shappe confesse iesus christ lorde vnto 〈◊〉 prayse god father wherfore dearly beloued ye haue 〈…〉 obeyed onely presence 〈…〉 moch absence euen 〈…〉 youre awne saluacion 〈…〉 〈…〉 god 〈…〉 wyll deed euen owne good reioysinge daye christ haue runne vayne nether laboured vayne 〈…〉 yee though offred vp vpō offerynge sacrifice youre faith glad reioyce ye glad also reioyce ye trust lorde iesus sende timotheus shortly vnto also maye good comforte whan knowe case ye stonde haue man like mynded pure affecciō careth seke awne iesus christes ye knowe profe childe vnto father hath mynistred vnto gospell hope sorowe receaue therfore lorde gladnes 〈…〉 make moch soche worke christ wente farre came nye vnto death regarded life fulfyll seruyce lackynge youre parte towarde iii chapter morover brother reioyce lorde wryte euer one thinge vnto greueth maketh surer bewarre dogges bewarre euell worker bewarre discension 〈…〉 circumcision euen serue god sprete reioyce christ iesu haue confidence flesh though haue wherof mighte reioyce ye flesh yf eny mā thynke hath wherof mighte reioyce flesh moch circūcysed eight daye one people israel trybe ben iamin hebrue hebrues concernynge lawe 〈…〉 pharise concernynge feruentnes 〈…〉 persecuted cōgregacion touchinge righteousnes lawe vnrebukable 〈…〉 thinges vauntage vnto haue counted losse christes sake yee thynke thinges losse excellent 〈…〉 knowleges sake christ iesu lorde haue counted thinge losse iudge donge mighte wynne christ founde hauynge myne awne righteousnes commeth lawe faith christ namely righteousnes commeth god faith knowe vertue comprehended christ iesu brother counte selfe yet haue gotten one thinge saye forget behynde stretch selfe vnto preace vnto ye marck apoynted optayne rewarde hye callynge god christ iesu let v therfore many parfecte thus wyse mynded yf ye otherwyse mynded praye god open euen vnto neuertheles wher vnto come let v procede one rule maye one accorde 〈◊〉 4 c 〈…〉 brother ye ye folowers loke thē shal reioyse greatly ye lorde last ye reuyued agayne care ye cared afore ye lacked oportunyte speake necessite haue lerned soeuer estate am1 tim 6 b therwith contēte lowe cā hye euery thinges mete peace god oure father lorde iesus christ 〈…〉 geue thankes vnto god allwaye makynge mēsion prayer without ceassynge call remembraunce youre worke faith youre laboure loue youre pacience hope 〈…〉 oure lorde iesus christ god oure father knowe brother beloued god ye electe 〈…〉 oure gospell hath bene worde onely power holy goost moch certayntie ye knowe maner amonge youre sake ye became folowers v lorde receaued worde moch affliccion ioye holy goost ye example beleued macedonia achaia frō worde lorde noysed onely macedonia achaia ī quarter also yor faith ī god spred abrode nedeth v speake eny thinge selues shewe maner entrynge vnto ye turned vnto god ymages serue lyuynge true god loke sonne act 1 b heauē raysed vp deed euen iesus hath delyuered v frō ioh 8 c wrath come ii chapter ye youre selues brother knowe oure intraūce vnto vayne suffred afore act 16 c shamefully intreated philippos ye knowe bolde oure god act 17 speake vnto ye gospel god moch stryuynge oure exhortacion brynge erroure ner yet vnclennes nether gyle alowed god gospell shulde commytted vnto v preache euen speake gal 1 b though wolde please mē god tryeth oure hertes haue gone aboute flateringe wordes ye knowe ner wayted oure owne profit phil 1 b god recorde nether soughte prayse men nether ner eny whan mighte haue bene chargeable vnto apostle christ tender amonge like norsse cherisheth hir child euen hartely affeccion towarde wolde good wyl haue dealte vnto onely gospell god oure lyues also ye deare vnto v ye remembre brother oure laboure trauayle act 20 • 2 te • daye nighte wroughte wolde chargeable vnto eny preached gospell god amonge ye witness god holyly iustly vnblameable behaued oure selues amōge tha • beleue ye knowe 〈…〉 child euen exhorte 〈…〉 besoughte euery one 〈…〉 wolde walke passe ye knowe cause seynge coulde longer forbeare sent mighte haue knowlege youre faith lest happly tempter tempted lest oure laboure bene vayne timotheus come frō vnto v hath shewed v youre faith wemē ladē wt synne wemen led dyuerse lustes euer lernynge neuer able come vnto knowlege trueth • xod 7 b like iamnes iābres withstode moses euen also resist trueth mē corrupte myndes lewde cōcernynge ye faith shal preuayle longer folishnes shal manifest vnto men thou hast sene experience doctryne faszhion lyuynge purpose faith longsufferynge loue pacience persecucions affliccions epistle apostle paul vnto philemon summe epistle reioyseth heare faith loue philemon desyreth forgeue seruaūt onesimus louyngly receaue agayne paul presoner iesu christ brother timotheus vnto philemon beloued oure helper beloued appia archippus felowe soudyer congregacion thy house grace peace god oure father lorde iesus christ thanke god makynge mencion wayes prayer moch heare thy loue faith thou hast lorde iesu towarde sayntes oure comen faith maye frutefull thorow knowlege ye good ye haue christ iesu greate ioye consolacion haue thy loue brother sayntes hertely refreshed wherfore though haue great boldnes christ commaunde becommeth yet loues sake rather beseke ye though euē paul aged presoner also iesu christ beseke sonne 〈…〉 onesimus haue begotten bondes tyme past vnprofitable profitable haue sent agayne receaue thou euen myne awne hert wolde haue kepte styll thy steade might haue mynistred vnto ye bondes ye gospell neuertheles without thy mynde wolde nothinge ye good thou doest shulde compulsion wyllingly happly therfore departed season thou shuldest receaue euer seruaunt aboue seruaunt euen brother beloued specially moch vnto ye ye flesh lorde yf thou holde thy companyon receaue euen selfe yf haue hurte oweth oughte laye charge paul haue wrytten myne awne hande wil recompence saye vnto ye • thou owest vnto euen thine owne selfe euen brother let enioye lorde refresh thou hert lorde trustinge thine obediēce haue wrytten vnto knowe thou wilt saye morouer prepare lodginge hope thorow youre prayer shalbe geuen vnto saluteth epaphras felowe rom 6 baptyme yt saueth v ye puttinge awaye fylth flesh yt good cō sciēce cōsenteth vnto god ye resurreccion iesus christ righte hande god gone heauē angel power mighte subdued vnto iiii chapter moch christ hath suffred v ye flesh arme youre selues likewyse mynde rom 9 suffreth flesh ceasseth frō synne yt hēce forth moch tyme yet remayneth ye flesh shulde lyue lustes mē wil god ynough yt haue spent ye tyme past life ye heythen whā walked wantannesse lustes dronkēnes glotony ryotous drynkynge ī abhominable idolatrye semeth thē straunge thinge yt ye runne also wt vnto excesse ryote speake euell shal geue acōptes vnto hī yt ready iudge ye quycke ye deed vnto purpose also ye gospell preached vnto deed yt shulde iudged like mē ī ye flesh shulde lyue vnto god ye sprete ende multiplied thorow knowlege god iesus christ oure lorde moch godly power hath geuen v thinges pertayne vnto life godlynes thorow knowlege hath called v owne glorie power wherby excellent greate promyses geuē vnto v namely ye shulde 〈…〉 partaker godly nature yf ye flye corrupte lust worlde geue ye youre diligence therfore vnto youre faith mynister vertue vertue knowlege knowlege temperancy temperancy pacience pacience godlynes godlynes brotherly loue brotherly loue generall loue yf thinges plenteous let ydle vnfrutefull ye knowlege oure lorde iesus christ lacketh thinges blynde gropeth waye hāde hath forgotten clensed olde synnes wherfore brethrē geue diligence make youre callynge eleccion sure yf ye soch thinges ye shal fall meanes shal plenteously mynistred vnto entrynge vnto ye euerlastinge kyngdome oure lorde sauioure iesus christ therfore wil necligēt put allwayes remembraunce soch thinges though ye knowe youre selues stablished present trueth notwithstondinge thinke mete lōge 〈…〉 tabernacle stere vp puttinge remembraunce sure must shortly put tabernacle euen oure lorde iesus christ hath shewed vnto yet wyl diligēce allwaye departynge ye maye haue wherwith kepe thinges remembraunce folowed deceaueable fable whan declared vnto power commynge oure lorde iesus christ 〈…〉 oure eye sawe maiestie whan receaued god father honoure prayse voyce came vnto excellent glory maner 〈…〉 deare sonne haue delyte voyce herde broughte downe frō heauen whan holy mount haue also sure worde prophecie ye well ye take hede thervnto vnto lighte 〈…〉 shyneth darke place vntyll daye dawne daye starre aryse youre hertes shal ye knowe first prophecie scripture done eny priuate interpretacion 〈…〉 prophecie neuer broughte wyll man holy men god spake moued ye holy goost ii chapter bvt false prophetes also amonge people 〈…〉 euen shalbe false teacher amonge likewyse preuely shal brynge damnable sectes euen denyenge lorde hath boughte shal brynge vpon selues swift damnacion 〈…〉 many shal folowe damnable wayes whō waye trueth shal euell spokē thorow cuvetousnes shal fayned wordes make marchaundise vpō whō iudgment necligēt tarienge olde damnacion slepeth 〈…〉 yf god spared angel synned cast downe cheynes darknes hell delyuered thē ouer kepte vnto iudgment gen 7 nether spared olde worlde saued noe preacher righteousnes himselfe beynge ye eight brought floude vpō worlde vngodly gen 19 c turned city sodom gomor aszhes ouerthrue damned made ensample vnto shulde lyue vngodly delyuered iust loth vexed vngodly conuersacion ye wicked moch righteous dwelt amonge must nedes se heare righteous soule greued daye daye vnlaufull dedes 1 cor 10 b lorde knoweth delyuer godly tentacion reserue vniust vnto daye iudgment punyshed specially walke flesh ye lust vnclennes despyse ruler beynge presumptuous stubborne feare speake euell thē yt auctorite iudae 1 b whā angel yet greater power might beare blasphemous iudgment agaynst lorde iere 12 ye brute beestes naturally broughte forth takē destroyed iudae 1 b speakynge euell yt knowe shal perishe owne destruccion receaue ye rewarde vnrighteousnes counte pleasure lyue deliciously season spottes fylthynes lyuynge pleasure disceaueable wayes feastynge wt youres hauynge eye full aduoutrye cā ceasse synne entysinge vnstable soules hauynge hert exercysed wt couetousnes cursed child haue forsaken righte waye gone astraye folowinge waye num 222324 balaam sonne bosor loued rewarde vnrighteousnes rebuked iniquyte tame domme beast spake mās voyce forbad foolishnes ye prophet welles without water iudae • c cloudes caried aboute tēpest whō ye myst darknesse reserued foreuer speake ye proude wordes vanite vnto ye vttemost entyse thorow wantannes vnto ye luste flesh euen cleane escaped walke erroure promyse libertye selues seruauntes corrupcion ioh 8 c rom 6 b euer man ouercome vnto bondage luc 9 f yf haue escaped fylthynes worlde thorow knowlege ye lorde sauioure iesus christ yet tangled agayne therin ouercome mat 12 c heb 6 latter ende worse vnto begynnynge bene better haue knowne waye righteousnes haue knowne act 5 turne holy commaundemēt geuen vnto happened vnto acordynge vnto true prouerbe pro 26 b eccli 34 ye dogg turned vomyte agayne ye sowe waszhed vnto hir walowynge myre iii chapter seconde epistle wryte vnto ye dearly beloued wherin stere vp warne youre pure mynde ye maye remembre wordes tolde holy prophetes also commaundement v apostle lorde sauioure first vnderstonde 1 tim 4▪ 2 tim 3 iudae 1 c last dayes shal come mocker wyll walke awne lustes saye eze 12 promes yeare one daye lorde slacke fulfyll promes mē counte slacknesse rom 2 paciēt v warde eze 18 wyl eny mā shulde lost euery man shulde amende himselfe neuertheles mat▪ 24 • te 5 apoc 3 daye lorde shal come euen night daye heauens shal perishe greate noyse elementes shal melte heate earth ye workes therin shal burne yf thinges shal perishe maner person ought ye holy cōuersacion godlynes lokynge hastynge vnto commynge lorde heauens shal perishe fyre elementes shal melt heate neuertheles 〈…〉 loke new heauen new earth acordynge promes wherin dwelleth righteousnes wherfore dearly beloued seynge ye loke soch thinges diligent yt ye maye founde peace without spot vndefyled counte long sufferynge oure lorde youre saluacion euen oure dearly beloued brother paul acordinge wyszdome geuē vnto wrote vnto yee speakinge ther allmost epistle wherin many thinges harde vnderstonde vnlerned vnstable peruerte scripture also awne dā nacion ye therfore beloued seynge ye knowe hande bewarre lest ye also plucte awaye thorow erroure ye wicked fall yor owne sted fastnes growe grace knowlege oure lorde sauioure iesus christ prayse euer amen first epistle apostle euangelist ihon summe epistle chap true chapter ye begynnynge haue herde 〈…〉 haue sene eye haue loked vpon 〈…〉 handes haue handled worde life life hath appeared haue sene beare wytnes shewe vnto ye life euerlastinge 〈…〉 father hath apeared vnto v haue sene herde declare vnto ye also maye haue fellishippe v oure fellishippe maye father sonne iesus christ wryte vnto 〈…〉 youre ioye maye full tydinges haue herde declare vnto that▪ god hateth brother yet darknesse yt loueth brother abydeth lighte none occasion euell yt hateth brother darknes walketh darknes tell whither goeth ye darknes hath blynded eye babe wryte vnto luc 24 • act 4 yor synnes forgeuen name sake wryte vnto father ye haue knowne ye begynnynge wryte vnto yonge mē ye haue euercome wicked wryte vnto litle child ye haue knowne father haue wrytten vnto father ye todaye yf ye shal heare voyce harden youre hertes 〈…〉 prouokynke daye temptacion wyldernes youre father tempted proued sawe workes fortye yeares longe wherfore greued wt generacion sayde erre euer hertes knewe wayes sware wrath shulde enter rest take hede brother eny euell hert vnbeleue departe lyuynge god exhorte youre selues daylie whyle called daye lest eny waxe harde harted thorow ye disceatfulnes synne become partaker christ yf kepe sure vnto ye ende begynnynge substāce longe sayde todaye yf ye shal heare voyce hardē youre hertes prouocaciō whan herde prouoked howbeit yt came egipte moses displeased fortye yeares longe displeased yt synned whose carcase ouerthrowne ye wyldernesse 〈…〉 sware yt shulde enter rest vnto thē yt beleued se yt coulde enter vnbeleue iiii chapter let v feare therfore lest eny v forsakynge promes entrynge rest shulde seme come behinde declared vnto v well vnto thē worde preachinge helped thē whā herde beleued haue beleued enter rest acordynge sayde euen haue sworne wrath shal enter rest spake verely lōge workes frō begynnynge worlde made spake certayne place seuēth daye wyse 〈…〉 god rested seuenth daye workes place agayne 〈◊〉 4 b shal come rest seynge foloweth thē must enter first preached entred therin vnbeleues sake therfore appoynteth daye agayne longe tyme sayeth todaye rehearsed dauid todaye yf ye shal heare voyce harden youre hertes yf iosua geuen rest thē wolde afterwarde haue spoken another daye therfore remayneth yet rest vnto people god entred rest ceasseth workes 〈…〉 god doth let v make haist therfore enter rest lest eny man fall ensample vnbeleue ye worde god quycke mightie operacion sharper thē eny two edged swerde 〈…〉 entreth thorow euen deuydinge soule sprete ye ioyntes mary iudger thoughtes intētes hert nether eny creature invisible ye sighte thinges naked bare vnto ye eye hī whō speake v chapter seynge haue greate hye prest euē iesus ye sonne god entred heauen let v holde oure prest taken frō amō ge men ordeyned men thinges pertayninge god 〈…〉 offer giftes sacrifice synne haue cōpassion ignoraunt waye moch himselfe also compased aboute infirmyte therfore bounde offer god honoure phil 2 though god sonne yet lerned obedience thinges suffred beynge made perfecte became cause euerlastinge saluaciō vnto thē yt obeye called god hye prest order melchisedech wherof haue many thinges saye harde vttered ye dull hearynge 1 cor • concernynge tyme ye ought teacher yet haue ye nede agayne yt teach first preceptes worde god become soch haue nede mylke stronge meate euery one fed yet mylte vnexperte worde righteousnes babe stronge meate belongeth vnto yt perfecte thorow custome haue wyttes exercysed iudge good euell vi chapter wherfore let v leaue doctryne pertaynynge begynnynge christen life let v go vnto perfeccion nomore laye ye foundacion repētaunce deed workes faith towarde god baptyme doctryne layenge hādes resurreccion deed eternall iudgment wil act 18 c iaco 4 b yf god permytte heb 10 • possible lighted haue taisted heauēly gyfte become partaker holy goost 2 pet 2 haue taisted ye good worde god power worlde come yf fall awaye concernynge selues crucifye sonne god afreszhe 〈◊〉 mocke shulde 〈◊〉 agayne vnto repentaunce earth drynketh 〈…〉 commeth oft vpon 〈…〉 forth herbes mete 〈…〉 receaueth blessynge god yt grounde beareth thornes thistle nothinge worth nye vnto cursynge whose ende brent neuertheles ye dearly beloued trust se better yt saluaciō nyer though thus speake mat 25 god vnrighteous shulde forget youre worke laboure loue ye shewed name whan ye mynistred vnto sayntes yet mynister yee desyre euery one shewe diligence stablyshinge hope euen vnto ende ye faynte folowe thorow faith paciē ce inheret promyses whan god made promes abraham none greater sweare gen 22 c sware himselfe sayde surely wil blesse multiplye ye dede abode paciētly optayned promes men sweare greater selues exo 22 b ooth ende stryfe confirme thinge amōge god wyllinge abundauntly shewe vnto heyres promes stablenes councell added ooth yt two immutable thinges vnpossible yt god shulde lye mighte haue stronge consolacion euen fled holde fast hope set v hope haue sure stedfast anker oure soule hope also entreth thinges within ye vayle whither forerūner v entred euē iesus made hye prest foreuer ye order melchisedech vii chapter melchisedech gen 14 kynge salem beynge prest hye god met abraham returned agayne slaughter kynges blessed vnto abraham also gaue tithe goodes first interpretacion kynge righteousnes kynge salem also saye kynge peace without father without mother without kynne hath nether begynnynge dayes ner ende life likened vnto sonne god contynueth prest euer cōsider greate man patriarke abraham gaue ti • he spoyles 〈…〉 verely child 〈…〉 whan recea •• presthode 〈…〉 •• mmaundement acordynge 〈…〉 tithe people 〈…〉 brethrē though also came loynes abraham whose kynred counted amō ge receaued tithe abraham blessed promes without naysayenge lesse receaueth blessynge ye better men dye receaue tithe receaueth tithe witnessed lyueth saye trueth leui himselfe also receaueth tithe payed tithe abraham yet loynes father abraham whan melchisedech met yf therfore perfeccion came presthode leuites vnder presthode people receaued lawe neded furthurmore another prest shulde ryse order melchisedech order aaron 〈…〉 yf presthode trāslated thē necessite must lawe translated also thinges spoken another trybe neuer man serued altare euidēt 〈…〉 oure lorde spronge trybe iuda trybe moses spake nothinge cōcernynge presthode yet euident thinge yf symilitude mechisedech aryse another prest made ye lawe carnall commaundement power endlesse life testifieth 〈…〉 thou art prest euer order melchisedech commaundement wente disanulled weaknesse vnprofitablenes lawe made nothinge perfecte introduccion better hope yt hope drawe nye vnto god cause better hope yt promysed without ooth prestes made without ooth prest ooth sayde vnto lorde sware wyl repente thou art prest euer order melchisedech thus iesus become stabliszher moch better testamēte amonge many made prestes suffred endure reason death man endureth euer hath euerlastinge presthode wherfore able also euer saue come vnto god lyueth euer 〈…〉 make intercession v became v haue soch hye prest holy innocent vndefyled separate synners made hyer heauen nedeth daylie 〈◊〉 9 b yonder hye prestes offre vp sacrifice first awne synnes people synnes dyd whan offered vp selfe 〈…〉 lawe maketh men prestes haue infirmitie worde ooth came sence lawe maketh sonne prest perfecte euermore viii chapter thinges haue spoken pyth 〈…〉 haue soch hye prest set ye righte hande seate maiestie heauē mynister holy thinges true tabernacle god pitched man euery hye prest ordened offre giftes sacrifice wherfore necessite yt man haue somwhat also offer prest yf vpon earth prestes yt acordynge lawe offer giftes prestes serue vnto ensample shadowe heauēly thinges euen answere god geuen vnto moses whan aboute fynish tabernacle 〈…〉 take hede sayde thou make thinges acordinge patrone shewed mount hath optayned excellent office moch mediatour better testament made better promyses yf first testament bene fautles shulde place haue bene soughte secōde rebukynge thē sayeth 〈…〉 beholde dayes wyll come sayeth lorde wyl fynish vpō house israel vpon house iuda new testament testament made father daye whan toke handes lede londe egipte 〈…〉 contynued testament regarded sayeth lorde testament wil make wt house israell dayes sayeth lorde wyl geue lawes mynde hertes bloude ox • nd goates shulde take awaye synnes wherfore whan commeth worlde sayeth 〈…〉 sacrifice offerynge thou woldest haue body hast thou ordeyned burnt offerynges synneofferynges hast thou alowed sayde lo come begynnynge boke wrytten shulde ye wyll god aboue whā sayde sacrifice offerynge burntsacrifices syn offerynges thou woldest haue nether hast alowed yet offered ye lawe thē sayde lo come wil thy god taketh awaye first stablyszhe latter wyll sanctified offerynge vp body iesus christ euery prest ready daylie mynistringe oftymes offereth one maner offerynges neuer take awaye synnes man seynge brethrē haue 〈…〉 fresure intraunce holy place bloude iesu hath prepared vnto v new lyuynge waye thorow vayle saye flesh seynge also haue hye prest ouer house god let v drawe nye true hert full workes let v forsake fellishippe haue amōge oure selues maner let v exhorte one another moch ye se daye draweth nye 〈…〉 yf synne wylfully haue receaued knowlege trueth remayneth vnto v nomore god cōsidre therfore endured soch speakinge agaynst hī synners lest ye weery faynte youre myndes ye haue yet resisted vnto bloude stryuynge agaynst synne haue forgotten consolacion speaketh vnto vnto child 〈…〉 sonne despyse chastenynge lorde nether faynte whan thou art rebuked 〈…〉 whō lorde loueth chasteneth yee scourgeth euery sonne receaueth yf ye endure chastenynge god offereth himselfe vnto vnto sonnes sonne father chasteneth yf ye vnder correccion wherof partaker ye bastardes sonnes morouer seyenge haue father oure flesh corrected v gaue reuerence shulde moch rather subieccion vnto ye father spirituall giftes yt mighte lyue verely dayes nurtred v awne pleasure lerneth v vnto yt profitable mighte receaue holynes maner chastisynge present tyme semeth ioyous greuous neuertheles afterwarde bringeth quyete frute righteousnes vnto exercysed therby 〈…〉 life vp therfore handes let downe weake knee se ye haue straight steppe vnto youre fete lest eny haltinge turne waye yee let rather healed folowe peace men holynes without man shal se lorde ād loke well mā destitute grace god lest sprynge vp eny bytter rote cause disquyetnes therby many defyled whoremonger vncleane person brother lowe degre reioyce yt exalted rich yt made lowe euē flor ye grasse shal vanyshe awaye sonne ryseth wt heat grasse wydereth floure falleth awaye beautie fassion periszheth euen shal ryche man ye dedes faith made perfect scripture fulfilled faith 〈◊〉 1 • b 〈◊〉 4 b 〈◊〉 ▪ 1 abrahā beleued god reputed vnto rightewesnes called ye frende god ye se dedes man iustified faith 〈…〉 likewise also raab harlot iustified thorow workes receaued messenger sent another waye body oute sprete deed euen faith wt dedes deed iii chapter brethrē euery man mat 23 • master remēbrynge shall receaue damnacion many thinges synne eccli 14 19 c 25 b yf man synne worde parfecte man able tame body beholde put bittes horse mouthes yt shulde obeye v turne aboute body beholde also ye shyppes though gret dryuen fearce windes yet turned smale helme whither soeuer violence gouerner wyll euen tōge lyttell member bosteth great thinges beholde gret thinge lyttell fyre kyndleth tonge fyre worlde wyckednes tonge set amonge oure membres defileth whole body setteth fyre haue nature selfe set fyre euen hell nature beastes byrdes serpentes thinges see meked tamed nature mā tōge man tame yt vnruely euell full deedly poyson therwith blesse god father therwith cursse wemen gen 1 • made similitude god one mouth proceadeth blessynge cursynge brethrē thinges ought doth fountayne sende forth one place swete water bytter also fygge tree brother beare oliue beries ether vyne beare fygges fountayne geue bothe salt water freszhe also eny man wyse endued learnynge amonge let shewe workes good cōuersacion meknes coupled wiszdome yf ye haue bitter enuyenge stryfe yor hertes reioyce nether belyars agaynst trueth wiszdome descendeth aboue erthy naturall dyuelishe enuyenge stryfe vnstablenes māner euell workes wiszdom frō aboue fyrst pure thē peasable gentle easy entreated full mercy good frutes without iudgynge without simulacion yee frute rightewesnes sowen peace thē mayntene peace iiii chapter whence commeth warre fightynge amonge come hence euen yor volupteousnesses rayne youre mēbres ye lust haue ye envie haue indignacion obtayne ye fight warre haue ye axe ye axe receaue ye axe amysse euē cōsume vpō yor voluptuousnes ye aduouterars wemē breke matrimonie knowe ye • oh 2 c 〈◊〉 1 b frenshippe ye worlde ennimite godwarde whosoeuer wilbe frende worlde made ye enemie god ether ye thinke yt scripture sayth vayne 〈◊〉 5 c sprete yt dwelleth lusteth euen contrary enuie geueth grace submit youre selues god • et 5 b resist deuell wil flye frō drawe nye god wil drawe nye clense yor hondes ye synners pourge youre hertes ye wauerynge mynded suffre affliccions sorowe ye wepe let youre laughter turned mornynge youre ioye heuynes pet 5 cast downe youre selues lorde shal iudgest another man • ze 18 luc 12 b go ye saye daye morow let v go soche citie continue yeare bye sell wynne yet cā tell shal happē morowe thinge youre life euen vapoure apereth lytell tyme thē presence caused earth dwell therin worshippe fyrst beest whose deedly woūde healed dyd greate wonder made fyre come downe heauē sight men deceaued dwelt earth ye meanes signes power sight beest sayenge dwelt earth shulde make ymage vnto beest wounde swearde dyd liue power geue sprete vnto ymage beest ymage beest shulde speake shulde cause many wolde worshippe ymage beest shulde kylled made herde harper playe vpon harper songe newe songe seate ye foure beestes elder man coulde learne yt songe hondred xliiijm redemed earth defyled wemen virgyns folowe lambe whither soeuer goeth 〈…〉 redemed men beynge fyrst frutes vnto god lambe mouthes founde gyle withoutē spot trone god sawe angell flye myddes heauen hauinge euerlastinge gospell preache vnto syt dwell earth nacions kinreddes shalbe punyszhed fyre brymstone holy angel lambe smoke torment ascendeth vp euermore haue re • daye ner nyght worshippe beast ymage whosoeuer receaueth prynt name 〈…〉 pacience sayntes heare kepe commaundementes faith iesu herde voyce heauen sayenge vnto wryte blessed ye deed dye lorde yee sprete sayeth rest laboures workes folowe loked beholde whyte cloude vpō ye cloude one syttynge like vnto sonne man hauinge heed golden crowne hōde sharpe sykle another angell came temple cryenge loude voyce sat cloude 〈…〉 thruste thy sycle reepe tyme come reepe corne earth rype sat ye cloude thrust sykle earth earth reeped another angell came temple heauen hauinge also sharpe sykle another angel came aultre power ouer fyre cryed loude crye vnto hym sharpe syckle sayde thruste thy sharpe syckle gather cluster ye earth hir grape rype angell thrust syckle erthe cut downe grape vynyarde earth cast greate wynefat ye wrath god wynefat trodden without cite bloude came fat euen vnto horsse brydles space thousande sixe hundreth furlonges xv chapter sawe another signe heuen grett mervellous vii angells havinge seven laste plage thē fulfylled wrath god sawe glassye see mingled fyre gotten victory beest ymage marke nombre name stonde glassye see hauinge ye harpes god songe songe moses seruaunt god songe lambe saynge greate maruellous thy workes lorde god almyghty iust true thy wayes thou kynge seuen plage clothed pure bryght lynnē hauynge brestes gyrded golden gerdelles one foure beestes gaue vnto seuen angelles seuen golden vialles full wrath god liueth euermore 〈◊〉 44 temple full smoke glory god power man able entre temple tyll seuen plage seuē angel fulfilled xvi chapter herde greate voyce temple sayenge seuen angel go youre wayes poure youre vialles wrath vpon earth fyrst went poured viall vpon earth fell noysom • sore botch vpon men marke beest vpon worshipped ymage seconde angel shed viall vpō see turned bloud deed man euery lyuinge thinge dyed see thyrde angel shed vyall vpon ryuers fountaynes water turned bloude herde angel saye lorde art wast thou art righteous holy thou hast geuē soche iudgmentes shed bloude sayntes prophetes therfore hast thou geuen bloude drynke worthy herde another angell aulter saye euen lorde god almighty true righteous thy iudgmentes fourth angell poured viall sonne power geuen vnto vexe men heate fyre men raged gret heate spake euell name god power ouer plage repented geue glory fifte angell poured vyall vpon seate beest kyngdome wexed derke gnewe tonges sorowe blasphemed god heauē sorowe payne sore repented dedes sixte angell poured vyall vpon gret ryuer euphrates water dryed vp waye kynges easte shulde prepared sawe thre vncleane spretes kike frogges come mouth dragon mouth beest mouth false prophet spretes deuels workynge myracles go vnto kynges earth whole worlde gaddre battayle gret daye god allmighty mat 24 luc 12 • 1 te 5 2 pet 3 • beholde come thefe happy watcheth kepeth garmentes lest founde naked men se filthynes gaddered togedder place called hebrue tonge armagedon seuenth angell poured viall ayre came greate voyce heauen seate sayenge▪ done folowed voyces 〈◊〉 dringes lightnynges 〈…〉 gret earthquake soch 〈…〉 vpon earth myghty 〈…〉 quake greate 〈…〉 deuyded thre party city nacions fell greate babilon came remembraunce god geue vnto hyr cuppe wyne fearcenes wrath euery yle fled awaye mountaynes founde fell greate hayle bene talentes heauē vpon men men blasphemed god plage hayle greate plage sore xvii chapter cam one seuē angel seuen vialles talked sayenge vnto come wil shewe iugdment greate whore sytteth vpon many water kynges earth haue commytted whordome inhabiters earth dronken wyne fornicacion caryed awaye wildernes ye sprete sawe woman syt vpon rose colored beest full name blasphemie seuē heades ten horne ye woman arayed purple rose color decked golde precious stone pearles cupp golde honde full abhominacions fylthines wordome forhed name wryttē mistery greate babilon mother whordome abominaciōs earth sawe wyfe dronkē bloude sayntes bloud witness iesu sawe wondred greate mervayle angell sayde vnto wherfore meruayllest thou wyl shewethe mistery woman beest beerith hath seuen heades ten horne beest thou seest shall ascende bottomlesse pytt shal go perdicion dwell earth shal wondre whose name wrytten boke life begynnynge worlde beholde beest mynde hath wiszdome people ye partaker synnes lest ye receaue plage synnes gone vp heauen lorde hath remembred wyckednes rewarde euen rewarded geue dubble acordinge workes poure dubble cuppe fylled vnto moche gloryfied selfe lyued wantanly moch poure ye punyszhmēt sorowe sayeth herte 〈…〉 syt beinge quene wyddowe shall se sorowe therfore shal plage come one daye death sorowe honger shalbe brēt fyre stronge lorde
